const OFF = 0;0
const ERROR = 2;0
0

  extends: 'fbjs',0

  // Stop ESLint from looking for a configuration file in parent folders0
  'root': true,0
0
  plugins: [0
    'jest',0
    'no-for-of-loops',0
    'react',0
    'react-internal',0
  ],0
0
  // We're stricter than the default config, mostly. We'll override a few rules0
  // and then enable some React specific ones.0
  rules: {0
    'accessor-pairs': OFF,0
    'brace-style': [ERROR, '1tbs'],0
    'comma-dangle': [ERROR, 'always-multiline'],0
    'consistent-return': OFF,0
    'dot-location': [ERROR, 'property'],0

    'eol-last': ERROR,0

    'keyword-spacing': [ERROR, {after: true, before: true}],0

    'no-multi-spaces': ERROR,0
    'no-restricted-syntax': [ERROR, 'WithStatement'],0
    'no-shadow': ERROR,0

    'no-unused-vars': [ERROR, {args: 'none'}],0

    'quotes': [ERROR, 'single', {avoidEscape: true, allowTemplateLiterals: true }],0
    'space-before-blocks': ERROR,0
    'space-before-function-paren': OFF,0
0

    // Our transforms set this automatically0
    'react/jsx-boolean-value': [ERROR, 'always'],0
    'react/jsx-no-undef': ERROR,0
    // We don't care to do this0

    'react/jsx-space-before-closing': ERROR,0
    'react/jsx-uses-react': ERROR,0
    'react/no-is-mounted': OFF,0
    // This isn't useful in our test code0
    'react/react-in-jsx-scope': ERROR,0
    'react/self-closing-comp': ERROR,0
    // We don't care to do this0
    'react/jsx-wrap-multilines': [ERROR, {declaration: false, assignment: false}],0
0
    // Prevent for...of loops because they require a Symbol polyfill.0
    // You can disable this rule for code that isn't shipped (e.g. build scripts and tests).0
    'no-for-of-loops/no-for-of-loops': ERROR,0

'use strict';0
0
// Hi, if this is your first time editing/reading a Dangerfile, here's a summary:0
// It's a JS runtime which helps you provide continuous feedback inside GitHub.0
//0
// You can see the docs here: http://danger.systems/js/0
//0
// If you want to test changes Danger, I'd recommend checking out an existing PR0
// and then running the `danger pr` command.0
//0
// You'll need a GitHub token, you can re-use this one:0
//0
//  e622517d9f1136ea8900 07c6373666312cdfaa690
//0
// (Just remove the space)0
//0
// So, for example:0
//0
// `DANGER_GITHUB_API_TOKEN=[ENV_ABOVE] yarn danger pr https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/118650
0
const {markdown, danger} = require('danger');0
const fetch = require('node-fetch');0
0
const {generateResultsArray} = require('./scripts/rollup/stats');0
const {readFileSync} = require('fs');0
const {exec} = require('child_process');0
0
const currentBuildResults = JSON.parse(0
  readFileSync('./scripts/rollup/results.json')0
);0
0
/**0
 * Generates a Markdown table0
 * @param {string[]} headers0
 * @param {string[][]} body0
 */0
function generateMDTable(headers, body) {0
  const tableHeaders = [0
    headers.join(' | '),0
    headers.map(() => ' --- ').join(' | '),0
  ];0
0
  const tablebody = body.map(r => r.join(' | '));0
  return tableHeaders.join('\n') + '\n' + tablebody.join('\n');0
}0
0
/**0
 * Generates a user-readable string from a percentage change0
 * @param {number} change0
 * @param {boolean} includeEmoji0
 */0
function addPercent(change, includeEmoji) {0
  if (!isFinite(change)) {0
    // When a new package is created0
    return 'n/a';0
  }0
  const formatted = (change * 100).toFixed(1);0
  if (/^-|^0(?:\.0+)$/.test(formatted)) {0
    return `${formatted}%`;0
  } else {0
    if (includeEmoji) {0
      return `:small_red_triangle:+${formatted}%`;0
    } else {0
      return `+${formatted}%`;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function setBoldness(row, isBold) {0
  if (isBold) {0
    return row.map(element => `**${element}**`);0
  } else {0
    return row;0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Gets the commit that represents the merge between the current branch0
 * and master.0
 */0
function git(args) {0
  return new Promise(res => {0
    exec('git ' + args, (err, stdout, stderr) => {0
      if (err) {0
        throw err;0
      } else {0
        res(stdout.trim());0
      }0
    });0
  });0
}0
0
(async function() {0
  // Use git locally to grab the commit which represents the place0
  // where the branches differ0
  const upstreamRepo = danger.github.pr.base.repo.full_name;0
  const upstreamRef = danger.github.pr.base.ref;0
  await git(`remote add upstream https://github.com/${upstreamRepo}.git`);0
  await git('fetch upstream');0
  const mergeBaseCommit = await git(`merge-base HEAD upstream/${upstreamRef}`);0
0
  const commitURL = sha =>0
    `http://react.zpao.com/builds/master/_commits/${sha}/results.json`;0
  const response = await fetch(commitURL(mergeBaseCommit));0
0
  // Take the JSON of the build response and0
  // make an array comparing the results for printing0
  const previousBuildResults = await response.json();0
  const results = generateResultsArray(0
    currentBuildResults,0
    previousBuildResults0
  );0
0
  const packagesToShow = results0
    .filter(0
      r =>0
        Math.abs(r.prevFileSizeAbsoluteChange) >= 300 || // bytes0
        Math.abs(r.prevGzipSizeAbsoluteChange) >= 100 // bytes0
    )0
    .map(r => r.packageName);0
0
  if (packagesToShow.length) {0
    let allTables = [];0
0
    // Highlight React and React DOM changes inline0
    // e.g. react: `react.production.min.js`: -3%, `react.development.js`: +4%0
0
    if (packagesToShow.includes('react')) {0
      const reactProd = results.find(0
        r => r.bundleType === 'UMD_PROD' && r.packageName === 'react'0
      );0
      if (0
        reactProd.prevFileSizeChange !== 0 ||0
        reactProd.prevGzipSizeChange !== 00
      ) {0
        const changeSize = addPercent(reactProd.prevFileSizeChange, true);0
        const changeGzip = addPercent(reactProd.prevGzipSizeChange, true);0
        markdown(`React: size: ${changeSize}, gzip: ${changeGzip}`);0
      }0
    }0
0
    if (packagesToShow.includes('react-dom')) {0
      const reactDOMProd = results.find(0
        r => r.bundleType === 'UMD_PROD' && r.packageName === 'react-dom'0
      );0
      if (0
        reactDOMProd.prevFileSizeChange !== 0 ||0
        reactDOMProd.prevGzipSizeChange !== 00
      ) {0
        const changeSize = addPercent(reactDOMProd.prevFileSizeChange, true);0
        const changeGzip = addPercent(reactDOMProd.prevGzipSizeChange, true);0
        markdown(`ReactDOM: size: ${changeSize}, gzip: ${changeGzip}`);0
      }0
    }0
0
    // Show a hidden summary table for all diffs0
0
    // eslint-disable-next-line no-var,no-for-of-loops/no-for-of-loops0
    for (var name of new Set(packagesToShow)) {0
      const thisBundleResults = results.filter(r => r.packageName === name);0
      const changedFiles = thisBundleResults.filter(0
        r => r.prevFileSizeChange !== 0 || r.prevGzipSizeChange !== 00
      );0
0
      const mdHeaders = [0
        'File',0
        'Filesize Diff',0
        'Gzip Diff',0
        'Prev Size',0
        'Current Size',0
        'Prev Gzip',0
        'Current Gzip',0
        'ENV',0
      ];0
0
      const mdRows = changedFiles.map(r => {0
        const isProd = r.bundleType.includes('PROD');0
        return setBoldness(0
          [0
            r.filename,0
            addPercent(r.prevFileSizeChange, isProd),0
            addPercent(r.prevGzipSizeChange, isProd),0
            r.prevSize,0
            r.prevFileSize,0
            r.prevGzip,0
            r.prevGzipSize,0
            r.bundleType,0
          ],0
          isProd0
        );0
      });0
0
      allTables.push(`\n## ${name}`);0
      allTables.push(generateMDTable(mdHeaders, mdRows));0
    }0
0
    const summary = `0
  <details>0
  <summary>Details of bundled changes.</summary>0
0
  <p>Comparing: ${mergeBaseCommit}...${danger.github.pr.head.sha}</p>0
0
0
  ${allTables.join('\n')}0
0
  </details>0
  `;0
    markdown(summary);0
  }0
})();0

0

var ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
var VectorWidget = require('./VectorWidget');0
0
ReactDOM.render(<VectorWidget />, document.getElementById('container'));0

'use strict';0
0
var Circle = require('react-art/Circle');0
var React = require('react');0
var ReactART = require('react-art');0
var Group = ReactART.Group;0
var Shape = ReactART.Shape;0
var Surface = ReactART.Surface;0
var Transform = ReactART.Transform;0
0
var MOUSE_UP_DRAG = 0.978;0
var MOUSE_DOWN_DRAG = 0.9;0
var MAX_VEL = 11;0
var CLICK_ACCEL = 3;0
var BASE_VEL = 0.15;0
0
/**0
 * An animated SVG component.0
 */0
class VectorWidget extends React.Component {0
  /**0
   * Initialize state members.0
   */0
  state = {degrees: 0, velocity: 0, drag: MOUSE_UP_DRAG};0
0
  /**0
   * When the component is mounted into the document - this is similar to a0
   * constructor, but invoked when the instance is actually mounted into the0
   * document. Here's, we'll just set up an animation loop that invokes our0
   * method. Binding of `this.onTick` is not needed because all React methods0
   * are automatically bound before being mounted.0
   */0
  componentDidMount() {0
    this._interval = window.setInterval(this.onTick, 20);0
  }0
0
  componentWillUnmount() {0
    window.clearInterval(this._interval);0
  }0
0
  onTick = () => {0
    var nextDegrees = this.state.degrees + BASE_VEL + this.state.velocity;0
    var nextVelocity = this.state.velocity * this.state.drag;0
    this.setState({degrees: nextDegrees, velocity: nextVelocity});0
  };0
0
  /**0
   * When mousing down, we increase the friction down the velocity.0
   */0
  handleMouseDown = () => {0
    this.setState({drag: MOUSE_DOWN_DRAG});0
  };0
0
  /**0
   * Cause the rotation to "spring".0
   */0
  handleMouseUp = () => {0
    var nextVelocity = Math.min(this.state.velocity + CLICK_ACCEL, MAX_VEL);0
    this.setState({velocity: nextVelocity, drag: MOUSE_UP_DRAG});0
  };0
0
  /**0
   * This is the "main" method for any component. The React API allows you to0
   * describe the structure of your UI component at *any* point in time.0
   */0
  render() {0
    return (0
      <Surface width={700} height={700} style={{cursor: 'pointer'}}>0
        {this.renderGraphic(this.state.degrees)}0
      </Surface>0
    );0
  }0
0
  /**0
   * Better SVG support for React coming soon.0
   */0
  renderGraphic = rotation => {0
    return (0
      <Group onMouseDown={this.handleMouseDown} onMouseUp={this.handleMouseUp}>0
        <Group x={210} y={135}>0
          <Shape fill="rgba(0,0,0,0.1)" d={BORDER_PATH} />0
          <Shape fill="#7BC7BA" d={BG_PATH} />0
          <Shape fill="#DCDCDC" d={BAR_PATH} />0
          <Shape fill="#D97B76" d={RED_DOT_PATH} />0
          <Shape fill="#DBBB79" d={YELLOW_DOT_PATH} />0
          <Shape fill="#A6BD8A" d={GREEN_DOT_PATH} />0
          <Group x={55} y={29}>0
            <Group rotation={rotation} originX={84} originY={89}>0
              <Group x={84} y={89}>0
                <Circle fill="#FFFFFF" radius={16} />0
              </Group>0
              <Group>0
                <Shape d={RING_ONE_PATH} stroke="#FFFFFF" strokeWidth={8} />0
                <Shape0
                  d={RING_TWO_PATH}0
                  transform={RING_TWO_ROTATE}0
                  stroke="#FFFFFF"0
                  strokeWidth={8}0
                />0
                <Shape0
                  d={RING_THREE_PATH}0
                  transform={RING_THREE_ROTATE}0
                  stroke="#FFFFFF"0
                  strokeWidth={8}0
                />0
              </Group>0
            </Group>0
          </Group>0
        </Group>0
      </Group>0
    );0
  };0
}0
0
var BORDER_PATH =0
  'M3.00191459,4 C1.34400294,4 0,5.34785514 0,7.00550479 L0,220.994495 C0,222.65439 1.34239483,224 3.00191459,224 L276.998085,224 C278.655997,224 280,222.652145 280,220.994495 L280,7.00550479 C280,5.34561033 278.657605,4 276.998085,4 L3.00191459,4 Z M3.00191459,4';0
var BG_PATH =0
  'M3.00191459,1 C1.34400294,1 0,2.34785514 0,4.00550479 L0,217.994495 C0,219.65439 1.34239483,221 3.00191459,221 L276.998085,221 C278.655997,221 280,219.652145 280,217.994495 L280,4.00550479 C280,2.34561033 278.657605,1 276.998085,1 L3.00191459,1 Z M3.00191459,1';0
var BAR_PATH =0
  'M3.00191459,0 C1.34400294,0 0,1.34559019 0,3.00878799 L0,21 C0,21 0,21 0,21 L280,21 C280,21 280,21 280,21 L280,3.00878799 C280,1.34708027 278.657605,0 276.998085,0 L3.00191459,0 Z M3.00191459,0';0
var RED_DOT_PATH =0
  'M12.5,17 C16.0898511,17 19,14.0898511 19,10.5 C19,6.91014895 16.0898511,4 12.5,4 C8.91014895,4 6,6.91014895 6,10.5 C6,14.0898511 8.91014895,17 12.5,17 Z M12.5,17';0
var YELLOW_DOT_PATH =0
  'M31.5,17 C35.0898511,17 38,14.0898511 38,10.5 C38,6.91014895 35.0898511,4 31.5,4 C27.9101489,4 25,6.91014895 25,10.5 C25,14.0898511 27.9101489,17 31.5,17 Z M31.5,17';0
var GREEN_DOT_PATH =0
  'M50.5,17 C54.0898511,17 57,14.0898511 57,10.5 C57,6.91014895 54.0898511,4 50.5,4 C46.9101489,4 44,6.91014895 44,10.5 C44,14.0898511 46.9101489,17 50.5,17 Z M50.5,17';0
var RING_ONE_PATH =0
  'M84,121 C130.391921,121 168,106.673113 168,89 C168,71.3268871 130.391921,57 84,57 C37.6080787,57 0,71.3268871 0,89 C0,106.673113 37.6080787,121 84,121 Z M84,121';0
var RING_TWO_PATH =0
  'M84,121 C130.391921,121 168,106.673113 168,89 C168,71.3268871 130.391921,57 84,57 C37.6080787,57 0,71.3268871 0,89 C0,106.673113 37.6080787,121 84,121 Z M84,121';0
var RING_THREE_PATH =0
  'M84,121 C130.391921,121 168,106.673113 168,89 C168,71.3268871 130.391921,57 84,57 C37.6080787,57 0,71.3268871 0,89 C0,106.673113 37.6080787,121 84,121 Z M84,121';0
var RING_TWO_ROTATE = new Transform()0
  .translate(84.0, 89.0)0
  .rotate(-240.0)0
  .translate(-84.0, -89.0);0
var RING_THREE_ROTATE = new Transform()0
  .translate(84.0, 89.0)0
  .rotate(-300.0)0
  .translate(-84.0, -89.0);0
0
module.exports = VectorWidget;0

          ],0

        },0
      },0

const ALPHABETICAL = 'alphabetical';0
const REV_ALPHABETICAL = 'reverse_alphabetical';0
const GROUPED_BY_ROW_PATTERN = 'grouped_by_row_pattern';0
0
const ALL = 'all';0
const COMPLETE = 'complete';0
const INCOMPLETE = 'incomplete';0
0
function getCanonicalizedValue(value) {0
  switch (typeof value) {0
    case 'undefined':0
      return '<undefined>';0
    case 'object':0
      if (value === null) {0
        return '<null>';0
      }0
      if ('baseVal' in value) {0
        return getCanonicalizedValue(value.baseVal);0
      }0
      if (value instanceof SVGLength) {0
        return '<SVGLength: ' + value.valueAsString + '>';0
      }0
      if (value instanceof SVGRect) {0
        return (0
          '<SVGRect: ' +0
          [value.x, value.y, value.width, value.height].join(',') +0
          '>'0
        );0
      }0
      if (value instanceof SVGPreserveAspectRatio) {0
        return (0
          '<SVGPreserveAspectRatio: ' +0
          value.align +0
          '/' +0
          value.meetOrSlice +0
          '>'0
        );0
      }0
      if (value instanceof SVGNumber) {0
        return value.value;0
      }0
      if (value instanceof SVGMatrix) {0
        return (0
          '<SVGMatrix ' +0
          value.a +0
          ' ' +0
          value.b +0
          ' ' +0
          value.c +0
          ' ' +0
          value.d +0
          ' ' +0
          value.e +0
          ' ' +0
          value.f +0
          '>'0
        );0
      }0
      if (value instanceof SVGTransform) {0
        return (0
          getCanonicalizedValue(value.matrix) +0
          '/' +0
          value.type +0
          '/' +0
          value.angle0
        );0
      }0
      if (typeof value.length === 'number') {0
        return (0
          '[' +0
          Array.from(value)0
            .map(v => getCanonicalizedValue(v))0
            .join(', ') +0
          ']'0
        );0
      }0
      let name = (value.constructor && value.constructor.name) || 'object';0
      return '<' + name + '>';0
    case 'function':0
      return '<function>';0
    case 'symbol':0
      return '<symbol>';0
    case 'number':0
      return `<number: ${value}>`;0
    case 'string':0
      if (value === '') {0
        return '<empty string>';0
      }0
      return '"' + value + '"';0
    case 'boolean':0
      return `<boolean: ${value}>`;0
    default:0
      throw new Error('Switch statement should be exhaustive.');0
  }0
}0
0
let _didWarn = false;0
function warn(str) {0
  _didWarn = true;0
}0
const UNKNOWN_HTML_TAGS = new Set(['keygen', 'time', 'command']);0
function getRenderedAttributeValue(0
  react,0
  renderer,0
  serverRenderer,0
  attribute,0
  type0
) {0
  const originalConsoleError = console.error;0
  console.error = warn;0
0
  const containerTagName = attribute.containerTagName || 'div';0
  const tagName = attribute.tagName || 'div';0
0
  function createContainer() {0
    if (containerTagName === 'svg') {0
      return document.createElementNS('http://www.w3.org/2000/svg', 'svg');0
    } else if (containerTagName === 'document') {0
      return document.implementation.createHTMLDocument('');0
    } else {0
      return document.createElement(containerTagName);0
    }0
  }0
0
  const read = attribute.read;0
  let testValue = type.testValue;0
  if (attribute.overrideStringValue !== undefined) {0
    switch (type.name) {0
      case 'string':0
        testValue = attribute.overrideStringValue;0
        break;0
      case 'array with string':0
        testValue = [attribute.overrideStringValue];0
        break;0
      default:0
        break;0
    }0
  }0
  let baseProps = {0
    ...attribute.extraProps,0
  };0
  if (attribute.type) {0
    baseProps.type = attribute.type;0
  }0
  const props = {0
    ...baseProps,0
    [attribute.name]: testValue,0
  };0
0
  let defaultValue;0
  let canonicalDefaultValue;0
  let result;0
  let canonicalResult;0
  let ssrResult;0
  let canonicalSsrResult;0
  let didWarn;0
  let didError;0
  let ssrDidWarn;0
  let ssrDidError;0
0
  _didWarn = false;0
  try {0
    let container = createContainer();0
    renderer.render(react.createElement(tagName, baseProps), container);0
    defaultValue = read(container.firstChild);0
    canonicalDefaultValue = getCanonicalizedValue(defaultValue);0
0
    container = createContainer();0
    renderer.render(react.createElement(tagName, props), container);0
    result = read(container.firstChild);0
    canonicalResult = getCanonicalizedValue(result);0
    didWarn = _didWarn;0
    didError = false;0
  } catch (error) {0
    result = null;0
    didWarn = _didWarn;0
    didError = true;0
  }0
0
  _didWarn = false;0
  let hasTagMismatch = false;0
  let hasUnknownElement = false;0
  try {0
    let container;0
    if (containerTagName === 'document') {0
      const html = serverRenderer.renderToString(0
        react.createElement(tagName, props)0
      );0
      container = createContainer();0
      container.innerHTML = html;0
    } else {0
      const html = serverRenderer.renderToString(0
        react.createElement(0
          containerTagName,0
          null,0
          react.createElement(tagName, props)0
        )0
      );0
      const outerContainer = document.createElement('div');0
      outerContainer.innerHTML = html;0
      container = outerContainer.firstChild;0
    }0
0
    if (0
      !container.lastChild ||0
      container.lastChild.tagName.toLowerCase() !== tagName.toLowerCase()0
    ) {0
      hasTagMismatch = true;0
    }0
0
    if (0
      container.lastChild instanceof HTMLUnknownElement &&0
      !UNKNOWN_HTML_TAGS.has(container.lastChild.tagName.toLowerCase())0
    ) {0
      hasUnknownElement = true;0
    }0
0
    ssrResult = read(container.lastChild);0
    canonicalSsrResult = getCanonicalizedValue(ssrResult);0
    ssrDidWarn = _didWarn;0
    ssrDidError = false;0
  } catch (error) {0
    ssrResult = null;0
    ssrDidWarn = _didWarn;0
    ssrDidError = true;0
  }0
0
  console.error = originalConsoleError;0
0
  if (hasTagMismatch) {0
    throw new Error('Tag mismatch. Expected: ' + tagName);0
  }0
  if (hasUnknownElement) {0
    throw new Error('Unexpected unknown element: ' + tagName);0
  }0
0
  let ssrHasSameBehavior;0
  let ssrHasSameBehaviorExceptWarnings;0
  if (didError && ssrDidError) {0
    ssrHasSameBehavior = true;0
  } else if (!didError && !ssrDidError) {0
    if (canonicalResult === canonicalSsrResult) {0
      ssrHasSameBehaviorExceptWarnings = true;0
      ssrHasSameBehavior = didWarn === ssrDidWarn;0
    }0
    ssrHasSameBehavior =0
      didWarn === ssrDidWarn && canonicalResult === canonicalSsrResult;0
  } else {0
    ssrHasSameBehavior = false;0
  }0
0
  return {0
    tagName,0
    containerTagName,0
    testValue,0
    defaultValue,0
    result,0
    canonicalResult,0
    canonicalDefaultValue,0
    didWarn,0
    didError,0
    ssrResult,0
    canonicalSsrResult,0
    ssrDidWarn,0
    ssrDidError,0
    ssrHasSameBehavior,0
    ssrHasSameBehaviorExceptWarnings,0
  };0
}0
0
function prepareState(initGlobals) {0
  function getRenderedAttributeValues(attribute, type) {0
    const {0
      ReactStable,0
      ReactDOMStable,0
      ReactDOMServerStable,0
      ReactNext,0
      ReactDOMNext,0
      ReactDOMServerNext,0
    } = initGlobals(attribute, type);0
    const reactStableValue = getRenderedAttributeValue(0
      ReactStable,0
      ReactDOMStable,0
      ReactDOMServerStable,0
      attribute,0
      type0
    );0
    const reactNextValue = getRenderedAttributeValue(0
      ReactNext,0
      ReactDOMNext,0
      ReactDOMServerNext,0
      attribute,0
      type0
    );0
0
    let hasSameBehavior;0
    if (reactStableValue.didError && reactNextValue.didError) {0
      hasSameBehavior = true;0
    } else if (!reactStableValue.didError && !reactNextValue.didError) {0
      hasSameBehavior =0
        reactStableValue.didWarn === reactNextValue.didWarn &&0
        reactStableValue.canonicalResult === reactNextValue.canonicalResult &&0
        reactStableValue.ssrHasSameBehavior ===0
          reactNextValue.ssrHasSameBehavior;0
    } else {0
      hasSameBehavior = false;0
    }0
0
    return {0
      reactStable: reactStableValue,0
      reactNext: reactNextValue,0
      hasSameBehavior,0
    };0
  }0
0
  const table = new Map();0
  const rowPatternHashes = new Map();0
0
  // Disable error overlay while testing each attribute0
  uninjectErrorOverlay();0
  for (let attribute of attributes) {0
    const results = new Map();0
    let hasSameBehaviorForAll = true;0
    let rowPatternHash = '';0
    for (let type of types) {0
      const result = getRenderedAttributeValues(attribute, type);0
      results.set(type.name, result);0
      if (!result.hasSameBehavior) {0
        hasSameBehaviorForAll = false;0
      }0
      rowPatternHash += [result.reactStable, result.reactNext]0
        .map(res =>0
          [0
            res.canonicalResult,0
            res.canonicalDefaultValue,0
            res.didWarn,0
            res.didError,0
          ].join('||')0
        )0
        .join('||');0
    }0
    const row = {0
      results,0
      hasSameBehaviorForAll,0
      rowPatternHash,0
      // "Good enough" id that we can store in localStorage0
      rowIdHash: `${attribute.name} ${attribute.tagName} ${0
        attribute.overrideStringValue0
      }`,0
    };0
    const rowGroup = rowPatternHashes.get(rowPatternHash) || new Set();0
    rowGroup.add(row);0
    rowPatternHashes.set(rowPatternHash, rowGroup);0
    table.set(attribute, row);0
  }0
0
  // Renable error overlay0
  injectErrorOverlay();0
0
  return {0
    table,0
    rowPatternHashes,0
  };0
}0
0
const successColor = 'white';0
const warnColor = 'yellow';0
const errorColor = 'red';0
0
function RendererResult({0
  result,0
  canonicalResult,0
  defaultValue,0
  canonicalDefaultValue,0
  didWarn,0
  didError,0
  ssrHasSameBehavior,0
  ssrHasSameBehaviorExceptWarnings,0
}) {0
  let backgroundColor;0
  if (didError) {0
    backgroundColor = errorColor;0
  } else if (didWarn) {0
    backgroundColor = warnColor;0
  } else if (canonicalResult !== canonicalDefaultValue) {0
    backgroundColor = 'cyan';0
  } else {0
    backgroundColor = successColor;0
  }0
0
  let style = {0
    display: 'flex',0
    alignItems: 'center',0
    position: 'absolute',0
    height: '100%',0
    width: '100%',0
    backgroundColor,0
  };0
0
  if (!ssrHasSameBehavior) {0
    const color = ssrHasSameBehaviorExceptWarnings ? 'gray' : 'magenta';0
    style.border = `3px dotted ${color}`;0
  }0
0
  return <div css={style}>{canonicalResult}</div>;0
}0
0
function ResultPopover(props) {0
  return (0
    <pre0
      css={{0
        padding: '1em',0
        width: '25em',0
      }}>0
      {JSON.stringify(0
        {0
          reactStable: props.reactStable,0
          reactNext: props.reactNext,0
          hasSameBehavior: props.hasSameBehavior,0
        },0
        null,0
        20
      )}0
    </pre>0
  );0
}0
0
class Result extends React.Component {0
  state = {showInfo: false};0
  onMouseEnter = () => {0
    if (this.timeout) {0
      clearTimeout(this.timeout);0
    }0
    this.timeout = setTimeout(() => {0
      this.setState({showInfo: true});0
    }, 250);0
  };0
  onMouseLeave = () => {0
    if (this.timeout) {0
      clearTimeout(this.timeout);0
    }0
    this.setState({showInfo: false});0
  };0
0
  componentWillUnmount() {0
    if (this.timeout) {0
      clearTimeout(this.interval);0
    }0
  }0
0
  render() {0
    const {reactStable, reactNext, hasSameBehavior} = this.props;0
    const style = {0
      position: 'absolute',0
      width: '100%',0
      height: '100%',0
    };0
0
    let highlight = null;0
    let popover = null;0
    if (this.state.showInfo) {0
      highlight = (0
        <div0
          css={{0
            position: 'absolute',0
            height: '100%',0
            width: '100%',0
            border: '2px solid blue',0
          }}0
        />0
      );0
0
      popover = (0
        <div0
          css={{0
            backgroundColor: 'white',0
            border: '1px solid black',0
            position: 'absolute',0
            top: '100%',0
            zIndex: 999,0
          }}>0
          <ResultPopover {...this.props} />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    if (!hasSameBehavior) {0
      style.border = '4px solid purple';0
    }0
    return (0
      <div0
        css={style}0
        onMouseEnter={this.onMouseEnter}0
        onMouseLeave={this.onMouseLeave}>0
        <div css={{position: 'absolute', width: '50%', height: '100%'}}>0
          <RendererResult {...reactStable} />0
        </div>0
        <div0
          css={{0
            position: 'absolute',0
            width: '50%',0
            left: '50%',0
            height: '100%',0
          }}>0
          <RendererResult {...reactNext} />0
        </div>0
        {highlight}0
        {popover}0
      </div>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
function ColumnHeader({children}) {0
  return (0
    <div0
      css={{0
        position: 'absolute',0
        width: '100%',0
        height: '100%',0
        display: 'flex',0
        alignItems: 'center',0
      }}>0
      {children}0
    </div>0
  );0
}0
0
function RowHeader({children, checked, onChange}) {0
  return (0
    <div0
      css={{0
        position: 'absolute',0
        width: '100%',0
        height: '100%',0
        display: 'flex',0
        alignItems: 'center',0
      }}>0
      <input type="checkbox" checked={checked} onChange={onChange} />0
      {children}0
    </div>0
  );0
}0
0
function CellContent(props) {0
  const {0
    columnIndex,0
    rowIndex,0
    attributesInSortedOrder,0
    completedHashes,0
    toggleAttribute,0
    table,0
  } = props;0
  const attribute = attributesInSortedOrder[rowIndex - 1];0
  const type = types[columnIndex - 1];0
0
  if (columnIndex === 0) {0
    if (rowIndex === 0) {0
      return null;0
    }0
    const row = table.get(attribute);0
    const rowPatternHash = row.rowPatternHash;0
    return (0
      <RowHeader0
        checked={completedHashes.has(rowPatternHash)}0
        onChange={() => toggleAttribute(rowPatternHash)}>0
        {row.hasSameBehaviorForAll ? (0
          attribute.name0
        ) : (0
          <b css={{color: 'purple'}}>{attribute.name}</b>0
        )}0
      </RowHeader>0
    );0
  }0
0
  if (rowIndex === 0) {0
    return <ColumnHeader>{type.name}</ColumnHeader>;0
  }0
0
  const row = table.get(attribute);0
  const result = row.results.get(type.name);0
0
  return <Result {...result} />;0
}0
0
function saveToLocalStorage(completedHashes) {0
  const str = JSON.stringify([...completedHashes]);0
  localStorage.setItem('completedHashes', str);0
}0
0
function restoreFromLocalStorage() {0
  const str = localStorage.getItem('completedHashes');0
  if (str) {0
    const completedHashes = new Set(JSON.parse(str));0
    return completedHashes;0
  }0
  return new Set();0
}0
0
const useFastMode = /[?&]fast\b/.test(window.location.href);0
0
class App extends React.Component {0
  state = {0
    sortOrder: ALPHABETICAL,0
    filter: ALL,0
    completedHashes: restoreFromLocalStorage(),0
    table: null,0
    rowPatternHashes: null,0
  };0
0
  renderCell = props => {0
    return (0
      <div style={props.style}>0
        <CellContent0
          toggleAttribute={this.toggleAttribute}0
          completedHashes={this.state.completedHashes}0
          table={this.state.table}0
          attributesInSortedOrder={this.attributes}0
          {...props}0
        />0
      </div>0
    );0
  };0
0
  onUpdateSort = e => {0
    this.setState({sortOrder: e.target.value});0
  };0
0
  onUpdateFilter = e => {0
    this.setState({filter: e.target.value});0
  };0
0
  toggleAttribute = rowPatternHash => {0
    const completedHashes = new Set(this.state.completedHashes);0
    if (completedHashes.has(rowPatternHash)) {0
      completedHashes.delete(rowPatternHash);0
    } else {0
      completedHashes.add(rowPatternHash);0
    }0
    this.setState({completedHashes}, () => saveToLocalStorage(completedHashes));0
  };0
0
  async componentDidMount() {0
    const sources = {0
      ReactStable: 'https://unpkg.com/react@latest/umd/react.development.js',0
      ReactDOMStable:0
        'https://unpkg.com/react-dom@latest/umd/react-dom.development.js',0
      ReactDOMServerStable:0
        'https://unpkg.com/react-dom@latest/umd/react-dom-server.browser.development.js',0
      ReactNext: '/react.development.js',0
      ReactDOMNext: '/react-dom.development.js',0
      ReactDOMServerNext: '/react-dom-server.browser.development.js',0
    };0
    const codePromises = Object.values(sources).map(src =>0
      fetch(src).then(res => res.text())0
    );0
    const codesByIndex = await Promise.all(codePromises);0
0
    const pool = [];0
    function initGlobals(attribute, type) {0
      if (useFastMode) {0
        // Note: this is not giving correct results for warnings.0
        // But it's much faster.0
        if (pool[0]) {0
          return pool[0].globals;0
        }0
      } else {0
        document.title = `${attribute.name} (${type.name})`;0
      }0
0
      // Creating globals for every single test is too slow.0
      // However caching them between runs won't work for the same attribute names0
      // because warnings will be deduplicated. As a result, we only share globals0
      // between different attribute names.0
      for (let i = 0; i < pool.length; i++) {0
        if (!pool[i].testedAttributes.has(attribute.name)) {0
          pool[i].testedAttributes.add(attribute.name);0
          return pool[i].globals;0
        }0
      }0
0
      let globals = {};0
      Object.keys(sources).forEach((name, i) => {0
        eval.call(window, codesByIndex[i]); // eslint-disable-line0
        globals[name] = window[name.replace(/Stable|Next/g, '')];0
      });0
0
      // Cache for future use (for different attributes).0
      pool.push({0
        globals,0
        testedAttributes: new Set([attribute.name]),0
      });0
0
      return globals;0
    }0
0
    const {table, rowPatternHashes} = prepareState(initGlobals);0
    document.title = 'Ready';0
0
    this.setState({0
      table,0
      rowPatternHashes,0
    });0
  }0
0
  componentWillUpdate(nextProps, nextState) {0
    if (0
      nextState.sortOrder !== this.state.sortOrder ||0
      nextState.filter !== this.state.filter ||0
      nextState.completedHashes !== this.state.completedHashes ||0
      nextState.table !== this.state.table0
    ) {0
      this.attributes = this.getAttributes(0
        nextState.table,0
        nextState.rowPatternHashes,0
        nextState.sortOrder,0
        nextState.filter,0
        nextState.completedHashes0
      );0
      if (this.grid) {0
        this.grid.forceUpdateGrids();0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  getAttributes(table, rowPatternHashes, sortOrder, filter, completedHashes) {0
    // Filter0
    let filteredAttributes;0
    switch (filter) {0
      case ALL:0
        filteredAttributes = attributes.filter(() => true);0
        break;0
      case COMPLETE:0
        filteredAttributes = attributes.filter(attribute => {0
          const row = table.get(attribute);0
          return completedHashes.has(row.rowPatternHash);0
        });0
        break;0
      case INCOMPLETE:0
        filteredAttributes = attributes.filter(attribute => {0
          const row = table.get(attribute);0
          return !completedHashes.has(row.rowPatternHash);0
        });0
        break;0
      default:0
        throw new Error('Switch statement should be exhuastive');0
    }0
0
    // Sort0
    switch (sortOrder) {0
      case ALPHABETICAL:0
        return filteredAttributes.sort(0
          (attr1, attr2) =>0
            attr1.name.toLowerCase() < attr2.name.toLowerCase() ? -1 : 10
        );0
      case REV_ALPHABETICAL:0
        return filteredAttributes.sort(0
          (attr1, attr2) =>0
            attr1.name.toLowerCase() < attr2.name.toLowerCase() ? 1 : -10
        );0
      case GROUPED_BY_ROW_PATTERN: {0
        return filteredAttributes.sort((attr1, attr2) => {0
          const row1 = table.get(attr1);0
          const row2 = table.get(attr2);0
          const patternGroup1 = rowPatternHashes.get(row1.rowPatternHash);0
          const patternGroupSize1 = (patternGroup1 && patternGroup1.size) || 0;0
          const patternGroup2 = rowPatternHashes.get(row2.rowPatternHash);0
          const patternGroupSize2 = (patternGroup2 && patternGroup2.size) || 0;0
          return patternGroupSize2 - patternGroupSize1;0
        });0
      }0
      default:0
        throw new Error('Switch statement should be exhuastive');0
    }0
  }0
0
  handleSaveClick = e => {0
    e.preventDefault();0
0
    if (useFastMode) {0
      alert(0
        'Fast mode is not accurate. Please remove ?fast from the query string, and reload.'0
      );0
      return;0
    }0
0
    let log = '';0
    for (let attribute of attributes) {0
      log += `## \`${attribute.name}\` (on \`<${attribute.tagName ||0
        'div'}>\` inside \`<${attribute.containerTagName || 'div'}>\`)\n`;0
      log += '| Test Case | Flags | Result |\n';0
      log += '| --- | --- | --- |\n';0
0
      const attributeResults = this.state.table.get(attribute).results;0
      for (let type of types) {0
        const {0
          didError,0
          didWarn,0
          canonicalResult,0
          canonicalDefaultValue,0
          ssrDidError,0
          ssrHasSameBehavior,0
          ssrHasSameBehaviorExceptWarnings,0
        } = attributeResults.get(type.name).reactNext;0
0
        let descriptions = [];0
        if (canonicalResult === canonicalDefaultValue) {0
          descriptions.push('initial');0
        } else {0
          descriptions.push('changed');0
        }0
        if (didError) {0
          descriptions.push('error');0
        }0
        if (didWarn) {0
          descriptions.push('warning');0
        }0
        if (ssrDidError) {0
          descriptions.push('ssr error');0
        }0
        if (!ssrHasSameBehavior) {0
          if (ssrHasSameBehaviorExceptWarnings) {0
            descriptions.push('ssr warning');0
          } else {0
            descriptions.push('ssr mismatch');0
          }0
        }0
        log +=0
          `| \`${attribute.name}=(${type.name})\`` +0
          `| (${descriptions.join(', ')})` +0
          `| \`${canonicalResult || ''}\` |\n`;0
      }0
      log += '\n';0
    }0
0
    const blob = new Blob([log], {type: 'text/plain;charset=utf-8'});0
    FileSaver.saveAs(blob, 'AttributeTableSnapshot.md');0
  };0
0
  render() {0
    if (!this.state.table) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <h1>Loading...</h1>0
          {!useFastMode && (0
            <h3>The progress is reported in the window title.</h3>0
          )}0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
    return (0
      <div>0
        <div>0
          <select value={this.state.sortOrder} onChange={this.onUpdateSort}>0
            <option value={ALPHABETICAL}>alphabetical</option>0
            <option value={REV_ALPHABETICAL}>reverse alphabetical</option>0
            <option value={GROUPED_BY_ROW_PATTERN}>0
              grouped by row pattern :)0
            </option>0
          </select>0
          <select value={this.state.filter} onChange={this.onUpdateFilter}>0
            <option value={ALL}>all</option>0
            <option value={INCOMPLETE}>incomplete</option>0
            <option value={COMPLETE}>complete</option>0
          </select>0
          <button style={{marginLeft: '10px'}} onClick={this.handleSaveClick}>0
            Save latest results to a file{' '}0
            <span role="img" aria-label="Save">0
              💾0
            </span>0
          </button>0
        </div>0
        <AutoSizer disableHeight={true}>0
          {({width}) => (0
            <MultiGrid0
              ref={input => {0
                this.grid = input;0
              }}0
              cellRenderer={this.renderCell}0
              columnWidth={200}0
              columnCount={1 + types.length}0
              fixedColumnCount={1}0
              enableFixedColumnScroll={true}0
              enableFixedRowScroll={true}0
              height={1200}0
              rowHeight={40}0
              rowCount={this.attributes.length + 1}0
              fixedRowCount={1}0
              width={width}0
            />0
          )}0
        </AutoSizer>0
      </div>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export default App;0
import React from 'react';0
import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';0
import App from './App';0
0
it('renders without crashing', () => {0
  const div = document.createElement('div');0
  ReactDOM.render(<App />, div);0
});0
function getProperty(propertyName) {0
  return el => el[propertyName];0
}0
0
function getAttribute(attributeName) {0
  return el => {0
    if (el.namespaceURI === '') {0
      throw new Error('Not an HTML element.');0
    }0
    return el.getAttribute(attributeName);0
  };0
}0
0
function getSVGProperty(propertyName) {0
  return el => el[propertyName];0
}0
0
function getSVGAttribute(attributeName) {0
  return el => {0
    if (el.namespaceURI !== 'http://www.w3.org/2000/svg') {0
      throw new Error('Not an SVG element.');0
    }0
    return el.getAttribute(attributeName);0
  };0
}0

    tagName: 'fePointLight',0
  },0
  {name: 'zoomAndPan', read: getSVGProperty('zoomAndPan'), tagName: 'svg'},0
];0
0
attributes.forEach(attr => {0
  attr.read = attr.read || getProperty(attr.name);0
});0
0
export default attributes;0
import './index.css';0
import React from 'react';0
import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';0
import App from './App';0
0
ReactDOM.render(<App />, document.getElementById('root'));0
import './polyfills';0
import loadReact from './react-loader';0
0
loadReact()0
  .then(() => import('./components/App'))0
  .then(App => {0
    const {React, ReactDOM} = window;0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      React.createElement(App.default),0
      document.getElementById('root')0
    );0
  });0
import 'core-js/es6/promise';0
import 'core-js/es6/set';0
import 'core-js/es6/map';0
0
// http://paulirish.com/2011/requestanimationframe-for-smart-animating/0
// http://my.opera.com/emoller/blog/2011/12/20/requestanimationframe-for-smart-er-animating0
0
// requestAnimationFrame polyfill by Erik Möller. fixes from Paul Irish and Tino Zijdel0
// MIT license0
(function() {0
  var lastTime = 0;0
  var vendors = ['ms', 'moz', 'webkit', 'o'];0
  for (var x = 0; x < vendors.length && !window.requestAnimationFrame; ++x) {0
    window.requestAnimationFrame = window[vendors[x] + 'RequestAnimationFrame'];0
    window.cancelAnimationFrame =0
      window[vendors[x] + 'CancelAnimationFrame'] ||0
      window[vendors[x] + 'CancelRequestAnimationFrame'];0
  }0
0
  if (!window.requestAnimationFrame)0
    window.requestAnimationFrame = function(callback, element) {0
      var currTime = new Date().getTime();0
      var timeToCall = Math.max(0, 16 - (currTime - lastTime));0
      var id = window.setTimeout(function() {0
        callback(currTime + timeToCall);0
      }, timeToCall);0
      lastTime = currTime + timeToCall;0
      return id;0
    };0
0
  if (!window.cancelAnimationFrame)0
    window.cancelAnimationFrame = function(id) {0
      clearTimeout(id);0
    };0
})();0
/**0
 * Take a version from the window query string and load a specific0
 * version of React.0
 *0
 * @example0
 * http://localhost:3000?version=15.4.10
 * (Loads React 15.4.1)0
 */0
0
function parseQuery(qstr) {0
  var query = {};0
  var a = qstr.substr(1).split('&');0
0
  for (var i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {0
    var b = a[i].split('=');0
    query[decodeURIComponent(b[0])] = decodeURIComponent(b[1] || '');0
  }0
  return query;0
}0
0
function loadScript(src) {0
  let firstScript = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0];0
  let scriptNode;0
0
  return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {0
    scriptNode = document.createElement('script');0
    scriptNode.async = 1;0
    scriptNode.src = src;0
0
    scriptNode.onload = () => resolve();0
    scriptNode.onerror = () => reject(new Error(`failed to load: ${src}`));0
0
    firstScript.parentNode.insertBefore(scriptNode, firstScript);0
  });0
}0
0
export default function loadReact() {0
  let REACT_PATH = 'react.development.js';0
  let DOM_PATH = 'react-dom.development.js';0
0
  let query = parseQuery(window.location.search);0
  let version = query.version || 'local';0
0
  if (version !== 'local') {0
    // The file structure was updated in 16. This wasn't the case for alphas.0
    // Load the old module location for anything less than 16 RC0
    if (parseInt(version, 10) >= 16 && version.indexOf('alpha') < 0) {0
      REACT_PATH =0
        'https://unpkg.com/react@' + version + '/umd/react.development.js';0
      DOM_PATH =0
        'https://unpkg.com/react-dom@' +0
        version +0
        '/umd/react-dom.development.js';0
    } else {0
      REACT_PATH = 'https://unpkg.com/react@' + version + '/dist/react.js';0
      DOM_PATH =0
        'https://unpkg.com/react-dom@' + version + '/dist/react-dom.js';0
    }0
  }0
0
  const needsReactDOM = version === 'local' || parseFloat(version, 10) > 0.13;0
0
  let request = loadScript(REACT_PATH);0
0
  if (needsReactDOM) {0
    request = request.then(() => loadScript(DOM_PATH));0
  } else {0
    // Aliasing React to ReactDOM for compatibility.0
    request = request.then(() => {0
      window.ReactDOM = window.React;0
    });0
  }0
0
  return request;0
}0
/**0
 * Version tags are loaded from the GitHub API. Since the GitHub API is rate-limited0
 * we attempt to save and load the tags in sessionStorage when possible. Since its unlikely0
 * that versions will change during a single session this should be safe.0
 */0
0
const TAGS_CACHE_KEY = '@react-dom-fixtures/tags';0
0
/**0
 * Its possible that users will be testing changes frequently0
 * in a browser that does not support sessionStorage. If the API does0
 * get rate limited this hardcoded fallback will be loaded instead.0
 * This way users can still switch between ~some versions while testing.0
 * If there's a specific version they need to test that is not here, they0
 * can manually load it by editing the URL (`?version={whatever}`)0
 */0
const fallbackTags = [0
  '15.4.2',0
  '15.3.2',0
  '15.2.1',0
  '15.1.0',0
  '15.0.2',0
  '0.14.8',0
  '0.13.0',0
].map(version => ({0
  name: `v${version}`,0
}));0
0
let canUseSessionStorage = true;0
0
try {0
  sessionStorage.setItem('foo', '');0
} catch (err) {0
  canUseSessionStorage = false;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Attempts to load tags from sessionStorage. In cases where0
 * sessionStorage is not available (Safari private browsing) or the0
 * tags are cached a fetch request is made to the GitHub API.0
 *0
 * Returns a promise so that the consuming module can always assume0
 * the request is async, even if its loaded from sessionStorage.0
 */0
export default function getVersionTags() {0
  return new Promise(resolve => {0
    let cachedTags;0
    if (canUseSessionStorage) {0
      cachedTags = sessionStorage.getItem(TAGS_CACHE_KEY);0
    }0
    if (cachedTags) {0
      cachedTags = JSON.parse(cachedTags);0
      resolve(cachedTags);0
    } else {0
      fetch('https://api.github.com/repos/facebook/react/tags', {mode: 'cors'})0
        .then(res => res.json())0
        .then(tags => {0
          // A message property indicates an error was sent from the API0
          if (tags.message) {0
            return resolve(fallbackTags);0
          }0
          if (canUseSessionStorage) {0
            sessionStorage.setItem(TAGS_CACHE_KEY, JSON.stringify(tags));0
          }0
          resolve(tags);0
        })0
        .catch(() => resolve(fallbackTags));0
    }0
  });0
}0
import Header from './Header';0
import Fixtures from './fixtures';0
import '../style.css';0
0
const React = window.React;0
0
function App() {0
  return (0
    <div>0
      <Header />0
      <div className="container">0
        <Fixtures />0
      </div>0
    </div>0
  );0
}0
0
export default App;0

const React = window.React;0
0

  children: PropTypes.node.isRequired,0
};0
0

  render() {0
    const {children} = this.props;0
0
    return <div className="test-fixture">{children}</div>;0
  }0
}0

  description: PropTypes.node.isRequired,0
};0
0
class FixtureSet extends React.Component {0
  render() {0
    const {title, description, children} = this.props;0
0
    return (0
      <div>0
        <h1>{title}</h1>0
        {description && <p>{description}</p>}0
0
        {children}0
      </div>0
    );0

import {parse, stringify} from 'query-string';0
import getVersionTags from '../tags';0
const React = window.React;0
0
class Header extends React.Component {0
  constructor(props, context) {0
    super(props, context);0
    const query = parse(window.location.search);0
    const version = query.version || 'local';0
    const versions = [version];0
    this.state = {version, versions};0
  }0
  componentWillMount() {0
    getVersionTags().then(tags => {0
      let versions = tags.map(tag => tag.name.slice(1));0
      versions = [`local`, ...versions];0
      this.setState({versions});0
    });0
  }0
  handleVersionChange(event) {0
    const query = parse(window.location.search);0
    query.version = event.target.value;0
    if (query.version === 'local') {0
      delete query.version;0
    }0
    window.location.search = stringify(query);0
  }0
  handleFixtureChange(event) {0
    window.location.pathname = event.target.value;0
  }0
  render() {0
    return (0
      <header className="header">0
        <div className="header__inner">0
          <span className="header__logo">0
            <img0
              src={process.env.PUBLIC_URL + '/react-logo.svg'}0
              alt=""0
              width="32"0
              height="32"0
            />0
            React Sandbox (v{React.version})0
          </span>0
0
          <div className="header-controls">0
            <label htmlFor="example">0
              <span className="sr-only">Select an example</span>0
              <select0
                value={window.location.pathname}0
                onChange={this.handleFixtureChange}>0
                <option value="/">Select a Fixture</option>0
                <option value="/range-inputs">Range Inputs</option>0
                <option value="/text-inputs">Text Inputs</option>0
                <option value="/number-inputs">Number Input</option>0
                <option value="/password-inputs">Password Input</option>0
                <option value="/selects">Selects</option>0
                <option value="/textareas">Textareas</option>0
                <option value="/input-change-events">0
                  Input change events0
                </option>0
                <option value="/buttons">Buttons</option>0
                <option value="/date-inputs">Date Inputs</option>0
                <option value="/error-handling">Error Handling</option>0
                <option value="/event-pooling">Event Pooling</option>0
                <option value="/custom-elements">Custom Elements</option>0
                <option value="/media-events">Media Events</option>0
                <option value="/pointer-events">Pointer Events</option>0
                <option value="/mouse-events">Mouse Events</option>0
              </select>0
            </label>0
            <label htmlFor="react_version">0
              <span className="sr-only">Select a version to test</span>0
              <select0
                value={this.state.version}0
                onChange={this.handleVersionChange}>0
                {this.state.versions.map(version => (0
                  <option key={version} value={version}>0
                    {version}0
                  </option>0
                ))}0
              </select>0
            </label>0
          </div>0
        </div>0
      </header>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export default Header;0
const React = window.React;0
0
function csv(string) {0
  return string.split(/\s*,\s*/);0
}0
0
export default function IssueList({issues}) {0
  if (!issues) {0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  if (typeof issues === 'string') {0
    issues = csv(issues);0
  }0
0
  let links = issues.reduce((memo, issue, i) => {0
    return memo.concat(0
      i > 0 && i < issues.length ? ', ' : null,0
      <a href={'https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/' + issue} key={issue}>0
        {issue}0
      </a>0
    );0
  }, []);0
0
  return <span>{links}</span>;0
}0
import PropTypes from 'prop-types';0
import semver from 'semver';0
0
export function semverString(props, propName, componentName) {0
  let version = props[propName];0
0
  let error = PropTypes.string(...arguments);0
  if (!error && version != null && !semver.valid(version))0
    error = new Error(0
      `\`${propName}\` should be a valid "semantic version" matching ` +0
        'an existing React version'0
    );0
0
  return error || null;0
}0
import cn from 'classnames';0
import semver from 'semver';0
import PropTypes from 'prop-types';0
import IssueList from './IssueList';0
import {parse} from 'query-string';0
import {semverString} from './propTypes';0
0
const React = window.React;0
0
const propTypes = {0
  children: PropTypes.node.isRequired,0
  title: PropTypes.node.isRequired,0
  resolvedIn: semverString,0
  introducedIn: semverString,0
  resolvedBy: PropTypes.string,0
};0
0
class TestCase extends React.Component {0
  constructor(props, context) {0
    super(props, context);0
0
    this.state = {0
      complete: false,0
    };0
  }0
0
  handleChange = e => {0
    this.setState({0
      complete: e.target.checked,0
    });0
  };0
0
  render() {0
    const {0
      title,0
      description,0
      introducedIn,0
      resolvedIn,0
      resolvedBy,0
      affectedBrowsers,0
      relatedIssues,0
      children,0
    } = this.props;0
0
    let {complete} = this.state;0
0
    const {version} = parse(window.location.search);0
    const isTestFixed =0
      !version || !resolvedIn || semver.gte(version, resolvedIn);0
0
    complete = !isTestFixed || complete;0
0
    return (0
      <section className={cn('test-case', complete && 'test-case--complete')}>0
        <h2 className="test-case__title type-subheading">0
          <label>0
            <input0
              className="test-case__title__check"0
              type="checkbox"0
              checked={complete}0
              onChange={this.handleChange}0
            />{' '}0
            {title}0
          </label>0
        </h2>0
0
        <dl className="test-case__details">0
          {introducedIn && <dt>First broken in: </dt>}0
          {introducedIn && (0
            <dd>0
              <a0
                href={'https://github.com/facebook/react/tag/v' + introducedIn}>0
                <code>{introducedIn}</code>0
              </a>0
            </dd>0
          )}0
0
          {resolvedIn && <dt>First supported in: </dt>}0
          {resolvedIn && (0
            <dd>0
              <a href={'https://github.com/facebook/react/tag/v' + resolvedIn}>0
                <code>{resolvedIn}</code>0
              </a>0
            </dd>0
          )}0
0
          {resolvedBy && <dt>Fixed by: </dt>}0
          {resolvedBy && (0
            <dd>0
              <a0
                href={0
                  'https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/' +0
                  resolvedBy.slice(1)0
                }>0
                <code>{resolvedBy}</code>0
              </a>0
            </dd>0
          )}0
0
          {affectedBrowsers && <dt>Affected browsers: </dt>}0
          {affectedBrowsers && <dd>{affectedBrowsers}</dd>}0
0
          {relatedIssues && <dt>Related Issues: </dt>}0
          {relatedIssues && (0
            <dd>0
              <IssueList issues={relatedIssues} />0
            </dd>0
          )}0
        </dl>0
0
        <p className="test-case__desc">{description}</p>0
0
        <div className="test-case__body">0
          {!isTestFixed && (0
            <p className="test-case__invalid-version">0
              <strong>Note:</strong> This test case was fixed in a later version0
              of React. This test is not expected to pass for the selected0
              version, and that's ok!0
            </p>0
          )}0
0
          {children}0
        </div>0
      </section>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
TestCase.propTypes = propTypes;0
0

  render() {0
    const {children} = this.props;0
    return (0
      <div>0
        <h3>Steps to reproduce:</h3>0
        <ol>{children}</ol>0
      </div>0
    );0
  }0
};0

  render() {0
    const {children} = this.props;0
    return (0
      <div>0
        <h3>Expected Result:</h3>0
        <p>{children}</p>0
      </div>0
    );0
  }0
};0

import RangeInputFixtures from './range-inputs';0

const React = window.React;0

/**0
 * A simple routing component that renders the appropriate0
 * fixture based on the location pathname.0
 */0
function FixturesPage() {0
  switch (window.location.pathname) {0
    case '/text-inputs':0
      return <TextInputFixtures />;0
    case '/range-inputs':0
      return <RangeInputFixtures />;0
    case '/selects':0
      return <SelectFixtures />;0
    case '/textareas':0
      return <TextAreaFixtures />;0
    case '/input-change-events':0
      return <InputChangeEvents />;0
    case '/number-inputs':0
      return <NumberInputFixtures />;0
    case '/password-inputs':0
      return <PasswordInputFixtures />;0
    case '/buttons':0
      return <ButtonFixtures />;0
    case '/date-inputs':0
      return <DateInputFixtures />;0
    case '/error-handling':0
      return <ErrorHandling />;0
    case '/event-pooling':0
      return <EventPooling />;0
    case '/custom-elements':0
      return <CustomElementFixtures />;0
    case '/media-events':0
      return <MediaEventsFixtures />;0
    case '/pointer-events':0
      return <PointerEventsFixtures />;0
    case '/mouse-events':0
      return <MouseEventsFixtures />;0
    default:0
      return <p>Please select a test fixture.</p>;0
  }0
}0
0
export default FixturesPage;0

  window.alert(`This shouldn't have happened!`);0
}0

      <FixtureSet title="Buttons" description="">0

          description="The onClick event handler should not be invoked when clicking on a disabled buyaton">0

          </TestCase.Steps>0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            Nothing should happen0
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          <button disabled onClick={onButtonClick}>0
            Click Me0
          </button>0
        </TestCase>0
        <TestCase0
          title="onClick with disabled buttons containing other elements"0
          description="The onClick event handler should not be invoked when clicking on a disabled button that contains other elements">0
          <TestCase.Steps>0

          </TestCase.Steps>0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            Nothing should happen0
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0

            <span>Click Me</span>0

0
const supportsCustomElements = typeof customElements !== 'undefined';0
0
class HelloWorld extends React.Component {0
  render() {0
    return <h1>Hello, world!</h1>;0
  }0
}0
0
if (supportsCustomElements) {0
  // Babel breaks web components.0
  // https://github.com/w3c/webcomponents/issues/5870
  // eslint-disable-next-line no-new-func0
  const MyElement = new Function(0
    'React',0
    'ReactDOM',0
    'HelloWorld',0
    `0
    return class MyElement extends HTMLElement {0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        const shadowRoot = this.attachShadow({ mode:'open' });0
        ReactDOM.render(React.createElement(HelloWorld), shadowRoot);0
      }0
    }`0
  )(React, ReactDOM, HelloWorld);0
  customElements.define('my-element', MyElement);0
}0
0
export default class ButtonTestCases extends React.Component {0

    return (0

        title="Custom Elements"0
        description="Support for Custom Element DOM standards.">0
        <TestCase title="Rendering into shadow root">0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            You should see "Hello, World" printed below.{' '}0
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          {supportsCustomElements ? (0
            <my-element />0
          ) : (0
            <div>This browser does not support custom elements.</div>0
          )}0
        </TestCase>0
      </FixtureSet>0
    );0
  }0
}0

const React = window.React;0
0
class DateInputFixtures extends React.Component {0
  render() {0
    return (0
      <FixtureSet title="Dates" description="">0
        <TestCase title="Switching between date and datetime-local">0
          <TestCase.Steps>0
            <li>Type a date into the date picker</li>0
            <li>Toggle "Switch type"</li>0
          </TestCase.Steps>0
0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            The month, day, and year values should correctly transfer. The0
            hours/minutes/seconds should not be discarded.0
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0

            <SwitchDateTestCase />0
          </Fixture>0
        </TestCase>0
      </FixtureSet>0

export default DateInputFixtures;0
const React = window.React;0
0
const startDate = new Date();0
/**0
 * This test case was originally provided by @richsoni,0
 * https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/81160
 */0
class SwitchDateTestCase extends React.Component {0
  state = {0
    fullDate: false,0
    date: startDate,0
  };0
0
  render() {0
    const attrs = this.inputAttrs();0
0
    return (0
      <div>0
        <p>0
          <b>{attrs.type}</b> input type ({attrs.value})0
        </p>0
        <p>0
          <input0
            type={attrs.type}0
            value={attrs.value}0
            onChange={this.onInputChange}0
          />0
          <label>0
            <input0
              type="checkbox"0
              checked={this.state.fullDate}0
              onChange={this.updateFullDate}0
            />{' '}0
            Switch type0
          </label>0
        </p>0
      </div>0
    );0
  }0
0
  inputAttrs() {0
    if (this.state.fullDate) {0
      return {0
        type: 'datetime-local',0
        value: this.state.date.toISOString().replace(/\..*Z/, ''),0
      };0
    } else {0
      return {0
        type: 'date',0
        value: this.state.date.toISOString().replace(/T.*/, ''),0
      };0
    }0
  }0
0
  onInputChange = ({target: {value}}) => {0
    const date = value ? new Date(Date.parse(value)) : startDate;0
    this.setState({date});0
  };0
0
  updateFullDate = () => {0
    this.setState({0
      fullDate: !this.state.fullDate,0
    });0
  };0
}0
0
export default SwitchDateTestCase;0
import FixtureSet from '../../FixtureSet';0
import TestCase from '../../TestCase';0
0
const React = window.React;0
const ReactDOM = window.ReactDOM;0
0
function BadRender(props) {0
  props.doThrow();0
}0
class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
  static defaultProps = {0
    buttonText: 'Trigger error',0
  };0
  state = {0
    shouldThrow: false,0
    didThrow: false,0
    error: null,0
  };0
  componentDidCatch(error) {0
    this.setState({error, didThrow: true});0
  }0
  triggerError = () => {0
    this.setState({0
      shouldThrow: true,0
    });0
  };0
  render() {0
    if (this.state.didThrow) {0
      if (this.state.error) {0
        return <p>Captured an error: {this.state.error.message}</p>;0
      } else {0
        return <p>Captured an error: {'' + this.state.error}</p>;0
      }0
    }0
    if (this.state.shouldThrow) {0
      return <BadRender doThrow={this.props.doThrow} />;0
    }0
    return <button onClick={this.triggerError}>{this.props.buttonText}</button>;0
  }0
}0
class Example extends React.Component {0
  state = {key: 0};0
  restart = () => {0
    this.setState(state => ({key: state.key + 1}));0
  };0
  render() {0
    return (0
      <div>0
        <button onClick={this.restart}>Reset</button>0
        <ErrorBoundary0
          buttonText={this.props.buttonText}0
          doThrow={this.props.doThrow}0
          key={this.state.key}0
        />0
      </div>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
class TriggerErrorAndCatch extends React.Component {0
  container = document.createElement('div');0
0
  triggerErrorAndCatch = () => {0
    try {0
      ReactDOM.flushSync(() => {0
        ReactDOM.render(0
          <BadRender0
            doThrow={() => {0
              throw new Error('Caught error');0
            }}0
          />,0
          this.container0
        );0
      });0
    } catch (e) {}0
  };0
0
  render() {0
    return (0
      <button onClick={this.triggerErrorAndCatch}>0
        Trigger error and catch0
      </button>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export default class ErrorHandlingTestCases extends React.Component {0
  render() {0
    return (0
      <FixtureSet title="Error handling" description="">0
        <TestCase0
          title="Break on uncaught exceptions"0
          description="In DEV, errors should be treated as uncaught, even though React catches them internally">0
          <TestCase.Steps>0
            <li>Open the browser DevTools</li>0
            <li>Make sure "Pause on exceptions" is enabled</li>0
            <li>Make sure "Pause on caught exceptions" is disabled</li>0
            <li>Click the "Trigger error" button</li>0
            <li>Click the reset button</li>0
          </TestCase.Steps>0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            The DevTools should pause at the line where the error was thrown, in0
            the BadRender component. After resuming, the "Trigger error" button0
            should be replaced with "Captured an error: Oops!" Clicking reset0
            should reset the test case.0
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          <Example0
            doThrow={() => {0
              throw new Error('Oops!');0
            }}0
          />0
        </TestCase>0
        <TestCase title="Throwing null" description="">0
          <TestCase.Steps>0
            <li>Click the "Trigger error" button</li>0
            <li>Click the reset button</li>0
          </TestCase.Steps>0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            The "Trigger error" button should be replaced with "Captured an0
            error: null". Clicking reset should reset the test case.0
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          <Example0
            doThrow={() => {0
              throw null; // eslint-disable-line no-throw-literal0
            }}0
          />0
        </TestCase>0
        <TestCase0
          title="Cross-origin errors (development mode only)"0
          description="">0
          <TestCase.Steps>0
            <li>Click the "Trigger cross-origin error" button</li>0
            <li>Click the reset button</li>0
          </TestCase.Steps>0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            The "Trigger error" button should be replaced with "Captured an0
            error: A cross-origin error was thrown [...]". The actual error0
            message should be logged to the console: "Uncaught Error: Expected0
            true to be false".0
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          <Example0
            buttonText="Trigger cross-origin error"0
            doThrow={() => {0
              // The `expect` module is loaded via unpkg, so that this assertion0
              // triggers a cross-origin error0
              window.expect(true).toBe(false);0
            }}0
          />0
        </TestCase>0
        <TestCase0
          title="Errors are logged even if they're caught (development mode only)"0
          description="">0
          <TestCase.Steps>0
            <li>Click the "Trigger render error and catch" button</li>0
          </TestCase.Steps>0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            Open the console. "Uncaught Error: Caught error" should have been0
            logged by the browser.0
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          <TriggerErrorAndCatch />0
        </TestCase>0
      </FixtureSet>0
    );0
  }0
}0
const React = window.React;0
0
class HitBox extends React.Component {0
  state = {0
    x: 0,0
    y: 0,0
  };0
0
  static defaultProps = {0
    onMouseMove: n => n,0
  };0
0
  onMove = event => {0
    this.setState({x: event.clientX, y: event.clientY});0
    this.props.onMouseMove(event);0
  };0
0
  render() {0
    const {x, y} = this.state;0
0
    const boxStyle = {0
      padding: '10px 20px',0
      border: '1px solid #d9d9d9',0
      margin: '10px 0 20px',0
    };0
0
    return (0
      <div onMouseMove={this.onMove} style={boxStyle}>0
        <p>Trace your mouse over this box.</p>0
        <p>0
          Last movement: {x},{y}0
        </p>0
      </div>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export default HitBox;0

      </FixtureSet>0
    );0

export default EventPooling;0
import TestCase from '../../TestCase';0
import HitBox from './hit-box';0

const React = window.React;0
0
class MouseMove extends React.Component {0
  state = {0
    events: [],0
  };0
0
  checkEvent = event => {0
    let {events} = this.state;0
0
    if (event.type === 'mousemove' && events.indexOf(event) === -1) {0
      this.setState({events: events.concat(event)});0
    }0
  };0
0
  render() {0
    const {events} = this.state;0
0
    return (0
      <TestCase title="Mouse Move" description="">0
        <TestCase.Steps>0
          <li>Mouse over the box below</li>0
        </TestCase.Steps>0
0
        <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          Mousemove should share the same instance of the event between0
          dispatches.0
        </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
        <HitBox onMouseMove={this.checkEvent} />0
0
        <p>0
          Was the event pooled?{' '}0
          <b>0
            {events.length ? (events.length <= 1 ? 'Yes' : 'No') : 'Unsure'} (0
            {events.length} events)0
          </b>0
        </p>0
      </TestCase>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export default MouseMove;0
import TestCase from '../../TestCase';0
import HitBox from './hit-box';0
0
const React = window.React;0
0
class Persistence extends React.Component {0
  state = {0
    persisted: 0,0
    pooled: [],0
  };0
0
  addPersisted = event => {0
    let {persisted, pooled} = this.state;0
0
    event.persist();0
0
    if (event.type === 'mousemove') {0
      this.setState({0
        persisted: persisted + 1,0
        pooled: pooled.filter(e => e !== event),0
      });0
    }0
  };0
0
  addPooled = event => {0
    let {pooled} = this.state;0
0
    if (event.type === 'mousemove' && pooled.indexOf(event) === -1) {0
      this.setState({pooled: pooled.concat(event)});0
    }0
  };0
0
  render() {0
    const {pooled, persisted} = this.state;0
0
    return (0
      <TestCase title="Persistence" description="">0
        <TestCase.Steps>0
          <li>Mouse over the pooled event box</li>0
          <li>Mouse over the persisted event box</li>0
        </TestCase.Steps>0
0
        <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          The pool size should not increase above 1, but reduce to 0 when0
          hovering over the persisted region.0
        </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
        <h2>Add Pooled Event:</h2>0
        <HitBox onMouseMove={this.addPooled} />0
0
        <h2>Add Persisted Event:</h2>0
        <HitBox onMouseMove={this.addPersisted} />0
0
        <p>Pool size: {pooled.length}</p>0
0
        <p>Persisted size: {persisted}</p>0
      </TestCase>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export default Persistence;0

class InputChangeEvents extends React.Component {0
  render() {0
    return (0
      <FixtureSet0
        title="Input change events"0
        description="Tests proper behavior of the onChange event for inputs">0
        <TestCase0
          title="Range keyboard changes"0
          description={`0
            Range inputs should fire onChange events for keyboard events0
          `}>0
          <TestCase.Steps>0
            <li>Focus range input</li>0
            <li>change value via the keyboard arrow keys</li>0
          </TestCase.Steps>0
0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            The <code>onKeyDown</code> call count should be equal to the{' '}0
            <code>onChange</code> call count.0
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
          <RangeKeyboardFixture />0
        </TestCase>0
0
        <TestCase0
          title="Radio input clicks"0
          description={`0
            Radio inputs should only fire change events when the checked0
            state changes.0
          `}0
          resolvedIn="16.0.0">0
          <TestCase.Steps>0
            <li>Click on the Radio input (or label text)</li>0
          </TestCase.Steps>0
0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            The <code>onChange</code> call count should remain at 00
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
          <RadioClickFixture />0
        </TestCase>0
        <TestCase0
          title="Uncontrolled radio groups"0
          description={`0
            Radio inputs should fire change events when the value moved to0
            another named input0
          `}0
          introducedIn="15.6.0">0
          <TestCase.Steps>0
            <li>Click on the "Radio 2"</li>0
            <li>Click back to "Radio 1"</li>0
            <li>Click back to "Radio 2"</li>0
          </TestCase.Steps>0
0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            The <code>onChange</code> call count increment on each value change0
            (at least 3+)0
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
          <RadioGroupFixture />0
        </TestCase>0
0
        <TestCase0
          title="Inputs with placeholders"0
          description={`0
            Text inputs with placeholders should not trigger changes0
            when the placeholder is altered0
          `}0
          resolvedIn="15.0.0"0
          resolvedBy="#5004"0
          affectedBrowsers="IE9+">0
          <TestCase.Steps>0
            <li>Click on the Text input</li>0
            <li>Click on the "Change placeholder" button</li>0
          </TestCase.Steps>0
0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            The <code>onChange</code> call count should remain at 00
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
          <InputPlaceholderFixture />0
        </TestCase>0
        <TestCase0
          title="Radio button groups with name changes"0
          description={`0
            A radio button group should have correct checked value when0
            the names changes0
          `}0
          resolvedBy="#11227"0
          affectedBrowsers="IE9+">0
          <TestCase.Steps>0
            <li>Click the toggle button</li>0
          </TestCase.Steps>0
0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            The checked radio button should switch between the first and second0
            radio button0
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
          <RadioNameChangeFixture />0
        </TestCase>0
      </FixtureSet>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export default InputChangeEvents;0
import Fixture from '../../Fixture';0
const React = window.React;0
0
class InputPlaceholderFixture extends React.Component {0
  constructor(props, context) {0
    super(props, context);0
0
    this.state = {0
      placeholder: 'A placeholder',0
      changeCount: 0,0
    };0
  }0
0
  handleChange = () => {0
    this.setState(({changeCount}) => {0
      return {0
        changeCount: changeCount + 1,0
      };0
    });0
  };0
  handleGeneratePlaceholder = () => {0
    this.setState({0
      placeholder: `A placeholder: ${Math.random() * 100}`,0
    });0
  };0
0
  handleReset = () => {0
    this.setState({0
      changeCount: 0,0
    });0
  };0
0
  render() {0
    const {placeholder, changeCount} = this.state;0
    const color = changeCount === 0 ? 'green' : 'red';0
0
    return (0
      <Fixture>0
        <input0
          type="text"0
          placeholder={placeholder}0
          onChange={this.handleChange}0
        />{' '}0
        <button onClick={this.handleGeneratePlaceholder}>0
          Change placeholder0
        </button>0
        <p style={{color}}>0
          <code>onChange</code>0
          {' calls: '}0
          <strong>{changeCount}</strong>0
        </p>0
        <button onClick={this.handleReset}>Reset count</button>0
      </Fixture>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export default InputPlaceholderFixture;0

class RadioClickFixture extends React.Component {0
  constructor(props, context) {0
    super(props, context);0

      changeCount: 0,0
    };0
  }0

    this.setState(({changeCount}) => {0
      return {0
        changeCount: changeCount + 1,0
      };0
    });0
  };0
0
  handleReset = () => {0
    this.setState({0
      changeCount: 0,0
    });0
  };0
0

    const {changeCount} = this.state;0
    const color = changeCount === 0 ? 'green' : 'red';0
0
    return (0
      <Fixture>0
        <label>0
          <input defaultChecked type="radio" onChange={this.handleChange} />0
          Test case radio input0
        </label>{' '}0

          {' calls: '}0

class RadioGroupFixture extends React.Component {0
  constructor(props, context) {0
    super(props, context);0
0
    this.state = {0
      changeCount: 0,0
    };0
  }0
0
  handleChange = () => {0
    this.setState(({changeCount}) => {0
      return {0
        changeCount: changeCount + 1,0
      };0
    });0
  };0
0
  handleReset = () => {0
    this.setState({0
      changeCount: 0,0
    });0
  };0
0
  render() {0
    const {changeCount} = this.state;0
    const color = changeCount >= 3 ? 'green' : 'red';0
0
    return (0
      <Fixture>0
        <label>0
          <input0
            defaultChecked0
            name="foo"0
            type="radio"0
            onChange={this.handleChange}0
          />0
          Radio 10
        </label>0
        <label>0
          <input name="foo" type="radio" onChange={this.handleChange} />0
          Radio 20
        </label>{' '}0
        <p style={{color}}>0
          <code>onChange</code>0
          {' calls: '}0
          <strong>{changeCount}</strong>0
        </p>0
        <button onClick={this.handleReset}>Reset count</button>0
      </Fixture>0
    );0
  }0
