export default RadioGroupFixture;0
const React = window.React;0
const noop = n => n;0
0
class RadioNameChangeFixture extends React.Component {0
  state = {0
    updated: false,0
  };0
  onClick = () => {0
    this.setState(state => {0
      return {updated: !state.updated};0
    });0
  };0
  render() {0
    const {updated} = this.state;0
    const radioName = updated ? 'firstName' : 'secondName';0
    return (0
      <div>0
        <label>0
          <input0
            type="radio"0
            name={radioName}0
            onChange={noop}0
            checked={updated === true}0
          />0
          First Radio0
        </label>0
0
        <label>0
          <input0
            type="radio"0
            name={radioName}0
            onChange={noop}0
            checked={updated === false}0
          />0
          Second Radio0
        </label>0
0
        <div>0
          <button type="button" onClick={this.onClick}>0
            Toggle0
          </button>0
        </div>0
      </div>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export default RadioNameChangeFixture;0
import Fixture from '../../Fixture';0
const React = window.React;0
0
class RangeKeyboardFixture extends React.Component {0
  constructor(props, context) {0
    super(props, context);0
0
    this.state = {0
      keydownCount: 0,0
      changeCount: 0,0
    };0
  }0
0
  componentDidMount() {0
    this.input.addEventListener('keydown', this.handleKeydown, false);0
  }0
0
  componentWillUnmount() {0
    this.input.removeEventListener('keydown', this.handleKeydown, false);0
  }0
0
  handleChange = () => {0
    this.setState(({changeCount}) => {0
      return {0
        changeCount: changeCount + 1,0
      };0
    });0
  };0
0
  handleKeydown = e => {0
    // only interesting in arrow key events0
    if ([37, 38, 39, 40].indexOf(e.keyCode) < 0) {0
      return;0
    }0
0
    this.setState(({keydownCount}) => {0
      return {0
        keydownCount: keydownCount + 1,0
      };0
    });0
  };0
0
  handleReset = () => {0
    this.setState({0
      keydownCount: 0,0
      changeCount: 0,0
    });0
  };0
0
  render() {0
    const {keydownCount, changeCount} = this.state;0
    const color = keydownCount === changeCount ? 'green' : 'red';0
0
    return (0
      <Fixture>0
        <div>0
          <input0
            type="range"0
            ref={r => (this.input = r)}0
            onChange={this.handleChange}0
          />0
          <button onClick={() => this.input.focus()}>Focus Knob</button>0
        </div>{' '}0
        <p style={{color}}>0
          <code>onKeyDown</code>0
          {' calls: '}0
          <strong>{keydownCount}</strong>0
          {' vs '}0
          <code>onChange</code>0
          {' calls: '}0
          <strong>{changeCount}</strong>0
        </p>0
        <button onClick={this.handleReset}>Reset counts</button>0
      </Fixture>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export default RangeKeyboardFixture;0
import FixtureSet from '../../FixtureSet';0
import TestCase from '../../TestCase';0
0
const React = window.React;0
0
export default class MediaEvents extends React.Component {0
  state = {0
    playbackRate: 2,0
    events: {0
      onCanPlay: false,0
      onCanPlayThrough: false,0
      onDurationChange: false,0
      onEmptied: false,0
      onEnded: false,0
      onError: false,0
      onLoadedData: false,0
      onLoadedMetadata: false,0
      onLoadStart: false,0
      onPause: false,0
      onPlay: false,0
      onPlaying: false,0
      onProgress: false,0
      onRateChange: false,0
      onSeeked: false,0
      onSeeking: false,0
      onSuspend: false,0
      onTimeUpdate: false,0
      onVolumeChange: false,0
      onWaiting: false,0
    },0
  };0
0
  updatePlaybackRate = () => {0
    this.video.playbackRate = 2;0
  };0
0
  setVideo = el => {0
    this.video = el;0
  };0
0
  eventDidFire(event) {0
    this.setState({0
      events: Object.assign({}, this.state.events, {[event]: true}),0
    });0
  }0
0
  getProgress() {0
    const events = Object.keys(this.state.events);0
    const total = events.length;0
    const fired = events.filter(type => this.state.events[type]).length;0
0
    return fired / total;0
  }0
0
  render() {0
    const events = Object.keys(this.state.events);0
    const handlers = events.reduce((events, event) => {0
      events[event] = this.eventDidFire.bind(this, event);0
      return events;0
    }, {});0
0
    return (0
      <FixtureSet title="Media Events" description="">0
        <TestCase0
          title="Event bubbling"0
          description="Media events should synthetically bubble">0
          <TestCase.Steps>0
            <li>Play the loaded video</li>0
            <li>Pause the loaded video</li>0
            <li>Play the failing video</li>0
            <li>Drag the track bar</li>0
            <li>Toggle the volume button</li>0
            <li>0
              <button onClick={this.updatePlaybackRate}>0
                Click this button to increase playback rate0
              </button>0
            </li>0
          </TestCase.Steps>0
0
          <p className="footnote">0
            Note: This test does not confirm <code>onStalled</code>,{' '}0
            <code>onAbort</code>, or <code>onEncrypted</code>0
          </p>0
0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            All events in the table below should be marked as "true".0
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
          <section {...handlers}>0
            <video src="/test.mp4" width="300" controls ref={this.setVideo} />0
            <video src="/missing.mp4" width="300" controls />0
            <p className="footnote">0
              Note: The second video will not load. This is intentional.0
            </p>0
          </section>0
          <hr />0
          <section>0
            <h3>Events</h3>0
            <p>The following events should bubble:</p>0
            <table>0
              <tbody>{events.map(this.renderOutcome, this)}</tbody>0
            </table>0
          </section>0
        </TestCase>0
      </FixtureSet>0
    );0
  }0
0
  renderOutcome(event) {0
    let fired = this.state.events[event];0
0
    return (0
      <tr key={event}>0
        <td>0
          <b>{event}</b>0
        </td>0
        <td style={{color: fired ? null : 'red'}}>{`${fired}`}</td>0
      </tr>0
    );0
  }0
}0
import FixtureSet from '../../FixtureSet';0
import MouseMovement from './mouse-movement';0
0
const React = window.React;0
0
class MouseEvents extends React.Component {0
  render() {0
    return (0
      <FixtureSet title="Mouse Events" description="">0
        <MouseMovement />0
      </FixtureSet>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export default MouseEvents;0
import TestCase from '../../TestCase';0
0
const React = window.React;0
0
class MouseMovement extends React.Component {0
  state = {0
    movement: {x: 0, y: 0},0
  };0
0
  onMove = event => {0
    this.setState({x: event.movementX, y: event.movementY});0
  };0
0
  render() {0
    const {x, y} = this.state;0
0
    const boxStyle = {0
      padding: '10px 20px',0
      border: '1px solid #d9d9d9',0
      margin: '10px 0 20px',0
    };0
0
    return (0
      <TestCase0
        title="Mouse Movement"0
        description="We polyfill the movementX and movementY fields."0
        affectedBrowsers="IE, Safari">0
        <TestCase.Steps>0
          <li>Mouse over the box below</li>0
        </TestCase.Steps>0
0
        <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          The reported values should equal the pixel (integer) difference0
          between mouse movements positions.0
        </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
        <div style={boxStyle} onMouseMove={this.onMove}>0
          <p>Trace your mouse over this box.</p>0
          <p>0
            Last movement: {x},{y}0
          </p>0
        </div>0
      </TestCase>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0

0
function NumberInputs() {0
  return (0
    <FixtureSet0
      title="Number inputs"0
      description="Number inputs inconsistently assign and report the value0
                     property depending on the browser.">0
      <TestCase0
        title="Backspacing"0
        description="The decimal place should not be lost">0
        <TestCase.Steps>0
          <li>Type "3.1"</li>0
          <li>Press backspace, eliminating the "1"</li>0
        </TestCase.Steps>0
0
        <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          The field should read "3.", preserving the decimal place0
        </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
        <NumberTestCase />0
0
        <p className="footnote">0
          <b>Notes:</b> Modern Chrome and Safari {'<='} 6 clear trailing0
          decimals on blur. React makes this concession so that the value0
          attribute remains in sync with the value property.0
        </p>0
      </TestCase>0
0
      <TestCase0
        title="Decimal precision"0
        description="Supports decimal precision greater than 2 places">0
        <TestCase.Steps>0
          <li>Type "0.01"</li>0
        </TestCase.Steps>0
0
        <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          The field should read "0.01"0
        </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
        <NumberTestCase />0
      </TestCase>0
0
      <TestCase0
        title="Exponent form"0
        description="Supports exponent form ('2e4')">0
        <TestCase.Steps>0
          <li>Type "2e"</li>0
          <li>Type 4, to read "2e4"</li>0
        </TestCase.Steps>0
0
        <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          The field should read "2e4". The parsed value should read "20000"0
        </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
        <NumberTestCase />0
      </TestCase>0
0
      <TestCase title="Exponent Form" description="Pressing 'e' at the end">0
        <TestCase.Steps>0
          <li>Type "3.14"</li>0
          <li>Press "e", so that the input reads "3.14e"</li>0
        </TestCase.Steps>0
0
        <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          The field should read "3.14e", the parsed value should be empty0
        </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
        <NumberTestCase />0
      </TestCase>0
0
      <TestCase0
        title="Exponent Form"0
        description="Supports pressing 'ee' in the middle of a number">0
        <TestCase.Steps>0
          <li>Type "3.14"</li>0
          <li>Move the text cursor to after the decimal place</li>0
          <li>Press "e" twice, so that the value reads "3.ee14"</li>0
        </TestCase.Steps>0
0
        <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          The field should read "3.ee14"0
        </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
        <NumberTestCase />0
      </TestCase>0
0
      <TestCase0
        title="Trailing Zeroes"0
        description="Typing '3.0' preserves the trailing zero">0
        <TestCase.Steps>0
          <li>Type "3.0"</li>0
        </TestCase.Steps>0
0
        <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          The field should read "3.0"0
        </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
        <NumberTestCase />0
      </TestCase>0
0
      <TestCase0
        title="Inserting decimals precision"0
        description="Inserting '.' in to '300' maintains the trailing zeroes">0
        <TestCase.Steps>0
          <li>Type "300"</li>0
          <li>Move the cursor to after the "3"</li>0
          <li>Type "."</li>0
        </TestCase.Steps>0
0
        <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          The field should read "3.00", not "3"0
        </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
        <NumberTestCase />0
      </TestCase>0
0
      <TestCase0
        title="Replacing numbers with -"0
        description="Replacing a number with the '-' sign should not clear the value">0
        <TestCase.Steps>0
          <li>Type "3"</li>0
          <li>Select the entire value"</li>0
          <li>Type '-' to replace '3' with '-'</li>0
        </TestCase.Steps>0
0
        <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          The field should read "-", not be blank.0
        </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
        <NumberTestCase />0
      </TestCase>0
0
      <TestCase0
        title="Negative numbers"0
        description="Typing minus when inserting a negative number should work">0
        <TestCase.Steps>0
          <li>Type "-"</li>0
          <li>Type '3'</li>0
        </TestCase.Steps>0
0
        <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          The field should read "-3".0
        </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
        <NumberTestCase />0
      </TestCase>0
      <TestCase0
        title="Decimal numbers"0
        description="eg: initial value is '.98', when format to '0.98', should change to '0.98' ">0
        <TestCase.Steps>0
          <li>initial value is '.98'</li>0
          <li>setState to '0.98'</li>0
        </TestCase.Steps>0
0
        <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          the input value should be '0.98'.0
        </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
        <NumberInputDecimal />0
      </TestCase>0
0
      <TestCase0
        title="Trailing zeroes"0
        description="Extraneous zeroes should be retained when changing the value via setState">0
        <TestCase.Steps>0
          <li>Change the text to 4.0000</li>0
          <li>Click "Reset to 3.0000"</li>0
        </TestCase.Steps>0
0
        <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          The field should read 3.0000, not 30
        </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
        <NumberInputExtraZeroes />0
0
        <p className="footnote">0
          <b>Notes:</b> Firefox drops extraneous zeroes when assigned. Zeroes0
          are preserved when editing, however directly assigning a new value0
          will drop zeroes. This{' '}0
          <a href="https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1003896">0
            is a bug in Firefox0
          </a>{' '}0
          that we can not control for.0
        </p>0
      </TestCase>0
    </FixtureSet>0
  );0
}0

class NumberInputDecimal extends React.Component {0
  state = {value: '.98'};0
  changeValue = () => {0
    this.setState({0
      value: '0.98',0
    });0
  };0
  render() {0
    const {value} = this.state;0
    return (0
      <Fixture>0
        <div>{this.props.children}</div>0
0
        <div className="control-box">0
          <input0
            type="number"0
            value={value}0
            onChange={e => {0
              this.setState({value: e.target.value});0
            }}0
          />0
          <button onClick={this.changeValue}>change.98 to 0.98</button>0
        </div>0
      </Fixture>0
    );0
  }0

class NumberTestCase extends React.Component {0
  state = {value: ''};0
  onChange = event => {0
    const parsed = parseFloat(event.target.value, 10);0
    const value = isNaN(parsed) ? '' : parsed;0
0
    this.setState({value});0
  };0
  render() {0
    return (0
      <Fixture>0
        <div>{this.props.children}</div>0
0
        <div className="control-box">0
          <fieldset>0
            <legend>Controlled</legend>0
            <input0
              type="number"0
              value={this.state.value}0
              onChange={this.onChange}0
            />0
            <span className="hint">0
              {' '}0
              Value: {JSON.stringify(this.state.value)}0
            </span>0
          </fieldset>0
0
          <fieldset>0
            <legend>Uncontrolled</legend>0
            <input type="number" defaultValue={0.5} />0
          </fieldset>0
        </div>0
      </Fixture>0
    );0
  }0
}0

export default PasswordTestCase;0
const React = window.React;0
0
const CIRCLE_SIZE = 80;0
0
class DragBox extends React.Component {0
  state = {0
    hasCapture: false,0
    circleLeft: 80,0
    circleTop: 80,0
  };0
  isDragging = false;0
  previousLeft = 0;0
  previousTop = 0;0
0
  onDown = event => {0
    this.isDragging = true;0
    event.target.setPointerCapture(event.pointerId);0
0
    // We store the initial coordinates to be able to calculate the changes0
    // later on.0
    this.extractPositionDelta(event);0
  };0
0
  onMove = event => {0
    if (!this.isDragging) {0
      return;0
    }0
    const {left, top} = this.extractPositionDelta(event);0
0
    this.setState(({circleLeft, circleTop}) => ({0
      circleLeft: circleLeft + left,0
      circleTop: circleTop + top,0
    }));0
  };0
0
  onUp = event => (this.isDragging = false);0
  onGotCapture = event => this.setState({hasCapture: true});0
  onLostCapture = event => this.setState({hasCapture: false});0
0
  extractPositionDelta = event => {0
    const left = event.pageX;0
    const top = event.pageY;0
    const delta = {0
      left: left - this.previousLeft,0
      top: top - this.previousTop,0
    };0
    this.previousLeft = left;0
    this.previousTop = top;0
    return delta;0
  };0
0
  render() {0
    const {hasCapture, circleLeft, circleTop} = this.state;0
0
    const boxStyle = {0
      border: '1px solid #d9d9d9',0
      margin: '10px 0 20px',0
      minHeight: 400,0
      width: '100%',0
      position: 'relative',0
    };0
0
    const circleStyle = {0
      width: CIRCLE_SIZE,0
      height: CIRCLE_SIZE,0
      borderRadius: CIRCLE_SIZE / 2,0
      position: 'absolute',0
      left: circleLeft,0
      top: circleTop,0
      backgroundColor: hasCapture ? 'blue' : 'green',0
      touchAction: 'none',0
    };0
0
    return (0
      <div style={boxStyle}>0
        <div0
          style={circleStyle}0
          onPointerDown={this.onDown}0
          onPointerMove={this.onMove}0
          onPointerUp={this.onUp}0
          onPointerCancel={this.onUp}0
          onGotPointerCapture={this.onGotCapture}0
          onLostPointerCapture={this.onLostCapture}0
        />0
      </div>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export default DragBox;0
import TestCase from '../../TestCase';0
import DragBox from './drag-box';0
0
const React = window.React;0
0
class Drag extends React.Component {0
  render() {0
    return (0

        <TestCase.Steps>0
          <li>Drag the circle below with any pointer tool</li>0
        </TestCase.Steps>0
0
        <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          While dragging, the circle must have turn blue to indicate that a0
          pointer capture was received.0
        </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
        <DragBox />0
      </TestCase>0
    );0
  }0
}0

const React = window.React;0
0
class DrawBox extends React.Component {0
  render() {0
    const boxStyle = {0
      border: '1px solid #d9d9d9',0
      margin: '10px 0 20px',0
      padding: '20px 20px',0
      touchAction: 'none',0
    };0
0
    const obstacleStyle = {0
      border: '1px solid #d9d9d9',0
      width: '25%',0
      height: '200px',0
      margin: '12.5%',0
      display: 'inline-block',0
    };0
0
    return (0
      <div0
        style={boxStyle}0
        onPointerOver={this.props.onOver}0
        onPointerOut={this.props.onOut}0
        onPointerEnter={this.props.onEnter}0
        onPointerLeave={this.props.onLeave}>0
        <div style={obstacleStyle} />0
        <div style={obstacleStyle} />0
      </div>0
    );0
  }0
}0

export default DrawBox;0
import TestCase from '../../TestCase';0
import HoverBox from './hover-box';0
0
const React = window.React;0
0
class Hover extends React.Component {0
  state = {0
    overs: 0,0
    outs: 0,0
    enters: 0,0
    leaves: 0,0
  };0
0
  onOver = () => this.setState({overs: this.state.overs + 1});0
  onOut = () => this.setState({outs: this.state.outs + 1});0
  onEnter = () => this.setState({enters: this.state.enters + 1});0
  onLeave = () => this.setState({leaves: this.state.leaves + 1});0
0
  render() {0
    const {overs, outs, enters, leaves} = this.state;0
0
    return (0
      <TestCase title="Hover" description="">0
        <TestCase.Steps>0
          <li>Hover over the above box and the obstacles</li>0
        </TestCase.Steps>0
0
        <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
          Overs and outs should increase when moving over the obstacles but0
          enters and leaves should not.0
        </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
        <HoverBox0
          onOver={this.onOver}0
          onOut={this.onOut}0
          onEnter={this.onEnter}0
          onLeave={this.onLeave}0
        />0
0
        <p>0
          Pointer Overs: <b>{overs}</b> <br />0
          Pointer Outs: <b>{outs}</b> <br />0
          Pointer Enters: <b>{enters}</b> <br />0
          Pointer Leaves: <b>{leaves}</b> <br />0
        </p>0
      </TestCase>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0

  };0

    return (0
      <form>0
        <fieldset>0
          <legend>Controlled</legend>0
          <input0
            type="range"0
            value={this.state.value}0
            onChange={this.onChange}0
          />0
          <span className="hint">Value: {this.state.value}</span>0
        </fieldset>0

const React = window.React;0
const ReactDOM = window.ReactDOM;0
0
class SelectFixture extends React.Component {0
  state = {value: ''};0
  _nestedDOMNode = null;0
  _singleFormDOMNode = null;0
  _multipleFormDOMNode = null;0
0
  onChange = event => {0
    this.setState({value: event.target.value});0
  };0
0
  resetSingleOptionForm = event => {0
    event.preventDefault();0
    this._singleFormDOMNode.reset();0
  };0
0
  resetMultipleOptionForm = event => {0
    event.preventDefault();0
    this._multipleFormDOMNode.reset();0
  };0
0
  componentDidMount() {0
    this._renderNestedSelect();0
  }0
0
  componentDidUpdate() {0
    this._renderNestedSelect();0
  }0
0
  _renderNestedSelect() {0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <select value={this.state.value} onChange={this.onChange}>0
        <option value="">Select a color</option>0
        <option value="red">Red</option>0
        <option value="blue">Blue</option>0
        <option value="green">Green</option>0
      </select>,0
      this._nestedDOMNode0
    );0
  }0
0
  render() {0
    return (0
      <FixtureSet title="Selects" description="">0
        <form className="field-group">0
          <fieldset>0
            <legend>Controlled</legend>0
            <select value={this.state.value} onChange={this.onChange}>0
              <option value="">Select a color</option>0
              <option value="red">Red</option>0
              <option value="blue">Blue</option>0
              <option value="green">Green</option>0
            </select>0
            <span className="hint">Value: {this.state.value}</span>0
          </fieldset>0
          <fieldset>0
            <legend>Uncontrolled</legend>0
            <select defaultValue="">0
              <option value="">Select a color</option>0
              <option value="red">Red</option>0
              <option value="blue">Blue</option>0
              <option value="green">Green</option>0
            </select>0
          </fieldset>0
          <fieldset>0
            <legend>Controlled in nested subtree</legend>0
            <div ref={node => (this._nestedDOMNode = node)} />0
            <span className="hint">0
              This should synchronize in both direction with the "Controlled".0
            </span>0
          </fieldset>0
        </form>0
0
        <TestCase title="A selected disabled option" relatedIssues="2803">0
          <TestCase.Steps>0
            <li>Open the select</li>0
            <li>Select "1"</li>0
            <li>Attempt to reselect "Please select an item"</li>0
          </TestCase.Steps>0
0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            The initial picked option should be "Please select an item", however0
            it should not be a selectable option.0
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
          <div className="test-fixture">0
            <select defaultValue="">0
              <option value="" disabled>0
                Please select an item0
              </option>0
              <option>0</option>0
              <option>1</option>0
              <option>2</option>0
            </select>0
          </div>0
        </TestCase>0
0
        <TestCase title="An unselected disabled option" relatedIssues="2803">0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            The initial picked option value should "0": the first non-disabled0
            option.0
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
          <div className="test-fixture">0
            <select defaultValue="">0
              <option disabled>Please select an item</option>0
              <option>0</option>0
              <option>1</option>0
              <option>2</option>0
            </select>0
          </div>0
        </TestCase>0
0
        <TestCase title="A single select being reset">0
          <TestCase.Steps>0
            <li>Open the select</li>0
            <li>Select "baz" or "foo"</li>0
            <li>Click the "Reset" button</li>0
          </TestCase.Steps>0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            The select should be reset to the initial value, "bar"0
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
          <div className="test-fixture">0
            <form ref={n => (this._singleFormDOMNode = n)}>0
              <select defaultValue="bar">0
                <option value="foo">foo</option>0
                <option value="bar">bar</option>0
                <option value="baz">baz</option>0
              </select>0
              <button onClick={this.resetSingleOptionForm}>Reset</button>0
            </form>0
          </div>0
        </TestCase>0
0
        <TestCase title="A multiple select being reset">0
          <TestCase.Steps>0
            <li>Select any combination of options</li>0
            <li>Click the "Reset" button</li>0
          </TestCase.Steps>0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            The select should be reset to the initial values "foo" and "baz"0
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
          <div className="test-fixture">0
            <form ref={n => (this._multipleFormDOMNode = n)}>0
              <select multiple defaultValue={['foo', 'baz']}>0
                <option value="foo">foo</option>0
                <option value="bar">bar</option>0
                <option value="baz">baz</option>0
              </select>0
              <button onClick={this.resetMultipleOptionForm}>Reset</button>0
            </form>0
          </div>0
        </TestCase>0
      </FixtureSet>0
    );0
  }0
}0

const React = window.React;0
0
class TextInputFixtures extends React.Component {0
  render() {0
    return (0
      <FixtureSet0
        title="Inputs"0
        description="Common behavior across controlled and uncontrolled inputs">0
        <TestCase title="Numbers in a controlled text field with no handler">0
          <TestCase.Steps>0
            <li>Move the cursor to after "2" in the text field</li>0
            <li>Type ".2" into the text input</li>0
          </TestCase.Steps>0
0
          <TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
            The text field's value should not update.0
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
          <Fixture>0
            <div className="control-box">0
              <fieldset>0
                <legend>Value as number</legend>0
                <input value={2} onChange={() => {}} />0
              </fieldset>0
0
              <fieldset>0
                <legend>Value as string</legend>0
                <input value={'2'} onChange={() => {}} />0
              </fieldset>0
            </div>0
          </Fixture>0

          <p className="footnote">0
            This issue was first introduced when we added extra logic to number0
            inputs to prevent unexpected behavior in Chrome and Safari (see the0
            number input test case).0
          </p>0
        </TestCase>0
0
        <TestCase0
          title="Required Inputs"0
          affectedBrowsers="Firefox"0
          relatedIssues="8395">0
          <TestCase.Steps>0
            <li>View this test in Firefox</li>0
          </TestCase.Steps>0

            You should{' '}0
            <b>0
              <i>not</i>0
            </b>{' '}0
            see a red aura, indicating the input is invalid.0
            <br />0
            This aura looks roughly like:0
            <input style={{boxShadow: '0 0 1px 1px red', marginLeft: 8}} />0
          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0
0
          <Fixture>0
            <form className="control-box">0
              <fieldset>0
                <legend>Empty value prop string</legend>0
                <input value="" required={true} />0
              </fieldset>0
              <fieldset>0
                <legend>No value prop</legend>0

              </fieldset>0

              </fieldset>0

            iOS Safari that involved assigning over value/defaultValue0
            properties of the input to prevent a display bug. This also triggers0
            input validation.0
          </p>0

          </p>0
        </TestCase>0

          </TestCase.ExpectedResult>0

          <InputTestCase type="number" defaultValue={0} />0

const React = window.React;0
0
class InputTestCase extends React.Component {0
  static defaultProps = {0
    type: 'text',0
    defaultValue: '',0
    parseAs: 'text',0
  };0
0
  constructor() {0
    super(...arguments);0
0
    this.state = {0
      value: this.props.defaultValue,0
    };0
  }0
0
  onChange = event => {0
    const raw = event.target.value;0
0
    switch (this.props.type) {0
      case 'number':0
        const parsed = parseFloat(event.target.value, 10);0
0
        this.setState({value: isNaN(parsed) ? '' : parsed});0
0
        break;0
      default:0
        this.setState({value: raw});0
    }0
  };0
0
  render() {0
    const {children, type, defaultValue} = this.props;0
    const {value} = this.state;0
0
    return (0
      <Fixture>0
        <div>{children}</div>0
0
        <div className="control-box">0
          <fieldset>0
            <legend>Controlled {type}</legend>0
            <input type={type} value={value} onChange={this.onChange} />0
            <p className="hint">Value: {JSON.stringify(this.state.value)}</p>0
          </fieldset>0
0
          <fieldset>0
            <legend>Uncontrolled {type}</legend>0
            <input type={type} defaultValue={defaultValue} />0
          </fieldset>0
        </div>0
      </Fixture>0
    );0
  }0
}0

class ReplaceEmailInput extends React.Component {0
  state = {0
    formSubmitted: false,0
  };0
0
  onReset = () => {0
    this.setState({formSubmitted: false});0
  };0
0
  onSubmit = event => {0
    event.preventDefault();0
    this.setState({formSubmitted: true});0
  };0
0
  render() {0
    return (0
      <Fixture>0
        <form className="control-box" onSubmit={this.onSubmit}>0
          <fieldset>0
            <legend>Email</legend>0
            {!this.state.formSubmitted ? (0
              <input type="email" />0
            ) : (0
              <input type="text" disabled={true} />0
            )}0
          </fieldset>0
        </form>0
        <button type="button" onClick={this.onReset}>0
          Reset0
        </button>0
      </Fixture>0
    );0
  }0
}0

const React = global.React;0
const ReactDOM = global.ReactDOM;0
0
class Counter extends React.unstable_AsyncComponent {0
  state = {counter: 0};0
  onCommit() {0
    setImmediate(() => {0
      this.setState(state => ({0
        counter: state.counter + 1,0
      }));0
    });0
  }0
  componentDidMount() {0
    this.onCommit();0
  }0
  componentDidUpdate() {0
    this.onCommit();0
  }0
  render() {0
    return <h1>{this.state.counter}</h1>;0
  }0
}0
0
const interval = 200;0
function block() {0
  const endTime = performance.now() + interval;0
  while (performance.now() < endTime) {}0
}0
setInterval(block, interval);0
0
// Should render a counter that increments approximately every second (the0
// expiration time of a low priority update).0
ReactDOM.render(<Counter />, document.getElementById('root'));0
block();0
import React, {Component} from 'react';0
import Draggable from 'react-draggable';0
import ReactNoop from 'react-noop-renderer';0
import Editor from './Editor';0
import Fibers from './Fibers';0
import describeFibers from './describeFibers';0
0
// The only place where we use it.0
const ReactFiberInstrumentation =0
  ReactNoop.__SECRET_INTERNALS_DO_NOT_USE_OR_YOU_WILL_BE_FIRED0
    .ReactFiberInstrumentation;0
0
function getFiberState(root, workInProgress) {0
  if (!root) {0
    return null;0
  }0
  return describeFibers(root.current, workInProgress);0
}0
0
const defaultCode = `0
log('Render <div>Hello</div>');0
ReactNoop.render(<div>Hello</div>);0
ReactNoop.flush();0
0
log('Render <h1>Goodbye</h1>');0
ReactNoop.render(<h1>Goodbye</h1>);0
ReactNoop.flush();0
`;0
0
class App extends Component {0
  constructor(props) {0
    super(props);0
    this.state = {0
      code: localStorage.getItem('fiber-debugger-code') || defaultCode,0
      isEditing: false,0
      history: [],0
      currentStep: 0,0
      show: {0
        alt: false,0
        child: true,0
        sibling: true,0
        return: false,0
        fx: false,0
      },0
      graphSettings: {0
        rankdir: 'TB',0
        trackActive: true,0
      },0
    };0
  }0
0
  componentDidMount() {0
    this.runCode(this.state.code);0
  }0
0
  runCode(code) {0
    let currentStage;0
    let currentRoot;0
0
    ReactFiberInstrumentation.debugTool = null;0
    ReactNoop.render(null);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    ReactFiberInstrumentation.debugTool = {0
      onMountContainer: root => {0
        currentRoot = root;0
      },0
      onUpdateContainer: root => {0
        currentRoot = root;0
      },0
      onBeginWork: fiber => {0
        const fibers = getFiberState(currentRoot, fiber);0
        const stage = currentStage;0
        this.setState(({history}) => ({0
          history: [0
            ...history,0
            {0
              action: 'BEGIN',0
              fibers,0
              stage,0
            },0
          ],0
        }));0
      },0
      onCompleteWork: fiber => {0
        const fibers = getFiberState(currentRoot, fiber);0
        const stage = currentStage;0
        this.setState(({history}) => ({0
          history: [0
            ...history,0
            {0
              action: 'COMPLETE',0
              fibers,0
              stage,0
            },0
          ],0
        }));0
      },0
      onCommitWork: fiber => {0
        const fibers = getFiberState(currentRoot, fiber);0
        const stage = currentStage;0
        this.setState(({history}) => ({0
          history: [0
            ...history,0
            {0
              action: 'COMMIT',0
              fibers,0
              stage,0
            },0
          ],0
        }));0
      },0
    };0
    window.React = React;0
    window.ReactNoop = ReactNoop;0
    window.expect = () => ({0
      toBe() {},0
      toContain() {},0
      toEqual() {},0
    });0
    window.log = s => (currentStage = s);0
    // eslint-disable-next-line0
    eval(0
      window.Babel.transform(code, {0
        presets: ['react', 'es2015'],0
      }).code0
    );0
  }0
0
  handleEdit = e => {0
    e.preventDefault();0
    this.setState({0
      isEditing: true,0
    });0
  };0
0
  handleCloseEdit = nextCode => {0
    localStorage.setItem('fiber-debugger-code', nextCode);0
    this.setState({0
      isEditing: false,0
      history: [],0
      currentStep: 0,0
      code: nextCode,0
    });0
    this.runCode(nextCode);0
  };0
0
  render() {0
    const {history, currentStep, isEditing, code} = this.state;0
    if (isEditing) {0
      return <Editor code={code} onClose={this.handleCloseEdit} />;0
    }0
0
    const {fibers, action, stage} = history[currentStep] || {};0
    let friendlyAction;0
    if (fibers) {0
      let wipFiber = fibers.descriptions[fibers.workInProgressID];0
      let friendlyFiber = wipFiber.type || wipFiber.tag + ' #' + wipFiber.id;0
      friendlyAction = `After ${action} on ${friendlyFiber}`;0
    }0
0
    return (0
      <div style={{height: '100%'}}>0
        {fibers && (0
          <Draggable>0
            <Fibers0
              fibers={fibers}0
              show={this.state.show}0
              graphSettings={this.state.graphSettings}0
            />0
          </Draggable>0
        )}0
        <div0
          style={{0
            width: '100%',0
            textAlign: 'center',0
            position: 'fixed',0
            bottom: 0,0
            padding: 10,0
            zIndex: 1,0
            backgroundColor: '#fafafa',0
            border: '1px solid #ccc',0
          }}>0
          <div style={{width: '50%', float: 'left'}}>0
            <input0
              type="range"0
              style={{width: '25%'}}0
              min={0}0
              max={history.length - 1}0
              value={currentStep}0
              onChange={e =>0
                this.setState({currentStep: Number(e.target.value)})0
              }0
            />0
            <p>0
              Step {currentStep}0
              : {friendlyAction} (0
              <a style={{color: 'gray'}} onClick={this.handleEdit} href="#">0
                Edit0
              </a>0
              )0
            </p>0
            {stage && <p>Stage: {stage}</p>}0
            {Object.keys(this.state.show).map(key => (0
              <label style={{marginRight: '10px'}} key={key}>0
                <input0
                  type="checkbox"0
                  checked={this.state.show[key]}0
                  onChange={e => {0
                    this.setState(({show}) => ({0
                      show: {...show, [key]: !show[key]},0
                    }));0
                  }}0
                />0
                {key}0
              </label>0
            ))}0
          </div>0
          <div style={{width: '50%', float: 'right'}}>0
            <h5>Graph Settings</h5>0
            <p>0
              <label style={{display: ''}}>0
                Direction:0
                <select0
                  onChange={e => {0
                    const rankdir = e.target.value;0
                    this.setState(({graphSettings}) => ({0
                      graphSettings: {...graphSettings, rankdir},0
                    }));0
                  }}>0
                  <option value="TB">top-down</option>0
                  <option value="BT">down-top</option>0
                  <option value="LR">left-right</option>0
                  <option value="RL">right-left</option>0
                </select>0
              </label>0
            </p>0
            <p>0
              <label style={{marginRight: '10px'}}>0
                <input0
                  type="checkbox"0
                  checked={this.state.graphSettings.trackActive}0
                  onChange={e => {0
                    this.setState(({graphSettings}) => ({0
                      graphSettings: {0
                        ...graphSettings,0
                        trackActive: !graphSettings.trackActive,0
                      },0
                    }));0
                  }}0
                />0
                Track active fiber0
              </label>0
            </p>0
          </div>0
        </div>0
      </div>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export default App;0
let nextFiberID = 1;0
const fiberIDMap = new WeakMap();0
0
function getFiberUniqueID(fiber) {0
  if (!fiberIDMap.has(fiber)) {0
    fiberIDMap.set(fiber, nextFiberID++);0
  }0
  return fiberIDMap.get(fiber);0
}0
0
function getFriendlyTag(tag) {0
  switch (tag) {0
    case 0:0
      return '[indeterminate]';0
    case 1:0
      return '[fn]';0
    case 2:0
      return '[class]';0
    case 3:0
      return '[root]';0
    case 4:0
      return '[portal]';0
    case 5:0
      return '[host]';0
    case 6:0
      return '[text]';0
    case 7:0
      return '[coroutine]';0
    case 8:0
      return '[handler]';0
    case 9:0
      return '[yield]';0
    case 10:0
      return '[frag]';0
    default:0
      throw new Error('Unknown tag.');0
  }0
}0
0
function getFriendlyEffect(effectTag) {0
  const effects = {0
    1: 'Performed Work',0
    2: 'Placement',0
    4: 'Update',0
    8: 'Deletion',0
    16: 'Content reset',0
    32: 'Callback',0
    64: 'Err',0
    128: 'Ref',0
  };0
  return Object.keys(effects)0
    .filter(flag => flag & effectTag)0
    .map(flag => effects[flag])0
    .join(' & ');0
}0
0
export default function describeFibers(rootFiber, workInProgress) {0
  let descriptions = {};0
  function acknowledgeFiber(fiber) {0
    if (!fiber) {0
      return null;0
    }0
    if (!fiber.return && fiber.tag !== 3) {0
      return null;0
    }0
    const id = getFiberUniqueID(fiber);0
    if (descriptions[id]) {0
      return id;0
    }0
    descriptions[id] = {};0
    Object.assign(descriptions[id], {0
      ...fiber,0
      id: id,0
      tag: getFriendlyTag(fiber.tag),0
      effectTag: getFriendlyEffect(fiber.effectTag),0
      type: fiber.type && '<' + (fiber.type.name || fiber.type) + '>',0
      stateNode: `[${typeof fiber.stateNode}]`,0
      return: acknowledgeFiber(fiber.return),0
      child: acknowledgeFiber(fiber.child),0
      sibling: acknowledgeFiber(fiber.sibling),0
      nextEffect: acknowledgeFiber(fiber.nextEffect),0
      firstEffect: acknowledgeFiber(fiber.firstEffect),0
      lastEffect: acknowledgeFiber(fiber.lastEffect),0
      alternate: acknowledgeFiber(fiber.alternate),0
    });0
    return id;0
  }0
0
  const rootID = acknowledgeFiber(rootFiber);0
  const workInProgressID = acknowledgeFiber(workInProgress);0
0
  let currentIDs = new Set();0
  function markAsCurent(id) {0
    currentIDs.add(id);0
    const fiber = descriptions[id];0
    if (fiber.sibling) {0
      markAsCurent(fiber.sibling);0
    }0
    if (fiber.child) {0
      markAsCurent(fiber.child);0
    }0
  }0
  markAsCurent(rootID);0
0
  return {0
    descriptions,0
    rootID,0
    currentIDs: Array.from(currentIDs),0
    workInProgressID,0
  };0
}0
import React, {Component} from 'react';0
0
class Editor extends Component {0
  constructor(props) {0
    super(props);0
    this.state = {0
      code: props.code,0
    };0
  }0
0
  render() {0
    return (0
      <div0
        style={{0
          height: '100%',0
          width: '100%',0
        }}>0
        <textarea0
          value={this.state.code}0
          onChange={e => this.setState({code: e.target.value})}0
          style={{0
            height: '80%',0
            width: '100%',0
            fontSize: '15px',0
          }}0
        />0
        <div style={{height: '20%', textAlign: 'center'}}>0
          <button0
            onClick={() => this.props.onClose(this.state.code)}0
            style={{fontSize: 'large'}}>0
            Run0
          </button>0
        </div>0
      </div>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export default Editor;0
import React from 'react';0
import {Motion, spring} from 'react-motion';0
import dagre from 'dagre';0
// import prettyFormat from 'pretty-format';0
// import reactElement from 'pretty-format/plugins/ReactElement';0
0
function getFiberColor(fibers, id) {0
  if (fibers.currentIDs.indexOf(id) > -1) {0
    return 'lightgreen';0
  }0
  if (id === fibers.workInProgressID) {0
    return 'yellow';0
  }0
  return 'lightyellow';0
}0
0
function Graph(props) {0
  const {rankdir, trackActive} = props.settings;0
  var g = new dagre.graphlib.Graph();0
  g.setGraph({0
    width: 1000,0
    height: 1000,0
    nodesep: 50,0
    edgesep: 150,0
    ranksep: 100,0
    marginx: 100,0
    marginy: 100,0
    rankdir,0
  });0
0
  var edgeLabels = {};0
  React.Children.forEach(props.children, function(child) {0
    if (!child) {0
      return;0
    }0
    if (child.type.isVertex) {0
      g.setNode(child.key, {0
        label: child,0
        width: child.props.width,0
        height: child.props.height,0
      });0
    } else if (child.type.isEdge) {0
      const relationshipKey = child.props.source + ':' + child.props.target;0
      if (!edgeLabels[relationshipKey]) {0
        edgeLabels[relationshipKey] = [];0
      }0
      edgeLabels[relationshipKey].push(child);0
    }0
  });0
0
  Object.keys(edgeLabels).forEach(key => {0
    const children = edgeLabels[key];0
    const child = children[0];0
    g.setEdge(child.props.source, child.props.target, {0
      label: child,0
      allChildren: children.map(c => c.props.children),0
      weight: child.props.weight,0
    });0
  });0
0
  dagre.layout(g);0
0
  var activeNode = g0
    .nodes()0
    .map(v => g.node(v))0
    .find(node => node.label.props.isActive);0
  const [winX, winY] = [window.innerWidth / 2, window.innerHeight / 2];0
  var focusDx = trackActive && activeNode ? winX - activeNode.x : 0;0
  var focusDy = trackActive && activeNode ? winY - activeNode.y : 0;0
0
  var nodes = g.nodes().map(v => {0
    var node = g.node(v);0
    return (0
      <Motion0
        style={{0
          x: props.isDragging ? node.x + focusDx : spring(node.x + focusDx),0
          y: props.isDragging ? node.y + focusDy : spring(node.y + focusDy),0
        }}0
        key={node.label.key}>0
        {interpolatingStyle =>0
          React.cloneElement(node.label, {0
            x: interpolatingStyle.x + props.dx,0
            y: interpolatingStyle.y + props.dy,0
            vanillaX: node.x,0
            vanillaY: node.y,0
          })0
        }0
      </Motion>0
    );0
  });0
0
  var edges = g.edges().map(e => {0
    var edge = g.edge(e);0
    let idx = 0;0
    return (0
      <Motion0
        style={edge.points.reduce((bag, point) => {0
          bag[idx + ':x'] = props.isDragging0
            ? point.x + focusDx0
            : spring(point.x + focusDx);0
          bag[idx + ':y'] = props.isDragging0
            ? point.y + focusDy0
            : spring(point.y + focusDy);0
          idx++;0
          return bag;0
        }, {})}0
        key={edge.label.key}>0
        {interpolatedStyle => {0
          let points = [];0
          Object.keys(interpolatedStyle).forEach(key => {0
            const [idx, prop] = key.split(':');0
            if (!points[idx]) {0
              points[idx] = {x: props.dx, y: props.dy};0
            }0
            points[idx][prop] += interpolatedStyle[key];0
          });0
          return React.cloneElement(edge.label, {0
            points,0
            id: edge.label.key,0
            children: edge.allChildren.join(', '),0
          });0
        }}0
      </Motion>0
    );0
  });0
0
  return (0
    <div0
      style={{0
        position: 'relative',0
        height: '100%',0
      }}>0
      {edges}0
      {nodes}0
    </div>0
  );0
}0
0
function Vertex(props) {0
  if (Number.isNaN(props.x) || Number.isNaN(props.y)) {0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  return (0
    <div0
      style={{0
        position: 'absolute',0
        border: '1px solid black',0
        left: props.x - props.width / 2,0
        top: props.y - props.height / 2,0
        width: props.width,0
        height: props.height,0
        overflow: 'hidden',0
        padding: '4px',0
        wordWrap: 'break-word',0
      }}>0
      {props.children}0
    </div>0
  );0
}0
Vertex.isVertex = true;0
0
const strokes = {0
  alt: 'blue',0
  child: 'green',0
  sibling: 'darkgreen',0
  return: 'red',0
  fx: 'purple',0
};0
0
function Edge(props) {0
  var points = props.points;0
  var path = 'M' + points[0].x + ' ' + points[0].y + ' ';0
0
  if (!points[0].x || !points[0].y) {0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  for (var i = 1; i < points.length; i++) {0
    path += 'L' + points[i].x + ' ' + points[i].y + ' ';0
    if (!points[i].x || !points[i].y) {0
      return null;0
    }0
  }0
0
  var lineID = props.id;0
0
  return (0
    <svg0
      width="100%"0
      height="100%"0
      style={{0
        position: 'absolute',0
        left: 0,0
        right: 0,0
        top: 0,0
        bottom: 0,0
      }}>0
      <defs>0
        <path d={path} id={lineID} />0
        <marker0
          id="markerCircle"0
          markerWidth="8"0
          markerHeight="8"0
          refX="5"0
          refY="5">0
          <circle cx="5" cy="5" r="3" style={{stroke: 'none', fill: 'black'}} />0
        </marker>0
        <marker0
          id="markerArrow"0
          markerWidth="13"0
          markerHeight="13"0
          refX="2"0
          refY="6"0
          orient="auto">0
          <path d="M2,2 L2,11 L10,6 L2,2" style={{fill: 'black'}} />0
        </marker>0
      </defs>0
0
      <use0
        xlinkHref={`#${lineID}`}0
        fill="none"0
        stroke={strokes[props.kind]}0
        style={{0
          markerStart: 'url(#markerCircle)',0
          markerEnd: 'url(#markerArrow)',0
        }}0
      />0
      <text>0
        <textPath xlinkHref={`#${lineID}`}>0
          {'     '}0
          {props.children}0
        </textPath>0
      </text>0
    </svg>0
  );0
}0
Edge.isEdge = true;0
0
function formatPriority(priority) {0
  switch (priority) {0
    case 1:0
      return 'synchronous';0
    case 2:0
      return 'task';0
    case 3:0
      return 'hi-pri work';0
    case 4:0
      return 'lo-pri work';0
    case 5:0
      return 'offscreen work';0
    default:0
      throw new Error('Unknown priority.');0
  }0
}0
0
export default function Fibers({fibers, show, graphSettings, ...rest}) {0
  const items = Object.keys(fibers.descriptions).map(0
    id => fibers.descriptions[id]0
  );0
0
  const isDragging = rest.className.indexOf('dragging') > -1;0
  const [_, sdx, sdy] =0
    rest.style.transform.match(/translate\((-?\d+)px,(-?\d+)px\)/) || [];0
  const dx = Number(sdx);0
  const dy = Number(sdy);0
0
  return (0
    <div0
      {...rest}0
      style={{0
        width: '100%',0
        height: '100%',0
        position: 'absolute',0
        top: 0,0
        left: 0,0
        ...rest.style,0
        transform: null,0
      }}>0
      <Graph0
        className="graph"0
        dx={dx}0
        dy={dy}0
        isDragging={isDragging}0
        settings={graphSettings}>0
        {items.map(fiber => [0
          <Vertex0
            key={fiber.id}0
            width={150}0
            height={100}0
            isActive={fiber.id === fibers.workInProgressID}>0
            <div0
              style={{0
                width: '100%',0
                height: '100%',0
                backgroundColor: getFiberColor(fibers, fiber.id),0
              }}0
              title={0
                /*prettyFormat(fiber, { plugins: [reactElement ]})*/0
                'todo: this was hanging last time I tried to pretty print'0
              }>0
              <small>0
                {fiber.tag} #{fiber.id}0
              </small>0
              <br />0
              {fiber.type}0
              <br />0
              {fibers.currentIDs.indexOf(fiber.id) === -1 ? (0
                <small>0
                  {fiber.pendingWorkPriority !== 0 && [0
                    <span key="span">0
                      Needs: {formatPriority(fiber.pendingWorkPriority)}0
                    </span>,0
                    <br key="br" />,0
                  ]}0
                  {fiber.memoizedProps !== null &&0
                    fiber.pendingProps !== null && [0
                      fiber.memoizedProps === fiber.pendingProps0
                        ? 'Can reuse memoized.'0
                        : 'Cannot reuse memoized.',0
                      <br key="br" />,0
                    ]}0
                </small>0
              ) : (0
                <small>Committed</small>0
              )}0
              {fiber.effectTag && [0
                <br key="br" />,0
                <small key="small">Effect: {fiber.effectTag}</small>,0
              ]}0
            </div>0
          </Vertex>,0
          fiber.child &&0
            show.child && (0
              <Edge0
                source={fiber.id}0
                target={fiber.child}0
                kind="child"0
                weight={1000}0
                key={`${fiber.id}-${fiber.child}-child`}>0
                child0
              </Edge>0
            ),0
          fiber.sibling &&0
            show.sibling && (0
              <Edge0
                source={fiber.id}0
                target={fiber.sibling}0
                kind="sibling"0
                weight={2000}0
                key={`${fiber.id}-${fiber.sibling}-sibling`}>0
                sibling0
              </Edge>0
            ),0
          fiber.return &&0
            show.return && (0
              <Edge0
                source={fiber.id}0
                target={fiber.return}0
                kind="return"0
                weight={1000}0
                key={`${fiber.id}-${fiber.return}-return`}>0
                return0
              </Edge>0
            ),0
          fiber.nextEffect &&0
            show.fx && (0
              <Edge0
                source={fiber.id}0
                target={fiber.nextEffect}0
                kind="fx"0
                weight={100}0
                key={`${fiber.id}-${fiber.nextEffect}-nextEffect`}>0
                nextFx0
              </Edge>0
            ),0
          fiber.firstEffect &&0
            show.fx && (0
              <Edge0
                source={fiber.id}0
                target={fiber.firstEffect}0
                kind="fx"0
                weight={100}0
                key={`${fiber.id}-${fiber.firstEffect}-firstEffect`}>0
                firstFx0
              </Edge>0
            ),0
          fiber.lastEffect &&0
            show.fx && (0
              <Edge0
                source={fiber.id}0
                target={fiber.lastEffect}0
                kind="fx"0
                weight={100}0
                key={`${fiber.id}-${fiber.lastEffect}-lastEffect`}>0
                lastFx0
              </Edge>0
            ),0
          fiber.alternate &&0
            show.alt && (0
              <Edge0
                source={fiber.id}0
                target={fiber.alternate}0
                kind="alt"0
                weight={10}0
                key={`${fiber.id}-${fiber.alternate}-alt`}>0
                alt0
              </Edge>0
            ),0
        ])}0
      </Graph>0
    </div>0
  );0
}0

const fs = require('fs');0
const path = require('path');0
const child_process = require('child_process');0
0
const fixtureDirs = fs.readdirSync(__dirname).filter(file => {0
  return fs.statSync(path.join(__dirname, file)).isDirectory();0
});0
0
const cmdArgs = [0
  {cmd: 'yarn', args: ['install']},0
  {cmd: 'yarn', args: ['build']},0
];0
0
function buildFixture(cmdArg, path) {0
  const opts = {0
    cwd: path,0
    stdio: 'inherit',0
  };0
  const result = child_process.spawnSync(cmdArg.cmd, cmdArg.args, opts);0
  if (result.status !== 0) {0
    throw new Error(`Failed to build fixtures!`);0
  }0
}0
0
fixtureDirs.forEach(dir => {0
  cmdArgs.forEach(cmdArg => {0
    // we only care about directories that have DEV and PROD directories in0
    // otherwise they don't need to be built0
    const devPath = path.join(__dirname, dir, 'dev');0
0
    if (fs.existsSync(devPath)) {0
      buildFixture(cmdArg, devPath);0
    }0
    const prodPath = path.join(__dirname, dir, 'prod');0
0
    if (fs.existsSync(prodPath)) {0
      buildFixture(cmdArg, prodPath);0
    }0
  });0
});0
0
console.log('-------------------------');0
console.log('All fixtures were built!');0
console.log('Now ensure all frames display a welcome message:');0
console.log('  npm install -g serve');0
console.log('  serve ../..');0
console.log('  open http://localhost:5000/fixtures/packaging/');0
console.log('-------------------------');0

const babelRegister = require('babel-register');0

0

  ignore: /\/(build|node_modules)\//,0
  presets: ['react-app'],0
});0

const express = require('express');0
const path = require('path');0
0
const app = express();0
0
// Application0
if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development') {0
  app.get('/', function(req, res) {0
    // In development mode we clear the module cache between each request to0
    // get automatic hot reloading.0
    for (var key in require.cache) {0
      delete require.cache[key];0
    }0
    const render = require('./render').default;0
    res.send(render(req.url));0
  });0
} else {0
  const render = require('./render').default;0
  app.get('/', function(req, res) {0
    res.send(render(req.url));0
  });0
}0
0
// Static resources0
app.use(express.static(path.resolve(__dirname, '..', 'build')));0
0
// Proxy everything else to create-react-app's webpack development server0
if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development') {0
  app.use(0
    '/',0
    proxy({0
      ws: true,0
      target: 'http://localhost:3001',0
    })0
  );0
}0
0
app.listen(3000, () => {0
  console.log('Listening on port 3000...');0
});0
0
app.on('error', function(error) {0
  if (error.syscall !== 'listen') {0
    throw error;0
  }0
0
  var bind = typeof port === 'string' ? 'Pipe ' + port : 'Port ' + port;0
0
  switch (error.code) {0
    case 'EACCES':0
      console.error(bind + ' requires elevated privileges');0
      process.exit(1);0
      break;0
    case 'EADDRINUSE':0
      console.error(bind + ' is already in use');0
      process.exit(1);0
      break;0
    default:0
      throw error;0
  }0
});0
import React from 'react';0
import {renderToString} from 'react-dom/server';0
0
import App from '../src/components/App';0
0
let assets;0
if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development') {0
  // Use the bundle from create-react-app's server in development mode.0
  assets = {0
    'main.js': '/static/js/bundle.js',0
    'main.css': '',0
  };0
} else {0
  assets = require('../build/asset-manifest.json');0
}0
0
export default function render() {0
  var html = renderToString(<App assets={assets} />);0
  // There's no way to render a doctype in React so prepend manually.0
  // Also append a bootstrap script tag.0
  return '<!DOCTYPE html>' + html;0
}0

import React, {Component} from 'react';0
0
import './Chrome.css';0
0
export default class Chrome extends Component {0
  render() {0
    const assets = this.props.assets;0
    return (0
      <html lang="en">0
        <head>0
          <meta charSet="utf-8" />0
          <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1" />0
          <link rel="shortcut icon" href="favicon.ico" />0
          <link rel="stylesheet" href={assets['main.css']} />0
          <title>{this.props.title}</title>0
        </head>0
        <body>0
          <noscript0
            dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{0
              __html: `<b>Enable JavaScript to run this app.</b>`,0
            }}0
          />0
          {this.props.children}0
          <script0
            dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{0
              __html: `assetManifest = ${JSON.stringify(assets)};`,0
            }}0
          />0
          <script src={assets['main.js']} />0
        </body>0
      </html>0
    );0
  }0
}0
import React, {Component} from 'react';0
0
import './Page.css';0
0
const autofocusedInputs = [0
  <input key="0" autoFocus placeholder="Has auto focus" />,0
  <input key="1" autoFocus placeholder="Has auto focus" />,0
];0
0
export default class Page extends Component {0
  state = {active: false};0
  handleClick = e => {0
    this.setState({active: true});0
  };0
  render() {0
    const link = (0
      <a className="bold" onClick={this.handleClick}>0
        Click Here0
      </a>0
    );0
    return (0
      <div>0
        <p suppressHydrationWarning={true}>A random number: {Math.random()}</p>0
        <p>Autofocus on page load: {autofocusedInputs}</p>0
        <p>{!this.state.active ? link : 'Thanks!'}</p>0
        {this.state.active && <p>Autofocus on update: {autofocusedInputs}</p>}0
      </div>0
    );0
  }0
}0

'use strict';0
0
export * from './src/createSubscription';0
'use strict';0
0
if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production') {0
  module.exports = require('./cjs/create-subscription.production.min.js');0
} else {0
  module.exports = require('./cjs/create-subscription.development.js');0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2014-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import React from 'react';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
type Unsubscribe = () => void;0
0
export function createSubscription<Property, Value>(0
  config: $ReadOnly<{|0
    // Synchronously gets the value for the subscribed property.0
    // Return undefined if the subscribable value is undefined,0
    // Or does not support synchronous reading (e.g. native Promise).0
    getCurrentValue: (source: Property) => Value | void,0
0
    // Setup a subscription for the subscribable value in props, and return an unsubscribe function.0
    // Return false to indicate the property cannot be unsubscribed from (e.g. native Promises).0
    // Due to the variety of change event types, subscribers should provide their own handlers.0
    // Those handlers should not attempt to update state though;0
    // They should call the callback() instead when a subscription changes.0
    subscribe: (0
      source: Property,0
      callback: (value: Value | void) => void,0
    ) => Unsubscribe,0
  |}>,0
): React$ComponentType<{0
  children: (value: Value | void) => React$Node,0
  source: Property,0
}> {0
  const {getCurrentValue, subscribe} = config;0
0
  warning(0
    typeof getCurrentValue === 'function',0
    'Subscription must specify a getCurrentValue function',0
  );0
  warning(0
    typeof subscribe === 'function',0
    'Subscription must specify a subscribe function',0
  );0
0
  type Props = {0
    children: (value: Value) => React$Element<any>,0
    source: Property,0
  };0
  type State = {0
    source: Property,0
    value: Value | void,0
  };0
0
  // Reference: https://gist.github.com/bvaughn/d569177d70b50b58bff69c3c4a5353f30
  class Subscription extends React.Component<Props, State> {0
    state: State = {0
      source: this.props.source,0
      value:0
        this.props.source != null0
          ? getCurrentValue(this.props.source)0
          : undefined,0
    };0
0
    _hasUnmounted: boolean = false;0
    _unsubscribe: Unsubscribe | null = null;0
0
    static getDerivedStateFromProps(nextProps, prevState) {0
      if (nextProps.source !== prevState.source) {0
        return {0
          source: nextProps.source,0
          value:0
            nextProps.source != null0
              ? getCurrentValue(nextProps.source)0
              : undefined,0
        };0
      }0
0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    componentDidMount() {0
      this.subscribe();0
    }0
0
    componentDidUpdate(prevProps, prevState) {0
      if (this.state.source !== prevState.source) {0
        this.unsubscribe(prevState);0
        this.subscribe();0
      }0
    }0
0
    componentWillUnmount() {0
      this.unsubscribe(this.state);0
0
      // Track mounted to avoid calling setState after unmounting0
      // For source like Promises that can't be unsubscribed from.0
      this._hasUnmounted = true;0
    }0
0
    render() {0
      return this.props.children(this.state.value);0
    }0
0
    subscribe() {0
      const {source} = this.state;0
      if (source != null) {0
        const callback = (value: Value | void) => {0
          if (this._hasUnmounted) {0
            return;0
          }0
0
          this.setState(state => {0
            // If the value is the same, skip the unnecessary state update.0
            if (value === state.value) {0
              return null;0
            }0
0
            // If this event belongs to an old or uncommitted data source, ignore it.0
            if (source !== state.source) {0
              return null;0
            }0
0
            return {value};0
          });0
        };0
0
        // Store the unsubscribe method for later (in case the subscribable prop changes).0
        const unsubscribe = subscribe(source, callback);0
        invariant(0
          typeof unsubscribe === 'function',0
          'A subscription must return an unsubscribe function.',0
        );0
0
        // It's safe to store unsubscribe on the instance because0
        // We only read or write that property during the "commit" phase.0
        this._unsubscribe = unsubscribe;0
0
        // External values could change between render and mount,0
        // In some cases it may be important to handle this case.0
        const value = getCurrentValue(this.props.source);0
        if (value !== this.state.value) {0
          this.setState({value});0
        }0
      }0
    }0
0
    unsubscribe(state: State) {0
      if (typeof this._unsubscribe === 'function') {0
        this._unsubscribe();0
      }0
      this._unsubscribe = null;0
    }0
  }0
0
  return Subscription;0
}0

 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let createSubscription;0
let BehaviorSubject;0
let ReactFeatureFlags;0
let React;0
let ReactNoop;0
let ReplaySubject;0
0
describe('createSubscription', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    createSubscription = require('create-subscription').createSubscription;0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode = false;0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
0
    BehaviorSubject = require('rxjs/BehaviorSubject').BehaviorSubject;0
    ReplaySubject = require('rxjs/ReplaySubject').ReplaySubject;0
  });0
0
  function createBehaviorSubject(initialValue) {0
    const behaviorSubject = new BehaviorSubject();0
    if (initialValue) {0
      behaviorSubject.next(initialValue);0
    }0
    return behaviorSubject;0
  }0
0
  function createReplaySubject(initialValue) {0
    const replaySubject = new ReplaySubject();0
    if (initialValue) {0
      replaySubject.next(initialValue);0
    }0
    return replaySubject;0
  }0
0
  it('supports basic subscription pattern', () => {0
    const Subscription = createSubscription({0
      getCurrentValue: source => source.getValue(),0
      subscribe: (source, callback) => {0
        const subscription = source.subscribe(callback);0
        return () => subscription.unsubscribe;0
      },0
    });0
0
    const observable = createBehaviorSubject();0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Subscription source={observable}>0
        {(value = 'default') => {0
          ReactNoop.yield(value);0
          return null;0
        }}0
      </Subscription>,0
    );0
0
    // Updates while subscribed should re-render the child component0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['default']);0
    observable.next(123);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([123]);0
    observable.next('abc');0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['abc']);0
0
    // Unmounting the subscriber should remove listeners0
    ReactNoop.render(<div />);0
    observable.next(456);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([]);0
  });0
0
  it('should support observable types like RxJS ReplaySubject', () => {0
    const Subscription = createSubscription({0
      getCurrentValue: source => {0
        let currentValue;0
        source0
          .subscribe(value => {0
            currentValue = value;0
          })0
          .unsubscribe();0
        return currentValue;0
      },0
      subscribe: (source, callback) => {0
        const subscription = source.subscribe(callback);0
        return () => subscription.unsubscribe;0
      },0
    });0
0
    function render(value = 'default') {0
      ReactNoop.yield(value);0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    const observable = createReplaySubject('initial');0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Subscription source={observable}>{render}</Subscription>);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['initial']);0
    observable.next('updated');0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['updated']);0
0
    // Unsetting the subscriber prop should reset subscribed values0
    ReactNoop.render(<Subscription>{render}</Subscription>);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['default']);0
  });0
0
  describe('Promises', () => {0
    it('should support Promises', async () => {0
      const Subscription = createSubscription({0
        getCurrentValue: source => undefined,0
        subscribe: (source, callback) => {0
          source.then(value => callback(value), value => callback(value));0
          // (Can't unsubscribe from a Promise)0
          return () => {};0
        },0
      });0
0
      function render(hasLoaded) {0
        if (hasLoaded === undefined) {0
          ReactNoop.yield('loading');0
        } else {0
          ReactNoop.yield(hasLoaded ? 'finished' : 'failed');0
        }0
        return null;0
      }0
0
      let resolveA, rejectB;0
      const promiseA = new Promise((resolve, reject) => {0
        resolveA = resolve;0
      });0
      const promiseB = new Promise((resolve, reject) => {0
        rejectB = reject;0
      });0
0
      // Test a promise that resolves after render0
      ReactNoop.render(<Subscription source={promiseA}>{render}</Subscription>);0
      expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['loading']);0
      resolveA(true);0
      await promiseA;0
      expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['finished']);0
0
      // Test a promise that resolves before render0
      // Note that this will require an extra render anyway,0
      // Because there is no way to syncrhonously get a Promise's value0
      rejectB(false);0
      ReactNoop.render(<Subscription source={promiseB}>{render}</Subscription>);0
      expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['loading']);0
      await promiseB.catch(() => true);0
      expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['failed']);0
    });0
0
    it('should still work if unsubscription is managed incorrectly', async () => {0
      const Subscription = createSubscription({0
        getCurrentValue: source => undefined,0
        subscribe: (source, callback) => {0
          source.then(callback);0
          // (Can't unsubscribe from a Promise)0
          return () => {};0
        },0
      });0
0
      function render(value = 'default') {0
        ReactNoop.yield(value);0
        return null;0
      }0
0
      let resolveA, resolveB;0
      const promiseA = new Promise(resolve => (resolveA = resolve));0
      const promiseB = new Promise(resolve => (resolveB = resolve));0
0
      // Subscribe first to Promise A then Promise B0
      ReactNoop.render(<Subscription source={promiseA}>{render}</Subscription>);0
      expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['default']);0
      ReactNoop.render(<Subscription source={promiseB}>{render}</Subscription>);0
      expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['default']);0
0
      // Resolve both Promises0
      resolveB(123);0
      resolveA('abc');0
      await Promise.all([promiseA, promiseB]);0
0
      // Ensure that only Promise B causes an update0
      expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([123]);0
    });0
0
    it('should not call setState for a Promise that resolves after unmount', async () => {0
      const Subscription = createSubscription({0
        getCurrentValue: source => undefined,0
        subscribe: (source, callback) => {0
          source.then(value => callback(value), value => callback(value));0
          // (Can't unsubscribe from a Promise)0
          return () => {};0
        },0
      });0
0
      function render(hasLoaded) {0
        ReactNoop.yield('rendered');0
        return null;0
      }0
0
      let resolvePromise;0
      const promise = new Promise((resolve, reject) => {0
        resolvePromise = resolve;0
      });0
0
      ReactNoop.render(<Subscription source={promise}>{render}</Subscription>);0
      expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['rendered']);0
0
      // Unmount0
      ReactNoop.render(null);0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
0
      // Resolve Promise should not trigger a setState warning0
      resolvePromise(true);0
      await promise;0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('should unsubscribe from old subscribables and subscribe to new subscribables when props change', () => {0
    const Subscription = createSubscription({0
      getCurrentValue: source => source.getValue(),0
      subscribe: (source, callback) => {0
        const subscription = source.subscribe(callback);0
        return () => subscription.unsubscribe();0
      },0
    });0
0
    function render(value = 'default') {0
      ReactNoop.yield(value);0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    const observableA = createBehaviorSubject('a-0');0
    const observableB = createBehaviorSubject('b-0');0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Subscription source={observableA}>{render}</Subscription>,0
    );0
0
    // Updates while subscribed should re-render the child component0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['a-0']);0
0
    // Unsetting the subscriber prop should reset subscribed values0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Subscription source={observableB}>{render}</Subscription>,0
    );0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['b-0']);0
0
    // Updates to the old subscribable should not re-render the child component0
    observableA.next('a-1');0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Updates to the bew subscribable should re-render the child component0
    observableB.next('b-1');0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['b-1']);0
  });0
0
  it('should ignore values emitted by a new subscribable until the commit phase', () => {0
    const log = [];0
0
    function Child({value}) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Child: ' + value);0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    const Subscription = createSubscription({0
      getCurrentValue: source => source.getValue(),0
      subscribe: (source, callback) => {0
        const subscription = source.subscribe(callback);0
        return () => subscription.unsubscribe();0
      },0
    });0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps(nextProps, prevState) {0
        if (nextProps.observed !== prevState.observed) {0
          return {0
            observed: nextProps.observed,0
          };0
        }0
0
        return null;0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        log.push('Parent.componentDidMount');0
      }0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        log.push('Parent.componentDidUpdate');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <Subscription source={this.state.observed}>0
            {(value = 'default') => {0
              ReactNoop.yield('Subscriber: ' + value);0
              return <Child value={value} />;0
            }}0
          </Subscription>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const observableA = createBehaviorSubject('a-0');0
    const observableB = createBehaviorSubject('b-0');0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent observed={observableA} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Subscriber: a-0', 'Child: a-0']);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['Parent.componentDidMount']);0
0
    // Start React update, but don't finish0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent observed={observableB} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushThrough(['Subscriber: b-0']);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['Parent.componentDidMount']);0
0
    // Emit some updates from the uncommitted subscribable0
    observableB.next('b-1');0
    observableB.next('b-2');0
    observableB.next('b-3');0
0
    // Update again0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent observed={observableA} />);0
0
    // Flush everything and ensure that the correct subscribable is used0
    // We expect the last emitted update to be rendered (because of the commit phase value check)0
    // But the intermediate ones should be ignored,0
    // And the final rendered output should be the higher-priority observable.0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'Child: b-0',0
      'Subscriber: b-3',0
      'Child: b-3',0
      'Subscriber: a-0',0
      'Child: a-0',0
    ]);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'Parent.componentDidMount',0
      'Parent.componentDidUpdate',0
      'Parent.componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should not drop values emitted between updates', () => {0
    const log = [];0
0
    function Child({value}) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Child: ' + value);0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    const Subscription = createSubscription({0
      getCurrentValue: source => source.getValue(),0
      subscribe: (source, callback) => {0
        const subscription = source.subscribe(callback);0
        return () => subscription.unsubscribe();0
      },0
    });0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps(nextProps, prevState) {0
        if (nextProps.observed !== prevState.observed) {0
          return {0
            observed: nextProps.observed,0
          };0
        }0
0
        return null;0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        log.push('Parent.componentDidMount');0
      }0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        log.push('Parent.componentDidUpdate');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <Subscription source={this.state.observed}>0
            {(value = 'default') => {0
              ReactNoop.yield('Subscriber: ' + value);0
              return <Child value={value} />;0
            }}0
          </Subscription>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const observableA = createBehaviorSubject('a-0');0
    const observableB = createBehaviorSubject('b-0');0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent observed={observableA} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Subscriber: a-0', 'Child: a-0']);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['Parent.componentDidMount']);0
0
    // Start React update, but don't finish0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent observed={observableB} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushThrough(['Subscriber: b-0']);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['Parent.componentDidMount']);0
0
    // Emit some updates from the old subscribable0
    observableA.next('a-1');0
    observableA.next('a-2');0
0
    // Update again0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent observed={observableA} />);0
0
    // Flush everything and ensure that the correct subscribable is used0
    // We expect the new subscribable to finish rendering,0
    // But then the updated values from the old subscribable should be used.0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'Child: b-0',0
      'Subscriber: a-2',0
      'Child: a-2',0
    ]);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'Parent.componentDidMount',0
      'Parent.componentDidUpdate',0
      'Parent.componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    // Updates from the new subsribable should be ignored.0
    observableB.next('b-1');0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([]);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'Parent.componentDidMount',0
      'Parent.componentDidUpdate',0
      'Parent.componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  describe('warnings', () => {0
    it('should warn for invalid missing getCurrentValue', () => {0
      expect(() => {0
        createSubscription(0
          {0
            subscribe: () => () => {},0
          },0
          () => null,0
        );0
      }).toWarnDev('Subscription must specify a getCurrentValue function');0
    });0
0
    it('should warn for invalid missing subscribe', () => {0
      expect(() => {0
        createSubscription(0
          {0
            getCurrentValue: () => () => {},0
          },0
          () => null,0
        );0
      }).toWarnDev('Subscription must specify a subscribe function');0
    });0
0
    it('should warn if subscribe does not return an unsubscribe method', () => {0
      const Subscription = createSubscription({0
        getCurrentValue: source => undefined,0
        subscribe: (source, callback) => {},0
      });0
0
      const observable = createBehaviorSubject();0
      ReactNoop.render(0
        <Subscription source={observable}>{value => null}</Subscription>,0
      );0
0
      expect(ReactNoop.flush).toThrow(0
        'A subscription must return an unsubscribe function.',0
      );0
    });0
  });0
});0

import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
/**0
 * Accumulates items that must not be null or undefined.0
 *0
 * This is used to conserve memory by avoiding array allocations.0
 *0
 * @return {*|array<*>} An accumulation of items.0
 */0
function accumulate<T>(0
  current: ?(T | Array<T>),0
  next: T | Array<T>,0
): T | Array<T> {0
  invariant(0
    next != null,0
    'accumulate(...): Accumulated items must be not be null or undefined.',0
  );0
0
  if (current == null) {0
    return next;0
  }0
0
  // Both are not empty. Warning: Never call x.concat(y) when you are not0
  // certain that x is an Array (x could be a string with concat method).0
  if (Array.isArray(current)) {0
    return current.concat(next);0
  }0
0
  if (Array.isArray(next)) {0
    return [current].concat(next);0
  }0
0
  return [current, next];0
}0
0
export default accumulate;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2014-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
/**0
 * Accumulates items that must not be null or undefined into the first one. This0
