 * is used to conserve memory by avoiding array allocations, and thus sacrifices0
 * API cleanness. Since `current` can be null before being passed in and not0
 * null after this function, make sure to assign it back to `current`:0
 *0
 * `a = accumulateInto(a, b);`0
 *0
 * This API should be sparingly used. Try `accumulate` for something cleaner.0
 *0
 * @return {*|array<*>} An accumulation of items.0
 */0
0
function accumulateInto<T>(0
  current: ?(Array<T> | T),0
  next: T | Array<T>,0
): T | Array<T> {0
  invariant(0
    next != null,0
    'accumulateInto(...): Accumulated items must not be null or undefined.',0
  );0
0
  if (current == null) {0
    return next;0
  }0
0
  // Both are not empty. Warning: Never call x.concat(y) when you are not0
  // certain that x is an Array (x could be a string with concat method).0
  if (Array.isArray(current)) {0
    if (Array.isArray(next)) {0
      current.push.apply(current, next);0
      return current;0
    }0
    current.push(next);0
    return current;0
  }0
0
  if (Array.isArray(next)) {0
    // A bit too dangerous to mutate `next`.0
    return [current].concat(next);0
  }0
0
  return [current, next];0
}0
0
export default accumulateInto;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import ReactErrorUtils from 'shared/ReactErrorUtils';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
import {0
  injectEventPluginOrder,0
  injectEventPluginsByName,0
  plugins,0
} from './EventPluginRegistry';0
import {0
  executeDispatchesInOrder,0
  getFiberCurrentPropsFromNode,0
} from './EventPluginUtils';0
import accumulateInto from './accumulateInto';0
import forEachAccumulated from './forEachAccumulated';0
0
import type {PluginModule} from './PluginModuleType';0
import type {ReactSyntheticEvent} from './ReactSyntheticEventType';0
import type {Fiber} from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiber';0
import type {AnyNativeEvent} from './PluginModuleType';0
import type {TopLevelType} from './TopLevelEventTypes';0
0
/**0
 * Internal queue of events that have accumulated their dispatches and are0
 * waiting to have their dispatches executed.0
 */0
let eventQueue: ?(Array<ReactSyntheticEvent> | ReactSyntheticEvent) = null;0
0
/**0
 * Dispatches an event and releases it back into the pool, unless persistent.0
 *0
 * @param {?object} event Synthetic event to be dispatched.0
 * @param {boolean} simulated If the event is simulated (changes exn behavior)0
 * @private0
 */0
const executeDispatchesAndRelease = function(0
  event: ReactSyntheticEvent,0
  simulated: boolean,0
) {0
  if (event) {0
    executeDispatchesInOrder(event, simulated);0
0
    if (!event.isPersistent()) {0
      event.constructor.release(event);0
    }0
  }0
};0
const executeDispatchesAndReleaseSimulated = function(e) {0
  return executeDispatchesAndRelease(e, true);0
};0
const executeDispatchesAndReleaseTopLevel = function(e) {0
  return executeDispatchesAndRelease(e, false);0
};0
0
function isInteractive(tag) {0
  return (0
    tag === 'button' ||0
    tag === 'input' ||0
    tag === 'select' ||0
    tag === 'textarea'0
  );0
}0
0
function shouldPreventMouseEvent(name, type, props) {0
  switch (name) {0
    case 'onClick':0
    case 'onClickCapture':0
    case 'onDoubleClick':0
    case 'onDoubleClickCapture':0
    case 'onMouseDown':0
    case 'onMouseDownCapture':0
    case 'onMouseMove':0
    case 'onMouseMoveCapture':0
    case 'onMouseUp':0
    case 'onMouseUpCapture':0
      return !!(props.disabled && isInteractive(type));0
    default:0
      return false;0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * This is a unified interface for event plugins to be installed and configured.0
 *0
 * Event plugins can implement the following properties:0
 *0
 *   `extractEvents` {function(string, DOMEventTarget, string, object): *}0
 *     Required. When a top-level event is fired, this method is expected to0
 *     extract synthetic events that will in turn be queued and dispatched.0
 *0
 *   `eventTypes` {object}0
 *     Optional, plugins that fire events must publish a mapping of registration0
 *     names that are used to register listeners. Values of this mapping must0
 *     be objects that contain `registrationName` or `phasedRegistrationNames`.0
 *0
 *   `executeDispatch` {function(object, function, string)}0
 *     Optional, allows plugins to override how an event gets dispatched. By0
 *     default, the listener is simply invoked.0
 *0
 * Each plugin that is injected into `EventsPluginHub` is immediately operable.0
 *0
 * @public0
 */0
0
/**0
 * Methods for injecting dependencies.0
 */0
export const injection = {0
  /**0
   * @param {array} InjectedEventPluginOrder0
   * @public0
   */0
  injectEventPluginOrder,0
0
  /**0
   * @param {object} injectedNamesToPlugins Map from names to plugin modules.0
   */0
  injectEventPluginsByName,0
};0
0
/**0
 * @param {object} inst The instance, which is the source of events.0
 * @param {string} registrationName Name of listener (e.g. `onClick`).0
 * @return {?function} The stored callback.0
 */0
export function getListener(inst: Fiber, registrationName: string) {0
  let listener;0
0
  // TODO: shouldPreventMouseEvent is DOM-specific and definitely should not0
  // live here; needs to be moved to a better place soon0
  const stateNode = inst.stateNode;0
  if (!stateNode) {0
    // Work in progress (ex: onload events in incremental mode).0
    return null;0
  }0
  const props = getFiberCurrentPropsFromNode(stateNode);0
  if (!props) {0
    // Work in progress.0
    return null;0
  }0
  listener = props[registrationName];0
  if (shouldPreventMouseEvent(registrationName, inst.type, props)) {0
    return null;0
  }0
  invariant(0
    !listener || typeof listener === 'function',0
    'Expected `%s` listener to be a function, instead got a value of `%s` type.',0
    registrationName,0
    typeof listener,0
  );0
  return listener;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Allows registered plugins an opportunity to extract events from top-level0
 * native browser events.0
 *0
 * @return {*} An accumulation of synthetic events.0
 * @internal0
 */0
function extractEvents(0
  topLevelType: TopLevelType,0
  targetInst: Fiber,0
  nativeEvent: AnyNativeEvent,0
  nativeEventTarget: EventTarget,0
): Array<ReactSyntheticEvent> | ReactSyntheticEvent | null {0
  let events = null;0
  for (let i = 0; i < plugins.length; i++) {0
    // Not every plugin in the ordering may be loaded at runtime.0
    const possiblePlugin: PluginModule<AnyNativeEvent> = plugins[i];0
    if (possiblePlugin) {0
      const extractedEvents = possiblePlugin.extractEvents(0
        topLevelType,0
        targetInst,0
        nativeEvent,0
        nativeEventTarget,0
      );0
      if (extractedEvents) {0
        events = accumulateInto(events, extractedEvents);0
      }0
    }0
  }0
  return events;0
}0
0
export function runEventsInBatch(0
  events: Array<ReactSyntheticEvent> | ReactSyntheticEvent | null,0
  simulated: boolean,0
) {0
  if (events !== null) {0
    eventQueue = accumulateInto(eventQueue, events);0
  }0
0
  // Set `eventQueue` to null before processing it so that we can tell if more0
  // events get enqueued while processing.0
  const processingEventQueue = eventQueue;0
  eventQueue = null;0
0
  if (!processingEventQueue) {0
    return;0
  }0
0
  if (simulated) {0
    forEachAccumulated(0
      processingEventQueue,0
      executeDispatchesAndReleaseSimulated,0
    );0
  } else {0
    forEachAccumulated(0
      processingEventQueue,0
      executeDispatchesAndReleaseTopLevel,0
    );0
  }0
  invariant(0
    !eventQueue,0
    'processEventQueue(): Additional events were enqueued while processing ' +0
      'an event queue. Support for this has not yet been implemented.',0
  );0
  // This would be a good time to rethrow if any of the event handlers threw.0
  ReactErrorUtils.rethrowCaughtError();0
}0
0
export function runExtractedEventsInBatch(0
  topLevelType: TopLevelType,0
  targetInst: Fiber,0
  nativeEvent: AnyNativeEvent,0
  nativeEventTarget: EventTarget,0
) {0
  const events = extractEvents(0
    topLevelType,0
    targetInst,0
    nativeEvent,0
    nativeEventTarget,0
  );0
  runEventsInBatch(events, false);0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {DispatchConfig} from './ReactSyntheticEventType';0
import type {0
  AnyNativeEvent,0
  PluginName,0
  PluginModule,0
} from './PluginModuleType';0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
type NamesToPlugins = {[key: PluginName]: PluginModule<AnyNativeEvent>};0
type EventPluginOrder = null | Array<PluginName>;0
0
/**0
 * Injectable ordering of event plugins.0
 */0
let eventPluginOrder: EventPluginOrder = null;0
0
/**0
 * Injectable mapping from names to event plugin modules.0
 */0
const namesToPlugins: NamesToPlugins = {};0
0
/**0
 * Recomputes the plugin list using the injected plugins and plugin ordering.0
 *0
 * @private0
 */0
function recomputePluginOrdering(): void {0
  if (!eventPluginOrder) {0
    // Wait until an `eventPluginOrder` is injected.0
    return;0
  }0
  for (const pluginName in namesToPlugins) {0
    const pluginModule = namesToPlugins[pluginName];0
    const pluginIndex = eventPluginOrder.indexOf(pluginName);0
    invariant(0
      pluginIndex > -1,0
      'EventPluginRegistry: Cannot inject event plugins that do not exist in ' +0
        'the plugin ordering, `%s`.',0
      pluginName,0
    );0
    if (plugins[pluginIndex]) {0
      continue;0
    }0
    invariant(0
      pluginModule.extractEvents,0
      'EventPluginRegistry: Event plugins must implement an `extractEvents` ' +0
        'method, but `%s` does not.',0
      pluginName,0
    );0
    plugins[pluginIndex] = pluginModule;0
    const publishedEvents = pluginModule.eventTypes;0
    for (const eventName in publishedEvents) {0
      invariant(0
        publishEventForPlugin(0
          publishedEvents[eventName],0
          pluginModule,0
          eventName,0
        ),0
        'EventPluginRegistry: Failed to publish event `%s` for plugin `%s`.',0
        eventName,0
        pluginName,0
      );0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Publishes an event so that it can be dispatched by the supplied plugin.0
 *0
 * @param {object} dispatchConfig Dispatch configuration for the event.0
 * @param {object} PluginModule Plugin publishing the event.0
 * @return {boolean} True if the event was successfully published.0
 * @private0
 */0
function publishEventForPlugin(0
  dispatchConfig: DispatchConfig,0
  pluginModule: PluginModule<AnyNativeEvent>,0
  eventName: string,0
): boolean {0
  invariant(0
    !eventNameDispatchConfigs.hasOwnProperty(eventName),0
    'EventPluginHub: More than one plugin attempted to publish the same ' +0
      'event name, `%s`.',0
    eventName,0
  );0
  eventNameDispatchConfigs[eventName] = dispatchConfig;0
0
  const phasedRegistrationNames = dispatchConfig.phasedRegistrationNames;0
  if (phasedRegistrationNames) {0
    for (const phaseName in phasedRegistrationNames) {0
      if (phasedRegistrationNames.hasOwnProperty(phaseName)) {0
        const phasedRegistrationName = phasedRegistrationNames[phaseName];0
        publishRegistrationName(0
          phasedRegistrationName,0
          pluginModule,0
          eventName,0
        );0
      }0
    }0
    return true;0
  } else if (dispatchConfig.registrationName) {0
    publishRegistrationName(0
      dispatchConfig.registrationName,0
      pluginModule,0
      eventName,0
    );0
    return true;0
  }0
  return false;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Publishes a registration name that is used to identify dispatched events.0
 *0
 * @param {string} registrationName Registration name to add.0
 * @param {object} PluginModule Plugin publishing the event.0
 * @private0
 */0
function publishRegistrationName(0
  registrationName: string,0
  pluginModule: PluginModule<AnyNativeEvent>,0
  eventName: string,0
): void {0
  invariant(0
    !registrationNameModules[registrationName],0
    'EventPluginHub: More than one plugin attempted to publish the same ' +0
      'registration name, `%s`.',0
    registrationName,0
  );0
  registrationNameModules[registrationName] = pluginModule;0
  registrationNameDependencies[registrationName] =0
    pluginModule.eventTypes[eventName].dependencies;0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const lowerCasedName = registrationName.toLowerCase();0
    possibleRegistrationNames[lowerCasedName] = registrationName;0
0
    if (registrationName === 'onDoubleClick') {0
      possibleRegistrationNames.ondblclick = registrationName;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Registers plugins so that they can extract and dispatch events.0
 *0
 * @see {EventPluginHub}0
 */0
0
/**0
 * Ordered list of injected plugins.0
 */0
export const plugins = [];0
0
/**0
 * Mapping from event name to dispatch config0
 */0
export const eventNameDispatchConfigs = {};0
0
/**0
 * Mapping from registration name to plugin module0
 */0
export const registrationNameModules = {};0
0
/**0
 * Mapping from registration name to event name0
 */0
export const registrationNameDependencies = {};0
0
/**0
 * Mapping from lowercase registration names to the properly cased version,0
 * used to warn in the case of missing event handlers. Available0
 * only in __DEV__.0
 * @type {Object}0
 */0
export const possibleRegistrationNames = __DEV__ ? {} : (null: any);0
// Trust the developer to only use possibleRegistrationNames in __DEV__0
0
/**0
 * Injects an ordering of plugins (by plugin name). This allows the ordering0
 * to be decoupled from injection of the actual plugins so that ordering is0
 * always deterministic regardless of packaging, on-the-fly injection, etc.0
 *0
 * @param {array} InjectedEventPluginOrder0
 * @internal0
 * @see {EventPluginHub.injection.injectEventPluginOrder}0
 */0
export function injectEventPluginOrder(0
  injectedEventPluginOrder: EventPluginOrder,0
): void {0
  invariant(0
    !eventPluginOrder,0
    'EventPluginRegistry: Cannot inject event plugin ordering more than ' +0
      'once. You are likely trying to load more than one copy of React.',0
  );0
  // Clone the ordering so it cannot be dynamically mutated.0
  eventPluginOrder = Array.prototype.slice.call(injectedEventPluginOrder);0
  recomputePluginOrdering();0
}0
0
/**0
 * Injects plugins to be used by `EventPluginHub`. The plugin names must be0
 * in the ordering injected by `injectEventPluginOrder`.0
 *0
 * Plugins can be injected as part of page initialization or on-the-fly.0
 *0
 * @param {object} injectedNamesToPlugins Map from names to plugin modules.0
 * @internal0
 * @see {EventPluginHub.injection.injectEventPluginsByName}0
 */0
export function injectEventPluginsByName(0
  injectedNamesToPlugins: NamesToPlugins,0
): void {0
  let isOrderingDirty = false;0
  for (const pluginName in injectedNamesToPlugins) {0
    if (!injectedNamesToPlugins.hasOwnProperty(pluginName)) {0
      continue;0
    }0
    const pluginModule = injectedNamesToPlugins[pluginName];0
    if (0
      !namesToPlugins.hasOwnProperty(pluginName) ||0
      namesToPlugins[pluginName] !== pluginModule0
    ) {0
      invariant(0
        !namesToPlugins[pluginName],0
        'EventPluginRegistry: Cannot inject two different event plugins ' +0
          'using the same name, `%s`.',0
        pluginName,0
      );0
      namesToPlugins[pluginName] = pluginModule;0
      isOrderingDirty = true;0
    }0
  }0
  if (isOrderingDirty) {0
    recomputePluginOrdering();0
  }0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import ReactErrorUtils from 'shared/ReactErrorUtils';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
export let getFiberCurrentPropsFromNode = null;0
export let getInstanceFromNode = null;0
export let getNodeFromInstance = null;0
0
export const injection = {0
  injectComponentTree: function(Injected) {0
    ({0
      getFiberCurrentPropsFromNode,0
      getInstanceFromNode,0
      getNodeFromInstance,0
    } = Injected);0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      warning(0
        getNodeFromInstance && getInstanceFromNode,0
        'EventPluginUtils.injection.injectComponentTree(...): Injected ' +0
          'module is missing getNodeFromInstance or getInstanceFromNode.',0
      );0
    }0
  },0
};0
0
let validateEventDispatches;0
if (__DEV__) {0
  validateEventDispatches = function(event) {0
    const dispatchListeners = event._dispatchListeners;0
    const dispatchInstances = event._dispatchInstances;0
0
    const listenersIsArr = Array.isArray(dispatchListeners);0
    const listenersLen = listenersIsArr0
      ? dispatchListeners.length0
      : dispatchListeners ? 1 : 0;0
0
    const instancesIsArr = Array.isArray(dispatchInstances);0
    const instancesLen = instancesIsArr0
      ? dispatchInstances.length0
      : dispatchInstances ? 1 : 0;0
0
    warning(0
      instancesIsArr === listenersIsArr && instancesLen === listenersLen,0
      'EventPluginUtils: Invalid `event`.',0
    );0
  };0
}0
0
/**0
 * Dispatch the event to the listener.0
 * @param {SyntheticEvent} event SyntheticEvent to handle0
 * @param {boolean} simulated If the event is simulated (changes exn behavior)0
 * @param {function} listener Application-level callback0
 * @param {*} inst Internal component instance0
 */0
function executeDispatch(event, simulated, listener, inst) {0
  const type = event.type || 'unknown-event';0
  event.currentTarget = getNodeFromInstance(inst);0
  ReactErrorUtils.invokeGuardedCallbackAndCatchFirstError(0
    type,0
    listener,0
    undefined,0
    event,0
  );0
  event.currentTarget = null;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Standard/simple iteration through an event's collected dispatches.0
 */0
export function executeDispatchesInOrder(event, simulated) {0
  const dispatchListeners = event._dispatchListeners;0
  const dispatchInstances = event._dispatchInstances;0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    validateEventDispatches(event);0
  }0
  if (Array.isArray(dispatchListeners)) {0
    for (let i = 0; i < dispatchListeners.length; i++) {0
      if (event.isPropagationStopped()) {0
        break;0
      }0
      // Listeners and Instances are two parallel arrays that are always in sync.0
      executeDispatch(0
        event,0
        simulated,0
        dispatchListeners[i],0
        dispatchInstances[i],0
      );0
    }0
  } else if (dispatchListeners) {0
    executeDispatch(event, simulated, dispatchListeners, dispatchInstances);0
  }0
  event._dispatchListeners = null;0
  event._dispatchInstances = null;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Standard/simple iteration through an event's collected dispatches, but stops0
 * at the first dispatch execution returning true, and returns that id.0
 *0
 * @return {?string} id of the first dispatch execution who's listener returns0
 * true, or null if no listener returned true.0
 */0
function executeDispatchesInOrderStopAtTrueImpl(event) {0
  const dispatchListeners = event._dispatchListeners;0
  const dispatchInstances = event._dispatchInstances;0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    validateEventDispatches(event);0
  }0
  if (Array.isArray(dispatchListeners)) {0
    for (let i = 0; i < dispatchListeners.length; i++) {0
      if (event.isPropagationStopped()) {0
        break;0
      }0
      // Listeners and Instances are two parallel arrays that are always in sync.0
      if (dispatchListeners[i](event, dispatchInstances[i])) {0
        return dispatchInstances[i];0
      }0
    }0
  } else if (dispatchListeners) {0
    if (dispatchListeners(event, dispatchInstances)) {0
      return dispatchInstances;0
    }0
  }0
  return null;0
}0
0
/**0
 * @see executeDispatchesInOrderStopAtTrueImpl0
 */0
export function executeDispatchesInOrderStopAtTrue(event) {0
  const ret = executeDispatchesInOrderStopAtTrueImpl(event);0
  event._dispatchInstances = null;0
  event._dispatchListeners = null;0
  return ret;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Execution of a "direct" dispatch - there must be at most one dispatch0
 * accumulated on the event or it is considered an error. It doesn't really make0
 * sense for an event with multiple dispatches (bubbled) to keep track of the0
 * return values at each dispatch execution, but it does tend to make sense when0
 * dealing with "direct" dispatches.0
 *0
 * @return {*} The return value of executing the single dispatch.0
 */0
export function executeDirectDispatch(event) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    validateEventDispatches(event);0
  }0
  const dispatchListener = event._dispatchListeners;0
  const dispatchInstance = event._dispatchInstances;0
  invariant(0
    !Array.isArray(dispatchListener),0
    'executeDirectDispatch(...): Invalid `event`.',0
  );0
  event.currentTarget = dispatchListener0
    ? getNodeFromInstance(dispatchInstance)0
    : null;0
  const res = dispatchListener ? dispatchListener(event) : null;0
  event.currentTarget = null;0
  event._dispatchListeners = null;0
  event._dispatchInstances = null;0
  return res;0
}0
0
/**0
 * @param {SyntheticEvent} event0
 * @return {boolean} True iff number of dispatches accumulated is greater than 0.0
 */0
export function hasDispatches(event) {0
  return !!event._dispatchListeners;0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import {0
  getParentInstance,0
  traverseTwoPhase,0
  traverseEnterLeave,0
} from 'shared/ReactTreeTraversal';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
import {getListener} from './EventPluginHub';0
import accumulateInto from './accumulateInto';0
import forEachAccumulated from './forEachAccumulated';0
0
type PropagationPhases = 'bubbled' | 'captured';0
0
/**0
 * Some event types have a notion of different registration names for different0
 * "phases" of propagation. This finds listeners by a given phase.0
 */0
function listenerAtPhase(inst, event, propagationPhase: PropagationPhases) {0
  const registrationName =0
    event.dispatchConfig.phasedRegistrationNames[propagationPhase];0
  return getListener(inst, registrationName);0
}0
0
/**0
 * A small set of propagation patterns, each of which will accept a small amount0
 * of information, and generate a set of "dispatch ready event objects" - which0
 * are sets of events that have already been annotated with a set of dispatched0
 * listener functions/ids. The API is designed this way to discourage these0
 * propagation strategies from actually executing the dispatches, since we0
 * always want to collect the entire set of dispatches before executing even a0
 * single one.0
 */0
0
/**0
 * Tags a `SyntheticEvent` with dispatched listeners. Creating this function0
 * here, allows us to not have to bind or create functions for each event.0
 * Mutating the event's members allows us to not have to create a wrapping0
 * "dispatch" object that pairs the event with the listener.0
 */0
function accumulateDirectionalDispatches(inst, phase, event) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    warning(inst, 'Dispatching inst must not be null');0
  }0
  const listener = listenerAtPhase(inst, event, phase);0
  if (listener) {0
    event._dispatchListeners = accumulateInto(0
      event._dispatchListeners,0
      listener,0
    );0
    event._dispatchInstances = accumulateInto(event._dispatchInstances, inst);0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Collect dispatches (must be entirely collected before dispatching - see unit0
 * tests). Lazily allocate the array to conserve memory.  We must loop through0
 * each event and perform the traversal for each one. We cannot perform a0
 * single traversal for the entire collection of events because each event may0
 * have a different target.0
 */0
function accumulateTwoPhaseDispatchesSingle(event) {0
  if (event && event.dispatchConfig.phasedRegistrationNames) {0
    traverseTwoPhase(event._targetInst, accumulateDirectionalDispatches, event);0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Same as `accumulateTwoPhaseDispatchesSingle`, but skips over the targetID.0
 */0
function accumulateTwoPhaseDispatchesSingleSkipTarget(event) {0
  if (event && event.dispatchConfig.phasedRegistrationNames) {0
    const targetInst = event._targetInst;0
    const parentInst = targetInst ? getParentInstance(targetInst) : null;0
    traverseTwoPhase(parentInst, accumulateDirectionalDispatches, event);0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Accumulates without regard to direction, does not look for phased0
 * registration names. Same as `accumulateDirectDispatchesSingle` but without0
 * requiring that the `dispatchMarker` be the same as the dispatched ID.0
 */0
function accumulateDispatches(inst, ignoredDirection, event) {0
  if (inst && event && event.dispatchConfig.registrationName) {0
    const registrationName = event.dispatchConfig.registrationName;0
    const listener = getListener(inst, registrationName);0
    if (listener) {0
      event._dispatchListeners = accumulateInto(0
        event._dispatchListeners,0
        listener,0
      );0
      event._dispatchInstances = accumulateInto(event._dispatchInstances, inst);0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Accumulates dispatches on an `SyntheticEvent`, but only for the0
 * `dispatchMarker`.0
 * @param {SyntheticEvent} event0
 */0
function accumulateDirectDispatchesSingle(event) {0
  if (event && event.dispatchConfig.registrationName) {0
    accumulateDispatches(event._targetInst, null, event);0
  }0
}0
0
export function accumulateTwoPhaseDispatches(events) {0
  forEachAccumulated(events, accumulateTwoPhaseDispatchesSingle);0
}0
0
export function accumulateTwoPhaseDispatchesSkipTarget(events) {0
  forEachAccumulated(events, accumulateTwoPhaseDispatchesSingleSkipTarget);0
}0
0
export function accumulateEnterLeaveDispatches(leave, enter, from, to) {0
  traverseEnterLeave(from, to, accumulateDispatches, leave, enter);0
}0
0
export function accumulateDirectDispatches(events) {0
  forEachAccumulated(events, accumulateDirectDispatchesSingle);0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
/**0
 * @param {array} arr an "accumulation" of items which is either an Array or0
 * a single item. Useful when paired with the `accumulate` module. This is a0
 * simple utility that allows us to reason about a collection of items, but0
 * handling the case when there is exactly one item (and we do not need to0
 * allocate an array).0
 * @param {function} cb Callback invoked with each element or a collection.0
 * @param {?} [scope] Scope used as `this` in a callback.0
 */0
function forEachAccumulated<T>(0
  arr: ?(Array<T> | T),0
  cb: (elem: T) => void,0
  scope: ?any,0
) {0
  if (Array.isArray(arr)) {0
    arr.forEach(cb, scope);0
  } else if (arr) {0
    cb.call(scope, arr);0
  }0
}0
0
export default forEachAccumulated;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {Fiber} from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiber';0
import type {0
  DispatchConfig,0
  ReactSyntheticEvent,0
} from './ReactSyntheticEventType';0
import type {TopLevelType} from './TopLevelEventTypes';0
0
export type EventTypes = {[key: string]: DispatchConfig};0
0
export type AnyNativeEvent = Event | KeyboardEvent | MouseEvent | Touch;0
0
export type PluginName = string;0
0
export type PluginModule<NativeEvent> = {0
  eventTypes: EventTypes,0
  extractEvents: (0
    topLevelType: TopLevelType,0
    targetInst: Fiber,0
    nativeTarget: NativeEvent,0
    nativeEventTarget: EventTarget,0
  ) => ?ReactSyntheticEvent,0
  tapMoveThreshold?: number,0
};0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
import {0
  getInstanceFromNode,0
  getFiberCurrentPropsFromNode,0
} from './EventPluginUtils';0
0
// Use to restore controlled state after a change event has fired.0
0
let fiberHostComponent = null;0
0
const ReactControlledComponentInjection = {0
  injectFiberControlledHostComponent: function(hostComponentImpl) {0
    // The fiber implementation doesn't use dynamic dispatch so we need to0
    // inject the implementation.0
    fiberHostComponent = hostComponentImpl;0
  },0
};0
0
let restoreTarget = null;0
let restoreQueue = null;0
0
function restoreStateOfTarget(target) {0
  // We perform this translation at the end of the event loop so that we0
  // always receive the correct fiber here0
  const internalInstance = getInstanceFromNode(target);0
  if (!internalInstance) {0
    // Unmounted0
    return;0
  }0
  invariant(0
    fiberHostComponent &&0
      typeof fiberHostComponent.restoreControlledState === 'function',0
    'Fiber needs to be injected to handle a fiber target for controlled ' +0
      'events. This error is likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
  );0
  const props = getFiberCurrentPropsFromNode(internalInstance.stateNode);0
  fiberHostComponent.restoreControlledState(0
    internalInstance.stateNode,0
    internalInstance.type,0
    props,0
  );0
}0
0
export const injection = ReactControlledComponentInjection;0
0
export function enqueueStateRestore(target) {0
  if (restoreTarget) {0
    if (restoreQueue) {0
      restoreQueue.push(target);0
    } else {0
      restoreQueue = [target];0
    }0
  } else {0
    restoreTarget = target;0
  }0
}0
0
export function needsStateRestore(): boolean {0
  return restoreTarget !== null || restoreQueue !== null;0
}0
0
export function restoreStateIfNeeded() {0
  if (!restoreTarget) {0
    return;0
  }0
  const target = restoreTarget;0
  const queuedTargets = restoreQueue;0
  restoreTarget = null;0
  restoreQueue = null;0
0
  restoreStateOfTarget(target);0
  if (queuedTargets) {0
    for (let i = 0; i < queuedTargets.length; i++) {0
      restoreStateOfTarget(queuedTargets[i]);0
    }0
  }0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import {0
  needsStateRestore,0
  restoreStateIfNeeded,0
} from './ReactControlledComponent';0
0
// Used as a way to call batchedUpdates when we don't have a reference to0
// the renderer. Such as when we're dispatching events or if third party0
// libraries need to call batchedUpdates. Eventually, this API will go away when0
// everything is batched by default. We'll then have a similar API to opt-out of0
// scheduled work and instead do synchronous work.0
0
// Defaults0
let _batchedUpdates = function(fn, bookkeeping) {0
  return fn(bookkeeping);0
};0
let _interactiveUpdates = function(fn, a, b) {0
  return fn(a, b);0
};0
let _flushInteractiveUpdates = function() {};0
0
let isBatching = false;0
export function batchedUpdates(fn, bookkeeping) {0
  if (isBatching) {0
    // If we are currently inside another batch, we need to wait until it0
    // fully completes before restoring state.0
    return fn(bookkeeping);0
  }0
  isBatching = true;0
  try {0
    return _batchedUpdates(fn, bookkeeping);0
  } finally {0
    // Here we wait until all updates have propagated, which is important0
    // when using controlled components within layers:0
    // https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/16980
    // Then we restore state of any controlled component.0
    isBatching = false;0
    const controlledComponentsHavePendingUpdates = needsStateRestore();0
    if (controlledComponentsHavePendingUpdates) {0
      // If a controlled event was fired, we may need to restore the state of0
      // the DOM node back to the controlled value. This is necessary when React0
      // bails out of the update without touching the DOM.0
      _flushInteractiveUpdates();0
      restoreStateIfNeeded();0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
export function interactiveUpdates(fn, a, b) {0
  return _interactiveUpdates(fn, a, b);0
}0
0
export function flushInteractiveUpdates() {0
  return _flushInteractiveUpdates();0
}0
0
export const injection = {0
  injectRenderer(renderer) {0
    _batchedUpdates = renderer.batchedUpdates;0
    _interactiveUpdates = renderer.interactiveUpdates;0
    _flushInteractiveUpdates = renderer.flushInteractiveUpdates;0
  },0
};0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * Flow type for SyntheticEvent class that includes private properties0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {Fiber} from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiber';0
import type {TopLevelType} from './TopLevelEventTypes';0
0
export type DispatchConfig = {0
  dependencies: Array<TopLevelType>,0
  phasedRegistrationNames?: {0
    bubbled: string,0
    captured: string,0
  },0
  registrationName?: string,0
  isInteractive?: boolean,0
};0
0
export type ReactSyntheticEvent = {0
  dispatchConfig: DispatchConfig,0
  getPooled: (0
    dispatchConfig: DispatchConfig,0
    targetInst: Fiber,0
    nativeTarget: Event,0
    nativeEventTarget: EventTarget,0
  ) => ReactSyntheticEvent,0
  isPersistent: () => boolean,0
} & SyntheticEvent<>;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import {getLowestCommonAncestor, isAncestor} from 'shared/ReactTreeTraversal';0
0
import {0
  executeDirectDispatch,0
  hasDispatches,0
  executeDispatchesInOrderStopAtTrue,0
  getInstanceFromNode,0
} from './EventPluginUtils';0
import {0
  accumulateDirectDispatches,0
  accumulateTwoPhaseDispatches,0
  accumulateTwoPhaseDispatchesSkipTarget,0
} from './EventPropagators';0
import ResponderSyntheticEvent from './ResponderSyntheticEvent';0
import ResponderTouchHistoryStore from './ResponderTouchHistoryStore';0
import accumulate from './accumulate';0
import {0
  TOP_SCROLL,0
  TOP_SELECTION_CHANGE,0
  TOP_TOUCH_CANCEL,0
  isStartish,0
  isMoveish,0
  isEndish,0
  startDependencies,0
  moveDependencies,0
  endDependencies,0
} from './ResponderTopLevelEventTypes';0
0
/**0
 * Instance of element that should respond to touch/move types of interactions,0
 * as indicated explicitly by relevant callbacks.0
 */0
let responderInst = null;0
0
/**0
 * Count of current touches. A textInput should become responder iff the0
 * selection changes while there is a touch on the screen.0
 */0
let trackedTouchCount = 0;0
0
const changeResponder = function(nextResponderInst, blockHostResponder) {0
  const oldResponderInst = responderInst;0
  responderInst = nextResponderInst;0
  if (ResponderEventPlugin.GlobalResponderHandler !== null) {0
    ResponderEventPlugin.GlobalResponderHandler.onChange(0
      oldResponderInst,0
      nextResponderInst,0
      blockHostResponder,0
    );0
  }0
};0
0
const eventTypes = {0
  /**0
   * On a `touchStart`/`mouseDown`, is it desired that this element become the0
   * responder?0
   */0
  startShouldSetResponder: {0
    phasedRegistrationNames: {0
      bubbled: 'onStartShouldSetResponder',0
      captured: 'onStartShouldSetResponderCapture',0
    },0
    dependencies: startDependencies,0
  },0
0
  /**0
   * On a `scroll`, is it desired that this element become the responder? This0
   * is usually not needed, but should be used to retroactively infer that a0
   * `touchStart` had occurred during momentum scroll. During a momentum scroll,0
   * a touch start will be immediately followed by a scroll event if the view is0
   * currently scrolling.0
   *0
   * TODO: This shouldn't bubble.0
   */0
  scrollShouldSetResponder: {0
    phasedRegistrationNames: {0
      bubbled: 'onScrollShouldSetResponder',0
      captured: 'onScrollShouldSetResponderCapture',0
    },0
    dependencies: [TOP_SCROLL],0
  },0
0
  /**0
   * On text selection change, should this element become the responder? This0
   * is needed for text inputs or other views with native selection, so the0
   * JS view can claim the responder.0
   *0
   * TODO: This shouldn't bubble.0
   */0
  selectionChangeShouldSetResponder: {0
    phasedRegistrationNames: {0
      bubbled: 'onSelectionChangeShouldSetResponder',0
      captured: 'onSelectionChangeShouldSetResponderCapture',0
    },0
    dependencies: [TOP_SELECTION_CHANGE],0
  },0
0
  /**0
   * On a `touchMove`/`mouseMove`, is it desired that this element become the0
   * responder?0
   */0
  moveShouldSetResponder: {0
    phasedRegistrationNames: {0
      bubbled: 'onMoveShouldSetResponder',0
      captured: 'onMoveShouldSetResponderCapture',0
    },0
    dependencies: moveDependencies,0
  },0
0
  /**0
   * Direct responder events dispatched directly to responder. Do not bubble.0
   */0
  responderStart: {0
    registrationName: 'onResponderStart',0
    dependencies: startDependencies,0
  },0
  responderMove: {0
    registrationName: 'onResponderMove',0
    dependencies: moveDependencies,0
  },0
  responderEnd: {0
    registrationName: 'onResponderEnd',0
    dependencies: endDependencies,0
  },0
  responderRelease: {0
    registrationName: 'onResponderRelease',0
    dependencies: endDependencies,0
  },0
  responderTerminationRequest: {0
    registrationName: 'onResponderTerminationRequest',0
    dependencies: [],0
  },0
  responderGrant: {0
    registrationName: 'onResponderGrant',0
    dependencies: [],0
  },0
  responderReject: {0
    registrationName: 'onResponderReject',0
    dependencies: [],0
  },0
  responderTerminate: {0
    registrationName: 'onResponderTerminate',0
    dependencies: [],0
  },0
};0
0
/**0
 *0
 * Responder System:0
 * ----------------0
 *0
 * - A global, solitary "interaction lock" on a view.0
 * - If a node becomes the responder, it should convey visual feedback0
 *   immediately to indicate so, either by highlighting or moving accordingly.0
 * - To be the responder means, that touches are exclusively important to that0
 *   responder view, and no other view.0
 * - While touches are still occurring, the responder lock can be transferred to0
 *   a new view, but only to increasingly "higher" views (meaning ancestors of0
 *   the current responder).0
 *0
 * Responder being granted:0
 * ------------------------0
 *0
 * - Touch starts, moves, and scrolls can cause an ID to become the responder.0
 * - We capture/bubble `startShouldSetResponder`/`moveShouldSetResponder` to0
 *   the "appropriate place".0
 * - If nothing is currently the responder, the "appropriate place" is the0
 *   initiating event's `targetID`.0
 * - If something *is* already the responder, the "appropriate place" is the0
 *   first common ancestor of the event target and the current `responderInst`.0
 * - Some negotiation happens: See the timing diagram below.0
 * - Scrolled views automatically become responder. The reasoning is that a0
 *   platform scroll view that isn't built on top of the responder system has0
 *   began scrolling, and the active responder must now be notified that the0
 *   interaction is no longer locked to it - the system has taken over.0
 *0
 * - Responder being released:0
 *   As soon as no more touches that *started* inside of descendants of the0
 *   *current* responderInst, an `onResponderRelease` event is dispatched to the0
 *   current responder, and the responder lock is released.0
 *0
 * TODO:0
 * - on "end", a callback hook for `onResponderEndShouldRemainResponder` that0
 *   determines if the responder lock should remain.0
 * - If a view shouldn't "remain" the responder, any active touches should by0
 *   default be considered "dead" and do not influence future negotiations or0
 *   bubble paths. It should be as if those touches do not exist.0
 * -- For multitouch: Usually a translate-z will choose to "remain" responder0
 *  after one out of many touches ended. For translate-y, usually the view0
 *  doesn't wish to "remain" responder after one of many touches end.0
 * - Consider building this on top of a `stopPropagation` model similar to0
 *   `W3C` events.0
 * - Ensure that `onResponderTerminate` is called on touch cancels, whether or0
 *   not `onResponderTerminationRequest` returns `true` or `false`.0
 *0
 */0
0
/*                                             Negotiation Performed0
                                             +-----------------------+0
                                            /                         \0
Process low level events to    +     Current Responder      +   wantsResponderID0
determine who to perform negot-|   (if any exists at all)   |0
iation/transition              | Otherwise just pass through|0
-------------------------------+----------------------------+------------------+0
Bubble to find first ID        |                            |0
to return true:wantsResponderID|                            |0
                               |                            |0
     +-------------+           |                            |0
     | onTouchStart|           |                            |0
     +------+------+     none  |                            |0
            |            return|                            |0
+-----------v-------------+true| +------------------------+ |0
|onStartShouldSetResponder|----->|onResponderStart (cur)  |<-----------+0
+-----------+-------------+    | +------------------------+ |          |0
            |                  |                            | +--------+-------+0
            | returned true for|       false:REJECT +-------->|onResponderReject0
            | wantsResponderID |                    |       | +----------------+0
            | (now attempt     | +------------------+-----+ |0
            |  handoff)        | |   onResponder          | |0
            +------------------->|      TerminationRequest| |0
                               | +------------------+-----+ |0
                               |                    |       | +----------------+0
                               |         true:GRANT +-------->|onResponderGrant|0
                               |                            | +--------+-------+0
                               | +------------------------+ |          |0
                               | |   onResponderTerminate |<-----------+0
                               | +------------------+-----+ |0
                               |                    |       | +----------------+0
                               |                    +-------->|onResponderStart|0
                               |                            | +----------------+0
Bubble to find first ID        |                            |0
to return true:wantsResponderID|                            |0
                               |                            |0
     +-------------+           |                            |0
     | onTouchMove |           |                            |0
     +------+------+     none  |                            |0
            |            return|                            |0
+-----------v-------------+true| +------------------------+ |0
|onMoveShouldSetResponder |----->|onResponderMove (cur)   |<-----------+0
+-----------+-------------+    | +------------------------+ |          |0
            |                  |                            | +--------+-------+0
            | returned true for|       false:REJECT +-------->|onResponderRejec|0
            | wantsResponderID |                    |       | +----------------+0
            | (now attempt     | +------------------+-----+ |0
            |  handoff)        | |   onResponder          | |0
            +------------------->|      TerminationRequest| |0
                               | +------------------+-----+ |0
                               |                    |       | +----------------+0
                               |         true:GRANT +-------->|onResponderGrant|0
                               |                            | +--------+-------+0
                               | +------------------------+ |          |0
                               | |   onResponderTerminate |<-----------+0
                               | +------------------+-----+ |0
                               |                    |       | +----------------+0
                               |                    +-------->|onResponderMove |0
                               |                            | +----------------+0
                               |                            |0
                               |                            |0
      Some active touch started|                            |0
      inside current responder | +------------------------+ |0
      +------------------------->|      onResponderEnd    | |0
      |                        | +------------------------+ |0
  +---+---------+              |                            |0
  | onTouchEnd  |              |                            |0
  +---+---------+              |                            |0
      |                        | +------------------------+ |0
      +------------------------->|     onResponderEnd     | |0
      No active touches started| +-----------+------------+ |0
      inside current responder |             |              |0
                               |             v              |0
                               | +------------------------+ |0
                               | |    onResponderRelease  | |0
                               | +------------------------+ |0
                               |                            |0
                               +                            + */0
0
/**0
 * A note about event ordering in the `EventPluginHub`.0
 *0
 * Suppose plugins are injected in the following order:0
 *0
 * `[R, S, C]`0
 *0
 * To help illustrate the example, assume `S` is `SimpleEventPlugin` (for0
 * `onClick` etc) and `R` is `ResponderEventPlugin`.0
 *0
 * "Deferred-Dispatched Events":0
 *0
 * - The current event plugin system will traverse the list of injected plugins,0
 *   in order, and extract events by collecting the plugin's return value of0
 *   `extractEvents()`.0
 * - These events that are returned from `extractEvents` are "deferred0
 *   dispatched events".0
 * - When returned from `extractEvents`, deferred-dispatched events contain an0
 *   "accumulation" of deferred dispatches.0
 * - These deferred dispatches are accumulated/collected before they are0
 *   returned, but processed at a later time by the `EventPluginHub` (hence the0
 *   name deferred).0
 *0
 * In the process of returning their deferred-dispatched events, event plugins0
 * themselves can dispatch events on-demand without returning them from0
 * `extractEvents`. Plugins might want to do this, so that they can use event0
 * dispatching as a tool that helps them decide which events should be extracted0
 * in the first place.0
 *0
 * "On-Demand-Dispatched Events":0
 *0
 * - On-demand-dispatched events are not returned from `extractEvents`.0
 * - On-demand-dispatched events are dispatched during the process of returning0
 *   the deferred-dispatched events.0
 * - They should not have side effects.0
 * - They should be avoided, and/or eventually be replaced with another0
 *   abstraction that allows event plugins to perform multiple "rounds" of event0
 *   extraction.0
 *0
 * Therefore, the sequence of event dispatches becomes:0
 *0
 * - `R`s on-demand events (if any)   (dispatched by `R` on-demand)0
 * - `S`s on-demand events (if any)   (dispatched by `S` on-demand)0
 * - `C`s on-demand events (if any)   (dispatched by `C` on-demand)0
 * - `R`s extracted events (if any)   (dispatched by `EventPluginHub`)0
 * - `S`s extracted events (if any)   (dispatched by `EventPluginHub`)0
 * - `C`s extracted events (if any)   (dispatched by `EventPluginHub`)0
 *0
 * In the case of `ResponderEventPlugin`: If the `startShouldSetResponder`0
 * on-demand dispatch returns `true` (and some other details are satisfied) the0
 * `onResponderGrant` deferred dispatched event is returned from0
 * `extractEvents`. The sequence of dispatch executions in this case0
 * will appear as follows:0
 *0
 * - `startShouldSetResponder` (`ResponderEventPlugin` dispatches on-demand)0
 * - `touchStartCapture`       (`EventPluginHub` dispatches as usual)0
 * - `touchStart`              (`EventPluginHub` dispatches as usual)0
 * - `responderGrant/Reject`   (`EventPluginHub` dispatches as usual)0
 */0
0
function setResponderAndExtractTransfer(0
  topLevelType,0
  targetInst,0
  nativeEvent,0
  nativeEventTarget,0
) {0
  const shouldSetEventType = isStartish(topLevelType)0
    ? eventTypes.startShouldSetResponder0
    : isMoveish(topLevelType)0
      ? eventTypes.moveShouldSetResponder0
      : topLevelType === TOP_SELECTION_CHANGE0
        ? eventTypes.selectionChangeShouldSetResponder0
        : eventTypes.scrollShouldSetResponder;0
0
  // TODO: stop one short of the current responder.0
  const bubbleShouldSetFrom = !responderInst0
    ? targetInst0
    : getLowestCommonAncestor(responderInst, targetInst);0
0
  // When capturing/bubbling the "shouldSet" event, we want to skip the target0
  // (deepest ID) if it happens to be the current responder. The reasoning:0
  // It's strange to get an `onMoveShouldSetResponder` when you're *already*0
  // the responder.0
  const skipOverBubbleShouldSetFrom = bubbleShouldSetFrom === responderInst;0
  const shouldSetEvent = ResponderSyntheticEvent.getPooled(0
    shouldSetEventType,0
    bubbleShouldSetFrom,0
    nativeEvent,0
    nativeEventTarget,0
  );0
  shouldSetEvent.touchHistory = ResponderTouchHistoryStore.touchHistory;0
  if (skipOverBubbleShouldSetFrom) {0
    accumulateTwoPhaseDispatchesSkipTarget(shouldSetEvent);0
  } else {0
    accumulateTwoPhaseDispatches(shouldSetEvent);0
  }0
  const wantsResponderInst = executeDispatchesInOrderStopAtTrue(shouldSetEvent);0
  if (!shouldSetEvent.isPersistent()) {0
    shouldSetEvent.constructor.release(shouldSetEvent);0
  }0
0
  if (!wantsResponderInst || wantsResponderInst === responderInst) {0
    return null;0
  }0
  let extracted;0
  const grantEvent = ResponderSyntheticEvent.getPooled(0
    eventTypes.responderGrant,0
    wantsResponderInst,0
    nativeEvent,0
    nativeEventTarget,0
  );0
  grantEvent.touchHistory = ResponderTouchHistoryStore.touchHistory;0
0
  accumulateDirectDispatches(grantEvent);0
  const blockHostResponder = executeDirectDispatch(grantEvent) === true;0
  if (responderInst) {0
    const terminationRequestEvent = ResponderSyntheticEvent.getPooled(0
      eventTypes.responderTerminationRequest,0
      responderInst,0
      nativeEvent,0
      nativeEventTarget,0
    );0
    terminationRequestEvent.touchHistory =0
      ResponderTouchHistoryStore.touchHistory;0
    accumulateDirectDispatches(terminationRequestEvent);0
    const shouldSwitch =0
      !hasDispatches(terminationRequestEvent) ||0
      executeDirectDispatch(terminationRequestEvent);0
    if (!terminationRequestEvent.isPersistent()) {0
      terminationRequestEvent.constructor.release(terminationRequestEvent);0
    }0
0
    if (shouldSwitch) {0
      const terminateEvent = ResponderSyntheticEvent.getPooled(0
        eventTypes.responderTerminate,0
        responderInst,0
        nativeEvent,0
        nativeEventTarget,0
      );0
      terminateEvent.touchHistory = ResponderTouchHistoryStore.touchHistory;0
      accumulateDirectDispatches(terminateEvent);0
      extracted = accumulate(extracted, [grantEvent, terminateEvent]);0
      changeResponder(wantsResponderInst, blockHostResponder);0
    } else {0
      const rejectEvent = ResponderSyntheticEvent.getPooled(0
        eventTypes.responderReject,0
        wantsResponderInst,0
        nativeEvent,0
        nativeEventTarget,0
      );0
      rejectEvent.touchHistory = ResponderTouchHistoryStore.touchHistory;0
      accumulateDirectDispatches(rejectEvent);0
      extracted = accumulate(extracted, rejectEvent);0
    }0
  } else {0
    extracted = accumulate(extracted, grantEvent);0
    changeResponder(wantsResponderInst, blockHostResponder);0
  }0
  return extracted;0
}0
0
/**0
 * A transfer is a negotiation between a currently set responder and the next0
 * element to claim responder status. Any start event could trigger a transfer0
 * of responderInst. Any move event could trigger a transfer.0
 *0
 * @param {string} topLevelType Record from `BrowserEventConstants`.0
 * @return {boolean} True if a transfer of responder could possibly occur.0
 */0
function canTriggerTransfer(topLevelType, topLevelInst, nativeEvent) {0
  return (0
    topLevelInst &&0
    // responderIgnoreScroll: We are trying to migrate away from specifically0
    // tracking native scroll events here and responderIgnoreScroll indicates we0
    // will send topTouchCancel to handle canceling touch events instead0
    ((topLevelType === TOP_SCROLL && !nativeEvent.responderIgnoreScroll) ||0
      (trackedTouchCount > 0 && topLevelType === TOP_SELECTION_CHANGE) ||0
      isStartish(topLevelType) ||0
      isMoveish(topLevelType))0
  );0
}0
0
/**0
 * Returns whether or not this touch end event makes it such that there are no0
 * longer any touches that started inside of the current `responderInst`.0
 *0
 * @param {NativeEvent} nativeEvent Native touch end event.0
 * @return {boolean} Whether or not this touch end event ends the responder.0
 */0
function noResponderTouches(nativeEvent) {0
  const touches = nativeEvent.touches;0
  if (!touches || touches.length === 0) {0
    return true;0
  }0
  for (let i = 0; i < touches.length; i++) {0
    const activeTouch = touches[i];0
    const target = activeTouch.target;0
    if (target !== null && target !== undefined && target !== 0) {0
      // Is the original touch location inside of the current responder?0
      const targetInst = getInstanceFromNode(target);0
      if (isAncestor(responderInst, targetInst)) {0
        return false;0
      }0
    }0
  }0
  return true;0
}0
0
const ResponderEventPlugin = {0
  /* For unit testing only */0
  _getResponder: function() {0
    return responderInst;0
  },0
0
  eventTypes: eventTypes,0
0
  /**0
   * We must be resilient to `targetInst` being `null` on `touchMove` or0
   * `touchEnd`. On certain platforms, this means that a native scroll has0
   * assumed control and the original touch targets are destroyed.0
   */0
  extractEvents: function(0
    topLevelType,0
    targetInst,0
    nativeEvent,0
    nativeEventTarget,0
  ) {0
    if (isStartish(topLevelType)) {0
      trackedTouchCount += 1;0
    } else if (isEndish(topLevelType)) {0
      if (trackedTouchCount >= 0) {0
        trackedTouchCount -= 1;0
      } else {0
        console.error(0
          'Ended a touch event which was not counted in `trackedTouchCount`.',0
        );0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ResponderTouchHistoryStore.recordTouchTrack(topLevelType, nativeEvent);0
0
    let extracted = canTriggerTransfer(topLevelType, targetInst, nativeEvent)0
      ? setResponderAndExtractTransfer(0
          topLevelType,0
          targetInst,0
          nativeEvent,0
          nativeEventTarget,0
        )0
      : null;0
    // Responder may or may not have transferred on a new touch start/move.0
    // Regardless, whoever is the responder after any potential transfer, we0
    // direct all touch start/move/ends to them in the form of0
    // `onResponderMove/Start/End`. These will be called for *every* additional0
    // finger that move/start/end, dispatched directly to whoever is the0
    // current responder at that moment, until the responder is "released".0
    //0
    // These multiple individual change touch events are are always bookended0
    // by `onResponderGrant`, and one of0
    // (`onResponderRelease/onResponderTerminate`).0
    const isResponderTouchStart = responderInst && isStartish(topLevelType);0
    const isResponderTouchMove = responderInst && isMoveish(topLevelType);0
    const isResponderTouchEnd = responderInst && isEndish(topLevelType);0
    const incrementalTouch = isResponderTouchStart0
      ? eventTypes.responderStart0
      : isResponderTouchMove0
        ? eventTypes.responderMove0
        : isResponderTouchEnd ? eventTypes.responderEnd : null;0
0
    if (incrementalTouch) {0
      const gesture = ResponderSyntheticEvent.getPooled(0
        incrementalTouch,0
        responderInst,0
        nativeEvent,0
        nativeEventTarget,0
      );0
      gesture.touchHistory = ResponderTouchHistoryStore.touchHistory;0
      accumulateDirectDispatches(gesture);0
      extracted = accumulate(extracted, gesture);0
    }0
0
    const isResponderTerminate =0
      responderInst && topLevelType === TOP_TOUCH_CANCEL;0
    const isResponderRelease =0
      responderInst &&0
      !isResponderTerminate &&0
      isEndish(topLevelType) &&0
      noResponderTouches(nativeEvent);0
    const finalTouch = isResponderTerminate0
      ? eventTypes.responderTerminate0
      : isResponderRelease ? eventTypes.responderRelease : null;0
    if (finalTouch) {0
      const finalEvent = ResponderSyntheticEvent.getPooled(0
        finalTouch,0
        responderInst,0
        nativeEvent,0
        nativeEventTarget,0
      );0
      finalEvent.touchHistory = ResponderTouchHistoryStore.touchHistory;0
      accumulateDirectDispatches(finalEvent);0
      extracted = accumulate(extracted, finalEvent);0
      changeResponder(null);0
    }0
0
    return extracted;0
  },0
0
  GlobalResponderHandler: null,0
0
  injection: {0
    /**0
     * @param {{onChange: (ReactID, ReactID) => void} GlobalResponderHandler0
     * Object that handles any change in responder. Use this to inject0
     * integration with an existing touch handling system etc.0
     */0
    injectGlobalResponderHandler(GlobalResponderHandler) {0
      ResponderEventPlugin.GlobalResponderHandler = GlobalResponderHandler;0
    },0
  },0
};0
0
export default ResponderEventPlugin;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import SyntheticEvent from './SyntheticEvent';0
0
/**0
 * `touchHistory` isn't actually on the native event, but putting it in the0
 * interface will ensure that it is cleaned up when pooled/destroyed. The0
 * `ResponderEventPlugin` will populate it appropriately.0
 */0
const ResponderSyntheticEvent = SyntheticEvent.extend({0
  touchHistory: function(nativeEvent) {0
    return null; // Actually doesn't even look at the native event.0
  },0
});0
0
export default ResponderSyntheticEvent;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
export const TOP_TOUCH_START = 'topTouchStart';0
export const TOP_TOUCH_MOVE = 'topTouchMove';0
export const TOP_TOUCH_END = 'topTouchEnd';0
export const TOP_TOUCH_CANCEL = 'topTouchCancel';0
export const TOP_SCROLL = 'topScroll';0
export const TOP_SELECTION_CHANGE = 'topSelectionChange';0
0
export function isStartish(topLevelType: mixed): boolean {0
  return topLevelType === TOP_TOUCH_START;0
}0
0
export function isMoveish(topLevelType: mixed): boolean {0
  return topLevelType === TOP_TOUCH_MOVE;0
}0
0
export function isEndish(topLevelType: mixed): boolean {0
  return topLevelType === TOP_TOUCH_END || topLevelType === TOP_TOUCH_CANCEL;0
}0
0
export const startDependencies = [TOP_TOUCH_START];0
export const moveDependencies = [TOP_TOUCH_MOVE];0
export const endDependencies = [TOP_TOUCH_CANCEL, TOP_TOUCH_END];0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
import {isStartish, isMoveish, isEndish} from './ResponderTopLevelEventTypes';0
0
/**0
 * Tracks the position and time of each active touch by `touch.identifier`. We0
 * should typically only see IDs in the range of 1-20 because IDs get recycled0
 * when touches end and start again.0
 */0
type TouchRecord = {0
  touchActive: boolean,0
  startPageX: number,0
  startPageY: number,0
  startTimeStamp: number,0
  currentPageX: number,0
  currentPageY: number,0
  currentTimeStamp: number,0
  previousPageX: number,0
  previousPageY: number,0
  previousTimeStamp: number,0
};0
0
const MAX_TOUCH_BANK = 20;0
const touchBank: Array<TouchRecord> = [];0
const touchHistory = {0
  touchBank,0
  numberActiveTouches: 0,0
  // If there is only one active touch, we remember its location. This prevents0
  // us having to loop through all of the touches all the time in the most0
  // common case.0
  indexOfSingleActiveTouch: -1,0
  mostRecentTimeStamp: 0,0
};0
0
type Touch = {0
  identifier: ?number,0
  pageX: number,0
  pageY: number,0
  timestamp: number,0
};0
type TouchEvent = {0
  changedTouches: Array<Touch>,0
  touches: Array<Touch>,0
};0
0
function timestampForTouch(touch: Touch): number {0
  // The legacy internal implementation provides "timeStamp", which has been0
  // renamed to "timestamp". Let both work for now while we iron it out0
  // TODO (evv): rename timeStamp to timestamp in internal code0
  return (touch: any).timeStamp || touch.timestamp;0
}0
0
/**0
 * TODO: Instead of making gestures recompute filtered velocity, we could0
 * include a built in velocity computation that can be reused globally.0
 */0
function createTouchRecord(touch: Touch): TouchRecord {0
  return {0
    touchActive: true,0
    startPageX: touch.pageX,0
    startPageY: touch.pageY,0
    startTimeStamp: timestampForTouch(touch),0
    currentPageX: touch.pageX,0
    currentPageY: touch.pageY,0
    currentTimeStamp: timestampForTouch(touch),0
    previousPageX: touch.pageX,0
    previousPageY: touch.pageY,0
    previousTimeStamp: timestampForTouch(touch),0
  };0
}0
0
function resetTouchRecord(touchRecord: TouchRecord, touch: Touch): void {0
  touchRecord.touchActive = true;0
  touchRecord.startPageX = touch.pageX;0
  touchRecord.startPageY = touch.pageY;0
  touchRecord.startTimeStamp = timestampForTouch(touch);0
  touchRecord.currentPageX = touch.pageX;0
  touchRecord.currentPageY = touch.pageY;0
  touchRecord.currentTimeStamp = timestampForTouch(touch);0
  touchRecord.previousPageX = touch.pageX;0
  touchRecord.previousPageY = touch.pageY;0
  touchRecord.previousTimeStamp = timestampForTouch(touch);0
}0
0
function getTouchIdentifier({identifier}: Touch): number {0
  invariant(identifier != null, 'Touch object is missing identifier.');0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    warning(0
      identifier <= MAX_TOUCH_BANK,0
      'Touch identifier %s is greater than maximum supported %s which causes ' +0
        'performance issues backfilling array locations for all of the indices.',0
      identifier,0
      MAX_TOUCH_BANK,0
    );0
  }0
  return identifier;0
}0
0
function recordTouchStart(touch: Touch): void {0
  const identifier = getTouchIdentifier(touch);0
  const touchRecord = touchBank[identifier];0
  if (touchRecord) {0
    resetTouchRecord(touchRecord, touch);0
  } else {0
    touchBank[identifier] = createTouchRecord(touch);0
  }0
  touchHistory.mostRecentTimeStamp = timestampForTouch(touch);0
}0
0
function recordTouchMove(touch: Touch): void {0
  const touchRecord = touchBank[getTouchIdentifier(touch)];0
  if (touchRecord) {0
    touchRecord.touchActive = true;0
    touchRecord.previousPageX = touchRecord.currentPageX;0
    touchRecord.previousPageY = touchRecord.currentPageY;0
    touchRecord.previousTimeStamp = touchRecord.currentTimeStamp;0
    touchRecord.currentPageX = touch.pageX;0
    touchRecord.currentPageY = touch.pageY;0
    touchRecord.currentTimeStamp = timestampForTouch(touch);0
    touchHistory.mostRecentTimeStamp = timestampForTouch(touch);0
  } else {0
    console.error(0
      'Cannot record touch move without a touch start.\n' + 'Touch Move: %s\n',0
      'Touch Bank: %s',0
      printTouch(touch),0
      printTouchBank(),0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
function recordTouchEnd(touch: Touch): void {0
  const touchRecord = touchBank[getTouchIdentifier(touch)];0
  if (touchRecord) {0
    touchRecord.touchActive = false;0
    touchRecord.previousPageX = touchRecord.currentPageX;0
    touchRecord.previousPageY = touchRecord.currentPageY;0
    touchRecord.previousTimeStamp = touchRecord.currentTimeStamp;0
    touchRecord.currentPageX = touch.pageX;0
    touchRecord.currentPageY = touch.pageY;0
    touchRecord.currentTimeStamp = timestampForTouch(touch);0
    touchHistory.mostRecentTimeStamp = timestampForTouch(touch);0
  } else {0
    console.error(0
      'Cannot record touch end without a touch start.\n' + 'Touch End: %s\n',0
      'Touch Bank: %s',0
      printTouch(touch),0
      printTouchBank(),0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
function printTouch(touch: Touch): string {0
  return JSON.stringify({0
    identifier: touch.identifier,0
    pageX: touch.pageX,0
    pageY: touch.pageY,0
    timestamp: timestampForTouch(touch),0
  });0
}0
0
function printTouchBank(): string {0
  let printed = JSON.stringify(touchBank.slice(0, MAX_TOUCH_BANK));0
  if (touchBank.length > MAX_TOUCH_BANK) {0
    printed += ' (original size: ' + touchBank.length + ')';0
  }0
  return printed;0
}0
0
const ResponderTouchHistoryStore = {0
  recordTouchTrack(topLevelType: string, nativeEvent: TouchEvent): void {0
    if (isMoveish(topLevelType)) {0
      nativeEvent.changedTouches.forEach(recordTouchMove);0
    } else if (isStartish(topLevelType)) {0
      nativeEvent.changedTouches.forEach(recordTouchStart);0
      touchHistory.numberActiveTouches = nativeEvent.touches.length;0
      if (touchHistory.numberActiveTouches === 1) {0
        touchHistory.indexOfSingleActiveTouch =0
          nativeEvent.touches[0].identifier;0
      }0
    } else if (isEndish(topLevelType)) {0
      nativeEvent.changedTouches.forEach(recordTouchEnd);0
      touchHistory.numberActiveTouches = nativeEvent.touches.length;0
      if (touchHistory.numberActiveTouches === 1) {0
        for (let i = 0; i < touchBank.length; i++) {0
          const touchTrackToCheck = touchBank[i];0
          if (touchTrackToCheck != null && touchTrackToCheck.touchActive) {0
            touchHistory.indexOfSingleActiveTouch = i;0
            break;0
          }0
        }0
        if (__DEV__) {0
          const activeRecord = touchBank[touchHistory.indexOfSingleActiveTouch];0
          warning(0
            activeRecord != null && activeRecord.touchActive,0
            'Cannot find single active touch.',0
          );0
        }0
      }0
    }0
  },0
0
  touchHistory,0
};0
0
export default ResponderTouchHistoryStore;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
/* eslint valid-typeof: 0 */0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
let didWarnForAddedNewProperty = false;0
const EVENT_POOL_SIZE = 10;0
0
const shouldBeReleasedProperties = [0
  'dispatchConfig',0
  '_targetInst',0
  'nativeEvent',0
  'isDefaultPrevented',0
  'isPropagationStopped',0
  '_dispatchListeners',0
  '_dispatchInstances',0
];0
0
/**0
 * @interface Event0
 * @see http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-3-Events/0
 */0
const EventInterface = {0
  type: null,0
  target: null,0
  // currentTarget is set when dispatching; no use in copying it here0
  currentTarget: function() {0
    return null;0
  },0
  eventPhase: null,0
  bubbles: null,0
  cancelable: null,0
  timeStamp: function(event) {0
    return event.timeStamp || Date.now();0
  },0
  defaultPrevented: null,0
  isTrusted: null,0
};0
0
function functionThatReturnsTrue() {0
  return true;0
}0
0
function functionThatReturnsFalse() {0
  return false;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Synthetic events are dispatched by event plugins, typically in response to a0
 * top-level event delegation handler.0
 *0
 * These systems should generally use pooling to reduce the frequency of garbage0
 * collection. The system should check `isPersistent` to determine whether the0
 * event should be released into the pool after being dispatched. Users that0
 * need a persisted event should invoke `persist`.0
 *0
 * Synthetic events (and subclasses) implement the DOM Level 3 Events API by0
 * normalizing browser quirks. Subclasses do not necessarily have to implement a0
 * DOM interface; custom application-specific events can also subclass this.0
 *0
 * @param {object} dispatchConfig Configuration used to dispatch this event.0
 * @param {*} targetInst Marker identifying the event target.0
 * @param {object} nativeEvent Native browser event.0
 * @param {DOMEventTarget} nativeEventTarget Target node.0
 */0
function SyntheticEvent(0
  dispatchConfig,0
  targetInst,0
  nativeEvent,0
  nativeEventTarget,0
) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    // these have a getter/setter for warnings0
    delete this.nativeEvent;0
    delete this.preventDefault;0
    delete this.stopPropagation;0
  }0
0
  this.dispatchConfig = dispatchConfig;0
  this._targetInst = targetInst;0
  this.nativeEvent = nativeEvent;0
0
  const Interface = this.constructor.Interface;0
  for (const propName in Interface) {0
    if (!Interface.hasOwnProperty(propName)) {0
      continue;0
    }0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      delete this[propName]; // this has a getter/setter for warnings0
    }0
    const normalize = Interface[propName];0
    if (normalize) {0
      this[propName] = normalize(nativeEvent);0
    } else {0
      if (propName === 'target') {0
        this.target = nativeEventTarget;0
      } else {0
        this[propName] = nativeEvent[propName];0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  const defaultPrevented =0
    nativeEvent.defaultPrevented != null0
      ? nativeEvent.defaultPrevented0
      : nativeEvent.returnValue === false;0
  if (defaultPrevented) {0
    this.isDefaultPrevented = functionThatReturnsTrue;0
  } else {0
    this.isDefaultPrevented = functionThatReturnsFalse;0
  }0
  this.isPropagationStopped = functionThatReturnsFalse;0
  return this;0
}0
0
Object.assign(SyntheticEvent.prototype, {0
  preventDefault: function() {0
    this.defaultPrevented = true;0
    const event = this.nativeEvent;0
    if (!event) {0
      return;0
    }0
0
    if (event.preventDefault) {0
      event.preventDefault();0
    } else if (typeof event.returnValue !== 'unknown') {0
      event.returnValue = false;0
    }0
    this.isDefaultPrevented = functionThatReturnsTrue;0
  },0
0
  stopPropagation: function() {0
    const event = this.nativeEvent;0
    if (!event) {0
      return;0
    }0
0
    if (event.stopPropagation) {0
      event.stopPropagation();0
    } else if (typeof event.cancelBubble !== 'unknown') {0
      // The ChangeEventPlugin registers a "propertychange" event for0
      // IE. This event does not support bubbling or cancelling, and0
      // any references to cancelBubble throw "Member not found".  A0
      // typeof check of "unknown" circumvents this issue (and is also0
      // IE specific).0
      event.cancelBubble = true;0
    }0
0
    this.isPropagationStopped = functionThatReturnsTrue;0
  },0
0
  /**0
   * We release all dispatched `SyntheticEvent`s after each event loop, adding0
   * them back into the pool. This allows a way to hold onto a reference that0
   * won't be added back into the pool.0
   */0
  persist: function() {0
    this.isPersistent = functionThatReturnsTrue;0
  },0
0
  /**0
   * Checks if this event should be released back into the pool.0
   *0
   * @return {boolean} True if this should not be released, false otherwise.0
   */0
  isPersistent: functionThatReturnsFalse,0
0
  /**0
   * `PooledClass` looks for `destructor` on each instance it releases.0
   */0
  destructor: function() {0
    const Interface = this.constructor.Interface;0
    for (const propName in Interface) {0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        Object.defineProperty(0
          this,0
          propName,0
          getPooledWarningPropertyDefinition(propName, Interface[propName]),0
        );0
      } else {0
        this[propName] = null;0
      }0
    }0
    for (let i = 0; i < shouldBeReleasedProperties.length; i++) {0
      this[shouldBeReleasedProperties[i]] = null;0
    }0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      Object.defineProperty(0
        this,0
        'nativeEvent',0
        getPooledWarningPropertyDefinition('nativeEvent', null),0
      );0
      Object.defineProperty(0
        this,0
        'preventDefault',0
        getPooledWarningPropertyDefinition('preventDefault', () => {}),0
      );0
      Object.defineProperty(0
        this,0
        'stopPropagation',0
        getPooledWarningPropertyDefinition('stopPropagation', () => {}),0
      );0
    }0
  },0
});0
0
SyntheticEvent.Interface = EventInterface;0
0
/**0
 * Helper to reduce boilerplate when creating subclasses.0
 */0
SyntheticEvent.extend = function(Interface) {0
  const Super = this;0
0
  const E = function() {};0
  E.prototype = Super.prototype;0
  const prototype = new E();0
0
  function Class() {0
    return Super.apply(this, arguments);0
  }0
  Object.assign(prototype, Class.prototype);0
  Class.prototype = prototype;0
  Class.prototype.constructor = Class;0
0
  Class.Interface = Object.assign({}, Super.Interface, Interface);0
  Class.extend = Super.extend;0
  addEventPoolingTo(Class);0
0
  return Class;0
};0
0
/** Proxying after everything set on SyntheticEvent0
 * to resolve Proxy issue on some WebKit browsers0
 * in which some Event properties are set to undefined (GH#10010)0
 */0
if (__DEV__) {0
  const isProxySupported =0
    typeof Proxy === 'function' &&0
    // https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/120110
    !Object.isSealed(new Proxy({}, {}));0
0
  if (isProxySupported) {0
    /*eslint-disable no-func-assign */0
    SyntheticEvent = new Proxy(SyntheticEvent, {0
      construct: function(target, args) {0
        return this.apply(target, Object.create(target.prototype), args);0
      },0
      apply: function(constructor, that, args) {0
        return new Proxy(constructor.apply(that, args), {0
          set: function(target, prop, value) {0
            if (0
              prop !== 'isPersistent' &&0
              !target.constructor.Interface.hasOwnProperty(prop) &&0
              shouldBeReleasedProperties.indexOf(prop) === -10
            ) {0
              warning(0
                didWarnForAddedNewProperty || target.isPersistent(),0
                "This synthetic event is reused for performance reasons. If you're " +0
                  "seeing this, you're adding a new property in the synthetic event object. " +0
                  'The property is never released. See ' +0
                  'https://fb.me/react-event-pooling for more information.',0
              );0
              didWarnForAddedNewProperty = true;0
            }0
            target[prop] = value;0
            return true;0
          },0
        });0
      },0
    });0
    /*eslint-enable no-func-assign */0
  }0
}0
0
addEventPoolingTo(SyntheticEvent);0
0
/**0
 * Helper to nullify syntheticEvent instance properties when destructing0
 *0
 * @param {String} propName0
 * @param {?object} getVal0
 * @return {object} defineProperty object0
 */0
function getPooledWarningPropertyDefinition(propName, getVal) {0
  const isFunction = typeof getVal === 'function';0
  return {0
    configurable: true,0
    set: set,0
    get: get,0
  };0
0
  function set(val) {0
    const action = isFunction ? 'setting the method' : 'setting the property';0
    warn(action, 'This is effectively a no-op');0
    return val;0
  }0
0
  function get() {0
    const action = isFunction0
      ? 'accessing the method'0
      : 'accessing the property';0
    const result = isFunction0
      ? 'This is a no-op function'0
      : 'This is set to null';0
    warn(action, result);0
    return getVal;0
  }0
0
  function warn(action, result) {0
    const warningCondition = false;0
    warning(0
      warningCondition,0
      "This synthetic event is reused for performance reasons. If you're seeing this, " +0
        "you're %s `%s` on a released/nullified synthetic event. %s. " +0
        'If you must keep the original synthetic event around, use event.persist(). ' +0
        'See https://fb.me/react-event-pooling for more information.',0
      action,0
      propName,0
      result,0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
function getPooledEvent(dispatchConfig, targetInst, nativeEvent, nativeInst) {0
  const EventConstructor = this;0
  if (EventConstructor.eventPool.length) {0
    const instance = EventConstructor.eventPool.pop();0
    EventConstructor.call(0
      instance,0
      dispatchConfig,0
      targetInst,0
      nativeEvent,0
      nativeInst,0
    );0
    return instance;0
  }0
  return new EventConstructor(0
    dispatchConfig,0
    targetInst,0
    nativeEvent,0
    nativeInst,0
  );0
}0
0
function releasePooledEvent(event) {0
  const EventConstructor = this;0
  invariant(0
    event instanceof EventConstructor,0
    'Trying to release an event instance  into a pool of a different type.',0
  );0
  event.destructor();0
  if (EventConstructor.eventPool.length < EVENT_POOL_SIZE) {0
    EventConstructor.eventPool.push(event);0
  }0
}0
0
function addEventPoolingTo(EventConstructor) {0
  EventConstructor.eventPool = [];0
  EventConstructor.getPooled = getPooledEvent;0
  EventConstructor.release = releasePooledEvent;0
}0
0
export default SyntheticEvent;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
export type RNTopLevelEventType =0
  | 'topMouseDown'0
  | 'topMouseMove'0
  | 'topMouseUp'0
  | 'topScroll'0
  | 'topSelectionChange'0
  | 'topTouchCancel'0
  | 'topTouchEnd'0
  | 'topTouchMove'0
  | 'topTouchStart';0
0
export opaque type DOMTopLevelEventType = string;0
0
// Do not uses the below two methods directly!0
// Instead use constants exported from DOMTopLevelEventTypes in ReactDOM.0
// (It is the only module that is allowed to access these methods.)0
0
export function unsafeCastStringToDOMTopLevelType(0
  topLevelType: string,0
): DOMTopLevelEventType {0
  return topLevelType;0
}0
0
export function unsafeCastDOMTopLevelTypeToString(0
  topLevelType: DOMTopLevelEventType,0
): string {0
  return topLevelType;0
}0
0
export type TopLevelType = DOMTopLevelEventType | RNTopLevelEventType;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2014-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let accumulateInto;0
0
describe('accumulateInto', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    accumulateInto = require('events/accumulateInto').default;0
  });0
0
  it('throws if the second item is null', () => {0
    expect(function() {0
      accumulateInto([], null);0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'accumulateInto(...): Accumulated items must not be null or undefined.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('returns the second item if first is null', () => {0
    const a = [];0
    expect(accumulateInto(null, a)).toBe(a);0
  });0
0
  it('merges the second into the first if first item is an array', () => {0
    const a = [1, 2];0
    const b = [3, 4];0
    accumulateInto(a, b);0
    expect(a).toEqual([1, 2, 3, 4]);0
    expect(b).toEqual([3, 4]);0
    const c = [1];0
    accumulateInto(c, 2);0
    expect(c).toEqual([1, 2]);0
  });0
0
  it('returns a new array if first or both items are scalar', () => {0
    const a = [2];0
    expect(accumulateInto(1, a)).toEqual([1, 2]);0
    expect(a).toEqual([2]);0
    expect(accumulateInto(1, 2)).toEqual([1, 2]);0
  });0
});0
/**0
