 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
describe('EventPluginRegistry', () => {0
  let EventPluginRegistry;0
  let createPlugin;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModuleRegistry();0
    // These tests are intentionally testing the private injection interface.0
    // The public API surface of this is covered by other tests so0
    // if `EventPluginRegistry` is ever deleted, these tests should be0
    // safe to remove too.0
    EventPluginRegistry = require('events/EventPluginRegistry');0
0
    createPlugin = function(properties) {0
      return Object.assign({extractEvents: function() {}}, properties);0
    };0
  });0
0
  it('should be able to inject ordering before plugins', () => {0
    const OnePlugin = createPlugin();0
    const TwoPlugin = createPlugin();0
    const ThreePlugin = createPlugin();0
0
    EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginOrder(['one', 'two', 'three']);0
    EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginsByName({0
      one: OnePlugin,0
      two: TwoPlugin,0
    });0
    EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginsByName({0
      three: ThreePlugin,0
    });0
0
    expect(EventPluginRegistry.plugins.length).toBe(3);0
    expect(EventPluginRegistry.plugins[0]).toBe(OnePlugin);0
    expect(EventPluginRegistry.plugins[1]).toBe(TwoPlugin);0
    expect(EventPluginRegistry.plugins[2]).toBe(ThreePlugin);0
  });0
0
  it('should be able to inject plugins before and after ordering', () => {0
    const OnePlugin = createPlugin();0
    const TwoPlugin = createPlugin();0
    const ThreePlugin = createPlugin();0
0
    EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginsByName({0
      one: OnePlugin,0
      two: TwoPlugin,0
    });0
    EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginOrder(['one', 'two', 'three']);0
    EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginsByName({0
      three: ThreePlugin,0
    });0
0
    expect(EventPluginRegistry.plugins.length).toBe(3);0
    expect(EventPluginRegistry.plugins[0]).toBe(OnePlugin);0
    expect(EventPluginRegistry.plugins[1]).toBe(TwoPlugin);0
    expect(EventPluginRegistry.plugins[2]).toBe(ThreePlugin);0
  });0
0
  it('should be able to inject repeated plugins and out-of-order', () => {0
    const OnePlugin = createPlugin();0
    const TwoPlugin = createPlugin();0
    const ThreePlugin = createPlugin();0
0
    EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginsByName({0
      one: OnePlugin,0
      three: ThreePlugin,0
    });0
    EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginOrder(['one', 'two', 'three']);0
    EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginsByName({0
      two: TwoPlugin,0
      three: ThreePlugin,0
    });0
0
    expect(EventPluginRegistry.plugins.length).toBe(3);0
    expect(EventPluginRegistry.plugins[0]).toBe(OnePlugin);0
    expect(EventPluginRegistry.plugins[1]).toBe(TwoPlugin);0
    expect(EventPluginRegistry.plugins[2]).toBe(ThreePlugin);0
  });0
0
  it('should throw if plugin does not implement `extractEvents`', () => {0
    const BadPlugin = {};0
0
    EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginOrder(['bad']);0
0
    expect(function() {0
      EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginsByName({0
        bad: BadPlugin,0
      });0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'EventPluginRegistry: Event plugins must implement an `extractEvents` ' +0
        'method, but `bad` does not.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should throw if plugin does not exist in ordering', () => {0
    const OnePlugin = createPlugin();0
    const RandomPlugin = createPlugin();0
0
    EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginOrder(['one']);0
0
    expect(function() {0
      EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginsByName({0
        one: OnePlugin,0
        random: RandomPlugin,0
      });0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'EventPluginRegistry: Cannot inject event plugins that do not exist ' +0
        'in the plugin ordering, `random`.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should throw if ordering is injected more than once', () => {0
    const pluginOrdering = [];0
0
    EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginOrder(pluginOrdering);0
0
    expect(function() {0
      EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginOrder(pluginOrdering);0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'EventPluginRegistry: Cannot inject event plugin ordering more than ' +0
        'once. You are likely trying to load more than one copy of React.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should throw if different plugins injected using same name', () => {0
    const OnePlugin = createPlugin();0
    const TwoPlugin = createPlugin();0
0
    EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginsByName({same: OnePlugin});0
0
    expect(function() {0
      EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginsByName({same: TwoPlugin});0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'EventPluginRegistry: Cannot inject two different event plugins using ' +0
        'the same name, `same`.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should publish registration names of injected plugins', () => {0
    const OnePlugin = createPlugin({0
      eventTypes: {0
        click: {registrationName: 'onClick'},0
        focus: {registrationName: 'onFocus'},0
      },0
    });0
    const TwoPlugin = createPlugin({0
      eventTypes: {0
        magic: {0
          phasedRegistrationNames: {0
            bubbled: 'onMagicBubble',0
            captured: 'onMagicCapture',0
          },0
        },0
      },0
    });0
0
    EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginsByName({one: OnePlugin});0
    EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginOrder(['one', 'two']);0
0
    expect(0
      Object.keys(EventPluginRegistry.registrationNameModules).length,0
    ).toBe(2);0
    expect(EventPluginRegistry.registrationNameModules.onClick).toBe(OnePlugin);0
    expect(EventPluginRegistry.registrationNameModules.onFocus).toBe(OnePlugin);0
0
    EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginsByName({two: TwoPlugin});0
0
    expect(0
      Object.keys(EventPluginRegistry.registrationNameModules).length,0
    ).toBe(4);0
    expect(EventPluginRegistry.registrationNameModules.onMagicBubble).toBe(0
      TwoPlugin,0
    );0
    expect(EventPluginRegistry.registrationNameModules.onMagicCapture).toBe(0
      TwoPlugin,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should throw if multiple registration names collide', () => {0
    const OnePlugin = createPlugin({0
      eventTypes: {0
        photoCapture: {registrationName: 'onPhotoCapture'},0
      },0
    });0
    const TwoPlugin = createPlugin({0
      eventTypes: {0
        photo: {0
          phasedRegistrationNames: {0
            bubbled: 'onPhotoBubble',0
            captured: 'onPhotoCapture',0
          },0
        },0
      },0
    });0
0
    EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginsByName({0
      one: OnePlugin,0
      two: TwoPlugin,0
    });0
0
    expect(function() {0
      EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginOrder(['one', 'two']);0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'EventPluginHub: More than one plugin attempted to publish the same ' +0
        'registration name, `onPhotoCapture`.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should throw if an invalid event is published', () => {0
    const OnePlugin = createPlugin({0
      eventTypes: {0
        badEvent: {0
          /* missing configuration */0
        },0
      },0
    });0
0
    EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginsByName({one: OnePlugin});0
0
    expect(function() {0
      EventPluginRegistry.injectEventPluginOrder(['one']);0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'EventPluginRegistry: Failed to publish event `badEvent` for plugin ' +0
        '`one`.',0
    );0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0

'use strict';0
0
const {HostComponent} = require('shared/ReactTypeOfWork');0
0
let EventPluginHub;0
let ResponderEventPlugin;0
0
const touch = function(nodeHandle, i) {0
  return {target: nodeHandle, identifier: i};0
};0
0
/**0
 * @param {NodeHandle} nodeHandle @see NodeHandle. Handle of target.0
 * @param {Array<Touch>} touches All active touches.0
 * @param {Array<Touch>} changedTouches Only the touches that have changed.0
 * @return {TouchEvent} Model of a touch event that is compliant with responder0
 * system plugin.0
 */0
const touchEvent = function(nodeHandle, touches, changedTouches) {0
  return {0
    target: nodeHandle,0
    changedTouches: changedTouches,0
    touches: touches,0
  };0
};0
0
const subsequence = function(arr, indices) {0
  const ret = [];0
  for (let i = 0; i < indices.length; i++) {0
    const index = indices[i];0
    ret.push(arr[index]);0
  }0
  return ret;0
};0
0
const antiSubsequence = function(arr, indices) {0
  const ret = [];0
  for (let i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) {0
    if (indices.indexOf(i) === -1) {0
      ret.push(arr[i]);0
    }0
  }0
  return ret;0
};0
0
/**0
 * Helper for creating touch test config data.0
 * @param allTouchHandles0
 */0
const _touchConfig = function(0
  topType,0
  targetNodeHandle,0
  allTouchHandles,0
  changedIndices,0
  eventTarget,0
) {0
  const allTouchObjects = allTouchHandles.map(touch);0
  const changedTouchObjects = subsequence(allTouchObjects, changedIndices);0
  const activeTouchObjects =0
    topType === 'topTouchStart'0
      ? allTouchObjects0
      : topType === 'topTouchMove'0
        ? allTouchObjects0
        : topType === 'topTouchEnd'0
          ? antiSubsequence(allTouchObjects, changedIndices)0
          : topType === 'topTouchCancel'0
            ? antiSubsequence(allTouchObjects, changedIndices)0
            : null;0
0
  return {0
    nativeEvent: touchEvent(0
      targetNodeHandle,0
      activeTouchObjects,0
      changedTouchObjects,0
    ),0
    topLevelType: topType,0
    targetInst: getInstanceFromNode(targetNodeHandle),0
  };0
};0
0
/**0
 * Creates test data for touch events using environment agnostic "node0
 * handles".0
 *0
 * @param {NodeHandle} nodeHandle Environment agnostic handle to DOM node.0
 * @param {Array<NodeHandle>} allTouchHandles Encoding of all "touches" in the0
 * form of a mapping from integer (touch `identifier`) to touch target. This is0
 * encoded in array form. Because of this, it is possible for two separate0
 * touches (meaning two separate indices) to have the same touch target ID -0
 * this corresponds to real world cases where two separate unique touches have0
 * the same target. These touches don't just represent all active touches,0
 * rather it also includes any touches that are not active, but are in the0
 * process of being removed.0
 * @param {Array<NodeHandle>} changedIndices Indices of `allTouchHandles` that0
 * have changed.0
 * @return {object} Config data used by test cases for extracting responder0
 * events.0
 */0
const startConfig = function(nodeHandle, allTouchHandles, changedIndices) {0
  return _touchConfig(0
    'topTouchStart',0
    nodeHandle,0
    allTouchHandles,0
    changedIndices,0
    nodeHandle,0
  );0
};0
0
/**0
 * @see `startConfig`0
 */0
const moveConfig = function(nodeHandle, allTouchHandles, changedIndices) {0
  return _touchConfig(0
    'topTouchMove',0
    nodeHandle,0
    allTouchHandles,0
    changedIndices,0
    nodeHandle,0
  );0
};0
0
/**0
 * @see `startConfig`0
 */0
const endConfig = function(nodeHandle, allTouchHandles, changedIndices) {0
  return _touchConfig(0
    'topTouchEnd',0
    nodeHandle,0
    allTouchHandles,0
    changedIndices,0
    nodeHandle,0
  );0
};0
0
/**0
 * Test config for events that aren't negotiation related, but rather result of0
 * a negotiation.0
 *0
 * Returns object of the form:0
 *0
 *     {0
 *       responderReject: {0
 *         // Whatever "readableIDToID" was passed in.0
 *         grandParent: {order: NA, assertEvent: null, returnVal: blah},0
 *         ...0
 *         child: {order: NA, assertEvent: null, returnVal: blah},0
 *       }0
 *       responderGrant: {0
 *         grandParent: {order: NA, assertEvent: null, returnVal: blah},0
 *         ...0
 *         child: {order: NA, assertEvent: null, returnVal: blah}0
 *       }0
 *       ...0
 *     }0
 *0
 * After this is created, a test case would configure specific event orderings0
 * and optional assertions. Anything left with an `order` of `NA` will be0
 * required to never be invoked (the test runner will make sure it throws if0
 * ever invoked).0
 *0
 */0
const NA = -1;0
const oneEventLoopTestConfig = function(readableIDToID) {0
  const ret = {0
    // Negotiation0
    scrollShouldSetResponder: {bubbled: {}, captured: {}},0
    startShouldSetResponder: {bubbled: {}, captured: {}},0
    moveShouldSetResponder: {bubbled: {}, captured: {}},0
    responderTerminationRequest: {},0
0
    // Non-negotiation0
    responderReject: {}, // These do not bubble capture.0
    responderGrant: {},0
    responderStart: {},0
    responderMove: {},0
    responderTerminate: {},0
    responderEnd: {},0
    responderRelease: {},0
  };0
  for (const eventName in ret) {0
    for (const readableNodeName in readableIDToID) {0
      if (ret[eventName].bubbled) {0
        // Two phase0
        ret[eventName].bubbled[readableNodeName] = {0
          order: NA,0
          assertEvent: null,0
          returnVal: undefined,0
        };0
        ret[eventName].captured[readableNodeName] = {0
          order: NA,0
          assertEvent: null,0
          returnVal: undefined,0
        };0
      } else {0
        ret[eventName][readableNodeName] = {0
          order: NA,0
          assertEvent: null,0
          returnVal: undefined,0
        };0
      }0
    }0
  }0
  return ret;0
};0
0
/**0
 * @param {object} eventTestConfig0
 * @param {object} readableIDToID0
 */0
const registerTestHandlers = function(eventTestConfig, readableIDToID) {0
  const runs = {dispatchCount: 0};0
  const neverFire = function(readableID, registrationName) {0
    runs.dispatchCount++;0
    expect('').toBe(0
      'Event type: ' +0
        registrationName +0
        '\nShould never occur on:' +0
        readableID +0
        '\nFor event test config:\n' +0
        JSON.stringify(eventTestConfig) +0
        '\n',0
    );0
  };0
0
  const registerOneEventType = function(registrationName, eventTypeTestConfig) {0
    for (const readableID in eventTypeTestConfig) {0
      const nodeConfig = eventTypeTestConfig[readableID];0
      const id = readableIDToID[readableID];0
      const handler =0
        nodeConfig.order === NA0
          ? neverFire.bind(null, readableID, registrationName)0
          : // We partially apply readableID and nodeConfig, as they change in the0
            // parent closure across iterations.0
            function(rID, config, e) {0
              expect(0
                rID +0
                  '->' +0
                  registrationName +0
                  ' index:' +0
                  runs.dispatchCount++,0
              ).toBe(rID + '->' + registrationName + ' index:' + config.order);0
              if (config.assertEvent) {0
                config.assertEvent(e);0
              }0
              return config.returnVal;0
            }.bind(null, readableID, nodeConfig);0
      putListener(getInstanceFromNode(id), registrationName, handler);0
    }0
  };0
  for (const eventName in eventTestConfig) {0
    const oneEventTypeTestConfig = eventTestConfig[eventName];0
    const hasTwoPhase = !!oneEventTypeTestConfig.bubbled;0
    if (hasTwoPhase) {0
      registerOneEventType(0
        ResponderEventPlugin.eventTypes[eventName].phasedRegistrationNames0
          .bubbled,0
        oneEventTypeTestConfig.bubbled,0
      );0
      registerOneEventType(0
        ResponderEventPlugin.eventTypes[eventName].phasedRegistrationNames0
          .captured,0
        oneEventTypeTestConfig.captured,0
      );0
    } else {0
      registerOneEventType(0
        ResponderEventPlugin.eventTypes[eventName].registrationName,0
        oneEventTypeTestConfig,0
      );0
    }0
  }0
  return runs;0
};0
0
const run = function(config, hierarchyConfig, nativeEventConfig) {0
  let max = NA;0
  const searchForMax = function(nodeConfig) {0
    for (const readableID in nodeConfig) {0
      const order = nodeConfig[readableID].order;0
      max = order > max ? order : max;0
    }0
  };0
  for (const eventName in config) {0
    const eventConfig = config[eventName];0
    if (eventConfig.bubbled) {0
      searchForMax(eventConfig.bubbled);0
      searchForMax(eventConfig.captured);0
    } else {0
      searchForMax(eventConfig);0
    }0
  }0
0
  // Register the handlers0
  const runData = registerTestHandlers(config, hierarchyConfig);0
0
  // Trigger the event0
  const extractedEvents = ResponderEventPlugin.extractEvents(0
    nativeEventConfig.topLevelType,0
    nativeEventConfig.targetInst,0
    nativeEventConfig.nativeEvent,0
    nativeEventConfig.target,0
  );0
0
  // At this point the negotiation events have been dispatched as part of the0
  // extraction process, but not the side effectful events. Below, we dispatch0
  // side effectful events.0
  EventPluginHub.runEventsInBatch(extractedEvents, true);0
0
  // Ensure that every event that declared an `order`, was actually dispatched.0
  expect('number of events dispatched:' + runData.dispatchCount).toBe(0
    'number of events dispatched:' + (max + 1),0
  ); // +1 for extra ++0
};0
0
const GRANDPARENT_HOST_NODE = {};0
const PARENT_HOST_NODE = {};0
const CHILD_HOST_NODE = {};0
const CHILD_HOST_NODE2 = {};0
0
// These intentionally look like Fibers. ReactTreeTraversal depends on their field names.0
// TODO: we could test this with regular DOM nodes (and real fibers) instead.0
const GRANDPARENT_INST = {0
  return: null,0
  tag: HostComponent,0
  stateNode: GRANDPARENT_HOST_NODE,0
  memoizedProps: {},0
};0
const PARENT_INST = {0
  return: GRANDPARENT_INST,0
  tag: HostComponent,0
  stateNode: PARENT_HOST_NODE,0
  memoizedProps: {},0
};0
const CHILD_INST = {0
  return: PARENT_INST,0
  tag: HostComponent,0
  stateNode: CHILD_HOST_NODE,0
  memoizedProps: {},0
};0
const CHILD_INST2 = {0
  return: PARENT_INST,0
  tag: HostComponent,0
  stateNode: CHILD_HOST_NODE2,0
  memoizedProps: {},0
};0
0
GRANDPARENT_HOST_NODE.testInstance = GRANDPARENT_INST;0
PARENT_HOST_NODE.testInstance = PARENT_INST;0
CHILD_HOST_NODE.testInstance = CHILD_INST;0
CHILD_HOST_NODE2.testInstance = CHILD_INST2;0
0
const three = {0
  grandParent: GRANDPARENT_HOST_NODE,0
  parent: PARENT_HOST_NODE,0
  child: CHILD_HOST_NODE,0
};0
0
const siblings = {0
  parent: PARENT_HOST_NODE,0
  childOne: CHILD_HOST_NODE,0
  childTwo: CHILD_HOST_NODE2,0
};0
0
function getInstanceFromNode(node) {0
  return node.testInstance;0
}0
0
function getNodeFromInstance(inst) {0
  return inst.stateNode;0
}0
0
function getFiberCurrentPropsFromNode(node) {0
  return node.testInstance.memoizedProps;0
}0
0
function putListener(instance, registrationName, handler) {0
  instance.memoizedProps[registrationName] = handler;0
}0
0
function deleteAllListeners(instance) {0
  instance.memoizedProps = {};0
}0
0
describe('ResponderEventPlugin', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    const ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    const ReactDOMUnstableNativeDependencies = require('react-dom/unstable-native-dependencies');0
    EventPluginHub =0
      ReactDOM.__SECRET_INTERNALS_DO_NOT_USE_OR_YOU_WILL_BE_FIRED0
        .EventPluginHub;0
    const injectComponentTree =0
      ReactDOMUnstableNativeDependencies.injectComponentTree;0
    ResponderEventPlugin =0
      ReactDOMUnstableNativeDependencies.ResponderEventPlugin;0
0
    deleteAllListeners(GRANDPARENT_INST);0
    deleteAllListeners(PARENT_INST);0
    deleteAllListeners(CHILD_INST);0
    deleteAllListeners(CHILD_INST2);0
0
    injectComponentTree({0
      getInstanceFromNode,0
      getNodeFromInstance,0
      getFiberCurrentPropsFromNode,0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('should do nothing when no one wants to respond', () => {0
    let config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.child = {0
      order: 2,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.bubbled.child = {order: 3, returnVal: false};0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.bubbled.parent = {0
      order: 4,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.bubbled.grandParent = {0
      order: 5,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    run(config, three, startConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(null);0
0
    // Now no handlers should be called on `touchEnd`.0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    run(config, three, endConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  /**0
   * Simple Start Granting0
   * --------------------0
   */0
0
  it('should grant responder grandParent while capturing', () => {0
    let config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: true,0
    };0
    config.responderGrant.grandParent = {order: 1};0
    config.responderStart.grandParent = {order: 2};0
    run(config, three, startConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.grandParent),0
    );0
0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.responderEnd.grandParent = {order: 0};0
    config.responderRelease.grandParent = {order: 1};0
    run(config, three, endConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('should grant responder parent while capturing', () => {0
    let config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: true,0
    };0
    config.responderGrant.parent = {order: 2};0
    config.responderStart.parent = {order: 3};0
    run(config, three, startConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.parent),0
    );0
0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.responderEnd.parent = {order: 0};0
    config.responderRelease.parent = {order: 1};0
    run(config, three, endConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('should grant responder child while capturing', () => {0
    let config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.child = {order: 2, returnVal: true};0
    config.responderGrant.child = {order: 3};0
    config.responderStart.child = {order: 4};0
    run(config, three, startConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.child),0
    );0
0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.responderEnd.child = {order: 0};0
    config.responderRelease.child = {order: 1};0
    run(config, three, endConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('should grant responder child while bubbling', () => {0
    let config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.child = {0
      order: 2,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.bubbled.child = {order: 3, returnVal: true};0
    config.responderGrant.child = {order: 4};0
    config.responderStart.child = {order: 5};0
    run(config, three, startConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.child),0
    );0
0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.responderEnd.child = {order: 0};0
    config.responderRelease.child = {order: 1};0
    run(config, three, endConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('should grant responder parent while bubbling', () => {0
    let config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.child = {0
      order: 2,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.bubbled.child = {order: 3, returnVal: false};0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.bubbled.parent = {order: 4, returnVal: true};0

    config.responderStart.parent = {order: 6};0

    run(config, three, startConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
0

      order: 0,0
      returnVal: true,0
    };0

    config.responderMove.grandParent = {order: 2};0

      getInstanceFromNode(three.grandParent),0
    );0

    run(config, three, endConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0

  });0

      getInstanceFromNode(three.grandParent),0

0
  /**0
   * Common ancestor tests0
   * ---------------------0
   */0
0
  it('should bubble negotiation to first common ancestor of responder', () => {0
    let config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: true,0
    };0
    config.responderGrant.parent = {order: 2};0
    config.responderStart.parent = {order: 3};0
    run(config, three, startConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.parent),0
    );0
0
    // While `parent` is still responder, we create new handlers that verify0
    // the ordering of propagation, restarting the count at `0`.0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.bubbled.grandParent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.responderStart.parent = {order: 2};0
    run(config, three, startConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.parent),0
    );0
0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.responderEnd.parent = {order: 0};0
    config.responderRelease.parent = {order: 1};0
    run(config, three, endConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('should bubble negotiation to first common ancestor of responder then transfer', () => {0
    let config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: true,0
    };0
    config.responderGrant.parent = {order: 2};0
    config.responderStart.parent = {order: 3};0
    run(config, three, startConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.parent),0
    );0
0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
0
    // Parent is responder, and responder is transferred by a second touch start0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: true,0
    };0
    config.responderGrant.grandParent = {order: 1};0
    config.responderTerminationRequest.parent = {order: 2, returnVal: true};0
    config.responderTerminate.parent = {order: 3};0
    config.responderStart.grandParent = {order: 4};0
    run(0
      config,0
      three,0
      startConfig(three.child, [three.child, three.child], [1]),0
    );0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.grandParent),0
    );0
0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.responderEnd.grandParent = {order: 0};0
    // one remains\ /one ended \0
    run(config, three, endConfig(three.child, [three.child, three.child], [1]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.grandParent),0
    );0
0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.responderEnd.grandParent = {order: 0};0
    config.responderRelease.grandParent = {order: 1};0
    run(config, three, endConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  /**0
   * If nothing is responder, then the negotiation should propagate directly to0
   * the deepest target in the second touch.0
   */0
  it('should negotiate with deepest target on second touch if nothing is responder', () => {0
    // Initially nothing wants to become the responder0
    let config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.bubbled.parent = {0
      order: 2,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.bubbled.grandParent = {0
      order: 3,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
0
    run(config, three, startConfig(three.parent, [three.parent], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(null);0
0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
0
    // Now child wants to become responder. Negotiation should bubble as deep0
    // as the target is because we don't find first common ancestor (with0
    // current responder) because there is no current responder.0
    // (Even if this is the second active touch).0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.child = {0
      order: 2,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.bubbled.child = {order: 3, returnVal: true};0
    config.responderGrant.child = {order: 4};0
    config.responderStart.child = {order: 5};0
    //                                     /  Two active touches  \  /one of them new\0
    run(0
      config,0
      three,0
      startConfig(three.child, [three.parent, three.child], [1]),0
    );0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.child),0
    );0
0
    // Now we remove the original first touch, keeping the second touch that0
    // started within the current responder (child). Nothing changes because0
    // there's still touches that started inside of the current responder.0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.responderEnd.child = {order: 0};0
    //                                      / one ended\  /one remains \0
    run(0
      config,0
      three,0
      endConfig(three.child, [three.parent, three.child], [0]),0
    );0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.child),0
    );0
0
    // Okay, now let's add back that first touch (nothing should change) and0
    // then we'll try peeling back the touches in the opposite order to make0
    // sure that first removing the second touch instantly causes responder to0
    // be released.0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.bubbled.parent = {0
      order: 2,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.bubbled.grandParent = {0
      order: 3,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    // Interesting: child still gets moves even though touch target is parent!0
    // Current responder gets a `responderStart` for any touch while responder.0
    config.responderStart.child = {order: 4};0
    //                                           /  Two active touches  \  /one of them new\0
    run(0
      config,0
      three,0
      startConfig(three.parent, [three.child, three.parent], [1]),0
    );0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.child),0
    );0
0
    // Now, move that new touch that had no effect, and did not start within0
    // the current responder.0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.moveShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.moveShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.moveShouldSetResponder.bubbled.parent = {order: 2, returnVal: false};0
    config.moveShouldSetResponder.bubbled.grandParent = {0
      order: 3,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    // Interesting: child still gets moves even though touch target is parent!0
    // Current responder gets a `responderMove` for any touch while responder.0
    config.responderMove.child = {order: 4};0
    //                                     /  Two active touches  \  /one of them moved\0
    run(0
      config,0
      three,0
      moveConfig(three.parent, [three.child, three.parent], [1]),0
    );0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.child),0
    );0
0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.responderEnd.child = {order: 0};0
    config.responderRelease.child = {order: 1};0
    //                                        /child end \ /parent remain\0
    run(0
      config,0
      three,0
      endConfig(three.child, [three.child, three.parent], [0]),0
    );0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  /**0
   * If nothing is responder, then the negotiation should propagate directly to0
   * the deepest target in the second touch.0
   */0
  it('should negotiate until first common ancestor when there are siblings', () => {0
    // Initially nothing wants to become the responder0
    let config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(siblings);0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.childOne = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.bubbled.childOne = {0
      order: 2,0
      returnVal: true,0
    };0
    config.responderGrant.childOne = {order: 3};0
    config.responderStart.childOne = {order: 4};0
0
    run(0
      config,0
      siblings,0
      startConfig(siblings.childOne, [siblings.childOne], [0]),0
    );0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(siblings.childOne),0
    );0
0
    // If the touch target is the sibling item, the negotiation should only0
    // propagate to first common ancestor of current responder and sibling (so0
    // the parent).0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(siblings);0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.bubbled.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.responderStart.childOne = {order: 2};0
0
    const touchConfig = startConfig(0
      siblings.childTwo,0
      [siblings.childOne, siblings.childTwo],0
      [1],0
    );0
    run(config, siblings, touchConfig);0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(siblings.childOne),0
    );0
0
    // move childOne0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(siblings);0
    config.moveShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.moveShouldSetResponder.bubbled.parent = {order: 1, returnVal: false};0
    config.responderMove.childOne = {order: 2};0
    run(0
      config,0
      siblings,0
      moveConfig(0
        siblings.childOne,0
        [siblings.childOne, siblings.childTwo],0
        [0],0
      ),0
    );0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(siblings.childOne),0
    );0
0
    // move childTwo: Only negotiates to `parent`.0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(siblings);0
    config.moveShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.moveShouldSetResponder.bubbled.parent = {order: 1, returnVal: false};0
    config.responderMove.childOne = {order: 2};0
    run(0
      config,0
      siblings,0
      moveConfig(0
        siblings.childTwo,0
        [siblings.childOne, siblings.childTwo],0
        [1],0
      ),0
    );0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(siblings.childOne),0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should notify of being rejected. responderStart/Move happens on current responder', () => {0
    // Initially nothing wants to become the responder0
    let config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.child = {0
      order: 2,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.bubbled.child = {order: 3, returnVal: true};0
    config.responderGrant.child = {order: 4};0
    config.responderStart.child = {order: 5};0
0
    run(config, three, startConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.child),0
    );0
0
    // Suppose parent wants to become responder on move, and is rejected0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.moveShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.moveShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.moveShouldSetResponder.bubbled.parent = {order: 2, returnVal: true};0
    config.responderGrant.parent = {order: 3};0
    config.responderTerminationRequest.child = {order: 4, returnVal: false};0
    config.responderReject.parent = {order: 5};0
    // The start/move should occur on the original responder if new one is rejected0
    config.responderMove.child = {order: 6};0
0
    let touchConfig = moveConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]);0
    run(config, three, touchConfig);0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.child),0
    );0
0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.bubbled.parent = {order: 2, returnVal: true};0
    config.responderGrant.parent = {order: 3};0
    config.responderTerminationRequest.child = {order: 4, returnVal: false};0
    config.responderReject.parent = {order: 5};0
    // The start/move should occur on the original responder if new one is rejected0
    config.responderStart.child = {order: 6};0
0
    touchConfig = startConfig(three.child, [three.child, three.child], [1]);0
    run(config, three, touchConfig);0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.child),0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should negotiate scroll', () => {0
    // Initially nothing wants to become the responder0
    let config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.child = {0
      order: 2,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.bubbled.child = {order: 3, returnVal: true};0
    config.responderGrant.child = {order: 4};0
    config.responderStart.child = {order: 5};0
0
    run(config, three, startConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.child),0
    );0
0
    // If the touch target is the sibling item, the negotiation should only0
    // propagate to first common ancestor of current responder and sibling (so0
    // the parent).0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.scrollShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.scrollShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.scrollShouldSetResponder.bubbled.parent = {0
      order: 2,0
      returnVal: true,0
    };0
    config.responderGrant.parent = {order: 3};0
    config.responderTerminationRequest.child = {order: 4, returnVal: false};0
    config.responderReject.parent = {order: 5};0
0
    run(config, three, {0
      topLevelType: 'topScroll',0
      targetInst: getInstanceFromNode(three.parent),0
      nativeEvent: {},0
    });0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.child),0
    );0
0
    // Now lets let the scroll take control this time.0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.scrollShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.scrollShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.scrollShouldSetResponder.bubbled.parent = {0
      order: 2,0
      returnVal: true,0
    };0
    config.responderGrant.parent = {order: 3};0
    config.responderTerminationRequest.child = {order: 4, returnVal: true};0
    config.responderTerminate.child = {order: 5};0
0
    run(config, three, {0
      topLevelType: 'topScroll',0
      targetInst: getInstanceFromNode(three.parent),0
      nativeEvent: {},0
    });0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.parent),0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should cancel correctly', () => {0
    // Initially our child becomes responder0
    let config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.grandParent = {0
      order: 0,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.parent = {0
      order: 1,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.captured.child = {0
      order: 2,0
      returnVal: false,0
    };0
    config.startShouldSetResponder.bubbled.child = {order: 3, returnVal: true};0
    config.responderGrant.child = {order: 4};0
    config.responderStart.child = {order: 5};0
0
    run(config, three, startConfig(three.child, [three.child], [0]));0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(0
      getInstanceFromNode(three.child),0
    );0
0
    config = oneEventLoopTestConfig(three);0
    config.responderEnd.child = {order: 0};0
    config.responderTerminate.child = {order: 1};0
0
    const nativeEvent = _touchConfig(0
      'topTouchCancel',0
      three.child,0
      [three.child],0
      [0],0
    );0
    run(config, three, nativeEvent);0
    expect(ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder()).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('should determine the first common ancestor correctly', () => {0
    // This test was moved here from the ReactTreeTraversal test since only the0
    // ResponderEventPlugin uses `getLowestCommonAncestor`0
    const React = require('react');0
    const ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
    const ReactTreeTraversal = require('shared/ReactTreeTraversal');0
    const ReactDOMComponentTree = require('../../react-dom/src/client/ReactDOMComponentTree');0
0
    class ChildComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div ref="DIV" id={this.props.id + '__DIV'}>0
            <div ref="DIV_1" id={this.props.id + '__DIV_1'} />0
            <div ref="DIV_2" id={this.props.id + '__DIV_2'} />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class ParentComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div ref="P" id="P">0
            <div ref="P_P1" id="P_P1">0
              <ChildComponent ref="P_P1_C1" id="P_P1_C1" />0
              <ChildComponent ref="P_P1_C2" id="P_P1_C2" />0
            </div>0
            <div ref="P_OneOff" id="P_OneOff" />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const parent = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<ParentComponent />);0
0
    const ancestors = [0
      // Common ancestor with self is self.0
      {0
        one: parent.refs.P_P1_C1.refs.DIV_1,0
        two: parent.refs.P_P1_C1.refs.DIV_1,0
        com: parent.refs.P_P1_C1.refs.DIV_1,0
      },0
      // Common ancestor with self is self - even if topmost DOM.0
      {one: parent.refs.P, two: parent.refs.P, com: parent.refs.P},0
      // Siblings0
      {0
        one: parent.refs.P_P1_C1.refs.DIV_1,0
        two: parent.refs.P_P1_C1.refs.DIV_2,0
        com: parent.refs.P_P1_C1.refs.DIV,0
      },0
      // Common ancestor with parent is the parent.0
      {0
        one: parent.refs.P_P1_C1.refs.DIV_1,0
        two: parent.refs.P_P1_C1.refs.DIV,0
        com: parent.refs.P_P1_C1.refs.DIV,0
      },0
      // Common ancestor with grandparent is the grandparent.0
      {0
        one: parent.refs.P_P1_C1.refs.DIV_1,0
        two: parent.refs.P_P1,0
        com: parent.refs.P_P1,0
      },0
      // Grandparent across subcomponent boundaries.0
      {0
        one: parent.refs.P_P1_C1.refs.DIV_1,0
        two: parent.refs.P_P1_C2.refs.DIV_1,0
        com: parent.refs.P_P1,0
      },0
      // Something deep with something one-off.0
      {0
        one: parent.refs.P_P1_C1.refs.DIV_1,0
        two: parent.refs.P_OneOff,0
        com: parent.refs.P,0
      },0
    ];0
    let i;0
    for (i = 0; i < ancestors.length; i++) {0
      const plan = ancestors[i];0
      const firstCommon = ReactTreeTraversal.getLowestCommonAncestor(0
        ReactDOMComponentTree.getInstanceFromNode(plan.one),0
        ReactDOMComponentTree.getInstanceFromNode(plan.two),0
      );0
      expect(firstCommon).toBe(0
        ReactDOMComponentTree.getInstanceFromNode(plan.com),0
      );0
    }0
  });0
});0

// Note: ideally these would be imported from DOMTopLevelEventTypes,0
// but our build system currently doesn't let us do that from a fork.0
0
export const TOP_TOUCH_START = 'touchstart';0
export const TOP_TOUCH_MOVE = 'touchmove';0
export const TOP_TOUCH_END = 'touchend';0
export const TOP_TOUCH_CANCEL = 'touchcancel';0
export const TOP_SCROLL = 'scroll';0
export const TOP_SELECTION_CHANGE = 'selectionchange';0
export const TOP_MOUSE_DOWN = 'mousedown';0
export const TOP_MOUSE_MOVE = 'mousemove';0
export const TOP_MOUSE_UP = 'mouseup';0
0
export function isStartish(topLevelType: mixed): boolean {0
  return topLevelType === TOP_TOUCH_START || topLevelType === TOP_MOUSE_DOWN;0
}0
0
export function isMoveish(topLevelType: mixed): boolean {0
  return topLevelType === TOP_TOUCH_MOVE || topLevelType === TOP_MOUSE_MOVE;0
}0
0
export function isEndish(topLevelType: mixed): boolean {0
  return (0
    topLevelType === TOP_TOUCH_END ||0
    topLevelType === TOP_TOUCH_CANCEL ||0
    topLevelType === TOP_MOUSE_UP0
  );0
}0
0
export const startDependencies = [TOP_TOUCH_START, TOP_MOUSE_DOWN];0
export const moveDependencies = [TOP_TOUCH_MOVE, TOP_MOUSE_MOVE];0
export const endDependencies = [TOP_TOUCH_CANCEL, TOP_TOUCH_END, TOP_MOUSE_UP];0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0

import {REACT_FORWARD_REF_TYPE} from 'shared/ReactSymbols';0
0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
export default function forwardRef<Props, ElementType: React$ElementType>(0
  render: (props: Props, ref: React$ElementRef<ElementType>) => React$Node,0
) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    warning(0
      typeof render === 'function',0
      'forwardRef requires a render function but was given %s.',0
      render === null ? 'null' : typeof render,0
    );0
0
    if (render != null) {0
      warning(0
        render.defaultProps == null && render.propTypes == null,0
        'forwardRef render functions do not support propTypes or defaultProps. ' +0
          'Did you accidentally pass a React component?',0
      );0
    }0
  }0
0
  return {0
    $$typeof: REACT_FORWARD_REF_TYPE,0
    render,0
  };0
}0

  cloneElement: __DEV__ ? cloneElementWithValidation : cloneElement,0

    assign,0

  });0

import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import lowPriorityWarning from 'shared/lowPriorityWarning';0
0
import ReactNoopUpdateQueue from './ReactNoopUpdateQueue';0
0
const emptyObject = {};0
if (__DEV__) {0
  Object.freeze(emptyObject);0
}0
0
/**0
 * Base class helpers for the updating state of a component.0
 */0
function Component(props, context, updater) {0
  this.props = props;0
  this.context = context;0
  // If a component has string refs, we will assign a different object later.0
  this.refs = emptyObject;0
  // We initialize the default updater but the real one gets injected by the0
  // renderer.0
  this.updater = updater || ReactNoopUpdateQueue;0
}0
0
Component.prototype.isReactComponent = {};0
0
/**0
 * Sets a subset of the state. Always use this to mutate0
 * state. You should treat `this.state` as immutable.0
 *0
 * There is no guarantee that `this.state` will be immediately updated, so0
 * accessing `this.state` after calling this method may return the old value.0
 *0
 * There is no guarantee that calls to `setState` will run synchronously,0
 * as they may eventually be batched together.  You can provide an optional0
 * callback that will be executed when the call to setState is actually0
 * completed.0
 *0
 * When a function is provided to setState, it will be called at some point in0
 * the future (not synchronously). It will be called with the up to date0
 * component arguments (state, props, context). These values can be different0
 * from this.* because your function may be called after receiveProps but before0
 * shouldComponentUpdate, and this new state, props, and context will not yet be0
 * assigned to this.0
 *0
 * @param {object|function} partialState Next partial state or function to0
 *        produce next partial state to be merged with current state.0
 * @param {?function} callback Called after state is updated.0
 * @final0
 * @protected0
 */0
Component.prototype.setState = function(partialState, callback) {0
  invariant(0
    typeof partialState === 'object' ||0
      typeof partialState === 'function' ||0
      partialState == null,0
    'setState(...): takes an object of state variables to update or a ' +0
      'function which returns an object of state variables.',0
  );0
  this.updater.enqueueSetState(this, partialState, callback, 'setState');0
};0
0
/**0
 * Forces an update. This should only be invoked when it is known with0
 * certainty that we are **not** in a DOM transaction.0
 *0
 * You may want to call this when you know that some deeper aspect of the0
 * component's state has changed but `setState` was not called.0
 *0
 * This will not invoke `shouldComponentUpdate`, but it will invoke0
 * `componentWillUpdate` and `componentDidUpdate`.0
 *0
 * @param {?function} callback Called after update is complete.0
 * @final0
 * @protected0
 */0
Component.prototype.forceUpdate = function(callback) {0
  this.updater.enqueueForceUpdate(this, callback, 'forceUpdate');0
};0
0
/**0
 * Deprecated APIs. These APIs used to exist on classic React classes but since0
 * we would like to deprecate them, we're not going to move them over to this0
 * modern base class. Instead, we define a getter that warns if it's accessed.0
 */0
if (__DEV__) {0
  const deprecatedAPIs = {0
    isMounted: [0
      'isMounted',0
      'Instead, make sure to clean up subscriptions and pending requests in ' +0
        'componentWillUnmount to prevent memory leaks.',0
    ],0
    replaceState: [0
      'replaceState',0
      'Refactor your code to use setState instead (see ' +0
        'https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/3236).',0
    ],0
  };0
  const defineDeprecationWarning = function(methodName, info) {0
    Object.defineProperty(Component.prototype, methodName, {0
      get: function() {0
        lowPriorityWarning(0
          false,0
          '%s(...) is deprecated in plain JavaScript React classes. %s',0
          info[0],0
          info[1],0
        );0
        return undefined;0
      },0
    });0
  };0
  for (const fnName in deprecatedAPIs) {0
    if (deprecatedAPIs.hasOwnProperty(fnName)) {0
      defineDeprecationWarning(fnName, deprecatedAPIs[fnName]);0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function ComponentDummy() {}0
ComponentDummy.prototype = Component.prototype;0
0
/**0
 * Convenience component with default shallow equality check for sCU.0
 */0
function PureComponent(props, context, updater) {0
  this.props = props;0
  this.context = context;0
  // If a component has string refs, we will assign a different object later.0
  this.refs = emptyObject;0
  this.updater = updater || ReactNoopUpdateQueue;0
}0
0
const pureComponentPrototype = (PureComponent.prototype = new ComponentDummy());0
pureComponentPrototype.constructor = PureComponent;0
// Avoid an extra prototype jump for these methods.0
Object.assign(pureComponentPrototype, Component.prototype);0
pureComponentPrototype.isPureReactComponent = true;0
0
export {Component, PureComponent};0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
import {0
  getIteratorFn,0
  REACT_ELEMENT_TYPE,0
  REACT_PORTAL_TYPE,0
} from 'shared/ReactSymbols';0
0
import {isValidElement, cloneAndReplaceKey} from './ReactElement';0
import ReactDebugCurrentFrame from './ReactDebugCurrentFrame';0
0
const SEPARATOR = '.';0
const SUBSEPARATOR = ':';0
0
/**0
 * Escape and wrap key so it is safe to use as a reactid0
 *0
 * @param {string} key to be escaped.0
 * @return {string} the escaped key.0
 */0
function escape(key) {0
  const escapeRegex = /[=:]/g;0
  const escaperLookup = {0
    '=': '=0',0
    ':': '=2',0
  };0
  const escapedString = ('' + key).replace(escapeRegex, function(match) {0
    return escaperLookup[match];0
  });0
0
  return '$' + escapedString;0
}0
0
/**0
 * TODO: Test that a single child and an array with one item have the same key0
 * pattern.0
 */0
0
let didWarnAboutMaps = false;0
0
const userProvidedKeyEscapeRegex = /\/+/g;0
function escapeUserProvidedKey(text) {0
  return ('' + text).replace(userProvidedKeyEscapeRegex, '$&/');0
}0
0
const POOL_SIZE = 10;0
const traverseContextPool = [];0
function getPooledTraverseContext(0
  mapResult,0
  keyPrefix,0
  mapFunction,0
  mapContext,0
) {0
  if (traverseContextPool.length) {0
    const traverseContext = traverseContextPool.pop();0
    traverseContext.result = mapResult;0
    traverseContext.keyPrefix = keyPrefix;0
    traverseContext.func = mapFunction;0
    traverseContext.context = mapContext;0
    traverseContext.count = 0;0
    return traverseContext;0
  } else {0
    return {0
      result: mapResult,0
      keyPrefix: keyPrefix,0
      func: mapFunction,0
      context: mapContext,0
      count: 0,0
    };0
  }0
}0
0
function releaseTraverseContext(traverseContext) {0
  traverseContext.result = null;0
  traverseContext.keyPrefix = null;0
  traverseContext.func = null;0
  traverseContext.context = null;0
  traverseContext.count = 0;0
  if (traverseContextPool.length < POOL_SIZE) {0
    traverseContextPool.push(traverseContext);0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * @param {?*} children Children tree container.0
 * @param {!string} nameSoFar Name of the key path so far.0
 * @param {!function} callback Callback to invoke with each child found.0
 * @param {?*} traverseContext Used to pass information throughout the traversal0
 * process.0
 * @return {!number} The number of children in this subtree.0
 */0
function traverseAllChildrenImpl(0
  children,0
  nameSoFar,0
  callback,0
  traverseContext,0
) {0
  const type = typeof children;0
0
  if (type === 'undefined' || type === 'boolean') {0
    // All of the above are perceived as null.0
    children = null;0
  }0
0
  let invokeCallback = false;0
0
  if (children === null) {0
    invokeCallback = true;0
  } else {0
    switch (type) {0
      case 'string':0
      case 'number':0
        invokeCallback = true;0
        break;0
      case 'object':0
        switch (children.$$typeof) {0
          case REACT_ELEMENT_TYPE:0
          case REACT_PORTAL_TYPE:0
            invokeCallback = true;0
        }0
    }0
  }0
0
  if (invokeCallback) {0
    callback(0
      traverseContext,0
      children,0
      // If it's the only child, treat the name as if it was wrapped in an array0
      // so that it's consistent if the number of children grows.0
      nameSoFar === '' ? SEPARATOR + getComponentKey(children, 0) : nameSoFar,0
    );0
    return 1;0
  }0
0
  let child;0
  let nextName;0
  let subtreeCount = 0; // Count of children found in the current subtree.0
  const nextNamePrefix =0
    nameSoFar === '' ? SEPARATOR : nameSoFar + SUBSEPARATOR;0
0
  if (Array.isArray(children)) {0
    for (let i = 0; i < children.length; i++) {0
      child = children[i];0
      nextName = nextNamePrefix + getComponentKey(child, i);0
      subtreeCount += traverseAllChildrenImpl(0
        child,0
        nextName,0
        callback,0
        traverseContext,0
      );0
    }0
  } else {0
    const iteratorFn = getIteratorFn(children);0
    if (typeof iteratorFn === 'function') {0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        // Warn about using Maps as children0
        if (iteratorFn === children.entries) {0
          warning(0
            didWarnAboutMaps,0
            'Using Maps as children is unsupported and will likely yield ' +0
              'unexpected results. Convert it to a sequence/iterable of keyed ' +0
              'ReactElements instead.%s',0
            ReactDebugCurrentFrame.getStackAddendum(),0
          );0
          didWarnAboutMaps = true;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const iterator = iteratorFn.call(children);0
      let step;0
      let ii = 0;0
      while (!(step = iterator.next()).done) {0
        child = step.value;0
        nextName = nextNamePrefix + getComponentKey(child, ii++);0
        subtreeCount += traverseAllChildrenImpl(0
          child,0
          nextName,0
          callback,0
          traverseContext,0
        );0
      }0
    } else if (type === 'object') {0
      let addendum = '';0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        addendum =0
          ' If you meant to render a collection of children, use an array ' +0
          'instead.' +0
          ReactDebugCurrentFrame.getStackAddendum();0
      }0
      const childrenString = '' + children;0
      invariant(0
        false,0
        'Objects are not valid as a React child (found: %s).%s',0
        childrenString === '[object Object]'0
          ? 'object with keys {' + Object.keys(children).join(', ') + '}'0
          : childrenString,0
        addendum,0
      );0
    }0
  }0
0
  return subtreeCount;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Traverses children that are typically specified as `props.children`, but0
 * might also be specified through attributes:0
 *0
 * - `traverseAllChildren(this.props.children, ...)`0
 * - `traverseAllChildren(this.props.leftPanelChildren, ...)`0
 *0
 * The `traverseContext` is an optional argument that is passed through the0
 * entire traversal. It can be used to store accumulations or anything else that0
 * the callback might find relevant.0
 *0
 * @param {?*} children Children tree object.0
 * @param {!function} callback To invoke upon traversing each child.0
 * @param {?*} traverseContext Context for traversal.0
 * @return {!number} The number of children in this subtree.0
 */0
function traverseAllChildren(children, callback, traverseContext) {0
  if (children == null) {0
    return 0;0
  }0
0
  return traverseAllChildrenImpl(children, '', callback, traverseContext);0
}0
0
/**0
 * Generate a key string that identifies a component within a set.0
 *0
 * @param {*} component A component that could contain a manual key.0
 * @param {number} index Index that is used if a manual key is not provided.0
 * @return {string}0
 */0
function getComponentKey(component, index) {0
  // Do some typechecking here since we call this blindly. We want to ensure0
  // that we don't block potential future ES APIs.0
  if (0
    typeof component === 'object' &&0
    component !== null &&0
    component.key != null0
  ) {0
    // Explicit key0
    return escape(component.key);0
  }0
  // Implicit key determined by the index in the set0
  return index.toString(36);0
}0
0
function forEachSingleChild(bookKeeping, child, name) {0
  const {func, context} = bookKeeping;0
  func.call(context, child, bookKeeping.count++);0
}0
0
/**0
 * Iterates through children that are typically specified as `props.children`.0
 *0
 * See https://reactjs.org/docs/react-api.html#reactchildrenforeach0
 *0
 * The provided forEachFunc(child, index) will be called for each0
 * leaf child.0
 *0
 * @param {?*} children Children tree container.0
 * @param {function(*, int)} forEachFunc0
 * @param {*} forEachContext Context for forEachContext.0
 */0
function forEachChildren(children, forEachFunc, forEachContext) {0
  if (children == null) {0
    return children;0
  }0
  const traverseContext = getPooledTraverseContext(0
    null,0
    null,0
    forEachFunc,0
    forEachContext,0
  );0
  traverseAllChildren(children, forEachSingleChild, traverseContext);0
  releaseTraverseContext(traverseContext);0
}0
0
function mapSingleChildIntoContext(bookKeeping, child, childKey) {0
  const {result, keyPrefix, func, context} = bookKeeping;0
0
  let mappedChild = func.call(context, child, bookKeeping.count++);0
  if (Array.isArray(mappedChild)) {0
    mapIntoWithKeyPrefixInternal(mappedChild, result, childKey, c => c);0
  } else if (mappedChild != null) {0
    if (isValidElement(mappedChild)) {0
      mappedChild = cloneAndReplaceKey(0
        mappedChild,0
        // Keep both the (mapped) and old keys if they differ, just as0
        // traverseAllChildren used to do for objects as children0
        keyPrefix +0
          (mappedChild.key && (!child || child.key !== mappedChild.key)0
            ? escapeUserProvidedKey(mappedChild.key) + '/'0
            : '') +0
          childKey,0
      );0
    }0
    result.push(mappedChild);0
  }0
}0
0
function mapIntoWithKeyPrefixInternal(children, array, prefix, func, context) {0
  let escapedPrefix = '';0
  if (prefix != null) {0
    escapedPrefix = escapeUserProvidedKey(prefix) + '/';0
  }0
  const traverseContext = getPooledTraverseContext(0
    array,0
    escapedPrefix,0
    func,0
    context,0
  );0
  traverseAllChildren(children, mapSingleChildIntoContext, traverseContext);0
  releaseTraverseContext(traverseContext);0
}0
0
/**0
 * Maps children that are typically specified as `props.children`.0
 *0
 * See https://reactjs.org/docs/react-api.html#reactchildrenmap0
 *0
 * The provided mapFunction(child, key, index) will be called for each0
 * leaf child.0
 *0
 * @param {?*} children Children tree container.0
 * @param {function(*, int)} func The map function.0
 * @param {*} context Context for mapFunction.0
 * @return {object} Object containing the ordered map of results.0
 */0
function mapChildren(children, func, context) {0
  if (children == null) {0
    return children;0
  }0
  const result = [];0
  mapIntoWithKeyPrefixInternal(children, result, null, func, context);0
  return result;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Count the number of children that are typically specified as0
 * `props.children`.0
 *0
 * See https://reactjs.org/docs/react-api.html#reactchildrencount0
 *0
 * @param {?*} children Children tree container.0
 * @return {number} The number of children.0
 */0
function countChildren(children) {0
  return traverseAllChildren(children, () => null, null);0
}0
0
/**0
 * Flatten a children object (typically specified as `props.children`) and0
 * return an array with appropriately re-keyed children.0
 *0
 * See https://reactjs.org/docs/react-api.html#reactchildrentoarray0
 */0
function toArray(children) {0
  const result = [];0
  mapIntoWithKeyPrefixInternal(children, result, null, child => child);0
  return result;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Returns the first child in a collection of children and verifies that there0
 * is only one child in the collection.0
 *0
 * See https://reactjs.org/docs/react-api.html#reactchildrenonly0
 *0
 * The current implementation of this function assumes that a single child gets0
 * passed without a wrapper, but the purpose of this helper function is to0
 * abstract away the particular structure of children.0
 *0
 * @param {?object} children Child collection structure.0
 * @return {ReactElement} The first and only `ReactElement` contained in the0
 * structure.0
 */0
function onlyChild(children) {0
  invariant(0
    isValidElement(children),0
    'React.Children.only expected to receive a single React element child.',0
  );0
  return children;0
}0
0
export {0
  forEachChildren as forEach,0
  mapChildren as map,0
  countChildren as count,0
  onlyChild as only,0
  toArray,0
};0
/**0

 *0
 * @flow0
 */0

import {REACT_PROVIDER_TYPE, REACT_CONTEXT_TYPE} from 'shared/ReactSymbols';0
0
import type {ReactContext} from 'shared/ReactTypes';0
0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
export function createContext<T>(0
  defaultValue: T,0
  calculateChangedBits: ?(a: T, b: T) => number,0
): ReactContext<T> {0
  if (calculateChangedBits === undefined) {0
    calculateChangedBits = null;0
  } else {0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      warning(0
        calculateChangedBits === null ||0
          typeof calculateChangedBits === 'function',0
        'createContext: Expected the optional second argument to be a ' +0
          'function. Instead received: %s',0
        calculateChangedBits,0
      );0
    }0
  }0
0
  const context: ReactContext<T> = {0
    $$typeof: REACT_CONTEXT_TYPE,0
    _calculateChangedBits: calculateChangedBits,0
    _defaultValue: defaultValue,0
    _currentValue: defaultValue,0
    // As a workaround to support multiple concurrent renderers, we categorize0
    // some renderers as primary and others as secondary. We only expect0
    // there to be two concurrent renderers at most: React Native (primary) and0
    // Fabric (secondary); React DOM (primary) and React ART (secondary).0
    // Secondary renderers store their context values on separate fields.0
    _currentValue2: defaultValue,0
    _changedBits: 0,0
    _changedBits2: 0,0
    // These are circular0
    Provider: (null: any),0
    Consumer: (null: any),0
  };0
0
  context.Provider = {0
    $$typeof: REACT_PROVIDER_TYPE,0
    _context: context,0
  };0
  context.Consumer = context;0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    context._currentRenderer = null;0
    context._currentRenderer2 = null;0
  }0
0
  return context;0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {RefObject} from 'shared/ReactTypes';0
0
// an immutable object with a single mutable value0
export function createRef(): RefObject {0
  const refObject = {0
    current: null,0
  };0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    Object.seal(refObject);0
  }0
  return refObject;0
}0
/**0

 *0

 */0

import type {Fiber} from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiber';0
0
/**0
 * Keeps track of the current owner.0
 *0
 * The current owner is the component who should own any components that are0
 * currently being constructed.0
 */0
const ReactCurrentOwner = {0
  /**0
   * @internal0
   * @type {ReactComponent}0
   */0
  current: (null: null | Fiber),0
};0
0
export default ReactCurrentOwner;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
const ReactDebugCurrentFrame = {};0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  // Component that is being worked on0
  ReactDebugCurrentFrame.getCurrentStack = (null: null | (() => string | null));0
0
  ReactDebugCurrentFrame.getStackAddendum = function(): string | null {0
    const impl = ReactDebugCurrentFrame.getCurrentStack;0
    if (impl) {0
      return impl();0
    }0
    return null;0
  };0
}0
0
export default ReactDebugCurrentFrame;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2014-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0

import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
import {REACT_ELEMENT_TYPE} from 'shared/ReactSymbols';0
0
import ReactCurrentOwner from './ReactCurrentOwner';0
0
const hasOwnProperty = Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty;0
0
const RESERVED_PROPS = {0
  key: true,0
  ref: true,0
  __self: true,0
  __source: true,0
};0
0
let specialPropKeyWarningShown, specialPropRefWarningShown;0
0
function hasValidRef(config) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (hasOwnProperty.call(config, 'ref')) {0
      const getter = Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(config, 'ref').get;0
      if (getter && getter.isReactWarning) {0
        return false;0
      }0
    }0
  }0
  return config.ref !== undefined;0
}0
0
function hasValidKey(config) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (hasOwnProperty.call(config, 'key')) {0
      const getter = Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(config, 'key').get;0
      if (getter && getter.isReactWarning) {0
        return false;0
      }0
    }0
  }0
  return config.key !== undefined;0
}0
0
function defineKeyPropWarningGetter(props, displayName) {0
  const warnAboutAccessingKey = function() {0
    if (!specialPropKeyWarningShown) {0
      specialPropKeyWarningShown = true;0
      warning(0
        false,0
        '%s: `key` is not a prop. Trying to access it will result ' +0
          'in `undefined` being returned. If you need to access the same ' +0
          'value within the child component, you should pass it as a different ' +0
          'prop. (https://fb.me/react-special-props)',0
        displayName,0
      );0
    }0
  };0
  warnAboutAccessingKey.isReactWarning = true;0
  Object.defineProperty(props, 'key', {0
    get: warnAboutAccessingKey,0
    configurable: true,0
  });0
}0
0
function defineRefPropWarningGetter(props, displayName) {0
  const warnAboutAccessingRef = function() {0
    if (!specialPropRefWarningShown) {0
      specialPropRefWarningShown = true;0
      warning(0
        false,0
        '%s: `ref` is not a prop. Trying to access it will result ' +0
          'in `undefined` being returned. If you need to access the same ' +0
          'value within the child component, you should pass it as a different ' +0
          'prop. (https://fb.me/react-special-props)',0
        displayName,0
      );0
    }0
  };0
  warnAboutAccessingRef.isReactWarning = true;0
  Object.defineProperty(props, 'ref', {0
    get: warnAboutAccessingRef,0
    configurable: true,0
  });0
}0
0
/**0
 * Factory method to create a new React element. This no longer adheres to0
 * the class pattern, so do not use new to call it. Also, no instanceof check0
 * will work. Instead test $$typeof field against Symbol.for('react.element') to check0
 * if something is a React Element.0
 *0
 * @param {*} type0
 * @param {*} key0
 * @param {string|object} ref0
 * @param {*} self A *temporary* helper to detect places where `this` is0
 * different from the `owner` when React.createElement is called, so that we0
 * can warn. We want to get rid of owner and replace string `ref`s with arrow0
 * functions, and as long as `this` and owner are the same, there will be no0
 * change in behavior.0
 * @param {*} source An annotation object (added by a transpiler or otherwise)0
 * indicating filename, line number, and/or other information.0
 * @param {*} owner0
 * @param {*} props0
 * @internal0
 */0
const ReactElement = function(type, key, ref, self, source, owner, props) {0
  const element = {0
    // This tag allows us to uniquely identify this as a React Element0
    $$typeof: REACT_ELEMENT_TYPE,0
0
    // Built-in properties that belong on the element0
    type: type,0
    key: key,0
    ref: ref,0
    props: props,0
0
    // Record the component responsible for creating this element.0
    _owner: owner,0
  };0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    // The validation flag is currently mutative. We put it on0
    // an external backing store so that we can freeze the whole object.0
    // This can be replaced with a WeakMap once they are implemented in0
    // commonly used development environments.0
    element._store = {};0
0
    // To make comparing ReactElements easier for testing purposes, we make0
    // the validation flag non-enumerable (where possible, which should0
    // include every environment we run tests in), so the test framework0
    // ignores it.0
    Object.defineProperty(element._store, 'validated', {0
      configurable: false,0
      enumerable: false,0
      writable: true,0
      value: false,0
    });0
    // self and source are DEV only properties.0
    Object.defineProperty(element, '_self', {0
      configurable: false,0
      enumerable: false,0
      writable: false,0
      value: self,0
    });0
    // Two elements created in two different places should be considered0
    // equal for testing purposes and therefore we hide it from enumeration.0
    Object.defineProperty(element, '_source', {0
      configurable: false,0
      enumerable: false,0
      writable: false,0
      value: source,0
    });0
    if (Object.freeze) {0
      Object.freeze(element.props);0
      Object.freeze(element);0
    }0
  }0
0
  return element;0
};0
0
/**0
 * Create and return a new ReactElement of the given type.0
 * See https://reactjs.org/docs/react-api.html#createelement0
 */0
export function createElement(type, config, children) {0
  let propName;0
0
  // Reserved names are extracted0
  const props = {};0
0
  let key = null;0
  let ref = null;0
  let self = null;0
  let source = null;0
0
  if (config != null) {0
    if (hasValidRef(config)) {0
      ref = config.ref;0
    }0
    if (hasValidKey(config)) {0
      key = '' + config.key;0
    }0
0
    self = config.__self === undefined ? null : config.__self;0
    source = config.__source === undefined ? null : config.__source;0
    // Remaining properties are added to a new props object0
    for (propName in config) {0
      if (0
        hasOwnProperty.call(config, propName) &&0
        !RESERVED_PROPS.hasOwnProperty(propName)0
      ) {0
        props[propName] = config[propName];0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  // Children can be more than one argument, and those are transferred onto0
  // the newly allocated props object.0
  const childrenLength = arguments.length - 2;0
  if (childrenLength === 1) {0
    props.children = children;0
  } else if (childrenLength > 1) {0
    const childArray = Array(childrenLength);0
    for (let i = 0; i < childrenLength; i++) {0
      childArray[i] = arguments[i + 2];0
    }0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      if (Object.freeze) {0
        Object.freeze(childArray);0
      }0
    }0
    props.children = childArray;0
  }0
0
  // Resolve default props0
  if (type && type.defaultProps) {0
    const defaultProps = type.defaultProps;0
    for (propName in defaultProps) {0
      if (props[propName] === undefined) {0
        props[propName] = defaultProps[propName];0
      }0
    }0
  }0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (key || ref) {0
      if (0
        typeof props.$$typeof === 'undefined' ||0
        props.$$typeof !== REACT_ELEMENT_TYPE0
      ) {0
        const displayName =0
          typeof type === 'function'0
            ? type.displayName || type.name || 'Unknown'0
            : type;0
        if (key) {0
          defineKeyPropWarningGetter(props, displayName);0
        }0
        if (ref) {0
          defineRefPropWarningGetter(props, displayName);0
        }0
      }0
    }0
  }0
  return ReactElement(0
    type,0
    key,0
    ref,0
    self,0
    source,0
    ReactCurrentOwner.current,0
    props,0
  );0
}0
0
/**0
 * Return a function that produces ReactElements of a given type.0
 * See https://reactjs.org/docs/react-api.html#createfactory0
 */0
export function createFactory(type) {0
  const factory = createElement.bind(null, type);0
  // Expose the type on the factory and the prototype so that it can be0
  // easily accessed on elements. E.g. `<Foo />.type === Foo`.0
  // This should not be named `constructor` since this may not be the function0
  // that created the element, and it may not even be a constructor.0
  // Legacy hook: remove it0
  factory.type = type;0
  return factory;0
}0
0
export function cloneAndReplaceKey(oldElement, newKey) {0
  const newElement = ReactElement(0
    oldElement.type,0
    newKey,0
    oldElement.ref,0
    oldElement._self,0
    oldElement._source,0
    oldElement._owner,0
    oldElement.props,0
  );0
0
  return newElement;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Clone and return a new ReactElement using element as the starting point.0
 * See https://reactjs.org/docs/react-api.html#cloneelement0
 */0
export function cloneElement(element, config, children) {0
  invariant(0
    !(element === null || element === undefined),0
    'React.cloneElement(...): The argument must be a React element, but you passed %s.',0
    element,0
  );0
0
  let propName;0
0
  // Original props are copied0
  const props = Object.assign({}, element.props);0
0
  // Reserved names are extracted0
  let key = element.key;0
  let ref = element.ref;0
  // Self is preserved since the owner is preserved.0
  const self = element._self;0
  // Source is preserved since cloneElement is unlikely to be targeted by a0
  // transpiler, and the original source is probably a better indicator of the0
  // true owner.0
  const source = element._source;0
0
  // Owner will be preserved, unless ref is overridden0
  let owner = element._owner;0
0
  if (config != null) {0
    if (hasValidRef(config)) {0
      // Silently steal the ref from the parent.0
      ref = config.ref;0
      owner = ReactCurrentOwner.current;0
    }0
    if (hasValidKey(config)) {0
      key = '' + config.key;0
    }0
0
    // Remaining properties override existing props0
    let defaultProps;0
    if (element.type && element.type.defaultProps) {0
      defaultProps = element.type.defaultProps;0
    }0
    for (propName in config) {0
      if (0
        hasOwnProperty.call(config, propName) &&0
        !RESERVED_PROPS.hasOwnProperty(propName)0
      ) {0
        if (config[propName] === undefined && defaultProps !== undefined) {0
          // Resolve default props0
          props[propName] = defaultProps[propName];0
        } else {0
          props[propName] = config[propName];0
        }0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  // Children can be more than one argument, and those are transferred onto0
  // the newly allocated props object.0
  const childrenLength = arguments.length - 2;0
  if (childrenLength === 1) {0
