    props.children = children;0
  } else if (childrenLength > 1) {0
    const childArray = Array(childrenLength);0
    for (let i = 0; i < childrenLength; i++) {0
      childArray[i] = arguments[i + 2];0
    }0
    props.children = childArray;0
  }0
0
  return ReactElement(element.type, key, ref, self, source, owner, props);0
}0
0
/**0
 * Verifies the object is a ReactElement.0
 * See https://reactjs.org/docs/react-api.html#isvalidelement0
 * @param {?object} object0
 * @return {boolean} True if `object` is a valid component.0
 * @final0
 */0
export function isValidElement(object) {0
  return (0
    typeof object === 'object' &&0
    object !== null &&0
    object.$$typeof === REACT_ELEMENT_TYPE0
  );0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2014-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
/**0
 * ReactElementValidator provides a wrapper around a element factory0
 * which validates the props passed to the element. This is intended to be0
 * used only in DEV and could be replaced by a static type checker for languages0
 * that support it.0
 */0
0
import lowPriorityWarning from 'shared/lowPriorityWarning';0
import describeComponentFrame from 'shared/describeComponentFrame';0
import isValidElementType from 'shared/isValidElementType';0
import getComponentName from 'shared/getComponentName';0
import {0
  getIteratorFn,0
  REACT_FORWARD_REF_TYPE,0
  REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE,0
} from 'shared/ReactSymbols';0
import checkPropTypes from 'prop-types/checkPropTypes';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
import ReactCurrentOwner from './ReactCurrentOwner';0
import {isValidElement, createElement, cloneElement} from './ReactElement';0
import ReactDebugCurrentFrame from './ReactDebugCurrentFrame';0
0
let currentlyValidatingElement;0
let propTypesMisspellWarningShown;0
0
let getDisplayName = () => {};0
let getStackAddendum = () => {};0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  currentlyValidatingElement = null;0
0
  propTypesMisspellWarningShown = false;0
0
  getDisplayName = function(element): string {0
    if (element == null) {0
      return '#empty';0
    } else if (typeof element === 'string' || typeof element === 'number') {0
      return '#text';0
    } else if (typeof element.type === 'string') {0
      return element.type;0
    }0
0
    const type = element.type;0
    if (type === REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE) {0
      return 'React.Fragment';0
    } else if (0
      typeof type === 'object' &&0
      type !== null &&0
      type.$$typeof === REACT_FORWARD_REF_TYPE0
    ) {0
      const functionName = type.render.displayName || type.render.name || '';0
      return functionName !== '' ? `ForwardRef(${functionName})` : 'ForwardRef';0
    } else {0
      return type.displayName || type.name || 'Unknown';0
    }0
  };0
0
  getStackAddendum = function(): string {0
    let stack = '';0
    if (currentlyValidatingElement) {0
      const name = getDisplayName(currentlyValidatingElement);0
      const owner = currentlyValidatingElement._owner;0
      stack += describeComponentFrame(0
        name,0
        currentlyValidatingElement._source,0
        owner && getComponentName(owner),0
      );0
    }0
    stack += ReactDebugCurrentFrame.getStackAddendum() || '';0
    return stack;0
  };0
}0
0
function getDeclarationErrorAddendum() {0
  if (ReactCurrentOwner.current) {0
    const name = getComponentName(ReactCurrentOwner.current);0
    if (name) {0
      return '\n\nCheck the render method of `' + name + '`.';0
    }0
  }0
  return '';0
}0
0
function getSourceInfoErrorAddendum(elementProps) {0
  if (0
    elementProps !== null &&0
    elementProps !== undefined &&0
    elementProps.__source !== undefined0
  ) {0
    const source = elementProps.__source;0
    const fileName = source.fileName.replace(/^.*[\\\/]/, '');0
    const lineNumber = source.lineNumber;0
    return '\n\nCheck your code at ' + fileName + ':' + lineNumber + '.';0
  }0
  return '';0
}0
0
/**0
 * Warn if there's no key explicitly set on dynamic arrays of children or0
 * object keys are not valid. This allows us to keep track of children between0
 * updates.0
 */0
const ownerHasKeyUseWarning = {};0
0
function getCurrentComponentErrorInfo(parentType) {0
  let info = getDeclarationErrorAddendum();0
0
  if (!info) {0
    const parentName =0
      typeof parentType === 'string'0
        ? parentType0
        : parentType.displayName || parentType.name;0
    if (parentName) {0
      info = `\n\nCheck the top-level render call using <${parentName}>.`;0
    }0
  }0
  return info;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Warn if the element doesn't have an explicit key assigned to it.0
 * This element is in an array. The array could grow and shrink or be0
 * reordered. All children that haven't already been validated are required to0
 * have a "key" property assigned to it. Error statuses are cached so a warning0
 * will only be shown once.0
 *0
 * @internal0
 * @param {ReactElement} element Element that requires a key.0
 * @param {*} parentType element's parent's type.0
 */0
function validateExplicitKey(element, parentType) {0
  if (!element._store || element._store.validated || element.key != null) {0
    return;0
  }0
  element._store.validated = true;0
0
  const currentComponentErrorInfo = getCurrentComponentErrorInfo(parentType);0
  if (ownerHasKeyUseWarning[currentComponentErrorInfo]) {0
    return;0
  }0
  ownerHasKeyUseWarning[currentComponentErrorInfo] = true;0
0
  // Usually the current owner is the offender, but if it accepts children as a0
  // property, it may be the creator of the child that's responsible for0
  // assigning it a key.0
  let childOwner = '';0
  if (0
    element &&0
    element._owner &&0
    element._owner !== ReactCurrentOwner.current0
  ) {0
    // Give the component that originally created this child.0
    childOwner = ` It was passed a child from ${getComponentName(0
      element._owner,0
    )}.`;0
  }0
0
  currentlyValidatingElement = element;0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    warning(0
      false,0
      'Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique "key" prop.' +0
        '%s%s See https://fb.me/react-warning-keys for more information.%s',0
      currentComponentErrorInfo,0
      childOwner,0
      getStackAddendum(),0
    );0
  }0
  currentlyValidatingElement = null;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Ensure that every element either is passed in a static location, in an0
 * array with an explicit keys property defined, or in an object literal0
 * with valid key property.0
 *0
 * @internal0
 * @param {ReactNode} node Statically passed child of any type.0
 * @param {*} parentType node's parent's type.0
 */0
function validateChildKeys(node, parentType) {0
  if (typeof node !== 'object') {0
    return;0
  }0
  if (Array.isArray(node)) {0
    for (let i = 0; i < node.length; i++) {0
      const child = node[i];0
      if (isValidElement(child)) {0
        validateExplicitKey(child, parentType);0
      }0
    }0
  } else if (isValidElement(node)) {0
    // This element was passed in a valid location.0
    if (node._store) {0
      node._store.validated = true;0
    }0
  } else if (node) {0
    const iteratorFn = getIteratorFn(node);0
    if (typeof iteratorFn === 'function') {0
      // Entry iterators used to provide implicit keys,0
      // but now we print a separate warning for them later.0
      if (iteratorFn !== node.entries) {0
        const iterator = iteratorFn.call(node);0
        let step;0
        while (!(step = iterator.next()).done) {0
          if (isValidElement(step.value)) {0
            validateExplicitKey(step.value, parentType);0
          }0
        }0
      }0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Given an element, validate that its props follow the propTypes definition,0
 * provided by the type.0
 *0
 * @param {ReactElement} element0
 */0
function validatePropTypes(element) {0
  const type = element.type;0
  let name, propTypes;0
  if (typeof type === 'function') {0
    // Class or functional component0
    name = type.displayName || type.name;0
    propTypes = type.propTypes;0
  } else if (0
    typeof type === 'object' &&0
    type !== null &&0
    type.$$typeof === REACT_FORWARD_REF_TYPE0
  ) {0
    // ForwardRef0
    const functionName = type.render.displayName || type.render.name || '';0
    name = functionName !== '' ? `ForwardRef(${functionName})` : 'ForwardRef';0
    propTypes = type.propTypes;0
  } else {0
    return;0
  }0
  if (propTypes) {0
    currentlyValidatingElement = element;0
    checkPropTypes(propTypes, element.props, 'prop', name, getStackAddendum);0
    currentlyValidatingElement = null;0
  } else if (type.PropTypes !== undefined && !propTypesMisspellWarningShown) {0
    propTypesMisspellWarningShown = true;0
    warning(0
      false,0
      'Component %s declared `PropTypes` instead of `propTypes`. Did you misspell the property assignment?',0
      name || 'Unknown',0
    );0
  }0
  if (typeof type.getDefaultProps === 'function') {0
    warning(0
      type.getDefaultProps.isReactClassApproved,0
      'getDefaultProps is only used on classic React.createClass ' +0
        'definitions. Use a static property named `defaultProps` instead.',0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Given a fragment, validate that it can only be provided with fragment props0
 * @param {ReactElement} fragment0
 */0
function validateFragmentProps(fragment) {0
  currentlyValidatingElement = fragment;0
0
  const keys = Object.keys(fragment.props);0
  for (let i = 0; i < keys.length; i++) {0
    const key = keys[i];0
    if (key !== 'children' && key !== 'key') {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'Invalid prop `%s` supplied to `React.Fragment`. ' +0
          'React.Fragment can only have `key` and `children` props.%s',0
        key,0
        getStackAddendum(),0
      );0
      break;0
    }0
  }0
0
  if (fragment.ref !== null) {0
    warning(0
      false,0
      'Invalid attribute `ref` supplied to `React.Fragment`.%s',0
      getStackAddendum(),0
    );0
  }0
0
  currentlyValidatingElement = null;0
}0
0
export function createElementWithValidation(type, props, children) {0
  const validType = isValidElementType(type);0
0
  // We warn in this case but don't throw. We expect the element creation to0
  // succeed and there will likely be errors in render.0
  if (!validType) {0
    let info = '';0
    if (0
      type === undefined ||0
      (typeof type === 'object' &&0
        type !== null &&0
        Object.keys(type).length === 0)0
    ) {0
      info +=0
        ' You likely forgot to export your component from the file ' +0
        "it's defined in, or you might have mixed up default and named imports.";0
    }0
0
    const sourceInfo = getSourceInfoErrorAddendum(props);0
    if (sourceInfo) {0
      info += sourceInfo;0
    } else {0
      info += getDeclarationErrorAddendum();0
    }0
0
    info += getStackAddendum() || '';0
0
    let typeString;0
    if (type === null) {0
      typeString = 'null';0
    } else if (Array.isArray(type)) {0
      typeString = 'array';0
    } else {0
      typeString = typeof type;0
    }0
0
    warning(0
      false,0
      'React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string (for ' +0
        'built-in components) or a class/function (for composite ' +0
        'components) but got: %s.%s',0
      typeString,0
      info,0
    );0
  }0
0
  const element = createElement.apply(this, arguments);0
0
  // The result can be nullish if a mock or a custom function is used.0
  // TODO: Drop this when these are no longer allowed as the type argument.0
  if (element == null) {0
    return element;0
  }0
0
  // Skip key warning if the type isn't valid since our key validation logic0
  // doesn't expect a non-string/function type and can throw confusing errors.0
  // We don't want exception behavior to differ between dev and prod.0
  // (Rendering will throw with a helpful message and as soon as the type is0
  // fixed, the key warnings will appear.)0
  if (validType) {0
    for (let i = 2; i < arguments.length; i++) {0
      validateChildKeys(arguments[i], type);0
    }0
  }0
0
  if (type === REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE) {0
    validateFragmentProps(element);0
  } else {0
    validatePropTypes(element);0
  }0
0
  return element;0
}0
0
export function createFactoryWithValidation(type) {0
  const validatedFactory = createElementWithValidation.bind(null, type);0
  validatedFactory.type = type;0
  // Legacy hook: remove it0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    Object.defineProperty(validatedFactory, 'type', {0
      enumerable: false,0
      get: function() {0
        lowPriorityWarning(0
          false,0
          'Factory.type is deprecated. Access the class directly ' +0
            'before passing it to createFactory.',0
        );0
        Object.defineProperty(this, 'type', {0
          value: type,0
        });0
        return type;0
      },0
    });0
  }0
0
  return validatedFactory;0
}0
0
export function cloneElementWithValidation(element, props, children) {0
  const newElement = cloneElement.apply(this, arguments);0
  for (let i = 2; i < arguments.length; i++) {0
    validateChildKeys(arguments[i], newElement.type);0
  }0
  validatePropTypes(newElement);0
  return newElement;0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2015-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
const didWarnStateUpdateForUnmountedComponent = {};0
0
function warnNoop(publicInstance, callerName) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const constructor = publicInstance.constructor;0
    const componentName =0
      (constructor && (constructor.displayName || constructor.name)) ||0
      'ReactClass';0
    const warningKey = `${componentName}.${callerName}`;0
    if (didWarnStateUpdateForUnmountedComponent[warningKey]) {0
      return;0
    }0
    warning(0
      false,0
      "Can't call %s on a component that is not yet mounted. " +0
        'This is a no-op, but it might indicate a bug in your application. ' +0
        'Instead, assign to `this.state` directly or define a `state = {};` ' +0
        'class property with the desired state in the %s component.',0
      callerName,0
      componentName,0
    );0
    didWarnStateUpdateForUnmountedComponent[warningKey] = true;0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * This is the abstract API for an update queue.0
 */0
const ReactNoopUpdateQueue = {0
  /**0
   * Checks whether or not this composite component is mounted.0
   * @param {ReactClass} publicInstance The instance we want to test.0
   * @return {boolean} True if mounted, false otherwise.0
   * @protected0
   * @final0
   */0
  isMounted: function(publicInstance) {0
    return false;0
  },0
0
  /**0
   * Forces an update. This should only be invoked when it is known with0
   * certainty that we are **not** in a DOM transaction.0
   *0
   * You may want to call this when you know that some deeper aspect of the0
   * component's state has changed but `setState` was not called.0
   *0
   * This will not invoke `shouldComponentUpdate`, but it will invoke0
   * `componentWillUpdate` and `componentDidUpdate`.0
   *0
   * @param {ReactClass} publicInstance The instance that should rerender.0
   * @param {?function} callback Called after component is updated.0
   * @param {?string} callerName name of the calling function in the public API.0
   * @internal0
   */0
  enqueueForceUpdate: function(publicInstance, callback, callerName) {0
    warnNoop(publicInstance, 'forceUpdate');0
  },0
0
  /**0
   * Replaces all of the state. Always use this or `setState` to mutate state.0
   * You should treat `this.state` as immutable.0
   *0
   * There is no guarantee that `this.state` will be immediately updated, so0
   * accessing `this.state` after calling this method may return the old value.0
   *0
   * @param {ReactClass} publicInstance The instance that should rerender.0
   * @param {object} completeState Next state.0
   * @param {?function} callback Called after component is updated.0
   * @param {?string} callerName name of the calling function in the public API.0
   * @internal0
   */0
  enqueueReplaceState: function(0
    publicInstance,0
    completeState,0
    callback,0
    callerName,0
  ) {0
    warnNoop(publicInstance, 'replaceState');0
  },0
0
  /**0
   * Sets a subset of the state. This only exists because _pendingState is0
   * internal. This provides a merging strategy that is not available to deep0
   * properties which is confusing. TODO: Expose pendingState or don't use it0
   * during the merge.0
   *0
   * @param {ReactClass} publicInstance The instance that should rerender.0
   * @param {object} partialState Next partial state to be merged with state.0
   * @param {?function} callback Called after component is updated.0
   * @param {?string} Name of the calling function in the public API.0
   * @internal0
   */0
  enqueueSetState: function(0
    publicInstance,0
    partialState,0
    callback,0
    callerName,0
  ) {0
    warnNoop(publicInstance, 'setState');0
  },0
};0
0
export default ReactNoopUpdateQueue;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactFeatureFlags;0
let createReactClass;0
0
describe('create-react-class-integration', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.warnAboutDeprecatedLifecycles = true;0
0
    React = require('react');0
    createReactClass = require('create-react-class/factory')(0
      React.Component,0
      React.isValidElement,0
      new React.Component().updater,0
    );0
  });0
0
  // TODO (RFC #6) Merge this back into createReactClassIntegration-test once0
  // the 'warnAboutDeprecatedLifecycles' feature flag has been removed.0
  it('isMounted works', () => {0
    const ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
0
    const ops = [];0
    let instance;0
    const Component = createReactClass({0
      displayName: 'MyComponent',0
      mixins: [0
        {0
          UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
            this.log('mixin.componentWillMount');0
          },0
          componentDidMount() {0
            this.log('mixin.componentDidMount');0
          },0
          UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {0
            this.log('mixin.componentWillUpdate');0
          },0
          componentDidUpdate() {0
            this.log('mixin.componentDidUpdate');0
          },0
          componentWillUnmount() {0
            this.log('mixin.componentWillUnmount');0
          },0
        },0
      ],0
      log(name) {0
        ops.push(`${name}: ${this.isMounted()}`);0
      },0
      getInitialState() {0
        this.log('getInitialState');0
        return {};0
      },0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        this.log('componentWillMount');0
      },0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.log('componentDidMount');0
      },0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {0
        this.log('componentWillUpdate');0
      },0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        this.log('componentDidUpdate');0
      },0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        this.log('componentWillUnmount');0
      },0
      render() {0
        instance = this;0
        this.log('render');0
        return <div />;0
      },0
    });0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: MyComponent: isMounted is deprecated. Instead, make sure to ' +0
        'clean up subscriptions and pending requests in componentWillUnmount ' +0
        'to prevent memory leaks.',0
    );0
0
    // Dedupe0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container);0
0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    instance.log('after unmount');0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'getInitialState: false',0
      'mixin.componentWillMount: false',0
      'componentWillMount: false',0
      'render: false',0
      'mixin.componentDidMount: true',0
      'componentDidMount: true',0
      'mixin.componentWillUpdate: true',0
      'componentWillUpdate: true',0
      'render: true',0
      'mixin.componentDidUpdate: true',0
      'componentDidUpdate: true',0
      'mixin.componentWillUnmount: true',0
      'componentWillUnmount: true',0
      'after unmount: false',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  describe('ReactNative NativeMethodsMixin', () => {0
    let ReactNative;0
    let NativeMethodsMixin;0
0
    beforeEach(() => {0
      ReactNative = require('react-native-renderer');0
      NativeMethodsMixin =0
        ReactNative.__SECRET_INTERNALS_DO_NOT_USE_OR_YOU_WILL_BE_FIRED0
          .NativeMethodsMixin;0
    });0
0
    it('should not warn about default DEV-only legacy lifecycle methods', () => {0
      const View = createReactClass({0
        mixins: [NativeMethodsMixin],0
        render: () => null,0
      });0
0
      ReactNative.render(<View />, 1);0
    });0
0
    it('should warn if users specify their own legacy componentWillMount', () => {0
      const View = createReactClass({0
        displayName: 'MyNativeComponent',0
        mixins: [NativeMethodsMixin],0
        componentWillMount: () => {},0
        render: () => null,0
      });0
0
      expect(() => ReactNative.render(<View />, 1)).toLowPriorityWarnDev(0
        'componentWillMount is deprecated and will be removed in the next major version. ' +0
          'Use componentDidMount instead. As a temporary workaround, ' +0
          'you can rename to UNSAFE_componentWillMount.' +0
          '\n\nPlease update the following components: MyNativeComponent',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should warn if users specify their own legacy componentWillReceiveProps', () => {0
      const View = createReactClass({0
        displayName: 'MyNativeComponent',0
        mixins: [NativeMethodsMixin],0
        componentWillReceiveProps: () => {},0
        render: () => null,0
      });0
0
      expect(() => ReactNative.render(<View />, 1)).toLowPriorityWarnDev(0
        'componentWillReceiveProps is deprecated and will be removed in the next major version. ' +0
          'Use static getDerivedStateFromProps instead.' +0
          '\n\nPlease update the following components: MyNativeComponent',0
      );0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let PropTypes;0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
let createReactClass;0
0
describe('create-react-class-integration', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
    createReactClass = require('create-react-class/factory')(0
      React.Component,0
      React.isValidElement,0
      new React.Component().updater,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should throw when `render` is not specified', () => {0
    expect(function() {0
      createReactClass({});0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'createClass(...): Class specification must implement a `render` method.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should copy prop types onto the Constructor', () => {0
    const propValidator = jest.fn();0
    const TestComponent = createReactClass({0
      propTypes: {0
        value: propValidator,0
      },0
      render: function() {0
        return <div />;0
      },0
    });0
0
    expect(TestComponent.propTypes).toBeDefined();0
    expect(TestComponent.propTypes.value).toBe(propValidator);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn on invalid prop types', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      createReactClass({0
        displayName: 'Component',0
        propTypes: {0
          prop: null,0
        },0
        render: function() {0
          return <span>{this.props.prop}</span>;0
        },0
      }),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Component: prop type `prop` is invalid; ' +0
        'it must be a function, usually from React.PropTypes.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn on invalid context types', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      createReactClass({0
        displayName: 'Component',0
        contextTypes: {0
          prop: null,0
        },0
        render: function() {0
          return <span>{this.props.prop}</span>;0
        },0
      }),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Component: context type `prop` is invalid; ' +0
        'it must be a function, usually from React.PropTypes.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should throw on invalid child context types', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      createReactClass({0
        displayName: 'Component',0
        childContextTypes: {0
          prop: null,0
        },0
        render: function() {0
          return <span>{this.props.prop}</span>;0
        },0
      }),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Component: child context type `prop` is invalid; ' +0
        'it must be a function, usually from React.PropTypes.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when misspelling shouldComponentUpdate', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      createReactClass({0
        componentShouldUpdate: function() {0
          return false;0
        },0
        render: function() {0
          return <div />;0
        },0
      }),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: A component has a method called componentShouldUpdate(). Did you ' +0
        'mean shouldComponentUpdate()? The name is phrased as a question ' +0
        'because the function is expected to return a value.',0
    );0
0
    expect(() =>0
      createReactClass({0
        displayName: 'NamedComponent',0
        componentShouldUpdate: function() {0
          return false;0
        },0
        render: function() {0
          return <div />;0
        },0
      }),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: NamedComponent has a method called componentShouldUpdate(). Did you ' +0
        'mean shouldComponentUpdate()? The name is phrased as a question ' +0
        'because the function is expected to return a value.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when misspelling componentWillReceiveProps', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      createReactClass({0
        componentWillRecieveProps: function() {0
          return false;0
        },0
        render: function() {0
          return <div />;0
        },0
      }),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: A component has a method called componentWillRecieveProps(). Did you ' +0
        'mean componentWillReceiveProps()?',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when misspelling UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      createReactClass({0
        UNSAFE_componentWillRecieveProps: function() {0
          return false;0
        },0
        render: function() {0
          return <div />;0
        },0
      }),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: A component has a method called UNSAFE_componentWillRecieveProps(). ' +0
        'Did you mean UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps()?',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should throw if a reserved property is in statics', () => {0
    expect(function() {0
      createReactClass({0
        statics: {0
          getDefaultProps: function() {0
            return {0
              foo: 0,0
            };0
          },0
        },0
0
        render: function() {0
          return <span />;0
        },0
      });0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'ReactClass: You are attempting to define a reserved property, ' +0
        '`getDefaultProps`, that shouldn\'t be on the "statics" key. Define ' +0
        'it as an instance property instead; it will still be accessible on ' +0
        'the constructor.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  // TODO: Consider actually moving these to statics or drop this unit test.0
  xit('should warn when using deprecated non-static spec keys', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      createReactClass({0
        mixins: [{}],0
        propTypes: {0
          foo: PropTypes.string,0
        },0
        contextTypes: {0
          foo: PropTypes.string,0
        },0
        childContextTypes: {0
          foo: PropTypes.string,0
        },0
        render: function() {0
          return <div />;0
        },0
      }),0
    ).toWarnDev([0
      'createClass(...): `mixins` is now a static property and should ' +0
        'be defined inside "statics".',0
      'createClass(...): `propTypes` is now a static property and should ' +0
        'be defined inside "statics".',0
      'createClass(...): `contextTypes` is now a static property and ' +0
        'should be defined inside "statics".',0
      'createClass(...): `childContextTypes` is now a static property and ' +0
        'should be defined inside "statics".',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should support statics', () => {0
    const Component = createReactClass({0
      statics: {0
        abc: 'def',0
        def: 0,0
        ghi: null,0
        jkl: 'mno',0
        pqr: function() {0
          return this;0
        },0
      },0
0
      render: function() {0
        return <span />;0
      },0
    });0
    let instance = <Component />;0
    instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance);0
    expect(instance.constructor.abc).toBe('def');0
    expect(Component.abc).toBe('def');0
    expect(instance.constructor.def).toBe(0);0
    expect(Component.def).toBe(0);0
    expect(instance.constructor.ghi).toBe(null);0
    expect(Component.ghi).toBe(null);0
    expect(instance.constructor.jkl).toBe('mno');0
    expect(Component.jkl).toBe('mno');0
    expect(instance.constructor.pqr()).toBe(Component);0
    expect(Component.pqr()).toBe(Component);0
  });0
0
  it('should work with object getInitialState() return values', () => {0
    const Component = createReactClass({0
      getInitialState: function() {0
        return {0
          occupation: 'clown',0
        };0
      },0
      render: function() {0
        return <span />;0
      },0
    });0
    let instance = <Component />;0
    instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance);0
    expect(instance.state.occupation).toEqual('clown');0
  });0
0
  it('should work with getDerivedStateFromProps() return values', () => {0
    const Component = createReactClass({0
      getInitialState() {0
        return {};0
      },0
      render: function() {0
        return <span />;0
      },0
    });0
    Component.getDerivedStateFromProps = () => {0
      return {occupation: 'clown'};0
    };0
    let instance = <Component />;0
    instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance);0
    expect(instance.state.occupation).toEqual('clown');0
  });0
0
  it('renders based on context getInitialState', () => {0
    const Foo = createReactClass({0
      contextTypes: {0
        className: PropTypes.string,0
      },0
      getInitialState() {0
        return {className: this.context.className};0
      },0
      render() {0
        return <span className={this.state.className} />;0
      },0
    });0
0
    const Outer = createReactClass({0
      childContextTypes: {0
        className: PropTypes.string,0
      },0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {className: 'foo'};0
      },0
      render() {0
        return <Foo />;0
      },0
    });0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Outer />, container);0
    expect(container.firstChild.className).toBe('foo');0
  });0
0
  it('should throw with non-object getInitialState() return values', () => {0
    [['an array'], 'a string', 1234].forEach(function(state) {0
      const Component = createReactClass({0
        getInitialState: function() {0
          return state;0
        },0
        render: function() {0
          return <span />;0
        },0
      });0
      let instance = <Component />;0
      expect(function() {0
        instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance);0
      }).toThrowError(0
        'Component.getInitialState(): must return an object or null',0
      );0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('should work with a null getInitialState() return value', () => {0
    const Component = createReactClass({0
      getInitialState: function() {0
        return null;0
      },0
      render: function() {0
        return <span />;0
      },0
    });0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />),0
    ).not.toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should throw when using legacy factories', () => {0
    const Component = createReactClass({0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      },0
    });0
0
    expect(() => expect(() => Component()).toThrow()).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Something is calling a React component directly. Use a ' +0
        'factory or JSX instead. See: https://fb.me/react-legacyfactory',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('replaceState and callback works', () => {0
    const ops = [];0
    const Component = createReactClass({0
      getInitialState() {0
        return {step: 0};0
      },0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Render: ' + this.state.step);0
        return <div />;0
      },0
    });0
0
    const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />);0
    instance.replaceState({step: 1}, () => {0
      ops.push('Callback: ' + instance.state.step);0
    });0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Render: 0', 'Render: 1', 'Callback: 1']);0
  });0
0
  it('getDerivedStateFromProps updates state when props change', () => {0
    const Component = createReactClass({0
      getInitialState() {0
        return {0
          count: 1,0
        };0
      },0
      render() {0
        return <div>count:{this.state.count}</div>;0
      },0
    });0
    Component.getDerivedStateFromProps = (nextProps, prevState) => ({0
      count: prevState.count + nextProps.incrementBy,0
    });0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        <Component incrementBy={0} />0
      </div>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(instance.textContent).toEqual('count:1');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        <Component incrementBy={2} />0
      </div>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(instance.textContent).toEqual('count:3');0
  });0
0
  it('should support the new static getDerivedStateFromProps method', () => {0
    let instance;0
    const Component = createReactClass({0
      statics: {0
        getDerivedStateFromProps: function() {0
          return {foo: 'bar'};0
        },0
      },0
0
      getInitialState() {0
        return {};0
      },0
0
      render: function() {0
        instance = this;0
        return null;0
      },0
    });0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component />, document.createElement('div'));0
    expect(instance.state.foo).toBe('bar');0
  });0
0
  it('warns if getDerivedStateFromProps is not static', () => {0
    const Foo = createReactClass({0
      getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
        return {};0
      },0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      },0
    });0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactDOM.render(<Foo foo="foo" />, document.createElement('div')),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Component: getDerivedStateFromProps() is defined as an instance method ' +0
        'and will be ignored. Instead, declare it as a static method.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('warns if getDerivedStateFromCatch is not static', () => {0
    const Foo = createReactClass({0
      getDerivedStateFromCatch() {0
        return {};0
      },0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      },0
    });0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactDOM.render(<Foo foo="foo" />, document.createElement('div')),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Component: getDerivedStateFromCatch() is defined as an instance method ' +0
        'and will be ignored. Instead, declare it as a static method.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('warns if getSnapshotBeforeUpdate is static', () => {0
    const Foo = createReactClass({0
      statics: {0
        getSnapshotBeforeUpdate: function() {0
          return null;0
        },0
      },0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      },0
    });0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactDOM.render(<Foo foo="foo" />, document.createElement('div')),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Component: getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() is defined as a static method ' +0
        'and will be ignored. Instead, declare it as an instance method.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if state is not properly initialized before getDerivedStateFromProps', () => {0
    const Component = createReactClass({0
      statics: {0
        getDerivedStateFromProps: function() {0
          return null;0
        },0
      },0
      render: function() {0
        return null;0
      },0
    });0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactDOM.render(<Component />, document.createElement('div')),0
    ).toWarnDev('Did not properly initialize state during construction.');0
  });0
0
  it('should not invoke deprecated lifecycles (cWM/cWRP/cWU) if new static gDSFP is present', () => {0
    const Component = createReactClass({0
      statics: {0
        getDerivedStateFromProps: function() {0
          return null;0
        },0
      },0
      componentWillMount: function() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      },0
      componentWillReceiveProps: function() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      },0
      componentWillUpdate: function() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      },0
      getInitialState: function() {0
        return {};0
      },0
      render: function() {0
        return null;0
      },0
    });0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<Component />, document.createElement('div'));0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Unsafe legacy lifecycles will not be called for components using new component APIs.\n\n' +0
        'Component uses getDerivedStateFromProps() but also contains the following legacy lifecycles:\n' +0
        '  componentWillMount\n' +0
        '  componentWillReceiveProps\n' +0
        '  componentWillUpdate\n\n' +0
        'The above lifecycles should be removed. Learn more about this warning here:\n' +0
        'https://fb.me/react-async-component-lifecycle-hooks',0
    );0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component foo={1} />, document.createElement('div'));0
  });0
0
  it('should not invoke deprecated lifecycles (cWM/cWRP/cWU) if new getSnapshotBeforeUpdate is present', () => {0
    const Component = createReactClass({0
      getSnapshotBeforeUpdate: function() {0
        return null;0
      },0
      componentWillMount: function() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      },0
      componentWillReceiveProps: function() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      },0
      componentWillUpdate: function() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      },0
      componentDidUpdate: function() {},0
      render: function() {0
        return null;0
      },0
    });0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<Component />, document.createElement('div'));0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Unsafe legacy lifecycles will not be called for components using new component APIs.\n\n' +0
        'Component uses getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() but also contains the following legacy lifecycles:\n' +0
        '  componentWillMount\n' +0
        '  componentWillReceiveProps\n' +0
        '  componentWillUpdate\n\n' +0
        'The above lifecycles should be removed. Learn more about this warning here:\n' +0
        'https://fb.me/react-async-component-lifecycle-hooks',0
    );0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component foo={1} />, document.createElement('div'));0
  });0
0
  it('should invoke both deprecated and new lifecycles if both are present', () => {0
    const log = [];0
0
    const Component = createReactClass({0
      mixins: [0
        {0
          componentWillMount: function() {0
            log.push('componentWillMount');0
          },0
          componentWillReceiveProps: function() {0
            log.push('componentWillReceiveProps');0
          },0
          componentWillUpdate: function() {0
            log.push('componentWillUpdate');0
          },0
        },0
      ],0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount: function() {0
        log.push('UNSAFE_componentWillMount');0
      },0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps: function() {0
        log.push('UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps');0
      },0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate: function() {0
        log.push('UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate');0
      },0
      render: function() {0
        return null;0
      },0
    });0
0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component foo="bar" />, div);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['componentWillMount', 'UNSAFE_componentWillMount']);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component foo="baz" />, div);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'componentWillUpdate',0
      'UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate',0
    ]);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
describe('forwardRef', () => {0
  let React;0
  let ReactFeatureFlags;0
  let ReactNoop;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode = false;0
    ReactFeatureFlags.replayFailedUnitOfWorkWithInvokeGuardedCallback = false;0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
  });0
0
  it('should work without a ref to be forwarded', () => {0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield(this.props.value);0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Wrapper(props) {0
      return <Child {...props} ref={props.forwardedRef} />;0
    }0
0
    const RefForwardingComponent = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => (0
      <Wrapper {...props} forwardedRef={ref} />0
    ));0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<RefForwardingComponent value={123} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([123]);0
  });0
0
  it('should forward a ref for a single child', () => {0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield(this.props.value);0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Wrapper(props) {0
      return <Child {...props} ref={props.forwardedRef} />;0
    }0
0
    const RefForwardingComponent = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => (0
      <Wrapper {...props} forwardedRef={ref} />0
    ));0
0
    const ref = React.createRef();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<RefForwardingComponent ref={ref} value={123} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([123]);0
    expect(ref.current instanceof Child).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('should forward a ref for multiple children', () => {0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield(this.props.value);0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Wrapper(props) {0
      return <Child {...props} ref={props.forwardedRef} />;0
    }0
0
    const RefForwardingComponent = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => (0
      <Wrapper {...props} forwardedRef={ref} />0
    ));0
0
    const ref = React.createRef();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <div>0
        <div />0
        <RefForwardingComponent ref={ref} value={123} />0
        <div />0
      </div>,0
    );0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([123]);0
    expect(ref.current instanceof Child).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('should maintain child instance and ref through updates', () => {0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
      }0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield(this.props.value);0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Wrapper(props) {0
      return <Child {...props} ref={props.forwardedRef} />;0
    }0
0
    const RefForwardingComponent = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => (0
      <Wrapper {...props} forwardedRef={ref} />0
    ));0
0
    let setRefCount = 0;0
    let ref;0
0
    const setRef = r => {0
      setRefCount++;0
      ref = r;0
    };0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<RefForwardingComponent ref={setRef} value={123} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([123]);0
    expect(ref instanceof Child).toBe(true);0
    expect(setRefCount).toBe(1);0
    ReactNoop.render(<RefForwardingComponent ref={setRef} value={456} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([456]);0
    expect(ref instanceof Child).toBe(true);0
    expect(setRefCount).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should not break lifecycle error handling', () => {0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        ReactNoop.yield('ErrorBoundary.componentDidCatch');0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          ReactNoop.yield('ErrorBoundary.render: catch');0
          return null;0
        }0
        ReactNoop.yield('ErrorBoundary.render: try');0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class BadRender extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('BadRender throw');0
        throw new Error('oops!');0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Wrapper(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Wrapper');0
      return <BadRender {...props} ref={props.forwardedRef} />;0
    }0
0
    const RefForwardingComponent = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => (0
      <Wrapper {...props} forwardedRef={ref} />0
    ));0
0
    const ref = React.createRef();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <RefForwardingComponent ref={ref} />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
    );0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary.render: try',0
      'Wrapper',0
      'BadRender throw',0
0
      // React retries one more time0
      'ErrorBoundary.render: try',0
      'Wrapper',0
      'BadRender throw',0
0
      // Errored again on retry. Now handle it.0
      'ErrorBoundary.componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary.render: catch',0
    ]);0
    expect(ref.current).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('should not re-run the render callback on a deep setState', () => {0
    let inst;0
0
    class Inner extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('Inner');0
        inst = this;0
        return <div ref={this.props.forwardedRef} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Middle(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Middle');0
      return <Inner {...props} />;0
    }0
0
    const Forward = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Forward');0
      return <Middle {...props} forwardedRef={ref} />;0
    });0
0
    function App() {0
      ReactNoop.yield('App');0
      return <Forward />;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['App', 'Forward', 'Middle', 'Inner']);0
0
    inst.setState({});0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Inner']);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
describe('forwardRef', () => {0
  let PropTypes;0
  let React;0
  let ReactNoop;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
  });0
0
  it('should update refs when switching between children', () => {0
    function FunctionalComponent({forwardedRef, setRefOnDiv}) {0
      return (0
        <section>0
          <div ref={setRefOnDiv ? forwardedRef : null}>First</div>0
          <span ref={setRefOnDiv ? null : forwardedRef}>Second</span>0
        </section>0
      );0
    }0
0
    const RefForwardingComponent = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => (0
      <FunctionalComponent {...props} forwardedRef={ref} />0
    ));0
0
    const ref = React.createRef();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<RefForwardingComponent ref={ref} setRefOnDiv={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ref.current.type).toBe('div');0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<RefForwardingComponent ref={ref} setRefOnDiv={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ref.current.type).toBe('span');0
  });0
0
  it('should support rendering null', () => {0
    const RefForwardingComponent = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => null);0
0
    const ref = React.createRef();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<RefForwardingComponent ref={ref} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ref.current).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('should support rendering null for multiple children', () => {0
    const RefForwardingComponent = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => null);0
0
    const ref = React.createRef();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <div>0
        <div />0
        <RefForwardingComponent ref={ref} />0
        <div />0
      </div>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ref.current).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('should support propTypes and defaultProps', () => {0
    function FunctionalComponent({forwardedRef, optional, required}) {0
      return (0
        <div ref={forwardedRef}>0
          {optional}0
          {required}0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    const RefForwardingComponent = React.forwardRef(function NamedFunction(0
      props,0
      ref,0
    ) {0
      return <FunctionalComponent {...props} forwardedRef={ref} />;0
    });0
    RefForwardingComponent.propTypes = {0
      optional: PropTypes.string,0
      required: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
    };0
    RefForwardingComponent.defaultProps = {0
      optional: 'default',0
    };0
0
    const ref = React.createRef();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <RefForwardingComponent ref={ref} optional="foo" required="bar" />,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ref.current.children).toEqual([{text: 'foo'}, {text: 'bar'}]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<RefForwardingComponent ref={ref} required="foo" />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ref.current.children).toEqual([{text: 'default'}, {text: 'foo'}]);0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactNoop.render(<RefForwardingComponent ref={ref} optional="foo" />),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed prop type: The prop `required` is marked as required in ' +0
        '`ForwardRef(NamedFunction)`, but its value is `undefined`.\n' +0
        '    in ForwardRef(NamedFunction) (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if not provided a callback during creation', () => {0
    expect(() => React.forwardRef(undefined)).toWarnDev(0
      'forwardRef requires a render function but was given undefined.',0
    );0
    expect(() => React.forwardRef(null)).toWarnDev(0
      'forwardRef requires a render function but was given null.',0
    );0
    expect(() => React.forwardRef('foo')).toWarnDev(0
      'forwardRef requires a render function but was given string.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if no render function is provided', () => {0
    expect(React.forwardRef).toWarnDev(0
      'forwardRef requires a render function but was given undefined.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if the render function provided has propTypes or defaultProps attributes', () => {0
    function renderWithPropTypes() {0
      return null;0
    }0
    renderWithPropTypes.propTypes = {};0
0
    function renderWithDefaultProps() {0
      return null;0
    }0
    renderWithDefaultProps.defaultProps = {};0
0
    expect(() => React.forwardRef(renderWithPropTypes)).toWarnDev(0
      'forwardRef render functions do not support propTypes or defaultProps. ' +0
        'Did you accidentally pass a React component?',0
    );0
    expect(() => React.forwardRef(renderWithDefaultProps)).toWarnDev(0
      'forwardRef render functions do not support propTypes or defaultProps. ' +0
        'Did you accidentally pass a React component?',0
    );0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
describe('onlyChild', () => {0
  let React;0
  let WrapComponent;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    WrapComponent = class extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            {React.Children.only(this.props.children, this.props.mapFn, this)}0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    };0
  });0
0
  it('should fail when passed two children', () => {0
    expect(function() {0
      const instance = (0
        <WrapComponent>0
          <div />0
          <span />0
        </WrapComponent>0
      );0
      React.Children.only(instance.props.children);0
    }).toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should fail when passed nully values', () => {0
    expect(function() {0
      const instance = <WrapComponent>{null}</WrapComponent>;0
      React.Children.only(instance.props.children);0
    }).toThrow();0
0
    expect(function() {0
      const instance = <WrapComponent>{undefined}</WrapComponent>;0
      React.Children.only(instance.props.children);0
    }).toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should fail when key/value objects', () => {0
    expect(function() {0
      const instance = <WrapComponent>{[<span key="abc" />]}</WrapComponent>;0
      React.Children.only(instance.props.children);0
    }).toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should not fail when passed interpolated single child', () => {0
    expect(function() {0
      const instance = <WrapComponent>{<span />}</WrapComponent>;0
      React.Children.only(instance.props.children);0
    }).not.toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should return the only child', () => {0
    const instance = (0
      <WrapComponent>0
        <span />0
      </WrapComponent>0
    );0
    expect(React.Children.only(instance.props.children)).toEqual(<span />);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
describe('ReactChildren', () => {0
  let React;0
  let ReactTestUtils;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
  });0
0
  it('should support identity for simple', () => {0
    const context = {};0
    const callback = jest.fn().mockImplementation(function(kid, index) {0
      expect(this).toBe(context);0
      return kid;0
    });0
0
    const simpleKid = <span key="simple" />;0
0
    // First pass children into a component to fully simulate what happens when0
    // using structures that arrive from transforms.0
0
    const instance = <div>{simpleKid}</div>;0
    React.Children.forEach(instance.props.children, callback, context);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(simpleKid, 0);0
    callback.mockClear();0
    const mappedChildren = React.Children.map(0
      instance.props.children,0
      callback,0
      context,0
    );0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(simpleKid, 0);0
    expect(mappedChildren[0]).toEqual(<span key=".$simple" />);0
  });0
0
  it('should support Portal components', () => {0
    const context = {};0
    const callback = jest.fn().mockImplementation(function(kid, index) {0
      expect(this).toBe(context);0
      return kid;0
    });0
    const ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    const portalContainer = document.createElement('div');0
0
    const simpleChild = <span key="simple" />;0
    const reactPortal = ReactDOM.createPortal(simpleChild, portalContainer);0
0
    const parentInstance = <div>{reactPortal}</div>;0
    React.Children.forEach(parentInstance.props.children, callback, context);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(reactPortal, 0);0
    callback.mockClear();0
    const mappedChildren = React.Children.map(0
      parentInstance.props.children,0
      callback,0
      context,0
    );0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(reactPortal, 0);0
    expect(mappedChildren[0]).toEqual(reactPortal);0
  });0
0
  it('should treat single arrayless child as being in array', () => {0
    const context = {};0
    const callback = jest.fn().mockImplementation(function(kid, index) {0
      expect(this).toBe(context);0
      return kid;0
    });0
0
    const simpleKid = <span />;0
    const instance = <div>{simpleKid}</div>;0
    React.Children.forEach(instance.props.children, callback, context);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(simpleKid, 0);0
    callback.mockClear();0
    const mappedChildren = React.Children.map(0
      instance.props.children,0
      callback,0
      context,0
    );0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(simpleKid, 0);0
    expect(mappedChildren[0]).toEqual(<span key=".0" />);0
  });0
0
  it('should treat single child in array as expected', () => {0
    const context = {};0
    const callback = jest.fn().mockImplementation(function(kid, index) {0
      expect(this).toBe(context);0
      return kid;0
    });0
0
    const simpleKid = <span key="simple" />;0
    const instance = <div>{[simpleKid]}</div>;0
    React.Children.forEach(instance.props.children, callback, context);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(simpleKid, 0);0
    callback.mockClear();0
    const mappedChildren = React.Children.map(0
      instance.props.children,0
      callback,0
      context,0
    );0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(simpleKid, 0);0
    expect(mappedChildren[0]).toEqual(<span key=".$simple" />);0
  });0
0
  it('should be called for each child', () => {0
    const zero = <div key="keyZero" />;0
    const one = null;0
    const two = <div key="keyTwo" />;0
    const three = null;0
    const four = <div key="keyFour" />;0
    const context = {};0
0
    const callback = jest.fn().mockImplementation(function(kid) {0
      expect(this).toBe(context);0
      return kid;0
    });0
0
    const instance = (0
      <div>0
        {zero}0
        {one}0
        {two}0
        {three}0
        {four}0
      </div>0
    );0
0
    function assertCalls() {0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(zero, 0);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(one, 1);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(two, 2);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(three, 3);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(four, 4);0
      callback.mockClear();0
    }0
0
    React.Children.forEach(instance.props.children, callback, context);0
    assertCalls();0
0
    const mappedChildren = React.Children.map(0
      instance.props.children,0
      callback,0
      context,0
    );0
    assertCalls();0
    expect(mappedChildren).toEqual([0
      <div key=".$keyZero" />,0
      <div key=".$keyTwo" />,0
      <div key=".$keyFour" />,0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should traverse children of different kinds', () => {0
    const div = <div key="divNode" />;0
    const span = <span key="spanNode" />;0
    const a = <a key="aNode" />;0
0
    const context = {};0
    const callback = jest.fn().mockImplementation(function(kid) {0
      expect(this).toBe(context);0
      return kid;0
    });0
0
    const instance = (0
      <div>0
        {div}0
        {[[span]]}0
        {[a]}0
        {'string'}0
        {1234}0
        {true}0
        {false}0
        {null}0
        {undefined}0
      </div>0
    );0
0
    function assertCalls() {0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(9);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(div, 0);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(span, 1);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(a, 2);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith('string', 3);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(1234, 4);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(null, 5);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(null, 6);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(null, 7);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(null, 8);0
      callback.mockClear();0
    }0
0
    React.Children.forEach(instance.props.children, callback, context);0
    assertCalls();0
0
    const mappedChildren = React.Children.map(0
      instance.props.children,0
      callback,0
      context,0
    );0
    assertCalls();0
    expect(mappedChildren).toEqual([0
      <div key=".$divNode" />,0
      <span key=".1:0:$spanNode" />,0
      <a key=".2:$aNode" />,0
      'string',0
      1234,0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should be called for each child in nested structure', () => {0
    const zero = <div key="keyZero" />;0
    const one = null;0
    const two = <div key="keyTwo" />;0
    const three = null;0
    const four = <div key="keyFour" />;0
    const five = <div key="keyFive" />;0
0
    const context = {};0
    const callback = jest.fn().mockImplementation(function(kid) {0
      return kid;0
    });0
0
    const instance = <div>{[[zero, one, two], [three, four], five]}</div>;0
0
    function assertCalls() {0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(6);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(zero, 0);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(one, 1);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(two, 2);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(three, 3);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(four, 4);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(five, 5);0
      callback.mockClear();0
    }0
0
    React.Children.forEach(instance.props.children, callback, context);0
    assertCalls();0
0
    const mappedChildren = React.Children.map(0
      instance.props.children,0
      callback,0
      context,0
    );0
    assertCalls();0
    expect(mappedChildren).toEqual([0
      <div key=".0:$keyZero" />,0
      <div key=".0:$keyTwo" />,0
      <div key=".1:$keyFour" />,0
      <div key=".$keyFive" />,0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should retain key across two mappings', () => {0
    const zeroForceKey = <div key="keyZero" />;0
    const oneForceKey = <div key="keyOne" />;0
    const context = {};0
    const callback = jest.fn().mockImplementation(function(kid) {0
      expect(this).toBe(context);0
      return kid;0
    });0
0
    const forcedKeys = (0
      <div>0
        {zeroForceKey}0
        {oneForceKey}0
      </div>0
    );0
0
    function assertCalls() {0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(zeroForceKey, 0);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(oneForceKey, 1);0
      callback.mockClear();0
    }0
0
    React.Children.forEach(forcedKeys.props.children, callback, context);0
    assertCalls();0
0
    const mappedChildren = React.Children.map(0
      forcedKeys.props.children,0
      callback,0
      context,0
    );0
    assertCalls();0
    expect(mappedChildren).toEqual([0
      <div key=".$keyZero" />,0
      <div key=".$keyOne" />,0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should be called for each child in an iterable without keys', () => {0
    const threeDivIterable = {0
      '@@iterator': function() {0
        let i = 0;0
        return {0
          next: function() {0
            if (i++ < 3) {0
              return {value: <div />, done: false};0
            } else {0
              return {value: undefined, done: true};0
            }0
          },0
        };0
      },0
    };0
0
    const context = {};0
    const callback = jest.fn().mockImplementation(function(kid) {0
      expect(this).toBe(context);0
      return kid;0
    });0
0
    let instance;0
    expect(() => (instance = <div>{threeDivIterable}</div>)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique "key" prop.',0
    );0
0
    function assertCalls() {0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(3);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(<div />, 0);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(<div />, 1);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(<div />, 2);0
      callback.mockClear();0
    }0
0
    React.Children.forEach(instance.props.children, callback, context);0
    assertCalls();0
0
    const mappedChildren = React.Children.map(0
      instance.props.children,0
      callback,0
      context,0
    );0
    assertCalls();0
    expect(mappedChildren).toEqual([0
      <div key=".0" />,0
      <div key=".1" />,0
      <div key=".2" />,0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should be called for each child in an iterable with keys', () => {0
    const threeDivIterable = {0
      '@@iterator': function() {0
        let i = 0;0
        return {0
          next: function() {0
            if (i++ < 3) {0
              return {value: <div key={'#' + i} />, done: false};0
            } else {0
              return {value: undefined, done: true};0
            }0
          },0
        };0
      },0
    };0
0
    const context = {};0
    const callback = jest.fn().mockImplementation(function(kid) {0
      expect(this).toBe(context);0
      return kid;0
    });0
0
    const instance = <div>{threeDivIterable}</div>;0
0
    function assertCalls() {0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(3);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(<div key="#1" />, 0);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(<div key="#2" />, 1);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(<div key="#3" />, 2);0
      callback.mockClear();0
    }0
0
    React.Children.forEach(instance.props.children, callback, context);0
    assertCalls();0
0
    const mappedChildren = React.Children.map(0
      instance.props.children,0
      callback,0
      context,0
    );0
    assertCalls();0
    expect(mappedChildren).toEqual([0
      <div key=".$#1" />,0
      <div key=".$#2" />,0
      <div key=".$#3" />,0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should not enumerate enumerable numbers (#4776)', () => {0
    /*eslint-disable no-extend-native */0
    Number.prototype['@@iterator'] = function() {0
      throw new Error('number iterator called');0
    };0
    /*eslint-enable no-extend-native */0
0
    try {0
      const instance = (0
        <div>0
          {5}0
          {12}0
          {13}0
        </div>0
      );0
0
      const context = {};0
      const callback = jest.fn().mockImplementation(function(kid) {0
        expect(this).toBe(context);0
        return kid;0
      });0
0
      const assertCalls = function() {0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(3);0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(5, 0);0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(12, 1);0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(13, 2);0
        callback.mockClear();0
      };0
0
      React.Children.forEach(instance.props.children, callback, context);0
      assertCalls();0
0
      const mappedChildren = React.Children.map(0
        instance.props.children,0
        callback,0
        context,0
      );0
      assertCalls();0
      expect(mappedChildren).toEqual([5, 12, 13]);0
    } finally {0
      delete Number.prototype['@@iterator'];0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('should allow extension of native prototypes', () => {0
    /*eslint-disable no-extend-native */0
    String.prototype.key = 'react';0
    Number.prototype.key = 'rocks';0
    /*eslint-enable no-extend-native */0
0
    const instance = (0
      <div>0
        {'a'}0
        {13}0
      </div>0
    );0
0
    const context = {};0
    const callback = jest.fn().mockImplementation(function(kid) {0
      expect(this).toBe(context);0
      return kid;0
    });0
0
    function assertCalls() {0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2, 0);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith('a', 0);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(13, 1);0
      callback.mockClear();0
    }0
0
    React.Children.forEach(instance.props.children, callback, context);0
    assertCalls();0
0
    const mappedChildren = React.Children.map(0
      instance.props.children,0
      callback,0
      context,0
    );0
    assertCalls();0
    expect(mappedChildren).toEqual(['a', 13]);0
0
    delete String.prototype.key;0
    delete Number.prototype.key;0
  });0
0
  it('should pass key to returned component', () => {0
    const mapFn = function(kid, index) {0
      return <div>{kid}</div>;0
    };0
0
    const simpleKid = <span key="simple" />;0
0
    const instance = <div>{simpleKid}</div>;0
    const mappedChildren = React.Children.map(instance.props.children, mapFn);0
0
    expect(React.Children.count(mappedChildren)).toBe(1);0
    expect(mappedChildren[0]).not.toBe(simpleKid);0
    expect(mappedChildren[0].props.children).toBe(simpleKid);0
    expect(mappedChildren[0].key).toBe('.$simple');0
  });0
0
  it('should invoke callback with the right context', () => {0
    let lastContext;0
    const callback = function(kid, index) {0
      lastContext = this;0
      return this;0
    };0
0
    // TODO: Use an object to test, after non-object fragments has fully landed.0
    const scopeTester = 'scope tester';0
0
    const simpleKid = <span key="simple" />;0
    const instance = <div>{simpleKid}</div>;0
    React.Children.forEach(instance.props.children, callback, scopeTester);0
    expect(lastContext).toBe(scopeTester);0
0
    const mappedChildren = React.Children.map(0
      instance.props.children,0
      callback,0
      scopeTester,0
    );0
0
    expect(React.Children.count(mappedChildren)).toBe(1);0
    expect(mappedChildren[0]).toBe(scopeTester);0
  });0
0
  it('should be called for each child', () => {0
    const zero = <div key="keyZero" />;0
    const one = null;0
    const two = <div key="keyTwo" />;0
    const three = null;0
    const four = <div key="keyFour" />;0
0
    const mapped = [0
      <div key="giraffe" />, // Key should be joined to obj key0
      null, // Key should be added even if we don't supply it!0
      <div />, // Key should be added even if not supplied!0
      <span />, // Map from null to something.0
      <div key="keyFour" />,0
    ];0
    const callback = jest.fn().mockImplementation(function(kid, index) {0
      return mapped[index];0
    });0
0
    const instance = (0
      <div>0
        {zero}0
        {one}0
        {two}0
        {three}0
        {four}0
      </div>0
    );0
0
    React.Children.forEach(instance.props.children, callback);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(zero, 0);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(one, 1);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(two, 2);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(three, 3);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(four, 4);0
    callback.mockClear();0
0
    const mappedChildren = React.Children.map(0
      instance.props.children,0
      callback,0
    );0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(5);0
    expect(React.Children.count(mappedChildren)).toBe(4);0
    // Keys default to indices.0
    expect([0
      mappedChildren[0].key,0
      mappedChildren[1].key,0
      mappedChildren[2].key,0
      mappedChildren[3].key,0
    ]).toEqual(['giraffe/.$keyZero', '.$keyTwo', '.3', '.$keyFour']);0
0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(zero, 0);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(one, 1);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(two, 2);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(three, 3);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(four, 4);0
0
    expect(mappedChildren[0]).toEqual(<div key="giraffe/.$keyZero" />);0
    expect(mappedChildren[1]).toEqual(<div key=".$keyTwo" />);0
    expect(mappedChildren[2]).toEqual(<span key=".3" />);0
    expect(mappedChildren[3]).toEqual(<div key=".$keyFour" />);0
  });0
0
  it('should be called for each child in nested structure', () => {0
    const zero = <div key="keyZero" />;0
    const one = null;0
    const two = <div key="keyTwo" />;0
    const three = null;0
    const four = <div key="keyFour" />;0
    const five = <div key="keyFive" />;0
0
    const zeroMapped = <div key="giraffe" />; // Key should be overridden0
    const twoMapped = <div />; // Key should be added even if not supplied!0
    const fourMapped = <div key="keyFour" />;0
    const fiveMapped = <div />;0
0
    const callback = jest.fn().mockImplementation(function(kid) {0
      switch (kid) {0
        case zero:0
          return zeroMapped;0
        case two:0
          return twoMapped;0
        case four:0
          return fourMapped;0
        case five:0
          return fiveMapped;0
        default:0
          return kid;0
      }0
    });0
0
    const frag = [[zero, one, two], [three, four], five];0
    const instance = <div>{[frag]}</div>;0
0
    React.Children.forEach(instance.props.children, callback);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(6);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(zero, 0);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(one, 1);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(two, 2);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(three, 3);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(four, 4);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(five, 5);0
    callback.mockClear();0
0
    const mappedChildren = React.Children.map(0
      instance.props.children,0
      callback,0
    );0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(6);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(zero, 0);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(one, 1);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(two, 2);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(three, 3);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(four, 4);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledWith(five, 5);0
0
    expect(React.Children.count(mappedChildren)).toBe(4);0
    // Keys default to indices.0
    expect([0
      mappedChildren[0].key,0
      mappedChildren[1].key,0
      mappedChildren[2].key,0
      mappedChildren[3].key,0
    ]).toEqual([0
      'giraffe/.0:0:$keyZero',0
      '.0:0:$keyTwo',0
      '.0:1:$keyFour',0
      '.0:$keyFive',0
    ]);0
0
    expect(mappedChildren[0]).toEqual(<div key="giraffe/.0:0:$keyZero" />);0
    expect(mappedChildren[1]).toEqual(<div key=".0:0:$keyTwo" />);0
    expect(mappedChildren[2]).toEqual(<div key=".0:1:$keyFour" />);0
    expect(mappedChildren[3]).toEqual(<div key=".0:$keyFive" />);0
  });0
0
  it('should retain key across two mappings', () => {0
    const zeroForceKey = <div key="keyZero" />;0
    const oneForceKey = <div key="keyOne" />;0
0
    // Key should be joined to object key0
    const zeroForceKeyMapped = <div key="giraffe" />;0
    // Key should be added even if we don't supply it!0
    const oneForceKeyMapped = <div />;0
0
    const mapFn = function(kid, index) {0
      return index === 0 ? zeroForceKeyMapped : oneForceKeyMapped;0
    };0
0
    const forcedKeys = (0
      <div>0
        {zeroForceKey}0
        {oneForceKey}0
      </div>0
    );0
0
    const expectedForcedKeys = ['giraffe/.$keyZero', '.$keyOne'];0
    const mappedChildrenForcedKeys = React.Children.map(0
      forcedKeys.props.children,0
      mapFn,0
    );0
    const mappedForcedKeys = mappedChildrenForcedKeys.map(c => c.key);0
    expect(mappedForcedKeys).toEqual(expectedForcedKeys);0
0
    const expectedRemappedForcedKeys = [0
      'giraffe/.$giraffe/.$keyZero',0
      '.$.$keyOne',0
    ];0
    const remappedChildrenForcedKeys = React.Children.map(0
      mappedChildrenForcedKeys,0
      mapFn,0
    );0
    expect(remappedChildrenForcedKeys.map(c => c.key)).toEqual(0
      expectedRemappedForcedKeys,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should not throw if key provided is a dupe with array key', () => {0
    const zero = <div />;0
    const one = <div key="0" />;0
0
    const mapFn = function() {0
      return null;0
    };0
0
    const instance = (0
      <div>0
        {zero}0
        {one}0
      </div>0
    );0
0
    expect(function() {0
      React.Children.map(instance.props.children, mapFn);0
    }).not.toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should use the same key for a cloned element', () => {0
    const instance = (0
      <div>0
        <div />0
      </div>0
    );0
0
    const mapped = React.Children.map(0
      instance.props.children,0
      element => element,0
    );0
0
    const mappedWithClone = React.Children.map(0
      instance.props.children,0
      element => React.cloneElement(element),0
    );0
0
    expect(mapped[0].key).toBe(mappedWithClone[0].key);0
  });0
0
  it('should use the same key for a cloned element with key', () => {0
    const instance = (0
      <div>0
        <div key="unique" />0
      </div>0
    );0
0
    const mapped = React.Children.map(0
      instance.props.children,0
      element => element,0
    );0
0
    const mappedWithClone = React.Children.map(0
      instance.props.children,0
      element => React.cloneElement(element, {key: 'unique'}),0
    );0
0
    expect(mapped[0].key).toBe(mappedWithClone[0].key);0
  });0
0
  it('should return 0 for null children', () => {0
    const numberOfChildren = React.Children.count(null);0
    expect(numberOfChildren).toBe(0);0
  });0
0
  it('should return 0 for undefined children', () => {0
    const numberOfChildren = React.Children.count(undefined);0
    expect(numberOfChildren).toBe(0);0
  });0
0
  it('should return 1 for single child', () => {0
    const simpleKid = <span key="simple" />;0
    const instance = <div>{simpleKid}</div>;0
    const numberOfChildren = React.Children.count(instance.props.children);0
    expect(numberOfChildren).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should count the number of children in flat structure', () => {0
    const zero = <div key="keyZero" />;0
    const one = null;0
    const two = <div key="keyTwo" />;0
    const three = null;0
    const four = <div key="keyFour" />;0
0
    const instance = (0
      <div>0
        {zero}0
        {one}0
        {two}0
        {three}0
        {four}0
      </div>0
    );0
    const numberOfChildren = React.Children.count(instance.props.children);0
    expect(numberOfChildren).toBe(5);0
  });0
0
  it('should count the number of children in nested structure', () => {0
    const zero = <div key="keyZero" />;0
    const one = null;0
    const two = <div key="keyTwo" />;0
    const three = null;0
    const four = <div key="keyFour" />;0
    const five = <div key="keyFive" />;0
0
    const instance = (0
      <div>{[[[zero, one, two], [three, four], five], null]}</div>0
    );0
    const numberOfChildren = React.Children.count(instance.props.children);0
    expect(numberOfChildren).toBe(7);0
  });0
0
  it('should flatten children to an array', () => {0
    expect(React.Children.toArray(undefined)).toEqual([]);0
    expect(React.Children.toArray(null)).toEqual([]);0
0
    expect(React.Children.toArray(<div />).length).toBe(1);0
    expect(React.Children.toArray([<div />]).length).toBe(1);0
    expect(React.Children.toArray(<div />)[0].key).toBe(0
      React.Children.toArray([<div />])[0].key,0
    );0
0
    const flattened = React.Children.toArray([0
      [<div key="apple" />, <div key="banana" />, <div key="camel" />],0
      [<div key="banana" />, <div key="camel" />, <div key="deli" />],0
    ]);0
    expect(flattened.length).toBe(6);0
    expect(flattened[1].key).toContain('banana');0
    expect(flattened[3].key).toContain('banana');0
    expect(flattened[1].key).not.toBe(flattened[3].key);0
0
    const reversed = React.Children.toArray([0
      [<div key="camel" />, <div key="banana" />, <div key="apple" />],0
      [<div key="deli" />, <div key="camel" />, <div key="banana" />],0
    ]);0
    expect(flattened[0].key).toBe(reversed[2].key);0
    expect(flattened[1].key).toBe(reversed[1].key);0
    expect(flattened[2].key).toBe(reversed[0].key);0
    expect(flattened[3].key).toBe(reversed[5].key);0
    expect(flattened[4].key).toBe(reversed[4].key);0
    expect(flattened[5].key).toBe(reversed[3].key);0
0
    // null/undefined/bool are all omitted0
    expect(React.Children.toArray([1, 'two', null, undefined, true])).toEqual([0
      1,0
      'two',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should escape keys', () => {0
    const zero = <div key="1" />;0
    const one = <div key="1=::=2" />;0
    const instance = (0
      <div>0
        {zero}0
        {one}0
      </div>0
    );0
    const mappedChildren = React.Children.map(0
      instance.props.children,0
      kid => kid,0
    );0
    expect(mappedChildren).toEqual([0
      <div key=".$1" />,0
      <div key=".$1=0=2=2=02" />,0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should throw on object', () => {0
    expect(function() {0
      React.Children.forEach({a: 1, b: 2}, function() {}, null);0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'Objects are not valid as a React child (found: object with keys ' +0
