        '{a, b}).' +0
        (__DEV__0
          ? ' If you meant to render a collection of children, use an ' +0
            'array instead.'0
          : ''),0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should throw on regex', () => {0
    // Really, we care about dates (#4840) but those have nondeterministic0
    // serialization (timezones) so let's test a regex instead:0
    expect(function() {0
      React.Children.forEach(/abc/, function() {}, null);0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'Objects are not valid as a React child (found: /abc/).' +0
        (__DEV__0
          ? ' If you meant to render a collection of children, use an ' +0
            'array instead.'0
          : ''),0
    );0
  });0
0
  describe('with fragments enabled', () => {0
    it('warns for keys for arrays of elements in a fragment', () => {0
      class ComponentReturningArray extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return [<div />, <div />];0
        }0
      }0
0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<ComponentReturningArray />),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: ' +0
          'Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique "key" prop.' +0
          ' See https://fb.me/react-warning-keys for more information.' +0
          '\n    in ComponentReturningArray (at **)',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('does not warn when there are keys on  elements in a fragment', () => {0
      class ComponentReturningArray extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return [<div key="foo" />, <div key="bar" />];0
        }0
      }0
0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<ComponentReturningArray />);0
    });0
0
    it('warns for keys for arrays at the top level', () => {0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument([<div />, <div />]),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: ' +0
          'Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique "key" prop.' +0
          ' See https://fb.me/react-warning-keys for more information.',0
      );0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0

'use strict';0
0
const spawnSync = require('child_process').spawnSync;0
0
describe('ReactClassEquivalence', () => {0
  it('tests the same thing for es6 classes and CoffeeScript', () => {0
    const result1 = runJest('ReactCoffeeScriptClass-test.coffee');0
    const result2 = runJest('ReactES6Class-test.js');0
    compareResults(result1, result2);0
  });0
0
  it('tests the same thing for es6 classes and TypeScript', () => {0
    const result1 = runJest('ReactTypeScriptClass-test.ts');0
    const result2 = runJest('ReactES6Class-test.js');0
    compareResults(result1, result2);0
  });0
});0
0
function runJest(testFile) {0
  const cwd = process.cwd();0
  const extension = process.platform === 'win32' ? '.cmd' : '';0
  const result = spawnSync('yarn' + extension, ['test', testFile], {0
    cwd,0
    env: Object.assign({}, process.env, {0
      REACT_CLASS_EQUIVALENCE_TEST: 'true',0
    }),0
  });0
0
  if (result.error) {0
    throw result.error;0
  }0
0
  if (result.status !== 0) {0
    throw new Error(0
      'jest process exited with: ' +0
        result.status +0
        '\n' +0
        'stdout: ' +0
        result.stdout.toString() +0
        'stderr: ' +0
        result.stderr.toString(),0
    );0
  }0
0
  return result.stdout.toString() + result.stderr.toString();0
}0
0
function compareResults(a, b) {0
  const regexp = /EQUIVALENCE.*$/gm;0
  const aSpecs = (a.match(regexp) || []).sort().join('\n');0
  const bSpecs = (b.match(regexp) || []).sort().join('\n');0
0
  if (aSpecs.length === 0 && bSpecs.length === 0) {0
    throw new Error('No spec results found in the output');0
  }0
0
  expect(aSpecs).toEqual(bSpecs);0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
// This test doesn't really have a good home yet. I'm leaving it here since this0
// behavior belongs to the old propTypes system yet is currently implemented0
// in the core ReactCompositeComponent. It should technically live in core's0
// test suite but I'll leave it here to indicate that this is an issue that0
// needs to be fixed.0
0
'use strict';0
0
let PropTypes;0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
0
describe('ReactContextValidator', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
  });0
0
  // TODO: This behavior creates a runtime dependency on propTypes. We should0
  // ensure that this is not required for ES6 classes with Flow.0
0
  it('should filter out context not in contextTypes', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    Component.contextTypes = {0
      foo: PropTypes.string,0
    };0
0
    class ComponentInFooBarContext extends React.Component {0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: 'abc',0
          bar: 123,0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <Component ref="child" />;0
      }0
    }0
    ComponentInFooBarContext.childContextTypes = {0
      foo: PropTypes.string,0
      bar: PropTypes.number,0
    };0
0
    const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <ComponentInFooBarContext />,0
    );0
    expect(instance.refs.child.context).toEqual({foo: 'abc'});0
  });0
0
  it('should pass next context to lifecycles', () => {0
    let actualComponentWillReceiveProps;0
    let actualShouldComponentUpdate;0
    let actualComponentWillUpdate;0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: this.props.foo,0
          bar: 'bar',0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <Component />;0
      }0
    }0
    Parent.childContextTypes = {0
      foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      bar: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
    };0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(nextProps, nextContext) {0
        actualComponentWillReceiveProps = nextContext;0
        return true;0
      }0
0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps, nextState, nextContext) {0
        actualShouldComponentUpdate = nextContext;0
        return true;0
      }0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate(nextProps, nextState, nextContext) {0
        actualComponentWillUpdate = nextContext;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    Component.contextTypes = {0
      foo: PropTypes.string,0
    };0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent foo="abc" />, container);0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent foo="def" />, container);0
    expect(actualComponentWillReceiveProps).toEqual({foo: 'def'});0
    expect(actualShouldComponentUpdate).toEqual({foo: 'def'});0
    expect(actualComponentWillUpdate).toEqual({foo: 'def'});0
  });0
0
  it('should check context types', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    Component.contextTypes = {0
      foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
    };0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed context type: ' +0
        'The context `foo` is marked as required in `Component`, but its value ' +0
        'is `undefined`.\n' +0
        '    in Component (at **)',0
    );0
0
    class ComponentInFooStringContext extends React.Component {0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: this.props.fooValue,0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <Component />;0
      }0
    }0
    ComponentInFooStringContext.childContextTypes = {0
      foo: PropTypes.string,0
    };0
0
    // No additional errors expected0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <ComponentInFooStringContext fooValue={'bar'} />,0
    );0
0
    class ComponentInFooNumberContext extends React.Component {0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: this.props.fooValue,0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <Component />;0
      }0
    }0
    ComponentInFooNumberContext.childContextTypes = {0
      foo: PropTypes.number,0
    };0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <ComponentInFooNumberContext fooValue={123} />,0
      ),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed context type: ' +0
        'Invalid context `foo` of type `number` supplied ' +0
        'to `Component`, expected `string`.\n' +0
        '    in Component (at **)\n' +0
        '    in ComponentInFooNumberContext (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should check child context types', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      getChildContext() {0
        return this.props.testContext;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    Component.childContextTypes = {0
      foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      bar: PropTypes.number,0
    };0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component testContext={{bar: 123}} />),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed child context type: ' +0
        'The child context `foo` is marked as required in `Component`, but its ' +0
        'value is `undefined`.\n' +0
        '    in Component (at **)',0
    );0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component testContext={{foo: 123}} />),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed child context type: ' +0
        'Invalid child context `foo` of type `number` ' +0
        'supplied to `Component`, expected `string`.\n' +0
        '    in Component (at **)',0
    );0
0
    // No additional errors expected0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <Component testContext={{foo: 'foo', bar: 123}} />,0
    );0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component testContext={{foo: 'foo'}} />);0
  });0
0
  it('warns of incorrect prop types on context provider', () => {0
    const TestContext = React.createContext();0
0
    TestContext.Provider.propTypes = {0
      value: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
    };0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<TestContext.Provider value="val" />);0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <TestContext.Provider />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed prop type: The prop `value` is marked as required in ' +0
        '`Context.Provider`, but its value is `undefined`.\n' +0
        '    in Component (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  // TODO (bvaughn) Remove this test and the associated behavior in the future.0
  // It has only been added in Fiber to match the (unintentional) behavior in Stack.0
  it('should warn (but not error) if getChildContext method is missing', () => {0
    class ComponentA extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    class ComponentB extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<ComponentA />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: ComponentA.childContextTypes is specified but there is no ' +0
        'getChildContext() method on the instance. You can either define ' +0
        'getChildContext() on ComponentA or remove childContextTypes from it.',0
    );0
0
    // Warnings should be deduped by component type0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<ComponentA />);0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<ComponentB />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: ComponentB.childContextTypes is specified but there is no ' +0
        'getChildContext() method on the instance. You can either define ' +0
        'getChildContext() on ComponentB or remove childContextTypes from it.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  // TODO (bvaughn) Remove this test and the associated behavior in the future.0
  // It has only been added in Fiber to match the (unintentional) behavior in Stack.0
  it('should pass parent context if getChildContext method is missing', () => {0
    class ParentContextProvider extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: 'FOO',0
        };0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <MiddleMissingContext />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class MiddleMissingContext extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        bar: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
      render() {0
        return <ChildContextConsumer />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let childContext;0
    class ChildContextConsumer extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        childContext = this.context;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    ChildContextConsumer.contextTypes = {0
      bar: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
    };0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<ParentContextProvider />),0
    ).toWarnDev([0
      'Warning: MiddleMissingContext.childContextTypes is specified but there is no getChildContext() method on the ' +0
        'instance. You can either define getChildContext() on MiddleMissingContext or remove childContextTypes from ' +0
        'it.',0
      'Warning: Failed context type: The context `bar` is marked as required in `ChildContextConsumer`, but its ' +0
        'value is `undefined`.',0
    ]);0
    expect(childContext.bar).toBeUndefined();0
    expect(childContext.foo).toBe('FOO');0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactTestRenderer;0
0
describe('ReactCreateRef', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactTestRenderer = require('react-test-renderer');0
  });0
0
  it('should warn in dev if an invalid ref object is provided', () => {0
    function Wrapper({children}) {0
      return children;0
    }0
0
    class ExampleComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestRenderer.create(0
        <Wrapper>0
          <div ref={{}} />0
        </Wrapper>,0
      ),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Unexpected ref object provided for div. ' +0
        'Use either a ref-setter function or React.createRef().\n' +0
        '    in div (at **)\n' +0
        '    in Wrapper (at **)',0
    );0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestRenderer.create(0
        <Wrapper>0
          <ExampleComponent ref={{}} />0
        </Wrapper>,0
      ),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Unexpected ref object provided for ExampleComponent. ' +0
        'Use either a ref-setter function or React.createRef().\n' +0
        '    in ExampleComponent (at **)\n' +0
        '    in Wrapper (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
0
describe('ReactElement', () => {0
  let ComponentClass;0
  let originalSymbol;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    // Delete the native Symbol if we have one to ensure we test the0
    // unpolyfilled environment.0
    originalSymbol = global.Symbol;0
    global.Symbol = undefined;0
0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
    // NOTE: We're explicitly not using JSX here. This is intended to test0
    // classic JS without JSX.0
    ComponentClass = class extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement('div');0
      }0
    };0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    global.Symbol = originalSymbol;0
  });0
0
  it('uses the fallback value when in an environment without Symbol', () => {0
    expect(<div />.$$typeof).toBe(0xeac7);0
  });0
0
  it('returns a complete element according to spec', () => {0
    const element = React.createFactory(ComponentClass)();0
    expect(element.type).toBe(ComponentClass);0
    expect(element.key).toBe(null);0
    expect(element.ref).toBe(null);0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(Object.isFrozen(element)).toBe(true);0
      expect(Object.isFrozen(element.props)).toBe(true);0
    }0
    expect(element.props).toEqual({});0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when `key` is being accessed on composite element', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div> {this.props.key} </div>;0
      }0
    }0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Child key="0" />0
            <Child key="1" />0
            <Child key="2" />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Parent />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Child: `key` is not a prop. Trying to access it will result ' +0
        'in `undefined` being returned. If you need to access the same ' +0
        'value within the child component, you should pass it as a different ' +0
        'prop. (https://fb.me/react-special-props)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when `key` is being accessed on a host element', () => {0
    const element = <div key="3" />;0
    expect(() => void element.props.key).toWarnDev(0
      'div: `key` is not a prop. Trying to access it will result ' +0
        'in `undefined` being returned. If you need to access the same ' +0
        'value within the child component, you should pass it as a different ' +0
        'prop. (https://fb.me/react-special-props)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when `ref` is being accessed', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div> {this.props.ref} </div>;0
      }0
    }0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Child ref="childElement" />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Parent />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Child: `ref` is not a prop. Trying to access it will result ' +0
        'in `undefined` being returned. If you need to access the same ' +0
        'value within the child component, you should pass it as a different ' +0
        'prop. (https://fb.me/react-special-props)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('allows a string to be passed as the type', () => {0
    const element = React.createFactory('div')();0
    expect(element.type).toBe('div');0
    expect(element.key).toBe(null);0
    expect(element.ref).toBe(null);0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(Object.isFrozen(element)).toBe(true);0
      expect(Object.isFrozen(element.props)).toBe(true);0
    }0
    expect(element.props).toEqual({});0
  });0
0
  it('returns an immutable element', () => {0
    const element = React.createFactory(ComponentClass)();0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(() => (element.type = 'div')).toThrow();0
    } else {0
      expect(() => (element.type = 'div')).not.toThrow();0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('does not reuse the original config object', () => {0
    const config = {foo: 1};0
    const element = React.createFactory(ComponentClass)(config);0
    expect(element.props.foo).toBe(1);0
    config.foo = 2;0
    expect(element.props.foo).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('does not fail if config has no prototype', () => {0
    const config = Object.create(null, {foo: {value: 1, enumerable: true}});0
    const element = React.createFactory(ComponentClass)(config);0
    expect(element.props.foo).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('extracts key and ref from the config', () => {0
    const element = React.createFactory(ComponentClass)({0
      key: '12',0
      ref: '34',0
      foo: '56',0
    });0
    expect(element.type).toBe(ComponentClass);0
    expect(element.key).toBe('12');0
    expect(element.ref).toBe('34');0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(Object.isFrozen(element)).toBe(true);0
      expect(Object.isFrozen(element.props)).toBe(true);0
    }0
    expect(element.props).toEqual({foo: '56'});0
  });0
0
  it('extracts null key and ref', () => {0
    const element = React.createFactory(ComponentClass)({0
      key: null,0
      ref: null,0
      foo: '12',0
    });0
    expect(element.type).toBe(ComponentClass);0
    expect(element.key).toBe('null');0
    expect(element.ref).toBe(null);0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(Object.isFrozen(element)).toBe(true);0
      expect(Object.isFrozen(element.props)).toBe(true);0
    }0
    expect(element.props).toEqual({foo: '12'});0
  });0
0
  it('ignores undefined key and ref', () => {0
    const props = {0
      foo: '56',0
      key: undefined,0
      ref: undefined,0
    };0
    const element = React.createFactory(ComponentClass)(props);0
    expect(element.type).toBe(ComponentClass);0
    expect(element.key).toBe(null);0
    expect(element.ref).toBe(null);0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(Object.isFrozen(element)).toBe(true);0
      expect(Object.isFrozen(element.props)).toBe(true);0
    }0
    expect(element.props).toEqual({foo: '56'});0
  });0
0
  it('ignores key and ref warning getters', () => {0
    const elementA = React.createElement('div');0
    const elementB = React.createElement('div', elementA.props);0
    expect(elementB.key).toBe(null);0
    expect(elementB.ref).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('coerces the key to a string', () => {0
    const element = React.createFactory(ComponentClass)({0
      key: 12,0
      foo: '56',0
    });0
    expect(element.type).toBe(ComponentClass);0
    expect(element.key).toBe('12');0
    expect(element.ref).toBe(null);0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(Object.isFrozen(element)).toBe(true);0
      expect(Object.isFrozen(element.props)).toBe(true);0
    }0
    expect(element.props).toEqual({foo: '56'});0
  });0
0
  it('preserves the owner on the element', () => {0
    const Component = React.createFactory(ComponentClass);0
    let element;0
0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        element = Component();0
        return element;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      React.createElement(Wrapper),0
    );0
    expect(element._owner.stateNode).toBe(instance);0
  });0
0
  it('merges an additional argument onto the children prop', () => {0
    const a = 1;0
    const element = React.createFactory(ComponentClass)(0
      {0
        children: 'text',0
      },0
      a,0
    );0
    expect(element.props.children).toBe(a);0
  });0
0
  it('does not override children if no rest args are provided', () => {0
    const element = React.createFactory(ComponentClass)({0
      children: 'text',0
    });0
    expect(element.props.children).toBe('text');0
  });0
0
  it('overrides children if null is provided as an argument', () => {0
    const element = React.createFactory(ComponentClass)(0
      {0
        children: 'text',0
      },0
      null,0
    );0
    expect(element.props.children).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('merges rest arguments onto the children prop in an array', () => {0
    const a = 1;0
    const b = 2;0
    const c = 3;0
    const element = React.createFactory(ComponentClass)(null, a, b, c);0
    expect(element.props.children).toEqual([1, 2, 3]);0
  });0
0
  // NOTE: We're explicitly not using JSX here. This is intended to test0
  // classic JS without JSX.0
  it('allows static methods to be called using the type property', () => {0
    class StaticMethodComponentClass extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement('div');0
      }0
    }0
    StaticMethodComponentClass.someStaticMethod = () => 'someReturnValue';0
0
    const element = React.createElement(StaticMethodComponentClass);0
    expect(element.type.someStaticMethod()).toBe('someReturnValue');0
  });0
0
  // NOTE: We're explicitly not using JSX here. This is intended to test0
  // classic JS without JSX.0
  it('identifies valid elements', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement('div');0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(React.isValidElement(React.createElement('div'))).toEqual(true);0
    expect(React.isValidElement(React.createElement(Component))).toEqual(true);0
0
    expect(React.isValidElement(null)).toEqual(false);0
    expect(React.isValidElement(true)).toEqual(false);0
    expect(React.isValidElement({})).toEqual(false);0
    expect(React.isValidElement('string')).toEqual(false);0
    expect(React.isValidElement(React.createFactory('div'))).toEqual(false);0
    expect(React.isValidElement(Component)).toEqual(false);0
    expect(React.isValidElement({type: 'div', props: {}})).toEqual(false);0
0
    const jsonElement = JSON.stringify(React.createElement('div'));0
    expect(React.isValidElement(JSON.parse(jsonElement))).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  // NOTE: We're explicitly not using JSX here. This is intended to test0
  // classic JS without JSX.0
  it('is indistinguishable from a plain object', () => {0
    const element = React.createElement('div', {className: 'foo'});0
    const object = {};0
    expect(element.constructor).toBe(object.constructor);0
  });0
0
  // NOTE: We're explicitly not using JSX here. This is intended to test0
  // classic JS without JSX.0
  it('should use default prop value when removing a prop', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement('span');0
      }0
    }0
    Component.defaultProps = {fruit: 'persimmon'};0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(0
      React.createElement(Component, {fruit: 'mango'}),0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(instance.props.fruit).toBe('mango');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(React.createElement(Component), container);0
    expect(instance.props.fruit).toBe('persimmon');0
  });0
0
  // NOTE: We're explicitly not using JSX here. This is intended to test0
  // classic JS without JSX.0
  it('should normalize props with default values', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement('span', null, this.props.prop);0
      }0
    }0
    Component.defaultProps = {prop: 'testKey'};0
0
    const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      React.createElement(Component),0
    );0
    expect(instance.props.prop).toBe('testKey');0
0
    const inst2 = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      React.createElement(Component, {prop: null}),0
    );0
    expect(inst2.props.prop).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('throws when changing a prop (in dev) after element creation', () => {0
    class Outer extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        const el = <div className="moo" />;0
0
        if (__DEV__) {0
          expect(function() {0
            el.props.className = 'quack';0
          }).toThrow();0
          expect(el.props.className).toBe('moo');0
        } else {0
          el.props.className = 'quack';0
          expect(el.props.className).toBe('quack');0
        }0
0
        return el;0
      }0
    }0
    const outer = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Outer color="orange" />);0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(outer).className).toBe('moo');0
    } else {0
      expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(outer).className).toBe('quack');0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('throws when adding a prop (in dev) after element creation', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    class Outer extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        const el = <div>{this.props.sound}</div>;0
0
        if (__DEV__) {0
          expect(function() {0
            el.props.className = 'quack';0
          }).toThrow();0
          expect(el.props.className).toBe(undefined);0
        } else {0
          el.props.className = 'quack';0
          expect(el.props.className).toBe('quack');0
        }0
0
        return el;0
      }0
    }0
    Outer.defaultProps = {sound: 'meow'};0
    const outer = ReactDOM.render(<Outer />, container);0
    expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(outer).textContent).toBe('meow');0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(outer).className).toBe('');0
    } else {0
      expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(outer).className).toBe('quack');0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('does not warn for NaN props', () => {0
    class Test extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    const test = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Test value={+undefined} />);0
    expect(test.props.value).toBeNaN();0
  });0
0
  // NOTE: We're explicitly not using JSX here. This is intended to test0
  // classic JS without JSX.0
  it('identifies elements, but not JSON, if Symbols are supported', () => {0
    // Rudimentary polyfill0
    // Once all jest engines support Symbols natively we can swap this to test0
    // WITH native Symbols by default.0
    const REACT_ELEMENT_TYPE = function() {}; // fake Symbol0
    const OTHER_SYMBOL = function() {}; // another fake Symbol0
    global.Symbol = function(name) {0
      return OTHER_SYMBOL;0
    };0
    global.Symbol.for = function(key) {0
      if (key === 'react.element') {0
        return REACT_ELEMENT_TYPE;0
      }0
      return OTHER_SYMBOL;0
    };0
0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    React = require('react');0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement('div');0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(React.isValidElement(React.createElement('div'))).toEqual(true);0
    expect(React.isValidElement(React.createElement(Component))).toEqual(true);0
0
    expect(React.isValidElement(null)).toEqual(false);0
    expect(React.isValidElement(true)).toEqual(false);0
    expect(React.isValidElement({})).toEqual(false);0
    expect(React.isValidElement('string')).toEqual(false);0
    expect(React.isValidElement(React.createFactory('div'))).toEqual(false);0
    expect(React.isValidElement(Component)).toEqual(false);0
    expect(React.isValidElement({type: 'div', props: {}})).toEqual(false);0
0
    const jsonElement = JSON.stringify(React.createElement('div'));0
    expect(React.isValidElement(JSON.parse(jsonElement))).toBe(false);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let PropTypes;0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
0
describe('ReactElementClone', () => {0
  let ComponentClass;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
0
    // NOTE: We're explicitly not using JSX here. This is intended to test0
    // classic JS without JSX.0
    ComponentClass = class extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement('div');0
      }0
    };0
  });0
0
  it('should clone a DOM component with new props', () => {0
    class Grandparent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <Parent child={<div className="child" />} />;0
      }0
    }0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div className="parent">0
            {React.cloneElement(this.props.child, {className: 'xyz'})}0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
    const component = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Grandparent />);0
    expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(component).childNodes[0].className).toBe('xyz');0
  });0
0
  it('should clone a composite component with new props', () => {0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div className={this.props.className} />;0
      }0
    }0
    class Grandparent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <Parent child={<Child className="child" />} />;0
      }0
    }0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div className="parent">0
            {React.cloneElement(this.props.child, {className: 'xyz'})}0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
    const component = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Grandparent />);0
    expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(component).childNodes[0].className).toBe('xyz');0
  });0
0
  it('does not fail if config has no prototype', () => {0
    const config = Object.create(null, {foo: {value: 1, enumerable: true}});0
    React.cloneElement(<div />, config);0
  });0
0
  it('should keep the original ref if it is not overridden', () => {0
    class Grandparent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <Parent child={<div ref="yolo" />} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>{React.cloneElement(this.props.child, {className: 'xyz'})}</div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const component = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Grandparent />);0
    expect(component.refs.yolo.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
  });0
0
  it('should transfer the key property', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
    const clone = React.cloneElement(<Component />, {key: 'xyz'});0
    expect(clone.key).toBe('xyz');0
  });0
0
  it('should transfer children', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        expect(this.props.children).toBe('xyz');0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      React.cloneElement(<Component />, {children: 'xyz'}),0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should shallow clone children', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        expect(this.props.children).toBe('xyz');0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      React.cloneElement(<Component>xyz</Component>, {}),0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should accept children as rest arguments', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const clone = React.cloneElement(0
      <Component>xyz</Component>,0
      {children: <Component />},0
      <div />,0
      <span />,0
    );0
0
    expect(clone.props.children).toEqual([<div />, <span />]);0
  });0
0
  it('should override children if undefined is provided as an argument', () => {0
    const element = React.createElement(0
      ComponentClass,0
      {0
        children: 'text',0
      },0
      undefined,0
    );0
    expect(element.props.children).toBe(undefined);0
0
    const element2 = React.cloneElement(0
      React.createElement(ComponentClass, {0
        children: 'text',0
      }),0
      {},0
      undefined,0
    );0
    expect(element2.props.children).toBe(undefined);0
  });0
0
  it('should support keys and refs', () => {0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        const clone = React.cloneElement(this.props.children, {0
          key: 'xyz',0
          ref: 'xyz',0
        });0
        expect(clone.key).toBe('xyz');0
        expect(clone.ref).toBe('xyz');0
        return <div>{clone}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Grandparent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <Parent ref="parent">0
            <span key="abc" />0
          </Parent>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const component = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Grandparent />);0
    expect(component.refs.parent.refs.xyz.tagName).toBe('SPAN');0
  });0
0
  it('should steal the ref if a new ref is specified', () => {0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        const clone = React.cloneElement(this.props.children, {ref: 'xyz'});0
        return <div>{clone}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Grandparent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <Parent ref="parent">0
            <span ref="child" />0
          </Parent>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const component = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Grandparent />);0
    expect(component.refs.child).toBeUndefined();0
    expect(component.refs.parent.refs.xyz.tagName).toBe('SPAN');0
  });0
0
  it('should overwrite props', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        expect(this.props.myprop).toBe('xyz');0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      React.cloneElement(<Component myprop="abc" />, {myprop: 'xyz'}),0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should normalize props with default values', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <span />;0
      }0
    }0
    Component.defaultProps = {prop: 'testKey'};0
0
    const instance = React.createElement(Component);0
    const clonedInstance = React.cloneElement(instance, {prop: undefined});0
    expect(clonedInstance.props.prop).toBe('testKey');0
    const clonedInstance2 = React.cloneElement(instance, {prop: null});0
    expect(clonedInstance2.props.prop).toBe(null);0
0
    const instance2 = React.createElement(Component, {prop: 'newTestKey'});0
    const cloneInstance3 = React.cloneElement(instance2, {prop: undefined});0
    expect(cloneInstance3.props.prop).toBe('testKey');0
    const cloneInstance4 = React.cloneElement(instance2, {});0
    expect(cloneInstance4.props.prop).toBe('newTestKey');0
  });0
0
  it('warns for keys for arrays of elements in rest args', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      React.cloneElement(<div />, null, [<div />, <div />]),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique "key" prop.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('does not warns for arrays of elements with keys', () => {0
    React.cloneElement(<div />, null, [<div key="#1" />, <div key="#2" />]);0
  });0
0
  it('does not warn when the element is directly in rest args', () => {0
    React.cloneElement(<div />, null, <div />, <div />);0
  });0
0
  it('does not warn when the array contains a non-element', () => {0
    React.cloneElement(<div />, null, [{}, {}]);0
  });0
0
  it('should check declared prop types after clone', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      static propTypes = {0
        color: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement('div', null, 'My color is ' + this.color);0
      }0
    }0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return React.cloneElement(this.props.child, {color: 123});0
      }0
    }0
    class GrandParent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement(Parent, {0
          child: React.createElement(Component, {color: 'red'}),0
        });0
      }0
    }0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(React.createElement(GrandParent)),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed prop type: ' +0
        'Invalid prop `color` of type `number` supplied to `Component`, ' +0
        'expected `string`.\n' +0
        '    in Component (created by GrandParent)\n' +0
        '    in Parent (created by GrandParent)\n' +0
        '    in GrandParent',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should ignore key and ref warning getters', () => {0
    const elementA = React.createElement('div');0
    const elementB = React.cloneElement(elementA, elementA.props);0
    expect(elementB.key).toBe(null);0
    expect(elementB.ref).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('should ignore undefined key and ref', () => {0
    const element = React.createFactory(ComponentClass)({0
      key: '12',0
      ref: '34',0
      foo: '56',0
    });0
    const props = {0
      key: undefined,0
      ref: undefined,0
      foo: 'ef',0
    };0
    const clone = React.cloneElement(element, props);0
    expect(clone.type).toBe(ComponentClass);0
    expect(clone.key).toBe('12');0
    expect(clone.ref).toBe('34');0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(Object.isFrozen(element)).toBe(true);0
      expect(Object.isFrozen(element.props)).toBe(true);0
    }0
    expect(clone.props).toEqual({foo: 'ef'});0
  });0
0
  it('should extract null key and ref', () => {0
    const element = React.createFactory(ComponentClass)({0
      key: '12',0
      ref: '34',0
      foo: '56',0
    });0
    const props = {0
      key: null,0
      ref: null,0
      foo: 'ef',0
    };0
    const clone = React.cloneElement(element, props);0
    expect(clone.type).toBe(ComponentClass);0
    expect(clone.key).toBe('null');0
    expect(clone.ref).toBe(null);0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(Object.isFrozen(element)).toBe(true);0
      expect(Object.isFrozen(element.props)).toBe(true);0
    }0
    expect(clone.props).toEqual({foo: 'ef'});0
  });0
0
  it('throws an error if passed null', () => {0
    const element = null;0
    expect(() => React.cloneElement(element)).toThrow(0
      'React.cloneElement(...): The argument must be a React element, but you passed null.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('throws an error if passed undefined', () => {0
    let element;0
    expect(() => React.cloneElement(element)).toThrow(0
      'React.cloneElement(...): The argument must be a React element, but you passed undefined.',0
    );0
  });0
});0

'use strict';0
0
// NOTE: We're explicitly not using JSX in this file. This is intended to test0
// classic JS without JSX.0
0
let PropTypes;0
let ReactFeatureFlags;0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
0
describe('ReactElementValidator', () => {0
  let ComponentClass;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.replayFailedUnitOfWorkWithInvokeGuardedCallback = false;0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
    ComponentClass = class extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement('div');0
      }0
    };0
  });0
0
  it('warns for keys for arrays of elements in rest args', () => {0
    const Component = React.createFactory(ComponentClass);0
0
    expect(() => {0
      Component(null, [Component(), Component()]);0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique "key" prop.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('warns for keys for arrays of elements with owner info', () => {0
    const Component = React.createFactory(ComponentClass);0
0
    class InnerClass extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return Component(null, this.props.childSet);0
      }0
    }0
0
    const InnerComponent = React.createFactory(InnerClass);0
0
    class ComponentWrapper extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return InnerComponent({childSet: [Component(), Component()]});0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(React.createElement(ComponentWrapper));0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique "key" prop.' +0
        '\n\nCheck the render method of `InnerClass`. ' +0
        'It was passed a child from ComponentWrapper. ',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('warns for keys for arrays with no owner or parent info', () => {0
    function Anonymous() {0
      return <div />;0
    }0
    Object.defineProperty(Anonymous, 'name', {value: undefined});0
0
    const divs = [<div />, <div />];0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Anonymous>{divs}</Anonymous>);0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique ' +0
        '"key" prop. See https://fb.me/react-warning-keys for more information.\n' +0
        '    in div (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('warns for keys for arrays of elements with no owner info', () => {0
    const divs = [<div />, <div />];0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div>{divs}</div>);0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique ' +0
        '"key" prop.\n\nCheck the top-level render call using <div>. See ' +0
        'https://fb.me/react-warning-keys for more information.\n' +0
        '    in div (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('warns for keys with component stack info', () => {0
    function Component() {0
      return <div>{[<div />, <div />]}</div>;0
    }0
0
    function Parent(props) {0
      return React.cloneElement(props.child);0
    }0
0
    function GrandParent() {0
      return <Parent child={<Component />} />;0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<GrandParent />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique ' +0
        '"key" prop.\n\nCheck the render method of `Component`. See ' +0
        'https://fb.me/react-warning-keys for more information.\n' +0
        '    in div (at **)\n' +0
        '    in Component (at **)\n' +0
        '    in Parent (at **)\n' +0
        '    in GrandParent (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('does not warn for keys when passing children down', () => {0
    function Wrapper(props) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          {props.children}0
          <footer />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <Wrapper>0
        <span />0
        <span />0
      </Wrapper>,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('warns for keys for iterables of elements in rest args', () => {0
    const Component = React.createFactory(ComponentClass);0
0
    const iterable = {0
      '@@iterator': function() {0
        let i = 0;0
        return {0
          next: function() {0
            const done = ++i > 2;0
            return {value: done ? undefined : Component(), done: done};0
          },0
        };0
      },0
    };0
0
    expect(() => Component(null, iterable)).toWarnDev(0
      'Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique "key" prop.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('does not warns for arrays of elements with keys', () => {0
    const Component = React.createFactory(ComponentClass);0
0
    Component(null, [Component({key: '#1'}), Component({key: '#2'})]);0
  });0
0
  it('does not warns for iterable elements with keys', () => {0
    const Component = React.createFactory(ComponentClass);0
0
    const iterable = {0
      '@@iterator': function() {0
        let i = 0;0
        return {0
          next: function() {0
            const done = ++i > 2;0
            return {0
              value: done ? undefined : Component({key: '#' + i}),0
              done: done,0
            };0
          },0
        };0
      },0
    };0
0
    Component(null, iterable);0
  });0
0
  it('does not warn when the element is directly in rest args', () => {0
    const Component = React.createFactory(ComponentClass);0
0
    Component(null, Component(), Component());0
  });0
0
  it('does not warn when the array contains a non-element', () => {0
    const Component = React.createFactory(ComponentClass);0
0
    Component(null, [{}, {}]);0
  });0
0
  it('should give context for PropType errors in nested components.', () => {0
    // In this test, we're making sure that if a proptype error is found in a0
    // component, we give a small hint as to which parent instantiated that0
    // component as per warnings about key usage in ReactElementValidator.0
    function MyComp(props) {0
      return React.createElement('div', null, 'My color is ' + props.color);0
    }0
    MyComp.propTypes = {0
      color: PropTypes.string,0
    };0
    function ParentComp() {0
      return React.createElement(MyComp, {color: 123});0
    }0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(React.createElement(ParentComp));0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed prop type: ' +0
        'Invalid prop `color` of type `number` supplied to `MyComp`, ' +0
        'expected `string`.\n' +0
        '    in MyComp (created by ParentComp)\n' +0
        '    in ParentComp',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('gives a helpful error when passing invalid types', () => {0
    expect(() => {0
      React.createElement(undefined);0
      React.createElement(null);0
      React.createElement(true);0
      React.createElement({x: 17});0
      React.createElement({});0
    }).toWarnDev([0
      'Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string ' +0
        '(for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite ' +0
        'components) but got: undefined. You likely forgot to export your ' +0
        "component from the file it's defined in, or you might have mixed up " +0
        'default and named imports.',0
      'Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string ' +0
        '(for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite ' +0
        'components) but got: null.',0
      'Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string ' +0
        '(for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite ' +0
        'components) but got: boolean.',0
      'Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string ' +0
        '(for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite ' +0
        'components) but got: object.',0
      'Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string ' +0
        '(for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite ' +0
        'components) but got: object. You likely forgot to export your ' +0
        "component from the file it's defined in, or you might have mixed up " +0
        'default and named imports.',0
    ]);0
0
    // Should not log any additional warnings0
    React.createElement('div');0
  });0
0
  it('includes the owner name when passing null, undefined, boolean, or number', () => {0
    function ParentComp() {0
      return React.createElement(null);0
    }0
0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(React.createElement(ParentComp));0
      }).toThrowError(0
        'Element type is invalid: expected a string (for built-in components) ' +0
          'or a class/function (for composite components) but got: null.' +0
          (__DEV__ ? '\n\nCheck the render method of `ParentComp`.' : ''),0
      );0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string ' +0
        '(for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite ' +0
        'components) but got: null.' +0
        '\n\nCheck the render method of `ParentComp`.\n    in ParentComp',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should check default prop values', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      static propTypes = {prop: PropTypes.string.isRequired};0
      static defaultProps = {prop: null};0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement('span', null, this.props.prop);0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(React.createElement(Component)),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed prop type: The prop `prop` is marked as required in ' +0
        '`Component`, but its value is `null`.\n' +0
        '    in Component',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should not check the default for explicit null', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      static propTypes = {prop: PropTypes.string.isRequired};0
      static defaultProps = {prop: 'text'};0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement('span', null, this.props.prop);0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        React.createElement(Component, {prop: null}),0
      );0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed prop type: The prop `prop` is marked as required in ' +0
        '`Component`, but its value is `null`.\n' +0
        '    in Component',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should check declared prop types', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      static propTypes = {0
        prop: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement('span', null, this.props.prop);0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(React.createElement(Component));0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        React.createElement(Component, {prop: 42}),0
      );0
    }).toWarnDev([0
      'Warning: Failed prop type: ' +0
        'The prop `prop` is marked as required in `Component`, but its value ' +0
        'is `undefined`.\n' +0
        '    in Component',0
      'Warning: Failed prop type: ' +0
        'Invalid prop `prop` of type `number` supplied to ' +0
        '`Component`, expected `string`.\n' +0
        '    in Component',0
    ]);0
0
    // Should not error for strings0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      React.createElement(Component, {prop: 'string'}),0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if a PropType creator is used as a PropType', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      static propTypes = {0
        myProp: PropTypes.shape,0
      };0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement('span', null, this.props.myProp.value);0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        React.createElement(Component, {myProp: {value: 'hi'}}),0
      );0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Component: type specification of prop `myProp` is invalid; ' +0
        'the type checker function must return `null` or an `Error` but ' +0
        'returned a function. You may have forgotten to pass an argument to ' +0
        'the type checker creator (arrayOf, instanceOf, objectOf, oneOf, ' +0
        'oneOfType, and shape all require an argument).',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if component declares PropTypes instead of propTypes', () => {0
    class MisspelledPropTypesComponent extends React.Component {0
      static PropTypes = {0
        prop: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement('span', null, this.props.prop);0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        React.createElement(MisspelledPropTypesComponent, {prop: 'Hi'}),0
      );0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Component MisspelledPropTypesComponent declared `PropTypes` ' +0
        'instead of `propTypes`. Did you misspell the property assignment?',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when accessing .type on an element factory', () => {0
    function TestComponent() {0
      return <div />;0
    }0
0
    let TestFactory = React.createFactory(TestComponent);0
    expect(() => TestFactory.type).toLowPriorityWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Factory.type is deprecated. Access the class directly before ' +0
        'passing it to createFactory.',0
    );0
0
    // Warn once, not again0
    expect(TestFactory.type).toBe(TestComponent);0
  });0
0
  it('does not warn when using DOM node as children', () => {0
    class DOMContainer extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ReactDOM.findDOMNode(this).appendChild(this.props.children);0
      }0
    }0
0
    const node = document.createElement('div');0
    // This shouldn't cause a stack overflow or any other problems (#3883)0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<DOMContainer>{node}</DOMContainer>);0
  });0
0
  it('should not enumerate enumerable numbers (#4776)', () => {0
    /*eslint-disable no-extend-native */0
    Number.prototype['@@iterator'] = function() {0
      throw new Error('number iterator called');0
    };0
    /*eslint-enable no-extend-native */0
0
    try {0
      void (0
        <div>0
          {5}0
          {12}0
          {13}0
        </div>0
      );0
    } finally {0
      delete Number.prototype['@@iterator'];0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('does not blow up with inlined children', () => {0
    // We don't suggest this since it silences all sorts of warnings, but we0
    // shouldn't blow up either.0
0
    const child = {0
      $$typeof: <div />.$$typeof,0
      type: 'span',0
      key: null,0
      ref: null,0
      props: {},0
      _owner: null,0
    };0
0
    void <div>{[child]}</div>;0
  });0
0
  it('does not blow up on key warning with undefined type', () => {0
    const Foo = undefined;0
    expect(() => {0
      void <Foo>{[<div />]}</Foo>;0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string ' +0
        '(for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite ' +0
        'components) but got: undefined. You likely forgot to export your ' +0
        "component from the file it's defined in, or you might have mixed up " +0
        'default and named imports.\n\nCheck your code at **.',0
    );0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let PropTypes;0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
0
describe('ReactES6Class', () => {0
  let container;0
  const freeze = function(expectation) {0
    Object.freeze(expectation);0
    return expectation;0
  };0
  let Inner;0
  let attachedListener = null;0
  let renderedName = null;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    attachedListener = null;0
    renderedName = null;0
    Inner = class extends React.Component {0
      getName() {0
        return this.props.name;0
      }0
      render() {0
        attachedListener = this.props.onClick;0
        renderedName = this.props.name;0
        return <div className={this.props.name} />;0
      }0
    };0
  });0
0
  function test(element, expectedTag, expectedClassName) {0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(element, container);0
    expect(container.firstChild).not.toBeNull();0
    expect(container.firstChild.tagName).toBe(expectedTag);0
    expect(container.firstChild.className).toBe(expectedClassName);0
    return instance;0
  }0
0
  it('preserves the name of the class for use in error messages', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {}0
    expect(Foo.name).toBe('Foo');0
  });0
0
  it('throws if no render function is defined', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {}0
    expect(() =>0
      expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Foo />, container)).toThrow(),0
    ).toWarnDev([0
      // A failed component renders twice in DEV0
      'Warning: Foo(...): No `render` method found on the returned component ' +0
        'instance: you may have forgotten to define `render`.',0
      'Warning: Foo(...): No `render` method found on the returned component ' +0
        'instance: you may have forgotten to define `render`.',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('renders a simple stateless component with prop', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <Inner name={this.props.bar} />;0
      }0
    }0
    test(<Foo bar="foo" />, 'DIV', 'foo');0
    test(<Foo bar="bar" />, 'DIV', 'bar');0
  });0
0
  it('renders based on state using initial values in this.props', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        this.state = {bar: this.props.initialValue};0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span className={this.state.bar} />;0
      }0
    }0
    test(<Foo initialValue="foo" />, 'SPAN', 'foo');0
  });0
0
  it('renders based on state using props in the constructor', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        this.state = {bar: props.initialValue};0
      }0
      changeState() {0
        this.setState({bar: 'bar'});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.bar === 'foo') {0
          return <div className="foo" />;0
        }0
        return <span className={this.state.bar} />;0
      }0
    }0
    const instance = test(<Foo initialValue="foo" />, 'DIV', 'foo');0
    instance.changeState();0
    test(<Foo />, 'SPAN', 'bar');0
  });0
0
  it('sets initial state with value returned by static getDerivedStateFromProps', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps(nextProps, prevState) {0
        return {0
          foo: nextProps.foo,0
          bar: 'bar',0
        };0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div className={`${this.state.foo} ${this.state.bar}`} />;0
      }0
    }0
    test(<Foo foo="foo" />, 'DIV', 'foo bar');0
  });0
0
  it('warns if getDerivedStateFromProps is not static', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
        return {};0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Foo foo="foo" />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Foo: getDerivedStateFromProps() is defined as an instance method ' +0
        'and will be ignored. Instead, declare it as a static method.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('warns if getDerivedStateFromCatch is not static', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      getDerivedStateFromCatch() {0
        return {};0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Foo foo="foo" />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Foo: getDerivedStateFromCatch() is defined as an instance method ' +0
        'and will be ignored. Instead, declare it as a static method.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('warns if getSnapshotBeforeUpdate is static', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      static getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() {}0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Foo foo="foo" />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Foo: getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() is defined as a static method ' +0
        'and will be ignored. Instead, declare it as an instance method.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('warns if state not initialized before static getDerivedStateFromProps', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps(nextProps, prevState) {0
        return {0
          foo: nextProps.foo,0
          bar: 'bar',0
        };0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div className={`${this.state.foo} ${this.state.bar}`} />;0
      }0
    }0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Foo foo="foo" />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Foo: Did not properly initialize state during construction. ' +0
        'Expected state to be an object, but it was undefined.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('updates initial state with values returned by static getDerivedStateFromProps', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        foo: 'foo',0
        bar: 'bar',0
      };0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps(nextProps, prevState) {0
        return {0
          foo: `not-${prevState.foo}`,0
        };0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div className={`${this.state.foo} ${this.state.bar}`} />;0
      }0
    }0
    test(<Foo />, 'DIV', 'not-foo bar');0
  });0
0
  it('renders updated state with values returned by static getDerivedStateFromProps', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        value: 'initial',0
      };0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps(nextProps, prevState) {0
        if (nextProps.update) {0
          return {0
            value: 'updated',0
          };0
        }0
        return null;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div className={this.state.value} />;0
      }0
    }0
    test(<Foo update={false} />, 'DIV', 'initial');0
    test(<Foo update={true} />, 'DIV', 'updated');0
  });0
0
  it('renders based on context in the constructor', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props, context) {0
        super(props, context);0
        this.state = {tag: context.tag, className: this.context.className};0
      }0
      render() {0
        const Tag = this.state.tag;0
        return <Tag className={this.state.className} />;0
      }0
    }0
    Foo.contextTypes = {0
      tag: PropTypes.string,0
      className: PropTypes.string,0
    };0
0
    class Outer extends React.Component {0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {tag: 'span', className: 'foo'};0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <Foo />;0
      }0
    }0
    Outer.childContextTypes = {0
      tag: PropTypes.string,0
      className: PropTypes.string,0
    };0
    test(<Outer />, 'SPAN', 'foo');0
  });0
0
  it('renders only once when setting state in componentWillMount', () => {0
    let renderCount = 0;0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        this.state = {bar: props.initialValue};0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        this.setState({bar: 'bar'});0
      }0
      render() {0
        renderCount++;0
        return <span className={this.state.bar} />;0
      }0
    }0
    test(<Foo initialValue="foo" />, 'SPAN', 'bar');0
    expect(renderCount).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn with non-object in the initial state property', () => {0
    [['an array'], 'a string', 1234].forEach(function(state) {0
      class Foo extends React.Component {0
        constructor() {0
          super();0
          this.state = state;0
        }0
        render() {0
          return <span />;0
        }0
      }0
      expect(() => test(<Foo />, 'SPAN', '')).toWarnDev(0
        'Foo.state: must be set to an object or null',0
      );0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('should render with null in the initial state property', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        this.state = null;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span />;0
      }0
    }0
    test(<Foo />, 'SPAN', '');0
  });0
0
  it('setState through an event handler', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        this.state = {bar: props.initialValue};0
      }0
      handleClick() {0
        this.setState({bar: 'bar'});0
      }0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <Inner name={this.state.bar} onClick={this.handleClick.bind(this)} />0
        );0
      }0
    }0
    test(<Foo initialValue="foo" />, 'DIV', 'foo');0
    attachedListener();0
    expect(renderedName).toBe('bar');0
  });0
0
  it('should not implicitly bind event handlers', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        this.state = {bar: props.initialValue};0
      }0
      handleClick() {0
        this.setState({bar: 'bar'});0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <Inner name={this.state.bar} onClick={this.handleClick} />;0
      }0
    }0
    test(<Foo initialValue="foo" />, 'DIV', 'foo');0
    expect(attachedListener).toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('renders using forceUpdate even when there is no state', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        this.mutativeValue = props.initialValue;0
      }0
      handleClick() {0
        this.mutativeValue = 'bar';0
        this.forceUpdate();0
      }0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <Inner0
            name={this.mutativeValue}0
            onClick={this.handleClick.bind(this)}0
          />0
        );0
      }0
    }0
    test(<Foo initialValue="foo" />, 'DIV', 'foo');0
    attachedListener();0
    expect(renderedName).toBe('bar');0
  });0
0
  it('will call all the normal life cycle methods', () => {0
    let lifeCycles = [];0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        this.state = {};0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        lifeCycles.push('will-mount');0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        lifeCycles.push('did-mount');0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(nextProps) {0
        lifeCycles.push('receive-props', nextProps);0
      }0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps, nextState) {0
        lifeCycles.push('should-update', nextProps, nextState);0
        return true;0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate(nextProps, nextState) {0
        lifeCycles.push('will-update', nextProps, nextState);0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate(prevProps, prevState) {0
        lifeCycles.push('did-update', prevProps, prevState);0
      }0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        lifeCycles.push('will-unmount');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span className={this.props.value} />;0
      }0
    }0
    test(<Foo value="foo" />, 'SPAN', 'foo');0
    expect(lifeCycles).toEqual(['will-mount', 'did-mount']);0
    lifeCycles = []; // reset0
    test(<Foo value="bar" />, 'SPAN', 'bar');0
    // prettier-ignore0
    expect(lifeCycles).toEqual([0
      'receive-props', freeze({value: 'bar'}),0
      'should-update', freeze({value: 'bar'}), {},0
      'will-update', freeze({value: 'bar'}), {},0
      'did-update', freeze({value: 'foo'}), {},0
    ]);0
    lifeCycles = []; // reset0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(lifeCycles).toEqual(['will-unmount']);0
  });0
0
  it('warns when classic properties are defined on the instance, but does not invoke them.', () => {0
    let getDefaultPropsWasCalled = false;0
    let getInitialStateWasCalled = false;0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        this.contextTypes = {};0
        this.propTypes = {};0
      }0
      getInitialState() {0
        getInitialStateWasCalled = true;0
        return {};0
      }0
      getDefaultProps() {0
        getDefaultPropsWasCalled = true;0
        return {};0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span className="foo" />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => test(<Foo />, 'SPAN', 'foo')).toWarnDev([0
      'getInitialState was defined on Foo, a plain JavaScript class.',0
      'getDefaultProps was defined on Foo, a plain JavaScript class.',0
      'propTypes was defined as an instance property on Foo.',0
      'contextTypes was defined as an instance property on Foo.',0
    ]);0
    expect(getInitialStateWasCalled).toBe(false);0
    expect(getDefaultPropsWasCalled).toBe(false);0
  });0
0
  it('does not warn about getInitialState() on class components if state is also defined.', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = this.getInitialState();0
      getInitialState() {0
        return {};0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span className="foo" />;0
      }0
    }0
    test(<Foo />, 'SPAN', 'foo');0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when misspelling shouldComponentUpdate', () => {0
    class NamedComponent extends React.Component {0
      componentShouldUpdate() {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span className="foo" />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => test(<NamedComponent />, 'SPAN', 'foo')).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: ' +0
        'NamedComponent has a method called componentShouldUpdate(). Did you ' +0
        'mean shouldComponentUpdate()? The name is phrased as a question ' +0
        'because the function is expected to return a value.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when misspelling componentWillReceiveProps', () => {0
    class NamedComponent extends React.Component {0
      componentWillRecieveProps() {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span className="foo" />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => test(<NamedComponent />, 'SPAN', 'foo')).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: ' +0
        'NamedComponent has a method called componentWillRecieveProps(). Did ' +0
        'you mean componentWillReceiveProps()?',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when misspelling UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps', () => {0
    class NamedComponent extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillRecieveProps() {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span className="foo" />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => test(<NamedComponent />, 'SPAN', 'foo')).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: ' +0
        'NamedComponent has a method called UNSAFE_componentWillRecieveProps(). ' +0
        'Did you mean UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps()?',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should throw AND warn when trying to access classic APIs', () => {0
    const instance = test(<Inner name="foo" />, 'DIV', 'foo');0
    expect(() =>0
      expect(() => instance.replaceState({})).toThrow(),0
    ).toLowPriorityWarnDev(0
      'replaceState(...) is deprecated in plain JavaScript React classes',0
    );0
    expect(() =>0
      expect(() => instance.isMounted()).toThrow(),0
    ).toLowPriorityWarnDev(0
      'isMounted(...) is deprecated in plain JavaScript React classes',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('supports this.context passed via getChildContext', () => {0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div className={this.context.bar} />;0
      }0
    }0
    Bar.contextTypes = {bar: PropTypes.string};0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {bar: 'bar-through-context'};0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <Bar />;0
      }0
    }0
    Foo.childContextTypes = {bar: PropTypes.string};0
    test(<Foo />, 'DIV', 'bar-through-context');0
  });0
0
  it('supports classic refs', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <Inner name="foo" ref="inner" />;0
      }0
    }0
    const instance = test(<Foo />, 'DIV', 'foo');0
    expect(instance.refs.inner.getName()).toBe('foo');0
  });0
0
  it('supports drilling through to the DOM using findDOMNode', () => {0
    const instance = test(<Inner name="foo" />, 'DIV', 'foo');0
    const node = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(instance);0
    expect(node).toBe(container.firstChild);0
  });0
});0
