'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
0
describe('ReactJSXElement', () => {0
  let Component;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
    Component = class extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    };0
  });0
0
  it('returns a complete element according to spec', () => {0
    const element = <Component />;0
    expect(element.type).toBe(Component);0
    expect(element.key).toBe(null);0
    expect(element.ref).toBe(null);0
    const expectation = {};0
    Object.freeze(expectation);0
    expect(element.props).toEqual(expectation);0
  });0
0
  it('allows a lower-case to be passed as the string type', () => {0
    const element = <div />;0
    expect(element.type).toBe('div');0
    expect(element.key).toBe(null);0
    expect(element.ref).toBe(null);0
    const expectation = {};0
    Object.freeze(expectation);0
    expect(element.props).toEqual(expectation);0
  });0
0
  it('allows a string to be passed as the type', () => {0
    const TagName = 'div';0
    const element = <TagName />;0
    expect(element.type).toBe('div');0
    expect(element.key).toBe(null);0
    expect(element.ref).toBe(null);0
    const expectation = {};0
    Object.freeze(expectation);0
    expect(element.props).toEqual(expectation);0
  });0
0
  it('returns an immutable element', () => {0
    const element = <Component />;0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(() => (element.type = 'div')).toThrow();0
    } else {0
      expect(() => (element.type = 'div')).not.toThrow();0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('does not reuse the object that is spread into props', () => {0
    const config = {foo: 1};0
    const element = <Component {...config} />;0
    expect(element.props.foo).toBe(1);0
    config.foo = 2;0
    expect(element.props.foo).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('extracts key and ref from the rest of the props', () => {0
    const element = <Component key="12" ref="34" foo="56" />;0
    expect(element.type).toBe(Component);0
    expect(element.key).toBe('12');0
    expect(element.ref).toBe('34');0
    const expectation = {foo: '56'};0
    Object.freeze(expectation);0
    expect(element.props).toEqual(expectation);0
  });0
0
  it('coerces the key to a string', () => {0
    const element = <Component key={12} foo="56" />;0
    expect(element.type).toBe(Component);0
    expect(element.key).toBe('12');0
    expect(element.ref).toBe(null);0
    const expectation = {foo: '56'};0
    Object.freeze(expectation);0
    expect(element.props).toEqual(expectation);0
  });0
0
  it('merges JSX children onto the children prop', () => {0
    const a = 1;0
    const element = <Component children="text">{a}</Component>;0
    expect(element.props.children).toBe(a);0
  });0
0
  it('does not override children if no JSX children are provided', () => {0
    const element = <Component children="text" />;0
    expect(element.props.children).toBe('text');0
  });0
0
  it('overrides children if null is provided as a JSX child', () => {0
    const element = <Component children="text">{null}</Component>;0
    expect(element.props.children).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('overrides children if undefined is provided as an argument', () => {0
    const element = <Component children="text">{undefined}</Component>;0
    expect(element.props.children).toBe(undefined);0
0
    const element2 = React.cloneElement(0
      <Component children="text" />,0
      {},0
      undefined,0
    );0
    expect(element2.props.children).toBe(undefined);0
  });0
0
  it('merges JSX children onto the children prop in an array', () => {0
    const a = 1;0
    const b = 2;0
    const c = 3;0
    const element = (0
      <Component>0
        {a}0
        {b}0
        {c}0
      </Component>0
    );0
    expect(element.props.children).toEqual([1, 2, 3]);0
  });0
0
  it('allows static methods to be called using the type property', () => {0
    class StaticMethodComponent {0
      static someStaticMethod() {0
        return 'someReturnValue';0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const element = <StaticMethodComponent />;0
    expect(element.type.someStaticMethod()).toBe('someReturnValue');0
  });0
0
  it('identifies valid elements', () => {0
    expect(React.isValidElement(<div />)).toEqual(true);0
    expect(React.isValidElement(<Component />)).toEqual(true);0
0
    expect(React.isValidElement(null)).toEqual(false);0
    expect(React.isValidElement(true)).toEqual(false);0
    expect(React.isValidElement({})).toEqual(false);0
    expect(React.isValidElement('string')).toEqual(false);0
    expect(React.isValidElement(Component)).toEqual(false);0
    expect(React.isValidElement({type: 'div', props: {}})).toEqual(false);0
  });0
0
  it('is indistinguishable from a plain object', () => {0
    const element = <div className="foo" />;0
    const object = {};0
    expect(element.constructor).toBe(object.constructor);0
  });0
0
  it('should use default prop value when removing a prop', () => {0
    Component.defaultProps = {fruit: 'persimmon'};0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(<Component fruit="mango" />, container);0
    expect(instance.props.fruit).toBe('mango');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container);0
    expect(instance.props.fruit).toBe('persimmon');0
  });0
0
  it('should normalize props with default values', () => {0
    class NormalizingComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <span>{this.props.prop}</span>;0
      }0
    }0
    NormalizingComponent.defaultProps = {prop: 'testKey'};0
0
    const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <NormalizingComponent />,0
    );0
    expect(instance.props.prop).toBe('testKey');0
0
    const inst2 = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <NormalizingComponent prop={null} />,0
    );0
    expect(inst2.props.prop).toBe(null);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
// TODO: All these warnings should become static errors using Flow instead0
// of dynamic errors when using JSX with Flow.0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
let PropTypes;0
0
describe('ReactJSXElementValidator', () => {0
  let Component;0
  let RequiredPropComponent;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
0
    Component = class extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    };0
0
    RequiredPropComponent = class extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <span>{this.props.prop}</span>;0
      }0
    };0
    RequiredPropComponent.displayName = 'RequiredPropComponent';0
    RequiredPropComponent.propTypes = {prop: PropTypes.string.isRequired};0
  });0
0
  it('warns for keys for arrays of elements in children position', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <Component>{[<Component />, <Component />]}</Component>,0
      ),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique "key" prop.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('warns for keys for arrays of elements with owner info', () => {0
    class InnerComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <Component>{this.props.childSet}</Component>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class ComponentWrapper extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <InnerComponent childSet={[<Component />, <Component />]} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<ComponentWrapper />),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique "key" prop.' +0
        '\n\nCheck the render method of `InnerComponent`. ' +0
        'It was passed a child from ComponentWrapper. ',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('warns for keys for iterables of elements in rest args', () => {0
    const iterable = {0
      '@@iterator': function() {0
        let i = 0;0
        return {0
          next: function() {0
            const done = ++i > 2;0
            return {value: done ? undefined : <Component />, done: done};0
          },0
        };0
      },0
    };0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component>{iterable}</Component>),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique "key" prop.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('does not warn for arrays of elements with keys', () => {0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <Component>{[<Component key="#1" />, <Component key="#2" />]}</Component>,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('does not warn for iterable elements with keys', () => {0
    const iterable = {0
      '@@iterator': function() {0
        let i = 0;0
        return {0
          next: function() {0
            const done = ++i > 2;0
            return {0
              value: done ? undefined : <Component key={'#' + i} />,0
              done: done,0
            };0
          },0
        };0
      },0
    };0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component>{iterable}</Component>);0
  });0
0
  it('does not warn for numeric keys in entry iterable as a child', () => {0
    const iterable = {0
      '@@iterator': function() {0
        let i = 0;0
        return {0
          next: function() {0
            const done = ++i > 2;0
            return {value: done ? undefined : [i, <Component />], done: done};0
          },0
        };0
      },0
    };0
    iterable.entries = iterable['@@iterator'];0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component>{iterable}</Component>);0
  });0
0
  it('does not warn when the element is directly as children', () => {0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <Component>0
        <Component />0
        <Component />0
      </Component>,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('does not warn when the child array contains non-elements', () => {0
    void <Component>{[{}, {}]}</Component>;0
  });0
0
  it('should give context for PropType errors in nested components.', () => {0
    // In this test, we're making sure that if a proptype error is found in a0
    // component, we give a small hint as to which parent instantiated that0
    // component as per warnings about key usage in ReactElementValidator.0
    class MyComp extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div>My color is {this.color}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
    MyComp.propTypes = {0
      color: PropTypes.string,0
    };0
    class ParentComp extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <MyComp color={123} />;0
      }0
    }0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<ParentComp />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed prop type: ' +0
        'Invalid prop `color` of type `number` supplied to `MyComp`, ' +0
        'expected `string`.\n' +0
        '    in MyComp (at **)\n' +0
        '    in ParentComp (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should update component stack after receiving next element', () => {0
    function MyComp() {0
      return null;0
    }0
    MyComp.propTypes = {0
      color: PropTypes.string,0
    };0
    function MiddleComp(props) {0
      return <MyComp color={props.color} />;0
    }0
    function ParentComp(props) {0
      if (props.warn) {0
        // This element has a source thanks to JSX.0
        return <MiddleComp color={42} />;0
      }0
      // This element has no source.0
      return React.createElement(MiddleComp, {color: 'blue'});0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<ParentComp warn={false} />, container);0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactDOM.render(<ParentComp warn={true} />, container),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed prop type: ' +0
        'Invalid prop `color` of type `number` supplied to `MyComp`, ' +0
        'expected `string`.\n' +0
        '    in MyComp (at **)\n' +0
        '    in MiddleComp (at **)\n' +0
        '    in ParentComp (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('gives a helpful error when passing null, undefined, or boolean', () => {0
    const Undefined = undefined;0
    const Null = null;0
    const True = true;0
    const Div = 'div';0
    expect(() => void <Undefined />).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string ' +0
        '(for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite ' +0
        'components) but got: undefined. You likely forgot to export your ' +0
        "component from the file it's defined in, or you might have mixed up " +0
        'default and named imports.' +0
        '\n\nCheck your code at **.',0
    );0
    expect(() => void <Null />).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string ' +0
        '(for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite ' +0
        'components) but got: null.' +0
        '\n\nCheck your code at **.',0
    );0
    expect(() => void <True />).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string ' +0
        '(for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite ' +0
        'components) but got: boolean.' +0
        '\n\nCheck your code at **.',0
    );0
    // No error expected0
    void <Div />;0
  });0
0
  it('should check default prop values', () => {0
    RequiredPropComponent.defaultProps = {prop: null};0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<RequiredPropComponent />),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed prop type: The prop `prop` is marked as required in ' +0
        '`RequiredPropComponent`, but its value is `null`.\n' +0
        '    in RequiredPropComponent (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should not check the default for explicit null', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<RequiredPropComponent prop={null} />),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed prop type: The prop `prop` is marked as required in ' +0
        '`RequiredPropComponent`, but its value is `null`.\n' +0
        '    in RequiredPropComponent (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should check declared prop types', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<RequiredPropComponent />),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed prop type: ' +0
        'The prop `prop` is marked as required in `RequiredPropComponent`, but ' +0
        'its value is `undefined`.\n' +0
        '    in RequiredPropComponent (at **)',0
    );0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<RequiredPropComponent prop={42} />),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed prop type: ' +0
        'Invalid prop `prop` of type `number` supplied to ' +0
        '`RequiredPropComponent`, expected `string`.\n' +0
        '    in RequiredPropComponent (at **)',0
    );0
0
    // Should not error for strings0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<RequiredPropComponent prop="string" />);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn on invalid prop types', () => {0
    // Since there is no prevalidation step for ES6 classes, there is no hook0
    // for us to issue a warning earlier than element creation when the error0
    // actually occurs. Since this step is skipped in production, we should just0
    // warn instead of throwing for this case.0
    class NullPropTypeComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <span>{this.props.prop}</span>;0
      }0
    }0
    NullPropTypeComponent.propTypes = {0
      prop: null,0
    };0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<NullPropTypeComponent />),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'NullPropTypeComponent: prop type `prop` is invalid; it must be a ' +0
        'function, usually from the `prop-types` package,',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn on invalid context types', () => {0
    class NullContextTypeComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <span>{this.props.prop}</span>;0
      }0
    }0
    NullContextTypeComponent.contextTypes = {0
      prop: null,0
    };0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<NullContextTypeComponent />),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'NullContextTypeComponent: context type `prop` is invalid; it must ' +0
        'be a function, usually from the `prop-types` package,',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if getDefaultProps is specificed on the class', () => {0
    class GetDefaultPropsComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <span>{this.props.prop}</span>;0
      }0
    }0
    GetDefaultPropsComponent.getDefaultProps = () => ({0
      prop: 'foo',0
    });0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<GetDefaultPropsComponent />),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'getDefaultProps is only used on classic React.createClass definitions.' +0
        ' Use a static property named `defaultProps` instead.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if component declares PropTypes instead of propTypes', () => {0
    class MisspelledPropTypesComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <span>{this.props.prop}</span>;0
      }0
    }0
    MisspelledPropTypesComponent.PropTypes = {0
      prop: PropTypes.string,0
    };0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <MisspelledPropTypesComponent prop="hi" />,0
      ),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Component MisspelledPropTypesComponent declared `PropTypes` ' +0
        'instead of `propTypes`. Did you misspell the property assignment?',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('warns for fragments with illegal attributes', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <React.Fragment a={1}>hello</React.Fragment>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Foo />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Invalid prop `a` supplied to `React.Fragment`. React.Fragment ' +0
        'can only have `key` and `children` props.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('warns for fragments with refs', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <React.Fragment0
            ref={bar => {0
              this.foo = bar;0
            }}>0
            hello0
          </React.Fragment>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Foo />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Invalid attribute `ref` supplied to `React.Fragment`.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('does not warn for fragments of multiple elements without keys', () => {0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <React.Fragment>0
        <span>1</span>0
        <span>2</span>0
      </React.Fragment>,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('warns for fragments of multiple elements with same key', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <span key="a">1</span>0
          <span key="a">2</span>0
          <span key="b">3</span>0
        </React.Fragment>,0
      ),0
    ).toWarnDev('Encountered two children with the same key, `a`.');0
  });0
});0

 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0

0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactFeatureFlags;0
let ReactTestRenderer;0
0
function loadModules({0
  enableProfilerTimer = true,0
  replayFailedUnitOfWorkWithInvokeGuardedCallback = false,0
} = {}) {0
  ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
  ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffects = false;0
  ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode = false;0
  ReactFeatureFlags.enableProfilerTimer = enableProfilerTimer;0
  ReactFeatureFlags.enableGetDerivedStateFromCatch = true;0
  ReactFeatureFlags.replayFailedUnitOfWorkWithInvokeGuardedCallback = replayFailedUnitOfWorkWithInvokeGuardedCallback;0
  React = require('react');0
  ReactTestRenderer = require('react-test-renderer');0
}0
0
describe('Profiler', () => {0
  describe('works in profiling and non-profiling bundles', () => {0
    [true, false].forEach(flagEnabled => {0
      describe(`enableProfilerTimer ${0
        flagEnabled ? 'enabled' : 'disabled'0
      }`, () => {0
        beforeEach(() => {0
          jest.resetModules();0
0
          loadModules({enableProfilerTimer: flagEnabled});0
        });0
0
        // This will throw in production too,0
        // But the test is only interested in verifying the DEV error message.0
        if (__DEV__) {0
          it('should warn if required params are missing', () => {0
            expect(() => {0
              ReactTestRenderer.create(<React.unstable_Profiler />);0
            }).toThrow(0
              'Profiler must specify an "id" string and "onRender" function as props',0
            );0
          });0
        }0
0
        it('should support an empty Profiler (with no children)', () => {0
          // As root0
          expect(0
            ReactTestRenderer.create(0
              <React.unstable_Profiler id="label" onRender={jest.fn()} />,0
            ).toJSON(),0
          ).toMatchSnapshot();0
0
          // As non-root0
          expect(0
            ReactTestRenderer.create(0
              <div>0
                <React.unstable_Profiler id="label" onRender={jest.fn()} />0
              </div>,0
            ).toJSON(),0
          ).toMatchSnapshot();0
        });0
0
        it('should render children', () => {0
          const FunctionalComponent = ({label}) => <span>{label}</span>;0
          const renderer = ReactTestRenderer.create(0
            <div>0
              <span>outside span</span>0
              <React.unstable_Profiler id="label" onRender={jest.fn()}>0
                <span>inside span</span>0
                <FunctionalComponent label="functional component" />0
              </React.unstable_Profiler>0
            </div>,0
          );0
          expect(renderer.toJSON()).toMatchSnapshot();0
        });0
0
        it('should support nested Profilers', () => {0
          const FunctionalComponent = ({label}) => <div>{label}</div>;0
          class ClassComponent extends React.Component {0
            render() {0
              return <block>{this.props.label}</block>;0
            }0
          }0
          const renderer = ReactTestRenderer.create(0
            <React.unstable_Profiler id="outer" onRender={jest.fn()}>0
              <FunctionalComponent label="outer functional component" />0
              <React.unstable_Profiler id="inner" onRender={jest.fn()}>0
                <ClassComponent label="inner class component" />0
                <span>inner span</span>0
              </React.unstable_Profiler>0
            </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
          );0
          expect(renderer.toJSON()).toMatchSnapshot();0
        });0
      });0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('onRender callback', () => {0
    let AdvanceTime;0
    let advanceTimeBy;0
    let mockNow;0
0
    const mockNowForTests = () => {0
      let currentTime = 0;0
0
      mockNow = jest.fn().mockImplementation(() => currentTime);0
0
      ReactTestRenderer.unstable_setNowImplementation(mockNow);0
      advanceTimeBy = amount => {0
        currentTime += amount;0
      };0
    };0
0
    beforeEach(() => {0
      jest.resetModules();0
0
      loadModules();0
      mockNowForTests();0
0
      AdvanceTime = class extends React.Component {0
        static defaultProps = {0
          byAmount: 10,0
          shouldComponentUpdate: true,0
        };0
        shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps) {0
          return nextProps.shouldComponentUpdate;0
        }0
        render() {0
          // Simulate time passing when this component is rendered0
          advanceTimeBy(this.props.byAmount);0
          return this.props.children || null;0
        }0
      };0
    });0
0
    it('is not invoked until the commit phase', () => {0
      const callback = jest.fn();0
0
      const Yield = ({value}) => {0
        renderer.unstable_yield(value);0
        return null;0
      };0
0
      const renderer = ReactTestRenderer.create(0
        <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={callback}>0
          <Yield value="first" />0
          <Yield value="last" />0
        </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
        {0
          unstable_isAsync: true,0
        },0
      );0
0
      // Times are logged until a render is committed.0
      renderer.unstable_flushThrough(['first']);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
      expect(renderer.unstable_flushAll()).toEqual(['last']);0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    });0
0
    it('does not record times for components outside of Profiler tree', () => {0
      ReactTestRenderer.create(0
        <div>0
          <AdvanceTime />0
          <AdvanceTime />0
          <AdvanceTime />0
        </div>,0
      );0
0
      // Should be called twice: once to compute the update expiration time,0
      // and once to record the commit time.0
      // No additional calls from ProfilerTimer are expected.0
      expect(mockNow).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
    });0
0
    it('logs render times for both mount and update', () => {0
      const callback = jest.fn();0
0
      advanceTimeBy(5); // 0 -> 50
0
      const renderer = ReactTestRenderer.create(0
        <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={callback}>0
          <AdvanceTime />0
        </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
      );0
0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
      let [call] = callback.mock.calls;0
0
      expect(call).toHaveLength(6);0
      expect(call[0]).toBe('test');0
      expect(call[1]).toBe('mount');0
      expect(call[2]).toBe(10); // actual time0
      expect(call[3]).toBe(10); // base time0
      expect(call[4]).toBe(5); // start time0
      expect(call[5]).toBe(15); // commit time0
0
      callback.mockReset();0
0
      advanceTimeBy(20); // 15 -> 350
0
      renderer.update(0
        <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={callback}>0
          <AdvanceTime />0
        </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
      );0
0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
      [call] = callback.mock.calls;0
0
      expect(call).toHaveLength(6);0
      expect(call[0]).toBe('test');0
      expect(call[1]).toBe('update');0
      expect(call[2]).toBe(10); // actual time0
      expect(call[3]).toBe(10); // base time0
      expect(call[4]).toBe(35); // start time0
      expect(call[5]).toBe(45); // commit time0
0
      callback.mockReset();0
0
      advanceTimeBy(20); // 45 -> 650
0
      renderer.update(0
        <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={callback}>0
          <AdvanceTime byAmount={4} />0
        </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
      );0
0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
      [call] = callback.mock.calls;0
0
      expect(call).toHaveLength(6);0
      expect(call[0]).toBe('test');0
      expect(call[1]).toBe('update');0
      expect(call[2]).toBe(4); // actual time0
      expect(call[3]).toBe(4); // base time0
      expect(call[4]).toBe(65); // start time0
      expect(call[5]).toBe(69); // commit time0
    });0
0
    it('includes render times of nested Profilers in their parent times', () => {0
      const callback = jest.fn();0
0
      advanceTimeBy(5); // 0 -> 50
0
      ReactTestRenderer.create(0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <React.unstable_Profiler id="parent" onRender={callback}>0
            <AdvanceTime byAmount={10}>0
              <React.unstable_Profiler id="child" onRender={callback}>0
                <AdvanceTime byAmount={20} />0
              </React.unstable_Profiler>0
            </AdvanceTime>0
          </React.unstable_Profiler>0
        </React.Fragment>,0
      );0
0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
0
      // Callbacks bubble (reverse order).0
      const [childCall, parentCall] = callback.mock.calls;0
      expect(childCall[0]).toBe('child');0
      expect(parentCall[0]).toBe('parent');0
0
      // Parent times should include child times0
      expect(childCall[2]).toBe(20); // actual time0
      expect(childCall[3]).toBe(20); // base time0
      expect(childCall[4]).toBe(15); // start time0
      expect(childCall[5]).toBe(35); // commit time0
      expect(parentCall[2]).toBe(30); // actual time0
      expect(parentCall[3]).toBe(30); // base time0
      expect(parentCall[4]).toBe(5); // start time0
      expect(parentCall[5]).toBe(35); // commit time0
    });0
0
    it('tracks sibling Profilers separately', () => {0
      const callback = jest.fn();0
0
      advanceTimeBy(5); // 0 -> 50
0
      ReactTestRenderer.create(0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <React.unstable_Profiler id="first" onRender={callback}>0
            <AdvanceTime byAmount={20} />0
          </React.unstable_Profiler>0
          <React.unstable_Profiler id="second" onRender={callback}>0
            <AdvanceTime byAmount={5} />0
          </React.unstable_Profiler>0
        </React.Fragment>,0
      );0
0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
0
      const [firstCall, secondCall] = callback.mock.calls;0
      expect(firstCall[0]).toBe('first');0
      expect(secondCall[0]).toBe('second');0
0
      // Parent times should include child times0
      expect(firstCall[2]).toBe(20); // actual time0
      expect(firstCall[3]).toBe(20); // base time0
      expect(firstCall[4]).toBe(5); // start time0
      expect(firstCall[5]).toBe(30); // commit time0
      expect(secondCall[2]).toBe(5); // actual time0
      expect(secondCall[3]).toBe(5); // base time0
      expect(secondCall[4]).toBe(25); // start time0
      expect(secondCall[5]).toBe(30); // commit time0
    });0
0
    it('does not include time spent outside of profile root', () => {0
      const callback = jest.fn();0
0
      advanceTimeBy(5); // 0 -> 50
0
      ReactTestRenderer.create(0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <AdvanceTime byAmount={20} />0
          <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={callback}>0
            <AdvanceTime byAmount={5} />0
          </React.unstable_Profiler>0
          <AdvanceTime byAmount={20} />0
        </React.Fragment>,0
      );0
0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
      const [call] = callback.mock.calls;0
      expect(call[0]).toBe('test');0
      expect(call[2]).toBe(5); // actual time0
      expect(call[3]).toBe(5); // base time0
      expect(call[4]).toBe(25); // start time0
      expect(call[5]).toBe(50); // commit time0
    });0
0
    it('is not called when blocked by sCU false', () => {0
      const callback = jest.fn();0
0
      let instance;0
      class Updater extends React.Component {0
        state = {};0
        render() {0
          instance = this;0
          return this.props.children;0
        }0
      }0
0
      class Pure extends React.PureComponent {0
        render() {0
          return this.props.children;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const renderer = ReactTestRenderer.create(0
        <React.unstable_Profiler id="outer" onRender={callback}>0
          <Updater>0
            <React.unstable_Profiler id="middle" onRender={callback}>0
              <Pure>0
                <React.unstable_Profiler id="inner" onRender={callback}>0
                  <div />0
                </React.unstable_Profiler>0
              </Pure>0
            </React.unstable_Profiler>0
          </Updater>0
        </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
      );0
0
      // All profile callbacks are called for initial render0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(3);0
0
      callback.mockReset();0
0
      renderer.unstable_flushSync(() => {0
        instance.setState({0
          count: 1,0
        });0
      });0
0
      // Only call profile updates for paths that have re-rendered0
      // Since "inner" is beneath a pure compoent, it isn't called0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
      expect(callback.mock.calls[0][0]).toBe('middle');0
      expect(callback.mock.calls[1][0]).toBe('outer');0
    });0
0
    it('decreases actual time but not base time when sCU prevents an update', () => {0
      const callback = jest.fn();0
0
      advanceTimeBy(5); // 0 -> 50
0
      const renderer = ReactTestRenderer.create(0
        <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={callback}>0
          <AdvanceTime byAmount={10}>0
            <AdvanceTime byAmount={10} shouldComponentUpdate={false} />0
          </AdvanceTime>0
        </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
      );0
0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
      advanceTimeBy(30); // 25 -> 550
0
      renderer.update(0
        <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={callback}>0
          <AdvanceTime byAmount={10}>0
            <AdvanceTime byAmount={10} shouldComponentUpdate={false} />0
          </AdvanceTime>0
        </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
      );0
0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
0
      const [mountCall, updateCall] = callback.mock.calls;0
0
      expect(mountCall[1]).toBe('mount');0
      expect(mountCall[2]).toBe(20); // actual time0
      expect(mountCall[3]).toBe(20); // base time0
      expect(mountCall[4]).toBe(5); // start time0
      expect(mountCall[5]).toBe(25); // commit time0
0
      expect(updateCall[1]).toBe('update');0
      expect(updateCall[2]).toBe(10); // actual time0
      expect(updateCall[3]).toBe(20); // base time0
      expect(updateCall[4]).toBe(55); // start time0
      expect(updateCall[5]).toBe(65); // commit time0
    });0
0
    it('includes time spent in render phase lifecycles', () => {0
      class WithLifecycles extends React.Component {0
        state = {};0
        static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
          advanceTimeBy(3);0
          return null;0
        }0
        shouldComponentUpdate() {0
          advanceTimeBy(7);0
          return true;0
        }0
        render() {0
          advanceTimeBy(5);0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const callback = jest.fn();0
0
      advanceTimeBy(5); // 0 -> 50
0
      const renderer = ReactTestRenderer.create(0
        <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={callback}>0
          <WithLifecycles />0
        </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
      );0
0
      advanceTimeBy(15); // 13 -> 280
0
      renderer.update(0
        <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={callback}>0
          <WithLifecycles />0
        </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
      );0
0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
0
      const [mountCall, updateCall] = callback.mock.calls;0
0
      expect(mountCall[1]).toBe('mount');0
      expect(mountCall[2]).toBe(8); // actual time0
      expect(mountCall[3]).toBe(8); // base time0
      expect(mountCall[4]).toBe(5); // start time0
      expect(mountCall[5]).toBe(13); // commit time0
0
      expect(updateCall[1]).toBe('update');0
      expect(updateCall[2]).toBe(15); // actual time0
      expect(updateCall[3]).toBe(15); // base time0
      expect(updateCall[4]).toBe(28); // start time0
      expect(updateCall[5]).toBe(43); // commit time0
    });0
0
    describe('with regard to interruptions', () => {0
      it('should accumulate actual time after a scheduling interruptions', () => {0
        const callback = jest.fn();0
0
        const Yield = ({renderTime}) => {0
          advanceTimeBy(renderTime);0
          renderer.unstable_yield('Yield:' + renderTime);0
          return null;0
        };0
0
        advanceTimeBy(5); // 0 -> 50
0
        // Render partially, but run out of time before completing.0
        const renderer = ReactTestRenderer.create(0
          <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={callback}>0
            <Yield renderTime={2} />0
            <Yield renderTime={3} />0
          </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
          {unstable_isAsync: true},0
        );0
        expect(renderer.unstable_flushThrough(['Yield:2'])).toEqual([0
          'Yield:2',0
        ]);0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
0
        // Resume render for remaining children.0
        expect(renderer.unstable_flushAll()).toEqual(['Yield:3']);0
0
        // Verify that logged times include both durations above.0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
        const [call] = callback.mock.calls;0
        expect(call[2]).toBe(5); // actual time0
        expect(call[3]).toBe(5); // base time0
        expect(call[4]).toBe(5); // start time0
        expect(call[5]).toBe(10); // commit time0
      });0
0
      it('should not include time between frames', () => {0
        const callback = jest.fn();0
0
        const Yield = ({renderTime}) => {0
          advanceTimeBy(renderTime);0
          renderer.unstable_yield('Yield:' + renderTime);0
          return null;0
        };0
0
        advanceTimeBy(5); // 0 -> 50
0
        // Render partially, but don't finish.0
        // This partial render should take 5ms of simulated time.0
        const renderer = ReactTestRenderer.create(0
          <React.unstable_Profiler id="outer" onRender={callback}>0
            <Yield renderTime={5} />0
            <Yield renderTime={10} />0
            <React.unstable_Profiler id="inner" onRender={callback}>0
              <Yield renderTime={17} />0
            </React.unstable_Profiler>0
          </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
          {unstable_isAsync: true},0
        );0
        expect(renderer.unstable_flushThrough(['Yield:5'])).toEqual([0
          'Yield:5',0
        ]);0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
0
        // Simulate time moving forward while frame is paused.0
        advanceTimeBy(50); // 10 -> 600
0
        // Flush the remaninig work,0
        // Which should take an additional 10ms of simulated time.0
        expect(renderer.unstable_flushAll()).toEqual(['Yield:10', 'Yield:17']);0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
0
        const [innerCall, outerCall] = callback.mock.calls;0
0
        // Verify that the actual time includes all work times,0
        // But not the time that elapsed between frames.0
        expect(innerCall[0]).toBe('inner');0
        expect(innerCall[2]).toBe(17); // actual time0
        expect(innerCall[3]).toBe(17); // base time0
        expect(innerCall[4]).toBe(70); // start time0
        expect(innerCall[5]).toBe(87); // commit time0
        expect(outerCall[0]).toBe('outer');0
        expect(outerCall[2]).toBe(32); // actual time0
        expect(outerCall[3]).toBe(32); // base time0
        expect(outerCall[4]).toBe(5); // start time0
        expect(outerCall[5]).toBe(87); // commit time0
      });0
0
      it('should report the expected times when a high-priority update replaces an in-progress initial render', () => {0
        const callback = jest.fn();0
0
        const Yield = ({renderTime}) => {0
          advanceTimeBy(renderTime);0
          renderer.unstable_yield('Yield:' + renderTime);0
          return null;0
        };0
0
        advanceTimeBy(5); // 0 -> 50
0
        // Render a partially update, but don't finish.0
        // This partial render should take 10ms of simulated time.0
        const renderer = ReactTestRenderer.create(0
          <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={callback}>0
            <Yield renderTime={10} />0
            <Yield renderTime={20} />0
          </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
          {unstable_isAsync: true},0
        );0
        expect(renderer.unstable_flushThrough(['Yield:10'])).toEqual([0
          'Yield:10',0
        ]);0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
0
        // Simulate time moving forward while frame is paused.0
        advanceTimeBy(100); // 15 -> 1150
0
        // Interrupt with higher priority work.0
        // The interrupted work simulates an additional 5ms of time.0
        expect(0
          renderer.unstable_flushSync(() => {0
            renderer.update(0
              <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={callback}>0
                <Yield renderTime={5} />0
              </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
            );0
          }),0
        ).toEqual(['Yield:5']);0
0
        // The initial work was thrown away in this case,0
        // So the actual and base times should only include the final rendered tree times.0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
        let call = callback.mock.calls[0];0
        expect(call[2]).toBe(5); // actual time0
        expect(call[3]).toBe(5); // base time0
        expect(call[4]).toBe(115); // start time0
        expect(call[5]).toBe(120); // commit time0
0
        callback.mockReset();0
0
        // Verify no more unexpected callbacks from low priority work0
        expect(renderer.unstable_flushAll()).toEqual([]);0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
      });0
0
      it('should report the expected times when a high-priority update replaces a low-priority update', () => {0
        const callback = jest.fn();0
0
        const Yield = ({renderTime}) => {0
          advanceTimeBy(renderTime);0
          renderer.unstable_yield('Yield:' + renderTime);0
          return null;0
        };0
0
        advanceTimeBy(5); // 0 -> 50
0
        const renderer = ReactTestRenderer.create(0
          <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={callback}>0
            <Yield renderTime={6} />0
            <Yield renderTime={15} />0
          </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
          {unstable_isAsync: true},0
        );0
0
        // Render everything initially.0
        // This should take 21 seconds of actual and base time.0
        expect(renderer.unstable_flushAll()).toEqual(['Yield:6', 'Yield:15']);0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
        let call = callback.mock.calls[0];0
        expect(call[2]).toBe(21); // actual time0
        expect(call[3]).toBe(21); // base time0
        expect(call[4]).toBe(5); // start time0
        expect(call[5]).toBe(26); // commit time0
0
        callback.mockReset();0
0
        advanceTimeBy(30); // 26 -> 560
0
        // Render a partially update, but don't finish.0
        // This partial render should take 3ms of simulated time.0
        renderer.update(0
          <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={callback}>0
            <Yield renderTime={3} />0
            <Yield renderTime={5} />0
            <Yield renderTime={9} />0
          </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
        );0
        expect(renderer.unstable_flushThrough(['Yield:3'])).toEqual([0
          'Yield:3',0
        ]);0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
0
        // Simulate time moving forward while frame is paused.0
        advanceTimeBy(100); // 59 -> 1590
0
        // Render another 5ms of simulated time.0
        expect(renderer.unstable_flushThrough(['Yield:5'])).toEqual([0
          'Yield:5',0
        ]);0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
0
        // Simulate time moving forward while frame is paused.0
        advanceTimeBy(100); // 164 -> 2640
0
        // Interrupt with higher priority work.0
        // The interrupted work simulates an additional 11ms of time.0
        expect(0
          renderer.unstable_flushSync(() => {0
            renderer.update(0
              <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={callback}>0
                <Yield renderTime={11} />0
              </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
            );0
          }),0
        ).toEqual(['Yield:11']);0
0
        // The actual time should include only the most recent render,0
        // Because this lets us avoid a lot of commit phase reset complexity.0
        // The base time includes only the final rendered tree times.0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
        call = callback.mock.calls[0];0
        expect(call[2]).toBe(11); // actual time0
        expect(call[3]).toBe(11); // base time0
        expect(call[4]).toBe(264); // start time0
        expect(call[5]).toBe(275); // commit time0
0
        // Verify no more unexpected callbacks from low priority work0
        expect(renderer.unstable_flushAll()).toEqual([]);0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
      });0
0
      it('should report the expected times when a high-priority update interrupts a low-priority update', () => {0
        const callback = jest.fn();0
0
        const Yield = ({renderTime}) => {0
          advanceTimeBy(renderTime);0
          renderer.unstable_yield('Yield:' + renderTime);0
          return null;0
        };0
0
        let first;0
        class FirstComponent extends React.Component {0
          state = {renderTime: 1};0
          render() {0
            first = this;0
            advanceTimeBy(this.state.renderTime);0
            renderer.unstable_yield('FirstComponent:' + this.state.renderTime);0
            return <Yield renderTime={4} />;0
          }0
        }0
        let second;0
        class SecondComponent extends React.Component {0
          state = {renderTime: 2};0
          render() {0
            second = this;0
            advanceTimeBy(this.state.renderTime);0
            renderer.unstable_yield('SecondComponent:' + this.state.renderTime);0
            return <Yield renderTime={7} />;0
          }0
        }0
0
        advanceTimeBy(5); // 0 -> 50
0
        const renderer = ReactTestRenderer.create(0
          <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={callback} foo="1">0
            <FirstComponent />0
            <SecondComponent />0
          </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
          {unstable_isAsync: true},0
        );0
0
        // Render everything initially.0
        // This simulates a total of 14ms of actual render time.0
        // The base render time is also 14ms for the initial render.0
        expect(renderer.unstable_flushAll()).toEqual([0
          'FirstComponent:1',0
          'Yield:4',0
          'SecondComponent:2',0
          'Yield:7',0
        ]);0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
        let call = callback.mock.calls[0];0
        expect(call[2]).toBe(14); // actual time0
        expect(call[3]).toBe(14); // base time0
        expect(call[4]).toBe(5); // start time0
        expect(call[5]).toBe(19); // commit time0
0
        callback.mockClear();0
0
        advanceTimeBy(100); // 19 -> 1190
0
        // Render a partially update, but don't finish.0
        // This partial render will take 10ms of actual render time.0
        first.setState({renderTime: 10});0
        expect(renderer.unstable_flushThrough(['FirstComponent:10'])).toEqual([0
          'FirstComponent:10',0
        ]);0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
0
        // Simulate time moving forward while frame is paused.0
        advanceTimeBy(100); // 129 -> 2290
0
        // Interrupt with higher priority work.0
        // This simulates a total of 37ms of actual render time.0
        expect(0
          renderer.unstable_flushSync(() => second.setState({renderTime: 30})),0
        ).toEqual(['SecondComponent:30', 'Yield:7']);0
0
        // The actual time should include only the most recent render (37ms),0
        // Because this lets us avoid a lot of commit phase reset complexity.0
        // The base time should include the more recent times for the SecondComponent subtree,0
        // As well as the original times for the FirstComponent subtree.0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
        call = callback.mock.calls[0];0
        expect(call[2]).toBe(37); // actual time0
        expect(call[3]).toBe(42); // base time0
        expect(call[4]).toBe(229); // start time0
        expect(call[5]).toBe(266); // commit time0
0
        callback.mockClear();0
0
        // Simulate time moving forward while frame is paused.0
        advanceTimeBy(100); // 266 -> 3660
0
        // Resume the original low priority update, with rebased state.0
        // This simulates a total of 14ms of actual render time,0
        // And does not include the original (interrupted) 10ms.0
        // The tree contains 42ms of base render time at this point,0
        // Reflecting the most recent (longer) render durations.0
        // TODO: This actual time should decrease by 10ms once the scheduler supports resuming.0
        expect(renderer.unstable_flushAll()).toEqual([0
          'FirstComponent:10',0
          'Yield:4',0
        ]);0
        expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
        call = callback.mock.calls[0];0
        expect(call[2]).toBe(14); // actual time0
        expect(call[3]).toBe(51); // base time0
        expect(call[4]).toBe(366); // start time0
        expect(call[5]).toBe(380); // commit time0
      });0
0
      [true, false].forEach(flagEnabled => {0
        describe(`replayFailedUnitOfWorkWithInvokeGuardedCallback ${0
          flagEnabled ? 'enabled' : 'disabled'0
        }`, () => {0
          beforeEach(() => {0
            jest.resetModules();0
0
            loadModules({0
              replayFailedUnitOfWorkWithInvokeGuardedCallback: flagEnabled,0
            });0
            mockNowForTests();0
          });0
0
          it('should accumulate actual time after an error handled by componentDidCatch()', () => {0
            const callback = jest.fn();0
0
            const ThrowsError = () => {0
              advanceTimeBy(10);0
              throw Error('expected error');0
            };0
0
            class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
              state = {error: null};0
              componentDidCatch(error) {0
                this.setState({error});0
              }0
              render() {0
                advanceTimeBy(2);0
                return this.state.error === null ? (0
                  this.props.children0
                ) : (0
                  <AdvanceTime byAmount={20} />0
                );0
              }0
            }0
0
            advanceTimeBy(5); // 0 -> 50
0
            ReactTestRenderer.create(0
              <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={callback}>0
                <ErrorBoundary>0
                  <AdvanceTime byAmount={5} />0
                  <ThrowsError />0
                </ErrorBoundary>0
              </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
            );0
0
            expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
0
            // Callbacks bubble (reverse order).0
            let [mountCall, updateCall] = callback.mock.calls;0
0
            // The initial mount only includes the ErrorBoundary (which takes 2ms)0
            // But it spends time rendering all of the failed subtree also.0
            expect(mountCall[1]).toBe('mount');0
            // actual time includes: 2 (ErrorBoundary) + 5 (AdvanceTime) + 10 (ThrowsError)0
            // If replayFailedUnitOfWorkWithInvokeGuardedCallback is enbaled, ThrowsError is replayed.0
            expect(mountCall[2]).toBe(flagEnabled && __DEV__ ? 27 : 17);0
            // base time includes: 2 (ErrorBoundary)0
            expect(mountCall[3]).toBe(2);0
            // start time0
            expect(mountCall[4]).toBe(5);0
            // commit time0
            expect(mountCall[5]).toBe(flagEnabled && __DEV__ ? 32 : 22);0
0
            // The update includes the ErrorBoundary and its fallback child0
            expect(updateCall[1]).toBe('update');0
            // actual time includes: 2 (ErrorBoundary) + 20 (AdvanceTime)0
            expect(updateCall[2]).toBe(22);0
            // base time includes: 2 (ErrorBoundary) + 20 (AdvanceTime)0
            expect(updateCall[3]).toBe(22);0
            // start time0
            expect(updateCall[4]).toBe(flagEnabled && __DEV__ ? 32 : 22);0
            // commit time0
            expect(updateCall[5]).toBe(flagEnabled && __DEV__ ? 54 : 44);0
          });0
0
          it('should accumulate actual time after an error handled by getDerivedStateFromCatch()', () => {0
            const callback = jest.fn();0
0
            const ThrowsError = () => {0
              advanceTimeBy(10);0
              throw Error('expected error');0
            };0
0
            class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
              state = {error: null};0
              static getDerivedStateFromCatch(error) {0
                return {error};0
              }0
              render() {0
                advanceTimeBy(2);0
                return this.state.error === null ? (0
                  this.props.children0
                ) : (0
                  <AdvanceTime byAmount={20} />0
                );0
              }0
            }0
0
            advanceTimeBy(5); // 0 -> 50
0
            ReactTestRenderer.create(0
              <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={callback}>0
                <ErrorBoundary>0
                  <AdvanceTime byAmount={5} />0
                  <ThrowsError />0
                </ErrorBoundary>0
              </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
            );0
0
            expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
            // Callbacks bubble (reverse order).0
            let [mountCall] = callback.mock.calls;0
0
            // The initial mount includes the ErrorBoundary's error state,0
            // But i also spends actual time rendering UI that fails and isn't included.0
            expect(mountCall[1]).toBe('mount');0
            // actual time includes: 2 (ErrorBoundary) + 5 (AdvanceTime) + 10 (ThrowsError)0
            // Then the re-render: 2 (ErrorBoundary) + 20 (AdvanceTime)0
            // If replayFailedUnitOfWorkWithInvokeGuardedCallback is enbaled, ThrowsError is replayed.0
            expect(mountCall[2]).toBe(flagEnabled && __DEV__ ? 49 : 39);0
            // base time includes: 2 (ErrorBoundary) + 20 (AdvanceTime)0
            expect(mountCall[3]).toBe(22);0
            // start time0
            expect(mountCall[4]).toBe(5);0
            // commit time0
            expect(mountCall[5]).toBe(flagEnabled && __DEV__ ? 54 : 44);0
          });0
        });0
      });0
    });0
0
    it('reflects the most recently rendered id value', () => {0
      const callback = jest.fn();0
0
      advanceTimeBy(5); // 0 -> 50
0
      const renderer = ReactTestRenderer.create(0
        <React.unstable_Profiler id="one" onRender={callback}>0
          <AdvanceTime byAmount={2} />0
        </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
      );0
0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
      advanceTimeBy(20); // 7 -> 270
0
      renderer.update(0
        <React.unstable_Profiler id="two" onRender={callback}>0
          <AdvanceTime byAmount={1} />0
        </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
      );0
0
      expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
0
      const [mountCall, updateCall] = callback.mock.calls;0
0
      expect(mountCall[0]).toBe('one');0
      expect(mountCall[1]).toBe('mount');0
      expect(mountCall[2]).toBe(2); // actual time0
      expect(mountCall[3]).toBe(2); // base time0
      expect(mountCall[4]).toBe(5); // start time0
0
      expect(updateCall[0]).toBe('two');0
      expect(updateCall[1]).toBe('update');0
      expect(updateCall[2]).toBe(1); // actual time0
      expect(updateCall[3]).toBe(1); // base time0
      expect(updateCall[4]).toBe(27); // start time0
    });0
  });0
});0

 *0
 * @emails react-core0

'use strict';0
0
describe('ReactProfiler DevTools integration', () => {0
  let React;0
  let ReactFeatureFlags;0
  let ReactTestRenderer;0
  let AdvanceTime;0
  let advanceTimeBy;0
  let hook;0
  let mockNow;0
0
  const mockNowForTests = () => {0
    let currentTime = 0;0
0
    mockNow = jest.fn().mockImplementation(() => currentTime);0
0
    ReactTestRenderer.unstable_setNowImplementation(mockNow);0
    advanceTimeBy = amount => {0
      currentTime += amount;0
    };0
  };0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    global.__REACT_DEVTOOLS_GLOBAL_HOOK__ = hook = {0
      inject: () => {},0
      onCommitFiberRoot: jest.fn((rendererId, root) => {}),0
      onCommitFiberUnmount: () => {},0
      supportsFiber: true,0
    };0
0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.enableProfilerTimer = true;0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactTestRenderer = require('react-test-renderer');0
0
    mockNowForTests();0
0
    AdvanceTime = class extends React.Component {0
      static defaultProps = {0
        byAmount: 10,0
        shouldComponentUpdate: true,0
      };0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps) {0
        return nextProps.shouldComponentUpdate;0
      }0
      render() {0
        // Simulate time passing when this component is rendered0
        advanceTimeBy(this.props.byAmount);0
        return this.props.children || null;0
      }0
    };0
  });0
0
  it('should auto-Profile all fibers if the DevTools hook is detected', () => {0
    const App = ({multiplier}) => {0
      advanceTimeBy(2);0
      return (0
        <React.unstable_Profiler id="Profiler" onRender={onRender}>0
          <AdvanceTime byAmount={3 * multiplier} shouldComponentUpdate={true} />0
          <AdvanceTime0
            byAmount={7 * multiplier}0
            shouldComponentUpdate={false}0
          />0
        </React.unstable_Profiler>0
      );0
    };0
0
    const onRender = jest.fn(() => {});0
    const rendered = ReactTestRenderer.create(<App multiplier={1} />);0
0
    expect(hook.onCommitFiberRoot).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
    // Measure observable timing using the Profiler component.0
    // The time spent in App (above the Profiler) won't be included in the durations,0
    // But needs to be accounted for in the offset times.0
    expect(onRender).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    expect(onRender).toHaveBeenCalledWith('Profiler', 'mount', 10, 10, 2, 12);0
    onRender.mockClear();0
0
    // Measure unobservable timing required by the DevTools profiler.0
    // At this point, the base time should include both:0
    // The time 2ms in the App component itself, and0
    // The 10ms spend in the Profiler sub-tree beneath.0
    expect(rendered.root.findByType(App)._currentFiber().treeBaseTime).toBe(12);0
0
    rendered.update(<App multiplier={2} />);0
0
    // Measure observable timing using the Profiler component.0
    // The time spent in App (above the Profiler) won't be included in the durations,0
    // But needs to be accounted for in the offset times.0
    expect(onRender).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    expect(onRender).toHaveBeenCalledWith('Profiler', 'update', 6, 13, 14, 20);0
0
    // Measure unobservable timing required by the DevTools profiler.0
    // At this point, the base time should include both:0
    // The initial 9ms for the components that do not re-render, and0
    // The updated 6ms for the component that does.0
    expect(rendered.root.findByType(App)._currentFiber().treeBaseTime).toBe(15);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
0
describe('ReactPureComponent', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
  });0
0
  it('should render', () => {0
    let renders = 0;0
    class Component extends React.PureComponent {0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        this.state = {type: 'mushrooms'};0
      }0
      render() {0
        renders++;0
        return <div>{this.props.text[0]}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    let text;0
    let component;0
0
    text = ['porcini'];0
    component = ReactDOM.render(<Component text={text} />, container);0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('porcini');0
    expect(renders).toBe(1);0
0
    text = ['morel'];0
    component = ReactDOM.render(<Component text={text} />, container);0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('morel');0
    expect(renders).toBe(2);0
0
    text[0] = 'portobello';0
    component = ReactDOM.render(<Component text={text} />, container);0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('morel');0
    expect(renders).toBe(2);0
0
    // Setting state without changing it doesn't cause a rerender.0
    component.setState({type: 'mushrooms'});0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('morel');0
    expect(renders).toBe(2);0
0
    // But changing state does.0
    component.setState({type: 'portobello mushrooms'});0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('portobello');0
    expect(renders).toBe(3);0
  });0
0
  it('can override shouldComponentUpdate', () => {0
    let renders = 0;0
    class Component extends React.PureComponent {0
      render() {0
        renders++;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return true;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: ' +0
        'Component has a method called shouldComponentUpdate(). ' +0
        'shouldComponentUpdate should not be used when extending React.PureComponent. ' +0
        'Please extend React.Component if shouldComponentUpdate is used.',0
    );0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container);0
    expect(renders).toBe(2);0
  });0
0
  it('extends React.Component', () => {0
    let renders = 0;0
    class Component extends React.PureComponent {0
      render() {0
        expect(this instanceof React.Component).toBe(true);0
        expect(this instanceof React.PureComponent).toBe(true);0
        renders++;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component />, document.createElement('div'));0
    expect(renders).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when shouldComponentUpdate is defined on React.PureComponent', () => {0
    class PureComponent extends React.PureComponent {0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return true;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<PureComponent />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: ' +0
        'PureComponent has a method called shouldComponentUpdate(). ' +0
        'shouldComponentUpdate should not be used when extending React.PureComponent. ' +0
        'Please extend React.Component if shouldComponentUpdate is used.',0
    );0
  });0
});0

'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactFeatureFlags;0
let ReactTestRenderer;0
let PropTypes;0
0
describe('ReactStrictMode', () => {0
  describe('debugRenderPhaseSideEffects', () => {0
    beforeEach(() => {0
      jest.resetModules();0
      ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
      ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffects = true;0
      React = require('react');0
      ReactTestRenderer = require('react-test-renderer');0
    });0
0
    it('should invoke precommit lifecycle methods twice', () => {0
      let log = [];0
      let shouldComponentUpdate = false;0
      class ClassComponent extends React.Component {0
        state = {};0
        static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
          log.push('getDerivedStateFromProps');0
          return null;0
        }0
        constructor(props) {0
          super(props);0
          log.push('constructor');0
        }0
        componentDidMount() {0
          log.push('componentDidMount');0
        }0
        componentDidUpdate() {0
          log.push('componentDidUpdate');0
        }0
        componentWillUnmount() {0
          log.push('componentWillUnmount');0
        }0
        shouldComponentUpdate() {0
          log.push('shouldComponentUpdate');0
          return shouldComponentUpdate;0
        }0
        render() {0
          log.push('render');0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const component = ReactTestRenderer.create(<ClassComponent />);0
0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        expect(log).toEqual([0
          'constructor',0
          'constructor',0
          'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
          'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
          'render',0
          'render',0
          'componentDidMount',0
        ]);0
      } else {0
        expect(log).toEqual([0
          'constructor',0
          'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
          'render',0
          'componentDidMount',0
        ]);0
      }0
0
      log = [];0
      shouldComponentUpdate = true;0
0
      component.update(<ClassComponent />);0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        expect(log).toEqual([0
          'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
          'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
          'shouldComponentUpdate',0
          'render',0
          'render',0
          'componentDidUpdate',0
        ]);0
      } else {0
        expect(log).toEqual([0
          'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
          'shouldComponentUpdate',0
          'render',0
          'componentDidUpdate',0
        ]);0
      }0
0
      log = [];0
      shouldComponentUpdate = false;0
0
      component.update(<ClassComponent />);0
0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        expect(log).toEqual([0
          'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
          'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
          'shouldComponentUpdate',0
        ]);0
      } else {0
        expect(log).toEqual([0
          'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
          'shouldComponentUpdate',0
        ]);0
      }0
    });0
0
    it('should invoke setState callbacks twice', () => {0
      class ClassComponent extends React.Component {0
        state = {0
          count: 1,0
        };0
        render() {0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      let setStateCount = 0;0
0
      const rendered = ReactTestRenderer.create(<ClassComponent />);0
      const instance = rendered.getInstance();0
      instance.setState(state => {0
        setStateCount++;0
        return {0
          count: state.count + 1,0
        };0
      });0
0
      // Callback should be invoked twice in DEV0
      expect(setStateCount).toBe(__DEV__ ? 2 : 1);0
      // But each time `state` should be the previous value0
      expect(instance.state.count).toBe(2);0
    });0
  });0
0
  [true, false].forEach(debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode => {0
    describe(`StrictMode (${debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode})`, () => {0
      beforeEach(() => {0
        jest.resetModules();0
        ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
        ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode = debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode;0
        React = require('react');0
        ReactTestRenderer = require('react-test-renderer');0
      });0
0
      it('should invoke precommit lifecycle methods twice in DEV', () => {0
        const {StrictMode} = React;0
0
        let log = [];0
        let shouldComponentUpdate = false;0
0
        function Root() {0
          return (0
            <StrictMode>0
              <ClassComponent />0
            </StrictMode>0
          );0
        }0
0
        class ClassComponent extends React.Component {0
          state = {};0
          static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
            log.push('getDerivedStateFromProps');0
            return null;0
          }0
          constructor(props) {0
            super(props);0
            log.push('constructor');0
          }0
          componentDidMount() {0
            log.push('componentDidMount');0
          }0
          componentDidUpdate() {0
            log.push('componentDidUpdate');0
          }0
          componentWillUnmount() {0
            log.push('componentWillUnmount');0
          }0
          shouldComponentUpdate() {0
            log.push('shouldComponentUpdate');0
            return shouldComponentUpdate;0
          }0
          render() {0
            log.push('render');0
            return null;0
          }0
        }0
0
        const component = ReactTestRenderer.create(<Root />);0
0
        if (__DEV__ && debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode) {0
          expect(log).toEqual([0
            'constructor',0
            'constructor',0
            'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
            'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
            'render',0
            'render',0
            'componentDidMount',0
          ]);0
        } else {0
          expect(log).toEqual([0
            'constructor',0
            'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
            'render',0
            'componentDidMount',0
          ]);0
        }0
0
        log = [];0
        shouldComponentUpdate = true;0
0
        component.update(<Root />);0
        if (__DEV__ && debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode) {0
          expect(log).toEqual([0
            'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
            'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
            'shouldComponentUpdate',0
            'render',0
            'render',0
            'componentDidUpdate',0
          ]);0
        } else {0
          expect(log).toEqual([0
            'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
            'shouldComponentUpdate',0
            'render',0
            'componentDidUpdate',0
          ]);0
        }0
0
        log = [];0
        shouldComponentUpdate = false;0
0
        component.update(<Root />);0
        if (__DEV__ && debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode) {0
          expect(log).toEqual([0
            'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
            'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
            'shouldComponentUpdate',0
          ]);0
        } else {0
          expect(log).toEqual([0
            'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
            'shouldComponentUpdate',0
          ]);0
        }0
      });0
0
      it('should invoke setState callbacks twice in DEV', () => {0
        const {StrictMode} = React;0
0
        let instance;0
        class ClassComponent extends React.Component {0
          state = {0
            count: 1,0
          };0
          render() {0
            instance = this;0
            return null;0
          }0
        }0
0
        let setStateCount = 0;0
0
        ReactTestRenderer.create(0
          <StrictMode>0
            <ClassComponent />0
          </StrictMode>,0
        );0
        instance.setState(state => {0
          setStateCount++;0
          return {0
            count: state.count + 1,0
          };0
        });0
0
        // Callback should be invoked twice (in DEV)0
        expect(setStateCount).toBe(0
          __DEV__ && debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode ? 2 : 1,0
        );0
        // But each time `state` should be the previous value0
        expect(instance.state.count).toBe(2);0
      });0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('async subtree', () => {0
    beforeEach(() => {0
      jest.resetModules();0
0
      React = require('react');0
      ReactTestRenderer = require('react-test-renderer');0
    });0
0
    it('should warn about unsafe legacy lifecycle methods within the tree', () => {0
      class SyncRoot extends React.Component {0
        UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {}0
        UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {}0
        UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {}0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
              <AsyncRoot />0
            </React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
      class AsyncRoot extends React.Component {0
        UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {}0
        UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {}0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <div>0
              <Wrapper>0
                <Foo />0
              </Wrapper>0
              <div>0
                <Bar />0
                <Foo />0
              </div>0
            </div>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
      function Wrapper({children}) {0
        return <div>{children}</div>;0
      }0
      class Foo extends React.Component {0
        UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {}0
        render() {0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
      class Bar extends React.Component {0
        UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {}0
        render() {0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      let rendered;0
      expect(() => {0
        rendered = ReactTestRenderer.create(<SyncRoot />);0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Unsafe lifecycle methods were found within a strict-mode tree:' +0
          '\n    in SyncRoot (at **)' +0
          '\n\ncomponentWillMount: Please update the following components ' +0
          'to use componentDidMount instead: AsyncRoot' +0
          '\n\ncomponentWillReceiveProps: Please update the following components ' +0
          'to use static getDerivedStateFromProps instead: Bar, Foo' +0
          '\n\ncomponentWillUpdate: Please update the following components ' +0
          'to use componentDidUpdate instead: AsyncRoot' +0
          '\n\nLearn more about this warning here:' +0
          '\nhttps://fb.me/react-strict-mode-warnings',0
      );0
0
      // Dedupe0
      rendered = ReactTestRenderer.create(<SyncRoot />);0
      rendered.update(<SyncRoot />);0
    });0
0
    it('should coalesce warnings by lifecycle name', () => {0
      class SyncRoot extends React.Component {0
        UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {}0
        UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {}0
        UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {}0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
              <AsyncRoot />0
            </React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
      class AsyncRoot extends React.Component {0
        UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {}0
        UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {}0
        render() {0
          return <Parent />;0
        }0
      }0
      class Parent extends React.Component {0
        componentWillMount() {}0
        componentWillUpdate() {}0
        componentWillReceiveProps() {}0
        render() {0
          return <Child />;0
        }0
      }0
      class Child extends React.Component {0
        UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {}0
        render() {0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      let rendered;0
0
      expect(0
        () => (rendered = ReactTestRenderer.create(<SyncRoot />)),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Unsafe lifecycle methods were found within a strict-mode tree:' +0
          '\n    in SyncRoot (at **)' +0
          '\n\ncomponentWillMount: Please update the following components ' +0
          'to use componentDidMount instead: AsyncRoot, Parent' +0
          '\n\ncomponentWillReceiveProps: Please update the following components ' +0
          'to use static getDerivedStateFromProps instead: Child, Parent' +0
          '\n\ncomponentWillUpdate: Please update the following components ' +0
          'to use componentDidUpdate instead: AsyncRoot, Parent' +0
          '\n\nLearn more about this warning here:' +0
          '\nhttps://fb.me/react-strict-mode-warnings',0
      );0
0
      // Dedupe0
      rendered = ReactTestRenderer.create(<SyncRoot />);0
      rendered.update(<SyncRoot />);0
    });0
0
    it('should group warnings by async root', () => {0
      class SyncRoot extends React.Component {0
        UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {}0
        UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {}0
        UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {}0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <div>0
              <AsyncRootOne />0
              <AsyncRootTwo />0
            </div>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
      class AsyncRootOne extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
              <Foo>0
                <Bar />0
              </Foo>0
            </React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
      class AsyncRootTwo extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
              <Foo>0
                <Baz />0
              </Foo>0
            </React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
      class Foo extends React.Component {0
        componentWillMount() {}0
        render() {0
          return this.props.children;0
        }0
      }0
      class Bar extends React.Component {0
        componentWillMount() {}0
        render() {0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
      class Baz extends React.Component {0
        componentWillMount() {}0
        render() {0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      let rendered;0
0
      expect(0
        () => (rendered = ReactTestRenderer.create(<SyncRoot />)),0
      ).toWarnDev([0
        'Unsafe lifecycle methods were found within a strict-mode tree:' +0
          '\n    in AsyncRootOne (at **)' +0
          '\n    in div (at **)' +0
          '\n    in SyncRoot (at **)' +0
          '\n\ncomponentWillMount: Please update the following components ' +0
          'to use componentDidMount instead: Bar, Foo',0
        'Unsafe lifecycle methods were found within a strict-mode tree:' +0
          '\n    in AsyncRootTwo (at **)' +0
          '\n    in div (at **)' +0
          '\n    in SyncRoot (at **)' +0
          '\n\ncomponentWillMount: Please update the following components ' +0
          'to use componentDidMount instead: Baz',0
      ]);0
0
      // Dedupe0
      rendered = ReactTestRenderer.create(<SyncRoot />);0
      rendered.update(<SyncRoot />);0
    });0
0
    it('should warn about components not present during the initial render', () => {0
      class AsyncRoot extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
              {this.props.foo ? <Foo /> : <Bar />}0
            </React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
      class Foo extends React.Component {0
        UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {}0
        render() {0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
      class Bar extends React.Component {0
        UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {}0
        render() {0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      let rendered;0
      expect(() => {0
        rendered = ReactTestRenderer.create(<AsyncRoot foo={true} />);0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Unsafe lifecycle methods were found within a strict-mode tree:' +0
          '\n    in AsyncRoot (at **)' +0
          '\n\ncomponentWillMount: Please update the following components ' +0
          'to use componentDidMount instead: Foo' +0
          '\n\nLearn more about this warning here:' +0
          '\nhttps://fb.me/react-strict-mode-warnings',0
      );0
0
      expect(() => rendered.update(<AsyncRoot foo={false} />)).toWarnDev(0
        'Unsafe lifecycle methods were found within a strict-mode tree:' +0
          '\n    in AsyncRoot (at **)' +0
          '\n\ncomponentWillMount: Please update the following components ' +0
          'to use componentDidMount instead: Bar' +0
          '\n\nLearn more about this warning here:' +0
          '\nhttps://fb.me/react-strict-mode-warnings',0
      );0
0
      // Dedupe0
      rendered.update(<AsyncRoot foo={true} />);0
      rendered.update(<AsyncRoot foo={false} />);0
    });0
0
    it('should also warn inside of "strict" mode trees', () => {0
      const {StrictMode} = React;0
0
      class SyncRoot extends React.Component {0
        UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {}0
        UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {}0
        UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {}0
        render() {0

      function Wrapper({children}) {0
        return (0

            <Foo />0
          </div>0
        );0

      class Foo extends React.Component {0
        UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {}0
        render() {0
          return null;0

        UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {}0
        render() {0

      );0

      // Dedupe0

      rendered.update(<SyncRoot />);0
