'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
0
describe('escapeTextForBrowser', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
  });0
0
  it('ampersand is escaped when passed as text content', () => {0
    const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<span>{'&'}</span>);0
    expect(response).toMatch('<span data-reactroot="">&amp;</span>');0
  });0
0
  it('double quote is escaped when passed as text content', () => {0
    const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<span>{'"'}</span>);0
    expect(response).toMatch('<span data-reactroot="">&quot;</span>');0
  });0
0
  it('single quote is escaped when passed as text content', () => {0
    const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<span>{"'"}</span>);0
    expect(response).toMatch('<span data-reactroot="">&#x27;</span>');0
  });0
0
  it('greater than entity is escaped when passed as text content', () => {0
    const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<span>{'>'}</span>);0
    expect(response).toMatch('<span data-reactroot="">&gt;</span>');0
  });0
0
  it('lower than entity is escaped when passed as text content', () => {0
    const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<span>{'<'}</span>);0
    expect(response).toMatch('<span data-reactroot="">&lt;</span>');0
  });0
0
  it('number is correctly passed as text content', () => {0
    const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<span>{42}</span>);0
    expect(response).toMatch('<span data-reactroot="">42</span>');0
  });0
0
  it('number is escaped to string when passed as text content', () => {0
    const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<img data-attr={42} />);0
    expect(response).toMatch('<img data-attr="42" data-reactroot=""/>');0
  });0
0
  it('escape text content representing a script tag', () => {0
    const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
      <span>{'<script type=\'\' src=""></script>'}</span>,0
    );0
    expect(response).toMatch(0
      '<span data-reactroot="">&lt;script type=&#x27;&#x27; ' +0
        'src=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;</span>',0
    );0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
jest.mock('../events/isEventSupported');0
0
describe('EventPluginHub', () => {0
  let React;0
  let ReactTestUtils;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
  });0
0
  it('should prevent non-function listeners, at dispatch', () => {0
    let node;0
    expect(() => {0
      node = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <div onClick="not a function" />,0
      );0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Expected `onClick` listener to be a function, instead got a value of `string` type.',0
    );0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.SimulateNative.click(node)).toThrowError(0
      'Expected `onClick` listener to be a function, instead got a value of `string` type.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should not prevent null listeners, at dispatch', () => {0
    const node = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div onClick={null} />);0
    expect(function() {0
      ReactTestUtils.SimulateNative.click(node);0
    }).not.toThrow();0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const React = require('react');0
const ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
const ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
0
describe('findDOMNode', () => {0
  it('findDOMNode should return null if passed null', () => {0
    expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(null)).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('findDOMNode should find dom element', () => {0
    class MyNode extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <span>Noise</span>0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const myNode = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<MyNode />);0
    const myDiv = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(myNode);0
    const mySameDiv = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(myDiv);0
    expect(myDiv.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
    expect(mySameDiv).toBe(myDiv);0
  });0
0
  it('findDOMNode should find dom element after an update from null', () => {0
    function Bar({flag}) {0
      if (flag) {0
        return <span>A</span>;0
      }0
      return null;0
    }0
    class MyNode extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <Bar flag={this.props.flag} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    const myNodeA = ReactDOM.render(<MyNode />, container);0
    const a = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(myNodeA);0
    expect(a).toBe(null);0
0
    const myNodeB = ReactDOM.render(<MyNode flag={true} />, container);0
    expect(myNodeA === myNodeB).toBe(true);0
0
    const b = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(myNodeB);0
    expect(b.tagName).toBe('SPAN');0
  });0
0
  it('findDOMNode should reject random objects', () => {0
    expect(function() {0
      ReactDOM.findDOMNode({foo: 'bar'});0
    }).toThrowError('Argument appears to not be a ReactComponent. Keys: foo');0
  });0
0
  it('findDOMNode should reject unmounted objects with render func', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const inst = ReactDOM.render(<Foo />, container);0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.findDOMNode(inst)).toThrowError(0
      'Unable to find node on an unmounted component.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('findDOMNode should not throw an error when called within a component that is not mounted', () => {0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(this)).toBeNull();0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Bar />)).not.toThrow();0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React = require('react');0
const ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
0
class TextWithStringRef extends React.Component {0
  render() {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    return <span ref="foo">Hello world!</span>;0
  }0
}0
0
describe('when different React version is used with string ref', () => {0
  it('throws the "Refs must have owner" warning', () => {0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<TextWithStringRef />);0
    }).toThrow(0
      'Element ref was specified as a string (foo) but no owner was set. This could happen for one of' +0
        ' the following reasons:\n' +0
        '1. You may be adding a ref to a functional component\n' +0
        "2. You may be adding a ref to a component that was not created inside a component's render method\n" +0
        '3. You have multiple copies of React loaded\n' +0
        'See https://fb.me/react-refs-must-have-owner for more information.',0
    );0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
0
describe('quoteAttributeValueForBrowser', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
  });0
0
  it('ampersand is escaped inside attributes', () => {0
    const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<img data-attr="&" />);0
    expect(response).toMatch('<img data-attr="&amp;" data-reactroot=""/>');0
  });0
0
  it('double quote is escaped inside attributes', () => {0
    const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<img data-attr={'"'} />);0
    expect(response).toMatch('<img data-attr="&quot;" data-reactroot=""/>');0
  });0
0
  it('single quote is escaped inside attributes', () => {0
    const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<img data-attr="'" />);0
    expect(response).toMatch('<img data-attr="&#x27;" data-reactroot=""/>');0
  });0
0
  it('greater than entity is escaped inside attributes', () => {0
    const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<img data-attr=">" />);0
    expect(response).toMatch('<img data-attr="&gt;" data-reactroot=""/>');0
  });0
0
  it('lower than entity is escaped inside attributes', () => {0
    const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<img data-attr="<" />);0
    expect(response).toMatch('<img data-attr="&lt;" data-reactroot=""/>');0
  });0
0
  it('number is escaped to string inside attributes', () => {0
    const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<img data-attr={42} />);0
    expect(response).toMatch('<img data-attr="42" data-reactroot=""/>');0
  });0
0
  it('object is passed to a string inside attributes', () => {0
    const sampleObject = {0
      toString: function() {0
        return 'ponys';0
      },0
    };0
0
    const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
      <img data-attr={sampleObject} />,0
    );0
    expect(response).toMatch('<img data-attr="ponys" data-reactroot=""/>');0
  });0
0
  it('script tag is escaped inside attributes', () => {0
    const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
      <img data-attr={'<script type=\'\' src=""></script>'} />,0
    );0
    expect(response).toMatch(0
      '<img data-attr="&lt;script type=&#x27;&#x27; ' +0
        'src=&quot;&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;" ' +0
        'data-reactroot=""/>',0
    );0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let EventPluginHub;0
let EventPluginRegistry;0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactDOMComponentTree;0
let ReactBrowserEventEmitter;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
0
let idCallOrder;0
const recordID = function(id) {0
  idCallOrder.push(id);0
};0
const recordIDAndStopPropagation = function(id, event) {0
  recordID(id);0
  event.stopPropagation();0
};0
const recordIDAndReturnFalse = function(id, event) {0
  recordID(id);0
  return false;0
};0
const LISTENER = jest.fn();0
const ON_CLICK_KEY = 'onClick';0
const ON_CHANGE_KEY = 'onChange';0
const ON_MOUSE_ENTER_KEY = 'onMouseEnter';0
0
let GRANDPARENT;0
let PARENT;0
let CHILD;0
0
let getListener;0
let putListener;0
let deleteAllListeners;0
0
let container;0
0
function registerSimpleTestHandler() {0
  putListener(CHILD, ON_CLICK_KEY, LISTENER);0
  const listener = getListener(CHILD, ON_CLICK_KEY);0
  expect(listener).toEqual(LISTENER);0
  return getListener(CHILD, ON_CLICK_KEY);0
}0
0
describe('ReactBrowserEventEmitter', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    LISTENER.mockClear();0
0
    // TODO: can we express this test with only public API?0
    EventPluginHub = require('events/EventPluginHub');0
    EventPluginRegistry = require('events/EventPluginRegistry');0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactDOMComponentTree = require('../client/ReactDOMComponentTree');0
    ReactBrowserEventEmitter = require('../events/ReactBrowserEventEmitter');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
    let GRANDPARENT_PROPS = {};0
    let PARENT_PROPS = {};0
    let CHILD_PROPS = {};0
0
    function Child(props) {0
      return <div ref={c => (CHILD = c)} {...props} />;0
    }0
0
    class ChildWrapper extends React.PureComponent {0
      render() {0
        return <Child {...this.props} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function renderTree() {0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div ref={c => (GRANDPARENT = c)} {...GRANDPARENT_PROPS}>0
          <div ref={c => (PARENT = c)} {...PARENT_PROPS}>0
            <ChildWrapper {...CHILD_PROPS} />0
          </div>0
        </div>,0
        container,0
      );0
    }0
0
    renderTree();0
0
    getListener = function(node, eventName) {0
      const inst = ReactDOMComponentTree.getInstanceFromNode(node);0
      return EventPluginHub.getListener(inst, eventName);0
    };0
    putListener = function(node, eventName, listener) {0
      switch (node) {0
        case CHILD:0
          CHILD_PROPS[eventName] = listener;0
          break;0
        case PARENT:0
          PARENT_PROPS[eventName] = listener;0
          break;0
        case GRANDPARENT:0
          GRANDPARENT_PROPS[eventName] = listener;0
          break;0
      }0
      // Rerender with new event listeners0
      renderTree();0
    };0
    deleteAllListeners = function(node) {0
      switch (node) {0
        case CHILD:0
          CHILD_PROPS = {};0
          break;0
        case PARENT:0
          PARENT_PROPS = {};0
          break;0
        case GRANDPARENT:0
          GRANDPARENT_PROPS = {};0
          break;0
      }0
      renderTree();0
    };0
0
    idCallOrder = [];0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
    container = null;0
  });0
0
  it('should store a listener correctly', () => {0
    registerSimpleTestHandler();0
    const listener = getListener(CHILD, ON_CLICK_KEY);0
    expect(listener).toBe(LISTENER);0
  });0
0
  it('should retrieve a listener correctly', () => {0
    registerSimpleTestHandler();0
    const listener = getListener(CHILD, ON_CLICK_KEY);0
    expect(listener).toEqual(LISTENER);0
  });0
0
  it('should clear all handlers when asked to', () => {0
    registerSimpleTestHandler();0
    deleteAllListeners(CHILD);0
    const listener = getListener(CHILD, ON_CLICK_KEY);0
    expect(listener).toBe(undefined);0
  });0
0
  it('should invoke a simple handler registered on a node', () => {0
    registerSimpleTestHandler();0
    CHILD.click();0
    expect(LISTENER).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should not invoke handlers if ReactBrowserEventEmitter is disabled', () => {0
    registerSimpleTestHandler();0
    ReactBrowserEventEmitter.setEnabled(false);0
    CHILD.click();0
    expect(LISTENER).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
    ReactBrowserEventEmitter.setEnabled(true);0
    CHILD.click();0
    expect(LISTENER).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should bubble simply', () => {0
    putListener(CHILD, ON_CLICK_KEY, recordID.bind(null, CHILD));0
    putListener(PARENT, ON_CLICK_KEY, recordID.bind(null, PARENT));0
    putListener(GRANDPARENT, ON_CLICK_KEY, recordID.bind(null, GRANDPARENT));0
    CHILD.click();0
    expect(idCallOrder.length).toBe(3);0
    expect(idCallOrder[0]).toBe(CHILD);0
    expect(idCallOrder[1]).toBe(PARENT);0
    expect(idCallOrder[2]).toBe(GRANDPARENT);0
  });0
0
  it('should bubble to the right handler after an update', () => {0
    putListener(GRANDPARENT, ON_CLICK_KEY, recordID.bind(null, 'GRANDPARENT'));0
    putListener(PARENT, ON_CLICK_KEY, recordID.bind(null, 'PARENT'));0
    putListener(CHILD, ON_CLICK_KEY, recordID.bind(null, 'CHILD'));0
    CHILD.click();0
    expect(idCallOrder).toEqual(['CHILD', 'PARENT', 'GRANDPARENT']);0
0
    idCallOrder = [];0
0
    // Update just the grand parent without updating the child.0
    putListener(0
      GRANDPARENT,0
      ON_CLICK_KEY,0
      recordID.bind(null, 'UPDATED_GRANDPARENT'),0
    );0
0
    CHILD.click();0
    expect(idCallOrder).toEqual(['CHILD', 'PARENT', 'UPDATED_GRANDPARENT']);0
  });0
0
  it('should continue bubbling if an error is thrown', () => {0
    putListener(CHILD, ON_CLICK_KEY, recordID.bind(null, CHILD));0
    putListener(PARENT, ON_CLICK_KEY, function() {0
      recordID(PARENT);0
      throw new Error('Handler interrupted');0
    });0
    putListener(GRANDPARENT, ON_CLICK_KEY, recordID.bind(null, GRANDPARENT));0
    expect(function() {0
      ReactTestUtils.Simulate.click(CHILD);0
    }).toThrow();0
    expect(idCallOrder.length).toBe(3);0
    expect(idCallOrder[0]).toBe(CHILD);0
    expect(idCallOrder[1]).toBe(PARENT);0
    expect(idCallOrder[2]).toBe(GRANDPARENT);0
  });0
0
  it('should set currentTarget', () => {0
    putListener(CHILD, ON_CLICK_KEY, function(event) {0
      recordID(CHILD);0
      expect(event.currentTarget).toBe(CHILD);0
    });0
    putListener(PARENT, ON_CLICK_KEY, function(event) {0
      recordID(PARENT);0
      expect(event.currentTarget).toBe(PARENT);0
    });0
    putListener(GRANDPARENT, ON_CLICK_KEY, function(event) {0
      recordID(GRANDPARENT);0
      expect(event.currentTarget).toBe(GRANDPARENT);0
    });0
    CHILD.click();0
    expect(idCallOrder.length).toBe(3);0
    expect(idCallOrder[0]).toBe(CHILD);0
    expect(idCallOrder[1]).toBe(PARENT);0
    expect(idCallOrder[2]).toBe(GRANDPARENT);0
  });0
0
  it('should support stopPropagation()', () => {0
    putListener(CHILD, ON_CLICK_KEY, recordID.bind(null, CHILD));0
    putListener(0
      PARENT,0
      ON_CLICK_KEY,0
      recordIDAndStopPropagation.bind(null, PARENT),0
    );0
    putListener(GRANDPARENT, ON_CLICK_KEY, recordID.bind(null, GRANDPARENT));0
    CHILD.click();0
    expect(idCallOrder.length).toBe(2);0
    expect(idCallOrder[0]).toBe(CHILD);0
    expect(idCallOrder[1]).toBe(PARENT);0
  });0
0
  it('should support overriding .isPropagationStopped()', () => {0
    // Ew. See D4504876.0
    putListener(CHILD, ON_CLICK_KEY, recordID.bind(null, CHILD));0
    putListener(PARENT, ON_CLICK_KEY, function(e) {0
      recordID(PARENT, e);0
      // This stops React bubbling but avoids touching the native event0
      e.isPropagationStopped = () => true;0
    });0
    putListener(GRANDPARENT, ON_CLICK_KEY, recordID.bind(null, GRANDPARENT));0
    CHILD.click();0
    expect(idCallOrder.length).toBe(2);0
    expect(idCallOrder[0]).toBe(CHILD);0
    expect(idCallOrder[1]).toBe(PARENT);0
  });0
0
  it('should stop after first dispatch if stopPropagation', () => {0
    putListener(0
      CHILD,0
      ON_CLICK_KEY,0
      recordIDAndStopPropagation.bind(null, CHILD),0
    );0
    putListener(PARENT, ON_CLICK_KEY, recordID.bind(null, PARENT));0
    putListener(GRANDPARENT, ON_CLICK_KEY, recordID.bind(null, GRANDPARENT));0
    CHILD.click();0
    expect(idCallOrder.length).toBe(1);0
    expect(idCallOrder[0]).toBe(CHILD);0
  });0
0
  it('should not stopPropagation if false is returned', () => {0
    putListener(CHILD, ON_CLICK_KEY, recordIDAndReturnFalse.bind(null, CHILD));0
    putListener(PARENT, ON_CLICK_KEY, recordID.bind(null, PARENT));0
    putListener(GRANDPARENT, ON_CLICK_KEY, recordID.bind(null, GRANDPARENT));0
    CHILD.click();0
    expect(idCallOrder.length).toBe(3);0
    expect(idCallOrder[0]).toBe(CHILD);0
    expect(idCallOrder[1]).toBe(PARENT);0
    expect(idCallOrder[2]).toBe(GRANDPARENT);0
  });0
0
  /**0
   * The entire event registration state of the world should be "locked-in" at0
   * the time the event occurs. This is to resolve many edge cases that come0
   * about from a listener on a lower-in-DOM node causing structural changes at0
   * places higher in the DOM. If this lower-in-DOM node causes new content to0
   * be rendered at a place higher-in-DOM, we need to be careful not to invoke0
   * these new listeners.0
   */0
0
  it('should invoke handlers that were removed while bubbling', () => {0
    const handleParentClick = jest.fn();0
    const handleChildClick = function(event) {0
      deleteAllListeners(PARENT);0
    };0
    putListener(CHILD, ON_CLICK_KEY, handleChildClick);0
    putListener(PARENT, ON_CLICK_KEY, handleParentClick);0
    CHILD.click();0
    expect(handleParentClick).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should not invoke newly inserted handlers while bubbling', () => {0
    const handleParentClick = jest.fn();0
    const handleChildClick = function(event) {0
      putListener(PARENT, ON_CLICK_KEY, handleParentClick);0
    };0
    putListener(CHILD, ON_CLICK_KEY, handleChildClick);0
    CHILD.click();0
    expect(handleParentClick).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
  });0
0
  it('should have mouse enter simulated by test utils', () => {0
    putListener(CHILD, ON_MOUSE_ENTER_KEY, recordID.bind(null, CHILD));0
    ReactTestUtils.Simulate.mouseEnter(CHILD);0
    expect(idCallOrder.length).toBe(1);0
    expect(idCallOrder[0]).toBe(CHILD);0
  });0
0
  it('should listen to events only once', () => {0
    spyOnDevAndProd(EventTarget.prototype, 'addEventListener');0
    ReactBrowserEventEmitter.listenTo(ON_CLICK_KEY, document);0
    ReactBrowserEventEmitter.listenTo(ON_CLICK_KEY, document);0
    expect(EventTarget.prototype.addEventListener).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should work with event plugins without dependencies', () => {0
    spyOnDevAndProd(EventTarget.prototype, 'addEventListener');0
0
    ReactBrowserEventEmitter.listenTo(ON_CLICK_KEY, document);0
0
    expect(EventTarget.prototype.addEventListener.calls.argsFor(0)[0]).toBe(0
      'click',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should work with event plugins with dependencies', () => {0
    spyOnDevAndProd(EventTarget.prototype, 'addEventListener');0
0
    ReactBrowserEventEmitter.listenTo(ON_CHANGE_KEY, document);0
0
    const setEventListeners = [];0
    const listenCalls = EventTarget.prototype.addEventListener.calls.allArgs();0
    for (let i = 0; i < listenCalls.length; i++) {0
      setEventListeners.push(listenCalls[i][1]);0
    }0
0
    const module = EventPluginRegistry.registrationNameModules[ON_CHANGE_KEY];0
    const dependencies = module.eventTypes.change.dependencies;0
    expect(setEventListeners.length).toEqual(dependencies.length);0
0
    for (let i = 0; i < setEventListeners.length; i++) {0
      expect(dependencies.indexOf(setEventListeners[i])).toBeTruthy();0
    }0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
// NOTE: We're explicitly not using JSX here. This is intended to test0
// the current stack addendum without having source location added by babel.0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
0
describe('ReactChildReconciler', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
  });0
0
  function createIterable(array) {0
    return {0
      '@@iterator': function() {0
        let i = 0;0
        return {0
          next() {0
            const next = {0
              value: i < array.length ? array[i] : undefined,0
              done: i === array.length,0
            };0
            i++;0
            return next;0
          },0
        };0
      },0
    };0
  }0
0
  it('warns for duplicated array keys', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div>{[<div key="1" />, <div key="1" />]}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Keys should be unique so that components maintain their identity ' +0
        'across updates. Non-unique keys may cause children to be ' +0
        'duplicated and/or omitted — the behavior is unsupported and ' +0
        'could change in a future version.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('warns for duplicated array keys with component stack info', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div>{[<div key="1" />, <div key="1" />]}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return React.cloneElement(this.props.child);0
      }0
    }0
0
    class GrandParent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <Parent child={<Component />} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<GrandParent />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Encountered two children with the same key, `1`. ' +0
        'Keys should be unique so that components maintain their identity ' +0
        'across updates. Non-unique keys may cause children to be ' +0
        'duplicated and/or omitted — the behavior is unsupported and ' +0
        'could change in a future version.',0
      '    in div (at **)\n' +0
        '    in Component (at **)\n' +0
        '    in Parent (at **)\n' +0
        '    in GrandParent (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('warns for duplicated iterable keys', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div>{createIterable([<div key="1" />, <div key="1" />])}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Keys should be unique so that components maintain their identity ' +0
        'across updates. Non-unique keys may cause children to be ' +0
        'duplicated and/or omitted — the behavior is unsupported and ' +0
        'could change in a future version.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('warns for duplicated iterable keys with component stack info', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div>{createIterable([<div key="1" />, <div key="1" />])}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return React.cloneElement(this.props.child);0
      }0
    }0
0
    class GrandParent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <Parent child={<Component />} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<GrandParent />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Encountered two children with the same key, `1`. ' +0
        'Keys should be unique so that components maintain their identity ' +0
        'across updates. Non-unique keys may cause children to be ' +0
        'duplicated and/or omitted — the behavior is unsupported and ' +0
        'could change in a future version.',0
      '    in div (at **)\n' +0
        '    in Component (at **)\n' +0
        '    in Parent (at **)\n' +0
        '    in GrandParent (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
0
describe('ReactComponent', () => {0
  function normalizeCodeLocInfo(str) {0
    return str && str.replace(/\(at .+?:\d+\)/g, '(at **)');0
  }0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
  });0
0
  it('should throw on invalid render targets', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    // jQuery objects are basically arrays; people often pass them in by mistake0
    expect(function() {0
      ReactDOM.render(<div />, [container]);0
    }).toThrowError(/Target container is not a DOM element./);0
0
    expect(function() {0
      ReactDOM.render(<div />, null);0
    }).toThrowError(/Target container is not a DOM element./);0
  });0
0
  it('should throw when supplying a ref outside of render method', () => {0
    let instance = <div ref="badDiv" />;0
    expect(function() {0
      instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance);0
    }).toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should throw (in dev) when children are mutated during render', () => {0
    function Wrapper(props) {0
      props.children[1] = <p key={1} />; // Mutation is illegal0
      return <div>{props.children}</div>;0
    }0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
          <Wrapper>0
            <span key={0} />0
            <span key={1} />0
            <span key={2} />0
          </Wrapper>,0
        );0
      }).toThrowError(/Cannot assign to read only property.*/);0
    } else {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <Wrapper>0
          <span key={0} />0
          <span key={1} />0
          <span key={2} />0
        </Wrapper>,0
      );0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('should throw (in dev) when children are mutated during update', () => {0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.props.children[1] = <p key={1} />; // Mutation is illegal0
        this.forceUpdate();0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
          <Wrapper>0
            <span key={0} />0
            <span key={1} />0
            <span key={2} />0
          </Wrapper>,0
        );0
      }).toThrowError(/Cannot assign to read only property.*/);0
    } else {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <Wrapper>0
          <span key={0} />0
          <span key={1} />0
          <span key={2} />0
        </Wrapper>,0
      );0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('should support refs on owned components', () => {0
    const innerObj = {};0
    const outerObj = {};0
0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      getObject = () => {0
        return this.props.object;0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        const inner = <Wrapper object={innerObj} ref="inner" />;0
        const outer = (0
          <Wrapper object={outerObj} ref="outer">0
            {inner}0
          </Wrapper>0
        );0
        return outer;0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        expect(this.refs.inner.getObject()).toEqual(innerObj);0
        expect(this.refs.outer.getObject()).toEqual(outerObj);0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />);0
  });0
0
  it('should not have refs on unmounted components', () => {0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <Child>0
            <div ref="test" />0
          </Child>0
        );0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        expect(this.refs && this.refs.test).toEqual(undefined);0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Parent child={<span />} />);0
  });0
0
  it('should support callback-style refs', () => {0
    const innerObj = {};0
    const outerObj = {};0
0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      getObject = () => {0
        return this.props.object;0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let mounted = false;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        const inner = (0
          <Wrapper object={innerObj} ref={c => (this.innerRef = c)} />0
        );0
        const outer = (0
          <Wrapper object={outerObj} ref={c => (this.outerRef = c)}>0
            {inner}0
          </Wrapper>0
        );0
        return outer;0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        expect(this.innerRef.getObject()).toEqual(innerObj);0
        expect(this.outerRef.getObject()).toEqual(outerObj);0
        mounted = true;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />);0
    expect(mounted).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('should support object-style refs', () => {0
    const innerObj = {};0
    const outerObj = {};0
0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      getObject = () => {0
        return this.props.object;0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let mounted = false;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        this.innerRef = React.createRef();0
        this.outerRef = React.createRef();0
      }0
      render() {0
        const inner = <Wrapper object={innerObj} ref={this.innerRef} />;0
        const outer = (0
          <Wrapper object={outerObj} ref={this.outerRef}>0
            {inner}0
          </Wrapper>0
        );0
        return outer;0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        expect(this.innerRef.current.getObject()).toEqual(innerObj);0
        expect(this.outerRef.current.getObject()).toEqual(outerObj);0
        mounted = true;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />);0
    expect(mounted).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('should support new-style refs with mixed-up owners', () => {0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      getTitle = () => {0
        return this.props.title;0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return this.props.getContent();0
      }0
    }0
0
    let mounted = false;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      getInner = () => {0
        // (With old-style refs, it's impossible to get a ref to this div0
        // because Wrapper is the current owner when this function is called.)0
        return <div className="inner" ref={c => (this.innerRef = c)} />;0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <Wrapper0
            title="wrapper"0
            ref={c => (this.wrapperRef = c)}0
            getContent={this.getInner}0
          />0
        );0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        // Check .props.title to make sure we got the right elements back0
        expect(this.wrapperRef.getTitle()).toBe('wrapper');0
        expect(this.innerRef.className).toBe('inner');0
        mounted = true;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />);0
    expect(mounted).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('should call refs at the correct time', () => {0
    const log = [];0
0
    class Inner extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        log.push(`inner ${this.props.id} render`);0
        return <div />;0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        log.push(`inner ${this.props.id} componentDidMount`);0
      }0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        log.push(`inner ${this.props.id} componentDidUpdate`);0
      }0
0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        log.push(`inner ${this.props.id} componentWillUnmount`);0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Outer extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Inner0
              id={1}0
              ref={c => {0
                log.push(`ref 1 got ${c ? `instance ${c.props.id}` : 'null'}`);0
              }}0
            />0
            <Inner0
              id={2}0
              ref={c => {0
                log.push(`ref 2 got ${c ? `instance ${c.props.id}` : 'null'}`);0
              }}0
            />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        log.push('outer componentDidMount');0
      }0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        log.push('outer componentDidUpdate');0
      }0
0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        log.push('outer componentWillUnmount');0
      }0
    }0
0
    // mount, update, unmount0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    log.push('start mount');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Outer />, el);0
    log.push('start update');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Outer />, el);0
    log.push('start unmount');0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(el);0
0
    /* eslint-disable indent */0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'start mount',0
      'inner 1 render',0
      'inner 2 render',0
      'inner 1 componentDidMount',0
      'ref 1 got instance 1',0
      'inner 2 componentDidMount',0
      'ref 2 got instance 2',0
      'outer componentDidMount',0
      'start update',0
      // Previous (equivalent) refs get cleared0
      // Fiber renders first, resets refs later0
      'inner 1 render',0
      'inner 2 render',0
      'ref 1 got null',0
      'ref 2 got null',0
      'inner 1 componentDidUpdate',0
      'ref 1 got instance 1',0
      'inner 2 componentDidUpdate',0
      'ref 2 got instance 2',0
      'outer componentDidUpdate',0
      'start unmount',0
      'outer componentWillUnmount',0
      'ref 1 got null',0
      'inner 1 componentWillUnmount',0
      'ref 2 got null',0
      'inner 2 componentWillUnmount',0
    ]);0
    /* eslint-enable indent */0
  });0
0
  it('fires the callback after a component is rendered', () => {0
    const callback = jest.fn();0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<div />, container, callback);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    ReactDOM.render(<div className="foo" />, container, callback);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
    ReactDOM.render(<span />, container, callback);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(3);0
  });0
0
  it('throws usefully when rendering badly-typed elements', () => {0
    const X = undefined;0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<X />)).toWarnDev(0
        'React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string (for built-in components) ' +0
          'or a class/function (for composite components) but got: undefined.',0
      );0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'Element type is invalid: expected a string (for built-in components) ' +0
        'or a class/function (for composite components) but got: undefined.' +0
        (__DEV__0
          ? " You likely forgot to export your component from the file it's " +0
            'defined in, or you might have mixed up default and named imports.'0
          : ''),0
    );0
0
    const Y = null;0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Y />)).toWarnDev(0
        'React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string (for built-in components) ' +0
          'or a class/function (for composite components) but got: null.',0
      );0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'Element type is invalid: expected a string (for built-in components) ' +0
        'or a class/function (for composite components) but got: null.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('includes owner name in the error about badly-typed elements', () => {0
    const X = undefined;0
0
    function Indirection(props) {0
      return <div>{props.children}</div>;0
    }0
0
    function Bar() {0
      return (0
        <Indirection>0
          <X />0
        </Indirection>0
      );0
    }0
0
    function Foo() {0
      return <Bar />;0
    }0
0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Foo />)).toWarnDev(0
        'React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string (for built-in components) ' +0
          'or a class/function (for composite components) but got: undefined.',0
      );0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'Element type is invalid: expected a string (for built-in components) ' +0
        'or a class/function (for composite components) but got: undefined.' +0
        (__DEV__0
          ? " You likely forgot to export your component from the file it's " +0
            'defined in, or you might have mixed up default and named imports.' +0
            '\n\nCheck the render method of `Bar`.'0
          : ''),0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('throws if a plain object is used as a child', () => {0
    const children = {0
      x: <span />,0
      y: <span />,0
      z: <span />,0
    };0
    const element = <div>{[children]}</div>;0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    let ex;0
    try {0
      ReactDOM.render(element, container);0
    } catch (e) {0
      ex = e;0
    }0
    expect(ex).toBeDefined();0
    expect(normalizeCodeLocInfo(ex.message)).toBe(0
      'Objects are not valid as a React child (found: object with keys {x, y, z}).' +0
        (__DEV__0
          ? ' If you meant to render a collection of children, use ' +0
            'an array instead.' +0
            '\n    in div (at **)'0
          : ''),0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('throws if a plain object even if it is in an owner', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        const children = {0
          a: <span />,0
          b: <span />,0
          c: <span />,0
        };0
        return <div>{[children]}</div>;0

    const container = document.createElement('div');0

0
  describe('with new features', () => {0
    it('warns on function as a return value from a function', () => {0
      function Foo() {0
        return Foo;0
      }0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Foo />, container)).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Functions are not valid as a React child. This may happen if ' +0
          'you return a Component instead of <Component /> from render. ' +0
          'Or maybe you meant to call this function rather than return it.\n' +0
          '    in Foo (at **)',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('warns on function as a return value from a class', () => {0
      class Foo extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return Foo;0
        }0
      }0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Foo />, container)).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Functions are not valid as a React child. This may happen if ' +0
          'you return a Component instead of <Component /> from render. ' +0
          'Or maybe you meant to call this function rather than return it.\n' +0
          '    in Foo (at **)',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('warns on function as a child to host component', () => {0
      function Foo() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <span>{Foo}</span>0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Foo />, container)).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Functions are not valid as a React child. This may happen if ' +0
          'you return a Component instead of <Component /> from render. ' +0
          'Or maybe you meant to call this function rather than return it.\n' +0
          '    in span (at **)\n' +0
          '    in div (at **)\n' +0
          '    in Foo (at **)',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('does not warn for function-as-a-child that gets resolved', () => {0
      function Bar(props) {0
        return props.children();0
      }0
      function Foo() {0
        return <Bar>{() => 'Hello'}</Bar>;0
      }0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<Foo />, container);0
      expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('Hello');0
    });0
0
    it('deduplicates function type warnings based on component type', () => {0
      class Foo extends React.PureComponent {0
        constructor() {0
          super();0
          this.state = {type: 'mushrooms'};0
        }0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <div>0
              {Foo}0
              {Foo}0
              <span>0
                {Foo}0
                {Foo}0
              </span>0
            </div>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      let component;0
      expect(() => {0
        component = ReactDOM.render(<Foo />, container);0
      }).toWarnDev([0
        'Warning: Functions are not valid as a React child. This may happen if ' +0
          'you return a Component instead of <Component /> from render. ' +0
          'Or maybe you meant to call this function rather than return it.\n' +0
          '    in div (at **)\n' +0
          '    in Foo (at **)',0
        'Warning: Functions are not valid as a React child. This may happen if ' +0
          'you return a Component instead of <Component /> from render. ' +0
          'Or maybe you meant to call this function rather than return it.\n' +0
          '    in span (at **)\n' +0
          '    in div (at **)\n' +0
          '    in Foo (at **)',0
      ]);0
      component.setState({type: 'portobello mushrooms'});0
    });0
  });0
});0

'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactFeatureFlags;0
0
describe('ReactComponentLifeCycle', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.warnAboutDeprecatedLifecycles = true;0
0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
  });0
0
  // TODO (RFC #6) Merge this back into ReactComponentLifeCycles-test once0
  // the 'warnAboutDeprecatedLifecycles' feature flag has been removed.0
  it('warns about deprecated unsafe lifecycles', function() {0
    class MyComponent extends React.Component {0
      componentWillMount() {}0
      componentWillReceiveProps() {}0
      componentWillUpdate() {}0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent x={1} />, container),0
    ).toLowPriorityWarnDev([0
      'componentWillMount is deprecated and will be removed in the next major version. ' +0
        'Use componentDidMount instead. As a temporary workaround, ' +0
        'you can rename to UNSAFE_componentWillMount.' +0
        '\n\nPlease update the following components: MyComponent',0
      'componentWillReceiveProps is deprecated and will be removed in the next major version. ' +0
        'Use static getDerivedStateFromProps instead.' +0
        '\n\nPlease update the following components: MyComponent',0
      'componentWillUpdate is deprecated and will be removed in the next major version. ' +0
        'Use componentDidUpdate instead. As a temporary workaround, ' +0
        'you can rename to UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate.' +0
        '\n\nPlease update the following components: MyComponent',0
    ]);0
0
    // Dedupe check (update and instantiate new0
    ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent x={2} />, container);0
    ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent key="new" x={1} />, container);0
  });0
0
  describe('react-lifecycles-compat', () => {0
    const {polyfill} = require('react-lifecycles-compat');0
0
    it('should not warn for components with polyfilled getDerivedStateFromProps', () => {0
      class PolyfilledComponent extends React.Component {0
        state = {};0
        static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
          return null;0
        }0
        render() {0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      polyfill(PolyfilledComponent);0
0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <React.StrictMode>0
          <PolyfilledComponent />0
        </React.StrictMode>,0
        container,0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should not warn for components with polyfilled getSnapshotBeforeUpdate', () => {0
      class PolyfilledComponent extends React.Component {0
        getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() {0
          return null;0
        }0
        componentDidUpdate() {}0
        render() {0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      polyfill(PolyfilledComponent);0
0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <React.StrictMode>0
          <PolyfilledComponent />0
        </React.StrictMode>,0
        container,0
      );0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
