'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
let PropTypes;0
0
const clone = function(o) {0
  return JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(o));0
};0
0
const GET_INIT_STATE_RETURN_VAL = {0
  hasWillMountCompleted: false,0
  hasRenderCompleted: false,0
  hasDidMountCompleted: false,0
  hasWillUnmountCompleted: false,0
};0
0
const INIT_RENDER_STATE = {0
  hasWillMountCompleted: true,0
  hasRenderCompleted: false,0
  hasDidMountCompleted: false,0
  hasWillUnmountCompleted: false,0
};0
0
const DID_MOUNT_STATE = {0
  hasWillMountCompleted: true,0
  hasRenderCompleted: true,0
  hasDidMountCompleted: false,0
  hasWillUnmountCompleted: false,0
};0
0
const NEXT_RENDER_STATE = {0
  hasWillMountCompleted: true,0
  hasRenderCompleted: true,0
  hasDidMountCompleted: true,0
  hasWillUnmountCompleted: false,0
};0
0
const WILL_UNMOUNT_STATE = {0
  hasWillMountCompleted: true,0
  hasDidMountCompleted: true,0
  hasRenderCompleted: true,0
  hasWillUnmountCompleted: false,0
};0
0
const POST_WILL_UNMOUNT_STATE = {0
  hasWillMountCompleted: true,0
  hasDidMountCompleted: true,0
  hasRenderCompleted: true,0
  hasWillUnmountCompleted: true,0
};0
0
/**0
 * Every React component is in one of these life cycles.0
 */0
type ComponentLifeCycle =0
  /**0
   * Mounted components have a DOM node representation and are capable of0
   * receiving new props.0
   */0
  | 'MOUNTED' /**0
   * Unmounted components are inactive and cannot receive new props.0
   */0
  | 'UNMOUNTED';0
0
function getLifeCycleState(instance): ComponentLifeCycle {0
  return instance.updater.isMounted(instance) ? 'MOUNTED' : 'UNMOUNTED';0
}0
0
/**0
 * TODO: We should make any setState calls fail in0
 * `getInitialState` and `componentWillMount`. They will usually fail0
 * anyways because `this._renderedComponent` is empty, however, if a component0
 * is *reused*, then that won't be the case and things will appear to work in0
 * some cases. Better to just block all updates in initialization.0
 */0
describe('ReactComponentLifeCycle', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
    PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
  });0
0
  it('should not reuse an instance when it has been unmounted', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    class StatefulComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const element = <StatefulComponent />;0
    const firstInstance = ReactDOM.render(element, container);0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    const secondInstance = ReactDOM.render(element, container);0
    expect(firstInstance).not.toBe(secondInstance);0
  });0
0
  /**0
   * If a state update triggers rerendering that in turn fires an onDOMReady,0
   * that second onDOMReady should not fail.0
   */0
  it('it should fire onDOMReady when already in onDOMReady', () => {0
    const _testJournal = [];0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        _testJournal.push('Child:onDOMReady');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class SwitcherParent extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        _testJournal.push('SwitcherParent:getInitialState');0
        this.state = {showHasOnDOMReadyComponent: false};0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        _testJournal.push('SwitcherParent:onDOMReady');0
        this.switchIt();0
      }0
0
      switchIt = () => {0
        this.setState({showHasOnDOMReadyComponent: true});0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            {this.state.showHasOnDOMReadyComponent ? <Child /> : <div />}0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<SwitcherParent />);0
    expect(_testJournal).toEqual([0
      'SwitcherParent:getInitialState',0
      'SwitcherParent:onDOMReady',0
      'Child:onDOMReady',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  // You could assign state here, but not access members of it, unless you0
  // had provided a getInitialState method.0
  it('throws when accessing state in componentWillMount', () => {0
    class StatefulComponent extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        void this.state.yada;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let instance = <StatefulComponent />;0
    expect(function() {0
      instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance);0
    }).toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should allow update state inside of componentWillMount', () => {0
    class StatefulComponent extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        this.setState({stateField: 'something'});0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let instance = <StatefulComponent />;0
    expect(function() {0
      instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance);0
    }).not.toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should not allow update state inside of getInitialState', () => {0
    class StatefulComponent extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props, context) {0
        super(props, context);0
        this.setState({stateField: 'something'});0
0
        this.state = {stateField: 'somethingelse'};0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<StatefulComponent />);0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      "Warning: Can't call setState on a component that is not yet mounted. " +0
        'This is a no-op, but it might indicate a bug in your application. ' +0
        'Instead, assign to `this.state` directly or define a `state = {};` ' +0
        'class property with the desired state in the StatefulComponent component.',0
    );0
0
    // Check deduplication; (no extra warnings should be logged).0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<StatefulComponent />);0
  });0
0
  it('should correctly determine if a component is mounted', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      _isMounted() {0
        // No longer a public API, but we can test that it works internally by0
        // reaching into the updater.0
        return this.updater.isMounted(this);0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        expect(this._isMounted()).toBeFalsy();0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        expect(this._isMounted()).toBeTruthy();0
      }0
      render() {0
        expect(this._isMounted()).toBeFalsy();0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const element = <Component />;0
0
    expect(() => {0
      const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(element);0
      expect(instance._isMounted()).toBeTruthy();0
    }).toWarnDev('Component is accessing isMounted inside its render()');0
  });0
0
  it('should correctly determine if a null component is mounted', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      _isMounted() {0
        // No longer a public API, but we can test that it works internally by0
        // reaching into the updater.0
        return this.updater.isMounted(this);0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        expect(this._isMounted()).toBeFalsy();0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        expect(this._isMounted()).toBeTruthy();0
      }0
      render() {0
        expect(this._isMounted()).toBeFalsy();0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const element = <Component />;0
0
    expect(() => {0
      const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(element);0
      expect(instance._isMounted()).toBeTruthy();0
    }).toWarnDev('Component is accessing isMounted inside its render()');0
  });0
0
  it('isMounted should return false when unmounted', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container);0
0
    // No longer a public API, but we can test that it works internally by0
    // reaching into the updater.0
    expect(instance.updater.isMounted(instance)).toBe(true);0
0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
0
    expect(instance.updater.isMounted(instance)).toBe(false);0
  });0
0
  it('warns if findDOMNode is used inside render', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {isMounted: false};0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.setState({isMounted: true});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.isMounted) {0
          expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(this).tagName).toBe('DIV');0
        }0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />);0
    }).toWarnDev('Component is accessing findDOMNode inside its render()');0
  });0
0
  it('should carry through each of the phases of setup', () => {0
    class LifeCycleComponent extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props, context) {0
        super(props, context);0
        this._testJournal = {};0
        const initState = {0
          hasWillMountCompleted: false,0
          hasDidMountCompleted: false,0
          hasRenderCompleted: false,0
          hasWillUnmountCompleted: false,0
        };0
        this._testJournal.returnedFromGetInitialState = clone(initState);0
        this._testJournal.lifeCycleAtStartOfGetInitialState = getLifeCycleState(0
          this,0
        );0
        this.state = initState;0
      }0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        this._testJournal.stateAtStartOfWillMount = clone(this.state);0
        this._testJournal.lifeCycleAtStartOfWillMount = getLifeCycleState(this);0
        this.state.hasWillMountCompleted = true;0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this._testJournal.stateAtStartOfDidMount = clone(this.state);0
        this._testJournal.lifeCycleAtStartOfDidMount = getLifeCycleState(this);0
        this.setState({hasDidMountCompleted: true});0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        const isInitialRender = !this.state.hasRenderCompleted;0
        if (isInitialRender) {0
          this._testJournal.stateInInitialRender = clone(this.state);0
          this._testJournal.lifeCycleInInitialRender = getLifeCycleState(this);0
        } else {0
          this._testJournal.stateInLaterRender = clone(this.state);0
          this._testJournal.lifeCycleInLaterRender = getLifeCycleState(this);0
        }0
        // you would *NEVER* do anything like this in real code!0
        this.state.hasRenderCompleted = true;0
        return <div ref="theDiv">I am the inner DIV</div>;0
      }0
0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        this._testJournal.stateAtStartOfWillUnmount = clone(this.state);0
        this._testJournal.lifeCycleAtStartOfWillUnmount = getLifeCycleState(0
          this,0
        );0
        this.state.hasWillUnmountCompleted = true;0
      }0
    }0
0
    // A component that is merely "constructed" (as in "constructor") but not0
    // yet initialized, or rendered.0
    //0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    let instance;0
    expect(() => {0
      instance = ReactDOM.render(<LifeCycleComponent />, container);0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'LifeCycleComponent is accessing isMounted inside its render() function',0
    );0
0
    // getInitialState0
    expect(instance._testJournal.returnedFromGetInitialState).toEqual(0
      GET_INIT_STATE_RETURN_VAL,0
    );0
    expect(instance._testJournal.lifeCycleAtStartOfGetInitialState).toBe(0
      'UNMOUNTED',0
    );0
0
    // componentWillMount0
    expect(instance._testJournal.stateAtStartOfWillMount).toEqual(0
      instance._testJournal.returnedFromGetInitialState,0
    );0
    expect(instance._testJournal.lifeCycleAtStartOfWillMount).toBe('UNMOUNTED');0
0
    // componentDidMount0
    expect(instance._testJournal.stateAtStartOfDidMount).toEqual(0
      DID_MOUNT_STATE,0
    );0
    expect(instance._testJournal.lifeCycleAtStartOfDidMount).toBe('MOUNTED');0
0
    // initial render0
    expect(instance._testJournal.stateInInitialRender).toEqual(0
      INIT_RENDER_STATE,0
    );0
    expect(instance._testJournal.lifeCycleInInitialRender).toBe('UNMOUNTED');0
0
    expect(getLifeCycleState(instance)).toBe('MOUNTED');0
0
    // Now *update the component*0
    instance.forceUpdate();0
0
    // render 2nd time0
    expect(instance._testJournal.stateInLaterRender).toEqual(NEXT_RENDER_STATE);0
    expect(instance._testJournal.lifeCycleInLaterRender).toBe('MOUNTED');0
0
    expect(getLifeCycleState(instance)).toBe('MOUNTED');0
0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
0
    expect(instance._testJournal.stateAtStartOfWillUnmount).toEqual(0
      WILL_UNMOUNT_STATE,0
    );0
    // componentWillUnmount called right before unmount.0
    expect(instance._testJournal.lifeCycleAtStartOfWillUnmount).toBe('MOUNTED');0
0
    // But the current lifecycle of the component is unmounted.0
    expect(getLifeCycleState(instance)).toBe('UNMOUNTED');0
    expect(instance.state).toEqual(POST_WILL_UNMOUNT_STATE);0
  });0
0
  it('should not throw when updating an auxiliary component', () => {0
    class Tooltip extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.container = document.createElement('div');0
        this.updateTooltip();0
      }0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        this.updateTooltip();0
      }0
0
      updateTooltip = () => {0
        // Even though this.props.tooltip has an owner, updating it shouldn't0
        // throw here because it's mounted as a root component0
        ReactDOM.render(this.props.tooltip, this.container);0
      };0
    }0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <Tooltip ref="tooltip" tooltip={<div>{this.props.tooltipText}</div>}>0
            {this.props.text}0
          </Tooltip>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component text="uno" tooltipText="one" />, container);0
0
    // Since `instance` is a root component, we can set its props. This also0
    // makes Tooltip rerender the tooltip component, which shouldn't throw.0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component text="dos" tooltipText="two" />, container);0
  });0
0
  it('should allow state updates in componentDidMount', () => {0
    /**0
     * calls setState in an componentDidMount.0
     */0
    class SetStateInComponentDidMount extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        stateField: this.props.valueToUseInitially,0
      };0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.setState({stateField: this.props.valueToUseInOnDOMReady});0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let instance = (0
      <SetStateInComponentDidMount0
        valueToUseInitially="hello"0
        valueToUseInOnDOMReady="goodbye"0
      />0
    );0
    instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance);0
    expect(instance.state.stateField).toBe('goodbye');0
  });0
0
  it('should call nested legacy lifecycle methods in the right order', () => {0
    let log;0
    const logger = function(msg) {0
      return function() {0
        // return true for shouldComponentUpdate0
        log.push(msg);0
        return true;0
      };0
    };0
    class Outer extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount = logger('outer componentWillMount');0
      componentDidMount = logger('outer componentDidMount');0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps = logger(0
        'outer componentWillReceiveProps',0
      );0
      shouldComponentUpdate = logger('outer shouldComponentUpdate');0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate = logger('outer componentWillUpdate');0
      componentDidUpdate = logger('outer componentDidUpdate');0
      componentWillUnmount = logger('outer componentWillUnmount');0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Inner x={this.props.x} />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Inner extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount = logger('inner componentWillMount');0
      componentDidMount = logger('inner componentDidMount');0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps = logger(0
        'inner componentWillReceiveProps',0
      );0
      shouldComponentUpdate = logger('inner shouldComponentUpdate');0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate = logger('inner componentWillUpdate');0
      componentDidUpdate = logger('inner componentDidUpdate');0
      componentWillUnmount = logger('inner componentWillUnmount');0
      render() {0
        return <span>{this.props.x}</span>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    log = [];0
    ReactDOM.render(<Outer x={1} />, container);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'outer componentWillMount',0
      'inner componentWillMount',0
      'inner componentDidMount',0
      'outer componentDidMount',0
    ]);0
0
    // Dedup warnings0
    log = [];0
    ReactDOM.render(<Outer x={2} />, container);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'outer componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'outer shouldComponentUpdate',0
      'outer componentWillUpdate',0
      'inner componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'inner shouldComponentUpdate',0
      'inner componentWillUpdate',0
      'inner componentDidUpdate',0
      'outer componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log = [];0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'outer componentWillUnmount',0
      'inner componentWillUnmount',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should call nested new lifecycle methods in the right order', () => {0
    let log;0
    const logger = function(msg) {0
      return function() {0
        // return true for shouldComponentUpdate0
        log.push(msg);0
        return true;0
      };0
    };0
    class Outer extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps(props, prevState) {0
        log.push('outer getDerivedStateFromProps');0
        return null;0
      }0
      componentDidMount = logger('outer componentDidMount');0
      shouldComponentUpdate = logger('outer shouldComponentUpdate');0
      getSnapshotBeforeUpdate = logger('outer getSnapshotBeforeUpdate');0
      componentDidUpdate = logger('outer componentDidUpdate');0
      componentWillUnmount = logger('outer componentWillUnmount');0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Inner x={this.props.x} />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Inner extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps(props, prevState) {0
        log.push('inner getDerivedStateFromProps');0
        return null;0
      }0
      componentDidMount = logger('inner componentDidMount');0
      shouldComponentUpdate = logger('inner shouldComponentUpdate');0
      getSnapshotBeforeUpdate = logger('inner getSnapshotBeforeUpdate');0
      componentDidUpdate = logger('inner componentDidUpdate');0
      componentWillUnmount = logger('inner componentWillUnmount');0
      render() {0
        return <span>{this.props.x}</span>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    log = [];0
    ReactDOM.render(<Outer x={1} />, container);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'outer getDerivedStateFromProps',0
      'inner getDerivedStateFromProps',0
      'inner componentDidMount',0
      'outer componentDidMount',0
    ]);0
0
    // Dedup warnings0
    log = [];0
    ReactDOM.render(<Outer x={2} />, container);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'outer getDerivedStateFromProps',0
      'outer shouldComponentUpdate',0
      'inner getDerivedStateFromProps',0
      'inner shouldComponentUpdate',0
      'inner getSnapshotBeforeUpdate',0
      'outer getSnapshotBeforeUpdate',0
      'inner componentDidUpdate',0
      'outer componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log = [];0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'outer componentWillUnmount',0
      'inner componentWillUnmount',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should not invoke deprecated lifecycles (cWM/cWRP/cWU) if new static gDSFP is present', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
        return null;0
      }0
      componentWillMount() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0
      componentWillReceiveProps() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0
      componentWillUpdate() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Unsafe legacy lifecycles will not be called for components using new component APIs.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should not invoke deprecated lifecycles (cWM/cWRP/cWU) if new getSnapshotBeforeUpdate is present', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() {0
        return null;0
      }0
      componentWillMount() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0
      componentWillReceiveProps() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0
      componentWillUpdate() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {}0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Component value={1} />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Unsafe legacy lifecycles will not be called for components using new component APIs.',0
    );0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component value={2} />, container);0
  });0
0
  it('should not invoke new unsafe lifecycles (cWM/cWRP/cWU) if static gDSFP is present', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
        return null;0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Component value={1} />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Unsafe legacy lifecycles will not be called for components using new component APIs.',0
    );0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component value={2} />, container);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn about deprecated lifecycles (cWM/cWRP/cWU) if new static gDSFP is present', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    class AllLegacyLifecycles extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
        return null;0
      }0
      componentWillMount() {}0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {}0
      componentWillUpdate() {}0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<AllLegacyLifecycles />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Unsafe legacy lifecycles will not be called for components using new component APIs.\n\n' +0
        'AllLegacyLifecycles uses getDerivedStateFromProps() but also contains the following legacy lifecycles:\n' +0
        '  componentWillMount\n' +0
        '  UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps\n' +0
        '  componentWillUpdate\n\n' +0
        'The above lifecycles should be removed. Learn more about this warning here:\n' +0
        'https://fb.me/react-async-component-lifecycle-hooks',0
    );0
0
    class WillMount extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
        return null;0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {}0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<WillMount />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Unsafe legacy lifecycles will not be called for components using new component APIs.\n\n' +0
        'WillMount uses getDerivedStateFromProps() but also contains the following legacy lifecycles:\n' +0
        '  UNSAFE_componentWillMount\n\n' +0
        'The above lifecycles should be removed. Learn more about this warning here:\n' +0
        'https://fb.me/react-async-component-lifecycle-hooks',0
    );0
0
    class WillMountAndUpdate extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
        return null;0
      }0
      componentWillMount() {}0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {}0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<WillMountAndUpdate />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Unsafe legacy lifecycles will not be called for components using new component APIs.\n\n' +0
        'WillMountAndUpdate uses getDerivedStateFromProps() but also contains the following legacy lifecycles:\n' +0
        '  componentWillMount\n' +0
        '  UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate\n\n' +0
        'The above lifecycles should be removed. Learn more about this warning here:\n' +0
        'https://fb.me/react-async-component-lifecycle-hooks',0
    );0
0
    class WillReceiveProps extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
        return null;0
      }0
      componentWillReceiveProps() {}0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<WillReceiveProps />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Unsafe legacy lifecycles will not be called for components using new component APIs.\n\n' +0
        'WillReceiveProps uses getDerivedStateFromProps() but also contains the following legacy lifecycles:\n' +0
        '  componentWillReceiveProps\n\n' +0
        'The above lifecycles should be removed. Learn more about this warning here:\n' +0
        'https://fb.me/react-async-component-lifecycle-hooks',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn about deprecated lifecycles (cWM/cWRP/cWU) if new getSnapshotBeforeUpdate is present', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    class AllLegacyLifecycles extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() {}0
      componentWillMount() {}0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {}0
      componentWillUpdate() {}0
      componentDidUpdate() {}0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<AllLegacyLifecycles />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Unsafe legacy lifecycles will not be called for components using new component APIs.\n\n' +0
        'AllLegacyLifecycles uses getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() but also contains the following legacy lifecycles:\n' +0
        '  componentWillMount\n' +0
        '  UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps\n' +0
        '  componentWillUpdate\n\n' +0
        'The above lifecycles should be removed. Learn more about this warning here:\n' +0
        'https://fb.me/react-async-component-lifecycle-hooks',0
    );0
0
    class WillMount extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() {}0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {}0
      componentDidUpdate() {}0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<WillMount />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Unsafe legacy lifecycles will not be called for components using new component APIs.\n\n' +0
        'WillMount uses getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() but also contains the following legacy lifecycles:\n' +0
        '  UNSAFE_componentWillMount\n\n' +0
        'The above lifecycles should be removed. Learn more about this warning here:\n' +0
        'https://fb.me/react-async-component-lifecycle-hooks',0
    );0
0
    class WillMountAndUpdate extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() {}0
      componentWillMount() {}0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {}0
      componentDidUpdate() {}0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<WillMountAndUpdate />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Unsafe legacy lifecycles will not be called for components using new component APIs.\n\n' +0
        'WillMountAndUpdate uses getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() but also contains the following legacy lifecycles:\n' +0
        '  componentWillMount\n' +0
        '  UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate\n\n' +0
        'The above lifecycles should be removed. Learn more about this warning here:\n' +0
        'https://fb.me/react-async-component-lifecycle-hooks',0
    );0
0
    class WillReceiveProps extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() {}0
      componentWillReceiveProps() {}0
      componentDidUpdate() {}0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<WillReceiveProps />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Unsafe legacy lifecycles will not be called for components using new component APIs.\n\n' +0
        'WillReceiveProps uses getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() but also contains the following legacy lifecycles:\n' +0
        '  componentWillReceiveProps\n\n' +0
        'The above lifecycles should be removed. Learn more about this warning here:\n' +0
        'https://fb.me/react-async-component-lifecycle-hooks',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('calls effects on module-pattern component', function() {0
    const log = [];0
0
    function Parent() {0
      return {0
        render() {0
          expect(typeof this.props).toBe('object');0
          log.push('render');0
          return <Child />;0
        },0
        UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
          log.push('will mount');0
        },0
        componentDidMount() {0
          log.push('did mount');0
        },0
        componentDidUpdate() {0
          log.push('did update');0
        },0
        getChildContext() {0
          return {x: 2};0
        },0
      };0
    }0
    Parent.childContextTypes = {0
      x: PropTypes.number,0
    };0
    function Child(props, context) {0
      expect(context.x).toBe(2);0
      return <div />;0
    }0
    Child.contextTypes = {0
      x: PropTypes.number,0
    };0
0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent ref={c => c && log.push('ref')} />, div);0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent ref={c => c && log.push('ref')} />, div);0
0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'will mount',0
      'render',0
      'did mount',0
      'ref',0
0
      'render',0
      'did update',0
      'ref',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if getDerivedStateFromProps returns undefined', () => {0
    class MyComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps() {}0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent />, div)).toWarnDev(0
      'MyComponent.getDerivedStateFromProps(): A valid state object (or null) must ' +0
        'be returned. You have returned undefined.',0
    );0
0
    // De-duped0
    ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent />, div);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if state is not initialized before getDerivedStateFromProps', () => {0
    class MyComponent extends React.Component {0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
        return null;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent />, div)).toWarnDev(0
      'MyComponent: Did not properly initialize state during construction. ' +0
        'Expected state to be an object, but it was undefined.',0
    );0
0
    // De-duped0
    ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent />, div);0
  });0
0
  it('should invoke both deprecated and new lifecycles if both are present', () => {0
    const log = [];0
0
    class MyComponent extends React.Component {0
      componentWillMount() {0
        log.push('componentWillMount');0
      }0
      componentWillReceiveProps() {0
        log.push('componentWillReceiveProps');0
      }0
      componentWillUpdate() {0
        log.push('componentWillUpdate');0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        log.push('UNSAFE_componentWillMount');0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {0
        log.push('UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps');0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {0
        log.push('UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent foo="bar" />, div);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['componentWillMount', 'UNSAFE_componentWillMount']);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent foo="baz" />, div);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'componentWillUpdate',0
      'UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should not override state with stale values if prevState is spread within getDerivedStateFromProps', () => {0
    const divRef = React.createRef();0
    let childInstance;0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      state = {local: 0};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps(nextProps, prevState) {0
        return {...prevState, remote: nextProps.remote};0
      }0
      updateState = () => {0
        this.setState(state => ({local: state.local + 1}));0
        this.props.onChange(this.state.remote + 1);0
      };0
      render() {0
        childInstance = this;0
        return (0
          <div onClick={this.updateState} ref={divRef}>{`remote:${0
            this.state.remote0
          }, local:${this.state.local}`}</div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      state = {value: 0};0
      handleChange = value => {0
        this.setState({value});0
      };0
      render() {0
        return <Child remote={this.state.value} onChange={this.handleChange} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
    try {0
      ReactDOM.render(<Parent />, container);0
      expect(divRef.current.textContent).toBe('remote:0, local:0');0
0
      // Trigger setState() calls0
      childInstance.updateState();0
      expect(divRef.current.textContent).toBe('remote:1, local:1');0
0
      // Trigger batched setState() calls0
      divRef.current.click();0
      expect(divRef.current.textContent).toBe('remote:2, local:2');0
    } finally {0
      document.body.removeChild(container);0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('should pass the return value from getSnapshotBeforeUpdate to componentDidUpdate', () => {0
    const log = [];0
0
    class MyComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        value: 0,0
      };0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps(nextProps, prevState) {0
        return {0
          value: prevState.value + 1,0
        };0
      }0
      getSnapshotBeforeUpdate(prevProps, prevState) {0
        log.push(0
          `getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() prevProps:${prevProps.value} prevState:${0
            prevState.value0
          }`,0
        );0
        return 'abc';0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate(prevProps, prevState, snapshot) {0
        log.push(0
          `componentDidUpdate() prevProps:${prevProps.value} prevState:${0
            prevState.value0
          } snapshot:${snapshot}`,0
        );0
      }0
      render() {0
        log.push('render');0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        <MyComponent value="foo" />0
      </div>,0
      div,0
    );0
    expect(log).toEqual(['render']);0
    log.length = 0;0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        <MyComponent value="bar" />0
      </div>,0
      div,0
    );0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'render',0
      'getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() prevProps:foo prevState:1',0
      'componentDidUpdate() prevProps:foo prevState:1 snapshot:abc',0
    ]);0
    log.length = 0;0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        <MyComponent value="baz" />0
      </div>,0
      div,0
    );0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'render',0
      'getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() prevProps:bar prevState:2',0
      'componentDidUpdate() prevProps:bar prevState:2 snapshot:abc',0
    ]);0
    log.length = 0;0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<div />, div);0
    expect(log).toEqual([]);0
  });0
0
  it('should call getSnapshotBeforeUpdate before mutations are committed', () => {0
    const log = [];0
0
    class MyComponent extends React.Component {0
      divRef = React.createRef();0
      getSnapshotBeforeUpdate(prevProps, prevState) {0
        log.push('getSnapshotBeforeUpdate');0
        expect(this.divRef.current.textContent).toBe(0
          `value:${prevProps.value}`,0
        );0
        return 'foobar';0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate(prevProps, prevState, snapshot) {0
        log.push('componentDidUpdate');0
        expect(this.divRef.current.textContent).toBe(0
          `value:${this.props.value}`,0
        );0
        expect(snapshot).toBe('foobar');0
      }0
      render() {0
        log.push('render');0
        return <div ref={this.divRef}>{`value:${this.props.value}`}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent value="foo" />, div);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['render']);0
    log.length = 0;0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent value="bar" />, div);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'render',0
      'getSnapshotBeforeUpdate',0
      'componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
    log.length = 0;0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if getSnapshotBeforeUpdate returns undefined', () => {0
    class MyComponent extends React.Component {0
      getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() {}0
      componentDidUpdate() {}0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent value="foo" />, div);0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent value="bar" />, div)).toWarnDev(0
      'MyComponent.getSnapshotBeforeUpdate(): A snapshot value (or null) must ' +0
        'be returned. You have returned undefined.',0
    );0
0
    // De-duped0
    ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent value="baz" />, div);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if getSnapshotBeforeUpdate is defined with no componentDidUpdate', () => {0
    class MyComponent extends React.Component {0
      getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() {0
        return null;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent />, div)).toWarnDev(0
      'MyComponent: getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() should be used with componentDidUpdate(). ' +0
        'This component defines getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() only.',0
    );0
0
    // De-duped0
    ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent />, div);0
  });0
});0

'use strict';0
0
let ChildUpdates;0
let MorphingComponent;0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
let ReactCurrentOwner;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
let PropTypes;0
0
describe('ReactCompositeComponent', () => {0
  const hasOwnProperty = Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty;0
0
  /**0
   * Performs equality by iterating through keys on an object and returning false0
   * when any key has values which are not strictly equal between the arguments.0
   * Returns true when the values of all keys are strictly equal.0
   */0
  function shallowEqual(objA: mixed, objB: mixed): boolean {0
    if (Object.is(objA, objB)) {0
      return true;0
    }0
    if (0
      typeof objA !== 'object' ||0
      objA === null ||0
      typeof objB !== 'object' ||0
      objB === null0
    ) {0
      return false;0
    }0
    const keysA = Object.keys(objA);0
    const keysB = Object.keys(objB);0
    if (keysA.length !== keysB.length) {0
      return false;0
    }0
    for (let i = 0; i < keysA.length; i++) {0
      if (0
        !hasOwnProperty.call(objB, keysA[i]) ||0
        !Object.is(objA[keysA[i]], objB[keysA[i]])0
      ) {0
        return false;0
      }0
    }0
    return true;0
  }0
0
  function shallowCompare(instance, nextProps, nextState) {0
    return (0
      !shallowEqual(instance.props, nextProps) ||0
      !shallowEqual(instance.state, nextState)0
    );0
  }0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
    ReactCurrentOwner = require('react')0
      .__SECRET_INTERNALS_DO_NOT_USE_OR_YOU_WILL_BE_FIRED.ReactCurrentOwner;0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
    PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
0
    MorphingComponent = class extends React.Component {0
      state = {activated: false};0
0
      _toggleActivatedState = () => {0
        this.setState({activated: !this.state.activated});0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        const toggleActivatedState = this._toggleActivatedState;0
        return !this.state.activated ? (0
          <a ref="x" onClick={toggleActivatedState} />0
        ) : (0
          <b ref="x" onClick={toggleActivatedState} />0
        );0
      }0
    };0
0
    /**0
     * We'll use this to ensure that an old version is not cached when it is0
     * reallocated again.0
     */0
    ChildUpdates = class extends React.Component {0
      getAnchor = () => {0
        return this.refs.anch;0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        const className = this.props.anchorClassOn ? 'anchorClass' : '';0
        return this.props.renderAnchor ? (0
          <a ref="anch" className={className} />0
        ) : (0
          <b />0
        );0
      }0
    };0
  });0
0
  it('should support module pattern components', () => {0
    function Child({test}) {0
      return {0
        render() {0
          return <div>{test}</div>;0
        },0
      };0
    }0
0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Child test="test" />, el);0
0
    expect(el.textContent).toBe('test');0
  });0
0
  it('should support rendering to different child types over time', () => {0
    const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<MorphingComponent />);0
    let el = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(instance);0
    expect(el.tagName).toBe('A');0
0
    instance._toggleActivatedState();0
    el = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(instance);0
    expect(el.tagName).toBe('B');0
0
    instance._toggleActivatedState();0
    el = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(instance);0
    expect(el.tagName).toBe('A');0
  });0
0
  it('should not thrash a server rendered layout with client side one', () => {0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Child />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const markup = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Parent />);0
0
    // Old API based on heuristic0
    let container = document.createElement('div');0
    container.innerHTML = markup;0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Parent />, container)).toLowPriorityWarnDev(0
      'render(): Calling ReactDOM.render() to hydrate server-rendered markup ' +0
        'will stop working in React v17. Replace the ReactDOM.render() call ' +0
        'with ReactDOM.hydrate() if you want React to attach to the server HTML.',0
    );0
0
    // New explicit API0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    container.innerHTML = markup;0
    ReactDOM.hydrate(<Parent />, container);0
  });0
0
  it('should react to state changes from callbacks', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
    try {0
      const instance = ReactDOM.render(<MorphingComponent />, container);0
      let el = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(instance);0
      expect(el.tagName).toBe('A');0
      el.click();0
      el = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(instance);0
      expect(el.tagName).toBe('B');0
    } finally {0
      document.body.removeChild(container);0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('should rewire refs when rendering to different child types', () => {0
    const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<MorphingComponent />);0
0
    expect(instance.refs.x.tagName).toBe('A');0
    instance._toggleActivatedState();0
    expect(instance.refs.x.tagName).toBe('B');0
    instance._toggleActivatedState();0
    expect(instance.refs.x.tagName).toBe('A');0
  });0
0
  it('should not cache old DOM nodes when switching constructors', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(0
      <ChildUpdates renderAnchor={true} anchorClassOn={false} />,0
      container,0
    );0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      // Warm any cache0
      <ChildUpdates renderAnchor={true} anchorClassOn={true} />,0
      container,0
    );0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      // Clear out the anchor0
      <ChildUpdates renderAnchor={false} anchorClassOn={true} />,0
      container,0
    );0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      // rerender0
      <ChildUpdates renderAnchor={true} anchorClassOn={false} />,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(instance.getAnchor().className).toBe('');0
  });0
0
  it('should use default values for undefined props', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      static defaultProps = {prop: 'testKey'};0
0
      render() {0
        return <span />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const instance1 = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />);0
    expect(instance1.props).toEqual({prop: 'testKey'});0
0
    const instance2 = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <Component prop={undefined} />,0
    );0
    expect(instance2.props).toEqual({prop: 'testKey'});0
0
    const instance3 = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <Component prop={null} />,0
    );0
    expect(instance3.props).toEqual({prop: null});0
  });0
0
  it('should not mutate passed-in props object', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      static defaultProps = {prop: 'testKey'};0
0
      render() {0
        return <span />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const inputProps = {};0
    let instance1 = <Component {...inputProps} />;0
    instance1 = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance1);0
    expect(instance1.props.prop).toBe('testKey');0
0
    // We don't mutate the input, just in case the caller wants to do something0
    // with it after using it to instantiate a component0
    expect(inputProps.prop).not.toBeDefined();0
  });0
0
  it('should warn about `forceUpdate` on not-yet-mounted components', () => {0
    class MyComponent extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        this.forceUpdate();0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      "Warning: Can't call forceUpdate on a component that is not yet mounted. " +0
        'This is a no-op, but it might indicate a bug in your application. ' +0
        'Instead, assign to `this.state` directly or define a `state = {};` ' +0
        'class property with the desired state in the MyComponent component.',0
    );0
0
    // No additional warning should be recorded0
    const container2 = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent />, container2);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn about `setState` on not-yet-mounted components', () => {0
    class MyComponent extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        this.setState();0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      "Warning: Can't call setState on a component that is not yet mounted. " +0
        'This is a no-op, but it might indicate a bug in your application. ' +0
        'Instead, assign to `this.state` directly or define a `state = {};` ' +0
        'class property with the desired state in the MyComponent component.',0
    );0
0
    // No additional warning should be recorded0
    const container2 = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent />, container2);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn about `forceUpdate` on unmounted components', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let instance = <Component />;0
    expect(instance.forceUpdate).not.toBeDefined();0
0
    instance = ReactDOM.render(instance, container);0
    instance.forceUpdate();0
0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
0
    expect(() => instance.forceUpdate()).toWarnDev(0
      "Warning: Can't call setState (or forceUpdate) on an unmounted " +0
        'component. This is a no-op, but it indicates a memory leak in your ' +0
        'application. To fix, cancel all subscriptions and asynchronous ' +0
        'tasks in the componentWillUnmount method.\n' +0
        '    in Component (at **)',0
    );0
0
    // No additional warning should be recorded0
    instance.forceUpdate();0
  });0
0
  it('should warn about `setState` on unmounted components', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
    let renders = 0;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {value: 0};0
0
      render() {0
        renders++;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let instance;0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        <span>0
          <Component ref={c => (instance = c || instance)} />0
        </span>0
      </div>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    expect(renders).toBe(1);0
0
    instance.setState({value: 1});0
0
    expect(renders).toBe(2);0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<div />, container);0
0
    expect(() => {0
      instance.setState({value: 2});0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      "Warning: Can't call setState (or forceUpdate) on an unmounted " +0
        'component. This is a no-op, but it indicates a memory leak in your ' +0
        'application. To fix, cancel all subscriptions and asynchronous ' +0
        'tasks in the componentWillUnmount method.\n' +0
        '    in Component (at **)\n' +0
        '    in span',0
    );0
0
    expect(renders).toBe(2);0
  });0
0
  it('should silently allow `setState`, not call cb on unmounting components', () => {0
    let cbCalled = false;0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {value: 0};0
0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        expect(() => {0
          this.setState({value: 2}, function() {0
            cbCalled = true;0
          });0
        }).not.toThrow();0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container);0
    instance.setState({value: 1});0
0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(cbCalled).toBe(false);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when rendering a class with a render method that does not extend React.Component', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    class ClassWithRenderNotExtended {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactDOM.render(<ClassWithRenderNotExtended />, container);0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: The <ClassWithRenderNotExtended /> component appears to have a render method, ' +0
          "but doesn't extend React.Component. This is likely to cause errors. " +0
          'Change ClassWithRenderNotExtended to extend React.Component instead.',0
      );0
    }).toThrow(TypeError);0
0
    // Test deduplication0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<ClassWithRenderNotExtended />, container);0
    }).toThrow(TypeError);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn about `setState` in render', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    let renderedState = -1;0
    let renderPasses = 0;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {value: 0};0
0
      render() {0
        renderPasses++;0
        renderedState = this.state.value;0
        if (this.state.value === 0) {0
          this.setState({value: 1});0
        }0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let instance;0
0
    expect(() => {0
      instance = ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container);0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Cannot update during an existing state transition (such as within ' +0
        "`render` or another component's constructor). Render methods should " +0
        'be a pure function of props and state; constructor side-effects are ' +0
        'an anti-pattern, but can be moved to `componentWillMount`.',0
    );0
0
    // The setState call is queued and then executed as a second pass. This0
    // behavior is undefined though so we're free to change it to suit the0
    // implementation details.0
    expect(renderPasses).toBe(2);0
    expect(renderedState).toBe(1);0
    expect(instance.state.value).toBe(1);0
0
    // Forcing a rerender anywhere will cause the update to happen.0
    const instance2 = ReactDOM.render(<Component prop={123} />, container);0
    expect(instance).toBe(instance2);0
    expect(renderedState).toBe(1);0
    expect(instance2.state.value).toBe(1);0
0
    // Test deduplication; (no additional warnings are expected).0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component prop={123} />, container);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn about `setState` in getChildContext', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    let renderPasses = 0;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {value: 0};0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        if (this.state.value === 0) {0
          this.setState({value: 1});0
        }0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        renderPasses++;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    Component.childContextTypes = {};0
0
    let instance;0
0
    expect(() => {0
      instance = ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container);0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: setState(...): Cannot call setState() inside getChildContext()',0
    );0
0
    expect(renderPasses).toBe(2);0
    expect(instance.state.value).toBe(1);0
0
    // Test deduplication; (no additional warnings are expected).0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container);0
  });0
0
  it('should cleanup even if render() fatals', () => {0
    class BadComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        throw new Error();0
      }0
    }0
0
    let instance = <BadComponent />;0
0
    expect(ReactCurrentOwner.current).toBe(null);0
0
    expect(() => {0
      instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance);0
    }).toThrow();0
0
    expect(ReactCurrentOwner.current).toBe(null);0
  });0

  it('should call componentWillUnmount before unmounting', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    let innerUnmounted = false;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Inner />0
            Text0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Inner extends React.Component {0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        innerUnmounted = true;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0

    ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container);0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(innerUnmounted).toBe(true);0
  });0

  it('should warn when shouldComponentUpdate() returns undefined', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {bogus: false};0
0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return undefined;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />);0
0
    expect(() => instance.setState({bogus: true})).toWarnDev(0

        'boolean value. Make sure to return true or false.',0
    );0

  it('should warn when componentDidUnmount method is defined', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUnmount = () => {};0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0

    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Component has a method called ' +0
        'componentDidUnmount(). But there is no such lifecycle method. ' +0
        'Did you mean componentWillUnmount()?',0

  it('should warn when componentDidReceiveProps method is defined', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      componentDidReceiveProps = () => {};0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Component has a method called ' +0
        'componentDidReceiveProps(). But there is no such lifecycle method. ' +0
        'If you meant to update the state in response to changing props, ' +0
        'use componentWillReceiveProps(). If you meant to fetch data or ' +0
        'run side-effects or mutations after React has updated the UI, use componentDidUpdate().',0
    );0
  });0

      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0

      'Warning: Setting defaultProps as an instance property on Component is not supported ' +0
        'and will be ignored. Instead, define defaultProps as a static property on Component.',0
    );0
  });0

  it('should pass context to children when not owner', () => {0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <Child>0
            <Grandchild />0
          </Child>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: 'bar',0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return React.Children.only(this.props.children);0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Grandchild extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.context.foo}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const component = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Parent />);0
    expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(component).innerHTML).toBe('bar');0

  it('should skip update when rerendering element in container', () => {0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let childRenders = 0;0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        childRenders++;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const child = <Child />;0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent>{child}</Parent>, container);0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent>{child}</Parent>, container);0
    expect(childRenders).toBe(1);0
  });0
