  it('should pass context when re-rendered for static child', () => {0
    let parentInstance = null;0
    let childInstance = null;0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string,0
        flag: PropTypes.bool,0
      };0
0
      state = {0
        flag: false,0
      };0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: 'bar',0
          flag: this.state.flag,0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return React.Children.only(this.props.children);0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Middle extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string,0
        flag: PropTypes.bool,0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        childInstance = this;0
        return <span>Child</span>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    parentInstance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <Parent>0
        <Middle>0
          <Child />0
        </Middle>0
      </Parent>,0
    );0
0
    expect(parentInstance.state.flag).toBe(false);0
    expect(childInstance.context).toEqual({foo: 'bar', flag: false});0
0
    parentInstance.setState({flag: true});0
    expect(parentInstance.state.flag).toBe(true);0
    expect(childInstance.context).toEqual({foo: 'bar', flag: true});0
  });0
0
  it('should pass context when re-rendered for static child within a composite component', () => {0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        flag: PropTypes.bool,0
      };0
0
      state = {0
        flag: true,0
      };0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          flag: this.state.flag,0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        flag: PropTypes.bool,0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <Parent ref="parent">0
            <Child ref="child" />0
          </Parent>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const wrapper = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Wrapper />);0
0
    expect(wrapper.refs.parent.state.flag).toEqual(true);0
    expect(wrapper.refs.child.context).toEqual({flag: true});0
0
    // We update <Parent /> while <Child /> is still a static prop relative to this update0
    wrapper.refs.parent.setState({flag: false});0
0
    expect(wrapper.refs.parent.state.flag).toEqual(false);0
    expect(wrapper.refs.child.context).toEqual({flag: false});0
  });0
0
  it('should pass context transitively', () => {0
    let childInstance = null;0
    let grandchildInstance = null;0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string,0
        depth: PropTypes.number,0
      };0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: 'bar',0
          depth: 0,0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <Child />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string,0
        depth: PropTypes.number,0
      };0
0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        depth: PropTypes.number,0
      };0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          depth: this.context.depth + 1,0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        childInstance = this;0
        return <Grandchild />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Grandchild extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string,0
        depth: PropTypes.number,0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        grandchildInstance = this;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Parent />);0
    expect(childInstance.context).toEqual({foo: 'bar', depth: 0});0
    expect(grandchildInstance.context).toEqual({foo: 'bar', depth: 1});0
  });0
0
  it('should pass context when re-rendered', () => {0
    let parentInstance = null;0
    let childInstance = null;0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string,0
        depth: PropTypes.number,0
      };0
0
      state = {0
        flag: false,0
      };0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: 'bar',0
          depth: 0,0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        let output = <Child />;0
        if (!this.state.flag) {0
          output = <span>Child</span>;0
        }0
        return output;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string,0
        depth: PropTypes.number,0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        childInstance = this;0
        return <span>Child</span>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    parentInstance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Parent />);0
    expect(childInstance).toBeNull();0
0
    expect(parentInstance.state.flag).toBe(false);0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      parentInstance.setState({flag: true});0
    });0
    expect(parentInstance.state.flag).toBe(true);0
0
    expect(childInstance.context).toEqual({foo: 'bar', depth: 0});0
  });0
0
  it('unmasked context propagates through updates', () => {0
    class Leaf extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(nextProps, nextContext) {0
        expect('foo' in nextContext).toBe(true);0
      }0
0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps, nextState, nextContext) {0
        expect('foo' in nextContext).toBe(true);0
        return true;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <span>{this.context.foo}</span>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Intermediary extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(nextProps, nextContext) {0
        expect('foo' in nextContext).toBe(false);0
      }0
0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps, nextState, nextContext) {0
        expect('foo' in nextContext).toBe(false);0
        return true;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <Leaf />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: this.props.cntxt,0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <Intermediary />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent cntxt="noise" />, div);0
    expect(div.children[0].innerHTML).toBe('noise');0
    div.children[0].innerHTML = 'aliens';0
    div.children[0].id = 'aliens';0
    expect(div.children[0].innerHTML).toBe('aliens');0
    expect(div.children[0].id).toBe('aliens');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent cntxt="bar" />, div);0
    expect(div.children[0].innerHTML).toBe('bar');0
    expect(div.children[0].id).toBe('aliens');0
  });0
0
  it('should trigger componentWillReceiveProps for context changes', () => {0
    let contextChanges = 0;0
    let propChanges = 0;0
0
    class GrandChild extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(nextProps, nextContext) {0
        expect('foo' in nextContext).toBe(true);0
0
        if (nextProps !== this.props) {0
          propChanges++;0
        }0
0
        if (nextContext !== this.context) {0
          contextChanges++;0
        }0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <span className="grand-child">{this.props.children}</span>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class ChildWithContext extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(nextProps, nextContext) {0
        expect('foo' in nextContext).toBe(true);0
0
        if (nextProps !== this.props) {0
          propChanges++;0
        }0
0
        if (nextContext !== this.context) {0
          contextChanges++;0
        }0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div className="child-with">{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class ChildWithoutContext extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(nextProps, nextContext) {0
        expect('foo' in nextContext).toBe(false);0
0
        if (nextProps !== this.props) {0
          propChanges++;0
        }0
0
        if (nextContext !== this.context) {0
          contextChanges++;0
        }0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div className="child-without">{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
0
      state = {0
        foo: 'abc',0
      };0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: this.state.foo,0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div className="parent">{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
0
    let parentInstance = null;0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <Parent ref={inst => (parentInstance = inst)}>0
        <ChildWithoutContext>0
          A10
          <GrandChild>A2</GrandChild>0
        </ChildWithoutContext>0
0
        <ChildWithContext>0
          B10
          <GrandChild>B2</GrandChild>0
        </ChildWithContext>0
      </Parent>,0
      div,0
    );0
0
    parentInstance.setState({0
      foo: 'def',0
    });0
0
    expect(propChanges).toBe(0);0
    expect(contextChanges).toBe(3); // ChildWithContext, GrandChild x 20
  });0
0
  it('should disallow nested render calls', () => {0
    class Inner extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Outer extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Inner />);0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Outer />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Render methods should be a pure function of props and state; ' +0
        'triggering nested component updates from render is not allowed. If ' +0
        'necessary, trigger nested updates in componentDidUpdate.\n\nCheck the ' +0
        'render method of Outer.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('only renders once if updated in componentWillReceiveProps', () => {0
    let renders = 0;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {updated: false};0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(props) {0
        expect(props.update).toBe(1);0
        expect(renders).toBe(1);0
        this.setState({updated: true});0
        expect(renders).toBe(1);0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        renders++;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(<Component update={0} />, container);0
    expect(renders).toBe(1);0
    expect(instance.state.updated).toBe(false);0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component update={1} />, container);0
    expect(renders).toBe(2);0
    expect(instance.state.updated).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('only renders once if updated in componentWillReceiveProps when batching', () => {0
    let renders = 0;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {updated: false};0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(props) {0
        expect(props.update).toBe(1);0
        expect(renders).toBe(1);0
        this.setState({updated: true});0
        expect(renders).toBe(1);0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        renders++;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(<Component update={0} />, container);0
    expect(renders).toBe(1);0
    expect(instance.state.updated).toBe(false);0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(() => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<Component update={1} />, container);0
    });0
    expect(renders).toBe(2);0
    expect(instance.state.updated).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('should update refs if shouldComponentUpdate gives false', () => {0
    class Static extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return false;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        if (this.props.flipped) {0
          return (0
            <div>0
              <Static ref="static0" key="B">0
                B (ignored)0
              </Static>0
              <Static ref="static1" key="A">0
                A (ignored)0
              </Static>0
            </div>0
          );0
        } else {0
          return (0
            <div>0
              <Static ref="static0" key="A">0
                A0
              </Static>0
              <Static ref="static1" key="B">0
                B0
              </Static>0
            </div>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const comp = ReactDOM.render(<Component flipped={false} />, container);0
    expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(comp.refs.static0).textContent).toBe('A');0
    expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(comp.refs.static1).textContent).toBe('B');0
0
    // When flipping the order, the refs should update even though the actual0
    // contents do not0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component flipped={true} />, container);0
    expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(comp.refs.static0).textContent).toBe('B');0
    expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(comp.refs.static1).textContent).toBe('A');0
  });0
0
  it('should allow access to findDOMNode in componentWillUnmount', () => {0
    let a = null;0
    let b = null;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        a = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(this);0
        expect(a).not.toBe(null);0
      }0
0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        b = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(this);0
        expect(b).not.toBe(null);0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(a).toBe(container.firstChild);0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container);0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(a).toBe(b);0
  });0
0
  it('context should be passed down from the parent', () => {0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: 'bar',0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <Parent>0
        <Component />0
      </Parent>,0
      div,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should replace state', () => {0
    class Moo extends React.Component {0
      state = {x: 1};0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const moo = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Moo />);0
    // No longer a public API, but we can test that it works internally by0
    // reaching into the updater.0
    moo.updater.enqueueReplaceState(moo, {y: 2});0
    expect('x' in moo.state).toBe(false);0
    expect(moo.state.y).toBe(2);0
  });0
0
  it('should support objects with prototypes as state', () => {0
    const NotActuallyImmutable = function(str) {0
      this.str = str;0
    };0
    NotActuallyImmutable.prototype.amIImmutable = function() {0
      return true;0
    };0
    class Moo extends React.Component {0
      state = new NotActuallyImmutable('first');0
      // No longer a public API, but we can test that it works internally by0
      // reaching into the updater.0
      _replaceState = update => this.updater.enqueueReplaceState(this, update);0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const moo = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Moo />);0
    expect(moo.state.str).toBe('first');0
    expect(moo.state.amIImmutable()).toBe(true);0
0
    const secondState = new NotActuallyImmutable('second');0
    moo._replaceState(secondState);0
    expect(moo.state.str).toBe('second');0
    expect(moo.state.amIImmutable()).toBe(true);0
    expect(moo.state).toBe(secondState);0
0
    moo.setState({str: 'third'});0
    expect(moo.state.str).toBe('third');0
    // Here we lose the prototype.0
    expect(moo.state.amIImmutable).toBe(undefined);0
0
    // When more than one state update is enqueued, we have the same behavior0
    const fifthState = new NotActuallyImmutable('fifth');0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      moo.setState({str: 'fourth'});0
      moo._replaceState(fifthState);0
    });0
    expect(moo.state).toBe(fifthState);0
0
    // When more than one state update is enqueued, we have the same behavior0
    const sixthState = new NotActuallyImmutable('sixth');0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      moo._replaceState(sixthState);0
      moo.setState({str: 'seventh'});0
    });0
    expect(moo.state.str).toBe('seventh');0
    expect(moo.state.amIImmutable).toBe(undefined);0
  });0
0
  it('should not warn about unmounting during unmounting', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const layer = document.createElement('div');0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ReactDOM.render(<div />, layer);0
      }0
0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(layer);0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Outer extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <Outer>0
        <Component />0
      </Outer>,0
      container,0
    );0
    ReactDOM.render(<Outer />, container);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when mutated props are passed', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        const _props = {idx: props.idx + '!'};0
        super(_props);0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <span />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Foo idx="qwe" />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Foo(...): When calling super() in `Foo`, make sure to pass ' +0
        "up the same props that your component's constructor was passed.",0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should only call componentWillUnmount once', () => {0
    let app;0
    let count = 0;0
0
    class App extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        if (this.props.stage === 1) {0
          return <UnunmountableComponent />;0
        } else {0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
    }0
0
    class UnunmountableComponent extends React.Component {0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        app.setState({});0
        count++;0
        throw Error('always fails');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>Hello {this.props.name}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    const setRef = ref => {0
      if (ref) {0
        app = ref;0
      }0
    };0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<App ref={setRef} stage={1} />, container);0
      ReactDOM.render(<App ref={setRef} stage={2} />, container);0
    }).toThrow();0
    expect(count).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('prepares new child before unmounting old', () => {0
    const log = [];0
0
    class Spy extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        log.push(this.props.name + ' componentWillMount');0
      }0
      render() {0
        log.push(this.props.name + ' render');0
        return <div />;0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        log.push(this.props.name + ' componentDidMount');0
      }0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        log.push(this.props.name + ' componentWillUnmount');0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <Spy key={this.props.name} name={this.props.name} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Wrapper name="A" />, container);0
    ReactDOM.render(<Wrapper name="B" />, container);0
0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'A componentWillMount',0
      'A render',0
      'A componentDidMount',0
0
      'B componentWillMount',0
      'B render',0
      'A componentWillUnmount',0
      'B componentDidMount',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('respects a shallow shouldComponentUpdate implementation', () => {0
    let renderCalls = 0;0
    class PlasticWrap extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props, context) {0
        super(props, context);0
        this.state = {0
          color: 'green',0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <Apple color={this.state.color} ref="apple" />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Apple extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        cut: false,0
        slices: 1,0
      };0
0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps, nextState) {0
        return shallowCompare(this, nextProps, nextState);0
      }0
0
      cut() {0
        this.setState({0
          cut: true,0
          slices: 10,0
        });0
      }0
0
      eatSlice() {0
        this.setState({0
          slices: this.state.slices - 1,0
        });0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        renderCalls++;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(<PlasticWrap />, container);0
    expect(renderCalls).toBe(1);0
0
    // Do not re-render based on props0
    instance.setState({color: 'green'});0
    expect(renderCalls).toBe(1);0
0
    // Re-render based on props0
    instance.setState({color: 'red'});0
    expect(renderCalls).toBe(2);0
0
    // Re-render base on state0
    instance.refs.apple.cut();0
    expect(renderCalls).toBe(3);0
0
    // No re-render based on state0
    instance.refs.apple.cut();0
    expect(renderCalls).toBe(3);0
0
    // Re-render based on state again0
    instance.refs.apple.eatSlice();0
    expect(renderCalls).toBe(4);0
  });0
0
  it('does not do a deep comparison for a shallow shouldComponentUpdate implementation', () => {0
    function getInitialState() {0
      return {0
        foo: [1, 2, 3],0
        bar: {a: 4, b: 5, c: 6},0
      };0
    }0
0
    let renderCalls = 0;0
    const initialSettings = getInitialState();0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = initialSettings;0
0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps, nextState) {0
        return shallowCompare(this, nextProps, nextState);0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        renderCalls++;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container);0
    expect(renderCalls).toBe(1);0
0
    // Do not re-render if state is equal0
    const settings = {0
      foo: initialSettings.foo,0
      bar: initialSettings.bar,0
    };0
    instance.setState(settings);0
    expect(renderCalls).toBe(1);0
0
    // Re-render because one field changed0
    initialSettings.foo = [1, 2, 3];0
    instance.setState(initialSettings);0
    expect(renderCalls).toBe(2);0
0
    // Re-render because the object changed0
    instance.setState(getInitialState());0
    expect(renderCalls).toBe(3);0
  });0
0
  it('should call setState callback with no arguments', () => {0
    let mockArgs;0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.setState({}, (...args) => (mockArgs = args));0
      }0
      render() {0
        return false;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />);0
    expect(mockArgs.length).toEqual(0);0
  });0
0
  it('this.state should be updated on setState callback inside componentWillMount', () => {0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    let stateSuccessfullyUpdated = false;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props, context) {0
        super(props, context);0
        this.state = {0
          hasUpdatedState: false,0
        };0
      }0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        this.setState(0
          {hasUpdatedState: true},0
          () => (stateSuccessfullyUpdated = this.state.hasUpdatedState),0
        );0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component />, div);0
    expect(stateSuccessfullyUpdated).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('should call the setState callback even if shouldComponentUpdate = false', done => {0
    const mockFn = jest.fn().mockReturnValue(false);0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
0
    let instance;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props, context) {0
        super(props, context);0
        this.state = {0
          hasUpdatedState: false,0
        };0
      }0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        instance = this;0
      }0
0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return mockFn();0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.state.hasUpdatedState}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component />, div);0
0
    expect(instance).toBeDefined();0
    expect(mockFn).not.toBeCalled();0
0
    instance.setState({hasUpdatedState: true}, () => {0
      expect(mockFn).toBeCalled();0
      expect(instance.state.hasUpdatedState).toBe(true);0
      done();0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('should return a meaningful warning when constructor is returned', () => {0
    class RenderTextInvalidConstructor extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        return {something: false};0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<RenderTextInvalidConstructor />);0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: RenderTextInvalidConstructor(...): No `render` method found on the returned component instance: ' +0
          'did you accidentally return an object from the constructor?',0
      );0
    }).toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should return error if render is not defined', () => {0
    class RenderTestUndefinedRender extends React.Component {}0
0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<RenderTestUndefinedRender />);0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: RenderTestUndefinedRender(...): No `render` method found on the returned ' +0
          'component instance: you may have forgotten to define `render`.',0
      );0
    }).toThrow();0
  });0
});0

'use strict';0
0
// Requires0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
0
// Test components0
let LowerLevelComposite;0
let MyCompositeComponent;0
0
let expectSingleChildlessDiv;0
0
/**0
 * Integration test, testing the combination of JSX with our unit of0
 * abstraction, `ReactCompositeComponent` does not ever add superfluous DOM0
 * nodes.0
 */0
describe('ReactCompositeComponentDOMMinimalism', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
0
    LowerLevelComposite = class extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    };0
0
    MyCompositeComponent = class extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <LowerLevelComposite>{this.props.children}</LowerLevelComposite>;0
      }0
    };0
0
    expectSingleChildlessDiv = function(instance) {0
      const el = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(instance);0
      expect(el.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
      expect(el.children.length).toBe(0);0
    };0
  });0
0
  it('should not render extra nodes for non-interpolated text', () => {0
    let instance = <MyCompositeComponent>A string child</MyCompositeComponent>;0
    instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance);0
    expectSingleChildlessDiv(instance);0
  });0
0
  it('should not render extra nodes for non-interpolated text', () => {0
    let instance = (0
      <MyCompositeComponent>{'Interpolated String Child'}</MyCompositeComponent>0
    );0
    instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance);0
    expectSingleChildlessDiv(instance);0
  });0
0
  it('should not render extra nodes for non-interpolated text', () => {0
    let instance = (0
      <MyCompositeComponent>0
        <ul>This text causes no children in ul, just innerHTML</ul>0
      </MyCompositeComponent>0
    );0
    instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance);0
    const el = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(instance);0
    expect(el.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
    expect(el.children.length).toBe(1);0
    expect(el.children[0].tagName).toBe('UL');0
    expect(el.children[0].children.length).toBe(0);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
0
describe('ReactCompositeComponentNestedState-state', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
  });0
0
  it('should provide up to date values for props', () => {0
    class ParentComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {color: 'blue'};0
0
      handleColor = color => {0
        this.props.logger('parent-handleColor', this.state.color);0
        this.setState({color: color}, function() {0
          this.props.logger('parent-after-setState', this.state.color);0
        });0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        this.props.logger('parent-render', this.state.color);0
        return (0
          <ChildComponent0
            logger={this.props.logger}0
            color={this.state.color}0
            onSelectColor={this.handleColor}0
          />0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class ChildComponent extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        props.logger('getInitialState', props.color);0
        this.state = {hue: 'dark ' + props.color};0
      }0
0
      handleHue = (shade, color) => {0
        this.props.logger('handleHue', this.state.hue, this.props.color);0
        this.props.onSelectColor(color);0
        this.setState(0
          function(state, props) {0
            this.props.logger(0
              'setState-this',0
              this.state.hue,0
              this.props.color,0
            );0
            this.props.logger('setState-args', state.hue, props.color);0
            return {hue: shade + ' ' + props.color};0
          },0
          function() {0
            this.props.logger(0
              'after-setState',0
              this.state.hue,0
              this.props.color,0
            );0
          },0
        );0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        this.props.logger('render', this.state.hue, this.props.color);0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <button onClick={this.handleHue.bind(this, 'dark', 'blue')}>0
              Dark Blue0
            </button>0
            <button onClick={this.handleHue.bind(this, 'light', 'blue')}>0
              Light Blue0
            </button>0
            <button onClick={this.handleHue.bind(this, 'dark', 'green')}>0
              Dark Green0
            </button>0
            <button onClick={this.handleHue.bind(this, 'light', 'green')}>0
              Light Green0
            </button>0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
    const logger = jest.fn();0
0
    void ReactDOM.render(<ParentComponent logger={logger} />, container);0
0
    // click "light green"0
    container.childNodes[0].childNodes[3].click();0
0
    expect(logger.mock.calls).toEqual([0
      ['parent-render', 'blue'],0
      ['getInitialState', 'blue'],0
      ['render', 'dark blue', 'blue'],0
      ['handleHue', 'dark blue', 'blue'],0
      ['parent-handleColor', 'blue'],0
      ['parent-render', 'green'],0
      ['setState-this', 'dark blue', 'blue'],0
      ['setState-args', 'dark blue', 'green'],0
      ['render', 'light green', 'green'],0
      ['after-setState', 'light green', 'green'],0
      ['parent-after-setState', 'green'],0
    ]);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
0
let TestComponent;0
0
describe('ReactCompositeComponent-state', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
0
    TestComponent = class extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        this.peekAtState('getInitialState', undefined, props);0
        this.state = {color: 'red'};0
      }0
0
      peekAtState = (from, state = this.state, props = this.props) => {0
        props.stateListener(from, state && state.color);0
      };0
0
      peekAtCallback = from => {0
        return () => this.peekAtState(from);0
      };0
0
      setFavoriteColor(nextColor) {0
        this.setState(0
          {color: nextColor},0
          this.peekAtCallback('setFavoriteColor'),0
        );0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        this.peekAtState('render');0
        return <div>{this.state.color}</div>;0
      }0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        this.peekAtState('componentWillMount-start');0
        this.setState(function(state) {0
          this.peekAtState('before-setState-sunrise', state);0
        });0
        this.setState(0
          {color: 'sunrise'},0
          this.peekAtCallback('setState-sunrise'),0
        );0
        this.setState(function(state) {0
          this.peekAtState('after-setState-sunrise', state);0
        });0
        this.peekAtState('componentWillMount-after-sunrise');0
        this.setState(0
          {color: 'orange'},0
          this.peekAtCallback('setState-orange'),0
        );0
        this.setState(function(state) {0
          this.peekAtState('after-setState-orange', state);0
        });0
        this.peekAtState('componentWillMount-end');0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.peekAtState('componentDidMount-start');0
        this.setState(0
          {color: 'yellow'},0
          this.peekAtCallback('setState-yellow'),0
        );0
        this.peekAtState('componentDidMount-end');0
      }0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(newProps) {0
        this.peekAtState('componentWillReceiveProps-start');0
        if (newProps.nextColor) {0
          this.setState(function(state) {0
            this.peekAtState('before-setState-receiveProps', state);0
            return {color: newProps.nextColor};0
          });0
          // No longer a public API, but we can test that it works internally by0
          // reaching into the updater.0
          this.updater.enqueueReplaceState(this, {color: undefined});0
          this.setState(function(state) {0
            this.peekAtState('before-setState-again-receiveProps', state);0
            return {color: newProps.nextColor};0
          }, this.peekAtCallback('setState-receiveProps'));0
          this.setState(function(state) {0
            this.peekAtState('after-setState-receiveProps', state);0
          });0
        }0
        this.peekAtState('componentWillReceiveProps-end');0
      }0
0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps, nextState) {0
        this.peekAtState('shouldComponentUpdate-currentState');0
        this.peekAtState('shouldComponentUpdate-nextState', nextState);0
        return true;0
      }0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate(nextProps, nextState) {0
        this.peekAtState('componentWillUpdate-currentState');0
        this.peekAtState('componentWillUpdate-nextState', nextState);0
      }0
0
      componentDidUpdate(prevProps, prevState) {0
        this.peekAtState('componentDidUpdate-currentState');0
        this.peekAtState('componentDidUpdate-prevState', prevState);0
      }0
0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        this.peekAtState('componentWillUnmount');0
      }0
    };0
  });0
0
  it('should support setting state', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
    const stateListener = jest.fn();0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(0
      <TestComponent stateListener={stateListener} />,0
      container,0
      function peekAtInitialCallback() {0
        this.peekAtState('initial-callback');0
      },0
    );0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <TestComponent stateListener={stateListener} nextColor="green" />,0
      container,0
      instance.peekAtCallback('setProps'),0
    );0
    instance.setFavoriteColor('blue');0
    instance.forceUpdate(instance.peekAtCallback('forceUpdate'));0
0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
0
    let expected = [0
      // there is no state when getInitialState() is called0
      ['getInitialState', null],0
      ['componentWillMount-start', 'red'],0
      // setState()'s only enqueue pending states.0
      ['componentWillMount-after-sunrise', 'red'],0
      ['componentWillMount-end', 'red'],0
      // pending state queue is processed0
      ['before-setState-sunrise', 'red'],0
      ['after-setState-sunrise', 'sunrise'],0
      ['after-setState-orange', 'orange'],0
      // pending state has been applied0
      ['render', 'orange'],0
      ['componentDidMount-start', 'orange'],0
      // setState-sunrise and setState-orange should be called here,0
      // after the bug in #17400
      // componentDidMount() called setState({color:'yellow'}), which is async.0
      // The update doesn't happen until the next flush.0
      ['componentDidMount-end', 'orange'],0
      ['setState-sunrise', 'orange'],0
      ['setState-orange', 'orange'],0
      ['initial-callback', 'orange'],0
      ['shouldComponentUpdate-currentState', 'orange'],0
      ['shouldComponentUpdate-nextState', 'yellow'],0
      ['componentWillUpdate-currentState', 'orange'],0
      ['componentWillUpdate-nextState', 'yellow'],0
      ['render', 'yellow'],0
      ['componentDidUpdate-currentState', 'yellow'],0
      ['componentDidUpdate-prevState', 'orange'],0
      ['setState-yellow', 'yellow'],0
      ['componentWillReceiveProps-start', 'yellow'],0
      // setState({color:'green'}) only enqueues a pending state.0
      ['componentWillReceiveProps-end', 'yellow'],0
      // pending state queue is processed0
      // We keep updates in the queue to support0
      // replaceState(prevState => newState).0
      ['before-setState-receiveProps', 'yellow'],0
      ['before-setState-again-receiveProps', undefined],0
      ['after-setState-receiveProps', 'green'],0
      ['shouldComponentUpdate-currentState', 'yellow'],0
      ['shouldComponentUpdate-nextState', 'green'],0
      ['componentWillUpdate-currentState', 'yellow'],0
      ['componentWillUpdate-nextState', 'green'],0
      ['render', 'green'],0
      ['componentDidUpdate-currentState', 'green'],0
      ['componentDidUpdate-prevState', 'yellow'],0
      ['setState-receiveProps', 'green'],0
      ['setProps', 'green'],0
      // setFavoriteColor('blue')0
      ['shouldComponentUpdate-currentState', 'green'],0
      ['shouldComponentUpdate-nextState', 'blue'],0
      ['componentWillUpdate-currentState', 'green'],0
      ['componentWillUpdate-nextState', 'blue'],0
      ['render', 'blue'],0
      ['componentDidUpdate-currentState', 'blue'],0
      ['componentDidUpdate-prevState', 'green'],0
      ['setFavoriteColor', 'blue'],0
      // forceUpdate()0
      ['componentWillUpdate-currentState', 'blue'],0
      ['componentWillUpdate-nextState', 'blue'],0
      ['render', 'blue'],0
      ['componentDidUpdate-currentState', 'blue'],0
      ['componentDidUpdate-prevState', 'blue'],0
      ['forceUpdate', 'blue'],0
      // unmountComponent()0
      // state is available within `componentWillUnmount()`0
      ['componentWillUnmount', 'blue'],0
    ];0
0
    expect(stateListener.mock.calls.join('\n')).toEqual(expected.join('\n'));0
  });0
0
  it('should call componentDidUpdate of children first', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    let ops = [];0
0
    let child = null;0
    let parent = null;0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      state = {bar: false};0
      componentDidMount() {0
        child = this;0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('child did update');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let shouldUpdate = true;0
0
    class Intermediate extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return shouldUpdate;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <Child />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      state = {foo: false};0
      componentDidMount() {0
        parent = this;0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('parent did update');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <Intermediate />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent />, container);0
0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(() => {0
      parent.setState({foo: true});0
      child.setState({bar: true});0
    });0
    // When we render changes top-down in a batch, children's componentDidUpdate0
    // happens before the parent.0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['child did update', 'parent did update']);0
0
    shouldUpdate = false;0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(() => {0
      parent.setState({foo: false});0
      child.setState({bar: false});0
    });0
    // We expect the same thing to happen if we bail out in the middle.0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['child did update', 'parent did update']);0
  });0
0
  it('should batch unmounts', () => {0
    let outer;0
0
    class Inner extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        // This should get silently ignored (maybe with a warning), but it0
        // shouldn't break React.0
        outer.setState({showInner: false});0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Outer extends React.Component {0
      state = {showInner: true};0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.state.showInner && <Inner />}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    outer = ReactDOM.render(<Outer />, container);0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    }).not.toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should update state when called from child cWRP', function() {0
    const log = [];0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      state = {value: 'one'};0
      render() {0
        log.push('parent render ' + this.state.value);0
        return <Child parent={this} value={this.state.value} />;0
      }0
    }0
    let updated = false;0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {0
        if (updated) {0
          return;0
        }0
        log.push('child componentWillReceiveProps ' + this.props.value);0
        this.props.parent.setState({value: 'two'});0
        log.push('child componentWillReceiveProps done ' + this.props.value);0
        updated = true;0
      }0
      render() {0
        log.push('child render ' + this.props.value);0
        return <div>{this.props.value}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent />, container);0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent />, container);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'parent render one',0
      'child render one',0
      'parent render one',0
      'child componentWillReceiveProps one',0
      'child componentWillReceiveProps done one',0
      'child render one',0
      'parent render two',0
      'child render two',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should merge state when sCU returns false', function() {0
    const log = [];0
    class Test extends React.Component {0
      state = {a: 0};0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps, nextState) {0
        log.push(0
          'scu from ' +0
            Object.keys(this.state) +0
            ' to ' +0
            Object.keys(nextState),0
        );0
        return false;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const test = ReactDOM.render(<Test />, container);0
    test.setState({b: 0});0
    expect(log.length).toBe(1);0
    test.setState({c: 0});0
    expect(log.length).toBe(2);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['scu from a to a,b', 'scu from a,b to a,b,c']);0
  });0
0
  it('should treat assigning to this.state inside cWRP as a replaceState, with a warning', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
    class Test extends React.Component {0
      state = {step: 1, extra: true};0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {0
        this.setState({step: 2}, () => {0
          // Tests that earlier setState callbacks are not dropped0
          ops.push(0
            `callback -- step: ${this.state.step}, extra: ${!!this.state0
              .extra}`,0
          );0
        });0
        // Treat like replaceState0
        this.state = {step: 3};0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push(0
          `render -- step: ${this.state.step}, extra: ${!!this.state.extra}`,0
        );0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    // Mount0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Test />, container);0
    // Update0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Test />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Test.componentWillReceiveProps(): Assigning directly to ' +0
        "this.state is deprecated (except inside a component's constructor). " +0
        'Use setState instead.',0
    );0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'render -- step: 1, extra: true',0
      'render -- step: 3, extra: false',0
      'callback -- step: 3, extra: false',0
    ]);0
0
    // Check deduplication; (no additional warnings are expected)0
    ReactDOM.render(<Test />, container);0
  });0
0
  it('should treat assigning to this.state inside cWM as a replaceState, with a warning', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
    class Test extends React.Component {0
      state = {step: 1, extra: true};0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        this.setState({step: 2}, () => {0
          // Tests that earlier setState callbacks are not dropped0
          ops.push(0
            `callback -- step: ${this.state.step}, extra: ${!!this.state0
              .extra}`,0
          );0
        });0
        // Treat like replaceState0
        this.state = {step: 3};0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push(0
          `render -- step: ${this.state.step}, extra: ${!!this.state.extra}`,0
        );0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    // Mount0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Test />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Test.componentWillMount(): Assigning directly to ' +0
        "this.state is deprecated (except inside a component's constructor). " +0
        'Use setState instead.',0
    );0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'render -- step: 3, extra: false',0
      'callback -- step: 3, extra: false',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should support stateful module pattern components', () => {0
    function Child() {0
      return {0
        state: {0
          count: 123,0
        },0
        render() {0
          return <div>{`count:${this.state.count}`}</div>;0
        },0
      };0
    }0
0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Child />, el);0
0
    expect(el.textContent).toBe('count:123');0
  });0
0
  it('should support getDerivedStateFromProps for module pattern components', () => {0
    function Child() {0
      return {0
        state: {0
          count: 1,0
        },0
        render() {0
          return <div>{`count:${this.state.count}`}</div>;0
        },0
      };0
    }0
    Child.getDerivedStateFromProps = (props, prevState) => {0
      return {0
        count: prevState.count + props.incrementBy,0
      };0
    };0
0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Child incrementBy={0} />, el);0
    expect(el.textContent).toBe('count:1');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Child incrementBy={2} />, el);0
    expect(el.textContent).toBe('count:3');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Child incrementBy={1} />, el);0
    expect(el.textContent).toBe('count:4');0
  });0
});0

  it('allows a DOM element to be used with a string', () => {0
    const element = React.createElement('div', {className: 'foo'});0
    const node = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(element);0
    expect(node.tagName).toBe('DIV');0

  it('should allow children to be passed as an argument', () => {0
    const argNode = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      React.createElement('div', null, 'child'),0
    );0
    expect(argNode.innerHTML).toBe('child');0
  });0

  it('should overwrite props.children with children argument', () => {0
    const conflictNode = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      React.createElement('div', {children: 'fakechild'}, 'child'),0
    );0
    expect(conflictNode.innerHTML).toBe('child');0
  });0

  /**0
   * We need to make sure that updates occur to the actual node that's in the0
   * DOM, instead of a stale cache.0
   */0
  it('should purge the DOM cache when removing nodes', () => {0
    let myDiv = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <div>0
        <div key="theDog" className="dog" />,0
        <div key="theBird" className="bird" />0
      </div>,0
    );0
    // Warm the cache with theDog0
    myDiv = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <div>0
        <div key="theDog" className="dogbeforedelete" />,0
        <div key="theBird" className="bird" />,0
      </div>,0
    );0
    // Remove theDog - this should purge the cache0
    myDiv = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <div>0
        <div key="theBird" className="bird" />,0
      </div>,0
    );0
    // Now, put theDog back. It's now a different DOM node.0
    myDiv = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <div>0
        <div key="theDog" className="dog" />,0
        <div key="theBird" className="bird" />,0
      </div>,0
    );0
    // Change the className of theDog. It will use the same element0
    myDiv = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <div>0
        <div key="theDog" className="bigdog" />,0
        <div key="theBird" className="bird" />,0
      </div>,0
    );0
    const dog = myDiv.childNodes[0];0
    expect(dog.className).toBe('bigdog');0
  });0
0
  it('throws in render() if the mount callback is not a function', () => {0
    function Foo() {0
      this.a = 1;0
      this.b = 2;0
    }0
0
    class A extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const myDiv = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactDOM.render(<A />, myDiv, 'no');0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'render(...): Expected the last optional `callback` argument to be ' +0
          'a function. Instead received: no.',0
      );0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'Invalid argument passed as callback. Expected a function. Instead ' +0
        'received: no',0
    );0
0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactDOM.render(<A />, myDiv, {foo: 'bar'});0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'render(...): Expected the last optional `callback` argument to be ' +0
          'a function. Instead received: [object Object].',0
      );0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'Invalid argument passed as callback. Expected a function. Instead ' +0
        'received: [object Object]',0
    );0
0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactDOM.render(<A />, myDiv, new Foo());0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'render(...): Expected the last optional `callback` argument to be ' +0
          'a function. Instead received: [object Object].',0
      );0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'Invalid argument passed as callback. Expected a function. Instead ' +0
        'received: [object Object]',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('throws in render() if the update callback is not a function', () => {0
    function Foo() {0
      this.a = 1;0
      this.b = 2;0
    }0
0
    class A extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const myDiv = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<A />, myDiv);0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactDOM.render(<A />, myDiv, 'no');0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'render(...): Expected the last optional `callback` argument to be ' +0
          'a function. Instead received: no.',0
      );0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'Invalid argument passed as callback. Expected a function. Instead ' +0
        'received: no',0
    );0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<A />, myDiv); // Re-mount0
    expect(() => {0

        ReactDOM.render(<A />, myDiv, {foo: 'bar'});0

          'a function. Instead received: [object Object].',0
