        'received: [object Object]',0
    );0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<A />, myDiv); // Re-mount0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactDOM.render(<A />, myDiv, new Foo());0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'render(...): Expected the last optional `callback` argument to be ' +0
          'a function. Instead received: [object Object].',0
      );0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'Invalid argument passed as callback. Expected a function. Instead ' +0
        'received: [object Object]',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('preserves focus', () => {0
    let input;0
    let input2;0
    class A extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <input id="one" ref={r => (input = input || r)} />0
            {this.props.showTwo && (0
              <input id="two" ref={r => (input2 = input2 || r)} />0
            )}0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        // Focus should have been restored to the original input0
        expect(document.activeElement.id).toBe('one');0
        input2.focus();0
        expect(document.activeElement.id).toBe('two');0
        log.push('input2 focused');0
      }0
    }0
0
    const log = [];0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
    try {0
      ReactDOM.render(<A showTwo={false} />, container);0
      input.focus();0
0
      // When the second input is added, let's simulate losing focus, which is0
      // something that could happen when manipulating DOM nodes (but is hard to0
      // deterministically force without relying intensely on React DOM0
      // implementation details)0
      const div = container.firstChild;0
      ['appendChild', 'insertBefore'].forEach(name => {0
        const mutator = div[name];0
        div[name] = function() {0
          if (input) {0
            input.blur();0
            expect(document.activeElement.tagName).toBe('BODY');0
            log.push('input2 inserted');0
          }0
          return mutator.apply(this, arguments);0
        };0
      });0
0
      expect(document.activeElement.id).toBe('one');0
      ReactDOM.render(<A showTwo={true} />, container);0
      // input2 gets added, which causes input to get blurred. Then0
      // componentDidUpdate focuses input2 and that should make it down to here,0
      // not get overwritten by focus restoration.0
      expect(document.activeElement.id).toBe('two');0
      expect(log).toEqual(['input2 inserted', 'input2 focused']);0
    } finally {0
      document.body.removeChild(container);0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('calls focus() on autoFocus elements after they have been mounted to the DOM', () => {0
    const originalFocus = HTMLElement.prototype.focus;0
0
    try {0
      let focusedElement;0
      let inputFocusedAfterMount = false;0
0
      // This test needs to determine that focus is called after mount.0
      // Can't check document.activeElement because PhantomJS is too permissive;0
      // It doesn't require element to be in the DOM to be focused.0
      HTMLElement.prototype.focus = function() {0
        focusedElement = this;0
        inputFocusedAfterMount = !!this.parentNode;0
      };0
0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      document.body.appendChild(container);0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div>0
          <h1>Auto-focus Test</h1>0
          <input autoFocus={true} />0
          <p>The above input should be focused after mount.</p>0
        </div>,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      expect(inputFocusedAfterMount).toBe(true);0
      expect(focusedElement.tagName).toBe('INPUT');0
    } finally {0
      HTMLElement.prototype.focus = originalFocus;0
    }0
  });0
0
  it("shouldn't fire duplicate event handler while handling other nested dispatch", () => {0
    const actual = [];0
0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.ref1.click();0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <div0
              onClick={() => {0
                actual.push('1st node clicked');0
                this.ref2.click();0
              }}0
              ref={ref => (this.ref1 = ref)}0
            />0
            <div0
              onClick={ref => {0
                actual.push("2nd node clicked imperatively from 1st's handler");0
              }}0
              ref={ref => (this.ref2 = ref)}0
            />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
    try {0
      ReactDOM.render(<Wrapper />, container);0
0
      const expected = [0
        '1st node clicked',0
        "2nd node clicked imperatively from 1st's handler",0
      ];0
      expect(actual).toEqual(expected);0
    } finally {0
      document.body.removeChild(container);0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('should not crash with devtools installed', () => {0
    try {0
      global.__REACT_DEVTOOLS_GLOBAL_HOOK__ = {0
        inject: function() {},0
        onCommitFiberRoot: function() {},0
        onCommitFiberUnmount: function() {},0
        supportsFiber: true,0
      };0
      jest.resetModules();0
      React = require('react');0
      ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
      class Component extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <div />;0
        }0
      }0
      ReactDOM.render(<Component />, document.createElement('container'));0
    } finally {0
      delete global.__REACT_DEVTOOLS_GLOBAL_HOOK__;0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('should not crash calling findDOMNode inside a functional component', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />);0
    const App = () => {0
      ReactDOM.findDOMNode(instance);0
      return <div />;0
    };0
0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      ReactDOM.render(<App />, container);0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('throws in DEV if jsdom is destroyed by the time setState() is called', () => {0
    class App extends React.Component {0
      state = {x: 1};0
      componentDidUpdate() {}0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(<App />, container);0
    const documentDescriptor = Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(0
      global,0
      'document',0
    );0
    try {0
      // Emulate jsdom environment cleanup.0
      // This is roughly what happens if the test finished and then0
      // an asynchronous callback tried to setState() after this.0
      delete global.document;0
0
      // The error we're interested in is thrown by invokeGuardedCallback, which0
      // in DEV is used 1) to replay a failed begin phase, or 2) when calling0
      // lifecycle methods. We're triggering the second case here.0
      const fn = () => instance.setState({x: 2});0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        expect(fn).toThrow(0
          'The `document` global was defined when React was initialized, but is not ' +0
            'defined anymore. This can happen in a test environment if a component ' +0
            'schedules an update from an asynchronous callback, but the test has already ' +0
            'finished running. To solve this, you can either unmount the component at ' +0
            'the end of your test (and ensure that any asynchronous operations get ' +0
            'canceled in `componentWillUnmount`), or you can change the test itself ' +0
            'to be asynchronous.',0
        );0
      } else {0
        expect(fn).not.toThrow();0
      }0
    } finally {0
      // Don't break other tests.0
      Object.defineProperty(global, 'document', documentDescriptor);0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('warns when requestAnimationFrame is not polyfilled in the browser', () => {0
    const previousRAF = global.requestAnimationFrame;0
    try {0
      global.requestAnimationFrame = undefined;0
      jest.resetModules();0
      expect(() => require('react-dom')).toWarnDev(0
        "This browser doesn't support requestAnimationFrame.",0
      );0
    } finally {0
      global.requestAnimationFrame = previousRAF;0
    }0
  });0
0
  // We're just testing importing, not using it.0
  // It is important because even isomorphic components may import it.0
  it('can import findDOMNode in Node environment', () => {0
    const previousRAF = global.requestAnimationFrame;0
    const previousRIC = global.requestIdleCallback;0
    const prevWindow = global.window;0
    try {0
      global.requestAnimationFrame = undefined;0
      global.requestIdleCallback = undefined;0
      // Simulate the Node environment:0
      delete global.window;0
      jest.resetModules();0
      expect(() => {0
        require('react-dom');0
      }).not.toThrow();0
    } finally {0
      global.requestAnimationFrame = previousRAF;0
      global.requestIdleCallback = previousRIC;0
      global.window = prevWindow;0
    }0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
describe('ReactDOM unknown attribute', () => {0
  let React;0
  let ReactDOM;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
  });0
0
  function testUnknownAttributeRemoval(givenValue) {0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<div unknown="something" />, el);0
    expect(el.firstChild.getAttribute('unknown')).toBe('something');0
    ReactDOM.render(<div unknown={givenValue} />, el);0
    expect(el.firstChild.hasAttribute('unknown')).toBe(false);0
  }0
0
  function testUnknownAttributeAssignment(givenValue, expectedDOMValue) {0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<div unknown="something" />, el);0
    expect(el.firstChild.getAttribute('unknown')).toBe('something');0
    ReactDOM.render(<div unknown={givenValue} />, el);0
    expect(el.firstChild.getAttribute('unknown')).toBe(expectedDOMValue);0
  }0
0
  describe('unknown attributes', () => {0
    it('removes values null and undefined', () => {0
      testUnknownAttributeRemoval(null);0
      testUnknownAttributeRemoval(undefined);0
    });0
0
    it('changes values true, false to null, and also warns once', () => {0
      expect(() => testUnknownAttributeAssignment(true, null)).toWarnDev(0
        'Received `true` for a non-boolean attribute `unknown`.\n\n' +0
          'If you want to write it to the DOM, pass a string instead: ' +0
          'unknown="true" or unknown={value.toString()}.\n' +0
          '    in div (at **)',0
      );0
      testUnknownAttributeAssignment(false, null);0
    });0
0
    it('removes unknown attributes that were rendered but are now missing', () => {0
      const el = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div unknown="something" />, el);0
      expect(el.firstChild.getAttribute('unknown')).toBe('something');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div />, el);0
      expect(el.firstChild.hasAttribute('unknown')).toBe(false);0
    });0
0
    it('passes through strings', () => {0
      testUnknownAttributeAssignment('a string', 'a string');0
    });0
0
    it('coerces numbers to strings', () => {0
      testUnknownAttributeAssignment(0, '0');0
      testUnknownAttributeAssignment(-1, '-1');0
      testUnknownAttributeAssignment(42, '42');0
      testUnknownAttributeAssignment(9000.99, '9000.99');0
    });0
0
    it('coerces NaN to strings and warns', () => {0
      expect(() => testUnknownAttributeAssignment(NaN, 'NaN')).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Received NaN for the `unknown` attribute. ' +0
          'If this is expected, cast the value to a string.\n' +0
          '    in div (at **)',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('coerces objects to strings and warns', () => {0
      const lol = {0
        toString() {0
          return 'lol';0
        },0
      };0
0
      testUnknownAttributeAssignment({hello: 'world'}, '[object Object]');0
      testUnknownAttributeAssignment(lol, 'lol');0
    });0
0
    it('removes symbols and warns', () => {0
      expect(() => testUnknownAttributeRemoval(Symbol('foo'))).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid value for prop `unknown` on <div> tag. Either remove it ' +0
          'from the element, or pass a string or number value to keep it ' +0
          'in the DOM. For details, see https://fb.me/react-attribute-behavior\n' +0
          '    in div (at **)',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('removes functions and warns', () => {0
      expect(() =>0
        testUnknownAttributeRemoval(function someFunction() {}),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid value for prop `unknown` on <div> tag. Either remove ' +0
          'it from the element, or pass a string or number value to ' +0
          'keep it in the DOM. For details, see ' +0
          'https://fb.me/react-attribute-behavior\n' +0
          '    in div (at **)',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('allows camelCase unknown attributes and warns', () => {0
      const el = document.createElement('div');0
0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOM.render(<div helloWorld="something" />, el),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'React does not recognize the `helloWorld` prop on a DOM element. ' +0
          'If you intentionally want it to appear in the DOM as a custom ' +0
          'attribute, spell it as lowercase `helloworld` instead. ' +0
          'If you accidentally passed it from a parent component, remove ' +0
          'it from the DOM element.\n' +0
          '    in div (at **)',0
      );0
0
      expect(el.firstChild.getAttribute('helloworld')).toBe('something');0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
describe('ReactDOMComponent', () => {0
  let React;0
  let ReactTestUtils;0
  let ReactDOM;0
  let ReactDOMServer;0
0
  function normalizeCodeLocInfo(str) {0
    return str && str.replace(/\(at .+?:\d+\)/g, '(at **)');0
  }0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
  });0
0
  describe('updateDOM', () => {0
    it('should handle className', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={{}} />, container);0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div className={'foo'} />, container);0
      expect(container.firstChild.className).toEqual('foo');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div className={'bar'} />, container);0
      expect(container.firstChild.className).toEqual('bar');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div className={null} />, container);0
      expect(container.firstChild.className).toEqual('');0
    });0
0
    it('should gracefully handle various style value types', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={{}} />, container);0
      const stubStyle = container.firstChild.style;0
0
      // set initial style0
      const setup = {0
        display: 'block',0
        left: '1px',0
        top: 2,0
        fontFamily: 'Arial',0
      };0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={setup} />, container);0
      expect(stubStyle.display).toEqual('block');0
      expect(stubStyle.left).toEqual('1px');0
      expect(stubStyle.top).toEqual('2px');0
      expect(stubStyle.fontFamily).toEqual('Arial');0
0
      // reset the style to their default state0
      const reset = {display: '', left: null, top: false, fontFamily: true};0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={reset} />, container);0
      expect(stubStyle.display).toEqual('');0
      expect(stubStyle.left).toEqual('');0
      expect(stubStyle.top).toEqual('');0
      expect(stubStyle.fontFamily).toEqual('');0
    });0
0
    it('should not update styles when mutating a proxy style object', () => {0
      const styleStore = {0
        display: 'none',0
        fontFamily: 'Arial',0
        lineHeight: 1.2,0
      };0
      // We use a proxy style object so that we can mutate it even if it is0
      // frozen in DEV.0
      const styles = {0
        get display() {0
          return styleStore.display;0
        },0
        set display(v) {0
          styleStore.display = v;0
        },0
        get fontFamily() {0
          return styleStore.fontFamily;0
        },0
        set fontFamily(v) {0
          styleStore.fontFamily = v;0
        },0
        get lineHeight() {0
          return styleStore.lineHeight;0
        },0
        set lineHeight(v) {0
          styleStore.lineHeight = v;0
        },0
      };0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={styles} />, container);0
0
      const stubStyle = container.firstChild.style;0
      stubStyle.display = styles.display;0
      stubStyle.fontFamily = styles.fontFamily;0
0
      styles.display = 'block';0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={styles} />, container);0
      expect(stubStyle.display).toEqual('none');0
      expect(stubStyle.fontFamily).toEqual('Arial');0
      expect(stubStyle.lineHeight).toEqual('1.2');0
0
      styles.fontFamily = 'Helvetica';0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={styles} />, container);0
      expect(stubStyle.display).toEqual('none');0
      expect(stubStyle.fontFamily).toEqual('Arial');0
      expect(stubStyle.lineHeight).toEqual('1.2');0
0
      styles.lineHeight = 0.5;0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={styles} />, container);0
      expect(stubStyle.display).toEqual('none');0
      expect(stubStyle.fontFamily).toEqual('Arial');0
      expect(stubStyle.lineHeight).toEqual('1.2');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={undefined} />, container);0
      expect(stubStyle.display).toBe('');0
      expect(stubStyle.fontFamily).toBe('');0
      expect(stubStyle.lineHeight).toBe('');0
    });0
0
    it('should throw when mutating style objects', () => {0
      const style = {border: '1px solid black'};0
0
      class App extends React.Component {0
        state = {style: style};0
0
        render() {0
          return <div style={this.state.style}>asd</div>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<App />);0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        expect(() => (style.position = 'absolute')).toThrow();0
      }0
    });0
0
    it('should warn for unknown prop', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOM.render(<div foo={() => {}} />, container),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid value for prop `foo` on <div> tag. Either remove it ' +0
          'from the element, or pass a string or number value to keep ' +0
          'it in the DOM. For details, see https://fb.me/react-attribute-behavior' +0
          '\n    in div (at **)',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should group multiple unknown prop warnings together', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOM.render(<div foo={() => {}} baz={() => {}} />, container),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid values for props `foo`, `baz` on <div> tag. Either remove ' +0
          'them from the element, or pass a string or number value to keep ' +0
          'them in the DOM. For details, see https://fb.me/react-attribute-behavior' +0
          '\n    in div (at **)',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should warn for onDblClick prop', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOM.render(<div onDblClick={() => {}} />, container),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid event handler property `onDblClick`. Did you mean `onDoubleClick`?\n    in div (at **)',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should warn for unknown string event handlers', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOM.render(<div onUnknown="alert(&quot;hack&quot;)" />, container),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Unknown event handler property `onUnknown`. It will be ignored.\n    in div (at **)',0
      );0
      expect(container.firstChild.hasAttribute('onUnknown')).toBe(false);0
      expect(container.firstChild.onUnknown).toBe(undefined);0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOM.render(<div onunknown="alert(&quot;hack&quot;)" />, container),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Unknown event handler property `onunknown`. It will be ignored.\n    in div (at **)',0
      );0
      expect(container.firstChild.hasAttribute('onunknown')).toBe(false);0
      expect(container.firstChild.onunknown).toBe(undefined);0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOM.render(0
          <div on-unknown="alert(&quot;hack&quot;)" />,0
          container,0
        ),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Unknown event handler property `on-unknown`. It will be ignored.\n    in div (at **)',0
      );0
      expect(container.firstChild.hasAttribute('on-unknown')).toBe(false);0
      expect(container.firstChild['on-unknown']).toBe(undefined);0
    });0
0
    it('should warn for unknown function event handlers', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOM.render(<div onUnknown={function() {}} />, container),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Unknown event handler property `onUnknown`. It will be ignored.\n    in div (at **)',0
      );0
      expect(container.firstChild.hasAttribute('onUnknown')).toBe(false);0
      expect(container.firstChild.onUnknown).toBe(undefined);0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOM.render(<div onunknown={function() {}} />, container),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Unknown event handler property `onunknown`. It will be ignored.\n    in div (at **)',0
      );0
      expect(container.firstChild.hasAttribute('onunknown')).toBe(false);0
      expect(container.firstChild.onunknown).toBe(undefined);0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOM.render(<div on-unknown={function() {}} />, container),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Unknown event handler property `on-unknown`. It will be ignored.\n    in div (at **)',0
      );0
      expect(container.firstChild.hasAttribute('on-unknown')).toBe(false);0
      expect(container.firstChild['on-unknown']).toBe(undefined);0
    });0
0
    it('should warn for badly cased React attributes', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<div CHILDREN="5" />, container)).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid DOM property `CHILDREN`. Did you mean `children`?\n    in div (at **)',0
      );0
      expect(container.firstChild.getAttribute('CHILDREN')).toBe('5');0
    });0
0
    it('should not warn for "0" as a unitless style value', () => {0
      class Component extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <div style={{margin: '0'}} />;0
        }0
      }0
0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />);0
    });0
0
    it('should warn nicely about NaN in style', () => {0
      const style = {fontSize: NaN};0
      const div = document.createElement('div');0
      expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<span style={style} />, div)).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: `NaN` is an invalid value for the `fontSize` css style property.' +0
          '\n    in span (at **)',0
      );0
      ReactDOM.render(<span style={style} />, div);0
    });0
0
    it('should update styles if initially null', () => {0
      let styles = null;0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={styles} />, container);0
0
      const stubStyle = container.firstChild.style;0
0
      styles = {display: 'block'};0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={styles} />, container);0
      expect(stubStyle.display).toEqual('block');0
    });0
0
    it('should update styles if updated to null multiple times', () => {0
      let styles = null;0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={styles} />, container);0
0
      styles = {display: 'block'};0
      const stubStyle = container.firstChild.style;0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={styles} />, container);0
      expect(stubStyle.display).toEqual('block');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={null} />, container);0
      expect(stubStyle.display).toEqual('');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={styles} />, container);0
      expect(stubStyle.display).toEqual('block');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={null} />, container);0
      expect(stubStyle.display).toEqual('');0
    });0
0
    it('should allow named slot projection on both web components and regular DOM elements', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <my-component>0
          <my-second-component slot="first" />0
          <button slot="second">Hello</button>0
        </my-component>,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      const lightDOM = container.firstChild.childNodes;0
0
      expect(lightDOM[0].getAttribute('slot')).toBe('first');0
      expect(lightDOM[1].getAttribute('slot')).toBe('second');0
    });0
0
    it('should skip reserved props on web components', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <my-component0
          children={['foo']}0
          suppressContentEditableWarning={true}0
          suppressHydrationWarning={true}0
        />,0
        container,0
      );0
      expect(container.firstChild.hasAttribute('children')).toBe(false);0
      expect(0
        container.firstChild.hasAttribute('suppressContentEditableWarning'),0
      ).toBe(false);0
      expect(0
        container.firstChild.hasAttribute('suppressHydrationWarning'),0
      ).toBe(false);0
0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <my-component0
          children={['bar']}0
          suppressContentEditableWarning={false}0
          suppressHydrationWarning={false}0
        />,0
        container,0
      );0
      expect(container.firstChild.hasAttribute('children')).toBe(false);0
      expect(0
        container.firstChild.hasAttribute('suppressContentEditableWarning'),0
      ).toBe(false);0
      expect(0
        container.firstChild.hasAttribute('suppressHydrationWarning'),0
      ).toBe(false);0
    });0
0
    it('should skip dangerouslySetInnerHTML on web components', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <my-component dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: 'hi'}} />,0
        container,0
      );0
      expect(container.firstChild.hasAttribute('dangerouslySetInnerHTML')).toBe(0
        false,0
      );0
0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <my-component dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: 'bye'}} />,0
        container,0
      );0
      expect(container.firstChild.hasAttribute('dangerouslySetInnerHTML')).toBe(0
        false,0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should render null and undefined as empty but print other falsy values', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: 'textContent'}} />,0
        container,0
      );0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('textContent');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: 0}} />, container);0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('0');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: false}} />,0
        container,0
      );0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('false');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: ''}} />,0
        container,0
      );0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: null}} />,0
        container,0
      );0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: undefined}} />,0
        container,0
      );0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('');0
    });0
0
    it('should remove attributes', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<img height="17" />, container);0
0
      expect(container.firstChild.hasAttribute('height')).toBe(true);0
      ReactDOM.render(<img />, container);0
      expect(container.firstChild.hasAttribute('height')).toBe(false);0
    });0
0
    it('should remove properties', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div className="monkey" />, container);0
0
      expect(container.firstChild.className).toEqual('monkey');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div />, container);0
      expect(container.firstChild.className).toEqual('');0
    });0
0
    it('should not set null/undefined attributes', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      // Initial render.0
      ReactDOM.render(<img src={null} data-foo={undefined} />, container);0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('src')).toBe(false);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('data-foo')).toBe(false);0
      // Update in one direction.0
      ReactDOM.render(<img src={undefined} data-foo={null} />, container);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('src')).toBe(false);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('data-foo')).toBe(false);0
      // Update in another direction.0
      ReactDOM.render(<img src={null} data-foo={undefined} />, container);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('src')).toBe(false);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('data-foo')).toBe(false);0
      // Removal.0
      ReactDOM.render(<img />, container);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('src')).toBe(false);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('data-foo')).toBe(false);0
      // Addition.0
      ReactDOM.render(<img src={undefined} data-foo={null} />, container);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('src')).toBe(false);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('data-foo')).toBe(false);0
    });0
0
    it('should apply React-specific aliases to HTML elements', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<form acceptCharset="foo" />, container);0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
      // Test attribute initialization.0
      expect(node.getAttribute('accept-charset')).toBe('foo');0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('acceptCharset')).toBe(false);0
      // Test attribute update.0
      ReactDOM.render(<form acceptCharset="boo" />, container);0
      expect(node.getAttribute('accept-charset')).toBe('boo');0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('acceptCharset')).toBe(false);0
      // Test attribute removal by setting to null.0
      ReactDOM.render(<form acceptCharset={null} />, container);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('accept-charset')).toBe(false);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('acceptCharset')).toBe(false);0
      // Restore.0
      ReactDOM.render(<form acceptCharset="foo" />, container);0
      expect(node.getAttribute('accept-charset')).toBe('foo');0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('acceptCharset')).toBe(false);0
      // Test attribute removal by setting to undefined.0
      ReactDOM.render(<form acceptCharset={undefined} />, container);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('accept-charset')).toBe(false);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('acceptCharset')).toBe(false);0
      // Restore.0
      ReactDOM.render(<form acceptCharset="foo" />, container);0
      expect(node.getAttribute('accept-charset')).toBe('foo');0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('acceptCharset')).toBe(false);0
      // Test attribute removal.0
      ReactDOM.render(<form />, container);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('accept-charset')).toBe(false);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('acceptCharset')).toBe(false);0
    });0
0
    it('should apply React-specific aliases to SVG elements', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<svg arabicForm="foo" />, container);0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
      // Test attribute initialization.0
      expect(node.getAttribute('arabic-form')).toBe('foo');0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('arabicForm')).toBe(false);0
      // Test attribute update.0
      ReactDOM.render(<svg arabicForm="boo" />, container);0
      expect(node.getAttribute('arabic-form')).toBe('boo');0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('arabicForm')).toBe(false);0
      // Test attribute removal by setting to null.0
      ReactDOM.render(<svg arabicForm={null} />, container);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('arabic-form')).toBe(false);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('arabicForm')).toBe(false);0
      // Restore.0
      ReactDOM.render(<svg arabicForm="foo" />, container);0
      expect(node.getAttribute('arabic-form')).toBe('foo');0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('arabicForm')).toBe(false);0
      // Test attribute removal by setting to undefined.0
      ReactDOM.render(<svg arabicForm={undefined} />, container);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('arabic-form')).toBe(false);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('arabicForm')).toBe(false);0
      // Restore.0
      ReactDOM.render(<svg arabicForm="foo" />, container);0
      expect(node.getAttribute('arabic-form')).toBe('foo');0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('arabicForm')).toBe(false);0
      // Test attribute removal.0
      ReactDOM.render(<svg />, container);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('arabic-form')).toBe(false);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('arabicForm')).toBe(false);0
    });0
0
    it('should properly update custom attributes on custom elements', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<some-custom-element foo="bar" />, container);0
      ReactDOM.render(<some-custom-element bar="buzz" />, container);0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('foo')).toBe(false);0
      expect(node.getAttribute('bar')).toBe('buzz');0
    });0
0
    it('should not apply React-specific aliases to custom elements', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<some-custom-element arabicForm="foo" />, container);0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
      // Should not get transformed to arabic-form as SVG would be.0
      expect(node.getAttribute('arabicForm')).toBe('foo');0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('arabic-form')).toBe(false);0
      // Test attribute update.0
      ReactDOM.render(<some-custom-element arabicForm="boo" />, container);0
      expect(node.getAttribute('arabicForm')).toBe('boo');0
      // Test attribute removal and addition.0
      ReactDOM.render(<some-custom-element acceptCharset="buzz" />, container);0
      // Verify the previous attribute was removed.0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('arabicForm')).toBe(false);0
      // Should not get transformed to accept-charset as HTML would be.0
      expect(node.getAttribute('acceptCharset')).toBe('buzz');0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('accept-charset')).toBe(false);0
    });0
0
    it('should clear a single style prop when changing `style`', () => {0
      let styles = {display: 'none', color: 'red'};0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={styles} />, container);0
0
      const stubStyle = container.firstChild.style;0
0
      styles = {color: 'green'};0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={styles} />, container);0
      expect(stubStyle.display).toEqual('');0
      expect(stubStyle.color).toEqual('green');0
    });0
0
    it('should reject attribute key injection attack on markup', () => {0
      expect(() => {0
        for (let i = 0; i < 3; i++) {0
          const container = document.createElement('div');0
          const element = React.createElement(0
            'x-foo-component',0
            {'blah" onclick="beevil" noise="hi': 'selected'},0
            null,0
          );0
          ReactDOM.render(element, container);0
        }0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid attribute name: `blah" onclick="beevil" noise="hi`',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should reject attribute key injection attack on update', () => {0
      expect(() => {0
        for (let i = 0; i < 3; i++) {0
          const container = document.createElement('div');0
          const beforeUpdate = React.createElement('x-foo-component', {}, null);0
          ReactDOM.render(beforeUpdate, container);0
0
          const afterUpdate = React.createElement(0
            'x-foo-component',0
            {'blah" onclick="beevil" noise="hi': 'selected'},0
            null,0
          );0
          ReactDOM.render(afterUpdate, container);0
        }0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid attribute name: `blah" onclick="beevil" noise="hi`',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should update arbitrary attributes for tags containing dashes', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
      const beforeUpdate = React.createElement('x-foo-component', {}, null);0
      ReactDOM.render(beforeUpdate, container);0
0
      const afterUpdate = <x-foo-component myattr="myval" />;0
      ReactDOM.render(afterUpdate, container);0
0
      expect(container.childNodes[0].getAttribute('myattr')).toBe('myval');0
    });0

    it('should clear all the styles when removing `style`', () => {0

      ReactDOM.render(<div />, container);0
      expect(stubStyle.display).toEqual('');0
      expect(stubStyle.color).toEqual('');0
    });0

    it('should update styles when `style` changes from null to object', () => {0

      const styles = {color: 'red'};0

      ReactDOM.render(<div />, container);0
      ReactDOM.render(<div style={styles} />, container);0
0
      const stubStyle = container.firstChild.style;0
      expect(stubStyle.color).toEqual('red');0
    });0
0
    it('should not reset innerHTML for when children is null', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div />, container);0
      container.firstChild.innerHTML = 'bonjour';0
      expect(container.firstChild.innerHTML).toEqual('bonjour');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div />, container);0
      expect(container.firstChild.innerHTML).toEqual('bonjour');0
    });0
0
    it('should reset innerHTML when switching from a direct text child to an empty child', () => {0
      const transitionToValues = [null, undefined, false];0
      transitionToValues.forEach(transitionToValue => {0
        const container = document.createElement('div');0
        ReactDOM.render(<div>bonjour</div>, container);0
        expect(container.firstChild.innerHTML).toEqual('bonjour');0
0
        ReactDOM.render(<div>{transitionToValue}</div>, container);0
        expect(container.firstChild.innerHTML).toEqual('');0
      });0
    });0
0
    it('should empty element when removing innerHTML', () => {0

      );0

      ReactDOM.render(<div />, container);0
      expect(container.firstChild.innerHTML).toEqual('');0
    });0

    it('should transition from string content to innerHTML', () => {0

      ReactDOM.render(<div>hello</div>, container);0
0
      expect(container.firstChild.innerHTML).toEqual('hello');0

        container,0
      );0
      expect(container.firstChild.innerHTML).toEqual('goodbye');0
    });0

    it('should transition from innerHTML to string content', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(0

        container,0
      );0

    });0

    it('should transition from innerHTML to children in nested el', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0

    it('should transition from children to innerHTML in nested el', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div>0
          <div>0
            <span>adieu</span>0
          </div>0
        </div>,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('adieu');0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div>0
          <div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: 'bonjour'}} />0
        </div>,0
        container,0
      );0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('bonjour');0
    });0
0
    it('should not incur unnecessary DOM mutations for attributes', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div id="" />, container);0
0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
      const nodeSetAttribute = node.setAttribute;0
      node.setAttribute = jest.fn();0
      node.setAttribute.mockImplementation(nodeSetAttribute);0
0
      const nodeRemoveAttribute = node.removeAttribute;0
      node.removeAttribute = jest.fn();0
      node.removeAttribute.mockImplementation(nodeRemoveAttribute);0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div id="" />, container);0
      expect(node.setAttribute).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
      expect(node.removeAttribute).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div id="foo" />, container);0
      expect(node.setAttribute).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
      expect(node.removeAttribute).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div id="foo" />, container);0
      expect(node.setAttribute).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
      expect(node.removeAttribute).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div />, container);0
      expect(node.setAttribute).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
      expect(node.removeAttribute).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div id="" />, container);0
      expect(node.setAttribute).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
      expect(node.removeAttribute).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div />, container);0
      expect(node.setAttribute).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
      expect(node.removeAttribute).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
    });0
0
    it('should not incur unnecessary DOM mutations for string properties', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div value="" />, container);0
0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
0
      const nodeValueSetter = jest.fn();0
0
      const oldSetAttribute = node.setAttribute.bind(node);0
      node.setAttribute = function(key, value) {0
        oldSetAttribute(key, value);0
        nodeValueSetter(key, value);0
      };0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div value="foo" />, container);0
      expect(nodeValueSetter).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div value="foo" />, container);0
      expect(nodeValueSetter).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div />, container);0
      expect(nodeValueSetter).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div value={null} />, container);0
      expect(nodeValueSetter).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div value="" />, container);0
      expect(nodeValueSetter).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div />, container);0
      expect(nodeValueSetter).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
    });0
0
    it('should not incur unnecessary DOM mutations for boolean properties', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div checked={true} />, container);0
0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
      let nodeValue = true;0
      const nodeValueSetter = jest.fn();0
      Object.defineProperty(node, 'checked', {0
        get: function() {0
          return nodeValue;0
        },0
        set: nodeValueSetter.mockImplementation(function(newValue) {0
          nodeValue = newValue;0
        }),0
      });0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div checked={true} />, container);0
      expect(nodeValueSetter).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div />, container);0
      expect(nodeValueSetter).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div checked={false} />, container);0
      expect(nodeValueSetter).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div checked={true} />, container);0
      expect(nodeValueSetter).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(3);0
    });0
0
    it('should ignore attribute whitelist for elements with the "is" attribute', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<button is="test" cowabunga="chevynova" />, container);0
      expect(container.firstChild.hasAttribute('cowabunga')).toBe(true);0
    });0
0
    it('should warn about non-string "is" attribute', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOM.render(<button is={function() {}} />, container),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Received a `function` for a string attribute `is`. If this is expected, cast ' +0
          'the value to a string.',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should not update when switching between null/undefined', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      const node = ReactDOM.render(<div />, container);0
0
      const setter = jest.fn();0
      node.setAttribute = setter;0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div dir={null} />, container);0
      ReactDOM.render(<div dir={undefined} />, container);0
      ReactDOM.render(<div />, container);0
      expect(setter).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
      ReactDOM.render(<div dir="ltr" />, container);0
      expect(setter).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    });0
0
    it('handles multiple child updates without interference', () => {0
      // This test might look like it's just testing ReactMultiChild but the0
      // last bug in this was actually in DOMChildrenOperations so this test0
      // needs to be in some DOM-specific test file.0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
      // ABCD0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div>0
          <div key="one">0
            <div key="A">A</div>0
            <div key="B">B</div>0
          </div>0
          <div key="two">0
            <div key="C">C</div>0
            <div key="D">D</div>0
          </div>0
        </div>,0
        container,0
      );0
      // BADC0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div>0
          <div key="one">0
            <div key="B">B</div>0
            <div key="A">A</div>0
          </div>0
          <div key="two">0
            <div key="D">D</div>0
            <div key="C">C</div>0
          </div>0
        </div>,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      expect(container.textContent).toBe('BADC');0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('createOpenTagMarkup', () => {0
    function quoteRegexp(str) {0
      return (str + '').replace(/([.?*+\^$\[\]\\(){}|-])/g, '\\$1');0
    }0
0
    function toHaveAttribute(actual, expected) {0
      const [attr, value] = expected;0
      let re = '(?:^|\\s)' + attr + '=[\\\'"]';0
      if (typeof value !== 'undefined') {0
        re += quoteRegexp(value) + '[\\\'"]';0
      }0
      return new RegExp(re).test(actual);0
    }0
0
    function genMarkup(props) {0
      return ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<div {...props} />);0
    }0
0
    it('should generate the correct markup with className', () => {0
      expect(toHaveAttribute(genMarkup({className: 'a'}), ['class', 'a']));0
      expect(toHaveAttribute(genMarkup({className: 'a b'}), ['class', 'a b']));0
      expect(toHaveAttribute(genMarkup({className: ''}), ['class', '']));0
    });0
0
    it('should escape style names and values', () => {0
      expect(0
        toHaveAttribute(0
          genMarkup({0
            style: {'b&ckground': '<3'},0
          }),0
          ['style', 'b&amp;ckground:&lt;3;'],0
        ),0
      );0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('createContentMarkup', () => {0
    function quoteRegexp(str) {0
      return (str + '').replace(/([.?*+\^$\[\]\\(){}|-])/g, '\\$1');0
    }0
0
    function genMarkup(props) {0
      return ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<div {...props} />);0
    }0
0
    function toHaveInnerhtml(actual, expected) {0
      const re = '^' + quoteRegexp(expected) + '$';0
      return new RegExp(re).test(actual);0
    }0
0
    it('should handle dangerouslySetInnerHTML', () => {0
      const innerHTML = {__html: 'testContent'};0
      expect(0
        toHaveInnerhtml(0
          genMarkup({dangerouslySetInnerHTML: innerHTML}),0
          'testContent',0
        ),0
      );0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('mountComponent', () => {0
    let mountComponent;0
0
    beforeEach(() => {0
      mountComponent = function(props) {0
        const container = document.createElement('div');0
        ReactDOM.render(<div {...props} />, container);0
      };0
    });0
0
    it('should work error event on <source> element', () => {0
      spyOnDevAndProd(console, 'log');0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <video>0
          <source0
            src="http://example.org/video"0
            type="video/mp4"0
            onError={e => console.log('onError called')}0
          />0
        </video>,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      const errorEvent = document.createEvent('Event');0
      errorEvent.initEvent('error', false, false);0
      container.getElementsByTagName('source')[0].dispatchEvent(errorEvent);0
0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        expect(console.log).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
        expect(console.log.calls.argsFor(0)[0]).toContain('onError called');0
      }0
    });0
0
    it('should not duplicate uppercased selfclosing tags', () => {0
      class Container extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return React.createElement('BR', null);0
        }0
      }0
0
      let returnedValue;0
0
      expect(() => {0
        returnedValue = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Container />);0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        '<BR /> is using incorrect casing. ' +0
          'Use PascalCase for React components, ' +0
          'or lowercase for HTML elements.',0
      );0
      expect(returnedValue).not.toContain('</BR>');0
    });0
0
    it('should warn on upper case HTML tags, not SVG nor custom tags', () => {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        React.createElement('svg', null, React.createElement('PATH')),0
      );0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(React.createElement('CUSTOM-TAG'));0
0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(React.createElement('IMG')),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        '<IMG /> is using incorrect casing. ' +0
          'Use PascalCase for React components, ' +0
          'or lowercase for HTML elements.',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should warn on props reserved for future use', () => {0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div aria="hello" />),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'The `aria` attribute is reserved for future use in React. ' +0
          'Pass individual `aria-` attributes instead.',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should warn if the tag is unrecognized', () => {0
      let realToString;0
      try {0
        realToString = Object.prototype.toString;0
        let wrappedToString = function() {0
          // Emulate browser behavior which is missing in jsdom0
          if (this instanceof window.HTMLUnknownElement) {0
            return '[object HTMLUnknownElement]';0
          }0
          // Special case! Read explanation below in the test.0
          if (this instanceof window.HTMLTimeElement) {0
            return '[object HTMLUnknownElement]';0
          }0
          return realToString.apply(this, arguments);0
        };0
        Object.prototype.toString = wrappedToString; // eslint-disable-line no-extend-native0
0
        expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<bar />)).toWarnDev(0
          'The tag <bar> is unrecognized in this browser',0
        );0
        // Test deduplication0
        expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<foo />)).toWarnDev(0
          'The tag <foo> is unrecognized in this browser',0
        );0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<foo />);0
        // This is a funny case.0
        // Chrome is the only major browser not shipping <time>. But as of July0
        // 2017 it intends to ship it due to widespread usage. We intentionally0
        // *don't* warn for <time> even if it's unrecognized by Chrome because0
        // it soon will be, and many apps have been using it anyway.0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<time />);0
        // Corner case. Make sure out deduplication logic doesn't break with weird tag.0
        expect(() =>0
          ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<hasOwnProperty />),0
        ).toWarnDev([0
          '<hasOwnProperty /> is using incorrect casing. ' +0
            'Use PascalCase for React components, ' +0
            'or lowercase for HTML elements.',0
          'The tag <hasOwnProperty> is unrecognized in this browser',0
        ]);0
      } finally {0
        Object.prototype.toString = realToString; // eslint-disable-line no-extend-native0
      }0
    });0
0
    it('should throw on children for void elements', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      let caughtErr;0
      try {0
        ReactDOM.render(<input>children</input>, container);0
      } catch (err) {0
        caughtErr = err;0
      }0
      expect(caughtErr).not.toBe(undefined);0
      expect(normalizeCodeLocInfo(caughtErr.message)).toContain(0
        'input is a void element tag and must neither have `children` nor ' +0
          'use `dangerouslySetInnerHTML`.' +0
          (__DEV__ ? '\n    in input (at **)' : ''),0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should throw on dangerouslySetInnerHTML for void elements', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      let caughtErr;0
      try {0
        ReactDOM.render(0
          <input dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: 'content'}} />,0
          container,0
        );0
      } catch (err) {0
        caughtErr = err;0
      }0
      expect(caughtErr).not.toBe(undefined);0
      expect(normalizeCodeLocInfo(caughtErr.message)).toContain(0
        'input is a void element tag and must neither have `children` nor ' +0
          'use `dangerouslySetInnerHTML`.' +0
          (__DEV__ ? '\n    in input (at **)' : ''),0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should emit a warning once for a named custom component using shady DOM', () => {0
      const defaultCreateElement = document.createElement.bind(document);0
0
      try {0
        document.createElement = element => {0
          const container = defaultCreateElement(element);0
          container.shadyRoot = {};0
          return container;0
        };0
        class ShadyComponent extends React.Component {0
          render() {0
            return <polymer-component />;0
          }0
        }0
        const node = document.createElement('div');0
        expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<ShadyComponent />, node)).toWarnDev(0
          'ShadyComponent is using shady DOM. Using shady DOM with React can ' +0
            'cause things to break subtly.',0
        );0
        mountComponent({is: 'custom-shady-div2'});0
      } finally {0
        document.createElement = defaultCreateElement;0
      }0
    });0
0
    it('should emit a warning once for an unnamed custom component using shady DOM', () => {0
      const defaultCreateElement = document.createElement.bind(document);0
0
      try {0
        document.createElement = element => {0
          const container = defaultCreateElement(element);0
          container.shadyRoot = {};0
          return container;0
        };0
0
        expect(() => mountComponent({is: 'custom-shady-div'})).toWarnDev(0
          'A component is using shady DOM. Using shady DOM with React can ' +0
            'cause things to break subtly.',0
        );0
0
        // No additional warnings are expected0
        mountComponent({is: 'custom-shady-div2'});0
      } finally {0
        document.createElement = defaultCreateElement;0
      }0
    });0
0
    it('should treat menuitem as a void element but still create the closing tag', () => {0
      // menuitem is not implemented in jsdom, so this triggers the unknown warning error0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
      const returnedValue = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
        <menu>0
          <menuitem />0
        </menu>,0
      );0
0
      expect(returnedValue).toContain('</menuitem>');0
0
      expect(function() {0
        expect(() => {0
          ReactDOM.render(0
            <menu>0
              <menuitem>children</menuitem>0
            </menu>,0
            container,0
          );0
        }).toWarnDev('The tag <menuitem> is unrecognized in this browser.');0
      }).toThrowError(0
        'menuitem is a void element tag and must neither have `children` nor use ' +0
          '`dangerouslySetInnerHTML`.',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should validate against multiple children props', () => {0
      expect(function() {0
        mountComponent({children: '', dangerouslySetInnerHTML: ''});0
      }).toThrowError(0
        'Can only set one of `children` or `props.dangerouslySetInnerHTML`.',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should validate against use of innerHTML', () => {0
      expect(() =>0
        mountComponent({innerHTML: '<span>Hi Jim!</span>'}),0
      ).toWarnDev('Directly setting property `innerHTML` is not permitted. ');0
    });0
0
    it('should validate against use of innerHTML without case sensitivity', () => {0
      expect(() =>0
        mountComponent({innerhtml: '<span>Hi Jim!</span>'}),0
      ).toWarnDev('Directly setting property `innerHTML` is not permitted. ');0
    });0
0
    it('should validate use of dangerouslySetInnerHTML', () => {0
      expect(function() {0
        mountComponent({dangerouslySetInnerHTML: '<span>Hi Jim!</span>'});0
      }).toThrowError(0
        '`props.dangerouslySetInnerHTML` must be in the form `{__html: ...}`. ' +0
          'Please visit https://fb.me/react-invariant-dangerously-set-inner-html for more information.',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should validate use of dangerouslySetInnerHTML', () => {0
      expect(function() {0
        mountComponent({dangerouslySetInnerHTML: {foo: 'bar'}});0
      }).toThrowError(0
        '`props.dangerouslySetInnerHTML` must be in the form `{__html: ...}`. ' +0
          'Please visit https://fb.me/react-invariant-dangerously-set-inner-html for more information.',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should allow {__html: null}', () => {0
      expect(function() {0
        mountComponent({dangerouslySetInnerHTML: {__html: null}});0
      }).not.toThrow();0
    });0
0
    it('should warn about contentEditable and children', () => {0
      expect(() =>0
        mountComponent({contentEditable: true, children: ''}),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: A component is `contentEditable` and contains `children` ' +0
          'managed by React. It is now your responsibility to guarantee that ' +0
          'none of those nodes are unexpectedly modified or duplicated. This ' +0
          'is probably not intentional.\n    in div (at **)',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should respect suppressContentEditableWarning', () => {0
      mountComponent({0
        contentEditable: true,0
        children: '',0
        suppressContentEditableWarning: true,0
      });0
    });0
0
    it('should validate against invalid styles', () => {0
      expect(function() {0
        mountComponent({style: 'display: none'});0
      }).toThrowError(0
        'The `style` prop expects a mapping from style properties to values, ' +0
          "not a string. For example, style={{marginRight: spacing + 'em'}} " +0
          'when using JSX.',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should throw for children on void elements', () => {0
      class X extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <input>moo</input>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      let caughtErr;0
      try {0
        ReactDOM.render(<X />, container);0
      } catch (err) {0
        caughtErr = err;0
      }0
0
      expect(caughtErr).not.toBe(undefined);0
      expect(normalizeCodeLocInfo(caughtErr.message)).toContain(0
        'input is a void element tag and must neither have `children` ' +0
          'nor use `dangerouslySetInnerHTML`.' +0
          (__DEV__ ? '\n    in input (at **)' + '\n    in X (at **)' : ''),0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should support custom elements which extend native elements', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      spyOnDevAndProd(document, 'createElement').and.callThrough();0
      ReactDOM.render(<div is="custom-div" />, container);0
      expect(document.createElement).toHaveBeenCalledWith('div', {0
        is: 'custom-div',0
      });0
    });0
0
    it('should work load and error events on <image> element in SVG', () => {0
      spyOnDevAndProd(console, 'log');0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <svg>0
          <image0
            xlinkHref="http://example.org/image"0
            onError={e => console.log('onError called')}0
            onLoad={e => console.log('onLoad called')}0
          />0
        </svg>,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      const loadEvent = document.createEvent('Event');0
      const errorEvent = document.createEvent('Event');0
0
      loadEvent.initEvent('load', false, false);0
      errorEvent.initEvent('error', false, false);0
0
      container.getElementsByTagName('image')[0].dispatchEvent(errorEvent);0
      container.getElementsByTagName('image')[0].dispatchEvent(loadEvent);0
0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        expect(console.log).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
        expect(console.log.calls.argsFor(0)[0]).toContain('onError called');0
        expect(console.log.calls.argsFor(1)[0]).toContain('onLoad called');0
      }0
    });0
0
    it('should receive a load event on <link> elements', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      const onLoad = jest.fn();0
0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <link href="http://example.org/link" onLoad={onLoad} />,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      const loadEvent = document.createEvent('Event');0
      const link = container.getElementsByTagName('link')[0];0
0
      loadEvent.initEvent('load', false, false);0
      link.dispatchEvent(loadEvent);0
0
      expect(onLoad).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    });0
0
    it('should receive an error event on <link> elements', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      const onError = jest.fn();0
0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <link href="http://example.org/link" onError={onError} />,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      const errorEvent = document.createEvent('Event');0
      const link = container.getElementsByTagName('link')[0];0
0
      errorEvent.initEvent('error', false, false);0
      link.dispatchEvent(errorEvent);0
0
      expect(onError).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('updateComponent', () => {0
    let container;0
0
    beforeEach(() => {0
      container = document.createElement('div');0
    });0
0
    it('should warn against children for void elements', () => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<input />, container);0
0
      expect(function() {0
        ReactDOM.render(<input>children</input>, container);0
      }).toThrowError(0
        'input is a void element tag and must neither have `children` nor use ' +0
          '`dangerouslySetInnerHTML`.',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should warn against dangerouslySetInnerHTML for void elements', () => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<input />, container);0
0
      expect(function() {0
        ReactDOM.render(0
          <input dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: 'content'}} />,0
          container,0
        );0
      }).toThrowError(0
        'input is a void element tag and must neither have `children` nor use ' +0
          '`dangerouslySetInnerHTML`.',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should validate against multiple children props', () => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<div />, container);0
0
      expect(function() {0
        ReactDOM.render(0
          <div children="" dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: ''}} />,0
          container,0
        );0
      }).toThrowError(0
        'Can only set one of `children` or `props.dangerouslySetInnerHTML`.',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should warn about contentEditable and children', () => {0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactDOM.render(0
          <div contentEditable={true}>0
            <div />0
          </div>,0
          container,0
        );0
      }).toWarnDev('contentEditable');0
    });0
0
    it('should validate against invalid styles', () => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<div />, container);0
0
      expect(function() {0
        ReactDOM.render(<div style={1} />, container);0
      }).toThrowError(0
        'The `style` prop expects a mapping from style properties to values, ' +0
          "not a string. For example, style={{marginRight: spacing + 'em'}} " +0
          'when using JSX.',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should report component containing invalid styles', () => {0
      class Animal extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <div style={1} />;0
        }0
      }0
0
      let caughtErr;0
      try {0
        ReactDOM.render(<Animal />, container);0
      } catch (err) {0
        caughtErr = err;0
      }0
0
      expect(caughtErr).not.toBe(undefined);0
      expect(normalizeCodeLocInfo(caughtErr.message)).toContain(0
        'The `style` prop expects a mapping from style properties to values, ' +0
          "not a string. For example, style={{marginRight: spacing + 'em'}} " +0
          'when using JSX.' +0
          (__DEV__ ? '\n    in div (at **)' + '\n    in Animal (at **)' : ''),0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should properly escape text content and attributes values', () => {0
      expect(0
        ReactDOMServer.renderToStaticMarkup(0
          React.createElement(0
            'div',0
            {0
              title: '\'"<>&',0
              style: {0
                textAlign: '\'"<>&',0
              },0
            },0
            '\'"<>&',0
          ),0
        ),0
      ).toBe(0
        '<div title="&#x27;&quot;&lt;&gt;&amp;" style="text-align:&#x27;&quot;&lt;&gt;&amp;">' +0
          '&#x27;&quot;&lt;&gt;&amp;' +0
          '</div>',0
      );0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('unmountComponent', () => {0
    it('unmounts children before unsetting DOM node info', () => {0
      class Inner extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <span />;0
        }0
0
        componentWillUnmount() {0
          // Should not throw0
          expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(this).nodeName).toBe('SPAN');0
        }0
      }0
0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div>0
          <Inner />0
        </div>,0
        container,0
      );0
      ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('tag sanitization', () => {0
    it('should throw when an invalid tag name is used server-side', () => {0
      const hackzor = React.createElement('script tag');0
      expect(() => ReactDOMServer.renderToString(hackzor)).toThrowError(0
        'Invalid tag: script tag',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should throw when an attack vector is used server-side', () => {0
      const hackzor = React.createElement('div><img /><div');0
      expect(() => ReactDOMServer.renderToString(hackzor)).toThrowError(0
        'Invalid tag: div><img /><div',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should throw when an invalid tag name is used', () => {0
      const hackzor = React.createElement('script tag');0
      expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(hackzor)).toThrow();0
    });0
0
    it('should throw when an attack vector is used', () => {0
      const hackzor = React.createElement('div><img /><div');0
      expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(hackzor)).toThrow();0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('nesting validation', () => {0
    it('warns on invalid nesting', () => {0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
          <div>0
            <tr />0
            <tr />0
          </div>,0
        );0
      }).toWarnDev([0
        'Warning: validateDOMNesting(...): <tr> cannot appear as a child of ' +0
          '<div>.' +0
          '\n    in tr (at **)' +0
          '\n    in div (at **)',0
        'Warning: validateDOMNesting(...): <tr> cannot appear as a child of ' +0
          '<div>.' +0
          '\n    in tr (at **)' +0
          '\n    in div (at **)',0
      ]);0
    });0
0
    it('warns on invalid nesting at root', () => {0
      const p = document.createElement('p');0
0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactDOM.render(0
          <span>0
            <p />0
          </span>,0
          p,0
        );0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: validateDOMNesting(...): <p> cannot appear as a descendant ' +0
          'of <p>.' +0
          // There is no outer `p` here because root container is not part of the stack.0
          '\n    in p (at **)' +0
          '\n    in span (at **)',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('warns nicely for table rows', () => {0
      class Row extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <tr>x</tr>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      class Foo extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <table>0
              <Row />{' '}0
            </table>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Foo />)).toWarnDev([0
        'Warning: validateDOMNesting(...): <tr> cannot appear as a child of ' +0
          '<table>. Add a <tbody> to your code to match the DOM tree generated ' +0
          'by the browser.' +0
          '\n    in tr (at **)' +0
          '\n    in Row (at **)' +0
          '\n    in table (at **)' +0
          '\n    in Foo (at **)',0
        'Warning: validateDOMNesting(...): Text nodes cannot appear as a ' +0
          'child of <tr>.' +0
          '\n    in tr (at **)' +0
          '\n    in Row (at **)' +0
          '\n    in table (at **)' +0
          '\n    in Foo (at **)',0
        'Warning: validateDOMNesting(...): Whitespace text nodes cannot ' +0
          "appear as a child of <table>. Make sure you don't have any extra " +0
          'whitespace between tags on each line of your source code.' +0
          '\n    in table (at **)' +0
          '\n    in Foo (at **)',0
      ]);0
    });0
0
    it('gives useful context in warnings', () => {0
      function Row() {0
        return <tr />;0
      }0
      function FancyRow() {0
        return <Row />;0
      }0
0
      class Table extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <table>{this.props.children}</table>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      class FancyTable extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <Table>{this.props.children}</Table>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      function Viz1() {0
        return (0
          <table>0
            <FancyRow />0
          </table>0
        );0
      }0
      function App1() {0
        return <Viz1 />;0
      }0
      expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<App1 />)).toWarnDev(0
        '\n    in tr (at **)' +0
          '\n    in Row (at **)' +0
          '\n    in FancyRow (at **)' +0
          '\n    in table (at **)' +0
          '\n    in Viz1 (at **)',0
      );0
0
      function Viz2() {0
        return (0
          <FancyTable>0
            <FancyRow />0
          </FancyTable>0
        );0
      }0
      function App2() {0
        return <Viz2 />;0
      }0
      expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<App2 />)).toWarnDev(0
        '\n    in tr (at **)' +0
          '\n    in Row (at **)' +0
          '\n    in FancyRow (at **)' +0
          '\n    in table (at **)' +0
          '\n    in Table (at **)' +0
          '\n    in FancyTable (at **)' +0
          '\n    in Viz2 (at **)',0
      );0
0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
          <FancyTable>0
            <FancyRow />0
          </FancyTable>,0
        );0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        '\n    in tr (at **)' +0
          '\n    in Row (at **)' +0
          '\n    in FancyRow (at **)' +0
          '\n    in table (at **)' +0
          '\n    in Table (at **)' +0
          '\n    in FancyTable (at **)',0
      );0
0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
          <table>0
            <FancyRow />0
          </table>,0
        );0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        '\n    in tr (at **)' +0
          '\n    in Row (at **)' +0
          '\n    in FancyRow (at **)' +0
          '\n    in table (at **)',0
      );0
0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
          <FancyTable>0
            <tr />0
          </FancyTable>,0
        );0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        '\n    in tr (at **)' +0
          '\n    in table (at **)' +0
          '\n    in Table (at **)' +0
          '\n    in FancyTable (at **)',0
      );0
0
      class Link extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <a>{this.props.children}</a>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
          <Link>0
            <div>0
              <Link />0
            </div>0
          </Link>,0
        );0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        '\n    in a (at **)' +0
          '\n    in Link (at **)' +0
          '\n    in div (at **)' +0
          '\n    in a (at **)' +0
          '\n    in Link (at **)',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should warn about incorrect casing on properties (ssr)', () => {0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
          React.createElement('input', {type: 'text', tabindex: '1'}),0
        );0
      }).toWarnDev('tabIndex');0
    });0
0
    it('should warn about incorrect casing on event handlers (ssr)', () => {0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
          React.createElement('input', {type: 'text', oninput: '1'}),0
        );0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Invalid event handler property `oninput`. ' +0
          'React events use the camelCase naming convention, ' +0
          // Note: we don't know the right event name so we0
          // use a generic one (onClick) as a suggestion.0
          // This is because we don't bundle the event system0
          // on the server.0
          'for example `onClick`.',0
      );0
      ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
        React.createElement('input', {type: 'text', onKeydown: '1'}),0
      );0
      // We can't warn for `onKeydown` on the server because0
      // there is no way tell if this is a valid event or not0
      // without access to the event system (which we don't bundle).0
    });0
0
    it('should warn about incorrect casing on properties', () => {0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
          React.createElement('input', {type: 'text', tabindex: '1'}),0
        );0
      }).toWarnDev('tabIndex');0
    });0
0
    it('should warn about incorrect casing on event handlers', () => {0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
          React.createElement('input', {type: 'text', oninput: '1'}),0
        );0
      }).toWarnDev('onInput');0

    });0

        );0

    });0

    it('should warn about props that are no longer supported', () => {0

0

        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div onFocusIn={() => {}} />),0
      ).toWarnDev(0

      );0

      ).toWarnDev(0

      );0
    });0
0

      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div />);0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div onfocusin={() => {}} />),0
      ).toWarnDev(0

      );0
    });0

      ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<div />);0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<div onFocusIn={() => {}} />),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
