      expect(() =>0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
          <div className="foo1">0
            <span class="foo2" />0
            <div onClick={() => {}} />0
            <strong onclick={() => {}} />0
            <div className="foo5" />0
            <div className="foo6" />0
          </div>,0
        ),0
      ).toWarnDev([0
        'Invalid DOM property `class`. Did you mean `className`?\n    in span (at **)',0
        'Invalid event handler property `onclick`. Did you mean `onClick`?\n    in strong (at **)',0
      ]);0
    });0
0
    it('gives source code refs for unknown prop warning for exact elements (ssr)', () => {0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
          <div className="foo1">0
            <span class="foo2" />0
            <div onClick="foo3" />0
            <strong onclick="foo4" />0
            <div className="foo5" />0
            <div className="foo6" />0
          </div>,0
        ),0
      ).toWarnDev([0
        'Invalid DOM property `class`. Did you mean `className`?\n    in span (at **)',0
        'Invalid event handler property `onclick`. ' +0
          'React events use the camelCase naming convention, for example `onClick`.' +0
          '\n    in strong (at **)',0
      ]);0
    });0
0
    it('gives source code refs for unknown prop warning for exact elements in composition', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
      class Parent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <div>0
              <Child1 />0
              <Child2 />0
              <Child3 />0
              <Child4 />0
            </div>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      class Child1 extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <span class="paladin">Child1</span>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      class Child2 extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <div>Child2</div>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      class Child3 extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <strong onclick="1">Child3</strong>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      class Child4 extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <div>Child4</div>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Parent />, container),0
      ).toWarnDev([0
        'Invalid DOM property `class`. Did you mean `className`?\n    in span (at **)',0
        'Invalid event handler property `onclick`. Did you mean `onClick`?\n    in strong (at **)',0
      ]);0
    });0
0
    it('gives source code refs for unknown prop warning for exact elements in composition (ssr)', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
      class Parent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <div>0
              <Child1 />0
              <Child2 />0
              <Child3 />0
              <Child4 />0
            </div>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      class Child1 extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <span class="paladin">Child1</span>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      class Child2 extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <div>Child2</div>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      class Child3 extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <strong onclick="1">Child3</strong>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      class Child4 extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <div>Child4</div>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Parent />, container),0
      ).toWarnDev([0
        'Invalid DOM property `class`. Did you mean `className`?\n    in span (at **)',0
        'Invalid event handler property `onclick`. ' +0
          'React events use the camelCase naming convention, for example `onClick`.' +0
          '\n    in strong (at **)',0
      ]);0
    });0
0
    it('should suggest property name if available', () => {0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
          React.createElement('label', {for: 'test'}),0
        ),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid DOM property `for`. Did you mean `htmlFor`?\n    in label',0
      );0
0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
          React.createElement('input', {type: 'text', autofocus: true}),0
        ),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid DOM property `autofocus`. Did you mean `autoFocus`?\n    in input',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should suggest property name if available (ssr)', () => {0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
          React.createElement('label', {for: 'test'}),0
        ),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid DOM property `for`. Did you mean `htmlFor`?\n    in label',0
      );0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
          React.createElement('input', {type: 'text', autofocus: true}),0
        ),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid DOM property `autofocus`. Did you mean `autoFocus`?\n    in input',0
      );0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('whitespace', () => {0
    it('renders innerHTML and preserves whitespace', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      const html = '\n  \t  <span>  \n  testContent  \t  </span>  \n  \t';0
      const elem = <div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: html}} />;0
0
      ReactDOM.render(elem, container);0
      expect(container.firstChild.innerHTML).toBe(html);0
    });0
0
    it('render and then updates innerHTML and preserves whitespace', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      const html = '\n  \t  <span>  \n  testContent1  \t  </span>  \n  \t';0
      const elem = <div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: html}} />;0
      ReactDOM.render(elem, container);0
0
      const html2 = '\n  \t  <div>  \n  testContent2  \t  </div>  \n  \t';0
      const elem2 = <div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: html2}} />;0
      ReactDOM.render(elem2, container);0
0
      expect(container.firstChild.innerHTML).toBe(html2);0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('Attributes with aliases', function() {0
    it('sets aliased attributes on HTML attributes', function() {0
      let el;0
      expect(() => {0
        el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div class="test" />);0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid DOM property `class`. Did you mean `className`?',0
      );0
0
      expect(el.className).toBe('test');0
    });0
0
    it('sets incorrectly cased aliased attributes on HTML attributes with a warning', function() {0
      let el;0
      expect(() => {0
        el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div cLASS="test" />);0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid DOM property `cLASS`. Did you mean `className`?',0
      );0
0
      expect(el.className).toBe('test');0
    });0
0
    it('sets aliased attributes on SVG elements with a warning', function() {0
      let el;0
      expect(() => {0
        el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
          <svg>0
            <text arabic-form="initial" />0
          </svg>,0
        );0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid DOM property `arabic-form`. Did you mean `arabicForm`?',0
      );0
      const text = el.querySelector('text');0
0
      expect(text.hasAttribute('arabic-form')).toBe(true);0
    });0
0
    it('sets aliased attributes on custom elements', function() {0
      const el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <div is="custom-element" class="test" />,0
      );0
0
      expect(el.getAttribute('class')).toBe('test');0
    });0
0
    it('aliased attributes on custom elements with bad casing', function() {0
      const el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <div is="custom-element" claSS="test" />,0
      );0
0
      expect(el.getAttribute('class')).toBe('test');0
    });0
0
    it('updates aliased attributes on custom elements', function() {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div is="custom-element" class="foo" />, container);0
      ReactDOM.render(<div is="custom-element" class="bar" />, container);0
0
      expect(container.firstChild.getAttribute('class')).toBe('bar');0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('Custom attributes', function() {0
    it('allows assignment of custom attributes with string values', function() {0
      const el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div whatever="30" />);0
0
      expect(el.getAttribute('whatever')).toBe('30');0
    });0
0
    it('removes custom attributes', function() {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div whatever="30" />, container);0
0
      expect(container.firstChild.getAttribute('whatever')).toBe('30');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div whatever={null} />, container);0
0
      expect(container.firstChild.hasAttribute('whatever')).toBe(false);0
    });0
0
    it('does not assign a boolean custom attributes as a string', function() {0
      let el;0
      expect(() => {0
        el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div whatever={true} />);0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Received `true` for a non-boolean attribute `whatever`.\n\n' +0
          'If you want to write it to the DOM, pass a string instead: ' +0
          'whatever="true" or whatever={value.toString()}.',0
      );0
0
      expect(el.hasAttribute('whatever')).toBe(false);0
    });0
0
    it('does not assign an implicit boolean custom attributes', function() {0
      let el;0
      expect(() => {0
        // eslint-disable-next-line react/jsx-boolean-value0
        el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div whatever />);0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Received `true` for a non-boolean attribute `whatever`.\n\n' +0
          'If you want to write it to the DOM, pass a string instead: ' +0
          'whatever="true" or whatever={value.toString()}.',0
      );0
0
      expect(el.hasAttribute('whatever')).toBe(false);0
    });0
0
    it('assigns a numeric custom attributes as a string', function() {0
      const el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div whatever={3} />);0
0
      expect(el.getAttribute('whatever')).toBe('3');0
    });0
0
    it('will not assign a function custom attributes', function() {0
      let el;0
      expect(() => {0
        el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div whatever={() => {}} />);0
      }).toWarnDev('Warning: Invalid value for prop `whatever` on <div> tag');0
0
      expect(el.hasAttribute('whatever')).toBe(false);0
    });0
0
    it('will assign an object custom attributes', function() {0
      const el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div whatever={{}} />);0
      expect(el.getAttribute('whatever')).toBe('[object Object]');0
    });0
0
    it('allows cased data attributes', function() {0
      let el;0
      expect(() => {0
        el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div data-fooBar="true" />);0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'React does not recognize the `data-fooBar` prop on a DOM element. ' +0
          'If you intentionally want it to appear in the DOM as a custom ' +0
          'attribute, spell it as lowercase `data-foobar` instead. ' +0
          'If you accidentally passed it from a parent component, remove ' +0
          'it from the DOM element.\n' +0
          '    in div (at **)',0
      );0
      expect(el.getAttribute('data-foobar')).toBe('true');0
    });0
0
    it('allows cased custom attributes', function() {0
      let el;0
      expect(() => {0
        el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div fooBar="true" />);0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'React does not recognize the `fooBar` prop on a DOM element. ' +0
          'If you intentionally want it to appear in the DOM as a custom ' +0
          'attribute, spell it as lowercase `foobar` instead. ' +0
          'If you accidentally passed it from a parent component, remove ' +0
          'it from the DOM element.\n' +0
          '    in div (at **)',0
      );0
      expect(el.getAttribute('foobar')).toBe('true');0
    });0
0
    it('warns on NaN attributes', function() {0
      let el;0
      expect(() => {0
        el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div whatever={NaN} />);0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Received NaN for the `whatever` attribute. If this is ' +0
          'expected, cast the value to a string.\n    in div',0
      );0
0
      expect(el.getAttribute('whatever')).toBe('NaN');0
    });0
0
    it('removes a property when it becomes invalid', function() {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<div whatever={0} />, container);0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOM.render(<div whatever={() => {}} />, container),0
      ).toWarnDev('Warning: Invalid value for prop `whatever` on <div> tag.');0
      const el = container.firstChild;0
      expect(el.hasAttribute('whatever')).toBe(false);0
    });0
0
    it('warns on bad casing of known HTML attributes', function() {0
      let el;0
      expect(() => {0
        el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div SiZe="30" />);0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid DOM property `SiZe`. Did you mean `size`?',0
      );0
0
      expect(el.getAttribute('size')).toBe('30');0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('Object stringification', function() {0
    it('allows objects on known properties', function() {0
      const el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div acceptCharset={{}} />);0
      expect(el.getAttribute('accept-charset')).toBe('[object Object]');0
    });0
0
    it('should pass objects as attributes if they define toString', () => {0
      const obj = {0
        toString() {0
          return 'hello';0
        },0
      };0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<img src={obj} />, container);0
      expect(container.firstChild.src).toBe('hello');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<svg arabicForm={obj} />, container);0
      expect(container.firstChild.getAttribute('arabic-form')).toBe('hello');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div unknown={obj} />, container);0
      expect(container.firstChild.getAttribute('unknown')).toBe('hello');0
    });0
0
    it('passes objects on known SVG attributes if they do not define toString', () => {0
      const obj = {};0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<svg arabicForm={obj} />, container);0
      expect(container.firstChild.getAttribute('arabic-form')).toBe(0
        '[object Object]',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('passes objects on custom attributes if they do not define toString', () => {0
      const obj = {};0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div unknown={obj} />, container);0
      expect(container.firstChild.getAttribute('unknown')).toBe(0
        '[object Object]',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('allows objects that inherit a custom toString method', function() {0
      const parent = {toString: () => 'hello.jpg'};0
      const child = Object.create(parent);0
      const el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<img src={child} />);0
0
      expect(el.src).toBe('hello.jpg');0
    });0
0
    it('assigns ajaxify (an important internal FB attribute)', function() {0
      const options = {toString: () => 'ajaxy'};0
      const el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div ajaxify={options} />);0
0
      expect(el.getAttribute('ajaxify')).toBe('ajaxy');0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('String boolean attributes', function() {0
    it('does not assign string boolean attributes for custom attributes', function() {0
      let el;0
      expect(() => {0
        el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div whatever={true} />);0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Received `true` for a non-boolean attribute `whatever`.\n\n' +0
          'If you want to write it to the DOM, pass a string instead: ' +0
          'whatever="true" or whatever={value.toString()}.',0
      );0
0
      expect(el.hasAttribute('whatever')).toBe(false);0
    });0
0
    it('stringifies the boolean true for allowed attributes', function() {0
      const el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div spellCheck={true} />);0
0
      expect(el.getAttribute('spellCheck')).toBe('true');0
    });0
0
    it('stringifies the boolean false for allowed attributes', function() {0
      const el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div spellCheck={false} />);0
0
      expect(el.getAttribute('spellCheck')).toBe('false');0
    });0
0
    it('stringifies implicit booleans for allowed attributes', function() {0
      // eslint-disable-next-line react/jsx-boolean-value0
      const el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div spellCheck />);0
0
      expect(el.getAttribute('spellCheck')).toBe('true');0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('Hyphenated SVG elements', function() {0
    it('the font-face element is not a custom element', function() {0
      let el;0
      expect(() => {0
        el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
          <svg>0
            <font-face x-height={false} />0
          </svg>,0
        );0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid DOM property `x-height`. Did you mean `xHeight`',0
      );0
0
      expect(el.querySelector('font-face').hasAttribute('x-height')).toBe(0
        false,0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('the font-face element does not allow unknown boolean values', function() {0
      let el;0
      expect(() => {0
        el = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
          <svg>0
            <font-face whatever={false} />0
          </svg>,0
        );0
      }).toWarnDev(0
        'Received `false` for a non-boolean attribute `whatever`.\n\n' +0
          'If you want to write it to the DOM, pass a string instead: ' +0
          'whatever="false" or whatever={value.toString()}.\n\n' +0
          'If you used to conditionally omit it with whatever={condition && value}, ' +0
          'pass whatever={condition ? value : undefined} instead.',0
      );0
0
      expect(el.querySelector('font-face').hasAttribute('whatever')).toBe(0
        false,0
      );0
    });0
  });0
0
  // These tests mostly verify the existing behavior.0
  // It may not always makes sense but we can't change it in minors.0
  describe('Custom elements', () => {0
    it('does not strip unknown boolean attributes', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<some-custom-element foo={true} />, container);0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
      expect(node.getAttribute('foo')).toBe('true');0
      ReactDOM.render(<some-custom-element foo={false} />, container);0
      expect(node.getAttribute('foo')).toBe('false');0
      ReactDOM.render(<some-custom-element />, container);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('foo')).toBe(false);0
      ReactDOM.render(<some-custom-element foo={true} />, container);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('foo')).toBe(true);0
    });0
0
    it('does not strip the on* attributes', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<some-custom-element onx="bar" />, container);0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
      expect(node.getAttribute('onx')).toBe('bar');0
      ReactDOM.render(<some-custom-element onx="buzz" />, container);0
      expect(node.getAttribute('onx')).toBe('buzz');0
      ReactDOM.render(<some-custom-element />, container);0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('onx')).toBe(false);0
      ReactDOM.render(<some-custom-element onx="bar" />, container);0
      expect(node.getAttribute('onx')).toBe('bar');0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2015-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
describe('ReactDOMComponentTree', () => {0
  let React;0
  let ReactDOM;0
  let container;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
    container = null;0
  });0
0
  it('finds nodes for instances on events', () => {0
    const mouseOverID = 'mouseOverID';0
    const clickID = 'clickID';0
    let currentTargetID = null;0
    // the current target of an event is set to result of getNodeFromInstance0
    // when an event is dispatched so we can test behavior by invoking0
    // events on elements in the tree and confirming the expected node is0
    // set as the current target0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      handler = e => {0
        currentTargetID = e.currentTarget.id;0
      };0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div id={mouseOverID} onMouseOver={this.handler}>0
            <div id={clickID} onClick={this.handler} />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    function simulateMouseEvent(elem, type) {0
      const event = new MouseEvent(type, {0
        bubbles: true,0
      });0
      elem.dispatchEvent(event);0
    }0
0
    const component = <Component />;0
    ReactDOM.render(component, container);0
    expect(currentTargetID).toBe(null);0
    simulateMouseEvent(document.getElementById(mouseOverID), 'mouseover');0
    expect(currentTargetID).toBe(mouseOverID);0
    simulateMouseEvent(document.getElementById(clickID), 'click');0
    expect(currentTargetID).toBe(clickID);0
  });0
0
  it('finds closest instance for node when an event happens', () => {0
    const nonReactElemID = 'aID';0
    const innerHTML = {__html: `<div id="${nonReactElemID}"></div>`};0
    const closestInstanceID = 'closestInstance';0
    let currentTargetID = null;0
0
    class ClosestInstance extends React.Component {0
      _onClick = e => {0
        currentTargetID = e.currentTarget.id;0
      };0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div0
            id={closestInstanceID}0
            onClick={this._onClick}0
            dangerouslySetInnerHTML={innerHTML}0
          />0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    function simulateClick(elem) {0
      const event = new MouseEvent('click', {0
        bubbles: true,0
      });0
      elem.dispatchEvent(event);0
    }0
0
    const component = <ClosestInstance />;0
    ReactDOM.render(<section>{component}</section>, container);0
    expect(currentTargetID).toBe(null);0
    simulateClick(document.getElementById(nonReactElemID));0
    expect(currentTargetID).toBe(closestInstanceID);0
  });0
0
  it('updates event handlers from fiber props', () => {0
    let action = '';0
    let instance;0
    const handlerA = () => (action = 'A');0
    const handlerB = () => (action = 'B');0
0
    function simulateMouseOver(target) {0
      const event = new MouseEvent('mouseover', {0
        bubbles: true,0
      });0
      target.dispatchEvent(event);0
    }0
0
    class HandlerFlipper extends React.Component {0
      state = {flip: false};0
      flip() {0
        this.setState({flip: true});0
      }0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div0
            id="update"0
            onMouseOver={this.state.flip ? handlerB : handlerA}0
          />0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <HandlerFlipper key="1" ref={n => (instance = n)} />,0
      container,0
    );0
    const node = container.firstChild;0
    simulateMouseOver(node);0
    expect(action).toEqual('A');0
    action = '';0
    // Render with the other event handler.0
    instance.flip();0
    simulateMouseOver(node);0
    expect(action).toEqual('B');0
  });0
0
  it('finds a controlled instance from node and gets its current fiber props', () => {0
    const inputID = 'inputID';0
    const startValue = undefined;0
    const finishValue = 'finish';0
0
    class Controlled extends React.Component {0
      state = {value: startValue};0
      a = null;0
      _onChange = e => this.setState({value: e.currentTarget.value});0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <input0
            id={inputID}0
            type="text"0
            ref={n => (this.a = n)}0
            value={this.state.value}0
            onChange={this._onChange}0
          />0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const setUntrackedInputValue = Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(0
      HTMLInputElement.prototype,0
      'value',0
    ).set;0
0
    function simulateInput(elem, value) {0
      const inputEvent = new Event('input', {0
        bubbles: true,0
      });0
      setUntrackedInputValue.call(elem, value);0
      elem.dispatchEvent(inputEvent);0
    }0
0
    const component = <Controlled />;0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(component, container);0
    expect(() => simulateInput(instance.a, finishValue)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: A component is changing an uncontrolled input of ' +0
        'type text to be controlled. Input elements should not ' +0
        'switch from uncontrolled to controlled (or vice versa). ' +0
        'Decide between using a controlled or uncontrolled input ' +0
        'element for the lifetime of the component. More info: ' +0
        'https://fb.me/react-controlled-components',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('finds instance of node that is attempted to be unmounted', () => {0
    const component = <div />;0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(<div>{component}</div>, container);0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(node)).toWarnDev(0
      "unmountComponentAtNode(): The node you're attempting to unmount " +0
        'was rendered by React and is not a top-level container. You may ' +0
        'have accidentally passed in a React root node instead of its ' +0
        'container.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('finds instance from node to stop rendering over other react rendered components', () => {0
    const component = (0
      <div>0
        <span>Hello</span>0
      </div>0
    );0
    const anotherComponent = <div />;0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(component, container);0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(anotherComponent, instance)).toWarnDev(0
      'render(...): Replacing React-rendered children with a new root ' +0
        'component. If you intended to update the children of this node, ' +0
        'you should instead have the existing children update their state ' +0
        'and render the new components instead of calling ReactDOM.render.',0
    );0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
describe('ReactDOMEventListener', () => {0
  let React;0
  let ReactDOM;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
  });0
0
  it('should dispatch events from outside React tree', () => {0
    const mock = jest.fn();0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(<div onMouseEnter={mock} />, container);0
    const otherNode = document.createElement('h1');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
    document.body.appendChild(otherNode);0
0
    otherNode.dispatchEvent(0
      new MouseEvent('mouseout', {0
        bubbles: true,0
        cancelable: true,0
        relatedTarget: node,0
      }),0
    );0
    expect(mock).toBeCalled();0
  });0
0
  describe('Propagation', () => {0
    it('should propagate events one level down', () => {0
      const mouseOut = jest.fn();0
      const onMouseOut = event => mouseOut(event.currentTarget);0
0
      const childContainer = document.createElement('div');0
      const parentContainer = document.createElement('div');0
      const childNode = ReactDOM.render(0
        <div onMouseOut={onMouseOut}>Child</div>,0
        childContainer,0
      );0
      const parentNode = ReactDOM.render(0
        <div onMouseOut={onMouseOut}>div</div>,0
        parentContainer,0
      );0
      parentNode.appendChild(childContainer);0
      document.body.appendChild(parentContainer);0
0
      const nativeEvent = document.createEvent('Event');0
      nativeEvent.initEvent('mouseout', true, true);0
      childNode.dispatchEvent(nativeEvent);0
0
      expect(mouseOut).toBeCalled();0
      expect(mouseOut).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
      expect(mouseOut.mock.calls[0][0]).toEqual(childNode);0
      expect(mouseOut.mock.calls[1][0]).toEqual(parentNode);0
0
      document.body.removeChild(parentContainer);0
    });0
0
    it('should propagate events two levels down', () => {0
      const mouseOut = jest.fn();0
      const onMouseOut = event => mouseOut(event.currentTarget);0
0
      const childContainer = document.createElement('div');0
      const parentContainer = document.createElement('div');0
      const grandParentContainer = document.createElement('div');0
      const childNode = ReactDOM.render(0
        <div onMouseOut={onMouseOut}>Child</div>,0
        childContainer,0
      );0
      const parentNode = ReactDOM.render(0
        <div onMouseOut={onMouseOut}>Parent</div>,0
        parentContainer,0
      );0
      const grandParentNode = ReactDOM.render(0
        <div onMouseOut={onMouseOut}>Parent</div>,0
        grandParentContainer,0
      );0
      parentNode.appendChild(childContainer);0
      grandParentNode.appendChild(parentContainer);0
0
      document.body.appendChild(grandParentContainer);0
0
      const nativeEvent = document.createEvent('Event');0
      nativeEvent.initEvent('mouseout', true, true);0
      childNode.dispatchEvent(nativeEvent);0
0
      expect(mouseOut).toBeCalled();0
      expect(mouseOut).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(3);0
      expect(mouseOut.mock.calls[0][0]).toEqual(childNode);0
      expect(mouseOut.mock.calls[1][0]).toEqual(parentNode);0
      expect(mouseOut.mock.calls[2][0]).toEqual(grandParentNode);0
0
      document.body.removeChild(grandParentContainer);0
    });0
0
    // Regression test for https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/11050
    it('should not get confused by disappearing elements', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      document.body.appendChild(container);0
      class MyComponent extends React.Component {0
        state = {clicked: false};0
        handleClick = () => {0
          this.setState({clicked: true});0
        };0
        componentDidMount() {0
          expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(this)).toBe(container.firstChild);0
        }0
        componentDidUpdate() {0
          expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(this)).toBe(container.firstChild);0
        }0
        render() {0
          if (this.state.clicked) {0
            return <span>clicked!</span>;0
          } else {0
            return <button onClick={this.handleClick}>not yet clicked</button>;0
          }0
        }0
      }0
      ReactDOM.render(<MyComponent />, container);0
      container.firstChild.dispatchEvent(0
        new MouseEvent('click', {0
          bubbles: true,0
        }),0
      );0
      expect(container.firstChild.textContent).toBe('clicked!');0
      document.body.removeChild(container);0
    });0
0
    it('should batch between handlers from different roots', () => {0
      const mock = jest.fn();0
0
      const childContainer = document.createElement('div');0
      const handleChildMouseOut = () => {0
        ReactDOM.render(<div>1</div>, childContainer);0
        mock(childNode.textContent);0
      };0
0
      const parentContainer = document.createElement('div');0
      const handleParentMouseOut = () => {0
        ReactDOM.render(<div>2</div>, childContainer);0
        mock(childNode.textContent);0
      };0
0
      const childNode = ReactDOM.render(0
        <div onMouseOut={handleChildMouseOut}>Child</div>,0
        childContainer,0
      );0
      const parentNode = ReactDOM.render(0
        <div onMouseOut={handleParentMouseOut}>Parent</div>,0
        parentContainer,0
      );0
      parentNode.appendChild(childContainer);0
      document.body.appendChild(parentContainer);0
0
      const nativeEvent = document.createEvent('Event');0
      nativeEvent.initEvent('mouseout', true, true);0
      childNode.dispatchEvent(nativeEvent);0
0
      // Child and parent should both call from event handlers.0
      expect(mock).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
      // The first call schedules a render of '1' into the 'Child'.0
      // However, we're batching so it isn't flushed yet.0
      expect(mock.mock.calls[0][0]).toBe('Child');0
      // The first call schedules a render of '2' into the 'Child'.0
      // We're still batching so it isn't flushed yet either.0
      expect(mock.mock.calls[1][0]).toBe('Child');0
      // By the time we leave the handler, the second update is flushed.0
      expect(childNode.textContent).toBe('2');0
      document.body.removeChild(parentContainer);0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('should not fire duplicate events for a React DOM tree', () => {0
    const mouseOut = jest.fn();0
    const onMouseOut = event => mouseOut(event.target);0
0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      getInner = () => {0
        return this.refs.inner;0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        const inner = <div ref="inner">Inner</div>;0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <div onMouseOut={onMouseOut} id="outer">0
              {inner}0
            </div>0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(<Wrapper />, container);0
0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
    const nativeEvent = document.createEvent('Event');0
    nativeEvent.initEvent('mouseout', true, true);0
    instance.getInner().dispatchEvent(nativeEvent);0
0
    expect(mouseOut).toBeCalled();0
    expect(mouseOut).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    expect(mouseOut.mock.calls[0][0]).toEqual(instance.getInner());0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
  });0
0
  // Regression test for https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/128770
  it('should not fire form events twice', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
    const formRef = React.createRef();0
    const inputRef = React.createRef();0
0
    const handleInvalid = jest.fn();0
    const handleReset = jest.fn();0
    const handleSubmit = jest.fn();0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <form ref={formRef} onReset={handleReset} onSubmit={handleSubmit}>0
        <input ref={inputRef} onInvalid={handleInvalid} />0
      </form>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    inputRef.current.dispatchEvent(0
      new Event('invalid', {0
        // https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Events/invalid0
        bubbles: false,0
      }),0
    );0
    expect(handleInvalid).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
    formRef.current.dispatchEvent(0
      new Event('reset', {0
        // https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Events/reset0
        bubbles: true,0
      }),0
    );0
    expect(handleReset).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
    formRef.current.dispatchEvent(0
      new Event('submit', {0
        // https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Events/submit0
        bubbles: true,0
      }),0
    );0
    expect(handleSubmit).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
    formRef.current.dispatchEvent(0
      new Event('submit', {0
        // Might happen on older browsers.0
        bubbles: true,0
      }),0
    );0
    expect(handleSubmit).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2); // It already fired in this test.0
0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
  });0
0
  it('should dispatch loadstart only for media elements', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
    const imgRef = React.createRef();0
    const videoRef = React.createRef();0
0
    const handleImgLoadStart = jest.fn();0
    const handleVideoLoadStart = jest.fn();0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        <img ref={imgRef} onLoadStart={handleImgLoadStart} />0
        <video ref={videoRef} onLoadStart={handleVideoLoadStart} />0
      </div>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    // Note for debugging: loadstart currently doesn't fire in Chrome.0
    // https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=4588510
    imgRef.current.dispatchEvent(0
      new ProgressEvent('loadstart', {0
        bubbles: false,0
      }),0
    );0
    // Historically, we happened to not support onLoadStart0
    // on <img>, and this test documents that lack of support.0
    // If we decide to support it in the future, we should change0
    // this line to expect 1 call. Note that fixing this would0
    // be simple but would require attaching a handler to each0
    // <img>. So far nobody asked us for it.0
    expect(handleImgLoadStart).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
0
    videoRef.current.dispatchEvent(0
      new ProgressEvent('loadstart', {0
        bubbles: false,0
      }),0
    );0
    expect(handleVideoLoadStart).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
  });0
0
  it('should not attempt to listen to unnecessary events on the top level', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
    const videoRef = React.createRef();0
    const handleVideoPlay = jest.fn(); // We'll test this one.0
    const mediaEvents = {0
      onAbort() {},0
      onCanPlay() {},0
      onCanPlayThrough() {},0
      onDurationChange() {},0
      onEmptied() {},0
      onEncrypted() {},0
      onEnded() {},0
      onError() {},0
      onLoadedData() {},0
      onLoadedMetadata() {},0
      onLoadStart() {},0
      onPause() {},0
      onPlay() {},0
      onPlaying() {},0
      onProgress() {},0
      onRateChange() {},0
      onSeeked() {},0
      onSeeking() {},0
      onStalled() {},0
      onSuspend() {},0
      onTimeUpdate() {},0
      onVolumeChange() {},0
      onWaiting() {},0
    };0
0
    const originalAddEventListener = document.addEventListener;0
    document.addEventListener = function(type) {0
      throw new Error(0
        `Did not expect to add a top-level listener for the "${type}" event.`,0
      );0
    };0
0
    try {0
      // We expect that mounting this tree will0
      // *not* attach handlers for any top-level events.0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div>0
          <video ref={videoRef} {...mediaEvents} onPlay={handleVideoPlay} />0
          <audio {...mediaEvents}>0
            <source {...mediaEvents} />0
          </audio>0
          <form onReset={() => {}} onSubmit={() => {}} />0
        </div>,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      // Also verify dispatching one of them works0
      videoRef.current.dispatchEvent(0
        new Event('play', {0
          bubbles: false,0
        }),0
      );0
      expect(handleVideoPlay).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    } finally {0
      document.addEventListener = originalAddEventListener;0
      document.body.removeChild(container);0
    }0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const React = require('react');0
const ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
const PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
0
describe('ReactDOMFiber', () => {0
  let container;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
  });0
0
  it('should render strings as children', () => {0
    const Box = ({value}) => <div>{value}</div>;0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Box value="foo" />, container);0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('foo');0
  });0
0
  it('should render numbers as children', () => {0
    const Box = ({value}) => <div>{value}</div>;0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Box value={10} />, container);0
0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('10');0
  });0
0
  it('should be called a callback argument', () => {0
    // mounting phase0
    let called = false;0
    ReactDOM.render(<div>Foo</div>, container, () => (called = true));0
    expect(called).toEqual(true);0
0
    // updating phase0
    called = false;0
    ReactDOM.render(<div>Foo</div>, container, () => (called = true));0
    expect(called).toEqual(true);0
  });0
0
  it('should call a callback argument when the same element is re-rendered', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div>Foo</div>;0
      }0
    }0
    const element = <Foo />;0
0
    // mounting phase0
    let called = false;0
    ReactDOM.render(element, container, () => (called = true));0
    expect(called).toEqual(true);0
0
    // updating phase0
    called = false;0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(() => {0
      ReactDOM.render(element, container, () => (called = true));0
    });0
    expect(called).toEqual(true);0
  });0
0
  it('should render a component returning strings directly from render', () => {0
    const Text = ({value}) => value;0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Text value="foo" />, container);0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('foo');0
  });0
0
  it('should render a component returning numbers directly from render', () => {0
    const Text = ({value}) => value;0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Text value={10} />, container);0
0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('10');0
  });0
0
  it('finds the DOM Text node of a string child', () => {0
    class Text extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return this.props.value;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let instance = null;0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <Text value="foo" ref={ref => (instance = ref)} />,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    const textNode = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(instance);0
    expect(textNode).toBe(container.firstChild);0
    expect(textNode.nodeType).toBe(3);0
    expect(textNode.nodeValue).toBe('foo');0
  });0
0
  it('finds the first child when a component returns a fragment', () => {0
    class Fragment extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return [<div key="a" />, <span key="b" />];0
      }0
    }0
0
    let instance = null;0
    ReactDOM.render(<Fragment ref={ref => (instance = ref)} />, container);0
0
    expect(container.childNodes.length).toBe(2);0
0
    const firstNode = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(instance);0
    expect(firstNode).toBe(container.firstChild);0
    expect(firstNode.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
  });0
0
  it('finds the first child even when fragment is nested', () => {0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Fragment extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return [0
          <Wrapper key="a">0
            <div />0
          </Wrapper>,0
          <span key="b" />,0
        ];0
      }0
    }0
0
    let instance = null;0
    ReactDOM.render(<Fragment ref={ref => (instance = ref)} />, container);0
0
    expect(container.childNodes.length).toBe(2);0
0
    const firstNode = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(instance);0
    expect(firstNode).toBe(container.firstChild);0
    expect(firstNode.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
  });0
0
  it('finds the first child even when first child renders null', () => {0
    class NullComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Fragment extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return [<NullComponent key="a" />, <div key="b" />, <span key="c" />];0
      }0
    }0
0
    let instance = null;0
    ReactDOM.render(<Fragment ref={ref => (instance = ref)} />, container);0
0
    expect(container.childNodes.length).toBe(2);0
0
    const firstNode = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(instance);0
    expect(firstNode).toBe(container.firstChild);0
    expect(firstNode.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
  });0
0
  it('renders an empty fragment', () => {0
    const Div = () => <div />;0
    const EmptyFragment = () => <React.Fragment />;0
    const NonEmptyFragment = () => (0
      <React.Fragment>0
        <Div />0
      </React.Fragment>0
    );0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<EmptyFragment />, container);0
    expect(container.firstChild).toBe(null);0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<NonEmptyFragment />, container);0
    expect(container.firstChild.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<EmptyFragment />, container);0
    expect(container.firstChild).toBe(null);0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Div />, container);0
    expect(container.firstChild.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<EmptyFragment />, container);0
    expect(container.firstChild).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  let svgEls, htmlEls, mathEls;0
  const expectSVG = {ref: el => svgEls.push(el)};0
  const expectHTML = {ref: el => htmlEls.push(el)};0
  const expectMath = {ref: el => mathEls.push(el)};0
0
  const usePortal = function(tree) {0
    return ReactDOM.createPortal(tree, document.createElement('div'));0
  };0
0
  const assertNamespacesMatch = function(tree) {0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    svgEls = [];0
    htmlEls = [];0
    mathEls = [];0
0
    ReactDOM.render(tree, container);0
    svgEls.forEach(el => {0
      expect(el.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/2000/svg');0
    });0
    htmlEls.forEach(el => {0
      expect(el.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml');0
    });0
    mathEls.forEach(el => {0
      expect(el.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML');0
    });0
0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('');0
  };0
0
  it('should render one portal', () => {0
    const portalContainer = document.createElement('div');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>{ReactDOM.createPortal(<div>portal</div>, portalContainer)}</div>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(portalContainer.innerHTML).toBe('<div>portal</div>');0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('<div></div>');0
0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(portalContainer.innerHTML).toBe('');0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('');0
  });0
0
  // TODO: remove in React 170
  it('should support unstable_createPortal alias', () => {0
    const portalContainer = document.createElement('div');0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div>0
          {ReactDOM.unstable_createPortal(<div>portal</div>, portalContainer)}0
        </div>,0
        container,0
      ),0
    ).toLowPriorityWarnDev(0
      'The ReactDOM.unstable_createPortal() alias has been deprecated, ' +0
        'and will be removed in React 17+. Update your code to use ' +0
        'ReactDOM.createPortal() instead. It has the exact same API, ' +0
        'but without the "unstable_" prefix.',0
    );0
    expect(portalContainer.innerHTML).toBe('<div>portal</div>');0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('<div></div>');0
0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(portalContainer.innerHTML).toBe('');0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('');0
  });0
0
  it('should render many portals', () => {0
    const portalContainer1 = document.createElement('div');0
    const portalContainer2 = document.createElement('div');0
0
    const ops = [];0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ops.push(`${this.props.name} componentDidMount`);0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push(`${this.props.name} componentDidUpdate`);0
      }0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        ops.push(`${this.props.name} componentWillUnmount`);0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.name}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ops.push(`Parent:${this.props.step} componentDidMount`);0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push(`Parent:${this.props.step} componentDidUpdate`);0
      }0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        ops.push(`Parent:${this.props.step} componentWillUnmount`);0
      }0
      render() {0
        const {step} = this.props;0
        return [0
          <Child key="a" name={`normal[0]:${step}`} />,0
          ReactDOM.createPortal(0
            <Child key="b" name={`portal1[0]:${step}`} />,0
            portalContainer1,0
          ),0
          <Child key="c" name={`normal[1]:${step}`} />,0
          ReactDOM.createPortal(0
            [0
              <Child key="d" name={`portal2[0]:${step}`} />,0
              <Child key="e" name={`portal2[1]:${step}`} />,0
            ],0
            portalContainer2,0
          ),0
        ];0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent step="a" />, container);0
    expect(portalContainer1.innerHTML).toBe('<div>portal1[0]:a</div>');0
    expect(portalContainer2.innerHTML).toBe(0
      '<div>portal2[0]:a</div><div>portal2[1]:a</div>',0
    );0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe(0
      '<div>normal[0]:a</div><div>normal[1]:a</div>',0
    );0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'normal[0]:a componentDidMount',0
      'portal1[0]:a componentDidMount',0
      'normal[1]:a componentDidMount',0
      'portal2[0]:a componentDidMount',0
      'portal2[1]:a componentDidMount',0
      'Parent:a componentDidMount',0
    ]);0
0
    ops.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent step="b" />, container);0
    expect(portalContainer1.innerHTML).toBe('<div>portal1[0]:b</div>');0
    expect(portalContainer2.innerHTML).toBe(0
      '<div>portal2[0]:b</div><div>portal2[1]:b</div>',0
    );0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe(0
      '<div>normal[0]:b</div><div>normal[1]:b</div>',0
    );0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'normal[0]:b componentDidUpdate',0
      'portal1[0]:b componentDidUpdate',0
      'normal[1]:b componentDidUpdate',0
      'portal2[0]:b componentDidUpdate',0
      'portal2[1]:b componentDidUpdate',0
      'Parent:b componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    ops.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(portalContainer1.innerHTML).toBe('');0
    expect(portalContainer2.innerHTML).toBe('');0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('');0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'Parent:b componentWillUnmount',0
      'normal[0]:b componentWillUnmount',0
      'portal1[0]:b componentWillUnmount',0
      'normal[1]:b componentWillUnmount',0
      'portal2[0]:b componentWillUnmount',0
      'portal2[1]:b componentWillUnmount',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should render nested portals', () => {0
    const portalContainer1 = document.createElement('div');0
    const portalContainer2 = document.createElement('div');0
    const portalContainer3 = document.createElement('div');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      [0
        <div key="a">normal[0]</div>,0
        ReactDOM.createPortal(0
          [0
            <div key="b">portal1[0]</div>,0
            ReactDOM.createPortal(0
              <div key="c">portal2[0]</div>,0
              portalContainer2,0
            ),0
            ReactDOM.createPortal(0
              <div key="d">portal3[0]</div>,0
              portalContainer3,0
            ),0
            <div key="e">portal1[1]</div>,0
          ],0
          portalContainer1,0
        ),0
        <div key="f">normal[1]</div>,0
      ],0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(portalContainer1.innerHTML).toBe(0
      '<div>portal1[0]</div><div>portal1[1]</div>',0
    );0
    expect(portalContainer2.innerHTML).toBe('<div>portal2[0]</div>');0
    expect(portalContainer3.innerHTML).toBe('<div>portal3[0]</div>');0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe(0
      '<div>normal[0]</div><div>normal[1]</div>',0
    );0
0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(portalContainer1.innerHTML).toBe('');0
    expect(portalContainer2.innerHTML).toBe('');0
    expect(portalContainer3.innerHTML).toBe('');0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('');0
  });0
0
  it('should reconcile portal children', () => {0
    const portalContainer = document.createElement('div');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>{ReactDOM.createPortal(<div>portal:1</div>, portalContainer)}</div>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(portalContainer.innerHTML).toBe('<div>portal:1</div>');0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('<div></div>');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>{ReactDOM.createPortal(<div>portal:2</div>, portalContainer)}</div>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(portalContainer.innerHTML).toBe('<div>portal:2</div>');0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('<div></div>');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>{ReactDOM.createPortal(<p>portal:3</p>, portalContainer)}</div>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(portalContainer.innerHTML).toBe('<p>portal:3</p>');0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('<div></div>');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>{ReactDOM.createPortal(['Hi', 'Bye'], portalContainer)}</div>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(portalContainer.innerHTML).toBe('HiBye');0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('<div></div>');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>{ReactDOM.createPortal(['Bye', 'Hi'], portalContainer)}</div>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(portalContainer.innerHTML).toBe('ByeHi');0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('<div></div>');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>{ReactDOM.createPortal(null, portalContainer)}</div>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(portalContainer.innerHTML).toBe('');0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('<div></div>');0
  });0

  it('should keep track of namespace across portals (simple)', () => {0
    assertNamespacesMatch(0
      <svg {...expectSVG}>0
        <image {...expectSVG} />0
        {usePortal(<div {...expectHTML} />)}0
        <image {...expectSVG} />0
      </svg>,0
    );0
    assertNamespacesMatch(0
      <math {...expectMath}>0
        <mi {...expectMath} />0
        {usePortal(<div {...expectHTML} />)}0
        <mi {...expectMath} />0
      </math>,0
    );0
    assertNamespacesMatch(0
      <div {...expectHTML}>0
        <p {...expectHTML} />0
        {usePortal(0
          <svg {...expectSVG}>0
            <image {...expectSVG} />0
          </svg>,0
        )}0
        <p {...expectHTML} />0
      </div>,0
    );0
  });0

  it('should keep track of namespace across portals (medium)', () => {0
    assertNamespacesMatch(0
      <svg {...expectSVG}>0
        <image {...expectSVG} />0
        {usePortal(<div {...expectHTML} />)}0
        <image {...expectSVG} />0
        {usePortal(<div {...expectHTML} />)}0
        <image {...expectSVG} />0
      </svg>,0
    );0
    assertNamespacesMatch(0
      <div {...expectHTML}>0
        <math {...expectMath}>0
          <mi {...expectMath} />0
          {usePortal(0
            <svg {...expectSVG}>0
              <image {...expectSVG} />0
            </svg>,0
          )}0
        </math>0
        <p {...expectHTML} />0
      </div>,0
    );0
    assertNamespacesMatch(0
      <math {...expectMath}>0
        <mi {...expectMath} />0
        {usePortal(0
          <svg {...expectSVG}>0
            <image {...expectSVG} />0
            <foreignObject {...expectSVG}>0
              <p {...expectHTML} />0
              <math {...expectMath}>0
                <mi {...expectMath} />0
              </math>0
              <p {...expectHTML} />0
            </foreignObject>0
            <image {...expectSVG} />0
          </svg>,0
        )}0
        <mi {...expectMath} />0
      </math>,0
    );0
    assertNamespacesMatch(0
      <div {...expectHTML}>0
        {usePortal(0
          <svg {...expectSVG}>0
            {usePortal(<div {...expectHTML} />)}0
            <image {...expectSVG} />0
          </svg>,0
        )}0
        <p {...expectHTML} />0
      </div>,0
    );0
    assertNamespacesMatch(0
      <svg {...expectSVG}>0
        <svg {...expectSVG}>0
          {usePortal(<div {...expectHTML} />)}0
          <image {...expectSVG} />0
        </svg>0
        <image {...expectSVG} />0
      </svg>,0
    );0

  it('should keep track of namespace across portals (complex)', () => {0
    assertNamespacesMatch(0
      <div {...expectHTML}>0
        {usePortal(0
          <svg {...expectSVG}>0
            <image {...expectSVG} />0
          </svg>,0
        )}0
        <p {...expectHTML} />0

            </foreignObject>0

          <image {...expectSVG} />0
        </svg>0
        <p {...expectHTML} />0
      </div>,0

      <div {...expectHTML}>0

          <foreignObject {...expectSVG}>0
            <p {...expectHTML} />0
            {usePortal(0

              </svg>,0
            )}0
            <p {...expectHTML} />0
          </foreignObject>0
          <image {...expectSVG} />0
        </svg>0
        <p {...expectHTML} />0
      </div>,0
    );0
  });0
