  it('should unwind namespaces on uncaught errors', () => {0
    function BrokenRender() {0
      throw new Error('Hello');0
    }0
0
    expect(() => {0
      assertNamespacesMatch(0
        <svg {...expectSVG}>0
          <BrokenRender />0
        </svg>,0
      );0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
    assertNamespacesMatch(<div {...expectHTML} />);0
  });0
0
  it('should unwind namespaces on caught errors', () => {0
    function BrokenRender() {0
      throw new Error('Hello');0
    }0
0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          return <p {...expectHTML} />;0
        }0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    assertNamespacesMatch(0
      <svg {...expectSVG}>0
        <foreignObject {...expectSVG}>0
          <ErrorBoundary>0
            <math {...expectMath}>0
              <BrokenRender />0
            </math>0
          </ErrorBoundary>0
        </foreignObject>0
        <image {...expectSVG} />0
      </svg>,0
    );0
    assertNamespacesMatch(<div {...expectHTML} />);0
  });0
0
  it('should unwind namespaces on caught errors in a portal', () => {0
    function BrokenRender() {0
      throw new Error('Hello');0
    }0
0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          return <image {...expectSVG} />;0
        }0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    assertNamespacesMatch(0
      <svg {...expectSVG}>0
        <ErrorBoundary>0
          {usePortal(0
            <div {...expectHTML}>0
              <math {...expectMath}>0
                <BrokenRender />)0
              </math>0
            </div>,0
          )}0
        </ErrorBoundary>0
        {usePortal(<div {...expectHTML} />)}0
      </svg>,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should pass portal context when rendering subtree elsewhere', () => {0
    const portalContainer = document.createElement('div');0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.context.foo}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: 'bar',0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return ReactDOM.createPortal(<Component />, portalContainer);0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent />, container);0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('');0
    expect(portalContainer.innerHTML).toBe('<div>bar</div>');0
  });0
0
  it('should update portal context if it changes due to setState', () => {0
    const portalContainer = document.createElement('div');0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
        getFoo: PropTypes.func.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.context.foo + '-' + this.context.getFoo()}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
        getFoo: PropTypes.func.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      state = {0
        bar: 'initial',0
      };0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: this.state.bar,0
          getFoo: () => this.state.bar,0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return ReactDOM.createPortal(<Component />, portalContainer);0
      }0
    }0
0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(<Parent />, container);0
    expect(portalContainer.innerHTML).toBe('<div>initial-initial</div>');0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('');0
    instance.setState({bar: 'changed'});0
    expect(portalContainer.innerHTML).toBe('<div>changed-changed</div>');0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('');0
  });0
0
  it('should update portal context if it changes due to re-render', () => {0
    const portalContainer = document.createElement('div');0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
        getFoo: PropTypes.func.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.context.foo + '-' + this.context.getFoo()}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
        getFoo: PropTypes.func.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: this.props.bar,0
          getFoo: () => this.props.bar,0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return ReactDOM.createPortal(<Component />, portalContainer);0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent bar="initial" />, container);0
    expect(portalContainer.innerHTML).toBe('<div>initial-initial</div>');0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent bar="changed" />, container);0
    expect(portalContainer.innerHTML).toBe('<div>changed-changed</div>');0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('');0
  });0
0
  it('findDOMNode should find dom element after expanding a fragment', () => {0
    class MyNode extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return !this.props.flag0
          ? [<div key="a" />]0
          : [<span key="b" />, <div key="a" />];0
      }0
    }0
0
    const myNodeA = ReactDOM.render(<MyNode />, container);0
    const a = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(myNodeA);0
    expect(a.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
0
    const myNodeB = ReactDOM.render(<MyNode flag={true} />, container);0
    expect(myNodeA === myNodeB).toBe(true);0
0
    const b = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(myNodeB);0
    expect(b.tagName).toBe('SPAN');0
  });0
0
  it('should bubble events from the portal to the parent', () => {0
    const portalContainer = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(portalContainer);0
    try {0
      const ops = [];0
      let portal = null;0
0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div onClick={() => ops.push('parent clicked')}>0
          {ReactDOM.createPortal(0
            <div0
              onClick={() => ops.push('portal clicked')}0
              ref={n => (portal = n)}>0
              portal0
            </div>,0
            portalContainer,0
          )}0
        </div>,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      expect(portal.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
0
      portal.click();0
0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['portal clicked', 'parent clicked']);0
    } finally {0
      document.body.removeChild(portalContainer);0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('should not onMouseLeave when staying in the portal', () => {0
    const portalContainer = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
    document.body.appendChild(portalContainer);0
0
    let ops = [];0
    let firstTarget = null;0
    let secondTarget = null;0
    let thirdTarget = null;0
0
    function simulateMouseMove(from, to) {0
      if (from) {0
        from.dispatchEvent(0
          new MouseEvent('mouseout', {0
            bubbles: true,0
            cancelable: true,0
            relatedTarget: to,0
          }),0
        );0
      }0
      if (to) {0
        to.dispatchEvent(0
          new MouseEvent('mouseover', {0
            bubbles: true,0
            cancelable: true,0
            relatedTarget: from,0
          }),0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    try {0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div>0
          <div0
            onMouseEnter={() => ops.push('enter parent')}0
            onMouseLeave={() => ops.push('leave parent')}>0
            <div ref={n => (firstTarget = n)} />0
            {ReactDOM.createPortal(0
              <div0
                onMouseEnter={() => ops.push('enter portal')}0
                onMouseLeave={() => ops.push('leave portal')}0
                ref={n => (secondTarget = n)}>0
                portal0
              </div>,0
              portalContainer,0
            )}0
          </div>0
          <div ref={n => (thirdTarget = n)} />0
        </div>,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      simulateMouseMove(null, firstTarget);0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['enter parent']);0
0
      ops = [];0
0
      simulateMouseMove(firstTarget, secondTarget);0
      expect(ops).toEqual([0
        // Parent did not invoke leave because we're still inside the portal.0
        'enter portal',0
      ]);0
0
      ops = [];0
0
      simulateMouseMove(secondTarget, thirdTarget);0
      expect(ops).toEqual([0
        'leave portal',0
        'leave parent', // Only when we leave the portal does onMouseLeave fire.0
      ]);0
    } finally {0
      document.body.removeChild(container);0
      document.body.removeChild(portalContainer);0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('should throw on bad createPortal argument', () => {0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOM.createPortal(<div>portal</div>, null);0
    }).toThrow('Target container is not a DOM element.');0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOM.createPortal(<div>portal</div>, document.createTextNode('hi'));0
    }).toThrow('Target container is not a DOM element.');0
  });0
0
  it('should warn for non-functional event listeners', () => {0
    class Example extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div onClick="woops" />;0
      }0
    }0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Example />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Expected `onClick` listener to be a function, instead got a value of `string` type.\n' +0
        '    in div (at **)\n' +0
        '    in Example (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn with a special message for `false` event listeners', () => {0
    class Example extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div onClick={false} />;0
      }0
    }0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Example />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Expected `onClick` listener to be a function, instead got `false`.\n\n' +0
        'If you used to conditionally omit it with onClick={condition && value}, ' +0
        'pass onClick={condition ? value : undefined} instead.\n',0
      '    in div (at **)\n' + '    in Example (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should not update event handlers until commit', () => {0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
    try {0
      let ops = [];0
      const handlerA = () => ops.push('A');0
      const handlerB = () => ops.push('B');0
0
      class Example extends React.Component {0
        state = {flip: false, count: 0};0
        flip() {0
          this.setState({flip: true, count: this.state.count + 1});0
        }0
        tick() {0
          this.setState({count: this.state.count + 1});0
        }0
        render() {0
          const useB = !this.props.forceA && this.state.flip;0
          return <div onClick={useB ? handlerB : handlerA} />;0
        }0
      }0
0
      class Click extends React.Component {0
        constructor() {0
          super();0
          node.click();0
        }0
        render() {0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      let inst;0
      ReactDOM.render([<Example key="a" ref={n => (inst = n)} />], container);0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
      expect(node.tagName).toEqual('DIV');0
0
      node.click();0
0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['A']);0
      ops = [];0
0
      // Render with the other event handler.0
      inst.flip();0
0
      node.click();0
0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['B']);0
      ops = [];0
0
      // Rerender without changing any props.0
      inst.tick();0
0
      node.click();0
0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['B']);0
      ops = [];0
0
      // Render a flip back to the A handler. The second component invokes the0
      // click handler during render to simulate a click during an aborted0
      // render. I use this hack because at current time we don't have a way to0
      // test aborted ReactDOM renders.0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        [<Example key="a" forceA={true} />, <Click key="b" />],0
        container,0
      );0
0
      // Because the new click handler has not yet committed, we should still0
      // invoke B.0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['B']);0
      ops = [];0
0
      // Any click that happens after commit, should invoke A.0
      node.click();0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['A']);0
    } finally {0
      document.body.removeChild(container);0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('should not crash encountering low-priority tree', () => {0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <div hidden={true}>0
        <div />0
      </div>,0
      container,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should not warn when rendering into an empty container', () => {0
    ReactDOM.render(<div>foo</div>, container);0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('<div>foo</div>');0
    ReactDOM.render(null, container);0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('');0
    ReactDOM.render(<div>bar</div>, container);0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('<div>bar</div>');0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when replacing a container which was manually updated outside of React', () => {0
    // when not messing with the DOM outside of React0
    ReactDOM.render(<div key="1">foo</div>, container);0
    ReactDOM.render(<div key="1">bar</div>, container);0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('<div>bar</div>');0
    // then we mess with the DOM before an update0
    // we know this will error - that is expected right now0
    // It's an error of type 'NotFoundError' with no message0
    container.innerHTML = '<div>MEOW.</div>';0
0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOM.render(<div key="2">baz</div>, container),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'render(...): ' +0
          'It looks like the React-rendered content of this container was ' +0
          'removed without using React. This is not supported and will ' +0
          'cause errors. Instead, call ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode ' +0
          'to empty a container.',0
      );0
    }).toThrowError();0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when doing an update to a container manually updated outside of React', () => {0
    // when not messing with the DOM outside of React0
    ReactDOM.render(<div>foo</div>, container);0
    ReactDOM.render(<div>bar</div>, container);0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('<div>bar</div>');0
    // then we mess with the DOM before an update0
    container.innerHTML = '<div>MEOW.</div>';0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<div>baz</div>, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'render(...): ' +0
        'It looks like the React-rendered content of this container was ' +0
        'removed without using React. This is not supported and will ' +0
        'cause errors. Instead, call ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode ' +0
        'to empty a container.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when doing an update to a container manually cleared outside of React', () => {0
    // when not messing with the DOM outside of React0
    ReactDOM.render(<div>foo</div>, container);0
    ReactDOM.render(<div>bar</div>, container);0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('<div>bar</div>');0
    // then we mess with the DOM before an update0
    container.innerHTML = '';0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<div>baz</div>, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'render(...): ' +0
        'It looks like the React-rendered content of this container was ' +0
        'removed without using React. This is not supported and will ' +0
        'cause errors. Instead, call ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode ' +0
        'to empty a container.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should render a text component with a text DOM node on the same document as the container', () => {0
    // 1. Create a new document through the use of iframe0
    // 2. Set up the spy to make asserts when a text component0
    //    is rendered inside the iframe container0
    const textContent = 'Hello world';0
    const iframe = document.createElement('iframe');0
    document.body.appendChild(iframe);0
    const iframeDocument = iframe.contentDocument;0
    iframeDocument.write(0
      '<!DOCTYPE html><html><head></head><body><div></div></body></html>',0
    );0
    iframeDocument.close();0
    const iframeContainer = iframeDocument.body.firstChild;0
0
    let actualDocument;0
    let textNode;0
0
    spyOnDevAndProd(iframeContainer, 'appendChild').and.callFake(node => {0
      actualDocument = node.ownerDocument;0
      textNode = node;0
    });0
0
    ReactDOM.render(textContent, iframeContainer);0
0
    expect(textNode.textContent).toBe(textContent);0
    expect(actualDocument).not.toBe(document);0
    expect(actualDocument).toBe(iframeDocument);0
    expect(iframeContainer.appendChild).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should mount into a document fragment', () => {0
    const fragment = document.createDocumentFragment();0
    ReactDOM.render(<div>foo</div>, fragment);0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('');0
    container.appendChild(fragment);0
    expect(container.innerHTML).toBe('<div>foo</div>');0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const React = require('react');0
let ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
0
let ReactDOM;0
0
const AsyncMode = React.unstable_AsyncMode;0
0
describe('ReactDOMFiberAsync', () => {0
  let container;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    // TODO pull this into helper method, reduce repetition.0
    // mock the browser APIs which are used in react-scheduler:0
    // - requestAnimationFrame should pass the DOMHighResTimeStamp argument0
    // - calling 'window.postMessage' should actually fire postmessage handlers0
    global.requestAnimationFrame = function(cb) {0
      return setTimeout(() => {0
        cb(Date.now());0
      });0
    };0
    const originalAddEventListener = global.addEventListener;0
    let postMessageCallback;0
    global.addEventListener = function(eventName, callback, useCapture) {0
      if (eventName === 'message') {0
        postMessageCallback = callback;0
      } else {0
        originalAddEventListener(eventName, callback, useCapture);0
      }0
    };0
    global.postMessage = function(messageKey, targetOrigin) {0
      const postMessageEvent = {source: window, data: messageKey};0
      if (postMessageCallback) {0
        postMessageCallback(postMessageEvent);0
      }0
    };0
    jest.resetModules();0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
  });0
0
  it('renders synchronously by default', () => {0
    const ops = [];0
    ReactDOM.render(<div>Hi</div>, container, () => {0
      ops.push(container.textContent);0
    });0
    ReactDOM.render(<div>Bye</div>, container, () => {0
      ops.push(container.textContent);0
    });0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Hi', 'Bye']);0
  });0
0
  describe('with feature flag disabled', () => {0
    beforeEach(() => {0
      jest.resetModules();0
      ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
      container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    });0
0
    it('renders synchronously', () => {0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <AsyncMode>0
          <div>Hi</div>0
        </AsyncMode>,0
        container,0
      );0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('Hi');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <AsyncMode>0
          <div>Bye</div>0
        </AsyncMode>,0
        container,0
      );0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('Bye');0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('with feature flag enabled', () => {0
    beforeEach(() => {0
      jest.resetModules();0
      ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
      container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode = false;0
      ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    });0
0
    it('createRoot makes the entire tree async', () => {0
      const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
      root.render(<div>Hi</div>);0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('');0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('Hi');0
0
      root.render(<div>Bye</div>);0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('Hi');0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('Bye');0
    });0
0
    it('updates inside an async tree are async by default', () => {0
      let instance;0
      class Component extends React.Component {0
        state = {step: 0};0
        render() {0
          instance = this;0
          return <div>{this.state.step}</div>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
      root.render(<Component />);0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('');0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('0');0
0
      instance.setState({step: 1});0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('0');0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('1');0
    });0
0
    it('AsyncMode creates an async subtree', () => {0
      let instance;0
      class Component extends React.Component {0
        state = {step: 0};0
        render() {0
          instance = this;0
          return <div>{this.state.step}</div>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <AsyncMode>0
          <Component />0
        </AsyncMode>,0
        container,0
      );0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
0
      instance.setState({step: 1});0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('0');0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('1');0
    });0
0
    it('updates inside an async subtree are async by default', () => {0
      let instance;0
      class Child extends React.Component {0
        state = {step: 0};0
        render() {0
          instance = this;0
          return <div>{this.state.step}</div>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div>0
          <AsyncMode>0
            <Child />0
          </AsyncMode>0
        </div>,0
        container,0
      );0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
0
      instance.setState({step: 1});0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('0');0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('1');0
    });0
0
    it('flushSync batches sync updates and flushes them at the end of the batch', () => {0
      let ops = [];0
      let instance;0
0
      class Component extends React.Component {0
        state = {text: ''};0
        push(val) {0
          this.setState(state => ({text: state.text + val}));0
        }0
        componentDidUpdate() {0
          ops.push(this.state.text);0
        }0
        render() {0
          instance = this;0
          return <span>{this.state.text}</span>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container);0
0
      instance.push('A');0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['A']);0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('A');0
0
      ReactDOM.flushSync(() => {0
        instance.push('B');0
        instance.push('C');0
        // Not flushed yet0
        expect(container.textContent).toEqual('A');0
        expect(ops).toEqual(['A']);0
      });0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('ABC');0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['A', 'ABC']);0
      instance.push('D');0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('ABCD');0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['A', 'ABC', 'ABCD']);0
    });0
0
    it('flushSync flushes updates even if nested inside another flushSync', () => {0
      let ops = [];0
      let instance;0
0
      class Component extends React.Component {0
        state = {text: ''};0
        push(val) {0
          this.setState(state => ({text: state.text + val}));0
        }0
        componentDidUpdate() {0
          ops.push(this.state.text);0
        }0
        render() {0
          instance = this;0
          return <span>{this.state.text}</span>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container);0
0
      instance.push('A');0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['A']);0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('A');0
0
      ReactDOM.flushSync(() => {0
        instance.push('B');0
        instance.push('C');0
        // Not flushed yet0
        expect(container.textContent).toEqual('A');0
        expect(ops).toEqual(['A']);0
0
        ReactDOM.flushSync(() => {0
          instance.push('D');0
        });0
        // The nested flushSync caused everything to flush.0
        expect(container.textContent).toEqual('ABCD');0
        expect(ops).toEqual(['A', 'ABCD']);0
      });0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('ABCD');0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['A', 'ABCD']);0
    });0
0
    it('flushSync throws if already performing work', () => {0
      class Component extends React.Component {0
        componentDidUpdate() {0
          ReactDOM.flushSync(() => {});0
        }0
        render() {0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      // Initial mount0
      ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container);0
      // Update0
      expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container)).toThrow(0
        'flushSync was called from inside a lifecycle method',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('flushSync flushes updates before end of the tick', () => {0
      let ops = [];0
      let instance;0
0
      class Component extends React.Component {0
        state = {text: ''};0
        push(val) {0
          this.setState(state => ({text: state.text + val}));0
        }0
        componentDidUpdate() {0
          ops.push(this.state.text);0
        }0
        render() {0
          instance = this;0
          return <span>{this.state.text}</span>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <AsyncMode>0
          <Component />0
        </AsyncMode>,0
        container,0
      );0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
0
      // Updates are async by default0
      instance.push('A');0
      expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('');0
0
      ReactDOM.flushSync(() => {0
        instance.push('B');0
        instance.push('C');0
        // Not flushed yet0
        expect(container.textContent).toEqual('');0
        expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
      });0
      // Only the active updates have flushed0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('BC');0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['BC']);0
0
      instance.push('D');0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('BC');0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['BC']);0
0
      // Flush the async updates0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('ABCD');0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['BC', 'ABCD']);0
    });0
0
    it('flushControlled flushes updates before yielding to browser', () => {0
      let inst;0
      class Counter extends React.Component {0
        state = {counter: 0};0
        increment = () =>0
          this.setState(state => ({counter: state.counter + 1}));0
        render() {0
          inst = this;0
          return this.state.counter;0
        }0
      }0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <AsyncMode>0
          <Counter />0
        </AsyncMode>,0
        container,0
      );0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('0');0
0
      // Test that a normal update is async0
      inst.increment();0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('0');0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('1');0
0
      let ops = [];0
      ReactDOM.unstable_flushControlled(() => {0
        inst.increment();0
        ReactDOM.unstable_flushControlled(() => {0
          inst.increment();0
          ops.push('end of inner flush: ' + container.textContent);0
        });0
        ops.push('end of outer flush: ' + container.textContent);0
      });0
      ops.push('after outer flush: ' + container.textContent);0
      expect(ops).toEqual([0
        'end of inner flush: 1',0
        'end of outer flush: 1',0
        'after outer flush: 3',0
      ]);0
    });0
0
    it('flushControlled does not flush until end of outermost batchedUpdates', () => {0
      let inst;0
      class Counter extends React.Component {0
        state = {counter: 0};0
        increment = () =>0
          this.setState(state => ({counter: state.counter + 1}));0
        render() {0
          inst = this;0
          return this.state.counter;0
        }0
      }0
      ReactDOM.render(<Counter />, container);0
0
      let ops = [];0
      ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(() => {0
        inst.increment();0
        ReactDOM.unstable_flushControlled(() => {0
          inst.increment();0
          ops.push('end of flushControlled fn: ' + container.textContent);0
        });0
        ops.push('end of batchedUpdates fn: ' + container.textContent);0
      });0
      ops.push('after batchedUpdates: ' + container.textContent);0
      expect(ops).toEqual([0
        'end of flushControlled fn: 0',0
        'end of batchedUpdates fn: 0',0
        'after batchedUpdates: 2',0
      ]);0
    });0
0
    it('flushControlled returns nothing', () => {0
      // In the future, we may want to return a thenable "work" object.0
      let inst;0
      class Counter extends React.Component {0
        state = {counter: 0};0
        increment = () =>0
          this.setState(state => ({counter: state.counter + 1}));0
        render() {0
          inst = this;0
          return this.state.counter;0
        }0
      }0
      ReactDOM.render(<Counter />, container);0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('0');0
0
      const returnValue = ReactDOM.unstable_flushControlled(() => {0
        inst.increment();0
        return 'something';0
      });0
      expect(container.textContent).toEqual('1');0
      expect(returnValue).toBe(undefined);0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0

 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
describe('ReactDOMIframe', () => {0
  let React;0
  let ReactTestUtils;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
  });0
0
  it('should trigger load events', () => {0
    const onLoadSpy = jest.fn();0
    let iframe = React.createElement('iframe', {onLoad: onLoadSpy});0
    iframe = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(iframe);0
0
    const loadEvent = document.createEvent('Event');0
    loadEvent.initEvent('load', false, false);0
0
    iframe.dispatchEvent(loadEvent);0
0
    expect(onLoadSpy).toHaveBeenCalled();0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
function emptyFunction() {}0
0
describe('ReactDOMInput', () => {0
  let React;0
  let ReactDOM;0
  let ReactDOMServer;0
  let ReactTestUtils;0
  let setUntrackedValue;0
0
  function dispatchEventOnNode(node, type) {0
    node.dispatchEvent(new Event(type, {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}));0
  }0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    setUntrackedValue = Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(0
      HTMLInputElement.prototype,0
      'value',0
    ).set;0
0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
  });0
0
  it('should properly control a value even if no event listener exists', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    let node;0
0
    expect(() => {0
      node = ReactDOM.render(<input type="text" value="lion" />, container);0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Failed prop type: You provided a `value` prop to a form field without an `onChange` handler.',0
    );0
0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
    try {0
      setUntrackedValue.call(node, 'giraffe');0
0
      // This must use the native event dispatching. If we simulate, we will0
      // bypass the lazy event attachment system so we won't actually test this.0
      dispatchEventOnNode(node, 'change');0
0
      expect(node.value).toBe('lion');0
    } finally {0
      document.body.removeChild(container);0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('should control a value in reentrant events', () => {0
    class ControlledInputs extends React.Component {0
      state = {value: 'lion'};0
      a = null;0
      b = null;0
      switchedFocus = false;0
      change(newValue) {0
        this.setState({value: newValue});0
        // Calling focus here will blur the text box which causes a native0
        // change event. Ideally we shouldn't have to fire this ourselves.0
        // Don't remove unless you've verified the fix in #8240 is still covered.0
        dispatchEventOnNode(this.a, 'change');0
        this.b.focus();0
      }0
      blur(currentValue) {0
        this.switchedFocus = true;0
        // currentValue should be 'giraffe' here because we should not have0
        // restored it on the target yet.0
        this.setState({value: currentValue});0
      }0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <input0
              type="text"0
              ref={n => (this.a = n)}0
              value={this.state.value}0
              onChange={e => this.change(e.target.value)}0
              onBlur={e => this.blur(e.target.value)}0
            />0
            <input type="text" ref={n => (this.b = n)} />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(<ControlledInputs />, container);0
0
    // We need it to be in the body to test native event dispatching.0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
    // Focus the field so we can later blur it.0
    // Don't remove unless you've verified the fix in #8240 is still covered.0
    instance.a.focus();0
    setUntrackedValue.call(instance.a, 'giraffe');0
    // This must use the native event dispatching. If we simulate, we will0
    // bypass the lazy event attachment system so we won't actually test this.0
    dispatchEventOnNode(instance.a, 'change');0
    dispatchEventOnNode(instance.a, 'blur');0
0
    expect(instance.a.value).toBe('giraffe');0
    expect(instance.switchedFocus).toBe(true);0
0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
  });0
0
  it('should control values in reentrant events with different targets', () => {0
    class ControlledInputs extends React.Component {0
      state = {value: 'lion'};0
      a = null;0
      b = null;0
      change(newValue) {0
        // This click will change the checkbox's value to false. Then it will0
        // invoke an inner change event. When we finally, flush, we need to0
        // reset the checkbox's value to true since that is its controlled0
        // value.0
        this.b.click();0
      }0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <input0
              type="text"0
              ref={n => (this.a = n)}0
              value="lion"0
              onChange={e => this.change(e.target.value)}0
            />0
            <input0
              type="checkbox"0
              ref={n => (this.b = n)}0
              checked={true}0
              onChange={() => {}}0
            />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(<ControlledInputs />, container);0
0
    // We need it to be in the body to test native event dispatching.0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
    setUntrackedValue.call(instance.a, 'giraffe');0
    // This must use the native event dispatching. If we simulate, we will0
    // bypass the lazy event attachment system so we won't actually test this.0
    dispatchEventOnNode(instance.a, 'input');0
0
    expect(instance.a.value).toBe('lion');0
    expect(instance.b.checked).toBe(true);0
0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
  });0
0
  describe('switching text inputs between numeric and string numbers', () => {0
    it('does change the number 2 to "2.0" with no change handler', () => {0
      const stub = <input type="text" value={2} onChange={jest.fn()} />;0
      const node = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(stub);0
0
      node.value = '2.0';0
0
      ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(node);0
0
      expect(node.getAttribute('value')).toBe('2');0
      expect(node.value).toBe('2');0
    });0
0
    it('does change the string "2" to "2.0" with no change handler', () => {0
      const stub = <input type="text" value={'2'} onChange={jest.fn()} />;0
      const node = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(stub);0
0
      node.value = '2.0';0
0
      ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(node);0
0
      expect(node.getAttribute('value')).toBe('2');0
      expect(node.value).toBe('2');0
    });0
0
    it('changes the number 2 to "2.0" using a change handler', () => {0
      class Stub extends React.Component {0
        state = {0
          value: 2,0
        };0
        onChange = event => {0
          this.setState({value: event.target.value});0
        };0
        render() {0
          const {value} = this.state;0
0
          return <input type="text" value={value} onChange={this.onChange} />;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const stub = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Stub />);0
      const node = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(stub);0
0
      node.value = '2.0';0
0
      ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(node);0
0
      expect(node.getAttribute('value')).toBe('2.0');0
      expect(node.value).toBe('2.0');0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('does change the string ".98" to "0.98" with no change handler', () => {0
    class Stub extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        value: '.98',0
      };0
      render() {0
        return <input type="number" value={this.state.value} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let stub;0
    expect(() => {0
      stub = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Stub />);0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'You provided a `value` prop to a form field ' +0
        'without an `onChange` handler.',0
    );0
    const node = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(stub);0
    stub.setState({value: '0.98'});0
0
    expect(node.value).toEqual('0.98');0
  });0
0
  it('performs a state change from "" to 0', () => {0
    class Stub extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        value: '',0
      };0
      render() {0
        return <input type="number" value={this.state.value} readOnly={true} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const stub = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Stub />);0
    const node = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(stub);0
    stub.setState({value: 0});0
0
    expect(node.value).toEqual('0');0
  });0
0
  it('updates the value on radio buttons from "" to 0', function() {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <input type="radio" value="" onChange={function() {}} />,0
      container,0
    );0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <input type="radio" value={0} onChange={function() {}} />,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.firstChild.value).toBe('0');0
    expect(container.firstChild.getAttribute('value')).toBe('0');0
  });0
0
  it('updates the value on checkboxes from "" to 0', function() {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <input type="checkbox" value="" onChange={function() {}} />,0
      container,0
    );0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <input type="checkbox" value={0} onChange={function() {}} />,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.firstChild.value).toBe('0');0
    expect(container.firstChild.getAttribute('value')).toBe('0');0
  });0
0
  it('distinguishes precision for extra zeroes in string number values', () => {0
    class Stub extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        value: '3.0000',0
      };0
      render() {0
        return <input type="number" value={this.state.value} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let stub;0
0
    expect(() => {0
      stub = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Stub />);0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'You provided a `value` prop to a form field ' +0
        'without an `onChange` handler.',0
    );0
    const node = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(stub);0
    stub.setState({value: '3'});0
0
    expect(node.value).toEqual('3');0
  });0
0
  it('should display `defaultValue` of number 0', () => {0

    const node = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(stub);0
0
    expect(node.getAttribute('value')).toBe('0');0
    expect(node.value).toBe('0');0
  });0
0
  it('only assigns defaultValue if it changes', () => {0
    class Test extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <input defaultValue="0" />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const component = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Test />);0
    const node = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(component);0
0
    Object.defineProperty(node, 'defaultValue', {0
      get() {0
        return '0';0
      },0
      set(value) {0
        throw new Error(0
          `defaultValue was assigned ${value}, but it did not change!`,0
        );0
      },0
    });0
0
    component.forceUpdate();0
  });0

    const container = document.createElement('div');0

      container,0
    );0

      'A component is changing a controlled input of type ' +0

    );0

0
  it('should not incur unnecessary DOM mutations', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<input value="a" onChange={() => {}} />, container);0
0
    const node = container.firstChild;0
    let nodeValue = 'a';0
    const nodeValueSetter = jest.fn();0
    Object.defineProperty(node, 'value', {0
      get: function() {0
        return nodeValue;0
      },0
      set: nodeValueSetter.mockImplementation(function(newValue) {0
        nodeValue = newValue;0
      }),0
    });0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<input value="a" onChange={() => {}} />, container);0
    expect(nodeValueSetter).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<input value="b" onChange={() => {}} />, container);0
    expect(nodeValueSetter).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should not incur unnecessary DOM mutations for numeric type conversion', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<input value="0" onChange={() => {}} />, container);0
0
    const node = container.firstChild;0
    let nodeValue = '0';0
    const nodeValueSetter = jest.fn();0
    Object.defineProperty(node, 'value', {0
      get: function() {0
        return nodeValue;0
      },0
      set: nodeValueSetter.mockImplementation(function(newValue) {0
        nodeValue = newValue;0
      }),0
    });0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<input value={0} onChange={() => {}} />, container);0
    expect(nodeValueSetter).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
  });0
0

  it('should have the correct target value', () => {0
    let handled = false;0
    const handler = function(event) {0
      expect(event.target.nodeName).toBe('INPUT');0
      handled = true;0
    };0
    const stub = <input type="text" value={0} onChange={handler} />;0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(stub, container);0
0
    setUntrackedValue.call(node, 'giraffe');0
0
    ReactTestUtils.SimulateNative.input(node, {0
      path: [node, container],0
    });0
0
    expect(handled).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('should not set a value for submit buttons unnecessarily', () => {0
    const stub = <input type="submit" />;0
    const node = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(stub);0
0
    // The value shouldn't be '', or else the button will have no text; it0
    // should have the default "Submit" or "Submit Query" label. Most browsers0
    // report this as not having a `value` attribute at all; IE reports it as0
    // the actual label that the user sees.0
    expect(0
      !node.hasAttribute('value') || node.getAttribute('value').length > 0,0
    ).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('should control radio buttons', () => {0
    class RadioGroup extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <input0
              ref="a"0
              type="radio"0
              name="fruit"0
              checked={true}0
              onChange={emptyFunction}0
            />0
            A0
            <input ref="b" type="radio" name="fruit" onChange={emptyFunction} />0
            B0
            <form>0
              <input0
                ref="c"0
                type="radio"0
                name="fruit"0
                defaultChecked={true}0
                onChange={emptyFunction}0
              />0
            </form>0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const stub = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<RadioGroup />);0
    const aNode = stub.refs.a;0
    const bNode = stub.refs.b;0
    const cNode = stub.refs.c;0
0
    expect(aNode.checked).toBe(true);0
    expect(bNode.checked).toBe(false);0
    // c is in a separate form and shouldn't be affected at all here0
    expect(cNode.checked).toBe(true);0
0
    bNode.checked = true;0
    // This next line isn't necessary in a proper browser environment, but0
    // jsdom doesn't uncheck the others in a group (which makes this whole test0
    // a little less effective)0
    aNode.checked = false;0
    expect(cNode.checked).toBe(true);0
0
    // Now let's run the actual ReactDOMInput change event handler0
    ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(bNode);0
0
    // The original state should have been restored0
    expect(aNode.checked).toBe(true);0
    expect(cNode.checked).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('should check the correct radio when the selected name moves', () => {0
    class App extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        updated: false,0
      };0
      onClick = () => {0
        this.setState({updated: true});0
      };0
      render() {0
        const {updated} = this.state;0
        const radioName = updated ? 'secondName' : 'firstName';0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <button type="button" onClick={this.onClick} />0
            <input0
              type="radio"0
              name={radioName}0
              onChange={emptyFunction}0
              checked={updated === true}0
            />0
            <input0
              type="radio"0
              name={radioName}0
              onChange={emptyFunction}0
              checked={updated === false}0
            />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const stub = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<App />);0
    const buttonNode = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(stub).childNodes[0];0
    const firstRadioNode = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(stub).childNodes[1];0
    expect(firstRadioNode.checked).toBe(false);0
    ReactTestUtils.Simulate.click(buttonNode);0
    expect(firstRadioNode.checked).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('should control radio buttons if the tree updates during render', () => {0
    const sharedParent = document.createElement('div');0
    const container1 = document.createElement('div');0
    const container2 = document.createElement('div');0
0
    sharedParent.appendChild(container1);0
0
    let aNode;0
    let bNode;0
    class ComponentA extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ReactDOM.render(<ComponentB />, container2);0
      }0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <input0
              ref={n => (aNode = n)}0
              type="radio"0
              name="fruit"0
              checked={true}0
              onChange={emptyFunction}0
            />0
            A0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class ComponentB extends React.Component {0
      state = {changed: false};0
      handleChange = () => {0
        this.setState({0
          changed: true,0
        });0
      };0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        sharedParent.appendChild(container2);0
      }0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <input0
              ref={n => (bNode = n)}0
              type="radio"0
              name="fruit"0
              checked={false}0
              onChange={this.handleChange}0
            />0
            B0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<ComponentA />, container1);0
0
    expect(aNode.checked).toBe(true);0
    expect(bNode.checked).toBe(false);0
0
    bNode.checked = true;0
    // This next line isn't necessary in a proper browser environment, but0
    // jsdom doesn't uncheck the others in a group (which makes this whole test0
    // a little less effective)0
    aNode.checked = false;0
0
    // Now let's run the actual ReactDOMInput change event handler0
    ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(bNode);0
0
    // The original state should have been restored0
    expect(aNode.checked).toBe(true);0
    expect(bNode.checked).toBe(false);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn with value and no onChange handler and readOnly specified', () => {0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <input type="text" value="zoink" readOnly={true} />,0
    );0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <input type="text" value="zoink" readOnly={false} />,0
      ),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed prop type: You provided a `value` prop to a form ' +0
        'field without an `onChange` handler. This will render a read-only ' +0
        'field. If the field should be mutable use `defaultValue`. ' +0
        'Otherwise, set either `onChange` or `readOnly`.\n' +0
        '    in input (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should have a this value of undefined if bind is not used', () => {0
    const unboundInputOnChange = function() {0
      expect(this).toBe(undefined);0
    };0
0
    let instance = <input type="text" onChange={unboundInputOnChange} />;0
    instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance);0
0
    ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(instance);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn with checked and no onChange handler with readOnly specified', () => {0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <input type="checkbox" checked="false" readOnly={true} />,0
    );0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <input type="checkbox" checked="false" readOnly={false} />,0
      ),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Failed prop type: You provided a `checked` prop to a form field without an `onChange` handler. ' +0
        'This will render a read-only field. If the field should be mutable use `defaultChecked`. ' +0
        'Otherwise, set either `onChange` or `readOnly`.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should update defaultValue to empty string', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<input type="text" defaultValue={'foo'} />, container);0
    ReactDOM.render(<input type="text" defaultValue={''} />, container);0
    expect(container.firstChild.defaultValue).toBe('');0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if value is null', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<input type="text" value={null} />),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      '`value` prop on `input` should not be null. ' +0
        'Consider using an empty string to clear the component or `undefined` ' +0
        'for uncontrolled components.',0
    );0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<input type="text" value={null} />);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if checked and defaultChecked props are specified', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <input0
          type="radio"0
          checked={true}0
          defaultChecked={true}0
          readOnly={true}0
        />,0
      ),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'A component contains an input of type radio with both checked and defaultChecked props. ' +0
        'Input elements must be either controlled or uncontrolled ' +0
        '(specify either the checked prop, or the defaultChecked prop, but not ' +0
        'both). Decide between using a controlled or uncontrolled input ' +0
        'element and remove one of these props. More info: ' +0
        'https://fb.me/react-controlled-components',0
    );0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <input0
        type="radio"0
        checked={true}0
        defaultChecked={true}0
        readOnly={true}0
      />,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if value and defaultValue props are specified', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <input type="text" value="foo" defaultValue="bar" readOnly={true} />,0
      ),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'A component contains an input of type text with both value and defaultValue props. ' +0
        'Input elements must be either controlled or uncontrolled ' +0
        '(specify either the value prop, or the defaultValue prop, but not ' +0
        'both). Decide between using a controlled or uncontrolled input ' +0
        'element and remove one of these props. More info: ' +0
        'https://fb.me/react-controlled-components',0
    );0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <input type="text" value="foo" defaultValue="bar" readOnly={true} />,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if controlled input switches to uncontrolled (value is undefined)', () => {0
    const stub = (0
      <input type="text" value="controlled" onChange={emptyFunction} />0
    );0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(stub, container);0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<input type="text" />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: A component is changing a controlled input of type text to be uncontrolled. ' +0
        'Input elements should not switch from controlled to uncontrolled (or vice versa). ' +0
        'Decide between using a controlled or uncontrolled input ' +0
        'element for the lifetime of the component. More info: https://fb.me/react-controlled-components\n' +0
        '    in input (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if controlled input switches to uncontrolled (value is null)', () => {0
    const stub = (0
      <input type="text" value="controlled" onChange={emptyFunction} />0
    );0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(stub, container);0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactDOM.render(<input type="text" value={null} />, container),0
    ).toWarnDev([0
      '`value` prop on `input` should not be null. ' +0
        'Consider using an empty string to clear the component or `undefined` for uncontrolled components',0

  it('should not warn if radio value changes but never becomes controlled', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<input type="radio" value="value" />, container);0
    ReactDOM.render(<input type="radio" />, container);0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <input type="radio" value="value" defaultChecked={true} />,0
      container,0
    );0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <input type="radio" value="value" onChange={() => null} />,0
      container,0
    );0
    ReactDOM.render(<input type="radio" />, container);0
  });0
0
  it('should not warn if radio value changes but never becomes uncontrolled', () => {0

    );0

    ReactDOM.render(0

        onChange={() => null}0

    ).toWarnDev(0

        'Input elements should not switch from controlled to uncontrolled (or vice versa). ' +0
        'Decide between using a controlled or uncontrolled input ' +0

        '    in input (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('sets type, step, min, max before value always', () => {0
    const log = [];0
    const originalCreateElement = document.createElement;0
    spyOnDevAndProd(document, 'createElement').and.callFake(function(type) {0
      const el = originalCreateElement.apply(this, arguments);0
      let value = '';0
0
      if (type === 'input') {0
        Object.defineProperty(el, 'value', {0
          get: function() {0
            return value;0
          },0
          set: function(val) {0
            value = '' + val;0
            log.push('set property value');0
          },0
        });0
        spyOnDevAndProd(el, 'setAttribute').and.callFake(function(name) {0
          log.push('set attribute ' + name);0
        });0
      }0
      return el;0
    });0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <input0
        value="0"0
        onChange={() => {}}0
        type="range"0
        min="0"0
        max="100"0
        step="1"0
      />,0
    );0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'set attribute type',0
      'set attribute min',0
      'set attribute max',0
      'set attribute step',0
      'set property value',0
      'set attribute value',0
      'set attribute checked',0
      'set attribute checked',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('sets value properly with type coming later in props', () => {0
    const input = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <input value="hi" type="radio" />,0
    );0
    expect(input.value).toBe('hi');0
  });0
0
  it('does not raise a validation warning when it switches types', () => {0
    class Input extends React.Component {0
      state = {type: 'number', value: 1000};0
0
      render() {0
        const {value, type} = this.state;0
        return <input onChange={() => {}} type={type} value={value} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const input = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Input />);0
    const node = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(input);0
0
    // If the value is set before the type, a validation warning will raise and0
    // the value will not be assigned.0
    input.setState({type: 'text', value: 'Test'});0
    expect(node.value).toEqual('Test');0
  });0
0
  it('resets value of date/time input to fix bugs in iOS Safari', () => {0
    function strify(x) {0
      return JSON.stringify(x, null, 2);0
    }0
0
    const log = [];0
    const originalCreateElement = document.createElement;0
    spyOnDevAndProd(document, 'createElement').and.callFake(function(type) {0
      const el = originalCreateElement.apply(this, arguments);0
      let value = '';0
      if (type === 'input') {0
        Object.defineProperty(el, 'value', {0
          get: function() {0
            return value;0
          },0
          set: function(val) {0
            value = '' + val;0
            log.push(`node.value = ${strify(val)}`);0
          },0
        });0
        spyOnDevAndProd(el, 'setAttribute').and.callFake(function(name, val) {0
          log.push(`node.setAttribute(${strify(name)}, ${strify(val)})`);0
        });0
      }0
      return el;0
    });0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <input type="date" defaultValue="1980-01-01" />,0
    );0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'node.setAttribute("type", "date")',0
      'node.value = "1980-01-01"',0
      'node.setAttribute("value", "1980-01-01")',0
      'node.setAttribute("checked", "")',0
      'node.setAttribute("checked", "")',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  describe('assigning the value attribute on controlled inputs', function() {0
    function getTestInput() {0
      return class extends React.Component {0
        state = {0
          value: this.props.value == null ? '' : this.props.value,0
        };0
        onChange = event => {0
          this.setState({value: event.target.value});0
        };0
        render() {0
          const type = this.props.type;0
          const value = this.state.value;0
0
          return <input type={type} value={value} onChange={this.onChange} />;0
        }0
      };0
    }0
0
    it('always sets the attribute when values change on text inputs', function() {0
      const Input = getTestInput();0
      const stub = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Input type="text" />);0
      const node = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(stub);0
0
      ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(node, {target: {value: '2'}});0
0
      expect(node.getAttribute('value')).toBe('2');0
    });0
0
    it('does not set the value attribute on number inputs if focused', () => {0
      const Input = getTestInput();0
      const stub = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <Input type="number" value="1" />,0
      );0
      const node = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(stub);0
0
      node.focus();0
0
      ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(node, {target: {value: '2'}});0
0
      expect(node.getAttribute('value')).toBe('1');0
    });0
0
    it('sets the value attribute on number inputs on blur', () => {0
      const Input = getTestInput();0
      const stub = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <Input type="number" value="1" />,0
      );0
      const node = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(stub);0
0
      ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(node, {target: {value: '2'}});0
      ReactTestUtils.SimulateNative.blur(node);0
0
      expect(node.getAttribute('value')).toBe('2');0
    });0
0
    it('an uncontrolled number input will not update the value attribute on blur', () => {0
      const node = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <input type="number" defaultValue="1" />,0
      );0
0
      node.value = 4;0
0
      ReactTestUtils.SimulateNative.blur(node);0
0
      expect(node.getAttribute('value')).toBe('1');0
    });0
0
    it('an uncontrolled text input will not update the value attribute on blur', () => {0
      const node = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <input type="text" defaultValue="1" />,0
      );0
0
      node.value = 4;0
0
      ReactTestUtils.SimulateNative.blur(node);0
0
      expect(node.getAttribute('value')).toBe('1');0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('setting a controlled input to undefined', () => {0
    let input;0
0
    function renderInputWithStringThenWithUndefined() {0
      class Input extends React.Component {0
        state = {value: 'first'};0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <input0
              onChange={e => this.setState({value: e.target.value})}0
              value={this.state.value}0
            />0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      const stub = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Input />);0
      input = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(stub);0
      ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(input, {target: {value: 'latest'}});0
      ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(input, {target: {value: undefined}});0
    }0
0
    it('reverts the value attribute to the initial value', () => {0
      expect(renderInputWithStringThenWithUndefined).toWarnDev(0
        'Input elements should not switch from controlled to ' +0
          'uncontrolled (or vice versa).',0
      );0
      expect(input.getAttribute('value')).toBe('first');0
    });0
0
    it('preserves the value property', () => {0
      expect(renderInputWithStringThenWithUndefined).toWarnDev(0
        'Input elements should not switch from controlled to ' +0
          'uncontrolled (or vice versa).',0
      );0
      expect(input.value).toBe('latest');0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('setting a controlled input to null', () => {0
    let input;0
0
    function renderInputWithStringThenWithNull() {0
      class Input extends React.Component {0
        state = {value: 'first'};0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <input0
              onChange={e => this.setState({value: e.target.value})}0
              value={this.state.value}0
            />0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      const stub = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Input />);0
      input = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(stub);0
      ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(input, {target: {value: 'latest'}});0
      ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(input, {target: {value: null}});0
    }0
0
    it('reverts the value attribute to the initial value', () => {0
      expect(renderInputWithStringThenWithNull).toWarnDev([0
        '`value` prop on `input` should not be null. ' +0
          'Consider using an empty string to clear the component ' +0
          'or `undefined` for uncontrolled components.',0
        'Input elements should not switch from controlled ' +0
          'to uncontrolled (or vice versa).',0
      ]);0
      expect(input.getAttribute('value')).toBe('first');0
    });0
0
    it('preserves the value property', () => {0
      expect(renderInputWithStringThenWithNull).toWarnDev([0
        '`value` prop on `input` should not be null. ' +0
          'Consider using an empty string to clear the component ' +0
          'or `undefined` for uncontrolled components.',0
        'Input elements should not switch from controlled ' +0
          'to uncontrolled (or vice versa).',0
      ]);0
      expect(input.value).toBe('latest');0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('When given a Symbol value', function() {0
    it('treats initial Symbol value as an empty string', function() {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOM.render(0
          <input value={Symbol('foobar')} onChange={() => {}} />,0
          container,0
        ),0
      ).toWarnDev('Invalid value for prop `value`');0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
0
      expect(node.value).toBe('');0
      expect(node.getAttribute('value')).toBe('');0
    });0
0
    it('treats updated Symbol value as an empty string', function() {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<input value="foo" onChange={() => {}} />, container);0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOM.render(0
          <input value={Symbol('foobar')} onChange={() => {}} />,0
          container,0
        ),0
      ).toWarnDev('Invalid value for prop `value`');0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
0
      expect(node.value).toBe('');0
      expect(node.getAttribute('value')).toBe('');0
    });0
0
    it('treats initial Symbol defaultValue as an empty string', function() {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<input defaultValue={Symbol('foobar')} />, container);0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
0
      expect(node.value).toBe('');0
      expect(node.getAttribute('value')).toBe('');0
      // TODO: we should warn here.0
    });0
0
    it('treats updated Symbol defaultValue as an empty string', function() {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<input defaultValue="foo" />, container);0
      ReactDOM.render(<input defaultValue={Symbol('foobar')} />, container);0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
0
      expect(node.value).toBe('foo');0
      expect(node.getAttribute('value')).toBe('');0
      // TODO: we should warn here.0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('When given a function value', function() {0
    it('treats initial function value as an empty string', function() {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOM.render(0
          <input value={() => {}} onChange={() => {}} />,0
          container,0
        ),0
      ).toWarnDev('Invalid value for prop `value`');0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
0
      expect(node.value).toBe('');0
      expect(node.getAttribute('value')).toBe('');0
    });0
0
    it('treats updated function value as an empty string', function() {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<input value="foo" onChange={() => {}} />, container);0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOM.render(0
          <input value={() => {}} onChange={() => {}} />,0
          container,0
        ),0
      ).toWarnDev('Invalid value for prop `value`');0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
0
      expect(node.value).toBe('');0
      expect(node.getAttribute('value')).toBe('');0
    });0
0
    it('treats initial function defaultValue as an empty string', function() {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<input defaultValue={() => {}} />, container);0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
0
      expect(node.value).toBe('');0
      expect(node.getAttribute('value')).toBe('');0
      // TODO: we should warn here.0
    });0
0
    it('treats updated function defaultValue as an empty string', function() {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<input defaultValue="foo" />, container);0
      ReactDOM.render(<input defaultValue={() => {}} />, container);0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
0
      expect(node.value).toBe('foo');0
      expect(node.getAttribute('value')).toBe('');0
      // TODO: we should warn here.0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('checked inputs without a value property', function() {0
    // In absence of a value, radio and checkboxes report a value of "on".0
    // Between 16 and 16.2, we assigned a node's value to it's current0
    // value in order to "dettach" it from defaultValue. This had the unfortunate0
    // side-effect of assigning value="on" to radio and checkboxes0
    it('does not add "on" in absence of value on a checkbox', function() {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <input type="checkbox" defaultChecked={true} />,0
        container,0
      );0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
0
      expect(node.value).toBe('on');0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('value')).toBe(false);0
    });0
0
    it('does not add "on" in absence of value on a radio', function() {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOM.render(<input type="radio" defaultChecked={true} />, container);0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
0
      expect(node.value).toBe('on');0
      expect(node.hasAttribute('value')).toBe(false);0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0
