 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
describe('ReactDOMInvalidARIAHook', () => {0
  let React;0
  let ReactTestUtils;0
  let mountComponent;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
0
    mountComponent = function(props) {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<div {...props} />);0
    };0
  });0
0
  describe('aria-* props', () => {0
    it('should allow valid aria-* props', () => {0
      mountComponent({'aria-label': 'Bumble bees'});0
    });0
    it('should warn for one invalid aria-* prop', () => {0
      expect(() => mountComponent({'aria-badprop': 'maybe'})).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid aria prop `aria-badprop` on <div> tag. ' +0
          'For details, see https://fb.me/invalid-aria-prop',0
      );0
    });0
    it('should warn for many invalid aria-* props', () => {0
      expect(() =>0
        mountComponent({0
          'aria-badprop': 'Very tall trees',0
          'aria-malprop': 'Turbulent seas',0
        }),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid aria props `aria-badprop`, `aria-malprop` on <div> ' +0
          'tag. For details, see https://fb.me/invalid-aria-prop',0
      );0
    });0
    it('should warn for an improperly cased aria-* prop', () => {0
      // The valid attribute name is aria-haspopup.0
      expect(() => mountComponent({'aria-hasPopup': 'true'})).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Unknown ARIA attribute `aria-hasPopup`. ' +0
          'Did you mean `aria-haspopup`?',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should warn for use of recognized camel case aria attributes', () => {0
      // The valid attribute name is aria-haspopup.0
      expect(() => mountComponent({ariaHasPopup: 'true'})).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid ARIA attribute `ariaHasPopup`. ' +0
          'Did you mean `aria-haspopup`?',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should warn for use of unrecognized camel case aria attributes', () => {0
      // The valid attribute name is aria-haspopup.0
      expect(() => mountComponent({ariaSomethingInvalid: 'true'})).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: Invalid ARIA attribute `ariaSomethingInvalid`. ARIA ' +0
          'attributes follow the pattern aria-* and must be lowercase.',0
      );0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
describe('ReactDOMOption', () => {0
  let React;0
  let ReactDOM;0
  let ReactTestUtils;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
  });0
0
  it('should flatten children to a string', () => {0
    let stub = (0
      <option>0
        {1} {'foo'}0
      </option>0
    );0
    const node = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(stub);0
0
    expect(node.innerHTML).toBe('1 foo');0
  });0
0
  it('should ignore and warn invalid children types', () => {0
    const el = (0
      <option>0
        {1} <div /> {2}0
      </option>0
    );0
    let node;0
    expect(() => {0
      node = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(el);0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      '<div> cannot appear as a child of <option>.\n' +0
        '    in div (at **)\n' +0
        '    in option (at **)',0
    );0
    expect(node.innerHTML).toBe('1  2');0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(el);0
  });0
0
  it('should ignore null/undefined/false children without warning', () => {0
    let stub = (0
      <option>0
        {1} {false}0
        {true}0
        {null}0
        {undefined} {2}0
      </option>0
    );0
    const node = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(stub);0
0
    expect(node.innerHTML).toBe('1  2');0
  });0
0
  it('should be able to use dangerouslySetInnerHTML on option', () => {0
    let stub = <option dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: 'foobar'}} />;0
    const node = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(stub);0
0
    expect(node.innerHTML).toBe('foobar');0
  });0
0
  it('should set attribute for empty value', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const option = ReactDOM.render(<option value="" />, container);0
    expect(option.hasAttribute('value')).toBe(true);0
    expect(option.getAttribute('value')).toBe('');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<option value="lava" />, container);0
    expect(option.hasAttribute('value')).toBe(true);0
    expect(option.getAttribute('value')).toBe('lava');0
  });0
0
  it('should allow ignoring `value` on option', () => {0
    const a = 'a';0
    let stub = (0
      <select value="giraffe" onChange={() => {}}>0
        <option>monkey</option>0
        <option>gir{a}ffe</option>0
        <option>gorill{a}</option>0
      </select>0
    );0
    const options = stub.props.children;0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(stub, container);0
0
    expect(node.selectedIndex).toBe(1);0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<select value="gorilla">{options}</select>, container);0
    expect(node.selectedIndex).toEqual(2);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React = require('react');0
let ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
let ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
let AsyncMode = React.unstable_AsyncMode;0
0
describe('ReactDOMRoot', () => {0
  let container;0
0
  let advanceCurrentTime;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    // TODO pull this into helper method, reduce repetition.0
    // mock the browser APIs which are used in react-scheduler:0
    // - requestAnimationFrame should pass the DOMHighResTimeStamp argument0
    // - calling 'window.postMessage' should actually fire postmessage handlers0
    // - must allow artificially changing time returned by Date.now0
    // Performance.now is not supported in the test environment0
    const originalDateNow = Date.now;0
    let advancedTime = null;0
    global.Date.now = function() {0
      if (advancedTime) {0
        return originalDateNow() + advancedTime;0
      }0
      return originalDateNow();0
    };0
    advanceCurrentTime = function(amount) {0
      advancedTime = amount;0
    };0
    global.requestAnimationFrame = function(cb) {0
      return setTimeout(() => {0
        cb(Date.now());0
      });0
    };0
    const originalAddEventListener = global.addEventListener;0
    let postMessageCallback;0
    global.addEventListener = function(eventName, callback, useCapture) {0
      if (eventName === 'message') {0
        postMessageCallback = callback;0
      } else {0
        originalAddEventListener(eventName, callback, useCapture);0
      }0
    };0
    global.postMessage = function(messageKey, targetOrigin) {0
      const postMessageEvent = {source: window, data: messageKey};0
      if (postMessageCallback) {0
        postMessageCallback(postMessageEvent);0
      }0
    };0
0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
    AsyncMode = React.unstable_AsyncMode;0
  });0
0
  it('renders children', () => {0
    const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
    root.render(<div>Hi</div>);0
    jest.runAllTimers();0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('Hi');0
  });0
0
  it('unmounts children', () => {0
    const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
    root.render(<div>Hi</div>);0
    jest.runAllTimers();0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('Hi');0
    root.unmount();0
    jest.runAllTimers();0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('');0
  });0
0
  it('`root.render` returns a thenable work object', () => {0
    const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
    const work = root.render(<AsyncMode>Hi</AsyncMode>);0
    let ops = [];0
    work.then(() => {0
      ops.push('inside callback: ' + container.textContent);0
    });0
    ops.push('before committing: ' + container.textContent);0
    jest.runAllTimers();0
    ops.push('after committing: ' + container.textContent);0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'before committing: ',0
      // `then` callback should fire during commit phase0
      'inside callback: Hi',0
      'after committing: Hi',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('resolves `work.then` callback synchronously if the work already committed', () => {0
    const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
    const work = root.render(<AsyncMode>Hi</AsyncMode>);0
    jest.runAllTimers();0
    let ops = [];0
    work.then(() => {0
      ops.push('inside callback');0
    });0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['inside callback']);0
  });0
0
  it('supports hydration', async () => {0
    const markup = await new Promise(resolve =>0
      resolve(0
        ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
          <div>0
            <span className="extra" />0
          </div>,0
        ),0
      ),0
    );0
0
    // Does not hydrate by default0
    const container1 = document.createElement('div');0
    container1.innerHTML = markup;0
    const root1 = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container1);0
    root1.render(0
      <div>0
        <span />0
      </div>,0
    );0
    jest.runAllTimers();0
0
    // Accepts `hydrate` option0
    const container2 = document.createElement('div');0
    container2.innerHTML = markup;0
    const root2 = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container2, {hydrate: true});0
    root2.render(0
      <div>0
        <span />0
      </div>,0
    );0
    expect(jest.runAllTimers).toWarnDev('Extra attributes');0
  });0
0
  it('does not clear existing children', async () => {0
    container.innerHTML = '<div>a</div><div>b</div>';0
    const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
    root.render(0
      <div>0
        <span>c</span>0
        <span>d</span>0
      </div>,0
    );0
    jest.runAllTimers();0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('abcd');0
    root.render(0
      <div>0
        <span>d</span>0
        <span>c</span>0
      </div>,0
    );0
    jest.runAllTimers();0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('abdc');0
  });0
0
  it('can defer a commit by batching it', () => {0
    const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
    const batch = root.createBatch();0
    batch.render(<div>Hi</div>);0
    // Hasn't committed yet0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('');0
    // Commit0
    batch.commit();0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('Hi');0
  });0
0
  it('applies setState in componentDidMount synchronously in a batch', done => {0
    class App extends React.Component {0
      state = {mounted: false};0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.setState({0
          mounted: true,0
        });0
      }0
      render() {0
        return this.state.mounted ? 'Hi' : 'Bye';0
      }0
    }0
0
    const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
    const batch = root.createBatch();0
    batch.render(0
      <AsyncMode>0
        <App />0
      </AsyncMode>,0
    );0
0
    jest.runAllTimers();0
0
    // Hasn't updated yet0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('');0
0
    let ops = [];0
    batch.then(() => {0
      // Still hasn't updated0
      ops.push(container.textContent);0
0
      // Should synchronously commit0
      batch.commit();0
      ops.push(container.textContent);0
0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['', 'Hi']);0
      done();0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('does not restart a completed batch when committing if there were no intervening updates', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
    function Foo(props) {0
      ops.push('Foo');0
      return props.children;0
    }0
    const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
    const batch = root.createBatch();0
    batch.render(<Foo>Hi</Foo>);0
    // Flush all async work.0
    jest.runAllTimers();0
    // Root should complete without committing.0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo']);0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('');0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Commit. Shouldn't re-render Foo.0
    batch.commit();0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('Hi');0
  });0
0
  it('can wait for a batch to finish', () => {0
    const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
    const batch = root.createBatch();0
    batch.render(<AsyncMode>Foo</AsyncMode>);0
0
    jest.runAllTimers();0
0
    // Hasn't updated yet0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('');0
0
    let ops = [];0
    batch.then(() => {0
      // Still hasn't updated0
      ops.push(container.textContent);0
      // Should synchronously commit0
      batch.commit();0
      ops.push(container.textContent);0
    });0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['', 'Foo']);0
  });0
0
  it('`batch.render` returns a thenable work object', () => {0
    const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
    const batch = root.createBatch();0
    const work = batch.render('Hi');0
    let ops = [];0
    work.then(() => {0
      ops.push('inside callback: ' + container.textContent);0
    });0
    ops.push('before committing: ' + container.textContent);0
    batch.commit();0
    ops.push('after committing: ' + container.textContent);0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'before committing: ',0
      // `then` callback should fire during commit phase0
      'inside callback: Hi',0
      'after committing: Hi',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('can commit an empty batch', () => {0
    const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
    root.render(<AsyncMode>1</AsyncMode>);0
0
    advanceCurrentTime(2000);0
    // This batch has a later expiration time than the earlier update.0
    const batch = root.createBatch();0
0
    // This should not flush the earlier update.0
    batch.commit();0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('');0
0
    jest.runAllTimers();0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('1');0
  });0
0
  it('two batches created simultaneously are committed separately', () => {0
    // (In other words, they have distinct expiration times)0
    const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
    const batch1 = root.createBatch();0
    batch1.render(1);0
    const batch2 = root.createBatch();0
    batch2.render(2);0
0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('');0
0
    batch1.commit();0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('1');0
0
    batch2.commit();0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('2');0
  });0
0
  it('commits an earlier batch without committing a later batch', () => {0
    const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
    const batch1 = root.createBatch();0
    batch1.render(1);0
0
    // This batch has a later expiration time0
    advanceCurrentTime(2000);0
    const batch2 = root.createBatch();0
    batch2.render(2);0
0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('');0
0
    batch1.commit();0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('1');0
0
    batch2.commit();0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('2');0
  });0
0
  it('commits a later batch without committing an earlier batch', () => {0
    const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
    const batch1 = root.createBatch();0
    batch1.render(1);0
0
    // This batch has a later expiration time0
    advanceCurrentTime(2000);0
    const batch2 = root.createBatch();0
    batch2.render(2);0
0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('');0
0
    batch2.commit();0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('2');0
0
    batch1.commit();0
    jest.runAllTimers();0
    expect(container.textContent).toEqual('1');0
  });0
0
  it('handles fatal errors triggered by batch.commit()', () => {0
    const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
    const batch = root.createBatch();0
    const InvalidType = undefined;0
    expect(() => batch.render(<InvalidType />)).toWarnDev([0
      'React.createElement: type is invalid',0
    ]);0
    expect(() => batch.commit()).toThrow('Element type is invalid');0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
describe('ReactDOMSelect', () => {0
  let React;0
  let ReactDOM;0
  let ReactDOMServer;0
  let ReactTestUtils;0
0
  const noop = function() {};0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
  });0
0
  it('should allow setting `defaultValue`', () => {0
    let stub = (0
      <select defaultValue="giraffe">0
        <option value="monkey">A monkey!</option>0
        <option value="giraffe">A giraffe!</option>0
        <option value="gorilla">A gorilla!</option>0
      </select>0
    );0
    const options = stub.props.children;0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(stub, container);0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('giraffe');0
0
    // Changing `defaultValue` should do nothing.0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <select defaultValue="gorilla">{options}</select>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(node.value).toEqual('giraffe');0
  });0
0
  it('should not throw with `defaultValue` and without children', () => {0
    const stub = <select defaultValue="dummy" />;0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(stub);0
    }).not.toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should not control when using `defaultValue`', () => {0
    const el = (0
      <select defaultValue="giraffe">0
        <option value="monkey">A monkey!</option>0
        <option value="giraffe">A giraffe!</option>0
        <option value="gorilla">A gorilla!</option>0
      </select>0
    );0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(el, container);0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('giraffe');0
0
    node.value = 'monkey';0
    ReactDOM.render(el, container);0
    // Uncontrolled selects shouldn't change the value after first mounting0
    expect(node.value).toEqual('monkey');0
  });0
0
  it('should allow setting `defaultValue` with multiple', () => {0
    let stub = (0
      <select multiple={true} defaultValue={['giraffe', 'gorilla']}>0
        <option value="monkey">A monkey!</option>0
        <option value="giraffe">A giraffe!</option>0
        <option value="gorilla">A gorilla!</option>0
      </select>0
    );0
    const options = stub.props.children;0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(stub, container);0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(false); // monkey0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(true); // giraffe0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(true); // gorilla0
0
    // Changing `defaultValue` should do nothing.0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <select multiple={true} defaultValue={['monkey']}>0
        {options}0
      </select>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(false); // monkey0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(true); // giraffe0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(true); // gorilla0
  });0
0
  it('should allow setting `value`', () => {0
    let stub = (0
      <select value="giraffe" onChange={noop}>0
        <option value="monkey">A monkey!</option>0
        <option value="giraffe">A giraffe!</option>0
        <option value="gorilla">A gorilla!</option>0
      </select>0
    );0
    const options = stub.props.children;0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(stub, container);0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('giraffe');0
0
    // Changing the `value` prop should change the selected option.0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <select value="gorilla" onChange={noop}>0
        {options}0
      </select>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(node.value).toEqual('gorilla');0
  });0
0
  it('should default to the first non-disabled option', () => {0
    let stub = (0
      <select defaultValue="">0
        <option disabled={true}>Disabled</option>0
        <option disabled={true}>Still Disabled</option>0
        <option>0</option>0
        <option disabled={true}>Also Disabled</option>0
      </select>0
    );0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(stub, container);0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(false);0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('should allow setting `value` to __proto__', () => {0
    let stub = (0
      <select value="__proto__" onChange={noop}>0
        <option value="monkey">A monkey!</option>0
        <option value="__proto__">A giraffe!</option>0
        <option value="gorilla">A gorilla!</option>0
      </select>0
    );0
    const options = stub.props.children;0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(stub, container);0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('__proto__');0
0
    // Changing the `value` prop should change the selected option.0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <select value="gorilla" onChange={noop}>0
        {options}0
      </select>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(node.value).toEqual('gorilla');0
  });0
0
  it('should not throw with `value` and without children', () => {0
    const stub = <select value="dummy" onChange={noop} />;0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(stub);0
    }).not.toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should allow setting `value` with multiple', () => {0
    let stub = (0
      <select multiple={true} value={['giraffe', 'gorilla']} onChange={noop}>0
        <option value="monkey">A monkey!</option>0
        <option value="giraffe">A giraffe!</option>0
        <option value="gorilla">A gorilla!</option>0
      </select>0
    );0
    const options = stub.props.children;0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(stub, container);0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(false); // monkey0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(true); // giraffe0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(true); // gorilla0
0
    // Changing the `value` prop should change the selected options.0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <select multiple={true} value={['monkey']} onChange={noop}>0
        {options}0
      </select>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(true); // monkey0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(false); // giraffe0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(false); // gorilla0
  });0
0
  it('should allow setting `value` to __proto__ with multiple', () => {0
    let stub = (0
      <select multiple={true} value={['__proto__', 'gorilla']} onChange={noop}>0
        <option value="monkey">A monkey!</option>0
        <option value="__proto__">A __proto__!</option>0
        <option value="gorilla">A gorilla!</option>0
      </select>0
    );0
    const options = stub.props.children;0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(stub, container);0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(false); // monkey0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(true); // __proto__0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(true); // gorilla0
0
    // Changing the `value` prop should change the selected options.0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <select multiple={true} value={['monkey']} onChange={noop}>0
        {options}0
      </select>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(true); // monkey0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(false); // __proto__0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(false); // gorilla0
  });0
0
  it('should not select other options automatically', () => {0
    let stub = (0
      <select multiple={true} value={['12']} onChange={noop}>0
        <option value="1">one</option>0
        <option value="2">two</option>0
        <option value="12">twelve</option>0
      </select>0
    );0
    const node = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(stub);0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(false); // one0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(false); // two0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(true); // twelve0
  });0
0
  it('should reset child options selected when they are changed and `value` is set', () => {0
    let stub = <select multiple={true} value={['a', 'b']} onChange={noop} />;0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(stub, container);0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <select multiple={true} value={['a', 'b']} onChange={noop}>0
        <option value="a">a</option>0
        <option value="b">b</option>0
        <option value="c">c</option>0
      </select>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(true); // a0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(true); // b0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(false); // c0
  });0
0
  it('should allow setting `value` with `objectToString`', () => {0
    const objectToString = {0
      animal: 'giraffe',0
      toString: function() {0
        return this.animal;0
      },0
    };0
0
    const el = (0
      <select multiple={true} value={[objectToString]} onChange={noop}>0
        <option value="monkey">A monkey!</option>0
        <option value="giraffe">A giraffe!</option>0
        <option value="gorilla">A gorilla!</option>0
      </select>0
    );0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(el, container);0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(false); // monkey0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(true); // giraffe0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(false); // gorilla0
0
    // Changing the `value` prop should change the selected options.0
    objectToString.animal = 'monkey';0
0
    const el2 = (0
      <select multiple={true} value={[objectToString]}>0
        <option value="monkey">A monkey!</option>0
        <option value="giraffe">A giraffe!</option>0
        <option value="gorilla">A gorilla!</option>0
      </select>0
    );0
    ReactDOM.render(el2, container);0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(true); // monkey0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(false); // giraffe0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(false); // gorilla0
  });0
0
  it('should allow switching to multiple', () => {0
    let stub = (0
      <select defaultValue="giraffe">0
        <option value="monkey">A monkey!</option>0
        <option value="giraffe">A giraffe!</option>0
        <option value="gorilla">A gorilla!</option>0
      </select>0
    );0
    const options = stub.props.children;0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(stub, container);0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(false); // monkey0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(true); // giraffe0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(false); // gorilla0
0
    // When making it multiple, giraffe and gorilla should be selected0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <select multiple={true} defaultValue={['giraffe', 'gorilla']}>0
        {options}0
      </select>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(false); // monkey0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(true); // giraffe0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(true); // gorilla0
  });0
0
  it('should allow switching from multiple', () => {0
    let stub = (0
      <select multiple={true} defaultValue={['giraffe', 'gorilla']}>0
        <option value="monkey">A monkey!</option>0
        <option value="giraffe">A giraffe!</option>0
        <option value="gorilla">A gorilla!</option>0
      </select>0
    );0
    const options = stub.props.children;0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(stub, container);0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(false); // monkey0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(true); // giraffe0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(true); // gorilla0
0
    // When removing multiple, defaultValue is applied again, being omitted0
    // means that "monkey" will be selected0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <select defaultValue="gorilla">{options}</select>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(false); // monkey0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(false); // giraffe0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(true); // gorilla0
  });0
0
  it('should remember value when switching to uncontrolled', () => {0

      </select>0
    );0
    const options = stub.props.children;0

0

    ReactDOM.render(<select>{options}</select>, container);0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(false); // monkey0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(true); // giraffe0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(false); // gorilla0
  });0

  it('should support server-side rendering', () => {0
    const stub = (0
      <select value="giraffe" onChange={noop}>0
        <option value="monkey">A monkey!</option>0
        <option value="giraffe">A giraffe!</option>0
        <option value="gorilla">A gorilla!</option>0
      </select>0
    );0
    const markup = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(stub);0
    expect(markup).toContain('<option selected="" value="giraffe"');0
    expect(markup).not.toContain('<option selected="" value="monkey"');0
    expect(markup).not.toContain('<option selected="" value="gorilla"');0
  });0
0

      <select defaultValue="giraffe">0

  });0

    expect(markup).not.toContain('<option selected="" value="monkey"');0
  });0

  it('should not control defaultValue if readding options', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(0
      <select multiple={true} defaultValue={['giraffe']}>0
        <option key="monkey" value="monkey">0
          A monkey!0
        </option>0
        <option key="giraffe" value="giraffe">0
          A giraffe!0
        </option>0

        </option>0
      </select>,0

    );0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(false); // monkey0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(true); // giraffe0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(false); // gorilla0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <select multiple={true} defaultValue={['giraffe']}>0

          A monkey!0

          A gorilla!0
        </option>0
      </select>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(false); // monkey0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(false); // gorilla0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <select multiple={true} defaultValue={['giraffe']}>0
        <option key="monkey" value="monkey">0
          A monkey!0
        </option>0
        <option key="giraffe" value="giraffe">0
          A giraffe!0
        </option>0
        <option key="gorilla" value="gorilla">0
          A gorilla!0
        </option>0
      </select>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(false); // monkey0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(false); // giraffe0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(false); // gorilla0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if value is null', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <select value={null}>0
          <option value="test" />0
        </select>,0
      ),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      '`value` prop on `select` should not be null. ' +0
        'Consider using an empty string to clear the component or `undefined` ' +0
        'for uncontrolled components.',0
    );0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <select value={null}>0
        <option value="test" />0
      </select>,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if selected is set on <option>', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <select>0
          <option selected={true} />0
          <option selected={true} />0
        </select>,0
      ),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Use the `defaultValue` or `value` props on <select> instead of ' +0
        'setting `selected` on <option>.',0
    );0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <select>0
        <option selected={true} />0
        <option selected={true} />0
      </select>,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if value is null and multiple is true', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <select value={null} multiple={true}>0
          <option value="test" />0
        </select>,0
      ),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      '`value` prop on `select` should not be null. ' +0
        'Consider using an empty array when `multiple` is ' +0
        'set to `true` to clear the component or `undefined` ' +0
        'for uncontrolled components.',0
    );0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <select value={null} multiple={true}>0
        <option value="test" />0
      </select>,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should refresh state on change', () => {0
    let stub = (0
      <select value="giraffe" onChange={noop}>0
        <option value="monkey">A monkey!</option>0
        <option value="giraffe">A giraffe!</option>0
        <option value="gorilla">A gorilla!</option>0
      </select>0
    );0
    const node = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(stub);0
0
    ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(node);0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('giraffe');0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if value and defaultValue props are specified', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <select value="giraffe" defaultValue="giraffe" readOnly={true}>0
          <option value="monkey">A monkey!</option>0
          <option value="giraffe">A giraffe!</option>0
          <option value="gorilla">A gorilla!</option>0
        </select>,0
      ),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Select elements must be either controlled or uncontrolled ' +0
        '(specify either the value prop, or the defaultValue prop, but not ' +0
        'both). Decide between using a controlled or uncontrolled select ' +0
        'element and remove one of these props. More info: ' +0
        'https://fb.me/react-controlled-components',0
    );0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <select value="giraffe" defaultValue="giraffe" readOnly={true}>0
        <option value="monkey">A monkey!</option>0
        <option value="giraffe">A giraffe!</option>0
        <option value="gorilla">A gorilla!</option>0
      </select>,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should be able to safely remove select onChange', () => {0
    function changeView() {0
      ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    let stub = (0
      <select value="giraffe" onChange={changeView}>0
        <option value="monkey">A monkey!</option>0
        <option value="giraffe">A giraffe!</option>0
        <option value="gorilla">A gorilla!</option>0
      </select>0
    );0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(stub, container);0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(node)).not.toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should select grandchild options nested inside an optgroup', () => {0
    const stub = (0
      <select value="b" onChange={noop}>0
        <optgroup label="group">0
          <option value="a">a</option>0
          <option value="b">b</option>0
          <option value="c">c</option>0
        </optgroup>0
      </select>0
    );0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(stub, container);0
0
    expect(node.options[0].selected).toBe(false); // a0
    expect(node.options[1].selected).toBe(true); // b0
    expect(node.options[2].selected).toBe(false); // c0
  });0
0
  it('should allow controlling `value` in a nested render', () => {0
    let selectNode;0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        value: 'giraffe',0
      };0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this._renderNested();0
      }0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        this._renderNested();0
      }0
0
      _handleChange(event) {0
        this.setState({value: event.target.value});0
      }0
0
      _renderNested() {0
        ReactDOM.render(0
          <select0
            onChange={this._handleChange.bind(this)}0
            ref={n => (selectNode = n)}0
            value={this.state.value}>0
            <option value="monkey">A monkey!</option>0
            <option value="giraffe">A giraffe!</option>0
            <option value="gorilla">A gorilla!</option>0
          </select>,0
          this._nestingContainer,0
        );0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div ref={n => (this._nestingContainer = n)} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent />, container);0
0
    expect(selectNode.value).toBe('giraffe');0
0
    selectNode.value = 'gorilla';0
0
    let nativeEvent = document.createEvent('Event');0
    nativeEvent.initEvent('input', true, true);0
    selectNode.dispatchEvent(nativeEvent);0
0
    expect(selectNode.value).toEqual('gorilla');0
0
    nativeEvent = document.createEvent('Event');0
    nativeEvent.initEvent('change', true, true);0
    selectNode.dispatchEvent(nativeEvent);0
0
    expect(selectNode.value).toEqual('gorilla');0
0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactDOMSelection;0
0
let getModernOffsetsFromPoints;0
0
describe('ReactDOMSelection', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactDOMSelection = require('../client/ReactDOMSelection');0
0
    ({getModernOffsetsFromPoints} = ReactDOMSelection);0
  });0
0
  // Simple implementation to compare correctness. React's old implementation of0
  // this logic used DOM Range objects and is available for manual testing at0
  // https://gist.github.com/sophiebits/2e6d571f4f10f33b62ea138a6e9c265c.0
  function simpleModernOffsetsFromPoints(0
    outerNode,0
    anchorNode,0
    anchorOffset,0
    focusNode,0
    focusOffset,0
  ) {0
    let start;0
    let end;0
    let length = 0;0
0
    function traverse(node) {0
      if (node.nodeType === Node.TEXT_NODE) {0
        if (node === anchorNode) {0
          start = length + anchorOffset;0
        }0
        if (node === focusNode) {0
          end = length + focusOffset;0
        }0
        length += node.nodeValue.length;0
        return;0
      }0
0
      for (let i = 0; true; i++) {0
        if (node === anchorNode && i === anchorOffset) {0
          start = length;0
        }0
        if (node === focusNode && i === focusOffset) {0
          end = length;0
        }0
        if (i === node.childNodes.length) {0
          break;0
        }0
        let n = node.childNodes[i];0
        traverse(n);0
      }0
    }0
    traverse(outerNode);0
0
    if (start === null || end === null) {0
      throw new Error('Provided anchor/focus nodes were outside of root.');0
    }0
    return {start, end};0
  }0
0
  // Complicated example derived from a real-world DOM tree. Has a bit of0
  // everything.0
  function getFixture() {0
    return ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        <div>0
          <div>0
            <div>xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx</div>0
          </div>0
          x0
          <div>0
            <div>0
              x0
              <div>0
                <div>0
                  <div>xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx</div>0
                  <div />0
                  <div />0
                  <div>xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx</div>0
                </div>0
              </div>0
            </div>0
          </div>0
          <div />0
        </div>0
        <div>0
          <div>0
            <div>0
              <div>xxxx</div>0
              <div>xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx</div>0
            </div>0
          </div>0
          <div>xxx</div>0
          <div>xxxxx</div>0
          <div>xxx</div>0
          <div>0
            <div>0
              <div>0
                <div>{['x', 'x', 'xxx']}</div>0
              </div>0
            </div>0
          </div>0
        </div>0
        <div>0
          <div>xxxxxx</div>0
        </div>0
      </div>,0
      document.createElement('div'),0
    );0
  }0
0
  it('returns correctly for base case', () => {0
    const node = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(getModernOffsetsFromPoints(node, node, 0, node, 0)).toEqual({0
      start: 0,0
      end: 0,0
    });0
    expect(simpleModernOffsetsFromPoints(node, node, 0, node, 0)).toEqual({0
      start: 0,0
      end: 0,0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('returns correctly for fuzz test', () => {0
    const fixtureRoot = getFixture();0
    const allNodes = [fixtureRoot].concat(0
      Array.from(fixtureRoot.querySelectorAll('*')),0
    );0
    expect(allNodes.length).toBe(27);0
    allNodes.slice().forEach(element => {0
      // Add text nodes.0
      allNodes.push(0
        ...Array.from(element.childNodes).filter(n => n.nodeType === 3),0
      );0
    });0
    expect(allNodes.length).toBe(41);0
0
    function randomNode() {0
      return allNodes[(Math.random() * allNodes.length) | 0];0
    }0
    function randomOffset(node) {0
      return (0
        (Math.random() *0
          (1 +0
            (node.nodeType === 3 ? node.nodeValue : node.childNodes).length)) |0
        00
      );0
    }0
0
    for (let i = 0; i < 2000; i++) {0
      const anchorNode = randomNode();0
      const anchorOffset = randomOffset(anchorNode);0
      const focusNode = randomNode();0
      const focusOffset = randomOffset(focusNode);0
0
      const offsets1 = getModernOffsetsFromPoints(0
        fixtureRoot,0
        anchorNode,0
        anchorOffset,0
        focusNode,0
        focusOffset,0
      );0
      const offsets2 = simpleModernOffsetsFromPoints(0
        fixtureRoot,0
        anchorNode,0
        anchorOffset,0
        focusNode,0
        focusOffset,0
      );0
      if (JSON.stringify(offsets1) !== JSON.stringify(offsets2)) {0
        throw new Error(0
          JSON.stringify(offsets1) +0
            ' does not match ' +0
            JSON.stringify(offsets2) +0
            ' for anchorNode=allNodes[' +0
            allNodes.indexOf(anchorNode) +0
            '], anchorOffset=' +0
            anchorOffset +0
            ', focusNode=allNodes[' +0
            allNodes.indexOf(focusNode) +0
            '], focusOffset=' +0
            focusOffset,0
        );0
      }0
    }0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils = require('./utils/ReactDOMServerIntegrationTestUtils');0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
0
function initModules() {0
  // Reset warning cache.0
  jest.resetModuleRegistry();0
  React = require('react');0
  ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
  ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
0
  // Make them available to the helpers.0
  return {0
    ReactDOM,0
    ReactDOMServer,0
  };0
}0
0
const {0
  resetModules,0
  itRenders,0
  clientCleanRender,0
} = ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils(initModules);0
0
describe('ReactDOMServerIntegration', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    resetModules();0
  });0
0
  describe('property to attribute mapping', function() {0
    describe('string properties', function() {0
      itRenders('simple numbers', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div width={30} />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('width')).toBe('30');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('simple strings', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div width={'30'} />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('width')).toBe('30');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no string prop with true value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<a href={true} />, 1);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('href')).toBe(false);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no string prop with false value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<a href={false} />, 1);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('href')).toBe(false);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no string prop with null value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div width={null} />);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('width')).toBe(false);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no string prop with function value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div width={function() {}} />, 1);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('width')).toBe(false);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no string prop with symbol value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div width={Symbol('foo')} />, 1);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('width')).toBe(false);0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('boolean properties', function() {0
      itRenders('boolean prop with true value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div hidden={true} />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('hidden')).toBe('');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('boolean prop with false value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div hidden={false} />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('hidden')).toBe(null);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('boolean prop with self value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div hidden="hidden" />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('hidden')).toBe('');0
      });0
0
      // this does not seem like correct behavior, since hidden="" in HTML indicates0
      // that the boolean property is present. however, it is how the current code0
      // behaves, so the test is included here.0
      itRenders('boolean prop with "" value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div hidden="" />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('hidden')).toBe(null);0
      });0
0
      // this seems like it might mask programmer error, but it's existing behavior.0
      itRenders('boolean prop with string value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div hidden="foo" />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('hidden')).toBe('');0
      });0
0
      // this seems like it might mask programmer error, but it's existing behavior.0
      itRenders('boolean prop with array value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div hidden={['foo', 'bar']} />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('hidden')).toBe('');0
      });0
0
      // this seems like it might mask programmer error, but it's existing behavior.0
      itRenders('boolean prop with object value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div hidden={{foo: 'bar'}} />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('hidden')).toBe('');0
      });0
0
      // this seems like it might mask programmer error, but it's existing behavior.0
      itRenders('boolean prop with non-zero number value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div hidden={10} />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('hidden')).toBe('');0
      });0
0
      // this seems like it might mask programmer error, but it's existing behavior.0
      itRenders('boolean prop with zero value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div hidden={0} />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('hidden')).toBe(null);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no boolean prop with null value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div hidden={null} />);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('hidden')).toBe(false);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no boolean prop with function value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div hidden={function() {}} />, 1);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('hidden')).toBe(false);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no boolean prop with symbol value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div hidden={Symbol('foo')} />, 1);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('hidden')).toBe(false);0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('download property (combined boolean/string attribute)', function() {0
      itRenders('download prop with true value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<a download={true} />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('download')).toBe('');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('download prop with false value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<a download={false} />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('download')).toBe(null);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('download prop with string value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<a download="myfile" />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('download')).toBe('myfile');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('download prop with string "false" value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<a download="false" />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('download')).toBe('false');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('download prop with string "true" value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<a download={'true'} />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('download')).toBe('true');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('download prop with number 0 value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<a download={0} />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('download')).toBe('0');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no download prop with null value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div download={null} />);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('download')).toBe(false);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no download prop with undefined value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div download={undefined} />);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('download')).toBe(false);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no download prop with function value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div download={function() {}} />, 1);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('download')).toBe(false);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no download prop with symbol value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div download={Symbol('foo')} />, 1);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('download')).toBe(false);0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('className property', function() {0
      itRenders('className prop with string value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div className="myClassName" />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('class')).toBe('myClassName');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('className prop with empty string value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div className="" />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('class')).toBe('');0
      });0

        expect(e.hasAttribute('class')).toBe(false);0
      });0

      itRenders('no className prop with false value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div className={false} />, 1);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('class')).toBe(false);0
      });0

      itRenders('no className prop with null value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div className={null} />);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('className')).toBe(false);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('badly cased className with a warning', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div classname="test" />, 1);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('class')).toBe(false);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('classname')).toBe(true);0
      });0
0
      itRenders(0
        'className prop when given the alias with a warning',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(<div class="test" />, 1);0
          expect(e.className).toBe('test');0
        },0
      );0
0
      itRenders(0
        'className prop when given a badly cased alias',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(<div cLASs="test" />, 1);0
          expect(e.className).toBe('test');0
        },0
      );0
    });0
0
    describe('htmlFor property', function() {0
      itRenders('htmlFor with string value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div htmlFor="myFor" />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('for')).toBe('myFor');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no badly cased htmlfor', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div htmlfor="myFor" />, 1);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('for')).toBe(false);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('htmlfor')).toBe('myFor');0
      });0

      });0

    });0

        const e = await render(<ol start={Symbol('foo')} />, 1);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('start')).toBe(false);0
      });0
