        'no positive numeric prop with function value',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(<input size={function() {}} />, 1);0
          expect(e.hasAttribute('size')).toBe(false);0
        },0
      );0
0
      itRenders('no positive numeric prop with symbol value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<input size={Symbol('foo')} />, 1);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('size')).toBe(false);0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('props with special meaning in React', function() {0
      itRenders('no ref attribute', async render => {0
        class RefComponent extends React.Component {0
          render() {0
            return <div ref="foo" />;0
          }0
        }0
        const e = await render(<RefComponent />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('ref')).toBe(null);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no children attribute', async render => {0
        const e = await render(React.createElement('div', {}, 'foo'));0
        expect(e.getAttribute('children')).toBe(null);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no key attribute', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div key="foo" />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('key')).toBe(null);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no dangerouslySetInnerHTML attribute', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: '<foo />'}} />,0
        );0
        expect(e.getAttribute('dangerouslySetInnerHTML')).toBe(null);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no suppressContentEditableWarning attribute', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div suppressContentEditableWarning={true} />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('suppressContentEditableWarning')).toBe(null);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no suppressHydrationWarning attribute', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<span suppressHydrationWarning={true} />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('suppressHydrationWarning')).toBe(null);0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('inline styles', function() {0
      itRenders('simple styles', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div style={{color: 'red', width: '30px'}} />);0
        expect(e.style.color).toBe('red');0
        expect(e.style.width).toBe('30px');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('relevant styles with px', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <div0
            style={{0
              left: 0,0
              margin: 16,0
              opacity: 0.5,0
              padding: '4px',0
            }}0
          />,0
        );0
        expect(e.style.left).toBe('0px');0
        expect(e.style.margin).toBe('16px');0
        expect(e.style.opacity).toBe('0.5');0
        expect(e.style.padding).toBe('4px');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('custom properties', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div style={{'--foo': 5}} />);0
        // This seems like an odd way computed properties are exposed in jsdom.0
        // In a real browser we'd read it with e.style.getPropertyValue('--foo')0
        expect(e.style.Foo).toBe('5');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no undefined styles', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <div style={{color: undefined, width: '30px'}} />,0
        );0
        expect(e.style.color).toBe('');0
        expect(e.style.width).toBe('30px');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no null styles', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div style={{color: null, width: '30px'}} />);0
        expect(e.style.color).toBe('');0
        expect(e.style.width).toBe('30px');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no empty styles', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div style={{color: null, width: null}} />);0
        expect(e.style.color).toBe('');0
        expect(e.style.width).toBe('');0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('style')).toBe(false);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('unitless-number rules with prefixes', async render => {0
        const {style} = await render(0
          <div0
            style={{0
              lineClamp: 10,0
              WebkitLineClamp: 10,0
              MozFlexGrow: 10,0
              msFlexGrow: 10,0
              msGridRow: 10,0
              msGridRowEnd: 10,0
              msGridRowSpan: 10,0
              msGridRowStart: 10,0
              msGridColumn: 10,0
              msGridColumnEnd: 10,0
              msGridColumnSpan: 10,0
              msGridColumnStart: 10,0
            }}0
          />,0
        );0
0
        expect(style.lineClamp).toBe('10');0
        expect(style.WebkitLineClamp).toBe('10');0
        expect(style.MozFlexGrow).toBe('10');0
        // jsdom is inconsistent in the style property name0
        // it uses on the client and when processing server markup.0
        // But it should be there either way.0
        expect(style.MsFlexGrow || style.msFlexGrow).toBe('10');0
        expect(style.MsGridRow || style.msGridRow).toBe('10');0
        expect(style.MsGridRowEnd || style.msGridRowEnd).toBe('10');0
        expect(style.MsGridRowSpan || style.msGridRowSpan).toBe('10');0
        expect(style.MsGridRowStart || style.msGridRowStart).toBe('10');0
        expect(style.MsGridColumn || style.msGridColumn).toBe('10');0
        expect(style.MsGridColumnEnd || style.msGridColumnEnd).toBe('10');0
        expect(style.MsGridColumnSpan || style.msGridColumnSpan).toBe('10');0
        expect(style.MsGridColumnStart || style.msGridColumnStart).toBe('10');0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('aria attributes', function() {0
      itRenders('simple strings', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div aria-label="hello" />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('aria-label')).toBe('hello');0
      });0
0
      // this probably is just masking programmer error, but it is existing behavior.0
      itRenders('aria string prop with false value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div aria-label={false} />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('aria-label')).toBe('false');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no aria prop with null value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div aria-label={null} />);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('aria-label')).toBe(false);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('"aria" attribute with a warning', async render => {0
        // Reserved for future use.0
        const e = await render(<div aria="hello" />, 1);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('aria')).toBe('hello');0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('cased attributes', function() {0
      itRenders(0
        'badly cased aliased HTML attribute with a warning',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(<meta httpequiv="refresh" />, 1);0
          expect(e.hasAttribute('http-equiv')).toBe(false);0
          expect(e.getAttribute('httpequiv')).toBe('refresh');0
        },0
      );0
0
      itRenders('badly cased SVG attribute with a warning', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <svg>0
            <text textlength="10" />0
          </svg>,0
          1,0
        );0
        // The discrepancy is expected as long as we emit a warning0
        // both on the client and the server.0
        if (render === clientCleanRender) {0
          // On the client, "textlength" is treated as a case-sensitive0
          // SVG attribute so the wrong attribute ("textlength") gets set.0
          expect(e.firstChild.getAttribute('textlength')).toBe('10');0
          expect(e.firstChild.hasAttribute('textLength')).toBe(false);0
        } else {0
          // When parsing HTML (including the hydration case), the browser0
          // correctly maps "textlength" to "textLength" SVG attribute.0
          // So it happens to work on the initial render.0
          expect(e.firstChild.getAttribute('textLength')).toBe('10');0
          expect(e.firstChild.hasAttribute('textlength')).toBe(false);0
        }0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no badly cased aliased SVG attribute alias', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <svg>0
            <text strokedasharray="10 10" />0
          </svg>,0
          1,0
        );0
        expect(e.firstChild.hasAttribute('stroke-dasharray')).toBe(false);0
        expect(e.firstChild.getAttribute('strokedasharray')).toBe('10 10');0
      });0
0
      itRenders(0
        'no badly cased original SVG attribute that is aliased',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(0
            <svg>0
              <text stroke-dasharray="10 10" />0
            </svg>,0
            1,0
          );0
          expect(e.firstChild.getAttribute('stroke-dasharray')).toBe('10 10');0
        },0
      );0
    });0
0
    describe('unknown attributes', function() {0
      itRenders('unknown attributes', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div foo="bar" />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('foo')).toBe('bar');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('unknown data- attributes', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div data-foo="bar" />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('data-foo')).toBe('bar');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('badly cased reserved attributes', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div CHILDREN="5" />, 1);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('CHILDREN')).toBe('5');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('"data" attribute', async render => {0
        // For `<object />` acts as `src`.0
        const e = await render(<object data="hello" />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('data')).toBe('hello');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('no unknown data- attributes with null value', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div data-foo={null} />);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('data-foo')).toBe(false);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('unknown data- attributes with casing', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div data-fooBar="true" />, 1);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('data-foobar')).toBe('true');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('unknown data- attributes with boolean true', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div data-foobar={true} />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('data-foobar')).toBe('true');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('unknown data- attributes with boolean false', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div data-foobar={false} />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('data-foobar')).toBe('false');0
      });0
0
      itRenders(0
        'no unknown data- attributes with casing and null value',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(<div data-fooBar={null} />, 1);0
          expect(e.hasAttribute('data-foobar')).toBe(false);0
        },0
      );0
0
      itRenders('custom attributes for non-standard elements', async render => {0
        // This test suite generally assumes that we get exactly0
        // the same warnings (or none) for all scenarios including0
        // SSR + innerHTML, hydration, and client-side rendering.0
        // However this particular warning fires only when creating0
        // DOM nodes on the client side. We force it to fire early0
        // so that it gets deduplicated later, and doesn't fail the test.0
        expect(() => {0
          ReactDOM.render(<nonstandard />, document.createElement('div'));0
        }).toWarnDev('The tag <nonstandard> is unrecognized in this browser.');0
0
        const e = await render(<nonstandard foo="bar" />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('foo')).toBe('bar');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('SVG tags with dashes in them', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <svg>0
            <font-face accentHeight={10} />0
          </svg>,0
        );0
        expect(e.firstChild.hasAttribute('accentHeight')).toBe(false);0
        expect(e.firstChild.getAttribute('accent-height')).toBe('10');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('cased custom attributes', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div fooBar="test" />, 1);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('foobar')).toBe('test');0
      });0
    });0
0
    itRenders('no HTML events', async render => {0
      const e = await render(<div onClick={() => {}} />);0
      expect(e.getAttribute('onClick')).toBe(null);0
      expect(e.getAttribute('onClick')).toBe(null);0
      expect(e.getAttribute('click')).toBe(null);0
    });0
0
    itRenders('no unknown events', async render => {0
      const e = await render(0
        <div onunknownevent="alert(&quot;hack&quot;)" />,0
        1,0
      );0
      expect(e.getAttribute('onunknownevent')).toBe(null);0
    });0
0
    itRenders('custom attribute named `on`', async render => {0
      const e = await render(<div on="tap:do-something" />);0
      expect(e.getAttribute('on')).toEqual('tap:do-something');0
    });0
  });0
0
  // These tests mostly verify the existing behavior.0
  // It may not always make sense but we can't change it in minors.0
  describe('custom elements', () => {0
    itRenders('class for custom elements', async render => {0
      const e = await render(<div is="custom-element" class="test" />, 0);0
      expect(e.getAttribute('class')).toBe('test');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('className for custom elements', async render => {0
      const e = await render(<div is="custom-element" className="test" />, 0);0
      expect(e.getAttribute('className')).toBe('test');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('htmlFor attribute on custom elements', async render => {0
      const e = await render(<div is="custom-element" htmlFor="test" />);0
      expect(e.getAttribute('htmlFor')).toBe('test');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('for attribute on custom elements', async render => {0
      const e = await render(<div is="custom-element" for="test" />);0
      expect(e.getAttribute('for')).toBe('test');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('unknown attributes for custom elements', async render => {0
      const e = await render(<custom-element foo="bar" />);0
      expect(e.getAttribute('foo')).toBe('bar');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('unknown `on*` attributes for custom elements', async render => {0
      const e = await render(<custom-element onunknown="bar" />);0
      expect(e.getAttribute('onunknown')).toBe('bar');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('unknown boolean `true` attributes as strings', async render => {0
      const e = await render(<custom-element foo={true} />);0
      expect(e.getAttribute('foo')).toBe('true');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('unknown boolean `false` attributes as strings', async render => {0
      const e = await render(<custom-element foo={false} />);0
      expect(e.getAttribute('foo')).toBe('false');0
    });0
0
    itRenders(0
      'no unknown attributes for custom elements with null value',0
      async render => {0
        const e = await render(<custom-element foo={null} />);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('foo')).toBe(false);0
      },0
    );0
0
    itRenders(0
      'unknown attributes for custom elements using is',0
      async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div is="custom-element" foo="bar" />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('foo')).toBe('bar');0
      },0
    );0
0
    itRenders(0
      'no unknown attributes for custom elements using is with null value',0
      async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div is="custom-element" foo={null} />);0
        expect(e.hasAttribute('foo')).toBe(false);0
      },0
    );0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils = require('./utils/ReactDOMServerIntegrationTestUtils');0
0
const TEXT_NODE_TYPE = 3;0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
0
function initModules() {0
  // Reset warning cache.0
  jest.resetModuleRegistry();0
  React = require('react');0
  ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
  ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
0
  // Make them available to the helpers.0
  return {0
    ReactDOM,0
    ReactDOMServer,0
  };0
}0
0
const {resetModules, itRenders} = ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils(initModules);0
0
describe('ReactDOMServerIntegration', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    resetModules();0
  });0
0
  describe('basic rendering', function() {0
    itRenders('a blank div', async render => {0
      const e = await render(<div />);0
      expect(e.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('a self-closing tag', async render => {0
      const e = await render(<br />);0
      expect(e.tagName).toBe('BR');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('a self-closing tag as a child', async render => {0
      const e = await render(0
        <div>0
          <br />0
        </div>,0
      );0
      expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
      expect(e.firstChild.tagName).toBe('BR');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('a string', async render => {0
      let e = await render('Hello');0
      expect(e.nodeType).toBe(3);0
      expect(e.nodeValue).toMatch('Hello');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('a number', async render => {0
      let e = await render(42);0
      expect(e.nodeType).toBe(3);0
      expect(e.nodeValue).toMatch('42');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('an array with one child', async render => {0
      let e = await render([<div key={1}>text1</div>]);0
      let parent = e.parentNode;0
      expect(parent.childNodes[0].tagName).toBe('DIV');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('an array with several children', async render => {0
      let Header = props => {0
        return <p>header</p>;0
      };0
      let Footer = props => {0
        return [<h2 key={1}>footer</h2>, <h3 key={2}>about</h3>];0
      };0
      let e = await render([0
        <div key={1}>text1</div>,0
        <span key={2}>text2</span>,0
        <Header key={3} />,0
        <Footer key={4} />,0
      ]);0
      let parent = e.parentNode;0
      expect(parent.childNodes[0].tagName).toBe('DIV');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[1].tagName).toBe('SPAN');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[2].tagName).toBe('P');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[3].tagName).toBe('H2');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[4].tagName).toBe('H3');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('a nested array', async render => {0
      let e = await render([0
        [<div key={1}>text1</div>],0
        <span key={1}>text2</span>,0
        [[[null, <p key={1} />], false]],0
      ]);0
      let parent = e.parentNode;0
      expect(parent.childNodes[0].tagName).toBe('DIV');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[1].tagName).toBe('SPAN');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[2].tagName).toBe('P');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('an iterable', async render => {0
      const threeDivIterable = {0
        '@@iterator': function() {0
          let i = 0;0
          return {0
            next: function() {0
              if (i++ < 3) {0
                return {value: <div key={i} />, done: false};0
              } else {0
                return {value: undefined, done: true};0
              }0
            },0
          };0
        },0
      };0
      let e = await render(threeDivIterable);0
      let parent = e.parentNode;0
      expect(parent.childNodes.length).toBe(3);0
      expect(parent.childNodes[0].tagName).toBe('DIV');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[1].tagName).toBe('DIV');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[2].tagName).toBe('DIV');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('emptyish values', async render => {0
      let e = await render(0);0
      expect(e.nodeType).toBe(TEXT_NODE_TYPE);0
      expect(e.nodeValue).toMatch('0');0
0
      // Empty string is special because client renders a node0
      // but server returns empty HTML. So we compare parent text.0
      expect((await render(<div>{''}</div>)).textContent).toBe('');0
0
      expect(await render([])).toBe(null);0
      expect(await render(false)).toBe(null);0
      expect(await render(true)).toBe(null);0
      expect(await render(undefined)).toBe(null);0
      expect(await render([[[false]], undefined])).toBe(null);0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils = require('./utils/ReactDOMServerIntegrationTestUtils');0
0
const TEXT_NODE_TYPE = 3;0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
0
function initModules() {0
  jest.resetModuleRegistry();0
  React = require('react');0
  ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
  ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
0
  // Make them available to the helpers.0
  return {0
    ReactDOM,0
    ReactDOMServer,0
  };0
}0
0
const {0
  resetModules,0
  itRenders,0
  itThrowsWhenRendering,0
  serverRender,0
  streamRender,0
  clientRenderOnServerString,0
} = ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils(initModules);0
0
describe('ReactDOMServerIntegration', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    resetModules();0
  });0
0
  describe('elements and children', function() {0
    function expectNode(node, type, value) {0
      expect(node).not.toBe(null);0
      expect(node.nodeType).toBe(type);0
      expect(node.nodeValue).toMatch(value);0
    }0
0
    function expectTextNode(node, text) {0
      expectNode(node, TEXT_NODE_TYPE, text);0
    }0
0
    describe('text children', function() {0
      itRenders('a div with text', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div>Text</div>);0
        expect(e.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
        expectNode(e.firstChild, TEXT_NODE_TYPE, 'Text');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('a div with text with flanking whitespace', async render => {0
        // prettier-ignore0
        const e = await render(<div>  Text </div>);0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
        expectNode(e.childNodes[0], TEXT_NODE_TYPE, '  Text ');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('a div with an empty text child', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div>{''}</div>);0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('a div with multiple empty text children', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <div>0
            {''}0
            {''}0
            {''}0
          </div>,0
        );0
        if (render === serverRender || render === streamRender) {0
          // For plain server markup result we should have no text nodes if0
          // they're all empty.0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
          expect(e.textContent).toBe('');0
        } else {0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(3);0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], '');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[1], '');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[2], '');0
        }0
      });0
0
      itRenders('a div with multiple whitespace children', async render => {0
        // prettier-ignore0
        const e = await render(<div>{' '}{' '}{' '}</div>);0
        if (0
          render === serverRender ||0
          render === clientRenderOnServerString ||0
          render === streamRender0
        ) {0
          // For plain server markup result we have comments between.0
          // If we're able to hydrate, they remain.0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(5);0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], ' ');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[2], ' ');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[4], ' ');0
        } else {0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(3);0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], ' ');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[1], ' ');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[2], ' ');0
        }0
      });0
0
      itRenders('a div with text sibling to a node', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <div>0
            Text<span>More Text</span>0
          </div>,0
        );0
        let spanNode;0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(2);0
        spanNode = e.childNodes[1];0
        expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], 'Text');0
        expect(spanNode.tagName).toBe('SPAN');0
        expect(spanNode.childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
        expectNode(spanNode.firstChild, TEXT_NODE_TYPE, 'More Text');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('a non-standard element with text', async render => {0
        // This test suite generally assumes that we get exactly0
        // the same warnings (or none) for all scenarios including0
        // SSR + innerHTML, hydration, and client-side rendering.0
        // However this particular warning fires only when creating0
        // DOM nodes on the client side. We force it to fire early0
        // so that it gets deduplicated later, and doesn't fail the test.0
        expect(() => {0
          ReactDOM.render(<nonstandard />, document.createElement('div'));0
        }).toWarnDev('The tag <nonstandard> is unrecognized in this browser.');0
0
        const e = await render(<nonstandard>Text</nonstandard>);0
        expect(e.tagName).toBe('NONSTANDARD');0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
        expectNode(e.firstChild, TEXT_NODE_TYPE, 'Text');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('a custom element with text', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<custom-element>Text</custom-element>);0
        expect(e.tagName).toBe('CUSTOM-ELEMENT');0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
        expectNode(e.firstChild, TEXT_NODE_TYPE, 'Text');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('a leading blank child with a text sibling', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div>{''}foo</div>);0
        if (render === serverRender || render === streamRender) {0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], 'foo');0
        } else {0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(2);0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], '');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[1], 'foo');0
        }0
      });0
0
      itRenders('a trailing blank child with a text sibling', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div>foo{''}</div>);0
        // with Fiber, there are just two text nodes.0
        if (render === serverRender || render === streamRender) {0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], 'foo');0
        } else {0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(2);0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], 'foo');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[1], '');0
        }0
      });0
0
      itRenders('an element with two text children', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <div>0
            {'foo'}0
            {'bar'}0
          </div>,0
        );0
        if (0
          render === serverRender ||0
          render === clientRenderOnServerString ||0
          render === streamRender0
        ) {0
          // In the server render output there's a comment between them.0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(3);0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], 'foo');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[2], 'bar');0
        } else {0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(2);0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], 'foo');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[1], 'bar');0
        }0
      });0
0
      itRenders(0
        'a component returning text node between two text nodes',0
        async render => {0
          const B = () => 'b';0
          const e = await render(0
            <div>0
              {'a'}0
              <B />0
              {'c'}0
            </div>,0
          );0
          if (0
            render === serverRender ||0
            render === clientRenderOnServerString ||0
            render === streamRender0
          ) {0
            // In the server render output there's a comment between them.0
            expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(5);0
            expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], 'a');0
            expectTextNode(e.childNodes[2], 'b');0
            expectTextNode(e.childNodes[4], 'c');0
          } else {0
            expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(3);0
            expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], 'a');0
            expectTextNode(e.childNodes[1], 'b');0
            expectTextNode(e.childNodes[2], 'c');0
          }0
        },0
      );0
0
      itRenders('a tree with sibling host and text nodes', async render => {0
        class X extends React.Component {0
          render() {0
            return [null, [<Y key="1" />], false];0
          }0
        }0
0
        function Y() {0
          return [<Z key="1" />, ['c']];0
        }0
0
        function Z() {0
          return null;0
        }0
0
        const e = await render(0
          <div>0
            {[['a'], 'b']}0
            <div>0
              <X key="1" />0
              d0
            </div>0
            e0
          </div>,0
        );0
        if (0
          render === serverRender ||0
          render === clientRenderOnServerString ||0
          render === streamRender0
        ) {0
          // In the server render output there's comments between text nodes.0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(5);0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], 'a');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[2], 'b');0
          expect(e.childNodes[3].childNodes.length).toBe(3);0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[3].childNodes[0], 'c');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[3].childNodes[2], 'd');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[4], 'e');0
        } else {0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(4);0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], 'a');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[1], 'b');0
          expect(e.childNodes[2].childNodes.length).toBe(2);0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[2].childNodes[0], 'c');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[2].childNodes[1], 'd');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[3], 'e');0
        }0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('number children', function() {0
      itRenders('a number as single child', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div>{3}</div>);0
        expect(e.textContent).toBe('3');0
      });0
0
      // zero is falsey, so it could look like no children if the code isn't careful.0
      itRenders('zero as single child', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div>{0}</div>);0
        expect(e.textContent).toBe('0');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('an element with number and text children', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <div>0
            {'foo'}0
            {40}0
          </div>,0
        );0
        // with Fiber, there are just two text nodes.0
        if (0
          render === serverRender ||0
          render === clientRenderOnServerString ||0
          render === streamRender0
        ) {0
          // In the server markup there's a comment between.0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(3);0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], 'foo');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[2], '40');0
        } else {0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(2);0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], 'foo');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[1], '40');0
        }0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('null, false, and undefined children', function() {0
      itRenders('null single child as blank', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div>{null}</div>);0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('false single child as blank', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div>{false}</div>);0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('undefined single child as blank', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div>{undefined}</div>);0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('a null component children as empty', async render => {0
        const NullComponent = () => null;0
        const e = await render(0
          <div>0
            <NullComponent />0
          </div>,0
        );0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('null children as blank', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div>{null}foo</div>);0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
        expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], 'foo');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('false children as blank', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div>{false}foo</div>);0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
        expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], 'foo');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('null and false children together as blank', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <div>0
            {false}0
            {null}foo{null}0
            {false}0
          </div>,0
        );0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
        expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], 'foo');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('only null and false children as blank', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <div>0
            {false}0
            {null}0
            {null}0
            {false}0
          </div>,0
        );0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('elements with implicit namespaces', function() {0
      itRenders('an svg element', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<svg />);0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
        expect(e.tagName).toBe('svg');0
        expect(e.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/2000/svg');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('svg child element with an attribute', async render => {0
        let e = await render(<svg viewBox="0 0 0 0" />);0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
        expect(e.tagName).toBe('svg');0
        expect(e.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/2000/svg');0
        expect(e.getAttribute('viewBox')).toBe('0 0 0 0');0
      });0
0
      itRenders(0
        'svg child element with a namespace attribute',0
        async render => {0
          let e = await render(0
            <svg>0
              <image xlinkHref="http://i.imgur.com/w7GCRPb.png" />0
            </svg>,0
          );0
          e = e.firstChild;0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
          expect(e.tagName).toBe('image');0
          expect(e.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/2000/svg');0
          expect(e.getAttributeNS('http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink', 'href')).toBe(0
            'http://i.imgur.com/w7GCRPb.png',0
          );0
        },0
      );0
0
      itRenders('svg child element with a badly cased alias', async render => {0
        let e = await render(0
          <svg>0
            <image xlinkhref="http://i.imgur.com/w7GCRPb.png" />0
          </svg>,0
          1,0
        );0
        e = e.firstChild;0
        expect(e.hasAttributeNS('http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink', 'href')).toBe(0
          false,0
        );0
        expect(e.getAttribute('xlinkhref')).toBe(0
          'http://i.imgur.com/w7GCRPb.png',0
        );0
      });0
0
      itRenders('svg element with a tabIndex attribute', async render => {0
        let e = await render(<svg tabIndex="1" />);0
        expect(e.tabIndex).toBe(1);0
      });0
0
      itRenders(0
        'svg element with a badly cased tabIndex attribute',0
        async render => {0
          let e = await render(<svg tabindex="1" />, 1);0
          expect(e.tabIndex).toBe(1);0
        },0
      );0
0
      itRenders('svg element with a mixed case name', async render => {0
        let e = await render(0
          <svg>0
            <filter>0
              <feMorphology />0
            </filter>0
          </svg>,0
        );0
        e = e.firstChild.firstChild;0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
        expect(e.tagName).toBe('feMorphology');0
        expect(e.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/2000/svg');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('a math element', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<math />);0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
        expect(e.tagName).toBe('math');0
        expect(e.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML');0
      });0
    });0
    // specially wrapped components0
    // (see the big switch near the beginning ofReactDOMComponent.mountComponent)0
    itRenders('an img', async render => {0
      const e = await render(<img />);0
      expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
      expect(e.nextSibling).toBe(null);0
      expect(e.tagName).toBe('IMG');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('a button', async render => {0
      const e = await render(<button />);0
      expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
      expect(e.nextSibling).toBe(null);0
      expect(e.tagName).toBe('BUTTON');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('a div with dangerouslySetInnerHTML', async render => {0
      const e = await render(0
        <div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: "<span id='child'/>"}} />,0
      );0
      expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
      expect(e.firstChild.tagName).toBe('SPAN');0
      expect(e.firstChild.getAttribute('id')).toBe('child');0
      expect(e.firstChild.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
    });0
0
    describe('newline-eating elements', function() {0
      itRenders(0
        'a newline-eating tag with content not starting with \\n',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(<pre>Hello</pre>);0
          expect(e.textContent).toBe('Hello');0
        },0
      );0
      itRenders(0
        'a newline-eating tag with content starting with \\n',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(<pre>{'\nHello'}</pre>);0
          expect(e.textContent).toBe('\nHello');0
        },0
      );0
      itRenders('a normal tag with content starting with \\n', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div>{'\nHello'}</div>);0
        expect(e.textContent).toBe('\nHello');0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('different component implementations', function() {0
      function checkFooDiv(e) {0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
        expectNode(e.firstChild, TEXT_NODE_TYPE, 'foo');0
      }0
0
      itRenders('stateless components', async render => {0
        const StatelessComponent = () => <div>foo</div>;0
        checkFooDiv(await render(<StatelessComponent />));0
      });0
0
      itRenders('ES6 class components', async render => {0
        class ClassComponent extends React.Component {0
          render() {0
            return <div>foo</div>;0
          }0
        }0
        checkFooDiv(await render(<ClassComponent />));0
      });0
0
      itRenders('factory components', async render => {0
        const FactoryComponent = () => {0
          return {0
            render: function() {0
              return <div>foo</div>;0
            },0
          };0
        };0
        checkFooDiv(await render(<FactoryComponent />));0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('component hierarchies', async function() {0
      itRenders('single child hierarchies of components', async render => {0
        const Component = props => <div>{props.children}</div>;0
        let e = await render(0
          <Component>0
            <Component>0
              <Component>0
                <Component />0
              </Component>0
            </Component>0
          </Component>,0
        );0
        for (let i = 0; i < 3; i++) {0
          expect(e.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
          e = e.firstChild;0
        }0
        expect(e.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('multi-child hierarchies of components', async render => {0
        const Component = props => <div>{props.children}</div>;0
        const e = await render(0
          <Component>0
            <Component>0
              <Component />0
              <Component />0
            </Component>0
            <Component>0
              <Component />0
              <Component />0
            </Component>0
          </Component>,0
        );0
        expect(e.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(2);0
        for (let i = 0; i < 2; i++) {0
          const child = e.childNodes[i];0
          expect(child.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
          expect(child.childNodes.length).toBe(2);0
          for (let j = 0; j < 2; j++) {0
            const grandchild = child.childNodes[j];0
            expect(grandchild.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
            expect(grandchild.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
          }0
        }0
      });0
0
      itRenders('a div with a child', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <div id="parent">0
            <div id="child" />0
          </div>,0
        );0
        expect(e.id).toBe('parent');0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
        expect(e.childNodes[0].id).toBe('child');0
        expect(e.childNodes[0].childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('a div with multiple children', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <div id="parent">0
            <div id="child1" />0
            <div id="child2" />0
          </div>,0
        );0
        expect(e.id).toBe('parent');0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(2);0
        expect(e.childNodes[0].id).toBe('child1');0
        expect(e.childNodes[0].childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
        expect(e.childNodes[1].id).toBe('child2');0
        expect(e.childNodes[1].childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
      });0
0
      itRenders(0
        'a div with multiple children separated by whitespace',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(0
            <div id="parent">0
              <div id="child1" /> <div id="child2" />0
            </div>,0
          );0
          expect(e.id).toBe('parent');0
          let child1, child2, textNode;0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(3);0
          child1 = e.childNodes[0];0
          textNode = e.childNodes[1];0
          child2 = e.childNodes[2];0
          expect(child1.id).toBe('child1');0
          expect(child1.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
          expectTextNode(textNode, ' ');0
          expect(child2.id).toBe('child2');0
          expect(child2.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
        },0
      );0
0
      itRenders(0
        'a div with a single child surrounded by whitespace',0
        async render => {0
          // prettier-ignore0
          const e = await render(<div id="parent">  <div id="child" />   </div>); // eslint-disable-line no-multi-spaces0
          let textNode1, child, textNode2;0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(3);0
          textNode1 = e.childNodes[0];0
          child = e.childNodes[1];0
          textNode2 = e.childNodes[2];0
          expect(e.id).toBe('parent');0
          expectTextNode(textNode1, '  ');0
          expect(child.id).toBe('child');0
          expect(child.childNodes.length).toBe(0);0
          expectTextNode(textNode2, '   ');0
        },0
      );0
0
      itRenders('a composite with multiple children', async render => {0
        const Component = props => props.children;0
        const e = await render(0
          <Component>{['a', 'b', [undefined], [[false, 'c']]]}</Component>,0
        );0
0
        let parent = e.parentNode;0
        if (0
          render === serverRender ||0
          render === clientRenderOnServerString ||0
          render === streamRender0
        ) {0
          // For plain server markup result we have comments between.0
          // If we're able to hydrate, they remain.0
          expect(parent.childNodes.length).toBe(5);0
          expectTextNode(parent.childNodes[0], 'a');0
          expectTextNode(parent.childNodes[2], 'b');0
          expectTextNode(parent.childNodes[4], 'c');0
        } else {0
          expect(parent.childNodes.length).toBe(3);0
          expectTextNode(parent.childNodes[0], 'a');0
          expectTextNode(parent.childNodes[1], 'b');0
          expectTextNode(parent.childNodes[2], 'c');0
        }0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('escaping >, <, and &', function() {0
      itRenders('>,<, and & as single child', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<div>{'<span>Text&quot;</span>'}</div>);0
        expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
        expectNode(e.firstChild, TEXT_NODE_TYPE, '<span>Text&quot;</span>');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('>,<, and & as multiple children', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <div>0
            {'<span>Text1&quot;</span>'}0
            {'<span>Text2&quot;</span>'}0
          </div>,0
        );0
        if (0
          render === serverRender ||0
          render === clientRenderOnServerString ||0
          render === streamRender0
        ) {0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(3);0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], '<span>Text1&quot;</span>');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[2], '<span>Text2&quot;</span>');0
        } else {0
          expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(2);0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[0], '<span>Text1&quot;</span>');0
          expectTextNode(e.childNodes[1], '<span>Text2&quot;</span>');0
        }0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('carriage return and null character', () => {0
      // HTML parsing normalizes CR and CRLF to LF.0
      // It also ignores null character.0
      // https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/single-page.html#preprocessing-the-input-stream0
      // If we have a mismatch, it might be caused by that (and should not be reported).0
      // We won't be patching up in this case as that matches our past behavior.0
0
      itRenders(0
        'an element with one text child with special characters',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(<div>{'foo\rbar\r\nbaz\nqux\u0000'}</div>);0
          if (render === serverRender || render === streamRender) {0
            expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
            // Everything becomes LF when parsed from server HTML.0
            // Null character is ignored.0
            expectNode(e.childNodes[0], TEXT_NODE_TYPE, 'foo\nbar\nbaz\nqux');0
          } else {0
            expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
            // Client rendering (or hydration) uses JS value with CR.0
            // Null character stays.0
            expectNode(0
              e.childNodes[0],0
              TEXT_NODE_TYPE,0
              'foo\rbar\r\nbaz\nqux\u0000',0
            );0
          }0
        },0
      );0
0
      itRenders(0
        'an element with two text children with special characters',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(0
            <div>0
              {'foo\rbar'}0
              {'\r\nbaz\nqux\u0000'}0
            </div>,0
          );0
          if (render === serverRender || render === streamRender) {0
            // We have three nodes because there is a comment between them.0
            expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(3);0
            // Everything becomes LF when parsed from server HTML.0
            // Null character is ignored.0
            expectNode(e.childNodes[0], TEXT_NODE_TYPE, 'foo\nbar');0
            expectNode(e.childNodes[2], TEXT_NODE_TYPE, '\nbaz\nqux');0
          } else if (render === clientRenderOnServerString) {0
            // We have three nodes because there is a comment between them.0
            expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(3);0
            // Hydration uses JS value with CR and null character.0
            expectNode(e.childNodes[0], TEXT_NODE_TYPE, 'foo\rbar');0
            expectNode(e.childNodes[2], TEXT_NODE_TYPE, '\r\nbaz\nqux\u0000');0
          } else {0
            expect(e.childNodes.length).toBe(2);0
            // Client rendering uses JS value with CR and null character.0
            expectNode(e.childNodes[0], TEXT_NODE_TYPE, 'foo\rbar');0
            expectNode(e.childNodes[1], TEXT_NODE_TYPE, '\r\nbaz\nqux\u0000');0
          }0
        },0
      );0
0
      itRenders(0
        'an element with an attribute value with special characters',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(<a title={'foo\rbar\r\nbaz\nqux\u0000'} />);0
          if (0
            render === serverRender ||0
            render === streamRender ||0
            render === clientRenderOnServerString0
          ) {0
            // Everything becomes LF when parsed from server HTML.0
            // Null character in an attribute becomes the replacement character.0
            // Hydration also ends up with LF because we don't patch up attributes.0
            expect(e.title).toBe('foo\nbar\nbaz\nqux\uFFFD');0
          } else {0
            // Client rendering uses JS value with CR and null character.0
            expect(e.title).toBe('foo\rbar\r\nbaz\nqux\u0000');0
          }0
        },0
      );0
    });0
0
    describe('components that throw errors', function() {0
      itThrowsWhenRendering(0
        'a function returning undefined',0
        async render => {0
          const UndefinedComponent = () => undefined;0
          await render(<UndefinedComponent />, 1);0
        },0
        'UndefinedComponent(...): Nothing was returned from render. ' +0
          'This usually means a return statement is missing. Or, to ' +0
          'render nothing, return null.',0
      );0
0
      itThrowsWhenRendering(0
        'a class returning undefined',0
        async render => {0
          class UndefinedComponent extends React.Component {0
            render() {0
              return undefined;0
            }0
          }0
          await render(<UndefinedComponent />, 1);0
        },0
        'UndefinedComponent(...): Nothing was returned from render. ' +0
          'This usually means a return statement is missing. Or, to ' +0
          'render nothing, return null.',0
      );0
0
      itThrowsWhenRendering(0
        'a function returning an object',0
        async render => {0
          const ObjectComponent = () => ({x: 123});0
          await render(<ObjectComponent />, 1);0
        },0
        'Objects are not valid as a React child (found: object with keys {x}).' +0
          (__DEV__0
            ? ' If you meant to render a collection of children, use ' +0
              'an array instead.'0
            : ''),0
      );0
0
      itThrowsWhenRendering(0
        'a class returning an object',0
        async render => {0
          class ObjectComponent extends React.Component {0
            render() {0
              return {x: 123};0
            }0
          }0
          await render(<ObjectComponent />, 1);0
        },0
        'Objects are not valid as a React child (found: object with keys {x}).' +0
          (__DEV__0
            ? ' If you meant to render a collection of children, use ' +0
              'an array instead.'0
            : ''),0
      );0
0
      itThrowsWhenRendering(0
        'top-level object',0
        async render => {0
          await render({x: 123});0
        },0
        'Objects are not valid as a React child (found: object with keys {x}).' +0
          (__DEV__0
            ? ' If you meant to render a collection of children, use ' +0
              'an array instead.'0
            : ''),0
      );0
    });0
0
    describe('badly-typed elements', function() {0
      itThrowsWhenRendering(0
        'object',0
        async render => {0
          let EmptyComponent = {};0
          expect(() => {0
            EmptyComponent = <EmptyComponent />;0
          }).toWarnDev(0
            'Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string ' +0
              '(for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite ' +0
              'components) but got: object. You likely forgot to export your ' +0
              "component from the file it's defined in, or you might have mixed up " +0
              'default and named imports.',0
          );0
          await render(EmptyComponent);0
        },0
        'Element type is invalid: expected a string (for built-in components) or a class/function ' +0
          '(for composite components) but got: object.' +0
          (__DEV__0
            ? " You likely forgot to export your component from the file it's defined in, " +0
              'or you might have mixed up default and named imports.'0
            : ''),0
      );0
0
      itThrowsWhenRendering(0
        'null',0
        async render => {0
          let NullComponent = null;0
          expect(() => {0
            NullComponent = <NullComponent />;0
          }).toWarnDev(0
            'Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string ' +0
              '(for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite ' +0
              'components) but got: null.',0
          );0
          await render(NullComponent);0
        },0
        'Element type is invalid: expected a string (for built-in components) or a class/function ' +0
          '(for composite components) but got: null',0
      );0
0
      itThrowsWhenRendering(0
        'undefined',0
        async render => {0
          let UndefinedComponent = undefined;0
          expect(() => {0
            UndefinedComponent = <UndefinedComponent />;0
          }).toWarnDev(0
            'Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string ' +0
              '(for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite ' +0
              'components) but got: undefined. You likely forgot to export your ' +0
              "component from the file it's defined in, or you might have mixed up " +0
              'default and named imports.',0
          );0
0
          await render(UndefinedComponent);0
        },0
        'Element type is invalid: expected a string (for built-in components) or a class/function ' +0
          '(for composite components) but got: undefined.' +0
          (__DEV__0
            ? " You likely forgot to export your component from the file it's defined in, " +0
              'or you might have mixed up default and named imports.'0
            : ''),0
      );0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0

 * @emails react-core0

0
'use strict';0
0
const ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils = require('./utils/ReactDOMServerIntegrationTestUtils');0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
0
function initModules() {0
  // Reset warning cache.0
  jest.resetModuleRegistry();0
  React = require('react');0
  ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
  ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
  ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
0
  // Make them available to the helpers.0
  return {0
    ReactDOM,0
    ReactDOMServer,0
  };0
}0
0
const {0
  resetModules,0
  itRenders,0
  itClientRenders,0
  renderIntoDom,0
  serverRender,0
} = ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils(initModules);0
0
describe('ReactDOMServerIntegration', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    resetModules();0
  });0
0
  describe('form controls', function() {0
    describe('inputs', function() {0
      itRenders('an input with a value and an onChange', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<input value="foo" onChange={() => {}} />);0
        expect(e.value).toBe('foo');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('an input with a value and readOnly', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<input value="foo" readOnly={true} />);0
        expect(e.value).toBe('foo');0
      });0
0
      itRenders(0
        'an input with a value and no onChange/readOnly',0
        async render => {0
          // this configuration should raise a dev warning that value without0
          // onChange or readOnly is a mistake.0
          const e = await render(<input value="foo" />, 1);0
          expect(e.value).toBe('foo');0
          expect(e.getAttribute('value')).toBe('foo');0
        },0
      );0
0
      itRenders('an input with a defaultValue', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<input defaultValue="foo" />);0
        expect(e.value).toBe('foo');0
        expect(e.getAttribute('value')).toBe('foo');0
        expect(e.getAttribute('defaultValue')).toBe(null);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('an input value overriding defaultValue', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <input value="foo" defaultValue="bar" readOnly={true} />,0
          1,0
        );0
        expect(e.value).toBe('foo');0
        expect(e.getAttribute('value')).toBe('foo');0
        expect(e.getAttribute('defaultValue')).toBe(null);0
      });0
0
      itRenders(0
        'an input value overriding defaultValue no matter the prop order',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(0
            <input defaultValue="bar" value="foo" readOnly={true} />,0
            1,0
          );0
          expect(e.value).toBe('foo');0
          expect(e.getAttribute('value')).toBe('foo');0
          expect(e.getAttribute('defaultValue')).toBe(null);0
        },0
      );0
    });0
0
    describe('checkboxes', function() {0
      itRenders('a checkbox that is checked with an onChange', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <input type="checkbox" checked={true} onChange={() => {}} />,0
        );0
        expect(e.checked).toBe(true);0
      });0
0
      itRenders('a checkbox that is checked with readOnly', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <input type="checkbox" checked={true} readOnly={true} />,0
        );0
        expect(e.checked).toBe(true);0
      });0
0
      itRenders(0
        'a checkbox that is checked and no onChange/readOnly',0
        async render => {0
          // this configuration should raise a dev warning that checked without0
          // onChange or readOnly is a mistake.0
          const e = await render(<input type="checkbox" checked={true} />, 1);0
          expect(e.checked).toBe(true);0
        },0
      );0
0
      itRenders('a checkbox with defaultChecked', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<input type="checkbox" defaultChecked={true} />);0
        expect(e.checked).toBe(true);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('defaultChecked')).toBe(null);0
      });0
0
      itRenders(0
        'a checkbox checked overriding defaultChecked',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(0
            <input0
              type="checkbox"0
              checked={true}0
              defaultChecked={false}0
              readOnly={true}0
            />,0
            1,0
          );0
          expect(e.checked).toBe(true);0
          expect(e.getAttribute('defaultChecked')).toBe(null);0
        },0
      );0
0
      itRenders(0
        'a checkbox checked overriding defaultChecked no matter the prop order',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(0
            <input0
              type="checkbox"0
              defaultChecked={false}0
              checked={true}0
              readOnly={true}0
            />,0
            1,0
          );0
          expect(e.checked).toBe(true);0
          expect(e.getAttribute('defaultChecked')).toBe(null);0
        },0
      );0
    });0
0
    describe('textareas', function() {0
      // textareas0
      // ---------0
      itRenders('a textarea with a value and an onChange', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<textarea value="foo" onChange={() => {}} />);0
        // textarea DOM elements don't have a value **attribute**, the text is0
        // a child of the element and accessible via the .value **property**.0
        expect(e.getAttribute('value')).toBe(null);0
        expect(e.value).toBe('foo');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('a textarea with a value and readOnly', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<textarea value="foo" readOnly={true} />);0
        // textarea DOM elements don't have a value **attribute**, the text is0
        // a child of the element and accessible via the .value **property**.0
        expect(e.getAttribute('value')).toBe(null);0
        expect(e.value).toBe('foo');0
      });0
0
      itRenders(0
        'a textarea with a value and no onChange/readOnly',0
        async render => {0
          // this configuration should raise a dev warning that value without0
          // onChange or readOnly is a mistake.0
          const e = await render(<textarea value="foo" />, 1);0
          expect(e.getAttribute('value')).toBe(null);0
          expect(e.value).toBe('foo');0
        },0
      );0
0
      itRenders('a textarea with a defaultValue', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<textarea defaultValue="foo" />);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('value')).toBe(null);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('defaultValue')).toBe(null);0
        expect(e.value).toBe('foo');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('a textarea value overriding defaultValue', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <textarea value="foo" defaultValue="bar" readOnly={true} />,0
          1,0
        );0
        expect(e.getAttribute('value')).toBe(null);0
        expect(e.getAttribute('defaultValue')).toBe(null);0
        expect(e.value).toBe('foo');0
      });0
0
      itRenders(0
        'a textarea value overriding defaultValue no matter the prop order',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(0
            <textarea defaultValue="bar" value="foo" readOnly={true} />,0
            1,0
          );0
          expect(e.getAttribute('value')).toBe(null);0
          expect(e.getAttribute('defaultValue')).toBe(null);0
          expect(e.value).toBe('foo');0
        },0
      );0
    });0
0
    describe('selects', function() {0
      let options;0
      beforeEach(function() {0
        options = [0
          <option key={1} value="foo" id="foo">0
            Foo0
          </option>,0
          <option key={2} value="bar" id="bar">0
            Bar0
          </option>,0
          <option key={3} value="baz" id="baz">0
            Baz0
          </option>,0
        ];0
      });0
0
      // a helper function to test the selected value of a <select> element.0
      // takes in a <select> DOM element (element) and a value or array of0
      // values that should be selected (selected).0
      const expectSelectValue = (element, selected) => {0
        if (!Array.isArray(selected)) {0
          selected = [selected];0
        }0
        // the select DOM element shouldn't ever have a value or defaultValue0
        // attribute; that is not how select values are expressed in the DOM.0
        expect(element.getAttribute('value')).toBe(null);0
        expect(element.getAttribute('defaultValue')).toBe(null);0
0
        ['foo', 'bar', 'baz'].forEach(value => {0
          const expectedValue = selected.indexOf(value) !== -1;0
          const option = element.querySelector(`#${value}`);0
          expect(option.selected).toBe(expectedValue);0
        });0
      };0
0
      itRenders('a select with a value and an onChange', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <select value="bar" onChange={() => {}}>0
            {options}0
          </select>,0
        );0
        expectSelectValue(e, 'bar');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('a select with a value and readOnly', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <select value="bar" readOnly={true}>0
            {options}0
          </select>,0
        );0
        expectSelectValue(e, 'bar');0
      });0
0
      itRenders(0
        'a select with a multiple values and an onChange',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(0
            <select value={['bar', 'baz']} multiple={true} onChange={() => {}}>0
              {options}0
            </select>,0
          );0
          expectSelectValue(e, ['bar', 'baz']);0
        },0
      );0
0
      itRenders(0
        'a select with a multiple values and readOnly',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(0
            <select value={['bar', 'baz']} multiple={true} readOnly={true}>0
              {options}0
            </select>,0
          );0
          expectSelectValue(e, ['bar', 'baz']);0
        },0
      );0
0
      itRenders(0
        'a select with a value and no onChange/readOnly',0
        async render => {0
          // this configuration should raise a dev warning that value without0
          // onChange or readOnly is a mistake.0
          const e = await render(<select value="bar">{options}</select>, 1);0
          expectSelectValue(e, 'bar');0
        },0
      );0
0
      itRenders('a select with a defaultValue', async render => {0
        const e = await render(<select defaultValue="bar">{options}</select>);0
        expectSelectValue(e, 'bar');0
      });0
0
      itRenders('a select value overriding defaultValue', async render => {0
        const e = await render(0
          <select value="bar" defaultValue="baz" readOnly={true}>0
            {options}0
          </select>,0
          1,0
        );0
        expectSelectValue(e, 'bar');0
      });0
0
      itRenders(0
        'a select value overriding defaultValue no matter the prop order',0
        async render => {0
          const e = await render(0
            <select defaultValue="baz" value="bar" readOnly={true}>0
              {options}0
            </select>,0
            1,0
          );0
          expectSelectValue(e, 'bar');0
        },0
      );0
    });0
0
    describe('user interaction', function() {0
      let ControlledInput,0
        ControlledTextArea,0
        ControlledCheckbox,0
        ControlledSelect;0
      beforeEach(() => {0
        ControlledInput = class extends React.Component {0
          static defaultProps = {0
            type: 'text',0
            initialValue: 'Hello',0
          };0
          constructor() {0
            super(...arguments);0
            this.state = {value: this.props.initialValue};0
          }0
          handleChange(event) {0
            if (this.props.onChange) {0
              this.props.onChange(event);0
            }0
            this.setState({value: event.target.value});0
          }0
          render() {0
            return (0
              <input0
                type={this.props.type}0
                value={this.state.value}0
                onChange={this.handleChange.bind(this)}0
              />0
            );0
          }0
        };0
        ControlledTextArea = class extends React.Component {0
          constructor() {0
            super();0
            this.state = {value: 'Hello'};0
          }0
          handleChange(event) {0
            if (this.props.onChange) {0
              this.props.onChange(event);0
            }0
            this.setState({value: event.target.value});0
          }0
          render() {0
            return (0
              <textarea0
                value={this.state.value}0
                onChange={this.handleChange.bind(this)}0
              />0
            );0
          }0
        };0
        ControlledCheckbox = class extends React.Component {0
          constructor() {0
            super();0
            this.state = {value: true};0
          }0
          handleChange(event) {0
            if (this.props.onChange) {0
              this.props.onChange(event);0
            }0
            this.setState({value: event.target.checked});0
          }0
          render() {0
            return (0
              <input0
                type="checkbox"0
                checked={this.state.value}0
                onChange={this.handleChange.bind(this)}0
              />0
            );0
          }0
        };0
        ControlledSelect = class extends React.Component {0
          constructor() {0
            super();0
            this.state = {value: 'Hello'};0
          }0
          handleChange(event) {0
            if (this.props.onChange) {0
              this.props.onChange(event);0
            }0
            this.setState({value: event.target.value});0
          }0
          render() {0
            return (0
              <select0
                value={this.state.value}0
                onChange={this.handleChange.bind(this)}>0
                <option key="1" value="Hello">0
                  Hello0
                </option>0
                <option key="2" value="Goodbye">0
                  Goodbye0
                </option>0
              </select>0
            );0
          }0
        };0
      });0
0
      describe('user interaction with controlled inputs', function() {0
        itClientRenders('a controlled text input', async render => {0
          let changeCount = 0;0
          const e = await render(0
            <ControlledInput onChange={() => changeCount++} />,0
          );0
          expect(changeCount).toBe(0);0
          expect(e.value).toBe('Hello');0
0
          // simulate a user typing.0
          e.value = 'Goodbye';0
          ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(e);0
0
          expect(changeCount).toBe(1);0
          expect(e.value).toBe('Goodbye');0
        });0
0
        itClientRenders('a controlled textarea', async render => {0
          let changeCount = 0;0
          const e = await render(0
            <ControlledTextArea onChange={() => changeCount++} />,0
          );0
          expect(changeCount).toBe(0);0
          expect(e.value).toBe('Hello');0
0
          // simulate a user typing.0
          e.value = 'Goodbye';0
          ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(e);0
0
          expect(changeCount).toBe(1);0
          expect(e.value).toBe('Goodbye');0
        });0
0
        itClientRenders('a controlled checkbox', async render => {0
          let changeCount = 0;0
          const e = await render(0
            <ControlledCheckbox onChange={() => changeCount++} />,0
          );0
          expect(changeCount).toBe(0);0
          expect(e.checked).toBe(true);0
0
          // simulate a user typing.0
          e.checked = false;0
          ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(e);0
0
          expect(changeCount).toBe(1);0
          expect(e.checked).toBe(false);0
        });0
0
        itClientRenders('a controlled select', async render => {0
          let changeCount = 0;0
          const e = await render(0
            <ControlledSelect onChange={() => changeCount++} />,0
          );0
          expect(changeCount).toBe(0);0
          expect(e.value).toBe('Hello');0
0
          // simulate a user typing.0
          e.value = 'Goodbye';0
          ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(e);0
0
          expect(changeCount).toBe(1);0
          expect(e.value).toBe('Goodbye');0
        });0
      });0
0
      describe('user interaction with inputs before client render', function() {0
        // renders the element and changes the value **before** the client0
        // code has a chance to render; this simulates what happens when a0
        // user starts to interact with a server-rendered form before0
        // ReactDOM.render is called. the client render should NOT blow away0
        // the changes the user has made.0
        const testUserInteractionBeforeClientRender = async (0
          element,0
          initialValue = 'Hello',0
          changedValue = 'Goodbye',0
          valueKey = 'value',0
        ) => {0
          const field = await serverRender(element);0
          expect(field[valueKey]).toBe(initialValue);0
0
          // simulate a user typing in the field **before** client-side reconnect happens.0
          field[valueKey] = changedValue;0
0
          resetModules();0
          // client render on top of the server markup.0
          const clientField = await renderIntoDom(0
            element,0
            field.parentNode,0
            true,0
          );0
          // verify that the input field was not replaced.0
          // Note that we cannot use expect(clientField).toBe(field) because0
          // of jest bug #17720
          expect(clientField === field).toBe(true);0
          // confirm that the client render has not changed what the user typed.0
          expect(clientField[valueKey]).toBe(changedValue);0
        };0
0
        it('should not blow away user-entered text on successful reconnect to an uncontrolled input', () =>0
          testUserInteractionBeforeClientRender(0
            <input defaultValue="Hello" />,0
          ));0
0
        it('should not blow away user-entered text on successful reconnect to a controlled input', async () => {0
          let changeCount = 0;0
          await testUserInteractionBeforeClientRender(0
            <ControlledInput onChange={() => changeCount++} />,0
          );0
          // note that there's a strong argument to be made that the DOM revival0
          // algorithm should notice that the user has changed the value and fire0
          // an onChange. however, it does not now, so that's what this tests.0
          expect(changeCount).toBe(0);0
        });0
0
        it('should not blow away user-interaction on successful reconnect to an uncontrolled range input', () =>0
          testUserInteractionBeforeClientRender(0
            <input type="text" defaultValue="0.5" />,0
            '0.5',0
            '1',0
          ));0
0
        it('should not blow away user-interaction on successful reconnect to a controlled range input', async () => {0
          let changeCount = 0;0
          await testUserInteractionBeforeClientRender(0
            <ControlledInput0
              type="range"0
              initialValue="0.25"0
              onChange={() => changeCount++}0
            />,0
            '0.25',0
            '1',0
          );0
          expect(changeCount).toBe(0);0
        });0
0
        it('should not blow away user-entered text on successful reconnect to an uncontrolled checkbox', () =>0
          testUserInteractionBeforeClientRender(0
            <input type="checkbox" defaultChecked={true} />,0
            true,0
            false,0
            'checked',0
          ));0
0
        it('should not blow away user-entered text on successful reconnect to a controlled checkbox', async () => {0
          let changeCount = 0;0
          await testUserInteractionBeforeClientRender(0
            <ControlledCheckbox onChange={() => changeCount++} />,0
            true,0
            false,0
            'checked',0
          );0
          expect(changeCount).toBe(0);0
        });0
0
        // skipping this test because React 15 does the wrong thing. it blows0
        // away the user's typing in the textarea.0
        xit('should not blow away user-entered text on successful reconnect to an uncontrolled textarea', () =>0
          testUserInteractionBeforeClientRender(0
            <textarea defaultValue="Hello" />,0
          ));0
0
        // skipping this test because React 15 does the wrong thing. it blows0
        // away the user's typing in the textarea.0
        xit('should not blow away user-entered text on successful reconnect to a controlled textarea', async () => {0
          let changeCount = 0;0
          await testUserInteractionBeforeClientRender(0
            <ControlledTextArea onChange={() => changeCount++} />,0
          );0
          expect(changeCount).toBe(0);0
        });0
0
        it('should not blow away user-selected value on successful reconnect to an uncontrolled select', () =>0
          testUserInteractionBeforeClientRender(0
            <select defaultValue="Hello">0
              <option key="1" value="Hello">0
                Hello0
              </option>0
              <option key="2" value="Goodbye">0
                Goodbye0
              </option>0
            </select>,0
          ));0
0
        it('should not blow away user-selected value on successful reconnect to an controlled select', async () => {0
          let changeCount = 0;0
          await testUserInteractionBeforeClientRender(0
            <ControlledSelect onChange={() => changeCount++} />,0
          );0
          expect(changeCount).toBe(0);0
        });0
      });0
    });0
  });0
});0
