'use strict';0
0
const ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils = require('./utils/ReactDOMServerIntegrationTestUtils');0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
0
function initModules() {0
  // Reset warning cache.0
  jest.resetModuleRegistry();0
  React = require('react');0
  ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
  ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
0
  // Make them available to the helpers.0
  return {0
    ReactDOM,0
    ReactDOMServer,0
  };0
}0
0
const {resetModules, itRenders} = ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils(initModules);0
0
describe('ReactDOMServerIntegration', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    resetModules();0
  });0
0
  describe('React.Fragment', () => {0
    itRenders('a fragment with one child', async render => {0
      let e = await render(0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <div>text1</div>0
        </React.Fragment>,0
      );0
      let parent = e.parentNode;0
      expect(parent.childNodes[0].tagName).toBe('DIV');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('a fragment with several children', async render => {0
      let Header = props => {0
        return <p>header</p>;0
      };0
      let Footer = props => {0
        return (0
          <React.Fragment>0
            <h2>footer</h2>0
            <h3>about</h3>0
          </React.Fragment>0
        );0
      };0
      let e = await render(0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <div>text1</div>0
          <span>text2</span>0
          <Header />0
          <Footer />0
        </React.Fragment>,0
      );0
      let parent = e.parentNode;0
      expect(parent.childNodes[0].tagName).toBe('DIV');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[1].tagName).toBe('SPAN');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[2].tagName).toBe('P');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[3].tagName).toBe('H2');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[4].tagName).toBe('H3');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('a nested fragment', async render => {0
      let e = await render(0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <React.Fragment>0
            <div>text1</div>0
          </React.Fragment>0
          <span>text2</span>0
          <React.Fragment>0
            <React.Fragment>0
              <React.Fragment>0
                {null}0
                <p />0
              </React.Fragment>0
              {false}0
            </React.Fragment>0
          </React.Fragment>0
        </React.Fragment>,0
      );0
      let parent = e.parentNode;0
      expect(parent.childNodes[0].tagName).toBe('DIV');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[1].tagName).toBe('SPAN');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[2].tagName).toBe('P');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('an empty fragment', async render => {0
      expect(await render(<React.Fragment />)).toBe(null);0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils = require('./utils/ReactDOMServerIntegrationTestUtils');0
0
let PropTypes;0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
0
function initModules() {0
  // Reset warning cache.0
  jest.resetModuleRegistry();0
  PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
  React = require('react');0
  ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
  ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
0
  // Make them available to the helpers.0
  return {0
    ReactDOM,0
    ReactDOMServer,0
  };0
}0
0
const {0
  resetModules,0
  itRenders,0
  itThrowsWhenRendering,0
} = ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils(initModules);0
0
describe('ReactDOMServerIntegration', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    resetModules();0
  });0
0
  describe('legacy context', function() {0
    let PurpleContext, RedContext;0
    beforeEach(() => {0
      class Parent extends React.Component {0
        getChildContext() {0
          return {text: this.props.text};0
        }0
        render() {0
          return this.props.children;0
        }0
      }0
      Parent.childContextTypes = {text: PropTypes.string};0
0
      PurpleContext = props => <Parent text="purple">{props.children}</Parent>;0
      RedContext = props => <Parent text="red">{props.children}</Parent>;0
    });0
0
    itRenders('class child with context', async render => {0
      class ClassChildWithContext extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <div>{this.context.text}</div>;0
        }0
      }0
      ClassChildWithContext.contextTypes = {text: PropTypes.string};0
0
      const e = await render(0
        <PurpleContext>0
          <ClassChildWithContext />0
        </PurpleContext>,0
      );0
      expect(e.textContent).toBe('purple');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('stateless child with context', async render => {0
      function StatelessChildWithContext(props, context) {0
        return <div>{context.text}</div>;0
      }0
      StatelessChildWithContext.contextTypes = {text: PropTypes.string};0
0
      const e = await render(0
        <PurpleContext>0
          <StatelessChildWithContext />0
        </PurpleContext>,0
      );0
      expect(e.textContent).toBe('purple');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('class child without context', async render => {0
      class ClassChildWithoutContext extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          // this should render blank; context isn't passed to this component.0
          return <div>{this.context.text}</div>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const e = await render(0
        <PurpleContext>0
          <ClassChildWithoutContext />0
        </PurpleContext>,0
      );0
      expect(e.textContent).toBe('');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('stateless child without context', async render => {0
      function StatelessChildWithoutContext(props, context) {0
        // this should render blank; context isn't passed to this component.0
        return <div>{context.text}</div>;0
      }0
0
      const e = await render(0
        <PurpleContext>0
          <StatelessChildWithoutContext />0
        </PurpleContext>,0
      );0
      expect(e.textContent).toBe('');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('class child with wrong context', async render => {0
      class ClassChildWithWrongContext extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          // this should render blank; context.text isn't passed to this component.0
          return <div id="classWrongChild">{this.context.text}</div>;0
        }0
      }0
      ClassChildWithWrongContext.contextTypes = {foo: PropTypes.string};0
0
      const e = await render(0
        <PurpleContext>0
          <ClassChildWithWrongContext />0
        </PurpleContext>,0
      );0
      expect(e.textContent).toBe('');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('stateless child with wrong context', async render => {0
      function StatelessChildWithWrongContext(props, context) {0
        // this should render blank; context.text isn't passed to this component.0
        return <div id="statelessWrongChild">{context.text}</div>;0
      }0
      StatelessChildWithWrongContext.contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
0
      const e = await render(0
        <PurpleContext>0
          <StatelessChildWithWrongContext />0
        </PurpleContext>,0
      );0
      expect(e.textContent).toBe('');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('with context passed through to a grandchild', async render => {0
      function Grandchild(props, context) {0
        return <div>{context.text}</div>;0
      }0
      Grandchild.contextTypes = {text: PropTypes.string};0
0
      const Child = props => <Grandchild />;0
0
      const e = await render(0
        <PurpleContext>0
          <Child />0
        </PurpleContext>,0
      );0
      expect(e.textContent).toBe('purple');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('a child context overriding a parent context', async render => {0
      const Grandchild = (props, context) => {0
        return <div>{context.text}</div>;0
      };0
      Grandchild.contextTypes = {text: PropTypes.string};0
0
      const e = await render(0
        <PurpleContext>0
          <RedContext>0
            <Grandchild />0
          </RedContext>0
        </PurpleContext>,0
      );0
      expect(e.textContent).toBe('red');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('a child context merged with a parent context', async render => {0
      class Parent extends React.Component {0
        getChildContext() {0
          return {text1: 'purple'};0
        }0
        render() {0
          return <Child />;0
        }0
      }0
      Parent.childContextTypes = {text1: PropTypes.string};0
0
      class Child extends React.Component {0
        getChildContext() {0
          return {text2: 'red'};0
        }0
        render() {0
          return <Grandchild />;0
        }0
      }0
      Child.childContextTypes = {text2: PropTypes.string};0
0
      const Grandchild = (props, context) => {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <div id="first">{context.text1}</div>0
            <div id="second">{context.text2}</div>0
          </div>0
        );0
      };0
      Grandchild.contextTypes = {0
        text1: PropTypes.string,0
        text2: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
0
      const e = await render(<Parent />);0
      expect(e.querySelector('#first').textContent).toBe('purple');0
      expect(e.querySelector('#second').textContent).toBe('red');0
    });0
0
    itRenders(0
      'with a call to componentWillMount before getChildContext',0
      async render => {0
        class WillMountContext extends React.Component {0
          getChildContext() {0
            return {text: this.state.text};0
          }0
          UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
            this.setState({text: 'foo'});0
          }0
          render() {0
            return <Child />;0
          }0
        }0
        WillMountContext.childContextTypes = {text: PropTypes.string};0
0
        const Child = (props, context) => {0
          return <div>{context.text}</div>;0
        };0
        Child.contextTypes = {text: PropTypes.string};0
0
        const e = await render(<WillMountContext />);0
        expect(e.textContent).toBe('foo');0
      },0
    );0
0
    itRenders(0
      'if getChildContext exists but childContextTypes is missing with a warning',0
      async render => {0
        function HopefulChild(props, context) {0
          return context.foo || 'nope';0
        }0
        HopefulChild.contextTypes = {0
          foo: PropTypes.string,0
        };0
        class ForgetfulParent extends React.Component {0
          render() {0
            return <HopefulChild />;0
          }0
          getChildContext() {0
            return {foo: 'bar'};0
          }0
        }0
        const e = await render(<ForgetfulParent />, 1);0
        expect(e.textContent).toBe('nope');0
      },0
    );0
0
    itThrowsWhenRendering(0
      'if getChildContext returns a value not in childContextTypes',0
      render => {0
        class MyComponent extends React.Component {0
          render() {0
            return <div />;0
          }0
          getChildContext() {0
            return {value1: 'foo', value2: 'bar'};0
          }0
        }0
        MyComponent.childContextTypes = {value1: PropTypes.string};0
        return render(<MyComponent />);0
      },0
      'MyComponent.getChildContext(): key "value2" is not defined in childContextTypes.',0
    );0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils = require('./utils/ReactDOMServerIntegrationTestUtils');0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
0
function initModules() {0
  // Reset warning cache.0
  jest.resetModuleRegistry();0
  React = require('react');0
  ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
  ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
0
  // Make them available to the helpers.0
  return {0
    ReactDOM,0
    ReactDOMServer,0
  };0
}0
0
const {resetModules, itRenders} = ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils(initModules);0
0
describe('ReactDOMServerIntegration', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    resetModules();0
  });0
0
  describe('React.StrictMode', () => {0
    itRenders('a strict mode with one child', async render => {0
      let e = await render(0
        <React.StrictMode>0
          <div>text1</div>0
        </React.StrictMode>,0
      );0
      let parent = e.parentNode;0
      expect(parent.childNodes[0].tagName).toBe('DIV');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('a strict mode with several children', async render => {0
      let Header = props => {0
        return <p>header</p>;0
      };0
      let Footer = props => {0
        return (0
          <React.StrictMode>0
            <h2>footer</h2>0
            <h3>about</h3>0
          </React.StrictMode>0
        );0
      };0
      let e = await render(0
        <React.StrictMode>0
          <div>text1</div>0
          <span>text2</span>0
          <Header />0
          <Footer />0
        </React.StrictMode>,0
      );0
      let parent = e.parentNode;0
      expect(parent.childNodes[0].tagName).toBe('DIV');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[1].tagName).toBe('SPAN');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[2].tagName).toBe('P');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[3].tagName).toBe('H2');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[4].tagName).toBe('H3');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('a nested strict mode', async render => {0
      let e = await render(0
        <React.StrictMode>0
          <React.StrictMode>0
            <div>text1</div>0
          </React.StrictMode>0
          <span>text2</span>0
          <React.StrictMode>0
            <React.StrictMode>0
              <React.StrictMode>0
                {null}0
                <p />0
              </React.StrictMode>0
              {false}0
            </React.StrictMode>0
          </React.StrictMode>0
        </React.StrictMode>,0
      );0
      let parent = e.parentNode;0
      expect(parent.childNodes[0].tagName).toBe('DIV');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[1].tagName).toBe('SPAN');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[2].tagName).toBe('P');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('an empty strict mode', async render => {0
      expect(await render(<React.StrictMode />)).toBe(null);0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('React.unstable_AsyncMode', () => {0
    itRenders('an async mode with one child', async render => {0
      let e = await render(0
        <React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
          <div>text1</div>0
        </React.unstable_AsyncMode>,0
      );0
      let parent = e.parentNode;0
      expect(parent.childNodes[0].tagName).toBe('DIV');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('an async mode with several children', async render => {0
      let Header = props => {0
        return <p>header</p>;0
      };0
      let Footer = props => {0
        return (0
          <React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
            <h2>footer</h2>0
            <h3>about</h3>0
          </React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
        );0
      };0
      let e = await render(0
        <React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
          <div>text1</div>0
          <span>text2</span>0
          <Header />0
          <Footer />0
        </React.unstable_AsyncMode>,0
      );0
      let parent = e.parentNode;0
      expect(parent.childNodes[0].tagName).toBe('DIV');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[1].tagName).toBe('SPAN');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[2].tagName).toBe('P');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[3].tagName).toBe('H2');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[4].tagName).toBe('H3');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('a nested async mode', async render => {0
      let e = await render(0
        <React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
          <React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
            <div>text1</div>0
          </React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
          <span>text2</span>0
          <React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
            <React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
              <React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
                {null}0
                <p />0
              </React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
              {false}0
            </React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
          </React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
        </React.unstable_AsyncMode>,0
      );0
      let parent = e.parentNode;0
      expect(parent.childNodes[0].tagName).toBe('DIV');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[1].tagName).toBe('SPAN');0
      expect(parent.childNodes[2].tagName).toBe('P');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('an empty async mode', async render => {0
      expect(await render(<React.unstable_AsyncMode />)).toBe(null);0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils = require('./utils/ReactDOMServerIntegrationTestUtils');0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
0
function initModules() {0
  // Reset warning cache.0
  jest.resetModuleRegistry();0
  React = require('react');0
  ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
  ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
0
  // Make them available to the helpers.0
  return {0
    ReactDOM,0
    ReactDOMServer,0
  };0
}0
0
const {resetModules, itRenders} = ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils(initModules);0
0
describe('ReactDOMServerIntegration', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    resetModules();0
  });0
0
  describe('context', function() {0
    let PurpleContext, RedContext, Consumer;0
    beforeEach(() => {0
      let Context = React.createContext('none');0
0
      class Parent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <Context.Provider value={this.props.text}>0
              {this.props.children}0
            </Context.Provider>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
      Consumer = Context.Consumer;0
      PurpleContext = props => <Parent text="purple">{props.children}</Parent>;0
      RedContext = props => <Parent text="red">{props.children}</Parent>;0
    });0
0
    itRenders('class child with context', async render => {0
      class ClassChildWithContext extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <div>0
              <Consumer>{text => text}</Consumer>0
            </div>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      const e = await render(0
        <PurpleContext>0
          <ClassChildWithContext />0
        </PurpleContext>,0
      );0
      expect(e.textContent).toBe('purple');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('stateless child with context', async render => {0
      function StatelessChildWithContext(props) {0
        return <Consumer>{text => text}</Consumer>;0
      }0
0
      const e = await render(0
        <PurpleContext>0
          <StatelessChildWithContext />0
        </PurpleContext>,0
      );0
      expect(e.textContent).toBe('purple');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('class child with default context', async render => {0
      class ClassChildWithWrongContext extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <div id="classWrongChild">0
              <Consumer>{text => text}</Consumer>0
            </div>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      const e = await render(<ClassChildWithWrongContext />);0
      expect(e.textContent).toBe('none');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('stateless child with wrong context', async render => {0
      function StatelessChildWithWrongContext(props) {0
        return (0
          <div id="statelessWrongChild">0
            <Consumer>{text => text}</Consumer>0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
0
      const e = await render(<StatelessChildWithWrongContext />);0
      expect(e.textContent).toBe('none');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('with context passed through to a grandchild', async render => {0
      function Grandchild(props) {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Consumer>{text => text}</Consumer>0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
0
      const Child = props => <Grandchild />;0
0
      const e = await render(0
        <PurpleContext>0
          <Child />0
        </PurpleContext>,0
      );0
      expect(e.textContent).toBe('purple');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('a child context overriding a parent context', async render => {0
      const Grandchild = props => {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Consumer>{text => text}</Consumer>0
          </div>0
        );0
      };0
0
      const e = await render(0
        <PurpleContext>0
          <RedContext>0
            <Grandchild />0
          </RedContext>0
        </PurpleContext>,0
      );0
      expect(e.textContent).toBe('red');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('multiple contexts', async render => {0
      const Theme = React.createContext('dark');0
      const Language = React.createContext('french');0
      class Parent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <Theme.Provider value="light">0
              <Child />0
            </Theme.Provider>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      function Child() {0
        return (0
          <Language.Provider value="english">0
            <Grandchild />0
          </Language.Provider>0
        );0
      }0
0
      const Grandchild = props => {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Theme.Consumer>0
              {theme => <div id="theme">{theme}</div>}0
            </Theme.Consumer>0
            <Language.Consumer>0
              {language => <div id="language">{language}</div>}0
            </Language.Consumer>0
          </div>0
        );0
      };0
0
      const e = await render(<Parent />);0
      expect(e.querySelector('#theme').textContent).toBe('light');0
      expect(e.querySelector('#language').textContent).toBe('english');0
    });0
0
    itRenders('nested context unwinding', async render => {0
      const Theme = React.createContext('dark');0
      const Language = React.createContext('french');0
0
      const App = () => (0
        <div>0
          <Theme.Provider value="light">0
            <Language.Provider value="english">0
              <Theme.Provider value="dark">0
                <Theme.Consumer>0
                  {theme => <div id="theme1">{theme}</div>}0
                </Theme.Consumer>0
              </Theme.Provider>0
              <Theme.Consumer>0
                {theme => <div id="theme2">{theme}</div>}0
              </Theme.Consumer>0
              <Language.Provider value="sanskrit">0
                <Theme.Provider value="blue">0
                  <Theme.Provider value="red">0
                    <Language.Consumer>0
                      {() => (0
                        <Language.Provider value="chinese">0
                          <Language.Provider value="hungarian" />0
                          <Language.Consumer>0
                            {language => <div id="language1">{language}</div>}0
                          </Language.Consumer>0
                        </Language.Provider>0
                      )}0
                    </Language.Consumer>0
                  </Theme.Provider>0
                  <Language.Consumer>0
                    {language => (0
                      <React.Fragment>0
                        <Theme.Consumer>0
                          {theme => <div id="theme3">{theme}</div>}0
                        </Theme.Consumer>0
                        <div id="language2">{language}</div>0
                      </React.Fragment>0
                    )}0
                  </Language.Consumer>0
                </Theme.Provider>0
              </Language.Provider>0
            </Language.Provider>0
          </Theme.Provider>0
          <Language.Consumer>0
            {language => <div id="language3">{language}</div>}0
          </Language.Consumer>0
        </div>0
      );0
      let e = await render(<App />);0
      expect(e.querySelector('#theme1').textContent).toBe('dark');0
      expect(e.querySelector('#theme2').textContent).toBe('light');0
      expect(e.querySelector('#theme3').textContent).toBe('blue');0
      expect(e.querySelector('#language1').textContent).toBe('chinese');0
      expect(e.querySelector('#language2').textContent).toBe('sanskrit');0
      expect(e.querySelector('#language3').textContent).toBe('french');0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils = require('./utils/ReactDOMServerIntegrationTestUtils');0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
0
function initModules() {0
  // Reset warning cache.0
  jest.resetModuleRegistry();0
0
  React = require('react');0
  ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
  ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
0
  // Make them available to the helpers.0
  return {0
    ReactDOM,0
    ReactDOMServer,0
  };0
}0
0
const {0
  resetModules,0
  expectMarkupMismatch,0
  expectMarkupMatch,0
} = ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils(initModules);0
0
describe('ReactDOMServerIntegration', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    resetModules();0
  });0
0
  describe('reconnecting to server markup', function() {0
    let EmptyComponent;0
    beforeEach(() => {0
      EmptyComponent = class extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return null;0
        }0
      };0
    });0
0
    describe('elements', function() {0
      describe('reconnecting different component implementations', function() {0
        let ES6ClassComponent, PureComponent, bareElement;0
        beforeEach(() => {0
          // try each type of component on client and server.0
          ES6ClassComponent = class extends React.Component {0
            render() {0
              return <div id={this.props.id} />;0
            }0
          };0
          PureComponent = props => <div id={props.id} />;0
          bareElement = <div id="foobarbaz" />;0
        });0
0
        it('should reconnect ES6 Class to ES6 Class', () =>0
          expectMarkupMatch(0
            <ES6ClassComponent id="foobarbaz" />,0
            <ES6ClassComponent id="foobarbaz" />,0
          ));0
0
        it('should reconnect Pure Component to ES6 Class', () =>0
          expectMarkupMatch(0
            <ES6ClassComponent id="foobarbaz" />,0
            <PureComponent id="foobarbaz" />,0
          ));0
0
        it('should reconnect Bare Element to ES6 Class', () =>0
          expectMarkupMatch(<ES6ClassComponent id="foobarbaz" />, bareElement));0
0
        it('should reconnect ES6 Class to Pure Component', () =>0
          expectMarkupMatch(0
            <PureComponent id="foobarbaz" />,0
            <ES6ClassComponent id="foobarbaz" />,0
          ));0
0
        it('should reconnect Pure Component to Pure Component', () =>0
          expectMarkupMatch(0
            <PureComponent id="foobarbaz" />,0
            <PureComponent id="foobarbaz" />,0
          ));0
0
        it('should reconnect Bare Element to Pure Component', () =>0
          expectMarkupMatch(<PureComponent id="foobarbaz" />, bareElement));0
0
        it('should reconnect ES6 Class to Bare Element', () =>0
          expectMarkupMatch(bareElement, <ES6ClassComponent id="foobarbaz" />));0
0
        it('should reconnect Pure Component to Bare Element', () =>0
          expectMarkupMatch(bareElement, <PureComponent id="foobarbaz" />));0
0
        it('should reconnect Bare Element to Bare Element', () =>0
          expectMarkupMatch(bareElement, bareElement));0
      });0
0
      it('should error reconnecting different element types', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(<div />, <span />));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting fewer root children', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(<span key="a" />, [0
          <span key="a" />,0
          <span key="b" />,0
        ]));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting missing attributes', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(<div id="foo" />, <div />));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting added attributes', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(<div />, <div id="foo" />));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting different attribute values', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(<div id="foo" />, <div id="bar" />));0
0
      it('can explicitly ignore errors reconnecting different element types of children', () =>0
        expectMarkupMatch(0
          <div>0
            <div />0
          </div>,0
          <div suppressHydrationWarning={true}>0
            <span />0
          </div>,0
        ));0
0
      it('can explicitly ignore errors reconnecting missing attributes', () =>0
        expectMarkupMatch(0
          <div id="foo" />,0
          <div suppressHydrationWarning={true} />,0
        ));0
0
      it('can explicitly ignore errors reconnecting added attributes', () =>0
        expectMarkupMatch(0
          <div />,0
          <div id="foo" suppressHydrationWarning={true} />,0
        ));0
0
      it('can explicitly ignore errors reconnecting different attribute values', () =>0
        expectMarkupMatch(0
          <div id="foo" />,0
          <div id="bar" suppressHydrationWarning={true} />,0
        ));0
0
      it('can not deeply ignore errors reconnecting different attribute values', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(0
          <div>0
            <div id="foo" />0
          </div>,0
          <div suppressHydrationWarning={true}>0
            <div id="bar" />0
          </div>,0
        ));0
    });0
0
    describe('inline styles', function() {0
      it('should error reconnecting missing style attribute', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(<div style={{width: '1px'}} />, <div />));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting added style attribute', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(<div />, <div style={{width: '1px'}} />));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting empty style attribute', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(0
          <div style={{width: '1px'}} />,0
          <div style={{}} />,0
        ));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting added style values', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(0
          <div style={{}} />,0
          <div style={{width: '1px'}} />,0
        ));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting different style values', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(0
          <div style={{width: '1px'}} />,0
          <div style={{width: '2px'}} />,0
        ));0
0
      it('should reconnect number and string versions of a number', () =>0
        expectMarkupMatch(0
          <div style={{width: '1px', height: 2}} />,0
          <div style={{width: 1, height: '2px'}} />,0
        ));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting reordered style values', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(0
          <div style={{width: '1px', fontSize: '2px'}} />,0
          <div style={{fontSize: '2px', width: '1px'}} />,0
        ));0
0
      it('can explicitly ignore errors reconnecting added style values', () =>0
        expectMarkupMatch(0
          <div style={{}} />,0
          <div style={{width: '1px'}} suppressHydrationWarning={true} />,0
        ));0
0
      it('can explicitly ignore reconnecting different style values', () =>0
        expectMarkupMatch(0
          <div style={{width: '1px'}} />,0
          <div style={{width: '2px'}} suppressHydrationWarning={true} />,0
        ));0
    });0
0
    describe('text nodes', function() {0
      it('should error reconnecting different text', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(<div>Text</div>, <div>Other Text</div>));0
0
      it('should reconnect a div with a number and string version of number', () =>0
        expectMarkupMatch(<div>{2}</div>, <div>2</div>));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting different numbers', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(<div>{2}</div>, <div>{3}</div>));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting different number from text', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(<div>{2}</div>, <div>3</div>));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting different text in two code blocks', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(0
          <div>0
            {'Text1'}0
            {'Text2'}0
          </div>,0
          <div>0
            {'Text1'}0
            {'Text3'}0
          </div>,0
        ));0
0
      it('can explicitly ignore reconnecting different text', () =>0
        expectMarkupMatch(0
          <div>Text</div>,0
          <div suppressHydrationWarning={true}>Other Text</div>,0
        ));0
0
      it('can explicitly ignore reconnecting different text in two code blocks', () =>0
        expectMarkupMatch(0
          <div suppressHydrationWarning={true}>0
            {'Text1'}0
            {'Text2'}0
          </div>,0
          <div suppressHydrationWarning={true}>0
            {'Text1'}0
            {'Text3'}0
          </div>,0
        ));0
    });0
0
    describe('element trees and children', function() {0
      it('should error reconnecting missing children', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(0
          <div>0
            <div />0
          </div>,0
          <div />,0
        ));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting added children', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(0
          <div />,0
          <div>0
            <div />0
          </div>,0
        ));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting more children', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(0
          <div>0
            <div />0
          </div>,0
          <div>0
            <div />0
            <div />0
          </div>,0
        ));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting fewer children', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(0
          <div>0
            <div />0
            <div />0
          </div>,0
          <div>0
            <div />0
          </div>,0
        ));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting reordered children', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(0
          <div>0
            <div />0
            <span />0
          </div>,0
          <div>0
            <span />0
            <div />0
          </div>,0
        ));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting a div with children separated by whitespace on the client', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(0
          <div id="parent">0
            <div id="child1" />0
            <div id="child2" />0
          </div>,0
          // prettier-ignore0
          <div id="parent"><div id="child1" />      <div id="child2" /></div>, // eslint-disable-line no-multi-spaces0
        ));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting a div with children separated by different whitespace on the server', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(0
          // prettier-ignore0
          <div id="parent"><div id="child1" />      <div id="child2" /></div>, // eslint-disable-line no-multi-spaces0
          <div id="parent">0
            <div id="child1" />0
            <div id="child2" />0
          </div>,0
        ));0
0
      it('should error reconnecting a div with children separated by different whitespace', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(0
          <div id="parent">0
            <div id="child1" /> <div id="child2" />0
          </div>,0
          // prettier-ignore0
          <div id="parent"><div id="child1" />      <div id="child2" /></div>, // eslint-disable-line no-multi-spaces0
        ));0
0
      it('can distinguish an empty component from a dom node', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(0
          <div>0
            <span />0
          </div>,0
          <div>0
            <EmptyComponent />0
          </div>,0
        ));0
0
      it('can distinguish an empty component from an empty text component', () =>0
        expectMarkupMatch(0
          <div>0
            <EmptyComponent />0
          </div>,0
          <div>{''}</div>,0
        ));0
0
      it('can explicitly ignore reconnecting more children', () =>0
        expectMarkupMatch(0
          <div>0
            <div />0
          </div>,0
          <div suppressHydrationWarning={true}>0
            <div />0
            <div />0
          </div>,0
        ));0
0
      it('can explicitly ignore reconnecting fewer children', () =>0
        expectMarkupMatch(0
          <div>0
            <div />0
            <div />0
          </div>,0
          <div suppressHydrationWarning={true}>0
            <div />0
          </div>,0
        ));0
0
      it('can explicitly ignore reconnecting reordered children', () =>0
        expectMarkupMatch(0
          <div suppressHydrationWarning={true}>0
            <div />0
            <span />0
          </div>,0
          <div suppressHydrationWarning={true}>0
            <span />0
            <div />0
          </div>,0
        ));0
0
      it('can not deeply ignore reconnecting reordered children', () =>0
        expectMarkupMismatch(0
          <div suppressHydrationWarning={true}>0
            <div>0
              <div />0
              <span />0
            </div>0
          </div>,0
          <div suppressHydrationWarning={true}>0
            <div>0
              <span />0
              <div />0
            </div>0
          </div>,0
        ));0
    });0
0
    // Markup Mismatches: misc0
    it('should error reconnecting a div with different dangerouslySetInnerHTML', () =>0
      expectMarkupMismatch(0
        <div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: "<span id='child1'/>"}} />,0
        <div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: "<span id='child2'/>"}} />,0
      ));0
0
    it('can explicitly ignore reconnecting a div with different dangerouslySetInnerHTML', () =>0
      expectMarkupMatch(0
        <div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: "<span id='child1'/>"}} />,0
        <div0
          dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: "<span id='child2'/>"}}0
          suppressHydrationWarning={true}0
        />,0
      ));0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils = require('./utils/ReactDOMServerIntegrationTestUtils');0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
0
function initModules() {0
  // Reset warning cache.0
  jest.resetModuleRegistry();0
  React = require('react');0
  ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
  ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
0
  // Make them available to the helpers.0
  return {0
    ReactDOM,0
    ReactDOMServer,0
  };0
}0
0
const {0
  resetModules,0
  asyncReactDOMRender,0
  clientRenderOnServerString,0
  expectMarkupMatch,0
} = ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils(initModules);0
0
describe('ReactDOMServerIntegration', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    resetModules();0
  });0
0
  describe('refs', function() {0
    it('should not run ref code on server', async () => {0
      let refCount = 0;0
      class RefsComponent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <div ref={e => refCount++} />;0
        }0
      }0
      await expectMarkupMatch(<RefsComponent />, <div />);0
      expect(refCount).toBe(0);0
    });0
0
    it('should run ref code on client', async () => {0
      let refCount = 0;0
      class RefsComponent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <div ref={e => refCount++} />;0
        }0
      }0
      await expectMarkupMatch(<div />, <RefsComponent />);0
      expect(refCount).toBe(1);0
    });0
0
    it('should send the correct element to ref functions on client', async () => {0
      let refElement = null;0
      class RefsComponent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <div ref={e => (refElement = e)} />;0
        }0
      }0
      const e = await clientRenderOnServerString(<RefsComponent />);0
      expect(refElement).not.toBe(null);0
      expect(refElement).toBe(e);0
    });0
0
    it('should have string refs on client when rendered over server markup', async () => {0
      class RefsComponent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <div ref="myDiv" />;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const markup = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<RefsComponent />);0
      const root = document.createElement('div');0
      root.innerHTML = markup;0
      let component = null;0
      resetModules();0
      await asyncReactDOMRender(0
        <RefsComponent ref={e => (component = e)} />,0
        root,0
        true,0
      );0
      expect(component.refs.myDiv).toBe(root.firstChild);0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('should forward refs', async () => {0
    const divRef = React.createRef();0
0
    class InnerComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div ref={this.props.forwardedRef}>{this.props.value}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const OuterComponent = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => (0
      <InnerComponent {...props} forwardedRef={ref} />0
    ));0
0
    await clientRenderOnServerString(0
      <OuterComponent ref={divRef} value="hello" />,0
    );0
0
    expect(divRef.current).not.toBe(null);0
    expect(divRef.current.textContent).toBe('hello');0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactFeatureFlags;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
0
describe('ReactDOMServerLifecycles', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.warnAboutDeprecatedLifecycles = true;0
0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
  });0
0
  it('should not invoke cWM if static gDSFP is present', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
        return null;0
      }0
      componentWillMount() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Component />),0
    ).toLowPriorityWarnDev(0
      'Component: componentWillMount() is deprecated and will be removed in the next major version.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  // TODO (RFC #6) Merge this back into ReactDOMServerLifecycles-test once0
  // the 'warnAboutDeprecatedLifecycles' feature flag has been removed.0
  it('should warn about deprecated lifecycle hooks', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      componentWillMount() {}0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Component />),0
    ).toLowPriorityWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Component: componentWillMount() is deprecated and will be removed ' +0
        'in the next major version.',0
    );0
0
    // De-duped0
    ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Component />);0
  });0
0
  describe('react-lifecycles-compat', () => {0
    const {polyfill} = require('react-lifecycles-compat');0
0
    it('should not warn for components with polyfilled getDerivedStateFromProps', () => {0
      class PolyfilledComponent extends React.Component {0
        state = {};0
        static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
          return null;0
        }0
        render() {0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      polyfill(PolyfilledComponent);0
0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
        <React.StrictMode>0
          <PolyfilledComponent />0
        </React.StrictMode>,0
        container,0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should not warn for components with polyfilled getSnapshotBeforeUpdate', () => {0
      class PolyfilledComponent extends React.Component {0
        getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() {0
          return null;0
        }0
        componentDidUpdate() {}0
        render() {0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      polyfill(PolyfilledComponent);0
0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
        <React.StrictMode>0
          <PolyfilledComponent />0
        </React.StrictMode>,0
        container,0
      );0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0

 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0

 * @emails react-core0

'use strict';0
0
const ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils = require('./utils/ReactDOMServerIntegrationTestUtils');0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
0
function initModules() {0
  // Reset warning cache.0
  jest.resetModuleRegistry();0
  React = require('react');0
  ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
0
  // Make them available to the helpers.0
  return {0
    ReactDOMServer,0
  };0
}0
0
const {resetModules} = ReactDOMServerIntegrationUtils(initModules);0
0
describe('ReactDOMServerLifecycles', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    resetModules();0
  });0
0
  it('should invoke the correct legacy lifecycle hooks', () => {0
    const log = [];0
0
    class Outer extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        log.push('outer componentWillMount');0
      }0
      render() {0
        log.push('outer render');0
        return <Inner />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Inner extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        log.push('inner componentWillMount');0
      }0
      render() {0
        log.push('inner render');0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Outer />);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'outer componentWillMount',0
      'outer render',0
      'inner componentWillMount',0
      'inner render',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should invoke the correct new lifecycle hooks', () => {0
    const log = [];0
0
    class Outer extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
        log.push('outer getDerivedStateFromProps');0
        return null;0
      }0
      render() {0
        log.push('outer render');0
        return <Inner />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Inner extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
        log.push('inner getDerivedStateFromProps');0
        return null;0
      }0
      render() {0
        log.push('inner render');0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Outer />);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'outer getDerivedStateFromProps',0
      'outer render',0
      'inner getDerivedStateFromProps',0
      'inner render',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should not invoke unsafe cWM if static gDSFP is present', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
        return null;0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Component />);0
  });0
0
  it('should update instance.state with value returned from getDerivedStateFromProps', () => {0
    class Grandparent extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        foo: 'foo',0
      };0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            {`Grandparent: ${this.state.foo}`}0
            <Parent />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        bar: 'bar',0
        baz: 'baz',0
      };0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps(props, prevState) {0
        return {0
          bar: `not ${prevState.bar}`,0
        };0
      }0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            {`Parent: ${this.state.bar}, ${this.state.baz}`}0
            <Child />;0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
        return {0
          qux: 'qux',0
        };0
      }0
      render() {0
        return `Child: ${this.state.qux}`;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const markup = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Grandparent />);0
    expect(markup).toContain('Grandparent: foo');0
    expect(markup).toContain('Parent: not bar, baz');0
    expect(markup).toContain('Child: qux');0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if getDerivedStateFromProps returns undefined', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps() {}0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Component />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Component.getDerivedStateFromProps(): A valid state object (or null) must ' +0
        'be returned. You have returned undefined.',0
    );0
0
    // De-duped0
    ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Component />);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if state is not initialized before getDerivedStateFromProps', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
        return null;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Component />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Component: Did not properly initialize state during construction. ' +0
        'Expected state to be an object, but it was undefined.',0
    );0
0
    // De-duped0
    ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Component />);0
  });0
0
  it('should invoke both deprecated and new lifecycles if both are present', () => {0
    const log = [];0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      componentWillMount() {0
        log.push('componentWillMount');0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        log.push('UNSAFE_componentWillMount');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Component />);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['componentWillMount', 'UNSAFE_componentWillMount']);0
  });0
0
  it('tracks state updates across components', () => {0
    class Outer extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        this.setState({x: 1});0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <Inner updateParent={this.updateParent}>{this.state.x}</Inner>;0
      }0
      updateParent = () => {0
        this.setState({x: 3});0
      };0
    }0
    class Inner extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        this.setState({x: 2});0
        this.props.updateParent();0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children + '-' + this.state.x}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
    expect(() => {0
      // Shouldn't be 1-3.0
      expect(ReactDOMServer.renderToStaticMarkup(<Outer />)).toBe(0
        '<div>1-2</div>',0
      );0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: setState(...): Can only update a mounting component. This ' +0
        'usually means you called setState() outside componentWillMount() on ' +0
        'the server. This is a no-op.\n\n' +0
        'Please check the code for the Outer component.',0
    );0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
0
describe('ReactDOMSVG', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
  });0
0
  it('creates initial namespaced markup', () => {0
    const markup = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
      <svg>0
        <image xlinkHref="http://i.imgur.com/w7GCRPb.png" />0
      </svg>,0
    );0
    expect(markup).toContain('xlink:href="http://i.imgur.com/w7GCRPb.png"');0
  });0
0
  it('creates elements with SVG namespace inside SVG tag during mount', () => {0
    const node = document.createElement('div');0
    let div,0
      div2,0
      div3,0
      foreignObject,0
      foreignObject2,0
      g,0
      image,0
      image2,0
      image3,0
      p,0
      svg,0
      svg2,0
      svg3,0
      svg4;0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        <svg ref={el => (svg = el)}>0
          <g ref={el => (g = el)} strokeWidth="5">0
            <svg ref={el => (svg2 = el)}>0
              <foreignObject ref={el => (foreignObject = el)}>0
                <svg ref={el => (svg3 = el)}>0
                  <svg ref={el => (svg4 = el)} />0
                  <image0
                    ref={el => (image = el)}0
                    xlinkHref="http://i.imgur.com/w7GCRPb.png"0
                  />0
                </svg>0
                <div ref={el => (div = el)} />0
              </foreignObject>0
            </svg>0
            <image0
              ref={el => (image2 = el)}0
              xlinkHref="http://i.imgur.com/w7GCRPb.png"0
            />0
            <foreignObject ref={el => (foreignObject2 = el)}>0
              <div ref={el => (div2 = el)} />0
            </foreignObject>0
          </g>0
        </svg>0
        <p ref={el => (p = el)}>0
          <svg>0
            <image0
              ref={el => (image3 = el)}0
              xlinkHref="http://i.imgur.com/w7GCRPb.png"0
            />0
          </svg>0
        </p>0
        <div ref={el => (div3 = el)} />0
      </div>,0
      node,0
    );0
    [svg, svg2, svg3, svg4].forEach(el => {0
      expect(el.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/2000/svg');0
      // SVG tagName is case sensitive.0
      expect(el.tagName).toBe('svg');0
    });0
    expect(g.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/2000/svg');0
    expect(g.tagName).toBe('g');0
    expect(g.getAttribute('stroke-width')).toBe('5');0
    expect(p.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml');0
    // DOM tagName is capitalized by browsers.0
    expect(p.tagName).toBe('P');0
    [image, image2, image3].forEach(el => {0
      expect(el.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/2000/svg');0
      expect(el.tagName).toBe('image');0
      expect(el.getAttributeNS('http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink', 'href')).toBe(0
        'http://i.imgur.com/w7GCRPb.png',0
      );0
    });0
    [foreignObject, foreignObject2].forEach(el => {0
      expect(el.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/2000/svg');0
      expect(el.tagName).toBe('foreignObject');0
    });0
    [div, div2, div3].forEach(el => {0
      expect(el.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml');0
      expect(el.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('creates elements with SVG namespace inside SVG tag during update', () => {0
    let inst,0
      div,0
      div2,0
      foreignObject,0
      foreignObject2,0
      g,0
      image,0
      image2,0
      svg,0
      svg2,0
      svg3,0
      svg4;0
0
    class App extends React.Component {0
      state = {step: 0};0
      render() {0
        inst = this;0
        const {step} = this.state;0
        if (step === 0) {0
          return null;0
        }0
        return (0
          <g ref={el => (g = el)} strokeWidth="5">0
            <svg ref={el => (svg2 = el)}>0
              <foreignObject ref={el => (foreignObject = el)}>0
                <svg ref={el => (svg3 = el)}>0
                  <svg ref={el => (svg4 = el)} />0
                  <image0
                    ref={el => (image = el)}0
                    xlinkHref="http://i.imgur.com/w7GCRPb.png"0
                  />0
                </svg>0
                <div ref={el => (div = el)} />0
              </foreignObject>0
            </svg>0
            <image0
              ref={el => (image2 = el)}0
              xlinkHref="http://i.imgur.com/w7GCRPb.png"0
            />0
            <foreignObject ref={el => (foreignObject2 = el)}>0
              <div ref={el => (div2 = el)} />0
            </foreignObject>0
          </g>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const node = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <svg ref={el => (svg = el)}>0
        <App />0
      </svg>,0
      node,0
    );0
    inst.setState({step: 1});0
0
    [svg, svg2, svg3, svg4].forEach(el => {0
      expect(el.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/2000/svg');0
      // SVG tagName is case sensitive.0
      expect(el.tagName).toBe('svg');0
    });0
    expect(g.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/2000/svg');0
    expect(g.tagName).toBe('g');0
    expect(g.getAttribute('stroke-width')).toBe('5');0
    [image, image2].forEach(el => {0
      expect(el.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/2000/svg');0
      expect(el.tagName).toBe('image');0
      expect(el.getAttributeNS('http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink', 'href')).toBe(0
        'http://i.imgur.com/w7GCRPb.png',0
      );0
    });0
    [foreignObject, foreignObject2].forEach(el => {0
      expect(el.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/2000/svg');0
      expect(el.tagName).toBe('foreignObject');0
    });0
    [div, div2].forEach(el => {0
      expect(el.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml');0
      // DOM tagName is capitalized by browsers.0
      expect(el.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('can render SVG into a non-React SVG tree', () => {0
    const outerSVGRoot = document.createElementNS(0
      'http://www.w3.org/2000/svg',0
      'svg',0
    );0
    const container = document.createElementNS(0
      'http://www.w3.org/2000/svg',0
      'g',0
    );0
    outerSVGRoot.appendChild(container);0
    let image;0
    ReactDOM.render(<image ref={el => (image = el)} />, container);0
    expect(image.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/2000/svg');0
    expect(image.tagName).toBe('image');0
  });0
0
  it('can render HTML into a foreignObject in non-React SVG tree', () => {0
    const outerSVGRoot = document.createElementNS(0
      'http://www.w3.org/2000/svg',0
      'svg',0
    );0
    const container = document.createElementNS(0
      'http://www.w3.org/2000/svg',0
      'foreignObject',0
    );0
    outerSVGRoot.appendChild(container);0
    let div;0
    ReactDOM.render(<div ref={el => (div = el)} />, container);0
    expect(div.namespaceURI).toBe('http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml');0
    expect(div.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
function emptyFunction() {}0
0
describe('ReactDOMTextarea', () => {0
  let React;0
  let ReactDOM;0
  let ReactDOMServer;0
  let ReactTestUtils;0
0
  let renderTextarea;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
0
    renderTextarea = function(component, container) {0
      if (!container) {0
        container = document.createElement('div');0
      }0
      const node = ReactDOM.render(component, container);0
0
      // Fixing jsdom's quirky behavior -- in reality, the parser should strip0
      // off the leading newline but we need to do it by hand here.0
      node.defaultValue = node.innerHTML.replace(/^\n/, '');0
      return node;0
    };0
  });0
0
  it('should allow setting `defaultValue`', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const node = renderTextarea(<textarea defaultValue="giraffe" />, container);0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('giraffe');0
0
    // Changing `defaultValue` should do nothing.0
    renderTextarea(<textarea defaultValue="gorilla" />, container);0
    expect(node.value).toEqual('giraffe');0
0
    node.value = 'cat';0
0
    renderTextarea(<textarea defaultValue="monkey" />, container);0
    expect(node.value).toEqual('cat');0
  });0
0
  it('should display `defaultValue` of number 0', () => {0
    const stub = <textarea defaultValue={0} />;0
    const node = renderTextarea(stub);0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('0');0
  });0
0
  it('should display "false" for `defaultValue` of `false`', () => {0
    const stub = <textarea defaultValue={false} />;0
    const node = renderTextarea(stub);0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('false');0
  });0
0
  it('should display "foobar" for `defaultValue` of `objToString`', () => {0
    const objToString = {0
      toString: function() {0
        return 'foobar';0
      },0
    };0
0
    const stub = <textarea defaultValue={objToString} />;0
    const node = renderTextarea(stub);0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('foobar');0
  });0
0
  it('should set defaultValue', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<textarea defaultValue="foo" />, container);0
    ReactDOM.render(<textarea defaultValue="bar" />, container);0
    ReactDOM.render(<textarea defaultValue="noise" />, container);0
    expect(container.firstChild.defaultValue).toBe('noise');0
  });0
0
  it('should not render value as an attribute', () => {0
    const stub = <textarea value="giraffe" onChange={emptyFunction} />;0
    const node = renderTextarea(stub);0
0
    expect(node.getAttribute('value')).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('should display `value` of number 0', () => {0
    const stub = <textarea value={0} />;0
    const node = renderTextarea(stub);0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('0');0
  });0
0
  it('should update defaultValue to empty string', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<textarea defaultValue={'foo'} />, container);0
    ReactDOM.render(<textarea defaultValue={''} />, container);0
    expect(container.firstChild.defaultValue).toBe('');0
  });0
0
  it('should allow setting `value` to `giraffe`', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    let stub = <textarea value="giraffe" onChange={emptyFunction} />;0
    const node = renderTextarea(stub, container);0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('giraffe');0
0
    stub = ReactDOM.render(0
      <textarea value="gorilla" onChange={emptyFunction} />,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(node.value).toEqual('gorilla');0
  });0
0
  it('should render defaultValue for SSR', () => {0
    const markup = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<textarea defaultValue="1" />);0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    div.innerHTML = markup;0
    expect(div.firstChild.innerHTML).toBe('1');0
    expect(div.firstChild.getAttribute('defaultValue')).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('should render value for SSR', () => {0
    const element = <textarea value="1" onChange={function() {}} />;0
    const markup = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(element);0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    div.innerHTML = markup;0
    expect(div.firstChild.innerHTML).toBe('1');0
    expect(div.firstChild.getAttribute('defaultValue')).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('should allow setting `value` to `true`', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    let stub = <textarea value="giraffe" onChange={emptyFunction} />;0
    const node = renderTextarea(stub, container);0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('giraffe');0
0
    stub = ReactDOM.render(0
      <textarea value={true} onChange={emptyFunction} />,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(node.value).toEqual('true');0
  });0
0
  it('should allow setting `value` to `false`', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    let stub = <textarea value="giraffe" onChange={emptyFunction} />;0
    const node = renderTextarea(stub, container);0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('giraffe');0
0
    stub = ReactDOM.render(0
      <textarea value={false} onChange={emptyFunction} />,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(node.value).toEqual('false');0
  });0
0
  it('should allow setting `value` to `objToString`', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    let stub = <textarea value="giraffe" onChange={emptyFunction} />;0
    const node = renderTextarea(stub, container);0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('giraffe');0
0
    const objToString = {0
      toString: function() {0
        return 'foo';0
      },0
    };0
    stub = ReactDOM.render(0
      <textarea value={objToString} onChange={emptyFunction} />,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(node.value).toEqual('foo');0
  });0
0
  it('should take updates to `defaultValue` for uncontrolled textarea', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(<textarea defaultValue="0" />, container);0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('0');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<textarea defaultValue="1" />, container);0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('0');0
  });0
0
  it('should take updates to children in lieu of `defaultValue` for uncontrolled textarea', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(<textarea defaultValue="0" />, container);0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('0');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<textarea>1</textarea>, container);0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('0');0
  });0
0
  it('should not incur unnecessary DOM mutations', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<textarea value="a" onChange={emptyFunction} />, container);0
0
    const node = container.firstChild;0
    let nodeValue = 'a';0
    const nodeValueSetter = jest.fn();0
    Object.defineProperty(node, 'value', {0
      get: function() {0
        return nodeValue;0
      },0
      set: nodeValueSetter.mockImplementation(function(newValue) {0
        nodeValue = newValue;0
      }),0
    });0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<textarea value="a" onChange={emptyFunction} />, container);0
    expect(nodeValueSetter).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<textarea value="b" onChange={emptyFunction} />, container);0
    expect(nodeValueSetter).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should properly control a value of number `0`', () => {0
    const stub = <textarea value={0} onChange={emptyFunction} />;0
    const node = renderTextarea(stub);0
0
    node.value = 'giraffe';0
    ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(node);0
    expect(node.value).toBe('0');0
  });0
0
  it('should treat children like `defaultValue`', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    let stub = <textarea>giraffe</textarea>;0
    let node;0
0
    expect(() => {0
      node = renderTextarea(stub, container);0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Use the `defaultValue` or `value` props instead of setting children on <textarea>.',0
    );0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('giraffe');0
0
    // Changing children should do nothing, it functions like `defaultValue`.0
    stub = ReactDOM.render(<textarea>gorilla</textarea>, container);0
    expect(node.value).toEqual('giraffe');0
  });0
0
  it('should keep value when switching to uncontrolled element if not changed', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    const node = renderTextarea(0
      <textarea value="kitten" onChange={emptyFunction} />,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('kitten');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<textarea defaultValue="gorilla" />, container);0
0
    expect(node.value).toEqual('kitten');0
  });0
0
  it('should keep value when switching to uncontrolled element if changed', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    const node = renderTextarea(0
      <textarea value="kitten" onChange={emptyFunction} />,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('kitten');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <textarea value="puppies" onChange={emptyFunction} />,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('puppies');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<textarea defaultValue="gorilla" />, container);0
0
    expect(node.value).toEqual('puppies');0
  });0
0
  it('should allow numbers as children', () => {0
    let node;0
    expect(() => {0
      node = renderTextarea(<textarea>{17}</textarea>);0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Use the `defaultValue` or `value` props instead of setting children on <textarea>.',0
    );0
    expect(node.value).toBe('17');0
  });0
0
  it('should allow booleans as children', () => {0
    let node;0
    expect(() => {0
      node = renderTextarea(<textarea>{false}</textarea>);0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Use the `defaultValue` or `value` props instead of setting children on <textarea>.',0
    );0
    expect(node.value).toBe('false');0
  });0
0
  it('should allow objects as children', () => {0
    const obj = {0
      toString: function() {0
        return 'sharkswithlasers';0
      },0
    };0
    let node;0
    expect(() => {0
      node = renderTextarea(<textarea>{obj}</textarea>);0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Use the `defaultValue` or `value` props instead of setting children on <textarea>.',0
    );0
    expect(node.value).toBe('sharkswithlasers');0
  });0
0
  it('should throw with multiple or invalid children', () => {0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
          <textarea>0
            {'hello'}0
            {'there'}0
          </textarea>,0
        ),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Use the `defaultValue` or `value` props instead of setting children on <textarea>.',0
      );0
    }).toThrow();0
0
    let node;0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(0
        () =>0
          (node = renderTextarea(0
            <textarea>0
              <strong />0
            </textarea>,0
          )),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Use the `defaultValue` or `value` props instead of setting children on <textarea>.',0
      );0
    }).not.toThrow();0
0
    expect(node.value).toBe('[object Object]');0
  });0
0
  it('should unmount', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    renderTextarea(<textarea />, container);0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if value is null', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<textarea value={null} />),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      '`value` prop on `textarea` should not be null. ' +0
        'Consider using an empty string to clear the component or `undefined` ' +0
        'for uncontrolled components.',0
    );0
0
    // No additional warnings are expected0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<textarea value={null} />);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if value and defaultValue are specified', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <textarea value="foo" defaultValue="bar" readOnly={true} />,0
      ),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Textarea elements must be either controlled or uncontrolled ' +0
        '(specify either the value prop, or the defaultValue prop, but not ' +0
        'both). Decide between using a controlled or uncontrolled textarea ' +0
        'and remove one of these props. More info: ' +0
        'https://fb.me/react-controlled-components',0
    );0
0
    // No additional warnings are expected0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <textarea value="foo" defaultValue="bar" readOnly={true} />,0
    );0
  });0
});0
/**0
