'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
0
// In standard React, TextComponent keeps track of different Text templates0
// using comments. However, in React Fiber, those comments are not outputted due0
// to the way Fiber keeps track of the templates.0
// This function "Normalizes" childNodes lists to avoid the presence of comments0
// and make the child list identical in standard React and Fiber0
function filterOutComments(nodeList) {0
  return [].slice.call(nodeList).filter(node => !(node instanceof Comment));0
}0
0
describe('ReactDOMTextComponent', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
  });0
0
  it('updates a mounted text component in place', () => {0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    let inst = ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        <span />0
        {'foo'}0
        {'bar'}0
      </div>,0
      el,0
    );0
    let nodes = filterOutComments(inst.childNodes);0
0
    let foo = nodes[1];0
    let bar = nodes[2];0
    expect(foo.data).toBe('foo');0
    expect(bar.data).toBe('bar');0
0
    inst = ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        <span />0
        {'baz'}0
        {'qux'}0
      </div>,0
      el,0
    );0
    // After the update, the text nodes should have stayed in place (as opposed0
    // to getting unmounted and remounted)0
    nodes = filterOutComments(inst.childNodes);0
    expect(nodes[1]).toBe(foo);0
    expect(nodes[2]).toBe(bar);0
    expect(foo.data).toBe('baz');0
    expect(bar.data).toBe('qux');0
  });0
0
  it('can be toggled in and out of the markup', () => {0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    let inst = ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        {'foo'}0
        <div />0
        {'bar'}0
      </div>,0
      el,0
    );0
0
    let childNodes = filterOutComments(inst.childNodes);0
    let childDiv = childNodes[1];0
0
    inst = ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        {null}0
        <div />0
        {null}0
      </div>,0
      el,0
    );0
    childNodes = filterOutComments(inst.childNodes);0
    expect(childNodes.length).toBe(1);0
    expect(childNodes[0]).toBe(childDiv);0
0
    inst = ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        {'foo'}0
        <div />0
        {'bar'}0
      </div>,0
      el,0
    );0
    childNodes = filterOutComments(inst.childNodes);0
    expect(childNodes.length).toBe(3);0
    expect(childNodes[0].data).toBe('foo');0
    expect(childNodes[1]).toBe(childDiv);0
    expect(childNodes[2].data).toBe('bar');0
  });0
0
  /**0
   * The following Node.normalize() tests are intentionally failing.0
   * See #9836 tracking whether we'll need to fix this or if it's unnecessary.0
   */0
0
  xit('can reconcile text merged by Node.normalize() alongside other elements', () => {0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    let inst = ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        {'foo'}0
        {'bar'}0
        {'baz'}0
        <span />0
        {'qux'}0
      </div>,0
      el,0
    );0
0
    inst.normalize();0
0
    inst = ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        {'bar'}0
        {'baz'}0
        {'qux'}0
        <span />0
        {'foo'}0
      </div>,0
      el,0
    );0
    expect(inst.textContent).toBe('barbazquxfoo');0
  });0
0
  xit('can reconcile text merged by Node.normalize()', () => {0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    let inst = ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        {'foo'}0
        {'bar'}0
        {'baz'}0
      </div>,0
      el,0
    );0
0
    inst.normalize();0
0
    inst = ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        {'bar'}0
        {'baz'}0
        {'qux'}0
      </div>,0
      el,0
    );0
    expect(inst.textContent).toBe('barbazqux');0
  });0
0
  it('can reconcile text from pre-rendered markup', () => {0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    let reactEl = (0
      <div>0
        {'foo'}0
        {'bar'}0
        {'baz'}0
      </div>0
    );0
    el.innerHTML = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(reactEl);0
0
    ReactDOM.hydrate(reactEl, el);0
    expect(el.textContent).toBe('foobarbaz');0
0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(el);0
0
    reactEl = (0
      <div>0
        {''}0
        {''}0
        {''}0
      </div>0
    );0
    el.innerHTML = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(reactEl);0
0
    ReactDOM.hydrate(reactEl, el);0
    expect(el.textContent).toBe('');0
  });0
0
  xit('can reconcile text arbitrarily split into multiple nodes', () => {0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    let inst = ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        <span />0
        {'foobarbaz'}0
      </div>,0
      el,0
    );0
0
    let childNodes = filterOutComments(inst.childNodes);0
    let textNode = childNodes[1];0
    textNode.textContent = 'foo';0
    inst.insertBefore(0
      document.createTextNode('bar'),0
      childNodes[1].nextSibling,0
    );0
    inst.insertBefore(0
      document.createTextNode('baz'),0
      childNodes[1].nextSibling,0
    );0
0
    inst = ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        <span />0
        {'barbazqux'}0
      </div>,0
      el,0
    );0
    expect(inst.textContent).toBe('barbazqux');0
  });0
0
  xit('can reconcile text arbitrarily split into multiple nodes on some substitutions only', () => {0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    let inst = ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        <span />0
        {'bar'}0
        <span />0
        {'foobarbaz'}0
        {'foo'}0
        {'barfoo'}0
        <span />0
      </div>,0
      el,0
    );0
0
    let childNodes = filterOutComments(inst.childNodes);0
    let textNode = childNodes[3];0
    textNode.textContent = 'foo';0
    inst.insertBefore(0
      document.createTextNode('bar'),0
      childNodes[3].nextSibling,0
    );0
    inst.insertBefore(0
      document.createTextNode('baz'),0
      childNodes[3].nextSibling,0
    );0
    let secondTextNode = childNodes[5];0
    secondTextNode.textContent = 'bar';0
    inst.insertBefore(0
      document.createTextNode('foo'),0
      childNodes[5].nextSibling,0
    );0
0
    inst = ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        <span />0
        {'baz'}0
        <span />0
        {'barbazqux'}0
        {'bar'}0
        {'bazbar'}0
        <span />0
      </div>,0
      el,0
    );0
    expect(inst.textContent).toBe('bazbarbazquxbarbazbar');0
  });0
0
  xit('can unmount normalized text nodes', () => {0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        {''}0
        {'foo'}0
        {'bar'}0
      </div>,0
      el,0
    );0
    el.normalize();0
    ReactDOM.render(<div />, el);0
    expect(el.innerHTML).toBe('<div></div>');0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2014-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
let TogglingComponent;0
0
let log;0
0
describe('ReactEmptyComponent', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
0
    log = jest.fn();0
0
    TogglingComponent = class extends React.Component {0
      state = {component: this.props.firstComponent};0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        log(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(this));0
        this.setState({component: this.props.secondComponent});0
      }0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        log(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(this));0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        const Component = this.state.component;0
        return Component ? <Component /> : null;0
      }0
    };0
  });0
0
  it('should not produce child DOM nodes for null and false', () => {0
    class Component1 extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Component2 extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return false;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container1 = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component1 />, container1);0
    expect(container1.children.length).toBe(0);0
0
    const container2 = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component2 />, container2);0
    expect(container2.children.length).toBe(0);0
  });0
0
  it('should still throw when rendering to undefined', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {}0
    }0
0
    expect(function() {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />);0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'Component(...): Nothing was returned from render. This usually means a return statement is missing. ' +0
        'Or, to render nothing, return null.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should be able to switch between rendering null and a normal tag', () => {0
    const instance1 = (0
      <TogglingComponent firstComponent={null} secondComponent={'div'} />0
    );0
    const instance2 = (0
      <TogglingComponent firstComponent={'div'} secondComponent={null} />0
    );0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance1);0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance2);0
0
    expect(log).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(4);0
    expect(log).toHaveBeenNthCalledWith(1, null);0
    expect(log).toHaveBeenNthCalledWith(0
      2,0
      expect.objectContaining({tagName: 'DIV'}),0
    );0
    expect(log).toHaveBeenNthCalledWith(0
      3,0
      expect.objectContaining({tagName: 'DIV'}),0
    );0
    expect(log).toHaveBeenNthCalledWith(4, null);0
  });0
0
  it('should be able to switch in a list of children', () => {0
    const instance1 = (0
      <TogglingComponent firstComponent={null} secondComponent={'div'} />0
    );0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
      <div>0
        {instance1}0
        {instance1}0
        {instance1}0
      </div>,0
    );0
0
    expect(log).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(6);0
    expect(log).toHaveBeenNthCalledWith(1, null);0
    expect(log).toHaveBeenNthCalledWith(2, null);0
    expect(log).toHaveBeenNthCalledWith(3, null);0
    expect(log).toHaveBeenNthCalledWith(0
      4,0
      expect.objectContaining({tagName: 'DIV'}),0
    );0
    expect(log).toHaveBeenNthCalledWith(0
      5,0
      expect.objectContaining({tagName: 'DIV'}),0
    );0
    expect(log).toHaveBeenNthCalledWith(0
      6,0
      expect.objectContaining({tagName: 'DIV'}),0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should distinguish between a script placeholder and an actual script tag', () => {0
    const instance1 = (0
      <TogglingComponent firstComponent={null} secondComponent={'script'} />0
    );0
    const instance2 = (0
      <TogglingComponent firstComponent={'script'} secondComponent={null} />0
    );0
0
    expect(function() {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance1);0
    }).not.toThrow();0
    expect(function() {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance2);0
    }).not.toThrow();0
0
    expect(log).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(4);0
    expect(log).toHaveBeenNthCalledWith(1, null);0
    expect(log).toHaveBeenNthCalledWith(0
      2,0
      expect.objectContaining({tagName: 'SCRIPT'}),0
    );0
    expect(log).toHaveBeenNthCalledWith(0
      3,0
      expect.objectContaining({tagName: 'SCRIPT'}),0
    );0
    expect(log).toHaveBeenNthCalledWith(4, null);0
  });0
0
  it(0
    'should have findDOMNode return null when multiple layers of composite ' +0
      'components render to the same null placeholder',0
    () => {0
      class GrandChild extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      class Child extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <GrandChild />;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const instance1 = (0
        <TogglingComponent firstComponent={'div'} secondComponent={Child} />0
      );0
      const instance2 = (0
        <TogglingComponent firstComponent={Child} secondComponent={'div'} />0
      );0
0
      expect(function() {0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance1);0
      }).not.toThrow();0
      expect(function() {0
        ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance2);0
      }).not.toThrow();0
0
      expect(log).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(4);0
      expect(log).toHaveBeenNthCalledWith(0
        1,0
        expect.objectContaining({tagName: 'DIV'}),0
      );0
      expect(log).toHaveBeenNthCalledWith(2, null);0
      expect(log).toHaveBeenNthCalledWith(3, null);0
      expect(log).toHaveBeenNthCalledWith(0
        4,0
        expect.objectContaining({tagName: 'DIV'}),0
      );0
    },0
  );0
0
  it('works when switching components', () => {0
    let assertions = 0;0
0
    class Inner extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <span />;0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        // Make sure the DOM node resolves properly even if we're replacing a0
        // `null` component0
        expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(this)).not.toBe(null);0
        assertions++;0
      }0
0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        // Even though we're getting replaced by `null`, we haven't been0
        // replaced yet!0
        expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(this)).not.toBe(null);0
        assertions++;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return this.props.showInner ? <Inner /> : null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    let component;0
0
    // Render the <Inner /> component...0
    component = ReactDOM.render(<Wrapper showInner={true} />, el);0
    expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(component)).not.toBe(null);0
0
    // Switch to null...0
    component = ReactDOM.render(<Wrapper showInner={false} />, el);0
    expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(component)).toBe(null);0
0
    // ...then switch back.0
    component = ReactDOM.render(<Wrapper showInner={true} />, el);0
    expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(component)).not.toBe(null);0
0
    expect(assertions).toBe(3);0
  });0
0
  it('can render null at the top level', () => {0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(null, div);0
    expect(div.innerHTML).toBe('');0
  });0
0
  it('does not break when updating during mount', () => {0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        if (this.props.onMount) {0
          this.props.onMount();0
        }0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        if (!this.props.visible) {0
          return null;0
        }0
0
        return <div>hello world</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      update = () => {0
        this.forceUpdate();0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Child key="1" visible={false} />0
            <Child key="0" visible={true} onMount={this.update} />0
            <Child key="2" visible={false} />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(function() {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Parent />);0
    }).not.toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('preserves the dom node during updates', () => {0
    class Empty extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Empty />, container);0
    const noscript1 = container.firstChild;0
    expect(noscript1).toBe(null);0
0
    // This update shouldn't create a DOM node0
    ReactDOM.render(<Empty />, container);0
    const noscript2 = container.firstChild;0
    expect(noscript2).toBe(null);0
  });0
});0

 */0

describe('ReactErrorBoundaries', () => {0
  let log;0
0
  let BrokenConstructor;0
  let BrokenComponentWillMount;0
  let BrokenComponentDidMount;0
  let BrokenComponentWillReceiveProps;0
  let BrokenComponentWillUpdate;0
  let BrokenComponentDidUpdate;0
  let BrokenComponentWillUnmount;0
  let BrokenRenderErrorBoundary;0
  let BrokenComponentWillMountErrorBoundary;0
  let BrokenComponentDidMountErrorBoundary;0
  let BrokenRender;0
  let ErrorBoundary;0
  let ErrorMessage;0
  let NoopErrorBoundary;0
  let RetryErrorBoundary;0
  let Normal;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.replayFailedUnitOfWorkWithInvokeGuardedCallback = false;0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    React = require('react');0

    log = [];0

    BrokenConstructor = class extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        log.push('BrokenConstructor constructor [!]');0
        throw new Error('Hello');0
      }0
      render() {0
        log.push('BrokenConstructor render');0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        log.push('BrokenConstructor componentWillMount');0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        log.push('BrokenConstructor componentDidMount');0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {0
        log.push('BrokenConstructor componentWillReceiveProps');0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {0
        log.push('BrokenConstructor componentWillUpdate');0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        log.push('BrokenConstructor componentDidUpdate');0
      }0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        log.push('BrokenConstructor componentWillUnmount');0
      }0
    };0

    BrokenComponentWillMountErrorBoundary = class extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        this.state = {error: null};0
        log.push('BrokenComponentWillMountErrorBoundary constructor');0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          log.push('BrokenComponentWillMountErrorBoundary render error');0
          return <div>Caught an error: {this.state.error.message}.</div>;0
        }0
        log.push('BrokenComponentWillMountErrorBoundary render success');0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        log.push(0
          'BrokenComponentWillMountErrorBoundary componentWillMount [!]',0
        );0
        throw new Error('Hello');0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        log.push('BrokenComponentWillMountErrorBoundary componentDidMount');0
      }0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        log.push('BrokenComponentWillMountErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount');0
      }0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        log.push('BrokenComponentWillMountErrorBoundary componentDidCatch');0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
    };0
0
    BrokenComponentDidMountErrorBoundary = class extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        this.state = {error: null};0
        log.push('BrokenComponentDidMountErrorBoundary constructor');0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          log.push('BrokenComponentDidMountErrorBoundary render error');0
          return <div>Caught an error: {this.state.error.message}.</div>;0
        }0
        log.push('BrokenComponentDidMountErrorBoundary render success');0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        log.push('BrokenComponentDidMountErrorBoundary componentWillMount');0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        log.push('BrokenComponentDidMountErrorBoundary componentDidMount [!]');0
        throw new Error('Hello');0
      }0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        log.push('BrokenComponentDidMountErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount');0
      }0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        log.push('BrokenComponentDidMountErrorBoundary componentDidCatch');0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
    };0
0
    BrokenRenderErrorBoundary = class extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0

      }0
      render() {0

          log.push('BrokenRenderErrorBoundary render error [!]');0

    BrokenRender = class extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        log.push('BrokenRender constructor');0
      }0
      render() {0
        log.push('BrokenRender render [!]');0
        throw new Error('Hello');0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        log.push('BrokenRender componentWillMount');0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        log.push('BrokenRender componentDidMount');0

        log.push('BrokenRender componentWillReceiveProps');0
      }0

        log.push('BrokenRender componentWillUpdate');0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        log.push('BrokenRender componentDidUpdate');0
      }0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        log.push('BrokenRender componentWillUnmount');0
      }0
    };0

    NoopErrorBoundary = class extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        log.push('NoopErrorBoundary constructor');0
      }0
      render() {0
        log.push('NoopErrorBoundary render');0
        return <BrokenRender />;0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        log.push('NoopErrorBoundary componentWillMount');0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        log.push('NoopErrorBoundary componentDidMount');0
      }0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        log.push('NoopErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount');0
      }0
      componentDidCatch() {0
        log.push('NoopErrorBoundary componentDidCatch');0
      }0
    };0
0
    Normal = class extends React.Component {0
      static defaultProps = {0
        logName: 'Normal',0
      };0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        log.push(`${this.props.logName} constructor`);0
      }0
      render() {0
        log.push(`${this.props.logName} render`);0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        log.push(`${this.props.logName} componentWillMount`);0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        log.push(`${this.props.logName} componentDidMount`);0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {0
        log.push(`${this.props.logName} componentWillReceiveProps`);0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {0
        log.push(`${this.props.logName} componentWillUpdate`);0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        log.push(`${this.props.logName} componentDidUpdate`);0
      }0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        log.push(`${this.props.logName} componentWillUnmount`);0
      }0
    };0
0
    ErrorBoundary = class extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        this.state = {error: null};0
        log.push(`${this.props.logName} constructor`);0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error && !this.props.forceRetry) {0
          log.push(`${this.props.logName} render error`);0
          return this.props.renderError(this.state.error, this.props);0
        }0
        log.push(`${this.props.logName} render success`);0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        log.push(`${this.props.logName} componentDidCatch`);0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        log.push(`${this.props.logName} componentWillMount`);0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        log.push(`${this.props.logName} componentDidMount`);0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {0
        log.push(`${this.props.logName} componentWillReceiveProps`);0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {0
        log.push(`${this.props.logName} componentWillUpdate`);0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        log.push(`${this.props.logName} componentDidUpdate`);0
      }0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        log.push(`${this.props.logName} componentWillUnmount`);0
      }0
    };0
    ErrorBoundary.defaultProps = {0
      logName: 'ErrorBoundary',0
      renderError(error, props) {0
        return (0
          <div ref={props.errorMessageRef}>0
            Caught an error: {error.message}.0
          </div>0
        );0
      },0
    };0
0
    RetryErrorBoundary = class extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        log.push('RetryErrorBoundary constructor');0
      }0
      render() {0
        log.push('RetryErrorBoundary render');0
        return <BrokenRender />;0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        log.push('RetryErrorBoundary componentWillMount');0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        log.push('RetryErrorBoundary componentDidMount');0
      }0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        log.push('RetryErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount');0
      }0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        log.push('RetryErrorBoundary componentDidCatch [!]');0
        // In Fiber, calling setState() (and failing) is treated as a rethrow.0
        this.setState({});0
      }0
    };0
0
    ErrorMessage = class extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        log.push('ErrorMessage constructor');0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        log.push('ErrorMessage componentWillMount');0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        log.push('ErrorMessage componentDidMount');0
      }0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        log.push('ErrorMessage componentWillUnmount');0
      }0
      render() {0
        log.push('ErrorMessage render');0
        return <div>Caught an error: {this.props.message}.</div>;0
      }0
    };0
  });0
0
  it('does not swallow exceptions on mounting without boundaries', () => {0
    let container = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<BrokenRender />, container);0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<BrokenComponentWillMount />, container);0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<BrokenComponentDidMount />, container);0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
  });0
0
  it('does not swallow exceptions on updating without boundaries', () => {0
    let container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<BrokenComponentWillUpdate />, container);0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<BrokenComponentWillUpdate />, container);0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<BrokenComponentWillReceiveProps />, container);0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<BrokenComponentWillReceiveProps />, container);0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<BrokenComponentDidUpdate />, container);0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<BrokenComponentDidUpdate />, container);0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
  });0
0
  it('does not swallow exceptions on unmounting without boundaries', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<BrokenComponentWillUnmount />, container);0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
  });0
0
  it('prevents errors from leaking into other roots', () => {0
    const container1 = document.createElement('div');0
    const container2 = document.createElement('div');0
    const container3 = document.createElement('div');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<span>Before 1</span>, container1);0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<BrokenRender />, container2);0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenRender />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container3,0
    );0
    expect(container1.firstChild.textContent).toBe('Before 1');0
    expect(container2.firstChild).toBe(null);0
    expect(container3.firstChild.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<span>After 1</span>, container1);0
    ReactDOM.render(<span>After 2</span>, container2);0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary forceRetry={true}>After 3</ErrorBoundary>,0
      container3,0
    );0
    expect(container1.firstChild.textContent).toBe('After 1');0
    expect(container2.firstChild.textContent).toBe('After 2');0
    expect(container3.firstChild.textContent).toBe('After 3');0
0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container1);0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container2);0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container3);0
    expect(container1.firstChild).toBe(null);0
    expect(container2.firstChild).toBe(null);0
    expect(container3.firstChild).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('renders an error state if child throws in render', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenRender />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.firstChild.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary constructor',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillMount',0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
      'BrokenRender constructor',0
      'BrokenRender componentWillMount',0
      'BrokenRender render [!]',0
      // Fiber mounts with null children before capturing error0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidMount',0
      // Catch and render an error message0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary render error',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount']);0
  });0
0
  it('renders an error state if child throws in constructor', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenConstructor />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.firstChild.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary constructor',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillMount',0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0

  it('renders an error state if context provider throws in componentWillMount', () => {0
    class BrokenComponentWillMountWithContext extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {foo: PropTypes.number};0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {foo: 42};0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        throw new Error('Hello');0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenComponentWillMountWithContext />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.firstChild.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
  });0
0
  it('renders an error state if module-style context provider throws in componentWillMount', () => {0
    function BrokenComponentWillMountWithContext() {0
      return {0
        getChildContext() {0
          return {foo: 42};0
        },0
        render() {0
          return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
        },0
        UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
          throw new Error('Hello');0
        },0
      };0
    }0
    BrokenComponentWillMountWithContext.childContextTypes = {0
      foo: PropTypes.number,0
    };0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenComponentWillMountWithContext />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.firstChild.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
  });0
0
  it('mounts the error message if mounting fails', () => {0
    function renderError(error) {0
      return <ErrorMessage message={error.message} />;0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary renderError={renderError}>0
        <BrokenRender />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary constructor',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillMount',0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
      'BrokenRender constructor',0
      'BrokenRender componentWillMount',0
      'BrokenRender render [!]',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidMount',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary render error',0
      'ErrorMessage constructor',0
      'ErrorMessage componentWillMount',0
      'ErrorMessage render',0
      'ErrorMessage componentDidMount',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount',0
      'ErrorMessage componentWillUnmount',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('propagates errors on retry on mounting', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <RetryErrorBoundary>0
          <BrokenRender />0
        </RetryErrorBoundary>0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.firstChild.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary constructor',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillMount',0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
      'RetryErrorBoundary constructor',0
      'RetryErrorBoundary componentWillMount',0
      'RetryErrorBoundary render',0
      'BrokenRender constructor',0
      'BrokenRender componentWillMount',0
      'BrokenRender render [!]',0
      // In Fiber, failed error boundaries render null before attempting to recover0
      'RetryErrorBoundary componentDidMount',0
      'RetryErrorBoundary componentDidCatch [!]',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidMount',0
      // Retry0
      'RetryErrorBoundary render',0
      'BrokenRender constructor',0
      'BrokenRender componentWillMount',0
      'BrokenRender render [!]',0
      // This time, the error propagates to the higher boundary0
      'RetryErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      // Render the error0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary render error',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount']);0
  });0
0
  it('propagates errors inside boundary during componentWillMount', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenComponentWillMountErrorBoundary />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.firstChild.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary constructor',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillMount',0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
      'BrokenComponentWillMountErrorBoundary constructor',0
      'BrokenComponentWillMountErrorBoundary componentWillMount [!]',0
      // The error propagates to the higher boundary0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidMount',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary render error',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount']);0
  });0
0
  it('propagates errors inside boundary while rendering error state', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenRenderErrorBoundary>0
          <BrokenRender />0
        </BrokenRenderErrorBoundary>0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.firstChild.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary constructor',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillMount',0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
      'BrokenRenderErrorBoundary constructor',0
      'BrokenRenderErrorBoundary componentWillMount',0
      'BrokenRenderErrorBoundary render success',0
      'BrokenRender constructor',0
      'BrokenRender componentWillMount',0
      'BrokenRender render [!]',0
      // The first error boundary catches the error0
      // It adjusts state but throws displaying the message0
      // Finish mounting with null children0
      'BrokenRenderErrorBoundary componentDidMount',0
      // Attempt to handle the error0
      'BrokenRenderErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidMount',0
      'BrokenRenderErrorBoundary render error [!]',0
      // Boundary fails with new error, propagate to next boundary0
      'BrokenRenderErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount',0
      // Attempt to handle the error again0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary render error',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount']);0
  });0
0
  it('does not call componentWillUnmount when aborting initial mount', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <Normal />0
        <BrokenRender />0
        <Normal />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.firstChild.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary constructor',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillMount',0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
      // Render first child0
      'Normal constructor',0
      'Normal componentWillMount',0
      'Normal render',0
      // Render second child (it throws)0
      'BrokenRender constructor',0
      'BrokenRender componentWillMount',0
      'BrokenRender render [!]',0
      // Render third child, even though an earlier sibling threw.0
      'Normal constructor',0
      'Normal componentWillMount',0
      'Normal render',0
      // Finish mounting with null children0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidMount',0
      // Handle the error0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      // Render the error message0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary render error',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount']);0
  });0
0
  it('resets callback refs if mounting aborts', () => {0
    function childRef(x) {0
      log.push('Child ref is set to ' + x);0
    }0
    function errorMessageRef(x) {0
      log.push('Error message ref is set to ' + x);0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary errorMessageRef={errorMessageRef}>0
        <div ref={childRef} />0
        <BrokenRender />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary constructor',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillMount',0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
      'BrokenRender constructor',0
      'BrokenRender componentWillMount',0
      'BrokenRender render [!]',0
      // Handle error:0
      // Finish mounting with null children0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidMount',0
      // Handle the error0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      // Render the error message0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary render error',0
      'Error message ref is set to [object HTMLDivElement]',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount',0
      'Error message ref is set to null',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('resets object refs if mounting aborts', () => {0
    let childRef = React.createRef();0
    let errorMessageRef = React.createRef();0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary errorMessageRef={errorMessageRef}>0
        <div ref={childRef} />0
        <BrokenRender />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary constructor',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillMount',0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
      'BrokenRender constructor',0
      'BrokenRender componentWillMount',0
      'BrokenRender render [!]',0
      // Handle error:0
      // Finish mounting with null children0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidMount',0
      // Handle the error0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      // Render the error message0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary render error',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
    expect(errorMessageRef.current.toString()).toEqual(0
      '[object HTMLDivElement]',0
    );0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount']);0
    expect(errorMessageRef.current).toEqual(null);0
  });0
0

0
  it('keeps refs up-to-date during updates', () => {0
    function child1Ref(x) {0
      log.push('Child1 ref is set to ' + x);0
    }0
    function child2Ref(x) {0
      log.push('Child2 ref is set to ' + x);0
    }0
    function errorMessageRef(x) {0
      log.push('Error message ref is set to ' + x);0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary errorMessageRef={errorMessageRef}>0
        <div ref={child1Ref} />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary constructor',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillMount',0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
      'Child1 ref is set to [object HTMLDivElement]',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidMount',0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary errorMessageRef={errorMessageRef}>0
        <div ref={child1Ref} />0
        <div ref={child2Ref} />0
        <BrokenRender />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
      // BrokenRender will abort rendering:0
      'BrokenRender constructor',0
      'BrokenRender componentWillMount',0
      'BrokenRender render [!]',0
      // Finish updating with null children0
      'Child1 ref is set to null',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
      // Handle the error0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary render error',0
      'Error message ref is set to [object HTMLDivElement]',0
      // Child2 ref is never set because its mounting aborted0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount',0
      'Error message ref is set to null',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('recovers from componentWillUnmount errors on update', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenComponentWillUnmount />0
        <BrokenComponentWillUnmount />0
        <Normal />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenComponentWillUnmount />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
      // Update existing child:0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount componentWillUpdate',0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount render',0
      // Unmounting throws:0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount componentWillUnmount [!]',0
      // Fiber proceeds with lifecycles despite errors0
      'Normal componentWillUnmount',0
      // The components have updated in this phase0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount componentDidUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
      // Now that commit phase is done, Fiber unmounts the boundary's children0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount componentWillUnmount [!]',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      // The initial render was aborted, so0
      // Fiber retries from the root.0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
      // The second willUnmount error should be captured and logged, too.0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      // Render an error now (stack will do it later)0
      'ErrorBoundary render error',0
      // Attempt to unmount previous child:0
      // Done0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount']);0
  });0
0
  it('recovers from nested componentWillUnmount errors on update', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <Normal>0
          <BrokenComponentWillUnmount />0
        </Normal>0
        <BrokenComponentWillUnmount />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <Normal>0
          <BrokenComponentWillUnmount />0
        </Normal>0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
      // Update existing children:0
      'Normal componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'Normal componentWillUpdate',0
      'Normal render',0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount componentWillUpdate',0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount render',0
      // Unmounting throws:0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount componentWillUnmount [!]',0
      // Fiber proceeds with lifecycles despite errors0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount componentDidUpdate',0
      'Normal componentDidUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
      'Normal componentWillUnmount',0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount componentWillUnmount [!]',0
      // Now that commit phase is done, Fiber handles errors0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      // The initial render was aborted, so0
      // Fiber retries from the root.0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
      // The second willUnmount error should be captured and logged, too.0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      // Render an error now (stack will do it later)0
      'ErrorBoundary render error',0
      // Done0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount']);0
  });0
0
  it('picks the right boundary when handling unmounting errors', () => {0
    function renderInnerError(error) {0
      return <div>Caught an inner error: {error.message}.</div>;0
    }0
    function renderOuterError(error) {0
      return <div>Caught an outer error: {error.message}.</div>;0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary0
        logName="OuterErrorBoundary"0
        renderError={renderOuterError}>0
        <ErrorBoundary0
          logName="InnerErrorBoundary"0
          renderError={renderInnerError}>0
          <BrokenComponentWillUnmount />0
        </ErrorBoundary>0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary0
        logName="OuterErrorBoundary"0
        renderError={renderOuterError}>0
        <ErrorBoundary0
          logName="InnerErrorBoundary"0
          renderError={renderInnerError}0
        />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('Caught an inner error: Hello.');0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      // Update outer boundary0
      'OuterErrorBoundary componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'OuterErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'OuterErrorBoundary render success',0
      // Update inner boundary0
      'InnerErrorBoundary componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'InnerErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'InnerErrorBoundary render success',0
      // Try unmounting child0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount componentWillUnmount [!]',0
      // Fiber proceeds with lifecycles despite errors0
      // Inner and outer boundaries have updated in this phase0
      'InnerErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
      'OuterErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
      // Now that commit phase is done, Fiber handles errors0
      // Only inner boundary receives the error:0
      'InnerErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'InnerErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      // Render an error now0
      'InnerErrorBoundary render error',0
      // In Fiber, this was a local update to the0
      // inner boundary so only its hook fires0
      'InnerErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'OuterErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount',0
      'InnerErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('can recover from error state', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenRender />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <Normal />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    // Error boundary doesn't retry by itself:0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
0
    // Force the success path:0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary forceRetry={true}>0
        <Normal />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.textContent).not.toContain('Caught an error');0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
      // Mount children:0
      'Normal constructor',0
      'Normal componentWillMount',0
      'Normal render',0
      // Finalize updates:0
      'Normal componentDidMount',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount',0
      'Normal componentWillUnmount',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('can update multiple times in error state', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenRender />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenRender />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<div>Other screen</div>, container);0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('Other screen');0
0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
  });0
0
  it("doesn't get into inconsistent state during removals", () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <Normal />0
        <BrokenComponentWillUnmount />0
        <Normal />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<ErrorBoundary />, container);0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount']);0
  });0
0
  it("doesn't get into inconsistent state during additions", () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<ErrorBoundary />, container);0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <Normal />0
        <BrokenRender />0
        <Normal />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount']);0
  });0
0
  it("doesn't get into inconsistent state during reorders", () => {0
    function getAMixOfNormalAndBrokenRenderElements() {0
      const elements = [];0
      for (let i = 0; i < 100; i++) {0
        elements.push(<Normal key={i} />);0
      }0
      elements.push(<MaybeBrokenRender key={100} />);0
0
      let currentIndex = elements.length;0
      while (0 !== currentIndex) {0
        const randomIndex = Math.floor(Math.random() * currentIndex);0
        currentIndex -= 1;0
        const temporaryValue = elements[currentIndex];0
        elements[currentIndex] = elements[randomIndex];0
        elements[randomIndex] = temporaryValue;0
      }0
      return elements;0
    }0
0
    class MaybeBrokenRender extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        if (fail) {0
          throw new Error('Hello');0
        }0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let fail = false;0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>{getAMixOfNormalAndBrokenRenderElements()}</ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.textContent).not.toContain('Caught an error');0
0
    fail = true;0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>{getAMixOfNormalAndBrokenRenderElements()}</ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount']);0
  });0
0
  it('catches errors originating downstream', () => {0
    let fail = false;0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      state = {shouldThrow: false};0
0
      render() {0
        if (fail) {0
          log.push('Stateful render [!]');0
          throw new Error('Hello');0
        }0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let statefulInst;0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <Stateful ref={inst => (statefulInst = inst)} />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    expect(() => {0
      fail = true;0
      statefulInst.forceUpdate();0
    }).not.toThrow();0
0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'Stateful render [!]',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary render error',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount']);0
  });0
0
  it('catches errors in componentDidMount', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenComponentWillUnmount>0
          <Normal />0
        </BrokenComponentWillUnmount>0
        <BrokenComponentDidMount />0
        <Normal logName="LastChild" />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary constructor',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillMount',0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount constructor',0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount componentWillMount',0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount render',0
      'Normal constructor',0
      'Normal componentWillMount',0
      'Normal render',0
      'BrokenComponentDidMount constructor',0
      'BrokenComponentDidMount componentWillMount',0
      'BrokenComponentDidMount render',0
      'LastChild constructor',0
      'LastChild componentWillMount',0
      'LastChild render',0
      // Start flushing didMount queue0
      'Normal componentDidMount',0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount componentDidMount',0
      'BrokenComponentDidMount componentDidMount [!]',0
      // Continue despite the error0
      'LastChild componentDidMount',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidMount',0
      // Now we are ready to handle the error0
      // Safely unmount every child0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount componentWillUnmount [!]',0
      // Continue unmounting safely despite any errors0
      'Normal componentWillUnmount',0
      'BrokenComponentDidMount componentWillUnmount',0
      'LastChild componentWillUnmount',0
      // Handle the error0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      // The willUnmount error should be captured and logged, too.0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary render error',0
      // The update has finished0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount']);0
  });0
0
  it('catches errors in componentDidUpdate', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenComponentDidUpdate />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenComponentDidUpdate />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
      'BrokenComponentDidUpdate componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'BrokenComponentDidUpdate componentWillUpdate',0
      'BrokenComponentDidUpdate render',0
      // All lifecycles run0
      'BrokenComponentDidUpdate componentDidUpdate [!]',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
      'BrokenComponentDidUpdate componentWillUnmount',0
      // Then, error is handled0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary render error',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount']);0
  });0
0
  it('propagates errors inside boundary during componentDidMount', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenComponentDidMountErrorBoundary0
          renderError={error => (0
            <div>We should never catch our own error: {error.message}.</div>0
          )}0
        />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.firstChild.textContent).toBe('Caught an error: Hello.');0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary constructor',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillMount',0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
      'BrokenComponentDidMountErrorBoundary constructor',0
      'BrokenComponentDidMountErrorBoundary componentWillMount',0
      'BrokenComponentDidMountErrorBoundary render success',0
      'BrokenComponentDidMountErrorBoundary componentDidMount [!]',0
      // Fiber proceeds with the hooks0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidMount',0
      'BrokenComponentDidMountErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount',0
      // The error propagates to the higher boundary0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      // Fiber retries from the root0
      'ErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'ErrorBoundary render error',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['ErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount']);0
  });0
0
  it('calls componentDidCatch for each error that is captured', () => {0
    function renderUnmountError(error) {0
      return <div>Caught an unmounting error: {error.message}.</div>;0
    }0
    function renderUpdateError(error) {0
      return <div>Caught an updating error: {error.message}.</div>;0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary logName="OuterErrorBoundary">0
        <ErrorBoundary0
          logName="InnerUnmountBoundary"0
          renderError={renderUnmountError}>0
          <BrokenComponentWillUnmount errorText="E1" />0
          <BrokenComponentWillUnmount errorText="E2" />0
        </ErrorBoundary>0
        <ErrorBoundary0
          logName="InnerUpdateBoundary"0
          renderError={renderUpdateError}>0
          <BrokenComponentDidUpdate errorText="E3" />0
          <BrokenComponentDidUpdate errorText="E4" />0
        </ErrorBoundary>0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary logName="OuterErrorBoundary">0
        <ErrorBoundary0
          logName="InnerUnmountBoundary"0
          renderError={renderUnmountError}0
        />0
        <ErrorBoundary0
          logName="InnerUpdateBoundary"0
          renderError={renderUpdateError}>0
          <BrokenComponentDidUpdate errorText="E3" />0
          <BrokenComponentDidUpdate errorText="E4" />0
        </ErrorBoundary>0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    expect(container.firstChild.textContent).toBe(0
      'Caught an unmounting error: E2.' + 'Caught an updating error: E4.',0
    );0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      // Begin update phase0
      'OuterErrorBoundary componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'OuterErrorBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'OuterErrorBoundary render success',0
      'InnerUnmountBoundary componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'InnerUnmountBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'InnerUnmountBoundary render success',0
      'InnerUpdateBoundary componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'InnerUpdateBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'InnerUpdateBoundary render success',0
      // First come the updates0
      'BrokenComponentDidUpdate componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'BrokenComponentDidUpdate componentWillUpdate',0
      'BrokenComponentDidUpdate render',0
      'BrokenComponentDidUpdate componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'BrokenComponentDidUpdate componentWillUpdate',0
      'BrokenComponentDidUpdate render',0
      // We're in commit phase now, deleting0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount componentWillUnmount [!]',0
      'BrokenComponentWillUnmount componentWillUnmount [!]',0
      // Continue despite errors, handle them after commit is done0
      'InnerUnmountBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
      // We're still in commit phase, now calling update lifecycles0
      'BrokenComponentDidUpdate componentDidUpdate [!]',0
      // Again, continue despite errors, we'll handle them later0
      'BrokenComponentDidUpdate componentDidUpdate [!]',0
      'InnerUpdateBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
      'OuterErrorBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
      // After the commit phase, attempt to recover from any errors that0
      // were captured0
      'BrokenComponentDidUpdate componentWillUnmount',0
      'BrokenComponentDidUpdate componentWillUnmount',0
      'InnerUnmountBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'InnerUnmountBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'InnerUpdateBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'InnerUpdateBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'InnerUnmountBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'InnerUnmountBoundary render error',0
      'InnerUpdateBoundary componentWillUpdate',0
      'InnerUpdateBoundary render error',0
      'InnerUnmountBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
      'InnerUpdateBoundary componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'OuterErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount',0
      'InnerUnmountBoundary componentWillUnmount',0
      'InnerUpdateBoundary componentWillUnmount',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('discards a bad root if the root component fails', () => {0
    const X = null;0
    const Y = undefined;0
    let err1;0
    let err2;0
0
    try {0
      let container = document.createElement('div');0
      expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<X />, container)).toWarnDev(0
        'React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string ' +0
          '(for built-in components) or a class/function ' +0
          '(for composite components) but got: null.',0
      );0
    } catch (err) {0
      err1 = err;0
    }0
    try {0
      let container = document.createElement('div');0
      expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Y />, container)).toWarnDev(0
        'React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string ' +0
          '(for built-in components) or a class/function ' +0
          '(for composite components) but got: undefined.',0
      );0
    } catch (err) {0
      err2 = err;0
    }0
0
    expect(err1.message).toMatch(/got: null/);0
    expect(err2.message).toMatch(/got: undefined/);0
  });0
0
  it('renders empty output if error boundary does not handle the error', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        Sibling0
        <NoopErrorBoundary>0
          <BrokenRender />0
        </NoopErrorBoundary>0
      </div>,0
      container,0
    );0
    expect(container.firstChild.textContent).toBe('Sibling');0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'NoopErrorBoundary constructor',0
      'NoopErrorBoundary componentWillMount',0
      'NoopErrorBoundary render',0
      'BrokenRender constructor',0
      'BrokenRender componentWillMount',0
      'BrokenRender render [!]',0
      // In Fiber, noop error boundaries render null0
      'NoopErrorBoundary componentDidMount',0
      'NoopErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      // Nothing happens.0
    ]);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['NoopErrorBoundary componentWillUnmount']);0
  });0
0
  it('passes first error when two errors happen in commit', () => {0
    const errors = [];0
    let caughtError;0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <Child />;0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        errors.push('parent sad');0
        throw new Error('parent sad');0
      }0
    }0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        errors.push('child sad');0
        throw new Error('child sad');0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    try {0
      // Here, we test the behavior where there is no error boundary and we0
      // delegate to the host root.0
      ReactDOM.render(<Parent />, container);0
    } catch (e) {0
      if (e.message !== 'parent sad' && e.message !== 'child sad') {0
        throw e;0
      }0
      caughtError = e;0
    }0
0
    expect(errors).toEqual(['child sad', 'parent sad']);0
    // Error should be the first thrown0
    expect(caughtError.message).toBe('child sad');0
  });0
0
  it('propagates uncaught error inside unbatched initial mount', () => {0
    function Foo() {0
      throw new Error('foo error');0
    }0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(() => {0
        ReactDOM.render(<Foo />, container);0
      });0
    }).toThrow('foo error');0
  });0
0
  it('handles errors that occur in before-mutation commit hook', () => {0
    const errors = [];0
    let caughtError;0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() {0
        errors.push('parent sad');0
        throw new Error('parent sad');0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {}0
      render() {0
        return <Child {...this.props} />;0
      }0
    }0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() {0
        errors.push('child sad');0
        throw new Error('child sad');0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {}0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent value={1} />, container);0
    try {0
      ReactDOM.render(<Parent value={2} />, container);0
    } catch (e) {0
      if (e.message !== 'parent sad' && e.message !== 'child sad') {0
        throw e;0
      }0
      caughtError = e;0
    }0
0
    expect(errors).toEqual(['child sad', 'parent sad']);0
    // Error should be the first thrown0
    expect(caughtError.message).toBe('child sad');0
  });0
});0

 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
0
describe('ReactEventIndependence', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
  });0
0
  it('does not crash with other react inside', () => {0
    let clicks = 0;0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
    try {0
      const div = ReactDOM.render(0
        <div0
          onClick={() => clicks++}0
          dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{0
            __html: '<button data-reactid=".z">click me</div>',0
          }}0
        />,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      div.firstChild.click();0
      expect(clicks).toBe(1);0
    } finally {0
      document.body.removeChild(container);0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('does not crash with other react outside', () => {0
    let clicks = 0;0
    const outer = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(outer);0
    try {0
      outer.setAttribute('data-reactid', '.z');0
      const inner = ReactDOM.render(0
        <button onClick={() => clicks++}>click me</button>,0
        outer,0
      );0
      inner.click();0
      expect(clicks).toBe(1);0
    } finally {0
      document.body.removeChild(outer);0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('does not when event fired on unmounted tree', () => {0
    let clicks = 0;0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
    try {0
      const button = ReactDOM.render(0
        <button onClick={() => clicks++}>click me</button>,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      // Now we unmount the component, as if caused by a non-React event handler0
      // for the same click we're about to simulate, like closing a layer:0
      ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
      button.click();0
0
      // Since the tree is unmounted, we don't dispatch the click event.0
      expect(clicks).toBe(0);0
    } finally {0
      document.body.removeChild(container);0
    }0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
0
describe('ReactIdentity', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
  });0
0
  it('should allow key property to express identity', () => {0
    let node;0
    const Component = props => (0
      <div ref={c => (node = c)}>0
        <div key={props.swap ? 'banana' : 'apple'} />0
        <div key={props.swap ? 'apple' : 'banana'} />0
      </div>0
    );0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component />, container);0
    const origChildren = Array.from(node.childNodes);0
    ReactDOM.render(<Component swap={true} />, container);0
    const newChildren = Array.from(node.childNodes);0
    expect(origChildren[0]).toBe(newChildren[1]);0
    expect(origChildren[1]).toBe(newChildren[0]);0
  });0
0
  it('should use composite identity', () => {0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <a>{this.props.children}</a>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    let node1;0
    let node2;0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <Wrapper key="wrap1">0
        <span ref={c => (node1 = c)} />0
      </Wrapper>,0
      container,0
    );0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <Wrapper key="wrap2">0
        <span ref={c => (node2 = c)} />0
      </Wrapper>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    expect(node1).not.toBe(node2);0
  });0
0
  function renderAComponentWithKeyIntoContainer(key, container) {0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <span ref="span" key={key} />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(<Wrapper />, container);0
    const span = instance.refs.span;0
    expect(span).not.toBe(null);0
  }0
0
  it('should allow any character as a key, in a detached parent', () => {0
    const detachedContainer = document.createElement('div');0
    renderAComponentWithKeyIntoContainer("<'WEIRD/&\\key'>", detachedContainer);0
  });0
0
  it('should allow any character as a key, in an attached parent', () => {0
    // This test exists to protect against implementation details that0
    // incorrectly query escaped IDs using DOM tools like getElementById.0
    const attachedContainer = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(attachedContainer);0
0
    renderAComponentWithKeyIntoContainer("<'WEIRD/&\\key'>", attachedContainer);0
0
    document.body.removeChild(attachedContainer);0
  });0
0
  it('should not allow scripts in keys to execute', () => {0
    const h4x0rKey =0
      '"><script>window[\'YOUVEBEENH4X0RED\']=true;</script><div id="';0
0
    const attachedContainer = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(attachedContainer);0
0
    renderAComponentWithKeyIntoContainer(h4x0rKey, attachedContainer);0
0
    document.body.removeChild(attachedContainer);0
0
    // If we get this far, make sure we haven't executed the code0
    expect(window.YOUVEBEENH4X0RED).toBe(undefined);0
  });0
0
  it('should let restructured components retain their uniqueness', () => {0
    const instance0 = <span />;0
    const instance1 = <span />;0
    const instance2 = <span />;0
0
    class TestComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            {instance2}0
            {this.props.children[0]}0
            {this.props.children[1]}0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class TestContainer extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <TestComponent>0
            {instance0}0
            {instance1}0
          </TestComponent>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(function() {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<TestContainer />);0
    }).not.toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should let nested restructures retain their uniqueness', () => {0
    const instance0 = <span />;0
    const instance1 = <span />;0
    const instance2 = <span />;0
0
    class TestComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            {instance2}0
            {this.props.children[0]}0
            {this.props.children[1]}0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class TestContainer extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <TestComponent>0
              {instance0}0
              {instance1}0
            </TestComponent>0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(function() {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<TestContainer />);0
    }).not.toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should let text nodes retain their uniqueness', () => {0
    class TestComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            {this.props.children}0
            <span />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class TestContainer extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <TestComponent>0
            <div />0
            {'second'}0
          </TestComponent>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(function() {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<TestContainer />);0
    }).not.toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should retain key during updates in composite components', () => {0
    class TestComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class TestContainer extends React.Component {0
      state = {swapped: false};0
0
      swap = () => {0
        this.setState({swapped: true});0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <TestComponent>0
            {this.state.swapped ? this.props.second : this.props.first}0
            {this.state.swapped ? this.props.first : this.props.second}0
          </TestComponent>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const instance0 = <span key="A" />;0
    const instance1 = <span key="B" />;0
0
    let wrapped = <TestContainer first={instance0} second={instance1} />;0
0
    wrapped = ReactDOM.render(wrapped, document.createElement('div'));0
    const div = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(wrapped);0
0
    const beforeA = div.childNodes[0];0
    const beforeB = div.childNodes[1];0
    wrapped.swap();0
    const afterA = div.childNodes[1];0
    const afterB = div.childNodes[0];0
0
    expect(beforeA).toBe(afterA);0
    expect(beforeB).toBe(afterB);0
  });0
0
  it('should not allow implicit and explicit keys to collide', () => {0
    const component = (0
      <div>0
        <span />0
        <span key="0" />0
      </div>0
    );0
0
    expect(function() {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(component);0
    }).not.toThrow();0
  });0
});0
/**0
