'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
let PropTypes;0
0
function normalizeCodeLocInfo(str) {0
  return str && str.replace(/\(at .+?:\d+\)/g, '(at **)');0
}0
0
describe('ReactDOMServer', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
    ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
  });0
0
  describe('renderToString', () => {0
    it('should generate simple markup', () => {0
      const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<span>hello world</span>);0
      expect(response).toMatch(0
        new RegExp('<span data-reactroot=""' + '>hello world</span>'),0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should generate simple markup for self-closing tags', () => {0
      const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<img />);0
      expect(response).toMatch(new RegExp('<img data-reactroot=""' + '/>'));0
    });0
0
    it('should generate comment markup for component returns null', () => {0
      class NullComponent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<NullComponent />);0
      expect(response).toBe('');0
    });0
0
    // TODO: Test that listeners are not registered onto any document/container.0
0
    it('should render composite components', () => {0
      class Parent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <div>0
              <Child name="child" />0
            </div>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      class Child extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <span>My name is {this.props.name}</span>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Parent />);0
      expect(response).toMatch(0
        new RegExp(0
          '<div ' +0
            'data-reactroot' +0
            '=""' +0
            '>' +0
            '<span' +0
            '>' +0
            'My name is <!-- -->child' +0
            '</span>' +0
            '</div>',0
        ),0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should only execute certain lifecycle methods', () => {0
      function runTest() {0
        const lifecycle = [];0
0
        class TestComponent extends React.Component {0
          constructor(props) {0
            super(props);0
            lifecycle.push('getInitialState');0
            this.state = {name: 'TestComponent'};0
          }0
0
          UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
            lifecycle.push('componentWillMount');0
          }0
0
          componentDidMount() {0
            lifecycle.push('componentDidMount');0
          }0
0
          render() {0
            lifecycle.push('render');0
            return <span>Component name: {this.state.name}</span>;0
          }0
0
          UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {0
            lifecycle.push('componentWillUpdate');0
          }0
0
          componentDidUpdate() {0
            lifecycle.push('componentDidUpdate');0
          }0
0
          shouldComponentUpdate() {0
            lifecycle.push('shouldComponentUpdate');0
          }0
0
          UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {0
            lifecycle.push('componentWillReceiveProps');0
          }0
0
          componentWillUnmount() {0
            lifecycle.push('componentWillUnmount');0
          }0
        }0
0
        const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<TestComponent />);0
0
        expect(response).toMatch(0
          new RegExp(0
            '<span ' +0
              'data-reactroot' +0
              '=""' +0
              '>' +0
              'Component name: <!-- -->TestComponent' +0
              '</span>',0
          ),0
        );0
        expect(lifecycle).toEqual([0
          'getInitialState',0
          'componentWillMount',0
          'render',0
        ]);0
      }0
0
      runTest();0
    });0
0
    it('should throw with silly args', () => {0
      expect(0
        ReactDOMServer.renderToString.bind(ReactDOMServer, {x: 123}),0
      ).toThrowError(0
        'Objects are not valid as a React child (found: object with keys {x})',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should throw prop mapping error for an <iframe /> with invalid props', () => {0
      let caughtErr;0
      try {0
        ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<iframe style="border:none;" />);0
      } catch (err) {0
        caughtErr = err;0
      }0
      expect(caughtErr).not.toBe(undefined);0
      expect(normalizeCodeLocInfo(caughtErr.message)).toContain(0
        'The `style` prop expects a mapping from style properties to values, not ' +0
          "a string. For example, style={{marginRight: spacing + 'em'}} when using JSX." +0
          (__DEV__ ? '\n    in iframe (at **)' : ''),0
      );0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('renderToStaticMarkup', () => {0
    it('should not put checksum and React ID on components', () => {0
      class NestedComponent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <div>inner text</div>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      class TestComponent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <span>0
              <NestedComponent />0
            </span>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToStaticMarkup(<TestComponent />);0
0
      expect(response).toBe('<span><div>inner text</div></span>');0
    });0
0
    it('should not put checksum and React ID on text components', () => {0
      class TestComponent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <span>0
              {'hello'} {'world'}0
            </span>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToStaticMarkup(<TestComponent />);0
0
      expect(response).toBe('<span>hello world</span>');0
    });0
0
    it('should not use comments for empty nodes', () => {0
      class TestComponent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToStaticMarkup(<TestComponent />);0
0
      expect(response).toBe('');0
    });0
0
    it('should only execute certain lifecycle methods', () => {0
      function runTest() {0
        const lifecycle = [];0
0
        class TestComponent extends React.Component {0
          constructor(props) {0
            super(props);0
            lifecycle.push('getInitialState');0
            this.state = {name: 'TestComponent'};0
          }0
0
          UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
            lifecycle.push('componentWillMount');0
          }0
0
          componentDidMount() {0
            lifecycle.push('componentDidMount');0
          }0
0
          render() {0
            lifecycle.push('render');0
            return <span>Component name: {this.state.name}</span>;0
          }0
0
          UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {0
            lifecycle.push('componentWillUpdate');0
          }0
0
          componentDidUpdate() {0
            lifecycle.push('componentDidUpdate');0
          }0
0
          shouldComponentUpdate() {0
            lifecycle.push('shouldComponentUpdate');0
          }0
0
          UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {0
            lifecycle.push('componentWillReceiveProps');0
          }0
0
          componentWillUnmount() {0
            lifecycle.push('componentWillUnmount');0
          }0
        }0
0
        const response = ReactDOMServer.renderToStaticMarkup(<TestComponent />);0
0
        expect(response).toBe('<span>Component name: TestComponent</span>');0
        expect(lifecycle).toEqual([0
          'getInitialState',0
          'componentWillMount',0
          'render',0
        ]);0
      }0
0
      runTest();0
    });0
0
    it('should throw with silly args', () => {0
      expect(0
        ReactDOMServer.renderToStaticMarkup.bind(ReactDOMServer, {x: 123}),0
      ).toThrowError(0
        'Objects are not valid as a React child (found: object with keys {x})',0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('allows setState in componentWillMount without using DOM', () => {0
      class Component extends React.Component {0
        UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
          this.setState({text: 'hello, world'});0
        }0
0
        render() {0
          return <div>{this.state.text}</div>;0
        }0
      }0
      const markup = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Component />);0
      expect(markup).toContain('hello, world');0
    });0
0
    it('allows setState in componentWillMount with custom constructor', () => {0
      class Component extends React.Component {0
        constructor() {0
          super();0
          this.state = {text: 'default state'};0
        }0
0
        UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
          this.setState({text: 'hello, world'});0
        }0
0
        render() {0
          return <div>{this.state.text}</div>;0
        }0
      }0
      const markup = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Component />);0
      expect(markup).toContain('hello, world');0
    });0
0
    it('renders with props when using custom constructor', () => {0
      class Component extends React.Component {0
        constructor() {0
          super();0
        }0
0
        render() {0
          return <div>{this.props.text}</div>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const markup = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
        <Component text="hello, world" />,0
      );0
      expect(markup).toContain('hello, world');0
    });0
0
    it('renders with context when using custom constructor', () => {0
      class Component extends React.Component {0
        constructor() {0
          super();0
        }0
0
        render() {0
          return <div>{this.context.text}</div>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      Component.contextTypes = {0
        text: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      class ContextProvider extends React.Component {0
        getChildContext() {0
          return {0
            text: 'hello, world',0
          };0
        }0
0
        render() {0
          return this.props.children;0
        }0
      }0
0
      ContextProvider.childContextTypes = {0
        text: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
0
      const markup = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
        <ContextProvider>0
          <Component />0
        </ContextProvider>,0
      );0
      expect(markup).toContain('hello, world');0
    });0
0
    it('renders with new context API', () => {0
      const Context = React.createContext(0);0
0
      function Consumer(props) {0
        return (0
          <Context.Consumer>{value => 'Result: ' + value}</Context.Consumer>0
        );0
      }0
0
      const Indirection = React.Fragment;0
0
      function App(props) {0
        return (0
          <Context.Provider value={props.value}>0
            <Context.Provider value={2}>0
              <Consumer />0
            </Context.Provider>0
            <Indirection>0
              <Indirection>0
                <Consumer />0
                <Context.Provider value={3}>0
                  <Consumer />0
                </Context.Provider>0
              </Indirection>0
            </Indirection>0
            <Consumer />0
          </Context.Provider>0
        );0
      }0
0
      const markup = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<App value={1} />);0
      // Extract the numbers rendered by the consumers0
      const results = markup.match(/\d+/g).map(Number);0
      expect(results).toEqual([2, 1, 3, 1]);0
    });0
0
    it('renders context API, reentrancy', () => {0
      const Context = React.createContext(0);0
0
      function Consumer(props) {0
        return (0
          <Context.Consumer>{value => 'Result: ' + value}</Context.Consumer>0
        );0
      }0
0
      let reentrantMarkup;0
      function Reentrant() {0
        reentrantMarkup = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
          <App value={1} reentrant={false} />,0
        );0
        return null;0
      }0
0
      const Indirection = React.Fragment;0
0
      function App(props) {0
        return (0
          <Context.Provider value={props.value}>0
            {props.reentrant && <Reentrant />}0
            <Context.Provider value={2}>0
              <Consumer />0
            </Context.Provider>0
            <Indirection>0
              <Indirection>0
                <Consumer />0
                <Context.Provider value={3}>0
                  <Consumer />0
                </Context.Provider>0
              </Indirection>0
            </Indirection>0
            <Consumer />0
          </Context.Provider>0
        );0
      }0
0
      const markup = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
        <App value={1} reentrant={true} />,0
      );0
      // Extract the numbers rendered by the consumers0
      const results = markup.match(/\d+/g).map(Number);0
      const reentrantResults = reentrantMarkup.match(/\d+/g).map(Number);0
      expect(results).toEqual([2, 1, 3, 1]);0
      expect(reentrantResults).toEqual([2, 1, 3, 1]);0
    });0
0
    it('renders components with different batching strategies', () => {0
      class StaticComponent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          const staticContent = ReactDOMServer.renderToStaticMarkup(0
            <div>0
              <img src="foo-bar.jpg" />0
            </div>,0
          );0
          return <div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: staticContent}} />;0
        }0
      }0
0
      class Component extends React.Component {0
        UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
          this.setState({text: 'hello, world'});0
        }0
0
        render() {0
          return <div>{this.state.text}</div>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      expect(0
        ReactDOMServer.renderToString.bind(0
          ReactDOMServer,0
          <div>0
            <StaticComponent />0
            <Component />0
          </div>,0
        ),0
      ).not.toThrow();0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('warns with a no-op when an async setState is triggered', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        this.setState({text: 'hello'});0
        setTimeout(() => {0
          this.setState({text: 'error'});0
        });0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div onClick={() => {}}>{this.state.text}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Foo />);0
    expect(() => jest.runOnlyPendingTimers()).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: setState(...): Can only update a mounting component.' +0
        ' This usually means you called setState() outside componentWillMount() on the server.' +0
        ' This is a no-op.\n\nPlease check the code for the Foo component.',0
    );0
0
    const markup = ReactDOMServer.renderToStaticMarkup(<Foo />);0
    expect(markup).toBe('<div>hello</div>');0
    // No additional warnings are expected0
    jest.runOnlyPendingTimers();0
  });0
0
  it('warns with a no-op when an async forceUpdate is triggered', () => {0
    class Baz extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        this.forceUpdate();0
        setTimeout(() => {0
          this.forceUpdate();0
        });0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div onClick={() => {}} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Baz />);0
    expect(() => jest.runOnlyPendingTimers()).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: forceUpdate(...): Can only update a mounting component. ' +0
        'This usually means you called forceUpdate() outside componentWillMount() on the server. ' +0
        'This is a no-op.\n\nPlease check the code for the Baz component.',0
    );0
    const markup = ReactDOMServer.renderToStaticMarkup(<Baz />);0
    expect(markup).toBe('<div></div>');0
  });0
0
  it('should throw (in dev) when children are mutated during render', () => {0
    function Wrapper(props) {0
      props.children[1] = <p key={1} />; // Mutation is illegal0
      return <div>{props.children}</div>;0
    }0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(() => {0
        ReactDOMServer.renderToStaticMarkup(0
          <Wrapper>0
            <span key={0} />0
            <span key={1} />0
            <span key={2} />0
          </Wrapper>,0
        );0
      }).toThrowError(/Cannot assign to read only property.*/);0
    } else {0
      expect(0
        ReactDOMServer.renderToStaticMarkup(0
          <Wrapper>0
            <span key={0} />0
            <span key={1} />0
            <span key={2} />0
          </Wrapper>,0
        ),0
      ).toContain('<p>');0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('warns about lowercase html but not in svg tags', () => {0
    function CompositeG(props) {0
      // Make sure namespace passes through composites0
      return <g>{props.children}</g>;0
    }0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactDOMServer.renderToStaticMarkup(0
        <div>0
          <inPUT />0
          <svg>0
            <CompositeG>0
              <linearGradient />0
              <foreignObject>0
                {/* back to HTML */}0
                <iFrame />0
              </foreignObject>0
            </CompositeG>0
          </svg>0
        </div>,0
      ),0
    ).toWarnDev([0
      'Warning: <inPUT /> is using incorrect casing. ' +0
        'Use PascalCase for React components, ' +0
        'or lowercase for HTML elements.',0
      // linearGradient doesn't warn0
      'Warning: <iFrame /> is using incorrect casing. ' +0
        'Use PascalCase for React components, ' +0
        'or lowercase for HTML elements.',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn about contentEditable and children', () => {0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<div contentEditable={true} children="" />),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: A component is `contentEditable` and contains `children` ' +0
        'managed by React. It is now your responsibility to guarantee that ' +0
        'none of those nodes are unexpectedly modified or duplicated. This ' +0
        'is probably not intentional.\n    in div (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when server rendering a class with a render method that does not extend React.Component', () => {0
    class ClassWithRenderNotExtended {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() =>0
        ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<ClassWithRenderNotExtended />),0
      ).toWarnDev(0
        'Warning: The <ClassWithRenderNotExtended /> component appears to have a render method, ' +0
          "but doesn't extend React.Component. This is likely to cause errors. " +0
          'Change ClassWithRenderNotExtended to extend React.Component instead.',0
      );0
    }).toThrow(TypeError);0
0
    // Test deduplication0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<ClassWithRenderNotExtended />);0
    }).toThrow(TypeError);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
let ReactDOMServerBrowser;0
0
describe('ReactServerRenderingBrowser', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
    // For extra isolation between what would be two bundles on npm0
    jest.resetModuleRegistry();0
    ReactDOMServerBrowser = require('react-dom/server.browser');0
  });0
0
  it('provides the same top-level API as react-dom/server', () => {0
    expect(Object.keys(ReactDOMServerBrowser)).toEqual(0
      Object.keys(ReactDOMServer),0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('returns the same results as react-dom/server', () => {0
    class Nice extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <h2>I am feeling very good today, thanks, how are you?</h2>;0
      }0
    }0
    function Greeting() {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <h1>How are you?</h1>0
          <Nice />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
    expect(ReactDOMServerBrowser.renderToString(<Greeting />)).toEqual(0
      ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Greeting />),0
    );0
    expect(ReactDOMServerBrowser.renderToStaticMarkup(<Greeting />)).toEqual(0
      ReactDOMServer.renderToStaticMarkup(<Greeting />),0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('throws meaningfully for server-only APIs', () => {0
    expect(() => ReactDOMServerBrowser.renderToNodeStream(<div />)).toThrow(0
      'ReactDOMServer.renderToNodeStream(): The streaming API is not available ' +0
        'in the browser. Use ReactDOMServer.renderToString() instead.',0
    );0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactDOMServerBrowser.renderToStaticNodeStream(<div />),0
    ).toThrow(0
      'ReactDOMServer.renderToStaticNodeStream(): The streaming API is not available ' +0
        'in the browser. Use ReactDOMServer.renderToStaticMarkup() instead.',0
    );0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
0
// These tests rely both on ReactDOMServer and ReactDOM.0
// If a test only needs ReactDOMServer, put it in ReactServerRendering-test instead.0
describe('ReactDOMServerHydration', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
  });0
0
  it('should have the correct mounting behavior (old hydrate API)', () => {0
    let mountCount = 0;0
    let numClicks = 0;0
0
    class TestComponent extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        mountCount++;0
      }0
0
      click = () => {0
        numClicks++;0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <span ref="span" onClick={this.click}>0
            Name: {this.props.name}0
          </span>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const element = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(element);0
    try {0
      ReactDOM.render(<TestComponent />, element);0
0
      let lastMarkup = element.innerHTML;0
0
      // Exercise the update path. Markup should not change,0
      // but some lifecycle methods should be run again.0
      ReactDOM.render(<TestComponent name="x" />, element);0
      expect(mountCount).toEqual(1);0
0
      // Unmount and remount. We should get another mount event and0
      // we should get different markup, as the IDs are unique each time.0
      ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(element);0
      expect(element.innerHTML).toEqual('');0
      ReactDOM.render(<TestComponent name="x" />, element);0
      expect(mountCount).toEqual(2);0
      expect(element.innerHTML).not.toEqual(lastMarkup);0
0
      // Now kill the node and render it on top of server-rendered markup, as if0
      // we used server rendering. We should mount again, but the markup should0
      // be unchanged. We will append a sentinel at the end of innerHTML to be0
      // sure that innerHTML was not changed.0
      ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(element);0
      expect(element.innerHTML).toEqual('');0
0
      lastMarkup = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<TestComponent name="x" />);0
      element.innerHTML = lastMarkup;0
0
      let instance;0
0
      expect(() => {0
        instance = ReactDOM.render(<TestComponent name="x" />, element);0
      }).toLowPriorityWarnDev(0
        'render(): Calling ReactDOM.render() to hydrate server-rendered markup ' +0
          'will stop working in React v17. Replace the ReactDOM.render() call ' +0
          'with ReactDOM.hydrate() if you want React to attach to the server HTML.',0
      );0
      expect(mountCount).toEqual(3);0
      expect(element.innerHTML).toBe(lastMarkup);0
0
      // Ensure the events system works after mount into server markup0
      expect(numClicks).toEqual(0);0
0
      instance.refs.span.click();0
      expect(numClicks).toEqual(1);0
0
      ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(element);0
      expect(element.innerHTML).toEqual('');0
0
      // Now simulate a situation where the app is not idempotent. React should0
      // warn but do the right thing.0
      element.innerHTML = lastMarkup;0
      expect(() => {0
        instance = ReactDOM.render(<TestComponent name="y" />, element);0
      }).toWarnDev('Text content did not match. Server: "x" Client: "y"');0
      expect(mountCount).toEqual(4);0
      expect(element.innerHTML.length > 0).toBe(true);0
      expect(element.innerHTML).not.toEqual(lastMarkup);0
0
      // Ensure the events system works after markup mismatch.0
      expect(numClicks).toEqual(1);0
      instance.refs.span.click();0
      expect(numClicks).toEqual(2);0
    } finally {0
      document.body.removeChild(element);0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('should have the correct mounting behavior (new hydrate API)', () => {0
    let mountCount = 0;0
    let numClicks = 0;0
0
    class TestComponent extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        mountCount++;0
      }0
0
      click = () => {0
        numClicks++;0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <span ref="span" onClick={this.click}>0
            Name: {this.props.name}0
          </span>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const element = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(element);0
    try {0
      ReactDOM.render(<TestComponent />, element);0
0
      let lastMarkup = element.innerHTML;0
0
      // Exercise the update path. Markup should not change,0
      // but some lifecycle methods should be run again.0
      ReactDOM.render(<TestComponent name="x" />, element);0
      expect(mountCount).toEqual(1);0
0
      // Unmount and remount. We should get another mount event and0
      // we should get different markup, as the IDs are unique each time.0
      ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(element);0
      expect(element.innerHTML).toEqual('');0
      ReactDOM.render(<TestComponent name="x" />, element);0
      expect(mountCount).toEqual(2);0
      expect(element.innerHTML).not.toEqual(lastMarkup);0
0
      // Now kill the node and render it on top of server-rendered markup, as if0
      // we used server rendering. We should mount again, but the markup should0
      // be unchanged. We will append a sentinel at the end of innerHTML to be0
      // sure that innerHTML was not changed.0
      ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(element);0
      expect(element.innerHTML).toEqual('');0
0
      lastMarkup = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<TestComponent name="x" />);0
      element.innerHTML = lastMarkup;0
0
      let instance = ReactDOM.hydrate(<TestComponent name="x" />, element);0
      expect(mountCount).toEqual(3);0
      expect(element.innerHTML).toBe(lastMarkup);0
0
      // Ensure the events system works after mount into server markup0
      expect(numClicks).toEqual(0);0
      instance.refs.span.click();0
      expect(numClicks).toEqual(1);0
0
      ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(element);0
      expect(element.innerHTML).toEqual('');0
0
      // Now simulate a situation where the app is not idempotent. React should0
      // warn but do the right thing.0
      element.innerHTML = lastMarkup;0
      expect(() => {0
        instance = ReactDOM.hydrate(<TestComponent name="y" />, element);0
      }).toWarnDev('Text content did not match. Server: "x" Client: "y"');0
      expect(mountCount).toEqual(4);0
      expect(element.innerHTML.length > 0).toBe(true);0
      expect(element.innerHTML).not.toEqual(lastMarkup);0
0
      // Ensure the events system works after markup mismatch.0
      expect(numClicks).toEqual(1);0
      instance.refs.span.click();0
      expect(numClicks).toEqual(2);0
    } finally {0
      document.body.removeChild(element);0
    }0
  });0
0
  // We have a polyfill for autoFocus on the client, but we intentionally don't0
  // want it to call focus() when hydrating because this can mess up existing0
  // focus before the JS has loaded.0
  it('should emit autofocus on the server but not focus() when hydrating', () => {0
    const element = document.createElement('div');0
    element.innerHTML = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
      <input autoFocus={true} />,0
    );0
    expect(element.firstChild.autofocus).toBe(true);0
0
    // It should not be called on mount.0
    element.firstChild.focus = jest.fn();0
    ReactDOM.hydrate(<input autoFocus={true} />, element);0
    expect(element.firstChild.focus).not.toHaveBeenCalled();0
0
    // Or during an update.0
    ReactDOM.render(<input autoFocus={true} />, element);0
    expect(element.firstChild.focus).not.toHaveBeenCalled();0
  });0
0
  it('should not focus on either server or client with autofocus={false}', () => {0
    const element = document.createElement('div');0
    element.innerHTML = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
      <input autoFocus={false} />,0
    );0
    expect(element.firstChild.autofocus).toBe(false);0
0
    element.firstChild.focus = jest.fn();0
    ReactDOM.hydrate(<input autoFocus={false} />, element);0
    expect(element.firstChild.focus).not.toHaveBeenCalled();0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<input autoFocus={false} />, element);0
    expect(element.firstChild.focus).not.toHaveBeenCalled();0
  });0
0
  // Regression test for https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/117260
  it('should not focus on either server or client with autofocus={false} even if there is a markup mismatch', () => {0
    const element = document.createElement('div');0
    element.innerHTML = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
      <button autoFocus={false}>server</button>,0
    );0
    expect(element.firstChild.autofocus).toBe(false);0
0
    element.firstChild.focus = jest.fn();0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactDOM.hydrate(<button autoFocus={false}>client</button>, element),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Text content did not match. Server: "server" Client: "client"',0
    );0
0
    expect(element.firstChild.focus).not.toHaveBeenCalled();0
  });0
0
  it('should throw rendering portals on the server', () => {0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOMServer.renderToString(0
        <div>{ReactDOM.createPortal(<div />, div)}</div>,0
      );0
    }).toThrow(0
      'Portals are not currently supported by the server renderer. ' +0
        'Render them conditionally so that they only appear on the client render.',0
    );0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let PropTypes;0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
0
function StatelessComponent(props) {0
  return <div>{props.name}</div>;0
}0
0
describe('ReactStatelessComponent', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModuleRegistry();0
    PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
  });0
0
  it('should render stateless component', () => {0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<StatelessComponent name="A" />, el);0
0
    expect(el.textContent).toBe('A');0
  });0
0
  it('should update stateless component', () => {0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <StatelessComponent {...this.props} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent name="A" />, el);0
    expect(el.textContent).toBe('A');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent name="B" />, el);0
    expect(el.textContent).toBe('B');0
  });0
0
  it('should unmount stateless component', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<StatelessComponent name="A" />, container);0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('A');0
0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('');0
  });0
0
  it('should pass context thru stateless component', () => {0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        test: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.context.test}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Parent() {0
      return <Child />;0
    }0
0
    class GrandParent extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        test: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {test: this.props.test};0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <Parent />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<GrandParent test="test" />, el);0
0
    expect(el.textContent).toBe('test');0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<GrandParent test="mest" />, el);0
0
    expect(el.textContent).toBe('mest');0
  });0
0
  it('should warn for getDerivedStateFromProps on a functional component', () => {0
    function StatelessComponentWithChildContext() {0
      return null;0
    }0
    StatelessComponentWithChildContext.getDerivedStateFromProps = function() {};0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactDOM.render(<StatelessComponentWithChildContext />, container),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'StatelessComponentWithChildContext: Stateless ' +0
        'functional components do not support getDerivedStateFromProps.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn for childContextTypes on a functional component', () => {0
    function StatelessComponentWithChildContext(props) {0
      return <div>{props.name}</div>;0
    }0
0
    StatelessComponentWithChildContext.childContextTypes = {0
      foo: PropTypes.string,0
    };0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <StatelessComponentWithChildContext name="A" />,0
        container,0
      ),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'StatelessComponentWithChildContext(...): childContextTypes cannot ' +0
        'be defined on a functional component.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should throw when stateless component returns undefined', () => {0
    function NotAComponent() {}0
    expect(function() {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <div>0
          <NotAComponent />0
        </div>,0
      );0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'NotAComponent(...): Nothing was returned from render. ' +0
        'This usually means a return statement is missing. Or, to render nothing, return null.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should throw on string refs in pure functions', () => {0
    function Child() {0
      return <div ref="me" />;0
    }0
0
    expect(function() {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Child test="test" />);0
    }).toThrowError(0
      __DEV__0
        ? 'Stateless function components cannot have refs.'0
        : // It happens because we don't save _owner in production for0
          // functional components.0
          'Element ref was specified as a string (me) but no owner was set. This could happen for one of' +0
          ' the following reasons:\n' +0
          '1. You may be adding a ref to a functional component\n' +0
          "2. You may be adding a ref to a component that was not created inside a component's render method\n" +0
          '3. You have multiple copies of React loaded\n' +0
          'See https://fb.me/react-refs-must-have-owner for more information.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when given a string ref', () => {0
    function Indirection(props) {0
      return <div>{props.children}</div>;0
    }0
0
    class ParentUsingStringRef extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <Indirection>0
            <StatelessComponent name="A" ref="stateless" />0
          </Indirection>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<ParentUsingStringRef />),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Stateless function components cannot be given refs. ' +0
        'Attempts to access this ref will fail.\n\nCheck the render method ' +0
        'of `ParentUsingStringRef`.\n' +0
        '    in StatelessComponent (at **)\n' +0
        '    in div (at **)\n' +0
        '    in Indirection (at **)\n' +0
        '    in ParentUsingStringRef (at **)',0
    );0
0
    // No additional warnings should be logged0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<ParentUsingStringRef />);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when given a function ref', () => {0
    function Indirection(props) {0
      return <div>{props.children}</div>;0
    }0
0
    class ParentUsingFunctionRef extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <Indirection>0
            <StatelessComponent0
              name="A"0
              ref={arg => {0
                expect(arg).toBe(null);0
              }}0
            />0
          </Indirection>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<ParentUsingFunctionRef />),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Stateless function components cannot be given refs. ' +0
        'Attempts to access this ref will fail.\n\nCheck the render method ' +0
        'of `ParentUsingFunctionRef`.\n' +0
        '    in StatelessComponent (at **)\n' +0
        '    in div (at **)\n' +0
        '    in Indirection (at **)\n' +0
        '    in ParentUsingFunctionRef (at **)',0
    );0
0
    // No additional warnings should be logged0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<ParentUsingFunctionRef />);0
  });0
0
  it('deduplicates ref warnings based on element or owner', () => {0
    // When owner uses JSX, we can use exact line location to dedupe warnings0
    class AnonymousParentUsingJSX extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <StatelessComponent name="A" ref={() => {}} />;0
      }0
    }0
    Object.defineProperty(AnonymousParentUsingJSX, 'name', {value: undefined});0
0
    let instance1;0
0
    expect(() => {0
      instance1 = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <AnonymousParentUsingJSX />,0
      );0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Stateless function components cannot be given refs.',0
    );0
    // Should be deduped (offending element is on the same line):0
    instance1.forceUpdate();0
    // Should also be deduped (offending element is on the same line):0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<AnonymousParentUsingJSX />);0
0
    // When owner doesn't use JSX, and is anonymous, we warn once per internal instance.0
    class AnonymousParentNotUsingJSX extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement(StatelessComponent, {0
          name: 'A',0
          ref: () => {},0
        });0
      }0
    }0
    Object.defineProperty(AnonymousParentNotUsingJSX, 'name', {0
      value: undefined,0
    });0
0
    let instance2;0
    expect(() => {0
      instance2 = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <AnonymousParentNotUsingJSX />,0
      );0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Stateless function components cannot be given refs.',0
    );0
    // Should be deduped (same internal instance, no additional warnings)0
    instance2.forceUpdate();0
    // Could not be deduped (different internal instance):0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<AnonymousParentNotUsingJSX />),0
    ).toWarnDev('Warning: Stateless function components cannot be given refs.');0
0
    // When owner doesn't use JSX, but is named, we warn once per owner name0
    class NamedParentNotUsingJSX extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement(StatelessComponent, {0
          name: 'A',0
          ref: () => {},0
        });0
      }0
    }0
    let instance3;0
    expect(() => {0
      instance3 = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<NamedParentNotUsingJSX />);0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Stateless function components cannot be given refs.',0
    );0
    // Should be deduped (same owner name, no additional warnings):0
    instance3.forceUpdate();0
    // Should also be deduped (same owner name, no additional warnings):0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<NamedParentNotUsingJSX />);0
  });0
0
  // This guards against a regression caused by clearing the current debug fiber.0
  // https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/108310
  it('should warn when giving a function ref with context', () => {0
    function Child() {0
      return null;0
    }0
    Child.contextTypes = {0
      foo: PropTypes.string,0
    };0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: 'bar',0
        };0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <Child ref={function() {}} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Parent />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Stateless function components cannot be given refs. ' +0
        'Attempts to access this ref will fail.\n\nCheck the render method ' +0
        'of `Parent`.\n' +0
        '    in Child (at **)\n' +0
        '    in Parent (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should provide a null ref', () => {0
    function Child() {0
      return <div />;0
    }0
0
    const comp = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Child />);0
    expect(comp).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('should use correct name in key warning', () => {0
    function Child() {0
      return <div>{[<span />]}</div>;0
    }0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Child />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique "key" prop.\n\n' +0
        'Check the render method of `Child`.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should support default props and prop types', () => {0
    function Child(props) {0
      return <div>{props.test}</div>;0
    }0
    Child.defaultProps = {test: 2};0
    Child.propTypes = {test: PropTypes.string};0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Child />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed prop type: Invalid prop `test` of type `number` ' +0
        'supplied to `Child`, expected `string`.\n' +0
        '    in Child (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should receive context', () => {0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        lang: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {lang: 'en'};0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <Child />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Child(props, context) {0
      return <div>{context.lang}</div>;0
    }0
    Child.contextTypes = {lang: PropTypes.string};0
0
    const el = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent />, el);0
    expect(el.textContent).toBe('en');0
  });0
0
  it('should work with arrow functions', () => {0
    let Child = function() {0
      return <div />;0
    };0
    // Will create a new bound function without a prototype, much like a native0
    // arrow function.0
    Child = Child.bind(this);0
0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Child />)).not.toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should allow simple functions to return null', () => {0
    const Child = function() {0
      return null;0
    };0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Child />)).not.toThrow();0
  });0
0
  it('should allow simple functions to return false', () => {0
    function Child() {0
      return false;0
    }0
    expect(() => ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Child />)).not.toThrow();0
  });0
});0
/**0

 * @emails react-core0

'use strict';0
0
let createRenderer;0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactDOMServer;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
0
function getTestDocument(markup) {0
  const doc = document.implementation.createHTMLDocument('');0
  doc.open();0
  doc.write(0
    markup ||0
      '<!doctype html><html><meta charset=utf-8><title>test doc</title>',0
  );0
  doc.close();0
  return doc;0
}0
0
describe('ReactTestUtils', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    createRenderer = require('react-test-renderer/shallow').createRenderer;0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactDOMServer = require('react-dom/server');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
  });0
0
  it('Simulate should have locally attached media events', () => {0
    expect(Object.keys(ReactTestUtils.Simulate).sort()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('SimulateNative should have locally attached media events', () => {0
    expect(Object.keys(ReactTestUtils.SimulateNative).sort()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('gives Jest mocks a passthrough implementation with mockComponent()', () => {0
    class MockedComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        throw new Error('Should not get here.');0
      }0
    }0
    // This is close enough to what a Jest mock would give us.0
    MockedComponent.prototype.render = jest.fn();0
0
    // Patch it up so it returns its children.0
    ReactTestUtils.mockComponent(MockedComponent);0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<MockedComponent>Hello</MockedComponent>, container);0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('Hello');0
  });0
0
  it('can scryRenderedComponentsWithType', () => {0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Child />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
    const renderedComponent = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Wrapper />);0
    const scryResults = ReactTestUtils.scryRenderedComponentsWithType(0
      renderedComponent,0
      Child,0
    );0
    expect(scryResults.length).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('can scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithClass with TextComponent', () => {0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            Hello <span>Jim</span>0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const renderedComponent = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Wrapper />);0
    const scryResults = ReactTestUtils.scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithClass(0
      renderedComponent,0
      'NonExistentClass',0
    );0
    expect(scryResults.length).toBe(0);0
  });0
0
  it('can scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithClass with className contains \\n', () => {0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            Hello <span className={'x\ny'}>Jim</span>0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const renderedComponent = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Wrapper />);0
    const scryResults = ReactTestUtils.scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithClass(0
      renderedComponent,0
      'x',0
    );0
    expect(scryResults.length).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('can scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithClass with multiple classes', () => {0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            Hello <span className={'x y z'}>Jim</span>0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const renderedComponent = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Wrapper />);0
    const scryResults1 = ReactTestUtils.scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithClass(0
      renderedComponent,0
      'x y',0
    );0
    expect(scryResults1.length).toBe(1);0
0
    const scryResults2 = ReactTestUtils.scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithClass(0
      renderedComponent,0
      'x z',0
    );0
    expect(scryResults2.length).toBe(1);0
0
    const scryResults3 = ReactTestUtils.scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithClass(0
      renderedComponent,0
      ['x', 'y'],0
    );0
    expect(scryResults3.length).toBe(1);0
0
    expect(scryResults1[0]).toBe(scryResults2[0]);0
    expect(scryResults1[0]).toBe(scryResults3[0]);0
0
    const scryResults4 = ReactTestUtils.scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithClass(0
      renderedComponent,0
      ['x', 'a'],0
    );0
    expect(scryResults4.length).toBe(0);0
0
    const scryResults5 = ReactTestUtils.scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithClass(0
      renderedComponent,0
      ['x a'],0
    );0
    expect(scryResults5.length).toBe(0);0
  });0
0
  it('traverses children in the correct order', () => {0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(0
      <Wrapper>0
        {null}0
        <div>purple</div>0
      </Wrapper>,0
      container,0
    );0
    const tree = ReactDOM.render(0
      <Wrapper>0
        <div>orange</div>0
        <div>purple</div>0
      </Wrapper>,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    const log = [];0
    ReactTestUtils.findAllInRenderedTree(tree, function(child) {0
      if (ReactTestUtils.isDOMComponent(child)) {0
        log.push(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(child).textContent);0
      }0
    });0
0
    // Should be document order, not mount order (which would be purple, orange)0
    expect(log).toEqual(['orangepurple', 'orange', 'purple']);0
  });0
0
  it('should support injected wrapper components as DOM components', () => {0
    const injectedDOMComponents = [0
      'button',0
      'form',0
      'iframe',0
      'img',0
      'input',0
      'option',0
      'select',0
      'textarea',0
    ];0
0
    injectedDOMComponents.forEach(function(type) {0
      const testComponent = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        React.createElement(type),0
      );0
      expect(testComponent.tagName).toBe(type.toUpperCase());0
      expect(ReactTestUtils.isDOMComponent(testComponent)).toBe(true);0
    });0
0
    // Full-page components (html, head, body) can't be rendered into a div0
    // directly...0
    class Root extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <html ref="html">0
            <head ref="head">0
              <title>hello</title>0
            </head>0
            <body ref="body">hello, world</body>0
          </html>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const markup = ReactDOMServer.renderToString(<Root />);0
    const testDocument = getTestDocument(markup);0
    const component = ReactDOM.hydrate(<Root />, testDocument);0
0
    expect(component.refs.html.tagName).toBe('HTML');0
    expect(component.refs.head.tagName).toBe('HEAD');0
    expect(component.refs.body.tagName).toBe('BODY');0
    expect(ReactTestUtils.isDOMComponent(component.refs.html)).toBe(true);0
    expect(ReactTestUtils.isDOMComponent(component.refs.head)).toBe(true);0
    expect(ReactTestUtils.isDOMComponent(component.refs.body)).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('can scry with stateless components involved', () => {0
    const Stateless = () => (0
      <div>0
        <hr />0
      </div>0
    );0
0
    class SomeComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Stateless />0
            <hr />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const inst = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<SomeComponent />);0
    const hrs = ReactTestUtils.scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithTag(inst, 'hr');0
    expect(hrs.length).toBe(2);0
  });0
0
  describe('Simulate', () => {0
    it('should change the value of an input field', () => {0
      const obj = {0
        handler: function(e) {0
          e.persist();0
        },0
      };0
      spyOnDevAndProd(obj, 'handler').and.callThrough();0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      const node = ReactDOM.render(0
        <input type="text" onChange={obj.handler} />,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      node.value = 'giraffe';0
      ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(node);0
0
      expect(obj.handler).toHaveBeenCalledWith(0
        expect.objectContaining({target: node}),0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should change the value of an input field in a component', () => {0
      class SomeComponent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <div>0
              <input0
                type="text"0
                ref="input"0
                onChange={this.props.handleChange}0
              />0
            </div>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      const obj = {0
        handler: function(e) {0
          e.persist();0
        },0
      };0
      spyOnDevAndProd(obj, 'handler').and.callThrough();0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      const instance = ReactDOM.render(0
        <SomeComponent handleChange={obj.handler} />,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      const node = instance.refs.input;0
      node.value = 'zebra';0
      ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(node);0
0
      expect(obj.handler).toHaveBeenCalledWith(0
        expect.objectContaining({target: node}),0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('should throw when attempting to use a React element', () => {0
      class SomeComponent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <div onClick={this.props.handleClick}>hello, world.</div>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const handler = jest.fn().mockName('spy');0
      const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
      const result = shallowRenderer.render(0
        <SomeComponent handleClick={handler} />,0
      );0
0
      expect(() => ReactTestUtils.Simulate.click(result)).toThrowError(0
        'TestUtils.Simulate expected a DOM node as the first argument but received ' +0
          'a React element. Pass the DOM node you wish to simulate the event on instead. ' +0
          'Note that TestUtils.Simulate will not work if you are using shallow rendering.',0
      );0
      expect(handler).not.toHaveBeenCalled();0
    });0
0
    it('should throw when attempting to use a component instance', () => {0
      class SomeComponent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return <div onClick={this.props.handleClick}>hello, world.</div>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const handler = jest.fn().mockName('spy');0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      const instance = ReactDOM.render(0
        <SomeComponent handleClick={handler} />,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      expect(() => ReactTestUtils.Simulate.click(instance)).toThrowError(0
        'TestUtils.Simulate expected a DOM node as the first argument but received ' +0
          'a component instance. Pass the DOM node you wish to simulate the event on instead.',0
      );0
      expect(handler).not.toHaveBeenCalled();0
    });0
0
    it('should not warn when used with extra properties', () => {0
      const CLIENT_X = 100;0
0
      class Component extends React.Component {0
        handleClick = e => {0
          expect(e.clientX).toBe(CLIENT_X);0
        };0
0
        render() {0
          return <div onClick={this.handleClick} />;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const element = document.createElement('div');0
      const instance = ReactDOM.render(<Component />, element);0
      ReactTestUtils.Simulate.click(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(instance), {0
        clientX: CLIENT_X,0
      });0
    });0
0
    it('should set the type of the event', () => {0
      let event;0
      const stub = jest.fn().mockImplementation(e => {0
        e.persist();0
        event = e;0
      });0
0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      const instance = ReactDOM.render(<div onKeyDown={stub} />, container);0
      const node = ReactDOM.findDOMNode(instance);0
0
      ReactTestUtils.Simulate.keyDown(node);0
0
      expect(event.type).toBe('keydown');0
      expect(event.nativeEvent.type).toBe('keydown');0
    });0
0
    it('should work with renderIntoDocument', () => {0
      const onChange = jest.fn();0
0
      class MyComponent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <div>0
              <input type="text" onChange={onChange} />0
            </div>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<MyComponent />);0
      const input = ReactTestUtils.findRenderedDOMComponentWithTag(0
        instance,0
        'input',0
      );0
      input.value = 'giraffe';0
      ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(input);0
0
      expect(onChange).toHaveBeenCalledWith(0
        expect.objectContaining({target: input}),0
      );0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('should call setState callback with no arguments', () => {0
    let mockArgs;0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.setState({}, (...args) => (mockArgs = args));0
      }0
      render() {0
        return false;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />);0
    expect(mockArgs.length).toEqual(0);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
0
const ChildComponent = ({id, eventHandler}) => (0
  <div0
    id={id + '__DIV'}0
    onClickCapture={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, 'captured', e.type)}0
    onClick={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, 'bubbled', e.type)}0
    onMouseEnter={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, e.type)}0
    onMouseLeave={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, e.type)}>0
    <div0
      id={id + '__DIV_1'}0
      onClickCapture={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, 'captured', e.type)}0
      onClick={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, 'bubbled', e.type)}0
      onMouseEnter={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, e.type)}0
      onMouseLeave={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, e.type)}0
    />0
    <div0
      id={id + '__DIV_2'}0
      onClickCapture={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, 'captured', e.type)}0
      onClick={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, 'bubbled', e.type)}0
      onMouseEnter={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, e.type)}0
      onMouseLeave={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, e.type)}0
    />0
  </div>0
);0
0
const ParentComponent = ({eventHandler}) => (0
  <div0
    id="P"0
    onClickCapture={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, 'captured', e.type)}0
    onClick={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, 'bubbled', e.type)}0
    onMouseEnter={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, e.type)}0
    onMouseLeave={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, e.type)}>0
    <div0
      id="P_P1"0
      onClickCapture={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, 'captured', e.type)}0
      onClick={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, 'bubbled', e.type)}0
      onMouseEnter={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, e.type)}0
      onMouseLeave={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, e.type)}>0
      <ChildComponent id="P_P1_C1" eventHandler={eventHandler} />0
      <ChildComponent id="P_P1_C2" eventHandler={eventHandler} />0
    </div>0
    <div0
      id="P_OneOff"0
      onClickCapture={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, 'captured', e.type)}0
      onClick={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, 'bubbled', e.type)}0
      onMouseEnter={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, e.type)}0
      onMouseLeave={e => eventHandler(e.currentTarget.id, e.type)}0
    />0
  </div>0
);0
0
describe('ReactTreeTraversal', () => {0
  const mockFn = jest.fn();0
  let container;0
  let outerNode1;0
  let outerNode2;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
0
    mockFn.mockReset();0
0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    outerNode1 = document.createElement('div');0
    outerNode2 = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
    document.body.appendChild(outerNode1);0
    document.body.appendChild(outerNode2);0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<ParentComponent eventHandler={mockFn} />, container);0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
    document.body.removeChild(outerNode1);0
    document.body.removeChild(outerNode2);0
    container = null;0
    outerNode1 = null;0
    outerNode2 = null;0
  });0
0
  describe('Two phase traversal', () => {0
    it('should not traverse when target is outside component boundary', () => {0
      outerNode1.dispatchEvent(0
        new MouseEvent('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
0
      expect(mockFn).not.toHaveBeenCalled();0
    });0
0
    it('should traverse two phase across component boundary', () => {0
      const expectedCalls = [0
        ['P', 'captured', 'click'],0
        ['P_P1', 'captured', 'click'],0
        ['P_P1_C1__DIV', 'captured', 'click'],0
        ['P_P1_C1__DIV_1', 'captured', 'click'],0
0
        ['P_P1_C1__DIV_1', 'bubbled', 'click'],0
        ['P_P1_C1__DIV', 'bubbled', 'click'],0
        ['P_P1', 'bubbled', 'click'],0
        ['P', 'bubbled', 'click'],0
      ];0
0
      const node = document.getElementById('P_P1_C1__DIV_1');0
      node.dispatchEvent(0
        new MouseEvent('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
0
      expect(mockFn.mock.calls).toEqual(expectedCalls);0
    });0
0
    it('should traverse two phase at shallowest node', () => {0
      const node = document.getElementById('P');0
      node.dispatchEvent(0
        new MouseEvent('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
0
      const expectedCalls = [0
        ['P', 'captured', 'click'],0
        ['P', 'bubbled', 'click'],0
      ];0
      expect(mockFn.mock.calls).toEqual(expectedCalls);0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('Enter leave traversal', () => {0
    it('should not traverse when enter/leaving outside DOM', () => {0
      outerNode1.dispatchEvent(0
        new MouseEvent('mouseout', {0
          bubbles: true,0
          cancelable: true,0
          relatedTarget: outerNode2,0
        }),0
      );0
0
      expect(mockFn).not.toHaveBeenCalled();0
    });0
0
    it('should not traverse if enter/leave the same node', () => {0
      const leaveNode = document.getElementById('P_P1_C1__DIV_1');0
      const enterNode = document.getElementById('P_P1_C1__DIV_1');0
0
      leaveNode.dispatchEvent(0
        new MouseEvent('mouseout', {0
          bubbles: true,0
          cancelable: true,0
          relatedTarget: enterNode,0
        }),0
      );0
0
      expect(mockFn).not.toHaveBeenCalled();0
    });0
0
    it('should traverse enter/leave to sibling - avoids parent', () => {0
      const leaveNode = document.getElementById('P_P1_C1__DIV_1');0
      const enterNode = document.getElementById('P_P1_C1__DIV_2');0
0
      const expectedCalls = [0
        ['P_P1_C1__DIV_1', 'mouseleave'],0
        // enter/leave shouldn't fire anything on the parent0
        ['P_P1_C1__DIV_2', 'mouseenter'],0
      ];0
0
      leaveNode.dispatchEvent(0
        new MouseEvent('mouseout', {0
          bubbles: true,0
          cancelable: true,0
          relatedTarget: enterNode,0
        }),0
      );0
0
      expect(mockFn.mock.calls).toEqual(expectedCalls);0
    });0
0
    it('should traverse enter/leave to parent - avoids parent', () => {0
      const leaveNode = document.getElementById('P_P1_C1__DIV_1');0
      const enterNode = document.getElementById('P_P1_C1__DIV');0
0
      const expectedCalls = [['P_P1_C1__DIV_1', 'mouseleave']];0
0
      leaveNode.dispatchEvent(0
        new MouseEvent('mouseout', {0
          bubbles: true,0
          cancelable: true,0
          relatedTarget: enterNode,0
        }),0
      );0
0
      expect(mockFn.mock.calls).toEqual(expectedCalls);0
    });0
0
    it('should enter from the window', () => {0
      const enterNode = document.getElementById('P_P1_C1__DIV');0
0
      const expectedCalls = [0
        ['P', 'mouseenter'],0
        ['P_P1', 'mouseenter'],0
        ['P_P1_C1__DIV', 'mouseenter'],0
      ];0
0
      outerNode1.dispatchEvent(0
        new MouseEvent('mouseout', {0
          bubbles: true,0
          cancelable: true,0
          relatedTarget: enterNode,0
        }),0
      );0
0
      expect(mockFn.mock.calls).toEqual(expectedCalls);0
    });0
0
    it('should enter from the window to the shallowest', () => {0
      const enterNode = document.getElementById('P');0
0
      const expectedCalls = [['P', 'mouseenter']];0
0
      outerNode1.dispatchEvent(0
        new MouseEvent('mouseout', {0
          bubbles: true,0
          cancelable: true,0
          relatedTarget: enterNode,0
        }),0
      );0
0
      expect(mockFn.mock.calls).toEqual(expectedCalls);0
    });0
0
    it('should leave to the window', () => {0
      const leaveNode = document.getElementById('P_P1_C1__DIV');0
0
      const expectedCalls = [0
        ['P_P1_C1__DIV', 'mouseleave'],0
        ['P_P1', 'mouseleave'],0
        ['P', 'mouseleave'],0
      ];0
0
      leaveNode.dispatchEvent(0
        new MouseEvent('mouseout', {0
          bubbles: true,0
          cancelable: true,0
          relatedTarget: outerNode1,0
        }),0
      );0
0
      expect(mockFn.mock.calls).toEqual(expectedCalls);0
    });0
0
    it('should leave to the window from the shallowest', () => {0
      const leaveNode = document.getElementById('P');0
0
      const expectedCalls = [['P', 'mouseleave']];0
0
      leaveNode.dispatchEvent(0
        new MouseEvent('mouseout', {0
          bubbles: true,0
          cancelable: true,0
          relatedTarget: outerNode1,0
        }),0
      );0
0
      expect(mockFn.mock.calls).toEqual(expectedCalls);0
    });0
  });0
});0
