'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
0
describe('ReactUpdates', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
  });0
0
  it('should batch state when updating state twice', () => {0
    let updateCount = 0;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {x: 0};0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        updateCount++;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.state.x}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />);0
    expect(instance.state.x).toBe(0);0
0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      instance.setState({x: 1});0
      instance.setState({x: 2});0
      expect(instance.state.x).toBe(0);0
      expect(updateCount).toBe(0);0
    });0
0
    expect(instance.state.x).toBe(2);0
    expect(updateCount).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should batch state when updating two different state keys', () => {0
    let updateCount = 0;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {x: 0, y: 0};0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        updateCount++;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            ({this.state.x}, {this.state.y})0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />);0
    expect(instance.state.x).toBe(0);0
    expect(instance.state.y).toBe(0);0
0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      instance.setState({x: 1});0
      instance.setState({y: 2});0
      expect(instance.state.x).toBe(0);0
      expect(instance.state.y).toBe(0);0
      expect(updateCount).toBe(0);0
    });0
0
    expect(instance.state.x).toBe(1);0
    expect(instance.state.y).toBe(2);0
    expect(updateCount).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should batch state and props together', () => {0
    let updateCount = 0;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {y: 0};0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        updateCount++;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            ({this.props.x}, {this.state.y})0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(<Component x={0} />, container);0
    expect(instance.props.x).toBe(0);0
    expect(instance.state.y).toBe(0);0
0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      ReactDOM.render(<Component x={1} />, container);0
      instance.setState({y: 2});0
      expect(instance.props.x).toBe(0);0
      expect(instance.state.y).toBe(0);0
      expect(updateCount).toBe(0);0
    });0
0
    expect(instance.props.x).toBe(1);0
    expect(instance.state.y).toBe(2);0
    expect(updateCount).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should batch parent/child state updates together', () => {0
    let parentUpdateCount = 0;0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      state = {x: 0};0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        parentUpdateCount++;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Child ref="child" x={this.state.x} />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    let childUpdateCount = 0;0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      state = {y: 0};0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        childUpdateCount++;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.x + this.state.y}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Parent />);0
    const child = instance.refs.child;0
    expect(instance.state.x).toBe(0);0
    expect(child.state.y).toBe(0);0
0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      instance.setState({x: 1});0
      child.setState({y: 2});0
      expect(instance.state.x).toBe(0);0
      expect(child.state.y).toBe(0);0
      expect(parentUpdateCount).toBe(0);0
      expect(childUpdateCount).toBe(0);0
    });0
0
    expect(instance.state.x).toBe(1);0
    expect(child.state.y).toBe(2);0
    expect(parentUpdateCount).toBe(1);0
    expect(childUpdateCount).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should batch child/parent state updates together', () => {0
    let parentUpdateCount = 0;0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      state = {x: 0};0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        parentUpdateCount++;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Child ref="child" x={this.state.x} />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    let childUpdateCount = 0;0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      state = {y: 0};0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        childUpdateCount++;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.x + this.state.y}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Parent />);0
    const child = instance.refs.child;0
    expect(instance.state.x).toBe(0);0
    expect(child.state.y).toBe(0);0
0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      child.setState({y: 2});0
      instance.setState({x: 1});0
      expect(instance.state.x).toBe(0);0
      expect(child.state.y).toBe(0);0
      expect(parentUpdateCount).toBe(0);0
      expect(childUpdateCount).toBe(0);0
    });0
0
    expect(instance.state.x).toBe(1);0
    expect(child.state.y).toBe(2);0
    expect(parentUpdateCount).toBe(1);0
0
    // Batching reduces the number of updates here to 1.0
    expect(childUpdateCount).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should support chained state updates', () => {0
    let updateCount = 0;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {x: 0};0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        updateCount++;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.state.x}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />);0
    expect(instance.state.x).toBe(0);0
0
    let innerCallbackRun = false;0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      instance.setState({x: 1}, function() {0
        instance.setState({x: 2}, function() {0
          expect(this).toBe(instance);0
          innerCallbackRun = true;0
          expect(instance.state.x).toBe(2);0
          expect(updateCount).toBe(2);0
        });0
        expect(instance.state.x).toBe(1);0
        expect(updateCount).toBe(1);0
      });0
      expect(instance.state.x).toBe(0);0
      expect(updateCount).toBe(0);0
    });0
0
    expect(innerCallbackRun).toBeTruthy();0
    expect(instance.state.x).toBe(2);0
    expect(updateCount).toBe(2);0
  });0
0
  it('should batch forceUpdate together', () => {0
    let shouldUpdateCount = 0;0
    let updateCount = 0;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {x: 0};0
0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        shouldUpdateCount++;0
      }0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        updateCount++;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.state.x}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />);0
    expect(instance.state.x).toBe(0);0
0
    let callbacksRun = 0;0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      instance.setState({x: 1}, function() {0
        callbacksRun++;0
      });0
      instance.forceUpdate(function() {0
        callbacksRun++;0
      });0
      expect(instance.state.x).toBe(0);0
      expect(updateCount).toBe(0);0
    });0
0
    expect(callbacksRun).toBe(2);0
    // shouldComponentUpdate shouldn't be called since we're forcing0
    expect(shouldUpdateCount).toBe(0);0
    expect(instance.state.x).toBe(1);0
    expect(updateCount).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should update children even if parent blocks updates', () => {0
    let parentRenderCount = 0;0
    let childRenderCount = 0;0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return false;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        parentRenderCount++;0
        return <Child ref="child" />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        childRenderCount++;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    expect(parentRenderCount).toBe(0);0
    expect(childRenderCount).toBe(0);0
0
    let instance = <Parent />;0
    instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(instance);0
0
    expect(parentRenderCount).toBe(1);0
    expect(childRenderCount).toBe(1);0
0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      instance.setState({x: 1});0
    });0
0
    expect(parentRenderCount).toBe(1);0
    expect(childRenderCount).toBe(1);0
0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      instance.refs.child.setState({x: 1});0
    });0
0
    expect(parentRenderCount).toBe(1);0
    expect(childRenderCount).toBe(2);0
  });0
0
  it('should not reconcile children passed via props', () => {0
    let numMiddleRenders = 0;0
    let numBottomRenders = 0;0
0
    class Top extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <Middle>0
            <Bottom />0
          </Middle>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Middle extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.forceUpdate();0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        numMiddleRenders++;0
        return React.Children.only(this.props.children);0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Bottom extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        numBottomRenders++;0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Top />);0
    expect(numMiddleRenders).toBe(2);0
    expect(numBottomRenders).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should flow updates correctly', () => {0
    let willUpdates = [];0
    let didUpdates = [];0
0
    const UpdateLoggingMixin = {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate: function() {0
        willUpdates.push(this.constructor.displayName);0
      },0
      componentDidUpdate: function() {0
        didUpdates.push(this.constructor.displayName);0
      },0
    };0
0
    class Box extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div ref="boxDiv">{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
    Object.assign(Box.prototype, UpdateLoggingMixin);0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <span ref="span">child</span>;0
      }0
    }0
    Object.assign(Child.prototype, UpdateLoggingMixin);0
0
    class Switcher extends React.Component {0
      state = {tabKey: 'hello'};0
      render() {0
        const child = this.props.children;0
0
        return (0
          <Box ref="box">0
            <div0
              ref="switcherDiv"0
              style={{0
                display: this.state.tabKey === child.key ? '' : 'none',0
              }}>0
              {child}0
            </div>0
          </Box>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
    Object.assign(Switcher.prototype, UpdateLoggingMixin);0
0
    class App extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <Switcher ref="switcher">0
            <Child key="hello" ref="child" />0
          </Switcher>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
    Object.assign(App.prototype, UpdateLoggingMixin);0
0
    let root = <App />;0
    root = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(root);0
0
    function expectUpdates(desiredWillUpdates, desiredDidUpdates) {0
      let i;0
      for (i = 0; i < desiredWillUpdates; i++) {0
        expect(willUpdates).toContain(desiredWillUpdates[i]);0
      }0
      for (i = 0; i < desiredDidUpdates; i++) {0
        expect(didUpdates).toContain(desiredDidUpdates[i]);0
      }0
      willUpdates = [];0
      didUpdates = [];0
    }0
0
    function triggerUpdate(c) {0
      c.setState({x: 1});0
    }0
0
    function testUpdates(components, desiredWillUpdates, desiredDidUpdates) {0
      let i;0
0
      ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
        for (i = 0; i < components.length; i++) {0
          triggerUpdate(components[i]);0
        }0
      });0
0
      expectUpdates(desiredWillUpdates, desiredDidUpdates);0
0
      // Try them in reverse order0
0
      ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
        for (i = components.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {0
          triggerUpdate(components[i]);0
        }0
      });0
0
      expectUpdates(desiredWillUpdates, desiredDidUpdates);0
    }0
    testUpdates(0
      [root.refs.switcher.refs.box, root.refs.switcher],0
      // Owner-child relationships have inverse will and did0
      ['Switcher', 'Box'],0
      ['Box', 'Switcher'],0
    );0
0
    testUpdates(0
      [root.refs.child, root.refs.switcher.refs.box],0
      // Not owner-child so reconcile independently0
      ['Box', 'Child'],0
      ['Box', 'Child'],0
    );0
0
    testUpdates(0
      [root.refs.child, root.refs.switcher],0
      // Switcher owns Box and Child, Box does not own Child0
      ['Switcher', 'Box', 'Child'],0
      ['Box', 'Switcher', 'Child'],0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should queue mount-ready handlers across different roots', () => {0
    // We'll define two components A and B, then update both of them. When A's0
    // componentDidUpdate handlers is called, B's DOM should already have been0
    // updated.0
0
    const bContainer = document.createElement('div');0
0
    let a;0
    let b;0
0
    let aUpdated = false;0
0
    class A extends React.Component {0
      state = {x: 0};0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(b).textContent).toBe('B1');0
        aUpdated = true;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        let portal = null;0
        // If we're using Fiber, we use Portals instead to achieve this.0
        portal = ReactDOM.createPortal(<B ref={n => (b = n)} />, bContainer);0
        return (0
          <div>0
            A{this.state.x}0
            {portal}0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class B extends React.Component {0
      state = {x: 0};0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>B{this.state.x}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    a = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<A />);0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      a.setState({x: 1});0
      b.setState({x: 1});0
    });0
0
    expect(aUpdated).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('should flush updates in the correct order', () => {0
    const updates = [];0
0
    class Outer extends React.Component {0
      state = {x: 0};0
0
      render() {0
        updates.push('Outer-render-' + this.state.x);0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Inner x={this.state.x} ref="inner" />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        const x = this.state.x;0
        updates.push('Outer-didUpdate-' + x);0
        updates.push('Inner-setState-' + x);0
        this.refs.inner.setState({x: x}, function() {0
          updates.push('Inner-callback-' + x);0
        });0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Inner extends React.Component {0
      state = {x: 0};0
0
      render() {0
        updates.push('Inner-render-' + this.props.x + '-' + this.state.x);0
        return <div />;0
      }0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        updates.push('Inner-didUpdate-' + this.props.x + '-' + this.state.x);0
      }0
    }0
0
    const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Outer />);0
0
    updates.push('Outer-setState-1');0
    instance.setState({x: 1}, function() {0
      updates.push('Outer-callback-1');0
      updates.push('Outer-setState-2');0
      instance.setState({x: 2}, function() {0
        updates.push('Outer-callback-2');0
      });0
    });0
0
    /* eslint-disable indent */0
    expect(updates).toEqual([0
      'Outer-render-0',0
      'Inner-render-0-0',0
0
      'Outer-setState-1',0
      'Outer-render-1',0
      'Inner-render-1-0',0
      'Inner-didUpdate-1-0',0
      'Outer-didUpdate-1',0
      // Happens in a batch, so don't re-render yet0
      'Inner-setState-1',0
      'Outer-callback-1',0
0
      // Happens in a batch0
      'Outer-setState-2',0
0
      // Flush batched updates all at once0
      'Outer-render-2',0
      'Inner-render-2-1',0
      'Inner-didUpdate-2-1',0
      'Inner-callback-1',0
      'Outer-didUpdate-2',0
      'Inner-setState-2',0
      'Outer-callback-2',0
      'Inner-render-2-2',0
      'Inner-didUpdate-2-2',0
      'Inner-callback-2',0
    ]);0
    /* eslint-enable indent */0
  });0
0
  it('should flush updates in the correct order across roots', () => {0
    const instances = [];0
    const updates = [];0
0
    class MockComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        updates.push(this.props.depth);0
        return <div />;0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        instances.push(this);0
        if (this.props.depth < this.props.count) {0
          ReactDOM.render(0
            <MockComponent0
              depth={this.props.depth + 1}0
              count={this.props.count}0
            />,0
            ReactDOM.findDOMNode(this),0
          );0
        }0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<MockComponent depth={0} count={2} />);0
0
    expect(updates).toEqual([0, 1, 2]);0
0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      // Simulate update on each component from top to bottom.0
      instances.forEach(function(instance) {0
        instance.forceUpdate();0
      });0
    });0
0
    expect(updates).toEqual([0, 1, 2, 0, 1, 2]);0
  });0
0
  it('should queue nested updates', () => {0
    // See https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/11470
0
    class X extends React.Component {0
      state = {s: 0};0
0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.s === 0) {0
          return (0
            <div>0
              <span>0</span>0
            </div>0
          );0
        } else {0
          return <div>1</div>;0
        }0
      }0
0
      go = () => {0
        this.setState({s: 1});0
        this.setState({s: 0});0
        this.setState({s: 1});0
      };0
    }0
0
    class Y extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Z />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Z extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {0
        x.go();0
      }0
    }0
0
    let x;0
    let y;0
0
    x = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<X />);0
    y = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Y />);0
    expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(x).textContent).toBe('0');0
0
    y.forceUpdate();0
    expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(x).textContent).toBe('1');0
  });0
0
  it('should queue updates from during mount', () => {0
    // See https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/13530
    let a;0
0
    class A extends React.Component {0
      state = {x: 0};0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        a = this;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>A{this.state.x}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class B extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        a.setState({x: 1});0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(0
        <div>0
          <A />0
          <B />0
        </div>,0
      );0
    });0
0
    expect(a.state.x).toBe(1);0
    expect(ReactDOM.findDOMNode(a).textContent).toBe('A1');0
  });0
0
  it('calls componentWillReceiveProps setState callback properly', () => {0
    let callbackCount = 0;0
0
    class A extends React.Component {0
      state = {x: this.props.x};0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(nextProps) {0
        const newX = nextProps.x;0
        this.setState({x: newX}, function() {0
          // State should have updated by the time this callback gets called0
          expect(this.state.x).toBe(newX);0
          callbackCount++;0
        });0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.state.x}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<A x={1} />, container);0
    ReactDOM.render(<A x={2} />, container);0
    expect(callbackCount).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('does not call render after a component as been deleted', () => {0
    let renderCount = 0;0
    let componentB = null;0
0
    class B extends React.Component {0
      state = {updates: 0};0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        componentB = this;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        renderCount++;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class A extends React.Component {0
      state = {showB: true};0
0
      render() {0
        return this.state.showB ? <B /> : <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const component = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<A />);0
0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      // B will have scheduled an update but the batching should ensure that its0
      // update never fires.0
      componentB.setState({updates: 1});0
      component.setState({showB: false});0
    });0
0
    expect(renderCount).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('throws in setState if the update callback is not a function', () => {0
    function Foo() {0
      this.a = 1;0
      this.b = 2;0
    }0
0
    class A extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let component = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<A />);0
0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() => component.setState({}, 'no')).toWarnDev(0
        'setState(...): Expected the last optional `callback` argument to be ' +0
          'a function. Instead received: no.',0
      );0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'Invalid argument passed as callback. Expected a function. Instead ' +0
        'received: no',0
    );0
    component = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<A />);0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() => component.setState({}, {foo: 'bar'})).toWarnDev(0
        'setState(...): Expected the last optional `callback` argument to be ' +0
          'a function. Instead received: [object Object].',0
      );0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'Invalid argument passed as callback. Expected a function. Instead ' +0
        'received: [object Object]',0
    );0
    // Make sure the warning is deduplicated and doesn't fire again0
    component = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<A />);0
    expect(() => component.setState({}, new Foo())).toThrowError(0
      'Invalid argument passed as callback. Expected a function. Instead ' +0
        'received: [object Object]',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('throws in forceUpdate if the update callback is not a function', () => {0
    function Foo() {0
      this.a = 1;0
      this.b = 2;0
    }0
0
    class A extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let component = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<A />);0
0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() => component.forceUpdate('no')).toWarnDev(0
        'forceUpdate(...): Expected the last optional `callback` argument to be ' +0
          'a function. Instead received: no.',0
      );0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'Invalid argument passed as callback. Expected a function. Instead ' +0
        'received: no',0
    );0
    component = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<A />);0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(() => component.forceUpdate({foo: 'bar'})).toWarnDev(0
        'forceUpdate(...): Expected the last optional `callback` argument to be ' +0
          'a function. Instead received: [object Object].',0
      );0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'Invalid argument passed as callback. Expected a function. Instead ' +0
        'received: [object Object]',0
    );0
    // Make sure the warning is deduplicated and doesn't fire again0
    component = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<A />);0
    expect(() => component.forceUpdate(new Foo())).toThrowError(0
      'Invalid argument passed as callback. Expected a function. Instead ' +0
        'received: [object Object]',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('does not update one component twice in a batch (#2410)', () => {0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      getChild = () => {0
        return this.refs.child;0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <Child ref="child" />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let renderCount = 0;0
    let postRenderCount = 0;0
    let once = false;0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      state = {updated: false};0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {0
        if (!once) {0
          once = true;0
          this.setState({updated: true});0
        }0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        expect(renderCount).toBe(postRenderCount + 1);0
        postRenderCount++;0
      }0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        expect(renderCount).toBe(postRenderCount + 1);0
        postRenderCount++;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        expect(renderCount).toBe(postRenderCount);0
        renderCount++;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const parent = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Parent />);0
    const child = parent.getChild();0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      parent.forceUpdate();0
      child.forceUpdate();0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('does not update one component twice in a batch (#6371)', () => {0
    let callbacks = [];0
    function emitChange() {0
      callbacks.forEach(c => c());0
    }0
0
    class App extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        this.state = {showChild: true};0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.setState({showChild: false});0
      }0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <ForceUpdatesOnChange />0
            {this.state.showChild && <EmitsChangeOnUnmount />}0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class EmitsChangeOnUnmount extends React.Component {0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        emitChange();0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class ForceUpdatesOnChange extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.onChange = () => this.forceUpdate();0
        this.onChange();0
        callbacks.push(this.onChange);0
      }0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        callbacks = callbacks.filter(c => c !== this.onChange);0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div key={Math.random()} onClick={function() {}} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<App />, document.createElement('div'));0
  });0
0
  it('unstable_batchedUpdates should return value from a callback', () => {0
    const result = ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      return 42;0
    });0
    expect(result).toEqual(42);0
  });0
0
  it('unmounts and remounts a root in the same batch', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<span>a</span>, container);0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
      ReactDOM.render(<span>b</span>, container);0
    });0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('b');0
  });0
0
  it('handles reentrant mounting in synchronous mode', () => {0
    let mounts = 0;0
    class Editor extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.text}</div>;0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        mounts++;0
        // This should be called only once but we guard just in case.0
        if (!this.props.rendered) {0
          this.props.onChange({rendered: true});0
        }0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    function render() {0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <Editor0
          onChange={newProps => {0
            props = {...props, ...newProps};0
            render();0
          }}0
          {...props}0
        />,0
        container,0
      );0
    }0
0
    let props = {text: 'hello', rendered: false};0
    render();0
    props = {...props, text: 'goodbye'};0
    render();0
    expect(container.textContent).toBe('goodbye');0
    expect(mounts).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('mounts and unmounts are sync even in a batch', () => {0
    const ops = [];0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(() => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<div>Hello</div>, container);0
      ops.push(container.textContent);0
      ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
      ops.push(container.textContent);0
    });0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Hello', '']);0
  });0
0
  it(0
    'in sync mode, updates in componentWillUpdate and componentDidUpdate ' +0
      'should both flush in the immediately subsequent commit',0
    () => {0
      let ops = [];0
      class Foo extends React.Component {0
        state = {a: false, b: false};0
        UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate(_, nextState) {0
          if (!nextState.a) {0
            this.setState({a: true});0
          }0
        }0
        componentDidUpdate() {0
          ops.push('Foo updated');0
          if (!this.state.b) {0
            this.setState({b: true});0
          }0
        }0
        render() {0
          ops.push(`a: ${this.state.a}, b: ${this.state.b}`);0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      // Mount0
      ReactDOM.render(<Foo />, container);0
      // Root update0
      ReactDOM.render(<Foo />, container);0
      expect(ops).toEqual([0
        // Mount0
        'a: false, b: false',0
        // Root update0
        'a: false, b: false',0
        'Foo updated',0
        // Subsequent update (both a and b should have flushed)0
        'a: true, b: true',0
        'Foo updated',0
        // There should not be any additional updates0
      ]);0
    },0
  );0
0
  it(0
    'in sync mode, updates in componentWillUpdate and componentDidUpdate ' +0
      '(on a sibling) should both flush in the immediately subsequent commit',0
    () => {0
      let ops = [];0
      class Foo extends React.Component {0
        state = {a: false};0
        UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate(_, nextState) {0
          if (!nextState.a) {0
            this.setState({a: true});0
          }0
        }0
        componentDidUpdate() {0
          ops.push('Foo updated');0
        }0
        render() {0
          ops.push(`a: ${this.state.a}`);0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      class Bar extends React.Component {0
        state = {b: false};0
        componentDidUpdate() {0
          ops.push('Bar updated');0
          if (!this.state.b) {0
            this.setState({b: true});0
          }0
        }0
        render() {0
          ops.push(`b: ${this.state.b}`);0
          return null;0
        }0
      }0
0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      // Mount0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div>0
          <Foo />0
          <Bar />0
        </div>,0
        container,0
      );0
      // Root update0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div>0
          <Foo />0
          <Bar />0
        </div>,0
        container,0
      );0
      expect(ops).toEqual([0
        // Mount0
        'a: false',0
        'b: false',0
        // Root update0
        'a: false',0
        'b: false',0
        'Foo updated',0
        'Bar updated',0
        // Subsequent update (both a and b should have flushed)0
        'a: true',0
        'b: true',0
        'Foo updated',0
        'Bar updated',0
        // There should not be any additional updates0
      ]);0
    },0
  );0
0
  it('uses correct base state for setState inside render phase', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {step: 0};0
      render() {0
        const memoizedStep = this.state.step;0
        this.setState(baseState => {0
          const baseStep = baseState.step;0
          ops.push(`base: ${baseStep}, memoized: ${memoizedStep}`);0
          return baseStep === 0 ? {step: 1} : null;0
        });0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => ReactDOM.render(<Foo />, container)).toWarnDev(0
      'Cannot update during an existing state transition',0
    );0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['base: 0, memoized: 0', 'base: 1, memoized: 1']);0
  });0
0
  it('does not re-render if state update is null', () => {0
    let container = document.createElement('div');0
0
    let instance;0
    let ops = [];0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        instance = this;0
        ops.push('render');0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    ReactDOM.render(<Foo />, container);0
0
    ops = [];0
    instance.setState(() => null);0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
  });0
0
  // Will change once we switch to async by default0
  it('synchronously renders hidden subtrees', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    let ops = [];0
0
    function Baz() {0
      ops.push('Baz');0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    function Bar() {0
      ops.push('Bar');0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    function Foo() {0
      ops.push('Foo');0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <div hidden={true}>0
            <Bar />0
          </div>0
          <Baz />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Mount0
    ReactDOM.render(<Foo />, container);0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Baz']);0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Update0
    ReactDOM.render(<Foo />, container);0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Baz']);0
  });0
0
  it('can render ridiculously large number of roots without triggering infinite update loop error', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        const limit = 1200;0
        for (let i = 0; i < limit; i++) {0
          if (i < limit - 1) {0
            ReactDOM.render(<div />, document.createElement('div'));0
          } else {0
            ReactDOM.render(<div />, document.createElement('div'), () => {0
              // The "nested update limit" error isn't thrown until setState0
              this.setState({});0
            });0
          }0
        }0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Foo />, container);0
  });0
0
  it('does not fall into an infinite update loop', () => {0
    class NonTerminating extends React.Component {0
      state = {step: 0};0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.setState({step: 1});0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {0
        this.setState({step: 2});0
      }0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            Hello {this.props.name}0
            {this.state.step}0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<NonTerminating />, container);0
    }).toThrow('Maximum');0
  });0
0
  it('does not fall into an infinite error loop', () => {0
    function BadRender() {0
      throw new Error('error');0
    }0
0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      componentDidCatch() {0
        this.props.parent.remount();0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <BadRender />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class NonTerminating extends React.Component {0
      state = {step: 0};0
      remount() {0
        this.setState(state => ({step: state.step + 1}));0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <ErrorBoundary key={this.state.step} parent={this} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactDOM.render(<NonTerminating />, container);0
    }).toThrow('Maximum');0
  });0
});0

 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0

 * @emails react-core0

'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
0
let TestComponent;0
0
describe('refs-destruction', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
0
    class ClassComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    TestComponent = class extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        if (this.props.destroy) {0
          return <div />;0
        } else if (this.props.removeRef) {0
          return (0
            <div>0
              <div />0
              <ClassComponent />0
            </div>0
          );0
        } else {0
          return (0
            <div>0
              <div ref="theInnerDiv" />0
              <ClassComponent ref="theInnerClassComponent" />0
            </div>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
    };0
  });0
0
  it('should remove refs when destroying the parent', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const testInstance = ReactDOM.render(<TestComponent />, container);0
    expect(ReactTestUtils.isDOMComponent(testInstance.refs.theInnerDiv)).toBe(0
      true,0
    );0
    expect(0
      Object.keys(testInstance.refs || {}).filter(key => testInstance.refs[key])0
        .length,0
    ).toEqual(2);0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(0
      Object.keys(testInstance.refs || {}).filter(key => testInstance.refs[key])0
        .length,0
    ).toEqual(0);0
  });0
0
  it('should remove refs when destroying the child', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const testInstance = ReactDOM.render(<TestComponent />, container);0
    expect(ReactTestUtils.isDOMComponent(testInstance.refs.theInnerDiv)).toBe(0
      true,0
    );0
    expect(0
      Object.keys(testInstance.refs || {}).filter(key => testInstance.refs[key])0
        .length,0
    ).toEqual(2);0
    ReactDOM.render(<TestComponent destroy={true} />, container);0
    expect(0
      Object.keys(testInstance.refs || {}).filter(key => testInstance.refs[key])0
        .length,0
    ).toEqual(0);0
  });0
0
  it('should remove refs when removing the child ref attribute', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    const testInstance = ReactDOM.render(<TestComponent />, container);0
    expect(ReactTestUtils.isDOMComponent(testInstance.refs.theInnerDiv)).toBe(0
      true,0
    );0
    expect(0
      Object.keys(testInstance.refs || {}).filter(key => testInstance.refs[key])0
        .length,0
    ).toEqual(2);0
    ReactDOM.render(<TestComponent removeRef={true} />, container);0
    expect(0
      Object.keys(testInstance.refs || {}).filter(key => testInstance.refs[key])0
        .length,0
    ).toEqual(0);0
  });0
0
  it('should not error when destroying child with ref asynchronously', () => {0
    class Modal extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.div = document.createElement('div');0
        document.body.appendChild(this.div);0
        this.componentDidUpdate();0
      }0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ReactDOM.render(<div>{this.props.children}</div>, this.div);0
      }0
0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        const self = this;0
        // some async animation0
        setTimeout(function() {0
          expect(function() {0
            ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(self.div);0
          }).not.toThrow();0
          document.body.removeChild(self.div);0
        }, 0);0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class AppModal extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <Modal>0
            <a ref="ref" />0
          </Modal>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class App extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return this.props.hidden ? null : <AppModal onClose={this.close} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    ReactDOM.render(<App />, container);0
    ReactDOM.render(<App hidden={true} />, container);0
    jest.runAllTimers();0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React = require('react');0
let ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
let ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
0
/**0
 * Counts clicks and has a renders an item for each click. Each item rendered0
 * has a ref of the form "clickLogN".0
 */0
class ClickCounter extends React.Component {0
  state = {count: this.props.initialCount};0
0
  triggerReset = () => {0
    this.setState({count: this.props.initialCount});0
  };0
0
  handleClick = () => {0
    this.setState({count: this.state.count + 1});0
  };0
0
  render() {0
    const children = [];0
    let i;0
    for (i = 0; i < this.state.count; i++) {0
      children.push(0
        <div0
          className="clickLogDiv"0
          key={'clickLog' + i}0
          ref={'clickLog' + i}0
        />,0
      );0
    }0
    return (0
      <span className="clickIncrementer" onClick={this.handleClick}>0
        {children}0
      </span>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Only purpose is to test that refs are tracked even when applied to a0
 * component that is injected down several layers. Ref systems are difficult to0
 * build in such a way that ownership is maintained in an airtight manner.0
 */0
class GeneralContainerComponent extends React.Component {0
  render() {0
    return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Notice how refs ownership is maintained even when injecting a component0
 * into a different parent.0
 */0
class TestRefsComponent extends React.Component {0
  doReset = () => {0
    this.refs.myCounter.triggerReset();0
  };0
0
  render() {0
    return (0
      <div>0
        <div ref="resetDiv" onClick={this.doReset}>0
          Reset Me By Clicking This.0
        </div>0
        <GeneralContainerComponent ref="myContainer">0
          <ClickCounter ref="myCounter" initialCount={1} />0
        </GeneralContainerComponent>0
      </div>0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
const expectClickLogsLengthToBe = function(instance, length) {0
  const clickLogs = ReactTestUtils.scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithClass(0
    instance,0
    'clickLogDiv',0
  );0
  expect(clickLogs.length).toBe(length);0
  expect(Object.keys(instance.refs.myCounter.refs).length).toBe(length);0
};0
0
describe('reactiverefs', () => {0
  let container;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    if (container) {0
      document.body.removeChild(container);0
      container = null;0
    }0
  });0
0
  /**0
   * Render a TestRefsComponent and ensure that the main refs are wired up.0
   */0
  const renderTestRefsComponent = function() {0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
    const testRefsComponent = ReactDOM.render(<TestRefsComponent />, container);0
    expect(testRefsComponent instanceof TestRefsComponent).toBe(true);0
0
    const generalContainer = testRefsComponent.refs.myContainer;0
    expect(generalContainer instanceof GeneralContainerComponent).toBe(true);0
0
    const counter = testRefsComponent.refs.myCounter;0
    expect(counter instanceof ClickCounter).toBe(true);0
0
    return testRefsComponent;0
  };0
0
  /**0
   * Ensure that for every click log there is a corresponding ref (from the0
   * perspective of the injected ClickCounter component.0
   */0
  it('Should increase refs with an increase in divs', () => {0
    const testRefsComponent = renderTestRefsComponent();0
    const clickIncrementer = ReactTestUtils.findRenderedDOMComponentWithClass(0
      testRefsComponent,0
      'clickIncrementer',0
    );0
0
    expectClickLogsLengthToBe(testRefsComponent, 1);0
0
    // After clicking the reset, there should still only be one click log ref.0
    testRefsComponent.refs.resetDiv.click();0
    expectClickLogsLengthToBe(testRefsComponent, 1);0
0
    // Begin incrementing clicks (and therefore refs).0
    clickIncrementer.click();0
    expectClickLogsLengthToBe(testRefsComponent, 2);0
0
    clickIncrementer.click();0
    expectClickLogsLengthToBe(testRefsComponent, 3);0
0
    // Now reset again0
    testRefsComponent.refs.resetDiv.click();0
    expectClickLogsLengthToBe(testRefsComponent, 1);0
  });0
});0
0
describe('factory components', () => {0
  it('Should correctly get the ref', () => {0
    function Comp() {0
      return {0
        render() {0
          return <div ref="elemRef" />;0
        },0
      };0
    }0
0
    const inst = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Comp />);0
    expect(inst.refs.elemRef.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
  });0
});0
0
/**0
 * Tests that when a ref hops around children, we can track that correctly.0
 */0
describe('ref swapping', () => {0
  let RefHopsAround;0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
0
    RefHopsAround = class extends React.Component {0
      state = {count: 0};0
0
      moveRef = () => {0
        this.setState({count: this.state.count + 1});0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        const count = this.state.count;0
        /**0
         * What we have here, is three divs with refs (div1/2/3), but a single0
         * moving cursor ref `hopRef` that "hops" around the three. We'll call the0
         * `moveRef()` function several times and make sure that the hop ref0
         * points to the correct divs.0
         */0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <div0
              className="first"0
              ref={count % 3 === 0 ? 'hopRef' : 'divOneRef'}0
            />0
            <div0
              className="second"0
              ref={count % 3 === 1 ? 'hopRef' : 'divTwoRef'}0
            />0
            <div0
              className="third"0
              ref={count % 3 === 2 ? 'hopRef' : 'divThreeRef'}0
            />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    };0
  });0
0
  it('Allow refs to hop around children correctly', () => {0
    const refHopsAround = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<RefHopsAround />);0
0
    const firstDiv = ReactTestUtils.findRenderedDOMComponentWithClass(0
      refHopsAround,0
      'first',0
    );0
    const secondDiv = ReactTestUtils.findRenderedDOMComponentWithClass(0
      refHopsAround,0
      'second',0
    );0
    const thirdDiv = ReactTestUtils.findRenderedDOMComponentWithClass(0
      refHopsAround,0
      'third',0
    );0
0
    expect(refHopsAround.refs.hopRef).toEqual(firstDiv);0
    expect(refHopsAround.refs.divTwoRef).toEqual(secondDiv);0
    expect(refHopsAround.refs.divThreeRef).toEqual(thirdDiv);0
0
    refHopsAround.moveRef();0
    expect(refHopsAround.refs.divOneRef).toEqual(firstDiv);0
    expect(refHopsAround.refs.hopRef).toEqual(secondDiv);0
    expect(refHopsAround.refs.divThreeRef).toEqual(thirdDiv);0
0
    refHopsAround.moveRef();0
    expect(refHopsAround.refs.divOneRef).toEqual(firstDiv);0
    expect(refHopsAround.refs.divTwoRef).toEqual(secondDiv);0
    expect(refHopsAround.refs.hopRef).toEqual(thirdDiv);0
0
    /**0
     * Make sure that after the third, we're back to where we started and the0
     * refs are completely restored.0
     */0
    refHopsAround.moveRef();0
    expect(refHopsAround.refs.hopRef).toEqual(firstDiv);0
    expect(refHopsAround.refs.divTwoRef).toEqual(secondDiv);0
    expect(refHopsAround.refs.divThreeRef).toEqual(thirdDiv);0
  });0
0
  it('always has a value for this.refs', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const instance = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Component />);0
    expect(!!instance.refs).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('ref called correctly for stateless component', () => {0
    let refCalled = 0;0
    function Inner(props) {0
      return <a ref={props.saveA} />;0
    }0
0
    class Outer extends React.Component {0
      saveA = () => {0
        refCalled++;0
      };0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.setState({});0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <Inner saveA={this.saveA} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Outer />);0
    expect(refCalled).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('coerces numbers to strings', () => {0
    class A extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div ref={1} />;0
      }0
    }0
    const a = ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<A />);0
    expect(a.refs[1].nodeName).toBe('DIV');0
  });0
});0
0
describe('root level refs', () => {0
  it('attaches and detaches root refs', () => {0
    let inst = null;0
0
    // host node0
    let ref = jest.fn(value => (inst = value));0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    let result = ReactDOM.render(<div ref={ref} />, container);0
    expect(ref).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    expect(ref.mock.calls[0][0]).toBeInstanceOf(HTMLDivElement);0
    expect(result).toBe(ref.mock.calls[0][0]);0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(ref).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
    expect(ref.mock.calls[1][0]).toBe(null);0
0
    // composite0
    class Comp extends React.Component {0
      method() {0
        return true;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div>Comp</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    inst = null;0
    ref = jest.fn(value => (inst = value));0
    result = ReactDOM.render(<Comp ref={ref} />, container);0
0
    expect(ref).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    expect(inst).toBeInstanceOf(Comp);0
    expect(result).toBe(inst);0
0
    // ensure we have the correct instance0
    expect(result.method()).toBe(true);0
    expect(inst.method()).toBe(true);0
0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(ref).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
    expect(ref.mock.calls[1][0]).toBe(null);0
0
    // fragment0
    inst = null;0
    ref = jest.fn(value => (inst = value));0
    let divInst = null;0
    const ref2 = jest.fn(value => (divInst = value));0
    result = ReactDOM.render(0
      [0
        <Comp ref={ref} key="a" />,0
        5,0
        <div ref={ref2} key="b">0
          Hello0
        </div>,0
      ],0
      container,0
    );0
0
    // first call should be `Comp`0
    expect(ref).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    expect(ref.mock.calls[0][0]).toBeInstanceOf(Comp);0
    expect(result).toBe(ref.mock.calls[0][0]);0
0
    expect(ref2).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    expect(divInst).toBeInstanceOf(HTMLDivElement);0
    expect(result).not.toBe(divInst);0
0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    expect(ref).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
    expect(ref.mock.calls[1][0]).toBe(null);0
    expect(ref2).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
    expect(ref2.mock.calls[1][0]).toBe(null);0
0
    // null0
    result = ReactDOM.render(null, container);0
    expect(result).toBe(null);0
0
    // primitives0
    result = ReactDOM.render(5, container);0
    expect(result).toBeInstanceOf(Text);0
  });0
});0
0
describe('creating element with ref in constructor', () => {0
  class RefTest extends React.Component {0
    constructor(props) {0
      super(props);0
      this.p = <p ref="p">Hello!</p>;0
    }0
0
    render() {0
      return <div>{this.p}</div>;0
    }0
  }0
0
  it('throws an error', () => {0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
0
    expect(function() {0
      ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<RefTest />);0
    }).toThrowError(0
      'Element ref was specified as a string (p) but no owner was set. This could happen for one of' +0
        ' the following reasons:\n' +0
        '1. You may be adding a ref to a functional component\n' +0
        "2. You may be adding a ref to a component that was not created inside a component's render method\n" +0
        '3. You have multiple copies of React loaded\n' +0
        'See https://fb.me/react-refs-must-have-owner for more information.',0
    );0
  });0
});0
0
describe('strings refs across renderers', () => {0
  it('does not break', () => {0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        // This component owns both refs.0
        return (0
          <Indirection0
            child1={<div ref="child1" />}0
            child2={<div ref="child2" />}0
          />0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Indirection extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        // One ref is being rendered later using another renderer copy.0
        jest.resetModules();0
        const AnotherCopyOfReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
        AnotherCopyOfReactDOM.render(this.props.child2, div2);0
      }0
      render() {0
        // The other one is being rendered directly.0
        return this.props.child1;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const div1 = document.createElement('div');0
    const div2 = document.createElement('div');0
    const inst = ReactDOM.render(<Parent />, div1);0
    // Only the first ref has rendered yet.0
    expect(inst.refs.child1.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
    expect(inst.refs.child1).toBe(div1.firstChild);0
0
    // Now both refs should be rendered.0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent />, div1);0
    expect(inst.refs.child1.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
    expect(inst.refs.child1).toBe(div1.firstChild);0
    expect(inst.refs.child2.tagName).toBe('DIV');0
    expect(inst.refs.child2).toBe(div2.firstChild);0
  });0
});0

'use strict';0
0
const React = require('react');0
const PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
const ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
const ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
const renderSubtreeIntoContainer = require('react-dom')0
  .unstable_renderSubtreeIntoContainer;0
0
describe('renderSubtreeIntoContainer', () => {0
  it('should pass context when rendering subtree elsewhere', () => {0
    const portal = document.createElement('div');0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.context.foo}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: 'bar',0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        expect(0
          function() {0
            renderSubtreeIntoContainer(this, <Component />, portal);0
          }.bind(this),0
        ).not.toThrow();0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactTestUtils.renderIntoDocument(<Parent />);0
    expect(portal.firstChild.innerHTML).toBe('bar');0
  });0
0
  it('should throw if parentComponent is invalid', () => {0
    const portal = document.createElement('div');0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.context.foo}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    // ESLint is confused here and thinks Parent is unused, presumably because0
    // it is only used inside of the class body?0
    // eslint-disable-next-line no-unused-vars0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: 'bar',0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        expect(function() {0
          renderSubtreeIntoContainer(<Parent />, <Component />, portal);0
        }).toThrowError('parentComponentmust be a valid React Component');0
      }0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('should update context if it changes due to setState', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
    const portal = document.createElement('div');0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
        getFoo: PropTypes.func.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.context.foo + '-' + this.context.getFoo()}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
        getFoo: PropTypes.func.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      state = {0
        bar: 'initial',0
      };0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: this.state.bar,0
          getFoo: () => this.state.bar,0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        renderSubtreeIntoContainer(this, <Component />, portal);0
      }0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        renderSubtreeIntoContainer(this, <Component />, portal);0
      }0
    }0
0
    const instance = ReactDOM.render(<Parent />, container);0
    expect(portal.firstChild.innerHTML).toBe('initial-initial');0
    instance.setState({bar: 'changed'});0
    expect(portal.firstChild.innerHTML).toBe('changed-changed');0
  });0
0
  it('should update context if it changes due to re-render', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
    const portal = document.createElement('div');0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
        getFoo: PropTypes.func.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.context.foo + '-' + this.context.getFoo()}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
        getFoo: PropTypes.func.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          foo: this.props.bar,0
          getFoo: () => this.props.bar,0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        renderSubtreeIntoContainer(this, <Component />, portal);0
      }0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        renderSubtreeIntoContainer(this, <Component />, portal);0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent bar="initial" />, container);0
    expect(portal.firstChild.innerHTML).toBe('initial-initial');0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent bar="changed" />, container);0
    expect(portal.firstChild.innerHTML).toBe('changed-changed');0
  });0
0
  it('should render portal with non-context-provider parent', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
    const portal = document.createElement('div');0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        renderSubtreeIntoContainer(this, <div>hello</div>, portal);0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent bar="initial" />, container);0
    expect(portal.firstChild.innerHTML).toBe('hello');0
  });0
0
  it('should get context through non-context-provider parent', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
    const portal = document.createElement('div');0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <Middle />;0
      }0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {value: this.props.value};0
      }0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        value: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
    }0
0
    class Middle extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        renderSubtreeIntoContainer(this, <Child />, portal);0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        value: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.context.value}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent value="foo" />, container);0
    expect(portal.textContent).toBe('foo');0
  });0
0
  it('should get context through middle non-context-provider layer', () => {0
    const container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
    const portal1 = document.createElement('div');0
    const portal2 = document.createElement('div');0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {value: this.props.value};0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        renderSubtreeIntoContainer(this, <Middle />, portal1);0
      }0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        value: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
    }0
0
    class Middle extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        renderSubtreeIntoContainer(this, <Child />, portal2);0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        value: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.context.value}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent value="foo" />, container);0
    expect(portal2.textContent).toBe('foo');0
  });0
0
  it('fails gracefully when mixing React 15 and 16', () => {0
    class C extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    const c = ReactDOM.render(<C />, document.createElement('div'));0
    // React 15 calls this:0
    // https://github.com/facebook/react/blob/77b71fc3c4/src/renderers/dom/client/ReactMount.js#L478-L4790
    expect(() => {0
      c._reactInternalInstance._processChildContext({});0
    }).toThrow(0
      __DEV__0
        ? '_processChildContext is not available in React 16+. This likely ' +0
          'means you have multiple copies of React and are attempting to nest ' +0
          'a React 15 tree inside a React 16 tree using ' +0
          "unstable_renderSubtreeIntoContainer, which isn't supported. Try to " +0
          'make sure you have only one copy of React (and ideally, switch to ' +0
          'ReactDOM.createPortal).'0
        : "Cannot read property '_processChildContext' of undefined",0
    );0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2015-present, Facebook, Inc.0

 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const React = require('react');0
const ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
0
function expectWarnings(tags, warnings = []) {0
  tags = [...tags];0
  warnings = [...warnings];0
0
  let element = null;0
  const containerTag = tags.shift();0
  const container =0
    containerTag === 'svg'0
      ? document.createElementNS('http://www.w3.org/2000/svg', containerTag)0
      : document.createElement(containerTag);0
0
  while (tags.length) {0
    const Tag = tags.pop();0
    element = <Tag>{element}</Tag>;0
  }0
0
  expect(() => ReactDOM.render(element, container)).toWarnDev(warnings);0
}0
0
describe('validateDOMNesting', () => {0
  it('allows valid nestings', () => {0
    expectWarnings(['table', 'tbody', 'tr', 'td', 'b']);0
    expectWarnings(0
      ['body', 'datalist', 'option'],0
      [0
        'render(): Rendering components directly into document.body is discouraged',0
      ],0
    );0
    expectWarnings(['div', 'a', 'object', 'a']);0
    expectWarnings(['div', 'p', 'button', 'p']);0
    expectWarnings(['p', 'svg', 'foreignObject', 'p']);0
    expectWarnings(['html', 'body', 'div']);0
0
    // Invalid, but not changed by browser parsing so we allow them0
    expectWarnings(['div', 'ul', 'ul', 'li']);0
    expectWarnings(['div', 'label', 'div']);0
    expectWarnings(['div', 'ul', 'li', 'section', 'li']);0
    expectWarnings(['div', 'ul', 'li', 'dd', 'li']);0
  });0
0
  it('prevents problematic nestings', () => {0
    expectWarnings(0
      ['a', 'a'],0
      [0
        'validateDOMNesting(...): <a> cannot appear as a descendant of <a>.\n' +0
          '    in a (at **)',0
      ],0
    );0
    expectWarnings(0
      ['form', 'form'],0
      [0
        'validateDOMNesting(...): <form> cannot appear as a descendant of <form>.\n' +0
          '    in form (at **)',0
      ],0
    );0
    expectWarnings(0
      ['p', 'p'],0
      [0
        'validateDOMNesting(...): <p> cannot appear as a descendant of <p>.\n' +0
          '    in p (at **)',0
      ],0
    );0
    expectWarnings(0
      ['table', 'tr'],0
      [0
        'validateDOMNesting(...): <tr> cannot appear as a child of <table>. ' +0
          'Add a <tbody> to your code to match the DOM tree generated by the browser.\n' +0
          '    in tr (at **)',0
      ],0
    );0
    expectWarnings(0
      ['div', 'ul', 'li', 'div', 'li'],0
      [0
        'validateDOMNesting(...): <li> cannot appear as a descendant of <li>.\n' +0
          '    in li (at **)\n' +0
          '    in div (at **)\n' +0
          '    in li (at **)\n' +0
          '    in ul (at **)',0
      ],0
    );0
    expectWarnings(0
      ['div', 'html'],0
      [0
        'validateDOMNesting(...): <html> cannot appear as a child of <div>.\n' +0
          '    in html (at **)',0
      ],0
    );0
    expectWarnings(0
      ['body', 'body'],0
      [0
        'render(): Rendering components directly into document.body is discouraged',0
        'validateDOMNesting(...): <body> cannot appear as a child of <body>.\n' +0
          '    in body (at **)',0
      ],0
    );0
    expectWarnings(0
      ['svg', 'foreignObject', 'body', 'p'],0
      [0
        'validateDOMNesting(...): <body> cannot appear as a child of <foreignObject>.\n' +0
          '    in body (at **)\n' +0
          '    in foreignObject (at **)',0
      ],0
    );0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0

'use strict';0
0
const stream = require('stream');0
0
module.exports = function(initModules) {0
  let ReactDOM;0
  let ReactDOMServer;0
0
  function resetModules() {0
    ({ReactDOM, ReactDOMServer} = initModules());0
  }0
0
  // Helper functions for rendering tests0
  // ====================================0
0
  // promisified version of ReactDOM.render()0
  function asyncReactDOMRender(reactElement, domElement, forceHydrate) {0
    return new Promise(resolve => {0
      if (forceHydrate) {0
        ReactDOM.hydrate(reactElement, domElement);0
      } else {0
        ReactDOM.render(reactElement, domElement);0
      }0
      // We can't use the callback for resolution because that will not catch0
      // errors. They're thrown.0
      resolve();0
    });0
  }0
  // performs fn asynchronously and expects count errors logged to console.error.0
  // will fail the test if the count of errors logged is not equal to count.0
  async function expectErrors(fn, count) {0
    if (console.error.calls && console.error.calls.reset) {0
      console.error.calls.reset();0
    } else {0
      // TODO: Rewrite tests that use this helper to enumerate expeceted errors.0
      // This will enable the helper to use the .toWarnDev() matcher instead of spying.0
      spyOnDev(console, 'error');0
    }0
0
    const result = await fn();0
    if (0
      console.error.calls &&0
      console.error.calls.count() !== count &&0
      console.error.calls.count() !== 00
    ) {0
      console.log(0
        `We expected ${count} warning(s), but saw ${console.error.calls.count()} warning(s).`,0
      );0
      if (console.error.calls.count() > 0) {0
        console.log(`We saw these warnings:`);0
        for (let i = 0; i < console.error.calls.count(); i++) {0
          console.log(console.error.calls.argsFor(i)[0]);0
        }0
      }0
    }0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(console.error).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(count);0
    }0
    return result;0
  }0
0
  // renders the reactElement into domElement, and expects a certain number of errors.0
  // returns a Promise that resolves when the render is complete.0
  function renderIntoDom(0
    reactElement,0
    domElement,0
    forceHydrate,0
    errorCount = 0,0
  ) {0
    return expectErrors(async () => {0
      await asyncReactDOMRender(reactElement, domElement, forceHydrate);0
      return domElement.firstChild;0
    }, errorCount);0
  }0
0
  async function renderIntoString(reactElement, errorCount = 0) {0
    return await expectErrors(0
      () =>0
        new Promise(resolve =>0
          resolve(ReactDOMServer.renderToString(reactElement)),0
        ),0
      errorCount,0
    );0
  }0
0
  // Renders text using SSR and then stuffs it into a DOM node; returns the DOM0
  // element that corresponds with the reactElement.0
  // Does not render on client or perform client-side revival.0
  async function serverRender(reactElement, errorCount = 0) {0
    const markup = await renderIntoString(reactElement, errorCount);0
    const domElement = document.createElement('div');0
    domElement.innerHTML = markup;0
    return domElement.firstChild;0
  }0
0
  // this just drains a readable piped into it to a string, which can be accessed0
  // via .buffer.0
  class DrainWritable extends stream.Writable {0
    constructor(options) {0
      super(options);0
      this.buffer = '';0
    }0
0
    _write(chunk, encoding, cb) {0
      this.buffer += chunk;0
      cb();0
    }0
  }0
0
  async function renderIntoStream(reactElement, errorCount = 0) {0
    return await expectErrors(0
      () =>0
        new Promise(resolve => {0
          let writable = new DrainWritable();0
          ReactDOMServer.renderToNodeStream(reactElement).pipe(writable);0
          writable.on('finish', () => resolve(writable.buffer));0
        }),0
      errorCount,0
    );0
  }0
0
  // Renders text using node stream SSR and then stuffs it into a DOM node;0
  // returns the DOM element that corresponds with the reactElement.0
  // Does not render on client or perform client-side revival.0
  async function streamRender(reactElement, errorCount = 0) {0
    const markup = await renderIntoStream(reactElement, errorCount);0
    const domElement = document.createElement('div');0
    domElement.innerHTML = markup;0
    return domElement.firstChild;0
  }0
0
  const clientCleanRender = (element, errorCount = 0) => {0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    return renderIntoDom(element, div, false, errorCount);0
  };0
0
  const clientRenderOnServerString = async (element, errorCount = 0) => {0
    const markup = await renderIntoString(element, errorCount);0
    resetModules();0
0
    const domElement = document.createElement('div');0
    domElement.innerHTML = markup;0
    let serverNode = domElement.firstChild;0
0
    const firstClientNode = await renderIntoDom(0
      element,0
      domElement,0
      true,0
      errorCount,0
    );0
    let clientNode = firstClientNode;0
0
    // Make sure all top level nodes match up0
    while (serverNode || clientNode) {0
      expect(serverNode != null).toBe(true);0
      expect(clientNode != null).toBe(true);0
      expect(clientNode.nodeType).toBe(serverNode.nodeType);0
      // Assert that the DOM element hasn't been replaced.0
      // Note that we cannot use expect(serverNode).toBe(clientNode) because0
      // of jest bug #1772.0
      expect(serverNode === clientNode).toBe(true);0
      serverNode = serverNode.nextSibling;0
      clientNode = clientNode.nextSibling;0
    }0
    return firstClientNode;0
  };0
0
  function BadMarkupExpected() {}0
0
  const clientRenderOnBadMarkup = async (element, errorCount = 0) => {0
    // First we render the top of bad mark up.0
    const domElement = document.createElement('div');0
    domElement.innerHTML =0
      '<div id="badIdWhichWillCauseMismatch" data-reactroot="" data-reactid="1"></div>';0
    await renderIntoDom(element, domElement, true, errorCount + 1);0
0
    // This gives us the resulting text content.0
    const hydratedTextContent = domElement.textContent;0
0
    // Next we render the element into a clean DOM node client side.0
    const cleanDomElement = document.createElement('div');0
    await asyncReactDOMRender(element, cleanDomElement, true);0
    // This gives us the expected text content.0
    const cleanTextContent = cleanDomElement.textContent;0
0
    // The only guarantee is that text content has been patched up if needed.0
    expect(hydratedTextContent).toBe(cleanTextContent);0
0
    // Abort any further expects. All bets are off at this point.0
    throw new BadMarkupExpected();0
  };0
0
  // runs a DOM rendering test as four different tests, with four different rendering0
  // scenarios:0
  // -- render to string on server0
  // -- render on client without any server markup "clean client render"0
  // -- render on client on top of good server-generated string markup0
  // -- render on client on top of bad server-generated markup0
  //0
  // testFn is a test that has one arg, which is a render function. the render0
  // function takes in a ReactElement and an optional expected error count and0
  // returns a promise of a DOM Element.0
  //0
  // You should only perform tests that examine the DOM of the results of0
  // render; you should not depend on the interactivity of the returned DOM element,0
  // as that will not work in the server string scenario.0
  function itRenders(desc, testFn) {0
    it(`renders ${desc} with server string render`, () => testFn(serverRender));0
    it(`renders ${desc} with server stream render`, () => testFn(streamRender));0
    itClientRenders(desc, testFn);0
  }0
0
  // run testFn in three different rendering scenarios:0
  // -- render on client without any server markup "clean client render"0
  // -- render on client on top of good server-generated string markup0
  // -- render on client on top of bad server-generated markup0
  //0
  // testFn is a test that has one arg, which is a render function. the render0
  // function takes in a ReactElement and an optional expected error count and0
  // returns a promise of a DOM Element.0
  //0
  // Since all of the renders in this function are on the client, you can test interactivity,0
  // unlike with itRenders.0
  function itClientRenders(desc, testFn) {0
    it(`renders ${desc} with clean client render`, () =>0
      testFn(clientCleanRender));0
    it(`renders ${desc} with client render on top of good server markup`, () =>0
      testFn(clientRenderOnServerString));0
    it(`renders ${desc} with client render on top of bad server markup`, async () => {0
      try {0
        await testFn(clientRenderOnBadMarkup);0
      } catch (x) {0
        // We expect this to trigger the BadMarkupExpected rejection.0
        if (!(x instanceof BadMarkupExpected)) {0
          // If not, rethrow.0
          throw x;0
        }0
      }0
    });0
  }0
0
  function itThrows(desc, testFn, partialMessage) {0
    it(`throws ${desc}`, () => {0
      return testFn().then(0
        () => expect(false).toBe('The promise resolved and should not have.'),0
        err => {0
          expect(err).toBeInstanceOf(Error);0
          expect(err.message).toContain(partialMessage);0
        },0
      );0
    });0
  }0
0
  function itThrowsWhenRendering(desc, testFn, partialMessage) {0
    itThrows(0
      `when rendering ${desc} with server string render`,0
      () => testFn(serverRender),0
      partialMessage,0
    );0
    itThrows(0
      `when rendering ${desc} with clean client render`,0
      () => testFn(clientCleanRender),0
      partialMessage,0
    );0
0
    // we subtract one from the warning count here because the throw means that it won't0
    // get the usual markup mismatch warning.0
    itThrows(0
      `when rendering ${desc} with client render on top of bad server markup`,0
      () =>0
        testFn((element, warningCount = 0) =>0
          clientRenderOnBadMarkup(element, warningCount - 1),0
        ),0
      partialMessage,0
    );0
  }0
0
  // renders serverElement to a string, sticks it into a DOM element, and then0
  // tries to render clientElement on top of it. shouldMatch is a boolean0
  // telling whether we should expect the markup to match or not.0
  async function testMarkupMatch(serverElement, clientElement, shouldMatch) {0
    const domElement = await serverRender(serverElement);0
    resetModules();0
    return renderIntoDom(0
      clientElement,0
      domElement.parentNode,0
      true,0
      shouldMatch ? 0 : 1,0
    );0
  }0
0
  // expects that rendering clientElement on top of a server-rendered0
  // serverElement does NOT raise a markup mismatch warning.0
  function expectMarkupMatch(serverElement, clientElement) {0
    return testMarkupMatch(serverElement, clientElement, true);0
  }0
0
  // expects that rendering clientElement on top of a server-rendered0
  // serverElement DOES raise a markup mismatch warning.0
  function expectMarkupMismatch(serverElement, clientElement) {0
    return testMarkupMatch(serverElement, clientElement, false);0
  }0
0
  return {0
    resetModules,0
    expectMarkupMismatch,0
    expectMarkupMatch,0
    itRenders,0
    itClientRenders,0
    itThrowsWhenRendering,0
    asyncReactDOMRender,0
    serverRender,0
    clientCleanRender,0
    clientRenderOnServerString,0
    renderIntoDom,0
    streamRender,0
  };0
};0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
