 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import {0
  getPropertyInfo,0
  shouldIgnoreAttribute,0
  shouldRemoveAttribute,0
  isAttributeNameSafe,0
  BOOLEAN,0
  OVERLOADED_BOOLEAN,0
} from '../shared/DOMProperty';0
0
import type {PropertyInfo} from '../shared/DOMProperty';0
0
/**0
 * Get the value for a property on a node. Only used in DEV for SSR validation.0
 * The "expected" argument is used as a hint of what the expected value is.0
 * Some properties have multiple equivalent values.0
 */0
export function getValueForProperty(0
  node: Element,0
  name: string,0
  expected: mixed,0
  propertyInfo: PropertyInfo,0
): mixed {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (propertyInfo.mustUseProperty) {0
      const {propertyName} = propertyInfo;0
      return (node: any)[propertyName];0
    } else {0
      const attributeName = propertyInfo.attributeName;0
0
      let stringValue = null;0
0
      if (propertyInfo.type === OVERLOADED_BOOLEAN) {0
        if (node.hasAttribute(attributeName)) {0
          const value = node.getAttribute(attributeName);0
          if (value === '') {0
            return true;0
          }0
          if (shouldRemoveAttribute(name, expected, propertyInfo, false)) {0
            return value;0
          }0
          if (value === '' + (expected: any)) {0
            return expected;0
          }0
          return value;0
        }0
      } else if (node.hasAttribute(attributeName)) {0
        if (shouldRemoveAttribute(name, expected, propertyInfo, false)) {0
          // We had an attribute but shouldn't have had one, so read it0
          // for the error message.0
          return node.getAttribute(attributeName);0
        }0
        if (propertyInfo.type === BOOLEAN) {0
          // If this was a boolean, it doesn't matter what the value is0
          // the fact that we have it is the same as the expected.0
          return expected;0
        }0
        // Even if this property uses a namespace we use getAttribute0
        // because we assume its namespaced name is the same as our config.0
        // To use getAttributeNS we need the local name which we don't have0
        // in our config atm.0
        stringValue = node.getAttribute(attributeName);0
      }0
0
      if (shouldRemoveAttribute(name, expected, propertyInfo, false)) {0
        return stringValue === null ? expected : stringValue;0
      } else if (stringValue === '' + (expected: any)) {0
        return expected;0
      } else {0
        return stringValue;0
      }0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Get the value for a attribute on a node. Only used in DEV for SSR validation.0
 * The third argument is used as a hint of what the expected value is. Some0
 * attributes have multiple equivalent values.0
 */0
export function getValueForAttribute(0
  node: Element,0
  name: string,0
  expected: mixed,0
): mixed {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (!isAttributeNameSafe(name)) {0
      return;0
    }0
    if (!node.hasAttribute(name)) {0
      return expected === undefined ? undefined : null;0
    }0
    const value = node.getAttribute(name);0
    if (value === '' + (expected: any)) {0
      return expected;0
    }0
    return value;0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Sets the value for a property on a node.0
 *0
 * @param {DOMElement} node0
 * @param {string} name0
 * @param {*} value0
 */0
export function setValueForProperty(0
  node: Element,0
  name: string,0
  value: mixed,0
  isCustomComponentTag: boolean,0
) {0
  const propertyInfo = getPropertyInfo(name);0
  if (shouldIgnoreAttribute(name, propertyInfo, isCustomComponentTag)) {0
    return;0
  }0
  if (shouldRemoveAttribute(name, value, propertyInfo, isCustomComponentTag)) {0
    value = null;0
  }0
  // If the prop isn't in the special list, treat it as a simple attribute.0
  if (isCustomComponentTag || propertyInfo === null) {0
    if (isAttributeNameSafe(name)) {0
      const attributeName = name;0
      if (value === null) {0
        node.removeAttribute(attributeName);0
      } else {0
        node.setAttribute(attributeName, '' + (value: any));0
      }0
    }0
    return;0
  }0
  const {mustUseProperty} = propertyInfo;0
  if (mustUseProperty) {0
    const {propertyName} = propertyInfo;0
    if (value === null) {0
      const {type} = propertyInfo;0
      (node: any)[propertyName] = type === BOOLEAN ? false : '';0
    } else {0
      // Contrary to `setAttribute`, object properties are properly0
      // `toString`ed by IE8/9.0
      (node: any)[propertyName] = value;0
    }0
    return;0
  }0
  // The rest are treated as attributes with special cases.0
  const {attributeName, attributeNamespace} = propertyInfo;0
  if (value === null) {0
    node.removeAttribute(attributeName);0
  } else {0
    const {type} = propertyInfo;0
    let attributeValue;0
    if (type === BOOLEAN || (type === OVERLOADED_BOOLEAN && value === true)) {0
      attributeValue = '';0
    } else {0
      // `setAttribute` with objects becomes only `[object]` in IE8/9,0
      // ('' + value) makes it output the correct toString()-value.0
      attributeValue = '' + (value: any);0
    }0
    if (attributeNamespace) {0
      node.setAttributeNS(attributeNamespace, attributeName, attributeValue);0
    } else {0
      node.setAttribute(attributeName, attributeValue);0
    }0
  }0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2015-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
export default function getActiveElement(doc: ?Document): ?Element {0
  doc = doc || (typeof document !== 'undefined' ? document : undefined);0
  if (typeof doc === 'undefined') {0
    return null;0
  }0
  try {0
    return doc.activeElement || doc.body;0
  } catch (e) {0
    return doc.body;0
  }0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import {TEXT_NODE} from '../shared/HTMLNodeType';0
0
/**0
 * Given any node return the first leaf node without children.0
 *0
 * @param {DOMElement|DOMTextNode} node0
 * @return {DOMElement|DOMTextNode}0
 */0
function getLeafNode(node) {0
  while (node && node.firstChild) {0
    node = node.firstChild;0
  }0
  return node;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Get the next sibling within a container. This will walk up the0
 * DOM if a node's siblings have been exhausted.0
 *0
 * @param {DOMElement|DOMTextNode} node0
 * @return {?DOMElement|DOMTextNode}0
 */0
function getSiblingNode(node) {0
  while (node) {0
    if (node.nextSibling) {0
      return node.nextSibling;0
    }0
    node = node.parentNode;0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Get object describing the nodes which contain characters at offset.0
 *0
 * @param {DOMElement|DOMTextNode} root0
 * @param {number} offset0
 * @return {?object}0
 */0
function getNodeForCharacterOffset(root, offset) {0
  let node = getLeafNode(root);0
  let nodeStart = 0;0
  let nodeEnd = 0;0
0
  while (node) {0
    if (node.nodeType === TEXT_NODE) {0
      nodeEnd = nodeStart + node.textContent.length;0
0
      if (nodeStart <= offset && nodeEnd >= offset) {0
        return {0
          node: node,0
          offset: offset - nodeStart,0
        };0
      }0
0
      nodeStart = nodeEnd;0
    }0
0
    node = getLeafNode(getSiblingNode(node));0
  }0
}0
0
export default getNodeForCharacterOffset;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import {canUseDOM} from 'shared/ExecutionEnvironment';0
0
let contentKey = null;0
0
/**0
 * Gets the key used to access text content on a DOM node.0
 *0
 * @return {?string} Key used to access text content.0
 * @internal0
 */0
function getTextContentAccessor() {0
  if (!contentKey && canUseDOM) {0
    // Prefer textContent to innerText because many browsers support both but0
    // SVG <text> elements don't support innerText even when <div> does.0
    contentKey =0
      'textContent' in document.documentElement ? 'textContent' : 'innerText';0
  }0
  return contentKey;0
}0
0
export default getTextContentAccessor;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
type ValueTracker = {0
  getValue(): string,0
  setValue(value: string): void,0
  stopTracking(): void,0
};0
type WrapperState = {_valueTracker?: ?ValueTracker};0
type ElementWithValueTracker = HTMLInputElement & WrapperState;0
0
function isCheckable(elem: HTMLInputElement) {0
  const type = elem.type;0
  const nodeName = elem.nodeName;0
  return (0
    nodeName &&0
    nodeName.toLowerCase() === 'input' &&0
    (type === 'checkbox' || type === 'radio')0
  );0
}0
0
function getTracker(node: ElementWithValueTracker) {0
  return node._valueTracker;0
}0
0
function detachTracker(node: ElementWithValueTracker) {0
  node._valueTracker = null;0
}0
0
function getValueFromNode(node: HTMLInputElement): string {0
  let value = '';0
  if (!node) {0
    return value;0
  }0
0
  if (isCheckable(node)) {0
    value = node.checked ? 'true' : 'false';0
  } else {0
    value = node.value;0
  }0
0
  return value;0
}0
0
function trackValueOnNode(node: any): ?ValueTracker {0
  const valueField = isCheckable(node) ? 'checked' : 'value';0
  const descriptor = Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(0
    node.constructor.prototype,0
    valueField,0
  );0
0
  let currentValue = '' + node[valueField];0
0
  // if someone has already defined a value or Safari, then bail0
  // and don't track value will cause over reporting of changes,0
  // but it's better then a hard failure0
  // (needed for certain tests that spyOn input values and Safari)0
  if (0
    node.hasOwnProperty(valueField) ||0
    typeof descriptor === 'undefined' ||0
    typeof descriptor.get !== 'function' ||0
    typeof descriptor.set !== 'function'0
  ) {0
    return;0
  }0
  const {get, set} = descriptor;0
  Object.defineProperty(node, valueField, {0
    configurable: true,0
    get: function() {0
      return get.call(this);0
    },0
    set: function(value) {0
      currentValue = '' + value;0
      set.call(this, value);0
    },0
  });0
  // We could've passed this the first time0
  // but it triggers a bug in IE11 and Edge 14/15.0
  // Calling defineProperty() again should be equivalent.0
  // https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/117680
  Object.defineProperty(node, valueField, {0
    enumerable: descriptor.enumerable,0
  });0
0
  const tracker = {0
    getValue() {0
      return currentValue;0
    },0
    setValue(value) {0
      currentValue = '' + value;0
    },0
    stopTracking() {0
      detachTracker(node);0
      delete node[valueField];0
    },0
  };0
  return tracker;0
}0
0
export function track(node: ElementWithValueTracker) {0
  if (getTracker(node)) {0
    return;0
  }0
0
  // TODO: Once it's just Fiber we can move this to node._wrapperState0
  node._valueTracker = trackValueOnNode(node);0
}0
0
export function updateValueIfChanged(node: ElementWithValueTracker) {0
  if (!node) {0
    return false;0
  }0
0
  const tracker = getTracker(node);0
  // if there is no tracker at this point it's unlikely0
  // that trying again will succeed0
  if (!tracker) {0
    return true;0
  }0
0
  const lastValue = tracker.getValue();0
  const nextValue = getValueFromNode(node);0
  if (nextValue !== lastValue) {0
    tracker.setValue(nextValue);0
    return true;0
  }0
  return false;0
}0
0
export function stopTracking(node: ElementWithValueTracker) {0
  const tracker = getTracker(node);0
  if (tracker) {0
    tracker.stopTracking();0
  }0
}0

 */0

import type {ReactNodeList} from 'shared/ReactTypes';0
// TODO: This type is shared between the reconciler and ReactDOM, but will0
// eventually be lifted out to the renderer.0
import type {0
  FiberRoot,0
  Batch as FiberRootBatch,0
} from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiberRoot';0
import type {Container} from './ReactDOMHostConfig';0
0
import '../shared/checkReact';0
import './ReactDOMClientInjection';0
0
import * as DOMRenderer from 'react-reconciler/inline.dom';0
import * as ReactPortal from 'shared/ReactPortal';0
import {canUseDOM} from 'shared/ExecutionEnvironment';0
import * as ReactGenericBatching from 'events/ReactGenericBatching';0
import * as ReactControlledComponent from 'events/ReactControlledComponent';0
import * as EventPluginHub from 'events/EventPluginHub';0
import * as EventPluginRegistry from 'events/EventPluginRegistry';0
import * as EventPropagators from 'events/EventPropagators';0
import * as ReactInstanceMap from 'shared/ReactInstanceMap';0
import ReactVersion from 'shared/ReactVersion';0
import {ReactCurrentOwner} from 'shared/ReactGlobalSharedState';0
import getComponentName from 'shared/getComponentName';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import lowPriorityWarning from 'shared/lowPriorityWarning';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
import * as ReactDOMComponentTree from './ReactDOMComponentTree';0
import * as ReactDOMFiberComponent from './ReactDOMFiberComponent';0
import * as ReactDOMEventListener from '../events/ReactDOMEventListener';0
import {0
  ELEMENT_NODE,0
  COMMENT_NODE,0
  DOCUMENT_NODE,0
  DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT_NODE,0
} from '../shared/HTMLNodeType';0
import {ROOT_ATTRIBUTE_NAME} from '../shared/DOMProperty';0
0
let topLevelUpdateWarnings;0
let warnOnInvalidCallback;0
let didWarnAboutUnstableCreatePortal = false;0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  if (0
    typeof Map !== 'function' ||0
    // $FlowIssue Flow incorrectly thinks Map has no prototype0
    Map.prototype == null ||0
    typeof Map.prototype.forEach !== 'function' ||0
    typeof Set !== 'function' ||0
    // $FlowIssue Flow incorrectly thinks Set has no prototype0
    Set.prototype == null ||0
    typeof Set.prototype.clear !== 'function' ||0
    typeof Set.prototype.forEach !== 'function'0
  ) {0
    warning(0
      false,0
      'React depends on Map and Set built-in types. Make sure that you load a ' +0
        'polyfill in older browsers. https://fb.me/react-polyfills',0
    );0
  }0
0
  topLevelUpdateWarnings = (container: DOMContainer) => {0
    if (container._reactRootContainer && container.nodeType !== COMMENT_NODE) {0
      const hostInstance = DOMRenderer.findHostInstanceWithNoPortals(0
        container._reactRootContainer._internalRoot.current,0
      );0
      if (hostInstance) {0
        warning(0
          hostInstance.parentNode === container,0
          'render(...): It looks like the React-rendered content of this ' +0
            'container was removed without using React. This is not ' +0
            'supported and will cause errors. Instead, call ' +0
            'ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode to empty a container.',0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const isRootRenderedBySomeReact = !!container._reactRootContainer;0
    const rootEl = getReactRootElementInContainer(container);0
    const hasNonRootReactChild = !!(0
      rootEl && ReactDOMComponentTree.getInstanceFromNode(rootEl)0
    );0
0
    warning(0
      !hasNonRootReactChild || isRootRenderedBySomeReact,0
      'render(...): Replacing React-rendered children with a new root ' +0
        'component. If you intended to update the children of this node, ' +0
        'you should instead have the existing children update their state ' +0
        'and render the new components instead of calling ReactDOM.render.',0
    );0
0
    warning(0
      container.nodeType !== ELEMENT_NODE ||0
        !((container: any): Element).tagName ||0
        ((container: any): Element).tagName.toUpperCase() !== 'BODY',0
      'render(): Rendering components directly into document.body is ' +0
        'discouraged, since its children are often manipulated by third-party ' +0
        'scripts and browser extensions. This may lead to subtle ' +0
        'reconciliation issues. Try rendering into a container element created ' +0
        'for your app.',0
    );0
  };0
0
  warnOnInvalidCallback = function(callback: mixed, callerName: string) {0
    warning(0
      callback === null || typeof callback === 'function',0
      '%s(...): Expected the last optional `callback` argument to be a ' +0
        'function. Instead received: %s.',0
      callerName,0
      callback,0
    );0
  };0
}0
0
ReactControlledComponent.injection.injectFiberControlledHostComponent(0
  ReactDOMFiberComponent,0
);0
0
type DOMContainer =0
  | (Element & {0
      _reactRootContainer: ?Root,0
    })0
  | (Document & {0
      _reactRootContainer: ?Root,0
    });0
0
type Batch = FiberRootBatch & {0
  render(children: ReactNodeList): Work,0
  then(onComplete: () => mixed): void,0
  commit(): void,0
0
  // The ReactRoot constuctor is hoisted but the prototype methods are not. If0
  // we move ReactRoot to be above ReactBatch, the inverse error occurs.0
  // $FlowFixMe Hoisting issue.0
  _root: Root,0
  _hasChildren: boolean,0
  _children: ReactNodeList,0
0
  _callbacks: Array<() => mixed> | null,0
  _didComplete: boolean,0
};0
0
function ReactBatch(root: ReactRoot) {0
  const expirationTime = DOMRenderer.computeUniqueAsyncExpiration();0
  this._expirationTime = expirationTime;0
  this._root = root;0
  this._next = null;0
  this._callbacks = null;0
  this._didComplete = false;0
  this._hasChildren = false;0
  this._children = null;0
  this._defer = true;0
}0
ReactBatch.prototype.render = function(children: ReactNodeList) {0
  invariant(0
    this._defer,0
    'batch.render: Cannot render a batch that already committed.',0
  );0
  this._hasChildren = true;0
  this._children = children;0
  const internalRoot = this._root._internalRoot;0
  const expirationTime = this._expirationTime;0
  const work = new ReactWork();0
  DOMRenderer.updateContainerAtExpirationTime(0
    children,0
    internalRoot,0
    null,0
    expirationTime,0
    work._onCommit,0
  );0
  return work;0
};0
ReactBatch.prototype.then = function(onComplete: () => mixed) {0
  if (this._didComplete) {0
    onComplete();0
    return;0
  }0
  let callbacks = this._callbacks;0
  if (callbacks === null) {0
    callbacks = this._callbacks = [];0
  }0
  callbacks.push(onComplete);0
};0
ReactBatch.prototype.commit = function() {0
  const internalRoot = this._root._internalRoot;0
  let firstBatch = internalRoot.firstBatch;0
  invariant(0
    this._defer && firstBatch !== null,0
    'batch.commit: Cannot commit a batch multiple times.',0
  );0
0
  if (!this._hasChildren) {0
    // This batch is empty. Return.0
    this._next = null;0
    this._defer = false;0
    return;0
  }0
0
  let expirationTime = this._expirationTime;0
0
  // Ensure this is the first batch in the list.0
  if (firstBatch !== this) {0
    // This batch is not the earliest batch. We need to move it to the front.0
    // Update its expiration time to be the expiration time of the earliest0
    // batch, so that we can flush it without flushing the other batches.0
    if (this._hasChildren) {0
      expirationTime = this._expirationTime = firstBatch._expirationTime;0
      // Rendering this batch again ensures its children will be the final state0
      // when we flush (updates are processed in insertion order: last0
      // update wins).0
      // TODO: This forces a restart. Should we print a warning?0
      this.render(this._children);0
    }0
0
    // Remove the batch from the list.0
    let previous = null;0
    let batch = firstBatch;0
    while (batch !== this) {0
      previous = batch;0
      batch = batch._next;0
    }0
    invariant(0
      previous !== null,0
      'batch.commit: Cannot commit a batch multiple times.',0
    );0
    previous._next = batch._next;0
0
    // Add it to the front.0
    this._next = firstBatch;0
    firstBatch = internalRoot.firstBatch = this;0
  }0
0
  // Synchronously flush all the work up to this batch's expiration time.0
  this._defer = false;0
  DOMRenderer.flushRoot(internalRoot, expirationTime);0
0
  // Pop the batch from the list.0
  const next = this._next;0
  this._next = null;0
  firstBatch = internalRoot.firstBatch = next;0
0
  // Append the next earliest batch's children to the update queue.0
  if (firstBatch !== null && firstBatch._hasChildren) {0
    firstBatch.render(firstBatch._children);0
  }0
};0
ReactBatch.prototype._onComplete = function() {0
  if (this._didComplete) {0
    return;0
  }0
  this._didComplete = true;0
  const callbacks = this._callbacks;0
  if (callbacks === null) {0
    return;0
  }0
  // TODO: Error handling.0
  for (let i = 0; i < callbacks.length; i++) {0
    const callback = callbacks[i];0
    callback();0
  }0
};0
0
type Work = {0
  then(onCommit: () => mixed): void,0
  _onCommit: () => void,0
  _callbacks: Array<() => mixed> | null,0
  _didCommit: boolean,0
};0
0
function ReactWork() {0
  this._callbacks = null;0
  this._didCommit = false;0
  // TODO: Avoid need to bind by replacing callbacks in the update queue with0
  // list of Work objects.0
  this._onCommit = this._onCommit.bind(this);0
}0
ReactWork.prototype.then = function(onCommit: () => mixed): void {0
  if (this._didCommit) {0
    onCommit();0
    return;0
  }0
  let callbacks = this._callbacks;0
  if (callbacks === null) {0
    callbacks = this._callbacks = [];0
  }0
  callbacks.push(onCommit);0
};0
ReactWork.prototype._onCommit = function(): void {0
  if (this._didCommit) {0
    return;0
  }0
  this._didCommit = true;0
  const callbacks = this._callbacks;0
  if (callbacks === null) {0
    return;0
  }0
  // TODO: Error handling.0
  for (let i = 0; i < callbacks.length; i++) {0
    const callback = callbacks[i];0
    invariant(0
      typeof callback === 'function',0
      'Invalid argument passed as callback. Expected a function. Instead ' +0
        'received: %s',0
      callback,0
    );0
    callback();0
  }0
};0
0
type Root = {0
  render(children: ReactNodeList, callback: ?() => mixed): Work,0
  unmount(callback: ?() => mixed): Work,0
  legacy_renderSubtreeIntoContainer(0
    parentComponent: ?React$Component<any, any>,0
    children: ReactNodeList,0
    callback: ?() => mixed,0
  ): Work,0
  createBatch(): Batch,0
0
  _internalRoot: FiberRoot,0
};0
0
function ReactRoot(container: Container, isAsync: boolean, hydrate: boolean) {0
  const root = DOMRenderer.createContainer(container, isAsync, hydrate);0
  this._internalRoot = root;0
}0
ReactRoot.prototype.render = function(0
  children: ReactNodeList,0
  callback: ?() => mixed,0
): Work {0
  const root = this._internalRoot;0
  const work = new ReactWork();0
  callback = callback === undefined ? null : callback;0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    warnOnInvalidCallback(callback, 'render');0
  }0
  if (callback !== null) {0
    work.then(callback);0
  }0
  DOMRenderer.updateContainer(children, root, null, work._onCommit);0
  return work;0
};0
ReactRoot.prototype.unmount = function(callback: ?() => mixed): Work {0
  const root = this._internalRoot;0
  const work = new ReactWork();0
  callback = callback === undefined ? null : callback;0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    warnOnInvalidCallback(callback, 'render');0
  }0
  if (callback !== null) {0
    work.then(callback);0
  }0
  DOMRenderer.updateContainer(null, root, null, work._onCommit);0
  return work;0
};0
ReactRoot.prototype.legacy_renderSubtreeIntoContainer = function(0
  parentComponent: ?React$Component<any, any>,0
  children: ReactNodeList,0
  callback: ?() => mixed,0
): Work {0
  const root = this._internalRoot;0
  const work = new ReactWork();0
  callback = callback === undefined ? null : callback;0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    warnOnInvalidCallback(callback, 'render');0
  }0
  if (callback !== null) {0
    work.then(callback);0
  }0
  DOMRenderer.updateContainer(children, root, parentComponent, work._onCommit);0
  return work;0
};0
ReactRoot.prototype.createBatch = function(): Batch {0
  const batch = new ReactBatch(this);0
  const expirationTime = batch._expirationTime;0
0
  const internalRoot = this._internalRoot;0
  const firstBatch = internalRoot.firstBatch;0
  if (firstBatch === null) {0
    internalRoot.firstBatch = batch;0
    batch._next = null;0
  } else {0
    // Insert sorted by expiration time then insertion order0
    let insertAfter = null;0
    let insertBefore = firstBatch;0
    while (0
      insertBefore !== null &&0
      insertBefore._expirationTime <= expirationTime0
    ) {0
      insertAfter = insertBefore;0
      insertBefore = insertBefore._next;0
    }0
    batch._next = insertBefore;0
    if (insertAfter !== null) {0
      insertAfter._next = batch;0
    }0
  }0
0
  return batch;0
};0
0
/**0
 * True if the supplied DOM node is a valid node element.0
 *0
 * @param {?DOMElement} node The candidate DOM node.0
 * @return {boolean} True if the DOM is a valid DOM node.0
 * @internal0
 */0
function isValidContainer(node) {0
  return !!(0
    node &&0
    (node.nodeType === ELEMENT_NODE ||0
      node.nodeType === DOCUMENT_NODE ||0
      node.nodeType === DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT_NODE ||0
      (node.nodeType === COMMENT_NODE &&0
        node.nodeValue === ' react-mount-point-unstable '))0
  );0
}0
0
function getReactRootElementInContainer(container: any) {0
  if (!container) {0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  if (container.nodeType === DOCUMENT_NODE) {0
    return container.documentElement;0
  } else {0
    return container.firstChild;0
  }0
}0
0
function shouldHydrateDueToLegacyHeuristic(container) {0
  const rootElement = getReactRootElementInContainer(container);0
  return !!(0
    rootElement &&0
    rootElement.nodeType === ELEMENT_NODE &&0
    rootElement.hasAttribute(ROOT_ATTRIBUTE_NAME)0
  );0
}0
0
ReactGenericBatching.injection.injectRenderer(DOMRenderer);0
0
let warnedAboutHydrateAPI = false;0
0
function legacyCreateRootFromDOMContainer(0
  container: DOMContainer,0
  forceHydrate: boolean,0
): Root {0
  const shouldHydrate =0
    forceHydrate || shouldHydrateDueToLegacyHeuristic(container);0
  // First clear any existing content.0
  if (!shouldHydrate) {0
    let warned = false;0
    let rootSibling;0
    while ((rootSibling = container.lastChild)) {0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        if (0
          !warned &&0
          rootSibling.nodeType === ELEMENT_NODE &&0
          (rootSibling: any).hasAttribute(ROOT_ATTRIBUTE_NAME)0
        ) {0
          warned = true;0
          warning(0
            false,0
            'render(): Target node has markup rendered by React, but there ' +0
              'are unrelated nodes as well. This is most commonly caused by ' +0
              'white-space inserted around server-rendered markup.',0
          );0
        }0
      }0
      container.removeChild(rootSibling);0
    }0
  }0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (shouldHydrate && !forceHydrate && !warnedAboutHydrateAPI) {0
      warnedAboutHydrateAPI = true;0
      lowPriorityWarning(0
        false,0
        'render(): Calling ReactDOM.render() to hydrate server-rendered markup ' +0
          'will stop working in React v17. Replace the ReactDOM.render() call ' +0
          'with ReactDOM.hydrate() if you want React to attach to the server HTML.',0
      );0
    }0
  }0
  // Legacy roots are not async by default.0
  const isAsync = false;0
  return new ReactRoot(container, isAsync, shouldHydrate);0
}0
0
function legacyRenderSubtreeIntoContainer(0
  parentComponent: ?React$Component<any, any>,0
  children: ReactNodeList,0
  container: DOMContainer,0
  forceHydrate: boolean,0
  callback: ?Function,0
) {0
  // TODO: Ensure all entry points contain this check0
  invariant(0
    isValidContainer(container),0
    'Target container is not a DOM element.',0
  );0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    topLevelUpdateWarnings(container);0
  }0
0
  // TODO: Without `any` type, Flow says "Property cannot be accessed on any0
  // member of intersection type." Whyyyyyy.0
  let root: Root = (container._reactRootContainer: any);0
  if (!root) {0
    // Initial mount0
    root = container._reactRootContainer = legacyCreateRootFromDOMContainer(0
      container,0
      forceHydrate,0
    );0
    if (typeof callback === 'function') {0
      const originalCallback = callback;0
      callback = function() {0
        const instance = DOMRenderer.getPublicRootInstance(root._internalRoot);0
        originalCallback.call(instance);0
      };0
    }0
    // Initial mount should not be batched.0
    DOMRenderer.unbatchedUpdates(() => {0
      if (parentComponent != null) {0
        root.legacy_renderSubtreeIntoContainer(0
          parentComponent,0
          children,0
          callback,0
        );0
      } else {0
        root.render(children, callback);0
      }0
    });0
  } else {0
    if (typeof callback === 'function') {0
      const originalCallback = callback;0
      callback = function() {0
        const instance = DOMRenderer.getPublicRootInstance(root._internalRoot);0
        originalCallback.call(instance);0
      };0
    }0
    // Update0
    if (parentComponent != null) {0
      root.legacy_renderSubtreeIntoContainer(0
        parentComponent,0
        children,0
        callback,0
      );0
    } else {0
      root.render(children, callback);0
    }0
  }0
  return DOMRenderer.getPublicRootInstance(root._internalRoot);0
}0
0
function createPortal(0
  children: ReactNodeList,0
  container: DOMContainer,0
  key: ?string = null,0
) {0
  invariant(0
    isValidContainer(container),0
    'Target container is not a DOM element.',0
  );0
  // TODO: pass ReactDOM portal implementation as third argument0
  return ReactPortal.createPortal(children, container, null, key);0
}0
0
const ReactDOM: Object = {0
  createPortal,0
0
  findDOMNode(0
    componentOrElement: Element | ?React$Component<any, any>,0
  ): null | Element | Text {0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      let owner = (ReactCurrentOwner.current: any);0
      if (owner !== null && owner.stateNode !== null) {0
        const warnedAboutRefsInRender =0
          owner.stateNode._warnedAboutRefsInRender;0
        warning(0
          warnedAboutRefsInRender,0
          '%s is accessing findDOMNode inside its render(). ' +0
            'render() should be a pure function of props and state. It should ' +0
            'never access something that requires stale data from the previous ' +0
            'render, such as refs. Move this logic to componentDidMount and ' +0
            'componentDidUpdate instead.',0
          getComponentName(owner) || 'A component',0
        );0
        owner.stateNode._warnedAboutRefsInRender = true;0
      }0
    }0
    if (componentOrElement == null) {0
      return null;0
    }0
    if ((componentOrElement: any).nodeType === ELEMENT_NODE) {0
      return (componentOrElement: any);0
    }0
0
    return DOMRenderer.findHostInstance(componentOrElement);0
  },0
0
  hydrate(element: React$Node, container: DOMContainer, callback: ?Function) {0
    // TODO: throw or warn if we couldn't hydrate?0
    return legacyRenderSubtreeIntoContainer(0
      null,0
      element,0
      container,0
      true,0
      callback,0
    );0
  },0
0
  render(0
    element: React$Element<any>,0
    container: DOMContainer,0
    callback: ?Function,0
  ) {0
    return legacyRenderSubtreeIntoContainer(0
      null,0
      element,0
      container,0
      false,0
      callback,0
    );0
  },0
0
  unstable_renderSubtreeIntoContainer(0
    parentComponent: React$Component<any, any>,0
    element: React$Element<any>,0
    containerNode: DOMContainer,0
    callback: ?Function,0
  ) {0
    invariant(0
      parentComponent != null && ReactInstanceMap.has(parentComponent),0
      'parentComponent must be a valid React Component',0
    );0
    return legacyRenderSubtreeIntoContainer(0
      parentComponent,0
      element,0
      containerNode,0
      false,0
      callback,0
    );0
  },0
0
  unmountComponentAtNode(container: DOMContainer) {0
    invariant(0
      isValidContainer(container),0
      'unmountComponentAtNode(...): Target container is not a DOM element.',0
    );0
0
    if (container._reactRootContainer) {0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        const rootEl = getReactRootElementInContainer(container);0
        const renderedByDifferentReact =0
          rootEl && !ReactDOMComponentTree.getInstanceFromNode(rootEl);0
        warning(0
          !renderedByDifferentReact,0
          "unmountComponentAtNode(): The node you're attempting to unmount " +0
            'was rendered by another copy of React.',0
        );0
      }0
0
      // Unmount should not be batched.0
      DOMRenderer.unbatchedUpdates(() => {0
        legacyRenderSubtreeIntoContainer(null, null, container, false, () => {0
          container._reactRootContainer = null;0
        });0
      });0
      // If you call unmountComponentAtNode twice in quick succession, you'll0
      // get `true` twice. That's probably fine?0
      return true;0
    } else {0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        const rootEl = getReactRootElementInContainer(container);0
        const hasNonRootReactChild = !!(0
          rootEl && ReactDOMComponentTree.getInstanceFromNode(rootEl)0
        );0
0
        // Check if the container itself is a React root node.0
        const isContainerReactRoot =0
          container.nodeType === 1 &&0
          isValidContainer(container.parentNode) &&0
          !!container.parentNode._reactRootContainer;0
0
        warning(0
          !hasNonRootReactChild,0
          "unmountComponentAtNode(): The node you're attempting to unmount " +0
            'was rendered by React and is not a top-level container. %s',0
          isContainerReactRoot0
            ? 'You may have accidentally passed in a React root node instead ' +0
              'of its container.'0
            : 'Instead, have the parent component update its state and ' +0
              'rerender in order to remove this component.',0
        );0
      }0
0
      return false;0
    }0
  },0
0
  // Temporary alias since we already shipped React 16 RC with it.0
  // TODO: remove in React 17.0
  unstable_createPortal(...args) {0
    if (!didWarnAboutUnstableCreatePortal) {0
      didWarnAboutUnstableCreatePortal = true;0
      lowPriorityWarning(0
        false,0
        'The ReactDOM.unstable_createPortal() alias has been deprecated, ' +0
          'and will be removed in React 17+. Update your code to use ' +0
          'ReactDOM.createPortal() instead. It has the exact same API, ' +0
          'but without the "unstable_" prefix.',0
      );0
    }0
    return createPortal(...args);0
  },0
0
  unstable_batchedUpdates: DOMRenderer.batchedUpdates,0
0
  unstable_deferredUpdates: DOMRenderer.deferredUpdates,0
0
  unstable_interactiveUpdates: DOMRenderer.interactiveUpdates,0
0
  flushSync: DOMRenderer.flushSync,0
0
  unstable_flushControlled: DOMRenderer.flushControlled,0
0
  __SECRET_INTERNALS_DO_NOT_USE_OR_YOU_WILL_BE_FIRED: {0
    // For TapEventPlugin which is popular in open source0
    EventPluginHub,0
    // Used by test-utils0
    EventPluginRegistry,0
    EventPropagators,0
    ReactControlledComponent,0
    ReactDOMComponentTree,0
    ReactDOMEventListener,0
  },0
};0
0
type RootOptions = {0
  hydrate?: boolean,0
};0
0
ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot = function createRoot(0
  container: DOMContainer,0
  options?: RootOptions,0
): ReactRoot {0
  const hydrate = options != null && options.hydrate === true;0
  return new ReactRoot(container, true, hydrate);0
};0
0
const foundDevTools = DOMRenderer.injectIntoDevTools({0
  findFiberByHostInstance: ReactDOMComponentTree.getClosestInstanceFromNode,0
  bundleType: __DEV__ ? 1 : 0,0
  version: ReactVersion,0
  rendererPackageName: 'react-dom',0
});0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  if (!foundDevTools && canUseDOM && window.top === window.self) {0
    // If we're in Chrome or Firefox, provide a download link if not installed.0
    if (0
      (navigator.userAgent.indexOf('Chrome') > -1 &&0
        navigator.userAgent.indexOf('Edge') === -1) ||0
      navigator.userAgent.indexOf('Firefox') > -10
    ) {0
      const protocol = window.location.protocol;0
      // Don't warn in exotic cases like chrome-extension://.0
      if (/^(https?|file):$/.test(protocol)) {0
        console.info(0
          '%cDownload the React DevTools ' +0
            'for a better development experience: ' +0
            'https://fb.me/react-devtools' +0
            (protocol === 'file:'0
              ? '\nYou might need to use a local HTTP server (instead of file://): ' +0
                'https://fb.me/react-devtools-faq'0
              : ''),0
          'font-weight:bold',0
        );0
      }0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
export default ReactDOM;0

import * as EventPluginUtils from 'events/EventPluginUtils';0

import * as ReactDOMComponentTree from './ReactDOMComponentTree';0
import BeforeInputEventPlugin from '../events/BeforeInputEventPlugin';0
import ChangeEventPlugin from '../events/ChangeEventPlugin';0
import DOMEventPluginOrder from '../events/DOMEventPluginOrder';0
import EnterLeaveEventPlugin from '../events/EnterLeaveEventPlugin';0
import SelectEventPlugin from '../events/SelectEventPlugin';0
import SimpleEventPlugin from '../events/SimpleEventPlugin';0
0
/**0
 * Inject modules for resolving DOM hierarchy and plugin ordering.0
 */0
EventPluginHub.injection.injectEventPluginOrder(DOMEventPluginOrder);0
EventPluginUtils.injection.injectComponentTree(ReactDOMComponentTree);0
0
/**0
 * Some important event plugins included by default (without having to require0
 * them).0
 */0
EventPluginHub.injection.injectEventPluginsByName({0
  SimpleEventPlugin: SimpleEventPlugin,0
  EnterLeaveEventPlugin: EnterLeaveEventPlugin,0
  ChangeEventPlugin: ChangeEventPlugin,0
  SelectEventPlugin: SelectEventPlugin,0
  BeforeInputEventPlugin: BeforeInputEventPlugin,0
});0

import {HostComponent, HostText} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfWork';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
const randomKey = Math.random()0
  .toString(36)0
  .slice(2);0
const internalInstanceKey = '__reactInternalInstance$' + randomKey;0
const internalEventHandlersKey = '__reactEventHandlers$' + randomKey;0
0
export function precacheFiberNode(hostInst, node) {0
  node[internalInstanceKey] = hostInst;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Given a DOM node, return the closest ReactDOMComponent or0
 * ReactDOMTextComponent instance ancestor.0
 */0
export function getClosestInstanceFromNode(node) {0
  if (node[internalInstanceKey]) {0
    return node[internalInstanceKey];0
  }0
0
  while (!node[internalInstanceKey]) {0
    if (node.parentNode) {0
      node = node.parentNode;0
    } else {0
      // Top of the tree. This node must not be part of a React tree (or is0
      // unmounted, potentially).0
      return null;0
    }0
  }0
0
  let inst = node[internalInstanceKey];0
  if (inst.tag === HostComponent || inst.tag === HostText) {0
    // In Fiber, this will always be the deepest root.0
    return inst;0
  }0
0
  return null;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Given a DOM node, return the ReactDOMComponent or ReactDOMTextComponent0
 * instance, or null if the node was not rendered by this React.0
 */0
export function getInstanceFromNode(node) {0
  const inst = node[internalInstanceKey];0
  if (inst) {0
    if (inst.tag === HostComponent || inst.tag === HostText) {0
      return inst;0
    } else {0
      return null;0
    }0
  }0
  return null;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Given a ReactDOMComponent or ReactDOMTextComponent, return the corresponding0
 * DOM node.0
 */0
export function getNodeFromInstance(inst) {0
  if (inst.tag === HostComponent || inst.tag === HostText) {0
    // In Fiber this, is just the state node right now. We assume it will be0
    // a host component or host text.0
    return inst.stateNode;0
  }0
0
  // Without this first invariant, passing a non-DOM-component triggers the next0
  // invariant for a missing parent, which is super confusing.0
  invariant(false, 'getNodeFromInstance: Invalid argument.');0
}0
0
export function getFiberCurrentPropsFromNode(node) {0
  return node[internalEventHandlersKey] || null;0
}0
0
export function updateFiberProps(node, props) {0
  node[internalEventHandlersKey] = props;0
}0

import TapEventPlugin from '../events/TapEventPlugin';0
0
Object.assign(0
  (ReactDOM.__SECRET_INTERNALS_DO_NOT_USE_OR_YOU_WILL_BE_FIRED: any),0
  {0
    // These are real internal dependencies that are trickier to remove:0
    ReactBrowserEventEmitter,0
    ReactFiberTreeReflection,0
    ReactDOMComponentTree,0
    ReactInstanceMap,0
    // Used by www msite:0
    TapEventPlugin,0
    // Perf experiment0
    addUserTimingListener,0
  },0
);0
0
