// TODO: direct imports like some-package/src/* are bad. Fix me.0
import ReactDebugCurrentFiber from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactDebugCurrentFiber';0
import {registrationNameModules} from 'events/EventPluginRegistry';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
import * as DOMPropertyOperations from './DOMPropertyOperations';0
import * as ReactDOMFiberInput from './ReactDOMFiberInput';0
import * as ReactDOMFiberOption from './ReactDOMFiberOption';0
import * as ReactDOMFiberSelect from './ReactDOMFiberSelect';0
import * as ReactDOMFiberTextarea from './ReactDOMFiberTextarea';0
import * as inputValueTracking from './inputValueTracking';0
import setInnerHTML from './setInnerHTML';0
import setTextContent from './setTextContent';0
import {0
  TOP_ERROR,0
  TOP_INVALID,0
  TOP_LOAD,0
  TOP_RESET,0
  TOP_SUBMIT,0
  TOP_TOGGLE,0
} from '../events/DOMTopLevelEventTypes';0
import {listenTo, trapBubbledEvent} from '../events/ReactBrowserEventEmitter';0
import {mediaEventTypes} from '../events/DOMTopLevelEventTypes';0
import * as CSSPropertyOperations from '../shared/CSSPropertyOperations';0
import {Namespaces, getIntrinsicNamespace} from '../shared/DOMNamespaces';0
import {0
  getPropertyInfo,0
  shouldIgnoreAttribute,0
  shouldRemoveAttribute,0
} from '../shared/DOMProperty';0
import assertValidProps from '../shared/assertValidProps';0
import {DOCUMENT_NODE, DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT_NODE} from '../shared/HTMLNodeType';0
import isCustomComponent from '../shared/isCustomComponent';0
import possibleStandardNames from '../shared/possibleStandardNames';0
import {validateProperties as validateARIAProperties} from '../shared/ReactDOMInvalidARIAHook';0
import {validateProperties as validateInputProperties} from '../shared/ReactDOMNullInputValuePropHook';0
import {validateProperties as validateUnknownProperties} from '../shared/ReactDOMUnknownPropertyHook';0
0
const {0
  getCurrentFiberOwnerName,0
  getCurrentFiberStackAddendum,0
} = ReactDebugCurrentFiber;0
let didWarnInvalidHydration = false;0
let didWarnShadyDOM = false;0
0
const DANGEROUSLY_SET_INNER_HTML = 'dangerouslySetInnerHTML';0
const SUPPRESS_CONTENT_EDITABLE_WARNING = 'suppressContentEditableWarning';0
const SUPPRESS_HYDRATION_WARNING = 'suppressHydrationWarning';0
const AUTOFOCUS = 'autoFocus';0
const CHILDREN = 'children';0
const STYLE = 'style';0
const HTML = '__html';0
0
const {html: HTML_NAMESPACE} = Namespaces;0
0
let getStack = () => '';0
0
let warnedUnknownTags;0
let suppressHydrationWarning;0
0
let validatePropertiesInDevelopment;0
let warnForTextDifference;0
let warnForPropDifference;0
let warnForExtraAttributes;0
let warnForInvalidEventListener;0
0
let normalizeMarkupForTextOrAttribute;0
let normalizeHTML;0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  getStack = getCurrentFiberStackAddendum;0
0
  warnedUnknownTags = {0
    // Chrome is the only major browser not shipping <time>. But as of July0
    // 2017 it intends to ship it due to widespread usage. We intentionally0
    // *don't* warn for <time> even if it's unrecognized by Chrome because0
    // it soon will be, and many apps have been using it anyway.0
    time: true,0
    // There are working polyfills for <dialog>. Let people use it.0
    dialog: true,0
  };0
0
  validatePropertiesInDevelopment = function(type, props) {0
    validateARIAProperties(type, props);0
    validateInputProperties(type, props);0
    validateUnknownProperties(type, props, /* canUseEventSystem */ true);0
  };0
0
  // HTML parsing normalizes CR and CRLF to LF.0
  // It also can turn \u0000 into \uFFFD inside attributes.0
  // https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/single-page.html#preprocessing-the-input-stream0
  // If we have a mismatch, it might be caused by that.0
  // We will still patch up in this case but not fire the warning.0
  const NORMALIZE_NEWLINES_REGEX = /\r\n?/g;0
  const NORMALIZE_NULL_AND_REPLACEMENT_REGEX = /\u0000|\uFFFD/g;0
0
  normalizeMarkupForTextOrAttribute = function(markup: mixed): string {0
    const markupString =0
      typeof markup === 'string' ? markup : '' + (markup: any);0
    return markupString0
      .replace(NORMALIZE_NEWLINES_REGEX, '\n')0
      .replace(NORMALIZE_NULL_AND_REPLACEMENT_REGEX, '');0
  };0
0
  warnForTextDifference = function(0
    serverText: string,0
    clientText: string | number,0
  ) {0
    if (didWarnInvalidHydration) {0
      return;0
    }0
    const normalizedClientText = normalizeMarkupForTextOrAttribute(clientText);0
    const normalizedServerText = normalizeMarkupForTextOrAttribute(serverText);0
    if (normalizedServerText === normalizedClientText) {0
      return;0
    }0
    didWarnInvalidHydration = true;0
    warning(0
      false,0
      'Text content did not match. Server: "%s" Client: "%s"',0
      normalizedServerText,0
      normalizedClientText,0
    );0
  };0
0
  warnForPropDifference = function(0
    propName: string,0
    serverValue: mixed,0
    clientValue: mixed,0
  ) {0
    if (didWarnInvalidHydration) {0
      return;0
    }0
    const normalizedClientValue = normalizeMarkupForTextOrAttribute(0
      clientValue,0
    );0
    const normalizedServerValue = normalizeMarkupForTextOrAttribute(0
      serverValue,0
    );0
    if (normalizedServerValue === normalizedClientValue) {0
      return;0
    }0
    didWarnInvalidHydration = true;0
    warning(0
      false,0
      'Prop `%s` did not match. Server: %s Client: %s',0
      propName,0
      JSON.stringify(normalizedServerValue),0
      JSON.stringify(normalizedClientValue),0
    );0
  };0
0
  warnForExtraAttributes = function(attributeNames: Set<string>) {0
    if (didWarnInvalidHydration) {0
      return;0
    }0
    didWarnInvalidHydration = true;0
    const names = [];0
    attributeNames.forEach(function(name) {0
      names.push(name);0
    });0
    warning(false, 'Extra attributes from the server: %s', names);0
  };0
0
  warnForInvalidEventListener = function(registrationName, listener) {0
    if (listener === false) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'Expected `%s` listener to be a function, instead got `false`.\n\n' +0
          'If you used to conditionally omit it with %s={condition && value}, ' +0
          'pass %s={condition ? value : undefined} instead.%s',0
        registrationName,0
        registrationName,0
        registrationName,0
        getCurrentFiberStackAddendum(),0
      );0
    } else {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'Expected `%s` listener to be a function, instead got a value of `%s` type.%s',0
        registrationName,0
        typeof listener,0
        getCurrentFiberStackAddendum(),0
      );0
    }0
  };0
0
  // Parse the HTML and read it back to normalize the HTML string so that it0
  // can be used for comparison.0
  normalizeHTML = function(parent: Element, html: string) {0
    // We could have created a separate document here to avoid0
    // re-initializing custom elements if they exist. But this breaks0
    // how <noscript> is being handled. So we use the same document.0
    // See the discussion in https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/11157.0
    const testElement =0
      parent.namespaceURI === HTML_NAMESPACE0
        ? parent.ownerDocument.createElement(parent.tagName)0
        : parent.ownerDocument.createElementNS(0
            (parent.namespaceURI: any),0
            parent.tagName,0
          );0
    testElement.innerHTML = html;0
    return testElement.innerHTML;0
  };0
}0
0
function ensureListeningTo(rootContainerElement, registrationName) {0
  const isDocumentOrFragment =0
    rootContainerElement.nodeType === DOCUMENT_NODE ||0
    rootContainerElement.nodeType === DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT_NODE;0
  const doc = isDocumentOrFragment0
    ? rootContainerElement0
    : rootContainerElement.ownerDocument;0
  listenTo(registrationName, doc);0
}0
0
function getOwnerDocumentFromRootContainer(0
  rootContainerElement: Element | Document,0
): Document {0
  return rootContainerElement.nodeType === DOCUMENT_NODE0
    ? (rootContainerElement: any)0
    : rootContainerElement.ownerDocument;0
}0
0
function noop() {}0
0
function trapClickOnNonInteractiveElement(node: HTMLElement) {0
  // Mobile Safari does not fire properly bubble click events on0
  // non-interactive elements, which means delegated click listeners do not0
  // fire. The workaround for this bug involves attaching an empty click0
  // listener on the target node.0
  // http://www.quirksmode.org/blog/archives/2010/09/click_event_del.html0
  // Just set it using the onclick property so that we don't have to manage any0
  // bookkeeping for it. Not sure if we need to clear it when the listener is0
  // removed.0
  // TODO: Only do this for the relevant Safaris maybe?0
  node.onclick = noop;0
}0
0
function setInitialDOMProperties(0
  tag: string,0
  domElement: Element,0
  rootContainerElement: Element | Document,0
  nextProps: Object,0
  isCustomComponentTag: boolean,0
): void {0
  for (const propKey in nextProps) {0
    if (!nextProps.hasOwnProperty(propKey)) {0
      continue;0
    }0
    const nextProp = nextProps[propKey];0
    if (propKey === STYLE) {0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        if (nextProp) {0
          // Freeze the next style object so that we can assume it won't be0
          // mutated. We have already warned for this in the past.0
          Object.freeze(nextProp);0
        }0
      }0
      // Relies on `updateStylesByID` not mutating `styleUpdates`.0
      CSSPropertyOperations.setValueForStyles(domElement, nextProp, getStack);0
    } else if (propKey === DANGEROUSLY_SET_INNER_HTML) {0
      const nextHtml = nextProp ? nextProp[HTML] : undefined;0
      if (nextHtml != null) {0
        setInnerHTML(domElement, nextHtml);0
      }0
    } else if (propKey === CHILDREN) {0
      if (typeof nextProp === 'string') {0
        // Avoid setting initial textContent when the text is empty. In IE11 setting0
        // textContent on a <textarea> will cause the placeholder to not0
        // show within the <textarea> until it has been focused and blurred again.0
        // https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/6731#issuecomment-2548745530
        const canSetTextContent = tag !== 'textarea' || nextProp !== '';0
        if (canSetTextContent) {0
          setTextContent(domElement, nextProp);0
        }0
      } else if (typeof nextProp === 'number') {0
        setTextContent(domElement, '' + nextProp);0
      }0
    } else if (0
      propKey === SUPPRESS_CONTENT_EDITABLE_WARNING ||0
      propKey === SUPPRESS_HYDRATION_WARNING0
    ) {0
      // Noop0
    } else if (propKey === AUTOFOCUS) {0
      // We polyfill it separately on the client during commit.0
      // We blacklist it here rather than in the property list because we emit it in SSR.0
    } else if (registrationNameModules.hasOwnProperty(propKey)) {0
      if (nextProp != null) {0
        if (__DEV__ && typeof nextProp !== 'function') {0
          warnForInvalidEventListener(propKey, nextProp);0
        }0
        ensureListeningTo(rootContainerElement, propKey);0
      }0
    } else if (nextProp != null) {0
      DOMPropertyOperations.setValueForProperty(0
        domElement,0
        propKey,0
        nextProp,0
        isCustomComponentTag,0
      );0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function updateDOMProperties(0
  domElement: Element,0
  updatePayload: Array<any>,0
  wasCustomComponentTag: boolean,0
  isCustomComponentTag: boolean,0
): void {0
  // TODO: Handle wasCustomComponentTag0
  for (let i = 0; i < updatePayload.length; i += 2) {0
    const propKey = updatePayload[i];0
    const propValue = updatePayload[i + 1];0
    if (propKey === STYLE) {0
      CSSPropertyOperations.setValueForStyles(domElement, propValue, getStack);0
    } else if (propKey === DANGEROUSLY_SET_INNER_HTML) {0
      setInnerHTML(domElement, propValue);0
    } else if (propKey === CHILDREN) {0
      setTextContent(domElement, propValue);0
    } else {0
      DOMPropertyOperations.setValueForProperty(0
        domElement,0
        propKey,0
        propValue,0
        isCustomComponentTag,0
      );0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
export function createElement(0
  type: string,0
  props: Object,0
  rootContainerElement: Element | Document,0
  parentNamespace: string,0
): Element {0
  let isCustomComponentTag;0
0
  // We create tags in the namespace of their parent container, except HTML0
  // tags get no namespace.0
  const ownerDocument: Document = getOwnerDocumentFromRootContainer(0
    rootContainerElement,0
  );0
  let domElement: Element;0
  let namespaceURI = parentNamespace;0
  if (namespaceURI === HTML_NAMESPACE) {0
    namespaceURI = getIntrinsicNamespace(type);0
  }0
  if (namespaceURI === HTML_NAMESPACE) {0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      isCustomComponentTag = isCustomComponent(type, props);0
      // Should this check be gated by parent namespace? Not sure we want to0
      // allow <SVG> or <mATH>.0
      warning(0
        isCustomComponentTag || type === type.toLowerCase(),0
        '<%s /> is using incorrect casing. ' +0
          'Use PascalCase for React components, ' +0
          'or lowercase for HTML elements.',0
        type,0
      );0
    }0
0
    if (type === 'script') {0
      // Create the script via .innerHTML so its "parser-inserted" flag is0
      // set to true and it does not execute0
      const div = ownerDocument.createElement('div');0
      div.innerHTML = '<script><' + '/script>'; // eslint-disable-line0
      // This is guaranteed to yield a script element.0
      const firstChild = ((div.firstChild: any): HTMLScriptElement);0
      domElement = div.removeChild(firstChild);0
    } else if (typeof props.is === 'string') {0
      // $FlowIssue `createElement` should be updated for Web Components0
      domElement = ownerDocument.createElement(type, {is: props.is});0
    } else {0
      // Separate else branch instead of using `props.is || undefined` above because of a Firefox bug.0
      // See discussion in https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/68960
      // and discussion in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=12762400
      domElement = ownerDocument.createElement(type);0
    }0
  } else {0
    domElement = ownerDocument.createElementNS(namespaceURI, type);0
  }0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (namespaceURI === HTML_NAMESPACE) {0
      if (0
        !isCustomComponentTag &&0
        Object.prototype.toString.call(domElement) ===0
          '[object HTMLUnknownElement]' &&0
        !Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty.call(warnedUnknownTags, type)0
      ) {0
        warnedUnknownTags[type] = true;0
        warning(0
          false,0
          'The tag <%s> is unrecognized in this browser. ' +0
            'If you meant to render a React component, start its name with ' +0
            'an uppercase letter.',0
          type,0
        );0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  return domElement;0
}0
0
export function createTextNode(0
  text: string,0
  rootContainerElement: Element | Document,0
): Text {0
  return getOwnerDocumentFromRootContainer(rootContainerElement).createTextNode(0
    text,0
  );0
}0
0
export function setInitialProperties(0
  domElement: Element,0
  tag: string,0
  rawProps: Object,0
  rootContainerElement: Element | Document,0
): void {0
  const isCustomComponentTag = isCustomComponent(tag, rawProps);0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    validatePropertiesInDevelopment(tag, rawProps);0
    if (0
      isCustomComponentTag &&0
      !didWarnShadyDOM &&0
      (domElement: any).shadyRoot0
    ) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        '%s is using shady DOM. Using shady DOM with React can ' +0
          'cause things to break subtly.',0
        getCurrentFiberOwnerName() || 'A component',0
      );0
      didWarnShadyDOM = true;0
    }0
  }0
0
  // TODO: Make sure that we check isMounted before firing any of these events.0
  let props: Object;0
  switch (tag) {0
    case 'iframe':0
    case 'object':0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_LOAD, domElement);0
      props = rawProps;0
      break;0
    case 'video':0
    case 'audio':0
      // Create listener for each media event0
      for (let i = 0; i < mediaEventTypes.length; i++) {0
        trapBubbledEvent(mediaEventTypes[i], domElement);0
      }0
      props = rawProps;0
      break;0
    case 'source':0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_ERROR, domElement);0
      props = rawProps;0
      break;0
    case 'img':0
    case 'image':0
    case 'link':0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_ERROR, domElement);0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_LOAD, domElement);0
      props = rawProps;0
      break;0
    case 'form':0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_RESET, domElement);0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_SUBMIT, domElement);0
      props = rawProps;0
      break;0
    case 'details':0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_TOGGLE, domElement);0
      props = rawProps;0
      break;0
    case 'input':0
      ReactDOMFiberInput.initWrapperState(domElement, rawProps);0
      props = ReactDOMFiberInput.getHostProps(domElement, rawProps);0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_INVALID, domElement);0
      // For controlled components we always need to ensure we're listening0
      // to onChange. Even if there is no listener.0
      ensureListeningTo(rootContainerElement, 'onChange');0
      break;0
    case 'option':0
      ReactDOMFiberOption.validateProps(domElement, rawProps);0
      props = ReactDOMFiberOption.getHostProps(domElement, rawProps);0
      break;0
    case 'select':0
      ReactDOMFiberSelect.initWrapperState(domElement, rawProps);0
      props = ReactDOMFiberSelect.getHostProps(domElement, rawProps);0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_INVALID, domElement);0
      // For controlled components we always need to ensure we're listening0
      // to onChange. Even if there is no listener.0
      ensureListeningTo(rootContainerElement, 'onChange');0
      break;0
    case 'textarea':0
      ReactDOMFiberTextarea.initWrapperState(domElement, rawProps);0
      props = ReactDOMFiberTextarea.getHostProps(domElement, rawProps);0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_INVALID, domElement);0
      // For controlled components we always need to ensure we're listening0
      // to onChange. Even if there is no listener.0
      ensureListeningTo(rootContainerElement, 'onChange');0
      break;0
    default:0
      props = rawProps;0
  }0
0
  assertValidProps(tag, props, getStack);0
0
  setInitialDOMProperties(0
    tag,0
    domElement,0
    rootContainerElement,0
    props,0
    isCustomComponentTag,0
  );0
0
  switch (tag) {0
    case 'input':0
      // TODO: Make sure we check if this is still unmounted or do any clean0
      // up necessary since we never stop tracking anymore.0
      inputValueTracking.track((domElement: any));0
      ReactDOMFiberInput.postMountWrapper(domElement, rawProps, false);0
      break;0
    case 'textarea':0
      // TODO: Make sure we check if this is still unmounted or do any clean0
      // up necessary since we never stop tracking anymore.0
      inputValueTracking.track((domElement: any));0
      ReactDOMFiberTextarea.postMountWrapper(domElement, rawProps);0
      break;0
    case 'option':0
      ReactDOMFiberOption.postMountWrapper(domElement, rawProps);0
      break;0
    case 'select':0
      ReactDOMFiberSelect.postMountWrapper(domElement, rawProps);0
      break;0
    default:0
      if (typeof props.onClick === 'function') {0
        // TODO: This cast may not be sound for SVG, MathML or custom elements.0
        trapClickOnNonInteractiveElement(((domElement: any): HTMLElement));0
      }0
      break;0
  }0
}0
0
// Calculate the diff between the two objects.0
export function diffProperties(0
  domElement: Element,0
  tag: string,0
  lastRawProps: Object,0
  nextRawProps: Object,0
  rootContainerElement: Element | Document,0
): null | Array<mixed> {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    validatePropertiesInDevelopment(tag, nextRawProps);0
  }0
0
  let updatePayload: null | Array<any> = null;0
0
  let lastProps: Object;0
  let nextProps: Object;0
  switch (tag) {0
    case 'input':0
      lastProps = ReactDOMFiberInput.getHostProps(domElement, lastRawProps);0
      nextProps = ReactDOMFiberInput.getHostProps(domElement, nextRawProps);0
      updatePayload = [];0
      break;0
    case 'option':0
      lastProps = ReactDOMFiberOption.getHostProps(domElement, lastRawProps);0
      nextProps = ReactDOMFiberOption.getHostProps(domElement, nextRawProps);0
      updatePayload = [];0
      break;0
    case 'select':0
      lastProps = ReactDOMFiberSelect.getHostProps(domElement, lastRawProps);0
      nextProps = ReactDOMFiberSelect.getHostProps(domElement, nextRawProps);0
      updatePayload = [];0
      break;0
    case 'textarea':0
      lastProps = ReactDOMFiberTextarea.getHostProps(domElement, lastRawProps);0
      nextProps = ReactDOMFiberTextarea.getHostProps(domElement, nextRawProps);0
      updatePayload = [];0
      break;0
    default:0
      lastProps = lastRawProps;0
      nextProps = nextRawProps;0
      if (0
        typeof lastProps.onClick !== 'function' &&0
        typeof nextProps.onClick === 'function'0
      ) {0
        // TODO: This cast may not be sound for SVG, MathML or custom elements.0
        trapClickOnNonInteractiveElement(((domElement: any): HTMLElement));0
      }0
      break;0
  }0
0
  assertValidProps(tag, nextProps, getStack);0
0
  let propKey;0
  let styleName;0
  let styleUpdates = null;0
  for (propKey in lastProps) {0
    if (0
      nextProps.hasOwnProperty(propKey) ||0
      !lastProps.hasOwnProperty(propKey) ||0
      lastProps[propKey] == null0
    ) {0
      continue;0
    }0
    if (propKey === STYLE) {0
      const lastStyle = lastProps[propKey];0
      for (styleName in lastStyle) {0
        if (lastStyle.hasOwnProperty(styleName)) {0
          if (!styleUpdates) {0
            styleUpdates = {};0
          }0
          styleUpdates[styleName] = '';0
        }0
      }0
    } else if (propKey === DANGEROUSLY_SET_INNER_HTML || propKey === CHILDREN) {0
      // Noop. This is handled by the clear text mechanism.0
    } else if (0
      propKey === SUPPRESS_CONTENT_EDITABLE_WARNING ||0
      propKey === SUPPRESS_HYDRATION_WARNING0
    ) {0
      // Noop0
    } else if (propKey === AUTOFOCUS) {0
      // Noop. It doesn't work on updates anyway.0
    } else if (registrationNameModules.hasOwnProperty(propKey)) {0
      // This is a special case. If any listener updates we need to ensure0
      // that the "current" fiber pointer gets updated so we need a commit0
      // to update this element.0
      if (!updatePayload) {0
        updatePayload = [];0
      }0
    } else {0
      // For all other deleted properties we add it to the queue. We use0
      // the whitelist in the commit phase instead.0
      (updatePayload = updatePayload || []).push(propKey, null);0
    }0
  }0
  for (propKey in nextProps) {0
    const nextProp = nextProps[propKey];0
    const lastProp = lastProps != null ? lastProps[propKey] : undefined;0
    if (0
      !nextProps.hasOwnProperty(propKey) ||0
      nextProp === lastProp ||0
      (nextProp == null && lastProp == null)0
    ) {0
      continue;0
    }0
    if (propKey === STYLE) {0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        if (nextProp) {0
          // Freeze the next style object so that we can assume it won't be0
          // mutated. We have already warned for this in the past.0
          Object.freeze(nextProp);0
        }0
      }0
      if (lastProp) {0
        // Unset styles on `lastProp` but not on `nextProp`.0
        for (styleName in lastProp) {0
          if (0
            lastProp.hasOwnProperty(styleName) &&0
            (!nextProp || !nextProp.hasOwnProperty(styleName))0
          ) {0
            if (!styleUpdates) {0
              styleUpdates = {};0
            }0
            styleUpdates[styleName] = '';0
          }0
        }0
        // Update styles that changed since `lastProp`.0
        for (styleName in nextProp) {0
          if (0
            nextProp.hasOwnProperty(styleName) &&0
            lastProp[styleName] !== nextProp[styleName]0
          ) {0
            if (!styleUpdates) {0
              styleUpdates = {};0
            }0
            styleUpdates[styleName] = nextProp[styleName];0
          }0
        }0
      } else {0
        // Relies on `updateStylesByID` not mutating `styleUpdates`.0
        if (!styleUpdates) {0
          if (!updatePayload) {0
            updatePayload = [];0
          }0
          updatePayload.push(propKey, styleUpdates);0
        }0
        styleUpdates = nextProp;0
      }0
    } else if (propKey === DANGEROUSLY_SET_INNER_HTML) {0
      const nextHtml = nextProp ? nextProp[HTML] : undefined;0
      const lastHtml = lastProp ? lastProp[HTML] : undefined;0
      if (nextHtml != null) {0
        if (lastHtml !== nextHtml) {0
          (updatePayload = updatePayload || []).push(propKey, '' + nextHtml);0
        }0
      } else {0
        // TODO: It might be too late to clear this if we have children0
        // inserted already.0
      }0
    } else if (propKey === CHILDREN) {0
      if (0
        lastProp !== nextProp &&0
        (typeof nextProp === 'string' || typeof nextProp === 'number')0
      ) {0
        (updatePayload = updatePayload || []).push(propKey, '' + nextProp);0
      }0
    } else if (0
      propKey === SUPPRESS_CONTENT_EDITABLE_WARNING ||0
      propKey === SUPPRESS_HYDRATION_WARNING0
    ) {0
      // Noop0
    } else if (registrationNameModules.hasOwnProperty(propKey)) {0
      if (nextProp != null) {0
        // We eagerly listen to this even though we haven't committed yet.0
        if (__DEV__ && typeof nextProp !== 'function') {0
          warnForInvalidEventListener(propKey, nextProp);0
        }0
        ensureListeningTo(rootContainerElement, propKey);0
      }0
      if (!updatePayload && lastProp !== nextProp) {0
        // This is a special case. If any listener updates we need to ensure0
        // that the "current" props pointer gets updated so we need a commit0
        // to update this element.0
        updatePayload = [];0
      }0
    } else {0
      // For any other property we always add it to the queue and then we0
      // filter it out using the whitelist during the commit.0
      (updatePayload = updatePayload || []).push(propKey, nextProp);0
    }0
  }0
  if (styleUpdates) {0
    (updatePayload = updatePayload || []).push(STYLE, styleUpdates);0
  }0
  return updatePayload;0
}0
0
// Apply the diff.0
export function updateProperties(0
  domElement: Element,0
  updatePayload: Array<any>,0
  tag: string,0
  lastRawProps: Object,0
  nextRawProps: Object,0
): void {0
  // Update checked *before* name.0
  // In the middle of an update, it is possible to have multiple checked.0
  // When a checked radio tries to change name, browser makes another radio's checked false.0
  if (0
    tag === 'input' &&0
    nextRawProps.type === 'radio' &&0
    nextRawProps.name != null0
  ) {0
    ReactDOMFiberInput.updateChecked(domElement, nextRawProps);0
  }0
0
  const wasCustomComponentTag = isCustomComponent(tag, lastRawProps);0
  const isCustomComponentTag = isCustomComponent(tag, nextRawProps);0
  // Apply the diff.0
  updateDOMProperties(0
    domElement,0
    updatePayload,0
    wasCustomComponentTag,0
    isCustomComponentTag,0
  );0
0
  // TODO: Ensure that an update gets scheduled if any of the special props0
  // changed.0
  switch (tag) {0
    case 'input':0
      // Update the wrapper around inputs *after* updating props. This has to0
      // happen after `updateDOMProperties`. Otherwise HTML5 input validations0
      // raise warnings and prevent the new value from being assigned.0
      ReactDOMFiberInput.updateWrapper(domElement, nextRawProps);0
      break;0
    case 'textarea':0
      ReactDOMFiberTextarea.updateWrapper(domElement, nextRawProps);0
      break;0
    case 'select':0
      // <select> value update needs to occur after <option> children0
      // reconciliation0
      ReactDOMFiberSelect.postUpdateWrapper(domElement, nextRawProps);0
      break;0
  }0
}0
0
function getPossibleStandardName(propName: string): string | null {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const lowerCasedName = propName.toLowerCase();0
    if (!possibleStandardNames.hasOwnProperty(lowerCasedName)) {0
      return null;0
    }0
    return possibleStandardNames[lowerCasedName] || null;0
  }0
  return null;0
}0
0
export function diffHydratedProperties(0
  domElement: Element,0
  tag: string,0
  rawProps: Object,0
  parentNamespace: string,0
  rootContainerElement: Element | Document,0
): null | Array<mixed> {0
  let isCustomComponentTag;0
  let extraAttributeNames: Set<string>;0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    suppressHydrationWarning = rawProps[SUPPRESS_HYDRATION_WARNING] === true;0
    isCustomComponentTag = isCustomComponent(tag, rawProps);0
    validatePropertiesInDevelopment(tag, rawProps);0
    if (0
      isCustomComponentTag &&0
      !didWarnShadyDOM &&0
      (domElement: any).shadyRoot0
    ) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        '%s is using shady DOM. Using shady DOM with React can ' +0
          'cause things to break subtly.',0
        getCurrentFiberOwnerName() || 'A component',0
      );0
      didWarnShadyDOM = true;0
    }0
  }0
0
  // TODO: Make sure that we check isMounted before firing any of these events.0
  switch (tag) {0
    case 'iframe':0
    case 'object':0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_LOAD, domElement);0
      break;0
    case 'video':0
    case 'audio':0
      // Create listener for each media event0
      for (let i = 0; i < mediaEventTypes.length; i++) {0
        trapBubbledEvent(mediaEventTypes[i], domElement);0
      }0
      break;0
    case 'source':0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_ERROR, domElement);0
      break;0
    case 'img':0
    case 'image':0
    case 'link':0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_ERROR, domElement);0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_LOAD, domElement);0
      break;0
    case 'form':0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_RESET, domElement);0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_SUBMIT, domElement);0
      break;0
    case 'details':0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_TOGGLE, domElement);0
      break;0
    case 'input':0
      ReactDOMFiberInput.initWrapperState(domElement, rawProps);0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_INVALID, domElement);0
      // For controlled components we always need to ensure we're listening0
      // to onChange. Even if there is no listener.0
      ensureListeningTo(rootContainerElement, 'onChange');0
      break;0
    case 'option':0
      ReactDOMFiberOption.validateProps(domElement, rawProps);0
      break;0
    case 'select':0
      ReactDOMFiberSelect.initWrapperState(domElement, rawProps);0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_INVALID, domElement);0
      // For controlled components we always need to ensure we're listening0
      // to onChange. Even if there is no listener.0
      ensureListeningTo(rootContainerElement, 'onChange');0
      break;0
    case 'textarea':0
      ReactDOMFiberTextarea.initWrapperState(domElement, rawProps);0
      trapBubbledEvent(TOP_INVALID, domElement);0
      // For controlled components we always need to ensure we're listening0
      // to onChange. Even if there is no listener.0
      ensureListeningTo(rootContainerElement, 'onChange');0
      break;0
  }0
0
  assertValidProps(tag, rawProps, getStack);0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    extraAttributeNames = new Set();0
    const attributes = domElement.attributes;0
    for (let i = 0; i < attributes.length; i++) {0
      const name = attributes[i].name.toLowerCase();0
      switch (name) {0
        // Built-in SSR attribute is whitelisted0
        case 'data-reactroot':0
          break;0
        // Controlled attributes are not validated0
        // TODO: Only ignore them on controlled tags.0
        case 'value':0
          break;0
        case 'checked':0
          break;0
        case 'selected':0
          break;0
        default:0
          // Intentionally use the original name.0
          // See discussion in https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/10676.0
          extraAttributeNames.add(attributes[i].name);0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  let updatePayload = null;0
  for (const propKey in rawProps) {0
    if (!rawProps.hasOwnProperty(propKey)) {0
      continue;0
    }0
    const nextProp = rawProps[propKey];0
    if (propKey === CHILDREN) {0
      // For text content children we compare against textContent. This0
      // might match additional HTML that is hidden when we read it using0
      // textContent. E.g. "foo" will match "f<span>oo</span>" but that still0
      // satisfies our requirement. Our requirement is not to produce perfect0
      // HTML and attributes. Ideally we should preserve structure but it's0
      // ok not to if the visible content is still enough to indicate what0
      // even listeners these nodes might be wired up to.0
      // TODO: Warn if there is more than a single textNode as a child.0
      // TODO: Should we use domElement.firstChild.nodeValue to compare?0
      if (typeof nextProp === 'string') {0
        if (domElement.textContent !== nextProp) {0
          if (__DEV__ && !suppressHydrationWarning) {0
            warnForTextDifference(domElement.textContent, nextProp);0
          }0
          updatePayload = [CHILDREN, nextProp];0
        }0
      } else if (typeof nextProp === 'number') {0
        if (domElement.textContent !== '' + nextProp) {0
          if (__DEV__ && !suppressHydrationWarning) {0
            warnForTextDifference(domElement.textContent, nextProp);0
          }0
          updatePayload = [CHILDREN, '' + nextProp];0
        }0
      }0
    } else if (registrationNameModules.hasOwnProperty(propKey)) {0
      if (nextProp != null) {0
        if (__DEV__ && typeof nextProp !== 'function') {0
          warnForInvalidEventListener(propKey, nextProp);0
        }0
        ensureListeningTo(rootContainerElement, propKey);0
      }0
    } else if (0
      __DEV__ &&0
      // Convince Flow we've calculated it (it's DEV-only in this method.)0
      typeof isCustomComponentTag === 'boolean'0
    ) {0
      // Validate that the properties correspond to their expected values.0
      let serverValue;0
      const propertyInfo = getPropertyInfo(propKey);0
      if (suppressHydrationWarning) {0
        // Don't bother comparing. We're ignoring all these warnings.0
      } else if (0
        propKey === SUPPRESS_CONTENT_EDITABLE_WARNING ||0
        propKey === SUPPRESS_HYDRATION_WARNING ||0
        // Controlled attributes are not validated0
        // TODO: Only ignore them on controlled tags.0
        propKey === 'value' ||0
        propKey === 'checked' ||0
        propKey === 'selected'0
      ) {0
        // Noop0
      } else if (propKey === DANGEROUSLY_SET_INNER_HTML) {0
        const rawHtml = nextProp ? nextProp[HTML] || '' : '';0
        const serverHTML = domElement.innerHTML;0
        const expectedHTML = normalizeHTML(domElement, rawHtml);0
        if (expectedHTML !== serverHTML) {0
          warnForPropDifference(propKey, serverHTML, expectedHTML);0
        }0
      } else if (propKey === STYLE) {0
        // $FlowFixMe - Should be inferred as not undefined.0
        extraAttributeNames.delete(propKey);0
        const expectedStyle = CSSPropertyOperations.createDangerousStringForStyles(0
          nextProp,0
        );0
        serverValue = domElement.getAttribute('style');0
        if (expectedStyle !== serverValue) {0
          warnForPropDifference(propKey, serverValue, expectedStyle);0
        }0
      } else if (isCustomComponentTag) {0
        // $FlowFixMe - Should be inferred as not undefined.0
        extraAttributeNames.delete(propKey.toLowerCase());0
        serverValue = DOMPropertyOperations.getValueForAttribute(0
          domElement,0
          propKey,0
          nextProp,0
        );0
0
        if (nextProp !== serverValue) {0
          warnForPropDifference(propKey, serverValue, nextProp);0
        }0
      } else if (0
        !shouldIgnoreAttribute(propKey, propertyInfo, isCustomComponentTag) &&0
        !shouldRemoveAttribute(0
          propKey,0
          nextProp,0
          propertyInfo,0
          isCustomComponentTag,0
        )0
      ) {0
        let isMismatchDueToBadCasing = false;0
        if (propertyInfo !== null) {0
          // $FlowFixMe - Should be inferred as not undefined.0
          extraAttributeNames.delete(propertyInfo.attributeName);0
          serverValue = DOMPropertyOperations.getValueForProperty(0
            domElement,0
            propKey,0
            nextProp,0
            propertyInfo,0
          );0
        } else {0
          let ownNamespace = parentNamespace;0
          if (ownNamespace === HTML_NAMESPACE) {0
            ownNamespace = getIntrinsicNamespace(tag);0
          }0
          if (ownNamespace === HTML_NAMESPACE) {0
            // $FlowFixMe - Should be inferred as not undefined.0
            extraAttributeNames.delete(propKey.toLowerCase());0
          } else {0
            const standardName = getPossibleStandardName(propKey);0
            if (standardName !== null && standardName !== propKey) {0
              // If an SVG prop is supplied with bad casing, it will0
              // be successfully parsed from HTML, but will produce a mismatch0
              // (and would be incorrectly rendered on the client).0
              // However, we already warn about bad casing elsewhere.0
              // So we'll skip the misleading extra mismatch warning in this case.0
              isMismatchDueToBadCasing = true;0
              // $FlowFixMe - Should be inferred as not undefined.0
              extraAttributeNames.delete(standardName);0
            }0
            // $FlowFixMe - Should be inferred as not undefined.0
            extraAttributeNames.delete(propKey);0
          }0
          serverValue = DOMPropertyOperations.getValueForAttribute(0
            domElement,0
            propKey,0
            nextProp,0
          );0
        }0
0
        if (nextProp !== serverValue && !isMismatchDueToBadCasing) {0
          warnForPropDifference(propKey, serverValue, nextProp);0
        }0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    // $FlowFixMe - Should be inferred as not undefined.0
    if (extraAttributeNames.size > 0 && !suppressHydrationWarning) {0
      // $FlowFixMe - Should be inferred as not undefined.0
      warnForExtraAttributes(extraAttributeNames);0
    }0
  }0
0
  switch (tag) {0
    case 'input':0
      // TODO: Make sure we check if this is still unmounted or do any clean0
      // up necessary since we never stop tracking anymore.0
      inputValueTracking.track((domElement: any));0
      ReactDOMFiberInput.postMountWrapper(domElement, rawProps, true);0
      break;0
    case 'textarea':0
      // TODO: Make sure we check if this is still unmounted or do any clean0
      // up necessary since we never stop tracking anymore.0
      inputValueTracking.track((domElement: any));0
      ReactDOMFiberTextarea.postMountWrapper(domElement, rawProps);0
      break;0
    case 'select':0
    case 'option':0
      // For input and textarea we current always set the value property at0
      // post mount to force it to diverge from attributes. However, for0
      // option and select we don't quite do the same thing and select0
      // is not resilient to the DOM state changing so we don't do that here.0
      // TODO: Consider not doing this for input and textarea.0
      break;0
    default:0
      if (typeof rawProps.onClick === 'function') {0
        // TODO: This cast may not be sound for SVG, MathML or custom elements.0
        trapClickOnNonInteractiveElement(((domElement: any): HTMLElement));0
      }0
      break;0
  }0
0
  return updatePayload;0
}0
0
export function diffHydratedText(textNode: Text, text: string): boolean {0
  const isDifferent = textNode.nodeValue !== text;0
  return isDifferent;0
}0
0
export function warnForUnmatchedText(textNode: Text, text: string) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    warnForTextDifference(textNode.nodeValue, text);0
  }0
}0
0
export function warnForDeletedHydratableElement(0
  parentNode: Element | Document,0
  child: Element,0
) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (didWarnInvalidHydration) {0
      return;0
    }0
    didWarnInvalidHydration = true;0
    warning(0
      false,0
      'Did not expect server HTML to contain a <%s> in <%s>.',0
      child.nodeName.toLowerCase(),0
      parentNode.nodeName.toLowerCase(),0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export function warnForDeletedHydratableText(0
  parentNode: Element | Document,0
  child: Text,0
) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (didWarnInvalidHydration) {0
      return;0
    }0
    didWarnInvalidHydration = true;0
    warning(0
      false,0
      'Did not expect server HTML to contain the text node "%s" in <%s>.',0
      child.nodeValue,0
      parentNode.nodeName.toLowerCase(),0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export function warnForInsertedHydratedElement(0
  parentNode: Element | Document,0
  tag: string,0
  props: Object,0
) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (didWarnInvalidHydration) {0
      return;0
    }0
    didWarnInvalidHydration = true;0
    warning(0
      false,0
      'Expected server HTML to contain a matching <%s> in <%s>.',0
      tag,0
      parentNode.nodeName.toLowerCase(),0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export function warnForInsertedHydratedText(0
  parentNode: Element | Document,0
  text: string,0
) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (text === '') {0
      // We expect to insert empty text nodes since they're not represented in0
      // the HTML.0
      // TODO: Remove this special case if we can just avoid inserting empty0
      // text nodes.0
      return;0
    }0
    if (didWarnInvalidHydration) {0
      return;0
    }0
    didWarnInvalidHydration = true;0
    warning(0
      false,0
      'Expected server HTML to contain a matching text node for "%s" in <%s>.',0
      text,0
      parentNode.nodeName.toLowerCase(),0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export function restoreControlledState(0
  domElement: Element,0
  tag: string,0
  props: Object,0
): void {0
  switch (tag) {0
    case 'input':0
      ReactDOMFiberInput.restoreControlledState(domElement, props);0
      return;0
    case 'textarea':0
      ReactDOMFiberTextarea.restoreControlledState(domElement, props);0
      return;0
    case 'select':0
      ReactDOMFiberSelect.restoreControlledState(domElement, props);0
      return;0
  }0
}0

 *0
 * @flow0

// TODO: direct imports like some-package/src/* are bad. Fix me.0
import ReactDebugCurrentFiber from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactDebugCurrentFiber';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
import * as DOMPropertyOperations from './DOMPropertyOperations';0
import {getFiberCurrentPropsFromNode} from './ReactDOMComponentTree';0
import ReactControlledValuePropTypes from '../shared/ReactControlledValuePropTypes';0
import * as inputValueTracking from './inputValueTracking';0
0
type InputWithWrapperState = HTMLInputElement & {0
  _wrapperState: {0
    initialValue: string,0
    initialChecked: ?boolean,0
    controlled?: boolean,0
  },0
};0
0
const {0
  getCurrentFiberOwnerName,0
  getCurrentFiberStackAddendum,0
} = ReactDebugCurrentFiber;0
let didWarnValueDefaultValue = false;0
let didWarnCheckedDefaultChecked = false;0
let didWarnControlledToUncontrolled = false;0
let didWarnUncontrolledToControlled = false;0
0
function isControlled(props) {0
  const usesChecked = props.type === 'checkbox' || props.type === 'radio';0
  return usesChecked ? props.checked != null : props.value != null;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Implements an <input> host component that allows setting these optional0
 * props: `checked`, `value`, `defaultChecked`, and `defaultValue`.0
 *0
 * If `checked` or `value` are not supplied (or null/undefined), user actions0
 * that affect the checked state or value will trigger updates to the element.0
 *0
 * If they are supplied (and not null/undefined), the rendered element will not0
 * trigger updates to the element. Instead, the props must change in order for0
 * the rendered element to be updated.0
 *0
 * The rendered element will be initialized as unchecked (or `defaultChecked`)0
 * with an empty value (or `defaultValue`).0
 *0
 * See http://www.w3.org/TR/2012/WD-html5-20121025/the-input-element.html0
 */0
0
export function getHostProps(element: Element, props: Object) {0
  const node = ((element: any): InputWithWrapperState);0
  const checked = props.checked;0
0
  const hostProps = Object.assign({}, props, {0
    defaultChecked: undefined,0
    defaultValue: undefined,0
    value: undefined,0
    checked: checked != null ? checked : node._wrapperState.initialChecked,0
  });0
0
  return hostProps;0
}0
0
export function initWrapperState(element: Element, props: Object) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    ReactControlledValuePropTypes.checkPropTypes(0
      'input',0
      props,0
      getCurrentFiberStackAddendum,0
    );0
0
    if (0
      props.checked !== undefined &&0
      props.defaultChecked !== undefined &&0
      !didWarnCheckedDefaultChecked0
    ) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        '%s contains an input of type %s with both checked and defaultChecked props. ' +0
          'Input elements must be either controlled or uncontrolled ' +0
          '(specify either the checked prop, or the defaultChecked prop, but not ' +0
          'both). Decide between using a controlled or uncontrolled input ' +0
          'element and remove one of these props. More info: ' +0
          'https://fb.me/react-controlled-components',0
        getCurrentFiberOwnerName() || 'A component',0
        props.type,0
      );0
      didWarnCheckedDefaultChecked = true;0
    }0
    if (0
      props.value !== undefined &&0
      props.defaultValue !== undefined &&0
      !didWarnValueDefaultValue0
    ) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        '%s contains an input of type %s with both value and defaultValue props. ' +0
          'Input elements must be either controlled or uncontrolled ' +0
          '(specify either the value prop, or the defaultValue prop, but not ' +0
          'both). Decide between using a controlled or uncontrolled input ' +0
          'element and remove one of these props. More info: ' +0
          'https://fb.me/react-controlled-components',0
        getCurrentFiberOwnerName() || 'A component',0
        props.type,0
      );0
      didWarnValueDefaultValue = true;0
    }0
  }0
0
  const node = ((element: any): InputWithWrapperState);0
  const defaultValue = props.defaultValue == null ? '' : props.defaultValue;0
0
  node._wrapperState = {0
    initialChecked:0
      props.checked != null ? props.checked : props.defaultChecked,0
    initialValue: getSafeValue(0
      props.value != null ? props.value : defaultValue,0
    ),0
    controlled: isControlled(props),0
  };0
}0
0
export function updateChecked(element: Element, props: Object) {0
  const node = ((element: any): InputWithWrapperState);0
  const checked = props.checked;0
  if (checked != null) {0
    DOMPropertyOperations.setValueForProperty(node, 'checked', checked, false);0
  }0
}0
0
export function updateWrapper(element: Element, props: Object) {0
  const node = ((element: any): InputWithWrapperState);0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const controlled = isControlled(props);0
0
    if (0
      !node._wrapperState.controlled &&0
      controlled &&0
      !didWarnUncontrolledToControlled0
    ) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'A component is changing an uncontrolled input of type %s to be controlled. ' +0
          'Input elements should not switch from uncontrolled to controlled (or vice versa). ' +0
          'Decide between using a controlled or uncontrolled input ' +0
          'element for the lifetime of the component. More info: https://fb.me/react-controlled-components%s',0
        props.type,0
        getCurrentFiberStackAddendum(),0
      );0
      didWarnUncontrolledToControlled = true;0
    }0
    if (0
      node._wrapperState.controlled &&0
      !controlled &&0
      !didWarnControlledToUncontrolled0
    ) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'A component is changing a controlled input of type %s to be uncontrolled. ' +0
          'Input elements should not switch from controlled to uncontrolled (or vice versa). ' +0
          'Decide between using a controlled or uncontrolled input ' +0
          'element for the lifetime of the component. More info: https://fb.me/react-controlled-components%s',0
        props.type,0
        getCurrentFiberStackAddendum(),0
      );0
      didWarnControlledToUncontrolled = true;0
    }0
  }0
0
  updateChecked(element, props);0
0
  const value = getSafeValue(props.value);0
0
  if (value != null) {0
    if (props.type === 'number') {0
      if (0
        (value === 0 && node.value === '') ||0
        // eslint-disable-next-line0
        node.value != value0
      ) {0
        node.value = '' + value;0
      }0
    } else if (node.value !== '' + value) {0
      node.value = '' + value;0
    }0
  }0
0
  if (props.hasOwnProperty('value')) {0
    setDefaultValue(node, props.type, value);0
  } else if (props.hasOwnProperty('defaultValue')) {0
    setDefaultValue(node, props.type, getSafeValue(props.defaultValue));0
  }0
0
  if (props.checked == null && props.defaultChecked != null) {0
    node.defaultChecked = !!props.defaultChecked;0
  }0
}0
0
export function postMountWrapper(0
  element: Element,0
  props: Object,0
  isHydrating: boolean,0
) {0
  const node = ((element: any): InputWithWrapperState);0
0
  if (props.hasOwnProperty('value') || props.hasOwnProperty('defaultValue')) {0
    const initialValue = '' + node._wrapperState.initialValue;0
    const currentValue = node.value;0
0
    // Do not assign value if it is already set. This prevents user text input0
    // from being lost during SSR hydration.0
    if (!isHydrating) {0
      // Do not re-assign the value property if there is no change. This0
      // potentially avoids a DOM write and prevents Firefox (~60.0.1) from0
      // prematurely marking required inputs as invalid0
      if (initialValue !== currentValue) {0
        node.value = initialValue;0
      }0
    }0
0
    // value must be assigned before defaultValue. This fixes an issue where the0
    // visually displayed value of date inputs disappears on mobile Safari and Chrome:0
    // https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/72330
    node.defaultValue = initialValue;0
  }0
0
  // Normally, we'd just do `node.checked = node.checked` upon initial mount, less this bug0
  // this is needed to work around a chrome bug where setting defaultChecked0
  // will sometimes influence the value of checked (even after detachment).0
  // Reference: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=6084160
  // We need to temporarily unset name to avoid disrupting radio button groups.0
  const name = node.name;0
  if (name !== '') {0
    node.name = '';0
  }0
  node.defaultChecked = !node.defaultChecked;0
  node.defaultChecked = !node.defaultChecked;0
  if (name !== '') {0
    node.name = name;0
  }0
}0
0
export function restoreControlledState(element: Element, props: Object) {0
  const node = ((element: any): InputWithWrapperState);0
  updateWrapper(node, props);0
  updateNamedCousins(node, props);0
}0
0
function updateNamedCousins(rootNode, props) {0
  const name = props.name;0
  if (props.type === 'radio' && name != null) {0
    let queryRoot: Element = rootNode;0
0
    while (queryRoot.parentNode) {0
      queryRoot = ((queryRoot.parentNode: any): Element);0
    }0
0
    // If `rootNode.form` was non-null, then we could try `form.elements`,0
    // but that sometimes behaves strangely in IE8. We could also try using0
    // `form.getElementsByName`, but that will only return direct children0
    // and won't include inputs that use the HTML5 `form=` attribute. Since0
    // the input might not even be in a form. It might not even be in the0
    // document. Let's just use the local `querySelectorAll` to ensure we don't0
    // miss anything.0
    const group = queryRoot.querySelectorAll(0
      'input[name=' + JSON.stringify('' + name) + '][type="radio"]',0
    );0
0
    for (let i = 0; i < group.length; i++) {0
      const otherNode = ((group[i]: any): HTMLInputElement);0
      if (otherNode === rootNode || otherNode.form !== rootNode.form) {0
        continue;0
      }0
      // This will throw if radio buttons rendered by different copies of React0
      // and the same name are rendered into the same form (same as #1939).0
      // That's probably okay; we don't support it just as we don't support0
      // mixing React radio buttons with non-React ones.0
      const otherProps = getFiberCurrentPropsFromNode(otherNode);0
      invariant(0
        otherProps,0
        'ReactDOMInput: Mixing React and non-React radio inputs with the ' +0
          'same `name` is not supported.',0
      );0
0
      // We need update the tracked value on the named cousin since the value0
      // was changed but the input saw no event or value set0
      inputValueTracking.updateValueIfChanged(otherNode);0
0
      // If this is a controlled radio button group, forcing the input that0
      // was previously checked to update will cause it to be come re-checked0
      // as appropriate.0
      updateWrapper(otherNode, otherProps);0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
// In Chrome, assigning defaultValue to certain input types triggers input validation.0
// For number inputs, the display value loses trailing decimal points. For email inputs,0
// Chrome raises "The specified value <x> is not a valid email address".0
//0
// Here we check to see if the defaultValue has actually changed, avoiding these problems0
// when the user is inputting text0
//0
// https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/72530
export function setDefaultValue(0
  node: InputWithWrapperState,0
  type: ?string,0
  value: *,0
) {0
  if (0
    // Focused number inputs synchronize on blur. See ChangeEventPlugin.js0
    type !== 'number' ||0
    node.ownerDocument.activeElement !== node0
  ) {0
    if (value == null) {0
      node.defaultValue = '' + node._wrapperState.initialValue;0
    } else if (node.defaultValue !== '' + value) {0
      node.defaultValue = '' + value;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function getSafeValue(value: *): * {0
  switch (typeof value) {0
    case 'boolean':0
    case 'number':0
    case 'object':0
    case 'string':0
    case 'undefined':0
      return value;0
    default:0
      // function, symbol are assigned as empty strings0
      return '';0
  }0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import React from 'react';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
let didWarnSelectedSetOnOption = false;0
0
function flattenChildren(children) {0
  let content = '';0
0
  // Flatten children and warn if they aren't strings or numbers;0
  // invalid types are ignored.0
  // We can silently skip them because invalid DOM nesting warning0
  // catches these cases in Fiber.0
  React.Children.forEach(children, function(child) {0
    if (child == null) {0
      return;0
    }0
    if (typeof child === 'string' || typeof child === 'number') {0
      content += child;0
    }0
  });0
0
  return content;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Implements an <option> host component that warns when `selected` is set.0
 */0
0
export function validateProps(element: Element, props: Object) {0
  // TODO (yungsters): Remove support for `selected` in <option>.0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (props.selected != null && !didWarnSelectedSetOnOption) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'Use the `defaultValue` or `value` props on <select> instead of ' +0
          'setting `selected` on <option>.',0
      );0
      didWarnSelectedSetOnOption = true;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
export function postMountWrapper(element: Element, props: Object) {0
  // value="" should make a value attribute (#6219)0
  if (props.value != null) {0
    element.setAttribute('value', props.value);0
  }0
}0
0
export function getHostProps(element: Element, props: Object) {0
  const hostProps = {children: undefined, ...props};0
  const content = flattenChildren(props.children);0
0
  if (content) {0
    hostProps.children = content;0
  }0
0
  return hostProps;0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
// TODO: direct imports like some-package/src/* are bad. Fix me.0
import ReactDebugCurrentFiber from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactDebugCurrentFiber';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
import ReactControlledValuePropTypes from '../shared/ReactControlledValuePropTypes';0
0
const {0
  getCurrentFiberOwnerName,0
  getCurrentFiberStackAddendum,0
} = ReactDebugCurrentFiber;0
0
let didWarnValueDefaultValue;0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  didWarnValueDefaultValue = false;0
}0
0
type SelectWithWrapperState = HTMLSelectElement & {0
  _wrapperState: {0
    initialValue: ?string,0
    wasMultiple: boolean,0
  },0
};0
0
function getDeclarationErrorAddendum() {0
  const ownerName = getCurrentFiberOwnerName();0
  if (ownerName) {0
    return '\n\nCheck the render method of `' + ownerName + '`.';0
  }0
  return '';0
}0
0
const valuePropNames = ['value', 'defaultValue'];0
0
/**0
 * Validation function for `value` and `defaultValue`.0
 */0
function checkSelectPropTypes(props) {0
  ReactControlledValuePropTypes.checkPropTypes(0
    'select',0
    props,0
    getCurrentFiberStackAddendum,0
  );0
0
  for (let i = 0; i < valuePropNames.length; i++) {0
    const propName = valuePropNames[i];0
    if (props[propName] == null) {0
      continue;0
    }0
    const isArray = Array.isArray(props[propName]);0
    if (props.multiple && !isArray) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'The `%s` prop supplied to <select> must be an array if ' +0
          '`multiple` is true.%s',0
        propName,0
        getDeclarationErrorAddendum(),0
      );0
    } else if (!props.multiple && isArray) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'The `%s` prop supplied to <select> must be a scalar ' +0
          'value if `multiple` is false.%s',0
        propName,0
        getDeclarationErrorAddendum(),0
      );0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function updateOptions(0
  node: HTMLSelectElement,0
  multiple: boolean,0
  propValue: any,0
  setDefaultSelected: boolean,0
) {0
  type IndexableHTMLOptionsCollection = HTMLOptionsCollection & {0
    [key: number]: HTMLOptionElement,0
  };0
  const options: IndexableHTMLOptionsCollection = node.options;0
0
  if (multiple) {0
    let selectedValues = (propValue: Array<string>);0
    let selectedValue = {};0
    for (let i = 0; i < selectedValues.length; i++) {0
      // Prefix to avoid chaos with special keys.0
      selectedValue['$' + selectedValues[i]] = true;0
    }0
    for (let i = 0; i < options.length; i++) {0
      const selected = selectedValue.hasOwnProperty('$' + options[i].value);0
      if (options[i].selected !== selected) {0
        options[i].selected = selected;0
      }0
      if (selected && setDefaultSelected) {0
        options[i].defaultSelected = true;0
      }0
    }0
  } else {0
    // Do not set `select.value` as exact behavior isn't consistent across all0
    // browsers for all cases.0
    let selectedValue = '' + (propValue: string);0
    let defaultSelected = null;0
    for (let i = 0; i < options.length; i++) {0
      if (options[i].value === selectedValue) {0
        options[i].selected = true;0
        if (setDefaultSelected) {0
          options[i].defaultSelected = true;0
        }0
        return;0
      }0
      if (defaultSelected === null && !options[i].disabled) {0
        defaultSelected = options[i];0
      }0
    }0
    if (defaultSelected !== null) {0
      defaultSelected.selected = true;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Implements a <select> host component that allows optionally setting the0
 * props `value` and `defaultValue`. If `multiple` is false, the prop must be a0
 * stringable. If `multiple` is true, the prop must be an array of stringables.0
 *0
 * If `value` is not supplied (or null/undefined), user actions that change the0
 * selected option will trigger updates to the rendered options.0
 *0
 * If it is supplied (and not null/undefined), the rendered options will not0
 * update in response to user actions. Instead, the `value` prop must change in0
 * order for the rendered options to update.0
 *0
 * If `defaultValue` is provided, any options with the supplied values will be0
 * selected.0
 */0
0
export function getHostProps(element: Element, props: Object) {0
  return Object.assign({}, props, {0
    value: undefined,0
  });0
}0
0
export function initWrapperState(element: Element, props: Object) {0
  const node = ((element: any): SelectWithWrapperState);0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    checkSelectPropTypes(props);0
  }0
0
  const value = props.value;0
  node._wrapperState = {0
    initialValue: value != null ? value : props.defaultValue,0
    wasMultiple: !!props.multiple,0
  };0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (0
      props.value !== undefined &&0
      props.defaultValue !== undefined &&0
      !didWarnValueDefaultValue0
    ) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'Select elements must be either controlled or uncontrolled ' +0
          '(specify either the value prop, or the defaultValue prop, but not ' +0
          'both). Decide between using a controlled or uncontrolled select ' +0
          'element and remove one of these props. More info: ' +0
          'https://fb.me/react-controlled-components',0
      );0
      didWarnValueDefaultValue = true;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
export function postMountWrapper(element: Element, props: Object) {0
  const node = ((element: any): SelectWithWrapperState);0
  node.multiple = !!props.multiple;0
  const value = props.value;0
  if (value != null) {0
    updateOptions(node, !!props.multiple, value, false);0
  } else if (props.defaultValue != null) {0
    updateOptions(node, !!props.multiple, props.defaultValue, true);0
  }0
}0
0
export function postUpdateWrapper(element: Element, props: Object) {0
  const node = ((element: any): SelectWithWrapperState);0
  // After the initial mount, we control selected-ness manually so don't pass0
  // this value down0
  node._wrapperState.initialValue = undefined;0
0
  const wasMultiple = node._wrapperState.wasMultiple;0
  node._wrapperState.wasMultiple = !!props.multiple;0
0
  const value = props.value;0
  if (value != null) {0
    updateOptions(node, !!props.multiple, value, false);0
  } else if (wasMultiple !== !!props.multiple) {0
    // For simplicity, reapply `defaultValue` if `multiple` is toggled.0
    if (props.defaultValue != null) {0
      updateOptions(node, !!props.multiple, props.defaultValue, true);0
    } else {0
      // Revert the select back to its default unselected state.0
      updateOptions(node, !!props.multiple, props.multiple ? [] : '', false);0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
export function restoreControlledState(element: Element, props: Object) {0
  const node = ((element: any): SelectWithWrapperState);0
  const value = props.value;0
0
  if (value != null) {0
    updateOptions(node, !!props.multiple, value, false);0
  }0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
// TODO: direct imports like some-package/src/* are bad. Fix me.0
import ReactDebugCurrentFiber from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactDebugCurrentFiber';0
0
import ReactControlledValuePropTypes from '../shared/ReactControlledValuePropTypes';0
0
const {getCurrentFiberStackAddendum} = ReactDebugCurrentFiber;0
let didWarnValDefaultVal = false;0
0
type TextAreaWithWrapperState = HTMLTextAreaElement & {0
  _wrapperState: {0
    initialValue: string,0
  },0
};0
0
/**0
 * Implements a <textarea> host component that allows setting `value`, and0
 * `defaultValue`. This differs from the traditional DOM API because value is0
 * usually set as PCDATA children.0
 *0
 * If `value` is not supplied (or null/undefined), user actions that affect the0
 * value will trigger updates to the element.0
 *0
 * If `value` is supplied (and not null/undefined), the rendered element will0
 * not trigger updates to the element. Instead, the `value` prop must change in0
 * order for the rendered element to be updated.0
 *0
 * The rendered element will be initialized with an empty value, the prop0
 * `defaultValue` if specified, or the children content (deprecated).0
 */0
0
export function getHostProps(element: Element, props: Object) {0
  const node = ((element: any): TextAreaWithWrapperState);0
  invariant(0
    props.dangerouslySetInnerHTML == null,0
    '`dangerouslySetInnerHTML` does not make sense on <textarea>.',0
  );0
0
  // Always set children to the same thing. In IE9, the selection range will0
  // get reset if `textContent` is mutated.  We could add a check in setTextContent0
  // to only set the value if/when the value differs from the node value (which would0
  // completely solve this IE9 bug), but Sebastian+Sophie seemed to like this0
  // solution. The value can be a boolean or object so that's why it's forced0
  // to be a string.0
  const hostProps = {0
    ...props,0
    value: undefined,0
    defaultValue: undefined,0
    children: '' + node._wrapperState.initialValue,0
  };0
0
  return hostProps;0
}0
0
export function initWrapperState(element: Element, props: Object) {0
  const node = ((element: any): TextAreaWithWrapperState);0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    ReactControlledValuePropTypes.checkPropTypes(0
      'textarea',0
      props,0
      getCurrentFiberStackAddendum,0
    );0
    if (0
      props.value !== undefined &&0
      props.defaultValue !== undefined &&0
      !didWarnValDefaultVal0
    ) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'Textarea elements must be either controlled or uncontrolled ' +0
          '(specify either the value prop, or the defaultValue prop, but not ' +0
          'both). Decide between using a controlled or uncontrolled textarea ' +0
          'and remove one of these props. More info: ' +0
          'https://fb.me/react-controlled-components',0
      );0
      didWarnValDefaultVal = true;0
    }0
  }0
0
  let initialValue = props.value;0
0
  // Only bother fetching default value if we're going to use it0
  if (initialValue == null) {0
    let defaultValue = props.defaultValue;0
    // TODO (yungsters): Remove support for children content in <textarea>.0
    let children = props.children;0
    if (children != null) {0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        warning(0
          false,0
          'Use the `defaultValue` or `value` props instead of setting ' +0
            'children on <textarea>.',0
        );0
      }0
      invariant(0
        defaultValue == null,0
        'If you supply `defaultValue` on a <textarea>, do not pass children.',0
      );0
      if (Array.isArray(children)) {0
        invariant(0
          children.length <= 1,0
          '<textarea> can only have at most one child.',0
        );0
        children = children[0];0
      }0
0
      defaultValue = '' + children;0
    }0
    if (defaultValue == null) {0
      defaultValue = '';0
    }0
    initialValue = defaultValue;0
  }0
0
  node._wrapperState = {0
    initialValue: '' + initialValue,0
  };0
}0
0
export function updateWrapper(element: Element, props: Object) {0
  const node = ((element: any): TextAreaWithWrapperState);0
  const value = props.value;0
  if (value != null) {0
    // Cast `value` to a string to ensure the value is set correctly. While0
    // browsers typically do this as necessary, jsdom doesn't.0
    const newValue = '' + value;0
0
    // To avoid side effects (such as losing text selection), only set value if changed0
    if (newValue !== node.value) {0
      node.value = newValue;0
    }0
    if (props.defaultValue == null) {0
      node.defaultValue = newValue;0
    }0
  }0
  if (props.defaultValue != null) {0
    node.defaultValue = props.defaultValue;0
  }0
}0
0
export function postMountWrapper(element: Element, props: Object) {0
  const node = ((element: any): TextAreaWithWrapperState);0
  // This is in postMount because we need access to the DOM node, which is not0
  // available until after the component has mounted.0
  const textContent = node.textContent;0
0
  // Only set node.value if textContent is equal to the expected0
  // initial value. In IE10/IE11 there is a bug where the placeholder attribute0
  // will populate textContent as well.0
  // https://developer.microsoft.com/microsoft-edge/platform/issues/101525/0
  if (textContent === node._wrapperState.initialValue) {0
    node.value = textContent;0
  }0
}0
0
export function restoreControlledState(element: Element, props: Object) {0
  // DOM component is still mounted; update0
  updateWrapper(element, props);0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import * as ReactScheduler from 'shared/ReactScheduler';0
0
import * as ReactDOMComponentTree from './ReactDOMComponentTree';0
import * as ReactDOMFiberComponent from './ReactDOMFiberComponent';0
import * as ReactInputSelection from './ReactInputSelection';0
import setTextContent from './setTextContent';0
import validateDOMNesting from './validateDOMNesting';0
import * as ReactBrowserEventEmitter from '../events/ReactBrowserEventEmitter';0
import {getChildNamespace} from '../shared/DOMNamespaces';0
import {0
  ELEMENT_NODE,0
  TEXT_NODE,0
  COMMENT_NODE,0
  DOCUMENT_NODE,0
  DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT_NODE,0
} from '../shared/HTMLNodeType';0
0
export type Type = string;0
export type Props = {0
  autoFocus?: boolean,0
  children?: mixed,0
  hidden?: boolean,0
  suppressHydrationWarning?: boolean,0
  dangerouslySetInnerHTML?: mixed,0
};0
export type Container = Element | Document;0
export type Instance = Element;0
export type TextInstance = Text;0
export type HydratableInstance = Element | Text;0
export type PublicInstance = Element | Text;0
type HostContextDev = {0
  namespace: string,0
  ancestorInfo: mixed,0
};0
type HostContextProd = string;0
export type HostContext = HostContextDev | HostContextProd;0
export type UpdatePayload = Array<mixed>;0
export type ChildSet = void; // Unused0
0
const {0
  createElement,0
  createTextNode,0
  setInitialProperties,0
  diffProperties,0
  updateProperties,0
  diffHydratedProperties,0
  diffHydratedText,0
  warnForUnmatchedText,0
  warnForDeletedHydratableElement,0
  warnForDeletedHydratableText,0
  warnForInsertedHydratedElement,0
  warnForInsertedHydratedText,0
} = ReactDOMFiberComponent;0
const {updatedAncestorInfo} = validateDOMNesting;0
const {precacheFiberNode, updateFiberProps} = ReactDOMComponentTree;0
0
let SUPPRESS_HYDRATION_WARNING;0
if (__DEV__) {0
  SUPPRESS_HYDRATION_WARNING = 'suppressHydrationWarning';0
}0
0
let eventsEnabled: ?boolean = null;0
let selectionInformation: ?mixed = null;0
0
function shouldAutoFocusHostComponent(type: string, props: Props): boolean {0
  switch (type) {0
    case 'button':0
    case 'input':0
    case 'select':0
    case 'textarea':0
      return !!props.autoFocus;0
  }0
  return false;0
}0
0
export * from 'shared/HostConfigWithNoPersistence';0
0
export function getRootHostContext(0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
): HostContext {0
  let type;0
  let namespace;0
  const nodeType = rootContainerInstance.nodeType;0
  switch (nodeType) {0
    case DOCUMENT_NODE:0
    case DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT_NODE: {0
      type = nodeType === DOCUMENT_NODE ? '#document' : '#fragment';0
      let root = (rootContainerInstance: any).documentElement;0
      namespace = root ? root.namespaceURI : getChildNamespace(null, '');0
      break;0
    }0
    default: {0
      const container: any =0
        nodeType === COMMENT_NODE0
          ? rootContainerInstance.parentNode0
          : rootContainerInstance;0
      const ownNamespace = container.namespaceURI || null;0
      type = container.tagName;0
      namespace = getChildNamespace(ownNamespace, type);0
      break;0
    }0
  }0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const validatedTag = type.toLowerCase();0
    const ancestorInfo = updatedAncestorInfo(null, validatedTag, null);0
    return {namespace, ancestorInfo};0
  }0
  return namespace;0
}0
0
export function getChildHostContext(0
  parentHostContext: HostContext,0
  type: string,0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
): HostContext {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const parentHostContextDev = ((parentHostContext: any): HostContextDev);0
    const namespace = getChildNamespace(parentHostContextDev.namespace, type);0
    const ancestorInfo = updatedAncestorInfo(0
      parentHostContextDev.ancestorInfo,0
      type,0
      null,0
    );0
    return {namespace, ancestorInfo};0
  }0
  const parentNamespace = ((parentHostContext: any): HostContextProd);0
  return getChildNamespace(parentNamespace, type);0
}0
0
export function getPublicInstance(instance: Instance): * {0
  return instance;0
}0
0
export function prepareForCommit(containerInfo: Container): void {0
  eventsEnabled = ReactBrowserEventEmitter.isEnabled();0
  selectionInformation = ReactInputSelection.getSelectionInformation();0
  ReactBrowserEventEmitter.setEnabled(false);0
}0
0
export function resetAfterCommit(containerInfo: Container): void {0
  ReactInputSelection.restoreSelection(selectionInformation);0
  selectionInformation = null;0
  ReactBrowserEventEmitter.setEnabled(eventsEnabled);0
  eventsEnabled = null;0
}0
0
export function createInstance(0
  type: string,0
  props: Props,0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
  hostContext: HostContext,0
  internalInstanceHandle: Object,0
): Instance {0
  let parentNamespace: string;0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    // TODO: take namespace into account when validating.0
    const hostContextDev = ((hostContext: any): HostContextDev);0
    validateDOMNesting(type, null, hostContextDev.ancestorInfo);0
    if (0
      typeof props.children === 'string' ||0
      typeof props.children === 'number'0
    ) {0
      const string = '' + props.children;0
      const ownAncestorInfo = updatedAncestorInfo(0
        hostContextDev.ancestorInfo,0
        type,0
        null,0
      );0
      validateDOMNesting(null, string, ownAncestorInfo);0
    }0
    parentNamespace = hostContextDev.namespace;0
  } else {0
    parentNamespace = ((hostContext: any): HostContextProd);0
  }0
  const domElement: Instance = createElement(0
    type,0
    props,0
    rootContainerInstance,0
    parentNamespace,0
  );0
  precacheFiberNode(internalInstanceHandle, domElement);0
  updateFiberProps(domElement, props);0
  return domElement;0
}0
0
export function appendInitialChild(0
  parentInstance: Instance,0
  child: Instance | TextInstance,0
): void {0
  parentInstance.appendChild(child);0
}0
0
export function finalizeInitialChildren(0
  domElement: Instance,0
  type: string,0
  props: Props,0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
  hostContext: HostContext,0
): boolean {0
  setInitialProperties(domElement, type, props, rootContainerInstance);0
  return shouldAutoFocusHostComponent(type, props);0
}0
0
export function prepareUpdate(0
  domElement: Instance,0
  type: string,0
  oldProps: Props,0
  newProps: Props,0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
  hostContext: HostContext,0
): null | Array<mixed> {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const hostContextDev = ((hostContext: any): HostContextDev);0
    if (0
      typeof newProps.children !== typeof oldProps.children &&0
      (typeof newProps.children === 'string' ||0
        typeof newProps.children === 'number')0
    ) {0
      const string = '' + newProps.children;0
      const ownAncestorInfo = updatedAncestorInfo(0
        hostContextDev.ancestorInfo,0
        type,0
        null,0
      );0
      validateDOMNesting(null, string, ownAncestorInfo);0
    }0
  }0
  return diffProperties(0
    domElement,0
    type,0
    oldProps,0
    newProps,0
    rootContainerInstance,0
  );0
}0
0
export function shouldSetTextContent(type: string, props: Props): boolean {0
  return (0
    type === 'textarea' ||0
    typeof props.children === 'string' ||0
    typeof props.children === 'number' ||0
    (typeof props.dangerouslySetInnerHTML === 'object' &&0
      props.dangerouslySetInnerHTML !== null &&0
      typeof props.dangerouslySetInnerHTML.__html === 'string')0
  );0
}0
0
export function shouldDeprioritizeSubtree(type: string, props: Props): boolean {0
  return !!props.hidden;0
}0
0
export function createTextInstance(0
  text: string,0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
  hostContext: HostContext,0
  internalInstanceHandle: Object,0
): TextInstance {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const hostContextDev = ((hostContext: any): HostContextDev);0
    validateDOMNesting(null, text, hostContextDev.ancestorInfo);0
  }0
  const textNode: TextInstance = createTextNode(text, rootContainerInstance);0
  precacheFiberNode(internalInstanceHandle, textNode);0
  return textNode;0
}0

export const now = ReactScheduler.now;0
export const isPrimaryRenderer = true;0
export const scheduleDeferredCallback = ReactScheduler.scheduleWork;0
export const cancelDeferredCallback = ReactScheduler.cancelScheduledWork;0

//     Mutation0

0
export const supportsMutation = true;0
0
export function commitMount(0
  domElement: Instance,0
  type: string,0
  newProps: Props,0
  internalInstanceHandle: Object,0
): void {0
  // Despite the naming that might imply otherwise, this method only0
  // fires if there is an `Update` effect scheduled during mounting.0
  // This happens if `finalizeInitialChildren` returns `true` (which it0
  // does to implement the `autoFocus` attribute on the client). But0
  // there are also other cases when this might happen (such as patching0
  // up text content during hydration mismatch). So we'll check this again.0
  if (shouldAutoFocusHostComponent(type, newProps)) {0
    ((domElement: any):0
      | HTMLButtonElement0
      | HTMLInputElement0
      | HTMLSelectElement0
      | HTMLTextAreaElement).focus();0
  }0
}0
0
export function commitUpdate(0
  domElement: Instance,0
  updatePayload: Array<mixed>,0
  type: string,0
  oldProps: Props,0
  newProps: Props,0
  internalInstanceHandle: Object,0
): void {0
  // Update the props handle so that we know which props are the ones with0
  // with current event handlers.0
  updateFiberProps(domElement, newProps);0
  // Apply the diff to the DOM node.0
  updateProperties(domElement, updatePayload, type, oldProps, newProps);0
}0
0
export function resetTextContent(domElement: Instance): void {0
  setTextContent(domElement, '');0
}0
0
export function commitTextUpdate(0
  textInstance: TextInstance,0
  oldText: string,0
  newText: string,0
): void {0
  textInstance.nodeValue = newText;0
}0

  parentInstance: Instance,0
  child: Instance | TextInstance,0
): void {0
  parentInstance.appendChild(child);0
}0

export function appendChildToContainer(0
  container: Container,0
  child: Instance | TextInstance,0
): void {0
  if (container.nodeType === COMMENT_NODE) {0
    (container.parentNode: any).insertBefore(child, container);0
  } else {0
    container.appendChild(child);0
  }0
}0
0
export function insertBefore(0
  parentInstance: Instance,0
  child: Instance | TextInstance,0
  beforeChild: Instance | TextInstance,0
): void {0
  parentInstance.insertBefore(child, beforeChild);0
}0
0
export function insertInContainerBefore(0
  container: Container,0
  child: Instance | TextInstance,0
  beforeChild: Instance | TextInstance,0
): void {0
  if (container.nodeType === COMMENT_NODE) {0
    (container.parentNode: any).insertBefore(child, beforeChild);0
  } else {0
    container.insertBefore(child, beforeChild);0
  }0
}0
0
export function removeChild(0
  parentInstance: Instance,0
  child: Instance | TextInstance,0
): void {0
  parentInstance.removeChild(child);0
}0
0
export function removeChildFromContainer(0
  container: Container,0
  child: Instance | TextInstance,0
): void {0
  if (container.nodeType === COMMENT_NODE) {0
    (container.parentNode: any).removeChild(child);0
  } else {0
    container.removeChild(child);0
  }0
}0
