// -------------------0
//     Hydration0
// -------------------0
0
export const supportsHydration = true;0
0
export function canHydrateInstance(0
  instance: Instance | TextInstance,0
  type: string,0
  props: Props,0
): null | Instance {0
  if (0
    instance.nodeType !== ELEMENT_NODE ||0
    type.toLowerCase() !== instance.nodeName.toLowerCase()0
  ) {0
    return null;0
  }0
  // This has now been refined to an element node.0
  return ((instance: any): Instance);0
}0
0
export function canHydrateTextInstance(0
  instance: Instance | TextInstance,0
  text: string,0
): null | TextInstance {0
  if (text === '' || instance.nodeType !== TEXT_NODE) {0
    // Empty strings are not parsed by HTML so there won't be a correct match here.0
    return null;0
  }0
  // This has now been refined to a text node.0
  return ((instance: any): TextInstance);0
}0
0
export function getNextHydratableSibling(0
  instance: Instance | TextInstance,0
): null | Instance | TextInstance {0
  let node = instance.nextSibling;0
  // Skip non-hydratable nodes.0
  while (0
    node &&0
    node.nodeType !== ELEMENT_NODE &&0
    node.nodeType !== TEXT_NODE0
  ) {0
    node = node.nextSibling;0
  }0
  return (node: any);0
}0
0
export function getFirstHydratableChild(0
  parentInstance: Container | Instance,0
): null | Instance | TextInstance {0
  let next = parentInstance.firstChild;0
  // Skip non-hydratable nodes.0
  while (0
    next &&0
    next.nodeType !== ELEMENT_NODE &&0
    next.nodeType !== TEXT_NODE0
  ) {0
    next = next.nextSibling;0
  }0
  return (next: any);0
}0
0
export function hydrateInstance(0
  instance: Instance,0
  type: string,0
  props: Props,0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
  hostContext: HostContext,0
  internalInstanceHandle: Object,0
): null | Array<mixed> {0
  precacheFiberNode(internalInstanceHandle, instance);0
  // TODO: Possibly defer this until the commit phase where all the events0
  // get attached.0
  updateFiberProps(instance, props);0
  let parentNamespace: string;0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const hostContextDev = ((hostContext: any): HostContextDev);0
    parentNamespace = hostContextDev.namespace;0
  } else {0
    parentNamespace = ((hostContext: any): HostContextProd);0
  }0
  return diffHydratedProperties(0
    instance,0
    type,0
    props,0
    parentNamespace,0
    rootContainerInstance,0
  );0
}0
0
export function hydrateTextInstance(0
  textInstance: TextInstance,0
  text: string,0
  internalInstanceHandle: Object,0
): boolean {0
  precacheFiberNode(internalInstanceHandle, textInstance);0
  return diffHydratedText(textInstance, text);0
}0
0

  parentContainer: Container,0
  textInstance: TextInstance,0

  if (__DEV__) {0
    warnForUnmatchedText(textInstance, text);0
  }0
}0

  parentType: string,0
  parentProps: Props,0
  parentInstance: Instance,0
  textInstance: TextInstance,0
  text: string,0
) {0
  if (__DEV__ && parentProps[SUPPRESS_HYDRATION_WARNING] !== true) {0
    warnForUnmatchedText(textInstance, text);0
  }0
}0
0
export function didNotHydrateContainerInstance(0
  parentContainer: Container,0
  instance: Instance | TextInstance,0
) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (instance.nodeType === 1) {0
      warnForDeletedHydratableElement(parentContainer, (instance: any));0
    } else {0
      warnForDeletedHydratableText(parentContainer, (instance: any));0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
export function didNotHydrateInstance(0
  parentType: string,0
  parentProps: Props,0
  parentInstance: Instance,0
  instance: Instance | TextInstance,0
) {0
  if (__DEV__ && parentProps[SUPPRESS_HYDRATION_WARNING] !== true) {0
    if (instance.nodeType === 1) {0
      warnForDeletedHydratableElement(parentInstance, (instance: any));0
    } else {0
      warnForDeletedHydratableText(parentInstance, (instance: any));0
    }0
  }0
}0

  parentContainer: Container,0

  }0

import getNodeForCharacterOffset from './getNodeForCharacterOffset';0
import getTextContentAccessor from './getTextContentAccessor';0
import {TEXT_NODE} from '../shared/HTMLNodeType';0
0
/**0
 * @param {DOMElement} outerNode0
 * @return {?object}0
 */0
export function getOffsets(outerNode) {0
  const selection = window.getSelection && window.getSelection();0
0
  if (!selection || selection.rangeCount === 0) {0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  const {anchorNode, anchorOffset, focusNode, focusOffset} = selection;0
0
  // In Firefox, anchorNode and focusNode can be "anonymous divs", e.g. the0
  // up/down buttons on an <input type="number">. Anonymous divs do not seem to0
  // expose properties, triggering a "Permission denied error" if any of its0
  // properties are accessed. The only seemingly possible way to avoid erroring0
  // is to access a property that typically works for non-anonymous divs and0
  // catch any error that may otherwise arise. See0
  // https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2084270
  try {0
    /* eslint-disable no-unused-expressions */0
    anchorNode.nodeType;0
    focusNode.nodeType;0
    /* eslint-enable no-unused-expressions */0
  } catch (e) {0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  return getModernOffsetsFromPoints(0
    outerNode,0
    anchorNode,0
    anchorOffset,0
    focusNode,0
    focusOffset,0
  );0
}0
0
/**0
 * Returns {start, end} where `start` is the character/codepoint index of0
 * (anchorNode, anchorOffset) within the textContent of `outerNode`, and0
 * `end` is the index of (focusNode, focusOffset).0
 *0
 * Returns null if you pass in garbage input but we should probably just crash.0
 *0
 * Exported only for testing.0
 */0
export function getModernOffsetsFromPoints(0
  outerNode,0
  anchorNode,0
  anchorOffset,0
  focusNode,0
  focusOffset,0
) {0
  let length = 0;0
  let start = -1;0
  let end = -1;0
  let indexWithinAnchor = 0;0
  let indexWithinFocus = 0;0
  let node = outerNode;0
  let parentNode = null;0
0
  outer: while (true) {0
    let next = null;0
0
    while (true) {0
      if (0
        node === anchorNode &&0
        (anchorOffset === 0 || node.nodeType === TEXT_NODE)0
      ) {0
        start = length + anchorOffset;0
      }0
      if (0
        node === focusNode &&0
        (focusOffset === 0 || node.nodeType === TEXT_NODE)0
      ) {0
        end = length + focusOffset;0
      }0
0
      if (node.nodeType === TEXT_NODE) {0
        length += node.nodeValue.length;0
      }0
0
      if ((next = node.firstChild) === null) {0
        break;0
      }0
      // Moving from `node` to its first child `next`.0
      parentNode = node;0
      node = next;0
    }0
0
    while (true) {0
      if (node === outerNode) {0
        // If `outerNode` has children, this is always the second time visiting0
        // it. If it has no children, this is still the first loop, and the only0
        // valid selection is anchorNode and focusNode both equal to this node0
        // and both offsets 0, in which case we will have handled above.0
        break outer;0
      }0
      if (parentNode === anchorNode && ++indexWithinAnchor === anchorOffset) {0
        start = length;0
      }0
      if (parentNode === focusNode && ++indexWithinFocus === focusOffset) {0
        end = length;0
      }0
      if ((next = node.nextSibling) !== null) {0
        break;0
      }0
      node = parentNode;0
      parentNode = node.parentNode;0
    }0
0
    // Moving from `node` to its next sibling `next`.0
    node = next;0
  }0
0
  if (start === -1 || end === -1) {0
    // This should never happen. (Would happen if the anchor/focus nodes aren't0
    // actually inside the passed-in node.)0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  return {0
    start: start,0
    end: end,0
  };0
}0
0
/**0
 * In modern non-IE browsers, we can support both forward and backward0
 * selections.0
 *0
 * Note: IE10+ supports the Selection object, but it does not support0
 * the `extend` method, which means that even in modern IE, it's not possible0
 * to programmatically create a backward selection. Thus, for all IE0
 * versions, we use the old IE API to create our selections.0
 *0
 * @param {DOMElement|DOMTextNode} node0
 * @param {object} offsets0
 */0
export function setOffsets(node, offsets) {0
  if (!window.getSelection) {0
    return;0
  }0
0
  const selection = window.getSelection();0
  const length = node[getTextContentAccessor()].length;0
  let start = Math.min(offsets.start, length);0
  let end = offsets.end === undefined ? start : Math.min(offsets.end, length);0
0
  // IE 11 uses modern selection, but doesn't support the extend method.0
  // Flip backward selections, so we can set with a single range.0
  if (!selection.extend && start > end) {0
    let temp = end;0
    end = start;0
    start = temp;0
  }0
0
  const startMarker = getNodeForCharacterOffset(node, start);0
  const endMarker = getNodeForCharacterOffset(node, end);0
0
  if (startMarker && endMarker) {0
    if (0
      selection.rangeCount === 1 &&0
      selection.anchorNode === startMarker.node &&0
      selection.anchorOffset === startMarker.offset &&0
      selection.focusNode === endMarker.node &&0
      selection.focusOffset === endMarker.offset0
    ) {0
      return;0
    }0
    const range = document.createRange();0
    range.setStart(startMarker.node, startMarker.offset);0
    selection.removeAllRanges();0
0
    if (start > end) {0
      selection.addRange(range);0
      selection.extend(endMarker.node, endMarker.offset);0
    } else {0
      range.setEnd(endMarker.node, endMarker.offset);0
      selection.addRange(range);0
    }0
  }0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import getActiveElement from './getActiveElement';0
0
import * as ReactDOMSelection from './ReactDOMSelection';0
import {ELEMENT_NODE, TEXT_NODE} from '../shared/HTMLNodeType';0
0
// TODO: this code is originally inlined from fbjs.0
// It is likely that we don't actually need all these checks0
// for the particular use case in this file.0
function isNode(object) {0
  const doc = object ? object.ownerDocument || object : document;0
  const defaultView = doc.defaultView || window;0
  return !!(0
    object &&0
    (typeof defaultView.Node === 'function'0
      ? object instanceof defaultView.Node0
      : typeof object === 'object' &&0
        typeof object.nodeType === 'number' &&0
        typeof object.nodeName === 'string')0
  );0
}0
0
function isTextNode(object) {0
  return isNode(object) && object.nodeType === TEXT_NODE;0
}0
0
function containsNode(outerNode, innerNode) {0
  if (!outerNode || !innerNode) {0
    return false;0
  } else if (outerNode === innerNode) {0
    return true;0
  } else if (isTextNode(outerNode)) {0
    return false;0
  } else if (isTextNode(innerNode)) {0
    return containsNode(outerNode, innerNode.parentNode);0
  } else if ('contains' in outerNode) {0
    return outerNode.contains(innerNode);0
  } else if (outerNode.compareDocumentPosition) {0
    return !!(outerNode.compareDocumentPosition(innerNode) & 16);0
  } else {0
    return false;0
  }0
}0
0
function isInDocument(node) {0
  return containsNode(document.documentElement, node);0
}0
0
/**0
 * @ReactInputSelection: React input selection module. Based on Selection.js,0
 * but modified to be suitable for react and has a couple of bug fixes (doesn't0
 * assume buttons have range selections allowed).0
 * Input selection module for React.0
 */0
0
/**0
 * @hasSelectionCapabilities: we get the element types that support selection0
 * from https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#do-not-apply, looking at `selectionStart`0
 * and `selectionEnd` rows.0
 */0
export function hasSelectionCapabilities(elem) {0
  const nodeName = elem && elem.nodeName && elem.nodeName.toLowerCase();0
  return (0
    nodeName &&0
    ((nodeName === 'input' &&0
      (elem.type === 'text' ||0
        elem.type === 'search' ||0
        elem.type === 'tel' ||0
        elem.type === 'url' ||0
        elem.type === 'password')) ||0
      nodeName === 'textarea' ||0
      elem.contentEditable === 'true')0
  );0
}0
0
export function getSelectionInformation() {0
  const focusedElem = getActiveElement();0
  return {0
    focusedElem: focusedElem,0
    selectionRange: hasSelectionCapabilities(focusedElem)0
      ? getSelection(focusedElem)0
      : null,0
  };0
}0
0
/**0
 * @restoreSelection: If any selection information was potentially lost,0
 * restore it. This is useful when performing operations that could remove dom0
 * nodes and place them back in, resulting in focus being lost.0
 */0
export function restoreSelection(priorSelectionInformation) {0
  const curFocusedElem = getActiveElement();0
  const priorFocusedElem = priorSelectionInformation.focusedElem;0
  const priorSelectionRange = priorSelectionInformation.selectionRange;0
  if (curFocusedElem !== priorFocusedElem && isInDocument(priorFocusedElem)) {0
    if (0
      priorSelectionRange !== null &&0
      hasSelectionCapabilities(priorFocusedElem)0
    ) {0
      setSelection(priorFocusedElem, priorSelectionRange);0
    }0
0
    // Focusing a node can change the scroll position, which is undesirable0
    const ancestors = [];0
    let ancestor = priorFocusedElem;0
    while ((ancestor = ancestor.parentNode)) {0
      if (ancestor.nodeType === ELEMENT_NODE) {0
        ancestors.push({0
          element: ancestor,0
          left: ancestor.scrollLeft,0
          top: ancestor.scrollTop,0
        });0
      }0
    }0
0
    if (typeof priorFocusedElem.focus === 'function') {0
      priorFocusedElem.focus();0
    }0
0
    for (let i = 0; i < ancestors.length; i++) {0
      const info = ancestors[i];0
      info.element.scrollLeft = info.left;0
      info.element.scrollTop = info.top;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * @getSelection: Gets the selection bounds of a focused textarea, input or0
 * contentEditable node.0
 * -@input: Look up selection bounds of this input0
 * -@return {start: selectionStart, end: selectionEnd}0
 */0
export function getSelection(input) {0
  let selection;0
0
  if ('selectionStart' in input) {0
    // Modern browser with input or textarea.0
    selection = {0
      start: input.selectionStart,0
      end: input.selectionEnd,0
    };0
  } else {0
    // Content editable or old IE textarea.0
    selection = ReactDOMSelection.getOffsets(input);0
  }0
0
  return selection || {start: 0, end: 0};0
}0
0
/**0
 * @setSelection: Sets the selection bounds of a textarea or input and focuses0
 * the input.0
 * -@input     Set selection bounds of this input or textarea0
 * -@offsets   Object of same form that is returned from get*0
 */0
export function setSelection(input, offsets) {0
  let {start, end} = offsets;0
  if (end === undefined) {0
    end = start;0
  }0
0
  if ('selectionStart' in input) {0
    input.selectionStart = start;0
    input.selectionEnd = Math.min(end, input.value.length);0
  } else {0
    ReactDOMSelection.setOffsets(input, offsets);0
  }0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import {Namespaces} from '../shared/DOMNamespaces';0
import createMicrosoftUnsafeLocalFunction from '../shared/createMicrosoftUnsafeLocalFunction';0
0
// SVG temp container for IE lacking innerHTML0
let reusableSVGContainer;0
0
/**0
 * Set the innerHTML property of a node0
 *0
 * @param {DOMElement} node0
 * @param {string} html0
 * @internal0
 */0
const setInnerHTML = createMicrosoftUnsafeLocalFunction(function(node, html) {0
  // IE does not have innerHTML for SVG nodes, so instead we inject the0
  // new markup in a temp node and then move the child nodes across into0
  // the target node0
0
  if (node.namespaceURI === Namespaces.svg && !('innerHTML' in node)) {0
    reusableSVGContainer =0
      reusableSVGContainer || document.createElement('div');0
    reusableSVGContainer.innerHTML = '<svg>' + html + '</svg>';0
    const svgNode = reusableSVGContainer.firstChild;0
    while (node.firstChild) {0
      node.removeChild(node.firstChild);0
    }0
    while (svgNode.firstChild) {0
      node.appendChild(svgNode.firstChild);0
    }0
  } else {0
    node.innerHTML = html;0
  }0
});0
0
export default setInnerHTML;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import {TEXT_NODE} from '../shared/HTMLNodeType';0
0
/**0
 * Set the textContent property of a node. For text updates, it's faster0
 * to set the `nodeValue` of the Text node directly instead of using0
 * `.textContent` which will remove the existing node and create a new one.0
 *0
 * @param {DOMElement} node0
 * @param {string} text0
 * @internal0
 */0
let setTextContent = function(node: Element, text: string): void {0
  if (text) {0
    let firstChild = node.firstChild;0
0
    if (0
      firstChild &&0
      firstChild === node.lastChild &&0
      firstChild.nodeType === TEXT_NODE0
    ) {0
      firstChild.nodeValue = text;0
      return;0
    }0
  }0
  node.textContent = text;0
};0
0
export default setTextContent;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2015-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
// TODO: direct imports like some-package/src/* are bad. Fix me.0
import ReactDebugCurrentFiber from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactDebugCurrentFiber';0
0
const {getCurrentFiberStackAddendum} = ReactDebugCurrentFiber;0
let validateDOMNesting = () => {};0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  // This validation code was written based on the HTML5 parsing spec:0
  // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/syntax.html#has-an-element-in-scope0
  //0
  // Note: this does not catch all invalid nesting, nor does it try to (as it's0
  // not clear what practical benefit doing so provides); instead, we warn only0
  // for cases where the parser will give a parse tree differing from what React0
  // intended. For example, <b><div></div></b> is invalid but we don't warn0
  // because it still parses correctly; we do warn for other cases like nested0
  // <p> tags where the beginning of the second element implicitly closes the0
  // first, causing a confusing mess.0
0
  // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/syntax.html#special0
  const specialTags = [0
    'address',0
    'applet',0
    'area',0
    'article',0
    'aside',0
    'base',0
    'basefont',0
    'bgsound',0
    'blockquote',0
    'body',0
    'br',0
    'button',0
    'caption',0
    'center',0
    'col',0
    'colgroup',0
    'dd',0
    'details',0
    'dir',0
    'div',0
    'dl',0
    'dt',0
    'embed',0
    'fieldset',0
    'figcaption',0
    'figure',0
    'footer',0
    'form',0
    'frame',0
    'frameset',0
    'h1',0
    'h2',0
    'h3',0
    'h4',0
    'h5',0
    'h6',0
    'head',0
    'header',0
    'hgroup',0
    'hr',0
    'html',0
    'iframe',0
    'img',0
    'input',0
    'isindex',0
    'li',0
    'link',0
    'listing',0
    'main',0
    'marquee',0
    'menu',0
    'menuitem',0
    'meta',0
    'nav',0
    'noembed',0
    'noframes',0
    'noscript',0
    'object',0
    'ol',0
    'p',0
    'param',0
    'plaintext',0
    'pre',0
    'script',0
    'section',0
    'select',0
    'source',0
    'style',0
    'summary',0
    'table',0
    'tbody',0
    'td',0
    'template',0
    'textarea',0
    'tfoot',0
    'th',0
    'thead',0
    'title',0
    'tr',0
    'track',0
    'ul',0
    'wbr',0
    'xmp',0
  ];0
0
  // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/syntax.html#has-an-element-in-scope0
  const inScopeTags = [0
    'applet',0
    'caption',0
    'html',0
    'table',0
    'td',0
    'th',0
    'marquee',0
    'object',0
    'template',0
0
    // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/syntax.html#html-integration-point0
    // TODO: Distinguish by namespace here -- for <title>, including it here0
    // errs on the side of fewer warnings0
    'foreignObject',0
    'desc',0
    'title',0
  ];0
0
  // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/syntax.html#has-an-element-in-button-scope0
  const buttonScopeTags = inScopeTags.concat(['button']);0
0
  // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/syntax.html#generate-implied-end-tags0
  const impliedEndTags = [0
    'dd',0
    'dt',0
    'li',0
    'option',0
    'optgroup',0
    'p',0
    'rp',0
    'rt',0
  ];0
0
  const emptyAncestorInfo = {0
    current: null,0
0
    formTag: null,0
    aTagInScope: null,0
    buttonTagInScope: null,0
    nobrTagInScope: null,0
    pTagInButtonScope: null,0
0
    listItemTagAutoclosing: null,0
    dlItemTagAutoclosing: null,0
  };0
0
  const updatedAncestorInfo = function(oldInfo, tag, instance) {0
    let ancestorInfo = {...(oldInfo || emptyAncestorInfo)};0
    let info = {tag: tag, instance: instance};0
0
    if (inScopeTags.indexOf(tag) !== -1) {0
      ancestorInfo.aTagInScope = null;0
      ancestorInfo.buttonTagInScope = null;0
      ancestorInfo.nobrTagInScope = null;0
    }0
    if (buttonScopeTags.indexOf(tag) !== -1) {0
      ancestorInfo.pTagInButtonScope = null;0
    }0
0
    // See rules for 'li', 'dd', 'dt' start tags in0
    // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/syntax.html#parsing-main-inbody0
    if (0
      specialTags.indexOf(tag) !== -1 &&0
      tag !== 'address' &&0
      tag !== 'div' &&0
      tag !== 'p'0
    ) {0
      ancestorInfo.listItemTagAutoclosing = null;0
      ancestorInfo.dlItemTagAutoclosing = null;0
    }0
0
    ancestorInfo.current = info;0
0
    if (tag === 'form') {0
      ancestorInfo.formTag = info;0
    }0
    if (tag === 'a') {0
      ancestorInfo.aTagInScope = info;0
    }0
    if (tag === 'button') {0
      ancestorInfo.buttonTagInScope = info;0
    }0
    if (tag === 'nobr') {0
      ancestorInfo.nobrTagInScope = info;0
    }0
    if (tag === 'p') {0
      ancestorInfo.pTagInButtonScope = info;0
    }0
    if (tag === 'li') {0
      ancestorInfo.listItemTagAutoclosing = info;0
    }0
    if (tag === 'dd' || tag === 'dt') {0
      ancestorInfo.dlItemTagAutoclosing = info;0
    }0
0
    return ancestorInfo;0
  };0
0
  /**0
   * Returns whether0
   */0
  const isTagValidWithParent = function(tag, parentTag) {0
    // First, let's check if we're in an unusual parsing mode...0
    switch (parentTag) {0
      // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/syntax.html#parsing-main-inselect0
      case 'select':0
        return tag === 'option' || tag === 'optgroup' || tag === '#text';0
      case 'optgroup':0
        return tag === 'option' || tag === '#text';0
      // Strictly speaking, seeing an <option> doesn't mean we're in a <select>0
      // but0
      case 'option':0
        return tag === '#text';0
      // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/syntax.html#parsing-main-intd0
      // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/syntax.html#parsing-main-incaption0
      // No special behavior since these rules fall back to "in body" mode for0
      // all except special table nodes which cause bad parsing behavior anyway.0
0
      // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/syntax.html#parsing-main-intr0
      case 'tr':0
        return (0
          tag === 'th' ||0
          tag === 'td' ||0
          tag === 'style' ||0
          tag === 'script' ||0
          tag === 'template'0
        );0
      // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/syntax.html#parsing-main-intbody0
      case 'tbody':0
      case 'thead':0
      case 'tfoot':0
        return (0
          tag === 'tr' ||0
          tag === 'style' ||0
          tag === 'script' ||0
          tag === 'template'0
        );0
      // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/syntax.html#parsing-main-incolgroup0
      case 'colgroup':0
        return tag === 'col' || tag === 'template';0
      // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/syntax.html#parsing-main-intable0
      case 'table':0
        return (0
          tag === 'caption' ||0
          tag === 'colgroup' ||0
          tag === 'tbody' ||0
          tag === 'tfoot' ||0
          tag === 'thead' ||0
          tag === 'style' ||0
          tag === 'script' ||0
          tag === 'template'0
        );0
      // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/syntax.html#parsing-main-inhead0
      case 'head':0
        return (0
          tag === 'base' ||0
          tag === 'basefont' ||0
          tag === 'bgsound' ||0
          tag === 'link' ||0
          tag === 'meta' ||0
          tag === 'title' ||0
          tag === 'noscript' ||0
          tag === 'noframes' ||0
          tag === 'style' ||0
          tag === 'script' ||0
          tag === 'template'0
        );0
      // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/semantics.html#the-html-element0
      case 'html':0
        return tag === 'head' || tag === 'body';0
      case '#document':0
        return tag === 'html';0
    }0
0
    // Probably in the "in body" parsing mode, so we outlaw only tag combos0
    // where the parsing rules cause implicit opens or closes to be added.0
    // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/syntax.html#parsing-main-inbody0
    switch (tag) {0
      case 'h1':0
      case 'h2':0
      case 'h3':0
      case 'h4':0
      case 'h5':0
      case 'h6':0
        return (0
          parentTag !== 'h1' &&0
          parentTag !== 'h2' &&0
          parentTag !== 'h3' &&0
          parentTag !== 'h4' &&0
          parentTag !== 'h5' &&0
          parentTag !== 'h6'0
        );0
0
      case 'rp':0
      case 'rt':0
        return impliedEndTags.indexOf(parentTag) === -1;0
0
      case 'body':0
      case 'caption':0
      case 'col':0
      case 'colgroup':0
      case 'frame':0
      case 'head':0
      case 'html':0
      case 'tbody':0
      case 'td':0
      case 'tfoot':0
      case 'th':0
      case 'thead':0
      case 'tr':0
        // These tags are only valid with a few parents that have special child0
        // parsing rules -- if we're down here, then none of those matched and0
        // so we allow it only if we don't know what the parent is, as all other0
        // cases are invalid.0
        return parentTag == null;0
    }0
0
    return true;0
  };0
0
  /**0
   * Returns whether0
   */0
  const findInvalidAncestorForTag = function(tag, ancestorInfo) {0
    switch (tag) {0
      case 'address':0
      case 'article':0
      case 'aside':0
      case 'blockquote':0
      case 'center':0
      case 'details':0
      case 'dialog':0
      case 'dir':0
      case 'div':0
      case 'dl':0
      case 'fieldset':0
      case 'figcaption':0
      case 'figure':0
      case 'footer':0
      case 'header':0
      case 'hgroup':0
      case 'main':0
      case 'menu':0
      case 'nav':0
      case 'ol':0
      case 'p':0
      case 'section':0
      case 'summary':0
      case 'ul':0
      case 'pre':0
      case 'listing':0
      case 'table':0
      case 'hr':0
      case 'xmp':0
      case 'h1':0
      case 'h2':0
      case 'h3':0
      case 'h4':0
      case 'h5':0
      case 'h6':0
        return ancestorInfo.pTagInButtonScope;0
0
      case 'form':0
        return ancestorInfo.formTag || ancestorInfo.pTagInButtonScope;0
0
      case 'li':0
        return ancestorInfo.listItemTagAutoclosing;0
0
      case 'dd':0
      case 'dt':0
        return ancestorInfo.dlItemTagAutoclosing;0
0
      case 'button':0
        return ancestorInfo.buttonTagInScope;0
0
      case 'a':0
        // Spec says something about storing a list of markers, but it sounds0
        // equivalent to this check.0
        return ancestorInfo.aTagInScope;0
0
      case 'nobr':0
        return ancestorInfo.nobrTagInScope;0
    }0
0
    return null;0
  };0
0
  const didWarn = {};0
0
  validateDOMNesting = function(childTag, childText, ancestorInfo) {0
    ancestorInfo = ancestorInfo || emptyAncestorInfo;0
    const parentInfo = ancestorInfo.current;0
    const parentTag = parentInfo && parentInfo.tag;0
0
    if (childText != null) {0
      warning(0
        childTag == null,0
        'validateDOMNesting: when childText is passed, childTag should be null',0
      );0
      childTag = '#text';0
    }0
0
    const invalidParent = isTagValidWithParent(childTag, parentTag)0
      ? null0
      : parentInfo;0
    const invalidAncestor = invalidParent0
      ? null0
      : findInvalidAncestorForTag(childTag, ancestorInfo);0
    const invalidParentOrAncestor = invalidParent || invalidAncestor;0
    if (!invalidParentOrAncestor) {0
      return;0
    }0
0
    const ancestorTag = invalidParentOrAncestor.tag;0
    const addendum = getCurrentFiberStackAddendum();0
0
    const warnKey =0
      !!invalidParent + '|' + childTag + '|' + ancestorTag + '|' + addendum;0
    if (didWarn[warnKey]) {0
      return;0
    }0
    didWarn[warnKey] = true;0
0
    let tagDisplayName = childTag;0
    let whitespaceInfo = '';0
    if (childTag === '#text') {0
      if (/\S/.test(childText)) {0
        tagDisplayName = 'Text nodes';0
      } else {0
        tagDisplayName = 'Whitespace text nodes';0
        whitespaceInfo =0
          " Make sure you don't have any extra whitespace between tags on " +0
          'each line of your source code.';0
      }0
    } else {0
      tagDisplayName = '<' + childTag + '>';0
    }0
0
    if (invalidParent) {0
      let info = '';0
      if (ancestorTag === 'table' && childTag === 'tr') {0
        info +=0
          ' Add a <tbody> to your code to match the DOM tree generated by ' +0
          'the browser.';0
      }0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'validateDOMNesting(...): %s cannot appear as a child of <%s>.%s%s%s',0
        tagDisplayName,0
        ancestorTag,0
        whitespaceInfo,0
        info,0
        addendum,0
      );0
    } else {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'validateDOMNesting(...): %s cannot appear as a descendant of ' +0
          '<%s>.%s',0
        tagDisplayName,0
        ancestorTag,0
        addendum,0
      );0
    }0
  };0
0
  // TODO: turn this into a named export0
  validateDOMNesting.updatedAncestorInfo = updatedAncestorInfo;0
}0
0
export default validateDOMNesting;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2016-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const React = require('react');0
const ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
0
describe('dangerouslySetInnerHTML', () => {0
  describe('when the node has innerHTML property', () => {0
    it('sets innerHTML on it', () => {0
      const container = document.createElement('div');0
      const node = ReactDOM.render(0
        <div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: '<h1>Hello</h1>'}} />,0
        container,0
      );0
      expect(node.innerHTML).toBe('<h1>Hello</h1>');0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('when the node does not have an innerHTML property', () => {0
    let innerHTMLDescriptor;0
0
    // In some versions of IE (TODO: which ones?) SVG nodes don't have0
    // innerHTML. To simulate this, we will take it off the Element prototype0
    // and put it onto the HTMLDivElement prototype. We expect that the logic0
    // checks for existence of innerHTML on SVG, and if one doesn't exist, falls0
    // back to using appendChild and removeChild.0
0
    beforeEach(() => {0
      innerHTMLDescriptor = Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(0
        Element.prototype,0
        'innerHTML',0
      );0
      delete Element.prototype.innerHTML;0
      Object.defineProperty(0
        HTMLDivElement.prototype,0
        'innerHTML',0
        innerHTMLDescriptor,0
      );0
    });0
0
    afterEach(() => {0
      delete HTMLDivElement.prototype.innerHTML;0
      Object.defineProperty(0
        Element.prototype,0
        'innerHTML',0
        innerHTMLDescriptor,0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('sets innerHTML on it', () => {0
      const html = '<circle></circle>';0
      const container = document.createElementNS(0
        'http://www.w3.org/2000/svg',0
        'svg',0
      );0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <g dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: html}} />,0
        container,0
      );0
      const circle = container.firstChild.firstChild;0
      expect(circle.tagName).toBe('circle');0
    });0
0
    it('clears previous children', () => {0
      const firstHtml = '<rect></rect>';0
      const secondHtml = '<circle></circle>';0
0
      const container = document.createElementNS(0
        'http://www.w3.org/2000/svg',0
        'svg',0
      );0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <g dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: firstHtml}} />,0
        container,0
      );0
      const rect = container.firstChild.firstChild;0
      expect(rect.tagName).toBe('rect');0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <g dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: secondHtml}} />,0
        container,0
      );0
      const circle = container.firstChild.firstChild;0
      expect(circle.tagName).toBe('circle');0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
// TODO: can we express this test with only public API?0
const getNodeForCharacterOffset = require('../getNodeForCharacterOffset')0
  .default;0
0
// Create node from HTML string0
function createNode(html) {0
  const node = (getTestDocument() || document).createElement('div');0
  node.innerHTML = html;0
  return node;0
}0
0
function getTestDocument(markup) {0
  const doc = document.implementation.createHTMLDocument('');0
  doc.open();0
  doc.write(0
    markup ||0
      '<!doctype html><html><meta charset=utf-8><title>test doc</title>',0
  );0
  doc.close();0
  return doc;0
}0
0
// Check getNodeForCharacterOffset return value matches expected result.0
function expectNodeOffset(result, textContent, nodeOffset) {0
  expect(result.node.textContent).toBe(textContent);0
  expect(result.offset).toBe(nodeOffset);0
}0
0
describe('getNodeForCharacterOffset', () => {0
  it('should handle siblings', () => {0
    const node = createNode('<i>123</i><i>456</i><i>789</i>');0
0
    expectNodeOffset(getNodeForCharacterOffset(node, 0), '123', 0);0
    expectNodeOffset(getNodeForCharacterOffset(node, 4), '456', 1);0
  });0
0
  it('should handle trailing chars', () => {0
    const node = createNode('<i>123</i><i>456</i><i>789</i>');0
0
    expectNodeOffset(getNodeForCharacterOffset(node, 3), '123', 3);0
    expectNodeOffset(getNodeForCharacterOffset(node, 9), '789', 3);0
  });0
0
  it('should handle trees', () => {0
    const node = createNode(0
      '<i>' +0
        '<i>1</i>' +0
        '<i>' +0
        '<i>' +0
        '<i>2</i>' +0
        '<i></i>' +0
        '</i>' +0
        '</i>' +0
        '<i>' +0
        '3' +0
        '<i>45</i>' +0
        '</i>' +0
        '</i>',0
    );0
0
    expectNodeOffset(getNodeForCharacterOffset(node, 3), '3', 1);0
    expectNodeOffset(getNodeForCharacterOffset(node, 5), '45', 2);0
    expect(getNodeForCharacterOffset(node, 10)).toBeUndefined();0
  });0
0
  it('should handle non-existent offset', () => {0
    const node = createNode('<i>123</i>');0
0
    expect(getNodeForCharacterOffset(node, -1)).toBeUndefined();0
    expect(getNodeForCharacterOffset(node, 4)).toBeUndefined();0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import type {TopLevelType} from 'events/TopLevelEventTypes';0
0
import {accumulateTwoPhaseDispatches} from 'events/EventPropagators';0
import {canUseDOM} from 'shared/ExecutionEnvironment';0
0
import {0
  TOP_BLUR,0
  TOP_COMPOSITION_START,0
  TOP_COMPOSITION_END,0
  TOP_COMPOSITION_UPDATE,0
  TOP_KEY_DOWN,0
  TOP_KEY_PRESS,0
  TOP_KEY_UP,0
  TOP_MOUSE_DOWN,0
  TOP_TEXT_INPUT,0
  TOP_PASTE,0
} from './DOMTopLevelEventTypes';0
import * as FallbackCompositionState from './FallbackCompositionState';0
import SyntheticCompositionEvent from './SyntheticCompositionEvent';0
import SyntheticInputEvent from './SyntheticInputEvent';0
0
const END_KEYCODES = [9, 13, 27, 32]; // Tab, Return, Esc, Space0
const START_KEYCODE = 229;0
0
const canUseCompositionEvent = canUseDOM && 'CompositionEvent' in window;0
0
let documentMode = null;0
if (canUseDOM && 'documentMode' in document) {0
  documentMode = document.documentMode;0
}0
0
// Webkit offers a very useful `textInput` event that can be used to0
// directly represent `beforeInput`. The IE `textinput` event is not as0
// useful, so we don't use it.0
const canUseTextInputEvent =0
  canUseDOM && 'TextEvent' in window && !documentMode;0
0
// In IE9+, we have access to composition events, but the data supplied0
// by the native compositionend event may be incorrect. Japanese ideographic0
// spaces, for instance (\u3000) are not recorded correctly.0
const useFallbackCompositionData =0
  canUseDOM &&0
  (!canUseCompositionEvent ||0
    (documentMode && documentMode > 8 && documentMode <= 11));0
0
const SPACEBAR_CODE = 32;0
const SPACEBAR_CHAR = String.fromCharCode(SPACEBAR_CODE);0
0
// Events and their corresponding property names.0
const eventTypes = {0
  beforeInput: {0
    phasedRegistrationNames: {0
      bubbled: 'onBeforeInput',0
      captured: 'onBeforeInputCapture',0
    },0
    dependencies: [0
      TOP_COMPOSITION_END,0
      TOP_KEY_PRESS,0
      TOP_TEXT_INPUT,0
      TOP_PASTE,0
    ],0
  },0
  compositionEnd: {0
    phasedRegistrationNames: {0
      bubbled: 'onCompositionEnd',0
      captured: 'onCompositionEndCapture',0
    },0
    dependencies: [0
      TOP_BLUR,0
      TOP_COMPOSITION_END,0
      TOP_KEY_DOWN,0
      TOP_KEY_PRESS,0
      TOP_KEY_UP,0
      TOP_MOUSE_DOWN,0
    ],0
  },0
  compositionStart: {0
    phasedRegistrationNames: {0
      bubbled: 'onCompositionStart',0
      captured: 'onCompositionStartCapture',0
    },0
    dependencies: [0
      TOP_BLUR,0
      TOP_COMPOSITION_START,0
      TOP_KEY_DOWN,0
      TOP_KEY_PRESS,0
      TOP_KEY_UP,0
      TOP_MOUSE_DOWN,0
    ],0
  },0
  compositionUpdate: {0
    phasedRegistrationNames: {0
      bubbled: 'onCompositionUpdate',0
      captured: 'onCompositionUpdateCapture',0
    },0
    dependencies: [0
      TOP_BLUR,0
      TOP_COMPOSITION_UPDATE,0
      TOP_KEY_DOWN,0
      TOP_KEY_PRESS,0
      TOP_KEY_UP,0
      TOP_MOUSE_DOWN,0
    ],0
  },0
};0
0
// Track whether we've ever handled a keypress on the space key.0
let hasSpaceKeypress = false;0
0
/**0
 * Return whether a native keypress event is assumed to be a command.0
 * This is required because Firefox fires `keypress` events for key commands0
 * (cut, copy, select-all, etc.) even though no character is inserted.0
 */0
function isKeypressCommand(nativeEvent) {0
  return (0
    (nativeEvent.ctrlKey || nativeEvent.altKey || nativeEvent.metaKey) &&0
    // ctrlKey && altKey is equivalent to AltGr, and is not a command.0
    !(nativeEvent.ctrlKey && nativeEvent.altKey)0
  );0
}0
0
/**0
 * Translate native top level events into event types.0
 *0
 * @param {string} topLevelType0
 * @return {object}0
 */0
function getCompositionEventType(topLevelType) {0
  switch (topLevelType) {0
    case TOP_COMPOSITION_START:0
      return eventTypes.compositionStart;0
    case TOP_COMPOSITION_END:0
      return eventTypes.compositionEnd;0
    case TOP_COMPOSITION_UPDATE:0
      return eventTypes.compositionUpdate;0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Does our fallback best-guess model think this event signifies that0
 * composition has begun?0
 *0
 * @param {string} topLevelType0
 * @param {object} nativeEvent0
 * @return {boolean}0
 */0
function isFallbackCompositionStart(topLevelType, nativeEvent) {0
  return topLevelType === TOP_KEY_DOWN && nativeEvent.keyCode === START_KEYCODE;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Does our fallback mode think that this event is the end of composition?0
 *0
 * @param {string} topLevelType0
 * @param {object} nativeEvent0
 * @return {boolean}0
 */0
function isFallbackCompositionEnd(topLevelType, nativeEvent) {0
  switch (topLevelType) {0
    case TOP_KEY_UP:0
      // Command keys insert or clear IME input.0
      return END_KEYCODES.indexOf(nativeEvent.keyCode) !== -1;0
    case TOP_KEY_DOWN:0
      // Expect IME keyCode on each keydown. If we get any other0
      // code we must have exited earlier.0
      return nativeEvent.keyCode !== START_KEYCODE;0
    case TOP_KEY_PRESS:0
    case TOP_MOUSE_DOWN:0
    case TOP_BLUR:0
      // Events are not possible without cancelling IME.0
      return true;0
    default:0
      return false;0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Google Input Tools provides composition data via a CustomEvent,0
 * with the `data` property populated in the `detail` object. If this0
 * is available on the event object, use it. If not, this is a plain0
 * composition event and we have nothing special to extract.0
 *0
 * @param {object} nativeEvent0
 * @return {?string}0
 */0
function getDataFromCustomEvent(nativeEvent) {0
  const detail = nativeEvent.detail;0
  if (typeof detail === 'object' && 'data' in detail) {0
    return detail.data;0
  }0
  return null;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Check if a composition event was triggered by Korean IME.0
 * Our fallback mode does not work well with IE's Korean IME,0
 * so just use native composition events when Korean IME is used.0
 * Although CompositionEvent.locale property is deprecated,0
 * it is available in IE, where our fallback mode is enabled.0
 *0
 * @param {object} nativeEvent0
 * @return {boolean}0
 */0
function isUsingKoreanIME(nativeEvent) {0
  return nativeEvent.locale === 'ko';0
}0
0
// Track the current IME composition status, if any.0
let isComposing = false;0
0
/**0
 * @return {?object} A SyntheticCompositionEvent.0
 */0
function extractCompositionEvent(0
  topLevelType,0
  targetInst,0
  nativeEvent,0
  nativeEventTarget,0
) {0
  let eventType;0
  let fallbackData;0
0
  if (canUseCompositionEvent) {0
    eventType = getCompositionEventType(topLevelType);0
  } else if (!isComposing) {0
    if (isFallbackCompositionStart(topLevelType, nativeEvent)) {0
      eventType = eventTypes.compositionStart;0
    }0
  } else if (isFallbackCompositionEnd(topLevelType, nativeEvent)) {0
    eventType = eventTypes.compositionEnd;0
  }0
0
  if (!eventType) {0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  if (useFallbackCompositionData && !isUsingKoreanIME(nativeEvent)) {0
    // The current composition is stored statically and must not be0
    // overwritten while composition continues.0
    if (!isComposing && eventType === eventTypes.compositionStart) {0
      isComposing = FallbackCompositionState.initialize(nativeEventTarget);0
    } else if (eventType === eventTypes.compositionEnd) {0
      if (isComposing) {0
        fallbackData = FallbackCompositionState.getData();0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  const event = SyntheticCompositionEvent.getPooled(0
    eventType,0
    targetInst,0
    nativeEvent,0
    nativeEventTarget,0
  );0
0
  if (fallbackData) {0
    // Inject data generated from fallback path into the synthetic event.0
    // This matches the property of native CompositionEventInterface.0
    event.data = fallbackData;0
  } else {0
    const customData = getDataFromCustomEvent(nativeEvent);0
    if (customData !== null) {0
      event.data = customData;0
    }0
  }0
0
  accumulateTwoPhaseDispatches(event);0
  return event;0
}0
0
/**0
 * @param {TopLevelType} topLevelType Number from `TopLevelType`.0
 * @param {object} nativeEvent Native browser event.0
 * @return {?string} The string corresponding to this `beforeInput` event.0
 */0
function getNativeBeforeInputChars(topLevelType: TopLevelType, nativeEvent) {0
  switch (topLevelType) {0
    case TOP_COMPOSITION_END:0
      return getDataFromCustomEvent(nativeEvent);0
    case TOP_KEY_PRESS:0
      /**0
       * If native `textInput` events are available, our goal is to make0
       * use of them. However, there is a special case: the spacebar key.0
       * In Webkit, preventing default on a spacebar `textInput` event0
       * cancels character insertion, but it *also* causes the browser0
       * to fall back to its default spacebar behavior of scrolling the0
       * page.0
       *0
       * Tracking at:0
       * https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=3551030
       *0
       * To avoid this issue, use the keypress event as if no `textInput`0
       * event is available.0
       */0
      const which = nativeEvent.which;0
      if (which !== SPACEBAR_CODE) {0
        return null;0
      }0
0
      hasSpaceKeypress = true;0
      return SPACEBAR_CHAR;0
0
    case TOP_TEXT_INPUT:0
      // Record the characters to be added to the DOM.0
      const chars = nativeEvent.data;0
0
      // If it's a spacebar character, assume that we have already handled0
      // it at the keypress level and bail immediately. Android Chrome0
      // doesn't give us keycodes, so we need to blacklist it.0
      if (chars === SPACEBAR_CHAR && hasSpaceKeypress) {0
        return null;0
      }0
0
      return chars;0
0
    default:0
      // For other native event types, do nothing.0
      return null;0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * For browsers that do not provide the `textInput` event, extract the0
 * appropriate string to use for SyntheticInputEvent.0
 *0
 * @param {number} topLevelType Number from `TopLevelEventTypes`.0
 * @param {object} nativeEvent Native browser event.0
 * @return {?string} The fallback string for this `beforeInput` event.0
 */0
function getFallbackBeforeInputChars(topLevelType: TopLevelType, nativeEvent) {0
  // If we are currently composing (IME) and using a fallback to do so,0
  // try to extract the composed characters from the fallback object.0
  // If composition event is available, we extract a string only at0
  // compositionevent, otherwise extract it at fallback events.0
  if (isComposing) {0
    if (0
      topLevelType === TOP_COMPOSITION_END ||0
      (!canUseCompositionEvent &&0
        isFallbackCompositionEnd(topLevelType, nativeEvent))0
    ) {0
      const chars = FallbackCompositionState.getData();0
      FallbackCompositionState.reset();0
      isComposing = false;0
      return chars;0
    }0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  switch (topLevelType) {0
    case TOP_PASTE:0
      // If a paste event occurs after a keypress, throw out the input0
      // chars. Paste events should not lead to BeforeInput events.0
      return null;0
    case TOP_KEY_PRESS:0
      /**0
       * As of v27, Firefox may fire keypress events even when no character0
       * will be inserted. A few possibilities:0
       *0
       * - `which` is `0`. Arrow keys, Esc key, etc.0
       *0
       * - `which` is the pressed key code, but no char is available.0
       *   Ex: 'AltGr + d` in Polish. There is no modified character for0
       *   this key combination and no character is inserted into the0
       *   document, but FF fires the keypress for char code `100` anyway.0
       *   No `input` event will occur.0
       *0
       * - `which` is the pressed key code, but a command combination is0
       *   being used. Ex: `Cmd+C`. No character is inserted, and no0
       *   `input` event will occur.0
       */0
      if (!isKeypressCommand(nativeEvent)) {0
        // IE fires the `keypress` event when a user types an emoji via0
        // Touch keyboard of Windows.  In such a case, the `char` property0
        // holds an emoji character like `\uD83D\uDE0A`.  Because its length0
        // is 2, the property `which` does not represent an emoji correctly.0
        // In such a case, we directly return the `char` property instead of0
        // using `which`.0
        if (nativeEvent.char && nativeEvent.char.length > 1) {0
          return nativeEvent.char;0
        } else if (nativeEvent.which) {0
          return String.fromCharCode(nativeEvent.which);0
        }0
      }0
      return null;0
    case TOP_COMPOSITION_END:0
      return useFallbackCompositionData && !isUsingKoreanIME(nativeEvent)0
        ? null0
        : nativeEvent.data;0
    default:0
      return null;0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Extract a SyntheticInputEvent for `beforeInput`, based on either native0
 * `textInput` or fallback behavior.0
 *0
 * @return {?object} A SyntheticInputEvent.0
 */0
function extractBeforeInputEvent(0
  topLevelType,0
  targetInst,0
  nativeEvent,0
  nativeEventTarget,0
) {0
  let chars;0
0
  if (canUseTextInputEvent) {0
    chars = getNativeBeforeInputChars(topLevelType, nativeEvent);0
  } else {0
    chars = getFallbackBeforeInputChars(topLevelType, nativeEvent);0
  }0
0
  // If no characters are being inserted, no BeforeInput event should0
  // be fired.0
  if (!chars) {0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  const event = SyntheticInputEvent.getPooled(0
    eventTypes.beforeInput,0
    targetInst,0
    nativeEvent,0
    nativeEventTarget,0
  );0
0
  event.data = chars;0
  accumulateTwoPhaseDispatches(event);0
  return event;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Create an `onBeforeInput` event to match0
 * http://www.w3.org/TR/2013/WD-DOM-Level-3-Events-20131105/#events-inputevents.0
 *0
 * This event plugin is based on the native `textInput` event0
 * available in Chrome, Safari, Opera, and IE. This event fires after0
 * `onKeyPress` and `onCompositionEnd`, but before `onInput`.0
 *0
 * `beforeInput` is spec'd but not implemented in any browsers, and0
 * the `input` event does not provide any useful information about what has0
 * actually been added, contrary to the spec. Thus, `textInput` is the best0
 * available event to identify the characters that have actually been inserted0
 * into the target node.0
 *0
 * This plugin is also responsible for emitting `composition` events, thus0
 * allowing us to share composition fallback code for both `beforeInput` and0
 * `composition` event types.0
 */0
const BeforeInputEventPlugin = {0
  eventTypes: eventTypes,0
0
  extractEvents: function(0
    topLevelType,0
    targetInst,0
    nativeEvent,0
    nativeEventTarget,0
  ) {0
    const composition = extractCompositionEvent(0
      topLevelType,0
      targetInst,0
      nativeEvent,0
      nativeEventTarget,0
    );0
0
    const beforeInput = extractBeforeInputEvent(0
      topLevelType,0
      targetInst,0
      nativeEvent,0
      nativeEventTarget,0
    );0
0
    if (composition === null) {0
      return beforeInput;0
    }0
0
    if (beforeInput === null) {0
      return composition;0
    }0
0
    return [composition, beforeInput];0
  },0
};0
0
export default BeforeInputEventPlugin;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import * as EventPluginHub from 'events/EventPluginHub';0
import {accumulateTwoPhaseDispatches} from 'events/EventPropagators';0
import {enqueueStateRestore} from 'events/ReactControlledComponent';0
import {batchedUpdates} from 'events/ReactGenericBatching';0
import SyntheticEvent from 'events/SyntheticEvent';0
import isTextInputElement from 'shared/isTextInputElement';0
import {canUseDOM} from 'shared/ExecutionEnvironment';0
0
import {0
  TOP_BLUR,0
  TOP_CHANGE,0
  TOP_CLICK,0
  TOP_FOCUS,0
  TOP_INPUT,0
  TOP_KEY_DOWN,0
  TOP_KEY_UP,0
  TOP_SELECTION_CHANGE,0
} from './DOMTopLevelEventTypes';0
import getEventTarget from './getEventTarget';0
import isEventSupported from './isEventSupported';0
import {getNodeFromInstance} from '../client/ReactDOMComponentTree';0
import * as inputValueTracking from '../client/inputValueTracking';0
import {setDefaultValue} from '../client/ReactDOMFiberInput';0
0
const eventTypes = {0
  change: {0
    phasedRegistrationNames: {0
      bubbled: 'onChange',0
      captured: 'onChangeCapture',0
    },0
    dependencies: [0
      TOP_BLUR,0
      TOP_CHANGE,0
      TOP_CLICK,0
      TOP_FOCUS,0
      TOP_INPUT,0
      TOP_KEY_DOWN,0
      TOP_KEY_UP,0
      TOP_SELECTION_CHANGE,0
    ],0
  },0
};0
0
function createAndAccumulateChangeEvent(inst, nativeEvent, target) {0
  const event = SyntheticEvent.getPooled(0
    eventTypes.change,0
    inst,0
    nativeEvent,0
    target,0
  );0
  event.type = 'change';0
  // Flag this event loop as needing state restore.0
  enqueueStateRestore(target);0
  accumulateTwoPhaseDispatches(event);0
  return event;0
}0
/**0
 * For IE shims0
 */0
let activeElement = null;0
let activeElementInst = null;0
0
/**0
 * SECTION: handle `change` event0
 */0
function shouldUseChangeEvent(elem) {0
  const nodeName = elem.nodeName && elem.nodeName.toLowerCase();0
  return (0
    nodeName === 'select' || (nodeName === 'input' && elem.type === 'file')0
  );0
}0
0
function manualDispatchChangeEvent(nativeEvent) {0
  const event = createAndAccumulateChangeEvent(0
    activeElementInst,0
    nativeEvent,0
    getEventTarget(nativeEvent),0
  );0
0
  // If change and propertychange bubbled, we'd just bind to it like all the0
  // other events and have it go through ReactBrowserEventEmitter. Since it0
  // doesn't, we manually listen for the events and so we have to enqueue and0
  // process the abstract event manually.0
  //0
  // Batching is necessary here in order to ensure that all event handlers run0
  // before the next rerender (including event handlers attached to ancestor0
  // elements instead of directly on the input). Without this, controlled0
  // components don't work properly in conjunction with event bubbling because0
  // the component is rerendered and the value reverted before all the event0
  // handlers can run. See https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/708.0
  batchedUpdates(runEventInBatch, event);0
}0
0
function runEventInBatch(event) {0
  EventPluginHub.runEventsInBatch(event, false);0
}0
0
function getInstIfValueChanged(targetInst) {0
  const targetNode = getNodeFromInstance(targetInst);0
  if (inputValueTracking.updateValueIfChanged(targetNode)) {0
    return targetInst;0
  }0
}0
0
function getTargetInstForChangeEvent(topLevelType, targetInst) {0
  if (topLevelType === TOP_CHANGE) {0
    return targetInst;0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * SECTION: handle `input` event0
 */0
let isInputEventSupported = false;0
if (canUseDOM) {0
  // IE9 claims to support the input event but fails to trigger it when0
  // deleting text, so we ignore its input events.0
  isInputEventSupported =0
    isEventSupported('input') &&0
    (!document.documentMode || document.documentMode > 9);0
}0
0
/**0
 * (For IE <=9) Starts tracking propertychange events on the passed-in element0
 * and override the value property so that we can distinguish user events from0
 * value changes in JS.0
 */0
function startWatchingForValueChange(target, targetInst) {0
  activeElement = target;0
  activeElementInst = targetInst;0
  activeElement.attachEvent('onpropertychange', handlePropertyChange);0
}0
0
/**0
 * (For IE <=9) Removes the event listeners from the currently-tracked element,0
 * if any exists.0
 */0
function stopWatchingForValueChange() {0
  if (!activeElement) {0
    return;0
  }0
  activeElement.detachEvent('onpropertychange', handlePropertyChange);0
  activeElement = null;0
  activeElementInst = null;0
}0
0
/**0
 * (For IE <=9) Handles a propertychange event, sending a `change` event if0
 * the value of the active element has changed.0
 */0
function handlePropertyChange(nativeEvent) {0
  if (nativeEvent.propertyName !== 'value') {0
    return;0
  }0
  if (getInstIfValueChanged(activeElementInst)) {0
    manualDispatchChangeEvent(nativeEvent);0
  }0
}0
0
function handleEventsForInputEventPolyfill(topLevelType, target, targetInst) {0
  if (topLevelType === TOP_FOCUS) {0
    // In IE9, propertychange fires for most input events but is buggy and0
    // doesn't fire when text is deleted, but conveniently, selectionchange0
    // appears to fire in all of the remaining cases so we catch those and0
    // forward the event if the value has changed0
    // In either case, we don't want to call the event handler if the value0
    // is changed from JS so we redefine a setter for `.value` that updates0
    // our activeElementValue variable, allowing us to ignore those changes0
    //0
    // stopWatching() should be a noop here but we call it just in case we0
    // missed a blur event somehow.0
    stopWatchingForValueChange();0
    startWatchingForValueChange(target, targetInst);0
  } else if (topLevelType === TOP_BLUR) {0
    stopWatchingForValueChange();0
  }0
}0
0
// For IE8 and IE9.0
function getTargetInstForInputEventPolyfill(topLevelType, targetInst) {0
  if (0
    topLevelType === TOP_SELECTION_CHANGE ||0
    topLevelType === TOP_KEY_UP ||0
    topLevelType === TOP_KEY_DOWN0
  ) {0
    // On the selectionchange event, the target is just document which isn't0
    // helpful for us so just check activeElement instead.0
    //0
    // 99% of the time, keydown and keyup aren't necessary. IE8 fails to fire0
    // propertychange on the first input event after setting `value` from a0
    // script and fires only keydown, keypress, keyup. Catching keyup usually0
    // gets it and catching keydown lets us fire an event for the first0
    // keystroke if user does a key repeat (it'll be a little delayed: right0
    // before the second keystroke). Other input methods (e.g., paste) seem to0
    // fire selectionchange normally.0
    return getInstIfValueChanged(activeElementInst);0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * SECTION: handle `click` event0
 */0
function shouldUseClickEvent(elem) {0
  // Use the `click` event to detect changes to checkbox and radio inputs.0
  // This approach works across all browsers, whereas `change` does not fire0
  // until `blur` in IE8.0
  const nodeName = elem.nodeName;0
  return (0
    nodeName &&0
    nodeName.toLowerCase() === 'input' &&0
    (elem.type === 'checkbox' || elem.type === 'radio')0
  );0
}0
0
function getTargetInstForClickEvent(topLevelType, targetInst) {0
  if (topLevelType === TOP_CLICK) {0
    return getInstIfValueChanged(targetInst);0
  }0
}0
0
function getTargetInstForInputOrChangeEvent(topLevelType, targetInst) {0
  if (topLevelType === TOP_INPUT || topLevelType === TOP_CHANGE) {0
    return getInstIfValueChanged(targetInst);0
  }0
}0
0
function handleControlledInputBlur(node) {0
  let state = node._wrapperState;0
0
  if (!state || !state.controlled || node.type !== 'number') {0
    return;0
  }0
0
  // If controlled, assign the value attribute to the current value on blur0
  setDefaultValue(node, 'number', node.value);0
}0
0
/**0
 * This plugin creates an `onChange` event that normalizes change events0
 * across form elements. This event fires at a time when it's possible to0
 * change the element's value without seeing a flicker.0
 *0
 * Supported elements are:0
 * - input (see `isTextInputElement`)0
 * - textarea0
 * - select0
 */0
const ChangeEventPlugin = {0
  eventTypes: eventTypes,0
0
  _isInputEventSupported: isInputEventSupported,0
0
  extractEvents: function(0
    topLevelType,0
    targetInst,0
    nativeEvent,0
    nativeEventTarget,0
  ) {0
    const targetNode = targetInst ? getNodeFromInstance(targetInst) : window;0
0
    let getTargetInstFunc, handleEventFunc;0
    if (shouldUseChangeEvent(targetNode)) {0
      getTargetInstFunc = getTargetInstForChangeEvent;0
    } else if (isTextInputElement(targetNode)) {0
      if (isInputEventSupported) {0
        getTargetInstFunc = getTargetInstForInputOrChangeEvent;0
      } else {0
        getTargetInstFunc = getTargetInstForInputEventPolyfill;0
        handleEventFunc = handleEventsForInputEventPolyfill;0
      }0
    } else if (shouldUseClickEvent(targetNode)) {0
      getTargetInstFunc = getTargetInstForClickEvent;0
    }0
0
    if (getTargetInstFunc) {0
      const inst = getTargetInstFunc(topLevelType, targetInst);0
      if (inst) {0
        const event = createAndAccumulateChangeEvent(0
          inst,0
          nativeEvent,0
          nativeEventTarget,0
        );0
        return event;0
      }0
    }0
0
    if (handleEventFunc) {0
      handleEventFunc(topLevelType, targetNode, targetInst);0
    }0
0
    // When blurring, set the value attribute for number inputs0
    if (topLevelType === TOP_BLUR) {0
      handleControlledInputBlur(targetNode);0
    }0
  },0
};0
0
export default ChangeEventPlugin;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
/**0
 * Module that is injectable into `EventPluginHub`, that specifies a0
 * deterministic ordering of `EventPlugin`s. A convenient way to reason about0
 * plugins, without having to package every one of them. This is better than0
 * having plugins be ordered in the same order that they are injected because0
 * that ordering would be influenced by the packaging order.0
 * `ResponderEventPlugin` must occur before `SimpleEventPlugin` so that0
 * preventing default on events is convenient in `SimpleEventPlugin` handlers.0
 */0
const DOMEventPluginOrder = [0
  'ResponderEventPlugin',0
  'SimpleEventPlugin',0
  'TapEventPlugin',0
  'EnterLeaveEventPlugin',0
  'ChangeEventPlugin',0
  'SelectEventPlugin',0
  'BeforeInputEventPlugin',0
];0
0
export default DOMEventPluginOrder;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0

/**0
 * To identify top level events in ReactDOM, we use constants defined by this0
 * module. This is the only module that uses the unsafe* methods to express0
 * that the constants actually correspond to the browser event names. This lets0
 * us save some bundle size by avoiding a top level type -> event name map.0
 * The rest of ReactDOM code should import top level types from this file.0
 */0
export const TOP_ABORT = unsafeCastStringToDOMTopLevelType('abort');0

  getVendorPrefixedEventName('animationend'),0
);0

// unless they're explicitly whitelisted in `ReactBrowserEventEmitter.listenTo`.0

  TOP_ABORT,0

 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
