import {accumulateEnterLeaveDispatches} from 'events/EventPropagators';0
0
import {0
  TOP_MOUSE_OUT,0
  TOP_MOUSE_OVER,0
  TOP_POINTER_OUT,0
  TOP_POINTER_OVER,0
} from './DOMTopLevelEventTypes';0
import SyntheticMouseEvent from './SyntheticMouseEvent';0
import SyntheticPointerEvent from './SyntheticPointerEvent';0
import {0
  getClosestInstanceFromNode,0
  getNodeFromInstance,0
} from '../client/ReactDOMComponentTree';0
0
const eventTypes = {0
  mouseEnter: {0
    registrationName: 'onMouseEnter',0
    dependencies: [TOP_MOUSE_OUT, TOP_MOUSE_OVER],0
  },0
  mouseLeave: {0
    registrationName: 'onMouseLeave',0
    dependencies: [TOP_MOUSE_OUT, TOP_MOUSE_OVER],0
  },0
  pointerEnter: {0
    registrationName: 'onPointerEnter',0
    dependencies: [TOP_POINTER_OUT, TOP_POINTER_OVER],0
  },0
  pointerLeave: {0
    registrationName: 'onPointerLeave',0
    dependencies: [TOP_POINTER_OUT, TOP_POINTER_OVER],0
  },0
};0
0
const EnterLeaveEventPlugin = {0
  eventTypes: eventTypes,0
0
  /**0
   * For almost every interaction we care about, there will be both a top-level0
   * `mouseover` and `mouseout` event that occurs. Only use `mouseout` so that0
   * we do not extract duplicate events. However, moving the mouse into the0
   * browser from outside will not fire a `mouseout` event. In this case, we use0
   * the `mouseover` top-level event.0
   */0
  extractEvents: function(0
    topLevelType,0
    targetInst,0
    nativeEvent,0
    nativeEventTarget,0
  ) {0
    const isOverEvent =0
      topLevelType === TOP_MOUSE_OVER || topLevelType === TOP_POINTER_OVER;0
    const isOutEvent =0
      topLevelType === TOP_MOUSE_OUT || topLevelType === TOP_POINTER_OUT;0
0
    if (isOverEvent && (nativeEvent.relatedTarget || nativeEvent.fromElement)) {0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    if (!isOutEvent && !isOverEvent) {0
      // Must not be a mouse or pointer in or out - ignoring.0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    let win;0
    if (nativeEventTarget.window === nativeEventTarget) {0
      // `nativeEventTarget` is probably a window object.0
      win = nativeEventTarget;0
    } else {0
      // TODO: Figure out why `ownerDocument` is sometimes undefined in IE8.0
      const doc = nativeEventTarget.ownerDocument;0
      if (doc) {0
        win = doc.defaultView || doc.parentWindow;0
      } else {0
        win = window;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let from;0
    let to;0
    if (isOutEvent) {0
      from = targetInst;0
      const related = nativeEvent.relatedTarget || nativeEvent.toElement;0
      to = related ? getClosestInstanceFromNode(related) : null;0
    } else {0
      // Moving to a node from outside the window.0
      from = null;0
      to = targetInst;0
    }0
0
    if (from === to) {0
      // Nothing pertains to our managed components.0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    let eventInterface, leaveEventType, enterEventType, eventTypePrefix;0
0
    if (topLevelType === TOP_MOUSE_OUT || topLevelType === TOP_MOUSE_OVER) {0
      eventInterface = SyntheticMouseEvent;0
      leaveEventType = eventTypes.mouseLeave;0
      enterEventType = eventTypes.mouseEnter;0
      eventTypePrefix = 'mouse';0
    } else if (0
      topLevelType === TOP_POINTER_OUT ||0
      topLevelType === TOP_POINTER_OVER0
    ) {0
      eventInterface = SyntheticPointerEvent;0
      leaveEventType = eventTypes.pointerLeave;0
      enterEventType = eventTypes.pointerEnter;0
      eventTypePrefix = 'pointer';0
    }0
0
    const fromNode = from == null ? win : getNodeFromInstance(from);0
    const toNode = to == null ? win : getNodeFromInstance(to);0
0
    const leave = eventInterface.getPooled(0
      leaveEventType,0
      from,0
      nativeEvent,0
      nativeEventTarget,0
    );0
    leave.type = eventTypePrefix + 'leave';0
    leave.target = fromNode;0
    leave.relatedTarget = toNode;0
0
    const enter = eventInterface.getPooled(0
      enterEventType,0
      to,0
      nativeEvent,0
      nativeEventTarget,0
    );0
    enter.type = eventTypePrefix + 'enter';0
    enter.target = toNode;0
    enter.relatedTarget = fromNode;0
0
    accumulateEnterLeaveDispatches(leave, enter, from, to);0
0
    return [leave, enter];0
  },0
};0
0
export default EnterLeaveEventPlugin;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
export function addEventBubbleListener(0
  element: Document | Element,0
  eventType: string,0
  listener: Function,0
): void {0
  element.addEventListener(eventType, listener, false);0
}0
0
export function addEventCaptureListener(0
  element: Document | Element,0
  eventType: string,0
  listener: Function,0
): void {0
  element.addEventListener(eventType, listener, true);0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import getTextContentAccessor from '../client/getTextContentAccessor';0
0
/**0
 * This helper object stores information about text content of a target node,0
 * allowing comparison of content before and after a given event.0
 *0
 * Identify the node where selection currently begins, then observe0
 * both its text content and its current position in the DOM. Since the0
 * browser may natively replace the target node during composition, we can0
 * use its position to find its replacement.0
 *0
 *0
 */0
const compositionState = {0
  _root: null,0
  _startText: null,0
  _fallbackText: null,0
};0
0
export function initialize(nativeEventTarget) {0
  compositionState._root = nativeEventTarget;0
  compositionState._startText = getText();0
  return true;0
}0
0
export function reset() {0
  compositionState._root = null;0
  compositionState._startText = null;0
  compositionState._fallbackText = null;0
}0
0
export function getData() {0
  if (compositionState._fallbackText) {0
    return compositionState._fallbackText;0
  }0
0
  let start;0
  const startValue = compositionState._startText;0
  const startLength = startValue.length;0
  let end;0
  const endValue = getText();0
  const endLength = endValue.length;0
0
  for (start = 0; start < startLength; start++) {0
    if (startValue[start] !== endValue[start]) {0
      break;0
    }0
  }0
0
  const minEnd = startLength - start;0
  for (end = 1; end <= minEnd; end++) {0
    if (startValue[startLength - end] !== endValue[endLength - end]) {0
      break;0
    }0
  }0
0
  const sliceTail = end > 1 ? 1 - end : undefined;0
  compositionState._fallbackText = endValue.slice(start, sliceTail);0
  return compositionState._fallbackText;0
}0
0
export function getText() {0
  if ('value' in compositionState._root) {0
    return compositionState._root.value;0
  }0
  return compositionState._root[getTextContentAccessor()];0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
/**0
 * `charCode` represents the actual "character code" and is safe to use with0
 * `String.fromCharCode`. As such, only keys that correspond to printable0
 * characters produce a valid `charCode`, the only exception to this is Enter.0
 * The Tab-key is considered non-printable and does not have a `charCode`,0
 * presumably because it does not produce a tab-character in browsers.0
 *0
 * @param {object} nativeEvent Native browser event.0
 * @return {number} Normalized `charCode` property.0
 */0
function getEventCharCode(nativeEvent) {0
  let charCode;0
  const keyCode = nativeEvent.keyCode;0
0
  if ('charCode' in nativeEvent) {0
    charCode = nativeEvent.charCode;0
0
    // FF does not set `charCode` for the Enter-key, check against `keyCode`.0
    if (charCode === 0 && keyCode === 13) {0
      charCode = 13;0
    }0
  } else {0
    // IE8 does not implement `charCode`, but `keyCode` has the correct value.0
    charCode = keyCode;0
  }0
0
  // IE and Edge (on Windows) and Chrome / Safari (on Windows and Linux)0
  // report Enter as charCode 10 when ctrl is pressed.0
  if (charCode === 10) {0
    charCode = 13;0
  }0
0
  // Some non-printable keys are reported in `charCode`/`keyCode`, discard them.0
  // Must not discard the (non-)printable Enter-key.0
  if (charCode >= 32 || charCode === 13) {0
    return charCode;0
  }0
0
  return 0;0
}0
0
export default getEventCharCode;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import getEventCharCode from './getEventCharCode';0
0
/**0
 * Normalization of deprecated HTML5 `key` values0
 * @see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent#Key_names0
 */0
const normalizeKey = {0
  Esc: 'Escape',0
  Spacebar: ' ',0
  Left: 'ArrowLeft',0
  Up: 'ArrowUp',0
  Right: 'ArrowRight',0
  Down: 'ArrowDown',0
  Del: 'Delete',0
  Win: 'OS',0
  Menu: 'ContextMenu',0
  Apps: 'ContextMenu',0
  Scroll: 'ScrollLock',0
  MozPrintableKey: 'Unidentified',0
};0
0
/**0
 * Translation from legacy `keyCode` to HTML5 `key`0
 * Only special keys supported, all others depend on keyboard layout or browser0
 * @see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent#Key_names0
 */0
const translateToKey = {0
  '8': 'Backspace',0
  '9': 'Tab',0
  '12': 'Clear',0
  '13': 'Enter',0
  '16': 'Shift',0
  '17': 'Control',0
  '18': 'Alt',0
  '19': 'Pause',0
  '20': 'CapsLock',0
  '27': 'Escape',0
  '32': ' ',0
  '33': 'PageUp',0
  '34': 'PageDown',0
  '35': 'End',0
  '36': 'Home',0
  '37': 'ArrowLeft',0
  '38': 'ArrowUp',0
  '39': 'ArrowRight',0
  '40': 'ArrowDown',0
  '45': 'Insert',0
  '46': 'Delete',0
  '112': 'F1',0
  '113': 'F2',0
  '114': 'F3',0
  '115': 'F4',0
  '116': 'F5',0
  '117': 'F6',0
  '118': 'F7',0
  '119': 'F8',0
  '120': 'F9',0
  '121': 'F10',0
  '122': 'F11',0
  '123': 'F12',0
  '144': 'NumLock',0
  '145': 'ScrollLock',0
  '224': 'Meta',0
};0
0
/**0
 * @param {object} nativeEvent Native browser event.0
 * @return {string} Normalized `key` property.0
 */0
function getEventKey(nativeEvent: KeyboardEvent): string {0
  if (nativeEvent.key) {0
    // Normalize inconsistent values reported by browsers due to0
    // implementations of a working draft specification.0
0
    // FireFox implements `key` but returns `MozPrintableKey` for all0
    // printable characters (normalized to `Unidentified`), ignore it.0
    const key = normalizeKey[nativeEvent.key] || nativeEvent.key;0
    if (key !== 'Unidentified') {0
      return key;0
    }0
  }0
0
  // Browser does not implement `key`, polyfill as much of it as we can.0
  if (nativeEvent.type === 'keypress') {0
    const charCode = getEventCharCode(nativeEvent);0
0
    // The enter-key is technically both printable and non-printable and can0
    // thus be captured by `keypress`, no other non-printable key should.0
    return charCode === 13 ? 'Enter' : String.fromCharCode(charCode);0
  }0
  if (nativeEvent.type === 'keydown' || nativeEvent.type === 'keyup') {0
    // While user keyboard layout determines the actual meaning of each0
    // `keyCode` value, almost all function keys have a universal value.0
    return translateToKey[nativeEvent.keyCode] || 'Unidentified';0
  }0
  return '';0
}0
0
export default getEventKey;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
/**0
 * Translation from modifier key to the associated property in the event.0
 * @see http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-3-Events/#keys-Modifiers0
 */0
0
const modifierKeyToProp = {0
  Alt: 'altKey',0
  Control: 'ctrlKey',0
  Meta: 'metaKey',0
  Shift: 'shiftKey',0
};0
0
// IE8 does not implement getModifierState so we simply map it to the only0
// modifier keys exposed by the event itself, does not support Lock-keys.0
// Currently, all major browsers except Chrome seems to support Lock-keys.0
function modifierStateGetter(keyArg) {0
  const syntheticEvent = this;0
  const nativeEvent = syntheticEvent.nativeEvent;0
  if (nativeEvent.getModifierState) {0
    return nativeEvent.getModifierState(keyArg);0
  }0
  const keyProp = modifierKeyToProp[keyArg];0
  return keyProp ? !!nativeEvent[keyProp] : false;0
}0
0
function getEventModifierState(nativeEvent) {0
  return modifierStateGetter;0
}0
0
export default getEventModifierState;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import {TEXT_NODE} from '../shared/HTMLNodeType';0
0
/**0
 * Gets the target node from a native browser event by accounting for0
 * inconsistencies in browser DOM APIs.0
 *0
 * @param {object} nativeEvent Native browser event.0
 * @return {DOMEventTarget} Target node.0
 */0
function getEventTarget(nativeEvent) {0
  // Fallback to nativeEvent.srcElement for IE90
  // https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/125060
  let target = nativeEvent.target || nativeEvent.srcElement || window;0
0
  // Normalize SVG <use> element events #49630
  if (target.correspondingUseElement) {0
    target = target.correspondingUseElement;0
  }0
0
  // Safari may fire events on text nodes (Node.TEXT_NODE is 3).0
  // @see http://www.quirksmode.org/js/events_properties.html0
  return target.nodeType === TEXT_NODE ? target.parentNode : target;0
}0
0
export default getEventTarget;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import {canUseDOM} from 'shared/ExecutionEnvironment';0
0
/**0
 * Generate a mapping of standard vendor prefixes using the defined style property and event name.0
 *0
 * @param {string} styleProp0
 * @param {string} eventName0
 * @returns {object}0
 */0
function makePrefixMap(styleProp, eventName) {0
  const prefixes = {};0
0
  prefixes[styleProp.toLowerCase()] = eventName.toLowerCase();0
  prefixes['Webkit' + styleProp] = 'webkit' + eventName;0
  prefixes['Moz' + styleProp] = 'moz' + eventName;0
  prefixes['ms' + styleProp] = 'MS' + eventName;0
  prefixes['O' + styleProp] = 'o' + eventName.toLowerCase();0
0
  return prefixes;0
}0
0
/**0
 * A list of event names to a configurable list of vendor prefixes.0
 */0
const vendorPrefixes = {0
  animationend: makePrefixMap('Animation', 'AnimationEnd'),0
  animationiteration: makePrefixMap('Animation', 'AnimationIteration'),0
  animationstart: makePrefixMap('Animation', 'AnimationStart'),0
  transitionend: makePrefixMap('Transition', 'TransitionEnd'),0
};0
0
/**0
 * Event names that have already been detected and prefixed (if applicable).0
 */0
const prefixedEventNames = {};0
0
/**0
 * Element to check for prefixes on.0
 */0
let style = {};0
0
/**0
 * Bootstrap if a DOM exists.0
 */0
if (canUseDOM) {0
  style = document.createElement('div').style;0
0
  // On some platforms, in particular some releases of Android 4.x,0
  // the un-prefixed "animation" and "transition" properties are defined on the0
  // style object but the events that fire will still be prefixed, so we need0
  // to check if the un-prefixed events are usable, and if not remove them from the map.0
  if (!('AnimationEvent' in window)) {0
    delete vendorPrefixes.animationend.animation;0
    delete vendorPrefixes.animationiteration.animation;0
    delete vendorPrefixes.animationstart.animation;0
  }0
0
  // Same as above0
  if (!('TransitionEvent' in window)) {0
    delete vendorPrefixes.transitionend.transition;0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Attempts to determine the correct vendor prefixed event name.0
 *0
 * @param {string} eventName0
 * @returns {string}0
 */0
function getVendorPrefixedEventName(eventName) {0
  if (prefixedEventNames[eventName]) {0
    return prefixedEventNames[eventName];0
  } else if (!vendorPrefixes[eventName]) {0
    return eventName;0
  }0
0
  const prefixMap = vendorPrefixes[eventName];0
0
  for (const styleProp in prefixMap) {0
    if (prefixMap.hasOwnProperty(styleProp) && styleProp in style) {0
      return (prefixedEventNames[eventName] = prefixMap[styleProp]);0
    }0
  }0
0
  return eventName;0
}0
0
export default getVendorPrefixedEventName;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import {canUseDOM} from 'shared/ExecutionEnvironment';0
0
/**0
 * Checks if an event is supported in the current execution environment.0
 *0
 * NOTE: This will not work correctly for non-generic events such as `change`,0
 * `reset`, `load`, `error`, and `select`.0
 *0
 * Borrows from Modernizr.0
 *0
 * @param {string} eventNameSuffix Event name, e.g. "click".0
 * @param {?boolean} capture Check if the capture phase is supported.0
 * @return {boolean} True if the event is supported.0
 * @internal0
 * @license Modernizr 3.0.0pre (Custom Build) | MIT0
 */0
function isEventSupported(eventNameSuffix, capture) {0
  if (!canUseDOM || (capture && !('addEventListener' in document))) {0
    return false;0
  }0
0
  const eventName = 'on' + eventNameSuffix;0
  let isSupported = eventName in document;0
0
  if (!isSupported) {0
    const element = document.createElement('div');0
    element.setAttribute(eventName, 'return;');0
    isSupported = typeof element[eventName] === 'function';0
  }0
0
  return isSupported;0
}0
0
export default isEventSupported;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import {registrationNameDependencies} from 'events/EventPluginRegistry';0
import {0
  TOP_BLUR,0
  TOP_CANCEL,0
  TOP_CLOSE,0
  TOP_FOCUS,0
  TOP_INVALID,0
  TOP_RESET,0
  TOP_SCROLL,0
  TOP_SUBMIT,0
  getRawEventName,0
  mediaEventTypes,0
} from './DOMTopLevelEventTypes';0
import {0
  setEnabled,0
  isEnabled,0
  trapBubbledEvent,0
  trapCapturedEvent,0
} from './ReactDOMEventListener';0
import isEventSupported from './isEventSupported';0
0
/**0
 * Summary of `ReactBrowserEventEmitter` event handling:0
 *0
 *  - Top-level delegation is used to trap most native browser events. This0
 *    may only occur in the main thread and is the responsibility of0
 *    ReactDOMEventListener, which is injected and can therefore support0
 *    pluggable event sources. This is the only work that occurs in the main0
 *    thread.0
 *0
 *  - We normalize and de-duplicate events to account for browser quirks. This0
 *    may be done in the worker thread.0
 *0
 *  - Forward these native events (with the associated top-level type used to0
 *    trap it) to `EventPluginHub`, which in turn will ask plugins if they want0
 *    to extract any synthetic events.0
 *0
 *  - The `EventPluginHub` will then process each event by annotating them with0
 *    "dispatches", a sequence of listeners and IDs that care about that event.0
 *0
 *  - The `EventPluginHub` then dispatches the events.0
 *0
 * Overview of React and the event system:0
 *0
 * +------------+    .0
 * |    DOM     |    .0
 * +------------+    .0
 *       |           .0
 *       v           .0
 * +------------+    .0
 * | ReactEvent |    .0
 * |  Listener  |    .0
 * +------------+    .                         +-----------+0
 *       |           .               +--------+|SimpleEvent|0
 *       |           .               |         |Plugin     |0
 * +-----|------+    .               v         +-----------+0
 * |     |      |    .    +--------------+                    +------------+0
 * |     +-----------.--->|EventPluginHub|                    |    Event   |0
 * |            |    .    |              |     +-----------+  | Propagators|0
 * | ReactEvent |    .    |              |     |TapEvent   |  |------------|0
 * |  Emitter   |    .    |              |<---+|Plugin     |  |other plugin|0
 * |            |    .    |              |     +-----------+  |  utilities |0
 * |     +-----------.--->|              |                    +------------+0
 * |     |      |    .    +--------------+0
 * +-----|------+    .                ^        +-----------+0
 *       |           .                |        |Enter/Leave|0
 *       +           .                +-------+|Plugin     |0
 * +-------------+   .                         +-----------+0
 * | application |   .0
 * |-------------|   .0
 * |             |   .0
 * |             |   .0
 * +-------------+   .0
 *                   .0
 *    React Core     .  General Purpose Event Plugin System0
 */0
0
const alreadyListeningTo = {};0
let reactTopListenersCounter = 0;0
0
/**0
 * To ensure no conflicts with other potential React instances on the page0
 */0
const topListenersIDKey = '_reactListenersID' + ('' + Math.random()).slice(2);0
0
function getListeningForDocument(mountAt: any) {0
  // In IE8, `mountAt` is a host object and doesn't have `hasOwnProperty`0
  // directly.0
  if (!Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty.call(mountAt, topListenersIDKey)) {0
    mountAt[topListenersIDKey] = reactTopListenersCounter++;0
    alreadyListeningTo[mountAt[topListenersIDKey]] = {};0
  }0
  return alreadyListeningTo[mountAt[topListenersIDKey]];0
}0
0
/**0
 * We listen for bubbled touch events on the document object.0
 *0
 * Firefox v8.01 (and possibly others) exhibited strange behavior when0
 * mounting `onmousemove` events at some node that was not the document0
 * element. The symptoms were that if your mouse is not moving over something0
 * contained within that mount point (for example on the background) the0
 * top-level listeners for `onmousemove` won't be called. However, if you0
 * register the `mousemove` on the document object, then it will of course0
 * catch all `mousemove`s. This along with iOS quirks, justifies restricting0
 * top-level listeners to the document object only, at least for these0
 * movement types of events and possibly all events.0
 *0
 * @see http://www.quirksmode.org/blog/archives/2010/09/click_event_del.html0
 *0
 * Also, `keyup`/`keypress`/`keydown` do not bubble to the window on IE, but0
 * they bubble to document.0
 *0
 * @param {string} registrationName Name of listener (e.g. `onClick`).0
 * @param {object} mountAt Container where to mount the listener0
 */0
export function listenTo(0
  registrationName: string,0
  mountAt: Document | Element,0
) {0
  const isListening = getListeningForDocument(mountAt);0
  const dependencies = registrationNameDependencies[registrationName];0
0
  for (let i = 0; i < dependencies.length; i++) {0
    const dependency = dependencies[i];0
    if (!(isListening.hasOwnProperty(dependency) && isListening[dependency])) {0
      switch (dependency) {0
        case TOP_SCROLL:0
          trapCapturedEvent(TOP_SCROLL, mountAt);0
          break;0
        case TOP_FOCUS:0
        case TOP_BLUR:0
          trapCapturedEvent(TOP_FOCUS, mountAt);0
          trapCapturedEvent(TOP_BLUR, mountAt);0
          // We set the flag for a single dependency later in this function,0
          // but this ensures we mark both as attached rather than just one.0
          isListening[TOP_BLUR] = true;0
          isListening[TOP_FOCUS] = true;0
          break;0
        case TOP_CANCEL:0
        case TOP_CLOSE:0
          if (isEventSupported(getRawEventName(dependency), true)) {0
            trapCapturedEvent(dependency, mountAt);0
          }0
          break;0
        case TOP_INVALID:0
        case TOP_SUBMIT:0
        case TOP_RESET:0
          // We listen to them on the target DOM elements.0
          // Some of them bubble so we don't want them to fire twice.0
          break;0
        default:0
          // By default, listen on the top level to all non-media events.0
          // Media events don't bubble so adding the listener wouldn't do anything.0
          const isMediaEvent = mediaEventTypes.indexOf(dependency) !== -1;0
          if (!isMediaEvent) {0
            trapBubbledEvent(dependency, mountAt);0
          }0
          break;0
      }0
      isListening[dependency] = true;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
export function isListeningToAllDependencies(0
  registrationName: string,0
  mountAt: Document | Element,0
) {0
  const isListening = getListeningForDocument(mountAt);0
  const dependencies = registrationNameDependencies[registrationName];0
  for (let i = 0; i < dependencies.length; i++) {0
    const dependency = dependencies[i];0
    if (!(isListening.hasOwnProperty(dependency) && isListening[dependency])) {0
      return false;0
    }0
  }0
  return true;0
}0
0
export {setEnabled, isEnabled, trapBubbledEvent, trapCapturedEvent};0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {AnyNativeEvent} from 'events/PluginModuleType';0
import type {Fiber} from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiber';0
import type {DOMTopLevelEventType} from 'events/TopLevelEventTypes';0
0
import {batchedUpdates, interactiveUpdates} from 'events/ReactGenericBatching';0
import {runExtractedEventsInBatch} from 'events/EventPluginHub';0
import {isFiberMounted} from 'react-reconciler/reflection';0
import {HostRoot} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfWork';0
0
import {addEventBubbleListener, addEventCaptureListener} from './EventListener';0
import getEventTarget from './getEventTarget';0
import {getClosestInstanceFromNode} from '../client/ReactDOMComponentTree';0
import SimpleEventPlugin from './SimpleEventPlugin';0
import {getRawEventName} from './DOMTopLevelEventTypes';0
0
const {isInteractiveTopLevelEventType} = SimpleEventPlugin;0
0
const CALLBACK_BOOKKEEPING_POOL_SIZE = 10;0
const callbackBookkeepingPool = [];0
0
/**0
 * Find the deepest React component completely containing the root of the0
 * passed-in instance (for use when entire React trees are nested within each0
 * other). If React trees are not nested, returns null.0
 */0
function findRootContainerNode(inst) {0
  // TODO: It may be a good idea to cache this to prevent unnecessary DOM0
  // traversal, but caching is difficult to do correctly without using a0
  // mutation observer to listen for all DOM changes.0
  while (inst.return) {0
    inst = inst.return;0
  }0
  if (inst.tag !== HostRoot) {0
    // This can happen if we're in a detached tree.0
    return null;0
  }0
  return inst.stateNode.containerInfo;0
}0
0
// Used to store ancestor hierarchy in top level callback0
function getTopLevelCallbackBookKeeping(0
  topLevelType,0
  nativeEvent,0
  targetInst,0
): {0
  topLevelType: ?DOMTopLevelEventType,0
  nativeEvent: ?AnyNativeEvent,0
  targetInst: Fiber | null,0
  ancestors: Array<Fiber>,0
} {0
  if (callbackBookkeepingPool.length) {0
    const instance = callbackBookkeepingPool.pop();0
    instance.topLevelType = topLevelType;0
    instance.nativeEvent = nativeEvent;0
    instance.targetInst = targetInst;0
    return instance;0
  }0
  return {0
    topLevelType,0
    nativeEvent,0
    targetInst,0
    ancestors: [],0
  };0
}0
0
function releaseTopLevelCallbackBookKeeping(instance) {0
  instance.topLevelType = null;0
  instance.nativeEvent = null;0
  instance.targetInst = null;0
  instance.ancestors.length = 0;0
  if (callbackBookkeepingPool.length < CALLBACK_BOOKKEEPING_POOL_SIZE) {0
    callbackBookkeepingPool.push(instance);0
  }0
}0
0
function handleTopLevel(bookKeeping) {0
  let targetInst = bookKeeping.targetInst;0
0
  // Loop through the hierarchy, in case there's any nested components.0
  // It's important that we build the array of ancestors before calling any0
  // event handlers, because event handlers can modify the DOM, leading to0
  // inconsistencies with ReactMount's node cache. See #1105.0
  let ancestor = targetInst;0
  do {0
    if (!ancestor) {0
      bookKeeping.ancestors.push(ancestor);0
      break;0
    }0
    const root = findRootContainerNode(ancestor);0
    if (!root) {0
      break;0
    }0
    bookKeeping.ancestors.push(ancestor);0
    ancestor = getClosestInstanceFromNode(root);0
  } while (ancestor);0
0
  for (let i = 0; i < bookKeeping.ancestors.length; i++) {0
    targetInst = bookKeeping.ancestors[i];0
    runExtractedEventsInBatch(0
      bookKeeping.topLevelType,0
      targetInst,0
      bookKeeping.nativeEvent,0
      getEventTarget(bookKeeping.nativeEvent),0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
// TODO: can we stop exporting these?0
export let _enabled = true;0
0
export function setEnabled(enabled: ?boolean) {0
  _enabled = !!enabled;0
}0
0
export function isEnabled() {0
  return _enabled;0
}0
0
/**0
 * Traps top-level events by using event bubbling.0
 *0
 * @param {number} topLevelType Number from `TopLevelEventTypes`.0
 * @param {object} element Element on which to attach listener.0
 * @return {?object} An object with a remove function which will forcefully0
 *                  remove the listener.0
 * @internal0
 */0
export function trapBubbledEvent(0
  topLevelType: DOMTopLevelEventType,0
  element: Document | Element,0
) {0
  if (!element) {0
    return null;0
  }0
  const dispatch = isInteractiveTopLevelEventType(topLevelType)0
    ? dispatchInteractiveEvent0
    : dispatchEvent;0
0
  addEventBubbleListener(0
    element,0
    getRawEventName(topLevelType),0
    // Check if interactive and wrap in interactiveUpdates0
    dispatch.bind(null, topLevelType),0
  );0
}0
0
/**0
 * Traps a top-level event by using event capturing.0
 *0
 * @param {number} topLevelType Number from `TopLevelEventTypes`.0
 * @param {object} element Element on which to attach listener.0
 * @return {?object} An object with a remove function which will forcefully0
 *                  remove the listener.0
 * @internal0
 */0
export function trapCapturedEvent(0
  topLevelType: DOMTopLevelEventType,0
  element: Document | Element,0
) {0
  if (!element) {0
    return null;0
  }0
  const dispatch = isInteractiveTopLevelEventType(topLevelType)0
    ? dispatchInteractiveEvent0
    : dispatchEvent;0
0
  addEventCaptureListener(0
    element,0
    getRawEventName(topLevelType),0
    // Check if interactive and wrap in interactiveUpdates0
    dispatch.bind(null, topLevelType),0
  );0
}0
0
function dispatchInteractiveEvent(topLevelType, nativeEvent) {0
  interactiveUpdates(dispatchEvent, topLevelType, nativeEvent);0
}0
0
export function dispatchEvent(0
  topLevelType: DOMTopLevelEventType,0
  nativeEvent: AnyNativeEvent,0
) {0
  if (!_enabled) {0
    return;0
  }0
0
  const nativeEventTarget = getEventTarget(nativeEvent);0
  let targetInst = getClosestInstanceFromNode(nativeEventTarget);0
  if (0
    targetInst !== null &&0
    typeof targetInst.tag === 'number' &&0
    !isFiberMounted(targetInst)0
  ) {0
    // If we get an event (ex: img onload) before committing that0
    // component's mount, ignore it for now (that is, treat it as if it was an0
    // event on a non-React tree). We might also consider queueing events and0
    // dispatching them after the mount.0
    targetInst = null;0
  }0
0
  const bookKeeping = getTopLevelCallbackBookKeeping(0
    topLevelType,0
    nativeEvent,0
    targetInst,0
  );0
0
  try {0
    // Event queue being processed in the same cycle allows0
    // `preventDefault`.0
    batchedUpdates(handleTopLevel, bookKeeping);0
  } finally {0
    releaseTopLevelCallbackBookKeeping(bookKeeping);0
  }0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import {accumulateTwoPhaseDispatches} from 'events/EventPropagators';0
import {canUseDOM} from 'shared/ExecutionEnvironment';0
import SyntheticEvent from 'events/SyntheticEvent';0
import isTextInputElement from 'shared/isTextInputElement';0
import shallowEqual from 'shared/shallowEqual';0
0
import {0
  TOP_BLUR,0
  TOP_CONTEXT_MENU,0
  TOP_FOCUS,0
  TOP_KEY_DOWN,0
  TOP_KEY_UP,0
  TOP_MOUSE_DOWN,0
  TOP_MOUSE_UP,0
  TOP_SELECTION_CHANGE,0
} from './DOMTopLevelEventTypes';0
import {isListeningToAllDependencies} from './ReactBrowserEventEmitter';0
import getActiveElement from '../client/getActiveElement';0
import {getNodeFromInstance} from '../client/ReactDOMComponentTree';0
import * as ReactInputSelection from '../client/ReactInputSelection';0
import {DOCUMENT_NODE} from '../shared/HTMLNodeType';0
0
const skipSelectionChangeEvent =0
  canUseDOM && 'documentMode' in document && document.documentMode <= 11;0
0
const eventTypes = {0
  select: {0
    phasedRegistrationNames: {0
      bubbled: 'onSelect',0
      captured: 'onSelectCapture',0
    },0
    dependencies: [0
      TOP_BLUR,0
      TOP_CONTEXT_MENU,0
      TOP_FOCUS,0
      TOP_KEY_DOWN,0
      TOP_KEY_UP,0
      TOP_MOUSE_DOWN,0
      TOP_MOUSE_UP,0
      TOP_SELECTION_CHANGE,0
    ],0
  },0
};0
0
let activeElement = null;0
let activeElementInst = null;0
let lastSelection = null;0
let mouseDown = false;0
0
/**0
 * Get an object which is a unique representation of the current selection.0
 *0
 * The return value will not be consistent across nodes or browsers, but0
 * two identical selections on the same node will return identical objects.0
 *0
 * @param {DOMElement} node0
 * @return {object}0
 */0
function getSelection(node) {0
  if (0
    'selectionStart' in node &&0
    ReactInputSelection.hasSelectionCapabilities(node)0
  ) {0
    return {0
      start: node.selectionStart,0
      end: node.selectionEnd,0
    };0
  } else if (window.getSelection) {0
    const selection = window.getSelection();0
    return {0
      anchorNode: selection.anchorNode,0
      anchorOffset: selection.anchorOffset,0
      focusNode: selection.focusNode,0
      focusOffset: selection.focusOffset,0
    };0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Poll selection to see whether it's changed.0
 *0
 * @param {object} nativeEvent0
 * @return {?SyntheticEvent}0
 */0
function constructSelectEvent(nativeEvent, nativeEventTarget) {0
  // Ensure we have the right element, and that the user is not dragging a0
  // selection (this matches native `select` event behavior). In HTML5, select0
  // fires only on input and textarea thus if there's no focused element we0
  // won't dispatch.0
  if (0
    mouseDown ||0
    activeElement == null ||0
    activeElement !== getActiveElement()0
  ) {0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  // Only fire when selection has actually changed.0
  const currentSelection = getSelection(activeElement);0
  if (!lastSelection || !shallowEqual(lastSelection, currentSelection)) {0
    lastSelection = currentSelection;0
0
    const syntheticEvent = SyntheticEvent.getPooled(0
      eventTypes.select,0
      activeElementInst,0
      nativeEvent,0
      nativeEventTarget,0
    );0
0
    syntheticEvent.type = 'select';0
    syntheticEvent.target = activeElement;0
0
    accumulateTwoPhaseDispatches(syntheticEvent);0
0
    return syntheticEvent;0
  }0
0
  return null;0
}0
0
/**0
 * This plugin creates an `onSelect` event that normalizes select events0
 * across form elements.0
 *0
 * Supported elements are:0
 * - input (see `isTextInputElement`)0
 * - textarea0
 * - contentEditable0
 *0
 * This differs from native browser implementations in the following ways:0
 * - Fires on contentEditable fields as well as inputs.0
 * - Fires for collapsed selection.0
 * - Fires after user input.0
 */0
const SelectEventPlugin = {0
  eventTypes: eventTypes,0
0
  extractEvents: function(0
    topLevelType,0
    targetInst,0
    nativeEvent,0
    nativeEventTarget,0
  ) {0
    const doc =0
      nativeEventTarget.window === nativeEventTarget0
        ? nativeEventTarget.document0
        : nativeEventTarget.nodeType === DOCUMENT_NODE0
          ? nativeEventTarget0
          : nativeEventTarget.ownerDocument;0
    // Track whether all listeners exists for this plugin. If none exist, we do0
    // not extract events. See #3639.0
    if (!doc || !isListeningToAllDependencies('onSelect', doc)) {0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    const targetNode = targetInst ? getNodeFromInstance(targetInst) : window;0
0
    switch (topLevelType) {0
      // Track the input node that has focus.0
      case TOP_FOCUS:0
        if (0
          isTextInputElement(targetNode) ||0
          targetNode.contentEditable === 'true'0
        ) {0
          activeElement = targetNode;0
          activeElementInst = targetInst;0
          lastSelection = null;0
        }0
        break;0
      case TOP_BLUR:0
        activeElement = null;0
        activeElementInst = null;0
        lastSelection = null;0
        break;0
      // Don't fire the event while the user is dragging. This matches the0
      // semantics of the native select event.0
      case TOP_MOUSE_DOWN:0
        mouseDown = true;0
        break;0
      case TOP_CONTEXT_MENU:0
      case TOP_MOUSE_UP:0
        mouseDown = false;0
        return constructSelectEvent(nativeEvent, nativeEventTarget);0
      // Chrome and IE fire non-standard event when selection is changed (and0
      // sometimes when it hasn't). IE's event fires out of order with respect0
      // to key and input events on deletion, so we discard it.0
      //0
      // Firefox doesn't support selectionchange, so check selection status0
      // after each key entry. The selection changes after keydown and before0
      // keyup, but we check on keydown as well in the case of holding down a0
      // key, when multiple keydown events are fired but only one keyup is.0
      // This is also our approach for IE handling, for the reason above.0
      case TOP_SELECTION_CHANGE:0
        if (skipSelectionChangeEvent) {0
          break;0
        }0
      // falls through0
      case TOP_KEY_DOWN:0
      case TOP_KEY_UP:0
        return constructSelectEvent(nativeEvent, nativeEventTarget);0
    }0
0
    return null;0
  },0
};0
0
export default SelectEventPlugin;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {0
  TopLevelType,0
  DOMTopLevelEventType,0
} from 'events/TopLevelEventTypes';0
import type {0
  DispatchConfig,0
  ReactSyntheticEvent,0
} from 'events/ReactSyntheticEventType';0
import type {Fiber} from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiber';0
import type {EventTypes, PluginModule} from 'events/PluginModuleType';0
0
import {accumulateTwoPhaseDispatches} from 'events/EventPropagators';0
import SyntheticEvent from 'events/SyntheticEvent';0
0
import * as DOMTopLevelEventTypes from './DOMTopLevelEventTypes';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
import SyntheticAnimationEvent from './SyntheticAnimationEvent';0
import SyntheticClipboardEvent from './SyntheticClipboardEvent';0
import SyntheticFocusEvent from './SyntheticFocusEvent';0
import SyntheticKeyboardEvent from './SyntheticKeyboardEvent';0
import SyntheticMouseEvent from './SyntheticMouseEvent';0
import SyntheticPointerEvent from './SyntheticPointerEvent';0
import SyntheticDragEvent from './SyntheticDragEvent';0
import SyntheticTouchEvent from './SyntheticTouchEvent';0
import SyntheticTransitionEvent from './SyntheticTransitionEvent';0
import SyntheticUIEvent from './SyntheticUIEvent';0
import SyntheticWheelEvent from './SyntheticWheelEvent';0
import getEventCharCode from './getEventCharCode';0
0
/**0
 * Turns0
 * ['abort', ...]0
 * into0
 * eventTypes = {0
 *   'abort': {0
 *     phasedRegistrationNames: {0
 *       bubbled: 'onAbort',0
 *       captured: 'onAbortCapture',0
 *     },0
 *     dependencies: [TOP_ABORT],0
 *   },0
 *   ...0
 * };0
 * topLevelEventsToDispatchConfig = new Map([0
 *   [TOP_ABORT, { sameConfig }],0
 * ]);0
 */0
type EventTuple = [DOMTopLevelEventType, string];0
const interactiveEventTypeNames: Array<EventTuple> = [0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_BLUR, 'blur'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CANCEL, 'cancel'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CLICK, 'click'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CLOSE, 'close'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CONTEXT_MENU, 'contextMenu'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_COPY, 'copy'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CUT, 'cut'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DOUBLE_CLICK, 'doubleClick'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG_END, 'dragEnd'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG_START, 'dragStart'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DROP, 'drop'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_FOCUS, 'focus'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_INPUT, 'input'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_INVALID, 'invalid'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_KEY_DOWN, 'keyDown'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_KEY_PRESS, 'keyPress'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_KEY_UP, 'keyUp'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_MOUSE_DOWN, 'mouseDown'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_MOUSE_UP, 'mouseUp'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_PASTE, 'paste'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_PAUSE, 'pause'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_PLAY, 'play'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_POINTER_CANCEL, 'pointerCancel'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_POINTER_DOWN, 'pointerDown'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_POINTER_UP, 'pointerUp'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_RATE_CHANGE, 'rateChange'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_RESET, 'reset'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_SEEKED, 'seeked'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_SUBMIT, 'submit'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TOUCH_CANCEL, 'touchCancel'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TOUCH_END, 'touchEnd'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TOUCH_START, 'touchStart'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_VOLUME_CHANGE, 'volumeChange'],0
];0
const nonInteractiveEventTypeNames: Array<EventTuple> = [0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ABORT, 'abort'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ANIMATION_END, 'animationEnd'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ANIMATION_ITERATION, 'animationIteration'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ANIMATION_START, 'animationStart'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CAN_PLAY, 'canPlay'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CAN_PLAY_THROUGH, 'canPlayThrough'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG, 'drag'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG_ENTER, 'dragEnter'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG_EXIT, 'dragExit'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG_LEAVE, 'dragLeave'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG_OVER, 'dragOver'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DURATION_CHANGE, 'durationChange'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_EMPTIED, 'emptied'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ENCRYPTED, 'encrypted'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ENDED, 'ended'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ERROR, 'error'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_GOT_POINTER_CAPTURE, 'gotPointerCapture'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_LOAD, 'load'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_LOADED_DATA, 'loadedData'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_LOADED_METADATA, 'loadedMetadata'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_LOAD_START, 'loadStart'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_LOST_POINTER_CAPTURE, 'lostPointerCapture'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_MOUSE_MOVE, 'mouseMove'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_MOUSE_OUT, 'mouseOut'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_MOUSE_OVER, 'mouseOver'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_PLAYING, 'playing'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_POINTER_MOVE, 'pointerMove'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_POINTER_OUT, 'pointerOut'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_POINTER_OVER, 'pointerOver'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_PROGRESS, 'progress'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_SCROLL, 'scroll'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_SEEKING, 'seeking'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_STALLED, 'stalled'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_SUSPEND, 'suspend'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TIME_UPDATE, 'timeUpdate'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TOGGLE, 'toggle'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TOUCH_MOVE, 'touchMove'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TRANSITION_END, 'transitionEnd'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_WAITING, 'waiting'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_WHEEL, 'wheel'],0
];0
0
const eventTypes: EventTypes = {};0
const topLevelEventsToDispatchConfig: {0
  [key: TopLevelType]: DispatchConfig,0
} = {};0
0
function addEventTypeNameToConfig(0
  [topEvent, event]: EventTuple,0
  isInteractive: boolean,0
) {0
  const capitalizedEvent = event[0].toUpperCase() + event.slice(1);0
  const onEvent = 'on' + capitalizedEvent;0
0
  const type = {0
    phasedRegistrationNames: {0
      bubbled: onEvent,0
      captured: onEvent + 'Capture',0
    },0
    dependencies: [topEvent],0
    isInteractive,0
  };0
  eventTypes[event] = type;0
  topLevelEventsToDispatchConfig[topEvent] = type;0
}0
0
interactiveEventTypeNames.forEach(eventTuple => {0
  addEventTypeNameToConfig(eventTuple, true);0
});0
nonInteractiveEventTypeNames.forEach(eventTuple => {0
  addEventTypeNameToConfig(eventTuple, false);0
});0
0
// Only used in DEV for exhaustiveness validation.0
const knownHTMLTopLevelTypes: Array<DOMTopLevelEventType> = [0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ABORT,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CANCEL,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CAN_PLAY,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CAN_PLAY_THROUGH,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CLOSE,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DURATION_CHANGE,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_EMPTIED,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ENCRYPTED,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ENDED,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ERROR,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_INPUT,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_INVALID,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_LOAD,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_LOADED_DATA,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_LOADED_METADATA,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_LOAD_START,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_PAUSE,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_PLAY,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_PLAYING,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_PROGRESS,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_RATE_CHANGE,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_RESET,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_SEEKED,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_SEEKING,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_STALLED,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_SUBMIT,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_SUSPEND,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TIME_UPDATE,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TOGGLE,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_VOLUME_CHANGE,0
  DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_WAITING,0
];0
0
const SimpleEventPlugin: PluginModule<MouseEvent> & {0
  isInteractiveTopLevelEventType: (topLevelType: TopLevelType) => boolean,0
} = {0
  eventTypes: eventTypes,0
0
  isInteractiveTopLevelEventType(topLevelType: TopLevelType): boolean {0
    const config = topLevelEventsToDispatchConfig[topLevelType];0
    return config !== undefined && config.isInteractive === true;0
  },0
0
  extractEvents: function(0
    topLevelType: TopLevelType,0
    targetInst: Fiber,0
    nativeEvent: MouseEvent,0
    nativeEventTarget: EventTarget,0
  ): null | ReactSyntheticEvent {0
    const dispatchConfig = topLevelEventsToDispatchConfig[topLevelType];0
    if (!dispatchConfig) {0
      return null;0
    }0
    let EventConstructor;0
    switch (topLevelType) {0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_KEY_PRESS:0
        // Firefox creates a keypress event for function keys too. This removes0
        // the unwanted keypress events. Enter is however both printable and0
        // non-printable. One would expect Tab to be as well (but it isn't).0
        if (getEventCharCode(nativeEvent) === 0) {0
          return null;0
        }0
      /* falls through */0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_KEY_DOWN:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_KEY_UP:0
        EventConstructor = SyntheticKeyboardEvent;0
        break;0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_BLUR:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_FOCUS:0
        EventConstructor = SyntheticFocusEvent;0
        break;0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CLICK:0
        // Firefox creates a click event on right mouse clicks. This removes the0
        // unwanted click events.0
        if (nativeEvent.button === 2) {0
          return null;0
        }0
      /* falls through */0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DOUBLE_CLICK:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_MOUSE_DOWN:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_MOUSE_MOVE:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_MOUSE_UP:0
      // TODO: Disabled elements should not respond to mouse events0
      /* falls through */0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_MOUSE_OUT:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_MOUSE_OVER:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CONTEXT_MENU:0
        EventConstructor = SyntheticMouseEvent;0
        break;0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG_END:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG_ENTER:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG_EXIT:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG_LEAVE:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG_OVER:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG_START:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DROP:0
        EventConstructor = SyntheticDragEvent;0
        break;0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TOUCH_CANCEL:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TOUCH_END:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TOUCH_MOVE:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TOUCH_START:0
        EventConstructor = SyntheticTouchEvent;0
        break;0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ANIMATION_END:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ANIMATION_ITERATION:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ANIMATION_START:0
        EventConstructor = SyntheticAnimationEvent;0
        break;0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TRANSITION_END:0
        EventConstructor = SyntheticTransitionEvent;0
        break;0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_SCROLL:0
        EventConstructor = SyntheticUIEvent;0
        break;0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_WHEEL:0
        EventConstructor = SyntheticWheelEvent;0
        break;0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_COPY:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CUT:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_PASTE:0
        EventConstructor = SyntheticClipboardEvent;0
        break;0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_GOT_POINTER_CAPTURE:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_LOST_POINTER_CAPTURE:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_POINTER_CANCEL:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_POINTER_DOWN:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_POINTER_MOVE:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_POINTER_OUT:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_POINTER_OVER:0
      case DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_POINTER_UP:0
        EventConstructor = SyntheticPointerEvent;0
        break;0
      default:0
        if (__DEV__) {0
          if (knownHTMLTopLevelTypes.indexOf(topLevelType) === -1) {0
            warning(0
              false,0
              'SimpleEventPlugin: Unhandled event type, `%s`. This warning ' +0
                'is likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
              topLevelType,0
            );0
          }0
        }0
        // HTML Events0
        // @see http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/index.html#events-00
        EventConstructor = SyntheticEvent;0
        break;0
    }0
    const event = EventConstructor.getPooled(0
      dispatchConfig,0
      targetInst,0
      nativeEvent,0
      nativeEventTarget,0
    );0
    accumulateTwoPhaseDispatches(event);0
    return event;0
  },0
};0
0
export default SimpleEventPlugin;0

 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0

const SyntheticAnimationEvent = SyntheticEvent.extend({0
  animationName: null,0
  elapsedTime: null,0
  pseudoElement: null,0
});0
0
export default SyntheticAnimationEvent;0

 * @interface Event0
 * @see http://www.w3.org/TR/clipboard-apis/0
 */0
const SyntheticClipboardEvent = SyntheticEvent.extend({0
  clipboardData: function(event) {0
    return 'clipboardData' in event0
      ? event.clipboardData0
      : window.clipboardData;0
  },0
});0

import SyntheticEvent from 'events/SyntheticEvent';0

/**0

import SyntheticUIEvent from './SyntheticUIEvent';0
import getEventCharCode from './getEventCharCode';0
import getEventKey from './getEventKey';0
import getEventModifierState from './getEventModifierState';0
0
/**0
 * @interface KeyboardEvent0
 * @see http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-3-Events/0
 */0
const SyntheticKeyboardEvent = SyntheticUIEvent.extend({0
  key: getEventKey,0
  location: null,0
  ctrlKey: null,0
  shiftKey: null,0
  altKey: null,0
  metaKey: null,0
  repeat: null,0
  locale: null,0
  getModifierState: getEventModifierState,0
  // Legacy Interface0
  charCode: function(event) {0
    // `charCode` is the result of a KeyPress event and represents the value of0
    // the actual printable character.0
0
    // KeyPress is deprecated, but its replacement is not yet final and not0
    // implemented in any major browser. Only KeyPress has charCode.0
    if (event.type === 'keypress') {0
      return getEventCharCode(event);0
    }0
    return 0;0
  },0
  keyCode: function(event) {0
    // `keyCode` is the result of a KeyDown/Up event and represents the value of0
    // physical keyboard key.0
0
    // The actual meaning of the value depends on the users' keyboard layout0
    // which cannot be detected. Assuming that it is a US keyboard layout0
    // provides a surprisingly accurate mapping for US and European users.0
    // Due to this, it is left to the user to implement at this time.0
    if (event.type === 'keydown' || event.type === 'keyup') {0
      return event.keyCode;0
    }0
    return 0;0
  },0
  which: function(event) {0
    // `which` is an alias for either `keyCode` or `charCode` depending on the0
    // type of the event.0
    if (event.type === 'keypress') {0
      return getEventCharCode(event);0
    }0
    if (event.type === 'keydown' || event.type === 'keyup') {0
      return event.keyCode;0
    }0
    return 0;0
  },0
});0
0
export default SyntheticKeyboardEvent;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import SyntheticUIEvent from './SyntheticUIEvent';0
import getEventModifierState from './getEventModifierState';0
0
let previousScreenX = 0;0
let previousScreenY = 0;0
// Use flags to signal movementX/Y has already been set0
let isMovementXSet = false;0
let isMovementYSet = false;0
0
/**0
 * @interface MouseEvent0
 * @see http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-3-Events/0
 */0
const SyntheticMouseEvent = SyntheticUIEvent.extend({0
  screenX: null,0
  screenY: null,0
  clientX: null,0
  clientY: null,0
  pageX: null,0
  pageY: null,0
  ctrlKey: null,0
  shiftKey: null,0
  altKey: null,0
  metaKey: null,0
  getModifierState: getEventModifierState,0
  button: null,0
  buttons: null,0
  relatedTarget: function(event) {0
    return (0
      event.relatedTarget ||0
      (event.fromElement === event.srcElement0
        ? event.toElement0
        : event.fromElement)0
    );0
  },0
  movementX: function(event) {0
    if ('movementX' in event) {0
      return event.movementX;0
    }0
0
    const screenX = previousScreenX;0
    previousScreenX = event.screenX;0
0
    if (!isMovementXSet) {0
      isMovementXSet = true;0
      return 0;0
    }0
0
    return event.screenX - screenX;0
  },0
  movementY: function(event) {0
    if ('movementY' in event) {0
      return event.movementY;0
    }0
0
    const screenY = previousScreenY;0
    previousScreenY = event.screenY;0
0
    if (!isMovementYSet) {0
      isMovementYSet = true;0
      return 0;0
    }0
0
    return event.screenY - screenY;0
  },0
});0
0
export default SyntheticMouseEvent;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import SyntheticMouseEvent from './SyntheticMouseEvent';0
0
/**0
 * @interface PointerEvent0
 * @see http://www.w3.org/TR/pointerevents/0
 */0
const SyntheticPointerEvent = SyntheticMouseEvent.extend({0
  pointerId: null,0
  width: null,0
  height: null,0
  pressure: null,0
  tiltX: null,0
  tiltY: null,0
  pointerType: null,0
  isPrimary: null,0
});0
0
export default SyntheticPointerEvent;0
/**0

import SyntheticUIEvent from './SyntheticUIEvent';0
import getEventModifierState from './getEventModifierState';0
0
/**0
 * @interface TouchEvent0
 * @see http://www.w3.org/TR/touch-events/0
 */0
const SyntheticTouchEvent = SyntheticUIEvent.extend({0
  touches: null,0
  targetTouches: null,0
  changedTouches: null,0
  altKey: null,0
  metaKey: null,0
  ctrlKey: null,0
  shiftKey: null,0
  getModifierState: getEventModifierState,0
});0
0
export default SyntheticTouchEvent;0

import SyntheticEvent from 'events/SyntheticEvent';0
0
/**0
 * @interface Event0
 * @see http://www.w3.org/TR/2009/WD-css3-transitions-20090320/#transition-events-0
 * @see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TransitionEvent0
 */0
const SyntheticTransitionEvent = SyntheticEvent.extend({0
  propertyName: null,0
  elapsedTime: null,0
  pseudoElement: null,0
});0
0
export default SyntheticTransitionEvent;0

import SyntheticEvent from 'events/SyntheticEvent';0
0
const SyntheticUIEvent = SyntheticEvent.extend({0
  view: null,0
  detail: null,0
});0
0
export default SyntheticUIEvent;0

import SyntheticMouseEvent from './SyntheticMouseEvent';0
0
/**0
 * @interface WheelEvent0
 * @see http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-3-Events/0
 */0
const SyntheticWheelEvent = SyntheticMouseEvent.extend({0
  deltaX(event) {0
    return 'deltaX' in event0
      ? event.deltaX0
      : // Fallback to `wheelDeltaX` for Webkit and normalize (right is positive).0
        'wheelDeltaX' in event ? -event.wheelDeltaX : 0;0
  },0
  deltaY(event) {0
    return 'deltaY' in event0
      ? event.deltaY0
      : // Fallback to `wheelDeltaY` for Webkit and normalize (down is positive).0
        'wheelDeltaY' in event0
        ? -event.wheelDeltaY0
        : // Fallback to `wheelDelta` for IE<9 and normalize (down is positive).0
          'wheelDelta' in event ? -event.wheelDelta : 0;0
  },0
  deltaZ: null,0
0
  // Browsers without "deltaMode" is reporting in raw wheel delta where one0
  // notch on the scroll is always +/- 120, roughly equivalent to pixels.0
  // A good approximation of DOM_DELTA_LINE (1) is 5% of viewport size or0
  // ~40 pixels, for DOM_DELTA_SCREEN (2) it is 87.5% of viewport size.0
  deltaMode: null,0
});0
0
export default SyntheticWheelEvent;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import {accumulateTwoPhaseDispatches} from 'events/EventPropagators';0
import type {TopLevelType} from 'events/TopLevelEventTypes';0
0
import {0
  TOP_MOUSE_DOWN,0
  TOP_MOUSE_MOVE,0
  TOP_MOUSE_UP,0
  TOP_POINTER_CANCEL,0
  TOP_POINTER_DOWN,0
  TOP_POINTER_UP,0
  TOP_POINTER_MOVE,0
  TOP_TOUCH_CANCEL,0
  TOP_TOUCH_END,0
  TOP_TOUCH_MOVE,0
  TOP_TOUCH_START,0
} from './DOMTopLevelEventTypes';0
import SyntheticUIEvent from './SyntheticUIEvent';0
0
function isStartish(topLevelType) {0
  return (0
    topLevelType === TOP_MOUSE_DOWN ||0
    topLevelType === TOP_TOUCH_START ||0
    topLevelType === TOP_POINTER_DOWN0
  );0
}0
0
function isEndish(topLevelType) {0
  return (0
    topLevelType === TOP_MOUSE_UP ||0
    topLevelType === TOP_POINTER_CANCEL ||0
    topLevelType === TOP_POINTER_UP ||0
    topLevelType === TOP_TOUCH_CANCEL ||0
    topLevelType === TOP_TOUCH_END0
  );0
}0
0
/**0
 * We are extending the Flow 'Touch' declaration to enable using bracket0
 * notation to access properties.0
 * Without this adjustment Flow throws0
 * "Indexable signature not found in Touch".0
 * See https://github.com/facebook/flow/issues/13230
 */0
type TouchPropertyKey = 'clientX' | 'clientY' | 'pageX' | 'pageY';0
0
declare class _Touch extends Touch {0
  [key: TouchPropertyKey]: number;0
}0
0
type AxisCoordinateData = {0
  page: TouchPropertyKey,0
  client: TouchPropertyKey,0
  envScroll: 'currentPageScrollLeft' | 'currentPageScrollTop',0
};0
0
type AxisType = {0
  x: AxisCoordinateData,0
  y: AxisCoordinateData,0
};0
0
type CoordinatesType = {0
  x: number,0
  y: number,0
};0
0
/**0
 * Number of pixels that are tolerated in between a `touchStart` and `touchEnd`0
 * in order to still be considered a 'tap' event.0
 */0
const tapMoveThreshold = 10;0
const startCoords: CoordinatesType = {x: 0, y: 0};0
0
const Axis: AxisType = {0
  x: {page: 'pageX', client: 'clientX', envScroll: 'currentPageScrollLeft'},0
  y: {page: 'pageY', client: 'clientY', envScroll: 'currentPageScrollTop'},0
};0
0
function extractSingleTouch(nativeEvent) {0
  // $FlowFixMe: figure out why this is missing0
  const touches = nativeEvent.touches;0
  // $FlowFixMe: figure out why this is missing0
  const changedTouches = nativeEvent.changedTouches;0
  const hasTouches = touches && touches.length > 0;0
  const hasChangedTouches = changedTouches && changedTouches.length > 0;0
0
  return !hasTouches && hasChangedTouches0
    ? changedTouches[0]0
    : hasTouches ? touches[0] : nativeEvent;0
}0
0
function getAxisCoordOfEvent(0
  axis: AxisCoordinateData,0
  nativeEvent: _Touch,0
): number {0
  const singleTouch = extractSingleTouch(nativeEvent);0
  if (singleTouch) {0
    return singleTouch[axis.page];0
  }0
  return nativeEvent[axis.page];0
}0
0
function getDistance(coords: CoordinatesType, nativeEvent: _Touch): number {0
  const pageX = getAxisCoordOfEvent(Axis.x, nativeEvent);0
  const pageY = getAxisCoordOfEvent(Axis.y, nativeEvent);0
  return Math.pow(0
    Math.pow(pageX - coords.x, 2) + Math.pow(pageY - coords.y, 2),0
    0.5,0
  );0
}0
0
const touchEvents = [0
  TOP_TOUCH_START,0
  TOP_TOUCH_CANCEL,0
  TOP_TOUCH_END,0
  TOP_TOUCH_MOVE,0
];0
0
const pointerEvents = [0
  TOP_POINTER_CANCEL,0
  TOP_POINTER_DOWN,0
  TOP_POINTER_MOVE,0
  TOP_POINTER_UP,0
];0
0
const dependencies: Array<TopLevelType> = [0
  TOP_MOUSE_DOWN,0
  TOP_MOUSE_MOVE,0
  TOP_MOUSE_UP,0
].concat(touchEvents, pointerEvents);0
0
const eventTypes = {0
  touchTap: {0
    phasedRegistrationNames: {0
      bubbled: 'onTouchTap',0
      captured: 'onTouchTapCapture',0
    },0
    dependencies: dependencies,0
  },0
};0
0
let usedTouch = false;0
let usedTouchTime = 0;0
const TOUCH_DELAY = 1000;0
0
const TapEventPlugin = {0
  tapMoveThreshold: tapMoveThreshold,0
0
  eventTypes: eventTypes,0
0
  extractEvents: function(0
    topLevelType: TopLevelType,0
    targetInst: mixed,0
    nativeEvent: _Touch,0
    nativeEventTarget: EventTarget,0
  ) {0
    if (!isStartish(topLevelType) && !isEndish(topLevelType)) {0
      return null;0
    }0
    // on ios, there is a delay after touch event and synthetic0
    // mouse events, so that user can perform double tap0
    // solution: ignore mouse events following touchevent within small timeframe0
    if (touchEvents.indexOf(topLevelType) !== -1) {0
      usedTouch = true;0
      usedTouchTime = Date.now();0
    } else {0
      if (usedTouch && Date.now() - usedTouchTime < TOUCH_DELAY) {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
    let event = null;0
    const distance = getDistance(startCoords, nativeEvent);0
    if (isEndish(topLevelType) && distance < tapMoveThreshold) {0
      event = SyntheticUIEvent.getPooled(0
        eventTypes.touchTap,0
        targetInst,0
        nativeEvent,0
        nativeEventTarget,0
      );0
    }0
    if (isStartish(topLevelType)) {0
      startCoords.x = getAxisCoordOfEvent(Axis.x, nativeEvent);0
      startCoords.y = getAxisCoordOfEvent(Axis.y, nativeEvent);0
    } else if (isEndish(topLevelType)) {0
      startCoords.x = 0;0
      startCoords.y = 0;0
    }0
    accumulateTwoPhaseDispatches(event);0
    return event;0
  },0
};0
0
export default TapEventPlugin;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
0
describe('BeforeInputEventPlugin', () => {0
  let container;0
0
  function loadReactDOM(envSimulator) {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    if (envSimulator) {0
      envSimulator();0
    }0
    return require('react-dom');0
  }0
0
  function simulateIE11() {0
    document.documentMode = 11;0
    window.CompositionEvent = {};0
  }0
0
  function simulateWebkit() {0
    window.CompositionEvent = {};0
    window.TextEvent = {};0
  }0
0
  function simulateComposition() {0
    window.CompositionEvent = {};0
  }0
0
  function simulateNoComposition() {0
    // no composition event in Window - will use fallback0
  }0
0
  function simulateEvent(elem, type, data) {0
    const event = new Event(type, {bubbles: true});0
    Object.assign(event, data);0
    elem.dispatchEvent(event);0
  }0
0
  function simulateKeyboardEvent(elem, type, data) {0
    const {char, value, ...rest} = data;0
    const event = new KeyboardEvent(type, {0
      bubbles: true,0
      ...rest,0
    });0
    if (char) {0
      event.char = char;0
    }0
    if (value) {0
      elem.value = value;0
    }0
    elem.dispatchEvent(event);0
  }0
0
  function simulatePaste(elem) {0
    const pasteEvent = new Event('paste', {0
      bubbles: true,0
    });0
    pasteEvent.clipboardData = {0
      dropEffect: null,0
      effectAllowed: null,0
      files: null,0
      items: null,0
      types: null,0
    };0
    elem.dispatchEvent(pasteEvent);0
  }0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    delete document.documentMode;0
    delete window.CompositionEvent;0
    delete window.TextEvent;0
    delete window.opera;0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
    container = null;0
  });0
0
  function keyCode(char) {0
    return char.charCodeAt(0);0
  }0
0
  const scenarios = [0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulateEvent,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: [0
        'compositionstart',0
        {detail: {data: 'test'}, data: 'test'},0
      ],0
    },0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulateEvent,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: [0
        'compositionupdate',0
        {detail: {data: 'test string'}, data: 'test string'},0
      ],0
    },0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulateEvent,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: [0
        'compositionend',0
        {detail: {data: 'test string 3'}, data: 'test string 3'},0
      ],0
    },0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulateEvent,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: ['textInput', {data: 'abcß'}],0
    },0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulateKeyboardEvent,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: ['keypress', {which: keyCode('a')}],0
    },0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulateKeyboardEvent,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: ['keypress', {which: keyCode(' ')}, ' '],0
    },0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulateEvent,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: ['textInput', {data: ' '}],0
    },0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulateKeyboardEvent,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: ['keypress', {which: keyCode('a'), ctrlKey: true}],0
    },0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulateKeyboardEvent,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: ['keypress', {which: keyCode('b'), altKey: true}],0
    },0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulateKeyboardEvent,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: [0
        'keypress',0
        {which: keyCode('c'), altKey: true, ctrlKey: true},0
      ],0
    },0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulateKeyboardEvent,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: [0
        'keypress',0
        {which: keyCode('X'), char: '\uD83D\uDE0A'},0
      ],0
    },0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulateEvent,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: ['textInput', {data: '\uD83D\uDE0A'}],0
    },0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulateKeyboardEvent,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: ['keydown', {keyCode: 229, value: 'foo'}],0
    },0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulateKeyboardEvent,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: ['keydown', {keyCode: 9, value: 'foobar'}],0
    },0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulateKeyboardEvent,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: ['keydown', {keyCode: 229, value: 'foofoo'}],0
    },0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulateKeyboardEvent,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: ['keyup', {keyCode: 9, value: 'fooBARfoo'}],0
    },0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulateKeyboardEvent,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: ['keydown', {keyCode: 229, value: 'foofoo'}],0
    },0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulateKeyboardEvent,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: ['keypress', {keyCode: 60, value: 'Barfoofoo'}],0
    },0
    {0
      eventSimulator: simulatePaste,0
      eventSimulatorArgs: [],0
    },0
  ];0
0
  const environments = [0
    {0
      emulator: simulateWebkit,0
      assertions: [0
        {0
          run: ({0
            beforeInputEvent,0
            compositionStartEvent,0
            spyOnBeforeInput,0
            spyOnCompositionStart,0
          }) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
            expect(spyOnCompositionStart).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
            expect(compositionStartEvent.type).toBe('compositionstart');0
            expect(compositionStartEvent.data).toBe('test');0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({0
            beforeInputEvent,0
            compositionUpdateEvent,0
            spyOnBeforeInput,0
            spyOnCompositionUpdate,0
          }) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
            expect(spyOnCompositionUpdate).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
            expect(compositionUpdateEvent.type).toBe('compositionupdate');0
            expect(compositionUpdateEvent.data).toBe('test string');0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.type).toBe('compositionend');0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.data).toBe('test string 3');0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.type).toBe('textInput');0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.data).toBe('abcß');0
          },0
        },0
        {0

            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0

          },0

      emulator: simulateNoComposition,0
      assertions: [0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0

            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0

        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.type).toBe('keypress');0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.data).toBe('a');0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.type).toBe('keypress');0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.data).toBe(' ');0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.type).toBe('keypress');0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.data).toBe('c');0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.type).toBe('keypress');0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.data).toBe('\uD83D\uDE0A');0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.type).toBe('keydown');0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.data).toBe('bar');0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.type).toBe('keyup');0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.data).toBe('BAR');0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.type).toBe('keypress');0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.data).toBe('Bar');0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
      ],0
    },0
    {0
      emulator: simulateComposition,0
      assertions: [0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.type).toBe('compositionend');0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.data).toBe('test string 3');0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.type).toBe('keypress');0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.data).toBe('a');0
          },0
        },0
