            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.type).toBe('keypress');0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.data).toBe(' ');0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.type).toBe('keypress');0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.data).toBe('c');0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.type).toBe('keypress');0
            expect(beforeInputEvent.data).toBe('\uD83D\uDE0A');0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
        {0
          run: ({beforeInputEvent, spyOnBeforeInput}) => {0
            expect(spyOnBeforeInput).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
            expect(beforeInputEvent).toBeNull();0
          },0
        },0
      ],0
    },0
  ];0
0
  const testInputComponent = (env, scenes) => {0
    let beforeInputEvent;0
    let compositionStartEvent;0
    let compositionUpdateEvent;0
    let spyOnBeforeInput;0
    let spyOnCompositionStart;0
    let spyOnCompositionUpdate;0
    ReactDOM = loadReactDOM(env.emulator);0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(0
      <input0
        type="text"0
        onBeforeInput={({type, data}) => {0
          spyOnBeforeInput();0
          beforeInputEvent = {type, data};0
        }}0
        onCompositionStart={({type, data}) => {0
          spyOnCompositionStart();0
          compositionStartEvent = {type, data};0
        }}0
        onCompositionUpdate={({type, data}) => {0
          spyOnCompositionUpdate();0
          compositionUpdateEvent = {type, data};0
        }}0
      />,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    scenes.forEach((s, id) => {0
      beforeInputEvent = null;0
      compositionStartEvent = null;0
      compositionUpdateEvent = null;0
      spyOnBeforeInput = jest.fn();0
      spyOnCompositionStart = jest.fn();0
      spyOnCompositionUpdate = jest.fn();0
      s.eventSimulator.apply(null, [node, ...s.eventSimulatorArgs]);0
      env.assertions[id].run({0
        beforeInputEvent,0
        compositionStartEvent,0
        compositionUpdateEvent,0
        spyOnBeforeInput,0
        spyOnCompositionStart,0
        spyOnCompositionUpdate,0
      });0
    });0
  };0
0
  const testContentEditableComponent = (env, scenes) => {0
    let beforeInputEvent;0
    let compositionStartEvent;0
    let compositionUpdateEvent;0
    let spyOnBeforeInput;0
    let spyOnCompositionStart;0
    let spyOnCompositionUpdate;0
    ReactDOM = loadReactDOM(env.emulator);0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(0
      <div0
        contentEditable={true}0
        onBeforeInput={({type, data}) => {0
          spyOnBeforeInput();0
          beforeInputEvent = {type, data};0
        }}0
        onCompositionStart={({type, data}) => {0
          spyOnCompositionStart();0
          compositionStartEvent = {type, data};0
        }}0
        onCompositionUpdate={({type, data}) => {0
          spyOnCompositionUpdate();0
          compositionUpdateEvent = {type, data};0
        }}0
      />,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    scenes.forEach((s, id) => {0
      beforeInputEvent = null;0
      compositionStartEvent = null;0
      compositionUpdateEvent = null;0
      spyOnBeforeInput = jest.fn();0
      spyOnCompositionStart = jest.fn();0
      spyOnCompositionUpdate = jest.fn();0
      s.eventSimulator.apply(null, [node, ...s.eventSimulatorArgs]);0
      env.assertions[id].run({0
        beforeInputEvent,0
        compositionStartEvent,0
        compositionUpdateEvent,0
        spyOnBeforeInput,0
        spyOnCompositionStart,0
        spyOnCompositionUpdate,0
      });0
    });0
  };0
0
  it('should extract onBeforeInput when simulating in Webkit on input[type=text]', () => {0
    testInputComponent(environments[0], scenarios);0
  });0
  it('should extract onBeforeInput when simulating in Webkit on contenteditable', () => {0
    testContentEditableComponent(environments[0], scenarios);0
  });0
0
  it('should extract onBeforeInput when simulating in IE11 on input[type=text]', () => {0
    testInputComponent(environments[1], scenarios);0
  });0
  it('should extract onBeforeInput when simulating in IE11 on contenteditable', () => {0
    testContentEditableComponent(environments[1], scenarios);0
  });0
0
  it('should extract onBeforeInput when simulating in env with no CompositionEvent on input[type=text]', () => {0
    testInputComponent(environments[2], scenarios);0
  });0
0
  // in an environment using composition fallback onBeforeInput will not work0
  // as expected on a contenteditable as keydown and keyup events are translated0
  // to keypress events0
0
  it('should extract onBeforeInput when simulating in env with only CompositionEvent on input[type=text]', () => {0
    testInputComponent(environments[3], scenarios);0
  });0
0
  it('should extract onBeforeInput when simulating in env with only CompositionEvent on contenteditable', () => {0
    testContentEditableComponent(environments[3], scenarios);0
  });0
});0
/**0

 * @emails react-core0

'use strict';0
0
const React = require('react');0
let ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
let ReactFeatureFlags;0
0
const setUntrackedChecked = Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(0
  HTMLInputElement.prototype,0
  'checked',0
).set;0
0
const setUntrackedValue = Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(0
  HTMLInputElement.prototype,0
  'value',0
).set;0
0
const setUntrackedTextareaValue = Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(0
  HTMLTextAreaElement.prototype,0
  'value',0
).set;0
0
describe('ChangeEventPlugin', () => {0
  let container;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    // TODO pull this into helper method, reduce repetition.0
    // mock the browser APIs which are used in react-scheduler:0
    // - requestAnimationFrame should pass the DOMHighResTimeStamp argument0
    // - calling 'window.postMessage' should actually fire postmessage handlers0
    global.requestAnimationFrame = function(cb) {0
      return setTimeout(() => {0
        cb(Date.now());0
      });0
    };0
    const originalAddEventListener = global.addEventListener;0
    let postMessageCallback;0
    global.addEventListener = function(eventName, callback, useCapture) {0
      if (eventName === 'message') {0
        postMessageCallback = callback;0
      } else {0
        originalAddEventListener(eventName, callback, useCapture);0
      }0
    };0
    global.postMessage = function(messageKey, targetOrigin) {0
      const postMessageEvent = {source: window, data: messageKey};0
      if (postMessageCallback) {0
        postMessageCallback(postMessageEvent);0
      }0
    };0
    jest.resetModules();0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
    container = null;0
  });0
0
  // We try to avoid firing "duplicate" React change events.0
  // However, to tell which events are "duplicates" and should be ignored,0
  // we are tracking the "current" input value, and only respect events0
  // that occur after it changes. In most of these tests, we verify that we0
  // keep track of the "current" value and only fire events when it changes.0
  // See https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/5746.0
0
  it('should consider initial text value to be current', () => {0
    let called = 0;0
0
    function cb(e) {0
      called++;0
      expect(e.type).toBe('change');0
    }0
0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(0
      <input type="text" onChange={cb} defaultValue="foo" />,0
      container,0
    );0
    node.dispatchEvent(new Event('input', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}));0
    node.dispatchEvent(new Event('change', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}));0
    // There should be no React change events because the value stayed the same.0
    expect(called).toBe(0);0
  });0
0
  it('should consider initial checkbox checked=true to be current', () => {0
    let called = 0;0
0
    function cb(e) {0
      called++;0
      expect(e.type).toBe('change');0
    }0
0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(0
      <input type="checkbox" onChange={cb} defaultChecked={true} />,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    // Secretly, set `checked` to false, so that dispatching the `click` will0
    // make it `true` again. Thus, at the time of the event, React should not0
    // consider it a change from the initial `true` value.0
    setUntrackedChecked.call(node, false);0
    node.dispatchEvent(0
      new MouseEvent('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
    );0
    // There should be no React change events because the value stayed the same.0
    expect(called).toBe(0);0
  });0
0
  it('should consider initial checkbox checked=false to be current', () => {0
    let called = 0;0
0
    function cb(e) {0
      called++;0
      expect(e.type).toBe('change');0
    }0
0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(0
      <input type="checkbox" onChange={cb} defaultChecked={false} />,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    // Secretly, set `checked` to true, so that dispatching the `click` will0
    // make it `false` again. Thus, at the time of the event, React should not0
    // consider it a change from the initial `false` value.0
    setUntrackedChecked.call(node, true);0
    node.dispatchEvent(0
      new MouseEvent('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
    );0
    // There should be no React change events because the value stayed the same.0
    expect(called).toBe(0);0
  });0
0
  it('should fire change for checkbox input', () => {0
    let called = 0;0
0
    function cb(e) {0
      called++;0
      expect(e.type).toBe('change');0
    }0
0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(0
      <input type="checkbox" onChange={cb} />,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    expect(node.checked).toBe(false);0
    node.dispatchEvent(0
      new MouseEvent('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
    );0
    // Note: unlike with text input events, dispatching `click` actually0
    // toggles the checkbox and updates its `checked` value.0
    expect(node.checked).toBe(true);0
    expect(called).toBe(1);0
0
    expect(node.checked).toBe(true);0
    node.dispatchEvent(0
      new MouseEvent('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
    );0
    expect(node.checked).toBe(false);0
    expect(called).toBe(2);0
  });0
0
  it('should not fire change setting the value programmatically', () => {0
    let called = 0;0
0
    function cb(e) {0
      called++;0
      expect(e.type).toBe('change');0
    }0
0
    const input = ReactDOM.render(0
      <input type="text" defaultValue="foo" onChange={cb} />,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    // Set it programmatically.0
    input.value = 'bar';0
    // Even if a DOM input event fires, React sees that the real input value now0
    // ('bar') is the same as the "current" one we already recorded.0
    input.dispatchEvent(new Event('input', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}));0
    expect(input.value).toBe('bar');0
    // In this case we don't expect to get a React event.0
    expect(called).toBe(0);0
0
    // However, we can simulate user typing by calling the underlying setter.0
    setUntrackedValue.call(input, 'foo');0
    // Now, when the event fires, the real input value ('foo') differs from the0
    // "current" one we previously recorded ('bar').0
    input.dispatchEvent(new Event('input', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}));0
    expect(input.value).toBe('foo');0
    // In this case React should fire an event for it.0
    expect(called).toBe(1);0
0
    // Verify again that extra events without real changes are ignored.0
    input.dispatchEvent(new Event('input', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}));0
    expect(called).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should not distinguish equal string and number values', () => {0
    let called = 0;0
0
    function cb(e) {0
      called++;0
      expect(e.type).toBe('change');0
    }0
0
    const input = ReactDOM.render(0
      <input type="text" defaultValue="42" onChange={cb} />,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    // When we set `value` as a property, React updates the "current" value0
    // that it tracks internally. The "current" value is later used to determine0
    // whether a change event is a duplicate or not.0
    // Even though we set value to a number, we still shouldn't get a change0
    // event because as a string, it's equal to the initial value ('42').0
    input.value = 42;0
    input.dispatchEvent(new Event('input', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}));0
    expect(input.value).toBe('42');0
    expect(called).toBe(0);0
  });0
0
  // See a similar input test above for a detailed description of why.0
  it('should not fire change when setting checked programmatically', () => {0
    let called = 0;0
0
    function cb(e) {0
      called++;0
      expect(e.type).toBe('change');0
    }0
0
    const input = ReactDOM.render(0
      <input type="checkbox" onChange={cb} defaultChecked={false} />,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    // Set the value, updating the "current" value that React tracks to true.0
    input.checked = true;0
    // Under the hood, uncheck the box so that the click will "check" it again.0
    setUntrackedChecked.call(input, false);0
    input.dispatchEvent(0
      new MouseEvent('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
    );0
    expect(input.checked).toBe(true);0
    // We don't expect a React event because at the time of the click, the real0
    // checked value (true) was the same as the last recorded "current" value0
    // (also true).0
    expect(called).toBe(0);0
0
    // However, simulating a normal click should fire a React event because the0
    // real value (false) would have changed from the last tracked value (true).0
    input.dispatchEvent(new Event('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}));0
    expect(called).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should unmount', () => {0
    const input = ReactDOM.render(<input />, container);0
0
    ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
  });0
0
  it('should only fire change for checked radio button once', () => {0
    let called = 0;0
0
    function cb(e) {0
      called++;0
      expect(e.type).toBe('change');0
    }0
0
    const input = ReactDOM.render(0
      <input type="radio" onChange={cb} />,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    setUntrackedChecked.call(input, true);0
    input.dispatchEvent(new Event('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}));0
    input.dispatchEvent(new Event('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}));0
    expect(called).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should track radio button cousins in a group', () => {0
    let called1 = 0;0
    let called2 = 0;0
0
    function cb1(e) {0
      called1++;0
      expect(e.type).toBe('change');0
    }0
0
    function cb2(e) {0
      called2++;0
      expect(e.type).toBe('change');0
    }0
0
    const div = ReactDOM.render(0
      <div>0
        <input type="radio" name="group" onChange={cb1} />0
        <input type="radio" name="group" onChange={cb2} />0
      </div>,0
      container,0
    );0
    const option1 = div.childNodes[0];0
    const option2 = div.childNodes[1];0
0
    // Select first option.0
    option1.dispatchEvent(0
      new Event('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
    );0
    expect(called1).toBe(1);0
    expect(called2).toBe(0);0
0
    // Select second option.0
    option2.dispatchEvent(0
      new Event('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
    );0
    expect(called1).toBe(1);0
    expect(called2).toBe(1);0
0
    // Select the first option.0
    // It should receive the React change event again.0
    option1.dispatchEvent(0
      new Event('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
    );0
    expect(called1).toBe(2);0
    expect(called2).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should deduplicate input value change events', () => {0
    let called = 0;0
0
    function cb(e) {0
      called++;0
      expect(e.type).toBe('change');0
    }0
0
    let input;0
    ['text', 'number', 'range'].forEach(type => {0
      called = 0;0
      input = ReactDOM.render(<input type={type} onChange={cb} />, container);0
      // Should be ignored (no change):0
      input.dispatchEvent(0
        new Event('change', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
      setUntrackedValue.call(input, '42');0
      input.dispatchEvent(0
        new Event('change', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
      // Should be ignored (no change):0
      input.dispatchEvent(0
        new Event('change', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
      expect(called).toBe(1);0
      ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
0
      called = 0;0
      input = ReactDOM.render(<input type={type} onChange={cb} />, container);0
      // Should be ignored (no change):0
      input.dispatchEvent(0
        new Event('input', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
      setUntrackedValue.call(input, '42');0
      input.dispatchEvent(0
        new Event('input', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
      // Should be ignored (no change):0
      input.dispatchEvent(0
        new Event('input', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
      expect(called).toBe(1);0
      ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
0
      called = 0;0
      input = ReactDOM.render(<input type={type} onChange={cb} />, container);0
      // Should be ignored (no change):0
      input.dispatchEvent(0
        new Event('change', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
      setUntrackedValue.call(input, '42');0
      input.dispatchEvent(0
        new Event('input', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
      // Should be ignored (no change):0
      input.dispatchEvent(0
        new Event('change', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
      expect(called).toBe(1);0
      ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(container);0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('should listen for both change and input events when supported', () => {0
    let called = 0;0
0
    function cb(e) {0
      called++;0
      expect(e.type).toBe('change');0
    }0
0
    const input = ReactDOM.render(0
      <input type="range" onChange={cb} />,0
      container,0
    );0
0
    setUntrackedValue.call(input, 10);0
    input.dispatchEvent(new Event('input', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}));0
0
    setUntrackedValue.call(input, 20);0
    input.dispatchEvent(new Event('change', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}));0
0
    expect(called).toBe(2);0
  });0
0
  it('should only fire events when the value changes for range inputs', () => {0
    let called = 0;0
0
    function cb(e) {0
      called++;0
      expect(e.type).toBe('change');0
    }0
0
    const input = ReactDOM.render(0
      <input type="range" onChange={cb} />,0
      container,0
    );0
    setUntrackedValue.call(input, '40');0
    input.dispatchEvent(new Event('input', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}));0
    input.dispatchEvent(new Event('change', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}));0
0
    setUntrackedValue.call(input, 'foo');0
    input.dispatchEvent(new Event('input', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}));0
    input.dispatchEvent(new Event('change', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}));0
0
    expect(called).toBe(2);0
  });0
0
  it('does not crash for nodes with custom value property', () => {0
    let originalCreateElement;0
    // https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/101960
    try {0
      originalCreateElement = document.createElement;0
      document.createElement = function() {0
        const node = originalCreateElement.apply(this, arguments);0
        Object.defineProperty(node, 'value', {0
          get() {},0
          set() {},0
        });0
        return node;0
      };0
      const div = document.createElement('div');0
      // Mount0
      const node = ReactDOM.render(<input type="text" />, div);0
      // Update0
      ReactDOM.render(<input type="text" />, div);0
      // Change0
      node.dispatchEvent(0
        new Event('change', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
      // Unmount0
      ReactDOM.unmountComponentAtNode(div);0
    } finally {0
      document.createElement = originalCreateElement;0
    }0
  });0
0
  describe('async mode', () => {0
    beforeEach(() => {0
      jest.resetModules();0
      ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
      ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode = false;0
      ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    });0
    it('text input', () => {0
      const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
      let input;0
0
      let ops = [];0
0
      class ControlledInput extends React.Component {0
        state = {value: 'initial'};0
        onChange = event => this.setState({value: event.target.value});0
        render() {0
          ops.push(`render: ${this.state.value}`);0
          const controlledValue =0
            this.state.value === 'changed' ? 'changed [!]' : this.state.value;0
          return (0
            <input0
              ref={el => (input = el)}0
              type="text"0
              value={controlledValue}0
              onChange={this.onChange}0
            />0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      // Initial mount. Test that this is async.0
      root.render(<ControlledInput />);0
      // Should not have flushed yet.0
      expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
      expect(input).toBe(undefined);0
      // Flush callbacks.0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['render: initial']);0
      expect(input.value).toBe('initial');0
0
      ops = [];0
0
      // Trigger a change event.0
      setUntrackedValue.call(input, 'changed');0
      input.dispatchEvent(0
        new Event('input', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
      // Change should synchronously flush0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['render: changed']);0
      // Value should be the controlled value, not the original one0
      expect(input.value).toBe('changed [!]');0
    });0
0
    it('checkbox input', () => {0
      const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
      let input;0
0
      let ops = [];0
0
      class ControlledInput extends React.Component {0
        state = {checked: false};0
        onChange = event => {0
          this.setState({checked: event.target.checked});0
        };0
        render() {0
          ops.push(`render: ${this.state.checked}`);0
          const controlledValue = this.props.reverse0
            ? !this.state.checked0
            : this.state.checked;0
          return (0
            <input0
              ref={el => (input = el)}0
              type="checkbox"0
              checked={controlledValue}0
              onChange={this.onChange}0
            />0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      // Initial mount. Test that this is async.0
      root.render(<ControlledInput reverse={false} />);0
      // Should not have flushed yet.0
      expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
      expect(input).toBe(undefined);0
      // Flush callbacks.0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['render: false']);0
      expect(input.checked).toBe(false);0
0
      ops = [];0
0
      // Trigger a change event.0
      input.dispatchEvent(0
        new MouseEvent('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
      // Change should synchronously flush0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['render: true']);0
      expect(input.checked).toBe(true);0
0
      // Now let's make sure we're using the controlled value.0
      root.render(<ControlledInput reverse={true} />);0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
0
      ops = [];0
0
      // Trigger another change event.0
      input.dispatchEvent(0
        new MouseEvent('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
      // Change should synchronously flush0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['render: true']);0
      expect(input.checked).toBe(false);0
    });0
0
    it('textarea', () => {0
      const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
      let textarea;0
0
      let ops = [];0
0
      class ControlledTextarea extends React.Component {0
        state = {value: 'initial'};0
        onChange = event => this.setState({value: event.target.value});0
        render() {0
          ops.push(`render: ${this.state.value}`);0
          const controlledValue =0
            this.state.value === 'changed' ? 'changed [!]' : this.state.value;0
          return (0
            <textarea0
              ref={el => (textarea = el)}0
              type="text"0
              value={controlledValue}0
              onChange={this.onChange}0
            />0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      // Initial mount. Test that this is async.0
      root.render(<ControlledTextarea />);0
      // Should not have flushed yet.0
      expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
      expect(textarea).toBe(undefined);0
      // Flush callbacks.0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['render: initial']);0
      expect(textarea.value).toBe('initial');0
0
      ops = [];0
0
      // Trigger a change event.0
      setUntrackedTextareaValue.call(textarea, 'changed');0
      textarea.dispatchEvent(0
        new Event('input', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
      // Change should synchronously flush0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['render: changed']);0
      // Value should be the controlled value, not the original one0
      expect(textarea.value).toBe('changed [!]');0
    });0
0
    it('parent of input', () => {0
      const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
      let input;0
0
      let ops = [];0
0
      class ControlledInput extends React.Component {0
        state = {value: 'initial'};0
        onChange = event => this.setState({value: event.target.value});0
        render() {0
          ops.push(`render: ${this.state.value}`);0
          const controlledValue =0
            this.state.value === 'changed' ? 'changed [!]' : this.state.value;0
          return (0
            <div onChange={this.onChange}>0
              <input0
                ref={el => (input = el)}0
                type="text"0
                value={controlledValue}0
                onChange={() => {0
                  // Does nothing. Parent handler is reponsible for updating.0
                }}0
              />0
            </div>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      // Initial mount. Test that this is async.0
      root.render(<ControlledInput />);0
      // Should not have flushed yet.0
      expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
      expect(input).toBe(undefined);0
      // Flush callbacks.0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['render: initial']);0
      expect(input.value).toBe('initial');0
0
      ops = [];0
0
      // Trigger a change event.0
      setUntrackedValue.call(input, 'changed');0
      input.dispatchEvent(0
        new Event('input', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
      // Change should synchronously flush0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['render: changed']);0
      // Value should be the controlled value, not the original one0
      expect(input.value).toBe('changed [!]');0
    });0
0
    it('is async for non-input events', () => {0
      const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
      let input;0
0
      let ops = [];0
0
      class ControlledInput extends React.Component {0
        state = {value: 'initial'};0
        onChange = event => this.setState({value: event.target.value});0
        reset = () => {0
          this.setState({value: ''});0
        };0
        render() {0
          ops.push(`render: ${this.state.value}`);0
          const controlledValue =0
            this.state.value === 'changed' ? 'changed [!]' : this.state.value;0
          return (0
            <input0
              ref={el => (input = el)}0
              type="text"0
              value={controlledValue}0
              onChange={this.onChange}0
              onClick={this.reset}0
            />0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      // Initial mount. Test that this is async.0
      root.render(<ControlledInput />);0
      // Should not have flushed yet.0
      expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
      expect(input).toBe(undefined);0
      // Flush callbacks.0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['render: initial']);0
      expect(input.value).toBe('initial');0
0
      ops = [];0
0
      // Trigger a click event0
      input.dispatchEvent(0
        new Event('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
      // Nothing should have changed0
      expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
      expect(input.value).toBe('initial');0
0
      // Flush callbacks.0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      // Now the click update has flushed.0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['render: ']);0
      expect(input.value).toBe('');0
    });0
  });0
});0

'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
0
describe('EnterLeaveEventPlugin', () => {0
  let container;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
0
    // The container has to be attached for events to fire.0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
    container = null;0
  });0
0
  it('should set onMouseLeave relatedTarget properly in iframe', () => {0
    const iframe = document.createElement('iframe');0
    container.appendChild(iframe);0
    const iframeDocument = iframe.contentDocument;0
    iframeDocument.write(0
      '<!DOCTYPE html><html><head></head><body><div></div></body></html>',0
    );0
    iframeDocument.close();0
0
    let leaveEvents = [];0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(0
      <div0
        onMouseLeave={e => {0
          e.persist();0
          leaveEvents.push(e);0
        }}0
      />,0
      iframeDocument.body.getElementsByTagName('div')[0],0
    );0
0
    node.dispatchEvent(0
      new MouseEvent('mouseout', {0
        bubbles: true,0
        cancelable: true,0
        relatedTarget: iframe.contentWindow,0
      }),0
    );0
0
    expect(leaveEvents.length).toBe(1);0
    expect(leaveEvents[0].target).toBe(node);0
    expect(leaveEvents[0].relatedTarget).toBe(iframe.contentWindow);0
  });0
0
  it('should set onMouseEnter relatedTarget properly in iframe', () => {0
    const iframe = document.createElement('iframe');0
    container.appendChild(iframe);0
    const iframeDocument = iframe.contentDocument;0
    iframeDocument.write(0
      '<!DOCTYPE html><html><head></head><body><div></div></body></html>',0
    );0
    iframeDocument.close();0
0
    let enterEvents = [];0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(0
      <div0
        onMouseEnter={e => {0
          e.persist();0
          enterEvents.push(e);0
        }}0
      />,0
      iframeDocument.body.getElementsByTagName('div')[0],0
    );0
0
    node.dispatchEvent(0
      new MouseEvent('mouseover', {0
        bubbles: true,0
        cancelable: true,0
        relatedTarget: null,0
      }),0
    );0
0
    expect(enterEvents.length).toBe(1);0
    expect(enterEvents[0].target).toBe(node);0
    expect(enterEvents[0].relatedTarget).toBe(iframe.contentWindow);0
  });0
0
  // Regression test for https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/10906.0
  it('should find the common parent after updates', () => {0
    let parentEnterCalls = 0;0
    let childEnterCalls = 0;0
    let parent = null;0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div0
            onMouseEnter={() => parentEnterCalls++}0
            ref={node => (parent = node)}>0
            {this.props.showChild && (0
              <div onMouseEnter={() => childEnterCalls++} />0
            )}0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent />, container);0
    // The issue only reproduced on insertion during the first update.0
    ReactDOM.render(<Parent showChild={true} />, container);0
0
    // Enter from parent into the child.0
    parent.dispatchEvent(0
      new MouseEvent('mouseout', {0
        bubbles: true,0
        cancelable: true,0
        relatedTarget: parent.firstChild,0
      }),0
    );0
0
    // Entering a child should fire on the child, not on the parent.0
    expect(childEnterCalls).toBe(1);0
    expect(parentEnterCalls).toBe(0);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2016-present, Facebook, Inc.0

 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
0
describe('getEventKey', () => {0
  let container;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
0
    // The container has to be attached for events to fire.0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
    container = null;0
  });0
0
  describe('when key is implemented in a browser', () => {0
    describe('when key is not normalized', () => {0
      it('returns a normalized value', () => {0
        let key = null;0
        class Comp extends React.Component {0
          render() {0
            return <input onKeyDown={e => (key = e.key)} />;0
          }0
        }0
0
        ReactDOM.render(<Comp />, container);0
0
        const nativeEvent = new KeyboardEvent('keydown', {0
          key: 'Del',0
          bubbles: true,0
          cancelable: true,0
        });0
        container.firstChild.dispatchEvent(nativeEvent);0
        expect(key).toBe('Delete');0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('when key is normalized', () => {0
      it('returns a key', () => {0
        let key = null;0
        class Comp extends React.Component {0
          render() {0
            return <input onKeyDown={e => (key = e.key)} />;0
          }0
        }0
0
        ReactDOM.render(<Comp />, container);0
0
        const nativeEvent = new KeyboardEvent('keydown', {0
          key: 'f',0
          bubbles: true,0
          cancelable: true,0
        });0
        container.firstChild.dispatchEvent(nativeEvent);0
        expect(key).toBe('f');0
      });0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('when key is not implemented in a browser', () => {0
    describe('when event type is keypress', () => {0
      describe('when charCode is 13', () => {0
        it('returns "Enter"', () => {0
          let key = null;0
          class Comp extends React.Component {0
            render() {0
              return <input onKeyPress={e => (key = e.key)} />;0
            }0
          }0
0
          ReactDOM.render(<Comp />, container);0
0
          const nativeEvent = new KeyboardEvent('keypress', {0
            charCode: 13,0
            bubbles: true,0
            cancelable: true,0
          });0
          container.firstChild.dispatchEvent(nativeEvent);0
          expect(key).toBe('Enter');0
        });0
      });0
0
      describe('when charCode is not 13', () => {0
        it('returns a string from a charCode', () => {0
          let key = null;0
          class Comp extends React.Component {0
            render() {0
              return <input onKeyPress={e => (key = e.key)} />;0
            }0
          }0
0
          ReactDOM.render(<Comp />, container);0
0
          const nativeEvent = new KeyboardEvent('keypress', {0
            charCode: 65,0
            bubbles: true,0
            cancelable: true,0
          });0
          container.firstChild.dispatchEvent(nativeEvent);0
          expect(key).toBe('A');0
        });0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('when event type is keydown or keyup', () => {0
      describe('when keyCode is recognized', () => {0
        it('returns a translated key', () => {0
          let key = null;0
          class Comp extends React.Component {0
            render() {0
              return <input onKeyDown={e => (key = e.key)} />;0
            }0
          }0
0
          ReactDOM.render(<Comp />, container);0
0
          const nativeEvent = new KeyboardEvent('keydown', {0
            keyCode: 45,0
            bubbles: true,0
            cancelable: true,0
          });0
          container.firstChild.dispatchEvent(nativeEvent);0
          expect(key).toBe('Insert');0
        });0
      });0
0
      describe('when keyCode is not recognized', () => {0
        it('returns Unidentified', () => {0
          let key = null;0
          class Comp extends React.Component {0
            render() {0
              return <input onKeyDown={e => (key = e.key)} />;0
            }0
          }0
0
          ReactDOM.render(<Comp />, container);0
0
          const nativeEvent = new KeyboardEvent('keydown', {0
            keyCode: 1337,0
            bubbles: true,0
            cancelable: true,0
          });0
          container.firstChild.dispatchEvent(nativeEvent);0
          expect(key).toBe('Unidentified');0
        });0
      });0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
0
describe('SelectEventPlugin', () => {0
  let container;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
    container = null;0
  });0
0
  // See https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/3639 for details.0
  it('does not get confused when dependent events are registered independently', () => {0
    const select = jest.fn();0
    const onSelect = event => {0
      expect(typeof event).toBe('object');0
      expect(event.type).toBe('select');0
      expect(event.target).toBe(node);0
      select(event.currentTarget);0
    };0
0
    // Pass `onMouseDown` so React registers a top-level listener.0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(0
      <input type="text" onMouseDown={function() {}} />,0
      container,0
    );0
    node.focus();0
0
    // Trigger `mousedown` and `mouseup`. Note that0
    // React is not currently listening to `mouseup`.0
    node.dispatchEvent(0
      new MouseEvent('mousedown', {0
        bubbles: true,0
        cancelable: true,0
      }),0
    );0
    node.dispatchEvent(0
      new MouseEvent('mouseup', {0
        bubbles: true,0
        cancelable: true,0
      }),0
    );0
0
    // Now subscribe to `onSelect`.0
    ReactDOM.render(<input type="text" onSelect={onSelect} />, container);0
    node.focus();0
0
    // This triggers a `select` event in our polyfill.0
    node.dispatchEvent(0
      new KeyboardEvent('keydown', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
    );0
0
    // Verify that it doesn't get "stuck" waiting for0
    // a `mouseup` event that it has "missed" because0
    // a top-level listener didn't exist yet.0
    expect(select).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should fire `onSelect` when a listener is present', () => {0
    const select = jest.fn();0
    const onSelect = event => {0
      expect(typeof event).toBe('object');0
      expect(event.type).toBe('select');0
      expect(event.target).toBe(node);0
      select(event.currentTarget);0
    };0
0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(0
      <input type="text" onSelect={onSelect} />,0
      container,0
    );0
    node.focus();0
0
    let nativeEvent = new MouseEvent('focus', {0
      bubbles: true,0
      cancelable: true,0
    });0
    node.dispatchEvent(nativeEvent);0
    expect(select).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
0
    nativeEvent = new MouseEvent('mousedown', {0
      bubbles: true,0
      cancelable: true,0
    });0
    node.dispatchEvent(nativeEvent);0
    expect(select).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
0
    nativeEvent = new MouseEvent('mouseup', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true});0
    node.dispatchEvent(nativeEvent);0
    expect(select).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
describe('SimpleEventPlugin', function() {0
  let React;0
  let ReactDOM;0
  let ReactFeatureFlags;0
0
  let onClick;0
  let container;0
0
  function expectClickThru(element) {0
    element.click();0
    expect(onClick).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
  }0
0
  function expectNoClickThru(element) {0
    element.click();0
    expect(onClick).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
  }0
0
  function mounted(element) {0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
    element = ReactDOM.render(element, container);0
    return element;0
  }0
0
  beforeEach(function() {0
    // TODO pull this into helper method, reduce repetition.0
    // mock the browser APIs which are used in react-scheduler:0
    // - requestAnimationFrame should pass the DOMHighResTimeStamp argument0
    // - calling 'window.postMessage' should actually fire postmessage handlers0
    global.requestAnimationFrame = function(cb) {0
      return setTimeout(() => {0
        cb(Date.now());0
      });0
    };0
    const originalAddEventListener = global.addEventListener;0
    let postMessageCallback;0
    global.addEventListener = function(eventName, callback, useCapture) {0
      if (eventName === 'message') {0
        postMessageCallback = callback;0
      } else {0
        originalAddEventListener(eventName, callback, useCapture);0
      }0
    };0
    global.postMessage = function(messageKey, targetOrigin) {0
      const postMessageEvent = {source: window, data: messageKey};0
      if (postMessageCallback) {0
        postMessageCallback(postMessageEvent);0
      }0
    };0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
0
    onClick = jest.fn();0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    if (container && document.body.contains(container)) {0
      document.body.removeChild(container);0
      container = null;0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('A non-interactive tags click when disabled', function() {0
    const element = <div onClick={onClick} />;0
    expectClickThru(mounted(element));0
  });0
0
  it('A non-interactive tags clicks bubble when disabled', function() {0
    const element = mounted(0
      <div onClick={onClick}>0
        <div />0
      </div>,0
    );0
    const child = element.firstChild;0
    child.click();0
    expect(onClick).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
  });0
0
  it('does not register a click when clicking a child of a disabled element', function() {0
    const element = mounted(0
      <button onClick={onClick} disabled={true}>0
        <span />0
      </button>,0
    );0
    const child = element.querySelector('span');0
0
    child.click();0
    expect(onClick).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
  });0
0
  it('triggers click events for children of disabled elements', function() {0
    const element = mounted(0
      <button disabled={true}>0
        <span onClick={onClick} />0
      </button>,0
    );0
    const child = element.querySelector('span');0
0
    child.click();0
    expect(onClick).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
  });0
0
  it('triggers parent captured click events when target is a child of a disabled elements', function() {0
    const element = mounted(0
      <div onClickCapture={onClick}>0
        <button disabled={true}>0
          <span />0
        </button>0
      </div>,0
    );0
    const child = element.querySelector('span');0
0
    child.click();0
    expect(onClick).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
  });0
0
  it('triggers captured click events for children of disabled elements', function() {0
    const element = mounted(0
      <button disabled={true}>0
        <span onClickCapture={onClick} />0
      </button>,0
    );0
    const child = element.querySelector('span');0
0
    child.click();0
    expect(onClick).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
  });0
0
  ['button', 'input', 'select', 'textarea'].forEach(function(tagName) {0
    describe(tagName, function() {0
      it('should forward clicks when it starts out not disabled', () => {0
        const element = React.createElement(tagName, {0
          onClick: onClick,0
        });0
0
        expectClickThru(mounted(element));0
      });0
0
      it('should not forward clicks when it starts out disabled', () => {0
        const element = React.createElement(tagName, {0
          onClick: onClick,0
          disabled: true,0
        });0
0
        expectNoClickThru(mounted(element));0
      });0
0
      it('should forward clicks when it becomes not disabled', () => {0
        container = document.createElement('div');0
        document.body.appendChild(container);0
        let element = ReactDOM.render(0
          React.createElement(tagName, {onClick: onClick, disabled: true}),0
          container,0
        );0
        element = ReactDOM.render(0
          React.createElement(tagName, {onClick: onClick}),0
          container,0
        );0
        expectClickThru(element);0
      });0
0
      it('should not forward clicks when it becomes disabled', () => {0
        container = document.createElement('div');0
        document.body.appendChild(container);0
        let element = ReactDOM.render(0
          React.createElement(tagName, {onClick: onClick}),0
          container,0
        );0
        element = ReactDOM.render(0
          React.createElement(tagName, {onClick: onClick, disabled: true}),0
          container,0
        );0
        expectNoClickThru(element);0
      });0
0
      it('should work correctly if the listener is changed', () => {0
        container = document.createElement('div');0
        document.body.appendChild(container);0
        let element = ReactDOM.render(0
          React.createElement(tagName, {onClick: onClick, disabled: true}),0
          container,0
        );0
        element = ReactDOM.render(0
          React.createElement(tagName, {onClick: onClick, disabled: false}),0
          container,0
        );0
        expectClickThru(element);0
      });0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('batches updates that occur as a result of a nested event dispatch', () => {0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
    let ops = [];0
    let button;0
    class Button extends React.Component {0
      state = {count: 0};0
      increment = () =>0
        this.setState(state => ({0
          count: state.count + 1,0
        }));0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push(`didUpdate - Count: ${this.state.count}`);0
      }0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <button0
            ref={el => (button = el)}0
            onFocus={this.increment}0
            onClick={() => {0
              // The focus call synchronously dispatches a nested event. All of0
              // the updates in this handler should be batched together.0
              this.increment();0
              button.focus();0
              this.increment();0
            }}>0
            Count: {this.state.count}0
          </button>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    function click() {0
      button.dispatchEvent(0
        new MouseEvent('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactDOM.render(<Button />, container);0
    expect(button.textContent).toEqual('Count: 0');0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
0
    click();0
0
    // There should be exactly one update.0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['didUpdate - Count: 3']);0
    expect(button.textContent).toEqual('Count: 3');0
  });0
0
  describe('interactive events, in async mode', () => {0
    beforeEach(() => {0
      jest.resetModules();0
      ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
      ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode = false;0
      ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    });0
0
    it('flushes pending interactive work before extracting event handler', () => {0
      container = document.createElement('div');0
      const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
      document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
      let ops = [];0
0
      let button;0
      class Button extends React.Component {0
        state = {disabled: false};0
        onClick = () => {0
          // Perform some side-effect0
          ops.push('Side-effect');0
          // Disable the button0
          this.setState({disabled: true});0
        };0
        render() {0
          ops.push(0
            `render button: ${this.state.disabled ? 'disabled' : 'enabled'}`,0
          );0
          return (0
            <button0
              ref={el => (button = el)}0
              // Handler is removed after the first click0
              onClick={this.state.disabled ? null : this.onClick}0
            />0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      // Initial mount0
      root.render(<Button />);0
      // Should not have flushed yet because it's async0
      expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
      expect(button).toBe(undefined);0
      // Flush async work0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      expect(ops).toEqual(['render button: enabled']);0
0
      ops = [];0
0
      function click() {0
        button.dispatchEvent(0
          new MouseEvent('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
        );0
      }0
0
      // Click the button to trigger the side-effect0
      click();0
      expect(ops).toEqual([0
        // The handler fired0
        'Side-effect',0
        // but the component did not re-render yet, because it's async0
      ]);0
0
      ops = [];0
0
      // Click the button again0
      click();0
      expect(ops).toEqual([0
        // Before handling this second click event, the previous interactive0
        // update is flushed0
        'render button: disabled',0
        // The event handler was removed from the button, so there's no second0
        // side-effect0
      ]);0
0
      ops = [];0
0
      // The handler should not fire again no matter how many times we0
      // click the handler.0
      click();0
      click();0
      click();0
      click();0
      click();0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
    });0
0
    it('end result of many interactive updates is deterministic', () => {0
      container = document.createElement('div');0
      const root = ReactDOM.unstable_createRoot(container);0
      document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
      let button;0
      class Button extends React.Component {0
        state = {count: 0};0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <button0
              ref={el => (button = el)}0
              onClick={() =>0
                // Intentionally not using the updater form here0
                this.setState({count: this.state.count + 1})0
              }>0
              Count: {this.state.count}0
            </button>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      // Initial mount0
      root.render(<Button />);0
      // Should not have flushed yet because it's async0
      expect(button).toBe(undefined);0
      // Flush async work0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      expect(button.textContent).toEqual('Count: 0');0
0
      function click() {0
        button.dispatchEvent(0
          new MouseEvent('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
        );0
      }0
0
      // Click the button a single time0
      click();0
      // The counter should not have updated yet because it's async0
      expect(button.textContent).toEqual('Count: 0');0
0
      // Click the button many more times0
      click();0
      click();0
      click();0
      click();0
      click();0
      click();0
0
      // Flush the remaining work0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      // The counter should equal the total number of clicks0
      expect(button.textContent).toEqual('Count: 7');0
    });0
0
    it('flushes lowest pending interactive priority', () => {0
      container = document.createElement('div');0
      document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
      let button;0
      class Button extends React.Component {0
        state = {lowPriCount: 0};0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <button0
              ref={el => (button = el)}0
              onClick={0
                // Intentionally not using the updater form here0
                () => this.setState({lowPriCount: this.state.lowPriCount + 1})0
              }>0
              High-pri count: {this.props.highPriCount}, Low-pri count:{' '}0
              {this.state.lowPriCount}0
            </button>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
        state = {highPriCount: 0};0
        render() {0
          return (0
            <div0
              onClick={0
                // Intentionally not using the updater form here0
                () => this.setState({highPriCount: this.state.highPriCount + 1})0
              }>0
              <React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
                <Button highPriCount={this.state.highPriCount} />0
              </React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
            </div>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      // Initial mount0
      ReactDOM.render(<Wrapper />, container);0
      expect(button.textContent).toEqual('High-pri count: 0, Low-pri count: 0');0
0
      function click() {0
        button.dispatchEvent(0
          new MouseEvent('click', {bubbles: true, cancelable: true}),0
        );0
      }0
0
      // Click the button a single time0
      click();0
      // The high-pri counter should flush synchronously, but not the0
      // low-pri counter0
      expect(button.textContent).toEqual('High-pri count: 1, Low-pri count: 0');0
0
      // Click the button many more times0
      click();0
      click();0
      click();0
      click();0
      click();0
      click();0
0
      // Flush the remaining work0
      jest.runAllTimers();0
      // Both counters should equal the total number of clicks0
      expect(button.textContent).toEqual('High-pri count: 7, Low-pri count: 7');0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('iOS bubbling click fix', function() {0
    // See http://www.quirksmode.org/blog/archives/2010/09/click_event_del.html0
0
    it('does not add a local click to interactive elements', function() {0
      container = document.createElement('div');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<button onClick={onClick} />, container);0
0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
0
      node.dispatchEvent(new MouseEvent('click'));0
0
      expect(onClick).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
    });0
0
    it('adds a local click listener to non-interactive elements', function() {0
      container = document.createElement('div');0
0
      ReactDOM.render(<div onClick={onClick} />, container);0
0
      const node = container.firstChild;0
0
      node.dispatchEvent(new MouseEvent('click'));0
0
      expect(onClick).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
    });0
  });0
});0

'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
0
describe('SyntheticClipboardEvent', () => {0
  let container;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
0
    // The container has to be attached for events to fire.0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
    container = null;0
  });0
0
  describe('ClipboardEvent interface', () => {0
    describe('clipboardData', () => {0
      describe('when event has clipboardData', () => {0
        it("returns event's clipboardData", () => {0
          let expectedCount = 0;0
0
          // Mock clipboardData since jsdom implementation doesn't have a constructor0
          const clipboardData = {0
            dropEffect: null,0
            effectAllowed: null,0
            files: null,0
            items: null,0
            types: null,0
          };0
          const eventHandler = event => {0
            expect(event.clipboardData).toBe(clipboardData);0
            expectedCount++;0
          };0
          const div = ReactDOM.render(0
            <div0
              onCopy={eventHandler}0
              onCut={eventHandler}0
              onPaste={eventHandler}0
            />,0
            container,0
          );0
0
          let event;0
          event = document.createEvent('Event');0
          event.initEvent('copy', true, true);0
          event.clipboardData = clipboardData;0
          div.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
          event = document.createEvent('Event');0
          event.initEvent('cut', true, true);0
          event.clipboardData = clipboardData;0
          div.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
          event = document.createEvent('Event');0
          event.initEvent('paste', true, true);0
          event.clipboardData = clipboardData;0
          div.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
          expect(expectedCount).toBe(3);0
        });0
      });0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('EventInterface', () => {0
    it('is able to `preventDefault` and `stopPropagation`', () => {0
      let expectedCount = 0;0
0
      const eventHandler = event => {0
        expect(event.isDefaultPrevented()).toBe(false);0
        event.preventDefault();0
        expect(event.isDefaultPrevented()).toBe(true);0
        expect(event.isPropagationStopped()).toBe(false);0
        event.stopPropagation();0
        expect(event.isPropagationStopped()).toBe(true);0
        expectedCount++;0
      };0
0
      const div = ReactDOM.render(0
        <div0
          onCopy={eventHandler}0
          onCut={eventHandler}0
          onPaste={eventHandler}0
        />,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      let event;0
      event = document.createEvent('Event');0
      event.initEvent('copy', true, true);0
      div.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
      event = document.createEvent('Event');0
      event.initEvent('cut', true, true);0
      div.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
      event = document.createEvent('Event');0
      event.initEvent('paste', true, true);0
      div.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
      expect(expectedCount).toBe(3);0
    });0
0
    it('is able to `persist`', () => {0
      const persistentEvents = [];0
      const eventHandler = event => {0
        expect(event.isPersistent()).toBe(false);0
        event.persist();0
        expect(event.isPersistent()).toBe(true);0
        persistentEvents.push(event);0
      };0
0
      const div = ReactDOM.render(0
        <div0
          onCopy={eventHandler}0
          onCut={eventHandler}0
          onPaste={eventHandler}0
        />,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      let event;0
      event = document.createEvent('Event');0
      event.initEvent('copy', true, true);0
      div.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
      event = document.createEvent('Event');0
      event.initEvent('cut', true, true);0
      div.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
      event = document.createEvent('Event');0
      event.initEvent('paste', true, true);0
      div.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
      expect(persistentEvents.length).toBe(3);0
      expect(persistentEvents[0].type).toBe('copy');0
      expect(persistentEvents[1].type).toBe('cut');0
      expect(persistentEvents[2].type).toBe('paste');0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
0
describe('SyntheticEvent', () => {0
  let container;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
    container = null;0
  });0
0
  it('should be able to `preventDefault`', () => {0
    let node;0
    let expectedCount = 0;0
0
    const eventHandler = syntheticEvent => {0
      expect(syntheticEvent.isDefaultPrevented()).toBe(false);0
      syntheticEvent.preventDefault();0
      expect(syntheticEvent.isDefaultPrevented()).toBe(true);0
      expect(syntheticEvent.defaultPrevented).toBe(true);0
0
      expectedCount++;0
    };0
    node = ReactDOM.render(<div onClick={eventHandler} />, container);0
0
    const event = document.createEvent('Event');0
    event.initEvent('click', true, true);0
    node.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
    expect(expectedCount).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should be prevented if nativeEvent is prevented', () => {0
    let node;0
    let expectedCount = 0;0
0
    const eventHandler = syntheticEvent => {0
      expect(syntheticEvent.isDefaultPrevented()).toBe(true);0
0
      expectedCount++;0
    };0
    node = ReactDOM.render(<div onClick={eventHandler} />, container);0
0
    let event;0
    event = document.createEvent('Event');0
    event.initEvent('click', true, true);0
    event.preventDefault();0
    node.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
    event = document.createEvent('Event');0
    event.initEvent('click', true, true);0
    // Emulate IE80
    Object.defineProperty(event, 'defaultPrevented', {0
      get() {},0
    });0
    Object.defineProperty(event, 'returnValue', {0
      get() {0
        return false;0
      },0
    });0
    node.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
    expect(expectedCount).toBe(2);0
  });0
0
  it('should be able to `stopPropagation`', () => {0
    let node;0
    let expectedCount = 0;0
0
    const eventHandler = syntheticEvent => {0
      expect(syntheticEvent.isPropagationStopped()).toBe(false);0
      syntheticEvent.stopPropagation();0
      expect(syntheticEvent.isPropagationStopped()).toBe(true);0
0
      expectedCount++;0
    };0
    node = ReactDOM.render(<div onClick={eventHandler} />, container);0
0
    const event = document.createEvent('Event');0
    event.initEvent('click', true, true);0
    node.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
    expect(expectedCount).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should be able to `persist`', () => {0
    let node;0
    let expectedCount = 0;0
    let syntheticEvent;0
0
    const eventHandler = e => {0
      expect(e.isPersistent()).toBe(false);0
      e.persist();0
      syntheticEvent = e;0
      expect(e.isPersistent()).toBe(true);0
0
      expectedCount++;0
    };0
    node = ReactDOM.render(<div onClick={eventHandler} />, container);0
0
    const event = document.createEvent('Event');0
    event.initEvent('click', true, true);0
    node.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
    expect(syntheticEvent.type).toBe('click');0
    expect(syntheticEvent.bubbles).toBe(true);0
    expect(syntheticEvent.cancelable).toBe(true);0
    expect(expectedCount).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should be nullified and log warnings if the synthetic event has not been persisted', () => {0
    let node;0
    let expectedCount = 0;0
    let syntheticEvent;0
0
    const eventHandler = e => {0
      syntheticEvent = e;0
0
      expectedCount++;0
    };0
    node = ReactDOM.render(<div onClick={eventHandler} />, container);0
0
    const event = document.createEvent('Event');0
    event.initEvent('click', true, true);0
    node.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
    const getExpectedWarning = property =>0
      'Warning: This synthetic event is reused for performance reasons. If ' +0
      `you're seeing this, you're accessing the property \`${property}\` on a ` +0
      'released/nullified synthetic event. This is set to null. If you must ' +0
      'keep the original synthetic event around, use event.persist(). ' +0
      'See https://fb.me/react-event-pooling for more information.';0
0
    // once for each property accessed0
    expect(() => expect(syntheticEvent.type).toBe(null)).toWarnDev(0
      getExpectedWarning('type'),0
    );0
    expect(() => expect(syntheticEvent.nativeEvent).toBe(null)).toWarnDev(0
      getExpectedWarning('nativeEvent'),0
    );0
    expect(() => expect(syntheticEvent.target).toBe(null)).toWarnDev(0
      getExpectedWarning('target'),0
    );0
0
    expect(expectedCount).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when setting properties of a synthetic event that has not been persisted', () => {0
    let node;0
    let expectedCount = 0;0
    let syntheticEvent;0
0
    const eventHandler = e => {0
      syntheticEvent = e;0
0
      expectedCount++;0
    };0
    node = ReactDOM.render(<div onClick={eventHandler} />, container);0
0
    const event = document.createEvent('Event');0
    event.initEvent('click', true, true);0
    node.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
    expect(() => {0
      syntheticEvent.type = 'MouseEvent';0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: This synthetic event is reused for performance reasons. If ' +0
        "you're seeing this, you're setting the property `type` on a " +0
        'released/nullified synthetic event. This is effectively a no-op. If you must ' +0
        'keep the original synthetic event around, use event.persist(). ' +0
        'See https://fb.me/react-event-pooling for more information.',0
    );0
    expect(expectedCount).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when calling `preventDefault` if the synthetic event has not been persisted', () => {0
    let node;0
    let expectedCount = 0;0
    let syntheticEvent;0
0
    const eventHandler = e => {0
      syntheticEvent = e;0
      expectedCount++;0
    };0
    node = ReactDOM.render(<div onClick={eventHandler} />, container);0
0
    const event = document.createEvent('Event');0
    event.initEvent('click', true, true);0
    node.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
    expect(() => syntheticEvent.preventDefault()).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: This synthetic event is reused for performance reasons. If ' +0
        "you're seeing this, you're accessing the method `preventDefault` on a " +0
        'released/nullified synthetic event. This is a no-op function. If you must ' +0
        'keep the original synthetic event around, use event.persist(). ' +0
        'See https://fb.me/react-event-pooling for more information.',0
    );0
    expect(expectedCount).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should warn when calling `stopPropagation` if the synthetic event has not been persisted', () => {0
    let node;0
    let expectedCount = 0;0
    let syntheticEvent;0
0
    const eventHandler = e => {0
      syntheticEvent = e;0
      expectedCount++;0
    };0
    node = ReactDOM.render(<div onClick={eventHandler} />, container);0
0
    const event = document.createEvent('Event');0
    event.initEvent('click', true, true);0
0
    node.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
    expect(() => syntheticEvent.stopPropagation()).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: This synthetic event is reused for performance reasons. If ' +0
        "you're seeing this, you're accessing the method `stopPropagation` on a " +0
        'released/nullified synthetic event. This is a no-op function. If you must ' +0
        'keep the original synthetic event around, use event.persist(). ' +0
        'See https://fb.me/react-event-pooling for more information.',0
    );0
    expect(expectedCount).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should properly log warnings when events simulated with rendered components', () => {0
    let event;0
    function assignEvent(e) {0
      event = e;0
    }0
    const node = ReactDOM.render(<div onClick={assignEvent} />, container);0
    node.click();0
0
    // access a property to cause the warning0
    expect(() => {0
      event.nativeEvent; // eslint-disable-line no-unused-expressions0
    }).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: This synthetic event is reused for performance reasons. If ' +0
        "you're seeing this, you're accessing the property `nativeEvent` on a " +0
        'released/nullified synthetic event. This is set to null. If you must ' +0
        'keep the original synthetic event around, use event.persist(). ' +0
        'See https://fb.me/react-event-pooling for more information.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn if Proxy is supported and the synthetic event is added a property', () => {0
    let node;0
    let expectedCount = 0;0
    let syntheticEvent;0
0
    const eventHandler = e => {0
      if (typeof Proxy === 'function') {0
        expect(() => {0
          e.foo = 'bar';0
        }).toWarnDev(0
          'Warning: This synthetic event is reused for performance reasons. If ' +0
            "you're seeing this, you're adding a new property in the synthetic " +0
            'event object. The property is never released. ' +0
            'See https://fb.me/react-event-pooling for more information.',0
        );0
      } else {0
        e.foo = 'bar';0
      }0
      syntheticEvent = e;0
      expectedCount++;0
    };0
    node = ReactDOM.render(<div onClick={eventHandler} />, container);0
0
    const event = document.createEvent('Event');0
    event.initEvent('click', true, true);0
0
    node.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
    expect(syntheticEvent.foo).toBe('bar');0
    expect(expectedCount).toBe(1);0
  });0
});0
/**0
