'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
0
describe('SyntheticKeyboardEvent', () => {0
  let container;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    // The container has to be attached for events to fire.0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
    container = null;0
  });0
0
  describe('KeyboardEvent interface', () => {0
    describe('charCode', () => {0
      describe('when event is `keypress`', () => {0
        describe('when charCode is present in nativeEvent', () => {0
          it('when charCode is 0 and keyCode is 13, returns 13', () => {0
            let charCode = null;0
            const node = ReactDOM.render(0
              <input0
                onKeyPress={e => {0
                  charCode = e.charCode;0
                }}0
              />,0
              container,0
            );0
            node.dispatchEvent(0
              new KeyboardEvent('keypress', {0
                charCode: 0,0
                keyCode: 13,0
                bubbles: true,0
                cancelable: true,0
              }),0
            );0
            expect(charCode).toBe(13);0
          });0
0
          it('when charCode is 32 or bigger and keyCode is missing, returns charCode', () => {0
            let charCode = null;0
            const node = ReactDOM.render(0
              <input0
                onKeyPress={e => {0
                  charCode = e.charCode;0
                }}0
              />,0
              container,0
            );0
            node.dispatchEvent(0
              new KeyboardEvent('keypress', {0
                charCode: 32,0
                bubbles: true,0
                cancelable: true,0
              }),0
            );0
            expect(charCode).toBe(32);0
          });0
0
          it('when charCode is 13 and keyCode is missing, returns charCode', () => {0
            let charCode = null;0
            const node = ReactDOM.render(0
              <input0
                onKeyPress={e => {0
                  charCode = e.charCode;0
                }}0
              />,0
              container,0
            );0
            node.dispatchEvent(0
              new KeyboardEvent('keypress', {0
                charCode: 13,0
                bubbles: true,0
                cancelable: true,0
              }),0
            );0
            expect(charCode).toBe(13);0
          });0
0
          // Firefox creates a keypress event for function keys too. This removes0
          // the unwanted keypress events. Enter is however both printable and0
          // non-printable. One would expect Tab to be as well (but it isn't).0
          it('when charCode is smaller than 32 but is not 13, and keyCode is missing, ignores keypress', () => {0
            let called = false;0
            const node = ReactDOM.render(0
              <input0
                onKeyPress={() => {0
                  called = true;0
                }}0
              />,0
              container,0
            );0
            node.dispatchEvent(0
              new KeyboardEvent('keypress', {0
                charCode: 31,0
                bubbles: true,0
                cancelable: true,0
              }),0
            );0
            expect(called).toBe(false);0
          });0
0
          it('when charCode is 10, returns 13', () => {0
            let charCode = null;0
            const node = ReactDOM.render(0
              <input0
                onKeyPress={e => {0
                  charCode = e.charCode;0
                }}0
              />,0
              container,0
            );0
            node.dispatchEvent(0
              new KeyboardEvent('keypress', {0
                charCode: 10,0
                bubbles: true,0
                cancelable: true,0
              }),0
            );0
            expect(charCode).toBe(13);0
          });0
0
          it('when charCode is 10 and ctrl is pressed, returns 13', () => {0
            let charCode = null;0
            const node = ReactDOM.render(0
              <input0
                onKeyPress={e => {0
                  charCode = e.charCode;0
                }}0
              />,0
              container,0
            );0
            node.dispatchEvent(0
              new KeyboardEvent('keypress', {0
                charCode: 10,0
                ctrlKey: true,0
                bubbles: true,0
                cancelable: true,0
              }),0
            );0
            expect(charCode).toBe(13);0
          });0
        });0
0
        // TODO: this seems IE8 specific.0
        // We can probably remove this normalization.0
        describe('when charCode is not present in nativeEvent', () => {0
          let charCodeDescriptor;0
0
          beforeEach(() => {0
            charCodeDescriptor = Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(0
              KeyboardEvent.prototype,0
              'charCode',0
            );0
            delete KeyboardEvent.prototype.charCode;0
          });0
0
          afterEach(() => {0
            // Don't forget to restore for other tests.0
            Object.defineProperty(0
              KeyboardEvent.prototype,0
              'charCode',0
              charCodeDescriptor,0
            );0
            charCodeDescriptor = null;0
          });0
0
          it('when keyCode is 32 or bigger, returns keyCode', () => {0
            let charCode = null;0
            const node = ReactDOM.render(0
              <input0
                onKeyPress={e => {0
                  charCode = e.charCode;0
                }}0
              />,0
              container,0
            );0
            node.dispatchEvent(0
              new KeyboardEvent('keypress', {0
                keyCode: 32,0
                bubbles: true,0
                cancelable: true,0
              }),0
            );0
            expect(charCode).toBe(32);0
          });0
0
          it('when keyCode is 13, returns 13', () => {0
            let charCode = null;0
            const node = ReactDOM.render(0
              <input0
                onKeyPress={e => {0
                  charCode = e.charCode;0
                }}0
              />,0
              container,0
            );0
            node.dispatchEvent(0
              new KeyboardEvent('keypress', {0
                keyCode: 13,0
                bubbles: true,0
                cancelable: true,0
              }),0
            );0
            expect(charCode).toBe(13);0
          });0
0
          it('when keyCode is smaller than 32 and is not 13, ignores keypress', () => {0
            let called = false;0
            const node = ReactDOM.render(0
              <input0
                onKeyPress={e => {0
                  called = true;0
                }}0
              />,0
              container,0
            );0
            node.dispatchEvent(0
              new KeyboardEvent('keypress', {0
                keyCode: 31,0
                bubbles: true,0
                cancelable: true,0
              }),0
            );0
            expect(called).toBe(false);0
          });0
        });0
      });0
0
      describe('when event is not `keypress`', () => {0
        it('returns 0', () => {0
          let charCodeDown = null;0
          let charCodeUp = null;0
          const node = ReactDOM.render(0
            <input0
              onKeyDown={e => {0
                charCodeDown = e.charCode;0
              }}0
              onKeyUp={e => {0
                charCodeUp = e.charCode;0
              }}0
            />,0
            container,0
          );0
          node.dispatchEvent(0
            new KeyboardEvent('keydown', {0
              key: 'Del',0
              bubbles: true,0
              cancelable: true,0
            }),0
          );0
          node.dispatchEvent(0
            new KeyboardEvent('keyup', {0
              key: 'Del',0
              bubbles: true,0
              cancelable: true,0
            }),0
          );0
          expect(charCodeDown).toBe(0);0
          expect(charCodeUp).toBe(0);0
        });0
      });0
0
      it('when charCode is smaller than 32 but is not 13, and keyCode is missing, charCode is 0', () => {0
        let charCode = null;0
        const node = ReactDOM.render(0
          <input0
            onKeyDown={e => {0
              charCode = e.charCode;0
            }}0
          />,0
          container,0
        );0
        node.dispatchEvent(0
          new KeyboardEvent('keydown', {0
            charCode: 31,0
            bubbles: true,0
            cancelable: true,0
          }),0
        );0
        expect(charCode).toBe(0);0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('keyCode', () => {0
      describe('when event is `keydown` or `keyup`', () => {0
        it('returns a passed keyCode', () => {0
          let keyCodeDown = null;0
          let keyCodeUp = null;0
          const node = ReactDOM.render(0
            <input0
              onKeyDown={e => {0
                keyCodeDown = e.keyCode;0
              }}0
              onKeyUp={e => {0
                keyCodeUp = e.keyCode;0
              }}0
            />,0
            container,0
          );0
          node.dispatchEvent(0
            new KeyboardEvent('keydown', {0
              keyCode: 40,0
              bubbles: true,0
              cancelable: true,0
            }),0
          );0
          node.dispatchEvent(0
            new KeyboardEvent('keyup', {0
              keyCode: 40,0
              bubbles: true,0
              cancelable: true,0
            }),0
          );0
          expect(keyCodeDown).toBe(40);0
          expect(keyCodeUp).toBe(40);0
        });0
      });0
0
      describe('when event is `keypress`', () => {0
        it('returns 0', () => {0
          let keyCode = null;0
          const node = ReactDOM.render(0
            <input0
              onKeyPress={e => {0
                keyCode = e.keyCode;0
              }}0
            />,0
            container,0
          );0
          node.dispatchEvent(0
            new KeyboardEvent('keypress', {0
              charCode: 65,0
              bubbles: true,0
              cancelable: true,0
            }),0
          );0
          expect(keyCode).toBe(0);0
        });0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('which', () => {0
      describe('when event is `keypress`', () => {0
        it('is consistent with `charCode`', () => {0
          let calls = 0;0
          const node = ReactDOM.render(0
            <input0
              onKeyPress={e => {0
                expect(e.which).toBe(e.charCode);0
                calls++;0
              }}0
            />,0
            container,0
          );0
          // Try different combinations from other tests.0
          node.dispatchEvent(0
            new KeyboardEvent('keypress', {0
              charCode: 0,0
              keyCode: 13,0
              bubbles: true,0
              cancelable: true,0
            }),0
          );0
          node.dispatchEvent(0
            new KeyboardEvent('keypress', {0
              charCode: 32,0
              bubbles: true,0
              cancelable: true,0
            }),0
          );0
          node.dispatchEvent(0
            new KeyboardEvent('keypress', {0
              charCode: 13,0
              bubbles: true,0
              cancelable: true,0
            }),0
          );0
          expect(calls).toBe(3);0
        });0
      });0
0
      describe('when event is `keydown` or `keyup`', () => {0
        it('is consistent with `keyCode`', () => {0
          let calls = 0;0
          const node = ReactDOM.render(0
            <input0
              onKeyDown={e => {0
                expect(e.which).toBe(e.keyCode);0
                calls++;0
              }}0
              onKeyUp={e => {0
                expect(e.which).toBe(e.keyCode);0
                calls++;0
              }}0
            />,0
            container,0
          );0
          node.dispatchEvent(0
            new KeyboardEvent('keydown', {0
              key: 'Del',0
              bubbles: true,0
              cancelable: true,0
            }),0
          );0
          node.dispatchEvent(0
            new KeyboardEvent('keydown', {0
              charCode: 31,0
              bubbles: true,0
              cancelable: true,0
            }),0
          );0
          node.dispatchEvent(0
            new KeyboardEvent('keydown', {0
              keyCode: 40,0
              bubbles: true,0
              cancelable: true,0
            }),0
          );0
          node.dispatchEvent(0
            new KeyboardEvent('keyup', {0
              key: 'Del',0
              bubbles: true,0
              cancelable: true,0
            }),0
          );0
          node.dispatchEvent(0
            new KeyboardEvent('keyup', {0
              keyCode: 40,0
              bubbles: true,0
              cancelable: true,0
            }),0
          );0
          expect(calls).toBe(5);0
        });0
      });0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('EventInterface', () => {0
    it('is able to `preventDefault` and `stopPropagation`', () => {0
      let expectedCount = 0;0
      const eventHandler = event => {0
        expect(event.isDefaultPrevented()).toBe(false);0
        event.preventDefault();0
        expect(event.isDefaultPrevented()).toBe(true);0
0
        expect(event.isPropagationStopped()).toBe(false);0
        event.stopPropagation();0
        expect(event.isPropagationStopped()).toBe(true);0
        expectedCount++;0
      };0
      let div = ReactDOM.render(0
        <div0
          onKeyDown={eventHandler}0
          onKeyUp={eventHandler}0
          onKeyPress={eventHandler}0
        />,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      div.dispatchEvent(0
        new KeyboardEvent('keydown', {0
          keyCode: 40,0
          bubbles: true,0
          cancelable: true,0
        }),0
      );0
      div.dispatchEvent(0
        new KeyboardEvent('keyup', {0
          keyCode: 40,0
          bubbles: true,0
          cancelable: true,0
        }),0
      );0
      div.dispatchEvent(0
        new KeyboardEvent('keypress', {0
          charCode: 40,0
          keyCode: 40,0
          bubbles: true,0
          cancelable: true,0
        }),0
      );0
      expect(expectedCount).toBe(3);0
    });0
0
    it('is able to `persist`', () => {0
      const persistentEvents = [];0
      const eventHandler = event => {0
        expect(event.isPersistent()).toBe(false);0
        event.persist();0
        expect(event.isPersistent()).toBe(true);0
        persistentEvents.push(event);0
      };0
      let div = ReactDOM.render(0
        <div0
          onKeyDown={eventHandler}0
          onKeyUp={eventHandler}0
          onKeyPress={eventHandler}0
        />,0
        container,0
      );0
0
      div.dispatchEvent(0
        new KeyboardEvent('keydown', {0
          keyCode: 40,0
          bubbles: true,0
          cancelable: true,0
        }),0
      );0
      div.dispatchEvent(0
        new KeyboardEvent('keyup', {0
          keyCode: 40,0
          bubbles: true,0
          cancelable: true,0
        }),0
      );0
      div.dispatchEvent(0
        new KeyboardEvent('keypress', {0
          charCode: 40,0
          keyCode: 40,0
          bubbles: true,0
          cancelable: true,0
        }),0
      );0
      expect(persistentEvents.length).toBe(3);0
      expect(persistentEvents[0].type).toBe('keydown');0
      expect(persistentEvents[1].type).toBe('keyup');0
      expect(persistentEvents[2].type).toBe('keypress');0
    });0
  });0
});0

 *0

'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
0
describe('SyntheticWheelEvent', () => {0
  let container;0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
0
    // The container has to be attached for events to fire.0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
    container = null;0
  });0
0
  it('should normalize properties from the MouseEvent interface', () => {0
    const events = [];0
    const onWheel = event => {0
      event.persist();0
      events.push(event);0
    };0
    ReactDOM.render(<div onWheel={onWheel} />, container);0
0
    container.firstChild.dispatchEvent(0
      new MouseEvent('wheel', {0
        bubbles: true,0
        button: 1,0
      }),0
    );0
0
    expect(events.length).toBe(1);0
    expect(events[0].button).toBe(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should normalize properties from the WheelEvent interface', () => {0
    const events = [];0
    const onWheel = event => {0
      event.persist();0
      events.push(event);0
    };0
    ReactDOM.render(<div onWheel={onWheel} />, container);0
0
    let event = new MouseEvent('wheel', {0
      bubbles: true,0
    });0
    // jsdom doesn't support these so we add them manually.0
    Object.assign(event, {0
      deltaX: 10,0
      deltaY: -50,0
    });0
    container.firstChild.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
    event = new MouseEvent('wheel', {0
      bubbles: true,0
    });0
    // jsdom doesn't support these so we add them manually.0
    Object.assign(event, {0
      wheelDeltaX: -10,0
      wheelDeltaY: 50,0
    });0
    container.firstChild.dispatchEvent(event);0
0
    expect(events.length).toBe(2);0
    expect(events[0].deltaX).toBe(10);0
    expect(events[0].deltaY).toBe(-50);0
    expect(events[1].deltaX).toBe(10);0
    expect(events[1].deltaY).toBe(-50);0
  });0
0
  it('should be able to `preventDefault` and `stopPropagation`', () => {0
    const events = [];0
    const onWheel = event => {0
      expect(event.isDefaultPrevented()).toBe(false);0
      event.preventDefault();0
      expect(event.isDefaultPrevented()).toBe(true);0
      event.persist();0
      events.push(event);0
    };0
    ReactDOM.render(<div onWheel={onWheel} />, container);0
0
    container.firstChild.dispatchEvent(0
      new MouseEvent('wheel', {0
        bubbles: true,0
        deltaX: 10,0
        deltaY: -50,0
      }),0
    );0
0
    container.firstChild.dispatchEvent(0
      new MouseEvent('wheel', {0
        bubbles: true,0
        deltaX: 10,0
        deltaY: -50,0
      }),0
    );0
0
    expect(events.length).toBe(2);0
  });0
0
  it('should be able to `persist`', () => {0
    const events = [];0
    const onWheel = event => {0
      expect(event.isPersistent()).toBe(false);0
      event.persist();0
      expect(event.isPersistent()).toBe(true);0
      events.push(event);0
    };0
    ReactDOM.render(<div onWheel={onWheel} />, container);0
0
    container.firstChild.dispatchEvent(0
      new MouseEvent('wheel', {0
        bubbles: true,0
      }),0
    );0
0
    expect(events.length).toBe(1);0
    expect(events[0].type).toBe('wheel');0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let EventPluginHub;0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactTestUtils;0
let TapEventPlugin;0
0
let tapMoveThreshold;0
let idCallOrder;0
const recordID = function(id) {0
  idCallOrder.push(id);0
};0
const LISTENER = jest.fn();0
const ON_TOUCH_TAP_KEY = 'onTouchTap';0
0
let GRANDPARENT;0
let PARENT;0
let CHILD;0
0
let putListener;0
let container;0
0
function touchStart(element, touchEventInit) {0
  element.dispatchEvent(0
    new TouchEvent('touchstart', {0
      bubbles: true,0
      cancelable: true,0
      ...touchEventInit,0
    }),0
  );0
}0
0
function touchEnd(element, touchEventInit) {0
  element.dispatchEvent(0
    new TouchEvent('touchend', {0
      bubbles: true,0
      cancelable: true,0
      ...touchEventInit,0
    }),0
  );0
}0
0
describe('TapEventPlugin', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    LISTENER.mockClear();0
0
    EventPluginHub = require('events/EventPluginHub');0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactTestUtils = require('react-dom/test-utils');0
    TapEventPlugin = require('react-dom/src/events/TapEventPlugin').default;0
0
    container = document.createElement('div');0
    document.body.appendChild(container);0
0
    const GRANDPARENT_PROPS = {};0
    const PARENT_PROPS = {};0
    const CHILD_PROPS = {};0
0
    function Child(props) {0
      return <div ref={c => (CHILD = c)} {...props} />;0
    }0
0
    class ChildWrapper extends React.PureComponent {0
      render() {0
        return <Child {...this.props} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function renderTree() {0
      ReactDOM.render(0
        <div ref={c => (GRANDPARENT = c)} {...GRANDPARENT_PROPS}>0
          <div ref={c => (PARENT = c)} {...PARENT_PROPS}>0
            <ChildWrapper {...CHILD_PROPS} />0
          </div>0
        </div>,0
        container,0
      );0
    }0
0
    renderTree();0
0
    putListener = function(node, eventName, listener) {0
      switch (node) {0
        case CHILD:0
          CHILD_PROPS[eventName] = listener;0
          break;0
        case PARENT:0
          PARENT_PROPS[eventName] = listener;0
          break;0
        case GRANDPARENT:0
          GRANDPARENT_PROPS[eventName] = listener;0
          break;0
      }0
      renderTree();0
    };0
0
    idCallOrder = [];0
    tapMoveThreshold = TapEventPlugin.tapMoveThreshold;0
    EventPluginHub.injection.injectEventPluginsByName({0
      TapEventPlugin: TapEventPlugin,0
    });0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    document.body.removeChild(container);0
    container = null;0
  });0
0
  /**0
   * The onTouchTap inject is ignore future,0
   * we should always test the deprecated message correct.0
   * See https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/116890
   */0
0
  it('should infer onTouchTap from a touchStart/End', () => {0
    putListener(CHILD, ON_TOUCH_TAP_KEY, recordID.bind(null, CHILD));0
    touchStart(CHILD, ReactTestUtils.nativeTouchData(0, 0));0
    touchEnd(CHILD, ReactTestUtils.nativeTouchData(0, 0));0
    expect(idCallOrder.length).toBe(1);0
    expect(idCallOrder[0]).toBe(CHILD);0
  });0
0
  it('should infer onTouchTap from when dragging below threshold', () => {0
    putListener(CHILD, ON_TOUCH_TAP_KEY, recordID.bind(null, CHILD));0
    touchStart(CHILD, ReactTestUtils.nativeTouchData(0, 0));0
    touchEnd(CHILD, ReactTestUtils.nativeTouchData(0, tapMoveThreshold - 1));0
    expect(idCallOrder.length).toBe(1);0
    expect(idCallOrder[0]).toBe(CHILD);0
  });0
0
  it('should not onTouchTap from when dragging beyond threshold', () => {0
    putListener(CHILD, ON_TOUCH_TAP_KEY, recordID.bind(null, CHILD));0
    touchStart(CHILD, ReactTestUtils.nativeTouchData(0, 0));0
    touchEnd(CHILD, ReactTestUtils.nativeTouchData(0, tapMoveThreshold + 1));0
    expect(idCallOrder.length).toBe(0);0
  });0
0
  it('should bubble onTouchTap', () => {0
    putListener(CHILD, ON_TOUCH_TAP_KEY, recordID.bind(null, CHILD));0
    putListener(PARENT, ON_TOUCH_TAP_KEY, recordID.bind(null, PARENT));0
    putListener(0
      GRANDPARENT,0
      ON_TOUCH_TAP_KEY,0
      recordID.bind(null, GRANDPARENT),0
    );0
    touchStart(CHILD, ReactTestUtils.nativeTouchData(0, 0));0
    touchEnd(CHILD, ReactTestUtils.nativeTouchData(0, 0));0
    expect(idCallOrder.length).toBe(3);0
    expect(idCallOrder[0] === CHILD).toBe(true);0
    expect(idCallOrder[1] === PARENT).toBe(true);0
    expect(idCallOrder[2] === GRANDPARENT).toBe(true);0
  });0
});0

export function addEventBubbleListener(0
  element: Element,0
  eventType: string,0
  listener: Function,0
): void {0
  EventListenerWWW.listen(element, eventType, listener);0
}0
0
export function addEventCaptureListener(0
  element: Element,0
  eventType: string,0
  listener: Function,0
): void {0
  EventListenerWWW.capture(element, eventType, listener);0
}0

/**0

import {0
  ID_ATTRIBUTE_NAME,0
  ROOT_ATTRIBUTE_NAME,0
  BOOLEAN,0
  OVERLOADED_BOOLEAN,0
  getPropertyInfo,0
  isAttributeNameSafe,0
  shouldIgnoreAttribute,0
  shouldRemoveAttribute,0
} from '../shared/DOMProperty';0
import quoteAttributeValueForBrowser from './quoteAttributeValueForBrowser';0
0
/**0
 * Operations for dealing with DOM properties.0
 */0
0
/**0
 * Creates markup for the ID property.0
 *0
 * @param {string} id Unescaped ID.0
 * @return {string} Markup string.0
 */0
export function createMarkupForID(id: string): string {0
  return ID_ATTRIBUTE_NAME + '=' + quoteAttributeValueForBrowser(id);0
}0
0
export function createMarkupForRoot(): string {0
  return ROOT_ATTRIBUTE_NAME + '=""';0
}0
0
/**0
 * Creates markup for a property.0
 *0
 * @param {string} name0
 * @param {*} value0
 * @return {?string} Markup string, or null if the property was invalid.0
 */0
export function createMarkupForProperty(name: string, value: mixed): string {0
  const propertyInfo = getPropertyInfo(name);0
  if (name !== 'style' && shouldIgnoreAttribute(name, propertyInfo, false)) {0
    return '';0
  }0
  if (shouldRemoveAttribute(name, value, propertyInfo, false)) {0
    return '';0
  }0
  if (propertyInfo !== null) {0
    const attributeName = propertyInfo.attributeName;0
    const {type} = propertyInfo;0
    if (type === BOOLEAN || (type === OVERLOADED_BOOLEAN && value === true)) {0
      return attributeName + '=""';0
    } else {0
      return attributeName + '=' + quoteAttributeValueForBrowser(value);0
    }0
  } else {0
    return name + '=' + quoteAttributeValueForBrowser(value);0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Creates markup for a custom property.0
 *0
 * @param {string} name0
 * @param {*} value0
 * @return {string} Markup string, or empty string if the property was invalid.0
 */0
export function createMarkupForCustomAttribute(0
  name: string,0
  value: mixed,0
): string {0
  if (!isAttributeNameSafe(name) || value == null) {0
    return '';0
  }0
  return name + '=' + quoteAttributeValueForBrowser(value);0
}0
/**0

 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * Based on the escape-html library, which is used under the MIT License below:0

 * without limitation the rights to use, copy, modify, merge, publish,0
 * distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies of the Software, and to0
 * permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to do so, subject to0
 * the following conditions:0
 *0
 * The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be0
 * included in all copies or substantial portions of the Software.0
 *0
 * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED 'AS IS', WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND,0
 * EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF0
 * MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT.0
 * IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY0
 * CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT,0
 * TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE0
 * SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE.0
 */0

// code copied and modified from escape-html0
/**0
 * Module variables.0
 * @private0
 */0
0
const matchHtmlRegExp = /["'&<>]/;0
0
/**0
 * Escapes special characters and HTML entities in a given html string.0
 *0
 * @param  {string} string HTML string to escape for later insertion0
 * @return {string}0
 * @public0
 */0
0
function escapeHtml(string) {0
  const str = '' + string;0
  const match = matchHtmlRegExp.exec(str);0
0
  if (!match) {0
    return str;0
  }0
0
  let escape;0
  let html = '';0
  let index = 0;0
  let lastIndex = 0;0
0
  for (index = match.index; index < str.length; index++) {0
    switch (str.charCodeAt(index)) {0
      case 34: // "0
        escape = '&quot;';0
        break;0
      case 38: // &0
        escape = '&amp;';0
        break;0
      case 39: // '0
        escape = '&#x27;'; // modified from escape-html; used to be '&#39'0
        break;0
      case 60: // <0
        escape = '&lt;';0
        break;0
      case 62: // >0
        escape = '&gt;';0
        break;0
      default:0
        continue;0
    }0
0
    if (lastIndex !== index) {0
      html += str.substring(lastIndex, index);0
    }0
0
    lastIndex = index + 1;0
    html += escape;0
  }0
0
  return lastIndex !== index ? html + str.substring(lastIndex, index) : html;0
}0
// end code copied and modified from escape-html0
0
/**0
 * Escapes text to prevent scripting attacks.0
 *0
 * @param {*} text Text value to escape.0
 * @return {string} An escaped string.0
 */0
function escapeTextForBrowser(text) {0
  if (typeof text === 'boolean' || typeof text === 'number') {0
    // this shortcircuit helps perf for types that we know will never have0
    // special characters, especially given that this function is used often0
    // for numeric dom ids.0
    return '' + text;0
  }0
  return escapeHtml(text);0
}0
0
export default escapeTextForBrowser;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import escapeTextForBrowser from './escapeTextForBrowser';0
0
/**0
 * Escapes attribute value to prevent scripting attacks.0
 *0
 * @param {*} value Value to escape.0
 * @return {string} An escaped string.0
 */0
function quoteAttributeValueForBrowser(value) {0
  return '"' + escapeTextForBrowser(value) + '"';0
}0
0
export default quoteAttributeValueForBrowser;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0

import {Readable} from 'stream';0
0
import ReactPartialRenderer from './ReactPartialRenderer';0
0
// This is a Readable Node.js stream which wraps the ReactDOMPartialRenderer.0
class ReactMarkupReadableStream extends Readable {0
  constructor(element, makeStaticMarkup) {0
    // Calls the stream.Readable(options) constructor. Consider exposing built-in0
    // features like highWaterMark in the future.0
    super({});0
    this.partialRenderer = new ReactPartialRenderer(element, makeStaticMarkup);0
  }0
0
  _read(size) {0
    try {0
      this.push(this.partialRenderer.read(size));0
    } catch (err) {0
      this.emit('error', err);0
    }0
  }0
}0
/**0
 * Render a ReactElement to its initial HTML. This should only be used on the0
 * server.0
 * See https://reactjs.org/docs/react-dom-stream.html#rendertonodestream0
 */0
export function renderToNodeStream(element) {0
  return new ReactMarkupReadableStream(element, false);0
}0
0
/**0
 * Similar to renderToNodeStream, except this doesn't create extra DOM attributes0
 * such as data-react-id that React uses internally.0
 * See https://reactjs.org/docs/react-dom-stream.html#rendertostaticnodestream0
 */0
export function renderToStaticNodeStream(element) {0
  return new ReactMarkupReadableStream(element, true);0
}0

function renderToNodeStream() {0
  invariant(0
    false,0
    'ReactDOMServer.renderToNodeStream(): The streaming API is not available ' +0
      'in the browser. Use ReactDOMServer.renderToString() instead.',0
  );0
}0
0
function renderToStaticNodeStream() {0
  invariant(0
    false,0
    'ReactDOMServer.renderToStaticNodeStream(): The streaming API is not available ' +0
      'in the browser. Use ReactDOMServer.renderToStaticMarkup() instead.',0
  );0
}0

  renderToString,0
  renderToStaticMarkup,0
  renderToNodeStream,0
  renderToStaticNodeStream,0
  version: ReactVersion,0

import ReactPartialRenderer from './ReactPartialRenderer';0

/**0
 * Render a ReactElement to its initial HTML. This should only be used on the0
 * server.0
 * See https://reactjs.org/docs/react-dom-server.html#rendertostring0
 */0
export function renderToString(element) {0
  const renderer = new ReactPartialRenderer(element, false);0
  const markup = renderer.read(Infinity);0
  return markup;0
}0

/**0
 * Similar to renderToString, except this doesn't create extra DOM attributes0
 * such as data-react-id that React uses internally.0
 * See https://reactjs.org/docs/react-dom-server.html#rendertostaticmarkup0
 */0
export function renderToStaticMarkup(element) {0
  const renderer = new ReactPartialRenderer(element, true);0
  const markup = renderer.read(Infinity);0
  return markup;0
}0

import type {ReactElement} from 'shared/ReactElementType';0

  ReactProvider,0
  ReactConsumer,0
  ReactContext,0
} from 'shared/ReactTypes';0

import React from 'react';0

import lowPriorityWarning from 'shared/lowPriorityWarning';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
import checkPropTypes from 'prop-types/checkPropTypes';0
import describeComponentFrame from 'shared/describeComponentFrame';0
import {ReactDebugCurrentFrame} from 'shared/ReactGlobalSharedState';0
import {warnAboutDeprecatedLifecycles} from 'shared/ReactFeatureFlags';0
import {0
  REACT_FORWARD_REF_TYPE,0
  REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE,0
  REACT_STRICT_MODE_TYPE,0

// Based on reading the React.Children implementation. TODO: type this somewhere?0
type ReactNode = string | number | ReactElement;0
type FlatReactChildren = Array<null | ReactNode>;0
type toArrayType = (children: mixed) => FlatReactChildren;0
const toArray = ((React.Children.toArray: any): toArrayType);0
0
let currentDebugStack;0
let currentDebugElementStack;0
0
let getStackAddendum = () => '';0
let describeStackFrame = element => '';0
0
let validatePropertiesInDevelopment = (type, props) => {};0
let setCurrentDebugStack = (stack: Array<Frame>) => {};0
let pushElementToDebugStack = (element: ReactElement) => {};0
let resetCurrentDebugStack = () => {};0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  validatePropertiesInDevelopment = function(type, props) {0
    validateARIAProperties(type, props);0
    validateInputProperties(type, props);0
    validateUnknownProperties(type, props, /* canUseEventSystem */ false);0
  };0
0
  describeStackFrame = function(element): string {0
    const source = element._source;0
    const type = element.type;0
    const name = getComponentName(type);0
    const ownerName = null;0
    return describeComponentFrame(name, source, ownerName);0
  };0
0
  currentDebugStack = null;0
  currentDebugElementStack = null;0
  setCurrentDebugStack = function(stack: Array<Frame>) {0
    const frame: Frame = stack[stack.length - 1];0
    currentDebugElementStack = ((frame: any): FrameDev).debugElementStack;0
    // We are about to enter a new composite stack, reset the array.0
    currentDebugElementStack.length = 0;0
    currentDebugStack = stack;0
    ReactDebugCurrentFrame.getCurrentStack = getStackAddendum;0
  };0
  pushElementToDebugStack = function(element: ReactElement) {0
    if (currentDebugElementStack !== null) {0
      currentDebugElementStack.push(element);0
    }0
  };0
  resetCurrentDebugStack = function() {0
    currentDebugElementStack = null;0
    currentDebugStack = null;0
    ReactDebugCurrentFrame.getCurrentStack = null;0
  };0
  getStackAddendum = function(): null | string {0
    if (currentDebugStack === null) {0
      return '';0
    }0
    let stack = '';0
    let debugStack = currentDebugStack;0
    for (let i = debugStack.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {0
      const frame: Frame = debugStack[i];0
      let debugElementStack = ((frame: any): FrameDev).debugElementStack;0
      for (let ii = debugElementStack.length - 1; ii >= 0; ii--) {0
        stack += describeStackFrame(debugElementStack[ii]);0
      }0
    }0
    return stack;0
  };0
}0
0
let didWarnDefaultInputValue = false;0
let didWarnDefaultChecked = false;0
let didWarnDefaultSelectValue = false;0
let didWarnDefaultTextareaValue = false;0
let didWarnInvalidOptionChildren = false;0
const didWarnAboutNoopUpdateForComponent = {};0
const didWarnAboutBadClass = {};0
const didWarnAboutDeprecatedWillMount = {};0
const didWarnAboutUndefinedDerivedState = {};0
const didWarnAboutUninitializedState = {};0
const valuePropNames = ['value', 'defaultValue'];0
const newlineEatingTags = {0
  listing: true,0
  pre: true,0
  textarea: true,0
};0
0
function getComponentName(type) {0
  return typeof type === 'string'0
    ? type0
    : typeof type === 'function' ? type.displayName || type.name : null;0
}0
0
// We accept any tag to be rendered but since this gets injected into arbitrary0
// HTML, we want to make sure that it's a safe tag.0
// http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml/#NT-Name0
const VALID_TAG_REGEX = /^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z:_\.\-\d]*$/; // Simplified subset0
const validatedTagCache = {};0
function validateDangerousTag(tag) {0
  if (!validatedTagCache.hasOwnProperty(tag)) {0
    invariant(VALID_TAG_REGEX.test(tag), 'Invalid tag: %s', tag);0
    validatedTagCache[tag] = true;0
  }0
}0
0
const styleNameCache = {};0
const processStyleName = function(styleName) {0
  if (styleNameCache.hasOwnProperty(styleName)) {0
    return styleNameCache[styleName];0
  }0
  const result = hyphenateStyleName(styleName);0
  styleNameCache[styleName] = result;0
  return result;0
};0
0
function createMarkupForStyles(styles): string | null {0
  let serialized = '';0
  let delimiter = '';0
  for (const styleName in styles) {0
    if (!styles.hasOwnProperty(styleName)) {0
      continue;0
    }0
    const isCustomProperty = styleName.indexOf('--') === 0;0
    const styleValue = styles[styleName];0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      if (!isCustomProperty) {0
        warnValidStyle(styleName, styleValue, getStackAddendum);0
      }0
    }0
    if (styleValue != null) {0
      serialized += delimiter + processStyleName(styleName) + ':';0
      serialized += dangerousStyleValue(0
        styleName,0
        styleValue,0
        isCustomProperty,0
      );0
0
      delimiter = ';';0
    }0
  }0
  return serialized || null;0
}0
0
function warnNoop(0
  publicInstance: React$Component<any, any>,0
  callerName: string,0
) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const constructor = publicInstance.constructor;0
    const componentName =0
      (constructor && getComponentName(constructor)) || 'ReactClass';0
    const warningKey = componentName + '.' + callerName;0
    if (didWarnAboutNoopUpdateForComponent[warningKey]) {0
      return;0
    }0
0
    warning(0
      false,0
      '%s(...): Can only update a mounting component. ' +0
        'This usually means you called %s() outside componentWillMount() on the server. ' +0
        'This is a no-op.\n\nPlease check the code for the %s component.',0
      callerName,0
      callerName,0
      componentName,0
    );0
    didWarnAboutNoopUpdateForComponent[warningKey] = true;0
  }0
}0
0
function shouldConstruct(Component) {0
  return Component.prototype && Component.prototype.isReactComponent;0
}0
0
function getNonChildrenInnerMarkup(props) {0
  const innerHTML = props.dangerouslySetInnerHTML;0
  if (innerHTML != null) {0
    if (innerHTML.__html != null) {0
      return innerHTML.__html;0
    }0
  } else {0
    const content = props.children;0
    if (typeof content === 'string' || typeof content === 'number') {0
      return escapeTextForBrowser(content);0
    }0
  }0
  return null;0
}0
0
function flattenTopLevelChildren(children: mixed): FlatReactChildren {0
  if (!React.isValidElement(children)) {0
    return toArray(children);0
  }0
  const element = ((children: any): ReactElement);0
  if (element.type !== REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE) {0
    return [element];0
  }0
  const fragmentChildren = element.props.children;0
  if (!React.isValidElement(fragmentChildren)) {0
    return toArray(fragmentChildren);0
  }0
  const fragmentChildElement = ((fragmentChildren: any): ReactElement);0
  return [fragmentChildElement];0
}0
0
function flattenOptionChildren(children: mixed): string {0
  let content = '';0
  // Flatten children and warn if they aren't strings or numbers;0
  // invalid types are ignored.0
  React.Children.forEach(children, function(child) {0
    if (child == null) {0
      return;0
    }0
    if (typeof child === 'string' || typeof child === 'number') {0
      content += child;0
    } else {0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        if (!didWarnInvalidOptionChildren) {0
          didWarnInvalidOptionChildren = true;0
          warning(0
            false,0
            'Only strings and numbers are supported as <option> children.',0
          );0
        }0
      }0
    }0
  });0
  return content;0
}0
0
const emptyObject = {};0
if (__DEV__) {0
  Object.freeze(emptyObject);0
}0
0
function maskContext(type, context) {0
  const contextTypes = type.contextTypes;0
  if (!contextTypes) {0
    return emptyObject;0
  }0
  const maskedContext = {};0
  for (const contextName in contextTypes) {0
    maskedContext[contextName] = context[contextName];0
  }0
  return maskedContext;0
}0
0
function checkContextTypes(typeSpecs, values, location: string) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    checkPropTypes(typeSpecs, values, location, 'Component', getStackAddendum);0
  }0
}0
0
function processContext(type, context) {0
  const maskedContext = maskContext(type, context);0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (type.contextTypes) {0
      checkContextTypes(type.contextTypes, maskedContext, 'context');0
    }0
  }0
  return maskedContext;0
}0
0
const STYLE = 'style';0
const RESERVED_PROPS = {0
  children: null,0
  dangerouslySetInnerHTML: null,0
  suppressContentEditableWarning: null,0
  suppressHydrationWarning: null,0
};0
0
function createOpenTagMarkup(0
  tagVerbatim: string,0
  tagLowercase: string,0
  props: Object,0
  namespace: string,0
  makeStaticMarkup: boolean,0
  isRootElement: boolean,0
): string {0
  let ret = '<' + tagVerbatim;0
0
  for (const propKey in props) {0
    if (!props.hasOwnProperty(propKey)) {0
      continue;0
    }0
    let propValue = props[propKey];0
    if (propValue == null) {0
      continue;0
    }0
    if (propKey === STYLE) {0
      propValue = createMarkupForStyles(propValue);0
    }0
    let markup = null;0
    if (isCustomComponent(tagLowercase, props)) {0
      if (!RESERVED_PROPS.hasOwnProperty(propKey)) {0
        markup = createMarkupForCustomAttribute(propKey, propValue);0
      }0
    } else {0
      markup = createMarkupForProperty(propKey, propValue);0
    }0
    if (markup) {0
      ret += ' ' + markup;0
    }0
  }0
0
  // For static pages, no need to put React ID and checksum. Saves lots of0
  // bytes.0
  if (makeStaticMarkup) {0
    return ret;0
  }0
0
  if (isRootElement) {0
    ret += ' ' + createMarkupForRoot();0
  }0
  return ret;0
}0
0
function validateRenderResult(child, type) {0
  if (child === undefined) {0
    invariant(0
      false,0
      '%s(...): Nothing was returned from render. This usually means a ' +0
        'return statement is missing. Or, to render nothing, ' +0
        'return null.',0
      getComponentName(type) || 'Component',0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
function resolve(0
  child: mixed,0
  context: Object,0
): {|0
  child: mixed,0
  context: Object,0
|} {0
  while (React.isValidElement(child)) {0
    // Safe because we just checked it's an element.0
    let element: ReactElement = (child: any);0
    let Component = element.type;0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      pushElementToDebugStack(element);0
    }0
    if (typeof Component !== 'function') {0
      break;0
    }0
    processChild(element, Component);0
  }0
0
  // Extra closure so queue and replace can be captured properly0
  function processChild(element, Component) {0
    let publicContext = processContext(Component, context);0
0
    let queue = [];0
    let replace = false;0
    let updater = {0
      isMounted: function(publicInstance) {0
        return false;0
      },0
      enqueueForceUpdate: function(publicInstance) {0
        if (queue === null) {0
          warnNoop(publicInstance, 'forceUpdate');0
          return null;0
        }0
      },0
      enqueueReplaceState: function(publicInstance, completeState) {0
        replace = true;0
        queue = [completeState];0
      },0
      enqueueSetState: function(publicInstance, currentPartialState) {0
        if (queue === null) {0
          warnNoop(publicInstance, 'setState');0
          return null;0
        }0
        queue.push(currentPartialState);0
      },0
    };0
0
    let inst;0
    if (shouldConstruct(Component)) {0
      inst = new Component(element.props, publicContext, updater);0
0
      if (typeof Component.getDerivedStateFromProps === 'function') {0
        if (__DEV__) {0
          if (inst.state === null || inst.state === undefined) {0
            const componentName = getComponentName(Component) || 'Unknown';0
            if (!didWarnAboutUninitializedState[componentName]) {0
              warning(0
                false,0
                '%s: Did not properly initialize state during construction. ' +0
                  'Expected state to be an object, but it was %s.',0
                componentName,0
                inst.state === null ? 'null' : 'undefined',0
              );0
              didWarnAboutUninitializedState[componentName] = true;0
            }0
          }0
        }0
0
        let partialState = Component.getDerivedStateFromProps.call(0
          null,0
          element.props,0
          inst.state,0
        );0
0
        if (__DEV__) {0
          if (partialState === undefined) {0
            const componentName = getComponentName(Component) || 'Unknown';0
            if (!didWarnAboutUndefinedDerivedState[componentName]) {0
              warning(0
                false,0
                '%s.getDerivedStateFromProps(): A valid state object (or null) must be returned. ' +0
                  'You have returned undefined.',0
                componentName,0
              );0
              didWarnAboutUndefinedDerivedState[componentName] = true;0
            }0
          }0
        }0
0
        if (partialState != null) {0
          inst.state = Object.assign({}, inst.state, partialState);0
        }0
      }0
    } else {0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        if (0
          Component.prototype &&0
          typeof Component.prototype.render === 'function'0
        ) {0
          const componentName = getComponentName(Component) || 'Unknown';0
0
          if (!didWarnAboutBadClass[componentName]) {0
            warning(0
              false,0
              "The <%s /> component appears to have a render method, but doesn't extend React.Component. " +0
                'This is likely to cause errors. Change %s to extend React.Component instead.',0
              componentName,0
              componentName,0
            );0
            didWarnAboutBadClass[componentName] = true;0
          }0
        }0
      }0
      inst = Component(element.props, publicContext, updater);0
      if (inst == null || inst.render == null) {0
        child = inst;0
        validateRenderResult(child, Component);0
        return;0
      }0
    }0
0
    inst.props = element.props;0
    inst.context = publicContext;0
    inst.updater = updater;0
0
    let initialState = inst.state;0
    if (initialState === undefined) {0
      inst.state = initialState = null;0
    }0
    if (0
      typeof inst.UNSAFE_componentWillMount === 'function' ||0
      typeof inst.componentWillMount === 'function'0
    ) {0
      if (typeof inst.componentWillMount === 'function') {0
        if (__DEV__) {0
          if (0
            warnAboutDeprecatedLifecycles &&0
            inst.componentWillMount.__suppressDeprecationWarning !== true0
          ) {0
            const componentName = getComponentName(Component) || 'Unknown';0
0
            if (!didWarnAboutDeprecatedWillMount[componentName]) {0
              lowPriorityWarning(0
                false,0
                '%s: componentWillMount() is deprecated and will be ' +0
                  'removed in the next major version. Read about the motivations ' +0
                  'behind this change: ' +0
                  'https://fb.me/react-async-component-lifecycle-hooks' +0
                  '\n\n' +0
                  'As a temporary workaround, you can rename to ' +0
                  'UNSAFE_componentWillMount instead.',0
                componentName,0
              );0
              didWarnAboutDeprecatedWillMount[componentName] = true;0
            }0
          }0
        }0
0
        // In order to support react-lifecycles-compat polyfilled components,0
        // Unsafe lifecycles should not be invoked for any component with the new gDSFP.0
        if (typeof Component.getDerivedStateFromProps !== 'function') {0
          inst.componentWillMount();0
        }0
      }0
      if (0
        typeof inst.UNSAFE_componentWillMount === 'function' &&0
        typeof Component.getDerivedStateFromProps !== 'function'0
      ) {0
        // In order to support react-lifecycles-compat polyfilled components,0
        // Unsafe lifecycles should not be invoked for any component with the new gDSFP.0
        inst.UNSAFE_componentWillMount();0
      }0
      if (queue.length) {0
        let oldQueue = queue;0
        let oldReplace = replace;0
        queue = null;0
        replace = false;0
0
        if (oldReplace && oldQueue.length === 1) {0
          inst.state = oldQueue[0];0
        } else {0
          let nextState = oldReplace ? oldQueue[0] : inst.state;0
          let dontMutate = true;0
          for (let i = oldReplace ? 1 : 0; i < oldQueue.length; i++) {0
            let partial = oldQueue[i];0
            let partialState =0
              typeof partial === 'function'0
                ? partial.call(inst, nextState, element.props, publicContext)0
                : partial;0
            if (partialState != null) {0
              if (dontMutate) {0
                dontMutate = false;0
                nextState = Object.assign({}, nextState, partialState);0
              } else {0
                Object.assign(nextState, partialState);0
              }0
            }0
          }0
          inst.state = nextState;0
        }0
      } else {0
        queue = null;0
      }0
    }0
    child = inst.render();0
0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      if (child === undefined && inst.render._isMockFunction) {0
        // This is probably bad practice. Consider warning here and0
        // deprecating this convenience.0
        child = null;0
      }0
    }0
    validateRenderResult(child, Component);0
0
    let childContext;0
    if (typeof inst.getChildContext === 'function') {0
      let childContextTypes = Component.childContextTypes;0
      if (typeof childContextTypes === 'object') {0
        childContext = inst.getChildContext();0
        for (let contextKey in childContext) {0
          invariant(0
            contextKey in childContextTypes,0
            '%s.getChildContext(): key "%s" is not defined in childContextTypes.',0
            getComponentName(Component) || 'Unknown',0
            contextKey,0
          );0
        }0
      } else {0
        warning(0
          false,0
          '%s.getChildContext(): childContextTypes must be defined in order to ' +0
            'use getChildContext().',0
          getComponentName(Component) || 'Unknown',0
        );0
      }0
    }0
    if (childContext) {0
      context = Object.assign({}, context, childContext);0
    }0
  }0
  return {child, context};0
}0
0
type Frame = {0
  type: mixed,0
  domNamespace: string,0
  children: FlatReactChildren,0
  childIndex: number,0
  context: Object,0
  footer: string,0
};0
0
type FrameDev = Frame & {0
  debugElementStack: Array<ReactElement>,0
};0
0
class ReactDOMServerRenderer {0
  stack: Array<Frame>;0
  exhausted: boolean;0
  // TODO: type this more strictly:0
  currentSelectValue: any;0
  previousWasTextNode: boolean;0
  makeStaticMarkup: boolean;0
0
  contextIndex: number;0
  contextStack: Array<ReactContext<any>>;0
  contextValueStack: Array<any>;0
  contextProviderStack: ?Array<ReactProvider<any>>; // DEV-only0
0
  constructor(children: mixed, makeStaticMarkup: boolean) {0
    const flatChildren = flattenTopLevelChildren(children);0
0
    const topFrame: Frame = {0
      type: null,0
      // Assume all trees start in the HTML namespace (not totally true, but0
      // this is what we did historically)0
      domNamespace: Namespaces.html,0
      children: flatChildren,0
      childIndex: 0,0
      context: emptyObject,0
      footer: '',0
    };0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      ((topFrame: any): FrameDev).debugElementStack = [];0
    }0
    this.stack = [topFrame];0
    this.exhausted = false;0
    this.currentSelectValue = null;0
    this.previousWasTextNode = false;0
    this.makeStaticMarkup = makeStaticMarkup;0
0
    // Context (new API)0
    this.contextIndex = -1;0
    this.contextStack = [];0
    this.contextValueStack = [];0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      this.contextProviderStack = [];0
    }0
  }0
0
  /**0
   * Note: We use just two stacks regardless of how many context providers you have.0
   * Providers are always popped in the reverse order to how they were pushed0
   * so we always know on the way down which provider you'll encounter next on the way up.0
   * On the way down, we push the current provider, and its context value *before*0
   * we mutated it, onto the stacks. Therefore, on the way up, we always know which0
   * provider needs to be "restored" to which value.0
   * https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/12985#issuecomment-3963012480
   */0
0
  pushProvider<T>(provider: ReactProvider<T>): void {0
    const index = ++this.contextIndex;0
    const context: ReactContext<any> = provider.type._context;0
    const previousValue = context._currentValue;0
0
    // Remember which value to restore this context to on our way up.0
    this.contextStack[index] = context;0
    this.contextValueStack[index] = previousValue;0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      // Only used for push/pop mismatch warnings.0
      (this.contextProviderStack: any)[index] = provider;0
    }0
0
    // Mutate the current value.0
    context._currentValue = provider.props.value;0
  }0
0
  popProvider<T>(provider: ReactProvider<T>): void {0
    const index = this.contextIndex;0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      warning(0
        index > -1 && provider === (this.contextProviderStack: any)[index],0
        'Unexpected pop.',0
      );0
    }0
0
    const context: ReactContext<any> = this.contextStack[index];0
    const previousValue = this.contextValueStack[index];0
0
    // "Hide" these null assignments from Flow by using `any`0
    // because conceptually they are deletions--as long as we0
    // promise to never access values beyond `this.contextIndex`.0
    this.contextStack[index] = (null: any);0
    this.contextValueStack[index] = (null: any);0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      (this.contextProviderStack: any)[index] = (null: any);0
    }0
    this.contextIndex--;0
0
    // Restore to the previous value we stored as we were walking down.0
    context._currentValue = previousValue;0
  }0
0
  read(bytes: number): string | null {0
    if (this.exhausted) {0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    let out = '';0
    while (out.length < bytes) {0
      if (this.stack.length === 0) {0
        this.exhausted = true;0
        break;0
      }0
      const frame: Frame = this.stack[this.stack.length - 1];0
      if (frame.childIndex >= frame.children.length) {0
        const footer = frame.footer;0
        out += footer;0
        if (footer !== '') {0
          this.previousWasTextNode = false;0
        }0
        this.stack.pop();0
        if (frame.type === 'select') {0
          this.currentSelectValue = null;0
        } else if (0
          frame.type != null &&0
          frame.type.type != null &&0
          frame.type.type.$$typeof === REACT_PROVIDER_TYPE0
        ) {0
          const provider: ReactProvider<any> = (frame.type: any);0
          this.popProvider(provider);0
        }0
        continue;0
      }0
      const child = frame.children[frame.childIndex++];0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        setCurrentDebugStack(this.stack);0
      }0
      out += this.render(child, frame.context, frame.domNamespace);0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        // TODO: Handle reentrant server render calls. This doesn't.0
        resetCurrentDebugStack();0
      }0
    }0
    return out;0
  }0
0
  render(0
    child: ReactNode | null,0
    context: Object,0
    parentNamespace: string,0
  ): string {0
    if (typeof child === 'string' || typeof child === 'number') {0
      const text = '' + child;0
      if (text === '') {0
        return '';0
      }0
      if (this.makeStaticMarkup) {0
        return escapeTextForBrowser(text);0
      }0
      if (this.previousWasTextNode) {0
        return '<!-- -->' + escapeTextForBrowser(text);0
      }0
      this.previousWasTextNode = true;0
      return escapeTextForBrowser(text);0
    } else {0
      let nextChild;0
      ({child: nextChild, context} = resolve(child, context));0
      if (nextChild === null || nextChild === false) {0
        return '';0
      } else if (!React.isValidElement(nextChild)) {0
        if (nextChild != null && nextChild.$$typeof != null) {0
          // Catch unexpected special types early.0
          const $$typeof = nextChild.$$typeof;0
          invariant(0
            $$typeof !== REACT_PORTAL_TYPE,0
            'Portals are not currently supported by the server renderer. ' +0
              'Render them conditionally so that they only appear on the client render.',0
          );0
          // Catch-all to prevent an infinite loop if React.Children.toArray() supports some new type.0
          invariant(0
            false,0
            'Unknown element-like object type: %s. This is likely a bug in React. ' +0
              'Please file an issue.',0
            ($$typeof: any).toString(),0
          );0
        }0
        const nextChildren = toArray(nextChild);0
        const frame: Frame = {0
          type: null,0
          domNamespace: parentNamespace,0
          children: nextChildren,0
          childIndex: 0,0
          context: context,0
          footer: '',0
        };0
        if (__DEV__) {0
          ((frame: any): FrameDev).debugElementStack = [];0
        }0
        this.stack.push(frame);0
        return '';0
      }0
      // Safe because we just checked it's an element.0
      const nextElement = ((nextChild: any): ReactElement);0
      const elementType = nextElement.type;0
0
      if (typeof elementType === 'string') {0
        return this.renderDOM(nextElement, context, parentNamespace);0
      }0
0
      switch (elementType) {0
        case REACT_STRICT_MODE_TYPE:0
        case REACT_ASYNC_MODE_TYPE:0
        case REACT_PROFILER_TYPE:0
        case REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE: {0
          const nextChildren = toArray(0
            ((nextChild: any): ReactElement).props.children,0
          );0
          const frame: Frame = {0
            type: null,0
            domNamespace: parentNamespace,0
            children: nextChildren,0
            childIndex: 0,0
            context: context,0
            footer: '',0
          };0
          if (__DEV__) {0
            ((frame: any): FrameDev).debugElementStack = [];0
          }0
          this.stack.push(frame);0
          return '';0
        }0
        // eslint-disable-next-line-no-fallthrough0
        default:0
          break;0
      }0
      if (typeof elementType === 'object' && elementType !== null) {0
        switch (elementType.$$typeof) {0
          case REACT_FORWARD_REF_TYPE: {0
            const element: ReactElement = ((nextChild: any): ReactElement);0
            const nextChildren = toArray(0
              elementType.render(element.props, element.ref),0
            );0
            const frame: Frame = {0
              type: null,0
              domNamespace: parentNamespace,0
              children: nextChildren,0
              childIndex: 0,0
              context: context,0
              footer: '',0
            };0
            if (__DEV__) {0
              ((frame: any): FrameDev).debugElementStack = [];0
            }0
            this.stack.push(frame);0
            return '';0
          }0
          case REACT_PROVIDER_TYPE: {0
            const provider: ReactProvider<any> = (nextChild: any);0
            const nextProps = provider.props;0
            const nextChildren = toArray(nextProps.children);0
            const frame: Frame = {0
              type: provider,0
              domNamespace: parentNamespace,0
              children: nextChildren,0
              childIndex: 0,0
              context: context,0
              footer: '',0
            };0
            if (__DEV__) {0
              ((frame: any): FrameDev).debugElementStack = [];0
            }0
0
            this.pushProvider(provider);0
0
            this.stack.push(frame);0
            return '';0
          }0
          case REACT_CONTEXT_TYPE: {0
            const consumer: ReactConsumer<any> = (nextChild: any);0
            const nextProps: any = consumer.props;0
            const nextValue = consumer.type._currentValue;0
0
            const nextChildren = toArray(nextProps.children(nextValue));0
            const frame: Frame = {0
              type: nextChild,0
              domNamespace: parentNamespace,0
              children: nextChildren,0
              childIndex: 0,0
              context: context,0
              footer: '',0
            };0
            if (__DEV__) {0
              ((frame: any): FrameDev).debugElementStack = [];0
            }0
            this.stack.push(frame);0
            return '';0
          }0
          default:0
            break;0
        }0
      }0
0
      let info = '';0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        const owner = nextElement._owner;0
        if (0
          elementType === undefined ||0
          (typeof elementType === 'object' &&0
            elementType !== null &&0
            Object.keys(elementType).length === 0)0
        ) {0
          info +=0
            ' You likely forgot to export your component from the file ' +0
            "it's defined in, or you might have mixed up default and " +0
            'named imports.';0
        }0
        const ownerName = owner ? getComponentName(owner) : null;0
        if (ownerName) {0
          info += '\n\nCheck the render method of `' + ownerName + '`.';0
        }0
      }0
      invariant(0
        false,0
        'Element type is invalid: expected a string (for built-in ' +0
          'components) or a class/function (for composite components) ' +0
          'but got: %s.%s',0
        elementType == null ? elementType : typeof elementType,0
        info,0
      );0
    }0
  }0
0
  renderDOM(0
    element: ReactElement,0
    context: Object,0
    parentNamespace: string,0
  ): string {0
    const tag = element.type.toLowerCase();0
0
    let namespace = parentNamespace;0
    if (parentNamespace === Namespaces.html) {0
      namespace = getIntrinsicNamespace(tag);0
    }0
0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      if (namespace === Namespaces.html) {0
        // Should this check be gated by parent namespace? Not sure we want to0
        // allow <SVG> or <mATH>.0
        warning(0
          tag === element.type,0
          '<%s /> is using incorrect casing. ' +0
            'Use PascalCase for React components, ' +0
            'or lowercase for HTML elements.',0
          element.type,0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    validateDangerousTag(tag);0
0
    let props = element.props;0
    if (tag === 'input') {0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        ReactControlledValuePropTypes.checkPropTypes(0
          'input',0
          props,0
          getStackAddendum,0
        );0
0
        if (0
          props.checked !== undefined &&0
          props.defaultChecked !== undefined &&0
          !didWarnDefaultChecked0
        ) {0
          warning(0
            false,0
            '%s contains an input of type %s with both checked and defaultChecked props. ' +0
              'Input elements must be either controlled or uncontrolled ' +0
              '(specify either the checked prop, or the defaultChecked prop, but not ' +0
              'both). Decide between using a controlled or uncontrolled input ' +0
              'element and remove one of these props. More info: ' +0
              'https://fb.me/react-controlled-components',0
            'A component',0
            props.type,0
          );0
          didWarnDefaultChecked = true;0
        }0
        if (0
          props.value !== undefined &&0
          props.defaultValue !== undefined &&0
          !didWarnDefaultInputValue0
        ) {0
          warning(0
            false,0
            '%s contains an input of type %s with both value and defaultValue props. ' +0
              'Input elements must be either controlled or uncontrolled ' +0
              '(specify either the value prop, or the defaultValue prop, but not ' +0
              'both). Decide between using a controlled or uncontrolled input ' +0
              'element and remove one of these props. More info: ' +0
              'https://fb.me/react-controlled-components',0
            'A component',0
            props.type,0
          );0
          didWarnDefaultInputValue = true;0
        }0
      }0
0
      props = Object.assign(0
        {0
          type: undefined,0
        },0
        props,0
        {0
          defaultChecked: undefined,0
          defaultValue: undefined,0
          value: props.value != null ? props.value : props.defaultValue,0
          checked: props.checked != null ? props.checked : props.defaultChecked,0
        },0
      );0
    } else if (tag === 'textarea') {0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        ReactControlledValuePropTypes.checkPropTypes(0
          'textarea',0
          props,0
          getStackAddendum,0
        );0
        if (0
          props.value !== undefined &&0
          props.defaultValue !== undefined &&0
          !didWarnDefaultTextareaValue0
        ) {0
          warning(0
            false,0
            'Textarea elements must be either controlled or uncontrolled ' +0
              '(specify either the value prop, or the defaultValue prop, but not ' +0
              'both). Decide between using a controlled or uncontrolled textarea ' +0
              'and remove one of these props. More info: ' +0
              'https://fb.me/react-controlled-components',0
          );0
          didWarnDefaultTextareaValue = true;0
        }0
      }0
0
      let initialValue = props.value;0
      if (initialValue == null) {0
        let defaultValue = props.defaultValue;0
        // TODO (yungsters): Remove support for children content in <textarea>.0
        let textareaChildren = props.children;0
        if (textareaChildren != null) {0
          if (__DEV__) {0
            warning(0
              false,0
              'Use the `defaultValue` or `value` props instead of setting ' +0
                'children on <textarea>.',0
            );0
          }0
          invariant(0
            defaultValue == null,0
            'If you supply `defaultValue` on a <textarea>, do not pass children.',0
          );0
          if (Array.isArray(textareaChildren)) {0
            invariant(0
              textareaChildren.length <= 1,0
              '<textarea> can only have at most one child.',0
            );0
            textareaChildren = textareaChildren[0];0
          }0
0
          defaultValue = '' + textareaChildren;0
        }0
        if (defaultValue == null) {0
          defaultValue = '';0
        }0
        initialValue = defaultValue;0
      }0
0
      props = Object.assign({}, props, {0
        value: undefined,0
        children: '' + initialValue,0
      });0
    } else if (tag === 'select') {0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        ReactControlledValuePropTypes.checkPropTypes(0
          'select',0
          props,0
          getStackAddendum,0
        );0
0
        for (let i = 0; i < valuePropNames.length; i++) {0
          const propName = valuePropNames[i];0
          if (props[propName] == null) {0
            continue;0
          }0
          const isArray = Array.isArray(props[propName]);0
          if (props.multiple && !isArray) {0
            warning(0
              false,0
              'The `%s` prop supplied to <select> must be an array if ' +0
                '`multiple` is true.%s',0
              propName,0
              '', // getDeclarationErrorAddendum(),0
            );0
          } else if (!props.multiple && isArray) {0
            warning(0
              false,0
              'The `%s` prop supplied to <select> must be a scalar ' +0
                'value if `multiple` is false.%s',0
              propName,0
              '', // getDeclarationErrorAddendum(),0
            );0
          }0
        }0
0
        if (0
          props.value !== undefined &&0
          props.defaultValue !== undefined &&0
          !didWarnDefaultSelectValue0
        ) {0
          warning(0
            false,0
            'Select elements must be either controlled or uncontrolled ' +0
              '(specify either the value prop, or the defaultValue prop, but not ' +0
              'both). Decide between using a controlled or uncontrolled select ' +0
              'element and remove one of these props. More info: ' +0
              'https://fb.me/react-controlled-components',0
          );0
          didWarnDefaultSelectValue = true;0
        }0
      }0
      this.currentSelectValue =0
        props.value != null ? props.value : props.defaultValue;0
      props = Object.assign({}, props, {0
        value: undefined,0
      });0
    } else if (tag === 'option') {0
      let selected = null;0
      const selectValue = this.currentSelectValue;0
      const optionChildren = flattenOptionChildren(props.children);0
      if (selectValue != null) {0
        let value;0
        if (props.value != null) {0
          value = props.value + '';0
        } else {0
          value = optionChildren;0
        }0
        selected = false;0
        if (Array.isArray(selectValue)) {0
          // multiple0
          for (let j = 0; j < selectValue.length; j++) {0
            if ('' + selectValue[j] === value) {0
              selected = true;0
              break;0
            }0
          }0
        } else {0
          selected = '' + selectValue === value;0
        }0
0
        props = Object.assign(0
          {0
            selected: undefined,0
            children: undefined,0
          },0
          props,0
          {0
            selected: selected,0
            children: optionChildren,0
          },0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      validatePropertiesInDevelopment(tag, props);0
    }0
0
    assertValidProps(tag, props, getStackAddendum);0
0
    let out = createOpenTagMarkup(0
      element.type,0
      tag,0
      props,0
      namespace,0
      this.makeStaticMarkup,0
      this.stack.length === 1,0
    );0
    let footer = '';0
    if (omittedCloseTags.hasOwnProperty(tag)) {0
      out += '/>';0
    } else {0
      out += '>';0
      footer = '</' + element.type + '>';0
    }0
    let children;0
    const innerMarkup = getNonChildrenInnerMarkup(props);0
    if (innerMarkup != null) {0
      children = [];0
      if (newlineEatingTags[tag] && innerMarkup.charAt(0) === '\n') {0
        // text/html ignores the first character in these tags if it's a newline0
        // Prefer to break application/xml over text/html (for now) by adding0
        // a newline specifically to get eaten by the parser. (Alternately for0
        // textareas, replacing "^\n" with "\r\n" doesn't get eaten, and the first0
        // \r is normalized out by HTMLTextAreaElement#value.)0
        // See: <http://www.w3.org/TR/html-polyglot/#newlines-in-textarea-and-pre>0
        // See: <http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/syntax.html#element-restrictions>0
        // See: <http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/syntax.html#newlines>0
        // See: Parsing of "textarea" "listing" and "pre" elements0
        //  from <http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/syntax.html#parsing-main-inbody>0
        out += '\n';0
      }0
      out += innerMarkup;0
    } else {0
      children = toArray(props.children);0
    }0
    const frame = {0
      domNamespace: getChildNamespace(parentNamespace, element.type),0
      type: tag,0
      children,0
      childIndex: 0,0
      context: context,0
      footer: footer,0
    };0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      ((frame: any): FrameDev).debugElementStack = [];0
    }0
    this.stack.push(frame);0
    this.previousWasTextNode = false;0
    return out;0
  }0
}0
0
export default ReactDOMServerRenderer;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0

import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
import voidElementTags from './voidElementTags';0
0
const HTML = '__html';0
0
function assertValidProps(tag: string, props: ?Object, getStack: () => string) {0
  if (!props) {0
    return;0
  }0
  // Note the use of `==` which checks for null or undefined.0
  if (voidElementTags[tag]) {0
    invariant(0
      props.children == null && props.dangerouslySetInnerHTML == null,0
      '%s is a void element tag and must neither have `children` nor ' +0
        'use `dangerouslySetInnerHTML`.%s',0
      tag,0
      getStack(),0
    );0
  }0
  if (props.dangerouslySetInnerHTML != null) {0
    invariant(0
      props.children == null,0
      'Can only set one of `children` or `props.dangerouslySetInnerHTML`.',0
    );0
    invariant(0
      typeof props.dangerouslySetInnerHTML === 'object' &&0
        HTML in props.dangerouslySetInnerHTML,0
      '`props.dangerouslySetInnerHTML` must be in the form `{__html: ...}`. ' +0
        'Please visit https://fb.me/react-invariant-dangerously-set-inner-html ' +0
        'for more information.',0
    );0
  }0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    warning(0
      props.suppressContentEditableWarning ||0
        !props.contentEditable ||0
        props.children == null,0
      'A component is `contentEditable` and contains `children` managed by ' +0
        'React. It is now your responsibility to guarantee that none of ' +0
        'those nodes are unexpectedly modified or duplicated. This is ' +0
        'probably not intentional.%s',0
      getStack(),0
    );0
  }0
  invariant(0
    props.style == null || typeof props.style === 'object',0
    'The `style` prop expects a mapping from style properties to values, ' +0
      "not a string. For example, style={{marginRight: spacing + 'em'}} when " +0
      'using JSX.%s',0
    getStack(),0
  );0
}0
0
export default assertValidProps;0

 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import React from 'react';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
invariant(0
  React,0
  'ReactDOM was loaded before React. Make sure you load ' +0
    'the React package before loading ReactDOM.',0
);0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
