/* globals MSApp */0
0
/**0
 * Create a function which has 'unsafe' privileges (required by windows8 apps)0
 */0
const createMicrosoftUnsafeLocalFunction = function(func) {0
  if (typeof MSApp !== 'undefined' && MSApp.execUnsafeLocalFunction) {0
    return function(arg0, arg1, arg2, arg3) {0
      MSApp.execUnsafeLocalFunction(function() {0
        return func(arg0, arg1, arg2, arg3);0
      });0
    };0
  } else {0
    return func;0
  }0
};0
0
export default createMicrosoftUnsafeLocalFunction;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
/**0
 * CSS properties which accept numbers but are not in units of "px".0
 */0
export const isUnitlessNumber = {0
  animationIterationCount: true,0
  borderImageOutset: true,0
  borderImageSlice: true,0
  borderImageWidth: true,0
  boxFlex: true,0
  boxFlexGroup: true,0
  boxOrdinalGroup: true,0
  columnCount: true,0
  columns: true,0
  flex: true,0
  flexGrow: true,0
  flexPositive: true,0
  flexShrink: true,0
  flexNegative: true,0
  flexOrder: true,0
  gridRow: true,0
  gridRowEnd: true,0
  gridRowSpan: true,0
  gridRowStart: true,0
  gridColumn: true,0
  gridColumnEnd: true,0
  gridColumnSpan: true,0
  gridColumnStart: true,0
  fontWeight: true,0
  lineClamp: true,0
  lineHeight: true,0
  opacity: true,0
  order: true,0
  orphans: true,0
  tabSize: true,0
  widows: true,0
  zIndex: true,0
  zoom: true,0
0
  // SVG-related properties0
  fillOpacity: true,0
  floodOpacity: true,0
  stopOpacity: true,0
  strokeDasharray: true,0
  strokeDashoffset: true,0
  strokeMiterlimit: true,0
  strokeOpacity: true,0
  strokeWidth: true,0
};0
0
/**0
 * @param {string} prefix vendor-specific prefix, eg: Webkit0
 * @param {string} key style name, eg: transitionDuration0
 * @return {string} style name prefixed with `prefix`, properly camelCased, eg:0
 * WebkitTransitionDuration0
 */0
function prefixKey(prefix, key) {0
  return prefix + key.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + key.substring(1);0
}0
0
/**0
 * Support style names that may come passed in prefixed by adding permutations0
 * of vendor prefixes.0
 */0
const prefixes = ['Webkit', 'ms', 'Moz', 'O'];0
0
// Using Object.keys here, or else the vanilla for-in loop makes IE8 go into an0
// infinite loop, because it iterates over the newly added props too.0
Object.keys(isUnitlessNumber).forEach(function(prop) {0
  prefixes.forEach(function(prefix) {0
    isUnitlessNumber[prefixKey(prefix, prop)] = isUnitlessNumber[prop];0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import dangerousStyleValue from './dangerousStyleValue';0
import hyphenateStyleName from './hyphenateStyleName';0
import warnValidStyle from './warnValidStyle';0
0
/**0
 * Operations for dealing with CSS properties.0
 */0
0
/**0
 * This creates a string that is expected to be equivalent to the style0
 * attribute generated by server-side rendering. It by-passes warnings and0
 * security checks so it's not safe to use this value for anything other than0
 * comparison. It is only used in DEV for SSR validation.0
 */0
export function createDangerousStringForStyles(styles) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    let serialized = '';0
    let delimiter = '';0
    for (const styleName in styles) {0
      if (!styles.hasOwnProperty(styleName)) {0
        continue;0
      }0
      const styleValue = styles[styleName];0
      if (styleValue != null) {0
        const isCustomProperty = styleName.indexOf('--') === 0;0
        serialized += delimiter + hyphenateStyleName(styleName) + ':';0
        serialized += dangerousStyleValue(0
          styleName,0
          styleValue,0
          isCustomProperty,0
        );0
0
        delimiter = ';';0
      }0
    }0
    return serialized || null;0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Sets the value for multiple styles on a node.  If a value is specified as0
 * '' (empty string), the corresponding style property will be unset.0
 *0
 * @param {DOMElement} node0
 * @param {object} styles0
 */0
export function setValueForStyles(node, styles, getStack) {0
  const style = node.style;0
  for (let styleName in styles) {0
    if (!styles.hasOwnProperty(styleName)) {0
      continue;0
    }0
    const isCustomProperty = styleName.indexOf('--') === 0;0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      if (!isCustomProperty) {0
        warnValidStyle(styleName, styles[styleName], getStack);0
      }0
    }0
    const styleValue = dangerousStyleValue(0
      styleName,0
      styles[styleName],0
      isCustomProperty,0
    );0
    if (styleName === 'float') {0
      styleName = 'cssFloat';0
    }0
    if (isCustomProperty) {0
      style.setProperty(styleName, styleValue);0
    } else {0
      style[styleName] = styleValue;0
    }0
  }0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import {isUnitlessNumber} from './CSSProperty';0
0
/**0
 * Convert a value into the proper css writable value. The style name `name`0
 * should be logical (no hyphens), as specified0
 * in `CSSProperty.isUnitlessNumber`.0
 *0
 * @param {string} name CSS property name such as `topMargin`.0
 * @param {*} value CSS property value such as `10px`.0
 * @return {string} Normalized style value with dimensions applied.0
 */0
function dangerousStyleValue(name, value, isCustomProperty) {0
  // Note that we've removed escapeTextForBrowser() calls here since the0
  // whole string will be escaped when the attribute is injected into0
  // the markup. If you provide unsafe user data here they can inject0
  // arbitrary CSS which may be problematic (I couldn't repro this):0
  // https://www.owasp.org/index.php/XSS_Filter_Evasion_Cheat_Sheet0
  // http://www.thespanner.co.uk/2007/11/26/ultimate-xss-css-injection/0
  // This is not an XSS hole but instead a potential CSS injection issue0
  // which has lead to a greater discussion about how we're going to0
  // trust URLs moving forward. See #21159010
0
  const isEmpty = value == null || typeof value === 'boolean' || value === '';0
  if (isEmpty) {0
    return '';0
  }0
0
  if (0
    !isCustomProperty &&0
    typeof value === 'number' &&0
    value !== 0 &&0
    !(isUnitlessNumber.hasOwnProperty(name) && isUnitlessNumber[name])0
  ) {0
    return value + 'px'; // Presumes implicit 'px' suffix for unitless numbers0
  }0
0
  return ('' + value).trim();0
}0
0
export default dangerousStyleValue;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
const HTML_NAMESPACE = 'http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml';0
const MATH_NAMESPACE = 'http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML';0
const SVG_NAMESPACE = 'http://www.w3.org/2000/svg';0
0
export const Namespaces = {0
  html: HTML_NAMESPACE,0
  mathml: MATH_NAMESPACE,0
  svg: SVG_NAMESPACE,0
};0
0
// Assumes there is no parent namespace.0
export function getIntrinsicNamespace(type: string): string {0
  switch (type) {0
    case 'svg':0
      return SVG_NAMESPACE;0
    case 'math':0
      return MATH_NAMESPACE;0
    default:0
      return HTML_NAMESPACE;0
  }0
}0
0
export function getChildNamespace(0
  parentNamespace: string | null,0
  type: string,0
): string {0
  if (parentNamespace == null || parentNamespace === HTML_NAMESPACE) {0
    // No (or default) parent namespace: potential entry point.0
    return getIntrinsicNamespace(type);0
  }0
  if (parentNamespace === SVG_NAMESPACE && type === 'foreignObject') {0
    // We're leaving SVG.0
    return HTML_NAMESPACE;0
  }0
  // By default, pass namespace below.0
  return parentNamespace;0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
type PropertyType = 0 | 1 | 2 | 3 | 4 | 5 | 6;0
0
// A reserved attribute.0
// It is handled by React separately and shouldn't be written to the DOM.0
export const RESERVED = 0;0
0
// A simple string attribute.0
// Attributes that aren't in the whitelist are presumed to have this type.0
export const STRING = 1;0
0
// A string attribute that accepts booleans in React. In HTML, these are called0
// "enumerated" attributes with "true" and "false" as possible values.0
// When true, it should be set to a "true" string.0
// When false, it should be set to a "false" string.0
export const BOOLEANISH_STRING = 2;0
0
// A real boolean attribute.0
// When true, it should be present (set either to an empty string or its name).0
// When false, it should be omitted.0
export const BOOLEAN = 3;0
0
// An attribute that can be used as a flag as well as with a value.0
// When true, it should be present (set either to an empty string or its name).0
// When false, it should be omitted.0
// For any other value, should be present with that value.0
export const OVERLOADED_BOOLEAN = 4;0
0
// An attribute that must be numeric or parse as a numeric.0
// When falsy, it should be removed.0
export const NUMERIC = 5;0
0
// An attribute that must be positive numeric or parse as a positive numeric.0
// When falsy, it should be removed.0
export const POSITIVE_NUMERIC = 6;0
0
export type PropertyInfo = {|0
  +acceptsBooleans: boolean,0
  +attributeName: string,0
  +attributeNamespace: string | null,0
  +mustUseProperty: boolean,0
  +propertyName: string,0
  +type: PropertyType,0
|};0
0
/* eslint-disable max-len */0
export const ATTRIBUTE_NAME_START_CHAR =0
  ':A-Z_a-z\\u00C0-\\u00D6\\u00D8-\\u00F6\\u00F8-\\u02FF\\u0370-\\u037D\\u037F-\\u1FFF\\u200C-\\u200D\\u2070-\\u218F\\u2C00-\\u2FEF\\u3001-\\uD7FF\\uF900-\\uFDCF\\uFDF0-\\uFFFD';0
/* eslint-enable max-len */0
export const ATTRIBUTE_NAME_CHAR =0
  ATTRIBUTE_NAME_START_CHAR + '\\-.0-9\\u00B7\\u0300-\\u036F\\u203F-\\u2040';0
0
export const ID_ATTRIBUTE_NAME = 'data-reactid';0
export const ROOT_ATTRIBUTE_NAME = 'data-reactroot';0
export const VALID_ATTRIBUTE_NAME_REGEX = new RegExp(0
  '^[' + ATTRIBUTE_NAME_START_CHAR + '][' + ATTRIBUTE_NAME_CHAR + ']*$',0
);0
0
const illegalAttributeNameCache = {};0
const validatedAttributeNameCache = {};0
0
export function isAttributeNameSafe(attributeName: string): boolean {0
  if (validatedAttributeNameCache.hasOwnProperty(attributeName)) {0
    return true;0
  }0
  if (illegalAttributeNameCache.hasOwnProperty(attributeName)) {0
    return false;0
  }0
  if (VALID_ATTRIBUTE_NAME_REGEX.test(attributeName)) {0
    validatedAttributeNameCache[attributeName] = true;0
    return true;0
  }0
  illegalAttributeNameCache[attributeName] = true;0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    warning(false, 'Invalid attribute name: `%s`', attributeName);0
  }0
  return false;0
}0
0
export function shouldIgnoreAttribute(0
  name: string,0
  propertyInfo: PropertyInfo | null,0
  isCustomComponentTag: boolean,0
): boolean {0
  if (propertyInfo !== null) {0
    return propertyInfo.type === RESERVED;0
  }0
  if (isCustomComponentTag) {0
    return false;0
  }0
  if (0
    name.length > 2 &&0
    (name[0] === 'o' || name[0] === 'O') &&0
    (name[1] === 'n' || name[1] === 'N')0
  ) {0
    return true;0
  }0
  return false;0
}0
0
export function shouldRemoveAttributeWithWarning(0
  name: string,0
  value: mixed,0
  propertyInfo: PropertyInfo | null,0
  isCustomComponentTag: boolean,0
): boolean {0
  if (propertyInfo !== null && propertyInfo.type === RESERVED) {0
    return false;0
  }0
  switch (typeof value) {0
    case 'function':0
    // $FlowIssue symbol is perfectly valid here0
    case 'symbol': // eslint-disable-line0
      return true;0
    case 'boolean': {0
      if (isCustomComponentTag) {0
        return false;0
      }0
      if (propertyInfo !== null) {0
        return !propertyInfo.acceptsBooleans;0
      } else {0
        const prefix = name.toLowerCase().slice(0, 5);0
        return prefix !== 'data-' && prefix !== 'aria-';0
      }0
    }0
    default:0
      return false;0
  }0
}0
0
export function shouldRemoveAttribute(0
  name: string,0
  value: mixed,0
  propertyInfo: PropertyInfo | null,0
  isCustomComponentTag: boolean,0
): boolean {0
  if (value === null || typeof value === 'undefined') {0
    return true;0
  }0
  if (0
    shouldRemoveAttributeWithWarning(0
      name,0
      value,0
      propertyInfo,0
      isCustomComponentTag,0
    )0
  ) {0
    return true;0
  }0
  if (isCustomComponentTag) {0
    return false;0
  }0
  if (propertyInfo !== null) {0
    switch (propertyInfo.type) {0
      case BOOLEAN:0
        return !value;0
      case OVERLOADED_BOOLEAN:0
        return value === false;0
      case NUMERIC:0
        return isNaN(value);0
      case POSITIVE_NUMERIC:0
        return isNaN(value) || (value: any) < 1;0
    }0
  }0
  return false;0
}0
0
export function getPropertyInfo(name: string): PropertyInfo | null {0
  return properties.hasOwnProperty(name) ? properties[name] : null;0
}0
0
function PropertyInfoRecord(0
  name: string,0
  type: PropertyType,0
  mustUseProperty: boolean,0
  attributeName: string,0
  attributeNamespace: string | null,0
) {0
  this.acceptsBooleans =0
    type === BOOLEANISH_STRING ||0
    type === BOOLEAN ||0
    type === OVERLOADED_BOOLEAN;0
  this.attributeName = attributeName;0
  this.attributeNamespace = attributeNamespace;0
  this.mustUseProperty = mustUseProperty;0
  this.propertyName = name;0
  this.type = type;0
}0
0
// When adding attributes to this list, be sure to also add them to0
// the `possibleStandardNames` module to ensure casing and incorrect0
// name warnings.0
const properties = {};0
0
// These props are reserved by React. They shouldn't be written to the DOM.0
[0
  'children',0
  'dangerouslySetInnerHTML',0
  // TODO: This prevents the assignment of defaultValue to regular0
  // elements (not just inputs). Now that ReactDOMInput assigns to the0
  // defaultValue property -- do we need this?0
  'defaultValue',0
  'defaultChecked',0
  'innerHTML',0
  'suppressContentEditableWarning',0
  'suppressHydrationWarning',0
  'style',0
].forEach(name => {0
  properties[name] = new PropertyInfoRecord(0
    name,0
    RESERVED,0
    false, // mustUseProperty0
    name, // attributeName0
    null, // attributeNamespace0
  );0
});0
0
// A few React string attributes have a different name.0
// This is a mapping from React prop names to the attribute names.0
[0
  ['acceptCharset', 'accept-charset'],0
  ['className', 'class'],0
  ['htmlFor', 'for'],0
  ['httpEquiv', 'http-equiv'],0
].forEach(([name, attributeName]) => {0
  properties[name] = new PropertyInfoRecord(0
    name,0
    STRING,0
    false, // mustUseProperty0
    attributeName, // attributeName0
    null, // attributeNamespace0
  );0
});0
0
// These are "enumerated" HTML attributes that accept "true" and "false".0
// In React, we let users pass `true` and `false` even though technically0
// these aren't boolean attributes (they are coerced to strings).0
['contentEditable', 'draggable', 'spellCheck', 'value'].forEach(name => {0
  properties[name] = new PropertyInfoRecord(0
    name,0
    BOOLEANISH_STRING,0
    false, // mustUseProperty0
    name.toLowerCase(), // attributeName0
    null, // attributeNamespace0
  );0
});0
0
// These are "enumerated" SVG attributes that accept "true" and "false".0
// In React, we let users pass `true` and `false` even though technically0
// these aren't boolean attributes (they are coerced to strings).0
// Since these are SVG attributes, their attribute names are case-sensitive.0
['autoReverse', 'externalResourcesRequired', 'preserveAlpha'].forEach(name => {0
  properties[name] = new PropertyInfoRecord(0
    name,0
    BOOLEANISH_STRING,0
    false, // mustUseProperty0
    name, // attributeName0
    null, // attributeNamespace0
  );0
});0
0
// These are HTML boolean attributes.0
[0
  'allowFullScreen',0
  'async',0
  // Note: there is a special case that prevents it from being written to the DOM0
  // on the client side because the browsers are inconsistent. Instead we call focus().0
  'autoFocus',0
  'autoPlay',0
  'controls',0
  'default',0
  'defer',0
  'disabled',0
  'formNoValidate',0
  'hidden',0
  'loop',0
  'noModule',0
  'noValidate',0
  'open',0
  'playsInline',0
  'readOnly',0
  'required',0
  'reversed',0
  'scoped',0
  'seamless',0
  // Microdata0
  'itemScope',0
].forEach(name => {0
  properties[name] = new PropertyInfoRecord(0
    name,0
    BOOLEAN,0
    false, // mustUseProperty0
    name.toLowerCase(), // attributeName0
    null, // attributeNamespace0
  );0
});0
0
// These are the few React props that we set as DOM properties0
// rather than attributes. These are all booleans.0
[0
  'checked',0
  // Note: `option.selected` is not updated if `select.multiple` is0
  // disabled with `removeAttribute`. We have special logic for handling this.0
  'multiple',0
  'muted',0
  'selected',0
].forEach(name => {0
  properties[name] = new PropertyInfoRecord(0
    name,0
    BOOLEAN,0
    true, // mustUseProperty0
    name.toLowerCase(), // attributeName0
    null, // attributeNamespace0
  );0
});0
0
// These are HTML attributes that are "overloaded booleans": they behave like0
// booleans, but can also accept a string value.0
['capture', 'download'].forEach(name => {0
  properties[name] = new PropertyInfoRecord(0
    name,0
    OVERLOADED_BOOLEAN,0
    false, // mustUseProperty0
    name.toLowerCase(), // attributeName0
    null, // attributeNamespace0
  );0
});0
0
// These are HTML attributes that must be positive numbers.0
['cols', 'rows', 'size', 'span'].forEach(name => {0
  properties[name] = new PropertyInfoRecord(0
    name,0
    POSITIVE_NUMERIC,0
    false, // mustUseProperty0
    name.toLowerCase(), // attributeName0
    null, // attributeNamespace0
  );0
});0
0
// These are HTML attributes that must be numbers.0
['rowSpan', 'start'].forEach(name => {0
  properties[name] = new PropertyInfoRecord(0
    name,0
    NUMERIC,0
    false, // mustUseProperty0
    name.toLowerCase(), // attributeName0
    null, // attributeNamespace0
  );0
});0
0
const CAMELIZE = /[\-\:]([a-z])/g;0
const capitalize = token => token[1].toUpperCase();0
0
// This is a list of all SVG attributes that need special casing, namespacing,0
// or boolean value assignment. Regular attributes that just accept strings0
// and have the same names are omitted, just like in the HTML whitelist.0
// Some of these attributes can be hard to find. This list was created by0
// scrapping the MDN documentation.0
[0
  'accent-height',0
  'alignment-baseline',0
  'arabic-form',0
  'baseline-shift',0
  'cap-height',0
  'clip-path',0
  'clip-rule',0
  'color-interpolation',0
  'color-interpolation-filters',0
  'color-profile',0
  'color-rendering',0
  'dominant-baseline',0
  'enable-background',0
  'fill-opacity',0
  'fill-rule',0
  'flood-color',0
  'flood-opacity',0
  'font-family',0
  'font-size',0
  'font-size-adjust',0
  'font-stretch',0
  'font-style',0
  'font-variant',0
  'font-weight',0
  'glyph-name',0
  'glyph-orientation-horizontal',0
  'glyph-orientation-vertical',0
  'horiz-adv-x',0
  'horiz-origin-x',0
  'image-rendering',0
  'letter-spacing',0
  'lighting-color',0
  'marker-end',0
  'marker-mid',0
  'marker-start',0
  'overline-position',0
  'overline-thickness',0
  'paint-order',0
  'panose-1',0
  'pointer-events',0
  'rendering-intent',0
  'shape-rendering',0
  'stop-color',0
  'stop-opacity',0
  'strikethrough-position',0
  'strikethrough-thickness',0
  'stroke-dasharray',0
  'stroke-dashoffset',0
  'stroke-linecap',0
  'stroke-linejoin',0
  'stroke-miterlimit',0
  'stroke-opacity',0
  'stroke-width',0
  'text-anchor',0
  'text-decoration',0
  'text-rendering',0
  'underline-position',0
  'underline-thickness',0
  'unicode-bidi',0
  'unicode-range',0
  'units-per-em',0
  'v-alphabetic',0
  'v-hanging',0
  'v-ideographic',0
  'v-mathematical',0
  'vector-effect',0
  'vert-adv-y',0
  'vert-origin-x',0
  'vert-origin-y',0
  'word-spacing',0
  'writing-mode',0
  'xmlns:xlink',0
  'x-height',0
].forEach(attributeName => {0
  const name = attributeName.replace(CAMELIZE, capitalize);0
  properties[name] = new PropertyInfoRecord(0
    name,0
    STRING,0
    false, // mustUseProperty0
    attributeName,0
    null, // attributeNamespace0
  );0
});0
0
// String SVG attributes with the xlink namespace.0
[0
  'xlink:actuate',0
  'xlink:arcrole',0
  'xlink:href',0
  'xlink:role',0
  'xlink:show',0
  'xlink:title',0
  'xlink:type',0
].forEach(attributeName => {0
  const name = attributeName.replace(CAMELIZE, capitalize);0
  properties[name] = new PropertyInfoRecord(0
    name,0
    STRING,0
    false, // mustUseProperty0
    attributeName,0
    'http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink',0
  );0
});0
0
// String SVG attributes with the xml namespace.0
['xml:base', 'xml:lang', 'xml:space'].forEach(attributeName => {0
  const name = attributeName.replace(CAMELIZE, capitalize);0
  properties[name] = new PropertyInfoRecord(0
    name,0
    STRING,0
    false, // mustUseProperty0
    attributeName,0
    'http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace',0
  );0
});0
0
// Special case: this attribute exists both in HTML and SVG.0
// Its "tabindex" attribute name is case-sensitive in SVG so we can't just use0
// its React `tabIndex` name, like we do for attributes that exist only in HTML.0
properties.tabIndex = new PropertyInfoRecord(0
  'tabIndex',0
  STRING,0
  false, // mustUseProperty0
  'tabindex', // attributeName0
  null, // attributeNamespace0
);0
/**0

 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0

/**0
 * HTML nodeType values that represent the type of the node0
 */0
0
export const ELEMENT_NODE = 1;0
export const TEXT_NODE = 3;0
export const COMMENT_NODE = 8;0
export const DOCUMENT_NODE = 9;0
export const DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT_NODE = 11;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
const uppercasePattern = /([A-Z])/g;0
const msPattern = /^ms-/;0
0
/**0
 * Hyphenates a camelcased CSS property name, for example:0
 *0
 *   > hyphenateStyleName('backgroundColor')0
 *   < "background-color"0
 *   > hyphenateStyleName('MozTransition')0
 *   < "-moz-transition"0
 *   > hyphenateStyleName('msTransition')0
 *   < "-ms-transition"0
 *0
 * As Modernizr suggests (http://modernizr.com/docs/#prefixed), an `ms` prefix0
 * is converted to `-ms-`.0
 */0
export default function hyphenateStyleName(name: string): string {0
  return name0
    .replace(uppercasePattern, '-$1')0
    .toLowerCase()0
    .replace(msPattern, '-ms-');0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
function isCustomComponent(tagName: string, props: Object) {0
  if (tagName.indexOf('-') === -1) {0
    return typeof props.is === 'string';0
  }0
  switch (tagName) {0
    // These are reserved SVG and MathML elements.0
    // We don't mind this whitelist too much because we expect it to never grow.0
    // The alternative is to track the namespace in a few places which is convoluted.0
    // https://w3c.github.io/webcomponents/spec/custom/#custom-elements-core-concepts0
    case 'annotation-xml':0
    case 'color-profile':0
    case 'font-face':0
    case 'font-face-src':0
    case 'font-face-uri':0
    case 'font-face-format':0
    case 'font-face-name':0
    case 'missing-glyph':0
      return false;0
    default:0
      return true;0
  }0
}0
0
export default isCustomComponent;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
// For HTML, certain tags should omit their close tag. We keep a whitelist for0
// those special-case tags.0
0
const omittedCloseTags = {0
  area: true,0
  base: true,0
  br: true,0
  col: true,0
  embed: true,0
  hr: true,0
  img: true,0
  input: true,0
  keygen: true,0
  link: true,0
  meta: true,0
  param: true,0
  source: true,0
  track: true,0
  wbr: true,0
  // NOTE: menuitem's close tag should be omitted, but that causes problems.0
};0
0
export default omittedCloseTags;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0

  'stroke-miterlimit': 'strokeMiterlimit',0
  strokewidth: 'strokeWidth',0
  'stroke-width': 'strokeWidth',0
  strokeopacity: 'strokeOpacity',0
  'stroke-opacity': 'strokeOpacity',0
  suppresscontenteditablewarning: 'suppressContentEditableWarning',0
  suppresshydrationwarning: 'suppressHydrationWarning',0
  surfacescale: 'surfaceScale',0
  systemlanguage: 'systemLanguage',0
  tablevalues: 'tableValues',0
  targetx: 'targetX',0
  targety: 'targetY',0
  textanchor: 'textAnchor',0
  'text-anchor': 'textAnchor',0
  textdecoration: 'textDecoration',0
  'text-decoration': 'textDecoration',0
  textlength: 'textLength',0
  textrendering: 'textRendering',0
  'text-rendering': 'textRendering',0
  to: 'to',0
  transform: 'transform',0
  typeof: 'typeof',0
  u1: 'u1',0
  u2: 'u2',0
  underlineposition: 'underlinePosition',0
  'underline-position': 'underlinePosition',0
  underlinethickness: 'underlineThickness',0
  'underline-thickness': 'underlineThickness',0
  unicode: 'unicode',0
  unicodebidi: 'unicodeBidi',0
  'unicode-bidi': 'unicodeBidi',0
  unicoderange: 'unicodeRange',0
  'unicode-range': 'unicodeRange',0
  unitsperem: 'unitsPerEm',0
  'units-per-em': 'unitsPerEm',0
  unselectable: 'unselectable',0
  valphabetic: 'vAlphabetic',0
  'v-alphabetic': 'vAlphabetic',0
  values: 'values',0
  vectoreffect: 'vectorEffect',0
  'vector-effect': 'vectorEffect',0
  version: 'version',0
  vertadvy: 'vertAdvY',0
  'vert-adv-y': 'vertAdvY',0
  vertoriginx: 'vertOriginX',0
  'vert-origin-x': 'vertOriginX',0
  vertoriginy: 'vertOriginY',0
  'vert-origin-y': 'vertOriginY',0
  vhanging: 'vHanging',0
  'v-hanging': 'vHanging',0
  videographic: 'vIdeographic',0
  'v-ideographic': 'vIdeographic',0
  viewbox: 'viewBox',0
  viewtarget: 'viewTarget',0
  visibility: 'visibility',0
  vmathematical: 'vMathematical',0
  'v-mathematical': 'vMathematical',0
  vocab: 'vocab',0
  widths: 'widths',0
  wordspacing: 'wordSpacing',0
  'word-spacing': 'wordSpacing',0
  writingmode: 'writingMode',0
  'writing-mode': 'writingMode',0
  x1: 'x1',0
  x2: 'x2',0
  x: 'x',0
  xchannelselector: 'xChannelSelector',0
  xheight: 'xHeight',0
  'x-height': 'xHeight',0
  xlinkactuate: 'xlinkActuate',0
  'xlink:actuate': 'xlinkActuate',0
  xlinkarcrole: 'xlinkArcrole',0
  'xlink:arcrole': 'xlinkArcrole',0
  xlinkhref: 'xlinkHref',0
  'xlink:href': 'xlinkHref',0
  xlinkrole: 'xlinkRole',0
  'xlink:role': 'xlinkRole',0
  xlinkshow: 'xlinkShow',0
  'xlink:show': 'xlinkShow',0
  xlinktitle: 'xlinkTitle',0
  'xlink:title': 'xlinkTitle',0
  xlinktype: 'xlinkType',0
  'xlink:type': 'xlinkType',0
  xmlbase: 'xmlBase',0
  'xml:base': 'xmlBase',0
  xmllang: 'xmlLang',0
  'xml:lang': 'xmlLang',0
  xmlns: 'xmlns',0
  'xml:space': 'xmlSpace',0
  xmlnsxlink: 'xmlnsXlink',0
  'xmlns:xlink': 'xmlnsXlink',0
  xmlspace: 'xmlSpace',0
  y1: 'y1',0
  y2: 'y2',0
  y: 'y',0
  ychannelselector: 'yChannelSelector',0
  z: 'z',0
  zoomandpan: 'zoomAndPan',0
};0
0
export default possibleStandardNames;0

import checkPropTypes from 'prop-types/checkPropTypes';0
0
const ReactControlledValuePropTypes = {0
  checkPropTypes: null,0
};0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  const hasReadOnlyValue = {0
    button: true,0
    checkbox: true,0
    image: true,0
    hidden: true,0
    radio: true,0
    reset: true,0
    submit: true,0
  };0
0
  const propTypes = {0
    value: function(props, propName, componentName) {0
      if (0
        !props[propName] ||0
        hasReadOnlyValue[props.type] ||0
        props.onChange ||0
        props.readOnly ||0
        props.disabled0
      ) {0
        return null;0
      }0
      return new Error(0
        'You provided a `value` prop to a form field without an ' +0
          '`onChange` handler. This will render a read-only field. If ' +0
          'the field should be mutable use `defaultValue`. Otherwise, ' +0
          'set either `onChange` or `readOnly`.',0
      );0
    },0
    checked: function(props, propName, componentName) {0
      if (0
        !props[propName] ||0
        props.onChange ||0
        props.readOnly ||0
        props.disabled0
      ) {0
        return null;0
      }0
      return new Error(0
        'You provided a `checked` prop to a form field without an ' +0
          '`onChange` handler. This will render a read-only field. If ' +0
          'the field should be mutable use `defaultChecked`. Otherwise, ' +0
          'set either `onChange` or `readOnly`.',0
      );0
    },0
  };0
0
  /**0
   * Provide a linked `value` attribute for controlled forms. You should not use0
   * this outside of the ReactDOM controlled form components.0
   */0
  ReactControlledValuePropTypes.checkPropTypes = function(0
    tagName,0
    props,0
    getStack,0
  ) {0
    checkPropTypes(propTypes, props, 'prop', tagName, getStack);0
  };0
}0
0
export default ReactControlledValuePropTypes;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
import {ReactDebugCurrentFrame} from 'shared/ReactGlobalSharedState';0
0
import {ATTRIBUTE_NAME_CHAR} from './DOMProperty';0
import isCustomComponent from './isCustomComponent';0
import validAriaProperties from './validAriaProperties';0
0
const warnedProperties = {};0
const rARIA = new RegExp('^(aria)-[' + ATTRIBUTE_NAME_CHAR + ']*$');0
const rARIACamel = new RegExp('^(aria)[A-Z][' + ATTRIBUTE_NAME_CHAR + ']*$');0
0
const hasOwnProperty = Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty;0
0
function getStackAddendum() {0
  const stack = ReactDebugCurrentFrame.getStackAddendum();0
  return stack != null ? stack : '';0
}0
0
function validateProperty(tagName, name) {0
  if (hasOwnProperty.call(warnedProperties, name) && warnedProperties[name]) {0
    return true;0
  }0
0
  if (rARIACamel.test(name)) {0
    const ariaName = 'aria-' + name.slice(4).toLowerCase();0
    const correctName = validAriaProperties.hasOwnProperty(ariaName)0
      ? ariaName0
      : null;0
0
    // If this is an aria-* attribute, but is not listed in the known DOM0
    // DOM properties, then it is an invalid aria-* attribute.0
    if (correctName == null) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'Invalid ARIA attribute `%s`. ARIA attributes follow the pattern aria-* and must be lowercase.%s',0
        name,0
        getStackAddendum(),0
      );0
      warnedProperties[name] = true;0
      return true;0
    }0
    // aria-* attributes should be lowercase; suggest the lowercase version.0
    if (name !== correctName) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'Invalid ARIA attribute `%s`. Did you mean `%s`?%s',0
        name,0
        correctName,0
        getStackAddendum(),0
      );0
      warnedProperties[name] = true;0
      return true;0
    }0
  }0
0
  if (rARIA.test(name)) {0
    const lowerCasedName = name.toLowerCase();0
    const standardName = validAriaProperties.hasOwnProperty(lowerCasedName)0
      ? lowerCasedName0
      : null;0
0
    // If this is an aria-* attribute, but is not listed in the known DOM0
    // DOM properties, then it is an invalid aria-* attribute.0
    if (standardName == null) {0
      warnedProperties[name] = true;0
      return false;0
    }0
    // aria-* attributes should be lowercase; suggest the lowercase version.0
    if (name !== standardName) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'Unknown ARIA attribute `%s`. Did you mean `%s`?%s',0
        name,0
        standardName,0
        getStackAddendum(),0
      );0
      warnedProperties[name] = true;0
      return true;0
    }0
  }0
0
  return true;0
}0
0
function warnInvalidARIAProps(type, props) {0
  const invalidProps = [];0
0
  for (const key in props) {0
    const isValid = validateProperty(type, key);0
    if (!isValid) {0
      invalidProps.push(key);0
    }0
  }0
0
  const unknownPropString = invalidProps0
    .map(prop => '`' + prop + '`')0
    .join(', ');0
0
  if (invalidProps.length === 1) {0
    warning(0
      false,0
      'Invalid aria prop %s on <%s> tag. ' +0
        'For details, see https://fb.me/invalid-aria-prop%s',0
      unknownPropString,0
      type,0
      getStackAddendum(),0
    );0
  } else if (invalidProps.length > 1) {0
    warning(0
      false,0
      'Invalid aria props %s on <%s> tag. ' +0
        'For details, see https://fb.me/invalid-aria-prop%s',0
      unknownPropString,0
      type,0
      getStackAddendum(),0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export function validateProperties(type, props) {0
  if (isCustomComponent(type, props)) {0
    return;0
  }0
  warnInvalidARIAProps(type, props);0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import {ReactDebugCurrentFrame} from 'shared/ReactGlobalSharedState';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
let didWarnValueNull = false;0
0
function getStackAddendum() {0
  const stack = ReactDebugCurrentFrame.getStackAddendum();0
  return stack != null ? stack : '';0
}0
0
export function validateProperties(type, props) {0
  if (type !== 'input' && type !== 'textarea' && type !== 'select') {0
    return;0
  }0
0
  if (props != null && props.value === null && !didWarnValueNull) {0
    didWarnValueNull = true;0
    if (type === 'select' && props.multiple) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        '`value` prop on `%s` should not be null. ' +0
          'Consider using an empty array when `multiple` is set to `true` ' +0
          'to clear the component or `undefined` for uncontrolled components.%s',0
        type,0
        getStackAddendum(),0
      );0
    } else {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        '`value` prop on `%s` should not be null. ' +0
          'Consider using an empty string to clear the component or `undefined` ' +0
          'for uncontrolled components.%s',0
        type,0
        getStackAddendum(),0
      );0
    }0
  }0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import {0
  registrationNameModules,0
  possibleRegistrationNames,0
} from 'events/EventPluginRegistry';0
import {ReactDebugCurrentFrame} from 'shared/ReactGlobalSharedState';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
import {0
  ATTRIBUTE_NAME_CHAR,0
  RESERVED,0
  shouldRemoveAttributeWithWarning,0
  getPropertyInfo,0
} from './DOMProperty';0
import isCustomComponent from './isCustomComponent';0
import possibleStandardNames from './possibleStandardNames';0
0
function getStackAddendum() {0
  const stack = ReactDebugCurrentFrame.getStackAddendum();0
  return stack != null ? stack : '';0
}0
0
let validateProperty = () => {};0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  const warnedProperties = {};0
  const hasOwnProperty = Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty;0
  const EVENT_NAME_REGEX = /^on./;0
  const INVALID_EVENT_NAME_REGEX = /^on[^A-Z]/;0
  const rARIA = new RegExp('^(aria)-[' + ATTRIBUTE_NAME_CHAR + ']*$');0
  const rARIACamel = new RegExp('^(aria)[A-Z][' + ATTRIBUTE_NAME_CHAR + ']*$');0
0
  validateProperty = function(tagName, name, value, canUseEventSystem) {0
    if (hasOwnProperty.call(warnedProperties, name) && warnedProperties[name]) {0
      return true;0
    }0
0
    const lowerCasedName = name.toLowerCase();0
    if (lowerCasedName === 'onfocusin' || lowerCasedName === 'onfocusout') {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'React uses onFocus and onBlur instead of onFocusIn and onFocusOut. ' +0
          'All React events are normalized to bubble, so onFocusIn and onFocusOut ' +0
          'are not needed/supported by React.',0
      );0
      warnedProperties[name] = true;0
      return true;0
    }0
0
    // We can't rely on the event system being injected on the server.0
    if (canUseEventSystem) {0
      if (registrationNameModules.hasOwnProperty(name)) {0
        return true;0
      }0
      const registrationName = possibleRegistrationNames.hasOwnProperty(0
        lowerCasedName,0
      )0
        ? possibleRegistrationNames[lowerCasedName]0
        : null;0
      if (registrationName != null) {0
        warning(0
          false,0
          'Invalid event handler property `%s`. Did you mean `%s`?%s',0
          name,0
          registrationName,0
          getStackAddendum(),0
        );0
        warnedProperties[name] = true;0
        return true;0
      }0
      if (EVENT_NAME_REGEX.test(name)) {0
        warning(0
          false,0
          'Unknown event handler property `%s`. It will be ignored.%s',0
          name,0
          getStackAddendum(),0
        );0
        warnedProperties[name] = true;0
        return true;0
      }0
    } else if (EVENT_NAME_REGEX.test(name)) {0
      // If no event plugins have been injected, we are in a server environment.0
      // So we can't tell if the event name is correct for sure, but we can filter0
      // out known bad ones like `onclick`. We can't suggest a specific replacement though.0
      if (INVALID_EVENT_NAME_REGEX.test(name)) {0
        warning(0
          false,0
          'Invalid event handler property `%s`. ' +0
            'React events use the camelCase naming convention, for example `onClick`.%s',0
          name,0
          getStackAddendum(),0
        );0
      }0
      warnedProperties[name] = true;0
      return true;0
    }0
0
    // Let the ARIA attribute hook validate ARIA attributes0
    if (rARIA.test(name) || rARIACamel.test(name)) {0
      return true;0
    }0
0
    if (lowerCasedName === 'innerhtml') {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'Directly setting property `innerHTML` is not permitted. ' +0
          'For more information, lookup documentation on `dangerouslySetInnerHTML`.',0
      );0
      warnedProperties[name] = true;0
      return true;0
    }0
0
    if (lowerCasedName === 'aria') {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'The `aria` attribute is reserved for future use in React. ' +0
          'Pass individual `aria-` attributes instead.',0
      );0
      warnedProperties[name] = true;0
      return true;0
    }0
0
    if (0
      lowerCasedName === 'is' &&0
      value !== null &&0
      value !== undefined &&0
      typeof value !== 'string'0
    ) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'Received a `%s` for a string attribute `is`. If this is expected, cast ' +0
          'the value to a string.%s',0
        typeof value,0
        getStackAddendum(),0
      );0
      warnedProperties[name] = true;0
      return true;0
    }0
0
    if (typeof value === 'number' && isNaN(value)) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'Received NaN for the `%s` attribute. If this is expected, cast ' +0
          'the value to a string.%s',0
        name,0
        getStackAddendum(),0
      );0
      warnedProperties[name] = true;0
      return true;0
    }0
0
    const propertyInfo = getPropertyInfo(name);0
    const isReserved = propertyInfo !== null && propertyInfo.type === RESERVED;0
0
    // Known attributes should match the casing specified in the property config.0
    if (possibleStandardNames.hasOwnProperty(lowerCasedName)) {0
      const standardName = possibleStandardNames[lowerCasedName];0
      if (standardName !== name) {0
        warning(0
          false,0
          'Invalid DOM property `%s`. Did you mean `%s`?%s',0
          name,0
          standardName,0
          getStackAddendum(),0
        );0
        warnedProperties[name] = true;0
        return true;0
      }0
    } else if (!isReserved && name !== lowerCasedName) {0
      // Unknown attributes should have lowercase casing since that's how they0
      // will be cased anyway with server rendering.0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'React does not recognize the `%s` prop on a DOM element. If you ' +0
          'intentionally want it to appear in the DOM as a custom ' +0
          'attribute, spell it as lowercase `%s` instead. ' +0
          'If you accidentally passed it from a parent component, remove ' +0
          'it from the DOM element.%s',0
        name,0
        lowerCasedName,0
        getStackAddendum(),0
      );0
      warnedProperties[name] = true;0
      return true;0
    }0
0
    if (0
      typeof value === 'boolean' &&0
      shouldRemoveAttributeWithWarning(name, value, propertyInfo, false)0
    ) {0
      if (value) {0
        warning(0
          false,0
          'Received `%s` for a non-boolean attribute `%s`.\n\n' +0
            'If you want to write it to the DOM, pass a string instead: ' +0
            '%s="%s" or %s={value.toString()}.%s',0
          value,0
          name,0
          name,0
          value,0
          name,0
          getStackAddendum(),0
        );0
      } else {0
        warning(0
          false,0
          'Received `%s` for a non-boolean attribute `%s`.\n\n' +0
            'If you want to write it to the DOM, pass a string instead: ' +0
            '%s="%s" or %s={value.toString()}.\n\n' +0
            'If you used to conditionally omit it with %s={condition && value}, ' +0
            'pass %s={condition ? value : undefined} instead.%s',0
          value,0
          name,0
          name,0
          value,0
          name,0
          name,0
          name,0
          getStackAddendum(),0
        );0
      }0
      warnedProperties[name] = true;0
      return true;0
    }0
0
    // Now that we've validated casing, do not validate0
    // data types for reserved props0
    if (isReserved) {0
      return true;0
    }0
0
    // Warn when a known attribute is a bad type0
    if (shouldRemoveAttributeWithWarning(name, value, propertyInfo, false)) {0
      warnedProperties[name] = true;0
      return false;0
    }0
0
    return true;0
  };0
}0
0
const warnUnknownProperties = function(type, props, canUseEventSystem) {0
  const unknownProps = [];0
  for (const key in props) {0
    const isValid = validateProperty(type, key, props[key], canUseEventSystem);0
    if (!isValid) {0
      unknownProps.push(key);0
    }0
  }0
0
  const unknownPropString = unknownProps0
    .map(prop => '`' + prop + '`')0
    .join(', ');0
  if (unknownProps.length === 1) {0
    warning(0
      false,0
      'Invalid value for prop %s on <%s> tag. Either remove it from the element, ' +0
        'or pass a string or number value to keep it in the DOM. ' +0
        'For details, see https://fb.me/react-attribute-behavior%s',0
      unknownPropString,0
      type,0
      getStackAddendum(),0
    );0
  } else if (unknownProps.length > 1) {0
    warning(0
      false,0
      'Invalid values for props %s on <%s> tag. Either remove them from the element, ' +0
        'or pass a string or number value to keep them in the DOM. ' +0
        'For details, see https://fb.me/react-attribute-behavior%s',0
      unknownPropString,0
      type,0
      getStackAddendum(),0
    );0
  }0
};0
0
export function validateProperties(type, props, canUseEventSystem) {0
  if (isCustomComponent(type, props)) {0
    return;0
  }0
  warnUnknownProperties(type, props, canUseEventSystem);0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
const ariaProperties = {0
  'aria-current': 0, // state0
  'aria-details': 0,0
  'aria-disabled': 0, // state0
  'aria-hidden': 0, // state0
  'aria-invalid': 0, // state0
  'aria-keyshortcuts': 0,0
  'aria-label': 0,0
  'aria-roledescription': 0,0
  // Widget Attributes0
  'aria-autocomplete': 0,0
  'aria-checked': 0,0
  'aria-expanded': 0,0
  'aria-haspopup': 0,0
  'aria-level': 0,0
  'aria-modal': 0,0
  'aria-multiline': 0,0
  'aria-multiselectable': 0,0
  'aria-orientation': 0,0
  'aria-placeholder': 0,0
  'aria-pressed': 0,0
  'aria-readonly': 0,0
  'aria-required': 0,0
  'aria-selected': 0,0
  'aria-sort': 0,0
  'aria-valuemax': 0,0
  'aria-valuemin': 0,0
  'aria-valuenow': 0,0
  'aria-valuetext': 0,0
  // Live Region Attributes0
  'aria-atomic': 0,0
  'aria-busy': 0,0
  'aria-live': 0,0
  'aria-relevant': 0,0
  // Drag-and-Drop Attributes0
  'aria-dropeffect': 0,0
  'aria-grabbed': 0,0
  // Relationship Attributes0
  'aria-activedescendant': 0,0
  'aria-colcount': 0,0
  'aria-colindex': 0,0
  'aria-colspan': 0,0
  'aria-controls': 0,0
  'aria-describedby': 0,0
  'aria-errormessage': 0,0
  'aria-flowto': 0,0
  'aria-labelledby': 0,0
  'aria-owns': 0,0
  'aria-posinset': 0,0
  'aria-rowcount': 0,0
  'aria-rowindex': 0,0
  'aria-rowspan': 0,0
  'aria-setsize': 0,0
};0

import omittedCloseTags from './omittedCloseTags';0
0
// For HTML, certain tags cannot have children. This has the same purpose as0
// `omittedCloseTags` except that `menuitem` should still have its closing tag.0
0
const voidElementTags = {0
  menuitem: true,0
  ...omittedCloseTags,0
};0

export default voidElementTags;0
/**0

import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
let warnValidStyle = () => {};0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  // 'msTransform' is correct, but the other prefixes should be capitalized0
  const badVendoredStyleNamePattern = /^(?:webkit|moz|o)[A-Z]/;0
  const msPattern = /^-ms-/;0
  const hyphenPattern = /-(.)/g;0
0
  // style values shouldn't contain a semicolon0
  const badStyleValueWithSemicolonPattern = /;\s*$/;0
0
  const warnedStyleNames = {};0
  const warnedStyleValues = {};0
  let warnedForNaNValue = false;0
  let warnedForInfinityValue = false;0
0
  const camelize = function(string) {0
    return string.replace(hyphenPattern, function(_, character) {0
      return character.toUpperCase();0
    });0
  };0
0
  const warnHyphenatedStyleName = function(name, getStack) {0
    if (warnedStyleNames.hasOwnProperty(name) && warnedStyleNames[name]) {0
      return;0
    }0
0
    warnedStyleNames[name] = true;0
    warning(0
      false,0
      'Unsupported style property %s. Did you mean %s?%s',0
      name,0
      // As Andi Smith suggests0
      // (http://www.andismith.com/blog/2012/02/modernizr-prefixed/), an `-ms` prefix0
      // is converted to lowercase `ms`.0
      camelize(name.replace(msPattern, 'ms-')),0
      getStack(),0
    );0
  };0
0
  const warnBadVendoredStyleName = function(name, getStack) {0
    if (warnedStyleNames.hasOwnProperty(name) && warnedStyleNames[name]) {0
      return;0
    }0
0
    warnedStyleNames[name] = true;0
    warning(0
      false,0
      'Unsupported vendor-prefixed style property %s. Did you mean %s?%s',0
      name,0
      name.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + name.slice(1),0
      getStack(),0
    );0
  };0
0
  const warnStyleValueWithSemicolon = function(name, value, getStack) {0
    if (warnedStyleValues.hasOwnProperty(value) && warnedStyleValues[value]) {0
      return;0
    }0
0
    warnedStyleValues[value] = true;0
    warning(0
      false,0
      "Style property values shouldn't contain a semicolon. " +0
        'Try "%s: %s" instead.%s',0
      name,0
      value.replace(badStyleValueWithSemicolonPattern, ''),0
      getStack(),0
    );0
  };0
0
  const warnStyleValueIsNaN = function(name, value, getStack) {0
    if (warnedForNaNValue) {0
      return;0
    }0
0
    warnedForNaNValue = true;0
    warning(0
      false,0
      '`NaN` is an invalid value for the `%s` css style property.%s',0
      name,0
      getStack(),0
    );0
  };0
0
  const warnStyleValueIsInfinity = function(name, value, getStack) {0
    if (warnedForInfinityValue) {0
      return;0
    }0
0
    warnedForInfinityValue = true;0
    warning(0
      false,0
      '`Infinity` is an invalid value for the `%s` css style property.%s',0
      name,0
      getStack(),0
    );0
  };0
0
  warnValidStyle = function(name, value, getStack) {0
    if (name.indexOf('-') > -1) {0
      warnHyphenatedStyleName(name, getStack);0
    } else if (badVendoredStyleNamePattern.test(name)) {0
      warnBadVendoredStyleName(name, getStack);0
    } else if (badStyleValueWithSemicolonPattern.test(value)) {0
      warnStyleValueWithSemicolon(name, value, getStack);0
    }0
0
    if (typeof value === 'number') {0
      if (isNaN(value)) {0
        warnStyleValueIsNaN(name, value, getStack);0
      } else if (!isFinite(value)) {0
        warnStyleValueIsInfinity(name, value, getStack);0
      }0
    }0
  };0
}0
0
export default warnValidStyle;0
/**0

 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0

import React from 'react';0
import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';0
import {findCurrentFiberUsingSlowPath} from 'react-reconciler/reflection';0
import * as ReactInstanceMap from 'shared/ReactInstanceMap';0
import {0
  ClassComponent,0
  FunctionalComponent,0
  HostComponent,0
  HostText,0
} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfWork';0
import SyntheticEvent from 'events/SyntheticEvent';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
import * as DOMTopLevelEventTypes from '../events/DOMTopLevelEventTypes';0
0
const {findDOMNode} = ReactDOM;0
const {0
  EventPluginHub,0
  EventPluginRegistry,0
  EventPropagators,0
  ReactControlledComponent,0
  ReactDOMComponentTree,0
  ReactDOMEventListener,0
} = ReactDOM.__SECRET_INTERNALS_DO_NOT_USE_OR_YOU_WILL_BE_FIRED;0
0
function Event(suffix) {}0
0
/**0
 * @class ReactTestUtils0
 */0
0
/**0
 * Simulates a top level event being dispatched from a raw event that occurred0
 * on an `Element` node.0
 * @param {number} topLevelType A number from `TopLevelEventTypes`0
 * @param {!Element} node The dom to simulate an event occurring on.0
 * @param {?Event} fakeNativeEvent Fake native event to use in SyntheticEvent.0
 */0
function simulateNativeEventOnNode(topLevelType, node, fakeNativeEvent) {0
  fakeNativeEvent.target = node;0
  ReactDOMEventListener.dispatchEvent(topLevelType, fakeNativeEvent);0
}0
0
/**0
 * Simulates a top level event being dispatched from a raw event that occurred0
 * on the `ReactDOMComponent` `comp`.0
 * @param {Object} topLevelType A type from `BrowserEventConstants.topLevelTypes`.0
 * @param {!ReactDOMComponent} comp0
 * @param {?Event} fakeNativeEvent Fake native event to use in SyntheticEvent.0
 */0
function simulateNativeEventOnDOMComponent(0
  topLevelType,0
  comp,0
  fakeNativeEvent,0
) {0
  simulateNativeEventOnNode(topLevelType, findDOMNode(comp), fakeNativeEvent);0
}0
0
function findAllInRenderedFiberTreeInternal(fiber, test) {0
  if (!fiber) {0
    return [];0
  }0
  const currentParent = findCurrentFiberUsingSlowPath(fiber);0
  if (!currentParent) {0
    return [];0
  }0
  let node = currentParent;0
  let ret = [];0
  while (true) {0
    if (0
      node.tag === HostComponent ||0
      node.tag === HostText ||0
      node.tag === ClassComponent ||0
      node.tag === FunctionalComponent0
    ) {0
      const publicInst = node.stateNode;0
      if (test(publicInst)) {0
        ret.push(publicInst);0
      }0
    }0
    if (node.child) {0
      node.child.return = node;0
      node = node.child;0
      continue;0
    }0
    if (node === currentParent) {0
      return ret;0
    }0
    while (!node.sibling) {0
      if (!node.return || node.return === currentParent) {0
        return ret;0
      }0
      node = node.return;0
    }0
    node.sibling.return = node.return;0
    node = node.sibling;0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Utilities for making it easy to test React components.0
 *0
 * See https://reactjs.org/docs/test-utils.html0
 *0
 * Todo: Support the entire DOM.scry query syntax. For now, these simple0
 * utilities will suffice for testing purposes.0
 * @lends ReactTestUtils0
 */0
const ReactTestUtils = {0
  renderIntoDocument: function(element) {0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    // None of our tests actually require attaching the container to the0
    // DOM, and doing so creates a mess that we rely on test isolation to0
    // clean up, so we're going to stop honoring the name of this method0
    // (and probably rename it eventually) if no problems arise.0
    // document.documentElement.appendChild(div);0
    return ReactDOM.render(element, div);0
  },0
0
  isElement: function(element) {0
    return React.isValidElement(element);0
  },0
0
  isElementOfType: function(inst, convenienceConstructor) {0
    return React.isValidElement(inst) && inst.type === convenienceConstructor;0
  },0
0
  isDOMComponent: function(inst) {0
    return !!(inst && inst.nodeType === 1 && inst.tagName);0
  },0
0
  isDOMComponentElement: function(inst) {0
    return !!(inst && React.isValidElement(inst) && !!inst.tagName);0
  },0
0
  isCompositeComponent: function(inst) {0
    if (ReactTestUtils.isDOMComponent(inst)) {0
      // Accessing inst.setState warns; just return false as that'll be what0
      // this returns when we have DOM nodes as refs directly0
      return false;0
    }0
    return (0
      inst != null &&0
      typeof inst.render === 'function' &&0
      typeof inst.setState === 'function'0
    );0
  },0
0
  isCompositeComponentWithType: function(inst, type) {0
    if (!ReactTestUtils.isCompositeComponent(inst)) {0
      return false;0
    }0
    const internalInstance = ReactInstanceMap.get(inst);0
    const constructor = internalInstance.type;0
    return constructor === type;0
  },0
0
  findAllInRenderedTree: function(inst, test) {0
    if (!inst) {0
      return [];0
    }0
    invariant(0
      ReactTestUtils.isCompositeComponent(inst),0
      'findAllInRenderedTree(...): instance must be a composite component',0
    );0
    const internalInstance = ReactInstanceMap.get(inst);0
    return findAllInRenderedFiberTreeInternal(internalInstance, test);0
  },0
0
  /**0
   * Finds all instance of components in the rendered tree that are DOM0
   * components with the class name matching `className`.0
   * @return {array} an array of all the matches.0
   */0
  scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithClass: function(root, classNames) {0
    return ReactTestUtils.findAllInRenderedTree(root, function(inst) {0
      if (ReactTestUtils.isDOMComponent(inst)) {0
        let className = inst.className;0
        if (typeof className !== 'string') {0
          // SVG, probably.0
          className = inst.getAttribute('class') || '';0
        }0
        const classList = className.split(/\s+/);0
0
        if (!Array.isArray(classNames)) {0
          invariant(0
            classNames !== undefined,0
            'TestUtils.scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithClass expects a ' +0
              'className as a second argument.',0
          );0
          classNames = classNames.split(/\s+/);0
        }0
        return classNames.every(function(name) {0
          return classList.indexOf(name) !== -1;0
        });0
      }0
      return false;0
    });0
  },0
0
  /**0
   * Like scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithClass but expects there to be one result,0
   * and returns that one result, or throws exception if there is any other0
   * number of matches besides one.0
   * @return {!ReactDOMComponent} The one match.0
   */0
  findRenderedDOMComponentWithClass: function(root, className) {0
    const all = ReactTestUtils.scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithClass(0
      root,0
      className,0
    );0
    if (all.length !== 1) {0
      throw new Error(0
        'Did not find exactly one match (found: ' +0
          all.length +0
          ') ' +0
          'for class:' +0
          className,0
      );0
    }0
    return all[0];0
  },0
0
  /**0
   * Finds all instance of components in the rendered tree that are DOM0
   * components with the tag name matching `tagName`.0
   * @return {array} an array of all the matches.0
   */0
  scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithTag: function(root, tagName) {0
    return ReactTestUtils.findAllInRenderedTree(root, function(inst) {0
      return (0
        ReactTestUtils.isDOMComponent(inst) &&0
        inst.tagName.toUpperCase() === tagName.toUpperCase()0
      );0
    });0
  },0
0
  /**0
   * Like scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithTag but expects there to be one result,0
   * and returns that one result, or throws exception if there is any other0
   * number of matches besides one.0
   * @return {!ReactDOMComponent} The one match.0
   */0
  findRenderedDOMComponentWithTag: function(root, tagName) {0
    const all = ReactTestUtils.scryRenderedDOMComponentsWithTag(root, tagName);0
    if (all.length !== 1) {0
      throw new Error(0
        'Did not find exactly one match (found: ' +0
          all.length +0
          ') ' +0
          'for tag:' +0
          tagName,0
      );0
    }0
    return all[0];0
  },0
0
  /**0
   * Finds all instances of components with type equal to `componentType`.0
   * @return {array} an array of all the matches.0
   */0
  scryRenderedComponentsWithType: function(root, componentType) {0
    return ReactTestUtils.findAllInRenderedTree(root, function(inst) {0
      return ReactTestUtils.isCompositeComponentWithType(inst, componentType);0
    });0
  },0
0
  /**0
   * Same as `scryRenderedComponentsWithType` but expects there to be one result0
   * and returns that one result, or throws exception if there is any other0
   * number of matches besides one.0
   * @return {!ReactComponent} The one match.0
   */0
  findRenderedComponentWithType: function(root, componentType) {0
    const all = ReactTestUtils.scryRenderedComponentsWithType(0
      root,0
      componentType,0
    );0
    if (all.length !== 1) {0
      throw new Error(0
        'Did not find exactly one match (found: ' +0
          all.length +0
          ') ' +0
          'for componentType:' +0
          componentType,0
      );0
    }0
    return all[0];0
  },0
0
  /**0
   * Pass a mocked component module to this method to augment it with0
   * useful methods that allow it to be used as a dummy React component.0
   * Instead of rendering as usual, the component will become a simple0
   * <div> containing any provided children.0
   *0
   * @param {object} module the mock function object exported from a0
   *                        module that defines the component to be mocked0
   * @param {?string} mockTagName optional dummy root tag name to return0
   *                              from render method (overrides0
   *                              module.mockTagName if provided)0
   * @return {object} the ReactTestUtils object (for chaining)0
   */0
  mockComponent: function(module, mockTagName) {0
    mockTagName = mockTagName || module.mockTagName || 'div';0
0
    module.prototype.render.mockImplementation(function() {0
      return React.createElement(mockTagName, null, this.props.children);0
    });0
0
    return this;0
  },0
0
  nativeTouchData: function(x, y) {0
    return {0
      touches: [{pageX: x, pageY: y}],0
    };0
  },0
0
  Simulate: null,0
  SimulateNative: {},0
};0
0
/**0
 * Exports:0
 *0
 * - `ReactTestUtils.Simulate.click(Element)`0
 * - `ReactTestUtils.Simulate.mouseMove(Element)`0
 * - `ReactTestUtils.Simulate.change(Element)`0
 * - ... (All keys from event plugin `eventTypes` objects)0
 */0
function makeSimulator(eventType) {0
  return function(domNode, eventData) {0
    invariant(0
      !React.isValidElement(domNode),0
      'TestUtils.Simulate expected a DOM node as the first argument but received ' +0
        'a React element. Pass the DOM node you wish to simulate the event on instead. ' +0
        'Note that TestUtils.Simulate will not work if you are using shallow rendering.',0
    );0
    invariant(0
      !ReactTestUtils.isCompositeComponent(domNode),0
      'TestUtils.Simulate expected a DOM node as the first argument but received ' +0
        'a component instance. Pass the DOM node you wish to simulate the event on instead.',0
    );0
0
    const dispatchConfig =0
      EventPluginRegistry.eventNameDispatchConfigs[eventType];0
0
    const fakeNativeEvent = new Event();0
    fakeNativeEvent.target = domNode;0
    fakeNativeEvent.type = eventType.toLowerCase();0
0
    // We don't use SyntheticEvent.getPooled in order to not have to worry about0
    // properly destroying any properties assigned from `eventData` upon release0
    const targetInst = ReactDOMComponentTree.getInstanceFromNode(domNode);0
    const event = new SyntheticEvent(0
      dispatchConfig,0
      targetInst,0
      fakeNativeEvent,0
      domNode,0
    );0
0
    // Since we aren't using pooling, always persist the event. This will make0
    // sure it's marked and won't warn when setting additional properties.0
    event.persist();0
    Object.assign(event, eventData);0
0
    if (dispatchConfig.phasedRegistrationNames) {0
      EventPropagators.accumulateTwoPhaseDispatches(event);0
    } else {0
      EventPropagators.accumulateDirectDispatches(event);0
    }0
0
    ReactDOM.unstable_batchedUpdates(function() {0
      // Normally extractEvent enqueues a state restore, but we'll just always0
      // do that since we we're by-passing it here.0
      ReactControlledComponent.enqueueStateRestore(domNode);0
      EventPluginHub.runEventsInBatch(event, true);0
    });0
    ReactControlledComponent.restoreStateIfNeeded();0
  };0
}0
0
function buildSimulators() {0
  ReactTestUtils.Simulate = {};0
0
  let eventType;0
  for (eventType in EventPluginRegistry.eventNameDispatchConfigs) {0
    /**0
     * @param {!Element|ReactDOMComponent} domComponentOrNode0
     * @param {?object} eventData Fake event data to use in SyntheticEvent.0
     */0
    ReactTestUtils.Simulate[eventType] = makeSimulator(eventType);0
  }0
}0
0
// Rebuild ReactTestUtils.Simulate whenever event plugins are injected0
const oldInjectEventPluginOrder =0
  EventPluginHub.injection.injectEventPluginOrder;0
EventPluginHub.injection.injectEventPluginOrder = function() {0
  oldInjectEventPluginOrder.apply(this, arguments);0
  buildSimulators();0
};0
const oldInjectEventPlugins = EventPluginHub.injection.injectEventPluginsByName;0
EventPluginHub.injection.injectEventPluginsByName = function() {0
  oldInjectEventPlugins.apply(this, arguments);0
  buildSimulators();0
};0
0
buildSimulators();0
0
/**0
 * Exports:0
 *0
 * - `ReactTestUtils.SimulateNative.click(Element/ReactDOMComponent)`0
 * - `ReactTestUtils.SimulateNative.mouseMove(Element/ReactDOMComponent)`0
 * - `ReactTestUtils.SimulateNative.mouseIn/ReactDOMComponent)`0
 * - `ReactTestUtils.SimulateNative.mouseOut(Element/ReactDOMComponent)`0
 * - ... (All keys from `BrowserEventConstants.topLevelTypes`)0
 *0
 * Note: Top level event types are a subset of the entire set of handler types0
 * (which include a broader set of "synthetic" events). For example, onDragDone0
 * is a synthetic event. Except when testing an event plugin or React's event0
 * handling code specifically, you probably want to use ReactTestUtils.Simulate0
 * to dispatch synthetic events.0
 */0
0
function makeNativeSimulator(eventType, topLevelType) {0
  return function(domComponentOrNode, nativeEventData) {0
    const fakeNativeEvent = new Event(eventType);0
    Object.assign(fakeNativeEvent, nativeEventData);0
    if (ReactTestUtils.isDOMComponent(domComponentOrNode)) {0
      simulateNativeEventOnDOMComponent(0
        topLevelType,0
        domComponentOrNode,0
        fakeNativeEvent,0
      );0
    } else if (domComponentOrNode.tagName) {0
      // Will allow on actual dom nodes.0
      simulateNativeEventOnNode(0
        topLevelType,0
        domComponentOrNode,0
        fakeNativeEvent,0
      );0
    }0
  };0
}0
0
[0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ABORT, 'abort'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ANIMATION_END, 'animationEnd'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ANIMATION_ITERATION, 'animationIteration'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ANIMATION_START, 'animationStart'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_BLUR, 'blur'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CAN_PLAY_THROUGH, 'canPlayThrough'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CAN_PLAY, 'canPlay'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CANCEL, 'cancel'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CHANGE, 'change'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CLICK, 'click'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CLOSE, 'close'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_COMPOSITION_END, 'compositionEnd'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_COMPOSITION_START, 'compositionStart'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_COMPOSITION_UPDATE, 'compositionUpdate'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CONTEXT_MENU, 'contextMenu'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_COPY, 'copy'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_CUT, 'cut'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DOUBLE_CLICK, 'doubleClick'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG_END, 'dragEnd'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG_ENTER, 'dragEnter'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG_EXIT, 'dragExit'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG_LEAVE, 'dragLeave'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG_OVER, 'dragOver'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG_START, 'dragStart'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DRAG, 'drag'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DROP, 'drop'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_DURATION_CHANGE, 'durationChange'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_EMPTIED, 'emptied'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ENCRYPTED, 'encrypted'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ENDED, 'ended'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_ERROR, 'error'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_FOCUS, 'focus'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_INPUT, 'input'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_KEY_DOWN, 'keyDown'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_KEY_PRESS, 'keyPress'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_KEY_UP, 'keyUp'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_LOAD_START, 'loadStart'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_LOAD_START, 'loadStart'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_LOAD, 'load'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_LOADED_DATA, 'loadedData'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_LOADED_METADATA, 'loadedMetadata'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_MOUSE_DOWN, 'mouseDown'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_MOUSE_MOVE, 'mouseMove'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_MOUSE_OUT, 'mouseOut'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_MOUSE_OVER, 'mouseOver'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_MOUSE_UP, 'mouseUp'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_PASTE, 'paste'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_PAUSE, 'pause'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_PLAY, 'play'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_PLAYING, 'playing'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_PROGRESS, 'progress'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_RATE_CHANGE, 'rateChange'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_SCROLL, 'scroll'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_SEEKED, 'seeked'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_SEEKING, 'seeking'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_SELECTION_CHANGE, 'selectionChange'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_STALLED, 'stalled'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_SUSPEND, 'suspend'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TEXT_INPUT, 'textInput'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TIME_UPDATE, 'timeUpdate'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TOGGLE, 'toggle'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TOUCH_CANCEL, 'touchCancel'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TOUCH_END, 'touchEnd'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TOUCH_MOVE, 'touchMove'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TOUCH_START, 'touchStart'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_TRANSITION_END, 'transitionEnd'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_VOLUME_CHANGE, 'volumeChange'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_WAITING, 'waiting'],0
  [DOMTopLevelEventTypes.TOP_WHEEL, 'wheel'],0
].forEach(([topLevelType, eventType]) => {0
  /**0
   * @param {!Element|ReactDOMComponent} domComponentOrNode0
   * @param {?Event} nativeEventData Fake native event to use in SyntheticEvent.0
   */0
  ReactTestUtils.SimulateNative[eventType] = makeNativeSimulator(0
    eventType,0
    topLevelType,0
  );0
});0

  EventPluginUtils.injection.injectComponentTree;0

  ReactDOMComponentTree,0

'use strict';0
0
import {0
  REACT_ASYNC_MODE_TYPE,0
  REACT_CONTEXT_TYPE,0
  REACT_ELEMENT_TYPE,0
  REACT_FORWARD_REF_TYPE,0
  REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE,0
  REACT_PORTAL_TYPE,0
  REACT_PROFILER_TYPE,0
  REACT_PROVIDER_TYPE,0
  REACT_STRICT_MODE_TYPE,0
} from 'shared/ReactSymbols';0
import isValidElementType from 'shared/isValidElementType';0
0
export function typeOf(object: any) {0
  if (typeof object === 'object' && object !== null) {0
    const $$typeof = object.$$typeof;0
0
    switch ($$typeof) {0
      case REACT_ELEMENT_TYPE:0
        const type = object.type;0
0
        switch (type) {0
          case REACT_ASYNC_MODE_TYPE:0
          case REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE:0
          case REACT_PROFILER_TYPE:0
          case REACT_STRICT_MODE_TYPE:0
            return type;0
          default:0
            const $$typeofType = type && type.$$typeof;0
0
            switch ($$typeofType) {0
              case REACT_CONTEXT_TYPE:0
              case REACT_FORWARD_REF_TYPE:0
              case REACT_PROVIDER_TYPE:0
                return $$typeofType;0
              default:0
                return $$typeof;0
            }0
        }0
      case REACT_PORTAL_TYPE:0
        return $$typeof;0
    }0
  }0
0
  return undefined;0
}0
0
export const AsyncMode = REACT_ASYNC_MODE_TYPE;0
export const ContextConsumer = REACT_CONTEXT_TYPE;0
export const ContextProvider = REACT_PROVIDER_TYPE;0
export const Element = REACT_ELEMENT_TYPE;0
export const ForwardRef = REACT_FORWARD_REF_TYPE;0
export const Fragment = REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE;0
export const Profiler = REACT_PROFILER_TYPE;0
export const Portal = REACT_PORTAL_TYPE;0
export const StrictMode = REACT_STRICT_MODE_TYPE;0
0
export {isValidElementType};0
0
export function isAsyncMode(object: any) {0
  return typeOf(object) === REACT_ASYNC_MODE_TYPE;0
}0
export function isContextConsumer(object: any) {0
  return typeOf(object) === REACT_CONTEXT_TYPE;0
}0
export function isContextProvider(object: any) {0
  return typeOf(object) === REACT_PROVIDER_TYPE;0
}0
export function isElement(object: any) {0
  return (0
    typeof object === 'object' &&0
    object !== null &&0
    object.$$typeof === REACT_ELEMENT_TYPE0
  );0
}0
export function isForwardRef(object: any) {0
  return typeOf(object) === REACT_FORWARD_REF_TYPE;0
}0
export function isFragment(object: any) {0
  return typeOf(object) === REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE;0
}0
export function isProfiler(object: any) {0
  return typeOf(object) === REACT_PROFILER_TYPE;0
}0
export function isPortal(object: any) {0
  return typeOf(object) === REACT_PORTAL_TYPE;0
}0
export function isStrictMode(object: any) {0
  return typeOf(object) === REACT_STRICT_MODE_TYPE;0
}0
/**0

 * @emails react-core0

0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactDOM;0
let ReactIs;0
0
describe('ReactIs', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactDOM = require('react-dom');0
    ReactIs = require('react-is');0
  });0
0
  it('should return undefined for unknown/invalid types', () => {0
    expect(ReactIs.typeOf('abc')).toBe(undefined);0
    expect(ReactIs.typeOf(true)).toBe(undefined);0
    expect(ReactIs.typeOf(123)).toBe(undefined);0
    expect(ReactIs.typeOf({})).toBe(undefined);0
    expect(ReactIs.typeOf(null)).toBe(undefined);0
    expect(ReactIs.typeOf(undefined)).toBe(undefined);0
  });0
0
  it('identifies valid element types', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement('div');0
      }0
    }0
0
    const StatelessComponent = () => React.createElement('div');0
0
    const ForwardRefComponent = React.forwardRef((props, ref) =>0
      React.createElement(Component, {forwardedRef: ref, ...props}),0
    );0
0
    const Context = React.createContext(false);0
0
    expect(ReactIs.isValidElementType('div')).toEqual(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isValidElementType(Component)).toEqual(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isValidElementType(StatelessComponent)).toEqual(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isValidElementType(ForwardRefComponent)).toEqual(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isValidElementType(Context.Provider)).toEqual(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isValidElementType(Context.Consumer)).toEqual(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isValidElementType(React.createFactory('div'))).toEqual(0
      true,0
    );0
    expect(ReactIs.isValidElementType(React.Fragment)).toEqual(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isValidElementType(React.unstable_AsyncMode)).toEqual(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isValidElementType(React.StrictMode)).toEqual(true);0
0
    expect(ReactIs.isValidElementType(true)).toEqual(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isValidElementType(123)).toEqual(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isValidElementType({})).toEqual(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isValidElementType(null)).toEqual(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isValidElementType(undefined)).toEqual(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isValidElementType({type: 'div', props: {}})).toEqual(false);0
  });0
0
  it('should identify async mode', () => {0
    expect(ReactIs.typeOf(<React.unstable_AsyncMode />)).toBe(0
      ReactIs.AsyncMode,0
    );0
    expect(ReactIs.isAsyncMode(<React.unstable_AsyncMode />)).toBe(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isAsyncMode({type: ReactIs.AsyncMode})).toBe(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isAsyncMode(<React.StrictMode />)).toBe(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isAsyncMode(<div />)).toBe(false);0
  });0
0
  it('should identify context consumers', () => {0
    const Context = React.createContext(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.typeOf(<Context.Consumer />)).toBe(ReactIs.ContextConsumer);0
    expect(ReactIs.isContextConsumer(<Context.Consumer />)).toBe(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isContextConsumer(<Context.Provider />)).toBe(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isContextConsumer(<div />)).toBe(false);0
  });0
0
  it('should identify context providers', () => {0
    const Context = React.createContext(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.typeOf(<Context.Provider />)).toBe(ReactIs.ContextProvider);0
    expect(ReactIs.isContextProvider(<Context.Provider />)).toBe(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isContextProvider(<Context.Consumer />)).toBe(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isContextProvider(<div />)).toBe(false);0
  });0
0
  it('should identify elements', () => {0
    expect(ReactIs.typeOf(<div />)).toBe(ReactIs.Element);0
    expect(ReactIs.isElement(<div />)).toBe(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isElement('div')).toBe(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isElement(true)).toBe(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isElement(123)).toBe(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isElement(null)).toBe(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isElement(undefined)).toBe(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isElement({})).toBe(false);0
0
    // It should also identify more specific types as elements0
    const Context = React.createContext(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isElement(<Context.Provider />)).toBe(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isElement(<Context.Consumer />)).toBe(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isElement(<React.Fragment />)).toBe(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isElement(<React.unstable_AsyncMode />)).toBe(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isElement(<React.StrictMode />)).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('should identify ref forwarding component', () => {0
    const RefForwardingComponent = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => null);0
    expect(ReactIs.typeOf(<RefForwardingComponent />)).toBe(ReactIs.ForwardRef);0
    expect(ReactIs.isForwardRef(<RefForwardingComponent />)).toBe(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isForwardRef({type: ReactIs.StrictMode})).toBe(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isForwardRef(<React.unstable_AsyncMode />)).toBe(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isForwardRef(<div />)).toBe(false);0
  });0
0
  it('should identify fragments', () => {0
    expect(ReactIs.typeOf(<React.Fragment />)).toBe(ReactIs.Fragment);0
    expect(ReactIs.isFragment(<React.Fragment />)).toBe(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isFragment({type: ReactIs.Fragment})).toBe(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isFragment('React.Fragment')).toBe(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isFragment(<div />)).toBe(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isFragment([])).toBe(false);0
  });0
0
  it('should identify portals', () => {0
    const div = document.createElement('div');0
    const portal = ReactDOM.createPortal(<div />, div);0
    expect(ReactIs.typeOf(portal)).toBe(ReactIs.Portal);0
    expect(ReactIs.isPortal(portal)).toBe(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isPortal(div)).toBe(false);0
  });0
0
  it('should identify strict mode', () => {0
    expect(ReactIs.typeOf(<React.StrictMode />)).toBe(ReactIs.StrictMode);0
    expect(ReactIs.isStrictMode(<React.StrictMode />)).toBe(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isStrictMode({type: ReactIs.StrictMode})).toBe(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isStrictMode(<React.unstable_AsyncMode />)).toBe(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isStrictMode(<div />)).toBe(false);0
  });0
0
  it('should identify profile root', () => {0
    expect(0
      ReactIs.typeOf(<React.unstable_Profiler id="foo" onRender={jest.fn()} />),0
    ).toBe(ReactIs.Profiler);0
    expect(0
      ReactIs.isProfiler(0
        <React.unstable_Profiler id="foo" onRender={jest.fn()} />,0
      ),0
    ).toBe(true);0
    expect(ReactIs.isProfiler({type: ReactIs.unstable_Profiler})).toBe(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isProfiler(<React.unstable_AsyncMode />)).toBe(false);0
    expect(ReactIs.isProfiler(<div />)).toBe(false);0
  });0
});0

const ReactFabric = require('./src/ReactFabric');0
0
// TODO: decide on the top-level export form.0
// This is hacky but makes it work with both Rollup and Jest.0
module.exports = ReactFabric.default ? ReactFabric.default : ReactFabric;0

'use strict';0
0
const ReactNativeRenderer = require('./src/ReactNativeRenderer');0
0
// TODO: decide on the top-level export form.0
// This is hacky but makes it work with both Rollup and Jest.0
module.exports = ReactNativeRenderer.default0
  ? ReactNativeRenderer.default0
  : ReactNativeRenderer;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2015-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
