import type {0
  MeasureInWindowOnSuccessCallback,0
  MeasureLayoutOnSuccessCallback,0
  MeasureOnSuccessCallback,0
  NativeMethodsMixinType,0
  ReactNativeBaseComponentViewConfig,0
} from './ReactNativeTypes';0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
// Modules provided by RN:0
import TextInputState from 'TextInputState';0
import UIManager from 'UIManager';0
0
import * as ReactNativeAttributePayload from './ReactNativeAttributePayload';0
import {0
  mountSafeCallback,0
  throwOnStylesProp,0
  warnForStyleProps,0
} from './NativeMethodsMixinUtils';0
0
export default function(0
  findNodeHandle: any => ?number,0
  findHostInstance: any => any,0
) {0
  /**0
   * `NativeMethodsMixin` provides methods to access the underlying native0
   * component directly. This can be useful in cases when you want to focus0
   * a view or measure its on-screen dimensions, for example.0
   *0
   * The methods described here are available on most of the default components0
   * provided by React Native. Note, however, that they are *not* available on0
   * composite components that aren't directly backed by a native view. This will0
   * generally include most components that you define in your own app. For more0
   * information, see [Direct0
   * Manipulation](docs/direct-manipulation.html).0
   *0
   * Note the Flow $Exact<> syntax is required to support mixins.0
   * React createClass mixins can only be used with exact types.0
   */0
  const NativeMethodsMixin: $Exact<NativeMethodsMixinType> = {0
    /**0
     * Determines the location on screen, width, and height of the given view and0
     * returns the values via an async callback. If successful, the callback will0
     * be called with the following arguments:0
     *0
     *  - x0
     *  - y0
     *  - width0
     *  - height0
     *  - pageX0
     *  - pageY0
     *0
     * Note that these measurements are not available until after the rendering0
     * has been completed in native. If you need the measurements as soon as0
     * possible, consider using the [`onLayout`0
     * prop](docs/view.html#onlayout) instead.0
     */0
    measure: function(callback: MeasureOnSuccessCallback) {0
      UIManager.measure(0
        findNodeHandle(this),0
        mountSafeCallback(this, callback),0
      );0
    },0
0
    /**0
     * Determines the location of the given view in the window and returns the0
     * values via an async callback. If the React root view is embedded in0
     * another native view, this will give you the absolute coordinates. If0
     * successful, the callback will be called with the following0
     * arguments:0
     *0
     *  - x0
     *  - y0
     *  - width0
     *  - height0
     *0
     * Note that these measurements are not available until after the rendering0
     * has been completed in native.0
     */0
    measureInWindow: function(callback: MeasureInWindowOnSuccessCallback) {0
      UIManager.measureInWindow(0
        findNodeHandle(this),0
        mountSafeCallback(this, callback),0
      );0
    },0
0
    /**0
     * Like [`measure()`](#measure), but measures the view relative an ancestor,0
     * specified as `relativeToNativeNode`. This means that the returned x, y0
     * are relative to the origin x, y of the ancestor view.0
     *0
     * As always, to obtain a native node handle for a component, you can use0
     * `findNodeHandle(component)`.0
     */0
    measureLayout: function(0
      relativeToNativeNode: number,0
      onSuccess: MeasureLayoutOnSuccessCallback,0
      onFail: () => void /* currently unused */,0
    ) {0
      UIManager.measureLayout(0
        findNodeHandle(this),0
        relativeToNativeNode,0
        mountSafeCallback(this, onFail),0
        mountSafeCallback(this, onSuccess),0
      );0
    },0
0
    /**0
     * This function sends props straight to native. They will not participate in0
     * future diff process - this means that if you do not include them in the0
     * next render, they will remain active (see [Direct0
     * Manipulation](docs/direct-manipulation.html)).0
     */0
    setNativeProps: function(nativeProps: Object) {0
      // Class components don't have viewConfig -> validateAttributes.0
      // Nor does it make sense to set native props on a non-native component.0
      // Instead, find the nearest host component and set props on it.0
      // Use findNodeHandle() rather than findNodeHandle() because0
      // We want the instance/wrapper (not the native tag).0
      let maybeInstance;0
0
      // Fiber errors if findNodeHandle is called for an umounted component.0
      // Tests using ReactTestRenderer will trigger this case indirectly.0
      // Mimicking stack behavior, we should silently ignore this case.0
      // TODO Fix ReactTestRenderer so we can remove this try/catch.0
      try {0
        maybeInstance = findHostInstance(this);0
      } catch (error) {}0
0
      // If there is no host component beneath this we should fail silently.0
      // This is not an error; it could mean a class component rendered null.0
      if (maybeInstance == null) {0
        return;0
      }0
0
      const viewConfig: ReactNativeBaseComponentViewConfig =0
        maybeInstance.viewConfig;0
0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        warnForStyleProps(nativeProps, viewConfig.validAttributes);0
      }0
0
      const updatePayload = ReactNativeAttributePayload.create(0
        nativeProps,0
        viewConfig.validAttributes,0
      );0
0
      // Avoid the overhead of bridge calls if there's no update.0
      // This is an expensive no-op for Android, and causes an unnecessary0
      // view invalidation for certain components (eg RCTTextInput) on iOS.0
      if (updatePayload != null) {0
        UIManager.updateView(0
          maybeInstance._nativeTag,0
          viewConfig.uiViewClassName,0
          updatePayload,0
        );0
      }0
    },0
0
    /**0
     * Requests focus for the given input or view. The exact behavior triggered0
     * will depend on the platform and type of view.0
     */0
    focus: function() {0
      TextInputState.focusTextInput(findNodeHandle(this));0
    },0
0
    /**0
     * Removes focus from an input or view. This is the opposite of `focus()`.0
     */0
    blur: function() {0
      TextInputState.blurTextInput(findNodeHandle(this));0
    },0
  };0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    // hide this from Flow since we can't define these properties outside of0
    // __DEV__ without actually implementing them (setting them to undefined0
    // isn't allowed by ReactClass)0
    const NativeMethodsMixin_DEV = (NativeMethodsMixin: any);0
    invariant(0
      !NativeMethodsMixin_DEV.componentWillMount &&0
        !NativeMethodsMixin_DEV.componentWillReceiveProps &&0
        !NativeMethodsMixin_DEV.UNSAFE_componentWillMount &&0
        !NativeMethodsMixin_DEV.UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps,0
      'Do not override existing functions.',0
    );0
    // TODO (bvaughn) Remove cWM and cWRP in a future version of React Native,0
    // Once these lifecycles have been remove from the reconciler.0
    NativeMethodsMixin_DEV.componentWillMount = function() {0
      throwOnStylesProp(this, this.props);0
    };0
    NativeMethodsMixin_DEV.componentWillReceiveProps = function(newProps) {0
      throwOnStylesProp(this, newProps);0
    };0
    NativeMethodsMixin_DEV.UNSAFE_componentWillMount = function() {0
      throwOnStylesProp(this, this.props);0
    };0
    NativeMethodsMixin_DEV.UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps = function(0
      newProps,0
    ) {0
      throwOnStylesProp(this, newProps);0
    };0
0
    // React may warn about cWM/cWRP/cWU methods being deprecated.0
    // Add a flag to suppress these warnings for this special case.0
    // TODO (bvaughn) Remove this flag once the above methods have been removed.0
    NativeMethodsMixin_DEV.componentWillMount.__suppressDeprecationWarning = true;0
    NativeMethodsMixin_DEV.componentWillReceiveProps.__suppressDeprecationWarning = true;0
  }0
0
  return NativeMethodsMixin;0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2015-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
/**0
 * In the future, we should cleanup callbacks by cancelling them instead of0
 * using this.0
 */0
export function mountSafeCallback(context: any, callback: ?Function): any {0
  return function() {0
    if (!callback) {0
      return undefined;0
    }0
    if (typeof context.__isMounted === 'boolean') {0
      // TODO(gaearon): this is gross and should be removed.0
      // It is currently necessary because View uses createClass,0
      // and so any measure() calls on View (which are done by React0
      // DevTools) trigger the isMounted() deprecation warning.0
      if (!context.__isMounted) {0
        return undefined;0
      }0
      // The else branch is important so that we don't0
      // trigger the deprecation warning by calling isMounted.0
    } else if (typeof context.isMounted === 'function') {0
      if (!context.isMounted()) {0
        return undefined;0
      }0
    }0
    return callback.apply(context, arguments);0
  };0
}0
0
export function throwOnStylesProp(component: any, props: any) {0
  if (props.styles !== undefined) {0
    const owner = component._owner || null;0
    const name = component.constructor.displayName;0
    let msg =0
      '`styles` is not a supported property of `' +0
      name +0
      '`, did ' +0
      'you mean `style` (singular)?';0
    if (owner && owner.constructor && owner.constructor.displayName) {0
      msg +=0
        '\n\nCheck the `' +0
        owner.constructor.displayName +0
        '` parent ' +0
        ' component.';0
    }0
    throw new Error(msg);0
  }0
}0
0
export function warnForStyleProps(props: any, validAttributes: any) {0
  for (const key in validAttributes.style) {0
    if (!(validAttributes[key] || props[key] === undefined)) {0
      console.error(0
        'You are setting the style `{ ' +0
          key +0
          ': ... }` as a prop. You ' +0
          'should nest it in a style object. ' +0
          'E.g. `{ style: { ' +0
          key +0
          ': ... } }`',0
      );0
    }0
  }0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {ReactFabricType} from './ReactNativeTypes';0
import type {ReactNodeList} from 'shared/ReactTypes';0
0
import './ReactFabricInjection';0
0
import * as ReactFabricRenderer from 'react-reconciler/inline.fabric';0
0
import * as ReactPortal from 'shared/ReactPortal';0
import * as ReactGenericBatching from 'events/ReactGenericBatching';0
import ReactVersion from 'shared/ReactVersion';0
0
import NativeMethodsMixin from './NativeMethodsMixin';0
import ReactNativeComponent from './ReactNativeComponent';0
import * as ReactFabricComponentTree from './ReactFabricComponentTree';0
import {getInspectorDataForViewTag} from './ReactNativeFiberInspector';0
0
import {ReactCurrentOwner} from 'shared/ReactGlobalSharedState';0
import getComponentName from 'shared/getComponentName';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
const findHostInstance = ReactFabricRenderer.findHostInstance;0
0
function findNodeHandle(componentOrHandle: any): ?number {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const owner = ReactCurrentOwner.current;0
    if (owner !== null && owner.stateNode !== null) {0
      warning(0
        owner.stateNode._warnedAboutRefsInRender,0
        '%s is accessing findNodeHandle inside its render(). ' +0
          'render() should be a pure function of props and state. It should ' +0
          'never access something that requires stale data from the previous ' +0
          'render, such as refs. Move this logic to componentDidMount and ' +0
          'componentDidUpdate instead.',0
        getComponentName(owner) || 'A component',0
      );0
0
      owner.stateNode._warnedAboutRefsInRender = true;0
    }0
  }0
  if (componentOrHandle == null) {0
    return null;0
  }0
  if (typeof componentOrHandle === 'number') {0
    // Already a node handle0
    return componentOrHandle;0
  }0
  if (componentOrHandle._nativeTag) {0
    return componentOrHandle._nativeTag;0
  }0
  if (componentOrHandle.canonical && componentOrHandle.canonical._nativeTag) {0
    return componentOrHandle.canonical._nativeTag;0
  }0
  const hostInstance = findHostInstance(componentOrHandle);0
  if (hostInstance == null) {0
    return hostInstance;0
  }0
  // TODO: the code is right but the types here are wrong.0
  // https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/128630
  if ((hostInstance: any).canonical) {0
    // Fabric0
    return (hostInstance: any).canonical._nativeTag;0
  }0
  return hostInstance._nativeTag;0
}0
0
ReactGenericBatching.injection.injectRenderer(ReactFabricRenderer);0
0
const roots = new Map();0
0
const ReactFabric: ReactFabricType = {0
  NativeComponent: ReactNativeComponent(findNodeHandle, findHostInstance),0
0
  findNodeHandle,0
0
  render(element: React$Element<any>, containerTag: any, callback: ?Function) {0
    let root = roots.get(containerTag);0
0
    if (!root) {0
      // TODO (bvaughn): If we decide to keep the wrapper component,0
      // We could create a wrapper for containerTag as well to reduce special casing.0
      root = ReactFabricRenderer.createContainer(containerTag, false, false);0
      roots.set(containerTag, root);0
    }0
    ReactFabricRenderer.updateContainer(element, root, null, callback);0
0
    return ReactFabricRenderer.getPublicRootInstance(root);0
  },0
0
  unmountComponentAtNode(containerTag: number) {0
    const root = roots.get(containerTag);0
    if (root) {0
      // TODO: Is it safe to reset this now or should I wait since this unmount could be deferred?0
      ReactFabricRenderer.updateContainer(null, root, null, () => {0
        roots.delete(containerTag);0
      });0
    }0
  },0
0
  createPortal(0
    children: ReactNodeList,0
    containerTag: number,0
    key: ?string = null,0
  ) {0
    return ReactPortal.createPortal(children, containerTag, null, key);0
  },0
0
  __SECRET_INTERNALS_DO_NOT_USE_OR_YOU_WILL_BE_FIRED: {0
    // Used as a mixin in many createClass-based components0
    NativeMethodsMixin: NativeMethodsMixin(findNodeHandle, findHostInstance),0
  },0
};0
0
ReactFabricRenderer.injectIntoDevTools({0
  findFiberByHostInstance: ReactFabricComponentTree.getClosestInstanceFromNode,0
  getInspectorDataForViewTag: getInspectorDataForViewTag,0
  bundleType: __DEV__ ? 1 : 0,0
  version: ReactVersion,0
  rendererPackageName: 'react-native-renderer',0
});0
0
export default ReactFabric;0

export function dispatchEvent(0
  target: Object,0
  topLevelType: TopLevelType,0
  nativeEvent: AnyNativeEvent,0
) {0
  const targetFiber = (target: Fiber);0
  batchedUpdates(function() {0
    runExtractedEventsInBatch(0
      topLevelType,0
      targetFiber,0
      nativeEvent,0
      nativeEvent.target,0
    );0
  });0
  // React Native doesn't use ReactControlledComponent but if it did, here's0
  // where it would do it.0
}0

const ReactFabricGlobalResponderHandler = {0
  onChange: function(from: any, to: any, blockNativeResponder: boolean) {0
    if (to !== null) {0
      const tag = to.stateNode.canonical._nativeTag;0
      UIManager.setJSResponder(tag, blockNativeResponder);0
    } else {0
      UIManager.clearJSResponder();0
    }0
  },0
};0

// Counter for uniquely identifying views.0
// % 10 === 1 means it is a rootTag.0
// % 2 === 0 means it is a Fabric tag.0
// This means that they never overlap.0
let nextReactTag = 2;0
0
type Node = Object;0

  node: Node,0
  canonical: ReactFabricHostComponent,0
};0

  node: Node,0

  isInAParentText: boolean,0
|}>;0

   * Register the event emitter with the native bridge0

/**0
 * This is used for refs on host components.0
 */0
class ReactFabricHostComponent {0
  _nativeTag: number;0
  viewConfig: ReactNativeBaseComponentViewConfig;0
  currentProps: Props;0
0
  constructor(0
    tag: number,0
    viewConfig: ReactNativeBaseComponentViewConfig,0
    props: Props,0
  ) {0
    this._nativeTag = tag;0
    this.viewConfig = viewConfig;0
    this.currentProps = props;0
  }0
0
  blur() {0
    TextInputState.blurTextInput(this._nativeTag);0
  }0
0
  focus() {0
    TextInputState.focusTextInput(this._nativeTag);0
  }0
0
  measure(callback: MeasureOnSuccessCallback) {0
    UIManager.measure(this._nativeTag, mountSafeCallback(this, callback));0
  }0
0
  measureInWindow(callback: MeasureInWindowOnSuccessCallback) {0
    UIManager.measureInWindow(0
      this._nativeTag,0
      mountSafeCallback(this, callback),0
    );0
  }0
0
  measureLayout(0
    relativeToNativeNode: number,0
    onSuccess: MeasureLayoutOnSuccessCallback,0
    onFail: () => void /* currently unused */,0
  ) {0
    UIManager.measureLayout(0
      this._nativeTag,0
      relativeToNativeNode,0
      mountSafeCallback(this, onFail),0
      mountSafeCallback(this, onSuccess),0
    );0
  }0
0
  setNativeProps(nativeProps: Object) {0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      warnForStyleProps(nativeProps, this.viewConfig.validAttributes);0
    }0
0
    const updatePayload = ReactNativeAttributePayload.create(0
      nativeProps,0
      this.viewConfig.validAttributes,0
    );0
0
    // Avoid the overhead of bridge calls if there's no update.0
    // This is an expensive no-op for Android, and causes an unnecessary0
    // view invalidation for certain components (eg RCTTextInput) on iOS.0
    if (updatePayload != null) {0
      UIManager.updateView(0
        this._nativeTag,0
        this.viewConfig.uiViewClassName,0
        updatePayload,0
      );0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
// eslint-disable-next-line no-unused-expressions0
(ReactFabricHostComponent.prototype: NativeMethodsMixinType);0
0
export * from 'shared/HostConfigWithNoMutation';0
export * from 'shared/HostConfigWithNoHydration';0

export function appendInitialChild(0
  parentInstance: Instance,0
  child: Instance | TextInstance,0
): void {0
  appendChildNode(parentInstance.node, child.node);0
}0
0
export function createInstance(0
  type: string,0
  props: Props,0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
  hostContext: HostContext,0
  internalInstanceHandle: Object,0
): Instance {0
  const tag = nextReactTag;0
  nextReactTag += 2;0
0
  const viewConfig = ReactNativeViewConfigRegistry.get(type);0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    for (const key in viewConfig.validAttributes) {0
      if (props.hasOwnProperty(key)) {0
        deepFreezeAndThrowOnMutationInDev(props[key]);0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  invariant(0
    type !== 'RCTView' || !hostContext.isInAParentText,0
    'Nesting of <View> within <Text> is not currently supported.',0
  );0
0
  const updatePayload = ReactNativeAttributePayload.create(0
    props,0
    viewConfig.validAttributes,0
  );0
0
  const node = createNode(0
    tag, // reactTag0
    viewConfig.uiViewClassName, // viewName0
    rootContainerInstance, // rootTag0
    updatePayload, // props0
    internalInstanceHandle, // internalInstanceHandle0
  );0
0
  const component = new ReactFabricHostComponent(tag, viewConfig, props);0
0
  return {0
    node: node,0
    canonical: component,0
  };0
}0
0
export function createTextInstance(0
  text: string,0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
  hostContext: HostContext,0
  internalInstanceHandle: Object,0
): TextInstance {0
  invariant(0
    hostContext.isInAParentText,0
    'Text strings must be rendered within a <Text> component.',0
  );0
0
  const tag = nextReactTag;0
  nextReactTag += 2;0
0
  const node = createNode(0
    tag, // reactTag0
    'RCTRawText', // viewName0
    rootContainerInstance, // rootTag0
    {text: text}, // props0
    internalInstanceHandle, // instance handle0
  );0
0
  return {0
    node: node,0
  };0
}0
0
export function finalizeInitialChildren(0
  parentInstance: Instance,0
  type: string,0
  props: Props,0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
  hostContext: HostContext,0
): boolean {0
  return false;0
}0
0
export function getRootHostContext(0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
): HostContext {0
  return {isInAParentText: false};0
}0
0
export function getChildHostContext(0
  parentHostContext: HostContext,0
  type: string,0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
): HostContext {0
  const prevIsInAParentText = parentHostContext.isInAParentText;0
  const isInAParentText =0
    type === 'AndroidTextInput' || // Android0
    type === 'RCTMultilineTextInputView' || // iOS0
    type === 'RCTSinglelineTextInputView' || // iOS0
    type === 'RCTText' ||0
    type === 'RCTVirtualText';0
0
  if (prevIsInAParentText !== isInAParentText) {0
    return {isInAParentText};0
  } else {0
    return parentHostContext;0
  }0
}0
0
export function getPublicInstance(instance: Instance): * {0
  return instance.canonical;0
}0
0
export function prepareForCommit(containerInfo: Container): void {0
  // Noop0
}0
0
export function prepareUpdate(0
  instance: Instance,0
  type: string,0
  oldProps: Props,0
  newProps: Props,0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
  hostContext: HostContext,0
): null | Object {0
  const viewConfig = instance.canonical.viewConfig;0
  const updatePayload = ReactNativeAttributePayload.diff(0
    oldProps,0
    newProps,0
    viewConfig.validAttributes,0
  );0
  // TODO: If the event handlers have changed, we need to update the current props0
  // in the commit phase but there is no host config hook to do it yet.0
  // So instead we hack it by updating it in the render phase.0
  instance.canonical.currentProps = newProps;0
  return updatePayload;0
}0
0
export function resetAfterCommit(containerInfo: Container): void {0
  // Noop0
}0
0
export function shouldDeprioritizeSubtree(type: string, props: Props): boolean {0
  return false;0
}0
0
export function shouldSetTextContent(type: string, props: Props): boolean {0
  // TODO (bvaughn) Revisit this decision.0
  // Always returning false simplifies the createInstance() implementation,0
  // But creates an additional child Fiber for raw text children.0
  // No additional native views are created though.0
  // It's not clear to me which is better so I'm deferring for now.0
  // More context @ github.com/facebook/react/pull/8560#discussion_r921113030
  return false;0
}0

// The Fabric renderer is secondary to the existing React Native renderer.0
export const isPrimaryRenderer = false;0
export const now = ReactNativeFrameScheduling.now;0
export const scheduleDeferredCallback =0
  ReactNativeFrameScheduling.scheduleDeferredCallback;0
export const cancelDeferredCallback =0
  ReactNativeFrameScheduling.cancelDeferredCallback;0

//     Persistence0

export const supportsPersistence = true;0
0
export function cloneInstance(0
  instance: Instance,0
  updatePayload: null | Object,0
  type: string,0
  oldProps: Props,0
  newProps: Props,0
  internalInstanceHandle: Object,0
  keepChildren: boolean,0
  recyclableInstance: null | Instance,0
): Instance {0
  const node = instance.node;0
  let clone;0
  if (keepChildren) {0
    if (updatePayload !== null) {0
      clone = cloneNodeWithNewProps(0
        node,0
        updatePayload,0
        internalInstanceHandle,0
      );0
    } else {0
      clone = cloneNode(node, internalInstanceHandle);0
    }0
  } else {0
    if (updatePayload !== null) {0
      clone = cloneNodeWithNewChildrenAndProps(0
        node,0
        updatePayload,0
        internalInstanceHandle,0
      );0
    } else {0
      clone = cloneNodeWithNewChildren(node, internalInstanceHandle);0
    }0
  }0
  return {0
    node: clone,0
    canonical: instance.canonical,0
  };0
}0

  appendChildNodeToSet(childSet, child.node);0

  container: Container,0
  newChildren: ChildSet,0

  completeRoot(container, newChildren);0
}0

export function replaceContainerChildren(0
  container: Container,0
  newChildren: ChildSet,0
): void {}0

import './ReactNativeInjectionShared';0
0
import * as ReactFabricComponentTree from './ReactFabricComponentTree';0

import ResponderEventPlugin from 'events/ResponderEventPlugin';0
0

0
ResponderEventPlugin.injection.injectGlobalResponderHandler(0
  ReactFabricGlobalResponderHandler,0
);0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2015-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
// Modules provided by RN:0
import deepDiffer from 'deepDiffer';0
import flattenStyle from 'flattenStyle';0
0
const emptyObject = {};0
0
/**0
 * Create a payload that contains all the updates between two sets of props.0
 *0
 * These helpers are all encapsulated into a single module, because they use0
 * mutation as a performance optimization which leads to subtle shared0
 * dependencies between the code paths. To avoid this mutable state leaking0
 * across modules, I've kept them isolated to this module.0
 */0
0
type AttributeDiffer = (prevProp: mixed, nextProp: mixed) => boolean;0
type AttributePreprocessor = (nextProp: mixed) => mixed;0
0
type CustomAttributeConfiguration =0
  | {diff: AttributeDiffer, process: AttributePreprocessor}0
  | {diff: AttributeDiffer}0
  | {process: AttributePreprocessor};0
0
type AttributeConfiguration = {0
  [key: string]:0
    | CustomAttributeConfiguration0
    | AttributeConfiguration /*| boolean*/,0
};0
0
type NestedNode = Array<NestedNode> | Object;0
0
// Tracks removed keys0
let removedKeys = null;0
let removedKeyCount = 0;0
0
function defaultDiffer(prevProp: mixed, nextProp: mixed): boolean {0
  if (typeof nextProp !== 'object' || nextProp === null) {0
    // Scalars have already been checked for equality0
    return true;0
  } else {0
    // For objects and arrays, the default diffing algorithm is a deep compare0
    return deepDiffer(prevProp, nextProp);0
  }0
}0
0
function restoreDeletedValuesInNestedArray(0
  updatePayload: Object,0
  node: NestedNode,0
  validAttributes: AttributeConfiguration,0
) {0
  if (Array.isArray(node)) {0
    let i = node.length;0
    while (i-- && removedKeyCount > 0) {0
      restoreDeletedValuesInNestedArray(0
        updatePayload,0
        node[i],0
        validAttributes,0
      );0
    }0
  } else if (node && removedKeyCount > 0) {0
    const obj = node;0
    for (const propKey in removedKeys) {0
      if (!removedKeys[propKey]) {0
        continue;0
      }0
      let nextProp = obj[propKey];0
      if (nextProp === undefined) {0
        continue;0
      }0
0
      const attributeConfig = validAttributes[propKey];0
      if (!attributeConfig) {0
        continue; // not a valid native prop0
      }0
0
      if (typeof nextProp === 'function') {0
        nextProp = true;0
      }0
      if (typeof nextProp === 'undefined') {0
        nextProp = null;0
      }0
0
      if (typeof attributeConfig !== 'object') {0
        // case: !Object is the default case0
        updatePayload[propKey] = nextProp;0
      } else if (0
        typeof attributeConfig.diff === 'function' ||0
        typeof attributeConfig.process === 'function'0
      ) {0
        // case: CustomAttributeConfiguration0
        const nextValue =0
          typeof attributeConfig.process === 'function'0
            ? attributeConfig.process(nextProp)0
            : nextProp;0
        updatePayload[propKey] = nextValue;0
      }0
      removedKeys[propKey] = false;0
      removedKeyCount--;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function diffNestedArrayProperty(0
  updatePayload: null | Object,0
  prevArray: Array<NestedNode>,0
  nextArray: Array<NestedNode>,0
  validAttributes: AttributeConfiguration,0
): null | Object {0
  const minLength =0
    prevArray.length < nextArray.length ? prevArray.length : nextArray.length;0
  let i;0
  for (i = 0; i < minLength; i++) {0
    // Diff any items in the array in the forward direction. Repeated keys0
    // will be overwritten by later values.0
    updatePayload = diffNestedProperty(0
      updatePayload,0
      prevArray[i],0
      nextArray[i],0
      validAttributes,0
    );0
  }0
  for (; i < prevArray.length; i++) {0
    // Clear out all remaining properties.0
    updatePayload = clearNestedProperty(0
      updatePayload,0
      prevArray[i],0
      validAttributes,0
    );0
  }0
  for (; i < nextArray.length; i++) {0
    // Add all remaining properties.0
    updatePayload = addNestedProperty(0
      updatePayload,0
      nextArray[i],0
      validAttributes,0
    );0
  }0
  return updatePayload;0
}0
0
function diffNestedProperty(0
  updatePayload: null | Object,0
  prevProp: NestedNode,0
  nextProp: NestedNode,0
  validAttributes: AttributeConfiguration,0
): null | Object {0
  if (!updatePayload && prevProp === nextProp) {0
    // If no properties have been added, then we can bail out quickly on object0
    // equality.0
    return updatePayload;0
  }0
0
  if (!prevProp || !nextProp) {0
    if (nextProp) {0
      return addNestedProperty(updatePayload, nextProp, validAttributes);0
    }0
    if (prevProp) {0
      return clearNestedProperty(updatePayload, prevProp, validAttributes);0
    }0
    return updatePayload;0
  }0
0
  if (!Array.isArray(prevProp) && !Array.isArray(nextProp)) {0
    // Both are leaves, we can diff the leaves.0
    return diffProperties(updatePayload, prevProp, nextProp, validAttributes);0
  }0
0
  if (Array.isArray(prevProp) && Array.isArray(nextProp)) {0
    // Both are arrays, we can diff the arrays.0
    return diffNestedArrayProperty(0
      updatePayload,0
      prevProp,0
      nextProp,0
      validAttributes,0
    );0
  }0
0
  if (Array.isArray(prevProp)) {0
    return diffProperties(0
      updatePayload,0
      // $FlowFixMe - We know that this is always an object when the input is.0
      flattenStyle(prevProp),0
      // $FlowFixMe - We know that this isn't an array because of above flow.0
      nextProp,0
      validAttributes,0
    );0
  }0
0
  return diffProperties(0
    updatePayload,0
    prevProp,0
    // $FlowFixMe - We know that this is always an object when the input is.0
    flattenStyle(nextProp),0
    validAttributes,0
  );0
}0
0
/**0
 * addNestedProperty takes a single set of props and valid attribute0
 * attribute configurations. It processes each prop and adds it to the0
 * updatePayload.0
 */0
function addNestedProperty(0
  updatePayload: null | Object,0
  nextProp: NestedNode,0
  validAttributes: AttributeConfiguration,0
) {0
  if (!nextProp) {0
    return updatePayload;0
  }0
0
  if (!Array.isArray(nextProp)) {0
    // Add each property of the leaf.0
    return addProperties(updatePayload, nextProp, validAttributes);0
  }0
0
  for (let i = 0; i < nextProp.length; i++) {0
    // Add all the properties of the array.0
    updatePayload = addNestedProperty(0
      updatePayload,0
      nextProp[i],0
      validAttributes,0
    );0
  }0
0
  return updatePayload;0
}0
0
/**0
 * clearNestedProperty takes a single set of props and valid attributes. It0
 * adds a null sentinel to the updatePayload, for each prop key.0
 */0
function clearNestedProperty(0
  updatePayload: null | Object,0
  prevProp: NestedNode,0
  validAttributes: AttributeConfiguration,0
): null | Object {0
  if (!prevProp) {0
    return updatePayload;0
  }0
0
  if (!Array.isArray(prevProp)) {0
    // Add each property of the leaf.0
    return clearProperties(updatePayload, prevProp, validAttributes);0
  }0
0
  for (let i = 0; i < prevProp.length; i++) {0
    // Add all the properties of the array.0
    updatePayload = clearNestedProperty(0
      updatePayload,0
      prevProp[i],0
      validAttributes,0
    );0
  }0
  return updatePayload;0
}0
0
/**0
 * diffProperties takes two sets of props and a set of valid attributes0
 * and write to updatePayload the values that changed or were deleted.0
 * If no updatePayload is provided, a new one is created and returned if0
 * anything changed.0
 */0
function diffProperties(0
  updatePayload: null | Object,0
  prevProps: Object,0
  nextProps: Object,0
  validAttributes: AttributeConfiguration,0
): null | Object {0
  let attributeConfig: ?(CustomAttributeConfiguration | AttributeConfiguration);0
  let nextProp;0
  let prevProp;0
0
  for (const propKey in nextProps) {0
    attributeConfig = validAttributes[propKey];0
    if (!attributeConfig) {0
      continue; // not a valid native prop0
    }0
0
    prevProp = prevProps[propKey];0
    nextProp = nextProps[propKey];0
0
    // functions are converted to booleans as markers that the associated0
    // events should be sent from native.0
    if (typeof nextProp === 'function') {0
      nextProp = (true: any);0
      // If nextProp is not a function, then don't bother changing prevProp0
      // since nextProp will win and go into the updatePayload regardless.0
      if (typeof prevProp === 'function') {0
        prevProp = (true: any);0
      }0
    }0
0
    // An explicit value of undefined is treated as a null because it overrides0
    // any other preceding value.0
    if (typeof nextProp === 'undefined') {0
      nextProp = (null: any);0
      if (typeof prevProp === 'undefined') {0
        prevProp = (null: any);0
      }0
    }0
0
    if (removedKeys) {0
      removedKeys[propKey] = false;0
    }0
0
    if (updatePayload && updatePayload[propKey] !== undefined) {0
      // Something else already triggered an update to this key because another0
      // value diffed. Since we're now later in the nested arrays our value is0
      // more important so we need to calculate it and override the existing0
      // value. It doesn't matter if nothing changed, we'll set it anyway.0
0
      // Pattern match on: attributeConfig0
      if (typeof attributeConfig !== 'object') {0
        // case: !Object is the default case0
        updatePayload[propKey] = nextProp;0
      } else if (0
        typeof attributeConfig.diff === 'function' ||0
        typeof attributeConfig.process === 'function'0
      ) {0
        // case: CustomAttributeConfiguration0
        const nextValue =0
          typeof attributeConfig.process === 'function'0
            ? attributeConfig.process(nextProp)0
            : nextProp;0
        updatePayload[propKey] = nextValue;0
      }0
      continue;0
    }0
0
    if (prevProp === nextProp) {0
      continue; // nothing changed0
    }0
0
    // Pattern match on: attributeConfig0
    if (typeof attributeConfig !== 'object') {0
      // case: !Object is the default case0
      if (defaultDiffer(prevProp, nextProp)) {0
        // a normal leaf has changed0
        (updatePayload || (updatePayload = {}))[propKey] = nextProp;0
      }0
    } else if (0
      typeof attributeConfig.diff === 'function' ||0
      typeof attributeConfig.process === 'function'0
    ) {0
      // case: CustomAttributeConfiguration0
      const shouldUpdate =0
        prevProp === undefined ||0
        (typeof attributeConfig.diff === 'function'0
          ? attributeConfig.diff(prevProp, nextProp)0
          : defaultDiffer(prevProp, nextProp));0
      if (shouldUpdate) {0
        const nextValue =0
          typeof attributeConfig.process === 'function'0
            ? attributeConfig.process(nextProp)0
            : nextProp;0
        (updatePayload || (updatePayload = {}))[propKey] = nextValue;0
      }0
    } else {0
      // default: fallthrough case when nested properties are defined0
      removedKeys = null;0
      removedKeyCount = 0;0
      // We think that attributeConfig is not CustomAttributeConfiguration at0
      // this point so we assume it must be AttributeConfiguration.0
      updatePayload = diffNestedProperty(0
        updatePayload,0
        prevProp,0
        nextProp,0
        ((attributeConfig: any): AttributeConfiguration),0
      );0
      if (removedKeyCount > 0 && updatePayload) {0
        restoreDeletedValuesInNestedArray(0
          updatePayload,0
          nextProp,0
          ((attributeConfig: any): AttributeConfiguration),0
        );0
        removedKeys = null;0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  // Also iterate through all the previous props to catch any that have been0
  // removed and make sure native gets the signal so it can reset them to the0
  // default.0
  for (const propKey in prevProps) {0
    if (nextProps[propKey] !== undefined) {0
      continue; // we've already covered this key in the previous pass0
    }0
    attributeConfig = validAttributes[propKey];0
    if (!attributeConfig) {0
      continue; // not a valid native prop0
    }0
0
    if (updatePayload && updatePayload[propKey] !== undefined) {0
      // This was already updated to a diff result earlier.0
      continue;0
    }0
0
    prevProp = prevProps[propKey];0
    if (prevProp === undefined) {0
      continue; // was already empty anyway0
    }0
    // Pattern match on: attributeConfig0
    if (0
      typeof attributeConfig !== 'object' ||0
      typeof attributeConfig.diff === 'function' ||0
      typeof attributeConfig.process === 'function'0
    ) {0
      // case: CustomAttributeConfiguration | !Object0
      // Flag the leaf property for removal by sending a sentinel.0
      (updatePayload || (updatePayload = {}))[propKey] = null;0
      if (!removedKeys) {0
        removedKeys = {};0
      }0
      if (!removedKeys[propKey]) {0
        removedKeys[propKey] = true;0
        removedKeyCount++;0
      }0
    } else {0
      // default:0
      // This is a nested attribute configuration where all the properties0
      // were removed so we need to go through and clear out all of them.0
      updatePayload = clearNestedProperty(0
        updatePayload,0
        prevProp,0
        ((attributeConfig: any): AttributeConfiguration),0
      );0
    }0
  }0
  return updatePayload;0
}0
0
/**0
 * addProperties adds all the valid props to the payload after being processed.0
 */0
function addProperties(0
  updatePayload: null | Object,0
  props: Object,0
  validAttributes: AttributeConfiguration,0
): null | Object {0
  // TODO: Fast path0
  return diffProperties(updatePayload, emptyObject, props, validAttributes);0
}0
0
/**0
 * clearProperties clears all the previous props by adding a null sentinel0
 * to the payload for each valid key.0
 */0
function clearProperties(0
  updatePayload: null | Object,0
  prevProps: Object,0
  validAttributes: AttributeConfiguration,0
): null | Object {0
  // TODO: Fast path0
  return diffProperties(updatePayload, prevProps, emptyObject, validAttributes);0
}0
0
export function create(0
  props: Object,0
  validAttributes: AttributeConfiguration,0
): null | Object {0
  return addProperties(0
    null, // updatePayload0
    props,0
    validAttributes,0
  );0
}0
0
export function diff(0
  prevProps: Object,0
  nextProps: Object,0
  validAttributes: AttributeConfiguration,0
): null | Object {0
  return diffProperties(0
    null, // updatePayload0
    prevProps,0
    nextProps,0
    validAttributes,0
  );0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2015-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {AnyNativeEvent} from 'events/PluginModuleType';0
import {0
  accumulateTwoPhaseDispatches,0
  accumulateDirectDispatches,0
} from 'events/EventPropagators';0
import type {TopLevelType} from 'events/TopLevelEventTypes';0
import * as ReactNativeViewConfigRegistry from 'ReactNativeViewConfigRegistry';0
import SyntheticEvent from 'events/SyntheticEvent';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
const {0
  customBubblingEventTypes,0
  customDirectEventTypes,0
  eventTypes,0
} = ReactNativeViewConfigRegistry;0
0
const ReactNativeBridgeEventPlugin = {0
  eventTypes: eventTypes,0
0
  /**0
   * @see {EventPluginHub.extractEvents}0
   */0
  extractEvents: function(0
    topLevelType: TopLevelType,0
    targetInst: Object,0
    nativeEvent: AnyNativeEvent,0
    nativeEventTarget: Object,0
  ): ?Object {0
    if (targetInst == null) {0
      // Probably a node belonging to another renderer's tree.0
      return null;0
    }0
    const bubbleDispatchConfig = customBubblingEventTypes[topLevelType];0
    const directDispatchConfig = customDirectEventTypes[topLevelType];0
    invariant(0
      bubbleDispatchConfig || directDispatchConfig,0
      'Unsupported top level event type "%s" dispatched',0
      topLevelType,0
    );0
    const event = SyntheticEvent.getPooled(0
      bubbleDispatchConfig || directDispatchConfig,0
      targetInst,0
      nativeEvent,0
      nativeEventTarget,0
    );0
    if (bubbleDispatchConfig) {0
      accumulateTwoPhaseDispatches(event);0
    } else if (directDispatchConfig) {0
      accumulateDirectDispatches(event);0
    } else {0
      return null;0
    }0
    return event;0
  },0
};0
0
export default ReactNativeBridgeEventPlugin;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 * @format0
 */0
0
import type {0
  MeasureInWindowOnSuccessCallback,0
  MeasureLayoutOnSuccessCallback,0
  MeasureOnSuccessCallback,0
  NativeMethodsMixinType,0
  ReactNativeBaseComponentViewConfig,0
} from './ReactNativeTypes';0
0
import React from 'react';0
// Modules provided by RN:0
import TextInputState from 'TextInputState';0
import UIManager from 'UIManager';0
0
import * as ReactNativeAttributePayload from './ReactNativeAttributePayload';0
import {mountSafeCallback} from './NativeMethodsMixinUtils';0
0
export default function(0
  findNodeHandle: any => ?number,0
  findHostInstance: any => any,0
) {0
  /**0
   * Superclass that provides methods to access the underlying native component.0
   * This can be useful when you want to focus a view or measure its dimensions.0
   *0
   * Methods implemented by this class are available on most default components0
   * provided by React Native. However, they are *not* available on composite0
   * components that are not directly backed by a native view. For more0
   * information, see [Direct Manipulation](docs/direct-manipulation.html).0
   *0
   * @abstract0
   */0
  class ReactNativeComponent<Props, State = void> extends React.Component<0
    Props,0
    State,0
  > {0
    /**0
     * Due to bugs in Flow's handling of React.createClass, some fields already0
     * declared in the base class need to be redeclared below.0
     */0
    props: Props;0
    state: State;0
0
    /**0
     * Removes focus. This is the opposite of `focus()`.0
     */0
    blur(): void {0
      TextInputState.blurTextInput(findNodeHandle(this));0
    }0
0
    /**0
     * Requests focus. The exact behavior depends on the platform and view.0
     */0
    focus(): void {0
      TextInputState.focusTextInput(findNodeHandle(this));0
    }0
0
    /**0
     * Measures the on-screen location and dimensions. If successful, the callback0
     * will be called asynchronously with the following arguments:0
     *0
     *  - x0
     *  - y0
     *  - width0
     *  - height0
     *  - pageX0
     *  - pageY0
     *0
     * These values are not available until after natives rendering completes. If0
     * you need the measurements as soon as possible, consider using the0
     * [`onLayout` prop](docs/view.html#onlayout) instead.0
     */0
    measure(callback: MeasureOnSuccessCallback): void {0
      UIManager.measure(0
        findNodeHandle(this),0
        mountSafeCallback(this, callback),0
      );0
    }0
0
    /**0
     * Measures the on-screen location and dimensions. Even if the React Native0
     * root view is embedded within another native view, this method will give you0
     * the absolute coordinates measured from the window. If successful, the0
     * callback will be called asynchronously with the following arguments:0
     *0
     *  - x0
     *  - y0
     *  - width0
     *  - height0
     *0
     * These values are not available until after natives rendering completes.0
     */0
    measureInWindow(callback: MeasureInWindowOnSuccessCallback): void {0
      UIManager.measureInWindow(0
        findNodeHandle(this),0
        mountSafeCallback(this, callback),0
      );0
    }0
0
    /**0
     * Similar to [`measure()`](#measure), but the resulting location will be0
     * relative to the supplied ancestor's location.0
     *0
     * Obtain a native node handle with `ReactNative.findNodeHandle(component)`.0
     */0
    measureLayout(0
      relativeToNativeNode: number,0
      onSuccess: MeasureLayoutOnSuccessCallback,0
      onFail: () => void /* currently unused */,0
    ): void {0
      UIManager.measureLayout(0
        findNodeHandle(this),0
        relativeToNativeNode,0
        mountSafeCallback(this, onFail),0
        mountSafeCallback(this, onSuccess),0
      );0
    }0
0
    /**0
     * This function sends props straight to native. They will not participate in0
     * future diff process - this means that if you do not include them in the0
     * next render, they will remain active (see [Direct0
     * Manipulation](docs/direct-manipulation.html)).0
     */0
    setNativeProps(nativeProps: Object): void {0
      // Class components don't have viewConfig -> validateAttributes.0
      // Nor does it make sense to set native props on a non-native component.0
      // Instead, find the nearest host component and set props on it.0
      // Use findNodeHandle() rather than ReactNative.findNodeHandle() because0
      // We want the instance/wrapper (not the native tag).0
      let maybeInstance;0
0
      // Fiber errors if findNodeHandle is called for an umounted component.0
      // Tests using ReactTestRenderer will trigger this case indirectly.0
      // Mimicking stack behavior, we should silently ignore this case.0
      // TODO Fix ReactTestRenderer so we can remove this try/catch.0
      try {0
        maybeInstance = findHostInstance(this);0
      } catch (error) {}0
0
      // If there is no host component beneath this we should fail silently.0
      // This is not an error; it could mean a class component rendered null.0
      if (maybeInstance == null) {0
        return;0
      }0
0
      const viewConfig: ReactNativeBaseComponentViewConfig =0
        maybeInstance.viewConfig || maybeInstance.canonical.viewConfig;0
0
      const updatePayload = ReactNativeAttributePayload.create(0
        nativeProps,0
        viewConfig.validAttributes,0
      );0
0
      // Avoid the overhead of bridge calls if there's no update.0
      // This is an expensive no-op for Android, and causes an unnecessary0
      // view invalidation for certain components (eg RCTTextInput) on iOS.0
      if (updatePayload != null) {0
        UIManager.updateView(0
          maybeInstance._nativeTag,0
          viewConfig.uiViewClassName,0
          updatePayload,0
        );0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  // eslint-disable-next-line no-unused-expressions0
  (ReactNativeComponent.prototype: NativeMethodsMixinType);0
0
  return ReactNativeComponent;0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
const instanceCache = {};0
const instanceProps = {};0
0
export function precacheFiberNode(hostInst, tag) {0
  instanceCache[tag] = hostInst;0
}0
0
export function uncacheFiberNode(tag) {0
  delete instanceCache[tag];0
  delete instanceProps[tag];0
}0
0
function getInstanceFromTag(tag) {0
  return instanceCache[tag] || null;0
}0
0
function getTagFromInstance(inst) {0
  let tag = inst.stateNode._nativeTag;0
  if (tag === undefined) {0
    tag = inst.stateNode.canonical._nativeTag;0
  }0
  invariant(tag, 'All native instances should have a tag.');0
  return tag;0
}0
0
export {0
  getInstanceFromTag as getClosestInstanceFromNode,0
  getInstanceFromTag as getInstanceFromNode,0
  getTagFromInstance as getNodeFromInstance,0
};0
0
export function getFiberCurrentPropsFromNode(stateNode) {0
  return instanceProps[stateNode._nativeTag] || null;0
}0
0
export function updateFiberProps(tag, props) {0
  instanceProps[tag] = props;0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2015-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0

import {getListener, runExtractedEventsInBatch} from 'events/EventPluginHub';0
import {registrationNameModules} from 'events/EventPluginRegistry';0
import {batchedUpdates} from 'events/ReactGenericBatching';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
import {getInstanceFromNode} from './ReactNativeComponentTree';0
0
import type {AnyNativeEvent} from 'events/PluginModuleType';0
import type {TopLevelType} from 'events/TopLevelEventTypes';0
0
export {getListener, registrationNameModules as registrationNames};0
0
/**0
 * Version of `ReactBrowserEventEmitter` that works on the receiving side of a0
 * serialized worker boundary.0
 */0
0
// Shared default empty native event - conserve memory.0
const EMPTY_NATIVE_EVENT = (({}: any): AnyNativeEvent);0
0
/**0
 * Selects a subsequence of `Touch`es, without destroying `touches`.0
 *0
 * @param {Array<Touch>} touches Deserialized touch objects.0
 * @param {Array<number>} indices Indices by which to pull subsequence.0
 * @return {Array<Touch>} Subsequence of touch objects.0
 */0
const touchSubsequence = function(touches, indices) {0
  const ret = [];0
  for (let i = 0; i < indices.length; i++) {0
    ret.push(touches[indices[i]]);0
  }0
  return ret;0
};0
0
/**0
 * TODO: Pool all of this.0
 *0
 * Destroys `touches` by removing touch objects at indices `indices`. This is0
 * to maintain compatibility with W3C touch "end" events, where the active0
 * touches don't include the set that has just been "ended".0
 *0
 * @param {Array<Touch>} touches Deserialized touch objects.0
 * @param {Array<number>} indices Indices to remove from `touches`.0
 * @return {Array<Touch>} Subsequence of removed touch objects.0
 */0
const removeTouchesAtIndices = function(0
  touches: Array<Object>,0
  indices: Array<number>,0
): Array<Object> {0
  const rippedOut = [];0
  // use an unsafe downcast to alias to nullable elements,0
  // so we can delete and then compact.0
  const temp: Array<?Object> = (touches: Array<any>);0
  for (let i = 0; i < indices.length; i++) {0
    const index = indices[i];0
    rippedOut.push(touches[index]);0
    temp[index] = null;0
  }0
  let fillAt = 0;0
  for (let j = 0; j < temp.length; j++) {0
    const cur = temp[j];0
    if (cur !== null) {0
      temp[fillAt++] = cur;0
    }0
  }0
  temp.length = fillAt;0
  return rippedOut;0
};0
0
/**0
 * Internal version of `receiveEvent` in terms of normalized (non-tag)0
 * `rootNodeID`.0
 *0
 * @see receiveEvent.0
 *0
 * @param {rootNodeID} rootNodeID React root node ID that event occurred on.0
 * @param {TopLevelType} topLevelType Top level type of event.0
 * @param {?object} nativeEventParam Object passed from native.0
 */0
export function _receiveRootNodeIDEvent(0
  rootNodeID: number,0
  topLevelType: TopLevelType,0
  nativeEventParam: ?AnyNativeEvent,0
) {0
  const nativeEvent = nativeEventParam || EMPTY_NATIVE_EVENT;0
  const inst = getInstanceFromNode(rootNodeID);0
  batchedUpdates(function() {0
    runExtractedEventsInBatch(0
      topLevelType,0
      inst,0
      nativeEvent,0
      nativeEvent.target,0
    );0
  });0
  // React Native doesn't use ReactControlledComponent but if it did, here's0
  // where it would do it.0
}0
0
/**0
 * Publicly exposed method on module for native objc to invoke when a top0
 * level event is extracted.0
 * @param {rootNodeID} rootNodeID React root node ID that event occurred on.0
 * @param {TopLevelType} topLevelType Top level type of event.0
 * @param {object} nativeEventParam Object passed from native.0
 */0
export function receiveEvent(0
  rootNodeID: number,0
  topLevelType: TopLevelType,0
  nativeEventParam: AnyNativeEvent,0
) {0
  _receiveRootNodeIDEvent(rootNodeID, topLevelType, nativeEventParam);0
}0
0
/**0
 * Simple multi-wrapper around `receiveEvent` that is intended to receive an0
 * efficient representation of `Touch` objects, and other information that0
 * can be used to construct W3C compliant `Event` and `Touch` lists.0
 *0
 * This may create dispatch behavior that differs than web touch handling. We0
 * loop through each of the changed touches and receive it as a single event.0
 * So two `touchStart`/`touchMove`s that occur simultaneously are received as0
 * two separate touch event dispatches - when they arguably should be one.0
 *0
 * This implementation reuses the `Touch` objects themselves as the `Event`s0
 * since we dispatch an event for each touch (though that might not be spec0
 * compliant). The main purpose of reusing them is to save allocations.0
 *0
 * TODO: Dispatch multiple changed touches in one event. The bubble path0
 * could be the first common ancestor of all the `changedTouches`.0
 *0
 * One difference between this behavior and W3C spec: cancelled touches will0
 * not appear in `.touches`, or in any future `.touches`, though they may0
 * still be "actively touching the surface".0
 *0
 * Web desktop polyfills only need to construct a fake touch event with0
 * identifier 0, also abandoning traditional click handlers.0
 */0
export function receiveTouches(0
  eventTopLevelType: TopLevelType,0
  touches: Array<Object>,0
  changedIndices: Array<number>,0
) {0
  const changedTouches =0
    eventTopLevelType === 'topTouchEnd' ||0
    eventTopLevelType === 'topTouchCancel'0
      ? removeTouchesAtIndices(touches, changedIndices)0
      : touchSubsequence(touches, changedIndices);0
0
  for (let jj = 0; jj < changedTouches.length; jj++) {0
    const touch = changedTouches[jj];0
    // Touch objects can fulfill the role of `DOM` `Event` objects if we set0
    // the `changedTouches`/`touches`. This saves allocations.0
    touch.changedTouches = changedTouches;0
    touch.touches = touches;0
    const nativeEvent = touch;0
    let rootNodeID = null;0
    const target = nativeEvent.target;0
    if (target !== null && target !== undefined) {0
      if (target < 1) {0
        if (__DEV__) {0
          warning(0
            false,0
            'A view is reporting that a touch occurred on tag zero.',0
          );0
        }0
      } else {0
        rootNodeID = target;0
      }0
    }0
    // $FlowFixMe Shouldn't we *not* call it if rootNodeID is null?0
    _receiveRootNodeIDEvent(rootNodeID, eventTopLevelType, nativeEvent);0
  }0
}0

 * Copyright (c) 2015-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
const ReactNativeEventPluginOrder = [0
  'ResponderEventPlugin',0
  'ReactNativeBridgeEventPlugin',0
];0
0
export default ReactNativeEventPluginOrder;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0

import type {0
  MeasureInWindowOnSuccessCallback,0
  MeasureLayoutOnSuccessCallback,0
  MeasureOnSuccessCallback,0
  NativeMethodsMixinType,0
  ReactNativeBaseComponentViewConfig,0
} from './ReactNativeTypes';0
import type {Instance} from './ReactNativeHostConfig';0
0
// Modules provided by RN:0
import TextInputState from 'TextInputState';0
import UIManager from 'UIManager';0
0
import * as ReactNativeAttributePayload from './ReactNativeAttributePayload';0
import {mountSafeCallback, warnForStyleProps} from './NativeMethodsMixinUtils';0
0
/**0
 * This component defines the same methods as NativeMethodsMixin but without the0
 * findNodeHandle wrapper. This wrapper is unnecessary for HostComponent views0
 * and would also result in a circular require.js dependency (since0
 * ReactNativeFiber depends on this component and NativeMethodsMixin depends on0
 * ReactNativeFiber).0
 */0
class ReactNativeFiberHostComponent {0
  _children: Array<Instance | number>;0
  _nativeTag: number;0
  viewConfig: ReactNativeBaseComponentViewConfig;0
0
  constructor(tag: number, viewConfig: ReactNativeBaseComponentViewConfig) {0
    this._nativeTag = tag;0
    this._children = [];0
    this.viewConfig = viewConfig;0
  }0
0
  blur() {0
    TextInputState.blurTextInput(this._nativeTag);0
  }0
0
  focus() {0
    TextInputState.focusTextInput(this._nativeTag);0
  }0
0
  measure(callback: MeasureOnSuccessCallback) {0
    UIManager.measure(this._nativeTag, mountSafeCallback(this, callback));0
  }0
0
  measureInWindow(callback: MeasureInWindowOnSuccessCallback) {0
    UIManager.measureInWindow(0
      this._nativeTag,0
      mountSafeCallback(this, callback),0
    );0
  }0
0
  measureLayout(0
    relativeToNativeNode: number,0
    onSuccess: MeasureLayoutOnSuccessCallback,0
    onFail: () => void /* currently unused */,0
  ) {0
    UIManager.measureLayout(0
      this._nativeTag,0
      relativeToNativeNode,0
      mountSafeCallback(this, onFail),0
      mountSafeCallback(this, onSuccess),0
    );0
  }0
0
  setNativeProps(nativeProps: Object) {0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      warnForStyleProps(nativeProps, this.viewConfig.validAttributes);0
    }0
0
    const updatePayload = ReactNativeAttributePayload.create(0
      nativeProps,0
      this.viewConfig.validAttributes,0
    );0
0
    // Avoid the overhead of bridge calls if there's no update.0
    // This is an expensive no-op for Android, and causes an unnecessary0
    // view invalidation for certain components (eg RCTTextInput) on iOS.0
    if (updatePayload != null) {0
      UIManager.updateView(0
        this._nativeTag,0
        this.viewConfig.uiViewClassName,0
        updatePayload,0
      );0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
// eslint-disable-next-line no-unused-expressions0
(ReactNativeFiberHostComponent.prototype: NativeMethodsMixinType);0
0
export default ReactNativeFiberHostComponent;0

 */0

import type {Fiber} from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiber';0
0
import {0
  findCurrentHostFiber,0
  findCurrentFiberUsingSlowPath,0
} from 'react-reconciler/reflection';0
import getComponentName from 'shared/getComponentName';0
import {HostComponent} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfWork';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
// Module provided by RN:0
import UIManager from 'UIManager';0
0
import {getClosestInstanceFromNode} from './ReactNativeComponentTree';0
0
const emptyObject = {};0
if (__DEV__) {0
  Object.freeze(emptyObject);0
}0
0
let getInspectorDataForViewTag;0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  const traverseOwnerTreeUp = function(hierarchy, instance: any) {0
    if (instance) {0
      hierarchy.unshift(instance);0
      traverseOwnerTreeUp(hierarchy, instance._debugOwner);0
    }0
  };0
0
  const getOwnerHierarchy = function(instance: any) {0
    const hierarchy = [];0
    traverseOwnerTreeUp(hierarchy, instance);0
    return hierarchy;0
  };0
0
  const lastNonHostInstance = function(hierarchy) {0
    for (let i = hierarchy.length - 1; i > 1; i--) {0
      const instance = hierarchy[i];0
0
      if (instance.tag !== HostComponent) {0
        return instance;0
      }0
    }0
    return hierarchy[0];0
  };0
0
  const getHostProps = function(fiber) {0
    const host = findCurrentHostFiber(fiber);0
    if (host) {0
      return host.memoizedProps || emptyObject;0
    }0
    return emptyObject;0
  };0
0
  const getHostNode = function(fiber: Fiber | null, findNodeHandle) {0
    let hostNode;0
    // look for children first for the hostNode0
    // as composite fibers do not have a hostNode0
    while (fiber) {0
      if (fiber.stateNode !== null && fiber.tag === HostComponent) {0
        hostNode = findNodeHandle(fiber.stateNode);0
      }0
      if (hostNode) {0
        return hostNode;0
      }0
      fiber = fiber.child;0
    }0
    return null;0
  };0
0
  const createHierarchy = function(fiberHierarchy) {0
    return fiberHierarchy.map(fiber => ({0
      name: getComponentName(fiber),0
      getInspectorData: findNodeHandle => ({0
        measure: callback =>0
          UIManager.measure(getHostNode(fiber, findNodeHandle), callback),0
        props: getHostProps(fiber),0
        source: fiber._debugSource,0
      }),0
    }));0
  };0
0
  getInspectorDataForViewTag = function(viewTag: number): Object {0
    const closestInstance = getClosestInstanceFromNode(viewTag);0
0
    // Handle case where user clicks outside of ReactNative0
    if (!closestInstance) {0
      return {0
        hierarchy: [],0
        props: emptyObject,0
        selection: null,0
        source: null,0
      };0
    }0
0
    const fiber = findCurrentFiberUsingSlowPath(closestInstance);0
    const fiberHierarchy = getOwnerHierarchy(fiber);0
    const instance = lastNonHostInstance(fiberHierarchy);0
    const hierarchy = createHierarchy(fiberHierarchy);0
    const props = getHostProps(instance);0
    const source = instance._debugSource;0
    const selection = fiberHierarchy.indexOf(instance);0
0
    return {0
      hierarchy,0
      props,0
      selection,0
      source,0
    };0
  };0
} else {0
  getInspectorDataForViewTag = () => {0
    invariant(0
      false,0
      'getInspectorDataForViewTag() is not available in production',0
    );0
  };0
}0
0
export {getInspectorDataForViewTag};0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0

 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {Deadline} from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiberScheduler';0
0
const hasNativePerformanceNow =0
  typeof performance === 'object' && typeof performance.now === 'function';0
0
const now = hasNativePerformanceNow0
  ? () => performance.now()0
  : () => Date.now();0
0
type Callback = (deadline: Deadline) => void;0
0
let scheduledCallback: Callback | null = null;0
let frameDeadline: number = 0;0
0
const frameDeadlineObject: Deadline = {0
  timeRemaining: () => frameDeadline - now(),0
  didTimeout: false,0
};0
0
function setTimeoutCallback() {0
  // TODO (bvaughn) Hard-coded 5ms unblocks initial async testing.0
  // React API probably changing to boolean rather than time remaining.0
  // Longer-term plan is to rewrite this using shared memory,0
  // And just return the value of the bit as the boolean.0
  frameDeadline = now() + 5;0
0
  const callback = scheduledCallback;0
  scheduledCallback = null;0
  if (callback !== null) {0
    callback(frameDeadlineObject);0
  }0
}0
0
// RN has a poor polyfill for requestIdleCallback so we aren't using it.0
// This implementation is only intended for short-term use anyway.0
// We also don't implement cancel functionality b'c Fiber doesn't currently need it.0
function scheduleDeferredCallback(0
  callback: Callback,0
  options?: {timeout: number},0
): number {0
  // We assume only one callback is scheduled at a time b'c that's how Fiber works.0
  scheduledCallback = callback;0
  const timeoutId = setTimeout(setTimeoutCallback, 1);0
  return (timeoutId: any); // Timeouts are always numbers on RN0
}0
0
function cancelDeferredCallback(callbackID: number) {0
  scheduledCallback = null;0
  clearTimeout((callbackID: any)); // Timeouts are always numbers on RN0
}0
0
export {now, scheduleDeferredCallback, cancelDeferredCallback};0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2015-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
// Module provided by RN:0
import UIManager from 'UIManager';0
0
const ReactNativeGlobalResponderHandler = {0
  onChange: function(from: any, to: any, blockNativeResponder: boolean) {0
    if (to !== null) {0
      const tag = to.stateNode._nativeTag;0
      UIManager.setJSResponder(tag, blockNativeResponder);0
    } else {0
      UIManager.clearJSResponder();0
    }0
  },0
};0
0
export default ReactNativeGlobalResponderHandler;0

import type {ReactNativeBaseComponentViewConfig} from './ReactNativeTypes';0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
// Modules provided by RN:0
import UIManager from 'UIManager';0
import deepFreezeAndThrowOnMutationInDev from 'deepFreezeAndThrowOnMutationInDev';0
0
import * as ReactNativeViewConfigRegistry from 'ReactNativeViewConfigRegistry';0
import * as ReactNativeAttributePayload from './ReactNativeAttributePayload';0
import {0
  precacheFiberNode,0
  uncacheFiberNode,0
  updateFiberProps,0
} from './ReactNativeComponentTree';0
import ReactNativeFiberHostComponent from './ReactNativeFiberHostComponent';0
import * as ReactNativeFrameScheduling from './ReactNativeFrameScheduling';0
0
export type Type = string;0
export type Props = Object;0
export type Container = number;0
export type Instance = {0
  _children: Array<Instance | number>,0
  _nativeTag: number,0
  viewConfig: ReactNativeBaseComponentViewConfig,0
};0
export type TextInstance = number;0
export type HydratableInstance = Instance | TextInstance;0
export type PublicInstance = Instance;0
export type HostContext = $ReadOnly<{|0
  isInAParentText: boolean,0
|}>;0
export type UpdatePayload = Object; // Unused0
export type ChildSet = void; // Unused0
0
const UPDATE_SIGNAL = {};0
if (__DEV__) {0
  Object.freeze(UPDATE_SIGNAL);0
}0
0
// Counter for uniquely identifying views.0
// % 10 === 1 means it is a rootTag.0
// % 2 === 0 means it is a Fabric tag.0
let nextReactTag = 3;0
function allocateTag() {0
  let tag = nextReactTag;0
  if (tag % 10 === 1) {0
    tag += 2;0
  }0
  nextReactTag = tag + 2;0
  return tag;0
}0
0
function recursivelyUncacheFiberNode(node: Instance | TextInstance) {0
  if (typeof node === 'number') {0
    // Leaf node (eg text)0
    uncacheFiberNode(node);0
  } else {0
    uncacheFiberNode((node: any)._nativeTag);0
0
    (node: any)._children.forEach(recursivelyUncacheFiberNode);0
  }0
}0
0
export * from 'shared/HostConfigWithNoPersistence';0
export * from 'shared/HostConfigWithNoHydration';0
0
export function appendInitialChild(0
  parentInstance: Instance,0
  child: Instance | TextInstance,0
): void {0
  parentInstance._children.push(child);0
}0
0
export function createInstance(0
  type: string,0
  props: Props,0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
  hostContext: HostContext,0
  internalInstanceHandle: Object,0
): Instance {0
  const tag = allocateTag();0
  const viewConfig = ReactNativeViewConfigRegistry.get(type);0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    for (const key in viewConfig.validAttributes) {0
      if (props.hasOwnProperty(key)) {0
        deepFreezeAndThrowOnMutationInDev(props[key]);0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  invariant(0
    type !== 'RCTView' || !hostContext.isInAParentText,0
    'Nesting of <View> within <Text> is not currently supported.',0
  );0
0
  const updatePayload = ReactNativeAttributePayload.create(0
    props,0
    viewConfig.validAttributes,0
  );0
0
  UIManager.createView(0
    tag, // reactTag0
    viewConfig.uiViewClassName, // viewName0
    rootContainerInstance, // rootTag0
    updatePayload, // props0
  );0
0
  const component = new ReactNativeFiberHostComponent(tag, viewConfig);0
0
  precacheFiberNode(internalInstanceHandle, tag);0
  updateFiberProps(tag, props);0
0
  // Not sure how to avoid this cast. Flow is okay if the component is defined0
  // in the same file but if it's external it can't see the types.0
  return ((component: any): Instance);0
}0
0
export function createTextInstance(0
  text: string,0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
  hostContext: HostContext,0
  internalInstanceHandle: Object,0
): TextInstance {0
  invariant(0
    hostContext.isInAParentText,0
    'Text strings must be rendered within a <Text> component.',0
  );0
0
  const tag = allocateTag();0
0
  UIManager.createView(0
    tag, // reactTag0
    'RCTRawText', // viewName0
    rootContainerInstance, // rootTag0
    {text: text}, // props0
  );0
0
  precacheFiberNode(internalInstanceHandle, tag);0
0
  return tag;0
}0
0
export function finalizeInitialChildren(0
  parentInstance: Instance,0
  type: string,0
  props: Props,0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
  hostContext: HostContext,0
): boolean {0
  // Don't send a no-op message over the bridge.0
  if (parentInstance._children.length === 0) {0
    return false;0
  }0
0
  // Map from child objects to native tags.0
  // Either way we need to pass a copy of the Array to prevent it from being frozen.0
  const nativeTags = parentInstance._children.map(0
    child =>0
      typeof child === 'number'0
        ? child // Leaf node (eg text)0
        : child._nativeTag,0
  );0
0
  UIManager.setChildren(0
    parentInstance._nativeTag, // containerTag0
    nativeTags, // reactTags0
  );0
0
  return false;0
}0
0
export function getRootHostContext(0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
): HostContext {0
  return {isInAParentText: false};0
}0
0
export function getChildHostContext(0
  parentHostContext: HostContext,0
  type: string,0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
): HostContext {0
  const prevIsInAParentText = parentHostContext.isInAParentText;0
  const isInAParentText =0
    type === 'AndroidTextInput' || // Android0
    type === 'RCTMultilineTextInputView' || // iOS0
    type === 'RCTSinglelineTextInputView' || // iOS0
    type === 'RCTText' ||0
    type === 'RCTVirtualText';0
0
  if (prevIsInAParentText !== isInAParentText) {0
    return {isInAParentText};0
  } else {0
    return parentHostContext;0
  }0
}0
0
export function getPublicInstance(instance: Instance): * {0
  return instance;0
}0

export function prepareForCommit(containerInfo: Container): void {0
  // Noop0
}0

  instance: Instance,0
  type: string,0
  oldProps: Props,0
  newProps: Props,0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
  hostContext: HostContext,0
): null | Object {0
  return UPDATE_SIGNAL;0
}0

export function resetAfterCommit(containerInfo: Container): void {0
  // Noop0
}0

export const now = ReactNativeFrameScheduling.now;0
export const isPrimaryRenderer = true;0

  ReactNativeFrameScheduling.scheduleDeferredCallback;0
export const cancelDeferredCallback =0
  ReactNativeFrameScheduling.cancelDeferredCallback;0
0
export function shouldDeprioritizeSubtree(type: string, props: Props): boolean {0
  return false;0
}0
0
export function shouldSetTextContent(type: string, props: Props): boolean {0
  // TODO (bvaughn) Revisit this decision.0
  // Always returning false simplifies the createInstance() implementation,0
  // But creates an additional child Fiber for raw text children.0
  // No additional native views are created though.0
  // It's not clear to me which is better so I'm deferring for now.0
  // More context @ github.com/facebook/react/pull/8560#discussion_r921113030
  return false;0
}0

export const supportsMutation = true;0
0
export function appendChild(0
  parentInstance: Instance,0
  child: Instance | TextInstance,0
): void {0
  const childTag = typeof child === 'number' ? child : child._nativeTag;0
  const children = parentInstance._children;0
  const index = children.indexOf(child);0
0
  if (index >= 0) {0
    children.splice(index, 1);0
    children.push(child);0
0
    UIManager.manageChildren(0
      parentInstance._nativeTag, // containerTag0
      [index], // moveFromIndices0
      [children.length - 1], // moveToIndices0
      [], // addChildReactTags0
      [], // addAtIndices0
      [], // removeAtIndices0
    );0
  } else {0
    children.push(child);0
0
    UIManager.manageChildren(0
      parentInstance._nativeTag, // containerTag0
      [], // moveFromIndices0
      [], // moveToIndices0
      [childTag], // addChildReactTags0
      [children.length - 1], // addAtIndices0
      [], // removeAtIndices0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export function appendChildToContainer(0
  parentInstance: Container,0
  child: Instance | TextInstance,0
): void {0
  const childTag = typeof child === 'number' ? child : child._nativeTag;0
  UIManager.setChildren(0
    parentInstance, // containerTag0
    [childTag], // reactTags0
  );0
}0
0
export function commitTextUpdate(0
  textInstance: TextInstance,0
  oldText: string,0
  newText: string,0
): void {0
  UIManager.updateView(0
    textInstance, // reactTag0
    'RCTRawText', // viewName0
    {text: newText}, // props0
  );0
}0
0
export function commitMount(0
  instance: Instance,0
  type: string,0
  newProps: Props,0
  internalInstanceHandle: Object,0
): void {0
  // Noop0
}0
0
export function commitUpdate(0
  instance: Instance,0
  updatePayloadTODO: Object,0
  type: string,0
  oldProps: Props,0
  newProps: Props,0
  internalInstanceHandle: Object,0
): void {0
  const viewConfig = instance.viewConfig;0
0
  updateFiberProps(instance._nativeTag, newProps);0
0
  const updatePayload = ReactNativeAttributePayload.diff(0
    oldProps,0
    newProps,0
    viewConfig.validAttributes,0
  );0
0
  // Avoid the overhead of bridge calls if there's no update.0
  // This is an expensive no-op for Android, and causes an unnecessary0
  // view invalidation for certain components (eg RCTTextInput) on iOS.0
  if (updatePayload != null) {0
    UIManager.updateView(0
      instance._nativeTag, // reactTag0
      viewConfig.uiViewClassName, // viewName0
      updatePayload, // props0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export function insertBefore(0
  parentInstance: Instance,0
  child: Instance | TextInstance,0
  beforeChild: Instance | TextInstance,0
): void {0
  const children = (parentInstance: any)._children;0
  const index = children.indexOf(child);0
0
  // Move existing child or add new child?0
  if (index >= 0) {0
    children.splice(index, 1);0
    const beforeChildIndex = children.indexOf(beforeChild);0
    children.splice(beforeChildIndex, 0, child);0
0
    UIManager.manageChildren(0
      (parentInstance: any)._nativeTag, // containerID0
      [index], // moveFromIndices0
      [beforeChildIndex], // moveToIndices0
      [], // addChildReactTags0
      [], // addAtIndices0
      [], // removeAtIndices0
    );0
  } else {0
    const beforeChildIndex = children.indexOf(beforeChild);0
    children.splice(beforeChildIndex, 0, child);0
0
    const childTag = typeof child === 'number' ? child : child._nativeTag;0
0
    UIManager.manageChildren(0
      (parentInstance: any)._nativeTag, // containerID0
      [], // moveFromIndices0
      [], // moveToIndices0
      [childTag], // addChildReactTags0
      [beforeChildIndex], // addAtIndices0
      [], // removeAtIndices0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export function insertInContainerBefore(0
  parentInstance: Container,0
  child: Instance | TextInstance,0
  beforeChild: Instance | TextInstance,0
): void {0
  // TODO (bvaughn): Remove this check when...0
  // We create a wrapper object for the container in ReactNative render()0
  // Or we refactor to remove wrapper objects entirely.0
  // For more info on pros/cons see PR #8560 description.0
  invariant(0
    typeof parentInstance !== 'number',0
    'Container does not support insertBefore operation',0
  );0
}0
0
export function removeChild(0
  parentInstance: Instance,0
  child: Instance | TextInstance,0
): void {0
  recursivelyUncacheFiberNode(child);0
  const children = parentInstance._children;0
  const index = children.indexOf(child);0
0
  children.splice(index, 1);0
0
  UIManager.manageChildren(0
    parentInstance._nativeTag, // containerID0
    [], // moveFromIndices0
    [], // moveToIndices0
    [], // addChildReactTags0
    [], // addAtIndices0
    [index], // removeAtIndices0
  );0
}0
0
export function removeChildFromContainer(0
  parentInstance: Container,0
  child: Instance | TextInstance,0
): void {0
  recursivelyUncacheFiberNode(child);0
  UIManager.manageChildren(0
    parentInstance, // containerID0
    [], // moveFromIndices0
    [], // moveToIndices0
    [], // addChildReactTags0
    [], // addAtIndices0
    [0], // removeAtIndices0
  );0
}0
0
export function resetTextContent(instance: Instance): void {0
  // Noop0
}0

/**0
 * Make sure essential globals are available and are patched correctly. Please don't remove this0
 * line. Bundles created by react-packager `require` it before executing any application code. This0
 * ensures it exists in the dependency graph and can be `require`d.0
 * TODO: require this in packager, not in React #109325170
 */0

import type {ReactNativeType} from './ReactNativeTypes';0
import type {ReactNodeList} from 'shared/ReactTypes';0
0
import './ReactNativeInjection';0
0
import * as ReactNativeFiberRenderer from 'react-reconciler/inline.native';0
import * as ReactPortal from 'shared/ReactPortal';0
import * as ReactGenericBatching from 'events/ReactGenericBatching';0
import ReactVersion from 'shared/ReactVersion';0
// Module provided by RN:0
import UIManager from 'UIManager';0
0
import {getStackAddendumByWorkInProgressFiber} from 'shared/ReactFiberComponentTreeHook';0
0
import NativeMethodsMixin from './NativeMethodsMixin';0
import ReactNativeComponent from './ReactNativeComponent';0
import * as ReactNativeComponentTree from './ReactNativeComponentTree';0
import {getInspectorDataForViewTag} from './ReactNativeFiberInspector';0
