import {ReactCurrentOwner} from 'shared/ReactGlobalSharedState';0
import getComponentName from 'shared/getComponentName';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
const findHostInstance = ReactNativeFiberRenderer.findHostInstance;0
0
function findNodeHandle(componentOrHandle: any): ?number {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const owner = ReactCurrentOwner.current;0
    if (owner !== null && owner.stateNode !== null) {0
      warning(0
        owner.stateNode._warnedAboutRefsInRender,0
        '%s is accessing findNodeHandle inside its render(). ' +0
          'render() should be a pure function of props and state. It should ' +0
          'never access something that requires stale data from the previous ' +0
          'render, such as refs. Move this logic to componentDidMount and ' +0
          'componentDidUpdate instead.',0
        getComponentName(owner) || 'A component',0
      );0
0
      owner.stateNode._warnedAboutRefsInRender = true;0
    }0
  }0
  if (componentOrHandle == null) {0
    return null;0
  }0
  if (typeof componentOrHandle === 'number') {0
    // Already a node handle0
    return componentOrHandle;0
  }0
  if (componentOrHandle._nativeTag) {0
    return componentOrHandle._nativeTag;0
  }0
  if (componentOrHandle.canonical && componentOrHandle.canonical._nativeTag) {0
    return componentOrHandle.canonical._nativeTag;0
  }0
  const hostInstance = findHostInstance(componentOrHandle);0
  if (hostInstance == null) {0
    return hostInstance;0
  }0
  if ((hostInstance: any).canonical) {0
    // Fabric0
    return (hostInstance: any).canonical._nativeTag;0
  }0
  return hostInstance._nativeTag;0
}0
0
ReactGenericBatching.injection.injectRenderer(ReactNativeFiberRenderer);0
0
function computeComponentStackForErrorReporting(reactTag: number): string {0
  let fiber = ReactNativeComponentTree.getClosestInstanceFromNode(reactTag);0
  if (!fiber) {0
    return '';0
  }0
  return getStackAddendumByWorkInProgressFiber(fiber);0
}0
0
const roots = new Map();0
0
const ReactNativeRenderer: ReactNativeType = {0
  NativeComponent: ReactNativeComponent(findNodeHandle, findHostInstance),0
0
  findNodeHandle,0
0
  render(element: React$Element<any>, containerTag: any, callback: ?Function) {0
    let root = roots.get(containerTag);0
0
    if (!root) {0
      // TODO (bvaughn): If we decide to keep the wrapper component,0
      // We could create a wrapper for containerTag as well to reduce special casing.0
      root = ReactNativeFiberRenderer.createContainer(0
        containerTag,0
        false,0
        false,0
      );0
      roots.set(containerTag, root);0
    }0
    ReactNativeFiberRenderer.updateContainer(element, root, null, callback);0
0
    return ReactNativeFiberRenderer.getPublicRootInstance(root);0
  },0
0
  unmountComponentAtNode(containerTag: number) {0
    const root = roots.get(containerTag);0
    if (root) {0
      // TODO: Is it safe to reset this now or should I wait since this unmount could be deferred?0
      ReactNativeFiberRenderer.updateContainer(null, root, null, () => {0
        roots.delete(containerTag);0
      });0
    }0
  },0
0
  unmountComponentAtNodeAndRemoveContainer(containerTag: number) {0
    ReactNativeRenderer.unmountComponentAtNode(containerTag);0
0
    // Call back into native to remove all of the subviews from this container0
    UIManager.removeRootView(containerTag);0
  },0
0
  createPortal(0
    children: ReactNodeList,0
    containerTag: number,0
    key: ?string = null,0
  ) {0
    return ReactPortal.createPortal(children, containerTag, null, key);0
  },0
0
  unstable_batchedUpdates: ReactGenericBatching.batchedUpdates,0
0
  __SECRET_INTERNALS_DO_NOT_USE_OR_YOU_WILL_BE_FIRED: {0
    // Used as a mixin in many createClass-based components0
    NativeMethodsMixin: NativeMethodsMixin(findNodeHandle, findHostInstance),0
    computeComponentStackForErrorReporting,0
  },0
};0
0
ReactNativeFiberRenderer.injectIntoDevTools({0
  findFiberByHostInstance: ReactNativeComponentTree.getClosestInstanceFromNode,0
  getInspectorDataForViewTag: getInspectorDataForViewTag,0
  bundleType: __DEV__ ? 1 : 0,0
  version: ReactVersion,0
  rendererPackageName: 'react-native-renderer',0
});0
0
export default ReactNativeRenderer;0

export type MeasureOnSuccessCallback = (0
  x: number,0
  y: number,0
  width: number,0
  height: number,0
  pageX: number,0
  pageY: number,0
) => void;0
0
export type MeasureInWindowOnSuccessCallback = (0
  x: number,0
  y: number,0
  width: number,0
  height: number,0
) => void;0
0
export type MeasureLayoutOnSuccessCallback = (0
  left: number,0
  top: number,0
  width: number,0
  height: number,0
) => void;0
0
type BubblingEventType = {0
  phasedRegistrationNames: {0
    captured: string,0
    bubbled: string,0
  },0
};0

type DirectEventType = {0
  registrationName: string,0
};0

  validAttributes: Object,0
  uiViewClassName: string,0
  bubblingEventTypes?: {[topLevelType: string]: BubblingEventType},0
  directEventTypes?: {[topLevelType: string]: DirectEventType},0
  propTypes?: Object,0
};0

/**0
 * Class only exists for its Flow type.0
 */0
class ReactNativeComponent<Props> extends React.Component<Props> {0
  blur(): void {}0
  focus(): void {}0
  measure(callback: MeasureOnSuccessCallback): void {}0
  measureInWindow(callback: MeasureInWindowOnSuccessCallback): void {}0
  measureLayout(0
    relativeToNativeNode: number,0
    onSuccess: MeasureLayoutOnSuccessCallback,0
    onFail?: () => void,0
  ): void {}0
  setNativeProps(nativeProps: Object): void {}0
}0
0
/**0
 * This type keeps ReactNativeFiberHostComponent and NativeMethodsMixin in sync.0
 * It can also provide types for ReactNative applications that use NMM or refs.0
 */0
export type NativeMethodsMixinType = {0
  blur(): void,0
  focus(): void,0
  measure(callback: MeasureOnSuccessCallback): void,0
  measureInWindow(callback: MeasureInWindowOnSuccessCallback): void,0
  measureLayout(0
    relativeToNativeNode: number,0
    onSuccess: MeasureLayoutOnSuccessCallback,0
    onFail: () => void,0
  ): void,0
  setNativeProps(nativeProps: Object): void,0
};0

 */0
export type ReactNativeType = {0
  NativeComponent: typeof ReactNativeComponent,0
  findNodeHandle(componentOrHandle: any): ?number,0
  render(0
    element: React$Element<any>,0
    containerTag: any,0
    callback: ?Function,0
  ): any,0
  unmountComponentAtNode(containerTag: number): any,0
  unmountComponentAtNodeAndRemoveContainer(containerTag: number): any,0
  unstable_batchedUpdates: any, // TODO (bvaughn) Add types0

  __SECRET_INTERNALS_DO_NOT_USE_OR_YOU_WILL_BE_FIRED: SecretInternalsType,0
};0

  ): any,0

'use strict';0
0
// TODO: Move deepDiffer into react0
0
const deepDiffer = function(one: any, two: any): boolean {0
  if (one === two) {0
    // Short circuit on identical object references instead of traversing them.0
    return false;0
  }0
  if (typeof one === 'function' && typeof two === 'function') {0
    // We consider all functions equal0
    return false;0
  }0
  if (typeof one !== 'object' || one === null) {0
    // Primitives can be directly compared0
    return one !== two;0
  }0
  if (typeof two !== 'object' || two === null) {0
    // We know they are different because the previous case would have triggered0
    // otherwise.0
    return true;0
  }0
  if (one.constructor !== two.constructor) {0
    return true;0
  }0
  if (Array.isArray(one)) {0
    // We know two is also an array because the constructors are equal0
    const len = one.length;0
    if (two.length !== len) {0
      return true;0
    }0
    for (let ii = 0; ii < len; ii++) {0
      if (deepDiffer(one[ii], two[ii])) {0
        return true;0
      }0
    }0
  } else {0
    for (const key in one) {0
      if (deepDiffer(one[key], two[key])) {0
        return true;0
      }0
    }0
    for (const twoKey in two) {0
      // The only case we haven't checked yet is keys that are in two but aren't0
      // in one, which means they are different.0
      if (one[twoKey] === undefined && two[twoKey] !== undefined) {0
        return true;0
      }0
    }0
  }0
  return false;0
};0
0
module.exports = deepDiffer;0
/**0

 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0

'use strict';0

// Mock of the Native Hooks0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
const roots = new Map();0
const allocatedTags = new Set();0
0
function dumpSubtree(info, indent) {0
  let out = '';0
  out += ' '.repeat(indent) + info.viewName + ' ' + JSON.stringify(info.props);0
  // eslint-disable-next-line no-for-of-loops/no-for-of-loops0
  for (const child of info.children) {0
    out += '\n' + dumpSubtree(child, indent + 2);0
  }0
  return out;0
}0
0
const RCTFabricUIManager = {0
  __dumpChildSetForJestTestsOnly: function(childSet) {0
    let result = [];0
    // eslint-disable-next-line no-for-of-loops/no-for-of-loops0
    for (const child of childSet) {0
      result.push(dumpSubtree(child, 0));0
    }0
    return result.join('\n');0
  },0
  __dumpHierarchyForJestTestsOnly: function() {0
    let result = [];0
    // eslint-disable-next-line no-for-of-loops/no-for-of-loops0
    for (const [rootTag, childSet] of roots) {0
      result.push(rootTag);0
      // eslint-disable-next-line no-for-of-loops/no-for-of-loops0
      for (const child of childSet) {0
        result.push(dumpSubtree(child, 1));0
      }0
    }0
    return result.join('\n');0
  },0
  createNode: jest.fn(function createNode(0
    reactTag,0
    viewName,0
    rootTag,0
    props,0
    instanceHandle,0
  ) {0
    invariant(0
      !allocatedTags.has(reactTag),0
      'Created two native views with tag %s',0
      reactTag,0
    );0
    allocatedTags.add(reactTag);0
    return {0
      reactTag: reactTag,0
      viewName: viewName,0
      props: props,0
      children: [],0
    };0
  }),0
  cloneNode: jest.fn(function cloneNode(node, instanceHandle) {0
    return {0
      reactTag: node.reactTag,0
      viewName: node.viewName,0
      props: node.props,0
      children: node.children,0
    };0
  }),0
  cloneNodeWithNewChildren: jest.fn(function cloneNodeWithNewChildren(0
    node,0
    instanceHandle,0
  ) {0
    return {0
      reactTag: node.reactTag,0
      viewName: node.viewName,0
      props: node.props,0
      children: [],0
    };0
  }),0
  cloneNodeWithNewProps: jest.fn(function cloneNodeWithNewProps(0
    node,0
    newPropsDiff,0
    instanceHandle,0
  ) {0
    return {0
      reactTag: node.reactTag,0
      viewName: node.viewName,0
      props: {...node.props, ...newPropsDiff},0
      children: node.children,0
    };0
  }),0
  cloneNodeWithNewChildrenAndProps: jest.fn(0
    function cloneNodeWithNewChildrenAndProps(0
      node,0
      newPropsDiff,0
      instanceHandle,0
    ) {0
      return {0
        reactTag: node.reactTag,0
        viewName: node.viewName,0
        props: {...node.props, ...newPropsDiff},0
        children: [],0
      };0
    },0
  ),0
  appendChild: jest.fn(function appendChild(parentNode, childNode) {0
    parentNode.children.push(childNode);0
  }),0
0
  createChildSet: jest.fn(function createChildSet() {0
    return [];0
  }),0
0
  appendChildToSet: jest.fn(function appendChildToSet(childSet, childNode) {0
    childSet.push(childNode);0
  }),0
0
  completeRoot: jest.fn(function completeRoot(rootTag, newChildSet) {0
    roots.set(rootTag, newChildSet);0
  }),0
0
  registerEventHandler: jest.fn(function registerEventHandler(callback) {}),0
};0
0
module.exports = RCTFabricUIManager;0

'use strict';0
0
import type {0
  ReactNativeBaseComponentViewConfig,0
  ViewConfigGetter,0
} from './ReactNativeTypes';0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
// Event configs0
const customBubblingEventTypes = {};0
const customDirectEventTypes = {};0
const eventTypes = {};0
0
exports.customBubblingEventTypes = customBubblingEventTypes;0
exports.customDirectEventTypes = customDirectEventTypes;0
exports.eventTypes = eventTypes;0
0
const viewConfigCallbacks = new Map();0
const viewConfigs = new Map();0
0
function processEventTypes(0
  viewConfig: ReactNativeBaseComponentViewConfig,0
): void {0
  const {bubblingEventTypes, directEventTypes} = viewConfig;0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (bubblingEventTypes != null && directEventTypes != null) {0
      for (const topLevelType in directEventTypes) {0
        invariant(0
          bubblingEventTypes[topLevelType] == null,0
          'Event cannot be both direct and bubbling: %s',0
          topLevelType,0
        );0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  if (bubblingEventTypes != null) {0
    for (const topLevelType in bubblingEventTypes) {0
      if (customBubblingEventTypes[topLevelType] == null) {0
        eventTypes[topLevelType] = customBubblingEventTypes[topLevelType] =0
          bubblingEventTypes[topLevelType];0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  if (directEventTypes != null) {0
    for (const topLevelType in directEventTypes) {0
      if (customDirectEventTypes[topLevelType] == null) {0
        eventTypes[topLevelType] = customDirectEventTypes[topLevelType] =0
          directEventTypes[topLevelType];0
      }0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Registers a native view/component by name.0
 * A callback is provided to load the view config from UIManager.0
 * The callback is deferred until the view is actually rendered.0
 * This is done to avoid causing Prepack deopts.0
 */0
exports.register = function(name: string, callback: ViewConfigGetter): string {0
  invariant(0
    !viewConfigCallbacks.has(name),0
    'Tried to register two views with the same name %s',0
    name,0
  );0
  viewConfigCallbacks.set(name, callback);0
  return name;0
};0
0
/**0
 * Retrieves a config for the specified view.0
 * If this is the first time the view has been used,0
 * This configuration will be lazy-loaded from UIManager.0
 */0
exports.get = function(name: string): ReactNativeBaseComponentViewConfig {0
  let viewConfig;0
  if (!viewConfigs.has(name)) {0
    const callback = viewConfigCallbacks.get(name);0
    invariant(0
      typeof callback === 'function',0
      'View config not found for name %s',0
      name,0
    );0
    viewConfigCallbacks.set(name, null);0
    viewConfig = callback();0
    processEventTypes(viewConfig);0
    viewConfigs.set(name, viewConfig);0
  } else {0
    viewConfig = viewConfigs.get(name);0
  }0
  invariant(viewConfig, 'View config not found for name %s', name);0
  return viewConfig;0
};0

 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0

'use strict';0
0
// Mock of the Native Hooks0
// TODO: Should this move into the components themselves? E.g. focusable0
0
const TextInputState = {};0
0
module.exports = TextInputState;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
// Mock of the Native Hooks0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
// Map of viewTag -> {children: [childTag], parent: ?parentTag}0
const roots = [];0
let views = new Map();0
0
function autoCreateRoot(tag) {0
  // Seriously, this is how we distinguish roots in RN.0
  if (!views.has(tag) && tag % 10 === 1) {0
    roots.push(tag);0
    views.set(tag, {0
      children: [],0
      parent: null,0
      props: {},0
      viewName: '<native root>',0
    });0
  }0
}0
0
function insertSubviewAtIndex(parent, child, index) {0
  const parentInfo = views.get(parent);0
  const childInfo = views.get(child);0
  invariant(0
    childInfo.parent === null,0
    'Inserting view %s %s which already has parent',0
    child,0
    JSON.stringify(childInfo.props),0
  );0
  invariant(0
    0 <= index && index <= parentInfo.children.length,0
    'Invalid index %s for children %s',0
    index,0
    parentInfo.children,0
  );0
  parentInfo.children.splice(index, 0, child);0
  childInfo.parent = parent;0
}0
0
function removeChild(parent, child) {0
  const parentInfo = views.get(parent);0
  const childInfo = views.get(child);0
  const index = parentInfo.children.indexOf(child);0
  invariant(index >= 0, 'Missing view %s during removal', child);0
  parentInfo.children.splice(index, 1);0
  childInfo.parent = null;0
}0
0
const RCTUIManager = {0
  __dumpHierarchyForJestTestsOnly: function() {0
    return roots.map(tag => dumpSubtree(tag, 0)).join('\n');0
0
    function dumpSubtree(tag, indent) {0
      const info = views.get(tag);0
      let out = '';0
      out +=0
        ' '.repeat(indent) + info.viewName + ' ' + JSON.stringify(info.props);0
      // eslint-disable-next-line no-for-of-loops/no-for-of-loops0
      for (const child of info.children) {0
        out += '\n' + dumpSubtree(child, indent + 2);0
      }0
      return out;0
    }0
  },0
  clearJSResponder: jest.fn(),0
  createView: jest.fn(function createView(reactTag, viewName, rootTag, props) {0
    invariant(0
      !views.has(reactTag),0
      'Created two native views with tag %s',0
      reactTag,0
    );0
    views.set(reactTag, {0
      children: [],0
      parent: null,0
      props: props,0
      viewName: viewName,0
    });0
  }),0
  setJSResponder: jest.fn(),0
  setChildren: jest.fn(function setChildren(parentTag, reactTags) {0
    autoCreateRoot(parentTag);0
    // Native doesn't actually check this but it seems like a good idea0
    invariant(0
      views.get(parentTag).children.length === 0,0
      'Calling .setChildren on nonempty view %s',0
      parentTag,0
    );0
    // This logic ported from iOS (RCTUIManager.m)0
    reactTags.forEach((tag, i) => {0
      insertSubviewAtIndex(parentTag, tag, i);0
    });0
  }),0
  manageChildren: jest.fn(function manageChildren(0
    parentTag,0
    moveFromIndices = [],0
    moveToIndices = [],0
    addChildReactTags = [],0
    addAtIndices = [],0
    removeAtIndices = [],0
  ) {0
    autoCreateRoot(parentTag);0
    // This logic ported from iOS (RCTUIManager.m)0
    invariant(0
      moveFromIndices.length === moveToIndices.length,0
      'Mismatched move indices %s and %s',0
      moveFromIndices,0
      moveToIndices,0
    );0
    invariant(0
      addChildReactTags.length === addAtIndices.length,0
      'Mismatched add indices %s and %s',0
      addChildReactTags,0
      addAtIndices,0
    );0
    const parentInfo = views.get(parentTag);0
    const permanentlyRemovedChildren = removeAtIndices.map(0
      index => parentInfo.children[index],0
    );0
    const temporarilyRemovedChildren = moveFromIndices.map(0
      index => parentInfo.children[index],0
    );0
    permanentlyRemovedChildren.forEach(tag => removeChild(parentTag, tag));0
    temporarilyRemovedChildren.forEach(tag => removeChild(parentTag, tag));0
    permanentlyRemovedChildren.forEach(tag => {0
      views.delete(tag);0
    });0
    // List of [index, tag]0
    const indicesToInsert = [];0
    temporarilyRemovedChildren.forEach((tag, i) => {0
      indicesToInsert.push([moveToIndices[i], temporarilyRemovedChildren[i]]);0
    });0
    addChildReactTags.forEach((tag, i) => {0
      indicesToInsert.push([addAtIndices[i], addChildReactTags[i]]);0
    });0
    indicesToInsert.sort((a, b) => a[0] - b[0]);0
    // eslint-disable-next-line no-for-of-loops/no-for-of-loops0
    for (const [i, tag] of indicesToInsert) {0
      insertSubviewAtIndex(parentTag, tag, i);0
    }0
  }),0
  updateView: jest.fn(),0
  removeSubviewsFromContainerWithID: jest.fn(function(parentTag) {0
    views.get(parentTag).children.forEach(tag => removeChild(parentTag, tag));0
  }),0
  replaceExistingNonRootView: jest.fn(),0
  __takeSnapshot: jest.fn(),0
};0
0
module.exports = RCTUIManager;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let createReactNativeComponentClass;0
let React;0
let ReactNative;0
0
describe('createReactNativeComponentClass', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    createReactNativeComponentClass = require('ReactNativeViewConfigRegistry')0
      .register;0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNative = require('react-native-renderer');0
  });0
0
  it('should register viewConfigs', () => {0
    const textViewConfig = {0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'Text',0
    };0
    const viewViewConfig = {0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'View',0
    };0
0
    const Text = createReactNativeComponentClass(0
      textViewConfig.uiViewClassName,0
      () => textViewConfig,0
    );0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass(0
      viewViewConfig.uiViewClassName,0
      () => viewViewConfig,0
    );0
0
    expect(Text).not.toBe(View);0
0
    ReactNative.render(<Text />, 1);0
    ReactNative.render(<View />, 1);0
  });0
0
  it('should not allow viewConfigs with duplicate uiViewClassNames to be registered', () => {0
    const textViewConfig = {0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'Text',0
    };0
    const altTextViewConfig = {0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'Text', // Same0
    };0
0
    createReactNativeComponentClass(0
      textViewConfig.uiViewClassName,0
      () => textViewConfig,0
    );0
0
    expect(() => {0
      createReactNativeComponentClass(0
        altTextViewConfig.uiViewClassName,0
        () => altTextViewConfig,0
      );0
    }).toThrow('Tried to register two views with the same name Text');0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactFabric;0
let createReactNativeComponentClass;0
let UIManager;0
let FabricUIManager;0
0
jest.mock('shared/ReactFeatureFlags', () =>0
  require('shared/forks/ReactFeatureFlags.native-fabric-oss'),0
);0
0
describe('ReactFabric', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactFabric = require('react-native-renderer/fabric');0
    FabricUIManager = require('FabricUIManager');0
    UIManager = require('UIManager');0
    createReactNativeComponentClass = require('ReactNativeViewConfigRegistry')0
      .register;0
  });0
0
  it('should be able to create and render a native component', () => {0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {foo: true},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTView',0
    }));0
0
    ReactFabric.render(<View foo="test" />, 1);0
    expect(FabricUIManager.createNode).toBeCalled();0
    expect(FabricUIManager.appendChild).not.toBeCalled();0
    expect(FabricUIManager.completeRoot).toBeCalled();0
  });0
0
  it('should be able to create and update a native component', () => {0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {foo: true},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTView',0
    }));0
0
    const firstNode = {};0
0
    FabricUIManager.createNode.mockReturnValue(firstNode);0
0
    ReactFabric.render(<View foo="foo" />, 11);0
0
    expect(FabricUIManager.createNode).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
    ReactFabric.render(<View foo="bar" />, 11);0
0
    expect(FabricUIManager.createNode).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewProps).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewProps.mock.calls[0][0]).toBe(0
      firstNode,0
    );0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewProps.mock.calls[0][1]).toEqual({0
      foo: 'bar',0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('should not call FabricUIManager.cloneNode after render for properties that have not changed', () => {0
    const Text = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTText', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {foo: true},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTText',0
    }));0
0
    ReactFabric.render(<Text foo="a">1</Text>, 11);0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNode).not.toBeCalled();0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewChildren).not.toBeCalled();0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewProps).not.toBeCalled();0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewChildrenAndProps).not.toBeCalled();0
0
    // If no properties have changed, we shouldn't call cloneNode.0
    ReactFabric.render(<Text foo="a">1</Text>, 11);0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNode).not.toBeCalled();0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewChildren).not.toBeCalled();0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewProps).not.toBeCalled();0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewChildrenAndProps).not.toBeCalled();0
0
    // Only call cloneNode for the changed property (and not for text).0
    ReactFabric.render(<Text foo="b">1</Text>, 11);0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNode).not.toBeCalled();0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewChildren).not.toBeCalled();0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewProps).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewChildrenAndProps).not.toBeCalled();0
0
    // Only call cloneNode for the changed text (and no other properties).0
    ReactFabric.render(<Text foo="b">2</Text>, 11);0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNode).not.toBeCalled();0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewChildren).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewProps).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewChildrenAndProps).not.toBeCalled();0
0
    // Call cloneNode for both changed text and properties.0
    ReactFabric.render(<Text foo="c">3</Text>, 11);0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNode).not.toBeCalled();0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewChildren).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewProps).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    expect(0
      FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewChildrenAndProps,0
    ).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
  });0
0
  it('should only pass props diffs to FabricUIManager.cloneNode', () => {0
    const Text = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTText', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {foo: true, bar: true},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTText',0
    }));0
0
    ReactFabric.render(0
      <Text foo="a" bar="a">0
        10
      </Text>,0
      11,0
    );0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNode).not.toBeCalled();0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewChildren).not.toBeCalled();0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewProps).not.toBeCalled();0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewChildrenAndProps).not.toBeCalled();0
0
    ReactFabric.render(0
      <Text foo="a" bar="b">0
        10
      </Text>,0
      11,0
    );0
    expect(FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewProps.mock.calls[0][1]).toEqual({0
      bar: 'b',0
    });0
    expect(FabricUIManager.__dumpHierarchyForJestTestsOnly()).toMatchSnapshot();0
0
    ReactFabric.render(0
      <Text foo="b" bar="b">0
        20
      </Text>,0
      11,0
    );0
    expect(0
      FabricUIManager.cloneNodeWithNewChildrenAndProps.mock.calls[0][1],0
    ).toEqual({0
      foo: 'b',0
    });0
    expect(FabricUIManager.__dumpHierarchyForJestTestsOnly()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('should not call UIManager.updateView from setNativeProps for properties that have not changed', () => {0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {foo: true},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTView',0
    }));0
0
    class Subclass extends ReactFabric.NativeComponent {0
      render() {0
        return <View />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    [View, Subclass].forEach(Component => {0
      UIManager.updateView.mockReset();0
0
      let viewRef;0
      ReactFabric.render(0
        <Component0
          foo="bar"0
          ref={ref => {0
            viewRef = ref;0
          }}0
        />,0
        11,0
      );0
      expect(UIManager.updateView).not.toBeCalled();0
0
      viewRef.setNativeProps({});0
      expect(UIManager.updateView).not.toBeCalled();0
0
      viewRef.setNativeProps({foo: 'baz'});0
      expect(UIManager.updateView).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('returns the correct instance and calls it in the callback', () => {0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {foo: true},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTView',0
    }));0
0
    let a;0
    let b;0
    const c = ReactFabric.render(0
      <View foo="foo" ref={v => (a = v)} />,0
      11,0
      function() {0
        b = this;0
      },0
    );0
0
    expect(a).toBeTruthy();0
    expect(a).toBe(b);0
    expect(a).toBe(c);0
  });0
0
  it('renders and reorders children', () => {0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {title: true},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTView',0
    }));0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        const chars = this.props.chars.split('');0
        return (0
          <View>{chars.map(text => <View key={text} title={text} />)}</View>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    // Mini multi-child stress test: lots of reorders, some adds, some removes.0
    const before = 'abcdefghijklmnopqrst';0
    const after = 'mxhpgwfralkeoivcstzy';0
0
    ReactFabric.render(<Component chars={before} />, 11);0
    expect(FabricUIManager.__dumpHierarchyForJestTestsOnly()).toMatchSnapshot();0
0
    ReactFabric.render(<Component chars={after} />, 11);0
    expect(FabricUIManager.__dumpHierarchyForJestTestsOnly()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('calls setState with no arguments', () => {0
    let mockArgs;0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.setState({}, (...args) => (mockArgs = args));0
      }0
      render() {0
        return false;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactFabric.render(<Component />, 11);0
    expect(mockArgs.length).toEqual(0);0
  });0
0
  it('should call complete after inserting children', () => {0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {foo: true},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTView',0
    }));0
0
    const snapshots = [];0
    FabricUIManager.completeRoot.mockImplementation(function(0
      rootTag,0
      newChildSet,0
    ) {0
      snapshots.push(0
        FabricUIManager.__dumpChildSetForJestTestsOnly(newChildSet),0
      );0
    });0
0
    ReactFabric.render(0
      <View foo="a">0
        <View foo="b" />0
      </View>,0
      22,0
    );0
    expect(snapshots).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('should throw when <View> is used inside of a <Text> ancestor', () => {0
    const Image = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTImage', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTImage',0
    }));0
    const Text = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTText', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTText',0
    }));0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTView',0
    }));0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactFabric.render(0
        <Text>0
          <View />0
        </Text>,0
        11,0
      ),0
    ).toThrow('Nesting of <View> within <Text> is not currently supported.');0
0
    // Non-View things (e.g. Image) are fine0
    ReactFabric.render(0
      <Text>0
        <Image />0
      </Text>,0
      11,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should throw for text not inside of a <Text> ancestor', () => {0
    const ScrollView = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTScrollView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTScrollView',0
    }));0
    const Text = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTText', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTText',0
    }));0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTView',0
    }));0
0
    expect(() => ReactFabric.render(<View>this should warn</View>, 11)).toThrow(0
      'Text strings must be rendered within a <Text> component.',0
    );0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactFabric.render(0
        <Text>0
          <ScrollView>hi hello hi</ScrollView>0
        </Text>,0
        11,0
      ),0
    ).toThrow('Text strings must be rendered within a <Text> component.');0
  });0
0
  it('should not throw for text inside of an indirect <Text> ancestor', () => {0
    const Text = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTText', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTText',0
    }));0
0
    const Indirection = () => 'Hi';0
0
    ReactFabric.render(0
      <Text>0
        <Indirection />0
      </Text>,0
      11,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('dispatches events to the last committed props', () => {0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTView',0
      directEventTypes: {0
        topTouchStart: {0
          registrationName: 'onTouchStart',0
        },0
      },0
    }));0
0
    const touchStart = jest.fn();0
    const touchStart2 = jest.fn();0
0
    ReactFabric.render(<View onTouchStart={touchStart} />, 11);0
0
    expect(FabricUIManager.createNode.mock.calls.length).toBe(1);0
    expect(FabricUIManager.registerEventHandler.mock.calls.length).toBe(1);0
0
    let [, , , , instanceHandle] = FabricUIManager.createNode.mock.calls[0];0
    let [dispatchEvent] = FabricUIManager.registerEventHandler.mock.calls[0];0
0
    let touchEvent = {0
      touches: [],0
      changedTouches: [],0
    };0
0
    expect(touchStart).not.toBeCalled();0
0
    dispatchEvent(instanceHandle, 'topTouchStart', touchEvent);0
0
    expect(touchStart).toBeCalled();0
    expect(touchStart2).not.toBeCalled();0
0
    ReactFabric.render(<View onTouchStart={touchStart2} />, 11);0
0
    // Intentionally dispatch to the same instanceHandle again.0
    dispatchEvent(instanceHandle, 'topTouchStart', touchEvent);0
0
    // The current semantics dictate that we always dispatch to the last committed0
    // props even though the actual scheduling of the event could have happened earlier.0
    // This could change in the future.0
    expect(touchStart2).toBeCalled();0
  });0
});0
/**0

 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactFabric;0
let ReactNative;0
let createReactNativeComponentClass;0
0
describe('ReactFabric', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    ReactNative = require('react-native-renderer');0
    jest.resetModules();0
    jest.mock('shared/ReactFeatureFlags', () =>0
      require('shared/forks/ReactFeatureFlags.native-fabric-oss'),0
    );0
0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactFabric = require('react-native-renderer/fabric');0
    createReactNativeComponentClass = require('ReactNativeViewConfigRegistry')0
      .register;0
  });0
0
  it('find Fabric nodes with the RN renderer', () => {0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {title: true},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTView',0
    }));0
0
    let ref = React.createRef();0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <View title="foo" />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactFabric.render(<Component ref={ref} />, 11);0
0
    let handle = ReactNative.findNodeHandle(ref.current);0
    expect(handle).toBe(2);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
'use strict';0
0
const ReactNativeAttributePayload = require('../ReactNativeAttributePayload');0
0
const diff = ReactNativeAttributePayload.diff;0
0
describe('ReactNativeAttributePayload', () => {0
  it('should work with simple example', () => {0
    expect(diff({a: 1, c: 3}, {b: 2, c: 3}, {a: true, b: true})).toEqual({0
      a: null,0
      b: 2,0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('should skip fields that are equal', () => {0
    expect(0
      diff(0
        {a: 1, b: 'two', c: true, d: false, e: undefined, f: 0},0
        {a: 1, b: 'two', c: true, d: false, e: undefined, f: 0},0
        {a: true, b: true, c: true, d: true, e: true, f: true},0
      ),0
    ).toEqual(null);0
  });0
0
  it('should remove fields', () => {0
    expect(diff({a: 1}, {}, {a: true})).toEqual({a: null});0
  });0
0
  it('should remove fields that are set to undefined', () => {0
    expect(diff({a: 1}, {a: undefined}, {a: true})).toEqual({a: null});0
  });0
0
  it('should ignore invalid fields', () => {0
    expect(diff({a: 1}, {b: 2}, {})).toEqual(null);0
  });0
0
  it('should use the diff attribute', () => {0
    const diffA = jest.fn((a, b) => true);0
    const diffB = jest.fn((a, b) => false);0
    expect(0
      diff(0
        {a: [1], b: [3]},0
        {a: [2], b: [4]},0
        {a: {diff: diffA}, b: {diff: diffB}},0
      ),0
    ).toEqual({a: [2]});0
    expect(diffA).toBeCalledWith([1], [2]);0
    expect(diffB).toBeCalledWith([3], [4]);0
  });0
0
  it('should not use the diff attribute on addition/removal', () => {0
    const diffA = jest.fn();0
    const diffB = jest.fn();0
    expect(0
      diff({a: [1]}, {b: [2]}, {a: {diff: diffA}, b: {diff: diffB}}),0
    ).toEqual({a: null, b: [2]});0
    expect(diffA).not.toBeCalled();0
    expect(diffB).not.toBeCalled();0
  });0
0
  it('should do deep diffs of Objects by default', () => {0
    expect(0
      diff(0
        {a: [1], b: {k: [3, 4]}, c: {k: [4, 4]}},0
        {a: [2], b: {k: [3, 4]}, c: {k: [4, 5]}},0
        {a: true, b: true, c: true},0
      ),0
    ).toEqual({a: [2], c: {k: [4, 5]}});0
  });0
0
  it('should work with undefined styles', () => {0
    expect(0
      diff(0
        {style: {a: '#ffffff', b: 1}},0
        {style: undefined},0
        {style: {b: true}},0
      ),0
    ).toEqual({b: null});0
    expect(0
      diff(0
        {style: undefined},0
        {style: {a: '#ffffff', b: 1}},0
        {style: {b: true}},0
      ),0
    ).toEqual({b: 1});0
    expect(0
      diff({style: undefined}, {style: undefined}, {style: {b: true}}),0
    ).toEqual(null);0
  });0
0
  it('should work with empty styles', () => {0
    expect(diff({a: 1, c: 3}, {}, {a: true, b: true})).toEqual({a: null});0
    expect(diff({}, {a: 1, c: 3}, {a: true, b: true})).toEqual({a: 1});0
    expect(diff({}, {}, {a: true, b: true})).toEqual(null);0
  });0
0
  it('should flatten nested styles and predefined styles', () => {0
    const validStyleAttribute = {someStyle: {foo: true, bar: true}};0
0
    expect(0
      diff({}, {someStyle: [{foo: 1}, {bar: 2}]}, validStyleAttribute),0
    ).toEqual({foo: 1, bar: 2});0
0
    expect(0
      diff({someStyle: [{foo: 1}, {bar: 2}]}, {}, validStyleAttribute),0
    ).toEqual({foo: null, bar: null});0
0
    const barStyle = {0
      bar: 3,0
    };0
0
    expect(0
      diff(0
        {},0
        {someStyle: [[{foo: 1}, {foo: 2}], barStyle]},0
        validStyleAttribute,0
      ),0
    ).toEqual({foo: 2, bar: 3});0
  });0
0
  it('should reset a value to a previous if it is removed', () => {0
    const validStyleAttribute = {someStyle: {foo: true, bar: true}};0
0
    expect(0
      diff(0
        {someStyle: [{foo: 1}, {foo: 3}]},0
        {someStyle: [{foo: 1}, {bar: 2}]},0
        validStyleAttribute,0
      ),0
    ).toEqual({foo: 1, bar: 2});0
  });0
0
  it('should not clear removed props if they are still in another slot', () => {0
    const validStyleAttribute = {someStyle: {foo: true, bar: true}};0
0
    expect(0
      diff(0
        {someStyle: [{}, {foo: 3, bar: 2}]},0
        {someStyle: [{foo: 3}, {bar: 2}]},0
        validStyleAttribute,0
      ),0
    ).toEqual({foo: 3}); // this should ideally be null. heuristic tradeoff.0
0
    expect(0
      diff(0
        {someStyle: [{}, {foo: 3, bar: 2}]},0
        {someStyle: [{foo: 1, bar: 1}, {bar: 2}]},0
        validStyleAttribute,0
      ),0
    ).toEqual({bar: 2, foo: 1});0
  });0
0
  it('should clear a prop if a later style is explicit null/undefined', () => {0
    const validStyleAttribute = {someStyle: {foo: true, bar: true}};0
    expect(0
      diff(0
        {someStyle: [{}, {foo: 3, bar: 2}]},0
        {someStyle: [{foo: 1}, {bar: 2, foo: null}]},0
        validStyleAttribute,0
      ),0
    ).toEqual({foo: null});0
0
    expect(0
      diff(0
        {someStyle: [{foo: 3}, {foo: null, bar: 2}]},0
        {someStyle: [{foo: null}, {bar: 2}]},0
        validStyleAttribute,0
      ),0
    ).toEqual({foo: null});0
0
    expect(0
      diff(0
        {someStyle: [{foo: 1}, {foo: null}]},0
        {someStyle: [{foo: 2}, {foo: null}]},0
        validStyleAttribute,0
      ),0
    ).toEqual({foo: null}); // this should ideally be null. heuristic.0
0
    // Test the same case with object equality because an early bailout doesn't0
    // work in this case.0
    const fooObj = {foo: 3};0
    expect(0
      diff(0
        {someStyle: [{foo: 1}, fooObj]},0
        {someStyle: [{foo: 2}, fooObj]},0
        validStyleAttribute,0
      ),0
    ).toEqual({foo: 3}); // this should ideally be null. heuristic.0
0
    expect(0
      diff(0
        {someStyle: [{foo: 1}, {foo: 3}]},0
        {someStyle: [{foo: 2}, {foo: undefined}]},0
        validStyleAttribute,0
      ),0
    ).toEqual({foo: null}); // this should ideally be null. heuristic.0
  });0
0
  // Function properties are just markers to native that events should be sent.0
  it('should convert functions to booleans', () => {0
    // Note that if the property changes from one function to another, we don't0
    // need to send an update.0
    expect(0
      diff(0
        {0
          a: function() {0
            return 1;0
          },0
          b: function() {0
            return 2;0
          },0
          c: 3,0
        },0
        {0
          b: function() {0
            return 9;0
          },0
          c: function() {0
            return 3;0
          },0
        },0
        {a: true, b: true, c: true},0
      ),0
    ).toEqual({a: null, c: true});0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactNative;0
let createReactNativeComponentClass;0
let computeComponentStackForErrorReporting;0
0
function normalizeCodeLocInfo(str) {0
  return str && str.replace(/\(at .+?:\d+\)/g, '(at **)');0
}0
0
describe('ReactNativeError', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNative = require('react-native-renderer');0
    createReactNativeComponentClass = require('ReactNativeViewConfigRegistry')0
      .register;0
    computeComponentStackForErrorReporting =0
      ReactNative.__SECRET_INTERNALS_DO_NOT_USE_OR_YOU_WILL_BE_FIRED0
        .computeComponentStackForErrorReporting;0
  });0
0
  it('should be able to extract a component stack from a native view', () => {0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass('View', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {foo: true},0
      uiViewClassName: 'View',0
    }));0
0
    const ref = React.createRef();0
0
    function FunctionalComponent(props) {0
      return props.children;0
    }0
0
    class ClassComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <FunctionalComponent>0
            <View foo="test" ref={ref} />0
          </FunctionalComponent>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNative.render(<ClassComponent />, 1);0
0
    let reactTag = ReactNative.findNodeHandle(ref.current);0
0
    let componentStack = normalizeCodeLocInfo(0
      computeComponentStackForErrorReporting(reactTag),0
    );0
0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(componentStack).toBe(0
        '\n' +0
          '    in View (at **)\n' +0
          '    in FunctionalComponent (at **)\n' +0
          '    in ClassComponent (at **)',0
      );0
    } else {0
      expect(componentStack).toBe(0
        '\n' +0
          '    in View\n' +0
          '    in FunctionalComponent\n' +0
          '    in ClassComponent',0
      );0
    }0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0

 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0

 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0

'use strict';0
0
let PropTypes;0
let RCTEventEmitter;0
let React;0
let ReactNative;0
let ResponderEventPlugin;0
let UIManager;0
let createReactNativeComponentClass;0
0
// Parallels requireNativeComponent() in that it lazily constructs a view config,0
// And registers view manager event types with ReactNativeViewConfigRegistry.0
const fakeRequireNativeComponent = (uiViewClassName, validAttributes) => {0
  const getViewConfig = () => {0
    const viewConfig = {0
      uiViewClassName,0
      validAttributes,0
      bubblingEventTypes: {0
        topTouchCancel: {0
          phasedRegistrationNames: {0
            bubbled: 'onTouchCancel',0
            captured: 'onTouchCancelCapture',0
          },0
        },0
        topTouchEnd: {0
          phasedRegistrationNames: {0
            bubbled: 'onTouchEnd',0
            captured: 'onTouchEndCapture',0
          },0
        },0
        topTouchMove: {0
          phasedRegistrationNames: {0
            bubbled: 'onTouchMove',0
            captured: 'onTouchMoveCapture',0
          },0
        },0
        topTouchStart: {0
          phasedRegistrationNames: {0
            bubbled: 'onTouchStart',0
            captured: 'onTouchStartCapture',0
          },0
        },0
      },0
      directEventTypes: {},0
    };0
0
    return viewConfig;0
  };0
0
  return createReactNativeComponentClass(uiViewClassName, getViewConfig);0
};0
0
beforeEach(() => {0
  jest.resetModules();0
0
  PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
  RCTEventEmitter = require('RCTEventEmitter');0
  React = require('react');0
  ReactNative = require('react-native-renderer');0
  ResponderEventPlugin = require('events/ResponderEventPlugin').default;0
  UIManager = require('UIManager');0
  createReactNativeComponentClass = require('ReactNativeViewConfigRegistry')0
    .register;0
});0
0
it('fails if unknown/unsupported event types are dispatched', () => {0
  expect(RCTEventEmitter.register).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
  const EventEmitter = RCTEventEmitter.register.mock.calls[0][0];0
  const View = fakeRequireNativeComponent('View', {});0
0
  ReactNative.render(<View onUnspecifiedEvent={() => {}} />, 1);0
0
  expect(UIManager.__dumpHierarchyForJestTestsOnly()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  expect(UIManager.createView).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
  const target = UIManager.createView.mock.calls[0][0];0
0
  expect(() => {0
    EventEmitter.receiveTouches(0
      'unspecifiedEvent',0
      [{target, identifier: 17}],0
      [0],0
    );0
  }).toThrow('Unsupported top level event type "unspecifiedEvent" dispatched');0
});0
0
it('handles events', () => {0
  expect(RCTEventEmitter.register).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
  const EventEmitter = RCTEventEmitter.register.mock.calls[0][0];0
  const View = fakeRequireNativeComponent('View', {foo: true});0
0
  const log = [];0
  ReactNative.render(0
    <View0
      foo="outer"0
      onTouchEnd={() => log.push('outer touchend')}0
      onTouchEndCapture={() => log.push('outer touchend capture')}0
      onTouchStart={() => log.push('outer touchstart')}0
      onTouchStartCapture={() => log.push('outer touchstart capture')}>0
      <View0
        foo="inner"0
        onTouchEndCapture={() => log.push('inner touchend capture')}0
        onTouchEnd={() => log.push('inner touchend')}0
        onTouchStartCapture={() => log.push('inner touchstart capture')}0
        onTouchStart={() => log.push('inner touchstart')}0
      />0
    </View>,0
    1,0
  );0
0
  expect(UIManager.__dumpHierarchyForJestTestsOnly()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  expect(UIManager.createView).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
0
  // Don't depend on the order of createView() calls.0
  // Stack creates views outside-in; fiber creates them inside-out.0
  const innerTag = UIManager.createView.mock.calls.find(0
    args => args[3].foo === 'inner',0
  )[0];0
0
  EventEmitter.receiveTouches(0
    'topTouchStart',0
    [{target: innerTag, identifier: 17}],0
    [0],0
  );0
  EventEmitter.receiveTouches(0
    'topTouchEnd',0
    [{target: innerTag, identifier: 17}],0
    [0],0
  );0
0
  expect(log).toEqual([0
    'outer touchstart capture',0
    'inner touchstart capture',0
    'inner touchstart',0
    'outer touchstart',0
    'outer touchend capture',0
    'inner touchend capture',0
    'inner touchend',0
    'outer touchend',0
  ]);0
});0
0
it('handles events on text nodes', () => {0
  expect(RCTEventEmitter.register).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
  const EventEmitter = RCTEventEmitter.register.mock.calls[0][0];0
  const Text = fakeRequireNativeComponent('RCTText', {});0
0
  class ContextHack extends React.Component {0
    static childContextTypes = {isInAParentText: PropTypes.bool};0
    getChildContext() {0
      return {isInAParentText: true};0
    }0
    render() {0
      return this.props.children;0
    }0
  }0
0
  const log = [];0
  ReactNative.render(0
    <ContextHack>0
      <Text>0
        <Text0
          onTouchEnd={() => log.push('string touchend')}0
          onTouchEndCapture={() => log.push('string touchend capture')}0
          onTouchStart={() => log.push('string touchstart')}0
          onTouchStartCapture={() => log.push('string touchstart capture')}>0
          Text Content0
        </Text>0
        <Text0
          onTouchEnd={() => log.push('number touchend')}0
          onTouchEndCapture={() => log.push('number touchend capture')}0
          onTouchStart={() => log.push('number touchstart')}0
          onTouchStartCapture={() => log.push('number touchstart capture')}>0
          {123}0
        </Text>0
      </Text>0
    </ContextHack>,0
    1,0
  );0
0
  expect(UIManager.createView).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(5);0
0
  // Don't depend on the order of createView() calls.0
  // Stack creates views outside-in; fiber creates them inside-out.0
  const innerTagString = UIManager.createView.mock.calls.find(0
    args => args[3] && args[3].text === 'Text Content',0
  )[0];0
  const innerTagNumber = UIManager.createView.mock.calls.find(0
    args => args[3] && args[3].text === '123',0
  )[0];0
0
  EventEmitter.receiveTouches(0
    'topTouchStart',0
    [{target: innerTagString, identifier: 17}],0
    [0],0
  );0
  EventEmitter.receiveTouches(0
    'topTouchEnd',0
    [{target: innerTagString, identifier: 17}],0
    [0],0
  );0
0
  EventEmitter.receiveTouches(0
    'topTouchStart',0
    [{target: innerTagNumber, identifier: 18}],0
    [0],0
  );0
  EventEmitter.receiveTouches(0
    'topTouchEnd',0
    [{target: innerTagNumber, identifier: 18}],0
    [0],0
  );0
0
  expect(log).toEqual([0
    'string touchstart capture',0
    'string touchstart',0
    'string touchend capture',0
    'string touchend',0
    'number touchstart capture',0
    'number touchstart',0
    'number touchend capture',0
    'number touchend',0
  ]);0
});0
0
it('handles when a responder is unmounted while a touch sequence is in progress', () => {0
  const EventEmitter = RCTEventEmitter.register.mock.calls[0][0];0
  const View = fakeRequireNativeComponent('View', {id: true});0
0
  function getViewById(id) {0
    return UIManager.createView.mock.calls.find(0
      args => args[3] && args[3].id === id,0
    )[0];0
  }0
0
  function getResponderId() {0
    const responder = ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder();0
    if (responder === null) {0
      return null;0
    }0
    const props = responder.memoizedProps;0
    return props ? props.id : null;0
  }0
0
  const log = [];0
  ReactNative.render(0
    <View id="parent">0
      <View key={1}>0
        <View0
          id="one"0
          onResponderEnd={() => log.push('one responder end')}0
          onResponderStart={() => log.push('one responder start')}0
          onStartShouldSetResponder={() => true}0
        />0
      </View>0
      <View key={2}>0
        <View0
          id="two"0
          onResponderEnd={() => log.push('two responder end')}0
          onResponderStart={() => log.push('two responder start')}0
          onStartShouldSetResponder={() => true}0
        />0
      </View>0
    </View>,0
    1,0
  );0
0
  EventEmitter.receiveTouches(0
    'topTouchStart',0
    [{target: getViewById('one'), identifier: 17}],0
    [0],0
  );0
0
  expect(getResponderId()).toBe('one');0
  expect(log).toEqual(['one responder start']);0
  log.splice(0);0
0
  ReactNative.render(0
    <View id="parent">0
      <View key={2}>0
        <View0
          id="two"0
          onResponderEnd={() => log.push('two responder end')}0
          onResponderStart={() => log.push('two responder start')}0
          onStartShouldSetResponder={() => true}0
        />0
      </View>0
    </View>,0
    1,0
  );0
0
  // TODO Verify the onResponderEnd listener has been called (before the unmount)0
  // expect(log).toEqual(['one responder end']);0
  // log.splice(0);0
0
  EventEmitter.receiveTouches(0
    'topTouchEnd',0
    [{target: getViewById('two'), identifier: 17}],0
    [0],0
  );0
0
  expect(getResponderId()).toBeNull();0
  expect(log).toEqual([]);0
0
  EventEmitter.receiveTouches(0
    'topTouchStart',0
    [{target: getViewById('two'), identifier: 17}],0
    [0],0
  );0
0
  expect(getResponderId()).toBe('two');0
  expect(log).toEqual(['two responder start']);0
});0
0
it('handles events without target', () => {0
  const EventEmitter = RCTEventEmitter.register.mock.calls[0][0];0
0
  const View = fakeRequireNativeComponent('View', {id: true});0
0
  function getViewById(id) {0
    return UIManager.createView.mock.calls.find(0
      args => args[3] && args[3].id === id,0
    )[0];0
  }0
0
  function getResponderId() {0
    const responder = ResponderEventPlugin._getResponder();0
    if (responder === null) {0
      return null;0
    }0
    const props = responder.memoizedProps;0
    return props ? props.id : null;0
  }0
0
  const log = [];0
0
  function render(renderFirstComponent) {0
    ReactNative.render(0
      <View id="parent">0
        <View key={1}>0
          {renderFirstComponent ? (0
            <View0
              id="one"0
              onResponderEnd={() => log.push('one responder end')}0
              onResponderStart={() => log.push('one responder start')}0
              onStartShouldSetResponder={() => true}0
            />0
          ) : null}0
        </View>0
        <View key={2}>0
          <View0
            id="two"0
            onResponderEnd={() => log.push('two responder end')}0
            onResponderStart={() => log.push('two responder start')}0
            onStartShouldSetResponder={() => true}0
          />0
        </View>0
      </View>,0
      1,0
    );0
  }0
0
  render(true);0
0
  EventEmitter.receiveTouches(0
    'topTouchStart',0
    [{target: getViewById('one'), identifier: 17}],0
    [0],0
  );0
0
  // Unmounting component 'one'.0
  render(false);0
0
  EventEmitter.receiveTouches(0
    'topTouchEnd',0
    [{target: getViewById('one'), identifier: 17}],0
    [0],0
  );0
0
  expect(getResponderId()).toBe(null);0
0
  EventEmitter.receiveTouches(0
    'topTouchStart',0
    [{target: getViewById('two'), identifier: 18}],0
    [0],0
  );0
0
  expect(getResponderId()).toBe('two');0
0
  EventEmitter.receiveTouches(0
    'topTouchEnd',0
    [{target: getViewById('two'), identifier: 18}],0
    [0],0
  );0
0
  expect(getResponderId()).toBe(null);0
0
  expect(log).toEqual([0
    'one responder start',0
    'two responder start',0
    'two responder end',0
  ]);0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactNative;0
let createReactNativeComponentClass;0
let UIManager;0
0
describe('ReactNative', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNative = require('react-native-renderer');0
    UIManager = require('UIManager');0
    createReactNativeComponentClass = require('ReactNativeViewConfigRegistry')0
      .register;0
  });0
0
  it('should be able to create and render a native component', () => {0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {foo: true},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTView',0
    }));0
0
    ReactNative.render(<View foo="test" />, 1);0
    expect(UIManager.createView).toBeCalled();0
    expect(UIManager.setChildren).toBeCalled();0
    expect(UIManager.manageChildren).not.toBeCalled();0
    expect(UIManager.updateView).not.toBeCalled();0
  });0
0
  it('should be able to create and update a native component', () => {0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {foo: true},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTView',0
    }));0
0
    ReactNative.render(<View foo="foo" />, 11);0
0
    expect(UIManager.createView).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    expect(UIManager.setChildren).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    expect(UIManager.manageChildren).not.toBeCalled();0
    expect(UIManager.updateView).not.toBeCalled();0
0
    ReactNative.render(<View foo="bar" />, 11);0
0
    expect(UIManager.createView).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    expect(UIManager.setChildren).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    expect(UIManager.manageChildren).not.toBeCalled();0
    expect(UIManager.updateView).toBeCalledWith(3, 'RCTView', {foo: 'bar'});0
  });0
0
  it('should not call UIManager.updateView after render for properties that have not changed', () => {0
    const Text = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTText', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {foo: true},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTText',0
    }));0
0
    ReactNative.render(<Text foo="a">1</Text>, 11);0
    expect(UIManager.updateView).not.toBeCalled();0
0
    // If no properties have changed, we shouldn't call updateView.0
    ReactNative.render(<Text foo="a">1</Text>, 11);0
    expect(UIManager.updateView).not.toBeCalled();0
0
    // Only call updateView for the changed property (and not for text).0
    ReactNative.render(<Text foo="b">1</Text>, 11);0
    expect(UIManager.updateView).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
0
    // Only call updateView for the changed text (and no other properties).0
    ReactNative.render(<Text foo="b">2</Text>, 11);0
    expect(UIManager.updateView).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
0
    // Call updateView for both changed text and properties.0
    ReactNative.render(<Text foo="c">3</Text>, 11);0
    expect(UIManager.updateView).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(4);0
  });0
0
  it('should not call UIManager.updateView from setNativeProps for properties that have not changed', () => {0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {foo: true},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTView',0
    }));0
0
    class Subclass extends ReactNative.NativeComponent {0
      render() {0
        return <View />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    [View, Subclass].forEach(Component => {0
      UIManager.updateView.mockReset();0
0
      let viewRef;0
      ReactNative.render(0
        <Component0
          foo="bar"0
          ref={ref => {0
            viewRef = ref;0
          }}0
        />,0
        11,0
      );0
      expect(UIManager.updateView).not.toBeCalled();0
0
      viewRef.setNativeProps({});0
      expect(UIManager.updateView).not.toBeCalled();0
0
      viewRef.setNativeProps({foo: 'baz'});0
      expect(UIManager.updateView).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('returns the correct instance and calls it in the callback', () => {0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {foo: true},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTView',0
    }));0
0
    let a;0
    let b;0
    const c = ReactNative.render(0
      <View foo="foo" ref={v => (a = v)} />,0
      11,0
      function() {0
        b = this;0
      },0
    );0
0
    expect(a).toBeTruthy();0
    expect(a).toBe(b);0
    expect(a).toBe(c);0
  });0
0
  it('renders and reorders children', () => {0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {title: true},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTView',0
    }));0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        const chars = this.props.chars.split('');0
        return (0
          <View>{chars.map(text => <View key={text} title={text} />)}</View>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    // Mini multi-child stress test: lots of reorders, some adds, some removes.0
    const before = 'abcdefghijklmnopqrst';0
    const after = 'mxhpgwfralkeoivcstzy';0
0
    ReactNative.render(<Component chars={before} />, 11);0
    expect(UIManager.__dumpHierarchyForJestTestsOnly()).toMatchSnapshot();0
0
    ReactNative.render(<Component chars={after} />, 11);0
    expect(UIManager.__dumpHierarchyForJestTestsOnly()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('calls setState with no arguments', () => {0
    let mockArgs;0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.setState({}, (...args) => (mockArgs = args));0
      }0
      render() {0
        return false;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNative.render(<Component />, 11);0
    expect(mockArgs.length).toEqual(0);0
  });0
0
  it('should throw when <View> is used inside of a <Text> ancestor', () => {0
    const Image = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTImage', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTImage',0
    }));0
    const Text = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTText', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTText',0
    }));0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTView',0
    }));0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactNative.render(0
        <Text>0
          <View />0
        </Text>,0
        11,0
      ),0
    ).toThrow('Nesting of <View> within <Text> is not currently supported.');0
0
    // Non-View things (e.g. Image) are fine0
    ReactNative.render(0
      <Text>0
        <Image />0
      </Text>,0
      11,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should throw for text not inside of a <Text> ancestor', () => {0
    const ScrollView = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTScrollView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTScrollView',0
    }));0
    const Text = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTText', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTText',0
    }));0
    const View = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTView', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTView',0
    }));0
0
    expect(() => ReactNative.render(<View>this should warn</View>, 11)).toThrow(0
      'Text strings must be rendered within a <Text> component.',0
    );0
0
    expect(() =>0
      ReactNative.render(0
        <Text>0
          <ScrollView>hi hello hi</ScrollView>0
        </Text>,0
        11,0
      ),0
    ).toThrow('Text strings must be rendered within a <Text> component.');0
  });0
0
  it('should not throw for text inside of an indirect <Text> ancestor', () => {0
    const Text = createReactNativeComponentClass('RCTText', () => ({0
      validAttributes: {},0
      uiViewClassName: 'RCTText',0
    }));0
0
    const Indirection = () => 'Hi';0
0
    ReactNative.render(0
      <Text>0
        <Indirection />0
      </Text>,0
      11,0
    );0
  });0
});0

'use strict';0
0
const ReactNoop = require('./src/ReactNoop');0
0
// TODO: decide on the top-level export form.0
// This is hacky but makes it work with both Rollup and Jest.0
module.exports = ReactNoop.default ? ReactNoop.default : ReactNoop;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const ReactNoopPersistent = require('./src/ReactNoopPersistent');0
0
// TODO: decide on the top-level export form.0
// This is hacky but makes it work with both Rollup and Jest.0
module.exports = ReactNoopPersistent.default0
  ? ReactNoopPersistent.default0
  : ReactNoopPersistent;0
'use strict';0
0
if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production') {0
  module.exports = require('./cjs/react-noop-renderer.production.min.js');0
} else {0
  module.exports = require('./cjs/react-noop-renderer.development.js');0
}0
'use strict';0
0
if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production') {0
  module.exports = require('./cjs/react-noop-renderer-persistent.production.min.js');0
} else {0
  module.exports = require('./cjs/react-noop-renderer-persistent.development.js');0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
