 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
/**0
 * This is a renderer of React that doesn't have a render target output.0
 * It is useful to demonstrate the internals of the reconciler in isolation0
 * and for testing semantics of reconciliation separate from the host0
 * environment.0
 */0
0
import type {Fiber} from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiber';0
import type {UpdateQueue} from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactUpdateQueue';0
import type {ReactNodeList} from 'shared/ReactTypes';0
0
import * as ReactPortal from 'shared/ReactPortal';0
import expect from 'expect';0
0
type Container = {rootID: string, children: Array<Instance | TextInstance>};0
type Props = {prop: any, hidden?: boolean, children?: mixed};0
type Instance = {|0
  type: string,0
  id: number,0
  children: Array<Instance | TextInstance>,0
  prop: any,0
|};0
type TextInstance = {|text: string, id: number|};0
0
const NO_CONTEXT = {};0
const UPDATE_SIGNAL = {};0
if (__DEV__) {0
  Object.freeze(NO_CONTEXT);0
  Object.freeze(UPDATE_SIGNAL);0
}0
0
function createReactNoop(reconciler: Function, useMutation: boolean) {0
  let scheduledCallback = null;0
0
  let instanceCounter = 0;0
  let failInBeginPhase = false;0
0
  function appendChild(0
    parentInstance: Instance | Container,0
    child: Instance | TextInstance,0
  ): void {0
    const index = parentInstance.children.indexOf(child);0
    if (index !== -1) {0
      parentInstance.children.splice(index, 1);0
    }0
    parentInstance.children.push(child);0
  }0
0
  function insertBefore(0
    parentInstance: Instance | Container,0
    child: Instance | TextInstance,0
    beforeChild: Instance | TextInstance,0
  ): void {0
    const index = parentInstance.children.indexOf(child);0
    if (index !== -1) {0
      parentInstance.children.splice(index, 1);0
    }0
    const beforeIndex = parentInstance.children.indexOf(beforeChild);0
    if (beforeIndex === -1) {0
      throw new Error('This child does not exist.');0
    }0
    parentInstance.children.splice(beforeIndex, 0, child);0
  }0
0
  function removeChild(0
    parentInstance: Instance | Container,0
    child: Instance | TextInstance,0
  ): void {0
    const index = parentInstance.children.indexOf(child);0
    if (index === -1) {0
      throw new Error('This child does not exist.');0
    }0
    parentInstance.children.splice(index, 1);0
  }0
0
  let elapsedTimeInMs = 0;0
0
  const sharedHostConfig = {0
    getRootHostContext() {0
      if (failInBeginPhase) {0
        throw new Error('Error in host config.');0
      }0
      return NO_CONTEXT;0
    },0
0
    getChildHostContext() {0
      return NO_CONTEXT;0
    },0
0
    getPublicInstance(instance) {0
      return instance;0
    },0
0
    createInstance(type: string, props: Props): Instance {0
      const inst = {0
        id: instanceCounter++,0
        type: type,0
        children: [],0
        prop: props.prop,0
      };0
      // Hide from unit tests0
      Object.defineProperty(inst, 'id', {value: inst.id, enumerable: false});0
      return inst;0
    },0
0
    appendInitialChild(0
      parentInstance: Instance,0
      child: Instance | TextInstance,0
    ): void {0
      parentInstance.children.push(child);0
    },0
0
    finalizeInitialChildren(0
      domElement: Instance,0
      type: string,0
      props: Props,0
    ): boolean {0
      return false;0
    },0
0
    prepareUpdate(0
      instance: Instance,0
      type: string,0
      oldProps: Props,0
      newProps: Props,0
    ): null | {} {0
      if (oldProps === null) {0
        throw new Error('Should have old props');0
      }0
      if (newProps === null) {0
        throw new Error('Should have new props');0
      }0
      return UPDATE_SIGNAL;0
    },0
0
    shouldSetTextContent(type: string, props: Props): boolean {0
      return (0
        typeof props.children === 'string' || typeof props.children === 'number'0
      );0
    },0
0
    shouldDeprioritizeSubtree(type: string, props: Props): boolean {0
      return !!props.hidden;0
    },0
0
    createTextInstance(0
      text: string,0
      rootContainerInstance: Container,0
      hostContext: Object,0
      internalInstanceHandle: Object,0
    ): TextInstance {0
      const inst = {text: text, id: instanceCounter++};0
      // Hide from unit tests0
      Object.defineProperty(inst, 'id', {value: inst.id, enumerable: false});0
      return inst;0
    },0
0
    scheduleDeferredCallback(callback) {0
      if (scheduledCallback) {0
        throw new Error(0
          'Scheduling a callback twice is excessive. Instead, keep track of ' +0
            'whether the callback has already been scheduled.',0
        );0
      }0
      scheduledCallback = callback;0
      return 0;0
    },0
0
    cancelDeferredCallback() {0
      if (scheduledCallback === null) {0
        throw new Error('No callback is scheduled.');0
      }0
      scheduledCallback = null;0
    },0
0
    prepareForCommit(): void {},0
0
    resetAfterCommit(): void {},0
0
    now(): number {0
      return elapsedTimeInMs;0
    },0
0
    isPrimaryRenderer: true,0
    supportsHydration: false,0
  };0
0
  const hostConfig = useMutation0
    ? {0
        ...sharedHostConfig,0
0
        supportsMutation: true,0
        supportsPersistence: false,0
0
        commitMount(instance: Instance, type: string, newProps: Props): void {0
          // Noop0
        },0
0
        commitUpdate(0
          instance: Instance,0
          updatePayload: Object,0
          type: string,0
          oldProps: Props,0
          newProps: Props,0
        ): void {0
          if (oldProps === null) {0
            throw new Error('Should have old props');0
          }0
          instance.prop = newProps.prop;0
        },0
0
        commitTextUpdate(0
          textInstance: TextInstance,0
          oldText: string,0
          newText: string,0
        ): void {0
          textInstance.text = newText;0
        },0
0
        appendChild: appendChild,0
        appendChildToContainer: appendChild,0
        insertBefore: insertBefore,0
        insertInContainerBefore: insertBefore,0
        removeChild: removeChild,0
        removeChildFromContainer: removeChild,0
0
        resetTextContent(instance: Instance): void {},0
      }0
    : {0
        ...sharedHostConfig,0
        supportsMutation: false,0
        supportsPersistence: true,0
0
        cloneInstance(0
          instance: Instance,0
          updatePayload: null | Object,0
          type: string,0
          oldProps: Props,0
          newProps: Props,0
          internalInstanceHandle: Object,0
          keepChildren: boolean,0
          recyclableInstance: null | Instance,0
        ): Instance {0
          const clone = {0
            id: instance.id,0
            type: type,0
            children: keepChildren ? instance.children : [],0
            prop: newProps.prop,0
          };0
          Object.defineProperty(clone, 'id', {0
            value: clone.id,0
            enumerable: false,0
          });0
          return clone;0
        },0
0
        createContainerChildSet(0
          container: Container,0
        ): Array<Instance | TextInstance> {0
          return [];0
        },0
0
        appendChildToContainerChildSet(0
          childSet: Array<Instance | TextInstance>,0
          child: Instance | TextInstance,0
        ): void {0
          childSet.push(child);0
        },0
0
        finalizeContainerChildren(0
          container: Container,0
          newChildren: Array<Instance | TextInstance>,0
        ): void {},0
0
        replaceContainerChildren(0
          container: Container,0
          newChildren: Array<Instance | TextInstance>,0
        ): void {0
          container.children = newChildren;0
        },0
      };0
0
  const NoopRenderer = reconciler(hostConfig);0
0
  const rootContainers = new Map();0
  const roots = new Map();0
  const DEFAULT_ROOT_ID = '<default>';0
0
  let yieldedValues = null;0
0
  let unitsRemaining;0
0
  function* flushUnitsOfWork(n: number): Generator<Array<mixed>, void, void> {0
    let didStop = false;0
    while (!didStop && scheduledCallback !== null) {0
      let cb = scheduledCallback;0
      scheduledCallback = null;0
      unitsRemaining = n;0
      cb({0
        timeRemaining() {0
          if (yieldedValues !== null) {0
            return 0;0
          }0
          if (unitsRemaining-- > 0) {0
            return 999;0
          }0
          didStop = true;0
          return 0;0
        },0
        // React's scheduler has its own way of keeping track of expired0
        // work and doesn't read this, so don't bother setting it to the0
        // correct value.0
        didTimeout: false,0
      });0
0
      if (yieldedValues !== null) {0
        const values = yieldedValues;0
        yieldedValues = null;0
        yield values;0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  const ReactNoop = {0
    getChildren(rootID: string = DEFAULT_ROOT_ID) {0
      const container = rootContainers.get(rootID);0
      if (container) {0
        return container.children;0
      } else {0
        return null;0
      }0
    },0
0
    createPortal(0
      children: ReactNodeList,0
      container: Container,0
      key: ?string = null,0
    ) {0
      return ReactPortal.createPortal(children, container, null, key);0
    },0
0
    // Shortcut for testing a single root0
    render(element: React$Element<any>, callback: ?Function) {0
      ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(element, DEFAULT_ROOT_ID, callback);0
    },0
0
    renderToRootWithID(0
      element: React$Element<any>,0
      rootID: string,0
      callback: ?Function,0
    ) {0
      let root = roots.get(rootID);0
      if (!root) {0
        const container = {rootID: rootID, children: []};0
        rootContainers.set(rootID, container);0
        root = NoopRenderer.createContainer(container, true, false);0
        roots.set(rootID, root);0
      }0
      NoopRenderer.updateContainer(element, root, null, callback);0
    },0
0
    unmountRootWithID(rootID: string) {0
      const root = roots.get(rootID);0
      if (root) {0
        NoopRenderer.updateContainer(null, root, null, () => {0
          roots.delete(rootID);0
          rootContainers.delete(rootID);0
        });0
      }0
    },0
0
    findInstance(0
      componentOrElement: Element | ?React$Component<any, any>,0
    ): null | Instance | TextInstance {0
      if (componentOrElement == null) {0
        return null;0
      }0
      // Unsound duck typing.0
      const component = (componentOrElement: any);0
      if (typeof component.id === 'number') {0
        return component;0
      }0
      return NoopRenderer.findHostInstance(component);0
    },0
0
    flushDeferredPri(timeout: number = Infinity): Array<mixed> {0
      // The legacy version of this function decremented the timeout before0
      // returning the new time.0
      // TODO: Convert tests to use flushUnitsOfWork or flushAndYield instead.0
      const n = timeout / 5 - 1;0
0
      let values = [];0
      // eslint-disable-next-line no-for-of-loops/no-for-of-loops0
      for (const value of flushUnitsOfWork(n)) {0
        values.push(...value);0
      }0
      return values;0
    },0
0
    flush(): Array<mixed> {0
      return ReactNoop.flushUnitsOfWork(Infinity);0
    },0
0
    flushAndYield(0
      unitsOfWork: number = Infinity,0
    ): Generator<Array<mixed>, void, void> {0
      return flushUnitsOfWork(unitsOfWork);0
    },0
0
    flushUnitsOfWork(n: number): Array<mixed> {0
      let values = yieldedValues || [];0
      yieldedValues = null;0
      // eslint-disable-next-line no-for-of-loops/no-for-of-loops0
      for (const value of flushUnitsOfWork(n)) {0
        values.push(...value);0
      }0
      return values;0
    },0
0
    flushThrough(expected: Array<mixed>): void {0
      let actual = [];0
      if (expected.length !== 0) {0
        // eslint-disable-next-line no-for-of-loops/no-for-of-loops0
        for (const value of flushUnitsOfWork(Infinity)) {0
          actual.push(...value);0
          if (actual.length >= expected.length) {0
            break;0
          }0
        }0
      }0
      expect(actual).toEqual(expected);0
    },0
0
    expire(ms: number): Array<mixed> {0
      ReactNoop.advanceTime(ms);0
      return ReactNoop.flushExpired();0
    },0
0
    advanceTime(ms: number): void {0
      elapsedTimeInMs += ms;0
    },0
0
    flushExpired(): Array<mixed> {0
      return ReactNoop.flushUnitsOfWork(0);0
    },0
0
    yield(value: mixed) {0
      if (yieldedValues === null) {0
        yieldedValues = [value];0
      } else {0
        yieldedValues.push(value);0
      }0
    },0
0
    clearYields() {0
      const values = yieldedValues;0
      yieldedValues = null;0
      return values;0
    },0
0
    hasScheduledCallback() {0
      return !!scheduledCallback;0
    },0
0
    batchedUpdates: NoopRenderer.batchedUpdates,0
0
    deferredUpdates: NoopRenderer.deferredUpdates,0
0
    unbatchedUpdates: NoopRenderer.unbatchedUpdates,0
0
    interactiveUpdates: NoopRenderer.interactiveUpdates,0
0
    flushSync(fn: () => mixed) {0
      yieldedValues = [];0
      NoopRenderer.flushSync(fn);0
      return yieldedValues;0
    },0
0
    // Logs the current state of the tree.0
    dumpTree(rootID: string = DEFAULT_ROOT_ID) {0
      const root = roots.get(rootID);0
      const rootContainer = rootContainers.get(rootID);0
      if (!root || !rootContainer) {0
        console.log('Nothing rendered yet.');0
        return;0
      }0
0
      let bufferedLog = [];0
      function log(...args) {0
        bufferedLog.push(...args, '\n');0
      }0
0
      function logHostInstances(0
        children: Array<Instance | TextInstance>,0
        depth,0
      ) {0
        for (let i = 0; i < children.length; i++) {0
          const child = children[i];0
          const indent = '  '.repeat(depth);0
          if (typeof child.text === 'string') {0
            log(indent + '- ' + child.text);0
          } else {0
            // $FlowFixMe - The child should've been refined now.0
            log(indent + '- ' + child.type + '#' + child.id);0
            // $FlowFixMe - The child should've been refined now.0
            logHostInstances(child.children, depth + 1);0
          }0
        }0
      }0
      function logContainer(container: Container, depth) {0
        log('  '.repeat(depth) + '- [root#' + container.rootID + ']');0
        logHostInstances(container.children, depth + 1);0
      }0
0
      function logUpdateQueue(updateQueue: UpdateQueue<mixed>, depth) {0
        log('  '.repeat(depth + 1) + 'QUEUED UPDATES');0
        const firstUpdate = updateQueue.firstUpdate;0
        if (!firstUpdate) {0
          return;0
        }0
0
        log(0
          '  '.repeat(depth + 1) + '~',0
          '[' + firstUpdate.expirationTime + ']',0
        );0
        while (firstUpdate.next) {0
          log(0
            '  '.repeat(depth + 1) + '~',0
            '[' + firstUpdate.expirationTime + ']',0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      function logFiber(fiber: Fiber, depth) {0
        log(0
          '  '.repeat(depth) +0
            '- ' +0
            // need to explicitly coerce Symbol to a string0
            (fiber.type ? fiber.type.name || fiber.type.toString() : '[root]'),0
          '[' + fiber.expirationTime + (fiber.pendingProps ? '*' : '') + ']',0
        );0
        if (fiber.updateQueue) {0
          logUpdateQueue(fiber.updateQueue, depth);0
        }0
        // const childInProgress = fiber.progressedChild;0
        // if (childInProgress && childInProgress !== fiber.child) {0
        //   log(0
        //     '  '.repeat(depth + 1) + 'IN PROGRESS: ' + fiber.pendingWorkPriority,0
        //   );0
        //   logFiber(childInProgress, depth + 1);0
        //   if (fiber.child) {0
        //     log('  '.repeat(depth + 1) + 'CURRENT');0
        //   }0
        // } else if (fiber.child && fiber.updateQueue) {0
        //   log('  '.repeat(depth + 1) + 'CHILDREN');0
        // }0
        if (fiber.child) {0
          logFiber(fiber.child, depth + 1);0
        }0
        if (fiber.sibling) {0
          logFiber(fiber.sibling, depth);0
        }0
      }0
0
      log('HOST INSTANCES:');0
      logContainer(rootContainer, 0);0
      log('FIBERS:');0
      logFiber(root.current, 0);0
0
      console.log(...bufferedLog);0
    },0
0
    simulateErrorInHostConfig(fn: () => void) {0
      failInBeginPhase = true;0
      try {0
        fn();0
      } finally {0
        failInBeginPhase = false;0
      }0
    },0
  };0
0
  return ReactNoop;0
}0
0
export default createReactNoop;0

/**0
 * This is a renderer of React that doesn't have a render target output.0
 * It is useful to demonstrate the internals of the reconciler in isolation0
 * and for testing semantics of reconciliation separate from the host0
 * environment.0
 */0
0
import ReactFiberReconciler from 'react-reconciler';0
import createReactNoop from './createReactNoop';0
0
const ReactNoop = createReactNoop(0
  ReactFiberReconciler, // reconciler0
  true, // useMutation0
);0
0
export default ReactNoop;0

/**0
 * This is a renderer of React that doesn't have a render target output.0
 * It is useful to demonstrate the internals of the reconciler in isolation0
 * and for testing semantics of reconciliation separate from the host0
 * environment.0
 */0
0
import ReactFiberPersistentReconciler from 'react-reconciler/persistent';0
import createReactNoop from './createReactNoop';0
0
const ReactNoopPersistent = createReactNoop(0
  ReactFiberPersistentReconciler, // reconciler0
  false, // useMutation0
);0
0
export default ReactNoopPersistent;0

// This entry point is intentionally not typed. It exists only for third-party0
// renderers. The renderers we ship (such as React DOM) instead import a named0
// "inline" entry point (for example, `react-reconciler/inline.dom`). It uses0
// the same code, but the Flow configuration redirects the host config to its0
// real implementation so we can check it against exact intended host types.0
//0
// Only one renderer (the one you passed to `yarn flow <renderer>`) is fully0
// type-checked at any given time. The Flow config maps the0
// `react-reconciler/inline.<renderer>` import (which is *not* Flow typed) to0
// `react-reconciler/inline-typed` (which *is*) for the current renderer.0
// On CI, we run Flow checks for each renderer separately.0
0
'use strict';0
0
const ReactFiberReconciler = require('./src/ReactFiberReconciler');0
0
// TODO: decide on the top-level export form.0
// This is hacky but makes it work with both Rollup and Jest.0
module.exports = ReactFiberReconciler.default0
  ? ReactFiberReconciler.default0
  : ReactFiberReconciler;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
// This file must have the Flow annotation.0
//0
// This is the Flow-typed entry point for the reconciler. It should not be0
// imported directly in code. Instead, our Flow configuration uses this entry0
// point for the currently checked renderer (the one you passed to `yarn flow`).0
//0
// For example, if you run `yarn flow dom`, `react-reconciler/inline.dom` points0
// to this module (and thus will be considered Flow-typed). But other renderers0
// (e.g. `react-test-renderer`) will see reconciler as untyped during the check.0
//0
// We can't make all entry points typed at the same time because different0
// renderers have different host config types. So we check them one by one.0
// We run Flow on all renderers on CI.0
0
export * from './src/ReactFiberReconciler';0

 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0

// Don't add it. See `./inline-typed.js` for an explanation.0
0
export * from './src/ReactFiberReconciler';0

'use strict';0
0
// This is the same export as in index.js,0
// with persistent reconciler flags turned on.0
const ReactFiberReconciler = require('./src/ReactFiberReconciler');0
0
// TODO: decide on the top-level export form.0
// This is hacky but makes it work with both Rollup and Jest.0

  ? ReactFiberReconciler.default0
  : ReactFiberReconciler;0

'use strict';0
0
export * from './src/ReactFiberTreeReflection';0
'use strict';0
0
if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production') {0
  module.exports = require('./cjs/react-reconciler.production.min.js');0
} else {0
  module.exports = require('./cjs/react-reconciler.development.js');0
}0
'use strict';0
0
if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production') {0
  module.exports = require('./cjs/react-reconciler-persistent.production.min.js');0
} else {0
  module.exports = require('./cjs/react-reconciler-persistent.development.js');0
}0
'use strict';0
0
if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production') {0
  module.exports = require('./cjs/react-reconciler-reflection.production.min.js');0
} else {0
  module.exports = require('./cjs/react-reconciler-reflection.development.js');0
}0

// Max 31 bit integer. The max integer size in V8 for 32-bit systems.0
// Math.pow(2, 30) - 10
// 0b1111111111111111111111111111110
export default 1073741823;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {Fiber} from './ReactFiber';0
0
import {getStackAddendumByWorkInProgressFiber} from 'shared/ReactFiberComponentTreeHook';0
0
export type CapturedValue<T> = {0
  value: T,0
  source: Fiber | null,0
  stack: string | null,0
};0
0
export type CapturedError = {0
  componentName: ?string,0
  componentStack: string,0
  error: mixed,0
  errorBoundary: ?Object,0
  errorBoundaryFound: boolean,0
  errorBoundaryName: string | null,0
  willRetry: boolean,0
};0
0
export function createCapturedValue<T>(0
  value: T,0
  source: Fiber,0
): CapturedValue<T> {0
  // If the value is an error, call this function immediately after it is thrown0
  // so the stack is accurate.0
  return {0
    value,0
    source,0
    stack: getStackAddendumByWorkInProgressFiber(source),0
  };0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {ReactElement} from 'shared/ReactElementType';0
import type {ReactPortal} from 'shared/ReactTypes';0
import type {Fiber} from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiber';0
import type {ExpirationTime} from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiberExpirationTime';0
0
import getComponentName from 'shared/getComponentName';0
import {Placement, Deletion} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfSideEffect';0
import {0
  getIteratorFn,0
  REACT_ELEMENT_TYPE,0
  REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE,0
  REACT_PORTAL_TYPE,0
} from 'shared/ReactSymbols';0
import {0
  FunctionalComponent,0
  ClassComponent,0
  HostText,0
  HostPortal,0
  Fragment,0
} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfWork';0
import {getStackAddendumByWorkInProgressFiber} from 'shared/ReactFiberComponentTreeHook';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
import {0
  createWorkInProgress,0
  createFiberFromElement,0
  createFiberFromFragment,0
  createFiberFromText,0
  createFiberFromPortal,0
} from './ReactFiber';0
import {emptyRefsObject} from './ReactFiberClassComponent';0
import ReactDebugCurrentFiber from './ReactDebugCurrentFiber';0
import {StrictMode} from './ReactTypeOfMode';0
0
const {getCurrentFiberStackAddendum} = ReactDebugCurrentFiber;0
0
let didWarnAboutMaps;0
let didWarnAboutStringRefInStrictMode;0
let ownerHasKeyUseWarning;0
let ownerHasFunctionTypeWarning;0
let warnForMissingKey = (child: mixed) => {};0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  didWarnAboutMaps = false;0
  didWarnAboutStringRefInStrictMode = {};0
0
  /**0
   * Warn if there's no key explicitly set on dynamic arrays of children or0
   * object keys are not valid. This allows us to keep track of children between0
   * updates.0
   */0
  ownerHasKeyUseWarning = {};0
  ownerHasFunctionTypeWarning = {};0
0
  warnForMissingKey = (child: mixed) => {0
    if (child === null || typeof child !== 'object') {0
      return;0
    }0
    if (!child._store || child._store.validated || child.key != null) {0
      return;0
    }0
    invariant(0
      typeof child._store === 'object',0
      'React Component in warnForMissingKey should have a _store. ' +0
        'This error is likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
    );0
    child._store.validated = true;0
0
    const currentComponentErrorInfo =0
      'Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique ' +0
      '"key" prop. See https://fb.me/react-warning-keys for ' +0
      'more information.' +0
      (getCurrentFiberStackAddendum() || '');0
    if (ownerHasKeyUseWarning[currentComponentErrorInfo]) {0
      return;0
    }0
    ownerHasKeyUseWarning[currentComponentErrorInfo] = true;0
0
    warning(0
      false,0
      'Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique ' +0
        '"key" prop. See https://fb.me/react-warning-keys for ' +0
        'more information.%s',0
      getCurrentFiberStackAddendum(),0
    );0
  };0
}0
0
const isArray = Array.isArray;0
0
function coerceRef(0
  returnFiber: Fiber,0
  current: Fiber | null,0
  element: ReactElement,0
) {0
  let mixedRef = element.ref;0
  if (0
    mixedRef !== null &&0
    typeof mixedRef !== 'function' &&0
    typeof mixedRef !== 'object'0
  ) {0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      if (returnFiber.mode & StrictMode) {0
        const componentName = getComponentName(returnFiber) || 'Component';0
        if (!didWarnAboutStringRefInStrictMode[componentName]) {0
          warning(0
            false,0
            'A string ref, "%s", has been found within a strict mode tree. ' +0
              'String refs are a source of potential bugs and should be avoided. ' +0
              'We recommend using createRef() instead.' +0
              '\n%s' +0
              '\n\nLearn more about using refs safely here:' +0
              '\nhttps://fb.me/react-strict-mode-string-ref',0
            mixedRef,0
            getStackAddendumByWorkInProgressFiber(returnFiber),0
          );0
          didWarnAboutStringRefInStrictMode[componentName] = true;0
        }0
      }0
    }0
0
    if (element._owner) {0
      const owner: ?Fiber = (element._owner: any);0
      let inst;0
      if (owner) {0
        const ownerFiber = ((owner: any): Fiber);0
        invariant(0
          ownerFiber.tag === ClassComponent,0
          'Stateless function components cannot have refs.',0
        );0
        inst = ownerFiber.stateNode;0
      }0
      invariant(0
        inst,0
        'Missing owner for string ref %s. This error is likely caused by a ' +0
          'bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
        mixedRef,0
      );0
      const stringRef = '' + mixedRef;0
      // Check if previous string ref matches new string ref0
      if (0
        current !== null &&0
        current.ref !== null &&0
        typeof current.ref === 'function' &&0
        current.ref._stringRef === stringRef0
      ) {0
        return current.ref;0
      }0
      const ref = function(value) {0
        let refs = inst.refs;0
        if (refs === emptyRefsObject) {0
          // This is a lazy pooled frozen object, so we need to initialize.0
          refs = inst.refs = {};0
        }0
        if (value === null) {0
          delete refs[stringRef];0
        } else {0
          refs[stringRef] = value;0
        }0
      };0
      ref._stringRef = stringRef;0
      return ref;0
    } else {0
      invariant(0
        typeof mixedRef === 'string',0
        'Expected ref to be a function or a string.',0
      );0
      invariant(0
        element._owner,0
        'Element ref was specified as a string (%s) but no owner was set. This could happen for one of' +0
          ' the following reasons:\n' +0
          '1. You may be adding a ref to a functional component\n' +0
          "2. You may be adding a ref to a component that was not created inside a component's render method\n" +0
          '3. You have multiple copies of React loaded\n' +0
          'See https://fb.me/react-refs-must-have-owner for more information.',0
        mixedRef,0
      );0
    }0
  }0
  return mixedRef;0
}0
0
function throwOnInvalidObjectType(returnFiber: Fiber, newChild: Object) {0
  if (returnFiber.type !== 'textarea') {0
    let addendum = '';0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      addendum =0
        ' If you meant to render a collection of children, use an array ' +0
        'instead.' +0
        (getCurrentFiberStackAddendum() || '');0
    }0
    invariant(0
      false,0
      'Objects are not valid as a React child (found: %s).%s',0
      Object.prototype.toString.call(newChild) === '[object Object]'0
        ? 'object with keys {' + Object.keys(newChild).join(', ') + '}'0
        : newChild,0
      addendum,0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
function warnOnFunctionType() {0
  const currentComponentErrorInfo =0
    'Functions are not valid as a React child. This may happen if ' +0
    'you return a Component instead of <Component /> from render. ' +0
    'Or maybe you meant to call this function rather than return it.' +0
    (getCurrentFiberStackAddendum() || '');0
0
  if (ownerHasFunctionTypeWarning[currentComponentErrorInfo]) {0
    return;0
  }0
  ownerHasFunctionTypeWarning[currentComponentErrorInfo] = true;0
0
  warning(0
    false,0
    'Functions are not valid as a React child. This may happen if ' +0
      'you return a Component instead of <Component /> from render. ' +0
      'Or maybe you meant to call this function rather than return it.%s',0
    getCurrentFiberStackAddendum() || '',0
  );0
}0
0
// This wrapper function exists because I expect to clone the code in each path0
// to be able to optimize each path individually by branching early. This needs0
// a compiler or we can do it manually. Helpers that don't need this branching0
// live outside of this function.0
function ChildReconciler(shouldTrackSideEffects) {0
  function deleteChild(returnFiber: Fiber, childToDelete: Fiber): void {0
    if (!shouldTrackSideEffects) {0
      // Noop.0
      return;0
    }0
    // Deletions are added in reversed order so we add it to the front.0
    // At this point, the return fiber's effect list is empty except for0
    // deletions, so we can just append the deletion to the list. The remaining0
    // effects aren't added until the complete phase. Once we implement0
    // resuming, this may not be true.0
    const last = returnFiber.lastEffect;0
    if (last !== null) {0
      last.nextEffect = childToDelete;0
      returnFiber.lastEffect = childToDelete;0
    } else {0
      returnFiber.firstEffect = returnFiber.lastEffect = childToDelete;0
    }0
    childToDelete.nextEffect = null;0
    childToDelete.effectTag = Deletion;0
  }0
0
  function deleteRemainingChildren(0
    returnFiber: Fiber,0
    currentFirstChild: Fiber | null,0
  ): null {0
    if (!shouldTrackSideEffects) {0
      // Noop.0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    // TODO: For the shouldClone case, this could be micro-optimized a bit by0
    // assuming that after the first child we've already added everything.0
    let childToDelete = currentFirstChild;0
    while (childToDelete !== null) {0
      deleteChild(returnFiber, childToDelete);0
      childToDelete = childToDelete.sibling;0
    }0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  function mapRemainingChildren(0
    returnFiber: Fiber,0
    currentFirstChild: Fiber,0
  ): Map<string | number, Fiber> {0
    // Add the remaining children to a temporary map so that we can find them by0
    // keys quickly. Implicit (null) keys get added to this set with their index0
    // instead.0
    const existingChildren: Map<string | number, Fiber> = new Map();0
0
    let existingChild = currentFirstChild;0
    while (existingChild !== null) {0
      if (existingChild.key !== null) {0
        existingChildren.set(existingChild.key, existingChild);0
      } else {0
        existingChildren.set(existingChild.index, existingChild);0
      }0
      existingChild = existingChild.sibling;0
    }0
    return existingChildren;0
  }0
0
  function useFiber(0
    fiber: Fiber,0
    pendingProps: mixed,0
    expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  ): Fiber {0
    // We currently set sibling to null and index to 0 here because it is easy0
    // to forget to do before returning it. E.g. for the single child case.0
    const clone = createWorkInProgress(fiber, pendingProps, expirationTime);0
    clone.index = 0;0
    clone.sibling = null;0
    return clone;0
  }0
0
  function placeChild(0
    newFiber: Fiber,0
    lastPlacedIndex: number,0
    newIndex: number,0
  ): number {0
    newFiber.index = newIndex;0
    if (!shouldTrackSideEffects) {0
      // Noop.0
      return lastPlacedIndex;0
    }0
    const current = newFiber.alternate;0
    if (current !== null) {0
      const oldIndex = current.index;0
      if (oldIndex < lastPlacedIndex) {0
        // This is a move.0
        newFiber.effectTag = Placement;0
        return lastPlacedIndex;0
      } else {0
        // This item can stay in place.0
        return oldIndex;0
      }0
    } else {0
      // This is an insertion.0
      newFiber.effectTag = Placement;0
      return lastPlacedIndex;0
    }0
  }0
0
  function placeSingleChild(newFiber: Fiber): Fiber {0
    // This is simpler for the single child case. We only need to do a0
    // placement for inserting new children.0
    if (shouldTrackSideEffects && newFiber.alternate === null) {0
      newFiber.effectTag = Placement;0
    }0
    return newFiber;0
  }0
0
  function updateTextNode(0
    returnFiber: Fiber,0
    current: Fiber | null,0
    textContent: string,0
    expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  ) {0
    if (current === null || current.tag !== HostText) {0
      // Insert0
      const created = createFiberFromText(0
        textContent,0
        returnFiber.mode,0
        expirationTime,0
      );0
      created.return = returnFiber;0
      return created;0
    } else {0
      // Update0
      const existing = useFiber(current, textContent, expirationTime);0
      existing.return = returnFiber;0
      return existing;0
    }0
  }0
0
  function updateElement(0
    returnFiber: Fiber,0
    current: Fiber | null,0
    element: ReactElement,0
    expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  ): Fiber {0
    if (current !== null && current.type === element.type) {0
      // Move based on index0
      const existing = useFiber(current, element.props, expirationTime);0
      existing.ref = coerceRef(returnFiber, current, element);0
      existing.return = returnFiber;0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        existing._debugSource = element._source;0
        existing._debugOwner = element._owner;0
      }0
      return existing;0
    } else {0
      // Insert0
      const created = createFiberFromElement(0
        element,0
        returnFiber.mode,0
        expirationTime,0
      );0
      created.ref = coerceRef(returnFiber, current, element);0
      created.return = returnFiber;0
      return created;0
    }0
  }0
0
  function updatePortal(0
    returnFiber: Fiber,0
    current: Fiber | null,0
    portal: ReactPortal,0
    expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  ): Fiber {0
    if (0
      current === null ||0
      current.tag !== HostPortal ||0
      current.stateNode.containerInfo !== portal.containerInfo ||0
      current.stateNode.implementation !== portal.implementation0
    ) {0
      // Insert0
      const created = createFiberFromPortal(0
        portal,0
        returnFiber.mode,0
        expirationTime,0
      );0
      created.return = returnFiber;0
      return created;0
    } else {0
      // Update0
      const existing = useFiber(current, portal.children || [], expirationTime);0
      existing.return = returnFiber;0
      return existing;0
    }0
  }0
0
  function updateFragment(0
    returnFiber: Fiber,0
    current: Fiber | null,0
    fragment: Iterable<*>,0
    expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
    key: null | string,0
  ): Fiber {0
    if (current === null || current.tag !== Fragment) {0
      // Insert0
      const created = createFiberFromFragment(0
        fragment,0
        returnFiber.mode,0
        expirationTime,0
        key,0
      );0
      created.return = returnFiber;0
      return created;0
    } else {0
      // Update0
      const existing = useFiber(current, fragment, expirationTime);0
      existing.return = returnFiber;0
      return existing;0
    }0
  }0
0
  function createChild(0
    returnFiber: Fiber,0
    newChild: any,0
    expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  ): Fiber | null {0
    if (typeof newChild === 'string' || typeof newChild === 'number') {0
      // Text nodes don't have keys. If the previous node is implicitly keyed0
      // we can continue to replace it without aborting even if it is not a text0
      // node.0
      const created = createFiberFromText(0
        '' + newChild,0
        returnFiber.mode,0
        expirationTime,0
      );0
      created.return = returnFiber;0
      return created;0
    }0
0
    if (typeof newChild === 'object' && newChild !== null) {0
      switch (newChild.$$typeof) {0
        case REACT_ELEMENT_TYPE: {0
          const created = createFiberFromElement(0
            newChild,0
            returnFiber.mode,0
            expirationTime,0
          );0
          created.ref = coerceRef(returnFiber, null, newChild);0
          created.return = returnFiber;0
          return created;0
        }0
        case REACT_PORTAL_TYPE: {0
          const created = createFiberFromPortal(0
            newChild,0
            returnFiber.mode,0
            expirationTime,0
          );0
          created.return = returnFiber;0
          return created;0
        }0
      }0
0
      if (isArray(newChild) || getIteratorFn(newChild)) {0
        const created = createFiberFromFragment(0
          newChild,0
          returnFiber.mode,0
          expirationTime,0
          null,0
        );0
        created.return = returnFiber;0
        return created;0
      }0
0
      throwOnInvalidObjectType(returnFiber, newChild);0
    }0
0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      if (typeof newChild === 'function') {0
        warnOnFunctionType();0
      }0
    }0
0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  function updateSlot(0
    returnFiber: Fiber,0
    oldFiber: Fiber | null,0
    newChild: any,0
    expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  ): Fiber | null {0
    // Update the fiber if the keys match, otherwise return null.0
0
    const key = oldFiber !== null ? oldFiber.key : null;0
0
    if (typeof newChild === 'string' || typeof newChild === 'number') {0
      // Text nodes don't have keys. If the previous node is implicitly keyed0
      // we can continue to replace it without aborting even if it is not a text0
      // node.0
      if (key !== null) {0
        return null;0
      }0
      return updateTextNode(0
        returnFiber,0
        oldFiber,0
        '' + newChild,0
        expirationTime,0
      );0
    }0
0
    if (typeof newChild === 'object' && newChild !== null) {0
      switch (newChild.$$typeof) {0
        case REACT_ELEMENT_TYPE: {0
          if (newChild.key === key) {0
            if (newChild.type === REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE) {0
              return updateFragment(0
                returnFiber,0
                oldFiber,0
                newChild.props.children,0
                expirationTime,0
                key,0
              );0
            }0
            return updateElement(0
              returnFiber,0
              oldFiber,0
              newChild,0
              expirationTime,0
            );0
          } else {0
            return null;0
          }0
        }0
        case REACT_PORTAL_TYPE: {0
          if (newChild.key === key) {0
            return updatePortal(0
              returnFiber,0
              oldFiber,0
              newChild,0
              expirationTime,0
            );0
          } else {0
            return null;0
          }0
        }0
      }0
0
      if (isArray(newChild) || getIteratorFn(newChild)) {0
        if (key !== null) {0
          return null;0
        }0
0
        return updateFragment(0
          returnFiber,0
          oldFiber,0
          newChild,0
          expirationTime,0
          null,0
        );0
      }0
0
      throwOnInvalidObjectType(returnFiber, newChild);0
    }0
0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      if (typeof newChild === 'function') {0
        warnOnFunctionType();0
      }0
    }0
0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  function updateFromMap(0
    existingChildren: Map<string | number, Fiber>,0
    returnFiber: Fiber,0
    newIdx: number,0
    newChild: any,0
    expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  ): Fiber | null {0
    if (typeof newChild === 'string' || typeof newChild === 'number') {0
      // Text nodes don't have keys, so we neither have to check the old nor0
      // new node for the key. If both are text nodes, they match.0
      const matchedFiber = existingChildren.get(newIdx) || null;0
      return updateTextNode(0
        returnFiber,0
        matchedFiber,0
        '' + newChild,0
        expirationTime,0
      );0
    }0
0
    if (typeof newChild === 'object' && newChild !== null) {0
      switch (newChild.$$typeof) {0
        case REACT_ELEMENT_TYPE: {0
          const matchedFiber =0
            existingChildren.get(0
              newChild.key === null ? newIdx : newChild.key,0
            ) || null;0
          if (newChild.type === REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE) {0
            return updateFragment(0
              returnFiber,0
              matchedFiber,0
              newChild.props.children,0
              expirationTime,0
              newChild.key,0
            );0
          }0
          return updateElement(0
            returnFiber,0
            matchedFiber,0
            newChild,0
            expirationTime,0
          );0
        }0
        case REACT_PORTAL_TYPE: {0
          const matchedFiber =0
            existingChildren.get(0
              newChild.key === null ? newIdx : newChild.key,0
            ) || null;0
          return updatePortal(0
            returnFiber,0
            matchedFiber,0
            newChild,0
            expirationTime,0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      if (isArray(newChild) || getIteratorFn(newChild)) {0
        const matchedFiber = existingChildren.get(newIdx) || null;0
        return updateFragment(0
          returnFiber,0
          matchedFiber,0
          newChild,0
          expirationTime,0
          null,0
        );0
      }0
0
      throwOnInvalidObjectType(returnFiber, newChild);0
    }0
0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      if (typeof newChild === 'function') {0
        warnOnFunctionType();0
      }0
    }0
0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  /**0
   * Warns if there is a duplicate or missing key0
   */0
  function warnOnInvalidKey(0
    child: mixed,0
    knownKeys: Set<string> | null,0
  ): Set<string> | null {0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      if (typeof child !== 'object' || child === null) {0
        return knownKeys;0
      }0
      switch (child.$$typeof) {0
        case REACT_ELEMENT_TYPE:0
        case REACT_PORTAL_TYPE:0
          warnForMissingKey(child);0
          const key = child.key;0
          if (typeof key !== 'string') {0
            break;0
          }0
          if (knownKeys === null) {0
            knownKeys = new Set();0
            knownKeys.add(key);0
            break;0
          }0
          if (!knownKeys.has(key)) {0
            knownKeys.add(key);0
            break;0
          }0
          warning(0
            false,0
            'Encountered two children with the same key, `%s`. ' +0
              'Keys should be unique so that components maintain their identity ' +0
              'across updates. Non-unique keys may cause children to be ' +0
              'duplicated and/or omitted — the behavior is unsupported and ' +0
              'could change in a future version.%s',0
            key,0
            getCurrentFiberStackAddendum(),0
          );0
          break;0
        default:0
          break;0
      }0
    }0
    return knownKeys;0
  }0
0
  function reconcileChildrenArray(0
    returnFiber: Fiber,0
    currentFirstChild: Fiber | null,0
    newChildren: Array<*>,0
    expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  ): Fiber | null {0
    // This algorithm can't optimize by searching from boths ends since we0
    // don't have backpointers on fibers. I'm trying to see how far we can get0
    // with that model. If it ends up not being worth the tradeoffs, we can0
    // add it later.0
0
    // Even with a two ended optimization, we'd want to optimize for the case0
    // where there are few changes and brute force the comparison instead of0
    // going for the Map. It'd like to explore hitting that path first in0
    // forward-only mode and only go for the Map once we notice that we need0
    // lots of look ahead. This doesn't handle reversal as well as two ended0
    // search but that's unusual. Besides, for the two ended optimization to0
    // work on Iterables, we'd need to copy the whole set.0
0
    // In this first iteration, we'll just live with hitting the bad case0
    // (adding everything to a Map) in for every insert/move.0
0
    // If you change this code, also update reconcileChildrenIterator() which0
    // uses the same algorithm.0
0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      // First, validate keys.0
      let knownKeys = null;0
      for (let i = 0; i < newChildren.length; i++) {0
        const child = newChildren[i];0
        knownKeys = warnOnInvalidKey(child, knownKeys);0
      }0
    }0
0
    let resultingFirstChild: Fiber | null = null;0
    let previousNewFiber: Fiber | null = null;0
0
    let oldFiber = currentFirstChild;0
    let lastPlacedIndex = 0;0
    let newIdx = 0;0
    let nextOldFiber = null;0
    for (; oldFiber !== null && newIdx < newChildren.length; newIdx++) {0
      if (oldFiber.index > newIdx) {0
        nextOldFiber = oldFiber;0
        oldFiber = null;0
      } else {0
        nextOldFiber = oldFiber.sibling;0
      }0
      const newFiber = updateSlot(0
        returnFiber,0
        oldFiber,0
        newChildren[newIdx],0
        expirationTime,0
      );0
      if (newFiber === null) {0
        // TODO: This breaks on empty slots like null children. That's0
        // unfortunate because it triggers the slow path all the time. We need0
        // a better way to communicate whether this was a miss or null,0
        // boolean, undefined, etc.0
        if (oldFiber === null) {0
          oldFiber = nextOldFiber;0
        }0
        break;0
      }0
      if (shouldTrackSideEffects) {0
        if (oldFiber && newFiber.alternate === null) {0
          // We matched the slot, but we didn't reuse the existing fiber, so we0
          // need to delete the existing child.0
          deleteChild(returnFiber, oldFiber);0
        }0
      }0
      lastPlacedIndex = placeChild(newFiber, lastPlacedIndex, newIdx);0
      if (previousNewFiber === null) {0
        // TODO: Move out of the loop. This only happens for the first run.0
        resultingFirstChild = newFiber;0
      } else {0
        // TODO: Defer siblings if we're not at the right index for this slot.0
        // I.e. if we had null values before, then we want to defer this0
        // for each null value. However, we also don't want to call updateSlot0
        // with the previous one.0
        previousNewFiber.sibling = newFiber;0
      }0
      previousNewFiber = newFiber;0
      oldFiber = nextOldFiber;0
    }0
0
    if (newIdx === newChildren.length) {0
      // We've reached the end of the new children. We can delete the rest.0
      deleteRemainingChildren(returnFiber, oldFiber);0
      return resultingFirstChild;0
    }0
0
    if (oldFiber === null) {0
      // If we don't have any more existing children we can choose a fast path0
      // since the rest will all be insertions.0
      for (; newIdx < newChildren.length; newIdx++) {0
        const newFiber = createChild(0
          returnFiber,0
          newChildren[newIdx],0
          expirationTime,0
        );0
        if (!newFiber) {0
          continue;0
        }0
        lastPlacedIndex = placeChild(newFiber, lastPlacedIndex, newIdx);0
        if (previousNewFiber === null) {0
          // TODO: Move out of the loop. This only happens for the first run.0
          resultingFirstChild = newFiber;0
        } else {0
          previousNewFiber.sibling = newFiber;0
        }0
        previousNewFiber = newFiber;0
      }0
      return resultingFirstChild;0
    }0
0
    // Add all children to a key map for quick lookups.0
    const existingChildren = mapRemainingChildren(returnFiber, oldFiber);0
0
    // Keep scanning and use the map to restore deleted items as moves.0
    for (; newIdx < newChildren.length; newIdx++) {0
      const newFiber = updateFromMap(0
        existingChildren,0
        returnFiber,0
        newIdx,0
        newChildren[newIdx],0
        expirationTime,0
      );0
      if (newFiber) {0
        if (shouldTrackSideEffects) {0
          if (newFiber.alternate !== null) {0
            // The new fiber is a work in progress, but if there exists a0
            // current, that means that we reused the fiber. We need to delete0
            // it from the child list so that we don't add it to the deletion0
            // list.0
            existingChildren.delete(0
              newFiber.key === null ? newIdx : newFiber.key,0
            );0
          }0
        }0
        lastPlacedIndex = placeChild(newFiber, lastPlacedIndex, newIdx);0
        if (previousNewFiber === null) {0
          resultingFirstChild = newFiber;0
        } else {0
          previousNewFiber.sibling = newFiber;0
        }0
        previousNewFiber = newFiber;0
      }0
    }0
0
    if (shouldTrackSideEffects) {0
      // Any existing children that weren't consumed above were deleted. We need0
      // to add them to the deletion list.0
      existingChildren.forEach(child => deleteChild(returnFiber, child));0
    }0
0
    return resultingFirstChild;0
  }0
0
  function reconcileChildrenIterator(0
    returnFiber: Fiber,0
    currentFirstChild: Fiber | null,0
    newChildrenIterable: Iterable<*>,0
    expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  ): Fiber | null {0
    // This is the same implementation as reconcileChildrenArray(),0
    // but using the iterator instead.0
0
    const iteratorFn = getIteratorFn(newChildrenIterable);0
    invariant(0
      typeof iteratorFn === 'function',0
      'An object is not an iterable. This error is likely caused by a bug in ' +0
        'React. Please file an issue.',0
    );0
0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      // Warn about using Maps as children0
      if ((newChildrenIterable: any).entries === iteratorFn) {0
        warning(0
          didWarnAboutMaps,0
          'Using Maps as children is unsupported and will likely yield ' +0
            'unexpected results. Convert it to a sequence/iterable of keyed ' +0
            'ReactElements instead.%s',0
          getCurrentFiberStackAddendum(),0
        );0
        didWarnAboutMaps = true;0
      }0
0
      // First, validate keys.0
      // We'll get a different iterator later for the main pass.0
      const newChildren = iteratorFn.call(newChildrenIterable);0
      if (newChildren) {0
        let knownKeys = null;0
        let step = newChildren.next();0
        for (; !step.done; step = newChildren.next()) {0
          const child = step.value;0
          knownKeys = warnOnInvalidKey(child, knownKeys);0
        }0
      }0
    }0
0
    const newChildren = iteratorFn.call(newChildrenIterable);0
    invariant(newChildren != null, 'An iterable object provided no iterator.');0
0
    let resultingFirstChild: Fiber | null = null;0
    let previousNewFiber: Fiber | null = null;0
0
    let oldFiber = currentFirstChild;0
    let lastPlacedIndex = 0;0
    let newIdx = 0;0
    let nextOldFiber = null;0
0
    let step = newChildren.next();0
    for (0
      ;0
      oldFiber !== null && !step.done;0
      newIdx++, step = newChildren.next()0
    ) {0
      if (oldFiber.index > newIdx) {0
        nextOldFiber = oldFiber;0
        oldFiber = null;0
      } else {0
        nextOldFiber = oldFiber.sibling;0
      }0
      const newFiber = updateSlot(0
        returnFiber,0
        oldFiber,0
        step.value,0
        expirationTime,0
      );0
      if (newFiber === null) {0
        // TODO: This breaks on empty slots like null children. That's0
        // unfortunate because it triggers the slow path all the time. We need0
        // a better way to communicate whether this was a miss or null,0
        // boolean, undefined, etc.0
        if (!oldFiber) {0
          oldFiber = nextOldFiber;0
        }0
        break;0
      }0
      if (shouldTrackSideEffects) {0
        if (oldFiber && newFiber.alternate === null) {0
          // We matched the slot, but we didn't reuse the existing fiber, so we0
          // need to delete the existing child.0
          deleteChild(returnFiber, oldFiber);0
        }0
      }0
      lastPlacedIndex = placeChild(newFiber, lastPlacedIndex, newIdx);0
      if (previousNewFiber === null) {0
        // TODO: Move out of the loop. This only happens for the first run.0
        resultingFirstChild = newFiber;0
      } else {0
        // TODO: Defer siblings if we're not at the right index for this slot.0
        // I.e. if we had null values before, then we want to defer this0
        // for each null value. However, we also don't want to call updateSlot0
        // with the previous one.0
        previousNewFiber.sibling = newFiber;0
      }0
      previousNewFiber = newFiber;0
      oldFiber = nextOldFiber;0
    }0
0
    if (step.done) {0
      // We've reached the end of the new children. We can delete the rest.0
      deleteRemainingChildren(returnFiber, oldFiber);0
      return resultingFirstChild;0
    }0
0
    if (oldFiber === null) {0
      // If we don't have any more existing children we can choose a fast path0
      // since the rest will all be insertions.0
      for (; !step.done; newIdx++, step = newChildren.next()) {0
        const newFiber = createChild(returnFiber, step.value, expirationTime);0
        if (newFiber === null) {0
          continue;0
        }0
        lastPlacedIndex = placeChild(newFiber, lastPlacedIndex, newIdx);0
        if (previousNewFiber === null) {0
          // TODO: Move out of the loop. This only happens for the first run.0
          resultingFirstChild = newFiber;0
        } else {0
          previousNewFiber.sibling = newFiber;0
        }0
        previousNewFiber = newFiber;0
      }0
      return resultingFirstChild;0
    }0
0
    // Add all children to a key map for quick lookups.0
    const existingChildren = mapRemainingChildren(returnFiber, oldFiber);0
0
    // Keep scanning and use the map to restore deleted items as moves.0
    for (; !step.done; newIdx++, step = newChildren.next()) {0
      const newFiber = updateFromMap(0
        existingChildren,0
        returnFiber,0
        newIdx,0
        step.value,0
        expirationTime,0
      );0
      if (newFiber !== null) {0
        if (shouldTrackSideEffects) {0
          if (newFiber.alternate !== null) {0
            // The new fiber is a work in progress, but if there exists a0
            // current, that means that we reused the fiber. We need to delete0
            // it from the child list so that we don't add it to the deletion0
            // list.0
            existingChildren.delete(0
              newFiber.key === null ? newIdx : newFiber.key,0
            );0
          }0
        }0
        lastPlacedIndex = placeChild(newFiber, lastPlacedIndex, newIdx);0
        if (previousNewFiber === null) {0
          resultingFirstChild = newFiber;0
        } else {0
          previousNewFiber.sibling = newFiber;0
        }0
        previousNewFiber = newFiber;0
      }0
    }0
0
    if (shouldTrackSideEffects) {0
      // Any existing children that weren't consumed above were deleted. We need0
      // to add them to the deletion list.0
      existingChildren.forEach(child => deleteChild(returnFiber, child));0
    }0
0
    return resultingFirstChild;0
  }0
0
  function reconcileSingleTextNode(0
    returnFiber: Fiber,0
    currentFirstChild: Fiber | null,0
    textContent: string,0
    expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  ): Fiber {0
    // There's no need to check for keys on text nodes since we don't have a0
    // way to define them.0
    if (currentFirstChild !== null && currentFirstChild.tag === HostText) {0
      // We already have an existing node so let's just update it and delete0
      // the rest.0
      deleteRemainingChildren(returnFiber, currentFirstChild.sibling);0
      const existing = useFiber(currentFirstChild, textContent, expirationTime);0
      existing.return = returnFiber;0
      return existing;0
    }0
    // The existing first child is not a text node so we need to create one0
    // and delete the existing ones.0
    deleteRemainingChildren(returnFiber, currentFirstChild);0
    const created = createFiberFromText(0
      textContent,0
      returnFiber.mode,0
      expirationTime,0
    );0
    created.return = returnFiber;0
    return created;0
  }0
0
  function reconcileSingleElement(0
    returnFiber: Fiber,0
    currentFirstChild: Fiber | null,0
    element: ReactElement,0
    expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  ): Fiber {0
    const key = element.key;0
    let child = currentFirstChild;0
    while (child !== null) {0
      // TODO: If key === null and child.key === null, then this only applies to0
      // the first item in the list.0
      if (child.key === key) {0
        if (0
          child.tag === Fragment0
            ? element.type === REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE0
            : child.type === element.type0
        ) {0
          deleteRemainingChildren(returnFiber, child.sibling);0
          const existing = useFiber(0
            child,0
            element.type === REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE0
              ? element.props.children0
              : element.props,0
            expirationTime,0
          );0
          existing.ref = coerceRef(returnFiber, child, element);0
          existing.return = returnFiber;0
          if (__DEV__) {0
            existing._debugSource = element._source;0
            existing._debugOwner = element._owner;0
          }0
          return existing;0
        } else {0
          deleteRemainingChildren(returnFiber, child);0
          break;0
        }0
      } else {0
        deleteChild(returnFiber, child);0
      }0
      child = child.sibling;0
    }0
0
    if (element.type === REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE) {0
      const created = createFiberFromFragment(0
        element.props.children,0
        returnFiber.mode,0
        expirationTime,0
        element.key,0
      );0
      created.return = returnFiber;0
      return created;0
    } else {0
      const created = createFiberFromElement(0
        element,0
        returnFiber.mode,0
        expirationTime,0
      );0
      created.ref = coerceRef(returnFiber, currentFirstChild, element);0
      created.return = returnFiber;0
      return created;0
    }0
  }0
0
  function reconcileSinglePortal(0
    returnFiber: Fiber,0
    currentFirstChild: Fiber | null,0
    portal: ReactPortal,0
    expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  ): Fiber {0
    const key = portal.key;0
    let child = currentFirstChild;0
    while (child !== null) {0
      // TODO: If key === null and child.key === null, then this only applies to0
      // the first item in the list.0
      if (child.key === key) {0
        if (0
          child.tag === HostPortal &&0
          child.stateNode.containerInfo === portal.containerInfo &&0
          child.stateNode.implementation === portal.implementation0
        ) {0
          deleteRemainingChildren(returnFiber, child.sibling);0
          const existing = useFiber(0
            child,0
            portal.children || [],0
            expirationTime,0
          );0
          existing.return = returnFiber;0
          return existing;0
        } else {0
          deleteRemainingChildren(returnFiber, child);0
          break;0
        }0
      } else {0
        deleteChild(returnFiber, child);0
      }0
      child = child.sibling;0
    }0
0
    const created = createFiberFromPortal(0
      portal,0
      returnFiber.mode,0
      expirationTime,0
    );0
    created.return = returnFiber;0
    return created;0
  }0
0
  // This API will tag the children with the side-effect of the reconciliation0
  // itself. They will be added to the side-effect list as we pass through the0
  // children and the parent.0
  function reconcileChildFibers(0
    returnFiber: Fiber,0
    currentFirstChild: Fiber | null,0
    newChild: any,0
    expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  ): Fiber | null {0
    // This function is not recursive.0
    // If the top level item is an array, we treat it as a set of children,0
    // not as a fragment. Nested arrays on the other hand will be treated as0
    // fragment nodes. Recursion happens at the normal flow.0
0
    // Handle top level unkeyed fragments as if they were arrays.0
    // This leads to an ambiguity between <>{[...]}</> and <>...</>.0
    // We treat the ambiguous cases above the same.0
    const isUnkeyedTopLevelFragment =0
      typeof newChild === 'object' &&0
      newChild !== null &&0
      newChild.type === REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE &&0
      newChild.key === null;0
    if (isUnkeyedTopLevelFragment) {0
      newChild = newChild.props.children;0
    }0
0
    // Handle object types0
    const isObject = typeof newChild === 'object' && newChild !== null;0
0
    if (isObject) {0
      switch (newChild.$$typeof) {0
        case REACT_ELEMENT_TYPE:0
          return placeSingleChild(0
            reconcileSingleElement(0
              returnFiber,0
              currentFirstChild,0
              newChild,0
              expirationTime,0
            ),0
          );0
        case REACT_PORTAL_TYPE:0
          return placeSingleChild(0
            reconcileSinglePortal(0
              returnFiber,0
              currentFirstChild,0
              newChild,0
              expirationTime,0
            ),0
          );0
      }0
    }0
0
    if (typeof newChild === 'string' || typeof newChild === 'number') {0
      return placeSingleChild(0
        reconcileSingleTextNode(0
          returnFiber,0
          currentFirstChild,0
          '' + newChild,0
          expirationTime,0
        ),0
      );0
    }0
0
    if (isArray(newChild)) {0
      return reconcileChildrenArray(0
        returnFiber,0
        currentFirstChild,0
        newChild,0
        expirationTime,0
      );0
    }0
0
    if (getIteratorFn(newChild)) {0
      return reconcileChildrenIterator(0
        returnFiber,0
        currentFirstChild,0
        newChild,0
        expirationTime,0
      );0
    }0
0
    if (isObject) {0
      throwOnInvalidObjectType(returnFiber, newChild);0
    }0
0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      if (typeof newChild === 'function') {0
        warnOnFunctionType();0
      }0
    }0
    if (typeof newChild === 'undefined' && !isUnkeyedTopLevelFragment) {0
      // If the new child is undefined, and the return fiber is a composite0
      // component, throw an error. If Fiber return types are disabled,0
      // we already threw above.0
      switch (returnFiber.tag) {0
        case ClassComponent: {0
          if (__DEV__) {0
            const instance = returnFiber.stateNode;0
            if (instance.render._isMockFunction) {0
              // We allow auto-mocks to proceed as if they're returning null.0
              break;0
            }0
          }0
        }0
        // Intentionally fall through to the next case, which handles both0
        // functions and classes0
        // eslint-disable-next-lined no-fallthrough0
        case FunctionalComponent: {0
          const Component = returnFiber.type;0
          invariant(0
            false,0
            '%s(...): Nothing was returned from render. This usually means a ' +0
              'return statement is missing. Or, to render nothing, ' +0
              'return null.',0
            Component.displayName || Component.name || 'Component',0
          );0
        }0
      }0
    }0
0
    // Remaining cases are all treated as empty.0
    return deleteRemainingChildren(returnFiber, currentFirstChild);0
  }0
0
  return reconcileChildFibers;0
}0
0
export const reconcileChildFibers = ChildReconciler(true);0
export const mountChildFibers = ChildReconciler(false);0
0
export function cloneChildFibers(0
  current: Fiber | null,0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
): void {0
  invariant(0
    current === null || workInProgress.child === current.child,0
    'Resuming work not yet implemented.',0
  );0
0
  if (workInProgress.child === null) {0
    return;0
  }0
0
  let currentChild = workInProgress.child;0
  let newChild = createWorkInProgress(0
    currentChild,0
    currentChild.pendingProps,0
    currentChild.expirationTime,0
  );0
  workInProgress.child = newChild;0
0
  newChild.return = workInProgress;0
  while (currentChild.sibling !== null) {0
    currentChild = currentChild.sibling;0
    newChild = newChild.sibling = createWorkInProgress(0
      currentChild,0
      currentChild.pendingProps,0
      currentChild.expirationTime,0
    );0
    newChild.return = workInProgress;0
  }0
  newChild.sibling = null;0
}0

 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import {ReactDebugCurrentFrame} from 'shared/ReactGlobalSharedState';0
import {getStackAddendumByWorkInProgressFiber} from 'shared/ReactFiberComponentTreeHook';0
import getComponentName from 'shared/getComponentName';0
0
import type {Fiber} from './ReactFiber';0
0
type LifeCyclePhase = 'render' | 'getChildContext';0
0
function getCurrentFiberOwnerName(): string | null {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const fiber = ReactDebugCurrentFiber.current;0
    if (fiber === null) {0
      return null;0
    }0
    const owner = fiber._debugOwner;0
    if (owner !== null && typeof owner !== 'undefined') {0
      return getComponentName(owner);0
    }0
  }0
  return null;0
}0
0
function getCurrentFiberStackAddendum(): string | null {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const fiber = ReactDebugCurrentFiber.current;0
    if (fiber === null) {0
      return null;0
    }0
    // Safe because if current fiber exists, we are reconciling,0
    // and it is guaranteed to be the work-in-progress version.0
    return getStackAddendumByWorkInProgressFiber(fiber);0
  }0
  return null;0
}0
0
function resetCurrentFiber() {0
  ReactDebugCurrentFrame.getCurrentStack = null;0
  ReactDebugCurrentFiber.current = null;0
  ReactDebugCurrentFiber.phase = null;0
}0
0
function setCurrentFiber(fiber: Fiber) {0
  ReactDebugCurrentFrame.getCurrentStack = getCurrentFiberStackAddendum;0
  ReactDebugCurrentFiber.current = fiber;0
  ReactDebugCurrentFiber.phase = null;0
}0
0
function setCurrentPhase(phase: LifeCyclePhase | null) {0
  ReactDebugCurrentFiber.phase = phase;0
}0
0
const ReactDebugCurrentFiber = {0
  current: (null: Fiber | null),0
  phase: (null: LifeCyclePhase | null),0
  resetCurrentFiber,0
  setCurrentFiber,0
  setCurrentPhase,0
  getCurrentFiberOwnerName,0
  getCurrentFiberStackAddendum,0
};0
0
export default ReactDebugCurrentFiber;0
/**0

 *0
