 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {Fiber} from './ReactFiber';0
0
import {enableUserTimingAPI} from 'shared/ReactFeatureFlags';0
import getComponentName from 'shared/getComponentName';0
import {0
  HostRoot,0
  HostComponent,0
  HostText,0
  HostPortal,0
  Fragment,0
  ContextProvider,0
  ContextConsumer,0
  Mode,0
} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfWork';0
0
type MeasurementPhase =0
  | 'componentWillMount'0
  | 'componentWillUnmount'0
  | 'componentWillReceiveProps'0
  | 'shouldComponentUpdate'0
  | 'componentWillUpdate'0
  | 'componentDidUpdate'0
  | 'componentDidMount'0
  | 'getChildContext'0
  | 'getSnapshotBeforeUpdate';0
0
// Prefix measurements so that it's possible to filter them.0
// Longer prefixes are hard to read in DevTools.0
const reactEmoji = '\u269B';0
const warningEmoji = '\u26D4';0
const supportsUserTiming =0
  typeof performance !== 'undefined' &&0
  typeof performance.mark === 'function' &&0
  typeof performance.clearMarks === 'function' &&0
  typeof performance.measure === 'function' &&0
  typeof performance.clearMeasures === 'function';0
0
// Keep track of current fiber so that we know the path to unwind on pause.0
// TODO: this looks the same as nextUnitOfWork in scheduler. Can we unify them?0
let currentFiber: Fiber | null = null;0
// If we're in the middle of user code, which fiber and method is it?0
// Reusing `currentFiber` would be confusing for this because user code fiber0
// can change during commit phase too, but we don't need to unwind it (since0
// lifecycles in the commit phase don't resemble a tree).0
let currentPhase: MeasurementPhase | null = null;0
let currentPhaseFiber: Fiber | null = null;0
// Did lifecycle hook schedule an update? This is often a performance problem,0
// so we will keep track of it, and include it in the report.0
// Track commits caused by cascading updates.0
let isCommitting: boolean = false;0
let hasScheduledUpdateInCurrentCommit: boolean = false;0
let hasScheduledUpdateInCurrentPhase: boolean = false;0
let commitCountInCurrentWorkLoop: number = 0;0
let effectCountInCurrentCommit: number = 0;0
let isWaitingForCallback: boolean = false;0
// During commits, we only show a measurement once per method name0
// to avoid stretch the commit phase with measurement overhead.0
const labelsInCurrentCommit: Set<string> = new Set();0
0
const formatMarkName = (markName: string) => {0
  return `${reactEmoji} ${markName}`;0
};0
0
const formatLabel = (label: string, warning: string | null) => {0
  const prefix = warning ? `${warningEmoji} ` : `${reactEmoji} `;0
  const suffix = warning ? ` Warning: ${warning}` : '';0
  return `${prefix}${label}${suffix}`;0
};0
0
const beginMark = (markName: string) => {0
  performance.mark(formatMarkName(markName));0
};0
0
const clearMark = (markName: string) => {0
  performance.clearMarks(formatMarkName(markName));0
};0
0
const endMark = (label: string, markName: string, warning: string | null) => {0
  const formattedMarkName = formatMarkName(markName);0
  const formattedLabel = formatLabel(label, warning);0
  try {0
    performance.measure(formattedLabel, formattedMarkName);0
  } catch (err) {0
    // If previous mark was missing for some reason, this will throw.0
    // This could only happen if React crashed in an unexpected place earlier.0
    // Don't pile on with more errors.0
  }0
  // Clear marks immediately to avoid growing buffer.0
  performance.clearMarks(formattedMarkName);0
  performance.clearMeasures(formattedLabel);0
};0
0
const getFiberMarkName = (label: string, debugID: number) => {0
  return `${label} (#${debugID})`;0
};0
0
const getFiberLabel = (0
  componentName: string,0
  isMounted: boolean,0
  phase: MeasurementPhase | null,0
) => {0
  if (phase === null) {0
    // These are composite component total time measurements.0
    return `${componentName} [${isMounted ? 'update' : 'mount'}]`;0
  } else {0
    // Composite component methods.0
    return `${componentName}.${phase}`;0
  }0
};0
0
const beginFiberMark = (0
  fiber: Fiber,0
  phase: MeasurementPhase | null,0
): boolean => {0
  const componentName = getComponentName(fiber) || 'Unknown';0
  const debugID = ((fiber._debugID: any): number);0
  const isMounted = fiber.alternate !== null;0
  const label = getFiberLabel(componentName, isMounted, phase);0
0
  if (isCommitting && labelsInCurrentCommit.has(label)) {0
    // During the commit phase, we don't show duplicate labels because0
    // there is a fixed overhead for every measurement, and we don't0
    // want to stretch the commit phase beyond necessary.0
    return false;0
  }0
  labelsInCurrentCommit.add(label);0
0
  const markName = getFiberMarkName(label, debugID);0
  beginMark(markName);0
  return true;0
};0
0
const clearFiberMark = (fiber: Fiber, phase: MeasurementPhase | null) => {0
  const componentName = getComponentName(fiber) || 'Unknown';0
  const debugID = ((fiber._debugID: any): number);0
  const isMounted = fiber.alternate !== null;0
  const label = getFiberLabel(componentName, isMounted, phase);0
  const markName = getFiberMarkName(label, debugID);0
  clearMark(markName);0
};0
0
const endFiberMark = (0
  fiber: Fiber,0
  phase: MeasurementPhase | null,0
  warning: string | null,0
) => {0
  const componentName = getComponentName(fiber) || 'Unknown';0
  const debugID = ((fiber._debugID: any): number);0
  const isMounted = fiber.alternate !== null;0
  const label = getFiberLabel(componentName, isMounted, phase);0
  const markName = getFiberMarkName(label, debugID);0
  endMark(label, markName, warning);0
};0
0
const shouldIgnoreFiber = (fiber: Fiber): boolean => {0
  // Host components should be skipped in the timeline.0
  // We could check typeof fiber.type, but does this work with RN?0
  switch (fiber.tag) {0
    case HostRoot:0
    case HostComponent:0
    case HostText:0
    case HostPortal:0
    case Fragment:0
    case ContextProvider:0
    case ContextConsumer:0
    case Mode:0
      return true;0
    default:0
      return false;0
  }0
};0
0
const clearPendingPhaseMeasurement = () => {0
  if (currentPhase !== null && currentPhaseFiber !== null) {0
    clearFiberMark(currentPhaseFiber, currentPhase);0
  }0
  currentPhaseFiber = null;0
  currentPhase = null;0
  hasScheduledUpdateInCurrentPhase = false;0
};0
0
const pauseTimers = () => {0
  // Stops all currently active measurements so that they can be resumed0
  // if we continue in a later deferred loop from the same unit of work.0
  let fiber = currentFiber;0
  while (fiber) {0
    if (fiber._debugIsCurrentlyTiming) {0
      endFiberMark(fiber, null, null);0
    }0
    fiber = fiber.return;0
  }0
};0
0
const resumeTimersRecursively = (fiber: Fiber) => {0
  if (fiber.return !== null) {0
    resumeTimersRecursively(fiber.return);0
  }0
  if (fiber._debugIsCurrentlyTiming) {0
    beginFiberMark(fiber, null);0
  }0
};0
0
const resumeTimers = () => {0
  // Resumes all measurements that were active during the last deferred loop.0
  if (currentFiber !== null) {0
    resumeTimersRecursively(currentFiber);0
  }0
};0
0
export function recordEffect(): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    effectCountInCurrentCommit++;0
  }0
}0
0
export function recordScheduleUpdate(): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    if (isCommitting) {0
      hasScheduledUpdateInCurrentCommit = true;0
    }0
    if (0
      currentPhase !== null &&0
      currentPhase !== 'componentWillMount' &&0
      currentPhase !== 'componentWillReceiveProps'0
    ) {0
      hasScheduledUpdateInCurrentPhase = true;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
export function startRequestCallbackTimer(): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    if (supportsUserTiming && !isWaitingForCallback) {0
      isWaitingForCallback = true;0
      beginMark('(Waiting for async callback...)');0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
export function stopRequestCallbackTimer(0
  didExpire: boolean,0
  expirationTime: number,0
): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    if (supportsUserTiming) {0
      isWaitingForCallback = false;0
      const warning = didExpire ? 'React was blocked by main thread' : null;0
      endMark(0
        `(Waiting for async callback... will force flush in ${expirationTime} ms)`,0
        '(Waiting for async callback...)',0
        warning,0
      );0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
export function startWorkTimer(fiber: Fiber): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    if (!supportsUserTiming || shouldIgnoreFiber(fiber)) {0
      return;0
    }0
    // If we pause, this is the fiber to unwind from.0
    currentFiber = fiber;0
    if (!beginFiberMark(fiber, null)) {0
      return;0
    }0
    fiber._debugIsCurrentlyTiming = true;0
  }0
}0
0
export function cancelWorkTimer(fiber: Fiber): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    if (!supportsUserTiming || shouldIgnoreFiber(fiber)) {0
      return;0
    }0
    // Remember we shouldn't complete measurement for this fiber.0
    // Otherwise flamechart will be deep even for small updates.0
    fiber._debugIsCurrentlyTiming = false;0
    clearFiberMark(fiber, null);0
  }0
}0
0
export function stopWorkTimer(fiber: Fiber): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    if (!supportsUserTiming || shouldIgnoreFiber(fiber)) {0
      return;0
    }0
    // If we pause, its parent is the fiber to unwind from.0
    currentFiber = fiber.return;0
    if (!fiber._debugIsCurrentlyTiming) {0
      return;0
    }0
    fiber._debugIsCurrentlyTiming = false;0
    endFiberMark(fiber, null, null);0
  }0
}0
0
export function stopFailedWorkTimer(fiber: Fiber): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    if (!supportsUserTiming || shouldIgnoreFiber(fiber)) {0
      return;0
    }0
    // If we pause, its parent is the fiber to unwind from.0
    currentFiber = fiber.return;0
    if (!fiber._debugIsCurrentlyTiming) {0
      return;0
    }0
    fiber._debugIsCurrentlyTiming = false;0
    const warning = 'An error was thrown inside this error boundary';0
    endFiberMark(fiber, null, warning);0
  }0
}0
0
export function startPhaseTimer(fiber: Fiber, phase: MeasurementPhase): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    if (!supportsUserTiming) {0
      return;0
    }0
    clearPendingPhaseMeasurement();0
    if (!beginFiberMark(fiber, phase)) {0
      return;0
    }0
    currentPhaseFiber = fiber;0
    currentPhase = phase;0
  }0
}0
0
export function stopPhaseTimer(): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    if (!supportsUserTiming) {0
      return;0
    }0
    if (currentPhase !== null && currentPhaseFiber !== null) {0
      const warning = hasScheduledUpdateInCurrentPhase0
        ? 'Scheduled a cascading update'0
        : null;0
      endFiberMark(currentPhaseFiber, currentPhase, warning);0
    }0
    currentPhase = null;0
    currentPhaseFiber = null;0
  }0
}0
0
export function startWorkLoopTimer(nextUnitOfWork: Fiber | null): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    currentFiber = nextUnitOfWork;0
    if (!supportsUserTiming) {0
      return;0
    }0
    commitCountInCurrentWorkLoop = 0;0
    // This is top level call.0
    // Any other measurements are performed within.0
    beginMark('(React Tree Reconciliation)');0
    // Resume any measurements that were in progress during the last loop.0
    resumeTimers();0
  }0
}0
0
export function stopWorkLoopTimer(0
  interruptedBy: Fiber | null,0
  didCompleteRoot: boolean,0
): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    if (!supportsUserTiming) {0
      return;0
    }0
    let warning = null;0
    if (interruptedBy !== null) {0
      if (interruptedBy.tag === HostRoot) {0
        warning = 'A top-level update interrupted the previous render';0
      } else {0
        const componentName = getComponentName(interruptedBy) || 'Unknown';0
        warning = `An update to ${componentName} interrupted the previous render`;0
      }0
    } else if (commitCountInCurrentWorkLoop > 1) {0
      warning = 'There were cascading updates';0
    }0
    commitCountInCurrentWorkLoop = 0;0
    let label = didCompleteRoot0
      ? '(React Tree Reconciliation: Completed Root)'0
      : '(React Tree Reconciliation: Yielded)';0
    // Pause any measurements until the next loop.0
    pauseTimers();0
    endMark(label, '(React Tree Reconciliation)', warning);0
  }0
}0
0
export function startCommitTimer(): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    if (!supportsUserTiming) {0
      return;0
    }0
    isCommitting = true;0
    hasScheduledUpdateInCurrentCommit = false;0
    labelsInCurrentCommit.clear();0
    beginMark('(Committing Changes)');0
  }0
}0
0
export function stopCommitTimer(): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    if (!supportsUserTiming) {0
      return;0
    }0
0
    let warning = null;0
    if (hasScheduledUpdateInCurrentCommit) {0
      warning = 'Lifecycle hook scheduled a cascading update';0
    } else if (commitCountInCurrentWorkLoop > 0) {0
      warning = 'Caused by a cascading update in earlier commit';0
    }0
    hasScheduledUpdateInCurrentCommit = false;0
    commitCountInCurrentWorkLoop++;0
    isCommitting = false;0
    labelsInCurrentCommit.clear();0
0
    endMark('(Committing Changes)', '(Committing Changes)', warning);0
  }0
}0
0
export function startCommitSnapshotEffectsTimer(): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    if (!supportsUserTiming) {0
      return;0
    }0
    effectCountInCurrentCommit = 0;0
    beginMark('(Committing Snapshot Effects)');0
  }0
}0
0
export function stopCommitSnapshotEffectsTimer(): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    if (!supportsUserTiming) {0
      return;0
    }0
    const count = effectCountInCurrentCommit;0
    effectCountInCurrentCommit = 0;0
    endMark(0
      `(Committing Snapshot Effects: ${count} Total)`,0
      '(Committing Snapshot Effects)',0
      null,0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export function startCommitHostEffectsTimer(): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    if (!supportsUserTiming) {0
      return;0
    }0
    effectCountInCurrentCommit = 0;0
    beginMark('(Committing Host Effects)');0
  }0
}0
0
export function stopCommitHostEffectsTimer(): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    if (!supportsUserTiming) {0
      return;0
    }0
    const count = effectCountInCurrentCommit;0
    effectCountInCurrentCommit = 0;0
    endMark(0
      `(Committing Host Effects: ${count} Total)`,0
      '(Committing Host Effects)',0
      null,0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
export function startCommitLifeCyclesTimer(): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    if (!supportsUserTiming) {0
      return;0
    }0
    effectCountInCurrentCommit = 0;0
    beginMark('(Calling Lifecycle Methods)');0
  }0
}0
0
export function stopCommitLifeCyclesTimer(): void {0
  if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
    if (!supportsUserTiming) {0
      return;0
    }0
    const count = effectCountInCurrentCommit;0
    effectCountInCurrentCommit = 0;0
    endMark(0
      `(Calling Lifecycle Methods: ${count} Total)`,0
      '(Calling Lifecycle Methods)',0
      null,0
    );0
  }0
}0

 * @flow0

import type {ReactElement, Source} from 'shared/ReactElementType';0
import type {ReactFragment, ReactPortal, RefObject} from 'shared/ReactTypes';0
import type {TypeOfWork} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfWork';0
import type {TypeOfMode} from './ReactTypeOfMode';0
import type {TypeOfSideEffect} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfSideEffect';0
import type {ExpirationTime} from './ReactFiberExpirationTime';0
import type {UpdateQueue} from './ReactUpdateQueue';0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import {enableProfilerTimer} from 'shared/ReactFeatureFlags';0
import {NoEffect} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfSideEffect';0
import {0
  IndeterminateComponent,0
  ClassComponent,0
  HostRoot,0
  HostComponent,0
  HostText,0
  HostPortal,0
  ForwardRef,0
  Fragment,0
  Mode,0
  ContextProvider,0
  ContextConsumer,0
  Profiler,0
  TimeoutComponent,0
} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfWork';0
import getComponentName from 'shared/getComponentName';0
0
import {isDevToolsPresent} from './ReactFiberDevToolsHook';0
import {NoWork} from './ReactFiberExpirationTime';0
import {NoContext, AsyncMode, ProfileMode, StrictMode} from './ReactTypeOfMode';0
import {0
  REACT_FORWARD_REF_TYPE,0
  REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE,0
  REACT_STRICT_MODE_TYPE,0
  REACT_PROFILER_TYPE,0
  REACT_PROVIDER_TYPE,0
  REACT_CONTEXT_TYPE,0
  REACT_ASYNC_MODE_TYPE,0
  REACT_TIMEOUT_TYPE,0
} from 'shared/ReactSymbols';0
0
let hasBadMapPolyfill;0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  hasBadMapPolyfill = false;0
  try {0
    const nonExtensibleObject = Object.preventExtensions({});0
    const testMap = new Map([[nonExtensibleObject, null]]);0
    const testSet = new Set([nonExtensibleObject]);0
    // This is necessary for Rollup to not consider these unused.0
    // https://github.com/rollup/rollup/issues/17710
    // TODO: we can remove these if Rollup fixes the bug.0
    testMap.set(0, 0);0
    testSet.add(0);0
  } catch (e) {0
    // TODO: Consider warning about bad polyfills0
    hasBadMapPolyfill = true;0
  }0
}0
0
// A Fiber is work on a Component that needs to be done or was done. There can0
// be more than one per component.0
export type Fiber = {|0
  // These first fields are conceptually members of an Instance. This used to0
  // be split into a separate type and intersected with the other Fiber fields,0
  // but until Flow fixes its intersection bugs, we've merged them into a0
  // single type.0
0
  // An Instance is shared between all versions of a component. We can easily0
  // break this out into a separate object to avoid copying so much to the0
  // alternate versions of the tree. We put this on a single object for now to0
  // minimize the number of objects created during the initial render.0
0
  // Tag identifying the type of fiber.0
  tag: TypeOfWork,0
0
  // Unique identifier of this child.0
  key: null | string,0
0
  // The function/class/module associated with this fiber.0
  type: any,0
0
  // The local state associated with this fiber.0
  stateNode: any,0
0
  // Conceptual aliases0
  // parent : Instance -> return The parent happens to be the same as the0
  // return fiber since we've merged the fiber and instance.0
0
  // Remaining fields belong to Fiber0
0
  // The Fiber to return to after finishing processing this one.0
  // This is effectively the parent, but there can be multiple parents (two)0
  // so this is only the parent of the thing we're currently processing.0
  // It is conceptually the same as the return address of a stack frame.0
  return: Fiber | null,0
0
  // Singly Linked List Tree Structure.0
  child: Fiber | null,0
  sibling: Fiber | null,0
  index: number,0
0
  // The ref last used to attach this node.0
  // I'll avoid adding an owner field for prod and model that as functions.0
  ref: null | (((handle: mixed) => void) & {_stringRef: ?string}) | RefObject,0
0
  // Input is the data coming into process this fiber. Arguments. Props.0
  pendingProps: any, // This type will be more specific once we overload the tag.0
  memoizedProps: any, // The props used to create the output.0
0
  // A queue of state updates and callbacks.0
  updateQueue: UpdateQueue<any> | null,0
0
  // The state used to create the output0
  memoizedState: any,0
0
  // Bitfield that describes properties about the fiber and its subtree. E.g.0
  // the AsyncMode flag indicates whether the subtree should be async-by-0
  // default. When a fiber is created, it inherits the mode of its0
  // parent. Additional flags can be set at creation time, but after that the0
  // value should remain unchanged throughout the fiber's lifetime, particularly0
  // before its child fibers are created.0
  mode: TypeOfMode,0
0
  // Effect0
  effectTag: TypeOfSideEffect,0
0
  // Singly linked list fast path to the next fiber with side-effects.0
  nextEffect: Fiber | null,0
0
  // The first and last fiber with side-effect within this subtree. This allows0
  // us to reuse a slice of the linked list when we reuse the work done within0
  // this fiber.0
  firstEffect: Fiber | null,0
  lastEffect: Fiber | null,0
0
  // Represents a time in the future by which this work should be completed.0
  // This is also used to quickly determine if a subtree has no pending changes.0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
0
  // This is a pooled version of a Fiber. Every fiber that gets updated will0
  // eventually have a pair. There are cases when we can clean up pairs to save0
  // memory if we need to.0
  alternate: Fiber | null,0
0
  // Time spent rendering this Fiber and its descendants for the current update.0
  // This tells us how well the tree makes use of sCU for memoization.0
  // This field is only set when the enableProfilerTimer flag is enabled.0
  actualDuration?: number,0
0
  // If the Fiber is currently active in the "render" phase,0
  // This marks the time at which the work began.0
  // This field is only set when the enableProfilerTimer flag is enabled.0
  actualStartTime?: number,0
0
  // Duration of the most recent render time for this Fiber.0
  // This value is not updated when we bailout for memoization purposes.0
  // This field is only set when the enableProfilerTimer flag is enabled.0
  selfBaseTime?: number,0
0
  // Sum of base times for all descedents of this Fiber.0
  // This value bubbles up during the "complete" phase.0
  // This field is only set when the enableProfilerTimer flag is enabled.0
  treeBaseTime?: number,0
0
  // Conceptual aliases0
  // workInProgress : Fiber ->  alternate The alternate used for reuse happens0
  // to be the same as work in progress.0
  // __DEV__ only0
  _debugID?: number,0
  _debugSource?: Source | null,0
  _debugOwner?: Fiber | null,0
  _debugIsCurrentlyTiming?: boolean,0
|};0
0
let debugCounter;0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  debugCounter = 1;0
}0
0
function FiberNode(0
  tag: TypeOfWork,0
  pendingProps: mixed,0
  key: null | string,0
  mode: TypeOfMode,0
) {0
  // Instance0
  this.tag = tag;0
  this.key = key;0
  this.type = null;0
  this.stateNode = null;0
0
  // Fiber0
  this.return = null;0
  this.child = null;0
  this.sibling = null;0
  this.index = 0;0
0
  this.ref = null;0
0
  this.pendingProps = pendingProps;0
  this.memoizedProps = null;0
  this.updateQueue = null;0
  this.memoizedState = null;0
0
  this.mode = mode;0
0
  // Effects0
  this.effectTag = NoEffect;0
  this.nextEffect = null;0
0
  this.firstEffect = null;0
  this.lastEffect = null;0
0
  this.expirationTime = NoWork;0
0
  this.alternate = null;0
0
  if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
    this.actualDuration = 0;0
    this.actualStartTime = 0;0
    this.selfBaseTime = 0;0
    this.treeBaseTime = 0;0
  }0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    this._debugID = debugCounter++;0
    this._debugSource = null;0
    this._debugOwner = null;0
    this._debugIsCurrentlyTiming = false;0
    if (!hasBadMapPolyfill && typeof Object.preventExtensions === 'function') {0
      Object.preventExtensions(this);0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
// This is a constructor function, rather than a POJO constructor, still0
// please ensure we do the following:0
// 1) Nobody should add any instance methods on this. Instance methods can be0
//    more difficult to predict when they get optimized and they are almost0
//    never inlined properly in static compilers.0
// 2) Nobody should rely on `instanceof Fiber` for type testing. We should0
//    always know when it is a fiber.0
// 3) We might want to experiment with using numeric keys since they are easier0
//    to optimize in a non-JIT environment.0
// 4) We can easily go from a constructor to a createFiber object literal if that0
//    is faster.0
// 5) It should be easy to port this to a C struct and keep a C implementation0
//    compatible.0
const createFiber = function(0
  tag: TypeOfWork,0
  pendingProps: mixed,0
  key: null | string,0
  mode: TypeOfMode,0
): Fiber {0
  // $FlowFixMe: the shapes are exact here but Flow doesn't like constructors0
  return new FiberNode(tag, pendingProps, key, mode);0
};0
0
function shouldConstruct(Component) {0
  return !!(Component.prototype && Component.prototype.isReactComponent);0
}0
0
// This is used to create an alternate fiber to do work on.0
export function createWorkInProgress(0
  current: Fiber,0
  pendingProps: any,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
): Fiber {0
  let workInProgress = current.alternate;0
  if (workInProgress === null) {0
    // We use a double buffering pooling technique because we know that we'll0
    // only ever need at most two versions of a tree. We pool the "other" unused0
    // node that we're free to reuse. This is lazily created to avoid allocating0
    // extra objects for things that are never updated. It also allow us to0
    // reclaim the extra memory if needed.0
    workInProgress = createFiber(0
      current.tag,0
      pendingProps,0
      current.key,0
      current.mode,0
    );0
    workInProgress.type = current.type;0
    workInProgress.stateNode = current.stateNode;0
0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      // DEV-only fields0
      workInProgress._debugID = current._debugID;0
      workInProgress._debugSource = current._debugSource;0
      workInProgress._debugOwner = current._debugOwner;0
    }0
0
    workInProgress.alternate = current;0
    current.alternate = workInProgress;0
  } else {0
    workInProgress.pendingProps = pendingProps;0
0
    // We already have an alternate.0
    // Reset the effect tag.0
    workInProgress.effectTag = NoEffect;0
0
    // The effect list is no longer valid.0
    workInProgress.nextEffect = null;0
    workInProgress.firstEffect = null;0
    workInProgress.lastEffect = null;0
0
    if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
      // We intentionally reset, rather than copy, actualDuration & actualStartTime.0
      // This prevents time from endlessly accumulating in new commits.0
      // This has the downside of resetting values for different priority renders,0
      // But works for yielding (the common case) and should support resuming.0
      workInProgress.actualDuration = 0;0
      workInProgress.actualStartTime = 0;0
    }0
  }0
0
  workInProgress.expirationTime = expirationTime;0
0
  workInProgress.child = current.child;0
  workInProgress.memoizedProps = current.memoizedProps;0
  workInProgress.memoizedState = current.memoizedState;0
  workInProgress.updateQueue = current.updateQueue;0
0
  // These will be overridden during the parent's reconciliation0
  workInProgress.sibling = current.sibling;0
  workInProgress.index = current.index;0
  workInProgress.ref = current.ref;0
0
  if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
    workInProgress.selfBaseTime = current.selfBaseTime;0
    workInProgress.treeBaseTime = current.treeBaseTime;0
  }0
0
  return workInProgress;0
}0
0
export function createHostRootFiber(isAsync: boolean): Fiber {0
  let mode = isAsync ? AsyncMode | StrictMode : NoContext;0
0
  if (enableProfilerTimer && isDevToolsPresent) {0
    // Always collect profile timings when DevTools are present.0
    // This enables DevTools to start capturing timing at any point–0
    // Without some nodes in the tree having empty base times.0
    mode |= ProfileMode;0
  }0
0
  return createFiber(HostRoot, null, null, mode);0
}0
0
export function createFiberFromElement(0
  element: ReactElement,0
  mode: TypeOfMode,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
): Fiber {0
  let owner = null;0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    owner = element._owner;0
  }0
0
  let fiber;0
  const type = element.type;0
  const key = element.key;0
  let pendingProps = element.props;0
0
  let fiberTag;0
  if (typeof type === 'function') {0
    fiberTag = shouldConstruct(type) ? ClassComponent : IndeterminateComponent;0
  } else if (typeof type === 'string') {0
    fiberTag = HostComponent;0
  } else {0
    switch (type) {0
      case REACT_FRAGMENT_TYPE:0
        return createFiberFromFragment(0
          pendingProps.children,0
          mode,0
          expirationTime,0
          key,0
        );0
      case REACT_ASYNC_MODE_TYPE:0
        fiberTag = Mode;0
        mode |= AsyncMode | StrictMode;0
        break;0
      case REACT_STRICT_MODE_TYPE:0
        fiberTag = Mode;0
        mode |= StrictMode;0
        break;0
      case REACT_PROFILER_TYPE:0
        return createFiberFromProfiler(pendingProps, mode, expirationTime, key);0
      case REACT_TIMEOUT_TYPE:0
        fiberTag = TimeoutComponent;0
        // Suspense does not require async, but its children should be strict0
        // mode compatible.0
        mode |= StrictMode;0
        break;0
      default:0
        fiberTag = getFiberTagFromObjectType(type, owner);0
        break;0
    }0
  }0
0
  fiber = createFiber(fiberTag, pendingProps, key, mode);0
  fiber.type = type;0
  fiber.expirationTime = expirationTime;0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    fiber._debugSource = element._source;0
    fiber._debugOwner = element._owner;0
  }0
0
  return fiber;0
}0
0
function getFiberTagFromObjectType(type, owner): TypeOfWork {0
  const $$typeof =0
    typeof type === 'object' && type !== null ? type.$$typeof : null;0
0
  switch ($$typeof) {0
    case REACT_PROVIDER_TYPE:0
      return ContextProvider;0
    case REACT_CONTEXT_TYPE:0
      // This is a consumer0
      return ContextConsumer;0
    case REACT_FORWARD_REF_TYPE:0
      return ForwardRef;0
    default: {0
      let info = '';0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        if (0
          type === undefined ||0
          (typeof type === 'object' &&0
            type !== null &&0
            Object.keys(type).length === 0)0
        ) {0
          info +=0
            ' You likely forgot to export your component from the file ' +0
            "it's defined in, or you might have mixed up default and " +0
            'named imports.';0
        }0
        const ownerName = owner ? getComponentName(owner) : null;0
        if (ownerName) {0
          info += '\n\nCheck the render method of `' + ownerName + '`.';0
        }0
      }0
      invariant(0
        false,0
        'Element type is invalid: expected a string (for built-in ' +0
          'components) or a class/function (for composite components) ' +0
          'but got: %s.%s',0
        type == null ? type : typeof type,0
        info,0
      );0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
export function createFiberFromFragment(0
  elements: ReactFragment,0
  mode: TypeOfMode,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  key: null | string,0
): Fiber {0
  const fiber = createFiber(Fragment, elements, key, mode);0
  fiber.expirationTime = expirationTime;0
  return fiber;0
}0
0
export function createFiberFromProfiler(0
  pendingProps: any,0
  mode: TypeOfMode,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  key: null | string,0
): Fiber {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (0
      typeof pendingProps.id !== 'string' ||0
      typeof pendingProps.onRender !== 'function'0
    ) {0
      invariant(0
        false,0
        'Profiler must specify an "id" string and "onRender" function as props',0
      );0
    }0
  }0
0
  const fiber = createFiber(Profiler, pendingProps, key, mode | ProfileMode);0
  fiber.type = REACT_PROFILER_TYPE;0
  fiber.expirationTime = expirationTime;0
0
  return fiber;0
}0
0
export function createFiberFromText(0
  content: string,0
  mode: TypeOfMode,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
): Fiber {0
  const fiber = createFiber(HostText, content, null, mode);0
  fiber.expirationTime = expirationTime;0
  return fiber;0
}0
0
export function createFiberFromHostInstanceForDeletion(): Fiber {0
  const fiber = createFiber(HostComponent, null, null, NoContext);0
  fiber.type = 'DELETED';0
  return fiber;0
}0
0
export function createFiberFromPortal(0
  portal: ReactPortal,0
  mode: TypeOfMode,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
): Fiber {0
  const pendingProps = portal.children !== null ? portal.children : [];0
  const fiber = createFiber(HostPortal, pendingProps, portal.key, mode);0
  fiber.expirationTime = expirationTime;0
  fiber.stateNode = {0
    containerInfo: portal.containerInfo,0
    pendingChildren: null, // Used by persistent updates0
    implementation: portal.implementation,0
  };0
  return fiber;0
}0
0
// Used for stashing WIP properties to replay failed work in DEV.0
export function assignFiberPropertiesInDEV(0
  target: Fiber | null,0
  source: Fiber,0
): Fiber {0
  if (target === null) {0
    // This Fiber's initial properties will always be overwritten.0
    // We only use a Fiber to ensure the same hidden class so DEV isn't slow.0
    target = createFiber(IndeterminateComponent, null, null, NoContext);0
  }0
0
  // This is intentionally written as a list of all properties.0
  // We tried to use Object.assign() instead but this is called in0
  // the hottest path, and Object.assign() was too slow:0
  // https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/125020
  // This code is DEV-only so size is not a concern.0
0
  target.tag = source.tag;0
  target.key = source.key;0
  target.type = source.type;0
  target.stateNode = source.stateNode;0
  target.return = source.return;0
  target.child = source.child;0
  target.sibling = source.sibling;0
  target.index = source.index;0
  target.ref = source.ref;0
  target.pendingProps = source.pendingProps;0
  target.memoizedProps = source.memoizedProps;0
  target.updateQueue = source.updateQueue;0
  target.memoizedState = source.memoizedState;0
  target.mode = source.mode;0
  target.effectTag = source.effectTag;0
  target.nextEffect = source.nextEffect;0
  target.firstEffect = source.firstEffect;0
  target.lastEffect = source.lastEffect;0
  target.expirationTime = source.expirationTime;0
  target.alternate = source.alternate;0
  if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
    target.actualDuration = source.actualDuration;0
    target.actualStartTime = source.actualStartTime;0
    target.selfBaseTime = source.selfBaseTime;0
    target.treeBaseTime = source.treeBaseTime;0
  }0
  target._debugID = source._debugID;0
  target._debugSource = source._debugSource;0
  target._debugOwner = source._debugOwner;0
  target._debugIsCurrentlyTiming = source._debugIsCurrentlyTiming;0
  return target;0
}0

import MAX_SIGNED_31_BIT_INT from './maxSigned31BitInt';0

const {getCurrentFiberStackAddendum} = ReactDebugCurrentFiber;0
0
let didWarnAboutBadClass;0
let didWarnAboutGetDerivedStateOnFunctionalComponent;0
let didWarnAboutStatelessRefs;0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  didWarnAboutBadClass = {};0
  didWarnAboutGetDerivedStateOnFunctionalComponent = {};0
  didWarnAboutStatelessRefs = {};0
}0
0
// TODO: Remove this and use reconcileChildrenAtExpirationTime directly.0
function reconcileChildren(current, workInProgress, nextChildren) {0
  reconcileChildrenAtExpirationTime(0
    current,0
    workInProgress,0
    nextChildren,0
    workInProgress.expirationTime,0
  );0
}0
0
function reconcileChildrenAtExpirationTime(0
  current,0
  workInProgress,0
  nextChildren,0
  renderExpirationTime,0
) {0
  if (current === null) {0
    // If this is a fresh new component that hasn't been rendered yet, we0
    // won't update its child set by applying minimal side-effects. Instead,0
    // we will add them all to the child before it gets rendered. That means0
    // we can optimize this reconciliation pass by not tracking side-effects.0
    workInProgress.child = mountChildFibers(0
      workInProgress,0
      null,0
      nextChildren,0
      renderExpirationTime,0
    );0
  } else {0
    // If the current child is the same as the work in progress, it means that0
    // we haven't yet started any work on these children. Therefore, we use0
    // the clone algorithm to create a copy of all the current children.0
0
    // If we had any progressed work already, that is invalid at this point so0
    // let's throw it out.0
    workInProgress.child = reconcileChildFibers(0
      workInProgress,0
      current.child,0
      nextChildren,0
      renderExpirationTime,0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
function updateForwardRef(current, workInProgress) {0
  const render = workInProgress.type.render;0
  const nextProps = workInProgress.pendingProps;0
  const ref = workInProgress.ref;0
  if (hasLegacyContextChanged()) {0
    // Normally we can bail out on props equality but if context has changed0
    // we don't do the bailout and we have to reuse existing props instead.0
  } else if (workInProgress.memoizedProps === nextProps) {0
    const currentRef = current !== null ? current.ref : null;0
    if (ref === currentRef) {0
      return bailoutOnAlreadyFinishedWork(current, workInProgress);0
    }0
  }0
0
  let nextChildren;0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    ReactCurrentOwner.current = workInProgress;0
    ReactDebugCurrentFiber.setCurrentPhase('render');0
    nextChildren = render(nextProps, ref);0
    ReactDebugCurrentFiber.setCurrentPhase(null);0
  } else {0
    nextChildren = render(nextProps, ref);0
  }0
0
  reconcileChildren(current, workInProgress, nextChildren);0
  memoizeProps(workInProgress, nextProps);0
  return workInProgress.child;0
}0
0
function updateFragment(current, workInProgress) {0
  const nextChildren = workInProgress.pendingProps;0
  if (hasLegacyContextChanged()) {0
    // Normally we can bail out on props equality but if context has changed0
    // we don't do the bailout and we have to reuse existing props instead.0
  } else if (workInProgress.memoizedProps === nextChildren) {0
    return bailoutOnAlreadyFinishedWork(current, workInProgress);0
  }0
  reconcileChildren(current, workInProgress, nextChildren);0
  memoizeProps(workInProgress, nextChildren);0
  return workInProgress.child;0
}0
0
function updateMode(current, workInProgress) {0
  const nextChildren = workInProgress.pendingProps.children;0
  if (hasLegacyContextChanged()) {0
    // Normally we can bail out on props equality but if context has changed0
    // we don't do the bailout and we have to reuse existing props instead.0
  } else if (0
    nextChildren === null ||0
    workInProgress.memoizedProps === nextChildren0
  ) {0
    return bailoutOnAlreadyFinishedWork(current, workInProgress);0
  }0
  reconcileChildren(current, workInProgress, nextChildren);0
  memoizeProps(workInProgress, nextChildren);0
  return workInProgress.child;0
}0
0
function updateProfiler(current, workInProgress) {0
  const nextProps = workInProgress.pendingProps;0
  if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
    workInProgress.effectTag |= Update;0
  }0
  if (workInProgress.memoizedProps === nextProps) {0
    return bailoutOnAlreadyFinishedWork(current, workInProgress);0
  }0
  const nextChildren = nextProps.children;0
  reconcileChildren(current, workInProgress, nextChildren);0
  memoizeProps(workInProgress, nextProps);0
  return workInProgress.child;0
}0
0
function markRef(current: Fiber | null, workInProgress: Fiber) {0
  const ref = workInProgress.ref;0
  if (0
    (current === null && ref !== null) ||0
    (current !== null && current.ref !== ref)0
  ) {0
    // Schedule a Ref effect0
    workInProgress.effectTag |= Ref;0
  }0
}0
0
function updateFunctionalComponent(current, workInProgress) {0
  const fn = workInProgress.type;0
  const nextProps = workInProgress.pendingProps;0
0
  if (hasLegacyContextChanged()) {0
    // Normally we can bail out on props equality but if context has changed0
    // we don't do the bailout and we have to reuse existing props instead.0
  } else {0
    if (workInProgress.memoizedProps === nextProps) {0
      return bailoutOnAlreadyFinishedWork(current, workInProgress);0
    }0
    // TODO: consider bringing fn.shouldComponentUpdate() back.0
    // It used to be here.0
  }0
0
  const unmaskedContext = getUnmaskedContext(workInProgress);0
  const context = getMaskedContext(workInProgress, unmaskedContext);0
0
  let nextChildren;0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    ReactCurrentOwner.current = workInProgress;0
    ReactDebugCurrentFiber.setCurrentPhase('render');0
    nextChildren = fn(nextProps, context);0
    ReactDebugCurrentFiber.setCurrentPhase(null);0
  } else {0
    nextChildren = fn(nextProps, context);0
  }0
  // React DevTools reads this flag.0
  workInProgress.effectTag |= PerformedWork;0
  reconcileChildren(current, workInProgress, nextChildren);0
  memoizeProps(workInProgress, nextProps);0
  return workInProgress.child;0
}0
0
function updateClassComponent(0
  current: Fiber | null,0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  renderExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
) {0
  // Push context providers early to prevent context stack mismatches.0
  // During mounting we don't know the child context yet as the instance doesn't exist.0
  // We will invalidate the child context in finishClassComponent() right after rendering.0
  const hasContext = pushLegacyContextProvider(workInProgress);0
  let shouldUpdate;0
  if (current === null) {0
    if (workInProgress.stateNode === null) {0
      // In the initial pass we might need to construct the instance.0
      constructClassInstance(0
        workInProgress,0
        workInProgress.pendingProps,0
        renderExpirationTime,0
      );0
      mountClassInstance(workInProgress, renderExpirationTime);0
0
      shouldUpdate = true;0
    } else {0
      // In a resume, we'll already have an instance we can reuse.0
      shouldUpdate = resumeMountClassInstance(0
        workInProgress,0
        renderExpirationTime,0
      );0
    }0
  } else {0
    shouldUpdate = updateClassInstance(0
      current,0
      workInProgress,0
      renderExpirationTime,0
    );0
  }0
  return finishClassComponent(0
    current,0
    workInProgress,0
    shouldUpdate,0
    hasContext,0
    renderExpirationTime,0
  );0
}0
0
function finishClassComponent(0
  current: Fiber | null,0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  shouldUpdate: boolean,0
  hasContext: boolean,0
  renderExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
) {0
  // Refs should update even if shouldComponentUpdate returns false0
  markRef(current, workInProgress);0
0
  const didCaptureError = (workInProgress.effectTag & DidCapture) !== NoEffect;0
0
  if (!shouldUpdate && !didCaptureError) {0
    // Context providers should defer to sCU for rendering0
    if (hasContext) {0
      invalidateContextProvider(workInProgress, false);0
    }0
0
    return bailoutOnAlreadyFinishedWork(current, workInProgress);0
  }0
0
  const ctor = workInProgress.type;0
  const instance = workInProgress.stateNode;0
0
  // Rerender0
  ReactCurrentOwner.current = workInProgress;0
  let nextChildren;0
  if (0
    didCaptureError &&0
    (!enableGetDerivedStateFromCatch ||0
      typeof ctor.getDerivedStateFromCatch !== 'function')0
  ) {0
    // If we captured an error, but getDerivedStateFrom catch is not defined,0
    // unmount all the children. componentDidCatch will schedule an update to0
    // re-render a fallback. This is temporary until we migrate everyone to0
    // the new API.0
    // TODO: Warn in a future release.0
    nextChildren = null;0
0
    if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
      stopBaseRenderTimerIfRunning();0
    }0
  } else {0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      ReactDebugCurrentFiber.setCurrentPhase('render');0
      nextChildren = instance.render();0
      if (0
        debugRenderPhaseSideEffects ||0
        (debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode &&0
          workInProgress.mode & StrictMode)0
      ) {0
        instance.render();0
      }0
      ReactDebugCurrentFiber.setCurrentPhase(null);0
    } else {0
      nextChildren = instance.render();0
    }0
  }0
0
  // React DevTools reads this flag.0
  workInProgress.effectTag |= PerformedWork;0
  if (didCaptureError) {0
    // If we're recovering from an error, reconcile twice: first to delete0
    // all the existing children.0
    reconcileChildrenAtExpirationTime(0
      current,0
      workInProgress,0
      null,0
      renderExpirationTime,0
    );0
    workInProgress.child = null;0
    // Now we can continue reconciling like normal. This has the effect of0
    // remounting all children regardless of whether their their0
    // identity matches.0
  }0
  reconcileChildrenAtExpirationTime(0
    current,0
    workInProgress,0
    nextChildren,0
    renderExpirationTime,0
  );0
  // Memoize props and state using the values we just used to render.0
  // TODO: Restructure so we never read values from the instance.0
  memoizeState(workInProgress, instance.state);0
  memoizeProps(workInProgress, instance.props);0
0
  // The context might have changed so we need to recalculate it.0
  if (hasContext) {0
    invalidateContextProvider(workInProgress, true);0
  }0
0
  return workInProgress.child;0
}0
0
function pushHostRootContext(workInProgress) {0
  const root = (workInProgress.stateNode: FiberRoot);0
  if (root.pendingContext) {0
    pushTopLevelContextObject(0
      workInProgress,0
      root.pendingContext,0
      root.pendingContext !== root.context,0
    );0
  } else if (root.context) {0
    // Should always be set0
    pushTopLevelContextObject(workInProgress, root.context, false);0
  }0
  pushHostContainer(workInProgress, root.containerInfo);0
}0
0
function updateHostRoot(current, workInProgress, renderExpirationTime) {0
  pushHostRootContext(workInProgress);0
  let updateQueue = workInProgress.updateQueue;0
  if (updateQueue !== null) {0
    const nextProps = workInProgress.pendingProps;0
    const prevState = workInProgress.memoizedState;0
    const prevChildren = prevState !== null ? prevState.element : null;0
    processUpdateQueue(0
      workInProgress,0
      updateQueue,0
      nextProps,0
      null,0
      renderExpirationTime,0
    );0
    const nextState = workInProgress.memoizedState;0
    // Caution: React DevTools currently depends on this property0
    // being called "element".0
    const nextChildren = nextState.element;0
0
    if (nextChildren === prevChildren) {0
      // If the state is the same as before, that's a bailout because we had0
      // no work that expires at this time.0
      resetHydrationState();0
      return bailoutOnAlreadyFinishedWork(current, workInProgress);0
    }0
    const root: FiberRoot = workInProgress.stateNode;0
    if (0
      (current === null || current.child === null) &&0
      root.hydrate &&0
      enterHydrationState(workInProgress)0
    ) {0
      // If we don't have any current children this might be the first pass.0
      // We always try to hydrate. If this isn't a hydration pass there won't0
      // be any children to hydrate which is effectively the same thing as0
      // not hydrating.0
0
      // This is a bit of a hack. We track the host root as a placement to0
      // know that we're currently in a mounting state. That way isMounted0
      // works as expected. We must reset this before committing.0
      // TODO: Delete this when we delete isMounted and findDOMNode.0
      workInProgress.effectTag |= Placement;0
0
      // Ensure that children mount into this root without tracking0
      // side-effects. This ensures that we don't store Placement effects on0
      // nodes that will be hydrated.0
      workInProgress.child = mountChildFibers(0
        workInProgress,0
        null,0
        nextChildren,0
        renderExpirationTime,0
      );0
    } else {0
      // Otherwise reset hydration state in case we aborted and resumed another0
      // root.0
      resetHydrationState();0
      reconcileChildren(current, workInProgress, nextChildren);0
    }0
    return workInProgress.child;0
  }0
  resetHydrationState();0
  // If there is no update queue, that's a bailout because the root has no props.0
  return bailoutOnAlreadyFinishedWork(current, workInProgress);0
}0
0
function updateHostComponent(current, workInProgress, renderExpirationTime) {0
  pushHostContext(workInProgress);0
0
  if (current === null) {0
    tryToClaimNextHydratableInstance(workInProgress);0
  }0
0
  const type = workInProgress.type;0
  const memoizedProps = workInProgress.memoizedProps;0
  const nextProps = workInProgress.pendingProps;0
  const prevProps = current !== null ? current.memoizedProps : null;0
0
  if (hasLegacyContextChanged()) {0
    // Normally we can bail out on props equality but if context has changed0
    // we don't do the bailout and we have to reuse existing props instead.0
  } else if (memoizedProps === nextProps) {0
    const isHidden =0
      workInProgress.mode & AsyncMode &&0
      shouldDeprioritizeSubtree(type, nextProps);0
    if (isHidden) {0
      // Before bailing out, make sure we've deprioritized a hidden component.0
      workInProgress.expirationTime = Never;0
    }0
    if (!isHidden || renderExpirationTime !== Never) {0
      return bailoutOnAlreadyFinishedWork(current, workInProgress);0
    }0
    // If we're rendering a hidden node at hidden priority, don't bailout. The0
    // parent is complete, but the children may not be.0
  }0
0
  let nextChildren = nextProps.children;0
  const isDirectTextChild = shouldSetTextContent(type, nextProps);0
0
  if (isDirectTextChild) {0
    // We special case a direct text child of a host node. This is a common0
    // case. We won't handle it as a reified child. We will instead handle0
    // this in the host environment that also have access to this prop. That0
    // avoids allocating another HostText fiber and traversing it.0
    nextChildren = null;0
  } else if (prevProps && shouldSetTextContent(type, prevProps)) {0
    // If we're switching from a direct text child to a normal child, or to0
    // empty, we need to schedule the text content to be reset.0
    workInProgress.effectTag |= ContentReset;0
  }0
0
  markRef(current, workInProgress);0
0
  // Check the host config to see if the children are offscreen/hidden.0
  if (0
    renderExpirationTime !== Never &&0
    workInProgress.mode & AsyncMode &&0
    shouldDeprioritizeSubtree(type, nextProps)0
  ) {0
    // Down-prioritize the children.0
    workInProgress.expirationTime = Never;0
    // Bailout and come back to this fiber later.0
    workInProgress.memoizedProps = nextProps;0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  reconcileChildren(current, workInProgress, nextChildren);0
  memoizeProps(workInProgress, nextProps);0
  return workInProgress.child;0
}0
0
function updateHostText(current, workInProgress) {0
  if (current === null) {0
    tryToClaimNextHydratableInstance(workInProgress);0
  }0
  const nextProps = workInProgress.pendingProps;0
  memoizeProps(workInProgress, nextProps);0
  // Nothing to do here. This is terminal. We'll do the completion step0
  // immediately after.0
  return null;0
}0
0
function mountIndeterminateComponent(0
  current,0
  workInProgress,0
  renderExpirationTime,0
) {0
  invariant(0
    current === null,0
    'An indeterminate component should never have mounted. This error is ' +0
      'likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
  );0
  const fn = workInProgress.type;0
  const props = workInProgress.pendingProps;0
  const unmaskedContext = getUnmaskedContext(workInProgress);0
  const context = getMaskedContext(workInProgress, unmaskedContext);0
0
  let value;0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (fn.prototype && typeof fn.prototype.render === 'function') {0
      const componentName = getComponentName(workInProgress) || 'Unknown';0
0
      if (!didWarnAboutBadClass[componentName]) {0
        warning(0
          false,0
          "The <%s /> component appears to have a render method, but doesn't extend React.Component. " +0
            'This is likely to cause errors. Change %s to extend React.Component instead.',0
          componentName,0
          componentName,0
        );0
        didWarnAboutBadClass[componentName] = true;0
      }0
    }0
0
    if (workInProgress.mode & StrictMode) {0
      ReactStrictModeWarnings.recordLegacyContextWarning(workInProgress, null);0
    }0
0
    ReactCurrentOwner.current = workInProgress;0
    value = fn(props, context);0
  } else {0
    value = fn(props, context);0
  }0
  // React DevTools reads this flag.0
  workInProgress.effectTag |= PerformedWork;0
0
  if (0
    typeof value === 'object' &&0
    value !== null &&0
    typeof value.render === 'function' &&0
    value.$$typeof === undefined0
  ) {0
    const Component = workInProgress.type;0
0
    // Proceed under the assumption that this is a class instance0
    workInProgress.tag = ClassComponent;0
0
    workInProgress.memoizedState =0
      value.state !== null && value.state !== undefined ? value.state : null;0
0
    const getDerivedStateFromProps = Component.getDerivedStateFromProps;0
    if (typeof getDerivedStateFromProps === 'function') {0
      applyDerivedStateFromProps(0
        workInProgress,0
        getDerivedStateFromProps,0
        props,0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Push context providers early to prevent context stack mismatches.0
    // During mounting we don't know the child context yet as the instance doesn't exist.0
    // We will invalidate the child context in finishClassComponent() right after rendering.0
    const hasContext = pushLegacyContextProvider(workInProgress);0
    adoptClassInstance(workInProgress, value);0
    mountClassInstance(workInProgress, renderExpirationTime);0
    return finishClassComponent(0
      current,0
      workInProgress,0
      true,0
      hasContext,0
      renderExpirationTime,0
    );0
  } else {0
    // Proceed under the assumption that this is a functional component0
    workInProgress.tag = FunctionalComponent;0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      const Component = workInProgress.type;0
0
      if (Component) {0
        warning(0
          !Component.childContextTypes,0
          '%s(...): childContextTypes cannot be defined on a functional component.',0
          Component.displayName || Component.name || 'Component',0
        );0
      }0
      if (workInProgress.ref !== null) {0
        let info = '';0
        const ownerName = ReactDebugCurrentFiber.getCurrentFiberOwnerName();0
        if (ownerName) {0
          info += '\n\nCheck the render method of `' + ownerName + '`.';0
        }0
0
        let warningKey = ownerName || workInProgress._debugID || '';0
        const debugSource = workInProgress._debugSource;0
        if (debugSource) {0
          warningKey = debugSource.fileName + ':' + debugSource.lineNumber;0
        }0
        if (!didWarnAboutStatelessRefs[warningKey]) {0
          didWarnAboutStatelessRefs[warningKey] = true;0
          warning(0
            false,0
            'Stateless function components cannot be given refs. ' +0
              'Attempts to access this ref will fail.%s%s',0
            info,0
            ReactDebugCurrentFiber.getCurrentFiberStackAddendum(),0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      if (typeof fn.getDerivedStateFromProps === 'function') {0
        const componentName = getComponentName(workInProgress) || 'Unknown';0
0
        if (!didWarnAboutGetDerivedStateOnFunctionalComponent[componentName]) {0
          warning(0
            false,0
            '%s: Stateless functional components do not support getDerivedStateFromProps.',0
            componentName,0
          );0
          didWarnAboutGetDerivedStateOnFunctionalComponent[0
            componentName0
          ] = true;0
        }0
      }0
    }0
    reconcileChildren(current, workInProgress, value);0
    memoizeProps(workInProgress, props);0
    return workInProgress.child;0
  }0
}0
0
function updateTimeoutComponent(current, workInProgress, renderExpirationTime) {0
  if (enableSuspense) {0
    const nextProps = workInProgress.pendingProps;0
    const prevProps = workInProgress.memoizedProps;0
0
    const prevDidTimeout = workInProgress.memoizedState;0
0
    // Check if we already attempted to render the normal state. If we did,0
    // and we timed out, render the placeholder state.0
    const alreadyCaptured =0
      (workInProgress.effectTag & DidCapture) === NoEffect;0
    const nextDidTimeout = !alreadyCaptured;0
0
    if (hasLegacyContextChanged()) {0
      // Normally we can bail out on props equality but if context has changed0
      // we don't do the bailout and we have to reuse existing props instead.0
    } else if (nextProps === prevProps && nextDidTimeout === prevDidTimeout) {0
      return bailoutOnAlreadyFinishedWork(current, workInProgress);0
    }0
0
    const render = nextProps.children;0
    const nextChildren = render(nextDidTimeout);0
    workInProgress.memoizedProps = nextProps;0
    workInProgress.memoizedState = nextDidTimeout;0
    reconcileChildren(current, workInProgress, nextChildren);0
    return workInProgress.child;0
  } else {0
    return null;0
  }0
}0
0
function updatePortalComponent(current, workInProgress, renderExpirationTime) {0
  pushHostContainer(workInProgress, workInProgress.stateNode.containerInfo);0
  const nextChildren = workInProgress.pendingProps;0
  if (hasLegacyContextChanged()) {0
    // Normally we can bail out on props equality but if context has changed0
    // we don't do the bailout and we have to reuse existing props instead.0
  } else if (workInProgress.memoizedProps === nextChildren) {0
    return bailoutOnAlreadyFinishedWork(current, workInProgress);0
  }0
0
  if (current === null) {0
    // Portals are special because we don't append the children during mount0
    // but at commit. Therefore we need to track insertions which the normal0
    // flow doesn't do during mount. This doesn't happen at the root because0
    // the root always starts with a "current" with a null child.0
    // TODO: Consider unifying this with how the root works.0
    workInProgress.child = reconcileChildFibers(0
      workInProgress,0
      null,0
      nextChildren,0
      renderExpirationTime,0
    );0
    memoizeProps(workInProgress, nextChildren);0
  } else {0
    reconcileChildren(current, workInProgress, nextChildren);0
    memoizeProps(workInProgress, nextChildren);0
  }0
  return workInProgress.child;0
}0
0
function propagateContextChange<V>(0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  context: ReactContext<V>,0
  changedBits: number,0
  renderExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
): void {0
  let fiber = workInProgress.child;0
  if (fiber !== null) {0
    // Set the return pointer of the child to the work-in-progress fiber.0
    fiber.return = workInProgress;0
  }0
  while (fiber !== null) {0
    let nextFiber;0
    // Visit this fiber.0
    switch (fiber.tag) {0
      case ContextConsumer:0
        // Check if the context matches.0
        const observedBits: number = fiber.stateNode | 0;0
        if (fiber.type === context && (observedBits & changedBits) !== 0) {0
          // Update the expiration time of all the ancestors, including0
          // the alternates.0
          let node = fiber;0
          while (node !== null) {0
            const alternate = node.alternate;0
            if (0
              node.expirationTime === NoWork ||0
              node.expirationTime > renderExpirationTime0
            ) {0
              node.expirationTime = renderExpirationTime;0
              if (0
                alternate !== null &&0
                (alternate.expirationTime === NoWork ||0
                  alternate.expirationTime > renderExpirationTime)0
              ) {0
                alternate.expirationTime = renderExpirationTime;0
              }0
            } else if (0
              alternate !== null &&0
              (alternate.expirationTime === NoWork ||0
                alternate.expirationTime > renderExpirationTime)0
            ) {0
              alternate.expirationTime = renderExpirationTime;0
            } else {0
              // Neither alternate was updated, which means the rest of the0
              // ancestor path already has sufficient priority.0
              break;0
            }0
            node = node.return;0
          }0
          // Don't scan deeper than a matching consumer. When we render the0
          // consumer, we'll continue scanning from that point. This way the0
          // scanning work is time-sliced.0
          nextFiber = null;0
        } else {0
          // Traverse down.0
          nextFiber = fiber.child;0
        }0
        break;0
      case ContextProvider:0
        // Don't scan deeper if this is a matching provider0
        nextFiber = fiber.type === workInProgress.type ? null : fiber.child;0
        break;0
      default:0
        // Traverse down.0
        nextFiber = fiber.child;0
        break;0
    }0
    if (nextFiber !== null) {0
      // Set the return pointer of the child to the work-in-progress fiber.0
      nextFiber.return = fiber;0
    } else {0
      // No child. Traverse to next sibling.0
      nextFiber = fiber;0
      while (nextFiber !== null) {0
        if (nextFiber === workInProgress) {0
          // We're back to the root of this subtree. Exit.0
          nextFiber = null;0
          break;0
        }0
        let sibling = nextFiber.sibling;0
        if (sibling !== null) {0
          // Set the return pointer of the sibling to the work-in-progress fiber.0
          sibling.return = nextFiber.return;0
          nextFiber = sibling;0
          break;0
        }0
        // No more siblings. Traverse up.0
        nextFiber = nextFiber.return;0
      }0
    }0
    fiber = nextFiber;0
  }0
}0
0
function updateContextProvider(current, workInProgress, renderExpirationTime) {0
  const providerType: ReactProviderType<any> = workInProgress.type;0
  const context: ReactContext<any> = providerType._context;0
0
  const newProps = workInProgress.pendingProps;0
  const oldProps = workInProgress.memoizedProps;0
  let canBailOnProps = true;0
0
  if (hasLegacyContextChanged()) {0
    canBailOnProps = false;0
    // Normally we can bail out on props equality but if context has changed0
    // we don't do the bailout and we have to reuse existing props instead.0
  } else if (oldProps === newProps) {0
    workInProgress.stateNode = 0;0
    pushProvider(workInProgress);0
    return bailoutOnAlreadyFinishedWork(current, workInProgress);0
  }0
0
  const newValue = newProps.value;0
  workInProgress.memoizedProps = newProps;0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const providerPropTypes = workInProgress.type.propTypes;0
0
    if (providerPropTypes) {0
      checkPropTypes(0
        providerPropTypes,0
        newProps,0
        'prop',0
        'Context.Provider',0
        getCurrentFiberStackAddendum,0
      );0
    }0
  }0
0
  let changedBits: number;0
  if (oldProps === null) {0
    // Initial render0
    changedBits = MAX_SIGNED_31_BIT_INT;0
  } else {0
    if (oldProps.value === newProps.value) {0
      // No change. Bailout early if children are the same.0
      if (oldProps.children === newProps.children && canBailOnProps) {0
        workInProgress.stateNode = 0;0
        pushProvider(workInProgress);0
        return bailoutOnAlreadyFinishedWork(current, workInProgress);0
      }0
      changedBits = 0;0
    } else {0
      const oldValue = oldProps.value;0
      // Use Object.is to compare the new context value to the old value.0
      // Inlined Object.is polyfill.0
      // https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/is0
      if (0
        (oldValue === newValue &&0
          (oldValue !== 0 || 1 / oldValue === 1 / newValue)) ||0
        (oldValue !== oldValue && newValue !== newValue) // eslint-disable-line no-self-compare0
      ) {0
        // No change. Bailout early if children are the same.0
        if (oldProps.children === newProps.children && canBailOnProps) {0
          workInProgress.stateNode = 0;0
          pushProvider(workInProgress);0
          return bailoutOnAlreadyFinishedWork(current, workInProgress);0
        }0
        changedBits = 0;0
      } else {0
        changedBits =0
          typeof context._calculateChangedBits === 'function'0
            ? context._calculateChangedBits(oldValue, newValue)0
            : MAX_SIGNED_31_BIT_INT;0
        if (__DEV__) {0
          warning(0
            (changedBits & MAX_SIGNED_31_BIT_INT) === changedBits,0
            'calculateChangedBits: Expected the return value to be a ' +0
              '31-bit integer. Instead received: %s',0
            changedBits,0
          );0
        }0
        changedBits |= 0;0
0
        if (changedBits === 0) {0
          // No change. Bailout early if children are the same.0
          if (oldProps.children === newProps.children && canBailOnProps) {0
            workInProgress.stateNode = 0;0
            pushProvider(workInProgress);0
            return bailoutOnAlreadyFinishedWork(current, workInProgress);0
          }0
        } else {0
          propagateContextChange(0
            workInProgress,0
            context,0
            changedBits,0
            renderExpirationTime,0
          );0
        }0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  workInProgress.stateNode = changedBits;0
  pushProvider(workInProgress);0
0
  const newChildren = newProps.children;0
  reconcileChildren(current, workInProgress, newChildren);0
  return workInProgress.child;0
}0
0
function updateContextConsumer(current, workInProgress, renderExpirationTime) {0
  const context: ReactContext<any> = workInProgress.type;0
  const newProps = workInProgress.pendingProps;0
  const oldProps = workInProgress.memoizedProps;0
0
  const newValue = getContextCurrentValue(context);0
  const changedBits = getContextChangedBits(context);0
0
  if (hasLegacyContextChanged()) {0
    // Normally we can bail out on props equality but if context has changed0
    // we don't do the bailout and we have to reuse existing props instead.0
  } else if (changedBits === 0 && oldProps === newProps) {0
    return bailoutOnAlreadyFinishedWork(current, workInProgress);0
  }0
  workInProgress.memoizedProps = newProps;0
0
  let observedBits = newProps.unstable_observedBits;0
  if (observedBits === undefined || observedBits === null) {0
    // Subscribe to all changes by default0
    observedBits = MAX_SIGNED_31_BIT_INT;0
  }0
  // Store the observedBits on the fiber's stateNode for quick access.0
  workInProgress.stateNode = observedBits;0
0
  if ((changedBits & observedBits) !== 0) {0
    // Context change propagation stops at matching consumers, for time-0
    // slicing. Continue the propagation here.0
    propagateContextChange(0
      workInProgress,0
      context,0
      changedBits,0
      renderExpirationTime,0
    );0
  } else if (oldProps === newProps) {0
    // Skip over a memoized parent with a bitmask bailout even0
    // if we began working on it because of a deeper matching child.0
    return bailoutOnAlreadyFinishedWork(current, workInProgress);0
  }0
  // There is no bailout on `children` equality because we expect people0
  // to often pass a bound method as a child, but it may reference0
  // `this.state` or `this.props` (and thus needs to re-render on `setState`).0
0
  const render = newProps.children;0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    warning(0
      typeof render === 'function',0
      'A context consumer was rendered with multiple children, or a child ' +0
        "that isn't a function. A context consumer expects a single child " +0
        'that is a function. If you did pass a function, make sure there ' +0
        'is no trailing or leading whitespace around it.',0
    );0
  }0
0
  let newChildren;0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    ReactCurrentOwner.current = workInProgress;0
    ReactDebugCurrentFiber.setCurrentPhase('render');0
    newChildren = render(newValue);0
    ReactDebugCurrentFiber.setCurrentPhase(null);0
  } else {0
    newChildren = render(newValue);0
  }0
0
  // React DevTools reads this flag.0
  workInProgress.effectTag |= PerformedWork;0
  reconcileChildren(current, workInProgress, newChildren);0
  return workInProgress.child;0
}0
0
/*0
  function reuseChildrenEffects(returnFiber : Fiber, firstChild : Fiber) {0
    let child = firstChild;0
    do {0
      // Ensure that the first and last effect of the parent corresponds0
      // to the children's first and last effect.0
      if (!returnFiber.firstEffect) {0
        returnFiber.firstEffect = child.firstEffect;0
      }0
      if (child.lastEffect) {0
        if (returnFiber.lastEffect) {0
          returnFiber.lastEffect.nextEffect = child.firstEffect;0
        }0
        returnFiber.lastEffect = child.lastEffect;0
      }0
    } while (child = child.sibling);0
  }0
  */0
0
function bailoutOnAlreadyFinishedWork(0
  current,0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
): Fiber | null {0
  cancelWorkTimer(workInProgress);0
0
  if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
    // Don't update "base" render times for bailouts.0
    stopBaseRenderTimerIfRunning();0
  }0
0
  // TODO: We should ideally be able to bail out early if the children have no0
  // more work to do. However, since we don't have a separation of this0
  // Fiber's priority and its children yet - we don't know without doing lots0
  // of the same work we do anyway. Once we have that separation we can just0
  // bail out here if the children has no more work at this priority level.0
  // if (workInProgress.priorityOfChildren <= priorityLevel) {0
  //   // If there are side-effects in these children that have not yet been0
  //   // committed we need to ensure that they get properly transferred up.0
  //   if (current && current.child !== workInProgress.child) {0
  //     reuseChildrenEffects(workInProgress, child);0
  //   }0
  //   return null;0
  // }0
0
  cloneChildFibers(current, workInProgress);0
  return workInProgress.child;0
}0
0
function bailoutOnLowPriority(current, workInProgress) {0
  cancelWorkTimer(workInProgress);0
0
  if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
    // Don't update "base" render times for bailouts.0
    stopBaseRenderTimerIfRunning();0
  }0
0
  // TODO: Handle HostComponent tags here as well and call pushHostContext()?0
  // See PR 8590 discussion for context0
  switch (workInProgress.tag) {0
    case HostRoot:0
      pushHostRootContext(workInProgress);0
      break;0
    case ClassComponent:0
      pushLegacyContextProvider(workInProgress);0
      break;0
    case HostPortal:0
      pushHostContainer(workInProgress, workInProgress.stateNode.containerInfo);0
      break;0
    case ContextProvider:0
      pushProvider(workInProgress);0
      break;0
  }0
  // TODO: What if this is currently in progress?0
  // How can that happen? How is this not being cloned?0
  return null;0
}0
0
// TODO: Delete memoizeProps/State and move to reconcile/bailout instead0
function memoizeProps(workInProgress: Fiber, nextProps: any) {0
  workInProgress.memoizedProps = nextProps;0
}0
0
function memoizeState(workInProgress: Fiber, nextState: any) {0
  workInProgress.memoizedState = nextState;0
  // Don't reset the updateQueue, in case there are pending updates. Resetting0
  // is handled by processUpdateQueue.0
}0
0
function beginWork(0
  current: Fiber | null,0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  renderExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
): Fiber | null {0
  if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
    if (workInProgress.mode & ProfileMode) {0
      markActualRenderTimeStarted(workInProgress);0
    }0
  }0
0
  if (0
    workInProgress.expirationTime === NoWork ||0
    workInProgress.expirationTime > renderExpirationTime0
  ) {0
    return bailoutOnLowPriority(current, workInProgress);0
  }0
0
  switch (workInProgress.tag) {0
    case IndeterminateComponent:0
      return mountIndeterminateComponent(0
        current,0
        workInProgress,0
        renderExpirationTime,0
      );0
    case FunctionalComponent:0
      return updateFunctionalComponent(current, workInProgress);0
    case ClassComponent:0
      return updateClassComponent(0
        current,0
        workInProgress,0
        renderExpirationTime,0
      );0
    case HostRoot:0
      return updateHostRoot(current, workInProgress, renderExpirationTime);0
    case HostComponent:0
      return updateHostComponent(current, workInProgress, renderExpirationTime);0
    case HostText:0
      return updateHostText(current, workInProgress);0
    case TimeoutComponent:0
      return updateTimeoutComponent(0
        current,0
        workInProgress,0
        renderExpirationTime,0
      );0
    case HostPortal:0
      return updatePortalComponent(0
        current,0
        workInProgress,0
        renderExpirationTime,0
      );0
    case ForwardRef:0
      return updateForwardRef(current, workInProgress);0
    case Fragment:0
      return updateFragment(current, workInProgress);0
    case Mode:0
      return updateMode(current, workInProgress);0
    case Profiler:0
      return updateProfiler(current, workInProgress);0
    case ContextProvider:0
      return updateContextProvider(0
        current,0
        workInProgress,0
        renderExpirationTime,0
      );0
    case ContextConsumer:0
      return updateContextConsumer(0
        current,0
        workInProgress,0
        renderExpirationTime,0
      );0
    default:0
      invariant(0
        false,0
        'Unknown unit of work tag. This error is likely caused by a bug in ' +0
          'React. Please file an issue.',0
      );0
  }0
}0
0
export {beginWork};0

 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0

import type {Fiber} from './ReactFiber';0
import type {ExpirationTime} from './ReactFiberExpirationTime';0
0
import React from 'react';0
import {Update, Snapshot} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfSideEffect';0
import {0
  debugRenderPhaseSideEffects,0
  debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode,0
  warnAboutDeprecatedLifecycles,0
} from 'shared/ReactFeatureFlags';0
import ReactStrictModeWarnings from './ReactStrictModeWarnings';0
import {isMounted} from 'react-reconciler/reflection';0
import * as ReactInstanceMap from 'shared/ReactInstanceMap';0
import shallowEqual from 'shared/shallowEqual';0
import getComponentName from 'shared/getComponentName';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
import {startPhaseTimer, stopPhaseTimer} from './ReactDebugFiberPerf';0
import {StrictMode} from './ReactTypeOfMode';0
import {0
  enqueueUpdate,0
  processUpdateQueue,0
  checkHasForceUpdateAfterProcessing,0
  resetHasForceUpdateBeforeProcessing,0
  createUpdate,0
  ReplaceState,0
  ForceUpdate,0
} from './ReactUpdateQueue';0
import {NoWork} from './ReactFiberExpirationTime';0
import {0
  cacheContext,0
  getMaskedContext,0
  getUnmaskedContext,0
  isContextConsumer,0
  hasContextChanged,0
  emptyContextObject,0
} from './ReactFiberContext';0
import {0
  requestCurrentTime,0
  computeExpirationForFiber,0
  scheduleWork,0
} from './ReactFiberScheduler';0
