const fakeInternalInstance = {};0
const isArray = Array.isArray;0
0
// React.Component uses a shared frozen object by default.0
// We'll use it to determine whether we need to initialize legacy refs.0
export const emptyRefsObject = new React.Component().refs;0
0
let didWarnAboutStateAssignmentForComponent;0
let didWarnAboutUninitializedState;0
let didWarnAboutGetSnapshotBeforeUpdateWithoutDidUpdate;0
let didWarnAboutLegacyLifecyclesAndDerivedState;0
let didWarnAboutUndefinedDerivedState;0
let warnOnUndefinedDerivedState;0
let warnOnInvalidCallback;0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  didWarnAboutStateAssignmentForComponent = new Set();0
  didWarnAboutUninitializedState = new Set();0
  didWarnAboutGetSnapshotBeforeUpdateWithoutDidUpdate = new Set();0
  didWarnAboutLegacyLifecyclesAndDerivedState = new Set();0
  didWarnAboutUndefinedDerivedState = new Set();0
0
  const didWarnOnInvalidCallback = new Set();0
0
  warnOnInvalidCallback = function(callback: mixed, callerName: string) {0
    if (callback === null || typeof callback === 'function') {0
      return;0
    }0
    const key = `${callerName}_${(callback: any)}`;0
    if (!didWarnOnInvalidCallback.has(key)) {0
      didWarnOnInvalidCallback.add(key);0
      warning(0
        false,0
        '%s(...): Expected the last optional `callback` argument to be a ' +0
          'function. Instead received: %s.',0
        callerName,0
        callback,0
      );0
    }0
  };0
0
  warnOnUndefinedDerivedState = function(workInProgress, partialState) {0
    if (partialState === undefined) {0
      const componentName = getComponentName(workInProgress) || 'Component';0
      if (!didWarnAboutUndefinedDerivedState.has(componentName)) {0
        didWarnAboutUndefinedDerivedState.add(componentName);0
        warning(0
          false,0
          '%s.getDerivedStateFromProps(): A valid state object (or null) must be returned. ' +0
            'You have returned undefined.',0
          componentName,0
        );0
      }0
    }0
  };0
0
  // This is so gross but it's at least non-critical and can be removed if0
  // it causes problems. This is meant to give a nicer error message for0
  // ReactDOM15.unstable_renderSubtreeIntoContainer(reactDOM16Component,0
  // ...)) which otherwise throws a "_processChildContext is not a function"0
  // exception.0
  Object.defineProperty(fakeInternalInstance, '_processChildContext', {0
    enumerable: false,0
    value: function() {0
      invariant(0
        false,0
        '_processChildContext is not available in React 16+. This likely ' +0
          'means you have multiple copies of React and are attempting to nest ' +0
          'a React 15 tree inside a React 16 tree using ' +0
          "unstable_renderSubtreeIntoContainer, which isn't supported. Try " +0
          'to make sure you have only one copy of React (and ideally, switch ' +0
          'to ReactDOM.createPortal).',0
      );0
    },0
  });0
  Object.freeze(fakeInternalInstance);0
}0
0
export function applyDerivedStateFromProps(0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  getDerivedStateFromProps: (props: any, state: any) => any,0
  nextProps: any,0
) {0
  const prevState = workInProgress.memoizedState;0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (0
      debugRenderPhaseSideEffects ||0
      (debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode &&0
        workInProgress.mode & StrictMode)0
    ) {0
      // Invoke the function an extra time to help detect side-effects.0
      getDerivedStateFromProps(nextProps, prevState);0
    }0
  }0
0
  const partialState = getDerivedStateFromProps(nextProps, prevState);0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    warnOnUndefinedDerivedState(workInProgress, partialState);0
  }0
  // Merge the partial state and the previous state.0
  const memoizedState =0
    partialState === null || partialState === undefined0
      ? prevState0
      : Object.assign({}, prevState, partialState);0
  workInProgress.memoizedState = memoizedState;0
0
  // Once the update queue is empty, persist the derived state onto the0
  // base state.0
  const updateQueue = workInProgress.updateQueue;0
  if (updateQueue !== null && updateQueue.expirationTime === NoWork) {0
    updateQueue.baseState = memoizedState;0
  }0
}0
0
const classComponentUpdater = {0
  isMounted,0
  enqueueSetState(inst, payload, callback) {0
    const fiber = ReactInstanceMap.get(inst);0
    const currentTime = requestCurrentTime();0
    const expirationTime = computeExpirationForFiber(currentTime, fiber);0
0
    const update = createUpdate(expirationTime);0
    update.payload = payload;0
    if (callback !== undefined && callback !== null) {0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        warnOnInvalidCallback(callback, 'setState');0
      }0
      update.callback = callback;0
    }0
0
    enqueueUpdate(fiber, update, expirationTime);0
    scheduleWork(fiber, expirationTime);0
  },0
  enqueueReplaceState(inst, payload, callback) {0
    const fiber = ReactInstanceMap.get(inst);0
    const currentTime = requestCurrentTime();0
    const expirationTime = computeExpirationForFiber(currentTime, fiber);0
0
    const update = createUpdate(expirationTime);0
    update.tag = ReplaceState;0
    update.payload = payload;0
0
    if (callback !== undefined && callback !== null) {0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        warnOnInvalidCallback(callback, 'replaceState');0
      }0
      update.callback = callback;0
    }0
0
    enqueueUpdate(fiber, update, expirationTime);0
    scheduleWork(fiber, expirationTime);0
  },0
  enqueueForceUpdate(inst, callback) {0
    const fiber = ReactInstanceMap.get(inst);0
    const currentTime = requestCurrentTime();0
    const expirationTime = computeExpirationForFiber(currentTime, fiber);0
0
    const update = createUpdate(expirationTime);0
    update.tag = ForceUpdate;0
0
    if (callback !== undefined && callback !== null) {0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        warnOnInvalidCallback(callback, 'forceUpdate');0
      }0
      update.callback = callback;0
    }0
0
    enqueueUpdate(fiber, update, expirationTime);0
    scheduleWork(fiber, expirationTime);0
  },0
};0
0
function checkShouldComponentUpdate(0
  workInProgress,0
  oldProps,0
  newProps,0
  oldState,0
  newState,0
  newContext,0
) {0
  const instance = workInProgress.stateNode;0
  const ctor = workInProgress.type;0
  if (typeof instance.shouldComponentUpdate === 'function') {0
    startPhaseTimer(workInProgress, 'shouldComponentUpdate');0
    const shouldUpdate = instance.shouldComponentUpdate(0
      newProps,0
      newState,0
      newContext,0
    );0
    stopPhaseTimer();0
0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      warning(0
        shouldUpdate !== undefined,0
        '%s.shouldComponentUpdate(): Returned undefined instead of a ' +0
          'boolean value. Make sure to return true or false.',0
        getComponentName(workInProgress) || 'Component',0
      );0
    }0
0
    return shouldUpdate;0
  }0
0
  if (ctor.prototype && ctor.prototype.isPureReactComponent) {0
    return (0
      !shallowEqual(oldProps, newProps) || !shallowEqual(oldState, newState)0
    );0
  }0
0
  return true;0
}0
0
function checkClassInstance(workInProgress: Fiber) {0
  const instance = workInProgress.stateNode;0
  const type = workInProgress.type;0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const name = getComponentName(workInProgress) || 'Component';0
    const renderPresent = instance.render;0
0
    if (!renderPresent) {0
      if (type.prototype && typeof type.prototype.render === 'function') {0
        warning(0
          false,0
          '%s(...): No `render` method found on the returned component ' +0
            'instance: did you accidentally return an object from the constructor?',0
          name,0
        );0
      } else {0
        warning(0
          false,0
          '%s(...): No `render` method found on the returned component ' +0
            'instance: you may have forgotten to define `render`.',0
          name,0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const noGetInitialStateOnES6 =0
      !instance.getInitialState ||0
      instance.getInitialState.isReactClassApproved ||0
      instance.state;0
    warning(0
      noGetInitialStateOnES6,0
      'getInitialState was defined on %s, a plain JavaScript class. ' +0
        'This is only supported for classes created using React.createClass. ' +0
        'Did you mean to define a state property instead?',0
      name,0
    );0
    const noGetDefaultPropsOnES6 =0
      !instance.getDefaultProps ||0
      instance.getDefaultProps.isReactClassApproved;0
    warning(0
      noGetDefaultPropsOnES6,0
      'getDefaultProps was defined on %s, a plain JavaScript class. ' +0
        'This is only supported for classes created using React.createClass. ' +0
        'Use a static property to define defaultProps instead.',0
      name,0
    );0
    const noInstancePropTypes = !instance.propTypes;0
    warning(0
      noInstancePropTypes,0
      'propTypes was defined as an instance property on %s. Use a static ' +0
        'property to define propTypes instead.',0
      name,0
    );0
    const noInstanceContextTypes = !instance.contextTypes;0
    warning(0
      noInstanceContextTypes,0
      'contextTypes was defined as an instance property on %s. Use a static ' +0
        'property to define contextTypes instead.',0
      name,0
    );0
    const noComponentShouldUpdate =0
      typeof instance.componentShouldUpdate !== 'function';0
    warning(0
      noComponentShouldUpdate,0
      '%s has a method called ' +0
        'componentShouldUpdate(). Did you mean shouldComponentUpdate()? ' +0
        'The name is phrased as a question because the function is ' +0
        'expected to return a value.',0
      name,0
    );0
    if (0
      type.prototype &&0
      type.prototype.isPureReactComponent &&0
      typeof instance.shouldComponentUpdate !== 'undefined'0
    ) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        '%s has a method called shouldComponentUpdate(). ' +0
          'shouldComponentUpdate should not be used when extending React.PureComponent. ' +0
          'Please extend React.Component if shouldComponentUpdate is used.',0
        getComponentName(workInProgress) || 'A pure component',0
      );0
    }0
    const noComponentDidUnmount =0
      typeof instance.componentDidUnmount !== 'function';0
    warning(0
      noComponentDidUnmount,0
      '%s has a method called ' +0
        'componentDidUnmount(). But there is no such lifecycle method. ' +0
        'Did you mean componentWillUnmount()?',0
      name,0
    );0
    const noComponentDidReceiveProps =0
      typeof instance.componentDidReceiveProps !== 'function';0
    warning(0
      noComponentDidReceiveProps,0
      '%s has a method called ' +0
        'componentDidReceiveProps(). But there is no such lifecycle method. ' +0
        'If you meant to update the state in response to changing props, ' +0
        'use componentWillReceiveProps(). If you meant to fetch data or ' +0
        'run side-effects or mutations after React has updated the UI, use componentDidUpdate().',0
      name,0
    );0
    const noComponentWillRecieveProps =0
      typeof instance.componentWillRecieveProps !== 'function';0
    warning(0
      noComponentWillRecieveProps,0
      '%s has a method called ' +0
        'componentWillRecieveProps(). Did you mean componentWillReceiveProps()?',0
      name,0
    );0
    const noUnsafeComponentWillRecieveProps =0
      typeof instance.UNSAFE_componentWillRecieveProps !== 'function';0
    warning(0
      noUnsafeComponentWillRecieveProps,0
      '%s has a method called ' +0
        'UNSAFE_componentWillRecieveProps(). Did you mean UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps()?',0
      name,0
    );0
    const hasMutatedProps = instance.props !== workInProgress.pendingProps;0
    warning(0
      instance.props === undefined || !hasMutatedProps,0
      '%s(...): When calling super() in `%s`, make sure to pass ' +0
        "up the same props that your component's constructor was passed.",0
      name,0
      name,0
    );0
    const noInstanceDefaultProps = !instance.defaultProps;0
    warning(0
      noInstanceDefaultProps,0
      'Setting defaultProps as an instance property on %s is not supported and will be ignored.' +0
        ' Instead, define defaultProps as a static property on %s.',0
      name,0
      name,0
    );0
0
    if (0
      typeof instance.getSnapshotBeforeUpdate === 'function' &&0
      typeof instance.componentDidUpdate !== 'function' &&0
      !didWarnAboutGetSnapshotBeforeUpdateWithoutDidUpdate.has(type)0
    ) {0
      didWarnAboutGetSnapshotBeforeUpdateWithoutDidUpdate.add(type);0
      warning(0
        false,0
        '%s: getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() should be used with componentDidUpdate(). ' +0
          'This component defines getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() only.',0
        getComponentName(workInProgress),0
      );0
    }0
0
    const noInstanceGetDerivedStateFromProps =0
      typeof instance.getDerivedStateFromProps !== 'function';0
    warning(0
      noInstanceGetDerivedStateFromProps,0
      '%s: getDerivedStateFromProps() is defined as an instance method ' +0
        'and will be ignored. Instead, declare it as a static method.',0
      name,0
    );0
    const noInstanceGetDerivedStateFromCatch =0
      typeof instance.getDerivedStateFromCatch !== 'function';0
    warning(0
      noInstanceGetDerivedStateFromCatch,0
      '%s: getDerivedStateFromCatch() is defined as an instance method ' +0
        'and will be ignored. Instead, declare it as a static method.',0
      name,0
    );0
    const noStaticGetSnapshotBeforeUpdate =0
      typeof type.getSnapshotBeforeUpdate !== 'function';0
    warning(0
      noStaticGetSnapshotBeforeUpdate,0
      '%s: getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() is defined as a static method ' +0
        'and will be ignored. Instead, declare it as an instance method.',0
      name,0
    );0
    const state = instance.state;0
    if (state && (typeof state !== 'object' || isArray(state))) {0
      warning(false, '%s.state: must be set to an object or null', name);0
    }0
    if (typeof instance.getChildContext === 'function') {0
      warning(0
        typeof type.childContextTypes === 'object',0
        '%s.getChildContext(): childContextTypes must be defined in order to ' +0
          'use getChildContext().',0
        name,0
      );0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function adoptClassInstance(workInProgress: Fiber, instance: any): void {0
  instance.updater = classComponentUpdater;0
  workInProgress.stateNode = instance;0
  // The instance needs access to the fiber so that it can schedule updates0
  ReactInstanceMap.set(instance, workInProgress);0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    instance._reactInternalInstance = fakeInternalInstance;0
  }0
}0
0
function constructClassInstance(0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  props: any,0
  renderExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
): any {0
  const ctor = workInProgress.type;0
  const unmaskedContext = getUnmaskedContext(workInProgress);0
  const needsContext = isContextConsumer(workInProgress);0
  const context = needsContext0
    ? getMaskedContext(workInProgress, unmaskedContext)0
    : emptyContextObject;0
0
  // Instantiate twice to help detect side-effects.0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (0
      debugRenderPhaseSideEffects ||0
      (debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode &&0
        workInProgress.mode & StrictMode)0
    ) {0
      new ctor(props, context); // eslint-disable-line no-new0
    }0
  }0
0
  const instance = new ctor(props, context);0
  const state = (workInProgress.memoizedState =0
    instance.state !== null && instance.state !== undefined0
      ? instance.state0
      : null);0
  adoptClassInstance(workInProgress, instance);0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (typeof ctor.getDerivedStateFromProps === 'function' && state === null) {0
      const componentName = getComponentName(workInProgress) || 'Component';0
      if (!didWarnAboutUninitializedState.has(componentName)) {0
        didWarnAboutUninitializedState.add(componentName);0
        warning(0
          false,0
          '%s: Did not properly initialize state during construction. ' +0
            'Expected state to be an object, but it was %s.',0
          componentName,0
          instance.state === null ? 'null' : 'undefined',0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    // If new component APIs are defined, "unsafe" lifecycles won't be called.0
    // Warn about these lifecycles if they are present.0
    // Don't warn about react-lifecycles-compat polyfilled methods though.0
    if (0
      typeof ctor.getDerivedStateFromProps === 'function' ||0
      typeof instance.getSnapshotBeforeUpdate === 'function'0
    ) {0
      let foundWillMountName = null;0
      let foundWillReceivePropsName = null;0
      let foundWillUpdateName = null;0
      if (0
        typeof instance.componentWillMount === 'function' &&0
        instance.componentWillMount.__suppressDeprecationWarning !== true0
      ) {0
        foundWillMountName = 'componentWillMount';0
      } else if (typeof instance.UNSAFE_componentWillMount === 'function') {0
        foundWillMountName = 'UNSAFE_componentWillMount';0
      }0
      if (0
        typeof instance.componentWillReceiveProps === 'function' &&0
        instance.componentWillReceiveProps.__suppressDeprecationWarning !== true0
      ) {0
        foundWillReceivePropsName = 'componentWillReceiveProps';0
      } else if (0
        typeof instance.UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps === 'function'0
      ) {0
        foundWillReceivePropsName = 'UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps';0
      }0
      if (0
        typeof instance.componentWillUpdate === 'function' &&0
        instance.componentWillUpdate.__suppressDeprecationWarning !== true0
      ) {0
        foundWillUpdateName = 'componentWillUpdate';0
      } else if (typeof instance.UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate === 'function') {0
        foundWillUpdateName = 'UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate';0
      }0
      if (0
        foundWillMountName !== null ||0
        foundWillReceivePropsName !== null ||0
        foundWillUpdateName !== null0
      ) {0
        const componentName = getComponentName(workInProgress) || 'Component';0
        const newApiName =0
          typeof ctor.getDerivedStateFromProps === 'function'0
            ? 'getDerivedStateFromProps()'0
            : 'getSnapshotBeforeUpdate()';0
        if (!didWarnAboutLegacyLifecyclesAndDerivedState.has(componentName)) {0
          didWarnAboutLegacyLifecyclesAndDerivedState.add(componentName);0
          warning(0
            false,0
            'Unsafe legacy lifecycles will not be called for components using new component APIs.\n\n' +0
              '%s uses %s but also contains the following legacy lifecycles:%s%s%s\n\n' +0
              'The above lifecycles should be removed. Learn more about this warning here:\n' +0
              'https://fb.me/react-async-component-lifecycle-hooks',0
            componentName,0
            newApiName,0
            foundWillMountName !== null ? `\n  ${foundWillMountName}` : '',0
            foundWillReceivePropsName !== null0
              ? `\n  ${foundWillReceivePropsName}`0
              : '',0
            foundWillUpdateName !== null ? `\n  ${foundWillUpdateName}` : '',0
          );0
        }0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  // Cache unmasked context so we can avoid recreating masked context unless necessary.0
  // ReactFiberContext usually updates this cache but can't for newly-created instances.0
  if (needsContext) {0
    cacheContext(workInProgress, unmaskedContext, context);0
  }0
0
  return instance;0
}0
0
function callComponentWillMount(workInProgress, instance) {0
  startPhaseTimer(workInProgress, 'componentWillMount');0
  const oldState = instance.state;0
0
  if (typeof instance.componentWillMount === 'function') {0
    instance.componentWillMount();0
  }0
  if (typeof instance.UNSAFE_componentWillMount === 'function') {0
    instance.UNSAFE_componentWillMount();0
  }0
0
  stopPhaseTimer();0
0
  if (oldState !== instance.state) {0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        '%s.componentWillMount(): Assigning directly to this.state is ' +0
          "deprecated (except inside a component's " +0
          'constructor). Use setState instead.',0
        getComponentName(workInProgress) || 'Component',0
      );0
    }0
    classComponentUpdater.enqueueReplaceState(instance, instance.state, null);0
  }0
}0
0
function callComponentWillReceiveProps(0
  workInProgress,0
  instance,0
  newProps,0
  newContext,0
) {0
  const oldState = instance.state;0
  startPhaseTimer(workInProgress, 'componentWillReceiveProps');0
  if (typeof instance.componentWillReceiveProps === 'function') {0
    instance.componentWillReceiveProps(newProps, newContext);0
  }0
  if (typeof instance.UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps === 'function') {0
    instance.UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(newProps, newContext);0
  }0
  stopPhaseTimer();0
0
  if (instance.state !== oldState) {0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      const componentName = getComponentName(workInProgress) || 'Component';0
      if (!didWarnAboutStateAssignmentForComponent.has(componentName)) {0
        didWarnAboutStateAssignmentForComponent.add(componentName);0
        warning(0
          false,0
          '%s.componentWillReceiveProps(): Assigning directly to ' +0
            "this.state is deprecated (except inside a component's " +0
            'constructor). Use setState instead.',0
          componentName,0
        );0
      }0
    }0
    classComponentUpdater.enqueueReplaceState(instance, instance.state, null);0
  }0
}0
0
// Invokes the mount life-cycles on a previously never rendered instance.0
function mountClassInstance(0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  renderExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
): void {0
  const ctor = workInProgress.type;0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    checkClassInstance(workInProgress);0
  }0
0
  const instance = workInProgress.stateNode;0
  const props = workInProgress.pendingProps;0
  const unmaskedContext = getUnmaskedContext(workInProgress);0
0
  instance.props = props;0
  instance.state = workInProgress.memoizedState;0
  instance.refs = emptyRefsObject;0
  instance.context = getMaskedContext(workInProgress, unmaskedContext);0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (workInProgress.mode & StrictMode) {0
      ReactStrictModeWarnings.recordUnsafeLifecycleWarnings(0
        workInProgress,0
        instance,0
      );0
0
      ReactStrictModeWarnings.recordLegacyContextWarning(0
        workInProgress,0
        instance,0
      );0
    }0
0
    if (warnAboutDeprecatedLifecycles) {0
      ReactStrictModeWarnings.recordDeprecationWarnings(0
        workInProgress,0
        instance,0
      );0
    }0
  }0
0
  let updateQueue = workInProgress.updateQueue;0
  if (updateQueue !== null) {0
    processUpdateQueue(0
      workInProgress,0
      updateQueue,0
      props,0
      instance,0
      renderExpirationTime,0
    );0
    instance.state = workInProgress.memoizedState;0
  }0
0
  const getDerivedStateFromProps = workInProgress.type.getDerivedStateFromProps;0
  if (typeof getDerivedStateFromProps === 'function') {0
    applyDerivedStateFromProps(workInProgress, getDerivedStateFromProps, props);0
    instance.state = workInProgress.memoizedState;0
  }0
0
  // In order to support react-lifecycles-compat polyfilled components,0
  // Unsafe lifecycles should not be invoked for components using the new APIs.0
  if (0
    typeof ctor.getDerivedStateFromProps !== 'function' &&0
    typeof instance.getSnapshotBeforeUpdate !== 'function' &&0
    (typeof instance.UNSAFE_componentWillMount === 'function' ||0
      typeof instance.componentWillMount === 'function')0
  ) {0
    callComponentWillMount(workInProgress, instance);0
    // If we had additional state updates during this life-cycle, let's0
    // process them now.0
    updateQueue = workInProgress.updateQueue;0
    if (updateQueue !== null) {0
      processUpdateQueue(0
        workInProgress,0
        updateQueue,0
        props,0
        instance,0
        renderExpirationTime,0
      );0
      instance.state = workInProgress.memoizedState;0
    }0
  }0
0
  if (typeof instance.componentDidMount === 'function') {0
    workInProgress.effectTag |= Update;0
  }0
}0
0
function resumeMountClassInstance(0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  renderExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
): boolean {0
  const ctor = workInProgress.type;0
  const instance = workInProgress.stateNode;0
0
  const oldProps = workInProgress.memoizedProps;0
  const newProps = workInProgress.pendingProps;0
  instance.props = oldProps;0
0
  const oldContext = instance.context;0
  const newUnmaskedContext = getUnmaskedContext(workInProgress);0
  const newContext = getMaskedContext(workInProgress, newUnmaskedContext);0
0
  const getDerivedStateFromProps = ctor.getDerivedStateFromProps;0
  const hasNewLifecycles =0
    typeof getDerivedStateFromProps === 'function' ||0
    typeof instance.getSnapshotBeforeUpdate === 'function';0
0
  // Note: During these life-cycles, instance.props/instance.state are what0
  // ever the previously attempted to render - not the "current". However,0
  // during componentDidUpdate we pass the "current" props.0
0
  // In order to support react-lifecycles-compat polyfilled components,0
  // Unsafe lifecycles should not be invoked for components using the new APIs.0
  if (0
    !hasNewLifecycles &&0
    (typeof instance.UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps === 'function' ||0
      typeof instance.componentWillReceiveProps === 'function')0
  ) {0
    if (oldProps !== newProps || oldContext !== newContext) {0
      callComponentWillReceiveProps(0
        workInProgress,0
        instance,0
        newProps,0
        newContext,0
      );0
    }0
  }0
0
  resetHasForceUpdateBeforeProcessing();0
0
  const oldState = workInProgress.memoizedState;0
  let newState = (instance.state = oldState);0
  let updateQueue = workInProgress.updateQueue;0
  if (updateQueue !== null) {0
    processUpdateQueue(0
      workInProgress,0
      updateQueue,0
      newProps,0
      instance,0
      renderExpirationTime,0
    );0
    newState = workInProgress.memoizedState;0
  }0
  if (0
    oldProps === newProps &&0
    oldState === newState &&0
    !hasContextChanged() &&0
    !checkHasForceUpdateAfterProcessing()0
  ) {0
    // If an update was already in progress, we should schedule an Update0
    // effect even though we're bailing out, so that cWU/cDU are called.0
    if (typeof instance.componentDidMount === 'function') {0
      workInProgress.effectTag |= Update;0
    }0
    return false;0
  }0
0
  if (typeof getDerivedStateFromProps === 'function') {0
    applyDerivedStateFromProps(0
      workInProgress,0
      getDerivedStateFromProps,0
      newProps,0
    );0
    newState = workInProgress.memoizedState;0
  }0
0
  const shouldUpdate =0
    checkHasForceUpdateAfterProcessing() ||0
    checkShouldComponentUpdate(0
      workInProgress,0
      oldProps,0
      newProps,0
      oldState,0
      newState,0
      newContext,0
    );0
0
  if (shouldUpdate) {0
    // In order to support react-lifecycles-compat polyfilled components,0
    // Unsafe lifecycles should not be invoked for components using the new APIs.0
    if (0
      !hasNewLifecycles &&0
      (typeof instance.UNSAFE_componentWillMount === 'function' ||0
        typeof instance.componentWillMount === 'function')0
    ) {0
      startPhaseTimer(workInProgress, 'componentWillMount');0
      if (typeof instance.componentWillMount === 'function') {0
        instance.componentWillMount();0
      }0
      if (typeof instance.UNSAFE_componentWillMount === 'function') {0
        instance.UNSAFE_componentWillMount();0
      }0
      stopPhaseTimer();0
    }0
    if (typeof instance.componentDidMount === 'function') {0
      workInProgress.effectTag |= Update;0
    }0
  } else {0
    // If an update was already in progress, we should schedule an Update0
    // effect even though we're bailing out, so that cWU/cDU are called.0
    if (typeof instance.componentDidMount === 'function') {0
      workInProgress.effectTag |= Update;0
    }0
0
    // If shouldComponentUpdate returned false, we should still update the0
    // memoized state to indicate that this work can be reused.0
    workInProgress.memoizedProps = newProps;0
    workInProgress.memoizedState = newState;0
  }0
0
  // Update the existing instance's state, props, and context pointers even0
  // if shouldComponentUpdate returns false.0
  instance.props = newProps;0
  instance.state = newState;0
  instance.context = newContext;0
0
  return shouldUpdate;0
}0
0
// Invokes the update life-cycles and returns false if it shouldn't rerender.0
function updateClassInstance(0
  current: Fiber,0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  renderExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
): boolean {0
  const ctor = workInProgress.type;0
  const instance = workInProgress.stateNode;0
0
  const oldProps = workInProgress.memoizedProps;0
  const newProps = workInProgress.pendingProps;0
  instance.props = oldProps;0
0
  const oldContext = instance.context;0
  const newUnmaskedContext = getUnmaskedContext(workInProgress);0
  const newContext = getMaskedContext(workInProgress, newUnmaskedContext);0
0
  const getDerivedStateFromProps = ctor.getDerivedStateFromProps;0
  const hasNewLifecycles =0
    typeof getDerivedStateFromProps === 'function' ||0
    typeof instance.getSnapshotBeforeUpdate === 'function';0
0
  // Note: During these life-cycles, instance.props/instance.state are what0
  // ever the previously attempted to render - not the "current". However,0
  // during componentDidUpdate we pass the "current" props.0
0
  // In order to support react-lifecycles-compat polyfilled components,0
  // Unsafe lifecycles should not be invoked for components using the new APIs.0
  if (0
    !hasNewLifecycles &&0
    (typeof instance.UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps === 'function' ||0
      typeof instance.componentWillReceiveProps === 'function')0
  ) {0
    if (oldProps !== newProps || oldContext !== newContext) {0
      callComponentWillReceiveProps(0
        workInProgress,0
        instance,0
        newProps,0
        newContext,0
      );0
    }0
  }0
0
  resetHasForceUpdateBeforeProcessing();0
0
  const oldState = workInProgress.memoizedState;0
  let newState = (instance.state = oldState);0
  let updateQueue = workInProgress.updateQueue;0
  if (updateQueue !== null) {0
    processUpdateQueue(0
      workInProgress,0
      updateQueue,0
      newProps,0
      instance,0
      renderExpirationTime,0
    );0
    newState = workInProgress.memoizedState;0
  }0
0
  if (0
    oldProps === newProps &&0
    oldState === newState &&0
    !hasContextChanged() &&0
    !checkHasForceUpdateAfterProcessing()0
  ) {0
    // If an update was already in progress, we should schedule an Update0
    // effect even though we're bailing out, so that cWU/cDU are called.0
    if (typeof instance.componentDidUpdate === 'function') {0
      if (0
        oldProps !== current.memoizedProps ||0
        oldState !== current.memoizedState0
      ) {0
        workInProgress.effectTag |= Update;0
      }0
    }0
    if (typeof instance.getSnapshotBeforeUpdate === 'function') {0
      if (0
        oldProps !== current.memoizedProps ||0
        oldState !== current.memoizedState0
      ) {0
        workInProgress.effectTag |= Snapshot;0
      }0
    }0
    return false;0
  }0
0
  if (typeof getDerivedStateFromProps === 'function') {0
    applyDerivedStateFromProps(0
      workInProgress,0
      getDerivedStateFromProps,0
      newProps,0
    );0
    newState = workInProgress.memoizedState;0
  }0
0
  const shouldUpdate =0
    checkHasForceUpdateAfterProcessing() ||0
    checkShouldComponentUpdate(0
      workInProgress,0
      oldProps,0
      newProps,0
      oldState,0
      newState,0
      newContext,0
    );0
0
  if (shouldUpdate) {0
    // In order to support react-lifecycles-compat polyfilled components,0
    // Unsafe lifecycles should not be invoked for components using the new APIs.0
    if (0
      !hasNewLifecycles &&0
      (typeof instance.UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate === 'function' ||0
        typeof instance.componentWillUpdate === 'function')0
    ) {0
      startPhaseTimer(workInProgress, 'componentWillUpdate');0
      if (typeof instance.componentWillUpdate === 'function') {0
        instance.componentWillUpdate(newProps, newState, newContext);0
      }0
      if (typeof instance.UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate === 'function') {0
        instance.UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate(newProps, newState, newContext);0
      }0
      stopPhaseTimer();0
    }0
    if (typeof instance.componentDidUpdate === 'function') {0
      workInProgress.effectTag |= Update;0
    }0
    if (typeof instance.getSnapshotBeforeUpdate === 'function') {0
      workInProgress.effectTag |= Snapshot;0
    }0
  } else {0
    // If an update was already in progress, we should schedule an Update0
    // effect even though we're bailing out, so that cWU/cDU are called.0
    if (typeof instance.componentDidUpdate === 'function') {0
      if (0
        oldProps !== current.memoizedProps ||0
        oldState !== current.memoizedState0
      ) {0
        workInProgress.effectTag |= Update;0
      }0
    }0
    if (typeof instance.getSnapshotBeforeUpdate === 'function') {0
      if (0
        oldProps !== current.memoizedProps ||0
        oldState !== current.memoizedState0
      ) {0
        workInProgress.effectTag |= Snapshot;0
      }0
    }0
0
    // If shouldComponentUpdate returned false, we should still update the0
    // memoized props/state to indicate that this work can be reused.0
    workInProgress.memoizedProps = newProps;0
    workInProgress.memoizedState = newState;0
  }0
0
  // Update the existing instance's state, props, and context pointers even0
  // if shouldComponentUpdate returns false.0
  instance.props = newProps;0
  instance.state = newState;0
  instance.context = newContext;0
0
  return shouldUpdate;0
}0
0
export {0
  adoptClassInstance,0
  constructClassInstance,0
  mountClassInstance,0
  resumeMountClassInstance,0
  updateClassInstance,0
};0

import type {0
  Instance,0
  TextInstance,0
  Container,0
  ChildSet,0
  UpdatePayload,0
} from './ReactFiberHostConfig';0
import type {Fiber} from './ReactFiber';0
import type {FiberRoot} from './ReactFiberRoot';0
import type {ExpirationTime} from './ReactFiberExpirationTime';0
import type {CapturedValue, CapturedError} from './ReactCapturedValue';0
0
import {enableProfilerTimer} from 'shared/ReactFeatureFlags';0
import {getCommitTime} from './ReactProfilerTimer';0
import {0
  ClassComponent,0
  HostRoot,0
  HostComponent,0
  HostText,0
  HostPortal,0
  Profiler,0
  TimeoutComponent,0
} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfWork';0
import ReactErrorUtils from 'shared/ReactErrorUtils';0
import {0
  ContentReset,0
  Placement,0
  Snapshot,0
  Update,0
} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfSideEffect';0
import {commitUpdateQueue} from './ReactUpdateQueue';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
import {onCommitUnmount} from './ReactFiberDevToolsHook';0
import {startPhaseTimer, stopPhaseTimer} from './ReactDebugFiberPerf';0
import getComponentName from 'shared/getComponentName';0
import {getStackAddendumByWorkInProgressFiber} from 'shared/ReactFiberComponentTreeHook';0
import {logCapturedError} from './ReactFiberErrorLogger';0
import {0
  getPublicInstance,0
  supportsMutation,0
  supportsPersistence,0
  commitMount,0
  commitUpdate,0
  resetTextContent,0
  commitTextUpdate,0
  appendChild,0
  appendChildToContainer,0
  insertBefore,0
  insertInContainerBefore,0
  removeChild,0
  removeChildFromContainer,0
  replaceContainerChildren,0
  createContainerChildSet,0
} from './ReactFiberHostConfig';0
import {captureCommitPhaseError} from './ReactFiberScheduler';0
0
const {0
  invokeGuardedCallback,0
  hasCaughtError,0
  clearCaughtError,0
} = ReactErrorUtils;0
0
let didWarnAboutUndefinedSnapshotBeforeUpdate: Set<mixed> | null = null;0
if (__DEV__) {0
  didWarnAboutUndefinedSnapshotBeforeUpdate = new Set();0
}0
0
export function logError(boundary: Fiber, errorInfo: CapturedValue<mixed>) {0
  const source = errorInfo.source;0
  let stack = errorInfo.stack;0
  if (stack === null && source !== null) {0
    stack = getStackAddendumByWorkInProgressFiber(source);0
  }0
0
  const capturedError: CapturedError = {0
    componentName: source !== null ? getComponentName(source) : null,0
    componentStack: stack !== null ? stack : '',0
    error: errorInfo.value,0
    errorBoundary: null,0
    errorBoundaryName: null,0
    errorBoundaryFound: false,0
    willRetry: false,0
  };0
0
  if (boundary !== null && boundary.tag === ClassComponent) {0
    capturedError.errorBoundary = boundary.stateNode;0
    capturedError.errorBoundaryName = getComponentName(boundary);0
    capturedError.errorBoundaryFound = true;0
    capturedError.willRetry = true;0
  }0
0
  try {0
    logCapturedError(capturedError);0
  } catch (e) {0
    // Prevent cycle if logCapturedError() throws.0
    // A cycle may still occur if logCapturedError renders a component that throws.0
    const suppressLogging = e && e.suppressReactErrorLogging;0
    if (!suppressLogging) {0
      console.error(e);0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
const callComponentWillUnmountWithTimer = function(current, instance) {0
  startPhaseTimer(current, 'componentWillUnmount');0
  instance.props = current.memoizedProps;0
  instance.state = current.memoizedState;0
  instance.componentWillUnmount();0
  stopPhaseTimer();0
};0
0
// Capture errors so they don't interrupt unmounting.0
function safelyCallComponentWillUnmount(current, instance) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    invokeGuardedCallback(0
      null,0
      callComponentWillUnmountWithTimer,0
      null,0
      current,0
      instance,0
    );0
    if (hasCaughtError()) {0
      const unmountError = clearCaughtError();0
      captureCommitPhaseError(current, unmountError);0
    }0
  } else {0
    try {0
      callComponentWillUnmountWithTimer(current, instance);0
    } catch (unmountError) {0
      captureCommitPhaseError(current, unmountError);0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function safelyDetachRef(current: Fiber) {0
  const ref = current.ref;0
  if (ref !== null) {0
    if (typeof ref === 'function') {0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        invokeGuardedCallback(null, ref, null, null);0
        if (hasCaughtError()) {0
          const refError = clearCaughtError();0
          captureCommitPhaseError(current, refError);0
        }0
      } else {0
        try {0
          ref(null);0
        } catch (refError) {0
          captureCommitPhaseError(current, refError);0
        }0
      }0
    } else {0
      ref.current = null;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function commitBeforeMutationLifeCycles(0
  current: Fiber | null,0
  finishedWork: Fiber,0
): void {0
  switch (finishedWork.tag) {0
    case ClassComponent: {0
      if (finishedWork.effectTag & Snapshot) {0
        if (current !== null) {0
          const prevProps = current.memoizedProps;0
          const prevState = current.memoizedState;0
          startPhaseTimer(finishedWork, 'getSnapshotBeforeUpdate');0
          const instance = finishedWork.stateNode;0
          instance.props = finishedWork.memoizedProps;0
          instance.state = finishedWork.memoizedState;0
          const snapshot = instance.getSnapshotBeforeUpdate(0
            prevProps,0
            prevState,0
          );0
          if (__DEV__) {0
            const didWarnSet = ((didWarnAboutUndefinedSnapshotBeforeUpdate: any): Set<0
              mixed,0
            >);0
            if (snapshot === undefined && !didWarnSet.has(finishedWork.type)) {0
              didWarnSet.add(finishedWork.type);0
              warning(0
                false,0
                '%s.getSnapshotBeforeUpdate(): A snapshot value (or null) ' +0
                  'must be returned. You have returned undefined.',0
                getComponentName(finishedWork),0
              );0
            }0
          }0
          instance.__reactInternalSnapshotBeforeUpdate = snapshot;0
          stopPhaseTimer();0
        }0
      }0
      return;0
    }0
    case HostRoot:0
    case HostComponent:0
    case HostText:0
    case HostPortal:0
      // Nothing to do for these component types0
      return;0
    default: {0
      invariant(0
        false,0
        'This unit of work tag should not have side-effects. This error is ' +0
          'likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
      );0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function commitLifeCycles(0
  finishedRoot: FiberRoot,0
  current: Fiber | null,0
  finishedWork: Fiber,0
  committedExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
): void {0
  switch (finishedWork.tag) {0
    case ClassComponent: {0
      const instance = finishedWork.stateNode;0
      if (finishedWork.effectTag & Update) {0
        if (current === null) {0
          startPhaseTimer(finishedWork, 'componentDidMount');0
          instance.props = finishedWork.memoizedProps;0
          instance.state = finishedWork.memoizedState;0
          instance.componentDidMount();0
          stopPhaseTimer();0
        } else {0
          const prevProps = current.memoizedProps;0
          const prevState = current.memoizedState;0
          startPhaseTimer(finishedWork, 'componentDidUpdate');0
          instance.props = finishedWork.memoizedProps;0
          instance.state = finishedWork.memoizedState;0
          instance.componentDidUpdate(0
            prevProps,0
            prevState,0
            instance.__reactInternalSnapshotBeforeUpdate,0
          );0
          stopPhaseTimer();0
        }0
      }0
      const updateQueue = finishedWork.updateQueue;0
      if (updateQueue !== null) {0
        instance.props = finishedWork.memoizedProps;0
        instance.state = finishedWork.memoizedState;0
        commitUpdateQueue(0
          finishedWork,0
          updateQueue,0
          instance,0
          committedExpirationTime,0
        );0
      }0
      return;0
    }0
    case HostRoot: {0
      const updateQueue = finishedWork.updateQueue;0
      if (updateQueue !== null) {0
        let instance = null;0
        if (finishedWork.child !== null) {0
          switch (finishedWork.child.tag) {0
            case HostComponent:0
              instance = getPublicInstance(finishedWork.child.stateNode);0
              break;0
            case ClassComponent:0
              instance = finishedWork.child.stateNode;0
              break;0
          }0
        }0
        commitUpdateQueue(0
          finishedWork,0
          updateQueue,0
          instance,0
          committedExpirationTime,0
        );0
      }0
      return;0
    }0
    case HostComponent: {0
      const instance: Instance = finishedWork.stateNode;0
0
      // Renderers may schedule work to be done after host components are mounted0
      // (eg DOM renderer may schedule auto-focus for inputs and form controls).0
      // These effects should only be committed when components are first mounted,0
      // aka when there is no current/alternate.0
      if (current === null && finishedWork.effectTag & Update) {0
        const type = finishedWork.type;0
        const props = finishedWork.memoizedProps;0
        commitMount(instance, type, props, finishedWork);0
      }0
0
      return;0
    }0
    case HostText: {0
      // We have no life-cycles associated with text.0
      return;0
    }0
    case HostPortal: {0
      // We have no life-cycles associated with portals.0
      return;0
    }0
    case Profiler: {0
      // We have no life-cycles associated with Profiler.0
      return;0
    }0
    case TimeoutComponent: {0
      // We have no life-cycles associated with Timeouts.0
      return;0
    }0
    default: {0
      invariant(0
        false,0
        'This unit of work tag should not have side-effects. This error is ' +0
          'likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
      );0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function commitAttachRef(finishedWork: Fiber) {0
  const ref = finishedWork.ref;0
  if (ref !== null) {0
    const instance = finishedWork.stateNode;0
    let instanceToUse;0
    switch (finishedWork.tag) {0
      case HostComponent:0
        instanceToUse = getPublicInstance(instance);0
        break;0
      default:0
        instanceToUse = instance;0
    }0
    if (typeof ref === 'function') {0
      ref(instanceToUse);0
    } else {0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        if (!ref.hasOwnProperty('current')) {0
          warning(0
            false,0
            'Unexpected ref object provided for %s. ' +0
              'Use either a ref-setter function or React.createRef().%s',0
            getComponentName(finishedWork),0
            getStackAddendumByWorkInProgressFiber(finishedWork),0
          );0
        }0
      }0
0
      ref.current = instanceToUse;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function commitDetachRef(current: Fiber) {0
  const currentRef = current.ref;0
  if (currentRef !== null) {0
    if (typeof currentRef === 'function') {0
      currentRef(null);0
    } else {0
      currentRef.current = null;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
// User-originating errors (lifecycles and refs) should not interrupt0
// deletion, so don't let them throw. Host-originating errors should0
// interrupt deletion, so it's okay0
function commitUnmount(current: Fiber): void {0
  if (typeof onCommitUnmount === 'function') {0
    onCommitUnmount(current);0
  }0
0
  switch (current.tag) {0
    case ClassComponent: {0
      safelyDetachRef(current);0
      const instance = current.stateNode;0
      if (typeof instance.componentWillUnmount === 'function') {0
        safelyCallComponentWillUnmount(current, instance);0
      }0
      return;0
    }0
    case HostComponent: {0
      safelyDetachRef(current);0
      return;0
    }0
    case HostPortal: {0
      // TODO: this is recursive.0
      // We are also not using this parent because0
      // the portal will get pushed immediately.0
      if (supportsMutation) {0
        unmountHostComponents(current);0
      } else if (supportsPersistence) {0
        emptyPortalContainer(current);0
      }0
      return;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function commitNestedUnmounts(root: Fiber): void {0
  // While we're inside a removed host node we don't want to call0
  // removeChild on the inner nodes because they're removed by the top0
  // call anyway. We also want to call componentWillUnmount on all0
  // composites before this host node is removed from the tree. Therefore0
  // we do an inner loop while we're still inside the host node.0
  let node: Fiber = root;0
  while (true) {0
    commitUnmount(node);0
    // Visit children because they may contain more composite or host nodes.0
    // Skip portals because commitUnmount() currently visits them recursively.0
    if (0
      node.child !== null &&0
      // If we use mutation we drill down into portals using commitUnmount above.0
      // If we don't use mutation we drill down into portals here instead.0
      (!supportsMutation || node.tag !== HostPortal)0
    ) {0
      node.child.return = node;0
      node = node.child;0
      continue;0
    }0
    if (node === root) {0
      return;0
    }0
    while (node.sibling === null) {0
      if (node.return === null || node.return === root) {0
        return;0
      }0
      node = node.return;0
    }0
    node.sibling.return = node.return;0
    node = node.sibling;0
  }0
}0
0
function detachFiber(current: Fiber) {0
  // Cut off the return pointers to disconnect it from the tree. Ideally, we0
  // should clear the child pointer of the parent alternate to let this0
  // get GC:ed but we don't know which for sure which parent is the current0
  // one so we'll settle for GC:ing the subtree of this child. This child0
  // itself will be GC:ed when the parent updates the next time.0
  current.return = null;0
  current.child = null;0
  if (current.alternate) {0
    current.alternate.child = null;0
    current.alternate.return = null;0
  }0
}0
0
function emptyPortalContainer(current: Fiber) {0
  if (!supportsPersistence) {0
    return;0
  }0
0
  const portal: {containerInfo: Container, pendingChildren: ChildSet} =0
    current.stateNode;0
  const {containerInfo} = portal;0
  const emptyChildSet = createContainerChildSet(containerInfo);0
  replaceContainerChildren(containerInfo, emptyChildSet);0
}0
0
function commitContainer(finishedWork: Fiber) {0
  if (!supportsPersistence) {0
    return;0
  }0
0
  switch (finishedWork.tag) {0
    case ClassComponent: {0
      return;0
    }0
    case HostComponent: {0
      return;0
    }0
    case HostText: {0
      return;0
    }0
    case HostRoot:0
    case HostPortal: {0
      const portalOrRoot: {0
        containerInfo: Container,0
        pendingChildren: ChildSet,0
      } =0
        finishedWork.stateNode;0
      const {containerInfo, pendingChildren} = portalOrRoot;0
      replaceContainerChildren(containerInfo, pendingChildren);0
      return;0
    }0
    default: {0
      invariant(0
        false,0
        'This unit of work tag should not have side-effects. This error is ' +0
          'likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
      );0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function getHostParentFiber(fiber: Fiber): Fiber {0
  let parent = fiber.return;0
  while (parent !== null) {0
    if (isHostParent(parent)) {0
      return parent;0
    }0
    parent = parent.return;0
  }0
  invariant(0
    false,0
    'Expected to find a host parent. This error is likely caused by a bug ' +0
      'in React. Please file an issue.',0
  );0
}0
0
function isHostParent(fiber: Fiber): boolean {0
  return (0
    fiber.tag === HostComponent ||0
    fiber.tag === HostRoot ||0
    fiber.tag === HostPortal0
  );0
}0
0
function getHostSibling(fiber: Fiber): ?Instance {0
  // We're going to search forward into the tree until we find a sibling host0
  // node. Unfortunately, if multiple insertions are done in a row we have to0
  // search past them. This leads to exponential search for the next sibling.0
  // TODO: Find a more efficient way to do this.0
  let node: Fiber = fiber;0
  siblings: while (true) {0
    // If we didn't find anything, let's try the next sibling.0
    while (node.sibling === null) {0
      if (node.return === null || isHostParent(node.return)) {0
        // If we pop out of the root or hit the parent the fiber we are the0
        // last sibling.0
        return null;0
      }0
      node = node.return;0
    }0
    node.sibling.return = node.return;0
    node = node.sibling;0
    while (node.tag !== HostComponent && node.tag !== HostText) {0
      // If it is not host node and, we might have a host node inside it.0
      // Try to search down until we find one.0
      if (node.effectTag & Placement) {0
        // If we don't have a child, try the siblings instead.0
        continue siblings;0
      }0
      // If we don't have a child, try the siblings instead.0
      // We also skip portals because they are not part of this host tree.0
      if (node.child === null || node.tag === HostPortal) {0
        continue siblings;0
      } else {0
        node.child.return = node;0
        node = node.child;0
      }0
    }0
    // Check if this host node is stable or about to be placed.0
    if (!(node.effectTag & Placement)) {0
      // Found it!0
      return node.stateNode;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function commitPlacement(finishedWork: Fiber): void {0
  if (!supportsMutation) {0
    return;0
  }0
0
  // Recursively insert all host nodes into the parent.0
  const parentFiber = getHostParentFiber(finishedWork);0
  let parent;0
  let isContainer;0
  switch (parentFiber.tag) {0
    case HostComponent:0
      parent = parentFiber.stateNode;0
      isContainer = false;0
      break;0
    case HostRoot:0
      parent = parentFiber.stateNode.containerInfo;0
      isContainer = true;0
      break;0
    case HostPortal:0
      parent = parentFiber.stateNode.containerInfo;0
      isContainer = true;0
      break;0
    default:0
      invariant(0
        false,0
        'Invalid host parent fiber. This error is likely caused by a bug ' +0
          'in React. Please file an issue.',0
      );0
  }0
  if (parentFiber.effectTag & ContentReset) {0
    // Reset the text content of the parent before doing any insertions0
    resetTextContent(parent);0
    // Clear ContentReset from the effect tag0
    parentFiber.effectTag &= ~ContentReset;0
  }0
0
  const before = getHostSibling(finishedWork);0
  // We only have the top Fiber that was inserted but we need recurse down its0
  // children to find all the terminal nodes.0
  let node: Fiber = finishedWork;0
  while (true) {0
    if (node.tag === HostComponent || node.tag === HostText) {0
      if (before) {0
        if (isContainer) {0
          insertInContainerBefore(parent, node.stateNode, before);0
        } else {0
          insertBefore(parent, node.stateNode, before);0
        }0
      } else {0
        if (isContainer) {0
          appendChildToContainer(parent, node.stateNode);0
        } else {0
          appendChild(parent, node.stateNode);0
        }0
      }0
    } else if (node.tag === HostPortal) {0
      // If the insertion itself is a portal, then we don't want to traverse0
      // down its children. Instead, we'll get insertions from each child in0
      // the portal directly.0
    } else if (node.child !== null) {0
      node.child.return = node;0
      node = node.child;0
      continue;0
    }0
    if (node === finishedWork) {0
      return;0
    }0
    while (node.sibling === null) {0
      if (node.return === null || node.return === finishedWork) {0
        return;0
      }0
      node = node.return;0
    }0
    node.sibling.return = node.return;0
    node = node.sibling;0
  }0
}0
0
function unmountHostComponents(current): void {0
  // We only have the top Fiber that was inserted but we need recurse down its0
  // children to find all the terminal nodes.0
  let node: Fiber = current;0
0
  // Each iteration, currentParent is populated with node's host parent if not0
  // currentParentIsValid.0
  let currentParentIsValid = false;0
  let currentParent;0
  let currentParentIsContainer;0
0
  while (true) {0
    if (!currentParentIsValid) {0
      let parent = node.return;0
      findParent: while (true) {0
        invariant(0
          parent !== null,0
          'Expected to find a host parent. This error is likely caused by ' +0
            'a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
        );0
        switch (parent.tag) {0
          case HostComponent:0
            currentParent = parent.stateNode;0
            currentParentIsContainer = false;0
            break findParent;0
          case HostRoot:0
            currentParent = parent.stateNode.containerInfo;0
            currentParentIsContainer = true;0
            break findParent;0
          case HostPortal:0
            currentParent = parent.stateNode.containerInfo;0
            currentParentIsContainer = true;0
            break findParent;0
        }0
        parent = parent.return;0
      }0
      currentParentIsValid = true;0
    }0
0
    if (node.tag === HostComponent || node.tag === HostText) {0
      commitNestedUnmounts(node);0
      // After all the children have unmounted, it is now safe to remove the0
      // node from the tree.0
      if (currentParentIsContainer) {0
        removeChildFromContainer((currentParent: any), node.stateNode);0
      } else {0
        removeChild((currentParent: any), node.stateNode);0
      }0
      // Don't visit children because we already visited them.0
    } else if (node.tag === HostPortal) {0
      // When we go into a portal, it becomes the parent to remove from.0
      // We will reassign it back when we pop the portal on the way up.0
      currentParent = node.stateNode.containerInfo;0
      // Visit children because portals might contain host components.0
      if (node.child !== null) {0
        node.child.return = node;0
        node = node.child;0
        continue;0
      }0
    } else {0
      commitUnmount(node);0
      // Visit children because we may find more host components below.0
      if (node.child !== null) {0
        node.child.return = node;0
        node = node.child;0
        continue;0
      }0
    }0
    if (node === current) {0
      return;0
    }0
    while (node.sibling === null) {0
      if (node.return === null || node.return === current) {0
        return;0
      }0
      node = node.return;0
      if (node.tag === HostPortal) {0
        // When we go out of the portal, we need to restore the parent.0
        // Since we don't keep a stack of them, we will search for it.0
        currentParentIsValid = false;0
      }0
    }0
    node.sibling.return = node.return;0
    node = node.sibling;0
  }0
}0
0
function commitDeletion(current: Fiber): void {0
  if (supportsMutation) {0
    // Recursively delete all host nodes from the parent.0
    // Detach refs and call componentWillUnmount() on the whole subtree.0
    unmountHostComponents(current);0
  } else {0
    // Detach refs and call componentWillUnmount() on the whole subtree.0
    commitNestedUnmounts(current);0
  }0
  detachFiber(current);0
}0
0
function commitWork(current: Fiber | null, finishedWork: Fiber): void {0
  if (!supportsMutation) {0
    commitContainer(finishedWork);0
    return;0
  }0
0
  switch (finishedWork.tag) {0
    case ClassComponent: {0
      return;0
    }0
    case HostComponent: {0
      const instance: Instance = finishedWork.stateNode;0
      if (instance != null) {0
        // Commit the work prepared earlier.0
        const newProps = finishedWork.memoizedProps;0
        // For hydration we reuse the update path but we treat the oldProps0
        // as the newProps. The updatePayload will contain the real change in0
        // this case.0
        const oldProps = current !== null ? current.memoizedProps : newProps;0
        const type = finishedWork.type;0
        // TODO: Type the updateQueue to be specific to host components.0
        const updatePayload: null | UpdatePayload = (finishedWork.updateQueue: any);0
        finishedWork.updateQueue = null;0
        if (updatePayload !== null) {0
          commitUpdate(0
            instance,0
            updatePayload,0
            type,0
            oldProps,0
            newProps,0
            finishedWork,0
          );0
        }0
      }0
      return;0
    }0
    case HostText: {0
      invariant(0
        finishedWork.stateNode !== null,0
        'This should have a text node initialized. This error is likely ' +0
          'caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
      );0
      const textInstance: TextInstance = finishedWork.stateNode;0
      const newText: string = finishedWork.memoizedProps;0
      // For hydration we reuse the update path but we treat the oldProps0
      // as the newProps. The updatePayload will contain the real change in0
      // this case.0
      const oldText: string =0
        current !== null ? current.memoizedProps : newText;0
      commitTextUpdate(textInstance, oldText, newText);0
      return;0
    }0
    case HostRoot: {0
      return;0
    }0
    case Profiler: {0
      if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
        const onRender = finishedWork.memoizedProps.onRender;0
        onRender(0
          finishedWork.memoizedProps.id,0
          current === null ? 'mount' : 'update',0
          finishedWork.actualDuration,0
          finishedWork.treeBaseTime,0
          finishedWork.actualStartTime,0
          getCommitTime(),0
        );0
      }0
      return;0
    }0
    case TimeoutComponent: {0
      return;0
    }0
    default: {0
      invariant(0
        false,0
        'This unit of work tag should not have side-effects. This error is ' +0
          'likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
      );0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function commitResetTextContent(current: Fiber) {0
  if (!supportsMutation) {0
    return;0
  }0
  resetTextContent(current.stateNode);0
}0
0
export {0
  commitBeforeMutationLifeCycles,0
  commitResetTextContent,0
  commitPlacement,0
  commitDeletion,0
  commitWork,0
  commitLifeCycles,0
  commitAttachRef,0
  commitDetachRef,0
};0
