 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {Fiber} from './ReactFiber';0
import type {ExpirationTime} from './ReactFiberExpirationTime';0
import type {FiberRoot} from './ReactFiberRoot';0
import type {0
  Instance,0
  Type,0
  Props,0
  UpdatePayload,0
  Container,0
  ChildSet,0
  HostContext,0
} from './ReactFiberHostConfig';0
0
import {enableProfilerTimer} from 'shared/ReactFeatureFlags';0
import {0
  IndeterminateComponent,0
  FunctionalComponent,0
  ClassComponent,0
  HostRoot,0
  HostComponent,0
  HostText,0
  HostPortal,0
  ContextProvider,0
  ContextConsumer,0
  ForwardRef,0
  Fragment,0
  Mode,0
  Profiler,0
  TimeoutComponent,0
} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfWork';0
import {Placement, Ref, Update} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfSideEffect';0
import {ProfileMode} from './ReactTypeOfMode';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
import {0
  createInstance,0
  createTextInstance,0
  appendInitialChild,0
  finalizeInitialChildren,0
  prepareUpdate,0
  supportsMutation,0
  supportsPersistence,0
  cloneInstance,0
  createContainerChildSet,0
  appendChildToContainerChildSet,0
  finalizeContainerChildren,0
} from './ReactFiberHostConfig';0
import {0
  getRootHostContainer,0
  popHostContext,0
  getHostContext,0
  popHostContainer,0
} from './ReactFiberHostContext';0
import {recordElapsedActualRenderTime} from './ReactProfilerTimer';0
import {0
  popContextProvider as popLegacyContextProvider,0
  popTopLevelContextObject as popTopLevelLegacyContextObject,0
} from './ReactFiberContext';0
import {popProvider} from './ReactFiberNewContext';0
import {0
  prepareToHydrateHostInstance,0
  prepareToHydrateHostTextInstance,0
  popHydrationState,0
} from './ReactFiberHydrationContext';0
0
function markUpdate(workInProgress: Fiber) {0
  // Tag the fiber with an update effect. This turns a Placement into0
  // a PlacementAndUpdate.0
  workInProgress.effectTag |= Update;0
}0
0
function markRef(workInProgress: Fiber) {0
  workInProgress.effectTag |= Ref;0
}0
0
function appendAllChildren(parent: Instance, workInProgress: Fiber) {0
  // We only have the top Fiber that was created but we need recurse down its0
  // children to find all the terminal nodes.0
  let node = workInProgress.child;0
  while (node !== null) {0
    if (node.tag === HostComponent || node.tag === HostText) {0
      appendInitialChild(parent, node.stateNode);0
    } else if (node.tag === HostPortal) {0
      // If we have a portal child, then we don't want to traverse0
      // down its children. Instead, we'll get insertions from each child in0
      // the portal directly.0
    } else if (node.child !== null) {0
      node.child.return = node;0
      node = node.child;0
      continue;0
    }0
    if (node === workInProgress) {0
      return;0
    }0
    while (node.sibling === null) {0
      if (node.return === null || node.return === workInProgress) {0
        return;0
      }0
      node = node.return;0
    }0
    node.sibling.return = node.return;0
    node = node.sibling;0
  }0
}0
0
let updateHostContainer;0
let updateHostComponent;0
let updateHostText;0
if (supportsMutation) {0
  // Mutation mode0
0
  updateHostContainer = function(workInProgress: Fiber) {0
    // Noop0
  };0
  updateHostComponent = function(0
    current: Fiber,0
    workInProgress: Fiber,0
    updatePayload: null | UpdatePayload,0
    type: Type,0
    oldProps: Props,0
    newProps: Props,0
    rootContainerInstance: Container,0
    currentHostContext: HostContext,0
  ) {0
    // TODO: Type this specific to this type of component.0
    workInProgress.updateQueue = (updatePayload: any);0
    // If the update payload indicates that there is a change or if there0
    // is a new ref we mark this as an update. All the work is done in commitWork.0
    if (updatePayload) {0
      markUpdate(workInProgress);0
    }0
  };0
  updateHostText = function(0
    current: Fiber,0
    workInProgress: Fiber,0
    oldText: string,0
    newText: string,0
  ) {0
    // If the text differs, mark it as an update. All the work in done in commitWork.0
    if (oldText !== newText) {0
      markUpdate(workInProgress);0
    }0
  };0
} else if (supportsPersistence) {0
  // Persistent host tree mode0
0
  // An unfortunate fork of appendAllChildren because we have two different parent types.0
  const appendAllChildrenToContainer = function(0
    containerChildSet: ChildSet,0
    workInProgress: Fiber,0
  ) {0
    // We only have the top Fiber that was created but we need recurse down its0
    // children to find all the terminal nodes.0
    let node = workInProgress.child;0
    while (node !== null) {0
      if (node.tag === HostComponent || node.tag === HostText) {0
        appendChildToContainerChildSet(containerChildSet, node.stateNode);0
      } else if (node.tag === HostPortal) {0
        // If we have a portal child, then we don't want to traverse0
        // down its children. Instead, we'll get insertions from each child in0
        // the portal directly.0
      } else if (node.child !== null) {0
        node.child.return = node;0
        node = node.child;0
        continue;0
      }0
      if (node === workInProgress) {0
        return;0
      }0
      while (node.sibling === null) {0
        if (node.return === null || node.return === workInProgress) {0
          return;0
        }0
        node = node.return;0
      }0
      node.sibling.return = node.return;0
      node = node.sibling;0
    }0
  };0
  updateHostContainer = function(workInProgress: Fiber) {0
    const portalOrRoot: {0
      containerInfo: Container,0
      pendingChildren: ChildSet,0
    } =0
      workInProgress.stateNode;0
    const childrenUnchanged = workInProgress.firstEffect === null;0
    if (childrenUnchanged) {0
      // No changes, just reuse the existing instance.0
    } else {0
      const container = portalOrRoot.containerInfo;0
      let newChildSet = createContainerChildSet(container);0
      // If children might have changed, we have to add them all to the set.0
      appendAllChildrenToContainer(newChildSet, workInProgress);0
      portalOrRoot.pendingChildren = newChildSet;0
      // Schedule an update on the container to swap out the container.0
      markUpdate(workInProgress);0
      finalizeContainerChildren(container, newChildSet);0
    }0
  };0
  updateHostComponent = function(0
    current: Fiber,0
    workInProgress: Fiber,0
    updatePayload: null | UpdatePayload,0
    type: Type,0
    oldProps: Props,0
    newProps: Props,0
    rootContainerInstance: Container,0
    currentHostContext: HostContext,0
  ) {0
    // If there are no effects associated with this node, then none of our children had any updates.0
    // This guarantees that we can reuse all of them.0
    const childrenUnchanged = workInProgress.firstEffect === null;0
    const currentInstance = current.stateNode;0
    if (childrenUnchanged && updatePayload === null) {0
      // No changes, just reuse the existing instance.0
      // Note that this might release a previous clone.0
      workInProgress.stateNode = currentInstance;0
    } else {0
      let recyclableInstance = workInProgress.stateNode;0
      let newInstance = cloneInstance(0
        currentInstance,0
        updatePayload,0
        type,0
        oldProps,0
        newProps,0
        workInProgress,0
        childrenUnchanged,0
        recyclableInstance,0
      );0
      if (0
        finalizeInitialChildren(0
          newInstance,0
          type,0
          newProps,0
          rootContainerInstance,0
          currentHostContext,0
        )0
      ) {0
        markUpdate(workInProgress);0
      }0
      workInProgress.stateNode = newInstance;0
      if (childrenUnchanged) {0
        // If there are no other effects in this tree, we need to flag this node as having one.0
        // Even though we're not going to use it for anything.0
        // Otherwise parents won't know that there are new children to propagate upwards.0
        markUpdate(workInProgress);0
      } else {0
        // If children might have changed, we have to add them all to the set.0
        appendAllChildren(newInstance, workInProgress);0
      }0
    }0
  };0
  updateHostText = function(0
    current: Fiber,0
    workInProgress: Fiber,0
    oldText: string,0
    newText: string,0
  ) {0
    if (oldText !== newText) {0
      // If the text content differs, we'll create a new text instance for it.0
      const rootContainerInstance = getRootHostContainer();0
      const currentHostContext = getHostContext();0
      workInProgress.stateNode = createTextInstance(0
        newText,0
        rootContainerInstance,0
        currentHostContext,0
        workInProgress,0
      );0
      // We'll have to mark it as having an effect, even though we won't use the effect for anything.0
      // This lets the parents know that at least one of their children has changed.0
      markUpdate(workInProgress);0
    }0
  };0
} else {0
  // No host operations0
  updateHostContainer = function(workInProgress: Fiber) {0
    // Noop0
  };0
  updateHostComponent = function(0
    current: Fiber,0
    workInProgress: Fiber,0
    updatePayload: null | UpdatePayload,0
    type: Type,0
    oldProps: Props,0
    newProps: Props,0
    rootContainerInstance: Container,0
    currentHostContext: HostContext,0
  ) {0
    // Noop0
  };0
  updateHostText = function(0
    current: Fiber,0
    workInProgress: Fiber,0
    oldText: string,0
    newText: string,0
  ) {0
    // Noop0
  };0
}0
0
function completeWork(0
  current: Fiber | null,0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  renderExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
): Fiber | null {0
  const newProps = workInProgress.pendingProps;0
0
  if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
    if (workInProgress.mode & ProfileMode) {0
      recordElapsedActualRenderTime(workInProgress);0
    }0
  }0
0
  switch (workInProgress.tag) {0
    case FunctionalComponent:0
      return null;0
    case ClassComponent: {0
      // We are leaving this subtree, so pop context if any.0
      popLegacyContextProvider(workInProgress);0
      return null;0
    }0
    case HostRoot: {0
      popHostContainer(workInProgress);0
      popTopLevelLegacyContextObject(workInProgress);0
      const fiberRoot = (workInProgress.stateNode: FiberRoot);0
      if (fiberRoot.pendingContext) {0
        fiberRoot.context = fiberRoot.pendingContext;0
        fiberRoot.pendingContext = null;0
      }0
      if (current === null || current.child === null) {0
        // If we hydrated, pop so that we can delete any remaining children0
        // that weren't hydrated.0
        popHydrationState(workInProgress);0
        // This resets the hacky state to fix isMounted before committing.0
        // TODO: Delete this when we delete isMounted and findDOMNode.0
        workInProgress.effectTag &= ~Placement;0
      }0
      updateHostContainer(workInProgress);0
      return null;0
    }0
    case HostComponent: {0
      popHostContext(workInProgress);0
      const rootContainerInstance = getRootHostContainer();0
      const type = workInProgress.type;0
      if (current !== null && workInProgress.stateNode != null) {0
        // If we have an alternate, that means this is an update and we need to0
        // schedule a side-effect to do the updates.0
        const oldProps = current.memoizedProps;0
        // If we get updated because one of our children updated, we don't0
        // have newProps so we'll have to reuse them.0
        // TODO: Split the update API as separate for the props vs. children.0
        // Even better would be if children weren't special cased at all tho.0
        const instance: Instance = workInProgress.stateNode;0
        const currentHostContext = getHostContext();0
        // TODO: Experiencing an error where oldProps is null. Suggests a host0
        // component is hitting the resume path. Figure out why. Possibly0
        // related to `hidden`.0
        const updatePayload = prepareUpdate(0
          instance,0
          type,0
          oldProps,0
          newProps,0
          rootContainerInstance,0
          currentHostContext,0
        );0
0
        updateHostComponent(0
          current,0
          workInProgress,0
          updatePayload,0
          type,0
          oldProps,0
          newProps,0
          rootContainerInstance,0
          currentHostContext,0
        );0
0
        if (current.ref !== workInProgress.ref) {0
          markRef(workInProgress);0
        }0
      } else {0
        if (!newProps) {0
          invariant(0
            workInProgress.stateNode !== null,0
            'We must have new props for new mounts. This error is likely ' +0
              'caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
          );0
          // This can happen when we abort work.0
          return null;0
        }0
0
        const currentHostContext = getHostContext();0
        // TODO: Move createInstance to beginWork and keep it on a context0
        // "stack" as the parent. Then append children as we go in beginWork0
        // or completeWork depending on we want to add then top->down or0
        // bottom->up. Top->down is faster in IE11.0
        let wasHydrated = popHydrationState(workInProgress);0
        if (wasHydrated) {0
          // TODO: Move this and createInstance step into the beginPhase0
          // to consolidate.0
          if (0
            prepareToHydrateHostInstance(0
              workInProgress,0
              rootContainerInstance,0
              currentHostContext,0
            )0
          ) {0
            // If changes to the hydrated node needs to be applied at the0
            // commit-phase we mark this as such.0
            markUpdate(workInProgress);0
          }0
        } else {0
          let instance = createInstance(0
            type,0
            newProps,0
            rootContainerInstance,0
            currentHostContext,0
            workInProgress,0
          );0
0
          appendAllChildren(instance, workInProgress);0
0
          // Certain renderers require commit-time effects for initial mount.0
          // (eg DOM renderer supports auto-focus for certain elements).0
          // Make sure such renderers get scheduled for later work.0
          if (0
            finalizeInitialChildren(0
              instance,0
              type,0
              newProps,0
              rootContainerInstance,0
              currentHostContext,0
            )0
          ) {0
            markUpdate(workInProgress);0
          }0
          workInProgress.stateNode = instance;0
        }0
0
        if (workInProgress.ref !== null) {0
          // If there is a ref on a host node we need to schedule a callback0
          markRef(workInProgress);0
        }0
      }0
      return null;0
    }0
    case HostText: {0
      let newText = newProps;0
      if (current && workInProgress.stateNode != null) {0
        const oldText = current.memoizedProps;0
        // If we have an alternate, that means this is an update and we need0
        // to schedule a side-effect to do the updates.0
        updateHostText(current, workInProgress, oldText, newText);0
      } else {0
        if (typeof newText !== 'string') {0
          invariant(0
            workInProgress.stateNode !== null,0
            'We must have new props for new mounts. This error is likely ' +0
              'caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
          );0
          // This can happen when we abort work.0
          return null;0
        }0
        const rootContainerInstance = getRootHostContainer();0
        const currentHostContext = getHostContext();0
        let wasHydrated = popHydrationState(workInProgress);0
        if (wasHydrated) {0
          if (prepareToHydrateHostTextInstance(workInProgress)) {0
            markUpdate(workInProgress);0
          }0
        } else {0
          workInProgress.stateNode = createTextInstance(0
            newText,0
            rootContainerInstance,0
            currentHostContext,0
            workInProgress,0
          );0
        }0
      }0
      return null;0
    }0
    case ForwardRef:0
      return null;0
    case TimeoutComponent:0
      return null;0
    case Fragment:0
      return null;0
    case Mode:0
      return null;0
    case Profiler:0
      return null;0
    case HostPortal:0
      popHostContainer(workInProgress);0
      updateHostContainer(workInProgress);0
      return null;0
    case ContextProvider:0
      // Pop provider fiber0
      popProvider(workInProgress);0
      return null;0
    case ContextConsumer:0
      return null;0
    // Error cases0
    case IndeterminateComponent:0
      invariant(0
        false,0
        'An indeterminate component should have become determinate before ' +0
          'completing. This error is likely caused by a bug in React. Please ' +0
          'file an issue.',0
      );0
    // eslint-disable-next-line no-fallthrough0
    default:0
      invariant(0
        false,0
        'Unknown unit of work tag. This error is likely caused by a bug in ' +0
          'React. Please file an issue.',0
      );0
  }0
}0
0
export {completeWork};0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {Fiber} from './ReactFiber';0
import type {StackCursor} from './ReactFiberStack';0
0
import {isFiberMounted} from 'react-reconciler/reflection';0
import {ClassComponent, HostRoot} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfWork';0
import getComponentName from 'shared/getComponentName';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
import checkPropTypes from 'prop-types/checkPropTypes';0
0
import ReactDebugCurrentFiber from './ReactDebugCurrentFiber';0
import {startPhaseTimer, stopPhaseTimer} from './ReactDebugFiberPerf';0
import {createCursor, push, pop} from './ReactFiberStack';0
0
let warnedAboutMissingGetChildContext;0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  warnedAboutMissingGetChildContext = {};0
}0
0
export const emptyContextObject = {};0
if (__DEV__) {0
  Object.freeze(emptyContextObject);0
}0
0
// A cursor to the current merged context object on the stack.0
let contextStackCursor: StackCursor<Object> = createCursor(emptyContextObject);0
// A cursor to a boolean indicating whether the context has changed.0
let didPerformWorkStackCursor: StackCursor<boolean> = createCursor(false);0
// Keep track of the previous context object that was on the stack.0
// We use this to get access to the parent context after we have already0
// pushed the next context provider, and now need to merge their contexts.0
let previousContext: Object = emptyContextObject;0
0
function getUnmaskedContext(workInProgress: Fiber): Object {0
  const hasOwnContext = isContextProvider(workInProgress);0
  if (hasOwnContext) {0
    // If the fiber is a context provider itself, when we read its context0
    // we have already pushed its own child context on the stack. A context0
    // provider should not "see" its own child context. Therefore we read the0
    // previous (parent) context instead for a context provider.0
    return previousContext;0
  }0
  return contextStackCursor.current;0
}0
0
function cacheContext(0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  unmaskedContext: Object,0
  maskedContext: Object,0
): void {0
  const instance = workInProgress.stateNode;0
  instance.__reactInternalMemoizedUnmaskedChildContext = unmaskedContext;0
  instance.__reactInternalMemoizedMaskedChildContext = maskedContext;0
}0
0
function getMaskedContext(0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  unmaskedContext: Object,0
): Object {0
  const type = workInProgress.type;0
  const contextTypes = type.contextTypes;0
  if (!contextTypes) {0
    return emptyContextObject;0
  }0
0
  // Avoid recreating masked context unless unmasked context has changed.0
  // Failing to do this will result in unnecessary calls to componentWillReceiveProps.0
  // This may trigger infinite loops if componentWillReceiveProps calls setState.0
  const instance = workInProgress.stateNode;0
  if (0
    instance &&0
    instance.__reactInternalMemoizedUnmaskedChildContext === unmaskedContext0
  ) {0
    return instance.__reactInternalMemoizedMaskedChildContext;0
  }0
0
  const context = {};0
  for (let key in contextTypes) {0
    context[key] = unmaskedContext[key];0
  }0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const name = getComponentName(workInProgress) || 'Unknown';0
    checkPropTypes(0
      contextTypes,0
      context,0
      'context',0
      name,0
      ReactDebugCurrentFiber.getCurrentFiberStackAddendum,0
    );0
  }0
0
  // Cache unmasked context so we can avoid recreating masked context unless necessary.0
  // Context is created before the class component is instantiated so check for instance.0
  if (instance) {0
    cacheContext(workInProgress, unmaskedContext, context);0
  }0
0
  return context;0
}0
0
function hasContextChanged(): boolean {0
  return didPerformWorkStackCursor.current;0
}0
0
function isContextConsumer(fiber: Fiber): boolean {0
  return fiber.tag === ClassComponent && fiber.type.contextTypes != null;0
}0
0
function isContextProvider(fiber: Fiber): boolean {0
  return fiber.tag === ClassComponent && fiber.type.childContextTypes != null;0
}0
0
function popContextProvider(fiber: Fiber): void {0
  if (!isContextProvider(fiber)) {0
    return;0
  }0
0
  pop(didPerformWorkStackCursor, fiber);0
  pop(contextStackCursor, fiber);0
}0
0
function popTopLevelContextObject(fiber: Fiber): void {0
  pop(didPerformWorkStackCursor, fiber);0
  pop(contextStackCursor, fiber);0
}0
0
function pushTopLevelContextObject(0
  fiber: Fiber,0
  context: Object,0
  didChange: boolean,0
): void {0
  invariant(0
    contextStackCursor.current === emptyContextObject,0
    'Unexpected context found on stack. ' +0
      'This error is likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
  );0
0
  push(contextStackCursor, context, fiber);0
  push(didPerformWorkStackCursor, didChange, fiber);0
}0
0
function processChildContext(fiber: Fiber, parentContext: Object): Object {0
  const instance = fiber.stateNode;0
  const childContextTypes = fiber.type.childContextTypes;0
0
  // TODO (bvaughn) Replace this behavior with an invariant() in the future.0
  // It has only been added in Fiber to match the (unintentional) behavior in Stack.0
  if (typeof instance.getChildContext !== 'function') {0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      const componentName = getComponentName(fiber) || 'Unknown';0
0
      if (!warnedAboutMissingGetChildContext[componentName]) {0
        warnedAboutMissingGetChildContext[componentName] = true;0
        warning(0
          false,0
          '%s.childContextTypes is specified but there is no getChildContext() method ' +0
            'on the instance. You can either define getChildContext() on %s or remove ' +0
            'childContextTypes from it.',0
          componentName,0
          componentName,0
        );0
      }0
    }0
    return parentContext;0
  }0
0
  let childContext;0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    ReactDebugCurrentFiber.setCurrentPhase('getChildContext');0
  }0
  startPhaseTimer(fiber, 'getChildContext');0
  childContext = instance.getChildContext();0
  stopPhaseTimer();0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    ReactDebugCurrentFiber.setCurrentPhase(null);0
  }0
  for (let contextKey in childContext) {0
    invariant(0
      contextKey in childContextTypes,0
      '%s.getChildContext(): key "%s" is not defined in childContextTypes.',0
      getComponentName(fiber) || 'Unknown',0
      contextKey,0
    );0
  }0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const name = getComponentName(fiber) || 'Unknown';0
    checkPropTypes(0
      childContextTypes,0
      childContext,0
      'child context',0
      name,0
      // In practice, there is one case in which we won't get a stack. It's when0
      // somebody calls unstable_renderSubtreeIntoContainer() and we process0
      // context from the parent component instance. The stack will be missing0
      // because it's outside of the reconciliation, and so the pointer has not0
      // been set. This is rare and doesn't matter. We'll also remove that API.0
      ReactDebugCurrentFiber.getCurrentFiberStackAddendum,0
    );0
  }0
0
  return {...parentContext, ...childContext};0
}0
0
function pushContextProvider(workInProgress: Fiber): boolean {0
  if (!isContextProvider(workInProgress)) {0
    return false;0
  }0
0
  const instance = workInProgress.stateNode;0
  // We push the context as early as possible to ensure stack integrity.0
  // If the instance does not exist yet, we will push null at first,0
  // and replace it on the stack later when invalidating the context.0
  const memoizedMergedChildContext =0
    (instance && instance.__reactInternalMemoizedMergedChildContext) ||0
    emptyContextObject;0
0
  // Remember the parent context so we can merge with it later.0
  // Inherit the parent's did-perform-work value to avoid inadvertently blocking updates.0
  previousContext = contextStackCursor.current;0
  push(contextStackCursor, memoizedMergedChildContext, workInProgress);0
  push(0
    didPerformWorkStackCursor,0
    didPerformWorkStackCursor.current,0
    workInProgress,0
  );0
0
  return true;0
}0
0
function invalidateContextProvider(0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  didChange: boolean,0
): void {0
  const instance = workInProgress.stateNode;0
  invariant(0
    instance,0
    'Expected to have an instance by this point. ' +0
      'This error is likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
  );0
0
  if (didChange) {0
    // Merge parent and own context.0
    // Skip this if we're not updating due to sCU.0
    // This avoids unnecessarily recomputing memoized values.0
    const mergedContext = processChildContext(workInProgress, previousContext);0
    instance.__reactInternalMemoizedMergedChildContext = mergedContext;0
0
    // Replace the old (or empty) context with the new one.0
    // It is important to unwind the context in the reverse order.0
    pop(didPerformWorkStackCursor, workInProgress);0
    pop(contextStackCursor, workInProgress);0
    // Now push the new context and mark that it has changed.0
    push(contextStackCursor, mergedContext, workInProgress);0
    push(didPerformWorkStackCursor, didChange, workInProgress);0
  } else {0
    pop(didPerformWorkStackCursor, workInProgress);0
    push(didPerformWorkStackCursor, didChange, workInProgress);0
  }0
}0
0
function findCurrentUnmaskedContext(fiber: Fiber): Object {0
  // Currently this is only used with renderSubtreeIntoContainer; not sure if it0
  // makes sense elsewhere0
  invariant(0
    isFiberMounted(fiber) && fiber.tag === ClassComponent,0
    'Expected subtree parent to be a mounted class component. ' +0
      'This error is likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
  );0
0
  let node: Fiber = fiber;0
  while (node.tag !== HostRoot) {0
    if (isContextProvider(node)) {0
      return node.stateNode.__reactInternalMemoizedMergedChildContext;0
    }0
    const parent = node.return;0
    invariant(0
      parent,0
      'Found unexpected detached subtree parent. ' +0
        'This error is likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
    );0
    node = parent;0
  }0
  return node.stateNode.context;0
}0
0
export {0
  getUnmaskedContext,0
  cacheContext,0
  getMaskedContext,0
  hasContextChanged,0
  isContextConsumer,0
  isContextProvider,0
  popContextProvider,0
  popTopLevelContextObject,0
  pushTopLevelContextObject,0
  processChildContext,0
  pushContextProvider,0
  invalidateContextProvider,0
  findCurrentUnmaskedContext,0
};0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0

 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {Fiber} from './ReactFiber';0
import type {FiberRoot} from './ReactFiberRoot';0
0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
declare var __REACT_DEVTOOLS_GLOBAL_HOOK__: Object | void;0
0
let onCommitFiberRoot = null;0
let onCommitFiberUnmount = null;0
let hasLoggedError = false;0
0
function catchErrors(fn) {0
  return function(arg) {0
    try {0
      return fn(arg);0
    } catch (err) {0
      if (__DEV__ && !hasLoggedError) {0
        hasLoggedError = true;0
        warning(false, 'React DevTools encountered an error: %s', err);0
      }0
    }0
  };0
}0
0
export const isDevToolsPresent =0
  typeof __REACT_DEVTOOLS_GLOBAL_HOOK__ !== 'undefined';0
0
export function injectInternals(internals: Object): boolean {0
  if (typeof __REACT_DEVTOOLS_GLOBAL_HOOK__ === 'undefined') {0
    // No DevTools0
    return false;0
  }0
  const hook = __REACT_DEVTOOLS_GLOBAL_HOOK__;0
  if (hook.isDisabled) {0
    // This isn't a real property on the hook, but it can be set to opt out0
    // of DevTools integration and associated warnings and logs.0
    // https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/38770
    return true;0
  }0
  if (!hook.supportsFiber) {0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'The installed version of React DevTools is too old and will not work ' +0
          'with the current version of React. Please update React DevTools. ' +0
          'https://fb.me/react-devtools',0
      );0
    }0
    // DevTools exists, even though it doesn't support Fiber.0
    return true;0
  }0
  try {0
    const rendererID = hook.inject(internals);0
    // We have successfully injected, so now it is safe to set up hooks.0
    onCommitFiberRoot = catchErrors(root =>0
      hook.onCommitFiberRoot(rendererID, root),0
    );0
    onCommitFiberUnmount = catchErrors(fiber =>0
      hook.onCommitFiberUnmount(rendererID, fiber),0
    );0
  } catch (err) {0
    // Catch all errors because it is unsafe to throw during initialization.0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      warning(false, 'React DevTools encountered an error: %s.', err);0
    }0
  }0
  // DevTools exists0
  return true;0
}0
0
export function onCommitRoot(root: FiberRoot) {0
  if (typeof onCommitFiberRoot === 'function') {0
    onCommitFiberRoot(root);0
  }0
}0
0
export function onCommitUnmount(fiber: Fiber) {0
  if (typeof onCommitFiberUnmount === 'function') {0
    onCommitFiberUnmount(fiber);0
  }0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {CapturedError} from './ReactCapturedValue';0
0
// This module is forked in different environments.0
// By default, return `true` to log errors to the console.0
// Forks can return `false` if this isn't desirable.0
export function showErrorDialog(capturedError: CapturedError): boolean {0
  return true;0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {CapturedError} from './ReactCapturedValue';0
0
import {showErrorDialog} from './ReactFiberErrorDialog';0
0
export function logCapturedError(capturedError: CapturedError): void {0
  const logError = showErrorDialog(capturedError);0
0
  // Allow injected showErrorDialog() to prevent default console.error logging.0
  // This enables renderers like ReactNative to better manage redbox behavior.0
  if (logError === false) {0
    return;0
  }0
0
  const error = (capturedError.error: any);0
  const suppressLogging = error && error.suppressReactErrorLogging;0
  if (suppressLogging) {0
    return;0
  }0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const {0
      componentName,0
      componentStack,0
      errorBoundaryName,0
      errorBoundaryFound,0
      willRetry,0
    } = capturedError;0
0
    const componentNameMessage = componentName0
      ? `The above error occurred in the <${componentName}> component:`0
      : 'The above error occurred in one of your React components:';0
0
    let errorBoundaryMessage;0
    // errorBoundaryFound check is sufficient; errorBoundaryName check is to satisfy Flow.0
    if (errorBoundaryFound && errorBoundaryName) {0
      if (willRetry) {0
        errorBoundaryMessage =0
          `React will try to recreate this component tree from scratch ` +0
          `using the error boundary you provided, ${errorBoundaryName}.`;0
      } else {0
        errorBoundaryMessage =0
          `This error was initially handled by the error boundary ${errorBoundaryName}.\n` +0
          `Recreating the tree from scratch failed so React will unmount the tree.`;0
      }0
    } else {0
      errorBoundaryMessage =0
        'Consider adding an error boundary to your tree to customize error handling behavior.\n' +0
        'Visit https://fb.me/react-error-boundaries to learn more about error boundaries.';0
    }0
    const combinedMessage =0
      `${componentNameMessage}${componentStack}\n\n` +0
      `${errorBoundaryMessage}`;0
0
    // In development, we provide our own message with just the component stack.0
    // We don't include the original error message and JS stack because the browser0
    // has already printed it. Even if the application swallows the error, it is still0
    // displayed by the browser thanks to the DEV-only fake event trick in ReactErrorUtils.0
    console.error(combinedMessage);0
  } else {0
    // In production, we print the error directly.0
    // This will include the message, the JS stack, and anything the browser wants to show.0
    // We pass the error object instead of custom message so that the browser displays the error natively.0
    console.error(error);0
  }0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import MAX_SIGNED_31_BIT_INT from './maxSigned31BitInt';0
0
export type ExpirationTime = number;0
0
export const NoWork = 0;0
export const Sync = 1;0
export const Never = MAX_SIGNED_31_BIT_INT;0
0
const UNIT_SIZE = 10;0
const MAGIC_NUMBER_OFFSET = 2;0
0
// 1 unit of expiration time represents 10ms.0
export function msToExpirationTime(ms: number): ExpirationTime {0
  // Always add an offset so that we don't clash with the magic number for NoWork.0
  return ((ms / UNIT_SIZE) | 0) + MAGIC_NUMBER_OFFSET;0
}0
0
export function expirationTimeToMs(expirationTime: ExpirationTime): number {0
  return (expirationTime - MAGIC_NUMBER_OFFSET) * UNIT_SIZE;0
}0
0
function ceiling(num: number, precision: number): number {0
  return (((num / precision) | 0) + 1) * precision;0
}0
0
export function computeExpirationBucket(0
  currentTime: ExpirationTime,0
  expirationInMs: number,0
  bucketSizeMs: number,0
): ExpirationTime {0
  return (0
    MAGIC_NUMBER_OFFSET +0
    ceiling(0
      currentTime - MAGIC_NUMBER_OFFSET + expirationInMs / UNIT_SIZE,0
      bucketSizeMs / UNIT_SIZE,0
    )0
  );0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2015-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
// We expect that our Rollup, Jest, and Flow configurations0
// always shim this module with the corresponding host config0
// (either provided by a renderer, or a generic shim for npm).0
//0
// We should never resolve to this file, but it exists to make0
// sure that if we *do* accidentally break the configuration,0
// the failure isn't silent.0
0
invariant(false, 'This module must be shimmed by a specific renderer.');0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {Fiber} from './ReactFiber';0
import type {StackCursor} from './ReactFiberStack';0
import type {Container, HostContext} from './ReactFiberHostConfig';0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
import {getChildHostContext, getRootHostContext} from './ReactFiberHostConfig';0
import {createCursor, push, pop} from './ReactFiberStack';0
0
declare class NoContextT {}0
const NO_CONTEXT: NoContextT = ({}: any);0
0
let contextStackCursor: StackCursor<HostContext | NoContextT> = createCursor(0
  NO_CONTEXT,0
);0
let contextFiberStackCursor: StackCursor<Fiber | NoContextT> = createCursor(0
  NO_CONTEXT,0
);0
let rootInstanceStackCursor: StackCursor<Container | NoContextT> = createCursor(0
  NO_CONTEXT,0
);0
0
function requiredContext<Value>(c: Value | NoContextT): Value {0
  invariant(0
    c !== NO_CONTEXT,0
    'Expected host context to exist. This error is likely caused by a bug ' +0
      'in React. Please file an issue.',0
  );0
  return (c: any);0
}0
0
function getRootHostContainer(): Container {0
  const rootInstance = requiredContext(rootInstanceStackCursor.current);0
  return rootInstance;0
}0
0
function pushHostContainer(fiber: Fiber, nextRootInstance: Container) {0
  // Push current root instance onto the stack;0
  // This allows us to reset root when portals are popped.0
  push(rootInstanceStackCursor, nextRootInstance, fiber);0
  // Track the context and the Fiber that provided it.0
  // This enables us to pop only Fibers that provide unique contexts.0
  push(contextFiberStackCursor, fiber, fiber);0
0
  // Finally, we need to push the host context to the stack.0
  // However, we can't just call getRootHostContext() and push it because0
  // we'd have a different number of entries on the stack depending on0
  // whether getRootHostContext() throws somewhere in renderer code or not.0
  // So we push an empty value first. This lets us safely unwind on errors.0
  push(contextStackCursor, NO_CONTEXT, fiber);0
  const nextRootContext = getRootHostContext(nextRootInstance);0
  // Now that we know this function doesn't throw, replace it.0
  pop(contextStackCursor, fiber);0
  push(contextStackCursor, nextRootContext, fiber);0
}0
0
function popHostContainer(fiber: Fiber) {0
  pop(contextStackCursor, fiber);0
  pop(contextFiberStackCursor, fiber);0
  pop(rootInstanceStackCursor, fiber);0
}0
0
function getHostContext(): HostContext {0
  const context = requiredContext(contextStackCursor.current);0
  return context;0
}0
0
function pushHostContext(fiber: Fiber): void {0
  const rootInstance: Container = requiredContext(0
    rootInstanceStackCursor.current,0
  );0
  const context: HostContext = requiredContext(contextStackCursor.current);0
  const nextContext = getChildHostContext(context, fiber.type, rootInstance);0
0
  // Don't push this Fiber's context unless it's unique.0
  if (context === nextContext) {0
    return;0
  }0
0
  // Track the context and the Fiber that provided it.0
  // This enables us to pop only Fibers that provide unique contexts.0
  push(contextFiberStackCursor, fiber, fiber);0
  push(contextStackCursor, nextContext, fiber);0
}0
0
function popHostContext(fiber: Fiber): void {0
  // Do not pop unless this Fiber provided the current context.0
  // pushHostContext() only pushes Fibers that provide unique contexts.0
  if (contextFiberStackCursor.current !== fiber) {0
    return;0
  }0
0
  pop(contextStackCursor, fiber);0
  pop(contextFiberStackCursor, fiber);0
}0
0
export {0
  getHostContext,0
  getRootHostContainer,0
  popHostContainer,0
  popHostContext,0
  pushHostContainer,0
  pushHostContext,0
};0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {Fiber} from './ReactFiber';0
import type {0
  Instance,0
  TextInstance,0
  HydratableInstance,0
  Container,0
  HostContext,0
} from './ReactFiberHostConfig';0
0
import {HostComponent, HostText, HostRoot} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfWork';0
import {Deletion, Placement} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfSideEffect';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
import {createFiberFromHostInstanceForDeletion} from './ReactFiber';0
import {0
  shouldSetTextContent,0
  supportsHydration,0
  canHydrateInstance,0
  canHydrateTextInstance,0
  getNextHydratableSibling,0
  getFirstHydratableChild,0
  hydrateInstance,0
  hydrateTextInstance,0
  didNotMatchHydratedContainerTextInstance,0
  didNotMatchHydratedTextInstance,0
  didNotHydrateContainerInstance,0
  didNotHydrateInstance,0
  didNotFindHydratableContainerInstance,0
  didNotFindHydratableContainerTextInstance,0
  didNotFindHydratableInstance,0
  didNotFindHydratableTextInstance,0
} from './ReactFiberHostConfig';0
0
// The deepest Fiber on the stack involved in a hydration context.0
// This may have been an insertion or a hydration.0
let hydrationParentFiber: null | Fiber = null;0
let nextHydratableInstance: null | HydratableInstance = null;0
let isHydrating: boolean = false;0
0
function enterHydrationState(fiber: Fiber): boolean {0
  if (!supportsHydration) {0
    return false;0
  }0
0
  const parentInstance = fiber.stateNode.containerInfo;0
  nextHydratableInstance = getFirstHydratableChild(parentInstance);0
  hydrationParentFiber = fiber;0
  isHydrating = true;0
  return true;0
}0
0
function deleteHydratableInstance(0
  returnFiber: Fiber,0
  instance: HydratableInstance,0
) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    switch (returnFiber.tag) {0
      case HostRoot:0
        didNotHydrateContainerInstance(0
          returnFiber.stateNode.containerInfo,0
          instance,0
        );0
        break;0
      case HostComponent:0
        didNotHydrateInstance(0
          returnFiber.type,0
          returnFiber.memoizedProps,0
          returnFiber.stateNode,0
          instance,0
        );0
        break;0
    }0
  }0
0
  const childToDelete = createFiberFromHostInstanceForDeletion();0
  childToDelete.stateNode = instance;0
  childToDelete.return = returnFiber;0
  childToDelete.effectTag = Deletion;0
0
  // This might seem like it belongs on progressedFirstDeletion. However,0
  // these children are not part of the reconciliation list of children.0
  // Even if we abort and rereconcile the children, that will try to hydrate0
  // again and the nodes are still in the host tree so these will be0
  // recreated.0
  if (returnFiber.lastEffect !== null) {0
    returnFiber.lastEffect.nextEffect = childToDelete;0
    returnFiber.lastEffect = childToDelete;0
  } else {0
    returnFiber.firstEffect = returnFiber.lastEffect = childToDelete;0
  }0
}0
0
function insertNonHydratedInstance(returnFiber: Fiber, fiber: Fiber) {0
  fiber.effectTag |= Placement;0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    switch (returnFiber.tag) {0
      case HostRoot: {0
        const parentContainer = returnFiber.stateNode.containerInfo;0
        switch (fiber.tag) {0
          case HostComponent:0
            const type = fiber.type;0
            const props = fiber.pendingProps;0
            didNotFindHydratableContainerInstance(parentContainer, type, props);0
            break;0
          case HostText:0
            const text = fiber.pendingProps;0
            didNotFindHydratableContainerTextInstance(parentContainer, text);0
            break;0
        }0
        break;0
      }0
      case HostComponent: {0
        const parentType = returnFiber.type;0
        const parentProps = returnFiber.memoizedProps;0
        const parentInstance = returnFiber.stateNode;0
        switch (fiber.tag) {0
          case HostComponent:0
            const type = fiber.type;0
            const props = fiber.pendingProps;0
            didNotFindHydratableInstance(0
              parentType,0
              parentProps,0
              parentInstance,0
              type,0
              props,0
            );0
            break;0
          case HostText:0
            const text = fiber.pendingProps;0
            didNotFindHydratableTextInstance(0
              parentType,0
              parentProps,0
              parentInstance,0
              text,0
            );0
            break;0
        }0
        break;0
      }0
      default:0
        return;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function tryHydrate(fiber, nextInstance) {0
  switch (fiber.tag) {0
    case HostComponent: {0
      const type = fiber.type;0
      const props = fiber.pendingProps;0
      const instance = canHydrateInstance(nextInstance, type, props);0
      if (instance !== null) {0
        fiber.stateNode = (instance: Instance);0
        return true;0
      }0
      return false;0
    }0
    case HostText: {0
      const text = fiber.pendingProps;0
      const textInstance = canHydrateTextInstance(nextInstance, text);0
      if (textInstance !== null) {0
        fiber.stateNode = (textInstance: TextInstance);0
        return true;0
      }0
      return false;0
    }0
    default:0
      return false;0
  }0
}0
0
function tryToClaimNextHydratableInstance(fiber: Fiber): void {0
  if (!isHydrating) {0
    return;0
  }0
  let nextInstance = nextHydratableInstance;0
  if (!nextInstance) {0
    // Nothing to hydrate. Make it an insertion.0
    insertNonHydratedInstance((hydrationParentFiber: any), fiber);0
    isHydrating = false;0
    hydrationParentFiber = fiber;0
    return;0
  }0
  const firstAttemptedInstance = nextInstance;0
  if (!tryHydrate(fiber, nextInstance)) {0
    // If we can't hydrate this instance let's try the next one.0
    // We use this as a heuristic. It's based on intuition and not data so it0
    // might be flawed or unnecessary.0
    nextInstance = getNextHydratableSibling(firstAttemptedInstance);0
    if (!nextInstance || !tryHydrate(fiber, nextInstance)) {0
      // Nothing to hydrate. Make it an insertion.0
      insertNonHydratedInstance((hydrationParentFiber: any), fiber);0
      isHydrating = false;0
      hydrationParentFiber = fiber;0
      return;0
    }0
    // We matched the next one, we'll now assume that the first one was0
    // superfluous and we'll delete it. Since we can't eagerly delete it0
    // we'll have to schedule a deletion. To do that, this node needs a dummy0
    // fiber associated with it.0
    deleteHydratableInstance(0
      (hydrationParentFiber: any),0
      firstAttemptedInstance,0
    );0
  }0
  hydrationParentFiber = fiber;0
  nextHydratableInstance = getFirstHydratableChild((nextInstance: any));0
}0
0
function prepareToHydrateHostInstance(0
  fiber: Fiber,0
  rootContainerInstance: Container,0
  hostContext: HostContext,0
): boolean {0
  if (!supportsHydration) {0
    invariant(0
      false,0
      'Expected prepareToHydrateHostInstance() to never be called. ' +0
        'This error is likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
    );0
  }0
0
  const instance: Instance = fiber.stateNode;0
  const updatePayload = hydrateInstance(0
    instance,0
    fiber.type,0
    fiber.memoizedProps,0
    rootContainerInstance,0
    hostContext,0
    fiber,0
  );0
  // TODO: Type this specific to this type of component.0
  fiber.updateQueue = (updatePayload: any);0
  // If the update payload indicates that there is a change or if there0
  // is a new ref we mark this as an update.0
  if (updatePayload !== null) {0
    return true;0
  }0
  return false;0
}0
0
function prepareToHydrateHostTextInstance(fiber: Fiber): boolean {0
  if (!supportsHydration) {0
    invariant(0
      false,0
      'Expected prepareToHydrateHostTextInstance() to never be called. ' +0
        'This error is likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
    );0
  }0
0
  const textInstance: TextInstance = fiber.stateNode;0
  const textContent: string = fiber.memoizedProps;0
  const shouldUpdate = hydrateTextInstance(textInstance, textContent, fiber);0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (shouldUpdate) {0
      // We assume that prepareToHydrateHostTextInstance is called in a context where the0
      // hydration parent is the parent host component of this host text.0
      const returnFiber = hydrationParentFiber;0
      if (returnFiber !== null) {0
        switch (returnFiber.tag) {0
          case HostRoot: {0
            const parentContainer = returnFiber.stateNode.containerInfo;0
            didNotMatchHydratedContainerTextInstance(0
              parentContainer,0
              textInstance,0
              textContent,0
            );0
            break;0
          }0
          case HostComponent: {0
            const parentType = returnFiber.type;0
            const parentProps = returnFiber.memoizedProps;0
            const parentInstance = returnFiber.stateNode;0
            didNotMatchHydratedTextInstance(0
              parentType,0
              parentProps,0
              parentInstance,0
              textInstance,0
              textContent,0
            );0
            break;0
          }0
        }0
      }0
    }0
  }0
  return shouldUpdate;0
}0
0
function popToNextHostParent(fiber: Fiber): void {0
  let parent = fiber.return;0
  while (0
    parent !== null &&0
    parent.tag !== HostComponent &&0
    parent.tag !== HostRoot0
  ) {0
    parent = parent.return;0
  }0
  hydrationParentFiber = parent;0
}0
0
function popHydrationState(fiber: Fiber): boolean {0
  if (!supportsHydration) {0
    return false;0
  }0
  if (fiber !== hydrationParentFiber) {0
    // We're deeper than the current hydration context, inside an inserted0
    // tree.0
    return false;0
  }0
  if (!isHydrating) {0
    // If we're not currently hydrating but we're in a hydration context, then0
    // we were an insertion and now need to pop up reenter hydration of our0
    // siblings.0
    popToNextHostParent(fiber);0
    isHydrating = true;0
    return false;0
  }0
0
  const type = fiber.type;0
0
  // If we have any remaining hydratable nodes, we need to delete them now.0
  // We only do this deeper than head and body since they tend to have random0
  // other nodes in them. We also ignore components with pure text content in0
  // side of them.0
  // TODO: Better heuristic.0
  if (0
    fiber.tag !== HostComponent ||0
    (type !== 'head' &&0
      type !== 'body' &&0
      !shouldSetTextContent(type, fiber.memoizedProps))0
  ) {0
    let nextInstance = nextHydratableInstance;0
    while (nextInstance) {0
      deleteHydratableInstance(fiber, nextInstance);0
      nextInstance = getNextHydratableSibling(nextInstance);0
    }0
  }0
0
  popToNextHostParent(fiber);0
  nextHydratableInstance = hydrationParentFiber0
    ? getNextHydratableSibling(fiber.stateNode)0
    : null;0
  return true;0
}0
0
function resetHydrationState(): void {0
  if (!supportsHydration) {0
    return;0
  }0
0
  hydrationParentFiber = null;0
  nextHydratableInstance = null;0
  isHydrating = false;0
}0
0
export {0
  enterHydrationState,0
  resetHydrationState,0
  tryToClaimNextHydratableInstance,0
  prepareToHydrateHostInstance,0
  prepareToHydrateHostTextInstance,0
  popHydrationState,0
};0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
// This lets us hook into Fiber to debug what it's doing.0
// See https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/8033.0
// This is not part of the public API, not even for React DevTools.0
// You may only inject a debugTool if you work on React Fiber itself.0
const ReactFiberInstrumentation = {0
  debugTool: null,0
};0
0
module.exports = ReactFiberInstrumentation;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {Fiber} from './ReactFiber';0
import type {ReactContext} from 'shared/ReactTypes';0
import type {StackCursor} from './ReactFiberStack';0
0
export type NewContext = {0
  pushProvider(providerFiber: Fiber): void,0
  popProvider(providerFiber: Fiber): void,0
  getContextCurrentValue(context: ReactContext<any>): any,0
  getContextChangedBits(context: ReactContext<any>): number,0
};0
0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
import {isPrimaryRenderer} from './ReactFiberHostConfig';0
import {createCursor, push, pop} from './ReactFiberStack';0
0
const providerCursor: StackCursor<Fiber | null> = createCursor(null);0
const valueCursor: StackCursor<mixed> = createCursor(null);0
const changedBitsCursor: StackCursor<number> = createCursor(0);0
0
let rendererSigil;0
if (__DEV__) {0
  // Use this to detect multiple renderers using the same context0
  rendererSigil = {};0
}0
0
function pushProvider(providerFiber: Fiber): void {0
  const context: ReactContext<any> = providerFiber.type._context;0
0
  if (isPrimaryRenderer) {0
    push(changedBitsCursor, context._changedBits, providerFiber);0
    push(valueCursor, context._currentValue, providerFiber);0
    push(providerCursor, providerFiber, providerFiber);0
0
    context._currentValue = providerFiber.pendingProps.value;0
    context._changedBits = providerFiber.stateNode;0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      warning(0
        context._currentRenderer === undefined ||0
          context._currentRenderer === null ||0
          context._currentRenderer === rendererSigil,0
        'Detected multiple renderers concurrently rendering the ' +0
          'same context provider. This is currently unsupported.',0
      );0
      context._currentRenderer = rendererSigil;0
    }0
  } else {0
    push(changedBitsCursor, context._changedBits2, providerFiber);0
    push(valueCursor, context._currentValue2, providerFiber);0
    push(providerCursor, providerFiber, providerFiber);0
0
    context._currentValue2 = providerFiber.pendingProps.value;0
    context._changedBits2 = providerFiber.stateNode;0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      warning(0
        context._currentRenderer2 === undefined ||0
          context._currentRenderer2 === null ||0
          context._currentRenderer2 === rendererSigil,0
        'Detected multiple renderers concurrently rendering the ' +0
          'same context provider. This is currently unsupported.',0
      );0
      context._currentRenderer2 = rendererSigil;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function popProvider(providerFiber: Fiber): void {0
  const changedBits = changedBitsCursor.current;0
  const currentValue = valueCursor.current;0
0
  pop(providerCursor, providerFiber);0
  pop(valueCursor, providerFiber);0
  pop(changedBitsCursor, providerFiber);0
0
  const context: ReactContext<any> = providerFiber.type._context;0
  if (isPrimaryRenderer) {0
    context._currentValue = currentValue;0
    context._changedBits = changedBits;0
  } else {0
    context._currentValue2 = currentValue;0
    context._changedBits2 = changedBits;0
  }0
}0
0
function getContextCurrentValue(context: ReactContext<any>): any {0
  return isPrimaryRenderer ? context._currentValue : context._currentValue2;0
}0
0
function getContextChangedBits(context: ReactContext<any>): number {0
  return isPrimaryRenderer ? context._changedBits : context._changedBits2;0
}0
0
export {0
  pushProvider,0
  popProvider,0
  getContextCurrentValue,0
  getContextChangedBits,0
};0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {FiberRoot} from './ReactFiberRoot';0
import type {ExpirationTime} from './ReactFiberExpirationTime';0
0
import {NoWork, Sync} from './ReactFiberExpirationTime';0
0
// TODO: Offscreen updates0
0
export function markPendingPriorityLevel(0
  root: FiberRoot,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
): void {0
  // If there's a gap between completing a failed root and retrying it,0
  // additional updates may be scheduled. Clear `didError`, in case the update0
  // is sufficient to fix the error.0
  root.didError = false;0
0
  // Update the latest and earliest pending times0
  const earliestPendingTime = root.earliestPendingTime;0
  if (earliestPendingTime === NoWork) {0
    // No other pending updates.0
    root.earliestPendingTime = root.latestPendingTime = expirationTime;0
  } else {0
    if (earliestPendingTime > expirationTime) {0
      // This is the earliest pending update.0
      root.earliestPendingTime = expirationTime;0
    } else {0
      const latestPendingTime = root.latestPendingTime;0
      if (latestPendingTime < expirationTime) {0
        // This is the latest pending update0
        root.latestPendingTime = expirationTime;0
      }0
    }0
  }0
  findNextPendingPriorityLevel(root);0
}0
0
export function markCommittedPriorityLevels(0
  root: FiberRoot,0
  earliestRemainingTime: ExpirationTime,0
): void {0
  root.didError = false;0
0
  if (earliestRemainingTime === NoWork) {0
    // Fast path. There's no remaining work. Clear everything.0
    root.earliestPendingTime = NoWork;0
    root.latestPendingTime = NoWork;0
    root.earliestSuspendedTime = NoWork;0
    root.latestSuspendedTime = NoWork;0
    root.latestPingedTime = NoWork;0
    findNextPendingPriorityLevel(root);0
    return;0
  }0
0
  // Let's see if the previous latest known pending level was just flushed.0
  const latestPendingTime = root.latestPendingTime;0
  if (latestPendingTime !== NoWork) {0
    if (latestPendingTime < earliestRemainingTime) {0
      // We've flushed all the known pending levels.0
      root.earliestPendingTime = root.latestPendingTime = NoWork;0
    } else {0
      const earliestPendingTime = root.earliestPendingTime;0
      if (earliestPendingTime < earliestRemainingTime) {0
        // We've flushed the earliest known pending level. Set this to the0
        // latest pending time.0
        root.earliestPendingTime = root.latestPendingTime;0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  // Now let's handle the earliest remaining level in the whole tree. We need to0
  // decide whether to treat it as a pending level or as suspended. Check0
  // it falls within the range of known suspended levels.0
0
  const earliestSuspendedTime = root.earliestSuspendedTime;0
  if (earliestSuspendedTime === NoWork) {0
    // There's no suspended work. Treat the earliest remaining level as a0
    // pending level.0
    markPendingPriorityLevel(root, earliestRemainingTime);0
    findNextPendingPriorityLevel(root);0
    return;0
  }0
0
  const latestSuspendedTime = root.latestSuspendedTime;0
  if (earliestRemainingTime > latestSuspendedTime) {0
    // The earliest remaining level is later than all the suspended work. That0
    // means we've flushed all the suspended work.0
    root.earliestSuspendedTime = NoWork;0
    root.latestSuspendedTime = NoWork;0
    root.latestPingedTime = NoWork;0
0
    // There's no suspended work. Treat the earliest remaining level as a0
    // pending level.0
    markPendingPriorityLevel(root, earliestRemainingTime);0
    findNextPendingPriorityLevel(root);0
    return;0
  }0
0
  if (earliestRemainingTime < earliestSuspendedTime) {0
    // The earliest remaining time is earlier than all the suspended work.0
    // Treat it as a pending update.0
    markPendingPriorityLevel(root, earliestRemainingTime);0
    findNextPendingPriorityLevel(root);0
    return;0
  }0
0
  // The earliest remaining time falls within the range of known suspended0
  // levels. We should treat this as suspended work.0
  findNextPendingPriorityLevel(root);0
}0
0
export function hasLowerPriorityWork(0
  root: FiberRoot,0
  renderExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
) {0
  return (0
    renderExpirationTime !== root.latestPendingTime &&0
    renderExpirationTime !== root.latestSuspendedTime0
  );0
}0
0
export function markSuspendedPriorityLevel(0
  root: FiberRoot,0
  suspendedTime: ExpirationTime,0
  didError: boolean,0
): void {0
  if (didError && !hasLowerPriorityWork(root, suspendedTime)) {0
    // TODO: When we add back resuming, we need to ensure the progressed work0
    // is thrown out and not reused during the restarted render. One way to0
    // invalidate the progressed work is to restart at expirationTime + 1.0
    root.didError = true;0
    findNextPendingPriorityLevel(root);0
    return;0
  }0
0
  // First, check the known pending levels and update them if needed.0
  const earliestPendingTime = root.earliestPendingTime;0
  const latestPendingTime = root.latestPendingTime;0
  if (earliestPendingTime === suspendedTime) {0
    if (latestPendingTime === suspendedTime) {0
      // Both known pending levels were suspended. Clear them.0
      root.earliestPendingTime = root.latestPendingTime = NoWork;0
    } else {0
      // The earliest pending level was suspended. Clear by setting it to the0
      // latest pending level.0
      root.earliestPendingTime = latestPendingTime;0
    }0
  } else if (latestPendingTime === suspendedTime) {0
    // The latest pending level was suspended. Clear by setting it to the0
    // latest pending level.0
    root.latestPendingTime = earliestPendingTime;0
  }0
0
  // Next, if we're working on the lowest known suspended level, clear the ping.0
  // TODO: What if a promise suspends and pings before the root completes?0
  const latestSuspendedTime = root.latestSuspendedTime;0
  if (latestSuspendedTime === suspendedTime) {0
    root.latestPingedTime = NoWork;0
  }0
0
  // Finally, update the known suspended levels.0
  const earliestSuspendedTime = root.earliestSuspendedTime;0
  if (earliestSuspendedTime === NoWork) {0
    // No other suspended levels.0
    root.earliestSuspendedTime = root.latestSuspendedTime = suspendedTime;0
  } else {0
    if (earliestSuspendedTime > suspendedTime) {0
      // This is the earliest suspended level.0
      root.earliestSuspendedTime = suspendedTime;0
    } else if (latestSuspendedTime < suspendedTime) {0
      // This is the latest suspended level0
      root.latestSuspendedTime = suspendedTime;0
    }0
  }0
  findNextPendingPriorityLevel(root);0
}0
0
export function markPingedPriorityLevel(0
  root: FiberRoot,0
  pingedTime: ExpirationTime,0
): void {0
  const latestSuspendedTime = root.latestSuspendedTime;0
  if (latestSuspendedTime !== NoWork && latestSuspendedTime <= pingedTime) {0
    const latestPingedTime = root.latestPingedTime;0
    if (latestPingedTime === NoWork || latestPingedTime < pingedTime) {0
      root.latestPingedTime = pingedTime;0
    }0
  }0
  findNextPendingPriorityLevel(root);0
}0
0
function findNextPendingPriorityLevel(root) {0
  const earliestSuspendedTime = root.earliestSuspendedTime;0
  const earliestPendingTime = root.earliestPendingTime;0
  let nextExpirationTimeToWorkOn;0
  let expirationTime;0
  if (earliestSuspendedTime === NoWork) {0
    // Fast path. There's no suspended work.0
    nextExpirationTimeToWorkOn = expirationTime = earliestPendingTime;0
  } else if (earliestPendingTime !== NoWork) {0
    // Check if there's known pending work.0
    nextExpirationTimeToWorkOn = earliestPendingTime;0
    expirationTime =0
      earliestSuspendedTime < earliestPendingTime0
        ? earliestSuspendedTime0
        : earliestPendingTime;0
  } else {0
    // Finally, if a suspended level was pinged, work on that. Otherwise there's0
    // nothing to work on.0
    nextExpirationTimeToWorkOn = expirationTime = root.latestPingedTime;0
  }0
0
  if (root.didError) {0
    // Revert to synchronous mode.0
    expirationTime = Sync;0
  }0
0
  root.nextExpirationTimeToWorkOn = nextExpirationTimeToWorkOn;0
  root.expirationTime = expirationTime;0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {Fiber} from './ReactFiber';0
import type {FiberRoot} from './ReactFiberRoot';0
import type {0
  Instance,0
  TextInstance,0
  Container,0
  PublicInstance,0
} from './ReactFiberHostConfig';0
import type {ReactNodeList} from 'shared/ReactTypes';0
import type {ExpirationTime} from './ReactFiberExpirationTime';0
0
import {0
  findCurrentHostFiber,0
  findCurrentHostFiberWithNoPortals,0
} from 'react-reconciler/reflection';0
import * as ReactInstanceMap from 'shared/ReactInstanceMap';0
import {HostComponent} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfWork';0
import getComponentName from 'shared/getComponentName';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
import {getPublicInstance} from './ReactFiberHostConfig';0
import {0
  findCurrentUnmaskedContext,0
  isContextProvider,0
  processChildContext,0
  emptyContextObject,0
} from './ReactFiberContext';0
import {createFiberRoot} from './ReactFiberRoot';0
import * as ReactFiberDevToolsHook from './ReactFiberDevToolsHook';0
import {0
  computeUniqueAsyncExpiration,0
  requestCurrentTime,0
  computeExpirationForFiber,0
  scheduleWork,0
  requestWork,0
  flushRoot,0
  batchedUpdates,0
  unbatchedUpdates,0
  flushSync,0
  flushControlled,0
  deferredUpdates,0
  syncUpdates,0
  interactiveUpdates,0
  flushInteractiveUpdates,0
} from './ReactFiberScheduler';0

import ReactFiberInstrumentation from './ReactFiberInstrumentation';0
import ReactDebugCurrentFiber from './ReactDebugCurrentFiber';0
0
type OpaqueRoot = FiberRoot;0
0
// 0 is PROD, 1 is DEV.0
// Might add PROFILE later.0
type BundleType = 0 | 1;0
0
type DevToolsConfig = {|0
  bundleType: BundleType,0
  version: string,0
  rendererPackageName: string,0
  // Note: this actually *does* depend on Fiber internal fields.0
  // Used by "inspect clicked DOM element" in React DevTools.0
  findFiberByHostInstance?: (instance: Instance | TextInstance) => Fiber,0
  // Used by RN in-app inspector.0
  // This API is unfortunately RN-specific.0
  // TODO: Change it to accept Fiber instead and type it properly.0
  getInspectorDataForViewTag?: (tag: number) => Object,0
|};0
0
let didWarnAboutNestedUpdates;0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  didWarnAboutNestedUpdates = false;0
}0
0
function getContextForSubtree(0
  parentComponent: ?React$Component<any, any>,0
): Object {0
  if (!parentComponent) {0
    return emptyContextObject;0
  }0
0
  const fiber = ReactInstanceMap.get(parentComponent);0
  const parentContext = findCurrentUnmaskedContext(fiber);0
  return isContextProvider(fiber)0
    ? processChildContext(fiber, parentContext)0
    : parentContext;0
}0
0
function scheduleRootUpdate(0
  current: Fiber,0
  element: ReactNodeList,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  callback: ?Function,0
) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (0
      ReactDebugCurrentFiber.phase === 'render' &&0
      ReactDebugCurrentFiber.current !== null &&0
      !didWarnAboutNestedUpdates0
    ) {0
      didWarnAboutNestedUpdates = true;0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'Render methods should be a pure function of props and state; ' +0
          'triggering nested component updates from render is not allowed. ' +0
          'If necessary, trigger nested updates in componentDidUpdate.\n\n' +0
          'Check the render method of %s.',0
        getComponentName(ReactDebugCurrentFiber.current) || 'Unknown',0
      );0
    }0
  }0
0
  const update = createUpdate(expirationTime);0
  // Caution: React DevTools currently depends on this property0
  // being called "element".0
  update.payload = {element};0
0
  callback = callback === undefined ? null : callback;0
  if (callback !== null) {0
    warning(0
      typeof callback === 'function',0
      'render(...): Expected the last optional `callback` argument to be a ' +0
        'function. Instead received: %s.',0
      callback,0
    );0
    update.callback = callback;0
  }0
  enqueueUpdate(current, update, expirationTime);0
0
  scheduleWork(current, expirationTime);0
  return expirationTime;0
}0
0
export function updateContainerAtExpirationTime(0
  element: ReactNodeList,0
  container: OpaqueRoot,0
  parentComponent: ?React$Component<any, any>,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  callback: ?Function,0
) {0
  // TODO: If this is a nested container, this won't be the root.0
  const current = container.current;0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (ReactFiberInstrumentation.debugTool) {0
      if (current.alternate === null) {0
        ReactFiberInstrumentation.debugTool.onMountContainer(container);0
      } else if (element === null) {0
        ReactFiberInstrumentation.debugTool.onUnmountContainer(container);0
      } else {0
        ReactFiberInstrumentation.debugTool.onUpdateContainer(container);0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  const context = getContextForSubtree(parentComponent);0
  if (container.context === null) {0
    container.context = context;0
  } else {0
    container.pendingContext = context;0
  }0
0
  return scheduleRootUpdate(current, element, expirationTime, callback);0
}0
0
function findHostInstance(component: Object): PublicInstance | null {0
  const fiber = ReactInstanceMap.get(component);0
  if (fiber === undefined) {0
    if (typeof component.render === 'function') {0
      invariant(false, 'Unable to find node on an unmounted component.');0
    } else {0
      invariant(0
        false,0
        'Argument appears to not be a ReactComponent. Keys: %s',0
        Object.keys(component),0
      );0
    }0
  }0
  const hostFiber = findCurrentHostFiber(fiber);0
  if (hostFiber === null) {0
    return null;0
  }0
  return hostFiber.stateNode;0
}0
0
export function createContainer(0
  containerInfo: Container,0
  isAsync: boolean,0
  hydrate: boolean,0
): OpaqueRoot {0
  return createFiberRoot(containerInfo, isAsync, hydrate);0
}0
0
export function updateContainer(0
  element: ReactNodeList,0
  container: OpaqueRoot,0
  parentComponent: ?React$Component<any, any>,0
  callback: ?Function,0
): ExpirationTime {0
  const current = container.current;0
  const currentTime = requestCurrentTime();0
  const expirationTime = computeExpirationForFiber(currentTime, current);0
  return updateContainerAtExpirationTime(0
    element,0
    container,0
    parentComponent,0
    expirationTime,0
    callback,0
  );0
}0
0
export {0
  flushRoot,0
  requestWork,0
  computeUniqueAsyncExpiration,0
  batchedUpdates,0
  unbatchedUpdates,0
  deferredUpdates,0
  syncUpdates,0
  interactiveUpdates,0
  flushInteractiveUpdates,0
  flushControlled,0
  flushSync,0
};0
0
export function getPublicRootInstance(0
  container: OpaqueRoot,0
): React$Component<any, any> | PublicInstance | null {0
  const containerFiber = container.current;0
  if (!containerFiber.child) {0
    return null;0
  }0
  switch (containerFiber.child.tag) {0
    case HostComponent:0
      return getPublicInstance(containerFiber.child.stateNode);0
    default:0
      return containerFiber.child.stateNode;0
  }0
}0
0
export {findHostInstance};0
0
export function findHostInstanceWithNoPortals(0
  fiber: Fiber,0
): PublicInstance | null {0
  const hostFiber = findCurrentHostFiberWithNoPortals(fiber);0
  if (hostFiber === null) {0
    return null;0
  }0
  return hostFiber.stateNode;0
}0
0
export function injectIntoDevTools(devToolsConfig: DevToolsConfig): boolean {0
  const {findFiberByHostInstance} = devToolsConfig;0
  return ReactFiberDevToolsHook.injectInternals({0
    ...devToolsConfig,0
    findHostInstanceByFiber(fiber: Fiber): Instance | TextInstance | null {0
      const hostFiber = findCurrentHostFiber(fiber);0
      if (hostFiber === null) {0
        return null;0
      }0
      return hostFiber.stateNode;0
    },0
    findFiberByHostInstance(instance: Instance | TextInstance): Fiber | null {0
      if (!findFiberByHostInstance) {0
        // Might not be implemented by the renderer.0
        return null;0
      }0
      return findFiberByHostInstance(instance);0
    },0
  });0
}0

import type {Fiber} from './ReactFiber';0
import type {ExpirationTime} from './ReactFiberExpirationTime';0
0
import {createHostRootFiber} from './ReactFiber';0
import {NoWork} from './ReactFiberExpirationTime';0
0
// TODO: This should be lifted into the renderer.0
export type Batch = {0
  _defer: boolean,0
  _expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  _onComplete: () => mixed,0
  _next: Batch | null,0
};0
0
export type FiberRoot = {0
  // Any additional information from the host associated with this root.0
  containerInfo: any,0
  // Used only by persistent updates.0
  pendingChildren: any,0
  // The currently active root fiber. This is the mutable root of the tree.0
  current: Fiber,0
0
  // The following priority levels are used to distinguish between 1)0
  // uncommitted work, 2) uncommitted work that is suspended, and 3) uncommitted0
  // work that may be unsuspended. We choose not to track each individual0
  // pending level, trading granularity for performance.0
  //0
  // The earliest and latest priority levels that are suspended from committing.0
  earliestSuspendedTime: ExpirationTime,0
  latestSuspendedTime: ExpirationTime,0
  // The earliest and latest priority levels that are not known to be suspended.0
  earliestPendingTime: ExpirationTime,0
  latestPendingTime: ExpirationTime,0
  // The latest priority level that was pinged by a resolved promise and can0
  // be retried.0
  latestPingedTime: ExpirationTime,0
0
  // If an error is thrown, and there are no more updates in the queue, we try0
  // rendering from the root one more time, synchronously, before handling0
  // the error.0
  didError: boolean,0
0
  pendingCommitExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  // A finished work-in-progress HostRoot that's ready to be committed.0
  // TODO: The reason this is separate from isReadyForCommit is because the0
  // FiberRoot concept will likely be lifted out of the reconciler and into0
  // the renderer.0
  finishedWork: Fiber | null,0
  // Top context object, used by renderSubtreeIntoContainer0
  context: Object | null,0
  pendingContext: Object | null,0
  // Determines if we should attempt to hydrate on the initial mount0
  +hydrate: boolean,0
  // Remaining expiration time on this root.0
  // TODO: Lift this into the renderer0
  nextExpirationTimeToWorkOn: ExpirationTime,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  // List of top-level batches. This list indicates whether a commit should be0
  // deferred. Also contains completion callbacks.0
  // TODO: Lift this into the renderer0
  firstBatch: Batch | null,0
  // Linked-list of roots0
  nextScheduledRoot: FiberRoot | null,0
};0
0
export function createFiberRoot(0
  containerInfo: any,0
  isAsync: boolean,0
  hydrate: boolean,0
): FiberRoot {0
  // Cyclic construction. This cheats the type system right now because0
  // stateNode is any.0
  const uninitializedFiber = createHostRootFiber(isAsync);0
  const root = {0
    current: uninitializedFiber,0
    containerInfo: containerInfo,0
    pendingChildren: null,0
0
    earliestPendingTime: NoWork,0
    latestPendingTime: NoWork,0
    earliestSuspendedTime: NoWork,0
    latestSuspendedTime: NoWork,0
    latestPingedTime: NoWork,0
0
    didError: false,0
0
    pendingCommitExpirationTime: NoWork,0
    finishedWork: null,0
    context: null,0
    pendingContext: null,0
    hydrate,0
    nextExpirationTimeToWorkOn: NoWork,0
    expirationTime: NoWork,0
    firstBatch: null,0
    nextScheduledRoot: null,0
  };0
  uninitializedFiber.stateNode = root;0
  return root;0
}0

 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0

import ReactErrorUtils from 'shared/ReactErrorUtils';0

import {ReactCurrentOwner} from 'shared/ReactGlobalSharedState';0
import ReactStrictModeWarnings from './ReactStrictModeWarnings';0

  NoEffect,0
  PerformedWork,0
  Placement,0
  Update,0
  Snapshot,0
  PlacementAndUpdate,0

} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfSideEffect';0
import {0

} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfWork';0

} from 'shared/ReactFeatureFlags';0

  now,0

  cancelDeferredCallback,0
  prepareForCommit,0
  resetAfterCommit,0
} from './ReactFiberHostConfig';0

  markPendingPriorityLevel,0
  markCommittedPriorityLevels,0
  markSuspendedPriorityLevel,0

  popContextProvider as popLegacyContextProvider,0

  checkActualRenderTimeStackEmpty,0
  pauseActualRenderTimerIfRunning,0
  recordCommitTime,0
  recordElapsedActualRenderTime,0
  recordElapsedBaseRenderTimeIfRunning,0
  resetActualRenderTimer,0
  resumeActualRenderTimerIfPaused,0
  startBaseRenderTimer,0
  stopBaseRenderTimerIfRunning,0
} from './ReactProfilerTimer';0

  resetStackAfterFatalErrorInDev,0

  throwException,0
  unwindWork,0
  unwindInterruptedWork,0
  createRootErrorUpdate,0
  createClassErrorUpdate,0
} from './ReactFiberUnwindWork';0

  commitWork,0

} from './ReactFiberCommitWork';0
