export type Deadline = {0
  timeRemaining: () => number,0
  didTimeout: boolean,0
};0
0
export type Thenable = {0
  then(resolve: () => mixed, reject?: () => mixed): mixed,0
};0
0
const {0
  invokeGuardedCallback,0
  hasCaughtError,0
  clearCaughtError,0
} = ReactErrorUtils;0
0
let didWarnAboutStateTransition;0
let didWarnSetStateChildContext;0
let warnAboutUpdateOnUnmounted;0
let warnAboutInvalidUpdates;0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  didWarnAboutStateTransition = false;0
  didWarnSetStateChildContext = false;0
  const didWarnStateUpdateForUnmountedComponent = {};0
0
  warnAboutUpdateOnUnmounted = function(fiber: Fiber) {0
    // We show the whole stack but dedupe on the top component's name because0
    // the problematic code almost always lies inside that component.0
    const componentName = getComponentName(fiber) || 'ReactClass';0
    if (didWarnStateUpdateForUnmountedComponent[componentName]) {0
      return;0
    }0
    warning(0
      false,0
      "Can't call setState (or forceUpdate) on an unmounted component. This " +0
        'is a no-op, but it indicates a memory leak in your application. To ' +0
        'fix, cancel all subscriptions and asynchronous tasks in the ' +0
        'componentWillUnmount method.%s',0
      getStackAddendumByWorkInProgressFiber(fiber),0
    );0
    didWarnStateUpdateForUnmountedComponent[componentName] = true;0
  };0
0
  warnAboutInvalidUpdates = function(instance: React$Component<any>) {0
    switch (ReactDebugCurrentFiber.phase) {0
      case 'getChildContext':0
        if (didWarnSetStateChildContext) {0
          return;0
        }0
        warning(0
          false,0
          'setState(...): Cannot call setState() inside getChildContext()',0
        );0
        didWarnSetStateChildContext = true;0
        break;0
      case 'render':0
        if (didWarnAboutStateTransition) {0
          return;0
        }0
        warning(0
          false,0
          'Cannot update during an existing state transition (such as within ' +0
            "`render` or another component's constructor). Render methods should " +0
            'be a pure function of props and state; constructor side-effects are ' +0
            'an anti-pattern, but can be moved to `componentWillMount`.',0
        );0
        didWarnAboutStateTransition = true;0
        break;0
    }0
  };0
}0
0
// Used to ensure computeUniqueAsyncExpiration is monotonically increasing.0
let lastUniqueAsyncExpiration: number = 0;0
0
// Represents the expiration time that incoming updates should use. (If this0
// is NoWork, use the default strategy: async updates in async mode, sync0
// updates in sync mode.)0
let expirationContext: ExpirationTime = NoWork;0
0
let isWorking: boolean = false;0
0
// The next work in progress fiber that we're currently working on.0
let nextUnitOfWork: Fiber | null = null;0
let nextRoot: FiberRoot | null = null;0
// The time at which we're currently rendering work.0
let nextRenderExpirationTime: ExpirationTime = NoWork;0
let nextLatestTimeoutMs: number = -1;0
let nextRenderDidError: boolean = false;0
0
// The next fiber with an effect that we're currently committing.0
let nextEffect: Fiber | null = null;0
0
let isCommitting: boolean = false;0
0
let legacyErrorBoundariesThatAlreadyFailed: Set<mixed> | null = null;0
0
// Used for performance tracking.0
let interruptedBy: Fiber | null = null;0
0
let stashedWorkInProgressProperties;0
let replayUnitOfWork;0
let isReplayingFailedUnitOfWork;0
let originalReplayError;0
let rethrowOriginalError;0
if (__DEV__ && replayFailedUnitOfWorkWithInvokeGuardedCallback) {0
  stashedWorkInProgressProperties = null;0
  isReplayingFailedUnitOfWork = false;0
  originalReplayError = null;0
  replayUnitOfWork = (0
    failedUnitOfWork: Fiber,0
    thrownValue: mixed,0
    isYieldy: boolean,0
  ) => {0
    if (0
      thrownValue !== null &&0
      typeof thrownValue === 'object' &&0
      typeof thrownValue.then === 'function'0
    ) {0
      // Don't replay promises. Treat everything else like an error.0
      // TODO: Need to figure out a different strategy if/when we add0
      // support for catching other types.0
      return;0
    }0
0
    // Restore the original state of the work-in-progress0
    if (stashedWorkInProgressProperties === null) {0
      // This should never happen. Don't throw because this code is DEV-only.0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'Could not replay rendering after an error. This is likely a bug in React. ' +0
          'Please file an issue.',0
      );0
      return;0
    }0
    assignFiberPropertiesInDEV(0
      failedUnitOfWork,0
      stashedWorkInProgressProperties,0
    );0
0
    switch (failedUnitOfWork.tag) {0
      case HostRoot:0
        popHostContainer(failedUnitOfWork);0
        popTopLevelLegacyContextObject(failedUnitOfWork);0
        break;0
      case HostComponent:0
        popHostContext(failedUnitOfWork);0
        break;0
      case ClassComponent:0
        popLegacyContextProvider(failedUnitOfWork);0
        break;0
      case HostPortal:0
        popHostContainer(failedUnitOfWork);0
        break;0
      case ContextProvider:0
        popProvider(failedUnitOfWork);0
        break;0
    }0
    // Replay the begin phase.0
    isReplayingFailedUnitOfWork = true;0
    originalReplayError = thrownValue;0
    invokeGuardedCallback(null, workLoop, null, isYieldy);0
    isReplayingFailedUnitOfWork = false;0
    originalReplayError = null;0
    if (hasCaughtError()) {0
      clearCaughtError();0
0
      if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
        if (failedUnitOfWork.mode & ProfileMode) {0
          recordElapsedActualRenderTime(failedUnitOfWork);0
        }0
0
        // Stop "base" render timer again (after the re-thrown error).0
        stopBaseRenderTimerIfRunning();0
      }0
    } else {0
      // If the begin phase did not fail the second time, set this pointer0
      // back to the original value.0
      nextUnitOfWork = failedUnitOfWork;0
    }0
  };0
  rethrowOriginalError = () => {0
    throw originalReplayError;0
  };0
}0
0
function resetStack() {0
  if (nextUnitOfWork !== null) {0
    let interruptedWork = nextUnitOfWork.return;0
    while (interruptedWork !== null) {0
      unwindInterruptedWork(interruptedWork);0
      interruptedWork = interruptedWork.return;0
    }0
  }0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    ReactStrictModeWarnings.discardPendingWarnings();0
    checkThatStackIsEmpty();0
  }0
0
  nextRoot = null;0
  nextRenderExpirationTime = NoWork;0
  nextLatestTimeoutMs = -1;0
  nextRenderDidError = false;0
  nextUnitOfWork = null;0
}0
0
function commitAllHostEffects() {0
  while (nextEffect !== null) {0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      ReactDebugCurrentFiber.setCurrentFiber(nextEffect);0
    }0
    recordEffect();0
0
    const effectTag = nextEffect.effectTag;0
0
    if (effectTag & ContentReset) {0
      commitResetTextContent(nextEffect);0
    }0
0
    if (effectTag & Ref) {0
      const current = nextEffect.alternate;0
      if (current !== null) {0
        commitDetachRef(current);0
      }0
    }0
0
    // The following switch statement is only concerned about placement,0
    // updates, and deletions. To avoid needing to add a case for every0
    // possible bitmap value, we remove the secondary effects from the0
    // effect tag and switch on that value.0
    let primaryEffectTag = effectTag & (Placement | Update | Deletion);0
    switch (primaryEffectTag) {0
      case Placement: {0
        commitPlacement(nextEffect);0
        // Clear the "placement" from effect tag so that we know that this is inserted, before0
        // any life-cycles like componentDidMount gets called.0
        // TODO: findDOMNode doesn't rely on this any more but isMounted0
        // does and isMounted is deprecated anyway so we should be able0
        // to kill this.0
        nextEffect.effectTag &= ~Placement;0
        break;0
      }0
      case PlacementAndUpdate: {0
        // Placement0
        commitPlacement(nextEffect);0
        // Clear the "placement" from effect tag so that we know that this is inserted, before0
        // any life-cycles like componentDidMount gets called.0
        nextEffect.effectTag &= ~Placement;0
0
        // Update0
        const current = nextEffect.alternate;0
        commitWork(current, nextEffect);0
        break;0
      }0
      case Update: {0
        const current = nextEffect.alternate;0
        commitWork(current, nextEffect);0
        break;0
      }0
      case Deletion: {0
        commitDeletion(nextEffect);0
        break;0
      }0
    }0
    nextEffect = nextEffect.nextEffect;0
  }0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    ReactDebugCurrentFiber.resetCurrentFiber();0
  }0
}0
0
function commitBeforeMutationLifecycles() {0
  while (nextEffect !== null) {0
    const effectTag = nextEffect.effectTag;0
0
    if (effectTag & Snapshot) {0
      recordEffect();0
      const current = nextEffect.alternate;0
      commitBeforeMutationLifeCycles(current, nextEffect);0
    }0
0
    // Don't cleanup effects yet;0
    // This will be done by commitAllLifeCycles()0
    nextEffect = nextEffect.nextEffect;0
  }0
}0
0
function commitAllLifeCycles(0
  finishedRoot: FiberRoot,0
  committedExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    ReactStrictModeWarnings.flushPendingUnsafeLifecycleWarnings();0
0
    if (warnAboutDeprecatedLifecycles) {0
      ReactStrictModeWarnings.flushPendingDeprecationWarnings();0
    }0
0
    if (warnAboutLegacyContextAPI) {0
      ReactStrictModeWarnings.flushLegacyContextWarning();0
    }0
  }0
  while (nextEffect !== null) {0
    const effectTag = nextEffect.effectTag;0
0
    if (effectTag & (Update | Callback)) {0
      recordEffect();0
      const current = nextEffect.alternate;0
      commitLifeCycles(0
        finishedRoot,0
        current,0
        nextEffect,0
        committedExpirationTime,0
      );0
    }0
0
    if (effectTag & Ref) {0
      recordEffect();0
      commitAttachRef(nextEffect);0
    }0
0
    const next = nextEffect.nextEffect;0
    // Ensure that we clean these up so that we don't accidentally keep them.0
    // I'm not actually sure this matters because we can't reset firstEffect0
    // and lastEffect since they're on every node, not just the effectful0
    // ones. So we have to clean everything as we reuse nodes anyway.0
    nextEffect.nextEffect = null;0
    // Ensure that we reset the effectTag here so that we can rely on effect0
    // tags to reason about the current life-cycle.0
    nextEffect = next;0
  }0
}0
0
function isAlreadyFailedLegacyErrorBoundary(instance: mixed): boolean {0
  return (0
    legacyErrorBoundariesThatAlreadyFailed !== null &&0
    legacyErrorBoundariesThatAlreadyFailed.has(instance)0
  );0
}0
0
function markLegacyErrorBoundaryAsFailed(instance: mixed) {0
  if (legacyErrorBoundariesThatAlreadyFailed === null) {0
    legacyErrorBoundariesThatAlreadyFailed = new Set([instance]);0
  } else {0
    legacyErrorBoundariesThatAlreadyFailed.add(instance);0
  }0
}0
0
function commitRoot(root: FiberRoot, finishedWork: Fiber): void {0
  isWorking = true;0
  isCommitting = true;0
  startCommitTimer();0
0
  invariant(0
    root.current !== finishedWork,0
    'Cannot commit the same tree as before. This is probably a bug ' +0
      'related to the return field. This error is likely caused by a bug ' +0
      'in React. Please file an issue.',0
  );0
  const committedExpirationTime = root.pendingCommitExpirationTime;0
  invariant(0
    committedExpirationTime !== NoWork,0
    'Cannot commit an incomplete root. This error is likely caused by a ' +0
      'bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
  );0
  root.pendingCommitExpirationTime = NoWork;0
0
  // Update the pending priority levels to account for the work that we are0
  // about to commit. This needs to happen before calling the lifecycles, since0
  // they may schedule additional updates.0
  const earliestRemainingTime = finishedWork.expirationTime;0
  markCommittedPriorityLevels(root, earliestRemainingTime);0
0
  // Reset this to null before calling lifecycles0
  ReactCurrentOwner.current = null;0
0
  let firstEffect;0
  if (finishedWork.effectTag > PerformedWork) {0
    // A fiber's effect list consists only of its children, not itself. So if0
    // the root has an effect, we need to add it to the end of the list. The0
    // resulting list is the set that would belong to the root's parent, if0
    // it had one; that is, all the effects in the tree including the root.0
    if (finishedWork.lastEffect !== null) {0
      finishedWork.lastEffect.nextEffect = finishedWork;0
      firstEffect = finishedWork.firstEffect;0
    } else {0
      firstEffect = finishedWork;0
    }0
  } else {0
    // There is no effect on the root.0
    firstEffect = finishedWork.firstEffect;0
  }0
0
  prepareForCommit(root.containerInfo);0
0
  // Invoke instances of getSnapshotBeforeUpdate before mutation.0
  nextEffect = firstEffect;0
  startCommitSnapshotEffectsTimer();0
  while (nextEffect !== null) {0
    let didError = false;0
    let error;0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      invokeGuardedCallback(null, commitBeforeMutationLifecycles, null);0
      if (hasCaughtError()) {0
        didError = true;0
        error = clearCaughtError();0
      }0
    } else {0
      try {0
        commitBeforeMutationLifecycles();0
      } catch (e) {0
        didError = true;0
        error = e;0
      }0
    }0
    if (didError) {0
      invariant(0
        nextEffect !== null,0
        'Should have next effect. This error is likely caused by a bug ' +0
          'in React. Please file an issue.',0
      );0
      captureCommitPhaseError(nextEffect, error);0
      // Clean-up0
      if (nextEffect !== null) {0
        nextEffect = nextEffect.nextEffect;0
      }0
    }0
  }0
  stopCommitSnapshotEffectsTimer();0
0
  if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
    // Mark the current commit time to be shared by all Profilers in this batch.0
    // This enables them to be grouped later.0
    recordCommitTime();0
  }0
0
  // Commit all the side-effects within a tree. We'll do this in two passes.0
  // The first pass performs all the host insertions, updates, deletions and0
  // ref unmounts.0
  nextEffect = firstEffect;0
  startCommitHostEffectsTimer();0
  while (nextEffect !== null) {0
    let didError = false;0
    let error;0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      invokeGuardedCallback(null, commitAllHostEffects, null);0
      if (hasCaughtError()) {0
        didError = true;0
        error = clearCaughtError();0
      }0
    } else {0
      try {0
        commitAllHostEffects();0
      } catch (e) {0
        didError = true;0
        error = e;0
      }0
    }0
    if (didError) {0
      invariant(0
        nextEffect !== null,0
        'Should have next effect. This error is likely caused by a bug ' +0
          'in React. Please file an issue.',0
      );0
      captureCommitPhaseError(nextEffect, error);0
      // Clean-up0
      if (nextEffect !== null) {0
        nextEffect = nextEffect.nextEffect;0
      }0
    }0
  }0
  stopCommitHostEffectsTimer();0
0
  resetAfterCommit(root.containerInfo);0
0
  // The work-in-progress tree is now the current tree. This must come after0
  // the first pass of the commit phase, so that the previous tree is still0
  // current during componentWillUnmount, but before the second pass, so that0
  // the finished work is current during componentDidMount/Update.0
  root.current = finishedWork;0
0
  // In the second pass we'll perform all life-cycles and ref callbacks.0
  // Life-cycles happen as a separate pass so that all placements, updates,0
  // and deletions in the entire tree have already been invoked.0
  // This pass also triggers any renderer-specific initial effects.0
  nextEffect = firstEffect;0
  startCommitLifeCyclesTimer();0
  while (nextEffect !== null) {0
    let didError = false;0
    let error;0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      invokeGuardedCallback(0
        null,0
        commitAllLifeCycles,0
        null,0
        root,0
        committedExpirationTime,0
      );0
      if (hasCaughtError()) {0
        didError = true;0
        error = clearCaughtError();0
      }0
    } else {0
      try {0
        commitAllLifeCycles(root, committedExpirationTime);0
      } catch (e) {0
        didError = true;0
        error = e;0
      }0
    }0
    if (didError) {0
      invariant(0
        nextEffect !== null,0
        'Should have next effect. This error is likely caused by a bug ' +0
          'in React. Please file an issue.',0
      );0
      captureCommitPhaseError(nextEffect, error);0
      if (nextEffect !== null) {0
        nextEffect = nextEffect.nextEffect;0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      checkActualRenderTimeStackEmpty();0
    }0
    resetActualRenderTimer();0
  }0
0
  isCommitting = false;0
  isWorking = false;0
  stopCommitLifeCyclesTimer();0
  stopCommitTimer();0
  if (typeof onCommitRoot === 'function') {0
    onCommitRoot(finishedWork.stateNode);0
  }0
  if (__DEV__ && ReactFiberInstrumentation.debugTool) {0
    ReactFiberInstrumentation.debugTool.onCommitWork(finishedWork);0
  }0
0
  const expirationTime = root.expirationTime;0
  if (expirationTime === NoWork) {0
    // If there's no remaining work, we can clear the set of already failed0
    // error boundaries.0
    legacyErrorBoundariesThatAlreadyFailed = null;0
  }0
  onCommit(root, expirationTime);0
}0
0
function resetExpirationTime(0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  renderTime: ExpirationTime,0
) {0
  if (renderTime !== Never && workInProgress.expirationTime === Never) {0
    // The children of this component are hidden. Don't bubble their0
    // expiration times.0
    return;0
  }0
0
  // Check for pending updates.0
  let newExpirationTime = NoWork;0
  switch (workInProgress.tag) {0
    case HostRoot:0
    case ClassComponent: {0
      const updateQueue = workInProgress.updateQueue;0
      if (updateQueue !== null) {0
        newExpirationTime = updateQueue.expirationTime;0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  // TODO: Calls need to visit stateNode0
0
  // Bubble up the earliest expiration time.0
  // (And "base" render timers if that feature flag is enabled)0
  if (enableProfilerTimer && workInProgress.mode & ProfileMode) {0
    let treeBaseTime = workInProgress.selfBaseTime;0
    let child = workInProgress.child;0
    while (child !== null) {0
      treeBaseTime += child.treeBaseTime;0
      if (0
        child.expirationTime !== NoWork &&0
        (newExpirationTime === NoWork ||0
          newExpirationTime > child.expirationTime)0
      ) {0
        newExpirationTime = child.expirationTime;0
      }0
      child = child.sibling;0
    }0
    workInProgress.treeBaseTime = treeBaseTime;0
  } else {0
    let child = workInProgress.child;0
    while (child !== null) {0
      if (0
        child.expirationTime !== NoWork &&0
        (newExpirationTime === NoWork ||0
          newExpirationTime > child.expirationTime)0
      ) {0
        newExpirationTime = child.expirationTime;0
      }0
      child = child.sibling;0
    }0
  }0
0
  workInProgress.expirationTime = newExpirationTime;0
}0
0
function completeUnitOfWork(workInProgress: Fiber): Fiber | null {0
  // Attempt to complete the current unit of work, then move to the0
  // next sibling. If there are no more siblings, return to the0
  // parent fiber.0
  while (true) {0
    // The current, flushed, state of this fiber is the alternate.0
    // Ideally nothing should rely on this, but relying on it here0
    // means that we don't need an additional field on the work in0
    // progress.0
    const current = workInProgress.alternate;0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      ReactDebugCurrentFiber.setCurrentFiber(workInProgress);0
    }0
0
    const returnFiber = workInProgress.return;0
    const siblingFiber = workInProgress.sibling;0
0
    if ((workInProgress.effectTag & Incomplete) === NoEffect) {0
      // This fiber completed.0
      let next = completeWork(0
        current,0
        workInProgress,0
        nextRenderExpirationTime,0
      );0
      stopWorkTimer(workInProgress);0
      resetExpirationTime(workInProgress, nextRenderExpirationTime);0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        ReactDebugCurrentFiber.resetCurrentFiber();0
      }0
0
      if (next !== null) {0
        stopWorkTimer(workInProgress);0
        if (__DEV__ && ReactFiberInstrumentation.debugTool) {0
          ReactFiberInstrumentation.debugTool.onCompleteWork(workInProgress);0
        }0
        // If completing this work spawned new work, do that next. We'll come0
        // back here again.0
        return next;0
      }0
0
      if (0
        returnFiber !== null &&0
        // Do not append effects to parents if a sibling failed to complete0
        (returnFiber.effectTag & Incomplete) === NoEffect0
      ) {0
        // Append all the effects of the subtree and this fiber onto the effect0
        // list of the parent. The completion order of the children affects the0
        // side-effect order.0
        if (returnFiber.firstEffect === null) {0
          returnFiber.firstEffect = workInProgress.firstEffect;0
        }0
        if (workInProgress.lastEffect !== null) {0
          if (returnFiber.lastEffect !== null) {0
            returnFiber.lastEffect.nextEffect = workInProgress.firstEffect;0
          }0
          returnFiber.lastEffect = workInProgress.lastEffect;0
        }0
0
        // If this fiber had side-effects, we append it AFTER the children's0
        // side-effects. We can perform certain side-effects earlier if0
        // needed, by doing multiple passes over the effect list. We don't want0
        // to schedule our own side-effect on our own list because if end up0
        // reusing children we'll schedule this effect onto itself since we're0
        // at the end.0
        const effectTag = workInProgress.effectTag;0
        // Skip both NoWork and PerformedWork tags when creating the effect list.0
        // PerformedWork effect is read by React DevTools but shouldn't be committed.0
        if (effectTag > PerformedWork) {0
          if (returnFiber.lastEffect !== null) {0
            returnFiber.lastEffect.nextEffect = workInProgress;0
          } else {0
            returnFiber.firstEffect = workInProgress;0
          }0
          returnFiber.lastEffect = workInProgress;0
        }0
      }0
0
      if (__DEV__ && ReactFiberInstrumentation.debugTool) {0
        ReactFiberInstrumentation.debugTool.onCompleteWork(workInProgress);0
      }0
0
      if (siblingFiber !== null) {0
        // If there is more work to do in this returnFiber, do that next.0
        return siblingFiber;0
      } else if (returnFiber !== null) {0
        // If there's no more work in this returnFiber. Complete the returnFiber.0
        workInProgress = returnFiber;0
        continue;0
      } else {0
        // We've reached the root.0
        return null;0
      }0
    } else {0
      // This fiber did not complete because something threw. Pop values off0
      // the stack without entering the complete phase. If this is a boundary,0
      // capture values if possible.0
      const next = unwindWork(workInProgress, nextRenderExpirationTime);0
      // Because this fiber did not complete, don't reset its expiration time.0
      if (workInProgress.effectTag & DidCapture) {0
        // Restarting an error boundary0
        stopFailedWorkTimer(workInProgress);0
      } else {0
        stopWorkTimer(workInProgress);0
      }0
0
      if (__DEV__) {0
        ReactDebugCurrentFiber.resetCurrentFiber();0
      }0
0
      if (next !== null) {0
        stopWorkTimer(workInProgress);0
        if (__DEV__ && ReactFiberInstrumentation.debugTool) {0
          ReactFiberInstrumentation.debugTool.onCompleteWork(workInProgress);0
        }0
        // If completing this work spawned new work, do that next. We'll come0
        // back here again.0
        // Since we're restarting, remove anything that is not a host effect0
        // from the effect tag.0
        next.effectTag &= HostEffectMask;0
        return next;0
      }0
0
      if (returnFiber !== null) {0
        // Mark the parent fiber as incomplete and clear its effect list.0
        returnFiber.firstEffect = returnFiber.lastEffect = null;0
        returnFiber.effectTag |= Incomplete;0
      }0
0
      if (__DEV__ && ReactFiberInstrumentation.debugTool) {0
        ReactFiberInstrumentation.debugTool.onCompleteWork(workInProgress);0
      }0
0
      if (siblingFiber !== null) {0
        // If there is more work to do in this returnFiber, do that next.0
        return siblingFiber;0
      } else if (returnFiber !== null) {0
        // If there's no more work in this returnFiber. Complete the returnFiber.0
        workInProgress = returnFiber;0
        continue;0
      } else {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  // Without this explicit null return Flow complains of invalid return type0
  // TODO Remove the above while(true) loop0
  // eslint-disable-next-line no-unreachable0
  return null;0
}0
0
function performUnitOfWork(workInProgress: Fiber): Fiber | null {0
  // The current, flushed, state of this fiber is the alternate.0
  // Ideally nothing should rely on this, but relying on it here0
  // means that we don't need an additional field on the work in0
  // progress.0
  const current = workInProgress.alternate;0
0
  // See if beginning this work spawns more work.0
  startWorkTimer(workInProgress);0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    ReactDebugCurrentFiber.setCurrentFiber(workInProgress);0
  }0
0
  if (__DEV__ && replayFailedUnitOfWorkWithInvokeGuardedCallback) {0
    stashedWorkInProgressProperties = assignFiberPropertiesInDEV(0
      stashedWorkInProgressProperties,0
      workInProgress,0
    );0
  }0
0
  let next;0
  if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
    if (workInProgress.mode & ProfileMode) {0
      startBaseRenderTimer();0
    }0
0
    next = beginWork(current, workInProgress, nextRenderExpirationTime);0
0
    if (workInProgress.mode & ProfileMode) {0
      // Update "base" time if the render wasn't bailed out on.0
      recordElapsedBaseRenderTimeIfRunning(workInProgress);0
      stopBaseRenderTimerIfRunning();0
    }0
  } else {0
    next = beginWork(current, workInProgress, nextRenderExpirationTime);0
  }0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    ReactDebugCurrentFiber.resetCurrentFiber();0
    if (isReplayingFailedUnitOfWork) {0
      // Currently replaying a failed unit of work. This should be unreachable,0
      // because the render phase is meant to be idempotent, and it should0
      // have thrown again. Since it didn't, rethrow the original error, so0
      // React's internal stack is not misaligned.0
      rethrowOriginalError();0
    }0
  }0
  if (__DEV__ && ReactFiberInstrumentation.debugTool) {0
    ReactFiberInstrumentation.debugTool.onBeginWork(workInProgress);0
  }0
0
  if (next === null) {0
    // If this doesn't spawn new work, complete the current work.0
    next = completeUnitOfWork(workInProgress);0
  }0
0
  ReactCurrentOwner.current = null;0
0
  return next;0
}0
0
function workLoop(isYieldy) {0
  if (!isYieldy) {0
    // Flush work without yielding0
    while (nextUnitOfWork !== null) {0
      nextUnitOfWork = performUnitOfWork(nextUnitOfWork);0
    }0
  } else {0
    // Flush asynchronous work until the deadline runs out of time.0
    while (nextUnitOfWork !== null && !shouldYield()) {0
      nextUnitOfWork = performUnitOfWork(nextUnitOfWork);0
    }0
0
    if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
      // If we didn't finish, pause the "actual" render timer.0
      // We'll restart it when we resume work.0
      pauseActualRenderTimerIfRunning();0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function renderRoot(root: FiberRoot, isYieldy: boolean): void {0
  invariant(0
    !isWorking,0
    'renderRoot was called recursively. This error is likely caused ' +0
      'by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
  );0
  isWorking = true;0
0
  const expirationTime = root.nextExpirationTimeToWorkOn;0
0
  // Check if we're starting from a fresh stack, or if we're resuming from0
  // previously yielded work.0
  if (0
    expirationTime !== nextRenderExpirationTime ||0
    root !== nextRoot ||0
    nextUnitOfWork === null0
  ) {0
    // Reset the stack and start working from the root.0
    resetStack();0
    nextRoot = root;0
    nextRenderExpirationTime = expirationTime;0
    nextUnitOfWork = createWorkInProgress(0
      nextRoot.current,0
      null,0
      nextRenderExpirationTime,0
    );0
    root.pendingCommitExpirationTime = NoWork;0
  }0
0
  let didFatal = false;0
0
  startWorkLoopTimer(nextUnitOfWork);0
0
  do {0
    try {0
      workLoop(isYieldy);0
    } catch (thrownValue) {0
      if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
        // Stop "base" render timer in the event of an error.0
        stopBaseRenderTimerIfRunning();0
      }0
0
      if (nextUnitOfWork === null) {0
        // This is a fatal error.0
        didFatal = true;0
        onUncaughtError(thrownValue);0
      } else {0
        if (__DEV__) {0
          // Reset global debug state0
          // We assume this is defined in DEV0
          (resetCurrentlyProcessingQueue: any)();0
        }0
0
        const failedUnitOfWork: Fiber = nextUnitOfWork;0
        if (__DEV__ && replayFailedUnitOfWorkWithInvokeGuardedCallback) {0
          replayUnitOfWork(failedUnitOfWork, thrownValue, isYieldy);0
        }0
0
        // TODO: we already know this isn't true in some cases.0
        // At least this shows a nicer error message until we figure out the cause.0
        // https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/12449#issuecomment-3867274310
        invariant(0
          nextUnitOfWork !== null,0
          'Failed to replay rendering after an error. This ' +0
            'is likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue ' +0
            'with a reproducing case to help us find it.',0
        );0
0
        const sourceFiber: Fiber = nextUnitOfWork;0
        let returnFiber = sourceFiber.return;0
        if (returnFiber === null) {0
          // This is the root. The root could capture its own errors. However,0
          // we don't know if it errors before or after we pushed the host0
          // context. This information is needed to avoid a stack mismatch.0
          // Because we're not sure, treat this as a fatal error. We could track0
          // which phase it fails in, but doesn't seem worth it. At least0
          // for now.0
          didFatal = true;0
          onUncaughtError(thrownValue);0
          break;0
        }0
        throwException(0
          root,0
          returnFiber,0
          sourceFiber,0
          thrownValue,0
          nextRenderExpirationTime,0
        );0
        nextUnitOfWork = completeUnitOfWork(sourceFiber);0
      }0
    }0
    break;0
  } while (true);0
0
  // We're done performing work. Time to clean up.0
  isWorking = false;0
0
  // Yield back to main thread.0
  if (didFatal) {0
    const didCompleteRoot = false;0
    stopWorkLoopTimer(interruptedBy, didCompleteRoot);0
    interruptedBy = null;0
    // There was a fatal error.0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      resetStackAfterFatalErrorInDev();0
    }0
    // `nextRoot` points to the in-progress root. A non-null value indicates0
    // that we're in the middle of an async render. Set it to null to indicate0
    // there's no more work to be done in the current batch.0
    nextRoot = null;0
    onFatal(root);0
  } else if (nextUnitOfWork === null) {0
    // We reached the root.0
    const rootWorkInProgress = root.current.alternate;0
    invariant(0
      rootWorkInProgress !== null,0
      'Finished root should have a work-in-progress. This error is likely ' +0
        'caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
    );0
    if ((rootWorkInProgress.effectTag & Incomplete) === NoEffect) {0
      // The root successfully completed.0
      const didCompleteRoot = true;0
      stopWorkLoopTimer(interruptedBy, didCompleteRoot);0
      interruptedBy = null;0
      // `nextRoot` points to the in-progress root. A non-null value indicates0
      // that we're in the middle of an async render. Set it to null to indicate0
      // there's no more work to be done in the current batch.0
      nextRoot = null;0
      onComplete(root, rootWorkInProgress, expirationTime);0
    } else {0
      // The root did not complete.0
      const didCompleteRoot = false;0
      stopWorkLoopTimer(interruptedBy, didCompleteRoot);0
      interruptedBy = null;0
      // `nextRoot` points to the in-progress root. A non-null value indicates0
      // that we're in the middle of an async render. Set it to null to indicate0
      // there's no more work to be done in the current batch.0
      nextRoot = null;0
      markSuspendedPriorityLevel(root, expirationTime, nextRenderDidError);0
      const suspendedExpirationTime = expirationTime;0
      const newExpirationTime = root.expirationTime;0
      onSuspend(0
        root,0
        suspendedExpirationTime,0
        newExpirationTime,0
        nextLatestTimeoutMs,0
      );0
    }0
  } else {0
    // There's still remaining async work in this tree, but we ran out of time0
    // in the current frame. Yield back to the renderer. Unless we're0
    // interrupted by a higher priority update, we'll continue later from where0
    // we left off.0
    const didCompleteRoot = false;0
    stopWorkLoopTimer(interruptedBy, didCompleteRoot);0
    interruptedBy = null;0
    onYield(root);0
  }0
}0
0
function dispatch(0
  sourceFiber: Fiber,0
  value: mixed,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
) {0
  invariant(0
    !isWorking || isCommitting,0
    'dispatch: Cannot dispatch during the render phase.',0
  );0
0
  let fiber = sourceFiber.return;0
  while (fiber !== null) {0
    switch (fiber.tag) {0
      case ClassComponent:0
        const ctor = fiber.type;0
        const instance = fiber.stateNode;0
        if (0
          typeof ctor.getDerivedStateFromCatch === 'function' ||0
          (typeof instance.componentDidCatch === 'function' &&0
            !isAlreadyFailedLegacyErrorBoundary(instance))0
        ) {0
          const errorInfo = createCapturedValue(value, sourceFiber);0
          const update = createClassErrorUpdate(0
            fiber,0
            errorInfo,0
            expirationTime,0
          );0
          enqueueUpdate(fiber, update, expirationTime);0
          scheduleWork(fiber, expirationTime);0
          return;0
        }0
        break;0
      case HostRoot: {0
        const errorInfo = createCapturedValue(value, sourceFiber);0
        const update = createRootErrorUpdate(fiber, errorInfo, expirationTime);0
        enqueueUpdate(fiber, update, expirationTime);0
        scheduleWork(fiber, expirationTime);0
        return;0
      }0
    }0
    fiber = fiber.return;0
  }0
0
  if (sourceFiber.tag === HostRoot) {0
    // Error was thrown at the root. There is no parent, so the root0
    // itself should capture it.0
    const rootFiber = sourceFiber;0
    const errorInfo = createCapturedValue(value, rootFiber);0
    const update = createRootErrorUpdate(rootFiber, errorInfo, expirationTime);0
    enqueueUpdate(rootFiber, update, expirationTime);0
    scheduleWork(rootFiber, expirationTime);0
  }0
}0
0
function captureCommitPhaseError(fiber: Fiber, error: mixed) {0
  return dispatch(fiber, error, Sync);0
}0
0
function computeAsyncExpiration(currentTime) {0
  // Given the current clock time, returns an expiration time. We use rounding0
  // to batch like updates together.0
  // Should complete within ~5000ms. 5250ms max.0
  const expirationMs = 5000;0
  const bucketSizeMs = 250;0
  return computeExpirationBucket(currentTime, expirationMs, bucketSizeMs);0
}0
0
function computeInteractiveExpiration(currentTime) {0
  let expirationMs;0
  // We intentionally set a higher expiration time for interactive updates in0
  // dev than in production.0
  // If the main thread is being blocked so long that you hit the expiration,0
  // it's a problem that could be solved with better scheduling.0
  // People will be more likely to notice this and fix it with the long0
  // expiration time in development.0
  // In production we opt for better UX at the risk of masking scheduling0
  // problems, by expiring fast.0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    // Should complete within ~500ms. 600ms max.0
    expirationMs = 500;0
  } else {0
    // In production things should be more responsive, 150ms max.0
    expirationMs = 150;0
  }0
  const bucketSizeMs = 100;0
  return computeExpirationBucket(currentTime, expirationMs, bucketSizeMs);0
}0
0
// Creates a unique async expiration time.0
function computeUniqueAsyncExpiration(): ExpirationTime {0
  const currentTime = requestCurrentTime();0
  let result = computeAsyncExpiration(currentTime);0
  if (result <= lastUniqueAsyncExpiration) {0
    // Since we assume the current time monotonically increases, we only hit0
    // this branch when computeUniqueAsyncExpiration is fired multiple times0
    // within a 200ms window (or whatever the async bucket size is).0
    result = lastUniqueAsyncExpiration + 1;0
  }0
  lastUniqueAsyncExpiration = result;0
  return lastUniqueAsyncExpiration;0
}0
0
function computeExpirationForFiber(currentTime: ExpirationTime, fiber: Fiber) {0
  let expirationTime;0
  if (expirationContext !== NoWork) {0
    // An explicit expiration context was set;0
    expirationTime = expirationContext;0
  } else if (isWorking) {0
    if (isCommitting) {0
      // Updates that occur during the commit phase should have sync priority0
      // by default.0
      expirationTime = Sync;0
    } else {0
      // Updates during the render phase should expire at the same time as0
      // the work that is being rendered.0
      expirationTime = nextRenderExpirationTime;0
    }0
  } else {0
    // No explicit expiration context was set, and we're not currently0
    // performing work. Calculate a new expiration time.0
    if (fiber.mode & AsyncMode) {0
      if (isBatchingInteractiveUpdates) {0
        // This is an interactive update0
        expirationTime = computeInteractiveExpiration(currentTime);0
      } else {0
        // This is an async update0
        expirationTime = computeAsyncExpiration(currentTime);0
      }0
      // If we're in the middle of rendering a tree, do not update at the same0
      // expiration time that is already rendering.0
      if (nextRoot !== null && expirationTime === nextRenderExpirationTime) {0
        expirationTime += 1;0
      }0
    } else {0
      // This is a sync update0
      expirationTime = Sync;0
    }0
  }0
  if (isBatchingInteractiveUpdates) {0
    // This is an interactive update. Keep track of the lowest pending0
    // interactive expiration time. This allows us to synchronously flush0
    // all interactive updates when needed.0
    if (0
      lowestPendingInteractiveExpirationTime === NoWork ||0
      expirationTime > lowestPendingInteractiveExpirationTime0
    ) {0
      lowestPendingInteractiveExpirationTime = expirationTime;0
    }0
  }0
  return expirationTime;0
}0
0
function markTimeout(0
  root: FiberRoot,0
  thenable: Thenable,0
  timeoutMs: number,0
  suspendedTime: ExpirationTime,0
) {0
  // Schedule the timeout.0
  if (timeoutMs >= 0 && nextLatestTimeoutMs < timeoutMs) {0
    nextLatestTimeoutMs = timeoutMs;0
  }0
}0
0
function markError(root: FiberRoot) {0
  nextRenderDidError = true;0
}0
0
function retrySuspendedRoot(root: FiberRoot, suspendedTime: ExpirationTime) {0
  markPingedPriorityLevel(root, suspendedTime);0
  const retryTime = root.expirationTime;0
  if (retryTime !== NoWork) {0
    requestWork(root, retryTime);0
  }0
}0
0
function scheduleWork(fiber: Fiber, expirationTime: ExpirationTime) {0
  recordScheduleUpdate();0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (fiber.tag === ClassComponent) {0
      const instance = fiber.stateNode;0
      warnAboutInvalidUpdates(instance);0
    }0
  }0
0
  let node = fiber;0
  while (node !== null) {0
    // Walk the parent path to the root and update each node's0
    // expiration time.0
    if (0
      node.expirationTime === NoWork ||0
      node.expirationTime > expirationTime0
    ) {0
      node.expirationTime = expirationTime;0
    }0
    if (node.alternate !== null) {0
      if (0
        node.alternate.expirationTime === NoWork ||0
        node.alternate.expirationTime > expirationTime0
      ) {0
        node.alternate.expirationTime = expirationTime;0
      }0
    }0
    if (node.return === null) {0
      if (node.tag === HostRoot) {0
        const root: FiberRoot = (node.stateNode: any);0
        if (0
          !isWorking &&0
          nextRenderExpirationTime !== NoWork &&0
          expirationTime < nextRenderExpirationTime0
        ) {0
          // This is an interruption. (Used for performance tracking.)0
          interruptedBy = fiber;0
          resetStack();0
        }0
        markPendingPriorityLevel(root, expirationTime);0
        if (0
          // If we're in the render phase, we don't need to schedule this root0
          // for an update, because we'll do it before we exit...0
          !isWorking ||0
          isCommitting ||0
          // ...unless this is a different root than the one we're rendering.0
          nextRoot !== root0
        ) {0
          const rootExpirationTime = root.expirationTime;0
          requestWork(root, rootExpirationTime);0
        }0
        if (nestedUpdateCount > NESTED_UPDATE_LIMIT) {0
          invariant(0
            false,0
            'Maximum update depth exceeded. This can happen when a ' +0
              'component repeatedly calls setState inside ' +0
              'componentWillUpdate or componentDidUpdate. React limits ' +0
              'the number of nested updates to prevent infinite loops.',0
          );0
        }0
      } else {0
        if (__DEV__) {0
          if (fiber.tag === ClassComponent) {0
            warnAboutUpdateOnUnmounted(fiber);0
          }0
        }0
        return;0
      }0
    }0
    node = node.return;0
  }0
}0
0
function deferredUpdates<A>(fn: () => A): A {0
  const currentTime = requestCurrentTime();0
  const previousExpirationContext = expirationContext;0
  expirationContext = computeAsyncExpiration(currentTime);0
  try {0
    return fn();0
  } finally {0
    expirationContext = previousExpirationContext;0
  }0
}0
0
function syncUpdates<A, B, C0, D, R>(0
  fn: (A, B, C0, D) => R,0
  a: A,0
  b: B,0
  c: C0,0
  d: D,0
): R {0
  const previousExpirationContext = expirationContext;0
  expirationContext = Sync;0
  try {0
    return fn(a, b, c, d);0
  } finally {0
    expirationContext = previousExpirationContext;0
  }0
}0
0
// TODO: Everything below this is written as if it has been lifted to the0
// renderers. I'll do this in a follow-up.0
0
// Linked-list of roots0
let firstScheduledRoot: FiberRoot | null = null;0
let lastScheduledRoot: FiberRoot | null = null;0
0
let callbackExpirationTime: ExpirationTime = NoWork;0
let callbackID: *;0
let isRendering: boolean = false;0
let nextFlushedRoot: FiberRoot | null = null;0
let nextFlushedExpirationTime: ExpirationTime = NoWork;0
let lowestPendingInteractiveExpirationTime: ExpirationTime = NoWork;0
let deadlineDidExpire: boolean = false;0
let hasUnhandledError: boolean = false;0
let unhandledError: mixed | null = null;0
let deadline: Deadline | null = null;0
0
let isBatchingUpdates: boolean = false;0
let isUnbatchingUpdates: boolean = false;0
let isBatchingInteractiveUpdates: boolean = false;0
0
let completedBatches: Array<Batch> | null = null;0
0
let originalStartTimeMs: number = now();0
let currentRendererTime: ExpirationTime = msToExpirationTime(0
  originalStartTimeMs,0
);0
let currentSchedulerTime: ExpirationTime = currentRendererTime;0
0
// Use these to prevent an infinite loop of nested updates0
const NESTED_UPDATE_LIMIT = 1000;0
let nestedUpdateCount: number = 0;0
0
const timeHeuristicForUnitOfWork = 1;0
0
function recomputeCurrentRendererTime() {0
  const currentTimeMs = now() - originalStartTimeMs;0
  currentRendererTime = msToExpirationTime(currentTimeMs);0
}0
0
function scheduleCallbackWithExpirationTime(expirationTime) {0
  if (callbackExpirationTime !== NoWork) {0
    // A callback is already scheduled. Check its expiration time (timeout).0
    if (expirationTime > callbackExpirationTime) {0
      // Existing callback has sufficient timeout. Exit.0
      return;0
    } else {0
      if (callbackID !== null) {0
        // Existing callback has insufficient timeout. Cancel and schedule a0
        // new one.0
        cancelDeferredCallback(callbackID);0
      }0
    }0
    // The request callback timer is already running. Don't start a new one.0
  } else {0
    startRequestCallbackTimer();0
  }0
0
  callbackExpirationTime = expirationTime;0
  const currentMs = now() - originalStartTimeMs;0
  const expirationTimeMs = expirationTimeToMs(expirationTime);0
  const timeout = expirationTimeMs - currentMs;0
  callbackID = scheduleDeferredCallback(performAsyncWork, {timeout});0
}0
0
// For every call to renderRoot, one of onFatal, onComplete, onSuspend, and0
// onYield is called upon exiting. We use these in lieu of returning a tuple.0
// I've also chosen not to inline them into renderRoot because these will0
// eventually be lifted into the renderer.0
function onFatal(root) {0
  root.finishedWork = null;0
}0
0
function onComplete(0
  root: FiberRoot,0
  finishedWork: Fiber,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
) {0
  root.pendingCommitExpirationTime = expirationTime;0
  root.finishedWork = finishedWork;0
}0
0
function onSuspend(0
  root: FiberRoot,0
  suspendedExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  timeoutMs: number,0
) {0
  if (timeoutMs >= 0) {0
    const suspendedRoot = root;0
    setTimeout(() => {0
      retrySuspendedRoot(suspendedRoot, suspendedExpirationTime);0
    }, timeoutMs);0
  }0
  root.expirationTime = expirationTime;0
}0
0
function onYield(root) {0
  root.finishedWork = null;0
}0
0
function onCommit(root, expirationTime) {0
  root.expirationTime = expirationTime;0
  root.finishedWork = null;0
}0
0
function requestCurrentTime() {0
  // requestCurrentTime is called by the scheduler to compute an expiration0
  // time.0
  //0
  // Expiration times are computed by adding to the current time (the start0
  // time). However, if two updates are scheduled within the same event, we0
  // should treat their start times as simultaneous, even if the actual clock0
  // time has advanced between the first and second call.0
0
  // In other words, because expiration times determine how updates are batched,0
  // we want all updates of like priority that occur within the same event to0
  // receive the same expiration time. Otherwise we get tearing.0
  //0
  // We keep track of two separate times: the current "renderer" time and the0
  // current "scheduler" time. The renderer time can be updated whenever; it0
  // only exists to minimize the calls performance.now.0
  //0
  // But the scheduler time can only be updated if there's no pending work, or0
  // if we know for certain that we're not in the middle of an event.0
0
  if (isRendering) {0
    // We're already rendering. Return the most recently read time.0
    return currentSchedulerTime;0
  }0
  // Check if there's pending work.0
  findHighestPriorityRoot();0
  if (0
    nextFlushedExpirationTime === NoWork ||0
    nextFlushedExpirationTime === Never0
  ) {0
    // If there's no pending work, or if the pending work is offscreen, we can0
    // read the current time without risk of tearing.0
    recomputeCurrentRendererTime();0
    currentSchedulerTime = currentRendererTime;0
    return currentSchedulerTime;0
  }0
  // There's already pending work. We might be in the middle of a browser0
  // event. If we were to read the current time, it could cause multiple updates0
  // within the same event to receive different expiration times, leading to0
  // tearing. Return the last read time. During the next idle callback, the0
  // time will be updated.0
  return currentSchedulerTime;0
}0
0
// requestWork is called by the scheduler whenever a root receives an update.0
// It's up to the renderer to call renderRoot at some point in the future.0
function requestWork(root: FiberRoot, expirationTime: ExpirationTime) {0
  addRootToSchedule(root, expirationTime);0
0
  if (isRendering) {0
    // Prevent reentrancy. Remaining work will be scheduled at the end of0
    // the currently rendering batch.0
    return;0
  }0
0
  if (isBatchingUpdates) {0
    // Flush work at the end of the batch.0
    if (isUnbatchingUpdates) {0
      // ...unless we're inside unbatchedUpdates, in which case we should0
      // flush it now.0
      nextFlushedRoot = root;0
      nextFlushedExpirationTime = Sync;0
      performWorkOnRoot(root, Sync, false);0
    }0
    return;0
  }0
0
  // TODO: Get rid of Sync and use current time?0
  if (expirationTime === Sync) {0
    performSyncWork();0
  } else {0
    scheduleCallbackWithExpirationTime(expirationTime);0
  }0
}0
0
function addRootToSchedule(root: FiberRoot, expirationTime: ExpirationTime) {0
  // Add the root to the schedule.0
  // Check if this root is already part of the schedule.0
  if (root.nextScheduledRoot === null) {0
    // This root is not already scheduled. Add it.0
    root.expirationTime = expirationTime;0
    if (lastScheduledRoot === null) {0
      firstScheduledRoot = lastScheduledRoot = root;0
      root.nextScheduledRoot = root;0
    } else {0
      lastScheduledRoot.nextScheduledRoot = root;0
      lastScheduledRoot = root;0
      lastScheduledRoot.nextScheduledRoot = firstScheduledRoot;0
    }0
  } else {0
    // This root is already scheduled, but its priority may have increased.0
    const remainingExpirationTime = root.expirationTime;0
    if (0
      remainingExpirationTime === NoWork ||0
      expirationTime < remainingExpirationTime0
    ) {0
      // Update the priority.0
      root.expirationTime = expirationTime;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function findHighestPriorityRoot() {0
  let highestPriorityWork = NoWork;0
  let highestPriorityRoot = null;0
  if (lastScheduledRoot !== null) {0
    let previousScheduledRoot = lastScheduledRoot;0
    let root = firstScheduledRoot;0
    while (root !== null) {0
      const remainingExpirationTime = root.expirationTime;0
      if (remainingExpirationTime === NoWork) {0
        // This root no longer has work. Remove it from the scheduler.0
0
        // TODO: This check is redudant, but Flow is confused by the branch0
        // below where we set lastScheduledRoot to null, even though we break0
        // from the loop right after.0
        invariant(0
          previousScheduledRoot !== null && lastScheduledRoot !== null,0
          'Should have a previous and last root. This error is likely ' +0
            'caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
        );0
        if (root === root.nextScheduledRoot) {0
          // This is the only root in the list.0
          root.nextScheduledRoot = null;0
          firstScheduledRoot = lastScheduledRoot = null;0
          break;0
        } else if (root === firstScheduledRoot) {0
          // This is the first root in the list.0
          const next = root.nextScheduledRoot;0
          firstScheduledRoot = next;0
          lastScheduledRoot.nextScheduledRoot = next;0
          root.nextScheduledRoot = null;0
        } else if (root === lastScheduledRoot) {0
          // This is the last root in the list.0
          lastScheduledRoot = previousScheduledRoot;0
          lastScheduledRoot.nextScheduledRoot = firstScheduledRoot;0
          root.nextScheduledRoot = null;0
          break;0
        } else {0
          previousScheduledRoot.nextScheduledRoot = root.nextScheduledRoot;0
          root.nextScheduledRoot = null;0
        }0
        root = previousScheduledRoot.nextScheduledRoot;0
      } else {0
        if (0
          highestPriorityWork === NoWork ||0
          remainingExpirationTime < highestPriorityWork0
        ) {0
          // Update the priority, if it's higher0
          highestPriorityWork = remainingExpirationTime;0
          highestPriorityRoot = root;0
        }0
        if (root === lastScheduledRoot) {0
          break;0
        }0
        previousScheduledRoot = root;0
        root = root.nextScheduledRoot;0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  // If the next root is the same as the previous root, this is a nested0
  // update. To prevent an infinite loop, increment the nested update count.0
  const previousFlushedRoot = nextFlushedRoot;0
  if (0
    previousFlushedRoot !== null &&0
    previousFlushedRoot === highestPriorityRoot &&0
    highestPriorityWork === Sync0
  ) {0
    nestedUpdateCount++;0
  } else {0
    // Reset whenever we switch roots.0
    nestedUpdateCount = 0;0
  }0
  nextFlushedRoot = highestPriorityRoot;0
  nextFlushedExpirationTime = highestPriorityWork;0
}0
0
function performAsyncWork(dl) {0
  performWork(NoWork, dl);0
}0
0
function performSyncWork() {0
  performWork(Sync, null);0
}0
0
function performWork(minExpirationTime: ExpirationTime, dl: Deadline | null) {0
  deadline = dl;0
0
  // Keep working on roots until there's no more work, or until the we reach0
  // the deadline.0
  findHighestPriorityRoot();0
0
  if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
    resumeActualRenderTimerIfPaused();0
  }0
0
  if (deadline !== null) {0
    recomputeCurrentRendererTime();0
    currentSchedulerTime = currentRendererTime;0
0
    if (enableUserTimingAPI) {0
      const didExpire = nextFlushedExpirationTime < currentRendererTime;0
      const timeout = expirationTimeToMs(nextFlushedExpirationTime);0
      stopRequestCallbackTimer(didExpire, timeout);0
    }0
0
    while (0
      nextFlushedRoot !== null &&0
      nextFlushedExpirationTime !== NoWork &&0
      (minExpirationTime === NoWork ||0
        minExpirationTime >= nextFlushedExpirationTime) &&0
      (!deadlineDidExpire || currentRendererTime >= nextFlushedExpirationTime)0
    ) {0
      performWorkOnRoot(nextFlushedRoot, nextFlushedExpirationTime, true);0
      findHighestPriorityRoot();0
      recomputeCurrentRendererTime();0
      currentSchedulerTime = currentRendererTime;0
    }0
  } else {0
    while (0
      nextFlushedRoot !== null &&0
      nextFlushedExpirationTime !== NoWork &&0
      (minExpirationTime === NoWork ||0
        minExpirationTime >= nextFlushedExpirationTime)0
    ) {0
      performWorkOnRoot(nextFlushedRoot, nextFlushedExpirationTime, false);0
      findHighestPriorityRoot();0
    }0
  }0
0
  // We're done flushing work. Either we ran out of time in this callback,0
  // or there's no more work left with sufficient priority.0
0
  // If we're inside a callback, set this to false since we just completed it.0
  if (deadline !== null) {0
    callbackExpirationTime = NoWork;0
    callbackID = null;0
  }0
  // If there's work left over, schedule a new callback.0
  if (nextFlushedExpirationTime !== NoWork) {0
    scheduleCallbackWithExpirationTime(nextFlushedExpirationTime);0
  }0
0
  // Clean-up.0
  deadline = null;0
  deadlineDidExpire = false;0
0
  finishRendering();0
}0
0
function flushRoot(root: FiberRoot, expirationTime: ExpirationTime) {0
  invariant(0
    !isRendering,0
    'work.commit(): Cannot commit while already rendering. This likely ' +0
      'means you attempted to commit from inside a lifecycle method.',0
  );0
  // Perform work on root as if the given expiration time is the current time.0
  // This has the effect of synchronously flushing all work up to and0
  // including the given time.0
  nextFlushedRoot = root;0
  nextFlushedExpirationTime = expirationTime;0
  performWorkOnRoot(root, expirationTime, false);0
  // Flush any sync work that was scheduled by lifecycles0
  performSyncWork();0
  finishRendering();0
}0
0
function finishRendering() {0
  nestedUpdateCount = 0;0
0
  if (completedBatches !== null) {0
    const batches = completedBatches;0
    completedBatches = null;0
    for (let i = 0; i < batches.length; i++) {0
      const batch = batches[i];0
      try {0
        batch._onComplete();0
      } catch (error) {0
        if (!hasUnhandledError) {0
          hasUnhandledError = true;0
          unhandledError = error;0
        }0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  if (hasUnhandledError) {0
    const error = unhandledError;0
    unhandledError = null;0
    hasUnhandledError = false;0
    throw error;0
  }0
}0
0
function performWorkOnRoot(0
  root: FiberRoot,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  isYieldy: boolean,0
) {0
  invariant(0
    !isRendering,0
    'performWorkOnRoot was called recursively. This error is likely caused ' +0
      'by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
  );0
0
  isRendering = true;0
0
  // Check if this is async work or sync/expired work.0
  if (!isYieldy) {0
    // Flush work without yielding.0
    let finishedWork = root.finishedWork;0
    if (finishedWork !== null) {0
      // This root is already complete. We can commit it.0
      completeRoot(root, finishedWork, expirationTime);0
    } else {0
      renderRoot(root, false);0
      finishedWork = root.finishedWork;0
      if (finishedWork !== null) {0
        // We've completed the root. Commit it.0
        completeRoot(root, finishedWork, expirationTime);0
      }0
    }0
  } else {0
    // Flush async work.0
    let finishedWork = root.finishedWork;0
    if (finishedWork !== null) {0
      // This root is already complete. We can commit it.0
      completeRoot(root, finishedWork, expirationTime);0
    } else {0
      renderRoot(root, true);0
      finishedWork = root.finishedWork;0
      if (finishedWork !== null) {0
        // We've completed the root. Check the deadline one more time0
        // before committing.0
        if (!shouldYield()) {0
          // Still time left. Commit the root.0
          completeRoot(root, finishedWork, expirationTime);0
        } else {0
          // There's no time left. Mark this root as complete. We'll come0
          // back and commit it later.0
          root.finishedWork = finishedWork;0
0
          if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
            // If we didn't finish, pause the "actual" render timer.0
            // We'll restart it when we resume work.0
            pauseActualRenderTimerIfRunning();0
          }0
        }0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  isRendering = false;0
}0
0
function completeRoot(0
  root: FiberRoot,0
  finishedWork: Fiber,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
): void {0
  // Check if there's a batch that matches this expiration time.0
  const firstBatch = root.firstBatch;0
  if (firstBatch !== null && firstBatch._expirationTime <= expirationTime) {0
    if (completedBatches === null) {0
      completedBatches = [firstBatch];0
    } else {0
      completedBatches.push(firstBatch);0
    }0
    if (firstBatch._defer) {0
      // This root is blocked from committing by a batch. Unschedule it until0
      // we receive another update.0
      root.finishedWork = finishedWork;0
      root.expirationTime = NoWork;0
      return;0
    }0
  }0
0
  // Commit the root.0
  root.finishedWork = null;0
  commitRoot(root, finishedWork);0
}0
0
// When working on async work, the reconciler asks the renderer if it should0
// yield execution. For DOM, we implement this with requestIdleCallback.0
function shouldYield() {0
  if (deadline === null || deadlineDidExpire) {0
    return false;0
  }0
  if (deadline.timeRemaining() > timeHeuristicForUnitOfWork) {0
    // Disregard deadline.didTimeout. Only expired work should be flushed0
    // during a timeout. This path is only hit for non-expired work.0
    return false;0
  }0
  deadlineDidExpire = true;0
  return true;0
}0
0
function onUncaughtError(error: mixed) {0
  invariant(0
    nextFlushedRoot !== null,0
    'Should be working on a root. This error is likely caused by a bug in ' +0
      'React. Please file an issue.',0
  );0
  // Unschedule this root so we don't work on it again until there's0
  // another update.0
  nextFlushedRoot.expirationTime = NoWork;0
  if (!hasUnhandledError) {0
    hasUnhandledError = true;0
    unhandledError = error;0
  }0
}0
0
// TODO: Batching should be implemented at the renderer level, not inside0
// the reconciler.0
function batchedUpdates<A, R>(fn: (a: A) => R, a: A): R {0
  const previousIsBatchingUpdates = isBatchingUpdates;0
  isBatchingUpdates = true;0
  try {0
    return fn(a);0
  } finally {0
    isBatchingUpdates = previousIsBatchingUpdates;0
    if (!isBatchingUpdates && !isRendering) {0
      performSyncWork();0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
// TODO: Batching should be implemented at the renderer level, not inside0
// the reconciler.0
function unbatchedUpdates<A, R>(fn: (a: A) => R, a: A): R {0
  if (isBatchingUpdates && !isUnbatchingUpdates) {0
    isUnbatchingUpdates = true;0
    try {0
      return fn(a);0
    } finally {0
      isUnbatchingUpdates = false;0
    }0
  }0
  return fn(a);0
}0
0
// TODO: Batching should be implemented at the renderer level, not within0
// the reconciler.0
function flushSync<A, R>(fn: (a: A) => R, a: A): R {0
  invariant(0
    !isRendering,0
    'flushSync was called from inside a lifecycle method. It cannot be ' +0
      'called when React is already rendering.',0
  );0
  const previousIsBatchingUpdates = isBatchingUpdates;0
  isBatchingUpdates = true;0
  try {0
    return syncUpdates(fn, a);0
  } finally {0
    isBatchingUpdates = previousIsBatchingUpdates;0
    performSyncWork();0
  }0
}0
0
function interactiveUpdates<A, B, R>(fn: (A, B) => R, a: A, b: B): R {0
  if (isBatchingInteractiveUpdates) {0
    return fn(a, b);0
  }0
  // If there are any pending interactive updates, synchronously flush them.0
  // This needs to happen before we read any handlers, because the effect of0
  // the previous event may influence which handlers are called during0
  // this event.0
  if (0
    !isBatchingUpdates &&0
    !isRendering &&0
    lowestPendingInteractiveExpirationTime !== NoWork0
  ) {0
    // Synchronously flush pending interactive updates.0
    performWork(lowestPendingInteractiveExpirationTime, null);0
    lowestPendingInteractiveExpirationTime = NoWork;0
  }0
  const previousIsBatchingInteractiveUpdates = isBatchingInteractiveUpdates;0
  const previousIsBatchingUpdates = isBatchingUpdates;0
  isBatchingInteractiveUpdates = true;0
  isBatchingUpdates = true;0
  try {0
    return fn(a, b);0
  } finally {0
    isBatchingInteractiveUpdates = previousIsBatchingInteractiveUpdates;0
    isBatchingUpdates = previousIsBatchingUpdates;0
    if (!isBatchingUpdates && !isRendering) {0
      performSyncWork();0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function flushInteractiveUpdates() {0
  if (!isRendering && lowestPendingInteractiveExpirationTime !== NoWork) {0
    // Synchronously flush pending interactive updates.0
    performWork(lowestPendingInteractiveExpirationTime, null);0
    lowestPendingInteractiveExpirationTime = NoWork;0
  }0
}0
0
function flushControlled(fn: () => mixed): void {0
  const previousIsBatchingUpdates = isBatchingUpdates;0
  isBatchingUpdates = true;0
  try {0
    syncUpdates(fn);0
  } finally {0
    isBatchingUpdates = previousIsBatchingUpdates;0
    if (!isBatchingUpdates && !isRendering) {0
      performWork(Sync, null);0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
export {0
  requestCurrentTime,0
  computeExpirationForFiber,0
  captureCommitPhaseError,0
  onUncaughtError,0
  markTimeout,0
  markError,0
  retrySuspendedRoot,0
  markLegacyErrorBoundaryAsFailed,0
  isAlreadyFailedLegacyErrorBoundary,0
  scheduleWork,0
  requestWork,0
  flushRoot,0
  batchedUpdates,0
  unbatchedUpdates,0
  flushSync,0
  flushControlled,0
  deferredUpdates,0
  syncUpdates,0
  interactiveUpdates,0
  flushInteractiveUpdates,0
  computeUniqueAsyncExpiration,0
};0

import type {Fiber} from './ReactFiber';0
0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
export type StackCursor<T> = {0
  current: T,0
};0
0
const valueStack: Array<any> = [];0
0
let fiberStack: Array<Fiber | null>;0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  fiberStack = [];0
}0
0
let index = -1;0
0
function createCursor<T>(defaultValue: T): StackCursor<T> {0
  return {0
    current: defaultValue,0
  };0
}0
0
function isEmpty(): boolean {0
  return index === -1;0
}0
0
function pop<T>(cursor: StackCursor<T>, fiber: Fiber): void {0
  if (index < 0) {0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      warning(false, 'Unexpected pop.');0
    }0
    return;0
  }0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (fiber !== fiberStack[index]) {0
      warning(false, 'Unexpected Fiber popped.');0
    }0
  }0
0
  cursor.current = valueStack[index];0
0
  valueStack[index] = null;0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    fiberStack[index] = null;0
  }0
0
  index--;0
}0
0
function push<T>(cursor: StackCursor<T>, value: T, fiber: Fiber): void {0
  index++;0
0
  valueStack[index] = cursor.current;0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    fiberStack[index] = fiber;0
  }0
0
  cursor.current = value;0
}0
0
function checkThatStackIsEmpty() {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (index !== -1) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'Expected an empty stack. Something was not reset properly.',0
      );0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
function resetStackAfterFatalErrorInDev() {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    index = -1;0
    valueStack.length = 0;0
    fiberStack.length = 0;0
  }0
}0
0
export {0
  createCursor,0
  isEmpty,0
  pop,0
  push,0
  // DEV only:0
  checkThatStackIsEmpty,0
  resetStackAfterFatalErrorInDev,0
};0
/**0

 *0

 */0
0
import type {Fiber} from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiber';0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
import * as ReactInstanceMap from 'shared/ReactInstanceMap';0
import {ReactCurrentOwner} from 'shared/ReactGlobalSharedState';0
import getComponentName from 'shared/getComponentName';0
import {0
  ClassComponent,0
  HostComponent,0
  HostRoot,0
  HostPortal,0
  HostText,0
} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfWork';0
import {NoEffect, Placement} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfSideEffect';0
0
const MOUNTING = 1;0
const MOUNTED = 2;0
const UNMOUNTED = 3;0
0
function isFiberMountedImpl(fiber: Fiber): number {0
  let node = fiber;0
  if (!fiber.alternate) {0
    // If there is no alternate, this might be a new tree that isn't inserted0
    // yet. If it is, then it will have a pending insertion effect on it.0
    if ((node.effectTag & Placement) !== NoEffect) {0
      return MOUNTING;0
    }0
    while (node.return) {0
      node = node.return;0
      if ((node.effectTag & Placement) !== NoEffect) {0
        return MOUNTING;0
      }0
    }0
  } else {0
    while (node.return) {0
      node = node.return;0
    }0
  }0
  if (node.tag === HostRoot) {0
    // TODO: Check if this was a nested HostRoot when used with0
    // renderContainerIntoSubtree.0
    return MOUNTED;0
  }0
  // If we didn't hit the root, that means that we're in an disconnected tree0
  // that has been unmounted.0
  return UNMOUNTED;0
}0
0
export function isFiberMounted(fiber: Fiber): boolean {0
  return isFiberMountedImpl(fiber) === MOUNTED;0
}0
0
export function isMounted(component: React$Component<any, any>): boolean {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    const owner = (ReactCurrentOwner.current: any);0
    if (owner !== null && owner.tag === ClassComponent) {0
      const ownerFiber: Fiber = owner;0
      const instance = ownerFiber.stateNode;0
      warning(0
        instance._warnedAboutRefsInRender,0
        '%s is accessing isMounted inside its render() function. ' +0
          'render() should be a pure function of props and state. It should ' +0
          'never access something that requires stale data from the previous ' +0
          'render, such as refs. Move this logic to componentDidMount and ' +0
          'componentDidUpdate instead.',0
        getComponentName(ownerFiber) || 'A component',0
      );0
      instance._warnedAboutRefsInRender = true;0
    }0
  }0
0
  const fiber: ?Fiber = ReactInstanceMap.get(component);0
  if (!fiber) {0
    return false;0
  }0
  return isFiberMountedImpl(fiber) === MOUNTED;0
}0
0
function assertIsMounted(fiber) {0
  invariant(0
    isFiberMountedImpl(fiber) === MOUNTED,0
    'Unable to find node on an unmounted component.',0
  );0
}0
0
export function findCurrentFiberUsingSlowPath(fiber: Fiber): Fiber | null {0
  let alternate = fiber.alternate;0
  if (!alternate) {0
    // If there is no alternate, then we only need to check if it is mounted.0
    const state = isFiberMountedImpl(fiber);0
    invariant(0
      state !== UNMOUNTED,0
      'Unable to find node on an unmounted component.',0
    );0
    if (state === MOUNTING) {0
      return null;0
    }0
    return fiber;0
  }0
  // If we have two possible branches, we'll walk backwards up to the root0
  // to see what path the root points to. On the way we may hit one of the0
  // special cases and we'll deal with them.0
  let a = fiber;0
  let b = alternate;0
  while (true) {0
    let parentA = a.return;0
    let parentB = parentA ? parentA.alternate : null;0
    if (!parentA || !parentB) {0
      // We're at the root.0
      break;0
    }0
0
    // If both copies of the parent fiber point to the same child, we can0
    // assume that the child is current. This happens when we bailout on low0
    // priority: the bailed out fiber's child reuses the current child.0
    if (parentA.child === parentB.child) {0
      let child = parentA.child;0
      while (child) {0
        if (child === a) {0
          // We've determined that A is the current branch.0
          assertIsMounted(parentA);0
          return fiber;0
        }0
        if (child === b) {0
          // We've determined that B is the current branch.0
          assertIsMounted(parentA);0
          return alternate;0
        }0
        child = child.sibling;0
      }0
      // We should never have an alternate for any mounting node. So the only0
      // way this could possibly happen is if this was unmounted, if at all.0
      invariant(false, 'Unable to find node on an unmounted component.');0
    }0
0
    if (a.return !== b.return) {0
      // The return pointer of A and the return pointer of B point to different0
      // fibers. We assume that return pointers never criss-cross, so A must0
      // belong to the child set of A.return, and B must belong to the child0
      // set of B.return.0
      a = parentA;0
      b = parentB;0
    } else {0
      // The return pointers point to the same fiber. We'll have to use the0
      // default, slow path: scan the child sets of each parent alternate to see0
      // which child belongs to which set.0
      //0
      // Search parent A's child set0
      let didFindChild = false;0
      let child = parentA.child;0
      while (child) {0
        if (child === a) {0
          didFindChild = true;0
          a = parentA;0
          b = parentB;0
          break;0
        }0
        if (child === b) {0
          didFindChild = true;0
          b = parentA;0
          a = parentB;0
          break;0
        }0
        child = child.sibling;0
      }0
      if (!didFindChild) {0
        // Search parent B's child set0
        child = parentB.child;0
        while (child) {0
          if (child === a) {0
            didFindChild = true;0
            a = parentB;0
            b = parentA;0
            break;0
          }0
          if (child === b) {0
            didFindChild = true;0
            b = parentB;0
            a = parentA;0
            break;0
          }0
          child = child.sibling;0
        }0
        invariant(0
          didFindChild,0
          'Child was not found in either parent set. This indicates a bug ' +0
            'in React related to the return pointer. Please file an issue.',0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    invariant(0
      a.alternate === b,0
      "Return fibers should always be each others' alternates. " +0
        'This error is likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
    );0
  }0
  // If the root is not a host container, we're in a disconnected tree. I.e.0
  // unmounted.0
  invariant(0
    a.tag === HostRoot,0
    'Unable to find node on an unmounted component.',0
  );0
  if (a.stateNode.current === a) {0
    // We've determined that A is the current branch.0
    return fiber;0
  }0
  // Otherwise B has to be current branch.0
  return alternate;0
}0
0
export function findCurrentHostFiber(parent: Fiber): Fiber | null {0
  const currentParent = findCurrentFiberUsingSlowPath(parent);0
  if (!currentParent) {0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  // Next we'll drill down this component to find the first HostComponent/Text.0
  let node: Fiber = currentParent;0
  while (true) {0
    if (node.tag === HostComponent || node.tag === HostText) {0
      return node;0
    } else if (node.child) {0
      node.child.return = node;0
      node = node.child;0
      continue;0
    }0
    if (node === currentParent) {0
      return null;0
    }0
    while (!node.sibling) {0
      if (!node.return || node.return === currentParent) {0
        return null;0
      }0
      node = node.return;0
    }0
    node.sibling.return = node.return;0
    node = node.sibling;0
  }0
  // Flow needs the return null here, but ESLint complains about it.0
  // eslint-disable-next-line no-unreachable0
  return null;0
}0
0
export function findCurrentHostFiberWithNoPortals(parent: Fiber): Fiber | null {0
  const currentParent = findCurrentFiberUsingSlowPath(parent);0
  if (!currentParent) {0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  // Next we'll drill down this component to find the first HostComponent/Text.0
  let node: Fiber = currentParent;0
  while (true) {0
    if (node.tag === HostComponent || node.tag === HostText) {0
      return node;0
    } else if (node.child && node.tag !== HostPortal) {0
      node.child.return = node;0
      node = node.child;0
      continue;0
    }0
    if (node === currentParent) {0
      return null;0
    }0
    while (!node.sibling) {0
      if (!node.return || node.return === currentParent) {0
        return null;0
      }0
      node = node.return;0
    }0
    node.sibling.return = node.return;0
    node = node.sibling;0
  }0
  // Flow needs the return null here, but ESLint complains about it.0
  // eslint-disable-next-line no-unreachable0
  return null;0
}0

 *0
 * @flow0
 */0

import type {CapturedValue} from './ReactCapturedValue';0
import type {Update} from './ReactUpdateQueue';0
import type {Thenable} from './ReactFiberScheduler';0
0
import {0
  ClassComponent,0
  HostRoot,0
  HostComponent,0
  HostPortal,0
  ContextProvider,0
  TimeoutComponent,0
} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfWork';0
import {0
  DidCapture,0
  Incomplete,0
  NoEffect,0
  ShouldCapture,0
} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfSideEffect';0
import {0
  enableGetDerivedStateFromCatch,0
  enableProfilerTimer,0
  enableSuspense,0
} from 'shared/ReactFeatureFlags';0
import {ProfileMode} from './ReactTypeOfMode';0
0

  enqueueCapturedUpdate,0
  createUpdate,0
  enqueueUpdate,0
  CaptureUpdate,0
} from './ReactUpdateQueue';0

  popContextProvider as popLegacyContextProvider,0
  popTopLevelContextObject as popTopLevelLegacyContextObject,0
} from './ReactFiberContext';0

  resumeActualRenderTimerIfPaused,0
  recordElapsedActualRenderTime,0
} from './ReactProfilerTimer';0

  markTimeout,0
  markError,0

} from './ReactFiberScheduler';0
