0
function createRootErrorUpdate(0
  fiber: Fiber,0
  errorInfo: CapturedValue<mixed>,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
): Update<null> {0
  const update = createUpdate(expirationTime);0
  // Unmount the root by rendering null.0
  update.tag = CaptureUpdate;0
  // Caution: React DevTools currently depends on this property0
  // being called "element".0
  update.payload = {element: null};0
  const error = errorInfo.value;0
  update.callback = () => {0
    onUncaughtError(error);0
    logError(fiber, errorInfo);0
  };0
  return update;0
}0
0
function createClassErrorUpdate(0
  fiber: Fiber,0
  errorInfo: CapturedValue<mixed>,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
): Update<mixed> {0
  const update = createUpdate(expirationTime);0
  update.tag = CaptureUpdate;0
  const getDerivedStateFromCatch = fiber.type.getDerivedStateFromCatch;0
  if (0
    enableGetDerivedStateFromCatch &&0
    typeof getDerivedStateFromCatch === 'function'0
  ) {0
    const error = errorInfo.value;0
    update.payload = () => {0
      return getDerivedStateFromCatch(error);0
    };0
  }0
0
  const inst = fiber.stateNode;0
  if (inst !== null && typeof inst.componentDidCatch === 'function') {0
    update.callback = function callback() {0
      if (0
        !enableGetDerivedStateFromCatch ||0
        getDerivedStateFromCatch !== 'function'0
      ) {0
        // To preserve the preexisting retry behavior of error boundaries,0
        // we keep track of which ones already failed during this batch.0
        // This gets reset before we yield back to the browser.0
        // TODO: Warn in strict mode if getDerivedStateFromCatch is0
        // not defined.0
        markLegacyErrorBoundaryAsFailed(this);0
      }0
      const error = errorInfo.value;0
      const stack = errorInfo.stack;0
      logError(fiber, errorInfo);0
      this.componentDidCatch(error, {0
        componentStack: stack !== null ? stack : '',0
      });0
    };0
  }0
  return update;0
}0
0
function schedulePing(finishedWork) {0
  // Once the promise resolves, we should try rendering the non-0
  // placeholder state again.0
  const currentTime = requestCurrentTime();0
  const expirationTime = computeExpirationForFiber(currentTime, finishedWork);0
  const recoveryUpdate = createUpdate(expirationTime);0
  enqueueUpdate(finishedWork, recoveryUpdate, expirationTime);0
  scheduleWork(finishedWork, expirationTime);0
}0
0
function throwException(0
  root: FiberRoot,0
  returnFiber: Fiber,0
  sourceFiber: Fiber,0
  value: mixed,0
  renderExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
) {0
  // The source fiber did not complete.0
  sourceFiber.effectTag |= Incomplete;0
  // Its effect list is no longer valid.0
  sourceFiber.firstEffect = sourceFiber.lastEffect = null;0
0
  if (0
    enableSuspense &&0
    value !== null &&0
    typeof value === 'object' &&0
    typeof value.then === 'function'0
  ) {0
    // This is a thenable.0
    const thenable: Thenable = (value: any);0
0
    // TODO: Should use the earliest known expiration time0
    const currentTime = requestCurrentTime();0
    const expirationTimeMs = expirationTimeToMs(renderExpirationTime);0
    const currentTimeMs = expirationTimeToMs(currentTime);0
    const startTimeMs = expirationTimeMs - 5000;0
    let elapsedMs = currentTimeMs - startTimeMs;0
    if (elapsedMs < 0) {0
      elapsedMs = 0;0
    }0
    const remainingTimeMs = expirationTimeMs - currentTimeMs;0
0
    // Find the earliest timeout of all the timeouts in the ancestor path.0
    // TODO: Alternatively, we could store the earliest timeout on the context0
    // stack, rather than searching on every suspend.0
    let workInProgress = returnFiber;0
    let earliestTimeoutMs = -1;0
    searchForEarliestTimeout: do {0
      if (workInProgress.tag === TimeoutComponent) {0
        const current = workInProgress.alternate;0
        if (current !== null && current.memoizedState === true) {0
          // A parent Timeout already committed in a placeholder state. We0
          // need to handle this promise immediately. In other words, we0
          // should never suspend inside a tree that already expired.0
          earliestTimeoutMs = 0;0
          break searchForEarliestTimeout;0
        }0
        let timeoutPropMs = workInProgress.pendingProps.ms;0
        if (typeof timeoutPropMs === 'number') {0
          if (timeoutPropMs <= 0) {0
            earliestTimeoutMs = 0;0
            break searchForEarliestTimeout;0
          } else if (0
            earliestTimeoutMs === -1 ||0
            timeoutPropMs < earliestTimeoutMs0
          ) {0
            earliestTimeoutMs = timeoutPropMs;0
          }0
        } else if (earliestTimeoutMs === -1) {0
          earliestTimeoutMs = remainingTimeMs;0
        }0
      }0
      workInProgress = workInProgress.return;0
    } while (workInProgress !== null);0
0
    // Compute the remaining time until the timeout.0
    const msUntilTimeout = earliestTimeoutMs - elapsedMs;0
0
    if (renderExpirationTime === Never || msUntilTimeout > 0) {0
      // There's still time remaining.0
      markTimeout(root, thenable, msUntilTimeout, renderExpirationTime);0
      const onResolveOrReject = () => {0
        retrySuspendedRoot(root, renderExpirationTime);0
      };0
      thenable.then(onResolveOrReject, onResolveOrReject);0
      return;0
    } else {0
      // No time remaining. Need to fallback to placeholder.0
      // Find the nearest timeout that can be retried.0
      workInProgress = returnFiber;0
      do {0
        switch (workInProgress.tag) {0
          case HostRoot: {0
            // The root expired, but no fallback was provided. Throw a0
            // helpful error.0
            const message =0
              renderExpirationTime === Sync0
                ? 'A synchronous update was suspended, but no fallback UI ' +0
                  'was provided.'0
                : 'An update was suspended for longer than the timeout, ' +0
                  'but no fallback UI was provided.';0
            value = new Error(message);0
            break;0
          }0
          case TimeoutComponent: {0
            if ((workInProgress.effectTag & DidCapture) === NoEffect) {0
              workInProgress.effectTag |= ShouldCapture;0
              const onResolveOrReject = schedulePing.bind(null, workInProgress);0
              thenable.then(onResolveOrReject, onResolveOrReject);0
              return;0
            }0
            // Already captured during this render. Continue to the next0
            // Timeout ancestor.0
            break;0
          }0
        }0
        workInProgress = workInProgress.return;0
      } while (workInProgress !== null);0
    }0
  } else {0
    // This is an error.0
    markError(root);0
    if (0
      // Retry (at the same priority) one more time before handling the error.0
      // The retry will flush synchronously. (Unless we're already rendering0
      // synchronously, in which case move to the next check.)0
      (!root.didError && renderExpirationTime !== Sync) ||0
      // There's lower priority work. If so, it may have the effect of fixing0
      // the exception that was just thrown.0
      hasLowerPriorityWork(root, renderExpirationTime)0
    ) {0
      return;0
    }0
  }0
0
  // We didn't find a boundary that could handle this type of exception. Start0
  // over and traverse parent path again, this time treating the exception0
  // as an error.0
  value = createCapturedValue(value, sourceFiber);0
  let workInProgress = returnFiber;0
  do {0
    switch (workInProgress.tag) {0
      case HostRoot: {0
        const errorInfo = value;0
        workInProgress.effectTag |= ShouldCapture;0
        const update = createRootErrorUpdate(0
          workInProgress,0
          errorInfo,0
          renderExpirationTime,0
        );0
        enqueueCapturedUpdate(workInProgress, update, renderExpirationTime);0
        return;0
      }0
      case ClassComponent:0
        // Capture and retry0
        const errorInfo = value;0
        const ctor = workInProgress.type;0
        const instance = workInProgress.stateNode;0
        if (0
          (workInProgress.effectTag & DidCapture) === NoEffect &&0
          ((typeof ctor.getDerivedStateFromCatch === 'function' &&0
            enableGetDerivedStateFromCatch) ||0
            (instance !== null &&0
              typeof instance.componentDidCatch === 'function' &&0
              !isAlreadyFailedLegacyErrorBoundary(instance)))0
        ) {0
          workInProgress.effectTag |= ShouldCapture;0
          // Schedule the error boundary to re-render using updated state0
          const update = createClassErrorUpdate(0
            workInProgress,0
            errorInfo,0
            renderExpirationTime,0
          );0
          enqueueCapturedUpdate(workInProgress, update, renderExpirationTime);0
          return;0
        }0
        break;0
      default:0
        break;0
    }0
    workInProgress = workInProgress.return;0
  } while (workInProgress !== null);0
}0
0
function unwindWork(0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  renderExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
) {0
  if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
    if (workInProgress.mode & ProfileMode) {0
      recordElapsedActualRenderTime(workInProgress);0
    }0
  }0
0
  switch (workInProgress.tag) {0
    case ClassComponent: {0
      popLegacyContextProvider(workInProgress);0
      const effectTag = workInProgress.effectTag;0
      if (effectTag & ShouldCapture) {0
        workInProgress.effectTag = (effectTag & ~ShouldCapture) | DidCapture;0
        return workInProgress;0
      }0
      return null;0
    }0
    case HostRoot: {0
      popHostContainer(workInProgress);0
      popTopLevelLegacyContextObject(workInProgress);0
      const effectTag = workInProgress.effectTag;0
      if (effectTag & ShouldCapture) {0
        workInProgress.effectTag = (effectTag & ~ShouldCapture) | DidCapture;0
        return workInProgress;0
      }0
      return null;0
    }0
    case HostComponent: {0
      popHostContext(workInProgress);0
      return null;0
    }0
    case TimeoutComponent: {0
      const effectTag = workInProgress.effectTag;0
      if (effectTag & ShouldCapture) {0
        workInProgress.effectTag = (effectTag & ~ShouldCapture) | DidCapture;0
        return workInProgress;0
      }0
      return null;0
    }0
    case HostPortal:0
      popHostContainer(workInProgress);0
      return null;0
    case ContextProvider:0
      popProvider(workInProgress);0
      return null;0
    default:0
      return null;0
  }0
}0
0
function unwindInterruptedWork(interruptedWork: Fiber) {0
  if (enableProfilerTimer) {0
    if (interruptedWork.mode & ProfileMode) {0
      // Resume in case we're picking up on work that was paused.0
      resumeActualRenderTimerIfPaused();0
      recordElapsedActualRenderTime(interruptedWork);0
    }0
  }0
0
  switch (interruptedWork.tag) {0
    case ClassComponent: {0
      popLegacyContextProvider(interruptedWork);0
      break;0
    }0
    case HostRoot: {0
      popHostContainer(interruptedWork);0
      popTopLevelLegacyContextObject(interruptedWork);0
      break;0
    }0
    case HostComponent: {0
      popHostContext(interruptedWork);0
      break;0
    }0
    case HostPortal:0
      popHostContainer(interruptedWork);0
      break;0
    case ContextProvider:0
      popProvider(interruptedWork);0
      break;0
    default:0
      break;0
  }0
}0
0
export {0
  throwException,0
  unwindWork,0
  unwindInterruptedWork,0
  createRootErrorUpdate,0
  createClassErrorUpdate,0
};0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {Fiber} from './ReactFiber';0
0
import getComponentName from 'shared/getComponentName';0
import {enableProfilerTimer} from 'shared/ReactFeatureFlags';0
0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
import {now} from './ReactFiberHostConfig';0
0
export type ProfilerTimer = {0
  checkActualRenderTimeStackEmpty(): void,0
  getCommitTime(): number,0
  markActualRenderTimeStarted(fiber: Fiber): void,0
  pauseActualRenderTimerIfRunning(): void,0
  recordElapsedActualRenderTime(fiber: Fiber): void,0
  resetActualRenderTimer(): void,0
  resumeActualRenderTimerIfPaused(): void,0
  recordCommitTime(): void,0
  recordElapsedBaseRenderTimeIfRunning(fiber: Fiber): void,0
  startBaseRenderTimer(): void,0
  stopBaseRenderTimerIfRunning(): void,0
};0
0
let commitTime: number = 0;0
0
function getCommitTime(): number {0
  return commitTime;0
}0
0
function recordCommitTime(): void {0
  if (!enableProfilerTimer) {0
    return;0
  }0
  commitTime = now();0
}0
0
/**0
 * The "actual" render time is total time required to render the descendants of a Profiler component.0
 * This time is stored as a stack, since Profilers can be nested.0
 * This time is started during the "begin" phase and stopped during the "complete" phase.0
 * It is paused (and accumulated) in the event of an interruption or an aborted render.0
 */0
0
let fiberStack: Array<Fiber | null>;0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  fiberStack = [];0
}0
0
let timerPausedAt: number = 0;0
let totalElapsedPauseTime: number = 0;0
0
function checkActualRenderTimeStackEmpty(): void {0
  if (!enableProfilerTimer) {0
    return;0
  }0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    warning(0
      fiberStack.length === 0,0
      'Expected an empty stack. Something was not reset properly.',0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
function markActualRenderTimeStarted(fiber: Fiber): void {0
  if (!enableProfilerTimer) {0
    return;0
  }0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    fiberStack.push(fiber);0
  }0
0
  fiber.actualDuration =0
    now() - ((fiber.actualDuration: any): number) - totalElapsedPauseTime;0
  fiber.actualStartTime = now();0
}0
0
function pauseActualRenderTimerIfRunning(): void {0
  if (!enableProfilerTimer) {0
    return;0
  }0
  if (timerPausedAt === 0) {0
    timerPausedAt = now();0
  }0
}0
0
function recordElapsedActualRenderTime(fiber: Fiber): void {0
  if (!enableProfilerTimer) {0
    return;0
  }0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    warning(0
      fiber === fiberStack.pop(),0
      'Unexpected Fiber (%s) popped.',0
      getComponentName(fiber),0
    );0
  }0
0
  fiber.actualDuration =0
    now() - totalElapsedPauseTime - ((fiber.actualDuration: any): number);0
}0
0
function resetActualRenderTimer(): void {0
  if (!enableProfilerTimer) {0
    return;0
  }0
  totalElapsedPauseTime = 0;0
}0
0
function resumeActualRenderTimerIfPaused(): void {0
  if (!enableProfilerTimer) {0
    return;0
  }0
  if (timerPausedAt > 0) {0
    totalElapsedPauseTime += now() - timerPausedAt;0
    timerPausedAt = 0;0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * The "base" render time is the duration of the “begin” phase of work for a particular fiber.0
 * This time is measured and stored on each fiber.0
 * The time for all sibling fibers are accumulated and stored on their parent during the "complete" phase.0
 * If a fiber bails out (sCU false) then its "base" timer is cancelled and the fiber is not updated.0
 */0
0
let baseStartTime: number = -1;0
0
function recordElapsedBaseRenderTimeIfRunning(fiber: Fiber): void {0
  if (!enableProfilerTimer) {0
    return;0
  }0
  if (baseStartTime !== -1) {0
    fiber.selfBaseTime = now() - baseStartTime;0
  }0
}0
0
function startBaseRenderTimer(): void {0
  if (!enableProfilerTimer) {0
    return;0
  }0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (baseStartTime !== -1) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'Cannot start base timer that is already running. ' +0
          'This error is likely caused by a bug in React. ' +0
          'Please file an issue.',0
      );0
    }0
  }0
  baseStartTime = now();0
}0
0
function stopBaseRenderTimerIfRunning(): void {0
  if (!enableProfilerTimer) {0
    return;0
  }0
  baseStartTime = -1;0
}0
0
export {0
  checkActualRenderTimeStackEmpty,0
  getCommitTime,0
  markActualRenderTimeStarted,0
  pauseActualRenderTimerIfRunning,0
  recordCommitTime,0
  recordElapsedActualRenderTime,0
  resetActualRenderTimer,0
  resumeActualRenderTimerIfPaused,0
  recordElapsedBaseRenderTimeIfRunning,0
  startBaseRenderTimer,0
  stopBaseRenderTimerIfRunning,0
};0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {Fiber} from './ReactFiber';0
0
import getComponentName from 'shared/getComponentName';0
import {getStackAddendumByWorkInProgressFiber} from 'shared/ReactFiberComponentTreeHook';0
import {StrictMode} from './ReactTypeOfMode';0
import lowPriorityWarning from 'shared/lowPriorityWarning';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
type LIFECYCLE =0
  | 'UNSAFE_componentWillMount'0
  | 'UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps'0
  | 'UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate';0
type LifecycleToComponentsMap = {[lifecycle: LIFECYCLE]: Array<Fiber>};0
type FiberToLifecycleMap = Map<Fiber, LifecycleToComponentsMap>;0
type FiberArray = Array<Fiber>;0
type FiberToFiberComponentsMap = Map<Fiber, FiberArray>;0
0
const ReactStrictModeWarnings = {0
  discardPendingWarnings(): void {},0
  flushPendingDeprecationWarnings(): void {},0
  flushPendingUnsafeLifecycleWarnings(): void {},0
  recordDeprecationWarnings(fiber: Fiber, instance: any): void {},0
  recordUnsafeLifecycleWarnings(fiber: Fiber, instance: any): void {},0
  recordLegacyContextWarning(fiber: Fiber, instance: any): void {},0
  flushLegacyContextWarning(): void {},0
};0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  const LIFECYCLE_SUGGESTIONS = {0
    UNSAFE_componentWillMount: 'componentDidMount',0
    UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps: 'static getDerivedStateFromProps',0
    UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate: 'componentDidUpdate',0
  };0
0
  let pendingComponentWillMountWarnings: Array<Fiber> = [];0
  let pendingComponentWillReceivePropsWarnings: Array<Fiber> = [];0
  let pendingComponentWillUpdateWarnings: Array<Fiber> = [];0
  let pendingUnsafeLifecycleWarnings: FiberToLifecycleMap = new Map();0
  let pendingLegacyContextWarning: FiberToFiberComponentsMap = new Map();0
0
  // Tracks components we have already warned about.0
  const didWarnAboutDeprecatedLifecycles = new Set();0
  const didWarnAboutUnsafeLifecycles = new Set();0
  const didWarnAboutLegacyContext = new Set();0
0
  const setToSortedString = set => {0
    const array = [];0
    set.forEach(value => {0
      array.push(value);0
    });0
    return array.sort().join(', ');0
  };0
0
  ReactStrictModeWarnings.discardPendingWarnings = () => {0
    pendingComponentWillMountWarnings = [];0
    pendingComponentWillReceivePropsWarnings = [];0
    pendingComponentWillUpdateWarnings = [];0
    pendingUnsafeLifecycleWarnings = new Map();0
    pendingLegacyContextWarning = new Map();0
  };0
0
  ReactStrictModeWarnings.flushPendingUnsafeLifecycleWarnings = () => {0
    ((pendingUnsafeLifecycleWarnings: any): FiberToLifecycleMap).forEach(0
      (lifecycleWarningsMap, strictRoot) => {0
        const lifecyclesWarningMesages = [];0
0
        Object.keys(lifecycleWarningsMap).forEach(lifecycle => {0
          const lifecycleWarnings = lifecycleWarningsMap[lifecycle];0
          if (lifecycleWarnings.length > 0) {0
            const componentNames = new Set();0
            lifecycleWarnings.forEach(fiber => {0
              componentNames.add(getComponentName(fiber) || 'Component');0
              didWarnAboutUnsafeLifecycles.add(fiber.type);0
            });0
0
            const formatted = lifecycle.replace('UNSAFE_', '');0
            const suggestion = LIFECYCLE_SUGGESTIONS[lifecycle];0
            const sortedComponentNames = setToSortedString(componentNames);0
0
            lifecyclesWarningMesages.push(0
              `${formatted}: Please update the following components to use ` +0
                `${suggestion} instead: ${sortedComponentNames}`,0
            );0
          }0
        });0
0
        if (lifecyclesWarningMesages.length > 0) {0
          const strictRootComponentStack = getStackAddendumByWorkInProgressFiber(0
            strictRoot,0
          );0
0
          warning(0
            false,0
            'Unsafe lifecycle methods were found within a strict-mode tree:%s' +0
              '\n\n%s' +0
              '\n\nLearn more about this warning here:' +0
              '\nhttps://fb.me/react-strict-mode-warnings',0
            strictRootComponentStack,0
            lifecyclesWarningMesages.join('\n\n'),0
          );0
        }0
      },0
    );0
0
    pendingUnsafeLifecycleWarnings = new Map();0
  };0
0
  const findStrictRoot = (fiber: Fiber): Fiber | null => {0
    let maybeStrictRoot = null;0
0
    let node = fiber;0
    while (node !== null) {0
      if (node.mode & StrictMode) {0
        maybeStrictRoot = node;0
      }0
      node = node.return;0
    }0
0
    return maybeStrictRoot;0
  };0
0
  ReactStrictModeWarnings.flushPendingDeprecationWarnings = () => {0
    if (pendingComponentWillMountWarnings.length > 0) {0
      const uniqueNames = new Set();0
      pendingComponentWillMountWarnings.forEach(fiber => {0
        uniqueNames.add(getComponentName(fiber) || 'Component');0
        didWarnAboutDeprecatedLifecycles.add(fiber.type);0
      });0
0
      const sortedNames = setToSortedString(uniqueNames);0
0
      lowPriorityWarning(0
        false,0
        'componentWillMount is deprecated and will be removed in the next major version. ' +0
          'Use componentDidMount instead. As a temporary workaround, ' +0
          'you can rename to UNSAFE_componentWillMount.' +0
          '\n\nPlease update the following components: %s' +0
          '\n\nLearn more about this warning here:' +0
          '\nhttps://fb.me/react-async-component-lifecycle-hooks',0
        sortedNames,0
      );0
0
      pendingComponentWillMountWarnings = [];0
    }0
0
    if (pendingComponentWillReceivePropsWarnings.length > 0) {0
      const uniqueNames = new Set();0
      pendingComponentWillReceivePropsWarnings.forEach(fiber => {0
        uniqueNames.add(getComponentName(fiber) || 'Component');0
        didWarnAboutDeprecatedLifecycles.add(fiber.type);0
      });0
0
      const sortedNames = setToSortedString(uniqueNames);0
0
      lowPriorityWarning(0
        false,0
        'componentWillReceiveProps is deprecated and will be removed in the next major version. ' +0
          'Use static getDerivedStateFromProps instead.' +0
          '\n\nPlease update the following components: %s' +0
          '\n\nLearn more about this warning here:' +0
          '\nhttps://fb.me/react-async-component-lifecycle-hooks',0
        sortedNames,0
      );0
0
      pendingComponentWillReceivePropsWarnings = [];0
    }0
0
    if (pendingComponentWillUpdateWarnings.length > 0) {0
      const uniqueNames = new Set();0
      pendingComponentWillUpdateWarnings.forEach(fiber => {0
        uniqueNames.add(getComponentName(fiber) || 'Component');0
        didWarnAboutDeprecatedLifecycles.add(fiber.type);0
      });0
0
      const sortedNames = setToSortedString(uniqueNames);0
0
      lowPriorityWarning(0
        false,0
        'componentWillUpdate is deprecated and will be removed in the next major version. ' +0
          'Use componentDidUpdate instead. As a temporary workaround, ' +0
          'you can rename to UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate.' +0
          '\n\nPlease update the following components: %s' +0
          '\n\nLearn more about this warning here:' +0
          '\nhttps://fb.me/react-async-component-lifecycle-hooks',0
        sortedNames,0
      );0
0
      pendingComponentWillUpdateWarnings = [];0
    }0
  };0
0
  ReactStrictModeWarnings.recordDeprecationWarnings = (0
    fiber: Fiber,0
    instance: any,0
  ) => {0
    // Dedup strategy: Warn once per component.0
    if (didWarnAboutDeprecatedLifecycles.has(fiber.type)) {0
      return;0
    }0
0
    // Don't warn about react-lifecycles-compat polyfilled components.0
    if (0
      typeof instance.componentWillMount === 'function' &&0
      instance.componentWillMount.__suppressDeprecationWarning !== true0
    ) {0
      pendingComponentWillMountWarnings.push(fiber);0
    }0
    if (0
      typeof instance.componentWillReceiveProps === 'function' &&0
      instance.componentWillReceiveProps.__suppressDeprecationWarning !== true0
    ) {0
      pendingComponentWillReceivePropsWarnings.push(fiber);0
    }0
    if (0
      typeof instance.componentWillUpdate === 'function' &&0
      instance.componentWillUpdate.__suppressDeprecationWarning !== true0
    ) {0
      pendingComponentWillUpdateWarnings.push(fiber);0
    }0
  };0
0
  ReactStrictModeWarnings.recordUnsafeLifecycleWarnings = (0
    fiber: Fiber,0
    instance: any,0
  ) => {0
    const strictRoot = findStrictRoot(fiber);0
    if (strictRoot === null) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'Expected to find a StrictMode component in a strict mode tree. ' +0
          'This error is likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
      );0
      return;0
    }0
0
    // Dedup strategy: Warn once per component.0
    // This is difficult to track any other way since component names0
    // are often vague and are likely to collide between 3rd party libraries.0
    // An expand property is probably okay to use here since it's DEV-only,0
    // and will only be set in the event of serious warnings.0
    if (didWarnAboutUnsafeLifecycles.has(fiber.type)) {0
      return;0
    }0
0
    let warningsForRoot;0
    if (!pendingUnsafeLifecycleWarnings.has(strictRoot)) {0
      warningsForRoot = {0
        UNSAFE_componentWillMount: [],0
        UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps: [],0
        UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate: [],0
      };0
0
      pendingUnsafeLifecycleWarnings.set(strictRoot, warningsForRoot);0
    } else {0
      warningsForRoot = pendingUnsafeLifecycleWarnings.get(strictRoot);0
    }0
0
    const unsafeLifecycles = [];0
    if (0
      (typeof instance.componentWillMount === 'function' &&0
        instance.componentWillMount.__suppressDeprecationWarning !== true) ||0
      typeof instance.UNSAFE_componentWillMount === 'function'0
    ) {0
      unsafeLifecycles.push('UNSAFE_componentWillMount');0
    }0
    if (0
      (typeof instance.componentWillReceiveProps === 'function' &&0
        instance.componentWillReceiveProps.__suppressDeprecationWarning !==0
          true) ||0
      typeof instance.UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps === 'function'0
    ) {0
      unsafeLifecycles.push('UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps');0
    }0
    if (0
      (typeof instance.componentWillUpdate === 'function' &&0
        instance.componentWillUpdate.__suppressDeprecationWarning !== true) ||0
      typeof instance.UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate === 'function'0
    ) {0
      unsafeLifecycles.push('UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate');0
    }0
0
    if (unsafeLifecycles.length > 0) {0
      unsafeLifecycles.forEach(lifecycle => {0
        ((warningsForRoot: any): LifecycleToComponentsMap)[lifecycle].push(0
          fiber,0
        );0
      });0
    }0
  };0
0
  ReactStrictModeWarnings.recordLegacyContextWarning = (0
    fiber: Fiber,0
    instance: any,0
  ) => {0
    const strictRoot = findStrictRoot(fiber);0
    if (strictRoot === null) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'Expected to find a StrictMode component in a strict mode tree. ' +0
          'This error is likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
      );0
      return;0
    }0
0
    // Dedup strategy: Warn once per component.0
    if (didWarnAboutLegacyContext.has(fiber.type)) {0
      return;0
    }0
0
    let warningsForRoot = pendingLegacyContextWarning.get(strictRoot);0
0
    if (0
      fiber.type.contextTypes != null ||0
      fiber.type.childContextTypes != null ||0
      (instance !== null && typeof instance.getChildContext === 'function')0
    ) {0
      if (warningsForRoot === undefined) {0
        warningsForRoot = [];0
        pendingLegacyContextWarning.set(strictRoot, warningsForRoot);0
      }0
      warningsForRoot.push(fiber);0
    }0
  };0
0
  ReactStrictModeWarnings.flushLegacyContextWarning = () => {0
    ((pendingLegacyContextWarning: any): FiberToFiberComponentsMap).forEach(0
      (fiberArray: FiberArray, strictRoot) => {0
        const uniqueNames = new Set();0
        fiberArray.forEach(fiber => {0
          uniqueNames.add(getComponentName(fiber) || 'Component');0
          didWarnAboutLegacyContext.add(fiber.type);0
        });0
0
        const sortedNames = setToSortedString(uniqueNames);0
        const strictRootComponentStack = getStackAddendumByWorkInProgressFiber(0
          strictRoot,0
        );0
0
        warning(0
          false,0
          'Legacy context API has been detected within a strict-mode tree: %s' +0
            '\n\nPlease update the following components: %s' +0
            '\n\nLearn more about this warning here:' +0
            '\nhttps://fb.me/react-strict-mode-warnings',0
          strictRootComponentStack,0
          sortedNames,0
        );0
      },0
    );0
  };0
}0
0
export default ReactStrictModeWarnings;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0

 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
export type TypeOfMode = number;0
0
export const NoContext = 0b000;0
export const AsyncMode = 0b001;0
export const StrictMode = 0b010;0
export const ProfileMode = 0b100;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
// UpdateQueue is a linked list of prioritized updates.0
//0
// Like fibers, update queues come in pairs: a current queue, which represents0
// the visible state of the screen, and a work-in-progress queue, which is0
// can be mutated and processed asynchronously before it is committed — a form0
// of double buffering. If a work-in-progress render is discarded before0
// finishing, we create a new work-in-progress by cloning the current queue.0
//0
// Both queues share a persistent, singly-linked list structure. To schedule an0
// update, we append it to the end of both queues. Each queue maintains a0
// pointer to first update in the persistent list that hasn't been processed.0
// The work-in-progress pointer always has a position equal to or greater than0
// the current queue, since we always work on that one. The current queue's0
// pointer is only updated during the commit phase, when we swap in the0
// work-in-progress.0
//0
// For example:0
//0
//   Current pointer:           A - B - C - D - E - F0
//   Work-in-progress pointer:              D - E - F0
//                                          ^0
//                                          The work-in-progress queue has0
//                                          processed more updates than current.0
//0
// The reason we append to both queues is because otherwise we might drop0
// updates without ever processing them. For example, if we only add updates to0
// the work-in-progress queue, some updates could be lost whenever a work-in0
// -progress render restarts by cloning from current. Similarly, if we only add0
// updates to the current queue, the updates will be lost whenever an already0
// in-progress queue commits and swaps with the current queue. However, by0
// adding to both queues, we guarantee that the update will be part of the next0
// work-in-progress. (And because the work-in-progress queue becomes the0
// current queue once it commits, there's no danger of applying the same0
// update twice.)0
//0
// Prioritization0
// --------------0
//0
// Updates are not sorted by priority, but by insertion; new updates are always0
// appended to the end of the list.0
//0
// The priority is still important, though. When processing the update queue0
// during the render phase, only the updates with sufficient priority are0
// included in the result. If we skip an update because it has insufficient0
// priority, it remains in the queue to be processed later, during a lower0
// priority render. Crucially, all updates subsequent to a skipped update also0
// remain in the queue *regardless of their priority*. That means high priority0
// updates are sometimes processed twice, at two separate priorities. We also0
// keep track of a base state, that represents the state before the first0
// update in the queue is applied.0
//0
// For example:0
//0
//   Given a base state of '', and the following queue of updates0
//0
//     A1 - B2 - C1 - D20
//0
//   where the number indicates the priority, and the update is applied to the0
//   previous state by appending a letter, React will process these updates as0
//   two separate renders, one per distinct priority level:0
//0
//   First render, at priority 1:0
//     Base state: ''0
//     Updates: [A1, C1]0
//     Result state: 'AC'0
//0
//   Second render, at priority 2:0
//     Base state: 'A'            <-  The base state does not include C1,0
//                                    because B2 was skipped.0
//     Updates: [B2, C1, D2]      <-  C1 was rebased on top of B20
//     Result state: 'ABCD'0
//0
// Because we process updates in insertion order, and rebase high priority0
// updates when preceding updates are skipped, the final result is deterministic0
// regardless of priority. Intermediate state may vary according to system0
// resources, but the final state is always the same.0
0
import type {Fiber} from './ReactFiber';0
import type {ExpirationTime} from './ReactFiberExpirationTime';0
0
import {NoWork} from './ReactFiberExpirationTime';0
import {0
  Callback,0
  ShouldCapture,0
  DidCapture,0
} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfSideEffect';0
import {ClassComponent} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfWork';0
0
import {0
  debugRenderPhaseSideEffects,0
  debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode,0
} from 'shared/ReactFeatureFlags';0
0
import {StrictMode} from './ReactTypeOfMode';0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
export type Update<State> = {0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
0
  tag: 0 | 1 | 2 | 3,0
  payload: any,0
  callback: (() => mixed) | null,0
0
  next: Update<State> | null,0
  nextEffect: Update<State> | null,0
};0
0
export type UpdateQueue<State> = {0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
  baseState: State,0
0
  firstUpdate: Update<State> | null,0
  lastUpdate: Update<State> | null,0
0
  firstCapturedUpdate: Update<State> | null,0
  lastCapturedUpdate: Update<State> | null,0
0
  firstEffect: Update<State> | null,0
  lastEffect: Update<State> | null,0
0
  firstCapturedEffect: Update<State> | null,0
  lastCapturedEffect: Update<State> | null,0
};0
0
export const UpdateState = 0;0
export const ReplaceState = 1;0
export const ForceUpdate = 2;0
export const CaptureUpdate = 3;0
0
// Global state that is reset at the beginning of calling `processUpdateQueue`.0
// It should only be read right after calling `processUpdateQueue`, via0
// `checkHasForceUpdateAfterProcessing`.0
let hasForceUpdate = false;0
0
let didWarnUpdateInsideUpdate;0
let currentlyProcessingQueue;0
export let resetCurrentlyProcessingQueue;0
if (__DEV__) {0
  didWarnUpdateInsideUpdate = false;0
  currentlyProcessingQueue = null;0
  resetCurrentlyProcessingQueue = () => {0
    currentlyProcessingQueue = null;0
  };0
}0
0
export function createUpdateQueue<State>(baseState: State): UpdateQueue<State> {0
  const queue: UpdateQueue<State> = {0
    expirationTime: NoWork,0
    baseState,0
    firstUpdate: null,0
    lastUpdate: null,0
    firstCapturedUpdate: null,0
    lastCapturedUpdate: null,0
    firstEffect: null,0
    lastEffect: null,0
    firstCapturedEffect: null,0
    lastCapturedEffect: null,0
  };0
  return queue;0
}0
0
function cloneUpdateQueue<State>(0
  currentQueue: UpdateQueue<State>,0
): UpdateQueue<State> {0
  const queue: UpdateQueue<State> = {0
    expirationTime: currentQueue.expirationTime,0
    baseState: currentQueue.baseState,0
    firstUpdate: currentQueue.firstUpdate,0
    lastUpdate: currentQueue.lastUpdate,0
0
    // TODO: With resuming, if we bail out and resuse the child tree, we should0
    // keep these effects.0
    firstCapturedUpdate: null,0
    lastCapturedUpdate: null,0
0
    firstEffect: null,0
    lastEffect: null,0
0
    firstCapturedEffect: null,0
    lastCapturedEffect: null,0
  };0
  return queue;0
}0
0
export function createUpdate(expirationTime: ExpirationTime): Update<*> {0
  return {0
    expirationTime: expirationTime,0
0
    tag: UpdateState,0
    payload: null,0
    callback: null,0
0
    next: null,0
    nextEffect: null,0
  };0
}0
0
function appendUpdateToQueue<State>(0
  queue: UpdateQueue<State>,0
  update: Update<State>,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
) {0
  // Append the update to the end of the list.0
  if (queue.lastUpdate === null) {0
    // Queue is empty0
    queue.firstUpdate = queue.lastUpdate = update;0
  } else {0
    queue.lastUpdate.next = update;0
    queue.lastUpdate = update;0
  }0
  if (0
    queue.expirationTime === NoWork ||0
    queue.expirationTime > expirationTime0
  ) {0
    // The incoming update has the earliest expiration of any update in the0
    // queue. Update the queue's expiration time.0
    queue.expirationTime = expirationTime;0
  }0
}0
0
export function enqueueUpdate<State>(0
  fiber: Fiber,0
  update: Update<State>,0
  expirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
) {0
  // Update queues are created lazily.0
  const alternate = fiber.alternate;0
  let queue1;0
  let queue2;0
  if (alternate === null) {0
    // There's only one fiber.0
    queue1 = fiber.updateQueue;0
    queue2 = null;0
    if (queue1 === null) {0
      queue1 = fiber.updateQueue = createUpdateQueue(fiber.memoizedState);0
    }0
  } else {0
    // There are two owners.0
    queue1 = fiber.updateQueue;0
    queue2 = alternate.updateQueue;0
    if (queue1 === null) {0
      if (queue2 === null) {0
        // Neither fiber has an update queue. Create new ones.0
        queue1 = fiber.updateQueue = createUpdateQueue(fiber.memoizedState);0
        queue2 = alternate.updateQueue = createUpdateQueue(0
          alternate.memoizedState,0
        );0
      } else {0
        // Only one fiber has an update queue. Clone to create a new one.0
        queue1 = fiber.updateQueue = cloneUpdateQueue(queue2);0
      }0
    } else {0
      if (queue2 === null) {0
        // Only one fiber has an update queue. Clone to create a new one.0
        queue2 = alternate.updateQueue = cloneUpdateQueue(queue1);0
      } else {0
        // Both owners have an update queue.0
      }0
    }0
  }0
  if (queue2 === null || queue1 === queue2) {0
    // There's only a single queue.0
    appendUpdateToQueue(queue1, update, expirationTime);0
  } else {0
    // There are two queues. We need to append the update to both queues,0
    // while accounting for the persistent structure of the list — we don't0
    // want the same update to be added multiple times.0
    if (queue1.lastUpdate === null || queue2.lastUpdate === null) {0
      // One of the queues is not empty. We must add the update to both queues.0
      appendUpdateToQueue(queue1, update, expirationTime);0
      appendUpdateToQueue(queue2, update, expirationTime);0
    } else {0
      // Both queues are non-empty. The last update is the same in both lists,0
      // because of structural sharing. So, only append to one of the lists.0
      appendUpdateToQueue(queue1, update, expirationTime);0
      // But we still need to update the `lastUpdate` pointer of queue2.0
      queue2.lastUpdate = update;0
    }0
  }0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (0
      fiber.tag === ClassComponent &&0
      (currentlyProcessingQueue === queue1 ||0
        (queue2 !== null && currentlyProcessingQueue === queue2)) &&0
      !didWarnUpdateInsideUpdate0
    ) {0
      warning(0
        false,0
        'An update (setState, replaceState, or forceUpdate) was scheduled ' +0
          'from inside an update function. Update functions should be pure, ' +0
          'with zero side-effects. Consider using componentDidUpdate or a ' +0
          'callback.',0
      );0
      didWarnUpdateInsideUpdate = true;0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
export function enqueueCapturedUpdate<State>(0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  update: Update<State>,0
  renderExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
) {0
  // Captured updates go into a separate list, and only on the work-in-0
  // progress queue.0
  let workInProgressQueue = workInProgress.updateQueue;0
  if (workInProgressQueue === null) {0
    workInProgressQueue = workInProgress.updateQueue = createUpdateQueue(0
      workInProgress.memoizedState,0
    );0
  } else {0
    // TODO: I put this here rather than createWorkInProgress so that we don't0
    // clone the queue unnecessarily. There's probably a better way to0
    // structure this.0
    workInProgressQueue = ensureWorkInProgressQueueIsAClone(0
      workInProgress,0
      workInProgressQueue,0
    );0
  }0
0
  // Append the update to the end of the list.0
  if (workInProgressQueue.lastCapturedUpdate === null) {0
    // This is the first render phase update0
    workInProgressQueue.firstCapturedUpdate = workInProgressQueue.lastCapturedUpdate = update;0
  } else {0
    workInProgressQueue.lastCapturedUpdate.next = update;0
    workInProgressQueue.lastCapturedUpdate = update;0
  }0
  if (0
    workInProgressQueue.expirationTime === NoWork ||0
    workInProgressQueue.expirationTime > renderExpirationTime0
  ) {0
    // The incoming update has the earliest expiration of any update in the0
    // queue. Update the queue's expiration time.0
    workInProgressQueue.expirationTime = renderExpirationTime;0
  }0
}0
0
function ensureWorkInProgressQueueIsAClone<State>(0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  queue: UpdateQueue<State>,0
): UpdateQueue<State> {0
  const current = workInProgress.alternate;0
  if (current !== null) {0
    // If the work-in-progress queue is equal to the current queue,0
    // we need to clone it first.0
    if (queue === current.updateQueue) {0
      queue = workInProgress.updateQueue = cloneUpdateQueue(queue);0
    }0
  }0
  return queue;0
}0
0
function getStateFromUpdate<State>(0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  queue: UpdateQueue<State>,0
  update: Update<State>,0
  prevState: State,0
  nextProps: any,0
  instance: any,0
): any {0
  switch (update.tag) {0
    case ReplaceState: {0
      const payload = update.payload;0
      if (typeof payload === 'function') {0
        // Updater function0
        if (__DEV__) {0
          if (0
            debugRenderPhaseSideEffects ||0
            (debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode &&0
              workInProgress.mode & StrictMode)0
          ) {0
            payload.call(instance, prevState, nextProps);0
          }0
        }0
        return payload.call(instance, prevState, nextProps);0
      }0
      // State object0
      return payload;0
    }0
    case CaptureUpdate: {0
      workInProgress.effectTag =0
        (workInProgress.effectTag & ~ShouldCapture) | DidCapture;0
    }0
    // Intentional fallthrough0
    case UpdateState: {0
      const payload = update.payload;0
      let partialState;0
      if (typeof payload === 'function') {0
        // Updater function0
        if (__DEV__) {0
          if (0
            debugRenderPhaseSideEffects ||0
            (debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode &&0
              workInProgress.mode & StrictMode)0
          ) {0
            payload.call(instance, prevState, nextProps);0
          }0
        }0
        partialState = payload.call(instance, prevState, nextProps);0
      } else {0
        // Partial state object0
        partialState = payload;0
      }0
      if (partialState === null || partialState === undefined) {0
        // Null and undefined are treated as no-ops.0
        return prevState;0
      }0
      // Merge the partial state and the previous state.0
      return Object.assign({}, prevState, partialState);0
    }0
    case ForceUpdate: {0
      hasForceUpdate = true;0
      return prevState;0
    }0
  }0
  return prevState;0
}0
0
export function processUpdateQueue<State>(0
  workInProgress: Fiber,0
  queue: UpdateQueue<State>,0
  props: any,0
  instance: any,0
  renderExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
): void {0
  hasForceUpdate = false;0
0
  if (0
    queue.expirationTime === NoWork ||0
    queue.expirationTime > renderExpirationTime0
  ) {0
    // Insufficient priority. Bailout.0
    return;0
  }0
0
  queue = ensureWorkInProgressQueueIsAClone(workInProgress, queue);0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    currentlyProcessingQueue = queue;0
  }0
0
  // These values may change as we process the queue.0
  let newBaseState = queue.baseState;0
  let newFirstUpdate = null;0
  let newExpirationTime = NoWork;0
0
  // Iterate through the list of updates to compute the result.0
  let update = queue.firstUpdate;0
  let resultState = newBaseState;0
  while (update !== null) {0
    const updateExpirationTime = update.expirationTime;0
    if (updateExpirationTime > renderExpirationTime) {0
      // This update does not have sufficient priority. Skip it.0
      if (newFirstUpdate === null) {0
        // This is the first skipped update. It will be the first update in0
        // the new list.0
        newFirstUpdate = update;0
        // Since this is the first update that was skipped, the current result0
        // is the new base state.0
        newBaseState = resultState;0
      }0
      // Since this update will remain in the list, update the remaining0
      // expiration time.0
      if (0
        newExpirationTime === NoWork ||0
        newExpirationTime > updateExpirationTime0
      ) {0
        newExpirationTime = updateExpirationTime;0
      }0
    } else {0
      // This update does have sufficient priority. Process it and compute0
      // a new result.0
      resultState = getStateFromUpdate(0
        workInProgress,0
        queue,0
        update,0
        resultState,0
        props,0
        instance,0
      );0
      const callback = update.callback;0
      if (callback !== null) {0
        workInProgress.effectTag |= Callback;0
        // Set this to null, in case it was mutated during an aborted render.0
        update.nextEffect = null;0
        if (queue.lastEffect === null) {0
          queue.firstEffect = queue.lastEffect = update;0
        } else {0
          queue.lastEffect.nextEffect = update;0
          queue.lastEffect = update;0
        }0
      }0
    }0
    // Continue to the next update.0
    update = update.next;0
  }0
0
  // Separately, iterate though the list of captured updates.0
  let newFirstCapturedUpdate = null;0
  update = queue.firstCapturedUpdate;0
  while (update !== null) {0
    const updateExpirationTime = update.expirationTime;0
    if (updateExpirationTime > renderExpirationTime) {0
      // This update does not have sufficient priority. Skip it.0
      if (newFirstCapturedUpdate === null) {0
        // This is the first skipped captured update. It will be the first0
        // update in the new list.0
        newFirstCapturedUpdate = update;0
        // If this is the first update that was skipped, the current result is0
        // the new base state.0
        if (newFirstUpdate === null) {0
          newBaseState = resultState;0
        }0
      }0
      // Since this update will remain in the list, update the remaining0
      // expiration time.0
      if (0
        newExpirationTime === NoWork ||0
        newExpirationTime > updateExpirationTime0
      ) {0
        newExpirationTime = updateExpirationTime;0
      }0
    } else {0
      // This update does have sufficient priority. Process it and compute0
      // a new result.0
      resultState = getStateFromUpdate(0
        workInProgress,0
        queue,0
        update,0
        resultState,0
        props,0
        instance,0
      );0
      const callback = update.callback;0
      if (callback !== null) {0
        workInProgress.effectTag |= Callback;0
        // Set this to null, in case it was mutated during an aborted render.0
        update.nextEffect = null;0
        if (queue.lastCapturedEffect === null) {0
          queue.firstCapturedEffect = queue.lastCapturedEffect = update;0
        } else {0
          queue.lastCapturedEffect.nextEffect = update;0
          queue.lastCapturedEffect = update;0
        }0
      }0
    }0
    update = update.next;0
  }0
0
  if (newFirstUpdate === null) {0
    queue.lastUpdate = null;0
  }0
  if (newFirstCapturedUpdate === null) {0
    queue.lastCapturedUpdate = null;0
  } else {0
    workInProgress.effectTag |= Callback;0
  }0
  if (newFirstUpdate === null && newFirstCapturedUpdate === null) {0
    // We processed every update, without skipping. That means the new base0
    // state is the same as the result state.0
    newBaseState = resultState;0
  }0
0
  queue.baseState = newBaseState;0
  queue.firstUpdate = newFirstUpdate;0
  queue.firstCapturedUpdate = newFirstCapturedUpdate;0
  queue.expirationTime = newExpirationTime;0
0
  workInProgress.memoizedState = resultState;0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    currentlyProcessingQueue = null;0
  }0
}0
0
function callCallback(callback, context) {0
  invariant(0
    typeof callback === 'function',0
    'Invalid argument passed as callback. Expected a function. Instead ' +0
      'received: %s',0
    callback,0
  );0
  callback.call(context);0
}0
0
export function resetHasForceUpdateBeforeProcessing() {0
  hasForceUpdate = false;0
}0
0
export function checkHasForceUpdateAfterProcessing(): boolean {0
  return hasForceUpdate;0
}0
0
export function commitUpdateQueue<State>(0
  finishedWork: Fiber,0
  finishedQueue: UpdateQueue<State>,0
  instance: any,0
  renderExpirationTime: ExpirationTime,0
): void {0
  // If the finished render included captured updates, and there are still0
  // lower priority updates left over, we need to keep the captured updates0
  // in the queue so that they are rebased and not dropped once we process the0
  // queue again at the lower priority.0
  if (finishedQueue.firstCapturedUpdate !== null) {0
    // Join the captured update list to the end of the normal list.0
    if (finishedQueue.lastUpdate !== null) {0
      finishedQueue.lastUpdate.next = finishedQueue.firstCapturedUpdate;0
      finishedQueue.lastUpdate = finishedQueue.lastCapturedUpdate;0
    }0
    // Clear the list of captured updates.0
    finishedQueue.firstCapturedUpdate = finishedQueue.lastCapturedUpdate = null;0
  }0
0
  // Commit the effects0
  let effect = finishedQueue.firstEffect;0
  finishedQueue.firstEffect = finishedQueue.lastEffect = null;0
  while (effect !== null) {0
    const callback = effect.callback;0
    if (callback !== null) {0
      effect.callback = null;0
      callCallback(callback, instance);0
    }0
    effect = effect.nextEffect;0
  }0
0
  effect = finishedQueue.firstCapturedEffect;0
  finishedQueue.firstCapturedEffect = finishedQueue.lastCapturedEffect = null;0
  while (effect !== null) {0
    const callback = effect.callback;0
    if (callback !== null) {0
      effect.callback = null;0
      callCallback(callback, instance);0
    }0
    effect = effect.nextEffect;0
  }0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactFeatureFlags;0
let ReactNoop;0
0
describe('ReactExpiration', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode = false;0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
  });0
0
  function span(prop) {0
    return {type: 'span', children: [], prop};0
  }0
0
  it('increases priority of updates as time progresses', () => {0
    ReactNoop.render(<span prop="done" />);0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Nothing has expired yet because time hasn't advanced.0
    ReactNoop.flushExpired();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Advance time a bit, but not enough to expire the low pri update.0
    ReactNoop.expire(4500);0
    ReactNoop.flushExpired();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Advance by another second. Now the update should expire and flush.0
    ReactNoop.expire(1000);0
    ReactNoop.flushExpired();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('done')]);0
  });0
0
  it('two updates of like priority in the same event always flush within the same batch', () => {0
    class Text extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ReactNoop.yield(`${this.props.text} [commit]`);0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ReactNoop.yield(`${this.props.text} [commit]`);0
      }0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield(`${this.props.text} [render]`);0
        return <span prop={this.props.text} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    // First, show what happens for updates in two separate events.0
    // Schedule an update.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Text text="A" />);0
    // Advance the timer and flush any work that expired. Flushing the expired0
    // work signals to the renderer that the event has ended.0
    ReactNoop.advanceTime(2000);0
    // Don't advance time by enough to expire the first update.0
    expect(ReactNoop.flushExpired()).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
    // Schedule another update.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Text text="B" />);0
    // The updates should flush in separate batches, since sufficient time0
    // passed in between them *and* they occurred in separate events.0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'A [render]',0
      'A [commit]',0
      'B [render]',0
      'B [commit]',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('B')]);0
0
    // Now do the same thing again, except this time don't flush any work in0
    // between the two updates.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Text text="A" />);0
    // Advance the timer, but don't flush the expired work. Because we still0
    // haven't entered an idle callback, the scheduler must assume that we're0
    // inside the same event.0
    ReactNoop.advanceTime(2000);0
    expect(ReactNoop.clearYields()).toEqual(null);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('B')]);0
    // Schedule another update.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Text text="B" />);0
    // The updates should flush in the same batch, since as far as the scheduler0
    // knows, they may have occurred inside the same event.0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['B [render]', 'B [commit]']);0
  });0
0
  it(0
    'two updates of like priority in the same event always flush within the ' +0
      "same batch, even if there's a sync update in between",0
    () => {0
      class Text extends React.Component {0
        componentDidMount() {0
          ReactNoop.yield(`${this.props.text} [commit]`);0
        }0
        componentDidUpdate() {0
          ReactNoop.yield(`${this.props.text} [commit]`);0
        }0
        render() {0
          ReactNoop.yield(`${this.props.text} [render]`);0
          return <span prop={this.props.text} />;0
        }0
      }0
0
      // First, show what happens for updates in two separate events.0
      // Schedule an update.0
      ReactNoop.render(<Text text="A" />);0
      // Advance the timer and flush any work that expired. Flushing the expired0
      // work signals to the renderer that the event has ended.0
      ReactNoop.advanceTime(2000);0
      // Don't advance time by enough to expire the first update.0
      expect(ReactNoop.flushExpired()).toEqual([]);0
      expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
      // Schedule another update.0
      ReactNoop.render(<Text text="B" />);0
      // The updates should flush in separate batches, since sufficient time0
      // passed in between them *and* they occurred in separate events.0
      expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
        'A [render]',0
        'A [commit]',0
        'B [render]',0
        'B [commit]',0
      ]);0
      expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('B')]);0
0
      // Now do the same thing again, except this time don't flush any work in0
      // between the two updates.0
      ReactNoop.render(<Text text="A" />);0
      // Advance the timer, but don't flush the expired work. Because we still0
      // haven't entered an idle callback, the scheduler must assume that we're0
      // inside the same event.0
      ReactNoop.advanceTime(2000);0
      expect(ReactNoop.clearYields()).toEqual(null);0
      expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('B')]);0
0
      // Perform some synchronous work. Again, the scheduler must assume we're0
      // inside the same event.0
      ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
        ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID('1', 'second-root');0
      });0
0
      // Even though React flushed a sync update, it should not have updated the0
      // current time. Schedule another update.0
      ReactNoop.render(<Text text="B" />);0
      // The updates should flush in the same batch, since as far as the scheduler0
      // knows, they may have occurred inside the same event.0
      expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['B [render]', 'B [commit]']);0
    },0
  );0
0
  it('cannot update at the same expiration time that is already rendering', () => {0
    let store = {text: 'initial'};0
    let subscribers = [];0
    class Connected extends React.Component {0
      state = {text: store.text};0
      componentDidMount() {0
        subscribers.push(this);0
        ReactNoop.yield(`${this.state.text} [${this.props.label}] [commit]`);0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ReactNoop.yield(`${this.state.text} [${this.props.label}] [commit]`);0
      }0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield(`${this.state.text} [${this.props.label}] [render]`);0
        return <span prop={this.state.text} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function App() {0
      return (0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <Connected label="A" />0
          <Connected label="B" />0
          <Connected label="C" />0
          <Connected label="D" />0
        </React.Fragment>0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Initial mount0
    ReactNoop.render(<App />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'initial [A] [render]',0
      'initial [B] [render]',0
      'initial [C] [render]',0
      'initial [D] [render]',0
      'initial [A] [commit]',0
      'initial [B] [commit]',0
      'initial [C] [commit]',0
      'initial [D] [commit]',0
    ]);0
0
    // Partial update0
    subscribers.forEach(s => s.setState({text: '1'}));0
    ReactNoop.flushThrough(['1 [A] [render]', '1 [B] [render]']);0
0
    // Before the update can finish, update again. Even though no time has0
    // advanced, this update should be given a different expiration time than0
    // the currently rendering one. So, C and D should render with 1, not 2.0
    subscribers.forEach(s => s.setState({text: '2'}));0
    ReactNoop.flushThrough(['1 [C] [render]', '1 [D] [render]']);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactFiberReconciler;0
0
describe('ReactFiberHostContext', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactFiberReconciler = require('react-reconciler');0
  });0
0
  it('works with null host context', () => {0
    let creates = 0;0
    const Renderer = ReactFiberReconciler({0
      prepareForCommit: function() {},0
      resetAfterCommit: function() {},0
      getRootHostContext: function() {0
        return null;0
      },0
      getChildHostContext: function() {0
        return null;0
      },0
      shouldSetTextContent: function() {0
        return false;0
      },0
      createInstance: function() {0
        creates++;0
      },0
      finalizeInitialChildren: function() {0
        return null;0
      },0
      appendInitialChild: function() {0
        return null;0
      },0
      now: function() {0
        return 0;0
      },0
      appendChildToContainer: function() {0
        return null;0
      },0
      supportsMutation: true,0
    });0
0
    const container = Renderer.createContainer(/* root: */ null);0
    Renderer.updateContainer(0
      <a>0
        <b />0
      </a>,0
      container,0
      /* parentComponent: */ null,0
      /* callback: */ null,0
    );0
    expect(creates).toBe(2);0
  });0
0
  it('should send the context to prepareForCommit and resetAfterCommit', () => {0
    let rootContext = {};0
    const Renderer = ReactFiberReconciler({0
      prepareForCommit: function(hostContext) {0
        expect(hostContext).toBe(rootContext);0
      },0
      resetAfterCommit: function(hostContext) {0
        expect(hostContext).toBe(rootContext);0
      },0
      getRootHostContext: function() {0
        return null;0
      },0
      getChildHostContext: function() {0
        return null;0
      },0
      shouldSetTextContent: function() {0
        return false;0
      },0
      createInstance: function() {0
        return null;0
      },0
      finalizeInitialChildren: function() {0
        return null;0
      },0
      appendInitialChild: function() {0
        return null;0
      },0
      now: function() {0
        return 0;0
      },0
      appendChildToContainer: function() {0
        return null;0
      },0
      supportsMutation: true,0
    });0
0
    const container = Renderer.createContainer(rootContext);0
    Renderer.updateContainer(0
      <a>0
        <b />0
      </a>,0
      container,0
      /* parentComponent: */ null,0
      /* callback: */ null,0
    );0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactNoop;0
0
describe('ReactFragment', () => {0
  beforeEach(function() {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
  });0
0
  function span(prop) {0
    return {type: 'span', children: [], prop};0
  }0
0
  function text(val) {0
    return {text: val};0
  }0
0
  function div(...children) {0
    children = children.map(c => (typeof c === 'string' ? {text: c} : c));0
    return {type: 'div', children, prop: undefined};0
  }0
0
  it('should render a single child via noop renderer', () => {0
    const element = (0
      <React.Fragment>0
        <span>foo</span>0
      </React.Fragment>0
    );0
0
    ReactNoop.render(element);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span()]);0
  });0
0
  it('should render zero children via noop renderer', () => {0
    const element = <React.Fragment />;0
0
    ReactNoop.render(element);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
  });0
0
  it('should render multiple children via noop renderer', () => {0
    const element = (0
      <React.Fragment>0
        hello <span>world</span>0
      </React.Fragment>0
    );0
0
    ReactNoop.render(element);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([text('hello '), span()]);0
  });0
0
  it('should render an iterable via noop renderer', () => {0
    const element = (0
      <React.Fragment>0
        {new Set([<span key="a">hi</span>, <span key="b">bye</span>])}0
      </React.Fragment>0
    );0
0
    ReactNoop.render(element);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(), span()]);0
  });0
0
  it('should preserve state of children with 1 level nesting', function() {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('Update Stateful');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo({condition}) {0
      return condition ? (0
        <Stateful key="a" />0
      ) : (0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <Stateful key="a" />0
          <div key="b">World</div>0
        </React.Fragment>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Update Stateful']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(), div()]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Update Stateful', 'Update Stateful']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
  });0
0
  it('should preserve state between top-level fragments', function() {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('Update Stateful');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo({condition}) {0
      return condition ? (0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <Stateful />0
        </React.Fragment>0
      ) : (0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <Stateful />0
        </React.Fragment>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Update Stateful']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Update Stateful', 'Update Stateful']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
  });0
0
  it('should preserve state of children nested at same level', function() {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('Update Stateful');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo({condition}) {0
      return condition ? (0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <React.Fragment>0
            <React.Fragment>0
              <Stateful key="a" />0
            </React.Fragment>0
          </React.Fragment>0
        </React.Fragment>0
      ) : (0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <React.Fragment>0
            <React.Fragment>0
              <div />0
              <Stateful key="a" />0
            </React.Fragment>0
          </React.Fragment>0
        </React.Fragment>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Update Stateful']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(), div()]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Update Stateful', 'Update Stateful']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
  });0
0
  it('should not preserve state in non-top-level fragment nesting', function() {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('Update Stateful');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo({condition}) {0
      return condition ? (0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <React.Fragment>0
            <Stateful key="a" />0
          </React.Fragment>0
        </React.Fragment>0
      ) : (0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <Stateful key="a" />0
        </React.Fragment>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
  });0
0
  it('should not preserve state of children if nested 2 levels without siblings', function() {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('Update Stateful');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo({condition}) {0
      return condition ? (0
        <Stateful key="a" />0
      ) : (0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <React.Fragment>0
            <Stateful key="a" />0
          </React.Fragment>0
        </React.Fragment>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
  });0
0
  it('should not preserve state of children if nested 2 levels with siblings', function() {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('Update Stateful');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo({condition}) {0
      return condition ? (0
        <Stateful key="a" />0
      ) : (0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <React.Fragment>0
            <Stateful key="a" />0
          </React.Fragment>0
          <div />0
        </React.Fragment>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(), div()]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
  });0
0
  it('should preserve state between array nested in fragment and fragment', function() {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('Update Stateful');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo({condition}) {0
      return condition ? (0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <Stateful key="a" />0
        </React.Fragment>0
      ) : (0
        <React.Fragment>{[<Stateful key="a" />]}</React.Fragment>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Update Stateful']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Update Stateful', 'Update Stateful']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
  });0
0
  it('should preserve state between top level fragment and array', function() {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('Update Stateful');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo({condition}) {0
      return condition ? (0
        [<Stateful key="a" />]0
      ) : (0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <Stateful key="a" />0
        </React.Fragment>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Update Stateful']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Update Stateful', 'Update Stateful']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
  });0
0
  it('should not preserve state between array nested in fragment and double nested fragment', function() {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('Update Stateful');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo({condition}) {0
      return condition ? (0
        <React.Fragment>{[<Stateful key="a" />]}</React.Fragment>0
      ) : (0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <React.Fragment>0
            <Stateful key="a" />0
          </React.Fragment>0
        </React.Fragment>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
  });0
0
  it('should not preserve state between array nested in fragment and double nested array', function() {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('Update Stateful');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo({condition}) {0
      return condition ? (0
        <React.Fragment>{[<Stateful key="a" />]}</React.Fragment>0
      ) : (0
        [[<Stateful key="a" />]]0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
  });0
0
  it('should preserve state between double nested fragment and double nested array', function() {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('Update Stateful');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo({condition}) {0
      return condition ? (0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <React.Fragment>0
            <Stateful key="a" />0
          </React.Fragment>0
        </React.Fragment>0
      ) : (0
        [[<Stateful key="a" />]]0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Update Stateful']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Update Stateful', 'Update Stateful']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
  });0
0
  it('should not preserve state of children when the keys are different', function() {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('Update Stateful');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo({condition}) {0
      return condition ? (0
        <React.Fragment key="a">0
          <Stateful />0
        </React.Fragment>0
      ) : (0
        <React.Fragment key="b">0
          <Stateful />0
          <span>World</span>0
        </React.Fragment>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(), span()]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
  });0
0
  it('should not preserve state between unkeyed and keyed fragment', function() {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('Update Stateful');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo({condition}) {0
      return condition ? (0
        <React.Fragment key="a">0
          <Stateful />0
        </React.Fragment>0
      ) : (0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <Stateful />0
        </React.Fragment>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
  });0
0
  it('should preserve state with reordering in multiple levels', function() {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('Update Stateful');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo({condition}) {0
      return condition ? (0
        <div>0
          <React.Fragment key="c">0
            <span>foo</span>0
            <div key="b">0
              <Stateful key="a" />0
            </div>0
          </React.Fragment>0
          <span>boop</span>0
        </div>0
      ) : (0
        <div>0
          <span>beep</span>0
          <React.Fragment key="c">0
            <div key="b">0
              <Stateful key="a" />0
            </div>0
            <span>bar</span>0
          </React.Fragment>0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Update Stateful']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(span(), div(div()), span())]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Update Stateful', 'Update Stateful']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(span(), div(div()), span())]);0
  });0
0
  it('should not preserve state when switching to a keyed fragment to an array', function() {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('Update Stateful');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo({condition}) {0
      return condition ? (0
        <div>0
          {0
            <React.Fragment key="foo">0
              <Stateful />0
            </React.Fragment>0
          }0
          <span />0
        </div>0
      ) : (0
        <div>0
          {[<Stateful />]}0
          <span />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={false} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toWarnDev(0
      'Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique "key" prop.',0
    );0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(div(), span())]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(div(), span())]);0
  });0
0
  it('should preserve state when it does not change positions', function() {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('Update Stateful');0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo({condition}) {0
      return condition0
        ? [0
            <span />,0
            <React.Fragment>0
              <Stateful />0
