            </React.Fragment>,0
          ]0
        : [0
            <span />,0
            <React.Fragment>0
              <Stateful />0
            </React.Fragment>,0
          ];0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toWarnDev(0
      'Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique "key" prop.',0
    );0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={false} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toWarnDev(0
      'Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique "key" prop.',0
    );0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Update Stateful']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(), div()]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo condition={true} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toWarnDev(0
      'Each child in an array or iterator should have a unique "key" prop.',0
    );0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Update Stateful', 'Update Stateful']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(), div()]);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactFeatureFlags;0
let ReactNoop;0
let PropTypes;0
0
describe('ReactIncremental', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode = false;0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
    PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
  });0
0
  it('should render a simple component', () => {0
    function Bar() {0
      return <div>Hello World</div>;0
    }0
0
    function Foo() {0
      return <Bar isBar={true} />;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
  });0
0
  it('should render a simple component, in steps if needed', () => {0
    let renderCallbackCalled = false;0
    let barCalled = false;0
    function Bar() {0
      barCalled = true;0
      return (0
        <span>0
          <div>Hello World</div>0
        </span>0
      );0
    }0
0
    let fooCalled = false;0
    function Foo() {0
      fooCalled = true;0
      return [<Bar key="a" isBar={true} />, <Bar key="b" isBar={true} />];0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />, () => (renderCallbackCalled = true));0
    expect(fooCalled).toBe(false);0
    expect(barCalled).toBe(false);0
    expect(renderCallbackCalled).toBe(false);0
    // Do one step of work.0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(7 + 5);0
    expect(fooCalled).toBe(true);0
    expect(barCalled).toBe(false);0
    expect(renderCallbackCalled).toBe(false);0
    // Do the rest of the work.0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(50);0
    expect(fooCalled).toBe(true);0
    expect(barCalled).toBe(true);0
    expect(renderCallbackCalled).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('updates a previous render', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    function Header() {0
      ops.push('Header');0
      return <h1>Hi</h1>;0
    }0
0
    function Content(props) {0
      ops.push('Content');0
      return <div>{props.children}</div>;0
    }0
0
    function Footer() {0
      ops.push('Footer');0
      return <footer>Bye</footer>;0
    }0
0
    const header = <Header />;0
    const footer = <Footer />;0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      ops.push('Foo');0
      return (0
        <div>0
          {header}0
          <Content>{props.text}</Content>0
          {footer}0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="foo" />, () =>0
      ops.push('renderCallbackCalled'),0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'Foo',0
      'Header',0
      'Content',0
      'Footer',0
      'renderCallbackCalled',0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="bar" />, () =>0
      ops.push('firstRenderCallbackCalled'),0
    );0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="bar" />, () =>0
      ops.push('secondRenderCallbackCalled'),0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    // TODO: Test bail out of host components. This is currently unobservable.0
0
    // Since this is an update, it should bail out and reuse the work from0
    // Header and Content.0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'Foo',0
      'Content',0
      'firstRenderCallbackCalled',0
      'secondRenderCallbackCalled',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('can cancel partially rendered work and restart', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    function Bar(props) {0
      ops.push('Bar');0
      return <div>{props.children}</div>;0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      ops.push('Foo');0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <Bar>{props.text}</Bar>0
          <Bar>{props.text}</Bar>0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Init0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="foo" />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="bar" />);0
    // Flush part of the work0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(20 + 5);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // This will abort the previous work and restart0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => ReactNoop.render(null));0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="baz" />);0
    ReactNoop.clearYields();0
0
    // Flush part of the new work0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(20 + 5);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar']);0
0
    // Flush the rest of the work which now includes the low priority0
    ReactNoop.flush(20);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Bar']);0
  });0
0
  it('should call callbacks even if updates are aborted', () => {0
    const ops = [];0
    let inst;0
0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        this.state = {0
          text: 'foo',0
          text2: 'foo',0
        };0
        inst = this;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <div>{this.state.text}</div>0
            <div>{this.state.text2}</div>0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    inst.setState(0
      () => {0
        ops.push('setState1');0
        return {text: 'bar'};0
      },0
      () => ops.push('callback1'),0
    );0
0
    // Flush part of the work0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(20 + 5);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['setState1']);0
0
    // This will abort the previous work and restart0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => ReactNoop.render(<Foo />));0
    inst.setState(0
      () => {0
        ops.push('setState2');0
        return {text2: 'baz'};0
      },0
      () => ops.push('callback2'),0
    );0
0
    // Flush the rest of the work which now includes the low priority0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'setState1',0
      'setState1',0
      'setState2',0
      'callback1',0
      'callback2',0
    ]);0
    expect(inst.state).toEqual({text: 'bar', text2: 'baz'});0
  });0
0
  it('can deprioritize unfinished work and resume it later', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    function Bar(props) {0
      ops.push('Bar');0
      return <div>{props.children}</div>;0
    }0
0
    function Middle(props) {0
      ops.push('Middle');0
      return <span>{props.children}</span>;0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      ops.push('Foo');0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <Bar>{props.text}</Bar>0
          <section hidden={true}>0
            <Middle>{props.text}</Middle>0
          </section>0
          <Bar>{props.text}</Bar>0
          <footer hidden={true}>0
            <Middle>Footer</Middle>0
          </footer>0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Init0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="foo" />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Bar', 'Middle', 'Middle']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Render part of the work. This should be enough to flush everything except0
    // the middle which has lower priority.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="bar" />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(40);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Bar']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Flush only the remaining work0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Middle', 'Middle']);0
  });0
0
  it('can deprioritize a tree from without dropping work', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    function Bar(props) {0
      ops.push('Bar');0
      return <div>{props.children}</div>;0
    }0
0
    function Middle(props) {0
      ops.push('Middle');0
      return <span>{props.children}</span>;0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      ops.push('Foo');0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <Bar>{props.text}</Bar>0
          <section hidden={true}>0
            <Middle>{props.text}</Middle>0
          </section>0
          <Bar>{props.text}</Bar>0
          <footer hidden={true}>0
            <Middle>Footer</Middle>0
          </footer>0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Init0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="foo" />);0
    });0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Bar', 'Middle', 'Middle']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Render the high priority work (everying except the hidden trees).0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="foo" />);0
    });0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Bar']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // The hidden content was deprioritized from high to low priority. A low0
    // priority callback should have been scheduled. Flush it now.0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Middle', 'Middle']);0
  });0
0
  xit('can resume work in a subtree even when a parent bails out', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    function Bar(props) {0
      ops.push('Bar');0
      return <div>{props.children}</div>;0
    }0
0
    function Tester() {0
      // This component is just here to ensure that the bail out is0
      // in fact in effect in the expected place for this test.0
      ops.push('Tester');0
      return <div />;0
    }0
0
    function Middle(props) {0
      ops.push('Middle');0
      return <span>{props.children}</span>;0
    }0
0
    const middleContent = (0
      <aaa>0
        <Tester />0
        <bbb hidden={true}>0
          <ccc>0
            <Middle>Hi</Middle>0
          </ccc>0
        </bbb>0
      </aaa>0
    );0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      ops.push('Foo');0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <Bar>{props.text}</Bar>0
          {middleContent}0
          <Bar>{props.text}</Bar>0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Init0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="foo" />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(52);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Tester', 'Bar']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // We're now rendering an update that will bail out on updating middle.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="bar" />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(45 + 5);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Bar']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Flush the rest to make sure that the bailout didn't block this work.0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Middle']);0
  });0
0
  xit('can resume work in a bailed subtree within one pass', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    function Bar(props) {0
      ops.push('Bar');0
      return <div>{props.children}</div>;0
    }0
0
    class Tester extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        // This component is just here to ensure that the bail out is0
        // in fact in effect in the expected place for this test.0
        ops.push('Tester');0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Middle(props) {0
      ops.push('Middle');0
      return <span>{props.children}</span>;0
    }0
0
    // Should content not just bail out on current, not workInProgress?0
0
    class Content extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return [0
          <Tester key="a" unused={this.props.unused} />,0
          <bbb key="b" hidden={true}>0
            <ccc>0
              <Middle>Hi</Middle>0
            </ccc>0
          </bbb>,0
        ];0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      ops.push('Foo');0
      return (0
        <div hidden={props.text === 'bar'}>0
          <Bar>{props.text}</Bar>0
          <Content unused={props.text} />0
          <Bar>{props.text}</Bar>0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Init0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="foo" />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(52 + 5);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Tester', 'Bar']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Make a quick update which will create a low pri tree on top of the0
    // already low pri tree.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="bar" />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(15);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // At this point, middle will bail out but it has not yet fully rendered.0
    // Since that is the same priority as its parent tree. This should render0
    // as a single batch. Therefore, it is correct that Middle should be in the0
    // middle. If it occurs after the two "Bar" components then it was flushed0
    // after them which is not correct.0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Bar', 'Middle', 'Bar']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Let us try this again without fully finishing the first time. This will0
    // create a hanging subtree that is reconciling at the normal priority.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="foo" />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(40);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // This update will create a tree that aborts that work and down-prioritizes0
    // it. If the priority levels aren't down-prioritized correctly this may0
    // abort rendering of the down-prioritized content.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="bar" />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Bar']);0
  });0
0
  xit('can resume mounting a class component', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
    let foo;0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <Foo prop={this.props.prop} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        // Test based on a www bug where props was null on resume0
        ops.push('Foo constructor: ' + props.prop);0
      }0
      render() {0
        foo = this;0
        ops.push('Foo');0
        return <Bar />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Bar() {0
      ops.push('Bar');0
      return <div />;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent prop="foo" />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(20);0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo constructor: foo', 'Foo']);0
0
    foo.setState({value: 'bar'});0
0
    ops = [];0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar']);0
  });0
0
  xit('reuses the same instance when resuming a class instance', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
    let foo;0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <Foo prop={this.props.prop} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let constructorCount = 0;0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        // Test based on a www bug where props was null on resume0
        ops.push('constructor: ' + props.prop);0
        constructorCount++;0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        ops.push('componentWillMount: ' + this.props.prop);0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {0
        ops.push('componentWillReceiveProps: ' + this.props.prop);0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ops.push('componentDidMount: ' + this.props.prop);0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {0
        ops.push('componentWillUpdate: ' + this.props.prop);0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('componentDidUpdate: ' + this.props.prop);0
      }0
      render() {0
        foo = this;0
        ops.push('render: ' + this.props.prop);0
        return <Bar />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Bar() {0
      ops.push('Foo did complete');0
      return <div />;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent prop="foo" />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(25);0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'constructor: foo',0
      'componentWillMount: foo',0
      'render: foo',0
      'Foo did complete',0
    ]);0
0
    foo.setState({value: 'bar'});0
0
    ops = [];0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(constructorCount).toEqual(1);0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'componentWillMount: foo',0
      'render: foo',0
      'Foo did complete',0
      'componentDidMount: foo',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  xit('can reuse work done after being preempted', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    function Bar(props) {0
      ops.push('Bar');0
      return <div>{props.children}</div>;0
    }0
0
    function Middle(props) {0
      ops.push('Middle');0
      return <span>{props.children}</span>;0
    }0
0
    const middleContent = (0
      <div>0
        <Middle>Hello</Middle>0
        <Bar>-</Bar>0
        <Middle>World</Middle>0
      </div>0
    );0
0
    const step0 = (0
      <div>0
        <Middle>Hi</Middle>0
        <Bar>{'Foo'}</Bar>0
        <Middle>There</Middle>0
      </div>0
    );0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      ops.push('Foo');0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <Bar>{props.text2}</Bar>0
          <div hidden={true}>{props.step === 0 ? step0 : middleContent}</div>0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Init0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="foo" text2="foo" step={0} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(55 + 25 + 5 + 5);0
0
    // We only finish the higher priority work. So the low pri content0
    // has not yet finished mounting.0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Middle', 'Bar']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Interrupt the rendering with a quick update. This should not touch the0
    // middle content.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="foo" text2="bar" step={0} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    // We've now rendered the entire tree but we didn't have to redo the work0
    // done by the first Middle and Bar already.0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Middle']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Make a quick update which will schedule low priority work to0
    // update the middle content.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="bar" text2="bar" step={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(30 + 25 + 5);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // The middle content is now pending rendering...0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(30 + 5);0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Middle', 'Bar']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // but we'll interrupt it to render some higher priority work.0
    // The middle content will bailout so it remains untouched.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="foo" text2="bar" step={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(30);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Since we did nothing to the middle subtree during the interruption,0
    // we should be able to reuse the reconciliation work that we already did0
    // without restarting.0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Middle']);0
  });0
0
  xit('can reuse work that began but did not complete, after being preempted', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
    let child;0
    let sibling;0
0
    function GreatGrandchild() {0
      ops.push('GreatGrandchild');0
      return <div />;0
    }0
0
    function Grandchild() {0
      ops.push('Grandchild');0
      return <GreatGrandchild />;0
    }0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      state = {step: 0};0
      render() {0
        child = this;0
        ops.push('Child');0
        return <Grandchild />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Sibling extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Sibling');0
        sibling = this;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Parent() {0
      ops.push('Parent');0
      return [0
        // The extra div is necessary because when Parent bails out during the0
        // high priority update, its progressedPriority is set to high.0
        // So its direct children cannot be reused when we resume at0
        // low priority. I think this would be fixed by changing0
        // pendingWorkPriority and progressedPriority to be the priority of0
        // the children only, not including the fiber itself.0
        <div key="a">0
          <Child />0
        </div>,0
        <Sibling key="b" />,0
      ];0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Begin working on a low priority update to Child, but stop before0
    // GreatGrandchild. Child and Grandchild begin but don't complete.0
    child.setState({step: 1});0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(30);0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Child', 'Grandchild']);0
0
    // Interrupt the current low pri work with a high pri update elsewhere in0
    // the tree.0
    ops = [];0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      sibling.setState({});0
    });0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Sibling']);0
0
    // Continue the low pri work. The work on Child and GrandChild was memoized0
    // so they should not be worked on again.0
    ops = [];0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      // No Child0
      // No Grandchild0
      'GreatGrandchild',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  xit('can reuse work if shouldComponentUpdate is false, after being preempted', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    function Bar(props) {0
      ops.push('Bar');0
      return <div>{props.children}</div>;0
    }0
0
    class Middle extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps) {0
        return this.props.children !== nextProps.children;0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Middle');0
        return <span>{this.props.children}</span>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Content extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps) {0
        return this.props.step !== nextProps.step;0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Content');0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Middle>{this.props.step === 0 ? 'Hi' : 'Hello'}</Middle>0
            <Bar>{this.props.step === 0 ? this.props.text : '-'}</Bar>0
            <Middle>{this.props.step === 0 ? 'There' : 'World'}</Middle>0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      ops.push('Foo');0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <Bar>{props.text}</Bar>0
          <div hidden={true}>0
            <Content step={props.step} text={props.text} />0
          </div>0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Init0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="foo" step={0} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Content', 'Middle', 'Bar', 'Middle']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Make a quick update which will schedule low priority work to0
    // update the middle content.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="bar" step={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(30 + 5);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // The middle content is now pending rendering...0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(30 + 25 + 5);0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Content', 'Middle', 'Bar']); // One more Middle left.0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // but we'll interrupt it to render some higher priority work.0
    // The middle content will bailout so it remains untouched.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="foo" step={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(30);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Since we did nothing to the middle subtree during the interruption,0
    // we should be able to reuse the reconciliation work that we already did0
    // without restarting.0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Middle']);0
  });0
0
  it('memoizes work even if shouldComponentUpdate returns false', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps) {0
        // this.props is the memoized props. So this should return true for0
        // every update except the first one.0
        const shouldUpdate = this.props.step !== 1;0
        ops.push('shouldComponentUpdate: ' + shouldUpdate);0
        return shouldUpdate;0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('render');0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo step={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ops = [];0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo step={2} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['shouldComponentUpdate: false']);0
0
    ops = [];0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo step={3} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      // If the memoized props were not updated during last bail out, sCU will0
      // keep returning false.0
      'shouldComponentUpdate: true',0
      'render',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('can update in the middle of a tree using setState', () => {0
    let instance;0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        this.state = {a: 'a'};0
        instance = this;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo() {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <Bar />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(instance.state).toEqual({a: 'a'});0
    instance.setState({b: 'b'});0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(instance.state).toEqual({a: 'a', b: 'b'});0
  });0
0
  it('can queue multiple state updates', () => {0
    let instance;0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        this.state = {a: 'a'};0
        instance = this;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo() {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <Bar />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    // Call setState multiple times before flushing0
    instance.setState({b: 'b'});0
    instance.setState({c: 'c'});0
    instance.setState({d: 'd'});0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(instance.state).toEqual({a: 'a', b: 'b', c: 'c', d: 'd'});0
  });0
0
  it('can use updater form of setState', () => {0
    let instance;0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        this.state = {num: 1};0
        instance = this;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo({multiplier}) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <Bar multiplier={multiplier} />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    function updater(state, props) {0
      return {num: state.num * props.multiplier};0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo multiplier={2} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(instance.state.num).toEqual(1);0
    instance.setState(updater);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(instance.state.num).toEqual(2);0
0
    instance.setState(updater);0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo multiplier={3} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(instance.state.num).toEqual(6);0
  });0
0
  it('can call setState inside update callback', () => {0
    let instance;0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        this.state = {num: 1};0
        instance = this;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo({multiplier}) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <Bar multiplier={multiplier} />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    function updater(state, props) {0
      return {num: state.num * props.multiplier};0
    }0
0
    function callback() {0
      this.setState({called: true});0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo multiplier={2} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    instance.setState(updater);0
    instance.setState(updater, callback);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(instance.state.num).toEqual(4);0
    expect(instance.state.called).toEqual(true);0
  });0
0
  it('can replaceState', () => {0
    let instance;0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      state = {a: 'a'};0
      render() {0
        instance = this;0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo() {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <Bar />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    instance.setState({b: 'b'});0
    instance.setState({c: 'c'});0
    instance.updater.enqueueReplaceState(instance, {d: 'd'});0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(instance.state).toEqual({d: 'd'});0
  });0
0
  it('can forceUpdate', () => {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    function Baz() {0
      ops.push('Baz');0
      return <div />;0
    }0
0
    let instance;0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        instance = this;0
      }0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Bar');0
        return <Baz />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo() {0
      ops.push('Foo');0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <Bar />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Baz']);0
    instance.forceUpdate();0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Baz', 'Bar', 'Baz']);0
  });0
0
  it('should clear forceUpdate after update is flushed', () => {0
    let a = 0;0
0
    class Foo extends React.PureComponent {0
      render() {0
        const msg = `A: ${a}, B: ${this.props.b}`;0
        ReactNoop.yield(msg);0
        return msg;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const foo = React.createRef(null);0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo ref={foo} b={0} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['A: 0, B: 0']);0
0
    a = 1;0
    foo.current.forceUpdate();0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['A: 1, B: 0']);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo ref={foo} b={0} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([]);0
  });0
0
  xit('can call sCU while resuming a partly mounted component', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    const instances = new Set();0
0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      state = {y: 'A'};0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        instances.add(this);0
      }0
      shouldComponentUpdate(newProps, newState) {0
        return this.props.x !== newProps.x || this.state.y !== newState.y;0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Bar:' + this.props.x);0
        return <span prop={'' + (this.props.x === this.state.y)} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      ops.push('Foo');0
      return [0
        <Bar key="a" x="A" />,0
        <Bar key="b" x={props.step === 0 ? 'B' : 'B2'} />,0
        <Bar key="c" x="C" />,0
        <Bar key="d" x="D" />,0
      ];0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo step={0} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(40);0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar:A', 'Bar:B', 'Bar:C']);0
0
    expect(instances.size).toBe(3);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo step={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(50);0
    // A was memoized and reused. B was memoized but couldn't be reused because0
    // props differences. C was memoized and reused. D never even started so it0
    // needed a new instance.0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar:B2', 'Bar:D']);0
0
    // We expect each rerender to correspond to a new instance.0
    expect(instances.size).toBe(4);0
  });0
0
  xit('gets new props when setting state on a partly updated component', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
    const instances = [];0
0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      state = {y: 'A'};0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        instances.push(this);0
      }0
      performAction() {0
        this.setState({0
          y: 'B',0
        });0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Bar:' + this.props.x + '-' + this.props.step);0
        return <span prop={'' + (this.props.x === this.state.y)} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Baz() {0
      // This component is used as a sibling to Foo so that we can fully0
      // complete Foo, without committing.0
      ops.push('Baz');0
      return <div />;0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      ops.push('Foo');0
      return [0
        <Bar key="a" x="A" step={props.step} />,0
        <Bar key="b" x="B" step={props.step} />,0
      ];0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <div>0
        <Foo step={0} />0
        <Baz />0
        <Baz />0
      </div>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Flush part way through with new props, fully completing the first Bar.0
    // However, it doesn't commit yet.0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <div>0
        <Foo step={1} />0
        <Baz />0
        <Baz />0
      </div>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(45);0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar:A-1', 'Bar:B-1', 'Baz']);0
0
    // Make an update to the same Bar.0
    instances[0].performAction();0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Bar:A-1', 'Baz']);0
  });0
0
  xit('calls componentWillMount twice if the initial render is aborted', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    class LifeCycle extends React.Component {0
      state = {x: this.props.x};0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(nextProps) {0
        ops.push(0
          'componentWillReceiveProps:' + this.state.x + '-' + nextProps.x,0
        );0
        this.setState({x: nextProps.x});0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        ops.push('componentWillMount:' + this.state.x + '-' + this.props.x);0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ops.push('componentDidMount:' + this.state.x + '-' + this.props.x);0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Trail() {0
      ops.push('Trail');0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    function App(props) {0
      ops.push('App');0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <LifeCycle x={props.x} />0
          <Trail />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App x={0} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(30);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['App', 'componentWillMount:0-0']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App x={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'App',0
      'componentWillReceiveProps:0-1',0
      'componentWillMount:1-1',0
      'Trail',0
      'componentDidMount:1-1',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  xit('uses state set in componentWillMount even if initial render was aborted', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    class LifeCycle extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        this.state = {x: this.props.x + '(ctor)'};0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        ops.push('componentWillMount:' + this.state.x);0
        this.setState({x: this.props.x + '(willMount)'});0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ops.push('componentDidMount:' + this.state.x);0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('render:' + this.state.x);0
        return <span />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function App(props) {0
      ops.push('App');0
      return <LifeCycle x={props.x} />;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App x={0} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(20);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'App',0
      'componentWillMount:0(ctor)',0
      'render:0(willMount)',0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
    ReactNoop.render(<App x={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'App',0
      'componentWillMount:0(willMount)',0
      'render:1(willMount)',0
      'componentDidMount:1(willMount)',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  xit('calls componentWill* twice if an update render is aborted', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    class LifeCycle extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        ops.push('componentWillMount:' + this.props.x);0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ops.push('componentDidMount:' + this.props.x);0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(nextProps) {0
        ops.push(0
          'componentWillReceiveProps:' + this.props.x + '-' + nextProps.x,0
        );0
      }0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps) {0
        ops.push('shouldComponentUpdate:' + this.props.x + '-' + nextProps.x);0
        return true;0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate(nextProps) {0
        ops.push('componentWillUpdate:' + this.props.x + '-' + nextProps.x);0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate(prevProps) {0
        ops.push('componentDidUpdate:' + this.props.x + '-' + prevProps.x);0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('render:' + this.props.x);0
        return <span />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Sibling() {0
      // The sibling is used to confirm that we've completed the first child,0
      // but not yet flushed.0
      ops.push('Sibling');0
      return <span />;0
    }0
0
    function App(props) {0
      ops.push('App');0
0
      return [<LifeCycle key="a" x={props.x} />, <Sibling key="b" />];0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App x={0} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'App',0
      'componentWillMount:0',0
      'render:0',0
      'Sibling',0
      'componentDidMount:0',0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App x={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(30);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'App',0
      'componentWillReceiveProps:0-1',0
      'shouldComponentUpdate:0-1',0
      'componentWillUpdate:0-1',0
      'render:1',0
      'Sibling',0
      // no componentDidUpdate0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App x={2} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'App',0
      'componentWillReceiveProps:1-2',0
      'shouldComponentUpdate:1-2',0
      'componentWillUpdate:1-2',0
      'render:2',0
      'Sibling',0
      // When componentDidUpdate finally gets called, it covers both updates.0
      'componentDidUpdate:2-0',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('calls getDerivedStateFromProps even for state-only updates', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
    let instance;0
0
    class LifeCycle extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps(props, prevState) {0
        ops.push('getDerivedStateFromProps');0
        return {foo: 'foo'};0
      }0
      changeState() {0
        this.setState({foo: 'bar'});0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('componentDidUpdate');0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('render');0
        instance = this;0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<LifeCycle />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['getDerivedStateFromProps', 'render']);0
    expect(instance.state).toEqual({foo: 'foo'});0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    instance.changeState();0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
      'render',0
      'componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
    expect(instance.state).toEqual({foo: 'foo'});0
  });0
0
  it('does not call getDerivedStateFromProps if neither state nor props have changed', () => {0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      state = {parentRenders: 0};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps(props, prevState) {0
        ReactNoop.yield('getDerivedStateFromProps');0
        return prevState.parentRenders + 1;0
      }0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('Parent');0
        return <Child parentRenders={this.state.parentRenders} ref={child} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('Child');0
        return this.props.parentRenders;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const child = React.createRef(null);0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'getDerivedStateFromProps',0
      'Parent',0
      'Child',0
    ]);0
0
    // Schedule an update on the child. The parent should not re-render.0
    child.current.setState({});0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Child']);0
  });0
0
  xit('does not call componentWillReceiveProps for state-only updates', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    const instances = [];0
0
    class LifeCycle extends React.Component {0
      state = {x: 0};0
      tick() {0
        this.setState({0
          x: this.state.x + 1,0
        });0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        instances.push(this);0
        ops.push('componentWillMount:' + this.state.x);0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ops.push('componentDidMount:' + this.state.x);0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(nextProps) {0
        ops.push('componentWillReceiveProps');0
      }0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps, nextState) {0
        ops.push('shouldComponentUpdate:' + this.state.x + '-' + nextState.x);0
        return true;0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate(nextProps, nextState) {0
        ops.push('componentWillUpdate:' + this.state.x + '-' + nextState.x);0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate(prevProps, prevState) {0
        ops.push('componentDidUpdate:' + this.state.x + '-' + prevState.x);0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('render:' + this.state.x);0
        return <span />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    // This wrap is a bit contrived because we can't pause a completed root and0
    // there is currently an issue where a component can't reuse its render0
    // output unless it fully completed.0
    class Wrap extends React.Component {0
      state = {y: 0};0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        instances.push(this);0
      }0
      tick() {0
        this.setState({0
          y: this.state.y + 1,0
        });0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Wrap');0
        return <LifeCycle y={this.state.y} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Sibling() {0
      // The sibling is used to confirm that we've completed the first child,0
      // but not yet flushed.0
      ops.push('Sibling');0
      return <span />;0
    }0
0
    function App(props) {0
      ops.push('App');0
      return [<Wrap key="a" />, <Sibling key="b" />];0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App y={0} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'App',0
      'Wrap',0
      'componentWillMount:0',0
      'render:0',0
      'Sibling',0
      'componentDidMount:0',0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // LifeCycle0
    instances[1].tick();0
0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(25);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      // no componentWillReceiveProps0
      'shouldComponentUpdate:0-1',0
      'componentWillUpdate:0-1',0
      'render:1',0
      // no componentDidUpdate0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // LifeCycle0
    instances[1].tick();0
0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      // no componentWillReceiveProps0
      'shouldComponentUpdate:1-2',0
      'componentWillUpdate:1-2',0
      'render:2',0
      // When componentDidUpdate finally gets called, it covers both updates.0
      'componentDidUpdate:2-0',0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Next we will update props of LifeCycle by updating its parent.0
0
    instances[0].tick();0
0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(30);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'Wrap',0
      'componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'shouldComponentUpdate:2-2',0
      'componentWillUpdate:2-2',0
      'render:2',0
      // no componentDidUpdate0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Next we will update LifeCycle directly but not with new props.0
    instances[1].tick();0
0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      // This should not trigger another componentWillReceiveProps because0
      // we never got new props.0
      'shouldComponentUpdate:2-3',0
      'componentWillUpdate:2-3',0
      'render:3',0
      'componentDidUpdate:3-2',0
    ]);0
0
    // TODO: Test that we get the expected values for the same scenario with0
    // incomplete parents.0
  });0
0
  xit('skips will/DidUpdate when bailing unless an update was already in progress', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    class LifeCycle extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        ops.push('componentWillMount');0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ops.push('componentDidMount');0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(nextProps) {0
        ops.push('componentWillReceiveProps');0
      }0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps) {0
        ops.push('shouldComponentUpdate');0
        // Bail0
        return this.props.x !== nextProps.x;0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate(nextProps) {0
        ops.push('componentWillUpdate');0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate(prevProps) {0
        ops.push('componentDidUpdate');0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('render');0
        return <span />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Sibling() {0
      ops.push('render sibling');0
      return <span />;0
    }0
0
    function App(props) {0
      return [<LifeCycle key="a" x={props.x} />, <Sibling key="b" />];0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App x={0} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'componentWillMount',0
      'render',0
      'render sibling',0
      'componentDidMount',0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Update to same props0
    ReactNoop.render(<App x={0} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'shouldComponentUpdate',0
      // no componentWillUpdate0
      // no render0
      'render sibling',0
      // no componentDidUpdate0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Begin updating to new props...0
    ReactNoop.render(<App x={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(30);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'shouldComponentUpdate',0
      'componentWillUpdate',0
      'render',0
      'render sibling',0
      // no componentDidUpdate yet0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // ...but we'll interrupt it to rerender the same props.0
    ReactNoop.render(<App x={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    // We can bail out this time, but we must call componentDidUpdate.0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'shouldComponentUpdate',0
      // no componentWillUpdate0
      // no render0
      'render sibling',0
      'componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('can nest batchedUpdates', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
    let instance;0
0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {n: 0};0
      render() {0
        instance = this;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    ops = [];0
0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      ReactNoop.batchedUpdates(() => {0
        instance.setState({n: 1}, () => ops.push('setState 1'));0
        instance.setState({n: 2}, () => ops.push('setState 2'));0
        ReactNoop.batchedUpdates(() => {0
          instance.setState({n: 3}, () => ops.push('setState 3'));0
          instance.setState({n: 4}, () => ops.push('setState 4'));0
          ops.push('end inner batchedUpdates');0
        });0
        ops.push('end outer batchedUpdates');0
      });0
    });0
0
    // ReactNoop.flush() not needed because updates are synchronous0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'end inner batchedUpdates',0
      'end outer batchedUpdates',0
      'setState 1',0
      'setState 2',0
      'setState 3',0
      'setState 4',0
    ]);0
    expect(instance.state.n).toEqual(4);0
  });0
0
  it('can handle if setState callback throws', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
    let instance;0
0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {n: 0};0
      render() {0
        instance = this;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    ops = [];0
0
    function updater({n}) {0
      return {n: n + 1};0
    }0
0
    instance.setState(updater, () => ops.push('first callback'));0
    instance.setState(updater, () => {0
      ops.push('second callback');0
      throw new Error('callback error');0
    });0
    instance.setState(updater, () => ops.push('third callback'));0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
    }).toThrow('callback error');0
0
    // The third callback isn't called because the second one throws0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['first callback', 'second callback']);0
    expect(instance.state.n).toEqual(3);0
  });0
0
  it('merges and masks context', () => {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Intl extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        locale: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          locale: this.props.locale,0
        };0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Intl ' + JSON.stringify(this.context));0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Router extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        route: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          route: this.props.route,0
        };0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Router ' + JSON.stringify(this.context));0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class ShowLocale extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        locale: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      render() {0
        ops.push('ShowLocale ' + JSON.stringify(this.context));0
        return this.context.locale;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class ShowRoute extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        route: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      render() {0
        ops.push('ShowRoute ' + JSON.stringify(this.context));0
        return this.context.route;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function ShowBoth(props, context) {0
      ops.push('ShowBoth ' + JSON.stringify(context));0
      return `${context.route} in ${context.locale}`;0
    }0
    ShowBoth.contextTypes = {0
      locale: PropTypes.string,0
      route: PropTypes.string,0
    };0
0
    class ShowNeither extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        ops.push('ShowNeither ' + JSON.stringify(this.context));0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Indirection extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Indirection ' + JSON.stringify(this.context));0
        return [0
          <ShowLocale key="a" />,0
          <ShowRoute key="b" />,0
          <ShowNeither key="c" />,0
          <Intl key="d" locale="ru">0
            <ShowBoth />0
          </Intl>,0
          <ShowBoth key="e" />,0
        ];0
      }0
    }0
0
    ops.length = 0;0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Intl locale="fr">0
        <ShowLocale />0
        <div>0
          <ShowBoth />0
        </div>0
      </Intl>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'Intl {}',0
      'ShowLocale {"locale":"fr"}',0
      'ShowBoth {"locale":"fr"}',0
    ]);0
0
    ops.length = 0;0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Intl locale="de">0
        <ShowLocale />0
        <div>0
          <ShowBoth />0
        </div>0
      </Intl>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'Intl {}',0
      'ShowLocale {"locale":"de"}',0
      'ShowBoth {"locale":"de"}',0
    ]);0
0
    ops.length = 0;0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Intl locale="sv">0
        <ShowLocale />0
        <div>0
          <ShowBoth />0
        </div>0
      </Intl>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(15);0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Intl {}']);0
0
    ops.length = 0;0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Intl locale="en">0
        <ShowLocale />0
        <Router route="/about">0
          <Indirection />0
        </Router>0
        <ShowBoth />0
      </Intl>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'ShowLocale {"locale":"sv"}',0
      'ShowBoth {"locale":"sv"}',0
      'Intl {}',0
      'ShowLocale {"locale":"en"}',0
      'Router {}',0
      'Indirection {}',0
      'ShowLocale {"locale":"en"}',0
      'ShowRoute {"route":"/about"}',0
      'ShowNeither {}',0
      'Intl {}',0
      'ShowBoth {"locale":"ru","route":"/about"}',0
      'ShowBoth {"locale":"en","route":"/about"}',0
      'ShowBoth {"locale":"en"}',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('does not leak own context into context provider', () => {0
    const ops = [];0
    class Recurse extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        n: PropTypes.number,0
      };0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        n: PropTypes.number,0
      };0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {n: (this.context.n || 3) - 1};0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Recurse ' + JSON.stringify(this.context));0
        if (this.context.n === 0) {0
          return null;0
        }0
        return <Recurse />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Recurse />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'Recurse {}',0
      'Recurse {"n":2}',0
      'Recurse {"n":1}',0
      'Recurse {"n":0}',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('provides context when reusing work', () => {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Intl extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        locale: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          locale: this.props.locale,0
        };0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Intl ' + JSON.stringify(this.context));0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class ShowLocale extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        locale: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      render() {0
        ops.push('ShowLocale ' + JSON.stringify(this.context));0
        return this.context.locale;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ops.length = 0;0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Intl locale="fr">0
        <ShowLocale />0
        <div hidden="true">0
          <ShowLocale />0
          <Intl locale="ru">0
            <ShowLocale />0
          </Intl>0
        </div>0
        <ShowLocale />0
      </Intl>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(40);0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'Intl {}',0
      'ShowLocale {"locale":"fr"}',0
      'ShowLocale {"locale":"fr"}',0
    ]);0
0
    ops.length = 0;0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'ShowLocale {"locale":"fr"}',0
      'Intl {}',0
      'ShowLocale {"locale":"ru"}',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('reads context when setState is below the provider', () => {0
    const ops = [];0
    let statefulInst;0
0
    class Intl extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        locale: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      getChildContext() {0
        const childContext = {0
          locale: this.props.locale,0
        };0
        ops.push('Intl:provide ' + JSON.stringify(childContext));0
        return childContext;0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Intl:read ' + JSON.stringify(this.context));0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class ShowLocaleClass extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        locale: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      render() {0
        ops.push('ShowLocaleClass:read ' + JSON.stringify(this.context));0
        return this.context.locale;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function ShowLocaleFn(props, context) {0
      ops.push('ShowLocaleFn:read ' + JSON.stringify(context));0
      return context.locale;0
    }0
    ShowLocaleFn.contextTypes = {0
      locale: PropTypes.string,0
    };0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      state = {x: 0};0
      render() {0
        statefulInst = this;0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function IndirectionFn(props, context) {0
      ops.push('IndirectionFn ' + JSON.stringify(context));0
      return props.children;0
    }0
0
    class IndirectionClass extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        ops.push('IndirectionClass ' + JSON.stringify(this.context));0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ops.length = 0;0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Intl locale="fr">0
        <IndirectionFn>0
          <IndirectionClass>0
            <Stateful>0
              <ShowLocaleClass />0
              <ShowLocaleFn />0
            </Stateful>0
          </IndirectionClass>0
        </IndirectionFn>0
      </Intl>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'Intl:read {}',0
      'Intl:provide {"locale":"fr"}',0
      'IndirectionFn {}',0
      'IndirectionClass {}',0
      'ShowLocaleClass:read {"locale":"fr"}',0
      'ShowLocaleFn:read {"locale":"fr"}',0
    ]);0
0
    ops.length = 0;0
    statefulInst.setState({x: 1});0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    // All work has been memoized because setState()0
    // happened below the context and could not have affected it.0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
  });0
0
  it('reads context when setState is above the provider', () => {0
    const ops = [];0
    let statefulInst;0
0
    class Intl extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        locale: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      getChildContext() {0
        const childContext = {0
          locale: this.props.locale,0
        };0
        ops.push('Intl:provide ' + JSON.stringify(childContext));0
        return childContext;0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Intl:read ' + JSON.stringify(this.context));0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class ShowLocaleClass extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        locale: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      render() {0
        ops.push('ShowLocaleClass:read ' + JSON.stringify(this.context));0
        return this.context.locale;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function ShowLocaleFn(props, context) {0
      ops.push('ShowLocaleFn:read ' + JSON.stringify(context));0
      return context.locale;0
    }0
    ShowLocaleFn.contextTypes = {0
      locale: PropTypes.string,0
    };0
0
    function IndirectionFn(props, context) {0
      ops.push('IndirectionFn ' + JSON.stringify(context));0
      return props.children;0
    }0
0
    class IndirectionClass extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        ops.push('IndirectionClass ' + JSON.stringify(this.context));0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      state = {locale: 'fr'};0
      render() {0
        statefulInst = this;0
        return <Intl locale={this.state.locale}>{this.props.children}</Intl>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ops.length = 0;0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Stateful>0
        <IndirectionFn>0
          <IndirectionClass>0
            <ShowLocaleClass />0
            <ShowLocaleFn />0
          </IndirectionClass>0
        </IndirectionFn>0
      </Stateful>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'Intl:read {}',0
      'Intl:provide {"locale":"fr"}',0
      'IndirectionFn {}',0
      'IndirectionClass {}',0
      'ShowLocaleClass:read {"locale":"fr"}',0
      'ShowLocaleFn:read {"locale":"fr"}',0
    ]);0
0
    ops.length = 0;0
    statefulInst.setState({locale: 'gr'});0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      // Intl is below setState() so it might have been0
      // affected by it. Therefore we re-render and recompute0
      // its child context.0
      'Intl:read {}',0
      'Intl:provide {"locale":"gr"}',0
      // TODO: it's unfortunate that we can't reuse work on0
      // these components even though they don't depend on context.0
      'IndirectionFn {}',0
      'IndirectionClass {}',0
      // These components depend on context:0
      'ShowLocaleClass:read {"locale":"gr"}',0
      'ShowLocaleFn:read {"locale":"gr"}',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('maintains the correct context when providers bail out due to low priority', () => {0
    class Root extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <Middle {...this.props} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let instance;0
0
    class Middle extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props, context) {0
        super(props, context);0
        instance = this;0
      }0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        // Return false so that our child will get a NoWork priority (and get bailed out)0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <Child />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    // Child must be a context provider to trigger the bug0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {};0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {};0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    // Init0
    ReactNoop.render(<Root />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    // Trigger an update in the middle of the tree0
    instance.setState({});0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
  });0
0
  it('maintains the correct context when unwinding due to an error in render', () => {0
    class Root extends React.Component {0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        // If context is pushed/popped correctly,0
        // This method will be used to handle the intentionally-thrown Error.0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <ContextProvider depth={1} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let instance;0
0
    class ContextProvider extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props, context) {0
        super(props, context);0
        this.state = {};0
        if (props.depth === 1) {0
          instance = this;0
        }0
      }0
      static childContextTypes = {};0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {};0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.throwError) {0
          throw Error();0
        }0
        return this.props.depth < 4 ? (0
          <ContextProvider depth={this.props.depth + 1} />0
        ) : (0
          <div />0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    // Init0
    ReactNoop.render(<Root />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    // Trigger an update in the middle of the tree0
    // This is necessary to reproduce the error as it curently exists.0
    instance.setState({0
      throwError: true,0
    });0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
  });0
0
  it('should not recreate masked context unless inputs have changed', () => {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    let scuCounter = 0;0
0
    class MyComponent extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {};0
      componentDidMount(prevProps, prevState) {0
        ops.push('componentDidMount');0
        this.setState({setStateInCDU: true});0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate(prevProps, prevState) {0
        ops.push('componentDidUpdate');0
        if (this.state.setStateInCDU) {0
          this.setState({setStateInCDU: false});0
        }0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(nextProps) {0
        ops.push('componentWillReceiveProps');0
        this.setState({setStateInCDU: true});0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('render');0
        return null;0
      }0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps, nextState) {0
        ops.push('shouldComponentUpdate');0
        return scuCounter++ < 5; // Don't let test hang0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<MyComponent />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toWarnDev(0
      'componentWillReceiveProps: Please update the following components ' +0
        'to use static getDerivedStateFromProps instead: MyComponent',0
    );0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'render',0
      'componentDidMount',0
      'shouldComponentUpdate',0
      'render',0
      'componentDidUpdate',0
      'shouldComponentUpdate',0
      'render',0
      'componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  xit('should reuse memoized work if pointers are updated before calling lifecycles', () => {0
    let cduNextProps = [];0
    let cduPrevProps = [];0
    let scuNextProps = [];0
    let scuPrevProps = [];0
    let renderCounter = 0;0
0
    function SecondChild(props) {0
      return <span>{props.children}</span>;0
    }0
0
    class FirstChild extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate(prevProps, prevState) {0
        cduNextProps.push(this.props);0
        cduPrevProps.push(prevProps);0
      }0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps, nextState) {0
        scuNextProps.push(nextProps);0
        scuPrevProps.push(this.props);0
        return this.props.children !== nextProps.children;0
      }0
      render() {0
        renderCounter++;0
        return <span>{this.props.children}</span>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Middle extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <FirstChild>{this.props.children}</FirstChild>0
            <SecondChild>{this.props.children}</SecondChild>0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Root(props) {0
      return (0
        <div hidden={true}>0
          <Middle {...props} />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Initial render of the entire tree.0
    // Renders: Root, Middle, FirstChild, SecondChild0
    ReactNoop.render(<Root>A</Root>);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(renderCounter).toBe(1);0
0
    // Schedule low priority work to update children.0
    // Give it enough time to partially render.0
    // Renders: Root, Middle, FirstChild0
    ReactNoop.render(<Root>B</Root>);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(20 + 30 + 5);0
0
    // At this point our FirstChild component has rendered a second time,0
    // But since the render is not completed cDU should not be called yet.0
    expect(renderCounter).toBe(2);0
    expect(scuPrevProps).toEqual([{children: 'A'}]);0
    expect(scuNextProps).toEqual([{children: 'B'}]);0
    expect(cduPrevProps).toEqual([]);0
    expect(cduNextProps).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Next interrupt the partial render with higher priority work.0
    // The in-progress child content will bailout.0
    // Renders: Root, Middle, FirstChild, SecondChild0
    ReactNoop.render(<Root>B</Root>);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    // At this point the higher priority render has completed.0
    // Since FirstChild props didn't change, sCU returned false.0
    // The previous memoized copy should be used.0
    expect(renderCounter).toBe(2);0
    expect(scuPrevProps).toEqual([{children: 'A'}, {children: 'B'}]);0
    expect(scuNextProps).toEqual([{children: 'B'}, {children: 'B'}]);0
    expect(cduPrevProps).toEqual([{children: 'A'}]);0
    expect(cduNextProps).toEqual([{children: 'B'}]);0
  });0
0
  it('updates descendants with new context values', () => {0
    let rendered = [];0
    let instance;0
0
    class TopContextProvider extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        count: PropTypes.number,0
      };0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        this.state = {count: 0};0
        instance = this;0
      }0
      getChildContext = () => ({0
        count: this.state.count,0
      });0
      render = () => this.props.children;0
      updateCount = () =>0
        this.setState(state => ({0
          count: state.count + 1,0
        }));0
    }0
0
    class Middle extends React.Component {0
      render = () => this.props.children;0
    }0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        count: PropTypes.number,0
      };0
      render = () => {0
        rendered.push(`count:${this.context.count}`);0
        return null;0
      };0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <TopContextProvider>0
        <Middle>0
          <Child />0
        </Middle>0
      </TopContextProvider>,0
    );0
0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(rendered).toEqual(['count:0']);0
    instance.updateCount();0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(rendered).toEqual(['count:0', 'count:1']);0
  });0
0
  it('updates descendants with multiple context-providing ancestors with new context values', () => {0
    let rendered = [];0
    let instance;0
0
    class TopContextProvider extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        count: PropTypes.number,0
      };0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        this.state = {count: 0};0
        instance = this;0
      }0
      getChildContext = () => ({0
        count: this.state.count,0
      });0
      render = () => this.props.children;0
      updateCount = () =>0
        this.setState(state => ({0
          count: state.count + 1,0
        }));0
    }0
0
    class MiddleContextProvider extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        name: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      getChildContext = () => ({0
        name: 'brian',0
      });0
      render = () => this.props.children;0
    }0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        count: PropTypes.number,0
      };0
      render = () => {0
        rendered.push(`count:${this.context.count}`);0
        return null;0
      };0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <TopContextProvider>0
        <MiddleContextProvider>0
          <Child />0
        </MiddleContextProvider>0
      </TopContextProvider>,0
    );0
0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(rendered).toEqual(['count:0']);0
    instance.updateCount();0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(rendered).toEqual(['count:0', 'count:1']);0
  });0
0
  it('should not update descendants with new context values if shouldComponentUpdate returns false', () => {0
    let rendered = [];0
    let instance;0
0
    class TopContextProvider extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        count: PropTypes.number,0
      };0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        this.state = {count: 0};0
        instance = this;0
      }0
      getChildContext = () => ({0
        count: this.state.count,0
      });0
      render = () => this.props.children;0
      updateCount = () =>0
        this.setState(state => ({0
          count: state.count + 1,0
        }));0
    }0
0
    class MiddleScu extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render = () => this.props.children;0
    }0
0
    class MiddleContextProvider extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        name: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      getChildContext = () => ({0
        name: 'brian',0
      });0
      render = () => this.props.children;0
    }0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        count: PropTypes.number,0
      };0
      render = () => {0
        rendered.push(`count:${this.context.count}`);0
        return null;0
      };0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <TopContextProvider>0
        <MiddleScu>0
          <MiddleContextProvider>0
            <Child />0
          </MiddleContextProvider>0
        </MiddleScu>0
      </TopContextProvider>,0
    );0
0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(rendered).toEqual(['count:0']);0
    instance.updateCount();0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(rendered).toEqual(['count:0']);0
  });0
0
  it('should update descendants with new context values if setState() is called in the middle of the tree', () => {0
    let rendered = [];0
    let middleInstance;0
    let topInstance;0
0
    class TopContextProvider extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        count: PropTypes.number,0
      };0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        this.state = {count: 0};0
        topInstance = this;0
      }0
      getChildContext = () => ({0
        count: this.state.count,0
      });0
      render = () => this.props.children;0
      updateCount = () =>0
        this.setState(state => ({0
          count: state.count + 1,0
        }));0
    }0
0
    class MiddleScu extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render = () => this.props.children;0
    }0
0
    class MiddleContextProvider extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        name: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        this.state = {name: 'brian'};0
        middleInstance = this;0
      }0
      getChildContext = () => ({0
        name: this.state.name,0
      });0
      updateName = name => {0
        this.setState({name});0
      };0
      render = () => this.props.children;0
    }0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        count: PropTypes.number,0
        name: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      render = () => {0
        rendered.push(`count:${this.context.count}, name:${this.context.name}`);0
        return null;0
      };0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <TopContextProvider>0
        <MiddleScu>0
          <MiddleContextProvider>0
            <Child />0
          </MiddleContextProvider>0
        </MiddleScu>0
      </TopContextProvider>,0
    );0
0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(rendered).toEqual(['count:0, name:brian']);0
    topInstance.updateCount();0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(rendered).toEqual(['count:0, name:brian']);0
    middleInstance.updateName('not brian');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(rendered).toEqual([0
      'count:0, name:brian',0
      'count:1, name:not brian',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('does not interrupt for update at same priority', () => {0
    function Parent(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Parent: ' + props.step);0
      return <Child step={props.step} />;0
    }0
0
    function Child(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Child: ' + props.step);0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent step={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushThrough(['Parent: 1']);0
0
    // Interrupt at same priority0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent step={2} />);0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Child: 1', 'Parent: 2', 'Child: 2']);0
  });0
0
  it('does not interrupt for update at lower priority', () => {0
    function Parent(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Parent: ' + props.step);0
      return <Child step={props.step} />;0
    }0
0
    function Child(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Child: ' + props.step);0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent step={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushThrough(['Parent: 1']);0
0
    // Interrupt at lower priority0
    ReactNoop.expire(2000);0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent step={2} />);0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Child: 1', 'Parent: 2', 'Child: 2']);0
  });0
0
  it('does interrupt for update at higher priority', () => {0
    function Parent(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Parent: ' + props.step);0
      return <Child step={props.step} />;0
    }0
0
    function Child(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Child: ' + props.step);0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent step={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushThrough(['Parent: 1']);0
0
    // Interrupt at higher priority0
    expect(0
      ReactNoop.flushSync(() => ReactNoop.render(<Parent step={2} />)),0
    ).toEqual(['Parent: 2', 'Child: 2']);0
    ReactNoop.clearYields();0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([]);0
  });0
0
  // We don't currently use fibers as keys. Re-enable this test if we0
  // ever do again.0
  it('does not break with a bad Map polyfill', () => {0
    const realMapSet = Map.prototype.set;0
0
    function triggerCodePathThatUsesFibersAsMapKeys() {0
      function Thing() {0
        throw new Error('No.');0
      }0
      class Boundary extends React.Component {0
        state = {didError: false};0
        componentDidCatch() {0
          this.setState({didError: true});0
        }0
        render() {0
          return this.state.didError ? null : <Thing />;0
        }0
      }0
      ReactNoop.render(<Boundary />);0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
    }0
0
    // First, verify that this code path normally receives Fibers as keys,0
    // and that they're not extensible.0
    jest.resetModules();0
    let receivedNonExtensibleObjects;0
    // eslint-disable-next-line no-extend-native0
    Map.prototype.set = function(key) {0
      if (typeof key === 'object' && key !== null) {0
        if (!Object.isExtensible(key)) {0
          receivedNonExtensibleObjects = true;0
        }0
      }0
      return realMapSet.apply(this, arguments);0
    };0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
    try {0
      receivedNonExtensibleObjects = false;0
      triggerCodePathThatUsesFibersAsMapKeys();0
    } finally {0
      // eslint-disable-next-line no-extend-native0
      Map.prototype.set = realMapSet;0
    }0
    // If this fails, find another code path in Fiber0
    // that passes Fibers as keys to Maps.0
    // Note that we only expect them to be non-extensible0
    // in development.0
    expect(receivedNonExtensibleObjects).toBe(__DEV__);0
0
    // Next, verify that a Map polyfill that "writes" to keys0
    // doesn't cause a failure.0
    jest.resetModules();0
    // eslint-disable-next-line no-extend-native0
    Map.prototype.set = function(key, value) {0
      if (typeof key === 'object' && key !== null) {0
        // A polyfill could do something like this.0
        // It would throw if an object is not extensible.0
        key.__internalValueSlot = value;0
      }0
      return realMapSet.apply(this, arguments);0
    };0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
    try {0
      triggerCodePathThatUsesFibersAsMapKeys();0
    } finally {0
      // eslint-disable-next-line no-extend-native0
      Map.prototype.set = realMapSet;0
    }0
    // If we got this far, our feature detection worked.0
    // We knew that Map#set() throws for non-extensible objects,0
    // so we didn't set them as non-extensible for that reason.0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let PropTypes;0
let ReactFeatureFlags;0
let React;0
let ReactNoop;0
0
describe('ReactIncrementalErrorHandling', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.enableGetDerivedStateFromCatch = true;0
    ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode = false;0
    ReactFeatureFlags.replayFailedUnitOfWorkWithInvokeGuardedCallback = false;0
    PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
  });0
0
  function div(...children) {0
    children = children.map(c => (typeof c === 'string' ? {text: c} : c));0
    return {type: 'div', children, prop: undefined};0
  }0
0
  function span(prop) {0
    return {type: 'span', children: [], prop};0
  }0
0
  function normalizeCodeLocInfo(str) {0
    return str && str.replace(/\(at .+?:\d+\)/g, '(at **)');0
  }0
0
  it('recovers from errors asynchronously', () => {0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        ReactNoop.yield('componentDidCatch');0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          ReactNoop.yield('ErrorBoundary (catch)');0
          return <ErrorMessage error={this.state.error} />;0
        }0
        ReactNoop.yield('ErrorBoundary (try)');0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function ErrorMessage(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('ErrorMessage');0
      return <span prop={`Caught an error: ${props.error.message}`} />;0
    }0
0
    function Indirection(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Indirection');0
      return props.children || null;0
    }0
0
    function BadRender() {0
      ReactNoop.yield('throw');0
      throw new Error('oops!');0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <Indirection>0
          <Indirection>0
            <Indirection>0
              <BadRender />0
              <Indirection />0
              <Indirection />0
            </Indirection>0
          </Indirection>0
        </Indirection>0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
    );0
0
    // Start rendering asynchronsouly0
    ReactNoop.flushThrough([0
      'ErrorBoundary (try)',0
      'Indirection',0
      'Indirection',0
      'Indirection',0
      // An error is thrown. React keeps rendering asynchronously.0
      'throw',0
    ]);0
0
    // Still rendering async...0
    ReactNoop.flushThrough(['Indirection']);0
0
    ReactNoop.flushThrough([0
      'Indirection',0
      // Now that the tree is complete, and there's no remaining work, React0
      // reverts to sync mode to retry one more time before handling the error.0
0
