      'ErrorBoundary (try)',0
      'Indirection',0
      'Indirection',0
      'Indirection',0
0
      // The error was thrown again. Now we can handle it.0
      'throw',0
      'Indirection',0
      'Indirection',0
      'componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary (catch)',0
      'ErrorMessage',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Caught an error: oops!')]);0
  });0
0
  it("retries at a lower priority if there's additional pending work", () => {0
    function App(props) {0
      if (props.isBroken) {0
        ReactNoop.yield('error');0
        throw new Error('Oops!');0
      }0
      ReactNoop.yield('success');0
      return <span prop="Everything is fine." />;0
    }0
0
    function onCommit() {0
      ReactNoop.yield('commit');0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App isBroken={true} />, onCommit);0
    ReactNoop.expire(2000);0
    ReactNoop.render(<App isBroken={false} />, onCommit);0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      // The first render fails. But because there's a lower priority pending0
      // update, it doesn't throw.0
      'error',0
      // Now we retry at the lower priority. This time it succeeds.0
      'success',0
      // Nothing commits until the second update completes.0
      'commit',0
      'commit',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Everything is fine.')]);0
  });0
0
  it('on error, retries at a lower priority using the expiration of higher priority', () => {0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      state = {hideChild: false};0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('commit: ' + this.state.hideChild);0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.hideChild) {0
          ReactNoop.yield('(empty)');0
          return <span prop="(empty)" />;0
        }0
        return <Child isBroken={this.props.childIsBroken} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Child(props) {0
      if (props.isBroken) {0
        ReactNoop.yield('Error!');0
        throw new Error('Error!');0
      }0
      ReactNoop.yield('Child');0
      return <span prop="Child" />;0
    }0
0
    // Initial mount0
    const parent = React.createRef(null);0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent ref={parent} childIsBroken={false} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Child']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Child')]);0
0
    // Schedule a low priority update to hide the child0
    parent.current.setState({hideChild: true});0
0
    // Before the low priority update is flushed, synchronsouly trigger an0
    // error in the child.0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(<Parent ref={parent} childIsBroken={true} />);0
    });0
    expect(ReactNoop.clearYields()).toEqual([0
      // First the sync update triggers an error0
      'Error!',0
      // Because there's a pending low priority update, we restart at the0
      // lower priority. This hides the children, suppressing the error.0
      '(empty)',0
      // Now the tree can commit.0
      'commit: true',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('(empty)')]);0
  });0
0
  it('retries one more time before handling error', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
    function BadRender() {0
      ops.push('BadRender');0
      ReactNoop.yield('BadRender');0
      throw new Error('oops');0
    }0
0
    function Sibling() {0
      ops.push('Sibling');0
      ReactNoop.yield('Sibling');0
      return <span prop="Sibling" />;0
    }0
0
    function Parent() {0
      ops.push('Parent');0
      ReactNoop.yield('Parent');0
      return (0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <BadRender />0
          <Sibling />0
        </React.Fragment>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent />);0
0
    // Render the bad component asynchronously0
    ReactNoop.flushThrough(['Parent', 'BadRender']);0
0
    // Finish the rest of the async work0
    ReactNoop.flushThrough(['Sibling']);0
0
    // Rendering one more unit of work should be enough to trigger the retry0
    // and synchronously throw an error.0
    ops = [];0
    expect(() => ReactNoop.flushUnitsOfWork(1)).toThrow('oops');0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Parent', 'BadRender', 'Sibling']);0
  });0
0
  // TODO: This is currently unobservable, but will be once we lift renderRoot0
  // and commitRoot into the renderer.0
  // it("does not retry synchronously if there's an update between complete and commit");0
0
  it('calls componentDidCatch multiple times for multiple errors', () => {0
    let id = 0;0
    class BadMount extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        throw new Error(`Error ${++id}`);0
      }0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('BadMount');0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {errorCount: 0};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        ReactNoop.yield(`componentDidCatch: ${error.message}`);0
        this.setState(state => ({errorCount: state.errorCount + 1}));0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.errorCount > 0) {0
          return <span prop={`Number of errors: ${this.state.errorCount}`} />;0
        }0
        ReactNoop.yield('ErrorBoundary');0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BadMount />0
        <BadMount />0
        <BadMount />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
    );0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary',0
      'BadMount',0
      'BadMount',0
      'BadMount',0
      'componentDidCatch: Error 1',0
      'componentDidCatch: Error 2',0
      'componentDidCatch: Error 3',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Number of errors: 3')]);0
  });0
0
  it('catches render error in a boundary during full deferred mounting', () => {0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          return (0
            <span prop={`Caught an error: ${this.state.error.message}.`} />0
          );0
        }0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function BrokenRender(props) {0
      throw new Error('Hello');0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenRender />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Caught an error: Hello.')]);0
  });0
0
  it('catches render error in a boundary during partial deferred mounting', () => {0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        ReactNoop.yield('ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch');0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          ReactNoop.yield('ErrorBoundary render error');0
          return (0
            <span prop={`Caught an error: ${this.state.error.message}.`} />0
          );0
        }0
        ReactNoop.yield('ErrorBoundary render success');0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function BrokenRender(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('BrokenRender');0
      throw new Error('Hello');0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenRender />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
    );0
0
    ReactNoop.flushThrough(['ErrorBoundary render success']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'BrokenRender',0
      // React retries one more time0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
0
      // Errored again on retry. Now handle it.0
      'BrokenRender',0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary render error',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Caught an error: Hello.')]);0
  });0
0
  it('catches render error in a boundary during synchronous mounting', () => {0
    const ops = [];0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        ops.push('ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch');0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          ops.push('ErrorBoundary render error');0
          return (0
            <span prop={`Caught an error: ${this.state.error.message}.`} />0
          );0
        }0
        ops.push('ErrorBoundary render success');0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function BrokenRender(props) {0
      ops.push('BrokenRender');0
      throw new Error('Hello');0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(0
        <ErrorBoundary>0
          <BrokenRender />0
        </ErrorBoundary>,0
      );0
    });0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
      'BrokenRender',0
      // React doesn't retry because we're already rendering synchronously.0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary render error',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Caught an error: Hello.')]);0
  });0
0
  it('catches render error in a boundary during batched mounting', () => {0
    const ops = [];0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        ops.push('ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch');0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          ops.push('ErrorBoundary render error');0
          return (0
            <span prop={`Caught an error: ${this.state.error.message}.`} />0
          );0
        }0
        ops.push('ErrorBoundary render success');0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function BrokenRender(props) {0
      ops.push('BrokenRender');0
      throw new Error('Hello');0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(<ErrorBoundary>Before the storm.</ErrorBoundary>);0
      ReactNoop.render(0
        <ErrorBoundary>0
          <BrokenRender />0
        </ErrorBoundary>,0
      );0
    });0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary render success',0
      'BrokenRender',0
      // React doesn't retry because we're already rendering synchronously.0
      'ErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary render error',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Caught an error: Hello.')]);0
  });0
0
  it('propagates an error from a noop error boundary during full deferred mounting', () => {0
    const ops = [];0
    class RethrowErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        ops.push('RethrowErrorBoundary componentDidCatch');0
        throw error;0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('RethrowErrorBoundary render');0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function BrokenRender() {0
      ops.push('BrokenRender');0
      throw new Error('Hello');0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <RethrowErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenRender />0
      </RethrowErrorBoundary>,0
    );0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'RethrowErrorBoundary render',0
      'BrokenRender',0
0
      // React retries one more time0
      'RethrowErrorBoundary render',0
      'BrokenRender',0
0
      // Errored again on retry. Now handle it.0
      'RethrowErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
  });0
0
  it('propagates an error from a noop error boundary during partial deferred mounting', () => {0
    const ops = [];0
    class RethrowErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        ops.push('RethrowErrorBoundary componentDidCatch');0
        throw error;0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('RethrowErrorBoundary render');0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function BrokenRender() {0
      ops.push('BrokenRender');0
      throw new Error('Hello');0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <RethrowErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenRender />0
      </RethrowErrorBoundary>,0
    );0
0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(15);0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['RethrowErrorBoundary render']);0
0
    ops.length = 0;0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0

      'BrokenRender',0
0

      'BrokenRender',0
0
      // Errored again on retry. Now handle it.0
      'RethrowErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
  });0

    class RethrowErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0

        ops.push('RethrowErrorBoundary componentDidCatch');0

      render() {0
        ops.push('RethrowErrorBoundary render');0
        return this.props.children;0

0
    function BrokenRender() {0
      ops.push('BrokenRender');0
      throw new Error('Hello');0
    }0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
        ReactNoop.render(0
          <RethrowErrorBoundary>0

          </RethrowErrorBoundary>,0
        );0
      });0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0

  it('propagates an error from a noop error boundary during batched mounting', () => {0
    const ops = [];0
    class RethrowErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        ops.push('RethrowErrorBoundary componentDidCatch');0
        throw error;0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('RethrowErrorBoundary render');0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function BrokenRender() {0
      ops.push('BrokenRender');0
      throw new Error('Hello');0
    }0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
        ReactNoop.render(0
          <RethrowErrorBoundary>Before the storm.</RethrowErrorBoundary>,0
        );0
        ReactNoop.render(0
          <RethrowErrorBoundary>0
            <BrokenRender />0
          </RethrowErrorBoundary>,0
        );0
      });0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0

      'RethrowErrorBoundary componentDidCatch',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
  });0
0
  it('applies batched updates regardless despite errors in scheduling', () => {0
    ReactNoop.render(<span prop="a:1" />);0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.batchedUpdates(() => {0
        ReactNoop.render(<span prop="a:2" />);0
        ReactNoop.render(<span prop="a:3" />);0
        throw new Error('Hello');0
      });0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('a:3')]);0
  });0
0
  it('applies nested batched updates despite errors in scheduling', () => {0
    ReactNoop.render(<span prop="a:1" />);0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.batchedUpdates(() => {0
        ReactNoop.render(<span prop="a:2" />);0
        ReactNoop.render(<span prop="a:3" />);0
        ReactNoop.batchedUpdates(() => {0
          ReactNoop.render(<span prop="a:4" />);0
          ReactNoop.render(<span prop="a:5" />);0
          throw new Error('Hello');0
        });0
      });0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('a:5')]);0
  });0
0
  it('applies sync updates regardless despite errors in scheduling', () => {0
    ReactNoop.render(<span prop="a:1" />);0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
        ReactNoop.batchedUpdates(() => {0
          ReactNoop.render(<span prop="a:2" />);0
          ReactNoop.render(<span prop="a:3" />);0
          throw new Error('Hello');0
        });0
      });0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('a:3')]);0
  });0

  it('can schedule updates after uncaught error in render on mount', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    function BrokenRender() {0
      ops.push('BrokenRender');0
      throw new Error('Hello');0
    }0
0
    function Foo() {0
      ops.push('Foo');0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<BrokenRender />);0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'BrokenRender',0
      // React retries one more time0
      'BrokenRender',0
      // Errored again on retry0
    ]);0
    ops = [];0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo']);0
  });0
0
  it('can schedule updates after uncaught error in render on update', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    function BrokenRender(props) {0
      ops.push('BrokenRender');0
      if (props.throw) {0
        throw new Error('Hello');0
      }0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    function Foo() {0
      ops.push('Foo');0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<BrokenRender throw={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    ops = [];0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(<BrokenRender throw={true} />);0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'BrokenRender',0
      // React retries one more time0
      'BrokenRender',0
      // Errored again on retry0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo']);0
  });0
0
  it('can schedule updates after uncaught error during umounting', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    class BrokenComponentWillUnmount extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        throw new Error('Hello');0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo() {0
      ops.push('Foo');0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<BrokenComponentWillUnmount />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(<div />);0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
0
    ops = [];0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo']);0
  });0
0
  it('should not attempt to recover an unmounting error boundary', () => {0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('Parent componentWillUnmount');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <Boundary />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Boundary extends React.Component {0
      componentDidCatch(e) {0
        ReactNoop.yield(`Caught error: ${e.message}`);0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <ThrowsOnUnmount />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class ThrowsOnUnmount extends React.Component {0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('ThrowsOnUnmount componentWillUnmount');0
        throw new Error('unmount error');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    ReactNoop.render(null);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      // Parent unmounts before the error is thrown.0
      'Parent componentWillUnmount',0
      'ThrowsOnUnmount componentWillUnmount',0
    ]);0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent />);0
  });0
0
  it('can unmount an error boundary before it is handled', () => {0
    let parent;0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      state = {step: 0};0
      render() {0
        parent = this;0
        return this.state.step === 0 ? <Boundary /> : null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Boundary extends React.Component {0
      componentDidCatch() {}0
      render() {0
        return <Child />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        parent.setState({step: 1});0
        throw new Error('update error');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(<Parent />);0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('continues work on other roots despite caught errors', () => {0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          return (0
            <span prop={`Caught an error: ${this.state.error.message}.`} />0
          );0
        }0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function BrokenRender(props) {0
      throw new Error('Hello');0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenRender />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
      'a',0
    );0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="b:1" />, 'b');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('a')).toEqual([0
      span('Caught an error: Hello.'),0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('b')).toEqual([span('b:1')]);0
  });0
0
  it('continues work on other roots despite uncaught errors', () => {0
    function BrokenRender(props) {0
      throw new Error('Hello');0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<BrokenRender />, 'a');0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('a')).toEqual([]);0
0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<BrokenRender />, 'a');0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="b:2" />, 'b');0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('a')).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('b')).toEqual([span('b:2')]);0
0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="a:3" />, 'a');0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<BrokenRender />, 'b');0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('a')).toEqual([span('a:3')]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('b')).toEqual([]);0
0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="a:4" />, 'a');0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<BrokenRender />, 'b');0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="c:4" />, 'c');0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('a')).toEqual([span('a:4')]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('b')).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('c')).toEqual([span('c:4')]);0
0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="a:5" />, 'a');0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="b:5" />, 'b');0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="c:5" />, 'c');0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="d:5" />, 'd');0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<BrokenRender />, 'e');0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('a')).toEqual([span('a:5')]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('b')).toEqual([span('b:5')]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('c')).toEqual([span('c:5')]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('d')).toEqual([span('d:5')]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('e')).toEqual([]);0
0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<BrokenRender />, 'a');0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="b:6" />, 'b');0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<BrokenRender />, 'c');0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="d:6" />, 'd');0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<BrokenRender />, 'e');0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="f:6" />, 'f');0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
    }).toThrow('Hello');0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('a')).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('b')).toEqual([span('b:6')]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('c')).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('d')).toEqual([span('d:6')]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('e')).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('f')).toEqual([span('f:6')]);0
0
    ReactNoop.unmountRootWithID('a');0
    ReactNoop.unmountRootWithID('b');0
    ReactNoop.unmountRootWithID('c');0
    ReactNoop.unmountRootWithID('d');0
    ReactNoop.unmountRootWithID('e');0
    ReactNoop.unmountRootWithID('f');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('a')).toEqual(null);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('b')).toEqual(null);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('c')).toEqual(null);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('d')).toEqual(null);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('e')).toEqual(null);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('f')).toEqual(null);0
  });0
0
  it('unwinds the context stack correctly on error', () => {0
    class Provider extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {message: PropTypes.string};0
      static contextTypes = {message: PropTypes.string};0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {0
          message: (this.context.message || '') + this.props.message,0
        };0
      }0
      render() {0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Connector(props, context) {0
      return <span prop={context.message} />;0
    }0
0
    Connector.contextTypes = {0
      message: PropTypes.string,0
    };0
0
    function BadRender() {0
      throw new Error('render error');0
    }0
0
    class Boundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <Provider message="b">0
            <Provider message="c">0
              <Provider message="d">0
                <Provider message="e">0
                  {!this.state.error && <BadRender />}0
                </Provider>0
              </Provider>0
            </Provider>0
          </Provider>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Provider message="a">0
        <Boundary />0
        <Connector />0
      </Provider>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    // If the context stack does not unwind, span will get 'abcde'0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('a')]);0
  });0
0
  it('catches reconciler errors in a boundary during mounting', () => {0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          return <span prop={this.state.error.message} />;0
        }0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
    const InvalidType = undefined;0
    function BrokenRender(props) {0
      return <InvalidType />;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenRender />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
    );0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toWarnDev([0
      'Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string',0
      // React retries once on error0
      'Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span(0
        'Element type is invalid: expected a string (for built-in components) or ' +0
          'a class/function (for composite components) but got: undefined.' +0
          (__DEV__0
            ? " You likely forgot to export your component from the file it's " +0
              'defined in, or you might have mixed up default and named imports.' +0
              '\n\nCheck the render method of `BrokenRender`.'0
            : ''),0
      ),0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('catches reconciler errors in a boundary during update', () => {0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          return <span prop={this.state.error.message} />;0
        }0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const InvalidType = undefined;0
    function BrokenRender(props) {0
      return props.fail ? <InvalidType /> : <span />;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenRender fail={false} />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenRender fail={true} />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
    );0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toWarnDev([0
      'Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string',0
      // React retries once on error0
      'Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span(0
        'Element type is invalid: expected a string (for built-in components) or ' +0
          'a class/function (for composite components) but got: undefined.' +0
          (__DEV__0
            ? " You likely forgot to export your component from the file it's " +0
              'defined in, or you might have mixed up default and named imports.' +0
              '\n\nCheck the render method of `BrokenRender`.'0
            : ''),0
      ),0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('recovers from uncaught reconciler errors', () => {0
    const InvalidType = undefined;0
    expect(() => ReactNoop.render(<InvalidType />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string',0
    );0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toThrowError(0
      'Element type is invalid: expected a string (for built-in components) or ' +0
        'a class/function (for composite components) but got: undefined.' +0
        (__DEV__0
          ? " You likely forgot to export your component from the file it's " +0
            'defined in, or you might have mixed up default and named imports.'0
          : ''),0
    );0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<span prop="hi" />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('hi')]);0
  });0
0
  it('unmounts components with uncaught errors', () => {0
    const ops = [];0
    let inst;0
0
    class BrokenRenderAndUnmount extends React.Component {0
      state = {fail: false};0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        ops.push('BrokenRenderAndUnmount componentWillUnmount');0
      }0
      render() {0
        inst = this;0
        if (this.state.fail) {0
          throw new Error('Hello.');0
        }0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        ops.push('Parent componentWillUnmount [!]');0
        throw new Error('One does not simply unmount me.');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Parent>0
        <Parent>0
          <BrokenRenderAndUnmount />0
        </Parent>0
      </Parent>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    inst.setState({fail: true});0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
    }).toThrowError('Hello.');0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      // Attempt to clean up.0
      // Errors in parents shouldn't stop children from unmounting.0
      'Parent componentWillUnmount [!]',0
      'Parent componentWillUnmount [!]',0
      'BrokenRenderAndUnmount componentWillUnmount',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
  });0
0
  it('does not interrupt unmounting if detaching a ref throws', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        ops.push('Bar unmount');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span prop="Bar" />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function barRef(inst) {0
      if (inst === null) {0
        ops.push('barRef detach');0
        throw new Error('Detach error');0
      }0
      ops.push('barRef attach');0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return <div>{props.hide ? null : <Bar ref={barRef} />}</div>;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['barRef attach']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(span('Bar'))]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Unmount0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo hide={true} />);0
    expect(() => ReactNoop.flush()).toThrow('Detach error');0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'barRef detach',0
      // Bar should unmount even though its ref threw an error while detaching0
      'Bar unmount',0
    ]);0
    // Because there was an error, entire tree should unmount0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
  });0
0
  it('handles error thrown by host config while working on failed root', () => {0
    ReactNoop.simulateErrorInHostConfig(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(<span />);0
      expect(() => ReactNoop.flush()).toThrow('Error in host config.');0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('handles error thrown by top-level callback', () => {0
    ReactNoop.render(<div />, () => {0
      throw new Error('Error!');0
    });0
    expect(() => ReactNoop.flush()).toThrow('Error!');0
  });0
0
  it('error boundaries capture non-errors', () => {0
    spyOnProd(console, 'error');0
    spyOnDev(console, 'error');0
    let ops = [];0
0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        // Should not be called0
        ops.push('componentDidCatch');0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          ops.push('ErrorBoundary (catch)');0
          return (0
            <span0
              prop={`Caught an error: ${this.state.error.nonStandardMessage}`}0
            />0
          );0
        }0
        ops.push('ErrorBoundary (try)');0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Indirection(props) {0
      ops.push('Indirection');0
      return props.children;0
    }0
0
    const notAnError = {nonStandardMessage: 'oops'};0
    function BadRender() {0
      ops.push('BadRender');0
      throw notAnError;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <Indirection>0
          <BadRender />0
        </Indirection>0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary (try)',0
      'Indirection',0
      'BadRender',0
0
      // React retries one more time0
      'ErrorBoundary (try)',0
      'Indirection',0
      'BadRender',0
0
      // Errored again on retry. Now handle it.0
      'componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary (catch)',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Caught an error: oops')]);0
0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(console.error).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
      expect(console.error.calls.argsFor(0)[0]).toContain(0
        'The above error occurred in the <BadRender> component:',0
      );0
    } else {0
      expect(console.error).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
      expect(console.error.calls.argsFor(0)[0]).toBe(notAnError);0
    }0
  });0
0
  // TODO: Error boundary does not catch promises0
0
  it('continues working on siblings of a component that throws', () => {0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        ReactNoop.yield('componentDidCatch');0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          ReactNoop.yield('ErrorBoundary (catch)');0
          return <ErrorMessage error={this.state.error} />;0
        }0
        ReactNoop.yield('ErrorBoundary (try)');0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function ErrorMessage(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('ErrorMessage');0
      return <span prop={`Caught an error: ${props.error.message}`} />;0
    }0
0
    function BadRenderSibling(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('BadRenderSibling');0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    function BadRender() {0
      ReactNoop.yield('throw');0
      throw new Error('oops!');0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BadRender />0
        <BadRenderSibling />0
        <BadRenderSibling />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
    );0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'ErrorBoundary (try)',0
      'throw',0
      // Continue rendering siblings after BadRender throws0
      'BadRenderSibling',0
      'BadRenderSibling',0
0
      // React retries one more time0
      'ErrorBoundary (try)',0
      'throw',0
      'BadRenderSibling',0
      'BadRenderSibling',0
0
      // Errored again on retry. Now handle it.0
      'componentDidCatch',0
      'ErrorBoundary (catch)',0
      'ErrorMessage',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Caught an error: oops!')]);0
  });0
0
  it('calls the correct lifecycles on the error boundary after catching an error (mixed)', () => {0
    // This test seems a bit contrived, but it's based on an actual regression0
    // where we checked for the existence of didUpdate instead of didMount, and0
    // didMount was not defined.0
    function BadRender() {0
      ReactNoop.yield('throw');0
      throw new Error('oops!');0
    }0
0
    class Parent extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null, other: false};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        ReactNoop.yield('did catch');0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('did update');0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          ReactNoop.yield('render error message');0
          return <span prop={`Caught an error: ${this.state.error.message}`} />;0
        }0
        ReactNoop.yield('render');0
        return <BadRender />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Parent step={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushThrough([0
      'render',0
      'throw',0
      'render',0
      'throw',0
      'did catch',0
      'render error message',0
      'did update',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Caught an error: oops!')]);0
  });0
0
  it('provides component stack to the error boundary with componentDidCatch', () => {0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null, errorInfo: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error, errorInfo) {0
        this.setState({error, errorInfo});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.errorInfo) {0
          ReactNoop.yield('render error message');0
          return (0
            <span0
              prop={`Caught an error:${normalizeCodeLocInfo(0
                this.state.errorInfo.componentStack,0
              )}.`}0
            />0
          );0
        }0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function BrokenRender(props) {0
      throw new Error('Hello');0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenRender />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span(0
        'Caught an error:\n' +0
          (__DEV__0
            ? '    in BrokenRender (at **)\n'0
            : '    in BrokenRender\n') +0
          (__DEV__ ? '    in ErrorBoundary (at **).' : '    in ErrorBoundary.'),0
      ),0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('does not provide component stack to the error boundary with getDerivedStateFromCatch', () => {0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      static getDerivedStateFromCatch(error, errorInfo) {0
        expect(errorInfo).toBeUndefined();0
        return {error};0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          return <span prop={`Caught an error: ${this.state.error.message}`} />;0
        }0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function BrokenRender(props) {0
      throw new Error('Hello');0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <BrokenRender />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Caught an error: Hello')]);0
  });0
});0

'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactFeatureFlags;0
let ReactNoop;0
0
describe('ReactIncrementalErrorLogging', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode = false;0
    ReactFeatureFlags.replayFailedUnitOfWorkWithInvokeGuardedCallback = false;0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
  });0
0
  it('should log errors that occur during the begin phase', () => {0
    // Errors are redundantly logged in production mode by ReactFiberErrorLogger.0
    // It's okay to ignore them for the purpose of this test.0
    spyOnProd(console, 'error');0
0
    class ErrorThrowingComponent extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        const error = new Error('componentWillMount error');0
        // Note: it's `true` on the Error prototype our test environment.0
        // That lets us avoid asserting on warnings for each expected error.0
        // Here we intentionally shadow it to test logging, like in real apps.0
        error.suppressReactErrorLogging = undefined;0
        throw error;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <div>0
        <span>0
          <ErrorThrowingComponent />0
        </span>0
      </div>,0
    );0
0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri).toWarnDev(0
        'The above error occurred in the <ErrorThrowingComponent> component:\n' +0
          '    in ErrorThrowingComponent (at **)\n' +0
          '    in span (at **)\n' +0
          '    in div (at **)\n\n' +0
          'Consider adding an error boundary to your tree to customize error handling behavior.',0
      );0
    }).toThrowError('componentWillMount error');0
  });0
0
  it('should log errors that occur during the commit phase', () => {0
    // Errors are redundantly logged in production mode by ReactFiberErrorLogger.0
    // It's okay to ignore them for the purpose of this test.0
    spyOnProd(console, 'error');0
0
    class ErrorThrowingComponent extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        const error = new Error('componentDidMount error');0
        // Note: it's `true` on the Error prototype our test environment.0
        // That lets us avoid asserting on warnings for each expected error.0
        // Here we intentionally shadow it to test logging, like in real apps.0
        error.suppressReactErrorLogging = undefined;0
        throw error;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <div>0
        <span>0
          <ErrorThrowingComponent />0
        </span>0
      </div>,0
    );0
0
    expect(() => {0
      expect(ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri).toWarnDev(0
        'The above error occurred in the <ErrorThrowingComponent> component:\n' +0
          '    in ErrorThrowingComponent (at **)\n' +0
          '    in span (at **)\n' +0
          '    in div (at **)\n\n' +0
          'Consider adding an error boundary to your tree to customize error handling behavior.',0
      );0
    }).toThrowError('componentDidMount error');0
  });0
0
  it('should ignore errors thrown in log method to prevent cycle', () => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    jest.mock('../ReactFiberErrorLogger');0
    try {0
      React = require('react');0
      ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
0
      // TODO Update this test to use toWarnDev() matcher if possible0
      spyOnDevAndProd(console, 'error');0
0
      class ErrorThrowingComponent extends React.Component {0
        render() {0
          throw new Error('render error');0
        }0
      }0
0
      const logCapturedErrorCalls = [];0
0
      const ReactFiberErrorLogger = require('../ReactFiberErrorLogger');0
      ReactFiberErrorLogger.logCapturedError.mockImplementation(0
        capturedError => {0
          logCapturedErrorCalls.push(capturedError);0
          const error = new Error('logCapturedError error');0
          // Note: it's `true` on the Error prototype our test environment.0
          // That lets us avoid asserting on warnings for each expected error.0
          // Here we intentionally shadow it to test logging, like in real apps.0
          error.suppressReactErrorLogging = undefined;0
          throw error;0
        },0
      );0
0
      try {0
        ReactNoop.render(0
          <div>0
            <span>0
              <ErrorThrowingComponent />0
            </span>0
          </div>,0
        );0
        ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri();0
      } catch (error) {}0
0
      expect(logCapturedErrorCalls.length).toBe(1);0
0
      // The error thrown in logCapturedError should also be logged0
      expect(console.error).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
      expect(console.error.calls.argsFor(0)[0].message).toContain(0
        'logCapturedError error',0
      );0
    } finally {0
      jest.unmock('../ReactFiberErrorLogger');0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('resets instance variables before unmounting failed node', () => {0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      render() {0
        return this.state.error ? null : this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {step: 0};0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.setState({step: 1});0
      }0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('componentWillUnmount: ' + this.state.step);0
      }0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('render: ' + this.state.step);0
        if (this.state.step > 0) {0
          throw new Error('oops');0
        }0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <ErrorBoundary>0
        <Foo />0
      </ErrorBoundary>,0
    );0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'render: 0',0
      'render: 1',0
      'componentWillUnmount: 0',0
    ]);0
  });0
});0
/**0

 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
