'use strict';0
0
describe('ReactIncrementalErrorReplay-test', () => {0
  it('copies all keys when stashing potentially failing work', () => {0
    // Note: this test is fragile and relies on internals.0
    // We almost always try to avoid such tests, but here the cost of0
    // the list getting out of sync (and causing subtle bugs in rare cases)0
    // is higher than the cost of maintaing the test.0
    const {0
      // Any Fiber factory function will do.0
      createHostRootFiber,0
      // This is the method we're going to test.0
      // If this is no longer used, you can delete this test file.0
      assignFiberPropertiesInDEV,0
    } = require('../ReactFiber');0
0
    // Get a real fiber.0
    const realFiber = createHostRootFiber(false);0
    const stash = assignFiberPropertiesInDEV(null, realFiber);0
0
    // Verify we get all the same fields.0
    expect(realFiber).toEqual(stash);0
0
    // Mutate the original.0
    for (let key in realFiber) {0
      realFiber[key] = key + '_' + Math.random();0
    }0
    expect(realFiber).not.toEqual(stash);0
0
    // Verify we can still "revert" to the stashed properties.0
    expect(assignFiberPropertiesInDEV(realFiber, stash)).toBe(realFiber);0
    expect(realFiber).toEqual(stash);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactNoop;0
0
describe('ReactIncrementalErrorReplay', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
  });0
0
  function div(...children) {0
    children = children.map(c => (typeof c === 'string' ? {text: c} : c));0
    return {type: 'div', children, prop: undefined};0
  }0
0
  function span(prop) {0
    return {type: 'span', children: [], prop};0
  }0
0
  it('should fail gracefully on error in the host environment', () => {0
    ReactNoop.simulateErrorInHostConfig(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(<span />);0
      expect(() => ReactNoop.flush()).toThrow('Error in host config.');0
    });0
  });0
0
  it("should ignore error if it doesn't throw on retry", () => {0
    let didInit = false;0
0
    function badLazyInit() {0
      const needsInit = !didInit;0
      didInit = true;0
      if (needsInit) {0
        throw new Error('Hi');0
      }0
    }0
0
    class App extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        badLazyInit();0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    ReactNoop.render(<App />);0
    expect(() => ReactNoop.flush()).not.toThrow();0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2016-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
describe('ReactDebugFiberPerf', () => {0
  let React;0
  let ReactNoop;0
  let PropTypes;0
0
  let root;0
  let activeMeasure;0
  let knownMarks;0
  let knownMeasures;0
  let comments;0
0
  function resetFlamechart() {0
    root = {0
      children: [],0
      indent: -1,0
      markName: null,0
      label: null,0
      parent: null,0
      toString() {0
        return this.children.map(c => c.toString()).join('\n');0
      },0
    };0
    activeMeasure = root;0
    knownMarks = new Set();0
    knownMeasures = new Set();0
    comments = [];0
  }0
0
  function addComment(comment) {0
    comments.push(comment);0
  }0
0
  function getFlameChart() {0
    // Make sure we unwind the measurement stack every time.0
    expect(activeMeasure.indent).toBe(-1);0
    expect(activeMeasure).toBe(root);0
    // We should always clean them up because browsers0
    // buffer user timing measurements forever.0
    expect(knownMarks.size).toBe(0);0
    expect(knownMeasures.size).toBe(0);0
    return root.toString();0
  }0
0
  function createUserTimingPolyfill() {0
    // This is not a true polyfill, but it gives us enough0
    // to capture measurements in a readable tree-like output.0
    // Reference: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/User_Timing_API0
    return {0
      mark(markName) {0
        const measure = {0
          children: [],0
          indent: activeMeasure.indent + 1,0
          markName: markName,0
          // Will be assigned on measure() call:0
          label: null,0
          parent: activeMeasure,0
          comments,0
          toString() {0
            return (0
              [0
                ...this.comments.map(c => '  '.repeat(this.indent) + '// ' + c),0
                '  '.repeat(this.indent) + this.label,0
                ...this.children.map(c => c.toString()),0
              ].join('\n') +0
              // Extra newline after each root reconciliation0
              (this.indent === 0 ? '\n' : '')0
            );0
          },0
        };0
        comments = [];0
        // Step one level deeper0
        activeMeasure.children.push(measure);0
        activeMeasure = measure;0
        knownMarks.add(markName);0
      },0
      // We don't use the overload with three arguments.0
      measure(label, markName) {0
        if (markName !== activeMeasure.markName) {0
          throw new Error('Unexpected measure() call.');0
        }0
        // Step one level up0
        activeMeasure.label = label;0
        activeMeasure = activeMeasure.parent;0
        knownMeasures.add(label);0
      },0
      clearMarks(markName) {0
        if (markName === activeMeasure.markName) {0
          // Step one level up if we're in this measure0
          activeMeasure = activeMeasure.parent;0
          activeMeasure.children.length--;0
        }0
        knownMarks.delete(markName);0
      },0
      clearMeasures(label) {0
        knownMeasures.delete(label);0
      },0
    };0
  }0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    resetFlamechart();0
    global.performance = createUserTimingPolyfill();0
0
    require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags').enableUserTimingAPI = true;0
    require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags').enableProfilerTimer = false;0
    require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags').replayFailedUnitOfWorkWithInvokeGuardedCallback = false;0
0
    // Import after the polyfill is set up:0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
    PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
  });0
0
  afterEach(() => {0
    delete global.performance;0
  });0
0
  function Parent(props) {0
    return <div>{props.children}</div>;0
  }0
0
  function Child(props) {0
    return <div>{props.children}</div>;0
  }0
0
  it('measures a simple reconciliation', () => {0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Parent>0
        <Child />0
      </Parent>,0
    );0
    addComment('Mount');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Parent>0
        <Child />0
      </Parent>,0
    );0
    addComment('Update');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(null);0
    addComment('Unmount');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(getFlameChart()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('properly displays the forwardRef component in measurements', () => {0
    const AnonymousForwardRef = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => (0
      <Child {...props} ref={ref} />0
    ));0
    const NamedForwardRef = React.forwardRef(function refForwarder(props, ref) {0
      return <Child {...props} ref={ref} />;0
    });0
    function notImportant(props, ref) {0
      return <Child {...props} ref={ref} />;0
    }0
    notImportant.displayName = 'OverriddenName';0
    const DisplayNamedForwardRef = React.forwardRef(notImportant);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Parent>0
        <AnonymousForwardRef />0
        <NamedForwardRef />0
        <DisplayNamedForwardRef />0
      </Parent>,0
    );0
    addComment('Mount');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(getFlameChart()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('does not include AsyncMode, StrictMode, or Profiler components in measurements', () => {0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={jest.fn()}>0
        <React.StrictMode>0
          <Parent>0
            <React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
              <Child />0
            </React.unstable_AsyncMode>0
          </Parent>0
        </React.StrictMode>0
      </React.unstable_Profiler>,0
    );0
    addComment('Mount');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(getFlameChart()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('does not include context provider or consumer in measurements', () => {0
    const {Consumer, Provider} = React.createContext(true);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Provider value={false}>0
        <Parent>0
          <Consumer>{value => <Child value={value} />}</Consumer>0
        </Parent>0
      </Provider>,0
    );0
    addComment('Mount');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(getFlameChart()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('skips parents during setState', () => {0
    class A extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class B extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    let a;0
    let b;0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Parent>0
        <Parent>0
          <Parent>0
            <A ref={inst => (a = inst)} />0
          </Parent>0
        </Parent>0
        <Parent>0
          <B ref={inst => (b = inst)} />0
        </Parent>0
      </Parent>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    resetFlamechart();0
0
    a.setState({});0
    b.setState({});0
    addComment('Should include just A and B, no Parents');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(getFlameChart()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('warns on cascading renders from setState', () => {0
    class Cascading extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.setState({});0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Parent>0
        <Cascading />0
      </Parent>,0
    );0
    addComment('Should print a warning');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(getFlameChart()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('warns on cascading renders from top-level render', () => {0
    class Cascading extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<Child />, 'b');0
        addComment('Scheduling another root from componentDidMount');0
        ReactNoop.flush();0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<Cascading />, 'a');0
    addComment('Rendering the first root');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(getFlameChart()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('does not treat setState from cWM or cWRP as cascading', () => {0
    class NotCascading extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        this.setState({});0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {0
        this.setState({});0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Parent>0
        <NotCascading />0
      </Parent>,0
    );0
    addComment('Should not print a warning');0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toWarnDev([0
      'componentWillMount: Please update the following components ' +0
        'to use componentDidMount instead: NotCascading' +0
        '\n\ncomponentWillReceiveProps: Please update the following components ' +0
        'to use static getDerivedStateFromProps instead: NotCascading',0
    ]);0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Parent>0
        <NotCascading />0
      </Parent>,0
    );0
    addComment('Should not print a warning');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(getFlameChart()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('captures all lifecycles', () => {0
    class AllLifecycles extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.any,0
      };0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return true;0
      }0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {foo: 42};0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {}0
      componentDidMount() {}0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {}0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {}0
      componentDidUpdate() {}0
      componentWillUnmount() {}0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    ReactNoop.render(<AllLifecycles />);0
    addComment('Mount');0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toWarnDev(0
      'componentWillMount: Please update the following components ' +0
        'to use componentDidMount instead: AllLifecycles' +0
        '\n\ncomponentWillReceiveProps: Please update the following components ' +0
        'to use static getDerivedStateFromProps instead: AllLifecycles' +0
        '\n\ncomponentWillUpdate: Please update the following components ' +0
        'to use componentDidUpdate instead: AllLifecycles',0
    );0
    ReactNoop.render(<AllLifecycles />);0
    addComment('Update');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    ReactNoop.render(null);0
    addComment('Unmount');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(getFlameChart()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('measures deprioritized work', () => {0
    addComment('Flush the parent');0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(0
        <Parent>0
          <div hidden={true}>0
            <Child />0
          </div>0
        </Parent>,0
      );0
    });0
    addComment('Flush the child');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(getFlameChart()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('measures deferred work in chunks', () => {0
    class A extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class B extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Parent>0
        <A>0
          <Child />0
        </A>0
        <B>0
          <Child />0
        </B>0
      </Parent>,0
    );0
    addComment('Start mounting Parent and A');0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(40);0
    addComment('Mount B just a little (but not enough to memoize)');0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(10);0
    addComment('Complete B and Parent');0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri();0
    expect(getFlameChart()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('recovers from fatal errors', () => {0
    function Baddie() {0
      throw new Error('Game over');0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Parent>0
        <Baddie />0
      </Parent>,0
    );0
    try {0
      addComment('Will fatal');0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
    } catch (err) {0
      expect(err.message).toBe('Game over');0
    }0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Parent>0
        <Child />0
      </Parent>,0
    );0
    addComment('Will reconcile from a clean state');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(getFlameChart()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('recovers from caught errors', () => {0
    function Baddie() {0
      throw new Error('Game over');0
    }0
0
    function ErrorReport() {0
      return <div />;0
    }0
0
    class Boundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          return <ErrorReport />;0
        }0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Parent>0
        <Boundary>0
          <Parent>0
            <Baddie />0
          </Parent>0
        </Boundary>0
      </Parent>,0
    );0
    addComment('Stop on Baddie and restart from Boundary');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(getFlameChart()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('deduplicates lifecycle names during commit to reduce overhead', () => {0
    class A extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate() {}0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class B extends React.Component {0
      componentDidUpdate(prevProps) {0
        if (this.props.cascade && !prevProps.cascade) {0
          this.setState({});0
        }0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Parent>0
        <A />0
        <B />0
        <A />0
        <B />0
      </Parent>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    resetFlamechart();0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Parent>0
        <A />0
        <B />0
        <A />0
        <B />0
      </Parent>,0
    );0
    addComment('The commit phase should mention A and B just once');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Parent>0
        <A />0
        <B />0
        <A />0
        <B cascade={true} />0
      </Parent>,0
    );0
    addComment("Because of deduplication, we don't know B was cascading,");0
    addComment('but we should still see the warning for the commit phase.');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(getFlameChart()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('supports portals', () => {0
    const noopContainer = {children: []};0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Parent>{ReactNoop.createPortal(<Child />, noopContainer, null)}</Parent>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(getFlameChart()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('does not schedule an extra callback if setState is called during a synchronous commit phase', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {step: 1};0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.setState({step: 2});0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span prop={this.state.step} />;0
      }0
    }0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(<Component />);0
    });0
    expect(getFlameChart()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('warns if an in-progress update is interrupted', () => {0
    function Foo() {0
      return <span />;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flushUnitsOfWork(2);0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    });0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(getFlameChart()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
0
  it('warns if async work expires (starvation)', () => {0
    function Foo() {0
      return <span />;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.expire(6000);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(getFlameChart()).toMatchSnapshot();0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactFeatureFlags;0
let ReactNoop;0
0
describe('ReactIncrementalReflection', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode = false;0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
  });0
0
  it('handles isMounted even when the initial render is deferred', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    const instances = [];0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      _isMounted() {0
        // No longer a public API, but we can test that it works internally by0
        // reaching into the updater.0
        return this.updater.isMounted(this);0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        instances.push(this);0
        ops.push('componentWillMount', this._isMounted());0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ops.push('componentDidMount', this._isMounted());0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo() {0
      return <Component />;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
0
    // Render part way through but don't yet commit the updates.0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(20);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['componentWillMount', false]);0
0
    expect(instances[0]._isMounted()).toBe(false);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Render the rest and commit the updates.0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toWarnDev(0
      'componentWillMount: Please update the following components ' +0
        'to use componentDidMount instead: Component',0
    );0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['componentDidMount', true]);0
0
    expect(instances[0]._isMounted()).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('handles isMounted when an unmount is deferred', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    const instances = [];0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      _isMounted() {0
        return this.updater.isMounted(this);0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        instances.push(this);0
      }0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        ops.push('componentWillUnmount', this._isMounted());0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Component');0
        return <span />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Other() {0
      ops.push('Other');0
      return <span />;0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return props.mount ? <Component /> : <Other />;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo mount={true} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toWarnDev(0
      'componentWillMount: Please update the following components ' +0
        'to use componentDidMount instead: Component',0
    );0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Component']);0
    ops = [];0
0
    expect(instances[0]._isMounted()).toBe(true);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo mount={false} />);0
    // Render part way through but don't yet commit the updates so it is not0
    // fully unmounted yet.0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(20);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Other']);0
    ops = [];0
0
    expect(instances[0]._isMounted()).toBe(true);0
0
    // Finish flushing the unmount.0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['componentWillUnmount', true]);0
0
    expect(instances[0]._isMounted()).toBe(false);0
  });0
0
  it('finds no node before insertion and correct node before deletion', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    let classInstance = null;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        classInstance = this;0
        ops.push('componentWillMount', ReactNoop.findInstance(this));0
      }0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ops.push('componentDidMount', ReactNoop.findInstance(this));0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {0
        ops.push('componentWillUpdate', ReactNoop.findInstance(this));0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('componentDidUpdate', ReactNoop.findInstance(this));0
      }0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        ops.push('componentWillUnmount', ReactNoop.findInstance(this));0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('render');0
        return this.props.step < 2 ? (0
          <span ref={ref => (this.span = ref)} />0
        ) : this.props.step === 2 ? (0
          <div ref={ref => (this.div = ref)} />0
        ) : this.props.step === 3 ? null : this.props.step === 4 ? (0
          <div ref={ref => (this.span = ref)} />0
        ) : null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Sibling() {0
      // Sibling is used to assert that we've rendered past the first component.0
      ops.push('render sibling');0
      return <span />;0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return [<Component key="a" step={props.step} />, <Sibling key="b" />];0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo step={0} />);0
    // Flush past Component but don't complete rendering everything yet.0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(30);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'componentWillMount',0
      null,0
      'render',0
      'render sibling',0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    expect(classInstance).toBeDefined();0
    // The instance has been complete but is still not committed so it should0
    // not find any host nodes in it.0
    expect(ReactNoop.findInstance(classInstance)).toBe(null);0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toWarnDev(0
      'componentWillMount: Please update the following components ' +0
        'to use componentDidMount instead: Component' +0
        '\n\ncomponentWillUpdate: Please update the following components ' +0
        'to use componentDidUpdate instead: Component',0
    );0
0
    const hostSpan = classInstance.span;0
    expect(hostSpan).toBeDefined();0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.findInstance(classInstance)).toBe(hostSpan);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['componentDidMount', hostSpan]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Flush next step which will cause an update but not yet render a new host0
    // node.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo step={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'componentWillUpdate',0
      hostSpan,0
      'render',0
      'render sibling',0
      'componentDidUpdate',0
      hostSpan,0
    ]);0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.findInstance(classInstance)).toBe(hostSpan);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // The next step will render a new host node but won't get committed yet.0
    // We expect this to mutate the original Fiber.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo step={2} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(30);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'componentWillUpdate',0
      hostSpan,0
      'render',0
      'render sibling',0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // This should still be the host span.0
    expect(ReactNoop.findInstance(classInstance)).toBe(hostSpan);0
0
    // When we finally flush the tree it will get committed.0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    const hostDiv = classInstance.div;0
0
    expect(hostDiv).toBeDefined();0
    expect(hostSpan).not.toBe(hostDiv);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['componentDidUpdate', hostDiv]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // We should now find the new host node.0
    expect(ReactNoop.findInstance(classInstance)).toBe(hostDiv);0
0
    // Render to null but don't commit it yet.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo step={3} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(25);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'componentWillUpdate',0
      hostDiv,0
      'render',0
      'render sibling',0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // This should still be the host div since the deletion is not committed.0
    expect(ReactNoop.findInstance(classInstance)).toBe(hostDiv);0
0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['componentDidUpdate', null]);0
0
    // This should still be the host div since the deletion is not committed.0
    expect(ReactNoop.findInstance(classInstance)).toBe(null);0
0
    // Render a div again0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo step={4} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Unmount the component.0
    ReactNoop.render([]);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['componentWillUnmount', hostDiv]);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactFeatureFlags;0
let ReactNoop;0
0
describe('ReactIncrementalScheduling', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode = false;0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
  });0
0
  function span(prop) {0
    return {type: 'span', children: [], prop};0
  }0
0
  it('schedules and flushes deferred work', () => {0
    ReactNoop.render(<span prop="1" />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('1')]);0
  });0
0
  it('searches for work on other roots once the current root completes', () => {0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="a:1" />, 'a');0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="b:1" />, 'b');0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="c:1" />, 'c');0
0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('a')).toEqual([span('a:1')]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('b')).toEqual([span('b:1')]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('c')).toEqual([span('c:1')]);0
  });0
0
  it('schedules top-level updates in order of priority', () => {0
    // Initial render.0
    ReactNoop.render(<span prop={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(1)]);0
0
    ReactNoop.batchedUpdates(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(<span prop={5} />);0
      ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
        ReactNoop.render(<span prop={2} />);0
        ReactNoop.render(<span prop={3} />);0
        ReactNoop.render(<span prop={4} />);0
      });0
    });0
    // The sync updates flush first.0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(4)]);0
0
    // The terminal value should be the last update that was scheduled,0
    // regardless of priority. In this case, that's the last sync update.0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(4)]);0
  });0
0
  it('schedules top-level updates with same priority in order of insertion', () => {0
    // Initial render.0
    ReactNoop.render(<span prop={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(1)]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<span prop={2} />);0
    ReactNoop.render(<span prop={3} />);0
    ReactNoop.render(<span prop={4} />);0
    ReactNoop.render(<span prop={5} />);0
0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(5)]);0
  });0
0
  it('works on deferred roots in the order they were scheduled', () => {0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="a:1" />, 'a');0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="b:1" />, 'b');0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="c:1" />, 'c');0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('a')).toEqual([span('a:1')]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('b')).toEqual([span('b:1')]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('c')).toEqual([span('c:1')]);0
0
    // Schedule deferred work in the reverse order0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="c:2" />, 'c');0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="b:2" />, 'b');0
    // Ensure it starts in the order it was scheduled0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(15 + 5);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('a')).toEqual([span('a:1')]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('b')).toEqual([span('b:1')]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('c')).toEqual([span('c:2')]);0
    // Schedule last bit of work, it will get processed the last0
    ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(<span prop="a:2" />, 'a');0
    // Keep performing work in the order it was scheduled0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(15 + 5);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('a')).toEqual([span('a:1')]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('b')).toEqual([span('b:2')]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('c')).toEqual([span('c:2')]);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(15 + 5);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('a')).toEqual([span('a:2')]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('b')).toEqual([span('b:2')]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren('c')).toEqual([span('c:2')]);0
  });0
0
  it('schedules sync updates when inside componentDidMount/Update', () => {0
    let instance;0
    let ops = [];0
0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {tick: 0};0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ops.push('componentDidMount (before setState): ' + this.state.tick);0
        this.setState({tick: 1});0
        // We're in a batch. Update hasn't flushed yet.0
        ops.push('componentDidMount (after setState): ' + this.state.tick);0
      }0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('componentDidUpdate: ' + this.state.tick);0
        if (this.state.tick === 2) {0
          ops.push('componentDidUpdate (before setState): ' + this.state.tick);0
          this.setState({tick: 3});0
          ops.push('componentDidUpdate (after setState): ' + this.state.tick);0
          // We're in a batch. Update hasn't flushed yet.0
        }0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        ops.push('render: ' + this.state.tick);0
        instance = this;0
        return <span prop={this.state.tick} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(20 + 5);0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'render: 0',0
      'componentDidMount (before setState): 0',0
      'componentDidMount (after setState): 0',0
      // If the setState inside componentDidMount were deferred, there would be0
      // no more ops. Because it has Task priority, we get these ops, too:0
      'render: 1',0
      'componentDidUpdate: 1',0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
    instance.setState({tick: 2});0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(20 + 5);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'render: 2',0
      'componentDidUpdate: 2',0
      'componentDidUpdate (before setState): 2',0
      'componentDidUpdate (after setState): 2',0
      // If the setState inside componentDidUpdate were deferred, there would be0
      // no more ops. Because it has Task priority, we get these ops, too:0
      'render: 3',0
      'componentDidUpdate: 3',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('can opt-in to async scheduling inside componentDidMount/Update', () => {0
    let instance;0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {tick: 0};0
0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ReactNoop.deferredUpdates(() => {0
          ReactNoop.yield(0
            'componentDidMount (before setState): ' + this.state.tick,0
          );0
          this.setState({tick: 1});0
          ReactNoop.yield(0
            'componentDidMount (after setState): ' + this.state.tick,0
          );0
        });0
      }0
0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ReactNoop.deferredUpdates(() => {0
          ReactNoop.yield('componentDidUpdate: ' + this.state.tick);0
          if (this.state.tick === 2) {0
            ReactNoop.yield(0
              'componentDidUpdate (before setState): ' + this.state.tick,0
            );0
            this.setState({tick: 3});0
            ReactNoop.yield(0
              'componentDidUpdate (after setState): ' + this.state.tick,0
            );0
          }0
        });0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('render: ' + this.state.tick);0
        instance = this;0
        return <span prop={this.state.tick} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    });0
    // The cDM update should not have flushed yet because it has async priority.0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(0)]);0
0
    // Now flush the cDM update.0
    ReactNoop.clearYields();0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['render: 1', 'componentDidUpdate: 1']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(1)]);0
0
    // Increment the tick to 2. This will trigger an update inside cDU. Flush0
    // the first update without flushing the second one.0
    instance.setState({tick: 2});0
    ReactNoop.flushThrough([0
      'render: 2',0
      'componentDidUpdate: 2',0
      'componentDidUpdate (before setState): 2',0
      'componentDidUpdate (after setState): 2',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(2)]);0
0
    // Now flush the cDU update.0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['render: 3', 'componentDidUpdate: 3']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(3)]);0
  });0
0
  it('performs Task work even after time runs out', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {step: 1};0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.setState({step: 2}, () => {0
          this.setState({step: 3}, () => {0
            this.setState({step: 4}, () => {0
              this.setState({step: 5});0
            });0
          });0
        });0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span prop={this.state.step} />;0
      }0
    }0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    // This should be just enough to complete all the work, but not enough to0
    // commit it.0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(20);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Do one more unit of work.0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(10);0
    // The updates should all be flushed with Task priority0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(5)]);0
  });0
0
  it('can opt-out of batching using unbatchedUpdates', () => {0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(<span prop={0} />);0
      expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
      // Should not have flushed yet because we're still batching0
0
      // unbatchedUpdates reverses the effect of batchedUpdates, so sync0
      // updates are not batched0
      ReactNoop.unbatchedUpdates(() => {0
        ReactNoop.render(<span prop={1} />);0
        expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(1)]);0
        ReactNoop.render(<span prop={2} />);0
        expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(2)]);0
      });0
0
      ReactNoop.render(<span prop={3} />);0
      expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(2)]);0
    });0
    // Remaining update is now flushed0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(3)]);0
  });0
0
  it('nested updates are always deferred, even inside unbatchedUpdates', () => {0
    let instance;0
    let ops = [];0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {step: 0};0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('componentDidUpdate: ' + this.state.step);0
        if (this.state.step === 1) {0
          ReactNoop.unbatchedUpdates(() => {0
            // This is a nested state update, so it should not be0
            // flushed synchronously, even though we wrapped it0
            // in unbatchedUpdates.0
            this.setState({step: 2});0
          });0
          expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(1)]);0
        }0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('render: ' + this.state.step);0
        instance = this;0
        return <span prop={this.state.step} />;0
      }0
    }0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(0)]);0
0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      instance.setState({step: 1});0
    });0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(2)]);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'render: 0',0
      'render: 1',0
      'componentDidUpdate: 1',0
      'render: 2',0
      'componentDidUpdate: 2',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('updates do not schedule a new callback if already inside a callback', () => {0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {foo: 'foo'};0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {0
        ReactNoop.yield(0
          'has callback before setState: ' + ReactNoop.hasScheduledCallback(),0
        );0
        this.setState({foo: 'baz'});0
        ReactNoop.yield(0
          'has callback after setState: ' + ReactNoop.hasScheduledCallback(),0
        );0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo step={1} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toWarnDev(0
      'componentWillReceiveProps: Please update the following components ' +0
        'to use static getDerivedStateFromProps instead: Foo',0
    );0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo step={2} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'has callback before setState: false',0
      'has callback after setState: false',0
    ]);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactFeatureFlags;0
let ReactNoop;0
0
describe('ReactIncrementalSideEffects', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode = false;0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
  });0
0
  function div(...children) {0
    children = children.map(c => (typeof c === 'string' ? {text: c} : c));0
    return {type: 'div', children, prop: undefined};0
  }0
0
  function span(prop) {0
    return {type: 'span', children: [], prop};0
  }0
0
  it('can update child nodes of a host instance', () => {0
    function Bar(props) {0
      return <span>{props.text}</span>;0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <Bar text={props.text} />0
          {props.text === 'World' ? <Bar text={props.text} /> : null}0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="Hello" />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(span())]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="World" />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(span(), span())]);0
  });0
0
  it('can update child nodes of a fragment', function() {0
    function Bar(props) {0
      return <span>{props.text}</span>;0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <Bar text={props.text} />0
          {props.text === 'World'0
            ? [<Bar key="a" text={props.text} />, <div key="b" />]0
            : props.text === 'Hi'0
              ? [<div key="b" />, <Bar key="a" text={props.text} />]0
              : null}0
          <span prop="test" />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="Hello" />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(span(), span('test'))]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="World" />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(span(), span(), div(), span('test')),0
    ]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="Hi" />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(span(), div(), span(), span('test')),0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('can update child nodes rendering into text nodes', function() {0
    function Bar(props) {0
      return props.text;0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <Bar text={props.text} />0
          {props.text === 'World'0
            ? [<Bar key="a" text={props.text} />, '!']0
            : null}0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="Hello" />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div('Hello')]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="World" />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div('World', 'World', '!')]);0
  });0
0
  it('can deletes children either components, host or text', function() {0
    function Bar(props) {0
      return <span prop={props.children} />;0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          {props.show0
            ? [<div key="a" />, <Bar key="b">Hello</Bar>, 'World']0
            : []}0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo show={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(div(), span('Hello'), 'World'),0
    ]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo show={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div()]);0
  });0
0
  it('can delete a child that changes type - implicit keys', function() {0
    let unmounted = false;0
0
    class ClassComponent extends React.Component {0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        unmounted = true;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span prop="Class" />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function FunctionalComponent(props) {0
      return <span prop="Function" />;0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          {props.useClass ? (0
            <ClassComponent />0
          ) : props.useFunction ? (0
            <FunctionalComponent />0
          ) : props.useText ? (0
            'Text'0
          ) : null}0
          Trail0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo useClass={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(span('Class'), 'Trail')]);0
0
    expect(unmounted).toBe(false);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo useFunction={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(span('Function'), 'Trail')]);0
0
    expect(unmounted).toBe(true);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo useText={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div('Text', 'Trail')]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div('Trail')]);0
  });0
0
  it('can delete a child that changes type - explicit keys', function() {0
    let unmounted = false;0
0
    class ClassComponent extends React.Component {0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        unmounted = true;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span prop="Class" />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function FunctionalComponent(props) {0
      return <span prop="Function" />;0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          {props.useClass ? (0
            <ClassComponent key="a" />0
          ) : props.useFunction ? (0
            <FunctionalComponent key="a" />0
          ) : null}0
          Trail0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo useClass={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(span('Class'), 'Trail')]);0
0
    expect(unmounted).toBe(false);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo useFunction={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(span('Function'), 'Trail')]);0
0
    expect(unmounted).toBe(true);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div('Trail')]);0
  });0
0
  it('does not update child nodes if a flush is aborted', () => {0
    function Bar(props) {0
      return <span prop={props.text} />;0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <div>0
            <Bar text={props.text} />0
            {props.text === 'Hello' ? <Bar text={props.text} /> : null}0
          </div>0
          <Bar text="Yo" />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="Hello" />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(div(span('Hello'), span('Hello')), span('Yo')),0
    ]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="World" />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(35);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(div(span('Hello'), span('Hello')), span('Yo')),0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('preserves a previously rendered node when deprioritized', () => {0
    function Middle(props) {0
      return <span prop={props.children} />;0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <div hidden={true}>0
            <Middle>{props.text}</Middle>0
          </div>0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="foo" />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(div(span('foo')))]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="bar" />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(20);0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(div(span('foo')))]);0
0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(div(span('bar')))]);0
  });0
0
  it('can reuse side-effects after being preempted', () => {0
    function Bar(props) {0
      return <span prop={props.children} />;0
    }0
0
    const middleContent = (0
      <div>0
        <Bar>Hello</Bar>0
        <Bar>World</Bar>0
      </div>0
    );0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return (0
        <div hidden={true}>0
          {props.step === 0 ? (0
            <div>0
              <Bar>Hi</Bar>0
              <Bar>{props.text}</Bar>0
            </div>0
          ) : (0
            middleContent0
          )}0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Init0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="foo" step={0} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(div(span('Hi'), span('foo'))),0
    ]);0
0
    // Make a quick update which will schedule low priority work to0
    // update the middle content.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="bar" step={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(30);0
0
    // The tree remains unchanged.0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(div(span('Hi'), span('foo'))),0
    ]);0
0
    // The first Bar has already completed its update but we'll interrupt it to0
    // render some higher priority work. The middle content will bailout so0
    // it remains untouched which means that it should reuse it next time.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="foo" step={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    // Since we did nothing to the middle subtree during the interruption,0
    // we should be able to reuse the reconciliation work that we already did0
    // without restarting. The side-effects should still be replayed.0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(div(span('Hello'), span('World'))),0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('can reuse side-effects after being preempted, if shouldComponentUpdate is false', () => {0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps) {0
        return this.props.children !== nextProps.children;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span prop={this.props.children} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Content extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps) {0
        return this.props.step !== nextProps.step;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <Bar>{this.props.step === 0 ? 'Hi' : 'Hello'}</Bar>0
            <Bar>{this.props.step === 0 ? this.props.text : 'World'}</Bar>0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return (0
        <div hidden={true}>0
          <Content step={props.step} text={props.text} />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Init0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="foo" step={0} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(div(span('Hi'), span('foo'))),0
    ]);0
0
    // Make a quick update which will schedule low priority work to0
    // update the middle content.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="bar" step={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(35);0
0
    // The tree remains unchanged.0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(div(span('Hi'), span('foo'))),0
    ]);0
0
    // The first Bar has already completed its update but we'll interrupt it to0
    // render some higher priority work. The middle content will bailout so0
    // it remains untouched which means that it should reuse it next time.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo text="foo" step={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush(30);0
0
    // Since we did nothing to the middle subtree during the interruption,0
    // we should be able to reuse the reconciliation work that we already did0
    // without restarting. The side-effects should still be replayed.0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(div(span('Hello'), span('World'))),0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('can update a completed tree before it has a chance to commit', () => {0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return <span prop={props.step} />;0
    }0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo step={1} />);0
    // This should be just enough to complete the tree without committing it0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(20);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
    // To confirm, perform one more unit of work. The tree should now be flushed.0
    // (ReactNoop decrements the time remaining by 5 *before* returning it from0
    // the deadline, so to perform n units of work, you need to give it 5n + 5.0
    // TODO: This is confusing. Decrement it after.)0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(10);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(1)]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo step={2} />);0
    // This should be just enough to complete the tree without committing it0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(20);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(1)]);0
    // This time, before we commit the tree, we update the root component with0
    // new props0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo step={3} />);0
    // Now let's commit. We already had a commit that was pending, which will0
    // render 2.0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(10);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(2)]);0
    // If we flush the rest of the work, we should get another commit that0
    // renders 3. If it renders 2 again, that means an update was dropped.0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(3)]);0
  });0
0
  it('updates a child even though the old props is empty', () => {0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return (0
        <div hidden={true}>0
          <span prop={1} />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(span(1))]);0
  });0
0
  xit('can defer side-effects and resume them later on', () => {0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps) {0
        return this.props.idx !== nextProps.idx;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span prop={this.props.idx} />;0
      }0
    }0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <span prop={props.tick} />0
          <div hidden={true}>0
            <Bar idx={props.idx} />0
            <Bar idx={props.idx + 1} />0
          </div>0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo tick={0} idx={0} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(40 + 25);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(0
        span(0),0
        div(/*the spans are down-prioritized and not rendered yet*/),0
      ),0
    ]);0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo tick={1} idx={0} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(35 + 25);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(span(1), div(/*still not rendered yet*/)),0
    ]);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(30 + 25);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(0
        span(1),0
        div(0
          // Now we had enough time to finish the spans.0
          span(0),0
          span(1),0
        ),0
      ),0
    ]);0
    const innerSpanA = ReactNoop.getChildren()[0].children[1].children[1];0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo tick={2} idx={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(30 + 25);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(0
        span(2),0
        div(0
          // Still same old numbers.0
          span(0),0
          span(1),0
        ),0
      ),0
    ]);0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo tick={3} idx={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(0
        span(3),0
        div(0
          // New numbers.0
          span(1),0
          span(2),0
        ),0
      ),0
    ]);0
0
    const innerSpanB = ReactNoop.getChildren()[0].children[1].children[1];0
    // This should have been an update to an existing instance, not recreation.0
    // We verify that by ensuring that the child instance was the same as0
    // before.0
    expect(innerSpanA).toBe(innerSpanB);0
  });0
0
  xit('can defer side-effects and reuse them later - complex', function() {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps) {0
        return this.props.idx !== nextProps.idx;0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Bar');0
        return <span prop={this.props.idx} />;0
      }0
    }0
    class Baz extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps) {0
        return this.props.idx !== nextProps.idx;0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Baz');0
        return [0
          <Bar key="a" idx={this.props.idx} />,0
          <Bar key="b" idx={this.props.idx} />,0
        ];0
      }0
    }0
    function Foo(props) {0
      ops.push('Foo');0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <span prop={props.tick} />0
          <div hidden={true}>0
            <Baz idx={props.idx} />0
            <Baz idx={props.idx} />0
            <Baz idx={props.idx} />0
          </div>0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo tick={0} idx={0} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(65 + 5);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(0
        span(0),0
        div(/*the spans are down-prioritized and not rendered yet*/),0
      ),0
    ]);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Baz', 'Bar']);0
    ops = [];0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo tick={1} idx={0} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(70);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(span(1), div(/*still not rendered yet*/)),0
    ]);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo']);0
    ops = [];0
0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(0
        span(1),0
        div(0
          // Now we had enough time to finish the spans.0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
        ),0
      ),0
    ]);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Bar', 'Baz', 'Bar', 'Bar', 'Baz', 'Bar', 'Bar']);0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Now we're going to update the index but we'll only let it finish half0
    // way through.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo tick={2} idx={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(95);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(0
        span(2),0
        div(0
          // Still same old numbers.0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
        ),0
      ),0
    ]);0
0
    // We let it finish half way through. That means we'll have one fully0
    // completed Baz, one half-way completed Baz and one fully incomplete Baz.0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Baz', 'Bar', 'Bar', 'Baz', 'Bar']);0
    ops = [];0
0
    // We'll update again, without letting the new index update yet. Only half0
    // way through.0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo tick={3} idx={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(50);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(0
        span(3),0
        div(0
          // Old numbers.0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
        ),0
      ),0
    ]);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo']);0
    ops = [];0
0
    // We should now be able to reuse some of the work we've already done0
    // and replay those side-effects.0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(0
        span(3),0
        div(0
          // New numbers.0
          span(1),0
          span(1),0
          span(1),0
          span(1),0
          span(1),0
          span(1),0
        ),0
      ),0
    ]);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Bar', 'Baz', 'Bar', 'Bar']);0
  });0
0
  it('deprioritizes setStates that happens within a deprioritized tree', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    const barInstances = [];0
0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        this.state = {active: false};0
        barInstances.push(this);0
      }0
      activate() {0
        this.setState({active: true});0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('Bar');0
        return <span prop={this.state.active ? 'X' : this.props.idx} />;0
      }0
    }0
    function Foo(props) {0
      ops.push('Foo');0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <span prop={props.tick} />0
          <div hidden={true}>0
            <Bar idx={props.idx} />0
            <Bar idx={props.idx} />0
            <Bar idx={props.idx} />0
          </div>0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo tick={0} idx={0} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(span(0), div(span(0), span(0), span(0))),0
    ]);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Bar', 'Bar']);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo tick={1} idx={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(70 + 5);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(0
        // Updated.0
        span(1),0
        div(0
          // Still not updated.0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
        ),0
      ),0
    ]);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Bar']);0
    ops = [];0
0
    barInstances[0].activate();0
0
    // This should not be enough time to render the content of all the hidden0
    // items. Including the set state since that is deprioritized.0
    // TODO: The cycles it takes to do this could be lowered with further0
    // optimizations.0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(35);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(0
        // Updated.0
        span(1),0
        div(0
          // Still not updated.0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
          span(0),0
        ),0
      ),0
    ]);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Bar']);0
    ops = [];0
0
    // However, once we render fully, we will have enough time to finish it all0
    // at once.0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      div(0
        span(1),0
        div(0
          // Now we had enough time to finish the spans.0
          span('X'),0
          span(1),0
          span(1),0
        ),0
      ),0
    ]);0
0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['Bar', 'Bar', 'Bar']);0
  });0
  // TODO: Test that side-effects are not cut off when a work in progress node0
  // moves to "current" without flushing due to having lower priority. Does this0
  // even happen? Maybe a child doesn't get processed because it is lower prio?0
0
  it('calls callback after update is flushed', () => {0
    let instance;0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        instance = this;0
        this.state = {text: 'foo'};0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span prop={this.state.text} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('foo')]);0
    let called = false;0
    instance.setState({text: 'bar'}, () => {0
      expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('bar')]);0
      called = true;0
    });0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(called).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('calls setState callback even if component bails out', () => {0
    let instance;0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      constructor() {0
        super();0
        instance = this;0
        this.state = {text: 'foo'};0
      }0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps, nextState) {0
        return this.state.text !== nextState.text;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span prop={this.state.text} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('foo')]);0
    let called = false;0
    instance.setState({}, () => {0
      called = true;0
    });0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(called).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  // TODO: Test that callbacks are not lost if an update is preempted.0
0
  it('calls componentWillUnmount after a deletion, even if nested', () => {0
    const ops = [];0
0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        ops.push(this.props.name);0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      componentWillUnmount() {0
        ops.push('Wrapper');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <Bar name={this.props.name} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          {props.show0
            ? [0
                <Bar key="a" name="A" />,0
                <Wrapper key="b" name="B" />,0
                <div key="cd">0
                  <Bar name="C" />0
                  <Wrapper name="D" />,0
                </div>,0
                [<Bar key="e" name="E" />, <Bar key="f" name="F" />],0
              ]0
            : []}0
          <div>{props.show ? <Bar key="g" name="G" /> : null}</div>0
          <Bar name="this should not unmount" />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo show={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual([]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo show={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'A',0
      'Wrapper',0
      'B',0
      'C',0
      'Wrapper',0
      'D',0
      'E',0
      'F',0
      'G',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('calls componentDidMount/Update after insertion/update', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ops.push('mount:' + this.props.name);0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('update:' + this.props.name);0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <span />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Wrapper extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ops.push('mount:wrapper-' + this.props.name);0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('update:wrapper-' + this.props.name);0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <Bar name={this.props.name} />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <Bar key="a" name="A" />0
          <Wrapper key="b" name="B" />0
          <div key="cd">0
            <Bar name="C" />0
            <Wrapper name="D" />0
          </div>0
          {[<Bar key="e" name="E" />, <Bar key="f" name="F" />]}0
          <div>0
            <Bar key="g" name="G" />0
          </div>0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'mount:A',0
      'mount:B',0
      'mount:wrapper-B',0
      'mount:C',0
      'mount:D',0
      'mount:wrapper-D',0
      'mount:E',0
      'mount:F',0
      'mount:G',0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'update:A',0
      'update:B',0
      'update:wrapper-B',0
      'update:C',0
      'update:D',0
      'update:wrapper-D',0
      'update:E',0
      'update:F',0
      'update:G',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('invokes ref callbacks after insertion/update/unmount', () => {0
    let classInstance = null;0
0
    let ops = [];0
0
    class ClassComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        classInstance = this;0
        return <span />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function FunctionalComponent(props) {0
      return <span />;0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return props.show ? (0
        <div>0
          <ClassComponent ref={n => ops.push(n)} />0
          <FunctionalComponent ref={n => ops.push(n)} />0
          <div ref={n => ops.push(n)} />0
        </div>0
      ) : null;0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo show={true} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Stateless function components cannot be given refs. ' +0
        'Attempts to access this ref will fail.\n\nCheck the render method ' +0
        'of `Foo`.\n' +0
        '    in FunctionalComponent (at **)\n' +0
        '    in div (at **)\n' +0
        '    in Foo (at **)',0
    );0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      classInstance,0
      // no call for functional components0
      div(),0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    // Refs that switch function instances get reinvoked0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo show={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      // detach all refs that switched handlers first.0
      null,0
      null,0
      // reattach as a separate phase0
      classInstance,0
      div(),0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo show={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      // unmount0
      null,0
      null,0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  // TODO: Test that mounts, updates, refs, unmounts and deletions happen in the0
  // expected way for aborted and resumed render life-cycles.0
0
  it('supports string refs', () => {0
    let fooInstance = null;0
0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      componentDidMount() {0
        this.test = 'test';0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        fooInstance = this;0
        return <Bar ref="bar" />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: A string ref, "bar", has been found within a strict mode tree.',0
    );0
0
    expect(fooInstance.refs.bar.test).toEqual('test');0
  });0
});0
