'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactFeatureFlags;0
let ReactNoop;0
0
describe('ReactIncrementalTriangle', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode = false;0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
  });0
0
  function span(prop) {0
    return {type: 'span', children: [], prop};0
  }0
0
  const FLUSH = 'FLUSH';0
  function flush(unitsOfWork = Infinity) {0
    return {0
      type: FLUSH,0
      unitsOfWork,0
    };0
  }0
0
  const FLUSH_ALL = 'FLUSH_ALL';0
  function flushAll() {0
    return {0
      type: FLUSH_ALL,0
    };0
  }0
0
  const STEP = 'STEP';0
  function step(counter) {0
    return {0
      type: STEP,0
      counter,0
    };0
  }0
0
  const INTERRUPT = 'INTERRUPT';0
  function interrupt(key) {0
    return {0
      type: INTERRUPT,0
    };0
  }0
0
  const TOGGLE = 'TOGGLE';0
  function toggle(childIndex) {0
    return {0
      type: TOGGLE,0
      childIndex,0
    };0
  }0
0
  const EXPIRE = 'EXPIRE';0
  function expire(ms) {0
    return {0
      type: EXPIRE,0
      ms,0
    };0
  }0
0
  const STOP = 'STOP';0
0
  function randomInteger(min, max) {0
    min = Math.ceil(min);0
    max = Math.floor(max);0
    return Math.floor(Math.random() * (max - min)) + min;0
  }0
0
  function formatAction(action) {0
    switch (action.type) {0
      case FLUSH:0
        return `flush(${action.unitsOfWork})`;0
      case FLUSH_ALL:0
        return 'flushAll()';0
      case STEP:0
        return `step(${action.counter})`;0
      case INTERRUPT:0
        return 'interrupt()';0
      case TOGGLE:0
        return `toggle(${action.childIndex})`;0
      case EXPIRE:0
        return `expire(${action.ms})`;0
      default:0
        throw new Error('Switch statement should be exhaustive');0
    }0
  }0
0
  function formatActions(actions) {0
    let result = 'simulate(';0
    for (let i = 0; i < actions.length; i++) {0
      const action = actions[i];0
      result += formatAction(action);0
      if (i !== actions.length - 1) {0
        result += ', ';0
      }0
    }0
    result += ')';0
    return result;0
  }0
0
  const MAX_DEPTH = 3;0
  const TOTAL_CHILDREN = Math.pow(3, MAX_DEPTH);0
  let TOTAL_TRIANGLES = 0;0
  for (let i = 0; i <= MAX_DEPTH; i++) {0
    TOTAL_TRIANGLES += Math.pow(3, i);0
  }0
0
  function randomAction() {0
    const weights = [0
      [FLUSH, 1],0
      [FLUSH_ALL, 1],0
      [STEP, 1],0
      [INTERRUPT, 1],0
      [TOGGLE, 1],0
      [EXPIRE, 1],0
    ];0
    let totalWeight = 0;0
    for (let i = 0; i < weights.length; i++) {0
      totalWeight += weights[i][1];0
    }0
0
    const randomNumber = Math.random() * totalWeight;0
    let actionType;0
    let remainingWeight = randomNumber;0
    for (let i = 0; i < weights.length; i++) {0
      const [option, weight] = weights[i];0
      remainingWeight -= weight;0
      if (remainingWeight <= 0) {0
        actionType = option;0
        break;0
      }0
    }0
0
    switch (actionType) {0
      case FLUSH:0
        return flush(randomInteger(0, TOTAL_TRIANGLES * 1.5));0
      case FLUSH_ALL:0
        return flushAll();0
      case STEP:0
        return step(randomInteger(0, 10));0
      case INTERRUPT:0
        return interrupt();0
      case TOGGLE:0
        return toggle(randomInteger(0, TOTAL_TRIANGLES));0
      case EXPIRE:0
        return expire(randomInteger(0, 1500));0
      default:0
        throw new Error('Switch statement should be exhaustive');0
    }0
  }0
0
  function randomActions(n) {0
    let actions = [];0
    for (let i = 0; i < n; i++) {0
      actions.push(randomAction());0
    }0
    return actions;0
  }0
0
  function TriangleSimulator(rootID) {0
    const CounterContext = React.createContext([]);0
    const ActiveContext = React.createContext(0);0
0
    let triangles = [];0
    let leafTriangles = [];0
    let yieldAfterEachRender = false;0
    class Triangle extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super();0
        this.index = triangles.length;0
        triangles.push(this);0
        if (props.remainingDepth === 0) {0
          this.leafIndex = leafTriangles.length;0
          leafTriangles.push(this);0
        }0
        this.state = {isActive: false};0
      }0
      activate() {0
        this.setState({isActive: true});0
      }0
      deactivate() {0
        this.setState({isActive: false});0
      }0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps, nextState) {0
        return (0
          this.props.counter !== nextProps.counter ||0
          this.props.activeDepth !== nextProps.activeDepth ||0
          this.state.isActive !== nextState.isActive0
        );0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (yieldAfterEachRender) {0
          ReactNoop.yield(this);0
        }0
        const {counter, remainingDepth} = this.props;0
        return (0
          <ActiveContext.Consumer>0
            {activeContext => (0
              <CounterContext.Consumer>0
                {counterContext => {0
                  const activeDepthProp = this.state.isActive0
                    ? this.props.activeDepth + 10
                    : this.props.activeDepth;0
                  const activeDepthContext = this.state.isActive0
                    ? activeContext + 10
                    : activeContext;0
                  if (remainingDepth === 0) {0
                    // Leaf0
                    const output = JSON.stringify({0
                      prop: counter,0
                      isActive: this.state.isActive,0
                      counterContext: counterContext,0
                      activeDepthProp,0
                      activeDepthContext,0
                    });0
                    return <span prop={output} />;0
                  }0
0
                  return (0
                    <ActiveContext.Provider value={activeDepthContext}>0
                      <CounterContext.Provider value={counter}>0
                        <Triangle0
                          counter={counter}0
                          activeDepth={activeDepthProp}0
                          remainingDepth={remainingDepth - 1}0
                        />0
                        <Triangle0
                          counter={counter}0
                          activeDepth={activeDepthProp}0
                          remainingDepth={remainingDepth - 1}0
                        />0
                        <Triangle0
                          counter={counter}0
                          activeDepth={activeDepthProp}0
                          remainingDepth={remainingDepth - 1}0
                        />0
                      </CounterContext.Provider>0
                    </ActiveContext.Provider>0
                  );0
                }}0
              </CounterContext.Consumer>0
            )}0
          </ActiveContext.Consumer>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    let appInstance;0
    class App extends React.Component {0
      state = {counter: 0};0
      interrupt() {0
        // Triggers a restart from the top.0
        this.forceUpdate();0
      }0
      setCounter(counter) {0
        const currentCounter = this.state.counter;0
        this.setState({counter});0
        return currentCounter;0
      }0
      render() {0
        appInstance = this;0
        return (0
          <Triangle0
            counter={this.state.counter}0
            activeDepth={0}0
            remainingDepth={this.props.remainingDepth}0
          />0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    let keyCounter = 0;0
    function reset(nextStep = 0) {0
      triangles = [];0
      leafTriangles = [];0
      // Remounts the whole tree by changing the key0
      if (rootID) {0
        ReactNoop.renderToRootWithID(0
          <App remainingDepth={MAX_DEPTH} key={keyCounter++} />,0
          rootID,0
        );0
      } else {0
        ReactNoop.render(<App remainingDepth={MAX_DEPTH} key={keyCounter++} />);0
      }0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
      assertConsistentTree();0
      return appInstance;0
    }0
0
    reset();0
0
    function assertConsistentTree(activeTriangleIndices = new Set(), counter) {0
      const children = ReactNoop.getChildren(rootID);0
0
      if (children.length !== TOTAL_CHILDREN) {0
        throw new Error('Wrong number of children.');0
      }0
0
      let expectedCounter = counter;0
0
      for (let i = 0; i < children.length; i++) {0
        let child = children[i];0
0
        const output = JSON.parse(child.prop);0
        const prop = output.prop;0
        const isActive = output.isActive;0
        const counterContext = output.counterContext;0
        const activeDepthProp = output.activeDepthProp;0
        const activeDepthContext = output.activeDepthContext;0
0
        // If an expected counter is not specified, use the value of the0
        // first child.0
        if (expectedCounter === undefined) {0
          expectedCounter = prop;0
        }0
        const expectedIsActive = activeTriangleIndices.has(i);0
0
        if (prop !== expectedCounter) {0
          throw new Error(0
            `Triangle ${i} is inconsistent: prop ${prop} instead of ` +0
              expectedCounter,0
          );0
        }0
0
        if (isActive !== expectedIsActive) {0
          throw new Error(0
            `Triangle ${i} is inconsistent: isActive ${isActive} instead of ` +0
              expectedIsActive,0
          );0
        }0
0
        if (counterContext !== prop) {0
          throw new Error(0
            `Triangle ${i} is inconsistent: prop ${prop} does not match ` +0
              `counterContext ${counterContext}`,0
          );0
        }0
0
        if (activeDepthContext !== activeDepthProp) {0
          throw new Error(0
            `Triangle ${i} is inconsistent: activeDepthProp ` +0
              `${activeDepthProp} does not match activeDepthContext ` +0
              activeDepthContext,0
          );0
        }0
      }0
    }0
0
    function* simulateAndYield() {0
      const app = reset();0
      let expectedCounterAtEnd = app.state.counter;0
0
      let activeIndices = new Set();0
      let activeLeafIndices = new Set();0
      let action;0
      while (true) {0
        action = yield;0
        if (action === STOP) {0
          break;0
        }0
        ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
          switch (action.type) {0
            case FLUSH:0
              ReactNoop.flushUnitsOfWork(action.unitsOfWork);0
              break;0
            case FLUSH_ALL:0
              ReactNoop.flush();0
              break;0
            case STEP:0
              ReactNoop.deferredUpdates(() => {0
                app.setCounter(action.counter);0
                expectedCounterAtEnd = action.counter;0
              });0
              break;0
            case INTERRUPT:0
              app.interrupt();0
              break;0
            case TOGGLE:0
              const targetTriangle = triangles[action.childIndex];0
              if (targetTriangle === undefined) {0
                throw new Error('Target index is out of bounds');0
              }0
              const index = targetTriangle.index;0
              const leafIndex = targetTriangle.leafIndex;0
              if (activeIndices.has(index)) {0
                activeIndices.delete(index);0
                if (leafIndex !== undefined) {0
                  activeLeafIndices.delete(leafIndex);0
                }0
                targetTriangle.deactivate();0
              } else {0
                activeIndices.add(index);0
                if (leafIndex !== undefined) {0
                  activeLeafIndices.add(leafIndex);0
                }0
                targetTriangle.activate();0
              }0
              break;0
            case EXPIRE:0
              ReactNoop.expire(action.ms);0
              break;0
            default:0
              throw new Error('Switch statement should be exhaustive');0
          }0
        });0
        assertConsistentTree(activeLeafIndices);0
      }0
      // Flush remaining work0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
      assertConsistentTree(activeLeafIndices, expectedCounterAtEnd);0
    }0
0
    function simulate(...actions) {0
      const gen = simulateAndYield();0
      // Call this once to prepare the generator0
      gen.next();0
      // eslint-disable-next-line no-for-of-loops/no-for-of-loops0
      for (let action of actions) {0
        gen.next(action);0
      }0
      gen.next(STOP);0
    }0
0
    return {0
      simulateAndYield,0
      simulate,0
      randomAction,0
      randomActions,0
    };0
  }0
0
  describe('single root', () => {0
    // These tests are not deterministic because the inputs are randomized. It0
    // runs a limited number of tests on every run. If it fails, it will output0
    // the case that led to the failure. Add the failing case to the test above0
    // to prevent future regressions.0
    it('hard-coded tests', () => {0
      const {simulate} = TriangleSimulator();0
      simulate(step(1));0
      simulate(toggle(0), step(1), toggle(0));0
      simulate(step(1), toggle(0), flush(2), step(2), toggle(0));0
      simulate(step(1), flush(3), toggle(0), step(0));0
      simulate(step(1), flush(3), toggle(18), step(0));0
      simulate(step(4), flush(52), expire(1476), flush(17), step(0));0
      simulate(interrupt(), toggle(10), step(2), expire(990), flush(46));0
      simulate(interrupt(), step(6), step(7), toggle(6), interrupt());0
      simulate(interrupt(), toggle(31), toggle(31), toggle(13), step(1));0
    });0
0
    it('generative tests', () => {0
      const {simulate} = TriangleSimulator();0
0
      const limit = 1000;0
0
      for (let i = 0; i < limit; i++) {0
        const actions = randomActions(5);0
        try {0
          simulate(...actions);0
        } catch (e) {0
          console.error(0
            `Triangle fuzz tester error! Copy and paste the following line into the test suite:0
${formatActions(actions)}0
          `,0
          );0
          throw e;0
        }0
      }0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('multiple roots', () => {0
    const rootIDs = ['a', 'b', 'c'];0
0
    function randomActionsPerRoot() {0
      function randomRootID() {0
        const index = randomInteger(0, rootIDs.length);0
        return rootIDs[index];0
      }0
0
      const actions = [];0
      for (let i = 0; i < 10; i++) {0
        const rootID = randomRootID();0
        const action = randomAction();0
        actions.push([rootID, action]);0
      }0
      return actions;0
    }0
0
    function formatActionsPerRoot(actions) {0
      let result = 'simulateMultipleRoots(';0
      for (let i = 0; i < actions.length; i++) {0
        const [rootID, action] = actions[i];0
        result += `['${rootID}', ${formatAction(action)}]`;0
        if (i !== actions.length - 1) {0
          result += ', ';0
        }0
      }0
      result += ')';0
      return result;0
    }0
0
    function simulateMultipleRoots(...actions) {0
      const roots = new Map();0
      // eslint-disable-next-line no-for-of-loops/no-for-of-loops0
      for (let rootID of rootIDs) {0
        const simulator = TriangleSimulator(rootID);0
        const generator = simulator.simulateAndYield();0
        // Call this once to prepare the generator0
        generator.next();0
        roots.set(rootID, generator);0
      }0
0
      actions.forEach(([rootID, action]) => {0
        const generator = roots.get(rootID);0
        generator.next(action);0
      });0
      roots.forEach(generator => {0
        generator.next(STOP);0
      });0
    }0
0
    it('hard-coded tests', () => {0
      simulateMultipleRoots(0
        ['b', interrupt()],0
        ['a', toggle(22)],0
        ['c', step(4)],0
        ['a', expire(10)],0
        ['a', interrupt()],0
        ['c', step(2)],0
        ['b', interrupt()],0
      );0
0
      simulateMultipleRoots(0
        ['c', toggle(0)],0
        ['c', step(1)],0
        ['b', flush(7)],0
        ['c', toggle(0)],0
      );0
    });0
0
    it('generative tests', () => {0
      const limit = 100;0
      for (let i = 0; i < limit; i++) {0
        const actions = randomActionsPerRoot();0
        try {0
          simulateMultipleRoots(...actions);0
        } catch (e) {0
          console.error(0
            `Triangle fuzz tester error! Copy and paste the following line into the test suite:0
${formatActionsPerRoot(actions)}0
              `,0
          );0
          throw e;0
        }0
      }0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0

 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactFeatureFlags;0
let ReactNoop;0
0
describe('ReactIncrementalUpdates', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModuleRegistry();0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode = false;0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
  });0
0
  function span(prop) {0
    return {type: 'span', children: [], prop};0
  }0
0
  it('applies updates in order of priority', () => {0
    let state;0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ReactNoop.deferredUpdates(() => {0
          // Has low priority0
          this.setState({b: 'b'});0
          this.setState({c: 'c'});0
        });0
        // Has Task priority0
        this.setState({a: 'a'});0
      }0
      render() {0
        state = this.state;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flushDeferredPri(25);0
    expect(state).toEqual({a: 'a'});0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(state).toEqual({a: 'a', b: 'b', c: 'c'});0
  });0
0
  it('applies updates with equal priority in insertion order', () => {0
    let state;0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      componentDidMount() {0
        // All have Task priority0
        this.setState({a: 'a'});0
        this.setState({b: 'b'});0
        this.setState({c: 'c'});0
      }0
      render() {0
        state = this.state;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(state).toEqual({a: 'a', b: 'b', c: 'c'});0
  });0
0
  it('only drops updates with equal or lesser priority when replaceState is called', () => {0
    let instance;0
    let ops = [];0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ops.push('componentDidMount');0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        ops.push('componentDidUpdate');0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('render');0
        instance = this;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      ReactNoop.deferredUpdates(() => {0
        instance.setState({x: 'x'});0
        instance.setState({y: 'y'});0
      });0
      instance.setState({a: 'a'});0
      instance.setState({b: 'b'});0
      ReactNoop.deferredUpdates(() => {0
        instance.updater.enqueueReplaceState(instance, {c: 'c'});0
        instance.setState({d: 'd'});0
      });0
    });0
0
    // Even though a replaceState has been already scheduled, it hasn't been0
    // flushed yet because it has async priority.0
    expect(instance.state).toEqual({a: 'a', b: 'b'});0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'render',0
      'componentDidMount',0
      'render',0
      'componentDidUpdate',0
    ]);0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    // Now the rest of the updates are flushed, including the replaceState.0
    expect(instance.state).toEqual({c: 'c', d: 'd'});0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['render', 'componentDidUpdate']);0
  });0
0
  it('can abort an update, schedule additional updates, and resume', () => {0
    let instance;0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      render() {0
        instance = this;0
        return (0
          <span0
            prop={Object.keys(this.state)0
              .sort()0
              .join('')}0
          />0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    function createUpdate(letter) {0
      return () => {0
        ReactNoop.yield(letter);0
        return {0
          [letter]: letter,0
        };0
      };0
    }0
0
    // Schedule some async updates0
    instance.setState(createUpdate('a'));0
    instance.setState(createUpdate('b'));0
    instance.setState(createUpdate('c'));0
0
    // Begin the updates but don't flush them yet0
    ReactNoop.flushThrough(['a', 'b', 'c']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('')]);0
0
    // Schedule some more updates at different priorities0
    instance.setState(createUpdate('d'));0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      instance.setState(createUpdate('e'));0
      instance.setState(createUpdate('f'));0
    });0
    instance.setState(createUpdate('g'));0
0
    // The sync updates should have flushed, but not the async ones0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('ef')]);0
0
    // Now flush the remaining work. Even though e and f were already processed,0
    // they should be processed again, to ensure that the terminal state0
    // is deterministic.0
    ReactNoop.clearYields();0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'a',0
      'b',0
      'c',0
0
      // e, f, and g are in a separate batch from a, b, and c because they0
      // were scheduled in the middle of a render0
      'e',0
      'f',0
      'g',0
0
      'd',0
      'e',0
      'f',0
      'g',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('abcdefg')]);0
  });0
0
  it('can abort an update, schedule a replaceState, and resume', () => {0
    let instance;0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      render() {0
        instance = this;0
        return (0
          <span0
            prop={Object.keys(this.state)0
              .sort()0
              .join('')}0
          />0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    function createUpdate(letter) {0
      return () => {0
        ReactNoop.yield(letter);0
        return {0
          [letter]: letter,0
        };0
      };0
    }0
0
    // Schedule some async updates0
    instance.setState(createUpdate('a'));0
    instance.setState(createUpdate('b'));0
    instance.setState(createUpdate('c'));0
0
    // Begin the updates but don't flush them yet0
    ReactNoop.flushThrough(['a', 'b', 'c']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('')]);0
0
    // Schedule some more updates at different priorities{0
    instance.setState(createUpdate('d'));0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      instance.setState(createUpdate('e'));0
      // No longer a public API, but we can test that it works internally by0
      // reaching into the updater.0
      instance.updater.enqueueReplaceState(instance, createUpdate('f'));0
    });0
    instance.setState(createUpdate('g'));0
0
    // The sync updates should have flushed, but not the async ones. Update d0
    // was dropped and replaced by e.0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('f')]);0
0
    // Now flush the remaining work. Even though e and f were already processed,0
    // they should be processed again, to ensure that the terminal state0
    // is deterministic.0
    ReactNoop.clearYields();0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'a',0
      'b',0
      'c',0
0
      // e, f, and g are in a separate batch from a, b, and c because they0
      // were scheduled in the middle of a render0
      'e',0
      'f',0
      'g',0
0
      'd',0
      'e',0
      'f',0
      'g',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('fg')]);0
  });0
0
  it('passes accumulation of previous updates to replaceState updater function', () => {0
    let instance;0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      render() {0
        instance = this;0
        return <span />;0
      }0
    }0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    instance.setState({a: 'a'});0
    instance.setState({b: 'b'});0
    // No longer a public API, but we can test that it works internally by0
    // reaching into the updater.0
    instance.updater.enqueueReplaceState(instance, previousState => ({0
      previousState,0
    }));0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(instance.state).toEqual({previousState: {a: 'a', b: 'b'}});0
  });0
0
  it('does not call callbacks that are scheduled by another callback until a later commit', () => {0
    let ops = [];0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ops.push('did mount');0
        this.setState({a: 'a'}, () => {0
          ops.push('callback a');0
          this.setState({b: 'b'}, () => {0
            ops.push('callback b');0
          });0
        });0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('render');0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      'render',0
      'did mount',0
      'render',0
      'callback a',0
      'render',0
      'callback b',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('gives setState during reconciliation the same priority as whatever level is currently reconciling', () => {0
    let instance;0
    let ops = [];0
0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {0
        ops.push('componentWillReceiveProps');0
        this.setState({b: 'b'});0
      }0
      render() {0
        ops.push('render');0
        instance = this;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toWarnDev(0
      'componentWillReceiveProps: Please update the following components ' +0
        'to use static getDerivedStateFromProps instead: Foo',0
    );0
0
    ops = [];0
0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      instance.setState({a: 'a'});0
0
      ReactNoop.render(<Foo />); // Trigger componentWillReceiveProps0
    });0
0
    expect(instance.state).toEqual({a: 'a', b: 'b'});0
    expect(ops).toEqual(['componentWillReceiveProps', 'render']);0
  });0
0
  it('enqueues setState inside an updater function as if the in-progress update is progressed (and warns)', () => {0
    let instance;0
    let ops = [];0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      render() {0
        ops.push('render');0
        instance = this;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    instance.setState(function a() {0
      ops.push('setState updater');0
      this.setState({b: 'b'});0
      return {a: 'a'};0
    });0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toWarnDev(0
      'An update (setState, replaceState, or forceUpdate) was scheduled ' +0
        'from inside an update function. Update functions should be pure, ' +0
        'with zero side-effects. Consider using componentDidUpdate or a ' +0
        'callback.',0
    );0
    expect(ops).toEqual([0
      // Initial render0
      'render',0
      'setState updater',0
      // Update b is enqueued with the same priority as update a, so it should0
      // be flushed in the same commit.0
      'render',0
    ]);0
    expect(instance.state).toEqual({a: 'a', b: 'b'});0
0
    // Test deduplication (no additional warnings expected)0
    instance.setState(function a() {0
      this.setState({a: 'a'});0
      return {b: 'b'};0
    });0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
  });0
0
  it('getDerivedStateFromProps should update base state of updateQueue (based on product bug)', () => {0
    // Based on real-world bug.0
0
    let foo;0
    class Foo extends React.Component {0
      state = {value: 'initial state'};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
        return {value: 'derived state'};0
      }0
      render() {0
        foo = this;0
        return (0
          <React.Fragment>0
            <span prop={this.state.value} />0
            <Bar />0
          </React.Fragment>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    let bar;0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        bar = this;0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    });0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('derived state')]);0
0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      // Triggers getDerivedStateFromProps again0
      ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
      // The noop callback is needed to trigger the specific internal path that0
      // led to this bug. Removing it causes it to "accidentally" work.0
      foo.setState({value: 'update state'}, function noop() {});0
    });0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('derived state')]);0
0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      bar.setState({});0
    });0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('derived state')]);0
  });0
});0

 * @emails react-core0
 */0
