'use strict';0
0
let ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
0
let React = require('react');0
let ReactNoop;0
let gen;0
0
describe('ReactNewContext', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode = false;0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
    gen = require('random-seed');0
  });0
0
  // function div(...children) {0
  //   children = children.map(c => (typeof c === 'string' ? {text: c} : c));0
  //   return {type: 'div', children, prop: undefined};0
  // }0
0
  function span(prop) {0
    return {type: 'span', children: [], prop};0
  }0
0
  it('simple mount and update', () => {0
    const Context = React.createContext(1);0
0
    function Consumer(props) {0
      return (0
        <Context.Consumer>0
          {value => <span prop={'Result: ' + value} />}0
        </Context.Consumer>0
      );0
    }0
0
    const Indirection = React.Fragment;0
0
    function App(props) {0
      return (0
        <Context.Provider value={props.value}>0
          <Indirection>0
            <Indirection>0
              <Consumer />0
            </Indirection>0
          </Indirection>0
        </Context.Provider>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={2} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Result: 2')]);0
0
    // Update0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={3} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Result: 3')]);0
  });0
0
  it('propagates through shouldComponentUpdate false', () => {0
    const Context = React.createContext(1);0
0
    function Provider(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Provider');0
      return (0
        <Context.Provider value={props.value}>0
          {props.children}0
        </Context.Provider>0
      );0
    }0
0
    function Consumer(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Consumer');0
      return (0
        <Context.Consumer>0
          {value => {0
            ReactNoop.yield('Consumer render prop');0
            return <span prop={'Result: ' + value} />;0
          }}0
        </Context.Consumer>0
      );0
    }0
0
    class Indirection extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('Indirection');0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function App(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('App');0
      return (0
        <Provider value={props.value}>0
          <Indirection>0
            <Indirection>0
              <Consumer />0
            </Indirection>0
          </Indirection>0
        </Provider>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={2} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'App',0
      'Provider',0
      'Indirection',0
      'Indirection',0
      'Consumer',0
      'Consumer render prop',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Result: 2')]);0
0
    // Update0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={3} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'App',0
      'Provider',0
      'Consumer render prop',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Result: 3')]);0
  });0
0
  it('consumers bail out if context value is the same', () => {0
    const Context = React.createContext(1);0
0
    function Provider(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Provider');0
      return (0
        <Context.Provider value={props.value}>0
          {props.children}0
        </Context.Provider>0
      );0
    }0
0
    function Consumer(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Consumer');0
      return (0
        <Context.Consumer>0
          {value => {0
            ReactNoop.yield('Consumer render prop');0
            return <span prop={'Result: ' + value} />;0
          }}0
        </Context.Consumer>0
      );0
    }0
0
    class Indirection extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('Indirection');0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function App(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('App');0
      return (0
        <Provider value={props.value}>0
          <Indirection>0
            <Indirection>0
              <Consumer />0
            </Indirection>0
          </Indirection>0
        </Provider>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={2} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'App',0
      'Provider',0
      'Indirection',0
      'Indirection',0
      'Consumer',0
      'Consumer render prop',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Result: 2')]);0
0
    // Update with the same context value0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={2} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'App',0
      'Provider',0
      // Don't call render prop again0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Result: 2')]);0
  });0
0
  it('nested providers', () => {0
    const Context = React.createContext(1);0
0
    function Provider(props) {0
      return (0
        <Context.Consumer>0
          {contextValue => (0
            // Multiply previous context value by 2, unless prop overrides0
            <Context.Provider value={props.value || contextValue * 2}>0
              {props.children}0
            </Context.Provider>0
          )}0
        </Context.Consumer>0
      );0
    }0
0
    function Consumer(props) {0
      return (0
        <Context.Consumer>0
          {value => <span prop={'Result: ' + value} />}0
        </Context.Consumer>0
      );0
    }0
0
    class Indirection extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function App(props) {0
      return (0
        <Provider value={props.value}>0
          <Indirection>0
            <Provider>0
              <Indirection>0
                <Provider>0
                  <Indirection>0
                    <Consumer />0
                  </Indirection>0
                </Provider>0
              </Indirection>0
            </Provider>0
          </Indirection>0
        </Provider>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={2} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Result: 8')]);0
0
    // Update0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={3} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Result: 12')]);0
  });0
0
  it('should provide the correct (default) values to consumers outside of a provider', () => {0
    const FooContext = React.createContext({value: 'foo-initial'});0
    const BarContext = React.createContext({value: 'bar-initial'});0
0
    const Verify = ({actual, expected}) => {0
      expect(expected).toBe(actual);0
      return null;0
    };0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <React.Fragment>0
        <BarContext.Provider value={{value: 'bar-updated'}}>0
          <BarContext.Consumer>0
            {({value}) => <Verify actual={value} expected="bar-updated" />}0
          </BarContext.Consumer>0
0
          <FooContext.Provider value={{value: 'foo-updated'}}>0
            <FooContext.Consumer>0
              {({value}) => <Verify actual={value} expected="foo-updated" />}0
            </FooContext.Consumer>0
          </FooContext.Provider>0
        </BarContext.Provider>0
0
        <FooContext.Consumer>0
          {({value}) => <Verify actual={value} expected="foo-initial" />}0
        </FooContext.Consumer>0
        <BarContext.Consumer>0
          {({value}) => <Verify actual={value} expected="bar-initial" />}0
        </BarContext.Consumer>0
      </React.Fragment>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
  });0
0
  it('multiple consumers in different branches', () => {0
    const Context = React.createContext(1);0
0
    function Provider(props) {0
      return (0
        <Context.Consumer>0
          {contextValue => (0
            // Multiply previous context value by 2, unless prop overrides0
            <Context.Provider value={props.value || contextValue * 2}>0
              {props.children}0
            </Context.Provider>0
          )}0
        </Context.Consumer>0
      );0
    }0
0
    function Consumer(props) {0
      return (0
        <Context.Consumer>0
          {value => <span prop={'Result: ' + value} />}0
        </Context.Consumer>0
      );0
    }0
0
    class Indirection extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function App(props) {0
      return (0
        <Provider value={props.value}>0
          <Indirection>0
            <Indirection>0
              <Provider>0
                <Consumer />0
              </Provider>0
            </Indirection>0
            <Indirection>0
              <Consumer />0
            </Indirection>0
          </Indirection>0
        </Provider>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={2} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span('Result: 4'),0
      span('Result: 2'),0
    ]);0
0
    // Update0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={3} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span('Result: 6'),0
      span('Result: 3'),0
    ]);0
0
    // Another update0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={4} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span('Result: 8'),0
      span('Result: 4'),0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('compares context values with Object.is semantics', () => {0
    const Context = React.createContext(1);0
0
    function Provider(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Provider');0
      return (0
        <Context.Provider value={props.value}>0
          {props.children}0
        </Context.Provider>0
      );0
    }0
0
    function Consumer(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Consumer');0
      return (0
        <Context.Consumer>0
          {value => {0
            ReactNoop.yield('Consumer render prop');0
            return <span prop={'Result: ' + value} />;0
          }}0
        </Context.Consumer>0
      );0
    }0
0
    class Indirection extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('Indirection');0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function App(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('App');0
      return (0
        <Provider value={props.value}>0
          <Indirection>0
            <Indirection>0
              <Consumer />0
            </Indirection>0
          </Indirection>0
        </Provider>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={NaN} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'App',0
      'Provider',0
      'Indirection',0
      'Indirection',0
      'Consumer',0
      'Consumer render prop',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Result: NaN')]);0
0
    // Update0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={NaN} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'App',0
      'Provider',0
      // Consumer should not re-render again0
      // 'Consumer render prop',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Result: NaN')]);0
  });0
0
  it('context unwinds when interrupted', () => {0
    const Context = React.createContext('Default');0
0
    function Consumer(props) {0
      return (0
        <Context.Consumer>0
          {value => <span prop={'Result: ' + value} />}0
        </Context.Consumer>0
      );0
    }0
0
    function BadRender() {0
      throw new Error('Bad render');0
    }0
0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error) {0
          return null;0
        }0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function App(props) {0
      return (0
        <React.Fragment>0
          <Context.Provider value="Does not unwind">0
            <ErrorBoundary>0
              <Context.Provider value="Unwinds after BadRender throws">0
                <BadRender />0
              </Context.Provider>0
            </ErrorBoundary>0
            <Consumer />0
          </Context.Provider>0
        </React.Fragment>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value="A" />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      // The second provider should use the default value.0
      span('Result: Does not unwind'),0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('can skip consumers with bitmask', () => {0
    const Context = React.createContext({foo: 0, bar: 0}, (a, b) => {0
      let result = 0;0
      if (a.foo !== b.foo) {0
        result |= 0b01;0
      }0
      if (a.bar !== b.bar) {0
        result |= 0b10;0
      }0
      return result;0
    });0
0
    function Provider(props) {0
      return (0
        <Context.Provider value={{foo: props.foo, bar: props.bar}}>0
          {props.children}0
        </Context.Provider>0
      );0
    }0
0
    function Foo() {0
      return (0
        <Context.Consumer unstable_observedBits={0b01}>0
          {value => {0
            ReactNoop.yield('Foo');0
            return <span prop={'Foo: ' + value.foo} />;0
          }}0
        </Context.Consumer>0
      );0
    }0
0
    function Bar() {0
      return (0
        <Context.Consumer unstable_observedBits={0b10}>0
          {value => {0
            ReactNoop.yield('Bar');0
            return <span prop={'Bar: ' + value.bar} />;0
          }}0
        </Context.Consumer>0
      );0
    }0
0
    class Indirection extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function App(props) {0
      return (0
        <Provider foo={props.foo} bar={props.bar}>0
          <Indirection>0
            <Indirection>0
              <Foo />0
            </Indirection>0
            <Indirection>0
              <Bar />0
            </Indirection>0
          </Indirection>0
        </Provider>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App foo={1} bar={1} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Foo: 1'), span('Bar: 1')]);0
0
    // Update only foo0
    ReactNoop.render(<App foo={2} bar={1} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Foo']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Foo: 2'), span('Bar: 1')]);0
0
    // Update only bar0
    ReactNoop.render(<App foo={2} bar={2} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Bar']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Foo: 2'), span('Bar: 2')]);0
0
    // Update both0
    ReactNoop.render(<App foo={3} bar={3} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Foo: 3'), span('Bar: 3')]);0
  });0
0
  it('can skip parents with bitmask bailout while updating their children', () => {0
    const Context = React.createContext({foo: 0, bar: 0}, (a, b) => {0
      let result = 0;0
      if (a.foo !== b.foo) {0
        result |= 0b01;0
      }0
      if (a.bar !== b.bar) {0
        result |= 0b10;0
      }0
      return result;0
    });0
0
    function Provider(props) {0
      return (0
        <Context.Provider value={{foo: props.foo, bar: props.bar}}>0
          {props.children}0
        </Context.Provider>0
      );0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return (0
        <Context.Consumer unstable_observedBits={0b01}>0
          {value => {0
            ReactNoop.yield('Foo');0
            return (0
              <React.Fragment>0
                <span prop={'Foo: ' + value.foo} />0
                {props.children && props.children()}0
              </React.Fragment>0
            );0
          }}0
        </Context.Consumer>0
      );0
    }0
0
    function Bar(props) {0
      return (0
        <Context.Consumer unstable_observedBits={0b10}>0
          {value => {0
            ReactNoop.yield('Bar');0
            return (0
              <React.Fragment>0
                <span prop={'Bar: ' + value.bar} />0
                {props.children && props.children()}0
              </React.Fragment>0
            );0
          }}0
        </Context.Consumer>0
      );0
    }0
0
    class Indirection extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function App(props) {0
      return (0
        <Provider foo={props.foo} bar={props.bar}>0
          <Indirection>0
            <Foo>0
              {/* Use a render prop so we don't test constant elements. */}0
              {() => (0
                <Indirection>0
                  <Bar>0
                    {() => (0
                      <Indirection>0
                        <Foo />0
                      </Indirection>0
                    )}0
                  </Bar>0
                </Indirection>0
              )}0
            </Foo>0
          </Indirection>0
        </Provider>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App foo={1} bar={1} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Foo']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span('Foo: 1'),0
      span('Bar: 1'),0
      span('Foo: 1'),0
    ]);0
0
    // Update only foo0
    ReactNoop.render(<App foo={2} bar={1} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Foo', 'Foo']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span('Foo: 2'),0
      span('Bar: 1'),0
      span('Foo: 2'),0
    ]);0
0
    // Update only bar0
    ReactNoop.render(<App foo={2} bar={2} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Bar']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span('Foo: 2'),0
      span('Bar: 2'),0
      span('Foo: 2'),0
    ]);0
0
    // Update both0
    ReactNoop.render(<App foo={3} bar={3} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Foo', 'Bar', 'Foo']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span('Foo: 3'),0
      span('Bar: 3'),0
      span('Foo: 3'),0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('warns if calculateChangedBits returns larger than a 31-bit integer', () => {0
    spyOnDev(console, 'error');0
0
    const Context = React.createContext(0
      0,0
      (a, b) => Math.pow(2, 32) - 1, // Return 32 bit int0
    );0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Context.Provider value={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    // Update0
    ReactNoop.render(<Context.Provider value={2} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(console.error).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
      expect(console.error.calls.argsFor(0)[0]).toContain(0
        'calculateChangedBits: Expected the return value to be a 31-bit ' +0
          'integer. Instead received: 4294967295',0
      );0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('warns if multiple renderers concurrently render the same context', () => {0
    spyOnDev(console, 'error');0
    const Context = React.createContext(0);0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Foo');0
      return null;0
    }0
0
    function App(props) {0
      return (0
        <Context.Provider value={props.value}>0
          <Foo />0
          <Foo />0
        </Context.Provider>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={1} />);0
    // Render past the Provider, but don't commit yet0
    ReactNoop.flushThrough(['Foo']);0
0
    // Get a new copy of ReactNoop0
    jest.resetModules();0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
0
    // Render the provider again using a different renderer0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={1} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(console.error.calls.argsFor(0)[0]).toContain(0
        'Detected multiple renderers concurrently rendering the same ' +0
          'context provider. This is currently unsupported',0
      );0
    }0
  });0
0
  it('warns if consumer child is not a function', () => {0
    spyOnDev(console, 'error');0
    const Context = React.createContext(0);0
    ReactNoop.render(<Context.Consumer />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush).toThrow('render is not a function');0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      expect(console.error.calls.argsFor(0)[0]).toContain(0
        'A context consumer was rendered with multiple children, or a child ' +0
          "that isn't a function",0
      );0
    }0
  });0
0
  it("does not re-render if there's an update in a child", () => {0
    const Context = React.createContext(0);0
0
    let child;0
    class Child extends React.Component {0
      state = {step: 0};0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('Child');0
        return (0
          <span0
            prop={`Context: ${this.props.context}, Step: ${this.state.step}`}0
          />0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    function App(props) {0
      return (0
        <Context.Provider value={props.value}>0
          <Context.Consumer>0
            {value => {0
              ReactNoop.yield('Consumer render prop');0
              return <Child ref={inst => (child = inst)} context={value} />;0
            }}0
          </Context.Consumer>0
        </Context.Provider>0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Initial mount0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={1} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Consumer render prop', 'Child']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Context: 1, Step: 0')]);0
0
    child.setState({step: 1});0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Child']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Context: 1, Step: 1')]);0
  });0
0
  it('provider bails out if children and value are unchanged (like sCU)', () => {0
    const Context = React.createContext(0);0
0
    function Child() {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Child');0
      return <span prop="Child" />;0
    }0
0
    const children = <Child />;0
0
    function App(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('App');0
      return (0
        <Context.Provider value={props.value}>{children}</Context.Provider>0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Initial mount0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={1} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['App', 'Child']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Child')]);0
0
    // Update0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={1} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'App',0
      // Child does not re-render0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Child')]);0
  });0
0
  it('provider does not bail out if legacy context changed above', () => {0
    const Context = React.createContext(0);0
0
    function Child() {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Child');0
      return <span prop="Child" />;0
    }0
0
    const children = <Child />;0
0
    class LegacyProvider extends React.Component {0
      static childContextTypes = {0
        legacyValue: () => {},0
      };0
      state = {legacyValue: 1};0
      getChildContext() {0
        return {legacyValue: this.state.legacyValue};0
      }0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('LegacyProvider');0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    class App extends React.Component {0
      state = {value: 1};0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('App');0
        return (0
          <Context.Provider value={this.state.value}>0
            {this.props.children}0
          </Context.Provider>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const legacyProviderRef = React.createRef();0
    const appRef = React.createRef();0
0
    // Initial mount0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <LegacyProvider ref={legacyProviderRef}>0
        <App ref={appRef} value={1}>0
          {children}0
        </App>0
      </LegacyProvider>,0
    );0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['LegacyProvider', 'App', 'Child']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Child')]);0
0
    // Update App with same value (should bail out)0
    appRef.current.setState({value: 1});0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['App']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Child')]);0
0
    // Update LegacyProvider (should not bail out)0
    legacyProviderRef.current.setState({value: 1});0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['LegacyProvider', 'App', 'Child']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Child')]);0
0
    // Update App with same value (should bail out)0
    appRef.current.setState({value: 1});0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['App']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Child')]);0
  });0
0
  it('consumer bails out if value is unchanged and something above bailed out', () => {0
    const Context = React.createContext(0);0
0
    function renderChildValue(value) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Consumer');0
      return <span prop={value} />;0
    }0
0
    function ChildWithInlineRenderCallback() {0
      ReactNoop.yield('ChildWithInlineRenderCallback');0
      // Note: we are intentionally passing an inline arrow. Don't refactor.0
      return (0
        <Context.Consumer>{value => renderChildValue(value)}</Context.Consumer>0
      );0
    }0
0
    function ChildWithCachedRenderCallback() {0
      ReactNoop.yield('ChildWithCachedRenderCallback');0
      return <Context.Consumer>{renderChildValue}</Context.Consumer>;0
    }0
0
    class PureIndirection extends React.PureComponent {0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('PureIndirection');0
        return (0
          <React.Fragment>0
            <ChildWithInlineRenderCallback />0
            <ChildWithCachedRenderCallback />0
          </React.Fragment>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class App extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('App');0
        return (0
          <Context.Provider value={this.props.value}>0
            <PureIndirection />0
          </Context.Provider>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    // Initial mount0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={1} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'App',0
      'PureIndirection',0
      'ChildWithInlineRenderCallback',0
      'Consumer',0
      'ChildWithCachedRenderCallback',0
      'Consumer',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(1), span(1)]);0
0
    // Update (bailout)0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={1} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['App']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(1), span(1)]);0
0
    // Update (no bailout)0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={2} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['App', 'Consumer', 'Consumer']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span(2), span(2)]);0
  });0
0
  // Context consumer bails out on propagating "deep" updates when `value` hasn't changed.0
  // However, it doesn't bail out from rendering if the component above it re-rendered anyway.0
  // If we bailed out on referential equality, it would be confusing that you0
  // can call this.setState(), but an autobound render callback "blocked" the update.0
  // https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/12470#issuecomment-3769177110
  it('consumer does not bail out if there were no bailouts above it', () => {0
    const Context = React.createContext(0);0
0
    class App extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        text: 'hello',0
      };0
0
      renderConsumer = context => {0
        ReactNoop.yield('App#renderConsumer');0
        return <span prop={this.state.text} />;0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('App');0
        return (0
          <Context.Provider value={this.props.value}>0
            <Context.Consumer>{this.renderConsumer}</Context.Consumer>0
          </Context.Provider>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    // Initial mount0
    let inst;0
    ReactNoop.render(<App value={1} ref={ref => (inst = ref)} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['App', 'App#renderConsumer']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('hello')]);0
0
    // Update0
    inst.setState({text: 'goodbye'});0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['App', 'App#renderConsumer']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('goodbye')]);0
  });0
0
  // This is a regression case for https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/12389.0
  it('does not run into an infinite loop', () => {0
    const Context = React.createContext(null);0
0
    class App extends React.Component {0
      renderItem(id) {0
        return (0
          <span key={id}>0
            <Context.Consumer>{() => <span>inner</span>}</Context.Consumer>0
            <span>outer</span>0
          </span>0
        );0
      }0
      renderList() {0
        const list = [1, 2].map(id => this.renderItem(id));0
        if (this.props.reverse) {0
          list.reverse();0
        }0
        return list;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <Context.Provider value={{}}>{this.renderList()}</Context.Provider>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App reverse={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    ReactNoop.render(<App reverse={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    ReactNoop.render(<App reverse={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
  });0
0
  // This is a regression case for https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/126860
  it('does not skip some siblings', () => {0
    const Context = React.createContext(0);0
0
    class App extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        step: 0,0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        ReactNoop.yield('App');0
        return (0
          <Context.Provider value={this.state.step}>0
            <StaticContent />0
            {this.state.step > 0 && <Indirection />}0
          </Context.Provider>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class StaticContent extends React.PureComponent {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <React.Fragment>0
            <React.Fragment>0
              <span prop="static 1" />0
              <span prop="static 2" />0
            </React.Fragment>0
          </React.Fragment>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    class Indirection extends React.PureComponent {0
      render() {0
        return <Consumer />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Consumer() {0
      return (0
        <Context.Consumer>0
          {value => {0
            ReactNoop.yield('Consumer');0
            return <span prop={value} />;0
          }}0
        </Context.Consumer>0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Initial mount0
    let inst;0
    ReactNoop.render(<App ref={ref => (inst = ref)} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['App']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span('static 1'),0
      span('static 2'),0
    ]);0
    // Update the first time0
    inst.setState({step: 1});0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['App', 'Consumer']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span('static 1'),0
      span('static 2'),0
      span(1),0
    ]);0
    // Update the second time0
    inst.setState({step: 2});0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['App', 'Consumer']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span('static 1'),0
      span('static 2'),0
      span(2),0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  describe('fuzz test', () => {0
    const Fragment = React.Fragment;0
    const contextKeys = ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G'];0
0
    const FLUSH_ALL = 'FLUSH_ALL';0
    function flushAll() {0
      return {0
        type: FLUSH_ALL,0
        toString() {0
          return `flushAll()`;0
        },0
      };0
    }0
0
    const FLUSH = 'FLUSH';0
    function flush(unitsOfWork) {0
      return {0
        type: FLUSH,0
        unitsOfWork,0
        toString() {0
          return `flush(${unitsOfWork})`;0
        },0
      };0
    }0
0
    const UPDATE = 'UPDATE';0
    function update(key, value) {0
      return {0
        type: UPDATE,0
        key,0
        value,0
        toString() {0
          return `update('${key}', ${value})`;0
        },0
      };0
    }0
0
    function randomInteger(min, max) {0
      min = Math.ceil(min);0
      max = Math.floor(max);0
      return Math.floor(Math.random() * (max - min)) + min;0
    }0
0
    function randomAction() {0
      switch (randomInteger(0, 3)) {0
        case 0:0
          return flushAll();0
        case 1:0
          return flush(randomInteger(0, 500));0
        case 2:0
          const key = contextKeys[randomInteger(0, contextKeys.length)];0
          const value = randomInteger(1, 10);0
          return update(key, value);0
        default:0
          throw new Error('Switch statement should be exhaustive');0
      }0
    }0
0
    function randomActions(n) {0
      let actions = [];0
      for (let i = 0; i < n; i++) {0
        actions.push(randomAction());0
      }0
      return actions;0
    }0
0
    function ContextSimulator(maxDepth) {0
      const contexts = new Map(0
        contextKeys.map(key => {0
          const Context = React.createContext(0);0
          Context.displayName = 'Context' + key;0
          return [key, Context];0
        }),0
      );0
0
      class ConsumerTree extends React.Component {0
        shouldComponentUpdate() {0
          return false;0
        }0
        render() {0
          if (this.props.depth >= this.props.maxDepth) {0
            return null;0
          }0
          const consumers = [0, 1, 2].map(i => {0
            const randomKey =0
              contextKeys[0
                this.props.rand.intBetween(0, contextKeys.length - 1)0
              ];0
            const Context = contexts.get(randomKey);0
            return (0
              <Context.Consumer key={i}>0
                {value => (0
                  <Fragment>0
                    <span prop={`${randomKey}:${value}`} />0
                    <ConsumerTree0
                      rand={this.props.rand}0
                      depth={this.props.depth + 1}0
                      maxDepth={this.props.maxDepth}0
                    />0
                  </Fragment>0
                )}0
              </Context.Consumer>0
            );0
          });0
          return consumers;0
        }0
      }0
0
      function Root(props) {0
        return contextKeys.reduceRight((children, key) => {0
          const Context = contexts.get(key);0
          const value = props.values[key];0
          return <Context.Provider value={value}>{children}</Context.Provider>;0
        }, <ConsumerTree rand={props.rand} depth={0} maxDepth={props.maxDepth} />);0
      }0
0
      const initialValues = contextKeys.reduce(0
        (result, key, i) => ({...result, [key]: i + 1}),0
        {},0
      );0
0
      function assertConsistentTree(expectedValues = {}) {0
        const children = ReactNoop.getChildren();0
        children.forEach(child => {0
          const text = child.prop;0
          const key = text[0];0
          const value = parseInt(text[2], 10);0
          const expectedValue = expectedValues[key];0
          if (expectedValue === undefined) {0
            // If an expected value was not explicitly passed to this function,0
            // use the first occurrence.0
            expectedValues[key] = value;0
          } else if (value !== expectedValue) {0
            throw new Error(0
              `Inconsistent value! Expected: ${key}:${expectedValue}. Actual: ${text}`,0
            );0
          }0
        });0
      }0
0
      function simulate(seed, actions) {0
        const rand = gen.create(seed);0
        let finalExpectedValues = initialValues;0
        function updateRoot() {0
          ReactNoop.render(0
            <Root0
              maxDepth={maxDepth}0
              rand={rand}0
              values={finalExpectedValues}0
            />,0
          );0
        }0
        updateRoot();0
0
        actions.forEach(action => {0
          switch (action.type) {0
            case FLUSH_ALL:0
              ReactNoop.flush();0
              break;0
            case FLUSH:0
              ReactNoop.flushUnitsOfWork(action.unitsOfWork);0
              break;0
            case UPDATE:0
              finalExpectedValues = {0
                ...finalExpectedValues,0
                [action.key]: action.value,0
              };0
              updateRoot();0
              break;0
            default:0
              throw new Error('Switch statement should be exhaustive');0
          }0
          assertConsistentTree();0
        });0
0
        ReactNoop.flush();0
        assertConsistentTree(finalExpectedValues);0
      }0
0
      return {simulate};0
    }0
0
    it('hard-coded tests', () => {0
      const {simulate} = ContextSimulator(5);0
      simulate('randomSeed', [flush(3), update('A', 4)]);0
    });0
0
    it('generated tests', () => {0
      const {simulate} = ContextSimulator(5);0
0
      const LIMIT = 100;0
      for (let i = 0; i < LIMIT; i++) {0
        const seed = Math.random()0
          .toString(36)0
          .substr(2, 5);0
        const actions = randomActions(5);0
        try {0
          simulate(seed, actions);0
        } catch (error) {0
          console.error(`0
Context fuzz tester error! Copy and paste the following line into the test suite:0
  simulate('${seed}', ${actions.join(', ')});0
`);0
          throw error;0
        }0
      }0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactNoopPersistent;0
0
describe('ReactPersistent', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoopPersistent = require('react-noop-renderer/persistent');0
  });0
0
  // Inlined from shared folder so we can run this test on a bundle.0
  function createPortal(children, containerInfo, implementation, key) {0
    return {0
      $$typeof: Symbol.for('react.portal'),0
      key: key == null ? null : '' + key,0
      children,0
      containerInfo,0
      implementation,0
    };0
  }0
0
  function render(element) {0
    ReactNoopPersistent.render(element);0
  }0
0
  function div(...children) {0
    children = children.map(c => (typeof c === 'string' ? {text: c} : c));0
    return {type: 'div', children, prop: undefined};0
  }0
0
  function span(prop) {0
    return {type: 'span', children: [], prop};0
  }0
0
  function getChildren() {0
    return ReactNoopPersistent.getChildren();0
  }0
0
  it('can update child nodes of a host instance', () => {0
    function Bar(props) {0
      return <span>{props.text}</span>;0
    }0
0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <Bar text={props.text} />0
          {props.text === 'World' ? <Bar text={props.text} /> : null}0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    render(<Foo text="Hello" />);0
    ReactNoopPersistent.flush();0
    const originalChildren = getChildren();0
    expect(originalChildren).toEqual([div(span())]);0
0
    render(<Foo text="World" />);0
    ReactNoopPersistent.flush();0
    const newChildren = getChildren();0
    expect(newChildren).toEqual([div(span(), span())]);0
0
    expect(originalChildren).toEqual([div(span())]);0
  });0
0
  it('can reuse child nodes between updates', () => {0
    function Baz(props) {0
      return <span prop={props.text} />;0
    }0
    class Bar extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate(newProps) {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <Baz text={this.props.text} />;0
      }0
    }0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <Bar text={props.text} />0
          {props.text === 'World' ? <Bar text={props.text} /> : null}0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    render(<Foo text="Hello" />);0
    ReactNoopPersistent.flush();0
    const originalChildren = getChildren();0
    expect(originalChildren).toEqual([div(span('Hello'))]);0
0
    render(<Foo text="World" />);0
    ReactNoopPersistent.flush();0
    const newChildren = getChildren();0
    expect(newChildren).toEqual([div(span('Hello'), span('World'))]);0
0
    expect(originalChildren).toEqual([div(span('Hello'))]);0
0
    // Reused node should have reference equality0
    expect(newChildren[0].children[0]).toBe(originalChildren[0].children[0]);0
  });0
0
  it('can update child text nodes', () => {0
    function Foo(props) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          {props.text}0
          <span />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
0
    render(<Foo text="Hello" />);0
    ReactNoopPersistent.flush();0
    const originalChildren = getChildren();0
    expect(originalChildren).toEqual([div('Hello', span())]);0
0
    render(<Foo text="World" />);0
    ReactNoopPersistent.flush();0
    const newChildren = getChildren();0
    expect(newChildren).toEqual([div('World', span())]);0
0
    expect(originalChildren).toEqual([div('Hello', span())]);0
  });0
0
  it('supports portals', () => {0
    function Parent(props) {0
      return <div>{props.children}</div>;0
    }0
0
    function BailoutSpan() {0
      return <span />;0
    }0
0
    class BailoutTest extends React.Component {0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <BailoutSpan />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Child(props) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <BailoutTest />0
          {props.children}0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
    const portalContainer = {rootID: 'persistent-portal-test', children: []};0
    const emptyPortalChildSet = portalContainer.children;0
    render(<Parent>{createPortal(<Child />, portalContainer, null)}</Parent>);0
    ReactNoopPersistent.flush();0
0
    expect(emptyPortalChildSet).toEqual([]);0
0
    const originalChildren = getChildren();0
    expect(originalChildren).toEqual([div()]);0
    const originalPortalChildren = portalContainer.children;0
    expect(originalPortalChildren).toEqual([div(span())]);0
0
    render(0
      <Parent>0
        {createPortal(<Child>Hello {'World'}</Child>, portalContainer, null)}0
      </Parent>,0
    );0
    ReactNoopPersistent.flush();0
0
    const newChildren = getChildren();0
    expect(newChildren).toEqual([div()]);0
    const newPortalChildren = portalContainer.children;0
    expect(newPortalChildren).toEqual([div(span(), 'Hello ', 'World')]);0
0
    expect(originalChildren).toEqual([div()]);0
    expect(originalPortalChildren).toEqual([div(span())]);0
0
    // Reused portal children should have reference equality0
    expect(newPortalChildren[0].children[0]).toBe(0
      originalPortalChildren[0].children[0],0
    );0
0
    // Deleting the Portal, should clear its children0
    render(<Parent />);0
    ReactNoopPersistent.flush();0
0
    const clearedPortalChildren = portalContainer.children;0
    expect(clearedPortalChildren).toEqual([]);0
0
    // The original is unchanged.0
    expect(newPortalChildren).toEqual([div(span(), 'Hello ', 'World')]);0
  });0
});0
let React;0
let ReactFeatureFlags;0
let Fragment;0
let ReactNoop;0
let SimpleCacheProvider;0
let Timeout;0
0
let cache;0
let TextResource;0
let textResourceShouldFail;0
0
describe('ReactSuspense', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    ReactFeatureFlags = require('shared/ReactFeatureFlags');0
    ReactFeatureFlags.debugRenderPhaseSideEffectsForStrictMode = false;0
    ReactFeatureFlags.replayFailedUnitOfWorkWithInvokeGuardedCallback = false;0
    ReactFeatureFlags.enableSuspense = true;0
    React = require('react');0
    Fragment = React.Fragment;0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
    SimpleCacheProvider = require('simple-cache-provider');0
    Timeout = React.Timeout;0
0
    function invalidateCache() {0
      cache = SimpleCacheProvider.createCache(invalidateCache);0
    }0
    invalidateCache();0
    TextResource = SimpleCacheProvider.createResource(([text, ms = 0]) => {0
      return new Promise((resolve, reject) =>0
        setTimeout(() => {0
          if (textResourceShouldFail) {0
            ReactNoop.yield(`Promise rejected [${text}]`);0
            reject(new Error('Failed to load: ' + text));0
          } else {0
            ReactNoop.yield(`Promise resolved [${text}]`);0
            resolve(text);0
          }0
        }, ms),0
      );0
    }, ([text, ms]) => text);0
    textResourceShouldFail = false;0
  });0
0
  function div(...children) {0
    children = children.map(c => (typeof c === 'string' ? {text: c} : c));0
    return {type: 'div', children, prop: undefined};0
  }0
0
  function span(prop) {0
    return {type: 'span', children: [], prop};0
  }0
0
  function advanceTimers(ms) {0
    // Note: This advances Jest's virtual time but not React's. Use0
    // ReactNoop.expire for that.0
    if (typeof ms !== 'number') {0
      throw new Error('Must specify ms');0
    }0
    jest.advanceTimersByTime(ms);0
    // Wait until the end of the current tick0
    return new Promise(resolve => {0
      setImmediate(resolve);0
    });0
  }0
0
  function Text(props) {0
    ReactNoop.yield(props.text);0
    return <span prop={props.text} />;0
  }0
0
  function AsyncText(props) {0
    const text = props.text;0
    try {0
      TextResource.read(cache, [props.text, props.ms]);0
      ReactNoop.yield(text);0
      return <span prop={text} />;0
    } catch (promise) {0
      if (typeof promise.then === 'function') {0
        ReactNoop.yield(`Suspend! [${text}]`);0
      } else {0
        ReactNoop.yield(`Error! [${text}]`);0
      }0
      throw promise;0
    }0
  }0
0
  function Fallback(props) {0
    return (0
      <Timeout ms={props.timeout}>0
        {didExpire => (didExpire ? props.placeholder : props.children)}0
      </Timeout>0
    );0
  }0
  it('suspends rendering and continues later', async () => {0
    function Bar(props) {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Bar');0
      return props.children;0
    }0
0
    function Foo() {0
      ReactNoop.yield('Foo');0
      return (0
        <Fallback>0
          <Bar>0
            <AsyncText text="A" ms={100} />0
            <Text text="B" />0
          </Bar>0
        </Fallback>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Foo />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'Foo',0
      'Bar',0
      // A suspends0
      'Suspend! [A]',0
      // But we keep rendering the siblings0
      'B',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Flush some of the time0
    await advanceTimers(50);0
    // Still nothing...0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Flush the promise completely0
    await advanceTimers(50);0
    // Renders successfully0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'Promise resolved [A]',0
      'Foo',0
      'Bar',0
      'A',0
      'B',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('A'), span('B')]);0
  });0
0
  it('suspends siblings and later recovers each independently', async () => {0
    // Render two sibling Timeout components0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Fragment>0
        <Fallback timeout={1000} placeholder={<Text text="Loading A..." />}>0
          <AsyncText text="A" ms={5000} />0
        </Fallback>0
        <Fallback timeout={3000} placeholder={<Text text="Loading B..." />}>0
          <AsyncText text="B" ms={6000} />0
        </Fallback>0
      </Fragment>,0
    );0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Suspend! [A]', 'Suspend! [B]']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Advance time by enough to timeout both components and commit their placeholders0
    ReactNoop.expire(4000);0
    await advanceTimers(4000);0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'Suspend! [A]',0
      'Loading A...',0
      'Suspend! [B]',0
      'Loading B...',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span('Loading A...'),0
      span('Loading B...'),0
    ]);0
0
    // Advance time by enough that the first Timeout's promise resolves0
    // and switches back to the normal view. The second Timeout should still show the placeholder0
    ReactNoop.expire(1000);0
    await advanceTimers(1000);0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Promise resolved [A]', 'A']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('A'), span('Loading B...')]);0
0
    // Advance time by enough that the second Timeout's promise resolves0
    // and switches back to the normal view0
    ReactNoop.expire(1000);0
    await advanceTimers(1000);0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Promise resolved [B]', 'B']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('A'), span('B')]);0
  });0
0
  it('continues rendering siblings after suspending', async () => {0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Fallback>0
        <Text text="A" />0
        <AsyncText text="B" />0
        <Text text="C" />0
        <Text text="D" />0
      </Fallback>,0
    );0
    // B suspends. Continue rendering the remaining siblings.0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['A', 'Suspend! [B]', 'C', 'D']);0
    // Did not commit yet.0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Wait for data to resolve0
    await advanceTimers(100);0
    // Renders successfully0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'Promise resolved [B]',0
      'A',0
      'B',0
      'C',0
      'D',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span('A'),0
      span('B'),0
      span('C'),0
      span('D'),0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('retries on error', async () => {0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      reset() {0
        this.setState({error: null});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error !== null) {0
          return <Text text={'Caught error: ' + this.state.error.message} />;0
        }0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const errorBoundary = React.createRef();0
    function App() {0
      return (0
        <Fallback>0
          <ErrorBoundary ref={errorBoundary}>0
            <AsyncText text="Result" ms={1000} />0
          </ErrorBoundary>0
        </Fallback>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Suspend! [Result]']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    textResourceShouldFail = true;0
    ReactNoop.expire(1000);0
    await advanceTimers(1000);0
    textResourceShouldFail = false;0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'Promise rejected [Result]',0
      'Error! [Result]',0
0
      // React retries one more time0
      'Error! [Result]',0
0
      // Errored again on retry. Now handle it.0
      'Caught error: Failed to load: Result',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span('Caught error: Failed to load: Result'),0
    ]);0
0
    // Reset the error boundary and cache, and try again.0
    errorBoundary.current.reset();0
    cache.invalidate();0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Suspend! [Result]']);0
    ReactNoop.expire(1000);0
    await advanceTimers(1000);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Promise resolved [Result]', 'Result']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Result')]);0
  });0
0
  it('retries on error after falling back to a placeholder', async () => {0
    class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {0
      state = {error: null};0
      componentDidCatch(error) {0
        this.setState({error});0
      }0
      reset() {0
        this.setState({error: null});0
      }0
      render() {0
        if (this.state.error !== null) {0
          return <Text text={'Caught error: ' + this.state.error.message} />;0
        }0
        return this.props.children;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const errorBoundary = React.createRef();0
    function App() {0
      return (0
        <Fallback timeout={1000} placeholder={<Text text="Loading..." />}>0
          <ErrorBoundary ref={errorBoundary}>0
            <AsyncText text="Result" ms={3000} />0
          </ErrorBoundary>0
        </Fallback>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Suspend! [Result]']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    ReactNoop.expire(2000);0
    await advanceTimers(2000);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Suspend! [Result]', 'Loading...']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Loading...')]);0
0
    textResourceShouldFail = true;0
    ReactNoop.expire(1000);0
    await advanceTimers(1000);0
    textResourceShouldFail = false;0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'Promise rejected [Result]',0
      'Error! [Result]',0
0
      // React retries one more time0
      'Error! [Result]',0
0
      // Errored again on retry. Now handle it.0
0
      'Caught error: Failed to load: Result',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span('Caught error: Failed to load: Result'),0
    ]);0
0
    // Reset the error boundary and cache, and try again.0
    errorBoundary.current.reset();0
    cache.invalidate();0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Suspend! [Result]']);0
    ReactNoop.expire(3000);0
    await advanceTimers(3000);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Promise resolved [Result]', 'Result']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Result')]);0
  });0
0
  it('can update at a higher priority while in a suspended state', async () => {0
    function App(props) {0
      return (0
        <Fallback>0
          <Text text={props.highPri} />0
          <AsyncText text={props.lowPri} />0
        </Fallback>0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Initial mount0
    ReactNoop.render(<App highPri="A" lowPri="1" />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    await advanceTimers(0);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('A'), span('1')]);0
0
    // Update the low-pri text0
    ReactNoop.render(<App highPri="A" lowPri="2" />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'A',0
      // Suspends0
      'Suspend! [2]',0
    ]);0
0
    // While we're still waiting for the low-pri update to complete, update the0
    // high-pri text at high priority.0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(<App highPri="B" lowPri="1" />);0
    });0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['B', '1']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('B'), span('1')]);0
0
    // Unblock the low-pri text and finish0
    await advanceTimers(0);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Promise resolved [2]']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('B'), span('1')]);0
  });0
0
  it('keeps working on lower priority work after being pinged', async () => {0
    function App(props) {0
      return (0
        <Fallback>0
          <AsyncText text="A" />0
          {props.showB && <Text text="B" />}0
        </Fallback>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App showB={false} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Suspend! [A]']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Advance React's virtual time by enough to fall into a new async bucket.0
    ReactNoop.expire(1200);0
    ReactNoop.render(<App showB={true} />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Suspend! [A]', 'B']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    await advanceTimers(0);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Promise resolved [A]', 'A', 'B']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('A'), span('B')]);0
  });0
0
  it('tries rendering a lower priority pending update even if a higher priority one suspends', async () => {0
    function App(props) {0
      if (props.hide) {0
        return <Text text="(empty)" />;0
      }0
      return (0
        <Fallback>0
          <AsyncText ms={2000} text="Async" />0
        </Fallback>0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Schedule a high pri update and a low pri update, without rendering in0
    // between.0
    ReactNoop.interactiveUpdates(() => {0
      // High pri0
      ReactNoop.render(<App />);0
    });0
    // Low pri0
    ReactNoop.render(<App hide={true} />);0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      // The first update suspends0
      'Suspend! [Async]',0
      // but we have another pending update that we can work on0
      '(empty)',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('(empty)')]);0
  });0
0
  it('coalesces all async updates when in a suspended state', async () => {0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Fallback>0
        <AsyncText text="A" />0
      </Fallback>,0
    );0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    await advanceTimers(0);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('A')]);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Fallback>0
        <AsyncText text="B" ms={50} />0
      </Fallback>,0
    );0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Suspend! [B]']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('A')]);0
0
    // Advance React's virtual time so that C falls into a new expiration bucket0
    ReactNoop.expire(1000);0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Fallback>0
        <AsyncText text="C" ms={100} />0
      </Fallback>,0
    );0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      // Tries C first, since it has a later expiration time0
      'Suspend! [C]',0
      // Does not retry B, because its promise has not resolved yet.0
    ]);0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('A')]);0
0
    // Unblock B0
    await advanceTimers(90);0
    // Even though B's promise resolved, the view is still suspended because it0
    // coalesced with C.0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Promise resolved [B]']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('A')]);0
0
    // Unblock C0
    await advanceTimers(50);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Promise resolved [C]', 'C']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('C')]);0
  });0
0
  it('forces an expiration after an update times out', async () => {0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Fragment>0
        <Fallback placeholder={<Text text="Loading..." />}>0
          <AsyncText text="Async" ms={20000} />0
        </Fallback>0
        <Text text="Sync" />0
      </Fragment>,0
    );0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      // The async child suspends0
      'Suspend! [Async]',0
      // Continue on the sibling0
      'Sync',0
    ]);0
    // The update hasn't expired yet, so we commit nothing.0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Advance both React's virtual time and Jest's timers by enough to expire0
    // the update, but not by enough to flush the suspending promise.0
    ReactNoop.expire(10000);0
    await advanceTimers(10000);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flushExpired()).toEqual([0
      // Still suspended.0
      'Suspend! [Async]',0
      // Now that the update has expired, we render the fallback UI0
      'Loading...',0
      'Sync',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Loading...'), span('Sync')]);0
0
    // Once the promise resolves, we render the suspended view0
    await advanceTimers(10000);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Promise resolved [Async]', 'Async']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Async'), span('Sync')]);0
  });0
0
  it('switches to an inner fallback even if it expires later', async () => {0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Fragment>0
        <Text text="Sync" />0
        <Fallback timeout={1000} placeholder={<Text text="Loading outer..." />}>0
          <AsyncText text="Outer content" ms={2000} />0
          <Fallback0
            timeout={3000}0
            placeholder={<Text text="Loading inner..." />}>0
            <AsyncText text="Inner content" ms={4000} />0
          </Fallback>0
        </Fallback>0
      </Fragment>,0
    );0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'Sync',0
      // The async content suspends0
      'Suspend! [Outer content]',0
      'Suspend! [Inner content]',0
    ]);0
    // The update hasn't expired yet, so we commit nothing.0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Expire the outer timeout, but don't expire the inner one.0
    // We should see the outer loading placeholder.0
    ReactNoop.expire(1500);0
    await advanceTimers(1500);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'Sync',0
      // Still suspended.0
      'Suspend! [Outer content]',0
      'Suspend! [Inner content]',0
      // We attempt to fallback to the inner placeholder0
      'Loading inner...',0
      // But the outer content is still suspended, so we need to fallback to0
      // the outer placeholder.0
      'Loading outer...',0
    ]);0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span('Sync'),0
      span('Loading outer...'),0
    ]);0
0
    // Resolve the outer content's promise0
    ReactNoop.expire(1000);0
    await advanceTimers(1000);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'Promise resolved [Outer content]',0
      'Outer content',0
      // Inner content still hasn't loaded0
      'Suspend! [Inner content]',0
      'Loading inner...',0
    ]);0
    // We should now see the inner fallback UI.0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span('Sync'),0
      span('Outer content'),0
      span('Loading inner...'),0
    ]);0
0
    // Finally, flush the inner promise. We should see the complete screen.0
    ReactNoop.expire(3000);0
    await advanceTimers(3000);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'Promise resolved [Inner content]',0
      'Inner content',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
      span('Sync'),0
      span('Outer content'),0
      span('Inner content'),0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('renders an expiration boundary synchronously', async () => {0
    // Synchronously render a tree that suspends0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() =>0
      ReactNoop.render(0
        <Fragment>0
          <Fallback placeholder={<Text text="Loading..." />}>0
            <AsyncText text="Async" />0
          </Fallback>0
          <Text text="Sync" />0
        </Fragment>,0
      ),0
    );0
    expect(ReactNoop.clearYields()).toEqual([0
      // The async child suspends0
      'Suspend! [Async]',0
      // We immediately render the fallback UI0
      'Loading...',0
      // Continue on the sibling0
      'Sync',0
    ]);0
    // The tree commits synchronously0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Loading...'), span('Sync')]);0
0
    // Once the promise resolves, we render the suspended view0
    await advanceTimers(0);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Promise resolved [Async]', 'Async']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Async'), span('Sync')]);0
  });0
0
  it('suspending inside an expired expiration boundary will bubble to the next one', async () => {0
    ReactNoop.flushSync(() =>0
      ReactNoop.render(0
        <Fragment>0
          <Fallback placeholder={<Text text="Loading (outer)..." />}>0
            <Fallback placeholder={<AsyncText text="Loading (inner)..." />}>0
              <AsyncText text="Async" />0
            </Fallback>0
            <Text text="Sync" />0
          </Fallback>0
        </Fragment>,0
      ),0
    );0
    expect(ReactNoop.clearYields()).toEqual([0
      'Suspend! [Async]',0
      'Suspend! [Loading (inner)...]',0
      'Sync',0
      'Loading (outer)...',0
    ]);0
    // The tree commits synchronously0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Loading (outer)...')]);0
  });0
0
  it('expires early with a `timeout` option', async () => {0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Fragment>0
        <Fallback timeout={1000} placeholder={<Text text="Loading..." />}>0
          <AsyncText text="Async" ms={3000} />0
        </Fallback>0
        <Text text="Sync" />0
      </Fragment>,0
    );0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      // The async child suspends0
      'Suspend! [Async]',0
      // Continue on the sibling0
      'Sync',0
    ]);0
    // The update hasn't expired yet, so we commit nothing.0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Advance both React's virtual time and Jest's timers by enough to trigger0
    // the timeout, but not by enough to flush the promise or reach the true0
    // expiration time.0
    ReactNoop.expire(2000);0
    await advanceTimers(2000);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      // Still suspended.0
      'Suspend! [Async]',0
      // Now that the expiration view has timed out, we render the fallback UI0
      'Loading...',0
      'Sync',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Loading...'), span('Sync')]);0
0
    // Once the promise resolves, we render the suspended view0
    await advanceTimers(1000);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Promise resolved [Async]', 'Async']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Async'), span('Sync')]);0
  });0
0
  it('throws a helpful error when a synchronous update is suspended', () => {0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.flushSync(() =>0
        ReactNoop.render(<Timeout>{() => <AsyncText text="Async" />}</Timeout>),0
      );0
    }).toThrow(0
      'A synchronous update was suspended, but no fallback UI was provided.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('throws a helpful error when an expired update is suspended', async () => {0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Timeout>{() => <AsyncText text="Async" ms={20000} />}</Timeout>,0
    );0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Suspend! [Async]']);0
    await advanceTimers(10000);0
    expect(() => {0
      ReactNoop.expire(10000);0
    }).toThrow(0
      'An update was suspended for longer than the timeout, but no fallback ' +0
        'UI was provided.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('a Timeout component correctly handles more than one suspended child', async () => {0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Fallback timeout={0}>0
        <AsyncText text="A" ms={100} />0
        <AsyncText text="B" ms={100} />0
      </Fallback>,0
    );0
    expect(ReactNoop.expire(10000)).toEqual(['Suspend! [A]', 'Suspend! [B]']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    await advanceTimers(100);0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'Promise resolved [A]',0
      'Promise resolved [B]',0
      'A',0
      'B',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('A'), span('B')]);0
  });0
0
  it('can resume rendering earlier than a timeout', async () => {0
    ReactNoop.render(0
      <Fallback timeout={1000} placeholder={<Text text="Loading..." />}>0
        <AsyncText text="Async" ms={100} />0
      </Fallback>,0
    );0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Suspend! [Async]']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Advance time by an amount slightly smaller than what's necessary to0
    // resolve the promise0
    await advanceTimers(99);0
0
    // Nothing has rendered yet0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Resolve the promise0
    await advanceTimers(1);0
    // We can now resume rendering0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Promise resolved [Async]', 'Async']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('Async')]);0
  });0
0
  it('starts working on an update even if its priority falls between two suspended levels', async () => {0
    function App(props) {0
      return (0
        <Fallback timeout={10000}>0
          {props.text === 'C' ? (0
            <Text text="C" />0
          ) : (0
            <AsyncText text={props.text} ms={10000} />0
          )}0
        </Fallback>0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Schedule an update0
    ReactNoop.render(<App text="A" />);0
    // The update should suspend.0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Suspend! [A]']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Advance time until right before it expires. This number may need to0
    // change if the default expiration for low priority updates is adjusted.0
    await advanceTimers(4999);0
    ReactNoop.expire(4999);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Schedule another low priority update.0
    ReactNoop.render(<App text="B" />);0
    // This update should also suspend.0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Suspend! [B]']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Schedule a high priority update. Its expiration time will fall between0
    // the expiration times of the previous two updates.0
    ReactNoop.interactiveUpdates(() => {0
      ReactNoop.render(<App text="C" />);0
    });0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['C']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('C')]);0
0
    await advanceTimers(10000);0
    // Flush the remaining work.0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'Promise resolved [A]',0
      'Promise resolved [B]',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('C')]);0
  });0
0
  it('can hide a tree to unblock its surroundings', async () => {0
    function App() {0
      return (0
        <Timeout ms={1000}>0
          {didTimeout => (0
            <Fragment>0
              <div hidden={didTimeout}>0
                <AsyncText text="Async" ms={3000} />0
              </div>0
              {didTimeout ? <Text text="Loading..." /> : null}0
            </Fragment>0
          )}0
        </Timeout>0
      );0
    }0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<App />);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Suspend! [Async]']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
    ReactNoop.expire(2000);0
    await advanceTimers(2000);0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
      'Suspend! [Async]',0
      'Loading...',0
      'Suspend! [Async]',0
    ]);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(), span('Loading...')]);0
0
    ReactNoop.expire(1000);0
    await advanceTimers(1000);0
0
    expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual(['Promise resolved [Async]', 'Async']);0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([div(span('Async'))]);0
  });0
0
  describe('splitting a high-pri update into high and low', () => {0
    React = require('react');0
0
    class AsyncValue extends React.Component {0
      state = {asyncValue: this.props.defaultValue};0
      componentDidMount() {0
        ReactNoop.deferredUpdates(() => {0
          this.setState((state, props) => ({asyncValue: props.value}));0
        });0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        if (this.props.value !== this.state.asyncValue) {0
          ReactNoop.deferredUpdates(() => {0
            this.setState((state, props) => ({asyncValue: props.value}));0
          });0
        }0
      }0
      render() {0
        return this.props.children(this.state.asyncValue);0
      }0
    }0
0
    it('coalesces async values when in a suspended state', async () => {0
      function App(props) {0
        const highPriText = props.text;0
        return (0
          <Fallback>0
            <AsyncValue value={highPriText} defaultValue={null}>0
              {lowPriText => (0
                <Fragment>0
                  <Text text={`High-pri: ${highPriText}`} />0
                  {lowPriText && (0
                    <AsyncText text={`Low-pri: ${lowPriText}`} ms={100} />0
                  )}0
                </Fragment>0
              )}0
            </AsyncValue>0
          </Fallback>0
        );0
      }0
0
      function renderAppSync(props) {0
        ReactNoop.flushSync(() => ReactNoop.render(<App {...props} />));0
      }0
0
      // Initial mount0
      renderAppSync({text: 'A'});0
      expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
        // First we render at high priority0
        'High-pri: A',0
        // Then we come back later to render a low priority0
        'High-pri: A',0
        // The low-pri view suspends0
        'Suspend! [Low-pri: A]',0
      ]);0
      expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('High-pri: A')]);0
0
      // Partially flush the promise for 'A', not by enough to resolve it.0
      await advanceTimers(99);0
0
      // Advance React's virtual time so that the next update falls into a new0
      // expiration bucket0
      ReactNoop.expire(2000);0
      // Update to B. At this point, the low-pri view still hasn't updated0
      // to 'A'.0
      renderAppSync({text: 'B'});0
      expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
        // First we render at high priority0
        'High-pri: B',0
        // Then we come back later to render a low priority0
        'High-pri: B',0
        // The low-pri view suspends0
        'Suspend! [Low-pri: B]',0
      ]);0
      expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('High-pri: B')]);0
0
      // Flush the rest of the promise for 'A', without flushing the one0
      // for 'B'.0
      await advanceTimers(1);0
      expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
        // A is unblocked0
        'Promise resolved [Low-pri: A]',0
        // But we don't try to render it, because there's a lower priority0
        // update that is also suspended.0
      ]);0
      expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('High-pri: B')]);0
0
      // Flush the remaining work.0
      await advanceTimers(99);0
      expect(ReactNoop.flush()).toEqual([0
        // B is unblocked0
        'Promise resolved [Low-pri: B]',0
        // Now we can continue rendering the async view0
        'High-pri: B',0
        'Low-pri: B',0
      ]);0
      expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([0
        span('High-pri: B'),0
        span('Low-pri: B'),0
      ]);0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('a Delay component', () => {0
    function Never() {0
      // Throws a promise that resolves after some arbitrarily large0
      // number of seconds. The idea is that this component will never0
      // resolve. It's always wrapped by a Timeout.0
      throw new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(() => resolve(), 10000));0
    }0
0
    function Delay({ms}) {0
      return (0
        <Timeout ms={ms}>0
          {didTimeout => {0
            if (didTimeout) {0
              // Once ms has elapsed, render null. This allows the rest of the0
              // tree to resume rendering.0
              return null;0
            }0
            return <Never />;0
          }}0
        </Timeout>0
      );0
    }0
0
    function DebouncedText({text, ms}) {0
      return (0
        <Fragment>0
          <Delay ms={ms} />0
          <Text text={text} />0
        </Fragment>0
      );0
    }0
0
    it('works', async () => {0
      ReactNoop.render(<DebouncedText text="A" ms={1000} />);0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
      expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
      await advanceTimers(800);0
      ReactNoop.expire(800);0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
      expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([]);0
0
      await advanceTimers(1000);0
      ReactNoop.expire(1000);0
      ReactNoop.flush();0
      expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([span('A')]);0
    });0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactNoop;0
0
// This is a new feature in Fiber so I put it in its own test file. It could0
// probably move to one of the other test files once it is official.0
describe('ReactTopLevelFragment', function() {0
  beforeEach(function() {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
  });0
0
  it('should render a simple fragment at the top of a component', function() {0
    function Fragment() {0
      return [<div key="a">Hello</div>, <div key="b">World</div>];0
    }0
    ReactNoop.render(<Fragment />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
  });0
0
  it('should preserve state when switching from a single child', function() {0
    let instance = null;0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        instance = this;0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Fragment({condition}) {0
      return condition ? (0
        <Stateful key="a" />0
      ) : (0
        [<Stateful key="a" />, <div key="b">World</div>]0
      );0
    }0
    ReactNoop.render(<Fragment />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    const instanceA = instance;0
0
    expect(instanceA).not.toBe(null);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Fragment condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    const instanceB = instance;0
0
    expect(instanceB).toBe(instanceA);0
  });0
0
  it('should not preserve state when switching to a nested array', function() {0
    let instance = null;0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        instance = this;0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Fragment({condition}) {0
      return condition ? (0
        <Stateful key="a" />0
      ) : (0
        [[<Stateful key="a" />, <div key="b">World</div>], <div key="c" />]0
      );0
    }0
    ReactNoop.render(<Fragment />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    const instanceA = instance;0
0
    expect(instanceA).not.toBe(null);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Fragment condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    const instanceB = instance;0
0
    expect(instanceB).not.toBe(instanceA);0
  });0
0
  it('preserves state if an implicit key slot switches from/to null', function() {0
    let instance = null;0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        instance = this;0
        return <div>World</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Fragment({condition}) {0
      return condition0
        ? [null, <Stateful key="a" />]0
        : [<div key="b">Hello</div>, <Stateful key="a" />];0
    }0
    ReactNoop.render(<Fragment />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    const instanceA = instance;0
0
    expect(instanceA).not.toBe(null);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Fragment condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    const instanceB = instance;0
0
    expect(instanceB).toBe(instanceA);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Fragment condition={false} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    const instanceC = instance;0
0
    expect(instanceC === instanceA).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('should preserve state in a reorder', function() {0
    let instance = null;0
0
    class Stateful extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        instance = this;0
        return <div>Hello</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    function Fragment({condition}) {0
      return condition0
        ? [[<div key="b">World</div>, <Stateful key="a" />]]0
        : [[<Stateful key="a" />, <div key="b">World</div>], <div key="c" />];0
    }0
    ReactNoop.render(<Fragment />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    const instanceA = instance;0
0
    expect(instanceA).not.toBe(null);0
0
    ReactNoop.render(<Fragment condition={true} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
0
    const instanceB = instance;0
0
    expect(instanceB).toBe(instanceA);0
  });0
});0
/**0

 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
