'use strict';0
0
let React;0
let ReactNoop;0
0
// This is a new feature in Fiber so I put it in its own test file. It could0
// probably move to one of the other test files once it is official.0
describe('ReactTopLevelText', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
    React = require('react');0
    ReactNoop = require('react-noop-renderer');0
  });0
0
  it('should render a component returning strings directly from render', () => {0
    const Text = ({value}) => value;0
    ReactNoop.render(<Text value="foo" />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([{text: 'foo'}]);0
  });0
0
  it('should render a component returning numbers directly from render', () => {0
    const Text = ({value}) => value;0
    ReactNoop.render(<Text value={10} />);0
    ReactNoop.flush();0
    expect(ReactNoop.getChildren()).toEqual([{text: '10'}]);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {CapturedError} from '../ReactCapturedValue';0
0
// Module provided by RN:0
import ExceptionsManager from 'ExceptionsManager';0
0
/**0
 * Intercept lifecycle errors and ensure they are shown with the correct stack0
 * trace within the native redbox component.0
 */0
export function showErrorDialog(capturedError: CapturedError): boolean {0
  const {componentStack, error} = capturedError;0
0
  let errorToHandle: Error;0
0
  // Typically Errors are thrown but eg strings or null can be thrown as well.0
  if (error instanceof Error) {0
    const {message, name} = error;0
0
    const summary = message ? `${name}: ${message}` : name;0
0
    errorToHandle = error;0
0
    try {0
      errorToHandle.message = `${summary}\n\nThis error is located at:${componentStack}`;0
    } catch (e) {}0
  } else if (typeof error === 'string') {0
    errorToHandle = new Error(0
      `${error}\n\nThis error is located at:${componentStack}`,0
    );0
  } else {0
    errorToHandle = new Error(`Unspecified error at:${componentStack}`);0
  }0
0
  ExceptionsManager.handleException(errorToHandle, false);0
0
  // Return false here to prevent ReactFiberErrorLogger default behavior of0
  // logging error details to console.error. Calls to console.error are0
  // automatically routed to the native redbox controller, which we've already0
  // done above by calling ExceptionsManager.0
  return false;0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {CapturedError} from '../ReactCapturedValue';0
0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
0
// Provided by www0
const ReactFiberErrorDialogWWW = require('ReactFiberErrorDialog');0
invariant(0
  typeof ReactFiberErrorDialogWWW.showErrorDialog === 'function',0
  'Expected ReactFiberErrorDialog.showErrorDialog to existbe a function.',0
);0
0
export function showErrorDialog(capturedError: CapturedError): boolean {0
  return ReactFiberErrorDialogWWW.showErrorDialog(capturedError);0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2015-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0

export * from 'react-art/src/ReactARTHostConfig';0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2015-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0

// This is a host config that's used for the `react-reconciler` package on npm.0
// It is only used by third-party renderers.0
//0
// Its API lets you pass the host config as an argument.0
// However, inside the `react-reconciler` we treat host config as a module.0
// This file is a shim between two worlds.0
//0
// It works because the `react-reconciler` bundle is wrapped in something like:0
//0
// module.exports = function ($$$config) {0
//   /* reconciler code */0
// }0
//0
// So `$$$config` looks like a global variable, but it's0
// really an argument to a top-level wrapping function.0
0
declare var $$$hostConfig: any;0
export opaque type Type = mixed; // eslint-disable-line no-undef0
export opaque type Props = mixed; // eslint-disable-line no-undef0
export opaque type Container = mixed; // eslint-disable-line no-undef0
export opaque type Instance = mixed; // eslint-disable-line no-undef0
export opaque type TextInstance = mixed; // eslint-disable-line no-undef0
export opaque type HydratableInstance = mixed; // eslint-disable-line no-undef0
export opaque type PublicInstance = mixed; // eslint-disable-line no-undef0
export opaque type HostContext = mixed; // eslint-disable-line no-undef0
export opaque type UpdatePayload = mixed; // eslint-disable-line no-undef0
export opaque type ChildSet = mixed; // eslint-disable-line no-undef0
0
export const getPublicInstance = $$$hostConfig.getPublicInstance;0
export const getRootHostContext = $$$hostConfig.getRootHostContext;0
export const getChildHostContext = $$$hostConfig.getChildHostContext;0
export const prepareForCommit = $$$hostConfig.prepareForCommit;0
export const resetAfterCommit = $$$hostConfig.resetAfterCommit;0
export const createInstance = $$$hostConfig.createInstance;0
export const appendInitialChild = $$$hostConfig.appendInitialChild;0
export const finalizeInitialChildren = $$$hostConfig.finalizeInitialChildren;0
export const prepareUpdate = $$$hostConfig.prepareUpdate;0
export const shouldSetTextContent = $$$hostConfig.shouldSetTextContent;0
export const shouldDeprioritizeSubtree =0
  $$$hostConfig.shouldDeprioritizeSubtree;0
export const createTextInstance = $$$hostConfig.createTextInstance;0
export const scheduleDeferredCallback = $$$hostConfig.scheduleDeferredCallback;0
export const cancelDeferredCallback = $$$hostConfig.cancelDeferredCallback;0
export const now = $$$hostConfig.now;0
export const isPrimaryRenderer = $$$hostConfig.isPrimaryRenderer;0
export const supportsMutation = $$$hostConfig.supportsMutation;0
export const supportsPersistence = $$$hostConfig.supportsPersistence;0
export const supportsHydration = $$$hostConfig.supportsHydration;0
0
// -------------------0
//      Mutation0
//     (optional)0
// -------------------0
export const appendChild = $$$hostConfig.appendChild;0
export const appendChildToContainer = $$$hostConfig.appendChildToContainer;0
export const commitTextUpdate = $$$hostConfig.commitTextUpdate;0
export const commitMount = $$$hostConfig.commitMount;0
export const commitUpdate = $$$hostConfig.commitUpdate;0
export const insertBefore = $$$hostConfig.insertBefore;0
export const insertInContainerBefore = $$$hostConfig.insertInContainerBefore;0
export const removeChild = $$$hostConfig.removeChild;0
export const removeChildFromContainer = $$$hostConfig.removeChildFromContainer;0
export const resetTextContent = $$$hostConfig.resetTextContent;0
0
// -------------------0
//     Persistence0
//     (optional)0
// -------------------0
export const cloneInstance = $$$hostConfig.cloneInstance;0
export const createContainerChildSet = $$$hostConfig.createContainerChildSet;0
export const appendChildToContainerChildSet =0
  $$$hostConfig.appendChildToContainerChildSet;0
export const finalizeContainerChildren =0
  $$$hostConfig.finalizeContainerChildren;0
export const replaceContainerChildren = $$$hostConfig.replaceContainerChildren;0
0
// -------------------0
//     Hydration0
//     (optional)0
// -------------------0
export const canHydrateInstance = $$$hostConfig.canHydrateInstance;0
export const canHydrateTextInstance = $$$hostConfig.canHydrateTextInstance;0
export const getNextHydratableSibling = $$$hostConfig.getNextHydratableSibling;0
export const getFirstHydratableChild = $$$hostConfig.getFirstHydratableChild;0
export const hydrateInstance = $$$hostConfig.hydrateInstance;0
export const hydrateTextInstance = $$$hostConfig.hydrateTextInstance;0
export const didNotMatchHydratedContainerTextInstance =0
  $$$hostConfig.didNotMatchHydratedContainerTextInstance;0
export const didNotMatchHydratedTextInstance =0
  $$$hostConfig.didNotMatchHydratedTextInstance;0
export const didNotHydrateContainerInstance =0
  $$$hostConfig.didNotHydrateContainerInstance;0
export const didNotHydrateInstance = $$$hostConfig.didNotHydrateInstance;0
export const didNotFindHydratableContainerInstance =0
  $$$hostConfig.didNotFindHydratableContainerInstance;0
export const didNotFindHydratableContainerTextInstance =0
  $$$hostConfig.didNotFindHydratableContainerTextInstance;0
export const didNotFindHydratableInstance =0
  $$$hostConfig.didNotFindHydratableInstance;0
export const didNotFindHydratableTextInstance =0
  $$$hostConfig.didNotFindHydratableTextInstance;0

export * from 'react-dom/src/client/ReactDOMHostConfig';0

/**0

export * from 'react-test-renderer/src/ReactTestHostConfig';0
/**0

'use strict';0
0
export * from './src/ReactScheduler';0
'use strict';0
0
if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production') {0
  module.exports = require('./cjs/react-scheduler.production.min.js');0
} else {0
  module.exports = require('./cjs/react-scheduler.development.js');0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
/**0
 * A scheduling library to allow scheduling work with more granular priority and0
 * control than requestAnimationFrame and requestIdleCallback.0
 * Current TODO items:0
 * X- Pull out the scheduleWork polyfill built into React0
 * X- Initial test coverage0
 * X- Support for multiple callbacks0
 * - Support for two priorities; serial and deferred0
 * - Better test coverage0
 * - Better docblock0
 * - Polish documentation, API0
 */0
0
// This is a built-in polyfill for requestIdleCallback. It works by scheduling0
// a requestAnimationFrame, storing the time for the start of the frame, then0
// scheduling a postMessage which gets scheduled after paint. Within the0
// postMessage handler do as much work as possible until time + frame rate.0
// By separating the idle call into a separate event tick we ensure that0
// layout, paint and other browser work is counted against the available time.0
// The frame rate is dynamically adjusted.0
0
import type {Deadline} from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiberScheduler';0
type FrameCallbackType = Deadline => void;0
type CallbackConfigType = {|0
  scheduledCallback: FrameCallbackType,0
  timeoutTime: number,0
  next: CallbackConfigType | null, // creating a linked list0
  prev: CallbackConfigType | null, // creating a linked list0
|};0
0
export type CallbackIdType = CallbackConfigType;0
0
import {canUseDOM} from 'shared/ExecutionEnvironment';0
import warning from 'shared/warning';0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  if (canUseDOM && typeof requestAnimationFrame !== 'function') {0
    warning(0
      false,0
      // TODO: reword this when schedule is a stand-alone module0
      "This browser doesn't support requestAnimationFrame. " +0
        'Make sure that you load a ' +0
        'polyfill in older browsers. https://fb.me/react-polyfills',0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
// We capture a local reference to any global, in case it gets polyfilled after0
// this module is initially evaluated.0
// We want to be using a consistent implementation.0
const localDate = Date;0
const localSetTimeout = setTimeout;0
const localClearTimeout = clearTimeout;0
0
const hasNativePerformanceNow =0
  typeof performance === 'object' && typeof performance.now === 'function';0
0
let now;0
if (hasNativePerformanceNow) {0
  const Performance = performance;0
  now = function() {0
    return Performance.now();0
  };0
} else {0
  now = function() {0
    return localDate.now();0
  };0
}0
0
let scheduleWork: (0
  callback: FrameCallbackType,0
  options?: {timeout: number},0
) => CallbackIdType;0
let cancelScheduledWork: (callbackId: CallbackIdType) => void;0
0
if (!canUseDOM) {0
  const timeoutIds = new Map();0
0
  scheduleWork = function(0
    callback: FrameCallbackType,0
    options?: {timeout: number},0
  ): CallbackIdType {0
    // keeping return type consistent0
    const callbackConfig = {0
      scheduledCallback: callback,0
      timeoutTime: 0,0
      next: null,0
      prev: null,0
    };0
    const timeoutId = localSetTimeout(() => {0
      callback({0
        timeRemaining() {0
          return Infinity;0
        },0
        didTimeout: false,0
      });0
    });0
    timeoutIds.set(callback, timeoutId);0
    return callbackConfig;0
  };0
  cancelScheduledWork = function(callbackId: CallbackIdType) {0
    const callback = callbackId.scheduledCallback;0
    const timeoutId = timeoutIds.get(callback);0
    timeoutIds.delete(callbackId);0
    localClearTimeout(timeoutId);0
  };0
} else {0
  const localRequestAnimationFrame = requestAnimationFrame;0
0
  let headOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList: CallbackConfigType | null = null;0
  let tailOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList: CallbackConfigType | null = null;0
0
  // We track what the next soonest timeoutTime is, to be able to quickly tell0
  // if none of the scheduled callbacks have timed out.0
  let nextSoonestTimeoutTime = -1;0
0
  let isIdleScheduled = false;0
  let isAnimationFrameScheduled = false;0
0
  let frameDeadline = 0;0
  // We start out assuming that we run at 30fps but then the heuristic tracking0
  // will adjust this value to a faster fps if we get more frequent animation0
  // frames.0
  let previousFrameTime = 33;0
  let activeFrameTime = 33;0
0
  const frameDeadlineObject: Deadline = {0
    didTimeout: false,0
    timeRemaining() {0
      const remaining = frameDeadline - now();0
      return remaining > 0 ? remaining : 0;0
    },0
  };0
0
  /**0
   * Handles the case where a callback errors:0
   * - don't catch the error, because this changes debugging behavior0
   * - do start a new postMessage callback, to call any remaining callbacks,0
   * - but only if there is an error, so there is not extra overhead.0
   */0
  const callUnsafely = function(0
    callbackConfig: CallbackConfigType,0
    arg: Deadline,0
  ) {0
    const callback = callbackConfig.scheduledCallback;0
    let finishedCalling = false;0
    try {0
      callback(arg);0
      finishedCalling = true;0
    } finally {0
      // always remove it from linked list0
      cancelScheduledWork(callbackConfig);0
0
      if (!finishedCalling) {0
        // an error must have been thrown0
        isIdleScheduled = true;0
        window.postMessage(messageKey, '*');0
      }0
    }0
  };0
0
  /**0
   * Checks for timed out callbacks, runs them, and then checks again to see if0
   * any more have timed out.0
   * Keeps doing this until there are none which have currently timed out.0
   */0
  const callTimedOutCallbacks = function() {0
    if (headOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList === null) {0
      return;0
    }0
0
    const currentTime = now();0
    // TODO: this would be more efficient if deferred callbacks are stored in0
    // min heap.0
    // Or in a linked list with links for both timeoutTime order and insertion0
    // order.0
    // For now an easy compromise is the current approach:0
    // Keep a pointer to the soonest timeoutTime, and check that first.0
    // If it has not expired, we can skip traversing the whole list.0
    // If it has expired, then we step through all the callbacks.0
    if (nextSoonestTimeoutTime === -1 || nextSoonestTimeoutTime > currentTime) {0
      // We know that none of them have timed out yet.0
      return;0
    }0
    // NOTE: we intentionally wait to update the nextSoonestTimeoutTime until0
    // after successfully calling any timed out callbacks.0
    // If a timed out callback throws an error, we could get stuck in a state0
    // where the nextSoonestTimeoutTime was set wrong.0
    let updatedNextSoonestTimeoutTime = -1; // we will update nextSoonestTimeoutTime below0
    const timedOutCallbacks = [];0
0
    // iterate once to find timed out callbacks and find nextSoonestTimeoutTime0
    let currentCallbackConfig = headOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList;0
    while (currentCallbackConfig !== null) {0
      const timeoutTime = currentCallbackConfig.timeoutTime;0
      if (timeoutTime !== -1 && timeoutTime <= currentTime) {0
        // it has timed out!0
        timedOutCallbacks.push(currentCallbackConfig);0
      } else {0
        if (0
          timeoutTime !== -1 &&0
          (updatedNextSoonestTimeoutTime === -1 ||0
            timeoutTime < updatedNextSoonestTimeoutTime)0
        ) {0
          updatedNextSoonestTimeoutTime = timeoutTime;0
        }0
      }0
      currentCallbackConfig = currentCallbackConfig.next;0
    }0
0
    if (timedOutCallbacks.length > 0) {0
      frameDeadlineObject.didTimeout = true;0
      for (let i = 0, len = timedOutCallbacks.length; i < len; i++) {0
        callUnsafely(timedOutCallbacks[i], frameDeadlineObject);0
      }0
    }0
0
    // NOTE: we intentionally wait to update the nextSoonestTimeoutTime until0
    // after successfully calling any timed out callbacks.0
    nextSoonestTimeoutTime = updatedNextSoonestTimeoutTime;0
  };0
0
  // We use the postMessage trick to defer idle work until after the repaint.0
  const messageKey =0
    '__reactIdleCallback$' +0
    Math.random()0
      .toString(36)0
      .slice(2);0
  const idleTick = function(event) {0
    if (event.source !== window || event.data !== messageKey) {0
      return;0
    }0
    isIdleScheduled = false;0
0
    if (headOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList === null) {0
      return;0
    }0
0
    // First call anything which has timed out, until we have caught up.0
    callTimedOutCallbacks();0
0
    let currentTime = now();0
    // Next, as long as we have idle time, try calling more callbacks.0
    while (0
      frameDeadline - currentTime > 0 &&0
      headOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList !== null0
    ) {0
      const latestCallbackConfig = headOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList;0
      frameDeadlineObject.didTimeout = false;0
      // callUnsafely will remove it from the head of the linked list0
      callUnsafely(latestCallbackConfig, frameDeadlineObject);0
      currentTime = now();0
    }0
    if (headOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList !== null) {0
      if (!isAnimationFrameScheduled) {0
        // Schedule another animation callback so we retry later.0
        isAnimationFrameScheduled = true;0
        localRequestAnimationFrame(animationTick);0
      }0
    }0
  };0
  // Assumes that we have addEventListener in this environment. Might need0
  // something better for old IE.0
  window.addEventListener('message', idleTick, false);0
0
  const animationTick = function(rafTime) {0
    isAnimationFrameScheduled = false;0
    let nextFrameTime = rafTime - frameDeadline + activeFrameTime;0
    if (0
      nextFrameTime < activeFrameTime &&0
      previousFrameTime < activeFrameTime0
    ) {0
      if (nextFrameTime < 8) {0
        // Defensive coding. We don't support higher frame rates than 120hz.0
        // If we get lower than that, it is probably a bug.0
        nextFrameTime = 8;0
      }0
      // If one frame goes long, then the next one can be short to catch up.0
      // If two frames are short in a row, then that's an indication that we0
      // actually have a higher frame rate than what we're currently optimizing.0
      // We adjust our heuristic dynamically accordingly. For example, if we're0
      // running on 120hz display or 90hz VR display.0
      // Take the max of the two in case one of them was an anomaly due to0
      // missed frame deadlines.0
      activeFrameTime =0
        nextFrameTime < previousFrameTime ? previousFrameTime : nextFrameTime;0
    } else {0
      previousFrameTime = nextFrameTime;0
    }0
    frameDeadline = rafTime + activeFrameTime;0
    if (!isIdleScheduled) {0
      isIdleScheduled = true;0
      window.postMessage(messageKey, '*');0
    }0
  };0
0
  scheduleWork = function(0
    callback: FrameCallbackType,0
    options?: {timeout: number},0
  ): CallbackIdType /* CallbackConfigType */ {0
    let timeoutTime = -1;0
    if (options != null && typeof options.timeout === 'number') {0
      timeoutTime = now() + options.timeout;0
    }0
    if (0
      nextSoonestTimeoutTime === -1 ||0
      (timeoutTime !== -1 && timeoutTime < nextSoonestTimeoutTime)0
    ) {0
      nextSoonestTimeoutTime = timeoutTime;0
    }0
0
    const scheduledCallbackConfig: CallbackConfigType = {0
      scheduledCallback: callback,0
      timeoutTime,0
      prev: null,0
      next: null,0
    };0
    if (headOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList === null) {0
      // Make this callback the head and tail of our list0
      headOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList = scheduledCallbackConfig;0
      tailOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList = scheduledCallbackConfig;0
    } else {0
      // Add latest callback as the new tail of the list0
      scheduledCallbackConfig.prev = tailOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList;0
      // renaming for clarity0
      const oldTailOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList = tailOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList;0
      if (oldTailOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList !== null) {0
        oldTailOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList.next = scheduledCallbackConfig;0
      }0
      tailOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList = scheduledCallbackConfig;0
    }0
0
    if (!isAnimationFrameScheduled) {0
      // If rAF didn't already schedule one, we need to schedule a frame.0
      // TODO: If this rAF doesn't materialize because the browser throttles, we0
      // might want to still have setTimeout trigger scheduleWork as a backup to ensure0
      // that we keep performing work.0
      isAnimationFrameScheduled = true;0
      localRequestAnimationFrame(animationTick);0
    }0
    return scheduledCallbackConfig;0
  };0
0
  cancelScheduledWork = function(0
    callbackConfig: CallbackIdType /* CallbackConfigType */,0
  ) {0
    if (0
      callbackConfig.prev === null &&0
      headOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList !== callbackConfig0
    ) {0
      // this callbackConfig has already been cancelled.0
      // cancelScheduledWork should be idempotent, a no-op after first call.0
      return;0
    }0
0
    /**0
     * There are four possible cases:0
     * - Head/nodeToRemove/Tail -> null0
     *   In this case we set Head and Tail to null.0
     * - Head -> ... middle nodes... -> Tail/nodeToRemove0
     *   In this case we point the middle.next to null and put middle as the new0
     *   Tail.0
     * - Head/nodeToRemove -> ...middle nodes... -> Tail0
     *   In this case we point the middle.prev at null and move the Head to0
     *   middle.0
     * - Head -> ... ?some nodes ... -> nodeToRemove -> ... ?some nodes ... -> Tail0
     *   In this case we point the Head.next to the Tail and the Tail.prev to0
     *   the Head.0
     */0
    const next = callbackConfig.next;0
    const prev = callbackConfig.prev;0
    callbackConfig.next = null;0
    callbackConfig.prev = null;0
    if (next !== null) {0
      // we have a next0
0
      if (prev !== null) {0
        // we have a prev0
0
        // callbackConfig is somewhere in the middle of a list of 3 or more nodes.0
        prev.next = next;0
        next.prev = prev;0
        return;0
      } else {0
        // there is a next but not a previous one;0
        // callbackConfig is the head of a list of 2 or more other nodes.0
        next.prev = null;0
        headOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList = next;0
        return;0
      }0
    } else {0
      // there is no next callback config; this must the tail of the list0
0
      if (prev !== null) {0
        // we have a prev0
0
        // callbackConfig is the tail of a list of 2 or more other nodes.0
        prev.next = null;0
        tailOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList = prev;0
        return;0
      } else {0
        // there is no previous callback config;0
        // callbackConfig is the only thing in the linked list,0
        // so both head and tail point to it.0
        headOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList = null;0
        tailOfPendingCallbacksLinkedList = null;0
        return;0
      }0
    }0
  };0
}0
0
export {now, scheduleWork, cancelScheduledWork};0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let ReactScheduler;0
type FrameTimeoutConfigType = {0
  // should only specify one or the other0
  timeLeftInFrame: ?number,0
  timePastFrameDeadline: ?number,0
};0
0
describe('ReactScheduler', () => {0
  let rAFCallbacks = [];0
  let postMessageCallback;0
  let postMessageEvents = [];0
  let postMessageErrors = [];0
  let catchPostMessageErrors = false;0
0
  function runPostMessageCallbacks(config: FrameTimeoutConfigType) {0
    let timeLeftInFrame = 0;0
    if (typeof config.timeLeftInFrame === 'number') {0
      timeLeftInFrame = config.timeLeftInFrame;0
    } else if (typeof config.timePastFrameDeadline === 'number') {0
      timeLeftInFrame = -1 * config.timePastFrameDeadline;0
    }0
    currentTime = startOfLatestFrame + frameSize - timeLeftInFrame;0
    if (postMessageCallback) {0
      while (postMessageEvents.length) {0
        if (catchPostMessageErrors) {0
          // catch errors for testing error handling0
          try {0
            postMessageCallback(postMessageEvents.shift());0
          } catch (e) {0
            postMessageErrors.push(e);0
          }0
        } else {0
          // we are not expecting errors0
          postMessageCallback(postMessageEvents.shift());0
        }0
      }0
    }0
  }0
  function runRAFCallbacks() {0
    startOfLatestFrame += frameSize;0
    currentTime = startOfLatestFrame;0
    rAFCallbacks.forEach(cb => cb());0
    rAFCallbacks = [];0
  }0
  function advanceOneFrame(config: FrameTimeoutConfigType = {}) {0
    runRAFCallbacks();0
    runPostMessageCallbacks(config);0
  }0
0
  let frameSize = 33;0
  let startOfLatestFrame = Date.now();0
  let currentTime = Date.now();0
0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    // TODO pull this into helper method, reduce repetition.0
    // mock the browser APIs which are used in react-scheduler:0
    // - requestAnimationFrame should pass the DOMHighResTimeStamp argument0
    // - calling 'window.postMessage' should actually fire postmessage handlers0
    // - Date.now should return the correct thing0
    // - test with native performance.now()0
    delete global.performance;0
    global.requestAnimationFrame = function(cb) {0
      return rAFCallbacks.push(() => {0
        cb(startOfLatestFrame);0
      });0
    };0
    const originalAddEventListener = global.addEventListener;0
    postMessageCallback = null;0
    postMessageEvents = [];0
    postMessageErrors = [];0
    global.addEventListener = function(eventName, callback, useCapture) {0
      if (eventName === 'message') {0
        postMessageCallback = callback;0
      } else {0
        originalAddEventListener(eventName, callback, useCapture);0
      }0
    };0
    global.postMessage = function(messageKey, targetOrigin) {0
      const postMessageEvent = {source: window, data: messageKey};0
      postMessageEvents.push(postMessageEvent);0
    };0
    global.Date.now = function() {0
      return currentTime;0
    };0
    jest.resetModules();0
    ReactScheduler = require('react-scheduler');0
  });0
0
  describe('scheduleWork', () => {0
    it('calls the callback within the frame when not blocked', () => {0
      const {scheduleWork} = ReactScheduler;0
      const cb = jest.fn();0
      scheduleWork(cb);0
      advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15});0
      expect(cb).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(1);0
      // should not have timed out and should include a timeRemaining method0
      expect(cb.mock.calls[0][0].didTimeout).toBe(false);0
      expect(typeof cb.mock.calls[0][0].timeRemaining()).toBe('number');0
    });0
0
    describe('with multiple callbacks', () => {0
      it('accepts multiple callbacks and calls within frame when not blocked', () => {0
        const {scheduleWork} = ReactScheduler;0
        const callbackLog = [];0
        const callbackA = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('A'));0
        const callbackB = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('B'));0
        scheduleWork(callbackA);0
        // initially waits to call the callback0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual([]);0
        // waits while second callback is passed0
        scheduleWork(callbackB);0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual([]);0
        // after a delay, calls as many callbacks as it has time for0
        advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15});0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['A', 'B']);0
        // callbackA should not have timed out and should include a timeRemaining method0
        expect(callbackA.mock.calls[0][0].didTimeout).toBe(false);0
        expect(typeof callbackA.mock.calls[0][0].timeRemaining()).toBe(0
          'number',0
        );0
        // callbackA should not have timed out and should include a timeRemaining method0
        expect(callbackB.mock.calls[0][0].didTimeout).toBe(false);0
        expect(typeof callbackB.mock.calls[0][0].timeRemaining()).toBe(0
          'number',0
        );0
      });0
0
      it("accepts callbacks betweeen animationFrame and postMessage and doesn't stall", () => {0
        const {scheduleWork} = ReactScheduler;0
        const callbackLog = [];0
        const callbackA = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('A'));0
        const callbackB = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('B'));0
        const callbackC = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('C'));0
        scheduleWork(callbackA);0
        // initially waits to call the callback0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual([]);0
        runRAFCallbacks();0
        // this should schedule work *after* the requestAnimationFrame but before the message handler0
        scheduleWork(callbackB);0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual([]);0
        // now it should drain the message queue and do all scheduled work0
        runPostMessageCallbacks({timeLeftInFrame: 15});0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['A', 'B']);0
0
        // advances timers, now with an empty queue of work (to ensure they don't deadlock)0
        advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15});0
0
        // see if more work can be done now.0
        scheduleWork(callbackC);0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['A', 'B']);0
        advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15});0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['A', 'B', 'C']);0
      });0
0
      it(0
        'schedules callbacks in correct order and' +0
          'keeps calling them if there is time',0
        () => {0
          const {scheduleWork} = ReactScheduler;0
          const callbackLog = [];0
          const callbackA = jest.fn(() => {0
            callbackLog.push('A');0
            scheduleWork(callbackC);0
          });0
          const callbackB = jest.fn(() => {0
            callbackLog.push('B');0
          });0
          const callbackC = jest.fn(() => {0
            callbackLog.push('C');0
          });0
0
          scheduleWork(callbackA);0
          // initially waits to call the callback0
          expect(callbackLog).toEqual([]);0
          // continues waiting while B is scheduled0
          scheduleWork(callbackB);0
          expect(callbackLog).toEqual([]);0
          // after a delay, calls the scheduled callbacks,0
          // and also calls new callbacks scheduled by current callbacks0
          advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15});0
          expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['A', 'B', 'C']);0
        },0
      );0
0
      it('schedules callbacks in correct order when callbacks have many nested scheduleWork calls', () => {0
        const {scheduleWork} = ReactScheduler;0
        const callbackLog = [];0
        const callbackA = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('A');0
          scheduleWork(callbackC);0
          scheduleWork(callbackD);0
        });0
        const callbackB = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('B');0
          scheduleWork(callbackE);0
          scheduleWork(callbackF);0
        });0
        const callbackC = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('C');0
        });0
        const callbackD = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('D');0
        });0
        const callbackE = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('E');0
        });0
        const callbackF = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('F');0
        });0
0
        scheduleWork(callbackA);0
        scheduleWork(callbackB);0
        // initially waits to call the callback0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual([]);0
        // while flushing callbacks, calls as many as it has time for0
        advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15});0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E', 'F']);0
      });0
0
      it('schedules callbacks in correct order when they use scheduleWork to schedule themselves', () => {0
        const {scheduleWork} = ReactScheduler;0
        const callbackLog = [];0
        let callbackAIterations = 0;0
        const callbackA = jest.fn(() => {0
          if (callbackAIterations < 1) {0
            scheduleWork(callbackA);0
          }0
          callbackLog.push('A' + callbackAIterations);0
          callbackAIterations++;0
        });0
        const callbackB = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('B'));0
0
        scheduleWork(callbackA);0
        // initially waits to call the callback0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual([]);0
        scheduleWork(callbackB);0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual([]);0
        // after a delay, calls the latest callback passed0
        advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15});0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['A0', 'B', 'A1']);0
      });0
    });0
0
    describe('when callbacks time out: ', () => {0
      // USEFUL INFO:0
      // startOfLatestFrame is a global that goes up every time rAF runs0
      // currentTime defaults to startOfLatestFrame inside rAF callback0
      // and currentTime defaults to 15 before next frame inside idleTick0
0
      describe('when there is no more time left in the frame', () => {0
        it('calls any callback which has timed out, waits for others', () => {0
          const {scheduleWork} = ReactScheduler;0
          startOfLatestFrame = 1000000000000;0
          currentTime = startOfLatestFrame - 10;0
          const callbackLog = [];0
          // simple case of one callback which times out, another that won't.0
          const callbackA = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('A'));0
          const callbackB = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('B'));0
          const callbackC = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('C'));0
0
          scheduleWork(callbackA); // won't time out0
          scheduleWork(callbackB, {timeout: 100}); // times out later0
          scheduleWork(callbackC, {timeout: 2}); // will time out fast0
0
          // push time ahead a bit so that we have no idle time0
          advanceOneFrame({timePastFrameDeadline: 16});0
0
          // callbackC should have timed out0
          expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['C']);0
0
          // push time ahead a bit so that we have no idle time0
          advanceOneFrame({timePastFrameDeadline: 16});0
0
          // callbackB should have timed out0
          expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['C', 'B']);0
0
          // let's give ourselves some idle time now0
          advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 16});0
0
          // we should have run callbackA in the idle time0
          expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['C', 'B', 'A']);0
        });0
      });0
0
      describe('when there is some time left in the frame', () => {0
        it('calls timed out callbacks and then any more pending callbacks, defers others if time runs out', () => {0
          const {scheduleWork} = ReactScheduler;0
          startOfLatestFrame = 1000000000000;0
          currentTime = startOfLatestFrame - 10;0
          const callbackLog = [];0
          // simple case of one callback which times out, others that won't.0
          const callbackA = jest.fn(() => {0
            callbackLog.push('A');0
            // time passes, causing us to run out of idle time0
            currentTime += 25;0
          });0
          const callbackB = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('B'));0
          const callbackC = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('C'));0
          const callbackD = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('D'));0
0
          scheduleWork(callbackA); // won't time out0
          scheduleWork(callbackB, {timeout: 100}); // times out later0
          scheduleWork(callbackC, {timeout: 2}); // will time out fast0
          scheduleWork(callbackD); // won't time out0
0
          advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15}); // runs rAF and postMessage callbacks0
0
          // callbackC should have timed out0
          // we should have had time to call A also, then we run out of time0
          expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['C', 'A']);0
0
          // push time ahead a bit so that we have no idle time0
          advanceOneFrame({timePastFrameDeadline: 16});0
0
          // callbackB should have timed out0
          // but we should not run callbackD because we have no idle time0
          expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['C', 'A', 'B']);0
0
          advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15}); // runs rAF and postMessage callbacks0
0
          // we should have run callbackD in the idle time0
          expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['C', 'A', 'B', 'D']);0
0
          advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15}); // runs rAF and postMessage callbacks0
0
          // we should not have run anything again, nothing is scheduled0
          expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['C', 'A', 'B', 'D']);0
        });0
      });0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('cancelScheduledWork', () => {0
    it('cancels the scheduled callback', () => {0
      const {scheduleWork, cancelScheduledWork} = ReactScheduler;0
      const cb = jest.fn();0
      const callbackId = scheduleWork(cb);0
      expect(cb).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
      cancelScheduledWork(callbackId);0
      advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15});0
      expect(cb).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
    });0
0
    describe('with multiple callbacks', () => {0
      it('when called more than once', () => {0
        const {scheduleWork, cancelScheduledWork} = ReactScheduler;0
        const callbackLog = [];0
        const callbackA = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('A'));0
        const callbackB = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('B'));0
        const callbackC = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('C'));0
        scheduleWork(callbackA);0
        const callbackId = scheduleWork(callbackB);0
        scheduleWork(callbackC);0
        cancelScheduledWork(callbackId);0
        cancelScheduledWork(callbackId);0
        cancelScheduledWork(callbackId);0
        // Initially doesn't call anything0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual([]);0
        advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15});0
0
        // Should still call A and C0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['A', 'C']);0
        expect(callbackB).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
      });0
0
      it('when one callback cancels the next one', () => {0
        const {scheduleWork, cancelScheduledWork} = ReactScheduler;0
        const callbackLog = [];0
        let callbackBId;0
        const callbackA = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('A');0
          cancelScheduledWork(callbackBId);0
        });0
        const callbackB = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('B'));0
        scheduleWork(callbackA);0
        callbackBId = scheduleWork(callbackB);0
        // Initially doesn't call anything0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual([]);0
        advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15});0
        // B should not get called because A cancelled B0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['A']);0
        expect(callbackB).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(0);0
      });0
    });0
  });0
0
  describe('when callbacks throw errors', () => {0
    describe('when some callbacks throw', () => {0
      /**0
       * +                                                             +0
       * |  rAF                        postMessage                     |0
       * |                                                             |0
       * |      +---------------------+                                |0
       * |      | paint/layout        |  cbA() cbB() cbC() cbD() cbE() |0
       * |      +---------------------+         ^           ^          |0
       * |                                      |           |          |0
       * +                                      |           |          +0
       *                                        +           +0
       *                                        throw errors0
       *0
       *0
       */0
      it('still calls all callbacks within same frame', () => {0
        const {scheduleWork} = ReactScheduler;0
        const callbackLog = [];0
        const callbackA = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('A'));0
        const callbackB = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('B');0
          throw new Error('B error');0
        });0
        const callbackC = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('C'));0
        const callbackD = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('D');0
          throw new Error('D error');0
        });0
        const callbackE = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('E'));0
        scheduleWork(callbackA);0
        scheduleWork(callbackB);0
        scheduleWork(callbackC);0
        scheduleWork(callbackD);0
        scheduleWork(callbackE);0
        // Initially doesn't call anything0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual([]);0
        catchPostMessageErrors = true;0
        advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15});0
        // calls all callbacks0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']);0
        // errors should still get thrown0
        const postMessageErrorMessages = postMessageErrors.map(e => e.message);0
        expect(postMessageErrorMessages).toEqual(['B error', 'D error']);0
        catchPostMessageErrors = false;0
      });0
0
      /**0
       *                                               timed out0
       *                                               +     +  +--+0
       *  +  rAF                        postMessage    |     |     |    +0
       *  |                                            |     |     |    |0
       *  |      +---------------------+               v     v     v    |0
       *  |      | paint/layout        |  cbA() cbB() cbC() cbD() cbE() |0
       *  |      +---------------------+   ^                 ^          |0
       *  |                                |                 |          |0
       *  +                                |                 |          +0
       *                                   +                 +0
       *                                   throw errors0
       *0
       *0
       */0
      it('and with some timed out callbacks, still calls all callbacks within same frame', () => {0
        const {scheduleWork} = ReactScheduler;0
        const callbackLog = [];0
        const callbackA = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('A');0
          throw new Error('A error');0
        });0
        const callbackB = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('B'));0
        const callbackC = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('C'));0
        const callbackD = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('D');0
          throw new Error('D error');0
        });0
        const callbackE = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('E'));0
        scheduleWork(callbackA);0
        scheduleWork(callbackB);0
        scheduleWork(callbackC, {timeout: 2}); // times out fast0
        scheduleWork(callbackD, {timeout: 2}); // times out fast0
        scheduleWork(callbackE, {timeout: 2}); // times out fast0
        // Initially doesn't call anything0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual([]);0
        catchPostMessageErrors = true;0
        advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15});0
        // calls all callbacks; calls timed out ones first0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['C', 'D', 'E', 'A', 'B']);0
        // errors should still get thrown0
        const postMessageErrorMessages = postMessageErrors.map(e => e.message);0
        expect(postMessageErrorMessages).toEqual(['D error', 'A error']);0
        catchPostMessageErrors = false;0
      });0
    });0
    describe('when all scheduled callbacks throw', () => {0
      /**0
       * +                                                             +0
       * |  rAF                        postMessage                     |0
       * |                                                             |0
       * |      +---------------------+                                |0
       * |      | paint/layout        |  cbA() cbB() cbC() cbD() cbE() |0
       * |      +---------------------+   ^     ^     ^     ^     ^    |0
       * |                                |     |     |     |     |    |0
       * +                                |     |     |     |     |    +0
       *                                  |     +     +     +     +0
       *                                  + all callbacks throw errors0
       *0
       *0
       */0
      it('still calls all callbacks within same frame', () => {0
        const {scheduleWork} = ReactScheduler;0
        const callbackLog = [];0
        const callbackA = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('A');0
          throw new Error('A error');0
        });0
        const callbackB = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('B');0
          throw new Error('B error');0
        });0
        const callbackC = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('C');0
          throw new Error('C error');0
        });0
        const callbackD = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('D');0
          throw new Error('D error');0
        });0
        const callbackE = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('E');0
          throw new Error('E error');0
        });0
        scheduleWork(callbackA);0
        scheduleWork(callbackB);0
        scheduleWork(callbackC);0
        scheduleWork(callbackD);0
        scheduleWork(callbackE);0
        // Initially doesn't call anything0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual([]);0
        catchPostMessageErrors = true;0
        advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15});0
        // calls all callbacks0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']);0
        // errors should still get thrown0
        const postMessageErrorMessages = postMessageErrors.map(e => e.message);0
        expect(postMessageErrorMessages).toEqual([0
          'A error',0
          'B error',0
          'C error',0
          'D error',0
          'E error',0
        ]);0
        catchPostMessageErrors = false;0
      });0
0
      /**0
       *                                  postMessage0
       *  +                                                             +0
       *  |  rAF                               all callbacks time out   |0
       *  |                                                             |0
       *  |      +---------------------+                                |0
       *  |      | paint/layout        |  cbA() cbB() cbC() cbD() cbE() |0
       *  |      +---------------------+   ^     ^     ^     ^     ^    |0
       *  |                                |     |     |     |     |    |0
       *  +                                |     |     |     |     |    +0
       *                                   |     +     +     +     +0
       *                                   + all callbacks throw errors0
       *0
       *0
       */0
      it('and with all timed out callbacks, still calls all callbacks within same frame', () => {0
        const {scheduleWork} = ReactScheduler;0
        const callbackLog = [];0
        const callbackA = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('A');0
          throw new Error('A error');0
        });0
        const callbackB = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('B');0
          throw new Error('B error');0
        });0
        const callbackC = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('C');0
          throw new Error('C error');0
        });0
        const callbackD = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('D');0
          throw new Error('D error');0
        });0
        const callbackE = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('E');0
          throw new Error('E error');0
        });0
        scheduleWork(callbackA, {timeout: 2}); // times out fast0
        scheduleWork(callbackB, {timeout: 2}); // times out fast0
        scheduleWork(callbackC, {timeout: 2}); // times out fast0
        scheduleWork(callbackD, {timeout: 2}); // times out fast0
        scheduleWork(callbackE, {timeout: 2}); // times out fast0
        // Initially doesn't call anything0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual([]);0
        catchPostMessageErrors = true;0
        advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15});0
        // calls all callbacks0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E']);0
        // errors should still get thrown0
        const postMessageErrorMessages = postMessageErrors.map(e => e.message);0
        expect(postMessageErrorMessages).toEqual([0
          'A error',0
          'B error',0
          'C error',0
          'D error',0
          'E error',0
        ]);0
        catchPostMessageErrors = false;0
      });0
    });0
    describe('when callbacks throw over multiple frames', () => {0
      /**0
       *0
       * **Detail View of Frame 1**0
       *0
       * +                                            +0
       * |  rAF                        postMessage    |0
       * |                                            |0
       * |      +---------------------+               |0
       * |      | paint/layout        |  cbA() cbB()  |  ... Frame 20
       * |      +---------------------+   ^     ^     |0
       * |                                |     |     |0
       * +                                +     |     +0
       *                              errors    |0
       *                                        +0
       *                                 takes long time0
       *                                 and pushes rest of0
       *                                 callbacks into0
       *                                 next frame ->0
       *0
       *0
       *0
       * **Overview of frames 1-4**0
       *0
       *0
       *  +            +            +            +            +0
       *  |            |            |            |            |0
       *  |  +--+      |  +--+      |  +--+      |  +--+      |0
       *  |  +--+  A,B+-> +--+  C,D+-> +--+  E,F+-> +--+  G   |0
       *  +        ^   +        ^   +        ^   +            +0
       *           |            |            |0
       *          error        error        error0
       *0
       *0
       */0
      it('still calls all callbacks within same frame', () => {0
        const {scheduleWork} = ReactScheduler;0
        startOfLatestFrame = 1000000000000;0
        currentTime = startOfLatestFrame - 10;0
        catchPostMessageErrors = true;0
        const callbackLog = [];0
        const callbackA = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('A');0
          throw new Error('A error');0
        });0
        const callbackB = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('B');0
          // time passes, causing us to run out of idle time0
          currentTime += 25;0
        });0
        const callbackC = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('C');0
          throw new Error('C error');0
        });0
        const callbackD = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('D');0
          // time passes, causing us to run out of idle time0
          currentTime += 25;0
        });0
        const callbackE = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('E');0
          throw new Error('E error');0
        });0
        const callbackF = jest.fn(() => {0
          callbackLog.push('F');0
          // time passes, causing us to run out of idle time0
          currentTime += 25;0
        });0
        const callbackG = jest.fn(() => callbackLog.push('G'));0
0
        scheduleWork(callbackA);0
        scheduleWork(callbackB);0
        scheduleWork(callbackC);0
        scheduleWork(callbackD);0
        scheduleWork(callbackE);0
        scheduleWork(callbackF);0
        scheduleWork(callbackG);0
0
        // does nothing initially0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual([]);0
0
        // frame 1;0
        // callback A runs and throws, callback B takes up rest of frame0
        advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15}); // runs rAF and postMessage callbacks0
0
        // calls A and B0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['A', 'B']);0
        // error was thrown from A0
        let postMessageErrorMessages = postMessageErrors.map(e => e.message);0
        expect(postMessageErrorMessages).toEqual(['A error']);0
0
        // frame 2;0
        // callback C runs and throws, callback D takes up rest of frame0
        advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15}); // runs rAF and postMessage callbacks0
0
        // calls C and D0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['A', 'B', 'C', 'D']);0
        // error was thrown from A0
        postMessageErrorMessages = postMessageErrors.map(e => e.message);0
        expect(postMessageErrorMessages).toEqual(['A error', 'C error']);0
0
        // frame 3;0
        // callback E runs and throws, callback F takes up rest of frame0
        advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15}); // runs rAF and postMessage callbacks0
0
        // calls E and F0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E', 'F']);0
        // error was thrown from A0
        postMessageErrorMessages = postMessageErrors.map(e => e.message);0
        expect(postMessageErrorMessages).toEqual([0
          'A error',0
          'C error',0
          'E error',0
        ]);0
0
        // frame 4;0
        // callback G runs and it's the last one0
        advanceOneFrame({timeLeftInFrame: 15}); // runs rAF and postMessage callbacks0
0
        // calls G0
        expect(callbackLog).toEqual(['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E', 'F', 'G']);0
        // error was thrown from A0
        postMessageErrorMessages = postMessageErrors.map(e => e.message);0
        expect(postMessageErrorMessages).toEqual([0
          'A error',0
          'C error',0
          'E error',0
        ]);0
0
        catchPostMessageErrors = true;0
      });0
    });0
  });0
0
  // TODO: test 'now'0
});0

'use strict';0
0
const ReactTestRenderer = require('./src/ReactTestRenderer');0
0
// TODO: decide on the top-level export form.0
// This is hacky but makes it work with both Rollup and Jest.0
module.exports = ReactTestRenderer.default0
  ? ReactTestRenderer.default0
  : ReactTestRenderer;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const ReactShallowRenderer = require('./src/ReactShallowRenderer');0
0
// TODO: decide on the top-level export form.0
// This is hacky but makes it work with both Rollup and Jest.0
module.exports = ReactShallowRenderer.default0
  ? ReactShallowRenderer.default0
  : ReactShallowRenderer;0
'use strict';0
0
if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production') {0
  module.exports = require('./cjs/react-test-renderer.production.min.js');0
} else {0
  module.exports = require('./cjs/react-test-renderer.development.js');0
}0
'use strict';0
0
if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production') {0
  module.exports = require('./cjs/react-test-renderer-shallow.production.min.js');0
} else {0
  module.exports = require('./cjs/react-test-renderer-shallow.development.js');0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 */0
0
import React from 'react';0
import {isForwardRef} from 'react-is';0
import describeComponentFrame from 'shared/describeComponentFrame';0
import getComponentName from 'shared/getComponentName';0
import shallowEqual from 'shared/shallowEqual';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import checkPropTypes from 'prop-types/checkPropTypes';0
0
const emptyObject = {};0
if (__DEV__) {0
  Object.freeze(emptyObject);0
}0
0
class ReactShallowRenderer {0
  static createRenderer = function() {0
    return new ReactShallowRenderer();0
  };0
0
  constructor() {0
    this._context = null;0
    this._element = null;0
    this._instance = null;0
    this._newState = null;0
    this._rendered = null;0
    this._rendering = false;0
    this._forcedUpdate = false;0
    this._updater = new Updater(this);0
  }0
0
  getMountedInstance() {0
    return this._instance;0
  }0
0
  getRenderOutput() {0
    return this._rendered;0
  }0
0
  render(element, context = emptyObject) {0
    invariant(0
      React.isValidElement(element),0
      'ReactShallowRenderer render(): Invalid component element.%s',0
      typeof element === 'function'0
        ? ' Instead of passing a component class, make sure to instantiate ' +0
          'it by passing it to React.createElement.'0
        : '',0
    );0
    // Show a special message for host elements since it's a common case.0
    invariant(0
      typeof element.type !== 'string',0
      'ReactShallowRenderer render(): Shallow rendering works only with custom ' +0
        'components, not primitives (%s). Instead of calling `.render(el)` and ' +0
        'inspecting the rendered output, look at `el.props` directly instead.',0
      element.type,0
    );0
    invariant(0
      isForwardRef(element) || typeof element.type === 'function',0
      'ReactShallowRenderer render(): Shallow rendering works only with custom ' +0
        'components, but the provided element type was `%s`.',0
      Array.isArray(element.type)0
        ? 'array'0
        : element.type === null ? 'null' : typeof element.type,0
    );0
0
    if (this._rendering) {0
      return;0
    }0
0
    this._rendering = true;0
    this._element = element;0
    this._context = getMaskedContext(element.type.contextTypes, context);0
0
    if (this._instance) {0
      this._updateClassComponent(element, this._context);0
    } else {0
      if (isForwardRef(element)) {0
        this._rendered = element.type.render(element.props, element.ref);0
      } else if (shouldConstruct(element.type)) {0
        this._instance = new element.type(0
          element.props,0
          this._context,0
          this._updater,0
        );0
0
        this._updateStateFromStaticLifecycle(element.props);0
0
        if (element.type.hasOwnProperty('contextTypes')) {0
          currentlyValidatingElement = element;0
0
          checkPropTypes(0
            element.type.contextTypes,0
            this._context,0
            'context',0
            getName(element.type, this._instance),0
            getStackAddendum,0
          );0
0
          currentlyValidatingElement = null;0
        }0
0
        this._mountClassComponent(element, this._context);0
      } else {0
        this._rendered = element.type(element.props, this._context);0
      }0
    }0
0
    this._rendering = false;0
    this._updater._invokeCallbacks();0
0
    return this.getRenderOutput();0
  }0
0
  unmount() {0
    if (this._instance) {0
      if (typeof this._instance.componentWillUnmount === 'function') {0
        this._instance.componentWillUnmount();0
      }0
    }0
0
    this._context = null;0
    this._element = null;0
    this._newState = null;0
    this._rendered = null;0
    this._instance = null;0
  }0
0
  _mountClassComponent(element, context) {0
    this._instance.context = context;0
    this._instance.props = element.props;0
    this._instance.state = this._instance.state || null;0
    this._instance.updater = this._updater;0
0
    if (0
      typeof this._instance.UNSAFE_componentWillMount === 'function' ||0
      typeof this._instance.componentWillMount === 'function'0
    ) {0
      const beforeState = this._newState;0
0
      // In order to support react-lifecycles-compat polyfilled components,0
      // Unsafe lifecycles should not be invoked for components using the new APIs.0
      if (0
        typeof element.type.getDerivedStateFromProps !== 'function' &&0
        typeof this._instance.getSnapshotBeforeUpdate !== 'function'0
      ) {0
        if (typeof this._instance.componentWillMount === 'function') {0
          this._instance.componentWillMount();0
        }0
        if (typeof this._instance.UNSAFE_componentWillMount === 'function') {0
          this._instance.UNSAFE_componentWillMount();0
        }0
      }0
0
      // setState may have been called during cWM0
      if (beforeState !== this._newState) {0
        this._instance.state = this._newState || emptyObject;0
      }0
    }0
0
    this._rendered = this._instance.render();0
    // Intentionally do not call componentDidMount()0
    // because DOM refs are not available.0
  }0
0
  _updateClassComponent(element, context) {0
    const {props, type} = element;0
0
    const oldState = this._instance.state || emptyObject;0
    const oldProps = this._instance.props;0
0
    if (oldProps !== props) {0
      // In order to support react-lifecycles-compat polyfilled components,0
      // Unsafe lifecycles should not be invoked for components using the new APIs.0
      if (0
        typeof element.type.getDerivedStateFromProps !== 'function' &&0
        typeof this._instance.getSnapshotBeforeUpdate !== 'function'0
      ) {0
        if (typeof this._instance.componentWillReceiveProps === 'function') {0
          this._instance.componentWillReceiveProps(props, context);0
        }0
        if (0
          typeof this._instance.UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps === 'function'0
        ) {0
          this._instance.UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(props, context);0
        }0
      }0
    }0
    this._updateStateFromStaticLifecycle(props);0
0
    // Read state after cWRP in case it calls setState0
    const state = this._newState || oldState;0
0
    let shouldUpdate = true;0
    if (this._forcedUpdate) {0
      shouldUpdate = true;0
      this._forcedUpdate = false;0
    } else if (typeof this._instance.shouldComponentUpdate === 'function') {0
      shouldUpdate = !!this._instance.shouldComponentUpdate(0
        props,0
        state,0
        context,0
      );0
    } else if (type.prototype && type.prototype.isPureReactComponent) {0
      shouldUpdate =0
        !shallowEqual(oldProps, props) || !shallowEqual(oldState, state);0
    }0
0
    if (shouldUpdate) {0
      // In order to support react-lifecycles-compat polyfilled components,0
      // Unsafe lifecycles should not be invoked for components using the new APIs.0
      if (0
        typeof element.type.getDerivedStateFromProps !== 'function' &&0
        typeof this._instance.getSnapshotBeforeUpdate !== 'function'0
      ) {0
        if (typeof this._instance.componentWillUpdate === 'function') {0
          this._instance.componentWillUpdate(props, state, context);0
        }0
        if (typeof this._instance.UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate === 'function') {0
          this._instance.UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate(props, state, context);0
        }0
      }0
    }0
0
    this._instance.context = context;0
    this._instance.props = props;0
    this._instance.state = state;0
0
    if (shouldUpdate) {0
      this._rendered = this._instance.render();0
    }0
    // Intentionally do not call componentDidUpdate()0
    // because DOM refs are not available.0
  }0
0
  _updateStateFromStaticLifecycle(props) {0
    const {type} = this._element;0
0
    if (typeof type.getDerivedStateFromProps === 'function') {0
      const oldState = this._newState || this._instance.state;0
      const partialState = type.getDerivedStateFromProps.call(0
        null,0
        props,0
        oldState,0
      );0
0
      if (partialState != null) {0
        const newState = Object.assign({}, oldState, partialState);0
        this._instance.state = this._newState = newState;0
      }0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
class Updater {0
  constructor(renderer) {0
    this._renderer = renderer;0
    this._callbacks = [];0
  }0
0
  _enqueueCallback(callback, publicInstance) {0
    if (typeof callback === 'function' && publicInstance) {0
      this._callbacks.push({0
        callback,0
        publicInstance,0
      });0
    }0
  }0
0
  _invokeCallbacks() {0
    const callbacks = this._callbacks;0
    this._callbacks = [];0
0
    callbacks.forEach(({callback, publicInstance}) => {0
      callback.call(publicInstance);0
    });0
  }0
0
  isMounted(publicInstance) {0
    return !!this._renderer._element;0
  }0
0
  enqueueForceUpdate(publicInstance, callback, callerName) {0
    this._enqueueCallback(callback, publicInstance);0
    this._renderer._forcedUpdate = true;0
    this._renderer.render(this._renderer._element, this._renderer._context);0
  }0
0
  enqueueReplaceState(publicInstance, completeState, callback, callerName) {0
    this._enqueueCallback(callback, publicInstance);0
    this._renderer._newState = completeState;0
    this._renderer.render(this._renderer._element, this._renderer._context);0
  }0
0
  enqueueSetState(publicInstance, partialState, callback, callerName) {0
    this._enqueueCallback(callback, publicInstance);0
    const currentState = this._renderer._newState || publicInstance.state;0
0
    if (typeof partialState === 'function') {0
      partialState = partialState.call(0
        publicInstance,0
        currentState,0
        publicInstance.props,0
      );0
    }0
0
    // Null and undefined are treated as no-ops.0
    if (partialState === null || partialState === undefined) {0
      return;0
    }0
0
    this._renderer._newState = {0
      ...currentState,0
      ...partialState,0
    };0
0
    this._renderer.render(this._renderer._element, this._renderer._context);0
  }0
}0
0
let currentlyValidatingElement = null;0
0
function getDisplayName(element) {0
  if (element == null) {0
    return '#empty';0
  } else if (typeof element === 'string' || typeof element === 'number') {0
    return '#text';0
  } else if (typeof element.type === 'string') {0
    return element.type;0
  } else {0
    return element.type.displayName || element.type.name || 'Unknown';0
  }0
}0
0
function getStackAddendum() {0
  let stack = '';0
  if (currentlyValidatingElement) {0
    const name = getDisplayName(currentlyValidatingElement);0
    const owner = currentlyValidatingElement._owner;0
    stack += describeComponentFrame(0
      name,0
      currentlyValidatingElement._source,0
      owner && getComponentName(owner),0
    );0
  }0
  return stack;0
}0
0
function getName(type, instance) {0
  const constructor = instance && instance.constructor;0
  return (0
    type.displayName ||0
    (constructor && constructor.displayName) ||0
    type.name ||0
    (constructor && constructor.name) ||0
    null0
  );0
}0
0
function shouldConstruct(Component) {0
  return !!(Component.prototype && Component.prototype.isReactComponent);0
}0
0
function getMaskedContext(contextTypes, unmaskedContext) {0
  if (!contextTypes) {0
    return emptyObject;0
  }0
  const context = {};0
  for (let key in contextTypes) {0
    context[key] = unmaskedContext[key];0
  }0
  return context;0
}0
0
export default ReactShallowRenderer;0

export function getPublicInstance(inst: Instance | TextInstance): * {0
  switch (inst.tag) {0
    case 'INSTANCE':0
      const createNodeMock = inst.rootContainerInstance.createNodeMock;0
      return createNodeMock({0
        type: inst.type,0
        props: inst.props,0
      });0
    default:0
      return inst;0
  }0
}0
0
export function appendChild(0
  parentInstance: Instance | Container,0
  child: Instance | TextInstance,0
): void {0
  const index = parentInstance.children.indexOf(child);0
  if (index !== -1) {0
    parentInstance.children.splice(index, 1);0
  }0
  parentInstance.children.push(child);0
}0
0
export function insertBefore(0
  parentInstance: Instance | Container,0
  child: Instance | TextInstance,0
  beforeChild: Instance | TextInstance,0
): void {0
  const index = parentInstance.children.indexOf(child);0
  if (index !== -1) {0
    parentInstance.children.splice(index, 1);0
  }0
  const beforeIndex = parentInstance.children.indexOf(beforeChild);0
  parentInstance.children.splice(beforeIndex, 0, child);0
}0
0
export function removeChild(0
  parentInstance: Instance | Container,0
  child: Instance | TextInstance,0
): void {0
  const index = parentInstance.children.indexOf(child);0
  parentInstance.children.splice(index, 1);0
}0
0
