import type {Fiber} from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiber';0
import type {FiberRoot} from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiberRoot';0
import type {Instance, TextInstance} from './ReactTestHostConfig';0
0
import * as TestRenderer from 'react-reconciler/inline.test';0
import {batchedUpdates} from 'events/ReactGenericBatching';0
import {findCurrentFiberUsingSlowPath} from 'react-reconciler/reflection';0
import {0
  Fragment,0
  FunctionalComponent,0
  ClassComponent,0
  HostComponent,0
  HostPortal,0
  HostText,0
  HostRoot,0
  ContextConsumer,0
  ContextProvider,0
  Mode,0
  ForwardRef,0
  Profiler,0
} from 'shared/ReactTypeOfWork';0
import invariant from 'shared/invariant';0
import ReactVersion from 'shared/ReactVersion';0
0
import * as ReactTestHostConfig from './ReactTestHostConfig';0
import * as TestRendererScheduling from './ReactTestRendererScheduling';0
0
type TestRendererOptions = {0
  createNodeMock: (element: React$Element<any>) => any,0
  unstable_isAsync: boolean,0
};0
0
type ReactTestRendererJSON = {|0
  type: string,0
  props: {[propName: string]: any},0
  children: null | Array<ReactTestRendererNode>,0
  $$typeof?: Symbol, // Optional because we add it with defineProperty().0
|};0
type ReactTestRendererNode = ReactTestRendererJSON | string;0
0
type FindOptions = $Shape<{0
  // performs a "greedy" search: if a matching node is found, will continue0
  // to search within the matching node's children. (default: true)0
  deep: boolean,0
}>;0
0
export type Predicate = (node: ReactTestInstance) => ?boolean;0
0
const defaultTestOptions = {0
  createNodeMock: function() {0
    return null;0
  },0
};0
0
function toJSON(inst: Instance | TextInstance): ReactTestRendererNode {0
  switch (inst.tag) {0
    case 'TEXT':0
      return inst.text;0
    case 'INSTANCE':0
      /* eslint-disable no-unused-vars */0
      // We don't include the `children` prop in JSON.0
      // Instead, we will include the actual rendered children.0
      const {children, ...props} = inst.props;0
      /* eslint-enable */0
      let renderedChildren = null;0
      if (inst.children && inst.children.length) {0
        renderedChildren = inst.children.map(toJSON);0
      }0
      const json: ReactTestRendererJSON = {0
        type: inst.type,0
        props: props,0
        children: renderedChildren,0
      };0
      Object.defineProperty(json, '$$typeof', {0
        value: Symbol.for('react.test.json'),0
      });0
      return json;0
    default:0
      throw new Error(`Unexpected node type in toJSON: ${inst.tag}`);0
  }0
}0
0
function childrenToTree(node) {0
  if (!node) {0
    return null;0
  }0
  const children = nodeAndSiblingsArray(node);0
  if (children.length === 0) {0
    return null;0
  } else if (children.length === 1) {0
    return toTree(children[0]);0
  }0
  return flatten(children.map(toTree));0
}0
0
function nodeAndSiblingsArray(nodeWithSibling) {0
  const array = [];0
  let node = nodeWithSibling;0
  while (node != null) {0
    array.push(node);0
    node = node.sibling;0
  }0
  return array;0
}0
0
function flatten(arr) {0
  const result = [];0
  const stack = [{i: 0, array: arr}];0
  while (stack.length) {0
    const n = stack.pop();0
    while (n.i < n.array.length) {0
      const el = n.array[n.i];0
      n.i += 1;0
      if (Array.isArray(el)) {0
        stack.push(n);0
        stack.push({i: 0, array: el});0
        break;0
      }0
      result.push(el);0
    }0
  }0
  return result;0
}0
0
function toTree(node: ?Fiber) {0
  if (node == null) {0
    return null;0
  }0
  switch (node.tag) {0
    case HostRoot:0
      return childrenToTree(node.child);0
    case HostPortal:0
      return childrenToTree(node.child);0
    case ClassComponent:0
      return {0
        nodeType: 'component',0
        type: node.type,0
        props: {...node.memoizedProps},0
        instance: node.stateNode,0
        rendered: childrenToTree(node.child),0
      };0
    case FunctionalComponent:0
      return {0
        nodeType: 'component',0
        type: node.type,0
        props: {...node.memoizedProps},0
        instance: null,0
        rendered: childrenToTree(node.child),0
      };0
    case HostComponent: {0
      return {0
        nodeType: 'host',0
        type: node.type,0
        props: {...node.memoizedProps},0
        instance: null, // TODO: use createNodeMock here somehow?0
        rendered: flatten(nodeAndSiblingsArray(node.child).map(toTree)),0
      };0
    }0
    case HostText:0
      return node.stateNode.text;0
    case Fragment:0
    case ContextProvider:0
    case ContextConsumer:0
    case Mode:0
    case Profiler:0
    case ForwardRef:0
      return childrenToTree(node.child);0
    default:0
      invariant(0
        false,0
        'toTree() does not yet know how to handle nodes with tag=%s',0
        node.tag,0
      );0
  }0
}0
0
const fiberToWrapper = new WeakMap();0
function wrapFiber(fiber: Fiber): ReactTestInstance {0
  let wrapper = fiberToWrapper.get(fiber);0
  if (wrapper === undefined && fiber.alternate !== null) {0
    wrapper = fiberToWrapper.get(fiber.alternate);0
  }0
  if (wrapper === undefined) {0
    wrapper = new ReactTestInstance(fiber);0
    fiberToWrapper.set(fiber, wrapper);0
  }0
  return wrapper;0
}0
0
const validWrapperTypes = new Set([0
  FunctionalComponent,0
  ClassComponent,0
  HostComponent,0
  ForwardRef,0
  // Normally skipped, but used when there's more than one root child.0
  HostRoot,0
]);0
0
function getChildren(parent: Fiber) {0
  const children = [];0
  const startingNode = parent;0
  let node: Fiber = startingNode;0
  if (node.child === null) {0
    return children;0
  }0
  node.child.return = node;0
  node = node.child;0
  outer: while (true) {0
    let descend = false;0
    if (validWrapperTypes.has(node.tag)) {0
      children.push(wrapFiber(node));0
    } else if (node.tag === HostText) {0
      children.push('' + node.memoizedProps);0
    } else {0
      descend = true;0
    }0
    if (descend && node.child !== null) {0
      node.child.return = node;0
      node = node.child;0
      continue;0
    }0
    while (node.sibling === null) {0
      if (node.return === startingNode) {0
        break outer;0
      }0
      node = (node.return: any);0
    }0
    (node.sibling: any).return = node.return;0
    node = (node.sibling: any);0
  }0
  return children;0
}0
0
class ReactTestInstance {0
  _fiber: Fiber;0
0
  _currentFiber(): Fiber {0
    // Throws if this component has been unmounted.0
    const fiber = findCurrentFiberUsingSlowPath(this._fiber);0
    invariant(0
      fiber !== null,0
      "Can't read from currently-mounting component. This error is likely " +0
        'caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.',0
    );0
    return fiber;0
  }0
0
  constructor(fiber: Fiber) {0
    invariant(0
      validWrapperTypes.has(fiber.tag),0
      'Unexpected object passed to ReactTestInstance constructor (tag: %s). ' +0
        'This is probably a bug in React.',0
      fiber.tag,0
    );0
    this._fiber = fiber;0
  }0
0
  get instance() {0
    if (this._fiber.tag === HostComponent) {0
      return ReactTestHostConfig.getPublicInstance(this._fiber.stateNode);0
    } else {0
      return this._fiber.stateNode;0
    }0
  }0
0
  get type() {0
    return this._fiber.type;0
  }0
0
  get props(): Object {0
    return this._currentFiber().memoizedProps;0
  }0
0
  get parent(): ?ReactTestInstance {0
    let parent = this._fiber.return;0
    while (parent !== null) {0
      if (validWrapperTypes.has(parent.tag)) {0
        if (parent.tag === HostRoot) {0
          // Special case: we only "materialize" instances for roots0
          // if they have more than a single child. So we'll check that now.0
          if (getChildren(parent).length < 2) {0
            return null;0
          }0
        }0
        return wrapFiber(parent);0
      }0
      parent = parent.return;0
    }0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  get children(): Array<ReactTestInstance | string> {0
    return getChildren(this._currentFiber());0
  }0
0
  // Custom search functions0
  find(predicate: Predicate): ReactTestInstance {0
    return expectOne(0
      this.findAll(predicate, {deep: false}),0
      `matching custom predicate: ${predicate.toString()}`,0
    );0
  }0
0
  findByType(type: any): ReactTestInstance {0
    return expectOne(0
      this.findAllByType(type, {deep: false}),0
      `with node type: "${type.displayName || type.name}"`,0
    );0
  }0
0
  findByProps(props: Object): ReactTestInstance {0
    return expectOne(0
      this.findAllByProps(props, {deep: false}),0
      `with props: ${JSON.stringify(props)}`,0
    );0
  }0
0
  findAll(0
    predicate: Predicate,0
    options: ?FindOptions = null,0
  ): Array<ReactTestInstance> {0
    return findAll(this, predicate, options);0
  }0
0
  findAllByType(0
    type: any,0
    options: ?FindOptions = null,0
  ): Array<ReactTestInstance> {0
    return findAll(this, node => node.type === type, options);0
  }0
0
  findAllByProps(0
    props: Object,0
    options: ?FindOptions = null,0
  ): Array<ReactTestInstance> {0
    return findAll(0
      this,0
      node => node.props && propsMatch(node.props, props),0
      options,0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
function findAll(0
  root: ReactTestInstance,0
  predicate: Predicate,0
  options: ?FindOptions,0
): Array<ReactTestInstance> {0
  const deep = options ? options.deep : true;0
  const results = [];0
0
  if (predicate(root)) {0
    results.push(root);0
    if (!deep) {0
      return results;0
    }0
  }0
0
  root.children.forEach(child => {0
    if (typeof child === 'string') {0
      return;0
    }0
    results.push(...findAll(child, predicate, options));0
  });0
0
  return results;0
}0
0
function expectOne(0
  all: Array<ReactTestInstance>,0
  message: string,0
): ReactTestInstance {0
  if (all.length === 1) {0
    return all[0];0
  }0
0
  const prefix =0
    all.length === 00
      ? 'No instances found '0
      : `Expected 1 but found ${all.length} instances `;0
0
  throw new Error(prefix + message);0
}0
0
function propsMatch(props: Object, filter: Object): boolean {0
  for (const key in filter) {0
    if (props[key] !== filter[key]) {0
      return false;0
    }0
  }0
  return true;0
}0
0
const ReactTestRendererFiber = {0
  create(element: React$Element<any>, options: TestRendererOptions) {0
    let createNodeMock = defaultTestOptions.createNodeMock;0
    let isAsync = false;0
    if (typeof options === 'object' && options !== null) {0
      if (typeof options.createNodeMock === 'function') {0
        createNodeMock = options.createNodeMock;0
      }0
      if (options.unstable_isAsync === true) {0
        isAsync = true;0
      }0
    }0
    let container = {0
      children: [],0
      createNodeMock,0
      tag: 'CONTAINER',0
    };0
    let root: FiberRoot | null = TestRenderer.createContainer(0
      container,0
      isAsync,0
      false,0
    );0
    invariant(root != null, 'something went wrong');0
    TestRenderer.updateContainer(element, root, null, null);0
0
    const entry = {0
      root: undefined, // makes flow happy0
      // we define a 'getter' for 'root' below using 'Object.defineProperty'0
      toJSON(): Array<ReactTestRendererNode> | ReactTestRendererNode | null {0
        if (root == null || root.current == null || container == null) {0
          return null;0
        }0
        if (container.children.length === 0) {0
          return null;0
        }0
        if (container.children.length === 1) {0
          return toJSON(container.children[0]);0
        }0
        return container.children.map(toJSON);0
      },0
      toTree() {0
        if (root == null || root.current == null) {0
          return null;0
        }0
        return toTree(root.current);0
      },0
      update(newElement: React$Element<any>) {0
        if (root == null || root.current == null) {0
          return;0
        }0
        TestRenderer.updateContainer(newElement, root, null, null);0
      },0
      unmount() {0
        if (root == null || root.current == null) {0
          return;0
        }0
        TestRenderer.updateContainer(null, root, null, null);0
        container = null;0
        root = null;0
      },0
      getInstance() {0
        if (root == null || root.current == null) {0
          return null;0
        }0
        return TestRenderer.getPublicRootInstance(root);0
      },0
      unstable_flushAll: TestRendererScheduling.flushAll,0
      unstable_flushSync(fn: Function) {0
        return TestRendererScheduling.withCleanYields(() => {0
          TestRenderer.flushSync(fn);0
        });0
      },0
      unstable_flushThrough: TestRendererScheduling.flushThrough,0
      unstable_yield: TestRendererScheduling.yieldValue,0
    };0
0
    Object.defineProperty(0
      entry,0
      'root',0
      ({0
        configurable: true,0
        enumerable: true,0
        get: function() {0
          if (root === null) {0
            throw new Error("Can't access .root on unmounted test renderer");0
          }0
          const children = getChildren(root.current);0
          if (children.length === 0) {0
            throw new Error("Can't access .root on unmounted test renderer");0
          } else if (children.length === 1) {0
            // Normally, we skip the root and just give you the child.0
            return children[0];0
          } else {0
            // However, we give you the root if there's more than one root child.0
            // We could make this the behavior for all cases but it would be a breaking change.0
            return wrapFiber(root.current);0
          }0
        },0
      }: Object),0
    );0
0
    return entry;0
  },0
0
  /* eslint-disable camelcase */0
  unstable_batchedUpdates: batchedUpdates,0
  /* eslint-enable camelcase */0
0
  unstable_setNowImplementation: TestRendererScheduling.setNowImplementation,0
};0
0
// Enable ReactTestRenderer to be used to test DevTools integration.0
TestRenderer.injectIntoDevTools({0
  findFiberByHostInstance: (() => {0
    throw new Error('TestRenderer does not support findFiberByHostInstance()');0
  }: any),0
  bundleType: __DEV__ ? 1 : 0,0
  version: ReactVersion,0
  rendererPackageName: 'react-test-renderer',0
});0
0
export default ReactTestRendererFiber;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0

 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
import type {Deadline} from 'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiberScheduler';0
0
// Current virtual time0
export let nowImplementation = () => 0;0
export let scheduledCallback: ((deadline: Deadline) => mixed) | null = null;0
export let yieldedValues: Array<mixed> | null = null;0
0
export function scheduleDeferredCallback(0
  callback: (deadline: Deadline) => mixed,0
  options?: {timeout: number},0
): number {0
  scheduledCallback = callback;0
  const fakeCallbackId = 0;0
  return fakeCallbackId;0
}0
0
export function cancelDeferredCallback(timeoutID: number): void {0
  scheduledCallback = null;0
}0
0
export function setNowImplementation(implementation: () => number): void {0
  nowImplementation = implementation;0
}0
0
export function flushAll(): Array<mixed> {0
  yieldedValues = null;0
  while (scheduledCallback !== null) {0
    const cb = scheduledCallback;0
    scheduledCallback = null;0
    cb({0
      timeRemaining() {0
        // Keep rendering until there's no more work0
        return 999;0
      },0
      // React's scheduler has its own way of keeping track of expired0
      // work and doesn't read this, so don't bother setting it to the0
      // correct value.0
      didTimeout: false,0
    });0
  }0
  if (yieldedValues === null) {0
    // Always return an array.0
    return [];0
  }0
  return yieldedValues;0
}0
0
export function flushThrough(expectedValues: Array<mixed>): Array<mixed> {0
  let didStop = false;0
  yieldedValues = null;0
  while (scheduledCallback !== null && !didStop) {0
    const cb = scheduledCallback;0
    scheduledCallback = null;0
    cb({0
      timeRemaining() {0
        if (0
          yieldedValues !== null &&0
          yieldedValues.length >= expectedValues.length0
        ) {0
          // We at least as many values as expected. Stop rendering.0
          didStop = true;0
          return 0;0
        }0
        // Keep rendering.0
        return 999;0
      },0
      // React's scheduler has its own way of keeping track of expired0
      // work and doesn't read this, so don't bother setting it to the0
      // correct value.0
      didTimeout: false,0
    });0
  }0
  if (yieldedValues === null) {0
    // Always return an array.0
    yieldedValues = [];0
  }0
  for (let i = 0; i < expectedValues.length; i++) {0
    const expectedValue = `"${(expectedValues[i]: any)}"`;0
    const yieldedValue =0
      i < yieldedValues.length ? `"${(yieldedValues[i]: any)}"` : 'nothing';0
    if (yieldedValue !== expectedValue) {0
      const error = new Error(0
        `flushThrough expected to yield ${(expectedValue: any)}, but ${(yieldedValue: any)} was yielded`,0
      );0
      // Attach expected and yielded arrays,0
      // So the caller could pretty print the diff (if desired).0
      (error: any).expectedValues = expectedValues;0
      (error: any).actualValues = yieldedValues;0
      throw error;0
    }0
  }0
  return yieldedValues;0
}0
0
export function yieldValue(value: mixed): void {0
  if (yieldedValues === null) {0
    yieldedValues = [value];0
  } else {0
    yieldedValues.push(value);0
  }0
}0
0
export function withCleanYields(fn: Function) {0
  yieldedValues = [];0
  fn();0
  return yieldedValues;0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 * @jest-environment node0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
let createRenderer;0
let PropTypes;0
let React;0
0
describe('ReactShallowRenderer', () => {0
  beforeEach(() => {0
    jest.resetModules();0
0
    createRenderer = require('react-test-renderer/shallow').createRenderer;0
    PropTypes = require('prop-types');0
    React = require('react');0
  });0
0
  it('should call all of the legacy lifecycle hooks', () => {0
    const logs = [];0
    const logger = message => () => logs.push(message) || true;0
0
    class SomeComponent extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount = logger('componentWillMount');0
      componentDidMount = logger('componentDidMount');0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps = logger('componentWillReceiveProps');0
      shouldComponentUpdate = logger('shouldComponentUpdate');0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate = logger('componentWillUpdate');0
      componentDidUpdate = logger('componentDidUpdate');0
      componentWillUnmount = logger('componentWillUnmount');0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(<SomeComponent foo={1} />);0
0
    // Calling cDU might lead to problems with host component references.0
    // Since our components aren't really mounted, refs won't be available.0
    expect(logs).toEqual(['componentWillMount']);0
0
    logs.splice(0);0
0
    const instance = shallowRenderer.getMountedInstance();0
    instance.setState({});0
0
    expect(logs).toEqual(['shouldComponentUpdate', 'componentWillUpdate']);0
0
    logs.splice(0);0
0
    shallowRenderer.render(<SomeComponent foo={2} />);0
0
    // The previous shallow renderer did not trigger cDU for props changes.0
    expect(logs).toEqual([0
      'componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'shouldComponentUpdate',0
      'componentWillUpdate',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should call all of the new lifecycle hooks', () => {0
    const logs = [];0
    const logger = message => () => logs.push(message) || true;0
0
    class SomeComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps = logger('getDerivedStateFromProps');0
      componentDidMount = logger('componentDidMount');0
      shouldComponentUpdate = logger('shouldComponentUpdate');0
      componentDidUpdate = logger('componentDidUpdate');0
      componentWillUnmount = logger('componentWillUnmount');0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(<SomeComponent foo={1} />);0
0
    // Calling cDU might lead to problems with host component references.0
    // Since our components aren't really mounted, refs won't be available.0
    expect(logs).toEqual(['getDerivedStateFromProps']);0
0
    logs.splice(0);0
0
    const instance = shallowRenderer.getMountedInstance();0
    instance.setState({});0
0
    expect(logs).toEqual(['getDerivedStateFromProps', 'shouldComponentUpdate']);0
0
    logs.splice(0);0
0
    shallowRenderer.render(<SomeComponent foo={2} />);0
0
    // The previous shallow renderer did not trigger cDU for props changes.0
    expect(logs).toEqual(['getDerivedStateFromProps', 'shouldComponentUpdate']);0
  });0
0
  it('should not invoke deprecated lifecycles (cWM/cWRP/cWU) if new static gDSFP is present', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps() {0
        return null;0
      }0
      componentWillMount() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0
      componentWillReceiveProps() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0
      componentWillUpdate() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(<Component />);0
  });0

    class Component extends React.Component {0
      getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() {0
        return null;0
      }0
      componentWillMount() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0
      componentWillReceiveProps() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0

        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(<Component value={1} />);0

  });0

  it('should not call getSnapshotBeforeUpdate or componentDidUpdate when updating since refs wont exist', () => {0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      getSnapshotBeforeUpdate() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0
      componentDidUpdate() {0
        throw Error('unexpected');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0

    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(<Component value={1} />);0

      throw Error('This component should not render');0
    }0

    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(React.createElement(Parent));0
  });0

  it('should have shallow rendering', () => {0
    class SomeComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>0
            <span className="child1" />0
            <span className="child2" />0
          </div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    const result = shallowRenderer.render(<SomeComponent />);0
0
    expect(result.type).toBe('div');0
    expect(result.props.children).toEqual([0
      <span className="child1" />,0
      <span className="child2" />,0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should handle ForwardRef', () => {0
    const testRef = React.createRef();0
    const SomeComponent = React.forwardRef((props, ref) => {0
      expect(ref).toEqual(testRef);0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <span className="child1" />0
          <span className="child2" />0
        </div>0
      );0
    });0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    const result = shallowRenderer.render(<SomeComponent ref={testRef} />);0

      <span className="child1" />,0

    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should handle Profiler', () => {0
    class SomeComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <React.unstable_Profiler id="test" onRender={jest.fn()}>0
            <div>0
              <span className="child1" />0
              <span className="child2" />0
            </div>0
          </React.unstable_Profiler>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    const result = shallowRenderer.render(<SomeComponent />);0
0
    expect(result.type).toBe(React.unstable_Profiler);0
    expect(result.props.children).toEqual(0
      <div>0
        <span className="child1" />0
        <span className="child2" />0
      </div>,0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should enable shouldComponentUpdate to prevent a re-render', () => {0
    let renderCounter = 0;0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {update: false};0
      shouldComponentUpdate(nextProps, nextState) {0
        return this.state.update !== nextState.update;0
      }0
      render() {0
        renderCounter++;0
        return <div>{`${renderCounter}`}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent />);0
    expect(shallowRenderer.getRenderOutput()).toEqual(<div>1</div>);0
0
    const instance = shallowRenderer.getMountedInstance();0
    instance.setState({update: false});0
    expect(shallowRenderer.getRenderOutput()).toEqual(<div>1</div>);0
0
    instance.setState({update: true});0
    expect(shallowRenderer.getRenderOutput()).toEqual(<div>2</div>);0
  });0
0
  it('should enable PureComponent to prevent a re-render', () => {0
    let renderCounter = 0;0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.PureComponent {0
      state = {update: false};0
      render() {0
        renderCounter++;0
        return <div>{`${renderCounter}`}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent />);0
    expect(shallowRenderer.getRenderOutput()).toEqual(<div>1</div>);0
0
    const instance = shallowRenderer.getMountedInstance();0
    instance.setState({update: false});0
    expect(shallowRenderer.getRenderOutput()).toEqual(<div>1</div>);0
0
    instance.setState({update: true});0
    expect(shallowRenderer.getRenderOutput()).toEqual(<div>2</div>);0
  });0
0
  it('should not run shouldComponentUpdate during forced update', () => {0
    let scuCounter = 0;0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {count: 1};0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        scuCounter++;0
        return false;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return <div>{`${this.state.count}`}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent />);0
    expect(scuCounter).toEqual(0);0
    expect(shallowRenderer.getRenderOutput()).toEqual(<div>1</div>);0
0
    // Force update the initial state. sCU should not fire.0
    const instance = shallowRenderer.getMountedInstance();0
    instance.forceUpdate();0
    expect(scuCounter).toEqual(0);0
    expect(shallowRenderer.getRenderOutput()).toEqual(<div>1</div>);0
0
    // Setting state updates the instance, but doesn't re-render0
    // because sCU returned false.0
    instance.setState(state => ({count: state.count + 1}));0
    expect(scuCounter).toEqual(1);0
    expect(instance.state.count).toEqual(2);0
    expect(shallowRenderer.getRenderOutput()).toEqual(<div>1</div>);0
0
    // A force update updates the render output, but doesn't call sCU.0
    instance.forceUpdate();0
    expect(scuCounter).toEqual(1);0
    expect(instance.state.count).toEqual(2);0
    expect(shallowRenderer.getRenderOutput()).toEqual(<div>2</div>);0
  });0
0
  it('should rerender when calling forceUpdate', () => {0
    let renderCounter = 0;0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        renderCounter += 1;0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent />);0
    expect(renderCounter).toEqual(1);0
0
    const instance = shallowRenderer.getMountedInstance();0
    instance.forceUpdate();0
    expect(renderCounter).toEqual(2);0
  });0
0
  it('should shallow render a functional component', () => {0
    function SomeComponent(props, context) {0
      return (0
        <div>0
          <div>{props.foo}</div>0
          <div>{context.bar}</div>0
          <span className="child1" />0
          <span className="child2" />0
        </div>0
      );0
    }0
    SomeComponent.contextTypes = {0
      bar: PropTypes.string,0
    };0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    const result = shallowRenderer.render(<SomeComponent foo={'FOO'} />, {0
      bar: 'BAR',0
    });0
0
    expect(result.type).toBe('div');0
    expect(result.props.children).toEqual([0
      <div>FOO</div>,0
      <div>BAR</div>,0
      <span className="child1" />,0
      <span className="child2" />,0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should shallow render a component returning strings directly from render', () => {0
    const Text = ({value}) => value;0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0

    expect(result).toEqual('foo');0
  });0

    const Text = ({value}) => value;0
0

  });0

    class SomeComponent extends React.Component {0

        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    class Fragment extends React.Component {0
      render() {0

      }0
    }0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    const result = shallowRenderer.render(<Fragment />);0
    expect(result).toEqual([0
      <div key="a" />,0

      <SomeComponent />,0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should shallow render a React.fragment', () => {0
    class SomeComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
    class Fragment extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <React.Fragment>0
            <div />0
            <span />0

          </React.Fragment>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    const result = shallowRenderer.render(<Fragment />);0

      <React.Fragment>0

    );0
  });0

  it('should throw for invalid elements', () => {0
    class SomeComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    expect(() => shallowRenderer.render(SomeComponent)).toThrowError(0
      'ReactShallowRenderer render(): Invalid component element. Instead of ' +0
        'passing a component class, make sure to instantiate it by passing it ' +0
        'to React.createElement.',0
    );0
    expect(() => shallowRenderer.render(<div />)).toThrowError(0
      'ReactShallowRenderer render(): Shallow rendering works only with ' +0
        'custom components, not primitives (div). Instead of calling ' +0
        '`.render(el)` and inspecting the rendered output, look at `el.props` ' +0
        'directly instead.',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should have shallow unmounting', () => {0
    const componentWillUnmount = jest.fn();0
0
    class SomeComponent extends React.Component {0
      componentWillUnmount = componentWillUnmount;0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(<SomeComponent />);0
    shallowRenderer.unmount();0
0
    expect(componentWillUnmount).toBeCalled();0
  });0
0
  it('can shallow render to null', () => {0
    class SomeComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    const result = shallowRenderer.render(<SomeComponent />);0
0
    expect(result).toBe(null);0
  });0
0
  it('can shallow render with a ref', () => {0
    class SomeComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <div ref="hello" />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    // Shouldn't crash.0
    shallowRenderer.render(<SomeComponent />);0
  });0
0
  it('lets you update shallowly rendered components', () => {0
    class SomeComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {clicked: false};0
0
      onClick = () => {0
        this.setState({clicked: true});0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        const className = this.state.clicked ? 'was-clicked' : '';0
0
        if (this.props.aNew === 'prop') {0
          return (0
            <a href="#" onClick={this.onClick} className={className}>0
              Test link0
            </a>0
          );0
        } else {0
          return (0
            <div>0
              <span className="child1" />0
              <span className="child2" />0
            </div>0
          );0
        }0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    const result = shallowRenderer.render(<SomeComponent />);0
    expect(result.type).toBe('div');0
    expect(result.props.children).toEqual([0
      <span className="child1" />,0
      <span className="child2" />,0
    ]);0
0
    const updatedResult = shallowRenderer.render(<SomeComponent aNew="prop" />);0
    expect(updatedResult.type).toBe('a');0
0
    const mockEvent = {};0
    updatedResult.props.onClick(mockEvent);0
0
    const updatedResultCausedByClick = shallowRenderer.getRenderOutput();0
    expect(updatedResultCausedByClick.type).toBe('a');0
    expect(updatedResultCausedByClick.props.className).toBe('was-clicked');0
  });0
0
  it('can access the mounted component instance', () => {0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      someMethod = () => {0
        return this.props.n;0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.n}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent n={5} />);0
    expect(shallowRenderer.getMountedInstance().someMethod()).toEqual(5);0
  });0
0
  it('can shallowly render components with contextTypes', () => {0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        name: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    const result = shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent />);0
    expect(result).toEqual(<div />);0
  });0
0
  it('passes expected params to legacy component lifecycle methods', () => {0
    const componentDidUpdateParams = [];0
    const componentWillReceivePropsParams = [];0
    const componentWillUpdateParams = [];0
    const setStateParams = [];0
    const shouldComponentUpdateParams = [];0
0
    const initialProp = {prop: 'init prop'};0
    const initialState = {state: 'init state'};0
    const initialContext = {context: 'init context'};0
    const updatedState = {state: 'updated state'};0
    const updatedProp = {prop: 'updated prop'};0
    const updatedContext = {context: 'updated context'};0
0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props, context) {0
        super(props, context);0
        this.state = initialState;0
      }0
      static contextTypes = {0
        context: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      componentDidUpdate(...args) {0
        componentDidUpdateParams.push(...args);0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(...args) {0
        componentWillReceivePropsParams.push(...args);0
        this.setState((...innerArgs) => {0
          setStateParams.push(...innerArgs);0
          return updatedState;0
        });0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate(...args) {0
        componentWillUpdateParams.push(...args);0
      }0
      shouldComponentUpdate(...args) {0
        shouldComponentUpdateParams.push(...args);0
        return true;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(0
      React.createElement(SimpleComponent, initialProp),0
      initialContext,0
    );0
    expect(componentDidUpdateParams).toEqual([]);0
    expect(componentWillReceivePropsParams).toEqual([]);0
    expect(componentWillUpdateParams).toEqual([]);0
    expect(setStateParams).toEqual([]);0
    expect(shouldComponentUpdateParams).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Lifecycle hooks should be invoked with the correct prev/next params on update.0
    shallowRenderer.render(0
      React.createElement(SimpleComponent, updatedProp),0
      updatedContext,0
    );0
    expect(componentWillReceivePropsParams).toEqual([0
      updatedProp,0
      updatedContext,0
    ]);0
    expect(setStateParams).toEqual([initialState, initialProp]);0
    expect(shouldComponentUpdateParams).toEqual([0
      updatedProp,0
      updatedState,0
      updatedContext,0
    ]);0
    expect(componentWillUpdateParams).toEqual([0
      updatedProp,0
      updatedState,0
      updatedContext,0
    ]);0
    expect(componentDidUpdateParams).toEqual([]);0
  });0
0
  it('passes expected params to new component lifecycle methods', () => {0
    const componentDidUpdateParams = [];0
    const getDerivedStateFromPropsParams = [];0
    const shouldComponentUpdateParams = [];0
0
    const initialProp = {prop: 'init prop'};0
    const initialState = {state: 'init state'};0
    const initialContext = {context: 'init context'};0
    const updatedProp = {prop: 'updated prop'};0
    const updatedContext = {context: 'updated context'};0
0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props, context) {0
        super(props, context);0
        this.state = initialState;0
      }0
      static contextTypes = {0
        context: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      componentDidUpdate(...args) {0
        componentDidUpdateParams.push(...args);0
      }0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps(...args) {0
        getDerivedStateFromPropsParams.push(args);0
        return null;0
      }0
      shouldComponentUpdate(...args) {0
        shouldComponentUpdateParams.push(...args);0
        return true;0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
0
    // The only lifecycle hook that should be invoked on initial render0
    // Is the static getDerivedStateFromProps() methods0
    shallowRenderer.render(0
      React.createElement(SimpleComponent, initialProp),0
      initialContext,0
    );0
    expect(getDerivedStateFromPropsParams).toEqual([0
      [initialProp, initialState],0
    ]);0
    expect(componentDidUpdateParams).toEqual([]);0
    expect(shouldComponentUpdateParams).toEqual([]);0
0
    // Lifecycle hooks should be invoked with the correct prev/next params on update.0
    shallowRenderer.render(0
      React.createElement(SimpleComponent, updatedProp),0
      updatedContext,0
    );0
    expect(getDerivedStateFromPropsParams).toEqual([0
      [initialProp, initialState],0
      [updatedProp, initialState],0
    ]);0
    expect(shouldComponentUpdateParams).toEqual([0
      updatedProp,0
      initialState,0
      updatedContext,0
    ]);0
    expect(componentDidUpdateParams).toEqual([]);0
  });0
0
  it('can shallowly render components with ref as function', () => {0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {clicked: false};0
0
      handleUserClick = () => {0
        this.setState({clicked: true});0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div0
            ref={() => {}}0
            onClick={this.handleUserClick}0
            className={this.state.clicked ? 'clicked' : ''}0
          />0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent />);0
    let result = shallowRenderer.getRenderOutput();0
    expect(result.type).toEqual('div');0
    expect(result.props.className).toEqual('');0
    result.props.onClick();0
0
    result = shallowRenderer.getRenderOutput();0
    expect(result.type).toEqual('div');0
    expect(result.props.className).toEqual('clicked');0
  });0
0
  it('can initialize state via static getDerivedStateFromProps', () => {0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        count: 1,0
      };0
0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps(props, prevState) {0
        return {0
          count: prevState.count + props.incrementBy,0
          other: 'foobar',0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return (0
          <div>{`count:${this.state.count}, other:${this.state.other}`}</div>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    const result = shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent incrementBy={2} />);0
    expect(result).toEqual(<div>count:3, other:foobar</div>);0
  });0
0
  it('can setState in componentWillMount when shallow rendering', () => {0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        this.setState({groovy: 'doovy'});0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.state.groovy}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    const result = shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent />);0
    expect(result).toEqual(<div>doovy</div>);0
  });0
0
  it('can setState in componentWillMount repeatedly when shallow rendering', () => {0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        separator: '-',0
      };0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        this.setState({groovy: 'doovy'});0
        this.setState({doovy: 'groovy'});0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        const {groovy, doovy, separator} = this.state;0
0
        return <div>{`${groovy}${separator}${doovy}`}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    const result = shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent />);0
    expect(result).toEqual(<div>doovy-groovy</div>);0
  });0
0
  it('can setState in componentWillMount with an updater function repeatedly when shallow rendering', () => {0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        separator: '-',0
      };0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        this.setState(state => ({groovy: 'doovy'}));0
        this.setState(state => ({doovy: state.groovy}));0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        const {groovy, doovy, separator} = this.state;0
0
        return <div>{`${groovy}${separator}${doovy}`}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    const result = shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent />);0
    expect(result).toEqual(<div>doovy-doovy</div>);0
  });0
0
  it('can setState in componentWillReceiveProps when shallow rendering', () => {0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {count: 0};0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(nextProps) {0
        if (nextProps.updateState) {0
          this.setState({count: 1});0
        }0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.state.count}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    let result = shallowRenderer.render(0
      <SimpleComponent updateState={false} />,0
    );0
    expect(result.props.children).toEqual(0);0
0
    result = shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent updateState={true} />);0
    expect(result.props.children).toEqual(1);0
  });0
0
  it('can update state with static getDerivedStateFromProps when shallow rendering', () => {0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {count: 1};0
0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps(nextProps, prevState) {0
        if (nextProps.updateState) {0
          return {count: nextProps.incrementBy + prevState.count};0
        }0
0
        return null;0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.state.count}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    let result = shallowRenderer.render(0
      <SimpleComponent updateState={false} incrementBy={0} />,0
    );0
    expect(result.props.children).toEqual(1);0
0
    result = shallowRenderer.render(0
      <SimpleComponent updateState={true} incrementBy={2} />,0
    );0
    expect(result.props.children).toEqual(3);0
0
    result = shallowRenderer.render(0
      <SimpleComponent updateState={false} incrementBy={2} />,0
    );0
    expect(result.props.children).toEqual(3);0
  });0
0
  it('should not override state with stale values if prevState is spread within getDerivedStateFromProps', () => {0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {value: 0};0
0
      static getDerivedStateFromProps(nextProps, prevState) {0
        return {...prevState};0
      }0
0
      updateState = () => {0
        this.setState(state => ({value: state.value + 1}));0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{`value:${this.state.value}`}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    let result = shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent />);0
    expect(result).toEqual(<div>value:0</div>);0
0
    let instance = shallowRenderer.getMountedInstance();0
    instance.updateState();0
    result = shallowRenderer.getRenderOutput();0
    expect(result).toEqual(<div>value:1</div>);0
  });0
0
  it('can setState with an updater function', () => {0
    let instance;0
0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        counter: 0,0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        instance = this;0
        return (0
          <button ref="button" onClick={this.onClick}>0
            {this.state.counter}0
          </button>0
        );0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    let result = shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent defaultCount={1} />);0
    expect(result.props.children).toEqual(0);0
0
    instance.setState((state, props) => {0
      return {counter: props.defaultCount + 1};0
    });0
0
    result = shallowRenderer.getRenderOutput();0
    expect(result.props.children).toEqual(2);0
  });0

  it('can access component instance from setState updater function', done => {0
    let instance;0
0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {};0
0
      render() {0
        instance = this;0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent />);0
0
    instance.setState(function updater(state, props) {0
      expect(this).toBe(instance);0
      done();0
    });0
  });0

  it('can setState with a callback', () => {0
    let instance;0
0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        counter: 0,0
      };0
      render() {0
        instance = this;0
        return <p>{this.state.counter}</p>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    const result = shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent />);0
    expect(result.props.children).toBe(0);0
0
    const callback = jest.fn(function() {0
      expect(this).toBe(instance);0
    });0
0
    instance.setState({counter: 1}, callback);0
0
    const updated = shallowRenderer.getRenderOutput();0
    expect(updated.props.children).toBe(1);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalled();0
  });0
0
  it('can replaceState with a callback', () => {0
    let instance;0
0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      state = {0
        counter: 0,0
      };0
      render() {0
        instance = this;0
        return <p>{this.state.counter}</p>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    const result = shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent />);0
    expect(result.props.children).toBe(0);0
0
    const callback = jest.fn(function() {0
      expect(this).toBe(instance);0
    });0
0
    // No longer a public API, but we can test that it works internally by0
    // reaching into the updater.0
    shallowRenderer._updater.enqueueReplaceState(0
      instance,0
      {counter: 1},0
      callback,0
    );0
0
    const updated = shallowRenderer.getRenderOutput();0
    expect(updated.props.children).toBe(1);0
    expect(callback).toHaveBeenCalled();0
  });0

    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0

  it('can pass context when shallowly rendering', () => {0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0

      };0

        return <div>{this.context.name}</div>;0

    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    const result = shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent />, {0
      name: 'foo',0
    });0
    expect(result).toEqual(<div>foo</div>);0

  it('should track context across updates', () => {0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
0
      state = {0
        bar: 'bar',0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{`${this.context.foo}:${this.state.bar}`}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    let result = shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent />, {0
      foo: 'foo',0
    });0
    expect(result).toEqual(<div>foo:bar</div>);0
0
    const instance = shallowRenderer.getMountedInstance();0
    instance.setState({bar: 'baz'});0
0
    result = shallowRenderer.getRenderOutput();0
    expect(result).toEqual(<div>foo:baz</div>);0
  });0
0
  it('should filter context by contextTypes', () => {0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        foo: PropTypes.string,0
      };0
      render() {0
        return <div>{`${this.context.foo}:${this.context.bar}`}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    let result = shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent />, {0
      foo: 'foo',0
      bar: 'bar',0
    });0
    expect(result).toEqual(<div>foo:undefined</div>);0
  });0

  it('can fail context when shallowly rendering', () => {0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      static contextTypes = {0
        name: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
      };0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.context.name}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    expect(() => shallowRenderer.render(<SimpleComponent />)).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed context type: The context `name` is marked as ' +0
        'required in `SimpleComponent`, but its value is `undefined`.\n' +0
        '    in SimpleComponent (at **)',0
    );0
  });0
0
  it('should warn about propTypes (but only once)', () => {0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return React.createElement('div', null, this.props.name);0
      }0
    }0
0
    SimpleComponent.propTypes = {0
      name: PropTypes.string.isRequired,0
    };0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    expect(() =>0
      shallowRenderer.render(React.createElement(SimpleComponent, {name: 123})),0
    ).toWarnDev(0
      'Warning: Failed prop type: Invalid prop `name` of type `number` ' +0
        'supplied to `SimpleComponent`, expected `string`.\n' +0
        '    in SimpleComponent',0
    );0
  });0

  it('should enable rendering of cloned element', () => {0
    class SimpleComponent extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
0
        this.state = {0
          bar: 'bar',0
        };0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{`${this.props.foo}:${this.state.bar}`}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    const el = <SimpleComponent foo="foo" />;0
    let result = shallowRenderer.render(el);0
    expect(result).toEqual(<div>foo:bar</div>);0
0
    const cloned = React.cloneElement(el, {foo: 'baz'});0
    result = shallowRenderer.render(cloned);0
    expect(result).toEqual(<div>baz:bar</div>);0
  });0
0
  it('this.state should be updated on setState callback inside componentWillMount', () => {0
    let stateSuccessfullyUpdated = false;0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props, context) {0
        super(props, context);0
        this.state = {0
          hasUpdatedState: false,0
        };0
      }0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        this.setState(0
          {hasUpdatedState: true},0
          () => (stateSuccessfullyUpdated = this.state.hasUpdatedState),0
        );0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.props.children}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(<Component />);0
    expect(stateSuccessfullyUpdated).toBe(true);0
  });0
0
  it('should handle multiple callbacks', () => {0
    const mockFn = jest.fn();0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props, context) {0
        super(props, context);0
        this.state = {0
          foo: 'foo',0
        };0
      }0
0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        this.setState({foo: 'bar'}, () => mockFn());0
        this.setState({foo: 'foobar'}, () => mockFn());0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.state.foo}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    shallowRenderer.render(<Component />);0
0
    expect(mockFn).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(2);0
0
    // Ensure the callback queue is cleared after the callbacks are invoked0
    const mountedInstance = shallowRenderer.getMountedInstance();0
    mountedInstance.setState({foo: 'bar'}, () => mockFn());0
    expect(mockFn).toHaveBeenCalledTimes(3);0
  });0
0
  it('should call the setState callback even if shouldComponentUpdate = false', done => {0
    const mockFn = jest.fn().mockReturnValue(false);0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props, context) {0
        super(props, context);0
        this.state = {0
          hasUpdatedState: false,0
        };0
      }0
0
      shouldComponentUpdate() {0
        return mockFn();0
      }0
0
      render() {0
        return <div>{this.state.hasUpdatedState}</div>;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(<Component />);0
0
    const mountedInstance = shallowRenderer.getMountedInstance();0
    mountedInstance.setState({hasUpdatedState: true}, () => {0
      expect(mockFn).toBeCalled();0
      expect(mountedInstance.state.hasUpdatedState).toBe(true);0
      done();0
    });0
  });0
0
  it('throws usefully when rendering badly-typed elements', () => {0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
0
    const renderAndVerifyWarningAndError = (Component, typeString) => {0
      expect(() => {0
        expect(() => shallowRenderer.render(<Component />)).toWarnDev(0
          'React.createElement: type is invalid -- expected a string ' +0
            '(for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite components) ' +0
            `but got: ${typeString}.`,0
        );0
      }).toThrowError(0
        'ReactShallowRenderer render(): Shallow rendering works only with custom ' +0
          `components, but the provided element type was \`${typeString}\`.`,0
      );0
    };0
0
    renderAndVerifyWarningAndError(undefined, 'undefined');0
    renderAndVerifyWarningAndError(null, 'null');0
    renderAndVerifyWarningAndError([], 'array');0
    renderAndVerifyWarningAndError({}, 'object');0
  });0
0
  it('should have initial state of null if not defined', () => {0
    class SomeComponent extends React.Component {0
      render() {0
        return <span />;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(<SomeComponent />);0
0
    expect(shallowRenderer.getMountedInstance().state).toBeNull();0
  });0
0
  it('should invoke both deprecated and new lifecycles if both are present', () => {0
    const log = [];0
0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      componentWillMount() {0
        log.push('componentWillMount');0
      }0
      componentWillReceiveProps() {0
        log.push('componentWillReceiveProps');0
      }0
      componentWillUpdate() {0
        log.push('componentWillUpdate');0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillMount() {0
        log.push('UNSAFE_componentWillMount');0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps() {0
        log.push('UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps');0
      }0
      UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate() {0
        log.push('UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate');0
      }0
      render() {0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(<Component foo="bar" />);0
    expect(log).toEqual(['componentWillMount', 'UNSAFE_componentWillMount']);0
0
    log.length = 0;0
0
    shallowRenderer.render(<Component foo="baz" />);0
    expect(log).toEqual([0
      'componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps',0
      'componentWillUpdate',0
      'UNSAFE_componentWillUpdate',0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  it('should stop the update when setState returns null or undefined', () => {0
    const log = [];0
    let instance;0
    class Component extends React.Component {0
      constructor(props) {0
        super(props);0
        this.state = {0
          count: 0,0
        };0
      }0
      render() {0
        log.push('render');0
        instance = this;0
        return null;0
      }0
    }0
    const shallowRenderer = createRenderer();0
    shallowRenderer.render(<Component />);0
    log.length = 0;0
    instance.setState(() => null);0
    instance.setState(() => undefined);0
    instance.setState(null);0
    instance.setState(undefined);0
    expect(log).toEqual([]);0
    instance.setState(state => ({count: state.count + 1}));0
    expect(log).toEqual(['render']);0
  });0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
