0
// We apply these settings to files that should run on Node.0
// They can't use JSX or ES6 modules, and must be in strict mode.0
// They can, however, use other ES6 features.0
0
module.exports = Object.assign({}, eslintrc, {0
  parser: 'espree',0
  parserOptions: {0
    ecmaVersion: 2017,0
    sourceType: 'script',0
    ecmaFeatures: {0
      experimentalObjectRestSpread: true,0
    },0
  },0
  rules: Object.assign({}, eslintrc.rules, {0
    'no-var': ERROR,0
    strict: ERROR,0
  }),0
});0

  parserOptions: {0
    ecmaVersion: 5,0
    sourceType: 'script',0

    strict: ERROR,0

'use strict';0
0
const eslintrc = require('../../.eslintrc');0
0
const ERROR = 2;0
0
// We apply these settings to the source files that get compiled.0
// They can use all features including JSX (but shouldn't use `var`).0
0
module.exports = Object.assign({}, eslintrc, {0
  rules: Object.assign({}, eslintrc.rules, {0
    'no-var': ERROR,0
  }),0
});0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const minimatch = require('minimatch');0
const CLIEngine = require('eslint').CLIEngine;0
const listChangedFiles = require('../shared/listChangedFiles');0
const {es5Paths, esNextPaths} = require('../shared/pathsByLanguageVersion');0
0
const allPaths = ['**/*.js'];0
0
let changedFiles = null;0
0
function runESLintOnFilesWithOptions(filePatterns, onlyChanged, options) {0
  const cli = new CLIEngine(options);0
  const formatter = cli.getFormatter();0
0
  if (onlyChanged && changedFiles === null) {0
    // Calculate lazily.0
    changedFiles = [...listChangedFiles()];0
  }0
  const finalFilePatterns = onlyChanged0
    ? intersect(changedFiles, filePatterns)0
    : filePatterns;0
  const report = cli.executeOnFiles(finalFilePatterns);0
0
  // When using `ignorePattern`, eslint will show `File ignored...` warnings for any ignores.0
  // We don't care because we *expect* some passed files will be ignores if `ignorePattern` is used.0
  const messages = report.results.filter(item => {0
    if (!onlyChanged) {0
      // Don't suppress the message on a full run.0
      // We only expect it to happen for "only changed" runs.0
      return true;0
    }0
    const ignoreMessage =0
      'File ignored because of a matching ignore pattern. Use "--no-ignore" to override.';0
    return !(item.messages[0] && item.messages[0].message === ignoreMessage);0
  });0
0
  const ignoredMessageCount = report.results.length - messages.length;0
  return {0
    output: formatter(messages),0
    errorCount: report.errorCount,0
    warningCount: report.warningCount - ignoredMessageCount,0
  };0
}0
0
function intersect(files, patterns) {0
  let intersection = [];0
  patterns.forEach(pattern => {0
    intersection = [0
      ...intersection,0
      ...minimatch.match(files, pattern, {matchBase: true}),0
    ];0
  });0
  return [...new Set(intersection)];0
}0
0
function runESLint({onlyChanged}) {0
  if (typeof onlyChanged !== 'boolean') {0
    throw new Error('Pass options.onlyChanged as a boolean.');0
  }0
  let errorCount = 0;0
  let warningCount = 0;0
  let output = '';0
  [0
    runESLintOnFilesWithOptions(allPaths, onlyChanged, {0
      configFile: `${__dirname}/eslintrc.default.js`,0
      ignorePattern: [...es5Paths, ...esNextPaths],0
    }),0
    runESLintOnFilesWithOptions(esNextPaths, onlyChanged, {0
      configFile: `${__dirname}/eslintrc.esnext.js`,0
    }),0
    runESLintOnFilesWithOptions(es5Paths, onlyChanged, {0
      configFile: `${__dirname}/eslintrc.es5.js`,0
    }),0
  ].forEach(result => {0
    errorCount += result.errorCount;0
    warningCount += result.warningCount;0
    output += result.output;0
  });0
  console.log(output);0
  return errorCount === 0 && warningCount === 0;0
}0
0
module.exports = runESLint;0
'use strict';0
0
module.exports = {0
  rules: {0
    'no-primitive-constructors': require('./no-primitive-constructors'),0
    'warning-and-invariant-args': require('./warning-and-invariant-args'),0
  },0
};0

'use strict';0
0
module.exports = function(context) {0
  function report(node, name, msg) {0
    context.report(node, `Do not use the ${name} constructor. ${msg}`);0
  }0
0
  function check(node) {0
    const name = node.callee.name;0
    switch (name) {0
      case 'Boolean':0
        report(0
          node,0
          name,0
          'To cast a value to a boolean, use double negation: !!value'0
        );0
        break;0
      case 'String':0
        report(0
          node,0
          name,0
          'To cast a value to a string, concat it with the empty string ' +0
            "(unless it's a symbol, which has different semantics): " +0
            "'' + value"0
        );0
        break;0
      case 'Number':0
        report(0
          node,0
          name,0
          'To cast a value to a number, use the plus operator: +value'0
        );0
        break;0
    }0
  }0
0
  return {0
    CallExpression: check,0
    NewExpression: check,0
  };0
};0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2015-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
/**0
 * The warning() and invariant() functions take format strings as their second0
 * argument.0
 */0
0
module.exports = function(context) {0
  // we also allow literal strings and concatenated literal strings0
  function getLiteralString(node) {0
    if (node.type === 'Literal' && typeof node.value === 'string') {0
      return node.value;0
    } else if (node.type === 'BinaryExpression' && node.operator === '+') {0
      const l = getLiteralString(node.left);0
      const r = getLiteralString(node.right);0
      if (l !== null && r !== null) {0
        return l + r;0
      }0
    }0
    return null;0
  }0
0
  return {0
    CallExpression: function(node) {0
      // This could be a little smarter by checking context.getScope() to see0
      // how warning/invariant was defined.0
      const isWarningOrInvariant =0
        node.callee.type === 'Identifier' &&0
        (node.callee.name === 'warning' || node.callee.name === 'invariant');0
      if (!isWarningOrInvariant) {0
        return;0
      }0
      if (node.arguments.length < 2) {0
        context.report(node, '{{name}} takes at least two arguments', {0
          name: node.callee.name,0
        });0
        return;0
      }0
      const format = getLiteralString(node.arguments[1]);0
      if (format === null) {0
        context.report(0
          node,0
          'The second argument to {{name}} must be a string literal',0
          {name: node.callee.name}0
        );0
        return;0
      }0
      if (format.length < 10 || /^[s\W]*$/.test(format)) {0
        context.report(0
          node,0
          'The {{name}} format should be able to uniquely identify this ' +0
            '{{name}}. Please, use a more descriptive format than: {{format}}',0
          {name: node.callee.name, format: format}0
        );0
        return;0
      }0
      // count the number of formatting substitutions, plus the first two args0
      const expectedNArgs = (format.match(/%s/g) || []).length + 2;0
      if (node.arguments.length !== expectedNArgs) {0
        context.report(0
          node,0
          'Expected {{expectedNArgs}} arguments in call to {{name}} based on ' +0
            'the number of "%s" substitutions, but got {{length}}',0
          {0
            expectedNArgs: expectedNArgs,0
            name: node.callee.name,0
            length: node.arguments.length,0
          }0
        );0
      }0
    },0
  };0
};0
0
module.exports.schema = [];0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2015-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @emails react-core0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const rule = require('../no-primitive-constructors');0
const RuleTester = require('eslint').RuleTester;0
const ruleTester = new RuleTester();0
0
ruleTester.run('eslint-rules/no-primitive-constructors', rule, {0
  valid: ['!!obj', "'' + obj", '+string'],0
  invalid: [0
    {0
      code: 'Boolean(obj)',0
      errors: [0
        {0
          message:0
            'Do not use the Boolean constructor. To cast a value to a boolean, use double negation: !!value',0
        },0
      ],0
    },0
    {0
      code: 'String(obj)',0
      errors: [0
        {0
          message:0
            'Do not use the String constructor. ' +0
            'To cast a value to a string, concat it with the empty string ' +0
            "(unless it's a symbol, which has different semantics): '' + value",0
        },0
      ],0
    },0
    {0
      code: 'Number(string)',0
      errors: [0
        {0
          message:0
            'Do not use the Number constructor. To cast a value to a number, use the plus operator: +value',0
        },0
      ],0
    },0
  ],0
});0

'use strict';0
0
const rule = require('../warning-and-invariant-args');0
const RuleTester = require('eslint').RuleTester;0
const ruleTester = new RuleTester();0
0
ruleTester.run('eslint-rules/warning-and-invariant-args', rule, {0
  valid: [0
    "warning(true, 'hello, world');",0
    "warning(true, 'expected %s, got %s', 42, 24);",0
    "invariant(true, 'hello, world');",0
    "invariant(true, 'expected %s, got %s', 42, 24);",0
  ],0
  invalid: [0
    {0
      code: "warning('hello, world');",0
      errors: [0
        {0
          message: 'warning takes at least two arguments',0
        },0
      ],0
    },0
    {0
      code: 'warning(true, null);',0
      errors: [0
        {0
          message: 'The second argument to warning must be a string literal',0
        },0
      ],0
    },0
    {0
      code: 'var g = 5; invariant(true, g);',0
      errors: [0
        {0
          message: 'The second argument to invariant must be a string literal',0
        },0
      ],0
    },0
    {0
      code: "warning(true, 'expected %s, got %s');",0
      errors: [0
        {0
          message:0
            'Expected 4 arguments in call to warning based on the number of ' +0
            '"%s" substitutions, but got 2',0
        },0
      ],0
    },0
    {0
      code: "warning(true, 'foo is a bar under foobar', 'junk argument');",0
      errors: [0
        {0
          message:0
            'Expected 2 arguments in call to warning based on the number of ' +0
            '"%s" substitutions, but got 3',0
        },0
      ],0
    },0
    {0
      code: "invariant(true, 'error!');",0
      errors: [0
        {0
          message:0
            'The invariant format should be able to uniquely identify this ' +0
            'invariant. Please, use a more descriptive format than: error!',0
        },0
      ],0
    },0
    {0
      code: "warning(true, 'error!');",0
      errors: [0
        {0
          message:0
            'The warning format should be able to uniquely identify this ' +0
            'warning. Please, use a more descriptive format than: error!',0
        },0
      ],0
    },0
    {0
      code: "warning(true, '%s %s, %s %s: %s (%s)', 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6);",0
      errors: [0
        {0
          message:0
            'The warning format should be able to uniquely identify this ' +0
            'warning. Please, use a more descriptive format than: ' +0
            '%s %s, %s %s: %s (%s)',0
        },0
      ],0
    },0
  ],0
});0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const fs = require('fs');0
const path = require('path');0
const execFileSync = require('child_process').execFileSync;0
0
let cwd = null;0
function exec(command, args) {0
  console.error('>', [command].concat(args));0
  const options = {};0
  if (cwd) {0
    options.cwd = cwd;0
  }0
  return execFileSync(command, args, options).toString();0
}0
0
const isCI = !!process.env.TRAVIS_REPO_SLUG;0
0
if (isCI) {0
  const branch = process.env.TRAVIS_BRANCH || process.env.CIRCLE_BRANCH;0
  const isPullRequest =0
    (!!process.env.TRAVIS_PULL_REQUEST &&0
      process.env.TRAVIS_PULL_REQUEST !== 'false') ||0
    !!process.env.CI_PULL_REQUEST;0
0
  if (branch !== 'master') {0
    console.error('facts-tracker: Branch is not master, exiting...');0
    process.exit(0);0
  }0
0
  if (isPullRequest) {0
    console.error('facts-tracker: This is a pull request, exiting...');0
    process.exit(0);0
  }0
0
  if (!process.env.GITHUB_USER) {0
    console.error(0
      'In order to use facts-tracker, you need to configure a ' +0
        'few environment variables in order to be able to commit to the ' +0
        'repository. Follow those steps to get you setup:\n' +0
        '\n' +0
        'Go to https://github.com/settings/tokens/new\n' +0
        ' - Fill "Token description" with "facts-tracker for ' +0
        process.env.TRAVIS_REPO_SLUG +0
        '"\n' +0
        ' - Check "public_repo"\n' +0
        ' - Press "Generate Token"\n' +0
        '\n' +0
        'In a different tab, go to https://travis-ci.org/' +0
        process.env.TRAVIS_REPO_SLUG +0
        '/settings\n' +0
        ' - Make sure "Build only if .travis.yml is present" is ON\n' +0
        ' - Fill "Name" with "GITHUB_USER" and "Value" with the name of the ' +0
        'account you generated the token with. Press "Add"\n' +0
        '\n' +0
        'Once this is done, commit anything to the repository to restart ' +0
        'Travis and it should work :)'0
    );0
    process.exit(1);0
  }0
0
  exec('git', [0
    'config',0
    '--global',0
    'user.name',0
    process.env.GITHUB_USER_NAME || 'facts-tracker',0
  ]);0
  exec('git', [0
    'config',0
    '--global',0
    'user.email',0
    process.env.GITHUB_USER_EMAIL || 'facts-tracker@no-reply.github.com',0
  ]);0
}0
0
if (process.argv.length <= 2) {0
  console.error('Usage: facts-tracker <name1> <value1> <name2> <value2>...');0
  process.exit(1);0
}0
0
function getRepoSlug() {0
  if (isCI) {0
    return process.env.TRAVIS_REPO_SLUG;0
  }0
0
  const remotes = exec('git', ['remote', '-v']).split('\n');0
  for (let i = 0; i < remotes.length; ++i) {0
    const match = remotes[i].match(/^origin\t[^:]+:([^\.]+).+\(fetch\)/);0
    if (match) {0
      return match[1];0
    }0
  }0
0
  console.error('Cannot find repository slug, sorry.');0
  process.exit(1);0
}0
0
const repoSlug = getRepoSlug();0
const currentCommitHash = exec('git', ['rev-parse', 'HEAD']).trim();0
const currentTimestamp = new Date()0
  .toISOString()0
  .replace('T', ' ')0
  .replace(/\..+/, '');0
0
function checkoutFactsFolder() {0
  const factsFolder = '../' + repoSlug.split('/')[1] + '-facts';0
  if (!fs.existsSync(factsFolder)) {0
    let repoURL;0
    if (isCI) {0
      repoURL =0
        'https://' +0
        process.env.GITHUB_USER +0
        '@github.com/' +0
        repoSlug +0
        '.git';0
    } else {0
      repoURL = 'git@github.com:' + repoSlug + '.git';0
    }0
0
    exec('git', [0
      'clone',0
      '--branch',0
      'facts',0
      '--depth=5',0
      repoURL,0
      factsFolder,0
    ]);0
  }0
0
  cwd = path.resolve(factsFolder);0
  exec('git', ['fetch']);0
  if (exec('git', ['status', '--porcelain'])) {0
    console.error('facts-tracker: `git status` is not clean, aborting.');0
    process.exit(1);0
  }0
  exec('git', ['rebase', 'origin/facts']);0
}0
checkoutFactsFolder();0
0
for (let i = 2; i < process.argv.length; i += 2) {0
  const name = process.argv[i].trim();0
  const value = process.argv[i + 1];0
  if (value.indexOf('\n') !== -1) {0
    console.error(0
      'facts-tracker: skipping',0
      name,0
      'as the value contains new lines:',0
      value0
    );0
    continue;0
  }0
0
  const filename = name + '.txt';0
  let lastLine;0
  try {0
    lastLine = exec('tail', ['-n', '1', filename]);0
  } catch (e) {0
    // ignore error0
  }0
  const lastValue =0
    lastLine && lastLine.replace(/^[^\t]+\t[^\t]+\t/, '').slice(0, -1); // commit hash \t timestamp \t // trailing \n0
0
  if (value !== lastValue) {0
    fs.appendFileSync(0
      path.resolve(cwd, filename),0
      currentCommitHash + '\t' + currentTimestamp + '\t' + value + '\n'0
    );0
  }0
0
  console.log(name);0
  console.log(lastValue);0
  console.log(value);0
}0
0
if (exec('git', ['status', '--porcelain'])) {0
  exec('git', ['add', '--all']);0
  exec('git', ['commit', '-m', 'Adding facts for ' + currentCommitHash]);0
  exec('git', ['push', 'origin', 'facts']);0
} else {0
  console.error('facts-tracker: nothing to update');0
}0
cwd = null;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2015-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const fs = require('fs');0
const mkdirp = require('mkdirp');0
const inlinedHostConfigs = require('../shared/inlinedHostConfigs');0
0
const configTemplate = fs0
  .readFileSync(__dirname + '/config/flowconfig')0
  .toString();0
0
function writeConfig(renderer) {0
  const folder = __dirname + '/' + renderer;0
  mkdirp.sync(folder);0
0
  const config = configTemplate.replace(0
    '%REACT_RENDERER_FLOW_OPTIONS%',0
    `0
module.name_mapper='react-reconciler/inline.${renderer}$$' -> 'react-reconciler/inline-typed'0
module.name_mapper='ReactFiberHostConfig$$' -> 'forks/ReactFiberHostConfig.${renderer}'0
    `.trim(),0
  );0
0
  const disclaimer = `0
# ---------------------------------------------------------------#0
# NOTE: this file is generated.                                  #0
# If you want to edit it, open ./scripts/flow/config/flowconfig. #0
# Then run Yarn for changes to take effect.                      #0
# ---------------------------------------------------------------#0
  `.trim();0
0
  const configFile = folder + '/.flowconfig';0
  let oldConfig;0
  try {0
    oldConfig = fs.readFileSync(configFile).toString();0
  } catch (err) {0
    oldConfig = null;0
  }0
  const newConfig = `0
${disclaimer}0
${config}0
${disclaimer}0
`.trim();0
0
  if (newConfig !== oldConfig) {0
    fs.writeFileSync(configFile, newConfig);0
    console.log(chalk.dim('Wrote a Flow config to ' + configFile));0
  }0
}0
0
// Write multiple configs in different folders0
// so that we can run those checks in parallel if we want.0
inlinedHostConfigs.forEach(rendererInfo => {0
  if (rendererInfo.isFlowTyped) {0
    writeConfig(rendererInfo.shortName);0
  }0
});0

'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const spawn = require('child_process').spawn;0
0
require('./createFlowConfigs');0
0
async function runFlow(renderer, args) {0
  return new Promise(resolve => {0
    console.log(0
      'Running Flow on the ' + chalk.yellow(renderer) + ' renderer...',0
    );0
    let cmd = __dirname + '/../../node_modules/.bin/flow';0
    if (process.platform === 'win32') {0
      cmd = cmd.replace(/\//g, '\\') + '.cmd';0
    }0
    spawn(cmd, args, {0
      // Allow colors to pass through:0
      stdio: 'inherit',0
      // Use a specific renderer config:0
      cwd: process.cwd() + '/scripts/flow/' + renderer + '/',0
    }).on('close', function(code) {0
      if (code !== 0) {0
        console.error(0
          'Flow failed for the ' + chalk.red(renderer) + ' renderer',0
        );0
        console.log();0
        process.exit(code);0
      } else {0
        console.log(0
          'Flow passed for the ' + chalk.green(renderer) + ' renderer',0
        );0
        resolve();0
      }0
    });0
  });0
}0
0
module.exports = runFlow;0
'use strict';0
0
module.exports = {0
  haste: {0
    hasteImplModulePath: require.resolve('./noHaste.js'),0
  },0
  modulePathIgnorePatterns: [0
    '<rootDir>/scripts/rollup/shims/',0
    '<rootDir>/scripts/bench/',0
  ],0
  transform: {0
    '.*': require.resolve('./preprocessor.js'),0
  },0
  setupFiles: [require.resolve('./setupEnvironment.js')],0
  setupTestFrameworkScriptFile: require.resolve('./setupTests.js'),0
  // Only include files directly in __tests__, not in nested folders.0
  testRegex: '/__tests__/[^/]*(\\.js|\\.coffee|[^d]\\.ts)$',0
  moduleFileExtensions: ['js', 'json', 'node', 'coffee', 'ts'],0
  rootDir: process.cwd(),0
  roots: ['<rootDir>/packages', '<rootDir>/scripts'],0
  collectCoverageFrom: ['packages/**/*.js'],0
  timers: 'fake',0
};0
'use strict';0
0
const {readdirSync, statSync} = require('fs');0
const {join} = require('path');0
const baseConfig = require('./config.base');0
0
// Find all folders in packages/* with package.json0
const packagesRoot = join(__dirname, '..', '..', 'packages');0
const packages = readdirSync(packagesRoot).filter(dir => {0
  if (dir.charAt(0) === '.') {0
    return false;0
  }0
  const packagePath = join(packagesRoot, dir, 'package.json');0
  return statSync(packagePath).isFile();0
});0
// Create a module map to point React packages to the build output0
const moduleNameMapper = {};0
packages.forEach(name => {0
  // Root entry point0
  moduleNameMapper[`^${name}$`] = `<rootDir>/build/node_modules/${name}`;0
  // Named entry points0
  moduleNameMapper[0
    `^${name}/(.*)$`0
  ] = `<rootDir>/build/node_modules/${name}/$1`;0
});0
0
module.exports = Object.assign({}, baseConfig, {0
  // Redirect imports to the compiled bundles0
  moduleNameMapper,0
  // Don't run bundle tests on blacklisted -test.internal.* files0
  testPathIgnorePatterns: ['/node_modules/', '-test.internal.js$'],0
  // Exclude the build output from transforms0
  transformIgnorePatterns: ['/node_modules/', '<rootDir>/build/'],0
});0
'use strict';0
0
const baseConfig = require('./config.base');0
0
module.exports = Object.assign({}, baseConfig, {0
  setupFiles: [0
    ...baseConfig.setupFiles,0
    require.resolve('./setupHostConfigs.js'),0
  ],0
});0
'use strict';0
0
throw new Error("Don't run `jest` directly. Run `yarn test` instead.");0
'use strict';0
0
module.exports = {0
  getHasteName() {0
    // We never want Haste.0
    return null;0
  },0
};0
'use strict';0
0
const path = require('path');0
0
const babel = require('babel-core');0
const coffee = require('coffee-script');0
0
const tsPreprocessor = require('./typescript/preprocessor');0
const createCacheKeyFunction = require('fbjs-scripts/jest/createCacheKeyFunction');0
0
// Use require.resolve to be resilient to file moves, npm updates, etc0
const pathToBabel = path.join(0
  require.resolve('babel-core'),0
  '..',0
  'package.json'0
);0
const pathToBabelPluginDevWithCode = require.resolve(0
  '../error-codes/replace-invariant-error-codes'0
);0
const pathToBabelPluginWrapWarning = require.resolve(0
  '../babel/wrap-warning-with-env-check'0
);0
const pathToBabelPluginAsyncToGenerator = require.resolve(0
  'babel-plugin-transform-async-to-generator'0
);0
const pathToBabelrc = path.join(__dirname, '..', '..', '.babelrc');0
const pathToErrorCodes = require.resolve('../error-codes/codes.json');0
0
const babelOptions = {0
  plugins: [0
    // For Node environment only. For builds, Rollup takes care of ESM.0
    require.resolve('babel-plugin-transform-es2015-modules-commonjs'),0
0
    pathToBabelPluginDevWithCode,0
    pathToBabelPluginWrapWarning,0
0
    // Keep stacks detailed in tests.0
    // Don't put this in .babelrc so that we don't embed filenames0
    // into ReactART builds that include JSX.0
    // TODO: I have not verified that this actually works.0
    require.resolve('babel-plugin-transform-react-jsx-source'),0
0
    require.resolve('../babel/transform-prevent-infinite-loops'),0
  ],0
  retainLines: true,0
};0
0
module.exports = {0
  process: function(src, filePath) {0
    if (filePath.match(/\.coffee$/)) {0
      return coffee.compile(src, {bare: true});0
    }0
    if (filePath.match(/\.ts$/) && !filePath.match(/\.d\.ts$/)) {0
      return tsPreprocessor.compile(src, filePath);0
    }0
    if (!filePath.match(/\/third_party\//)) {0
      // for test files, we also apply the async-await transform, but we want to0
      // make sure we don't accidentally apply that transform to product code.0
      const isTestFile = !!filePath.match(/\/__tests__\//);0
      return babel.transform(0
        src,0
        Object.assign(0
          {filename: path.relative(process.cwd(), filePath)},0
          babelOptions,0
          isTestFile0
            ? {0
                plugins: [pathToBabelPluginAsyncToGenerator].concat(0
                  babelOptions.plugins0
                ),0
              }0
            : {}0
        )0
      ).code;0
    }0
    return src;0
  },0
0
  getCacheKey: createCacheKeyFunction([0
    __filename,0
    pathToBabel,0
    pathToBabelrc,0
    pathToBabelPluginDevWithCode,0
    pathToBabelPluginWrapWarning,0
    pathToErrorCodes,0
  ]),0
};0
/* eslint-disable */0
0
const NODE_ENV = process.env.NODE_ENV;0
if (NODE_ENV !== 'development' && NODE_ENV !== 'production') {0
  throw new Error('NODE_ENV must either be set to development or production.');0
}0
global.__DEV__ = NODE_ENV === 'development';0
global.__PROFILE__ = NODE_ENV === 'development';0
0
global.requestAnimationFrame = function(callback) {0
  setTimeout(callback);0
};0
0
global.requestIdleCallback = function(callback) {0
  return setTimeout(() => {0
    callback({0
      timeRemaining() {0
        return Infinity;0
      },0
    });0
  });0
};0
0
global.cancelIdleCallback = function(callbackID) {0
  clearTimeout(callbackID);0
};0
0
// By default React console.error()'s any errors, caught or uncaught.0
// However it is annoying to assert that a warning fired each time0
// we assert that there is an exception in our tests. This lets us0
// opt out of extra console error reporting for most tests except0
// for the few that specifically test the logging by shadowing this0
// property. In real apps, it would usually not be defined at all.0
Error.prototype.suppressReactErrorLogging = true;0
0
if (typeof window !== 'undefined') {0
  // Same as above.0
  DOMException.prototype.suppressReactErrorLogging = true;0
0
  // Also prevent JSDOM from logging intentionally thrown errors.0
  // TODO: it might make sense to do it the other way around.0
  // https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/11098#issuecomment-3550325390
  window.addEventListener('error', event => {0
    if (event.error != null && event.error.suppressReactErrorLogging) {0
      event.preventDefault();0
    }0
  });0
}0
'use strict';0
0
const inlinedHostConfigs = require('../shared/inlinedHostConfigs');0
0
// When testing the custom renderer code path through `react-reconciler`,0
// turn the export into a function, and use the argument as host config.0
const shimHostConfigPath = 'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiberHostConfig';0
jest.mock('react-reconciler', () => {0
  return config => {0
    jest.mock(shimHostConfigPath, () => config);0
    return require.requireActual('react-reconciler');0
  };0
});0
jest.mock('react-reconciler/persistent', () => {0
  return config => {0
    jest.mock(shimHostConfigPath, () => config);0
    return require.requireActual('react-reconciler/persistent');0
  };0
});0
0
// But for inlined host configs (such as React DOM, Native, etc), we0
// mock their named entry points to establish a host config mapping.0
inlinedHostConfigs.forEach(rendererInfo => {0
  if (rendererInfo.shortName === 'custom') {0
    // There is no inline entry point for the custom renderers.0
    // Instead, it's handled by the generic `react-reconciler` entry point above.0
    return;0
  }0
  jest.mock(`react-reconciler/inline.${rendererInfo.shortName}`, () => {0
    let hasImportedShimmedConfig = false;0
0
    // We want the reconciler to pick up the host config for this renderer.0
    jest.mock(shimHostConfigPath, () => {0
      hasImportedShimmedConfig = true;0
      return require.requireActual(0
        `react-reconciler/src/forks/ReactFiberHostConfig.${0
          rendererInfo.shortName0
        }.js`0
      );0
    });0
0
    const renderer = require.requireActual('react-reconciler');0
    // If the shimmed config factory function above has not run,0
    // it means this test file loads more than one renderer0
    // but doesn't reset modules between them. This won't work.0
    if (!hasImportedShimmedConfig) {0
      throw new Error(0
        `Could not import the "${rendererInfo.shortName}" renderer ` +0
          `in this suite because another renderer has already been ` +0
          `loaded earlier. Call jest.resetModules() before importing any ` +0
          `of the following entry points:\n\n` +0
          rendererInfo.entryPoints.map(entry => `  * ${entry}`)0
      );0
    }0
0
    return renderer;0
  });0
});0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
0
if (process.env.REACT_CLASS_EQUIVALENCE_TEST) {0
  // Inside the class equivalence tester, we have a custom environment, let's0
  // require that instead.0
  require('./spec-equivalence-reporter/setupTests.js');0
} else {0
  const env = jasmine.getEnv();0
  const errorMap = require('../error-codes/codes.json');0
0
  // TODO: Stop using spyOn in all the test since that seem deprecated.0
  // This is a legacy upgrade path strategy from:0
  // https://github.com/facebook/jest/blob/v20.0.4/packages/jest-matchers/src/spyMatchers.js#L1600
  const isSpy = spy => spy.calls && typeof spy.calls.count === 'function';0
0
  const spyOn = global.spyOn;0
  const noop = function() {};0
0
  // Spying on console methods in production builds can mask errors.0
  // This is why we added an explicit spyOnDev() helper.0
  // It's too easy to accidentally use the more familiar spyOn() helper though,0
  // So we disable it entirely.0
  // Spying on both dev and prod will require using both spyOnDev() and spyOnProd().0
  global.spyOn = function() {0
    throw new Error(0
      'Do not use spyOn(). ' +0
        'It can accidentally hide unexpected errors in production builds. ' +0
        'Use spyOnDev(), spyOnProd(), or spyOnDevAndProd() instead.'0
    );0
  };0
0
  if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production') {0
    global.spyOnDev = noop;0
    global.spyOnProd = spyOn;0
    global.spyOnDevAndProd = spyOn;0
  } else {0
    global.spyOnDev = spyOn;0
    global.spyOnProd = noop;0
    global.spyOnDevAndProd = spyOn;0
  }0
0
  expect.extend({0
    ...require('./matchers/toWarnDev'),0
  });0
0
  // We have a Babel transform that inserts guards against infinite loops.0
  // If a loop runs for too many iterations, we throw an error and set this0
  // global variable. The global lets us detect an infinite loop even if0
  // the actual error object ends up being caught and ignored. An infinite0
  // loop must always fail the test!0
  env.beforeEach(() => {0
    global.infiniteLoopError = null;0
  });0
  env.afterEach(() => {0
    const error = global.infiniteLoopError;0
    global.infiniteLoopError = null;0
    if (error) {0
      throw error;0
    }0
  });0
0
  ['error', 'warn'].forEach(methodName => {0
    const unexpectedConsoleCallStacks = [];0
    const newMethod = function(message) {0
      // Capture the call stack now so we can warn about it later.0
      // The call stack has helpful information for the test author.0
      // Don't throw yet though b'c it might be accidentally caught and suppressed.0
      const stack = new Error().stack;0
      unexpectedConsoleCallStacks.push([0
        stack.substr(stack.indexOf('\n') + 1),0
        message,0
      ]);0
    };0
0
    console[methodName] = newMethod;0
0
    env.beforeEach(() => {0
      unexpectedConsoleCallStacks.length = 0;0
    });0
0
    env.afterEach(() => {0
      if (console[methodName] !== newMethod && !isSpy(console[methodName])) {0
        throw new Error(0
          `Test did not tear down console.${methodName} mock properly.`0
        );0
      }0
0
      if (unexpectedConsoleCallStacks.length > 0) {0
        const messages = unexpectedConsoleCallStacks.map(0
          ([stack, message]) =>0
            `${chalk.red(message)}\n` +0
            `${stack0
              .split('\n')0
              .map(line => chalk.gray(line))0
              .join('\n')}`0
        );0
0
        const message =0
          `Expected test not to call ${chalk.bold(0
            `console.${methodName}()`0
          )}.\n\n` +0
          'If the warning is expected, test for it explicitly by:\n' +0
          `1. Using the ${chalk.bold('.toWarnDev()')} / ${chalk.bold(0
            '.toLowPriorityWarnDev()'0
          )} matchers, or...\n` +0
          `2. Mock it out using ${chalk.bold(0
            'spyOnDev'0
          )}(console, '${methodName}') or ${chalk.bold(0
            'spyOnProd'0
          )}(console, '${methodName}'), and test that the warning occurs.`;0
0
        throw new Error(`${message}\n\n${messages.join('\n\n')}`);0
      }0
    });0
  });0
0
  if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production') {0
    // In production, we strip error messages and turn them into codes.0
    // This decodes them back so that the test assertions on them work.0
    const decodeErrorMessage = function(message) {0
      if (!message) {0
        return message;0
      }0
      const re = /error-decoder.html\?invariant=(\d+)([^\s]*)/;0
      const matches = message.match(re);0
      if (!matches || matches.length !== 3) {0
        return message;0
      }0
      const code = parseInt(matches[1], 10);0
      const args = matches[2]0
        .split('&')0
        .filter(s => s.startsWith('args[]='))0
        .map(s => s.substr('args[]='.length))0
        .map(decodeURIComponent);0
      const format = errorMap[code];0
      let argIndex = 0;0
      return format.replace(/%s/g, () => args[argIndex++]);0
    };0
    const OriginalError = global.Error;0
    const ErrorProxy = new Proxy(OriginalError, {0
      apply(target, thisArg, argumentsList) {0
        const error = Reflect.apply(target, thisArg, argumentsList);0
        error.message = decodeErrorMessage(error.message);0
        return error;0
      },0
      construct(target, argumentsList, newTarget) {0
        const error = Reflect.construct(target, argumentsList, newTarget);0
        error.message = decodeErrorMessage(error.message);0
        return error;0
      },0
    });0
    ErrorProxy.OriginalError = OriginalError;0
    global.Error = ErrorProxy;0
  }0
0
  require('jasmine-check').install();0
}0
'use strict';0
0
const jestDiff = require('jest-diff');0
0
function normalizeCodeLocInfo(str) {0
  return str && str.replace(/at .+?:\d+/g, 'at **');0
}0
0
const createMatcherFor = consoleMethod =>0
  function matcher(callback, expectedMessages) {0
    if (__DEV__) {0
      // Warn about incorrect usage of matcher.0
      if (typeof expectedMessages === 'string') {0
        expectedMessages = [expectedMessages];0
      } else if (!Array.isArray(expectedMessages)) {0
        throw Error(0
          `toWarnDev() requires a parameter of type string or an array of strings ` +0
            `but was given ${typeof expectedMessages}.`0
        );0
      }0
0
      const unexpectedWarnings = [];0
0
      // Catch errors thrown by the callback,0
      // But only rethrow them if all test expectations have been satisfied.0
      // Otherwise an Error in the callback can mask a failed expectation,0
      // and result in a test that passes when it shouldn't.0
      let caughtError;0
0
      const consoleSpy = message => {0
        const normalizedMessage = normalizeCodeLocInfo(message);0
0
        for (let index = 0; index < expectedMessages.length; index++) {0
          const expectedMessage = expectedMessages[index];0
          if (0
            normalizedMessage === expectedMessage ||0
            normalizedMessage.includes(expectedMessage)0
          ) {0
            expectedMessages.splice(index, 1);0
            return;0
          }0
        }0
0
        let errorMessage;0
        if (expectedMessages.length === 0) {0
          errorMessage =0
            'Unexpected warning recorded: ' +0
            this.utils.printReceived(normalizedMessage);0
        } else if (expectedMessages.length === 1) {0
          errorMessage =0
            'Unexpected warning recorded: ' +0
            jestDiff(expectedMessages[0], normalizedMessage);0
        } else {0
          errorMessage =0
            'Unexpected warning recorded: ' +0
            jestDiff(expectedMessages, [normalizedMessage]);0
        }0
0
        // Record the call stack for unexpected warnings.0
        // We don't throw an Error here though,0
        // Because it might be suppressed by ReactFiberScheduler.0
        unexpectedWarnings.push(new Error(errorMessage));0
      };0
0
      // TODO Decide whether we need to support nested toWarn* expectations.0
      // If we don't need id, add a check here to see if this is already our spy,0
      // And throw an error.0
      const originalMethod = console[consoleMethod];0
0
      // Avoid using Jest's built-in spy since it can't be removed.0
      console[consoleMethod] = consoleSpy;0
0
      try {0
        callback();0
      } catch (error) {0
        caughtError = error;0
      } finally {0
        // Restore the unspied method so that unexpected errors fail tests.0
        console[consoleMethod] = originalMethod;0
0
        // Any unexpected Errors thrown by the callback should fail the test.0
        // This should take precedence since unexpected errors could block warnings.0
        if (caughtError) {0
          throw caughtError;0
        }0
0
        // Any unexpected warnings should be treated as a failure.0
        if (unexpectedWarnings.length > 0) {0
          return {0
            message: () => unexpectedWarnings[0].stack,0
            pass: false,0
          };0
        }0
0
        // Any remaining messages indicate a failed expectations.0
        if (expectedMessages.length > 0) {0
          return {0
            message: () =>0
              `Expected warning was not recorded:\n  ${this.utils.printReceived(0
                expectedMessages[0]0
              )}`,0
            pass: false,0
          };0
        }0
0
        return {pass: true};0
      }0
    } else {0
      // Any uncaught errors or warnings should fail tests in production mode.0
      callback();0
0
      return {pass: true};0
    }0
  };0
0
module.exports = {0
  toLowPriorityWarnDev: createMatcherFor('warn'),0
  toWarnDev: createMatcherFor('error'),0
};0

 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
const expect = global.expect;0
0
let numExpectations = 0;0
0
global.expect = function() {0
  numExpectations += 1;0
  return expect.apply(this, arguments);0
};0
0
const spyOn = global.spyOn;0
0
// Spying on console methods in production builds can mask errors.0
// This is why we added an explicit spyOnDev() helper.0
// It's too easy to accidentally use the more familiar spyOn() helper though,0
// So we disable it entirely.0
// Spying on both dev and prod will require using both spyOnDev() and spyOnProd().0
global.spyOn = function() {0
  throw new Error(0
    'Do not use spyOn(). ' +0
      'It can accidentally hide unexpected errors in production builds. ' +0
      'Use spyOnDev(), spyOnProd(), or spyOnDevAndProd() instead.'0
  );0
};0
0
global.spyOnDev = function(...args) {0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    return spyOn(...args);0
  }0
};0
0
global.spyOnDevAndProd = spyOn;0
0
global.spyOnProd = function(...args) {0
  if (!__DEV__) {0
    return spyOn(...args);0
  }0
};0
0
expect.extend({0
  ...require('../matchers/toWarnDev'),0
});0
0
beforeEach(() => (numExpectations = 0));0
0
jasmine.currentEnv_.addReporter({0
  specDone: spec => {0
    console.log(0
      `EQUIVALENCE: ${spec.description}, ` +0
        `status: ${spec.status}, ` +0
        `numExpectations: ${numExpectations}`0
    );0
  },0
});0
'use strict';0
0
const fs = require('fs');0
const path = require('path');0
const ts = require('typescript');0
0
const tsOptions = {0
  module: ts.ModuleKind.CommonJS,0
  jsx: ts.JsxEmit.React,0
};0
0
function formatErrorMessage(error) {0
  return (0
    error.file.filename +0
    '(' +0
    error.file.getLineAndCharacterOfPosition(error.start).line +0
    '): ' +0
    error.messageText0
  );0
}0
0
function compile(content, contentFilename) {0
  let output = null;0
  const compilerHost = {0
    getSourceFile(filename, languageVersion) {0
      let source;0
      const jestRegex = /jest\.d\.ts/;0
      const reactRegex = /(?:React|ReactDOM|PropTypes)(?:\.d)?\.ts$/;0
0
      // `path.normalize` is used to turn forward slashes in0
      // the file path into backslashes on Windows.0
      filename = path.normalize(filename);0
      if (filename === 'lib.d.ts') {0
        source = fs0
          .readFileSync(require.resolve('typescript/lib/lib.d.ts'))0
          .toString();0
      } else if (filename.match(jestRegex)) {0
        source = fs.readFileSync(path.join(__dirname, 'jest.d.ts')).toString();0
      } else if (filename === contentFilename) {0
        source = content;0
      } else if (reactRegex.test(filename)) {0
        // TypeScript will look for the .d.ts files in each ancestor directory,0
        // so there may not be a file at the referenced path as it climbs the0
        // hierarchy.0
        try {0
          source = fs.readFileSync(filename).toString();0
        } catch (e) {0
          if (e.code === 'ENOENT') {0
            return undefined;0
          }0
          throw e;0
        }0
      } else {0
        throw new Error('Unexpected filename ' + filename);0
      }0
      return ts.createSourceFile(filename, source, 'ES5', '0');0
    },0
    writeFile(name, text, writeByteOrderMark) {0
      if (output === null) {0
        output = text;0
      } else {0
        throw new Error('Expected only one dependency.');0
      }0
    },0
    getCanonicalFileName(filename) {0
      return filename;0
    },0
    getCurrentDirectory() {0
      return '';0
    },0
    getNewLine() {0
      return '\n';0
    },0
    fileExists(filename) {0
      return ts.sys.fileExists(filename);0
    },0
    useCaseSensitiveFileNames() {0
      return ts.sys.useCaseSensitiveFileNames;0
    },0
  };0
  const program = ts.createProgram(0
    ['lib.d.ts', 'jest.d.ts', contentFilename],0
    tsOptions,0
    compilerHost0
  );0
  const emitResult = program.emit();0
  const errors = ts0
    .getPreEmitDiagnostics(program)0
    .concat(emitResult.diagnostics);0
  if (errors.length) {0
    throw new Error(errors.map(formatErrorMessage).join('\n'));0
  }0
  return output;0
}0
0
module.exports = {0
  compile: compile,0
};0
'use strict';0
0
module.exports = require('bindings')('perfcounters');0

 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0
#ifndef incl_HPHP_UTIL_HARDWARE_COUNTER_H_0
#define incl_HPHP_UTIL_HARDWARE_COUNTER_H_0
0
#include "thread-local.h"0
0
#include <cstdint>0
#include <memory>0
#include <vector>0
0
namespace HPHP {0
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
0
#ifndef NO_HARDWARE_COUNTERS0
0
class InstructionCounter;0
class LoadCounter;0
class StoreCounter;0
0
struct PerfTable {0
  const char* name;0
  uint32_t type;0
  uint64_t config;0
};0
0
class HardwareCounterImpl;0
0
class HardwareCounter {0
public:0
  HardwareCounter();0
  ~HardwareCounter();0
0
  static void Reset();0
  static int64_t GetInstructionCount();0
  static int64_t GetLoadCount();0
  static int64_t GetStoreCount();0
  static bool SetPerfEvents(std::string events);0
  static void IncInstructionCount(int64_t amount);0
  static void IncLoadCount(int64_t amount);0
  static void IncStoreCount(int64_t amount);0
0
  typedef void (*PerfEventCallback)(const std::string&, int64_t, void*);0
  static void GetPerfEvents(PerfEventCallback f, void* data);0
  static void ClearPerfEvents();0
  static void Init(bool enable, const std::string& events, bool subProc);0
  static DECLARE_THREAD_LOCAL_NO_CHECK(HardwareCounter, s_counter);0
  bool m_countersSet{false};0
private:0
  void reset();0
  int64_t getInstructionCount();0
  int64_t getLoadCount();0
  int64_t getStoreCount();0
  bool eventExists(const char* event);0
  bool addPerfEvent(const char* event);0
  bool setPerfEvents(std::string events);0
  void getPerfEvents(PerfEventCallback f, void* data);0
  void clearPerfEvents();0
0
  std::unique_ptr<InstructionCounter> m_instructionCounter;0
  std::unique_ptr<LoadCounter> m_loadCounter;0
  std::unique_ptr<StoreCounter> m_storeCounter;0
  std::vector<std::unique_ptr<HardwareCounterImpl>> m_counters;0
};0
0
#else // NO_HARDWARE_COUNTERS0
0
/* Stub implementation for platforms without hardware counters (non-linux)0
 * This mock class pretends to track performance events, but just returns0
 * static values, so it doesn't even need to worry about thread safety0
 * for the one static instance of itself.0
 */0
class HardwareCounter {0
public:0
  HardwareCounter() : m_countersSet(false) { }0
  ~HardwareCounter() { }0
0
  static void Reset() { }0
  static int64_t GetInstructionCount() { return 0; }0
  static int64_t GetLoadCount() { return 0; }0
  static int64_t GetStoreCount() { return 0; }0
  static bool SetPerfEvents(folly::StringPiece events) { return false; }0
  static void IncInstructionCount(int64_t amount) {}0
  static void IncLoadCount(int64_t amount) {}0
  static void IncStoreCount(int64_t amount) {}0
  typedef void (*PerfEventCallback)(const std::string&, int64_t, void*);0
  static void GetPerfEvents(PerfEventCallback f, void* data) { }0
  static void ClearPerfEvents() { }0
  static void Init(bool enable, const std::string& events, bool subProc) {}0
0
  // Normally exposed by DECLARE_THREAD_LOCAL_NO_CHECK0
  void getCheck() { }0
  void destroy() { }0
  static HardwareCounter s_counter;0
  bool m_countersSet;0
};0
0
#endif // NO_HARDWARE_COUNTERS0
0

}0
0
#endif0

#ifndef incl_HPHP_PORTABILITY_H_0
#define incl_HPHP_PORTABILITY_H_0
0
// From folly/Likely.h0
#if defined(__GNUC__) && __GNUC__ >= 40
#define LIKELY(x)   (__builtin_expect((x), 1))0
#define UNLIKELY(x) (__builtin_expect((x), 0))0
#else0
#define LIKELY(x)   (x)0
#define UNLIKELY(x) (x)0
#endif0
0
//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
0
/*0
 * Various macros to make certain things conditional on either0
 * compiler or architecture.0
 *0
 * Currently we don't *really* compile on anything other than gcc or0
 * sometimes clang, and there are some parts of the code using0
 * __attribute__ stuff directly, but some things go through these0
 * macros to make it maybe easier to change later.0
 */0
0
//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
0
// TODO: does clang define __GNUC__ ?0
#ifndef __GNUC__0
# define __attribute__(x)0
#endif0
0
//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
0
#ifdef ATTRIBUTE_UNUSED0
# undef ATTRIBUTE_UNUSED0
#endif0
#ifdef ATTRIBUTE_NORETURN0
# undef ATTRIBUTE_NORETURN0
#endif0
#ifdef ATTRIBUTE_PRINTF0
# undef ATTRIBUTE_PRINTF0
#endif0
#ifdef ATTRIBUTE_PRINTF_STRING0
# undef ATTRIBUTE_PRINTF_STRING0
#endif0
0
#define ATTRIBUTE_PRINTF_STRING FOLLY_PRINTF_FORMAT0
0
#ifdef _MSC_VER0
#define ATTRIBUTE_NORETURN __declspec(noreturn)0
#define ATTRIBUTE_PRINTF(a1, a2)0
#ifndef __thread0
# define __thread __declspec(thread)0
#endif0
#define ATTRIBUTE_UNUSED0
0
#define ALWAYS_INLINE __forceinline0
#define EXTERNALLY_VISIBLE0
#define FLATTEN0
#define NEVER_INLINE __declspec(noinline)0
#define UNUSED0
#else0
#define ATTRIBUTE_NORETURN __attribute__((__noreturn__))0
#define ATTRIBUTE_PRINTF(a1, a2) \0
  __attribute__((__format__ (__printf__, a1, a2)))0
#define ATTRIBUTE_UNUSED   __attribute__((__unused__))0
0
#define ALWAYS_INLINE      inline __attribute__((__always_inline__))0
#define EXTERNALLY_VISIBLE __attribute__((__externally_visible__))0
#define FLATTEN            __attribute__((__flatten__))0
#define NEVER_INLINE       __attribute__((__noinline__))0
#define UNUSED             __attribute__((__unused__))0
#endif0
0
#ifdef DEBUG0
# define DEBUG_ONLY /* nop */0
#else0
# define DEBUG_ONLY UNUSED0
#endif0
0
/*0
 * We need to keep some unreferenced functions from being removed by0
 * the linker. There is no compile time mechanism for doing this, but0
 * by putting them in the same section as some other, referenced function0
 * in the same file, we can keep them around.0
 *0
 * So this macro should be used to mark at least one function that is0
 * referenced, and other functions that are not referenced in the same0
 * file.0
 *0
 * Note: this may not work properly with LTO. We'll revisit when/if we0
 * move to it.0
 */0
#ifndef __APPLE__0
# define KEEP_SECTION \0
    __attribute__((__section__(".text.keep")))0
#else0
# define KEEP_SECTION \0
    __attribute__((__section__(".text,.text.keep")))0
#endif0
0
#if defined(__APPLE__)0
// OS X has a macro "isset" defined in this header. Force the include so we can0
// make sure the macro gets undef'd. (I think this also applies to BSD, but we0
// can cross that road when we come to it.)0
# include <sys/param.h>0
# ifdef isset0
#  undef isset0
# endif0
#endif0
0
//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
0
#if defined(__x86_64__)0
0
# if defined(__clang__)0
#  define DECLARE_FRAME_POINTER(fp)               \0
    ActRec* fp;                                   \0
    asm volatile("mov %%rbp, %0" : "=r" (fp) ::)0
# else0
#  define DECLARE_FRAME_POINTER(fp) register ActRec* fp asm("rbp");0
# endif0
0
#elif defined(_M_X64)0
0
// TODO: FIXME! Without this implemented properly, the JIT0
// will fail "pretty spectacularly".0
# define DECLARE_FRAME_POINTER(fp) \0
  always_assert(false);            \0
  register ActRec* fp = nullptr;0
0
#elif defined(__AARCH64EL__)0
0
# if defined(__clang__)0
#  error Clang implementation not done for ARM0
# endif0
# define DECLARE_FRAME_POINTER(fp) register ActRec* fp asm("x29");0
0
#elif defined(__powerpc64__)0
0
# if defined(__clang__)0
#  error Clang implementation not done for PPC640
# endif0
# define DECLARE_FRAME_POINTER(fp) register ActRec* fp = (ActRec*) __builtin_frame_address(0);0
0
#else0
0
# error What are the stack and frame pointers called on your architecture?0
0
#endif0
0
//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
0
// We reserve the exit status 127 to signal a failure in the0
// interpreter. 127 is a valid exit code on all reasonable0
// architectures: POSIX requires at least 8 unsigned bits and0
// Windows 32 signed bits.0
#define HPHP_EXIT_FAILURE 1270
0
//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
0
#if FACEBOOK0
// Linking in libbfd is a gigantic PITA. If you want this yourself in a non-FB0
// build, feel free to define HAVE_LIBBFD and specify the right options to link0
// in libbfd.a in the extra C++ options.0
#define HAVE_LIBBFD 10
#endif0
0
#ifndef PACKAGE0
// The value doesn't matter, but it must be defined before you include0
// bfd.h0
#define PACKAGE "hhvm"0
#endif0
0
//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
0
#endif0

 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0

#ifndef incl_HPHP_THREAD_LOCAL_H_0
#define incl_HPHP_THREAD_LOCAL_H_0
0
#include <assert.h>0
#include <stdio.h>0
#include <stdlib.h>0
#include <stdint.h>0
#include <pthread.h>0
#include <errno.h>0
#include <stdexcept>0
#include <type_traits>0
#include <utility>0
#include "portability.h"0
0
namespace HPHP {0
0
// return the location of the current thread's tdata section0
std::pair<void*,size_t> getCppTdata();0
0
inline uintptr_t tlsBase() {0
  uintptr_t retval;0
#if defined(__x86_64__)0
  asm ("movq %%fs:0, %0" : "=r" (retval));0
#elif defined(__AARCH64EL__)0
  // mrs == "move register <-- system"0
  // tpidr_el0 == "thread process id register for exception level 0"0
  asm ("mrs %0, tpidr_el0" : "=r" (retval));0
#elif defined (__powerpc64__)0
  asm ("xor %0,%0,%0\n\t"0
       "or  %0,%0,13\n\t"0
      : "=r" (retval));0
#elif defined(_M_X64)0
  retval = (uintptr_t)_readfsbase_u64();0
  retval = *(uintptr_t*)(retval + 88);0
#else0
# error How do you access thread-local storage on this machine?0
#endif0
  return retval;0
}0
0
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
// gcc >= 4.3.0 supports the '__thread' keyword for thread locals0
//0
// Clang seems to have added this feature, or at the very least it is ignoring0
// __thread keyword and compiling anyway0
//0
// On OSX, gcc does emulate TLS but in a manner that invalidates assumptions0
// we have made about __thread and makes accessing thread-local variables in a0
// JIT-friendly fashion difficult (as the compiler is doing a lot of magic that0
// is not contractual or documented that we would need to duplicate in emitted0
// code) so for now we're not going to use it. One possibility if we really0
// want to do this is to generate functions that access variables of interest0
// in ThreadLocal* (all of them are NoCheck right now) and use the bytes of0
// gcc's compiled functions to find the values we would need to pass to0
// __emutls_get_address.0
//0
// icc 13.0.0 appears to support it as well but we end up with0
// assembler warnings of unknown importance about incorrect section0
// types0
//0
// __thread on cygwin and mingw uses pthreads emulation not native tls so0
// the emulation for thread local must be used as well0
//0
// So we use __thread on gcc, icc and clang, unless we are on OSX. On OSX, we0
// use our own emulation. Use the DECLARE_THREAD_LOCAL() and0
// IMPLEMENT_THREAD_LOCAL() macros to access either __thread or the emulation0
// as appropriate.0
0
#if !defined(NO_TLS) &&                                       \0
    !defined(__CYGWIN__) && !defined(__MINGW__) &&            \0
   ((__llvm__ && __clang__) ||                                \0
   __GNUC__ > 4 || (__GNUC__ == 4 && __GNUC_MINOR__ > 3) ||   \0
   __INTEL_COMPILER || defined(_MSC_VER))0
#define USE_GCC_FAST_TLS0
#endif0
0
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
// helper0
0
inline void ThreadLocalCheckReturn(int ret, const char *funcName) {0
  if (ret != 0) {0
    // This is used from global constructors so the safest thing to do is just0
    // print to stderr and exit().0
    fprintf(stderr, "%s returned %d", funcName, ret);0
    exit(1);0
  }0
}0
0
inline void ThreadLocalCreateKey(pthread_key_t *key, void (*del)(void*)) {0
  int ret = pthread_key_create(key, del);0
  ThreadLocalCheckReturn(ret, "pthread_key_create");0
}0
0
inline void ThreadLocalSetValue(pthread_key_t key, const void* value) {0
  int ret = pthread_setspecific(key, value);0
  ThreadLocalCheckReturn(ret, "pthread_setspecific");0
}0
0
#ifdef __APPLE__0
typedef struct __darwin_pthread_handler_rec darwin_pthread_handler;0
#endif0
0
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
0
/**0
 * A thread-local object is a "global" object within a thread. This is useful0
 * for writing apartment-threaded code, where nothing is actually shared0
 * between different threads (hence no locking) but those variables are not0
 * on stack in local scope. To use it, just do something like this,0
 *0
 *   IMPLEMENT_THREAD_LOCAL(MyClass, static_object);0
 *     static_object->data_ = ...;0
 *     static_object->doSomething();0
 *0
 *   IMPLEMENT_THREAD_LOCAL(int, static_number);0
 *     int value = *static_number;0
 *0
 * So, syntax-wise it's similar to pointers. The type parameter can be a0
 * primitive types. If it's a class, there has to be a default constructor.0
 */0
0
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
#if defined(USE_GCC_FAST_TLS)0
0
/**0
 * We keep a linked list of destructors in ThreadLocalManager to be called on0
 * thread exit. ThreadLocalNode is a node in this list.0
 */0
template <typename T>0
struct ThreadLocalNode {0
  T * m_p;0
  void (*m_on_thread_exit_fn)(void * p);0
  void * m_next;0
  size_t m_size;0
};0
0
struct ThreadLocalManager {0
  template<class T>0
  static void PushTop(ThreadLocalNode<T>& node) {0
    PushTop(&node, sizeof(T));0
  }0
  template<class F> void scan(F& mark) const;0
0
private:0
  static void PushTop(void* node, size_t size);0
  struct ThreadLocalList {0
    void* head{nullptr};0
#ifdef __APPLE__0
    ThreadLocalList();0
    darwin_pthread_handler handler;0
#endif0
  };0
  static ThreadLocalList* getList(void* p) {0
    return static_cast<ThreadLocalList*>(p);0
  }0
  ThreadLocalManager() : m_key(0) {0
#ifdef __APPLE__0
    ThreadLocalCreateKey(&m_key, nullptr);0
#else0
    ThreadLocalCreateKey(&m_key, ThreadLocalManager::OnThreadExit);0
#endif0
  };0
  static void OnThreadExit(void *p);0
  pthread_key_t m_key;0
0
  static ThreadLocalManager& GetManager();0
};0
0
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
// ThreadLocal allocates by calling new without parameters and frees by calling0
// delete0
0
template<typename T>0
void ThreadLocalOnThreadExit(void * p) {0
  ThreadLocalNode<T> * pNode = (ThreadLocalNode<T>*)p;0
  delete pNode->m_p;0
  pNode->m_p = nullptr;0
}0
0
/**0
 * The USE_GCC_FAST_TLS implementation of ThreadLocal is just a lazy-initialized0
 * pointer wrapper. In this case, we have one ThreadLocal object per thread.0
 */0
template<typename T>0
struct ThreadLocal {0
  T *get() const {0
    if (m_node.m_p == nullptr) {0
      const_cast<ThreadLocal<T>*>(this)->create();0
    }0
    return m_node.m_p;0
  }0
0
  NEVER_INLINE void create();0
0
  bool isNull() const { return m_node.m_p == nullptr; }0
0
  void destroy() {0
    delete m_node.m_p;0
    m_node.m_p = nullptr;0
  }0
0
  void nullOut() {0
    m_node.m_p = nullptr;0
  }0
0
  T *operator->() const {0
    return get();0
  }0
0
  T &operator*() const {0
    return *get();0
  }0
0
  ThreadLocalNode<T> m_node;0
};0
0
template<typename T>0
void ThreadLocal<T>::create() {0
  if (m_node.m_on_thread_exit_fn == nullptr) {0
    m_node.m_on_thread_exit_fn = ThreadLocalOnThreadExit<T>;0
    ThreadLocalManager::PushTop(m_node);0
  }0
  assert(m_node.m_p == nullptr);0
  m_node.m_p = new T();0
}0
0
/**0
 * ThreadLocalNoCheck is a pointer wrapper like ThreadLocal, except that it is0
 * explicitly initialized with getCheck(), rather than being initialized when0
 * it is first dereferenced.0
 */0
template<typename T>0
struct ThreadLocalNoCheck {0
  NEVER_INLINE T *getCheck() const;0
  T* getNoCheck() const {0
    assert(m_node.m_p);0
    return m_node.m_p;0
  }0
0
  NEVER_INLINE void create();0
0
  bool isNull() const { return m_node.m_p == nullptr; }0
0
  void destroy() {0
    delete m_node.m_p;0
    m_node.m_p = nullptr;0
  }0
0
  T *operator->() const {0
    return getNoCheck();0
  }0
0
  T &operator*() const {0
    return *getNoCheck();0
  }0
0
  ThreadLocalNode<T> m_node;0
private:0
  void setNull() { m_node.m_p = nullptr; }0
};0
0
template<typename T>0
void ThreadLocalNoCheck<T>::create() {0
  if (m_node.m_on_thread_exit_fn == nullptr) {0
    m_node.m_on_thread_exit_fn = ThreadLocalOnThreadExit<T>;0
    ThreadLocalManager::PushTop(m_node);0
  }0
  assert(m_node.m_p == nullptr);0
  m_node.m_p = new T();0
}0
template<typename T>0
T *ThreadLocalNoCheck<T>::getCheck() const {0
  if (m_node.m_p == nullptr) {0
    const_cast<ThreadLocalNoCheck<T>*>(this)->create();0
  }0
  return m_node.m_p;0
}0
0
0
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
// Singleton thread-local storage for T0
0
template<typename T>0
void ThreadLocalSingletonOnThreadExit(void *obj) {0
  T::OnThreadExit((T*)obj);0
}0
0
// ThreadLocalSingleton has NoCheck property0
template <typename T>0
class ThreadLocalSingleton {0
public:0
  ThreadLocalSingleton() { s_inited = true; }0
0
  NEVER_INLINE static T *getCheck();0
0
  static T* getNoCheck() {0
    assert(s_inited);0
    assert(s_singleton == (T*)&s_storage);0
    return (T*)&s_storage;0
  }0
0
  static bool isNull() { return s_singleton == nullptr; }0
0
  static void destroy() {0
    assert(!s_singleton || s_singleton == (T*)&s_storage);0
    T* p = s_singleton;0
    if (p) {0
      T::Delete(p);0
      s_singleton = nullptr;0
    }0
  }0
0
  T *operator->() const {0
    return getNoCheck();0
  }0
0
  T &operator*() const {0
    return *getNoCheck();0
  }0
0
private:0
  static __thread T *s_singleton;0
  typedef typename std::aligned_storage<sizeof(T), sizeof(void*)>::type0
          StorageType;0
  static __thread StorageType s_storage;0
  static bool s_inited; // no-fast-TLS requires construction so be consistent0
};0
0
template<typename T>0
bool ThreadLocalSingleton<T>::s_inited = false;0
0
template<typename T>0
T *ThreadLocalSingleton<T>::getCheck() {0
  assert(s_inited);0
  if (!s_singleton) {0
    T* p = (T*) &s_storage;0
    T::Create(p);0
    s_singleton = p;0
  }0
  return s_singleton;0
}0
0
template<typename T> __thread T *ThreadLocalSingleton<T>::s_singleton;0
template<typename T> __thread typename ThreadLocalSingleton<T>::StorageType0
                              ThreadLocalSingleton<T>::s_storage;0
0
0
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
// some classes don't need new/delete at all0
0
template<typename T, bool throwOnNull = true>0
struct ThreadLocalProxy {0
  T *get() const {0
    if (m_p == nullptr && throwOnNull) {0
      throw std::runtime_error("ThreadLocalProxy::get() called before set()");0
    }0
    return m_p;0
  }0
0
  void set(T* obj) {0
    m_p = obj;0
  }0
0
  bool isNull() const { return m_p == nullptr; }0
0
  void destroy() {0
    m_p = nullptr;0
  }0
0
  T *operator->() const {0
    return get();0
  }0
0
  T &operator*() const {0
    return *get();0
  }0
0
  T * m_p;0
};0
0
/*0
 * How to use the thread-local macros:0
 *0
 * Use DECLARE_THREAD_LOCAL to declare a *static* class field as thread local:0
 *   class SomeClass {0
 *     static DECLARE_THREAD_LOCAL(SomeFieldType, f);0
 *   }0
 *0
 * Use IMPLEMENT_THREAD_LOCAL in the cpp file to implement the field:0
 *   IMPLEMENT_THREAD_LOCAL(SomeFieldType, SomeClass::f);0
 *0
 * Remember: *Never* write IMPLEMENT_THREAD_LOCAL in a header file.0
 */0
0
#define DECLARE_THREAD_LOCAL(T, f) \0
  __thread HPHP::ThreadLocal<T> f0
#define IMPLEMENT_THREAD_LOCAL(T, f) \0
  __thread HPHP::ThreadLocal<T> f0
0
#define DECLARE_THREAD_LOCAL_NO_CHECK(T, f) \0
  __thread HPHP::ThreadLocalNoCheck<T> f0
#define IMPLEMENT_THREAD_LOCAL_NO_CHECK(T, f) \0
  __thread HPHP::ThreadLocalNoCheck<T> f0
0
#define DECLARE_THREAD_LOCAL_PROXY(T, N, f) \0
  __thread HPHP::ThreadLocalProxy<T, N> f0
#define IMPLEMENT_THREAD_LOCAL_PROXY(T, N, f) \0
  __thread HPHP::ThreadLocalProxy<T, N> f0
0
#else /* USE_GCC_FAST_TLS */0
0
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
// ThreadLocal allocates by calling new() without parameters0
0
template<typename T>0
void ThreadLocalOnThreadExit(void *p) {0
  delete (T*)p;0
}0
0
#ifdef __APPLE__0
// The __thread variables in class T will be freed when pthread calls0
// the destructor function on Mac. We can register a handler in0
// pthread_t->__cleanup_stack similar to pthread_cleanup_push(). The handler0
// will be called earlier so the __thread variables will still exist in the0
// handler when the thread exits.0
//0
// See the details at:0
// https://github.com/facebook/hhvm/issues/4444#issuecomment-924975820
typedef struct __darwin_pthread_handler_rec darwin_pthread_handler;0
0
template<typename T>0
void ThreadLocalOnThreadCleanup(void *key) {0
  void *obj = pthread_getspecific((pthread_key_t)key);0
  if (obj) {0
    ThreadLocalOnThreadExit<T>(obj);0
  }0
}0
0
inline void ThreadLocalSetCleanupHandler(pthread_key_t cleanup_key,0
                                         pthread_key_t key,0
                                         void (*del)(void*)) {0
  // Prevent from adding the handler for multiple times.0
  darwin_pthread_handler *handler =0
      (darwin_pthread_handler*)pthread_getspecific(cleanup_key);0
  if (handler)0
    return;0
0
  pthread_t self = pthread_self();0
0
  handler = new darwin_pthread_handler();0
  handler->__routine = del;0
  handler->__arg = (void*)key;0
  handler->__next = self->__cleanup_stack;0
  self->__cleanup_stack = handler;0
0
  ThreadLocalSetValue(cleanup_key, handler);0
}0
#endif0
0
/**0
 * This is the emulation version of ThreadLocal. In this case, the ThreadLocal0
 * object is a true global, and the get() method returns a thread-dependent0
 * pointer from pthread's thread-specific data management.0
 */0
template<typename T>0
class ThreadLocal {0
public:0
  /**0
   * Constructor that has to be called from a thread-neutral place.0
   */0
  ThreadLocal() : m_key(0) {0
#ifdef __APPLE__0
    ThreadLocalCreateKey(&m_key, nullptr);0
    ThreadLocalCreateKey(&m_cleanup_key,0
                         ThreadLocalOnThreadExit<darwin_pthread_handler>);0
#else0
    ThreadLocalCreateKey(&m_key, ThreadLocalOnThreadExit<T>);0
#endif0
  }0
0
  T *get() const {0
    T *obj = (T*)pthread_getspecific(m_key);0
    if (obj == nullptr) {0
      obj = new T();0
      ThreadLocalSetValue(m_key, obj);0
#ifdef __APPLE__0
      ThreadLocalSetCleanupHandler(m_cleanup_key, m_key,0
                                   ThreadLocalOnThreadCleanup<T>);0
#endif0
    }0
    return obj;0
  }0
0
  bool isNull() const { return pthread_getspecific(m_key) == nullptr; }0
0
  void destroy() {0
    delete (T*)pthread_getspecific(m_key);0
    ThreadLocalSetValue(m_key, nullptr);0
  }0
0
  void nullOut() {0
    ThreadLocalSetValue(m_key, nullptr);0
  }0
0
  /**0
   * Access object's member or method through this operator overload.0
   */0
  T *operator->() const {0
    return get();0
  }0
0
  T &operator*() const {0
    return *get();0
  }0
0
private:0
  pthread_key_t m_key;0
0
#ifdef __APPLE__0
  pthread_key_t m_cleanup_key;0
#endif0
};0
0
template<typename T>0
class ThreadLocalNoCheck {0
public:0
  /**0
   * Constructor that has to be called from a thread-neutral place.0
   */0
  ThreadLocalNoCheck() : m_key(0) {0
#ifdef __APPLE__0
    ThreadLocalCreateKey(&m_key, nullptr);0
    ThreadLocalCreateKey(&m_cleanup_key,0
                         ThreadLocalOnThreadExit<darwin_pthread_handler>);0
#else0
    ThreadLocalCreateKey(&m_key, ThreadLocalOnThreadExit<T>);0
#endif0
  }0
0
  NEVER_INLINE T *getCheck() const;0
0
  T* getNoCheck() const {0
    T *obj = (T*)pthread_getspecific(m_key);0
    assert(obj);0
    return obj;0
  }0
0
  bool isNull() const { return pthread_getspecific(m_key) == nullptr; }0
0
  void destroy() {0
    delete (T*)pthread_getspecific(m_key);0
    ThreadLocalSetValue(m_key, nullptr);0
  }0
0
  /**0
   * Access object's member or method through this operator overload.0
   */0
  T *operator->() const {0
    return getNoCheck();0
  }0
0
  T &operator*() const {0
    return *getNoCheck();0
  }0
0
public:0
  void setNull() { ThreadLocalSetValue(m_key, nullptr); }0
  pthread_key_t m_key;0
0
#ifdef __APPLE__0
  pthread_key_t m_cleanup_key;0
#endif0
};0
0
template<typename T>0
T *ThreadLocalNoCheck<T>::getCheck() const {0
  T *obj = (T*)pthread_getspecific(m_key);0
  if (obj == nullptr) {0
    obj = new T();0
    ThreadLocalSetValue(m_key, obj);0
#ifdef __APPLE__0
    ThreadLocalSetCleanupHandler(m_cleanup_key, m_key,0
                                 ThreadLocalOnThreadCleanup<T>);0
#endif0
  }0
  return obj;0
}0
0
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
// Singleton thread-local storage for T0
0
template<typename T>0
void ThreadLocalSingletonOnThreadExit(void *obj) {0
  T::OnThreadExit((T*)obj);0
  free(obj);0
}0
0
#ifdef __APPLE__0
template<typename T>0
void ThreadLocalSingletonOnThreadCleanup(void *key) {0
  void *obj = pthread_getspecific((pthread_key_t)key);0
  if (obj) {0
    ThreadLocalSingletonOnThreadExit<T>(obj);0
  }0
}0
#endif0
0
// ThreadLocalSingleton has NoCheck property0
template<typename T>0
class ThreadLocalSingleton {0
public:0
  ThreadLocalSingleton() { getKey(); }0
0
  NEVER_INLINE static T *getCheck();0
  static T* getNoCheck() {0
    assert(s_inited);0
    T *obj = (T*)pthread_getspecific(s_key);0
    assert(obj);0
    return obj;0
  }0
0
  static bool isNull() {0
    return !s_inited || pthread_getspecific(s_key) == nullptr;0
  }0
0
  static void destroy() {0
    void* p = pthread_getspecific(s_key);0
    T::Delete((T*)p);0
    free(p);0
    ThreadLocalSetValue(s_key, nullptr);0
  }0
0
  T *operator->() const {0
    return getNoCheck();0
  }0
0
  T &operator*() const {0
    return *getNoCheck();0
  }0
0
private:0
  static pthread_key_t s_key;0
  static bool s_inited; // pthread_key_t has no portable valid sentinel0
0
#ifdef __APPLE__0
  static pthread_key_t s_cleanup_key;0
#endif0
0
  static pthread_key_t getKey() {0
    if (!s_inited) {0
      s_inited = true;0
#ifdef __APPLE__0
      ThreadLocalCreateKey(&s_key, nullptr);0
      ThreadLocalCreateKey(&s_cleanup_key,0
                           ThreadLocalOnThreadExit<darwin_pthread_handler>);0
#else0
      ThreadLocalCreateKey(&s_key, ThreadLocalSingletonOnThreadExit<T>);0
#endif0
    }0
    return s_key;0
  }0
};0
0
template<typename T>0
T *ThreadLocalSingleton<T>::getCheck() {0
  assert(s_inited);0
  T *obj = (T*)pthread_getspecific(s_key);0
  if (obj == nullptr) {0
    obj = (T*)malloc(sizeof(T));0
    T::Create(obj);0
    ThreadLocalSetValue(s_key, obj);0
#ifdef __APPLE__0
    ThreadLocalSetCleanupHandler(s_cleanup_key, s_key,0
                                 ThreadLocalSingletonOnThreadCleanup<T>);0
#endif0
  }0
  return obj;0
}0
0
template<typename T>0
pthread_key_t ThreadLocalSingleton<T>::s_key;0
template<typename T>0
bool ThreadLocalSingleton<T>::s_inited = false;0
0
#ifdef __APPLE__0
template<typename T>0
pthread_key_t ThreadLocalSingleton<T>::s_cleanup_key;0
#endif0
0
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
// some classes don't need new/delete at all0
0
template<typename T, bool throwOnNull = true>0
class ThreadLocalProxy {0
public:0
  /**0
   * Constructor that has to be called from a thread-neutral place.0
   */0
  ThreadLocalProxy() : m_key(0) {0
    ThreadLocalCreateKey(&m_key, nullptr);0
  }0
0
  T *get() const {0
    T *obj = (T*)pthread_getspecific(m_key);0
    if (obj == nullptr && throwOnNull) {0
      throw std::runtime_error("ThreadLocalProxy::get() called before set()");0
    }0
    return obj;0
  }0
0
  void set(T* obj) {0
    ThreadLocalSetValue(m_key, obj);0
  }0
0
  bool isNull() const { return pthread_getspecific(m_key) == nullptr; }0
0
  void destroy() {0
    ThreadLocalSetValue(m_key, nullptr);0
  }0
0
  /**0
   * Access object's member or method through this operator overload.0
   */0
  T *operator->() const {0
    return get();0
  }0
0
  T &operator*() const {0
    return *get();0
  }0
0
public:0
  pthread_key_t m_key;0
};0
0
/**0
 * The emulation version of the thread-local macros0
 */0
#define DECLARE_THREAD_LOCAL(T, f) HPHP::ThreadLocal<T> f0
#define IMPLEMENT_THREAD_LOCAL(T, f) HPHP::ThreadLocal<T> f0
0
#define DECLARE_THREAD_LOCAL_NO_CHECK(T, f) HPHP::ThreadLocalNoCheck<T> f0
#define IMPLEMENT_THREAD_LOCAL_NO_CHECK(T, f) HPHP::ThreadLocalNoCheck<T> f0
0
#define DECLARE_THREAD_LOCAL_PROXY(T, N, f) HPHP::ThreadLocalProxy<T, N> f0
#define IMPLEMENT_THREAD_LOCAL_PROXY(T, N, f) HPHP::ThreadLocalProxy<T, N> f0
0
#endif /* USE_GCC_FAST_TLS */0
0
///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////0
}0
0
#endif // incl_HPHP_THREAD_LOCAL_H_0
/**0

 *0
