 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
'use strict';0
0
// Based on similar script in Jest0
// https://github.com/facebook/jest/blob/a7acc5ae519613647ff2c253dd21933d6f94b47f/scripts/prettier.js0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const glob = require('glob');0
const prettier = require('prettier');0
const fs = require('fs');0
const listChangedFiles = require('../shared/listChangedFiles');0
const prettierConfigPath = require.resolve('../../.prettierrc');0
0
const mode = process.argv[2] || 'check';0
const shouldWrite = mode === 'write' || mode === 'write-changed';0
const onlyChanged = mode === 'check-changed' || mode === 'write-changed';0
0
const changedFiles = onlyChanged ? listChangedFiles() : null;0
let didWarn = false;0
let didError = false;0
0
const files = glob0
  .sync('**/*.js', {ignore: '**/node_modules/**'})0
  .filter(f => !onlyChanged || changedFiles.has(f));0
0
if (!files.length) {0
  return;0
}0
0
files.forEach(file => {0
  const options = prettier.resolveConfig.sync(file, {0
    config: prettierConfigPath,0
  });0
  try {0
    const input = fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8');0
    if (shouldWrite) {0
      const output = prettier.format(input, options);0
      if (output !== input) {0
        fs.writeFileSync(file, output, 'utf8');0
      }0
    } else {0
      if (!prettier.check(input, options)) {0
        if (!didWarn) {0
          console.log(0
            '\n' +0
              chalk.red(0
                `  This project uses prettier to format all JavaScript code.\n`0
              ) +0
              chalk.dim(`    Please run `) +0
              chalk.reset('yarn prettier-all') +0
              chalk.dim(0
                ` and add changes to files listed below to your commit:`0
              ) +0
              `\n\n`0
          );0
          didWarn = true;0
        }0
        console.log(file);0
      }0
    }0
  } catch (error) {0
    didError = true;0
    console.log('\n\n' + error.message);0
    console.log(file);0
  }0
});0
0
if (didWarn || didError) {0
  process.exit(1);0
}0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
'use strict';0
0
const babylon = require('babylon');0
const fs = require('fs');0
const through = require('through2');0
const traverse = require('babel-traverse').default;0
const gs = require('glob-stream');0
0
const evalToString = require('../shared/evalToString');0
0
const babylonOptions = {0
  sourceType: 'module',0
  // As a parser, babylon has its own options and we can't directly0
  // import/require a babel preset. It should be kept **the same** as0
  // the `babel-plugin-syntax-*` ones specified in0
  // https://github.com/facebook/fbjs/blob/master/babel-preset/configure.js0
  plugins: [0
    'classProperties',0
    'flow',0
    'jsx',0
    'trailingFunctionCommas',0
    'objectRestSpread',0
  ],0
};0
0
const warnings = new Set();0
0
function transform(file, enc, cb) {0
  fs.readFile(file.path, 'utf8', function(err, source) {0
    if (err) {0
      cb(err);0
      return;0
    }0
0
    const ast = babylon.parse(source, babylonOptions);0
    traverse(ast, {0
      CallExpression: {0
        exit: function(astPath) {0
          const callee = astPath.get('callee');0
          if (0
            callee.isIdentifier({name: 'warning'}) ||0
            callee.isIdentifier({name: 'lowPriorityWarning'})0
          ) {0
            const node = astPath.node;0
0
            // warning messages can be concatenated (`+`) at runtime, so here's0
            // a trivial partial evaluator that interprets the literal value0
            const warningMsgLiteral = evalToString(node.arguments[1]);0
            warnings.add(JSON.stringify(warningMsgLiteral));0
          }0
        },0
      },0
    });0
0
    cb(null);0
  });0
}0
0
gs(['packages/**/*.js', '!**/__tests__/**/*.js', '!**/__mocks__/**/*.js']).pipe(0
  through.obj(transform, cb => {0
    process.stdout.write(0
      Array.from(warnings)0
        .sort()0
        .join('\n') + '\n'0
    );0
    cb();0
  })0
);0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const {exec} = require('child_process');0
0
// Follows the steps outlined in github.com/facebook/react/issues/106200
const run = async () => {0
  const chalk = require('chalk');0
  const logUpdate = require('log-update');0
  const {getPublicPackages} = require('./utils');0
0
  const addGitTag = require('./build-commands/add-git-tag');0
  const buildArtifacts = require('./build-commands/build-artifacts');0
  const checkCircleCiStatus = require('./build-commands/check-circle-ci-status');0
  const checkEnvironmentVariables = require('./build-commands/check-environment-variables');0
  const checkNpmPermissions = require('./build-commands/check-npm-permissions');0
  const checkPackageDependencies = require('./build-commands/check-package-dependencies');0
  const checkUncommittedChanges = require('./build-commands/check-uncommitted-changes');0
  const installYarnDependencies = require('./build-commands/install-yarn-dependencies');0
  const parseBuildParameters = require('./build-commands/parse-build-parameters');0
  const printPostBuildSummary = require('./build-commands/print-post-build-summary');0
  const runAutomatedTests = require('./build-commands/run-automated-tests');0
  const runAutomatedBundleTests = require('./build-commands/run-automated-bundle-tests');0
  const updateGit = require('./build-commands/update-git');0
  const updateNoopRendererDependencies = require('./build-commands/update-noop-renderer-dependencies');0
  const updatePackageVersions = require('./build-commands/update-package-versions');0
  const updateYarnDependencies = require('./build-commands/update-yarn-dependencies');0
  const validateVersion = require('./build-commands/validate-version');0
0
  try {0
    const params = parseBuildParameters();0
    params.packages = getPublicPackages();0
    await checkEnvironmentVariables(params);0
    await validateVersion(params);0
    await checkUncommittedChanges(params);0
    await checkNpmPermissions(params);0
    await updateGit(params);0
    await checkCircleCiStatus(params);0
    await installYarnDependencies(params);0
    await checkPackageDependencies(params);0
    await updateYarnDependencies(params);0
    await runAutomatedTests(params);0
    await updatePackageVersions(params);0
    await updateNoopRendererDependencies(params);0
    await buildArtifacts(params);0
    await runAutomatedBundleTests(params);0
    await addGitTag(params);0
    await printPostBuildSummary(params);0
  } catch (error) {0
    logUpdate.clear();0
0
    const message = error.message.trim().replace(/\n +/g, '\n');0
    const stack = error.stack.replace(error.message, '');0
0
    console.log(0
      `${chalk.bgRed.white(' ERROR ')} ${chalk.red(message)}\n\n${chalk.gray(0
        stack0
      )}`0
    );0
0
    process.exit(1);0
  }0
};0
0
// Install (or update) release script dependencies before proceeding.0
// This needs to be done before we require() the first NPM module.0
exec('yarn install', {cwd: __dirname}, (error, stdout, stderr) => {0
  if (error) {0
    console.error(error);0
    process.exit(1);0
  } else {0
    run();0
  }0
});0
'use strict';0
0
const dependencies = ['object-assign', 'prop-types'];0
0
const paramDefinitions = [0
  {0
    name: 'dry',0
    type: Boolean,0
    description: 'Build artifacts but do not commit or publish',0
    defaultValue: false,0
  },0
  {0
    name: 'path',0
    type: String,0
    alias: 'p',0
    description:0
      'Location of React repository to release; defaults to [bold]{cwd}',0
    defaultValue: '.',0
  },0
  {0
    name: 'version',0
    type: String,0
    alias: 'v',0
    description: 'Semantic version number',0
  },0
  {0
    name: 'branch',0
    type: String,0
    alias: 'b',0
    description: 'Branch to build from; defaults to [bold]{master}',0
    defaultValue: 'master',0
  },0
  {0
    name: 'local',0
    type: Boolean,0
    description:0
      "Don't push or pull changes from remote repo. Don't check CI status.",0
  },0
  {0
    name: 'tag',0
    type: String,0
    description:0
      'The npm dist tag; defaults to [bold]{latest} for a stable' +0
      'release, [bold]{next} for unstable',0
  },0
];0
0
module.exports = {0
  dependencies,0
  paramDefinitions,0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const logUpdate = require('log-update');0
const {getPublicPackages} = require('./utils');0
0
const checkBuildStatus = require('./publish-commands/check-build-status');0
const commitChangelog = require('./publish-commands/commit-changelog');0
const getNpmTwoFactorAuth = require('./publish-commands/get-npm-two-factor-auth');0
const parsePublishParams = require('./publish-commands/parse-publish-params');0
const printPostPublishSummary = require('./publish-commands/print-post-publish-summary');0
const pushGitRemote = require('./publish-commands/push-git-remote');0
const publishToNpm = require('./publish-commands/publish-to-npm');0
0
// Follows the steps outlined in github.com/facebook/react/issues/106200
const run = async () => {0
  const params = parsePublishParams();0
  params.packages = getPublicPackages();0
0
  try {0
    await checkBuildStatus(params);0
    await commitChangelog(params);0
    await pushGitRemote(params);0
    params.otp = await getNpmTwoFactorAuth(params);0
    await publishToNpm(params);0
    await printPostPublishSummary(params);0
  } catch (error) {0
    logUpdate.clear();0
0
    const message = error.message.trim().replace(/\n +/g, '\n');0
    const stack = error.stack.replace(error.message, '');0
0
    console.log(0
      `${chalk.bgRed.white(' ERROR ')} ${chalk.red(message)}\n\n${chalk.gray(0
        stack0
      )}`0
    );0
0
    process.exit(1);0
  }0
};0
0
run();0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const {dots} = require('cli-spinners');0
const {exec} = require('child-process-promise');0
const {readdirSync, readFileSync, statSync} = require('fs');0
const logUpdate = require('log-update');0
const {join} = require('path');0
0
const execRead = async (command, options) => {0
  const {stdout} = await exec(command, options);0
0
  return stdout.trim();0
};0
0
const unexecutedCommands = [];0
0
const execUnlessDry = async (command, {cwd, dry}) => {0
  if (dry) {0
    unexecutedCommands.push(`${command} # {cwd: ${cwd}}`);0
  } else {0
    await exec(command, {cwd});0
  }0
};0
0
const getPublicPackages = () => {0
  const packagesRoot = join(__dirname, '..', '..', 'packages');0
0
  return readdirSync(packagesRoot).filter(dir => {0
    const packagePath = join(packagesRoot, dir, 'package.json');0
0
    if (dir.charAt(0) !== '.' && statSync(packagePath).isFile()) {0
      const packageJSON = JSON.parse(readFileSync(packagePath));0
0
      return packageJSON.private !== true;0
    }0
0
    return false;0
  });0
};0
0
const getUnexecutedCommands = () => {0
  if (unexecutedCommands.length > 0) {0
    return chalk`0
      The following commands were not executed because of the {bold --dry} flag:0
      {gray ${unexecutedCommands.join('\n')}}0
    `;0
  } else {0
    return '';0
  }0
};0
0
const logPromise = async (promise, text, isLongRunningTask = false) => {0
  const {frames, interval} = dots;0
0
  let index = 0;0
0
  const inProgressMessage = `- this may take a few ${0
    isLongRunningTask ? 'minutes' : 'seconds'0
  }`;0
0
  const id = setInterval(() => {0
    index = ++index % frames.length;0
    logUpdate(0
      `${chalk.yellow(frames[index])} ${text} ${chalk.gray(inProgressMessage)}`0
    );0
  }, interval);0
0
  try {0
    const returnValue = await promise;0
0
    clearInterval(id);0
0
    logUpdate(`${chalk.green('✓')} ${text}`);0
    logUpdate.done();0
0
    return returnValue;0
  } catch (error) {0
    logUpdate.clear();0
0
    throw error;0
  }0
};0
0
const runYarnTask = async (cwd, task, errorMessage) => {0
  try {0
    await exec(`yarn ${task}`, {cwd});0
  } catch (error) {0
    throw Error(0
      chalk`0
      ${errorMessage}0
0
      {white ${error.stdout}}0
    `0
    );0
  }0
};0
0
module.exports = {0
  execRead,0
  execUnlessDry,0
  getPublicPackages,0
  getUnexecutedCommands,0
  logPromise,0
  runYarnTask,0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const {execUnlessDry, logPromise} = require('../utils');0
0
const run = async ({cwd, dry, version}) => {0
  await execUnlessDry(0
    `git tag -a v${version} -m "Tagging ${version} release"`,0
    {0
      cwd,0
      dry,0
    }0
  );0
};0
0
module.exports = async ({cwd, dry, version}) => {0
  return logPromise(0
    run({cwd, dry, version}),0
    `Creating git tag ${chalk.yellow.bold(`v${version}`)}`0
  );0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const {exec} = require('child-process-promise');0
const {execRead, execUnlessDry, logPromise} = require('../utils');0
0
const run = async ({cwd, dry, version}) => {0
  await exec('yarn build -- --extract-errors', {cwd});0
0
  const modifiedFiles = await execRead('git ls-files -m', {cwd});0
0
  if (modifiedFiles.includes('scripts/error-codes/codes.json')) {0
    await execUnlessDry('git add scripts/error-codes/codes.json', {cwd, dry});0
    await execUnlessDry(0
      `git commit -m "Update error codes for ${version} release"`,0
      {cwd, dry}0
    );0
  }0
0
  if (modifiedFiles.includes('scripts/rollup/results.json')) {0
    await execUnlessDry('git add scripts/rollup/results.json', {cwd, dry});0
    await execUnlessDry(0
      `git commit -m "Update bundle sizes for ${version} release"`,0
      {cwd, dry}0
    );0
  }0
};0
0
module.exports = async params => {0
  return logPromise(run(params), 'Building artifacts', true);0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const http = require('request-promise-json');0
const {execRead, logPromise} = require('../utils');0
0
// https://circleci.com/docs/api/v1-reference/#projects0
const CIRCLE_CI_BASE_URL =0
  'https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/github/facebook/react/tree/master';0
0
const check = async ({cwd}) => {0
  const token = process.env.CIRCLE_CI_API_TOKEN;0
  const uri = `${CIRCLE_CI_BASE_URL}?circle-token=${token}&limit=1`;0
0
  const response = await http.get(uri, true);0
  const {outcome, status, vcs_revision: ciRevision} = response[0];0
0
  const gitRevision = await execRead('git rev-parse HEAD', {cwd});0
0
  if (gitRevision !== ciRevision) {0
    throw Error(0
      chalk`0
      CircleCI is stale0
0
      {white The latest Git revision is {yellow.bold ${gitRevision}}}0
      {white The most recent CircleCI revision is {yellow.bold ${ciRevision}}}0
      {white Please wait for CircleCI to catch up.}0
    `0
    );0
  } else if (outcome !== 'success') {0
    throw Error(0
      chalk`0
      CircleCI failed0
      0
      {white The most recent CircleCI build has a status of {red.bold ${outcome ||0
        status}}}0
      {white Please retry this build in CircleCI if you believe this is an error.}0
    `0
    );0
  }0
};0
0
module.exports = async params => {0
  if (params.local) {0
    return;0
  }0
  return logPromise(check(params), 'Checking CircleCI status');0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
0
module.exports = () => {0
  if (!process.env.CIRCLE_CI_API_TOKEN) {0
    throw Error(0
      chalk`0
      {red Missing CircleCI API token}0
0
      {white The CircleCI API is used to check the status of the latest commit.}0
      {white This API requires a token which must be exposed via a {yellow.bold CIRCLE_CI_API_TOKEN} environment var.}0
      {white In order to run this script you will need to create your own API token.}0
      {white Instructions can be found at:}0
0
      {blue.bold https://circleci.com/docs/api/v1-reference/#getting-started}0
0
      {white To make this token available to the release script, add it to your {yellow.bold .bash_profile} like so:}0
0
      {gray # React release script}0
      {white export CIRCLE_CI_API_TOKEN=<your-token-here>}0
    `0
    );0
  }0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const {execRead, logPromise} = require('../utils');0
0
module.exports = async ({packages}) => {0
  const currentUser = await execRead('npm whoami');0
  const failedProjects = [];0
0
  const checkProject = async project => {0
    const owners = (await execRead(`npm owner ls ${project}`))0
      .split('\n')0
      .filter(owner => owner)0
      .map(owner => owner.split(' ')[0]);0
0
    if (!owners.includes(currentUser)) {0
      failedProjects.push(project);0
    }0
  };0
0
  await logPromise(0
    Promise.all(packages.map(checkProject)),0
    `Checking ${chalk.yellow.bold(currentUser)}'s NPM permissions`0
  );0
0
  if (failedProjects.length) {0
    throw Error(0
      chalk`0
      Insufficient NPM permissions0
0
      {white NPM user {yellow.bold ${currentUser}} is not an owner for:}0
      {red ${failedProjects.join(', ')}}0
0
      {white Please contact a React team member to be added to the above project(s).}0
      `0
    );0
  }0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const {readJson} = require('fs-extra');0
const {join} = require('path');0
const {dependencies} = require('../config');0
const {logPromise} = require('../utils');0
0
const check = async ({cwd, packages}) => {0
  const rootPackage = await readJson(join(cwd, 'package.json'));0
0
  const projectPackages = [];0
  for (let i = 0; i < packages.length; i++) {0
    const project = packages[i];0
    projectPackages.push(0
      await readJson(join(cwd, join('packages', project), 'package.json'))0
    );0
  }0
0
  const invalidDependencies = [];0
0
  const checkModule = module => {0
    const rootVersion = rootPackage.devDependencies[module];0
0
    projectPackages.forEach(projectPackage => {0
      // Not all packages have dependencies (eg react-is)0
      const projectVersion = projectPackage.dependencies0
        ? projectPackage.dependencies[module]0
        : undefined;0
0
      if (rootVersion !== projectVersion && projectVersion !== undefined) {0
        invalidDependencies.push(0
          `${module} is ${chalk.red.bold(rootVersion)} in root but ` +0
            `${chalk.red.bold(projectVersion)} in ${projectPackage.name}`0
        );0
      }0
    });0
  };0
0
  await Promise.all(dependencies.map(checkModule));0
0
  if (invalidDependencies.length) {0
    throw Error(0
      chalk`0
      Dependency mismatch0
0
      {white The following dependencies do not match between the root package and NPM dependencies:}0
      ${invalidDependencies0
        .map(dependency => chalk.white(dependency))0
        .join('\n')}0
    `0
    );0
  }0
};0
0
module.exports = async params => {0
  return logPromise(check(params), 'Checking runtime dependencies');0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const {execRead} = require('../utils');0
0
module.exports = async ({cwd}) => {0
  const status = await execRead('git diff HEAD', {cwd});0
0
  if (status) {0
    throw Error(0
      chalk`0
      Uncommitted local changes0
0
      {white Please revert or commit all local changes before making a release.}0
    `0
    );0
  }0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const {exec} = require('child-process-promise');0
const {logPromise} = require('../utils');0
0
const install = async ({cwd}) => {0
  await exec('rm -rf node_modules', {cwd});0
  await exec('yarn', {cwd});0
};0
0
module.exports = async ({cwd}) => {0
  return logPromise(install({cwd}), 'Installing NPM dependencies');0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const commandLineArgs = require('command-line-args');0
const commandLineUsage = require('command-line-usage');0
const figlet = require('figlet');0
const {paramDefinitions} = require('../config');0
0
module.exports = () => {0
  const params = commandLineArgs(paramDefinitions);0
0
  if (!params.version) {0
    const usage = commandLineUsage([0
      {0
        content: chalk0
          .hex('#61dafb')0
          .bold(figlet.textSync('react', {font: 'Graffiti'})),0
        raw: true,0
      },0
      {0
        content: 'Automated pre-release build script.',0
      },0
      {0
        header: 'Options',0
        optionList: paramDefinitions,0
      },0
      {0
        header: 'Examples',0
        content: [0
          {0
            desc: '1. A concise example.',0
            example: '$ ./build.js [bold]{-v} [underline]{16.0.0}',0
          },0
          {0
            desc: '2. Dry run build a release candidate (no git commits).',0
            example:0
              '$ ./build.js [bold]{--dry} [bold]{-v} [underline]{16.0.0-rc.0}',0
          },0
          {0
            desc: '3. Release from another checkout.',0
            example:0
              '$ ./build.js [bold]{--version}=[underline]{16.0.0} [bold]{--path}=/path/to/react/repo',0
          },0
        ],0
      },0
    ]);0
    console.log(usage);0
    process.exit(1);0
  }0
0
  return {0
    ...params,0
    cwd: params.path, // For script convenience0
  };0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const {join, relative} = require('path');0
const {getUnexecutedCommands} = require('../utils');0
0
const CHANGELOG_PATH =0
  'https://github.com/facebook/react/edit/master/CHANGELOG.md';0
0
module.exports = ({cwd, dry, path, version}) => {0
  const publishPath = relative(0
    process.env.PWD,0
    join(__dirname, '../publish.js')0
  );0
  const command =0
    `${publishPath} -v ${version}` +0
    (path ? ` -p ${path}` : '') +0
    (dry ? ' --dry' : '');0
0
  const packagingFixturesPath = join(cwd, 'fixtures/packaging');0
  const standaloneFixturePath = join(0
    cwd,0
    'fixtures/packaging/babel-standalone/dev.html'0
  );0
0
  console.log(0
    chalk`0
    {green.bold Build successful!}0
    ${getUnexecutedCommands()}0
    Next there are a couple of manual steps:0
0
    {bold.underline Step 1: Update the CHANGELOG}0
0
    Here are a few things to keep in mind:0
    • The changes should be easy to understand. (Friendly one-liners are better than PR titles.)0
    • Make sure all contributors are credited.0
    • Verify that the markup is valid by previewing it in the editor: {blue.bold ${CHANGELOG_PATH}}0
0
    {bold.underline Step 2: Smoke test the packages}0
0
    1. Open {yellow.bold ${standaloneFixturePath}} in the browser.0
    2. It should say {italic "Hello world!"}0
    3. Next go to {yellow.bold ${packagingFixturesPath}} and run {bold node build-all.js}0
    4. Install the "serve" module ({bold npm install -g serve})0
    5. Go to the repo root and {bold serve -s .}0
    6. Open {blue.bold http://localhost:5000/fixtures/packaging}0
    7. Verify every iframe shows {italic "Hello world!"}0
0
    After completing the above steps, resume the release process by running:0
    {yellow.bold ${command}}0
  `.replace(/\n +/g, '\n')0
  );0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const {logPromise, runYarnTask} = require('../utils');0
0
module.exports = async ({cwd}) => {0
  await logPromise(0
    runYarnTask(cwd, 'lint-build', 'Lint bundle failed'),0
    'Running ESLint on bundle'0
  );0
  await logPromise(0
    runYarnTask(0
      cwd,0
      'test-build',0
      'Jest tests on the bundle failed in development'0
    ),0
    'Running Jest tests on the bundle in the development environment',0
    true0
  );0
  await logPromise(0
    runYarnTask(0
      cwd,0
      'test-build-prod',0
      'Jest tests on the bundle failed in production'0
    ),0
    'Running Jest tests on the bundle in the production environment',0
    true0
  );0
};0

0
'use strict';0
0
const {logPromise, runYarnTask} = require('../utils');0
0
module.exports = async ({cwd}) => {0
  await logPromise(runYarnTask(cwd, 'lint', 'Lint failed'), 'Running ESLint');0
  await logPromise(0
    runYarnTask(cwd, 'flow-ci', 'Flow failed'),0
    'Running Flow checks'0
  );0
  await logPromise(0
    runYarnTask(cwd, 'test', 'Jest tests failed in development'),0
    'Running Jest tests in the development environment',0
    true0
  );0
  await logPromise(0
    runYarnTask(cwd, 'test-prod', 'Jest tests failed in production'),0
    'Running Jest tests in the production environment',0
    true0
  );0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const {exec} = require('child-process-promise');0
const {logPromise} = require('../utils');0
0
const update = async ({cwd, branch, local}) => {0
  if (!local) {0
    await exec('git fetch', {cwd});0
  }0
  await exec(`git checkout ${branch}`, {cwd});0
  if (!local) {0
    await exec('git pull', {cwd});0
  }0
};0
0
module.exports = async params => {0
  return logPromise(0
    update(params),0
    `Updating checkout ${chalk.yellow.bold(0
      params.cwd0
    )} on branch ${chalk.yellow.bold(params.branch)}}`0
  );0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const {readJson, writeJson} = require('fs-extra');0
const {join} = require('path');0
const semver = require('semver');0
const {execRead, execUnlessDry, logPromise} = require('../utils');0
0
const getReactReconcilerVersion = async cwd => {0
  const path = join(cwd, 'packages', 'react-reconciler', 'package.json');0
  const json = await readJson(path);0
  return json.version;0
};0
0
const update = async ({cwd, dry}) => {0
  const path = join(cwd, 'packages', 'react-noop-renderer', 'package.json');0
  const json = await readJson(path);0
0
  // IMPORTANT: This script must be run after update-package-versions,0
  // Since it depends up the updated react-reconciler version.0
  const reconcilerVersion = await getReactReconcilerVersion(cwd);0
0
  // There is no wildcard for semver that includes prerelease ranges as well.0
  // This causes problems for our Yarn workspaces setup,0
  // Since the noop-renderer depends on react-reconciler.0
  // So we have a special case check for this that ensures semver compatibility.0
  if (semver.prerelease(reconcilerVersion)) {0
    json.dependencies['react-reconciler'] = `* || ${reconcilerVersion}`;0
  } else {0
    json.dependencies['react-reconciler'] = '*';0
  }0
0
  await writeJson(path, json, {spaces: 2});0
0
  const status = await execRead('git status -s', {cwd});0
  if (status) {0
    await execUnlessDry(0
      `git commit -am "Updating dependencies for react-noop-renderer"`,0
      {cwd, dry}0
    );0
  }0
};0
0
module.exports = async params => {0
  return logPromise(update(params), 'Updating noop renderer dependencies');0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const {exec} = require('child-process-promise');0
const {readFileSync, writeFileSync} = require('fs');0
const {readJson, writeJson} = require('fs-extra');0
const {join} = require('path');0
const semver = require('semver');0
const {execUnlessDry, logPromise} = require('../utils');0
0
const update = async ({cwd, dry, packages, version}) => {0
  try {0
    // Update root package.json0
    const packagePath = join(cwd, 'package.json');0
    const rootPackage = await readJson(packagePath);0
    rootPackage.version = version;0
    await writeJson(packagePath, rootPackage, {spaces: 2});0
0
    // Update ReactVersion source file0
    const reactVersionPath = join(cwd, 'packages/shared/ReactVersion.js');0
    const reactVersion = readFileSync(reactVersionPath, 'utf8').replace(0
      /module\.exports = '[^']+';/,0
      `module.exports = '${version}';`0
    );0
    writeFileSync(reactVersionPath, reactVersion);0
0
    // Update renderer versions and peer dependencies0
    const updateProjectPackage = async project => {0
      const path = join(cwd, 'packages', project, 'package.json');0
      const json = await readJson(path);0
      const prerelease = semver.prerelease(version);0
0
      // Unstable packages (eg version < 1.0) are treated specially:0
      // Rather than use the release version (eg 16.1.0)-0
      // We just auto-increment the minor version (eg 0.1.0 -> 0.2.0).0
      // If we're doing a prerelease, we also append the suffix (eg 0.2.0-beta).0
      if (semver.lt(json.version, '1.0.0')) {0
        let suffix = '';0
        if (prerelease) {0
          suffix = `-${prerelease.join('.')}`;0
        }0
0
        // If this is a new pre-release, increment the minor.0
        // Else just increment (or remove) the pre-release suffix.0
        // This way our minor version isn't incremented unnecessarily with each prerelease.0
        const minor = semver.prerelease(json.version)0
          ? semver.minor(json.version)0
          : semver.minor(json.version) + 1;0
0
        json.version = `0.${minor}.0${suffix}`;0
      } else {0
        json.version = version;0
      }0
0
      if (project !== 'react' && json.peerDependencies) {0
        let peerVersion = json.peerDependencies.react.replace('^', '');0
0
        // If the previous release was a pre-release version,0
        // The peer dependency will contain multiple versions, eg "^16.0.0 || 16.3.0-alpha.0"0
        // In this case, assume the first one will be the major and extract it.0
        if (peerVersion.includes(' || ')) {0
          peerVersion = peerVersion.split(' || ')[0];0
        }0
0
        // Release engineers can manually update minor and bugfix versions,0
        // But we should ensure that major versions always match.0
        if (semver.major(version) !== semver.major(peerVersion)) {0
          json.peerDependencies.react = `^${semver.major(version)}.0.0`;0
        } else {0
          json.peerDependencies.react = `^${peerVersion}`;0
        }0
0
        // If this is a prerelease, update the react dependency as well.0
        // A dependency on a major version won't satisfy a prerelease version.0
        // So rather than eg "^16.0.0" we need "^16.0.0 || 16.3.0-alpha.0"0
        if (prerelease) {0
          json.peerDependencies.react += ` || ${version}`;0
        }0
0
        // Update inter-package dependencies as well.0
        // e.g. react-test-renderer depends on react-is0
        if (json.dependencies) {0
          Object.keys(json.dependencies).forEach(dependency => {0
            if (packages.indexOf(dependency) >= 0) {0
              json.dependencies[dependency] = `^${version}`;0
            }0
          });0
        }0
      }0
0
      await writeJson(path, json, {spaces: 2});0
    };0
    await Promise.all(packages.map(updateProjectPackage));0
0
    // Version sanity check0
    await exec('yarn version-check', {cwd});0
0
    await execUnlessDry(0
      `git commit -am "Updating package versions for release ${version}"`,0
      {cwd, dry}0
    );0
  } catch (error) {0
    throw Error(0
      chalk`0
      Failed while updating package versions0
0
      {white ${error.message}}0
    `0
    );0
  }0
};0
0
module.exports = async params => {0
  return logPromise(update(params), 'Updating package versions');0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const {exec} = require('child-process-promise');0
const {dependencies} = require('../config');0
const {execRead, execUnlessDry, logPromise} = require('../utils');0
0
const update = async ({cwd, dry, version}) => {0
  await exec(`yarn upgrade ${dependencies.join(' ')}`, {cwd});0
0
  const modifiedFiles = await execRead('git ls-files -m', {cwd});0
0
  // If yarn.lock has changed we should commit it.0
  // If anything else has changed, it's an error.0
  if (modifiedFiles) {0
    if (modifiedFiles !== 'yarn.lock') {0
      throw Error(0
        chalk`0
        Unexpected modifications0
0
        {white The following files have been modified unexpectedly:}0
        {gray ${modifiedFiles}}0
        `0
      );0
    }0
0
    await execUnlessDry(0
      `git commit -am "Updating yarn.lock file for ${version} release"`,0
      {cwd, dry}0
    );0
  }0
};0
0
module.exports = async params => {0
  return logPromise(update(params), 'Upgrading NPM dependencies');0
};0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const {readJson} = require('fs-extra');0
const {join} = require('path');0
const semver = require('semver');0
0
module.exports = async ({cwd, version}) => {0
  if (!semver.valid(version)) {0
    throw Error('Invalid version specified');0
  }0
0
  const rootPackage = await readJson(join(cwd, 'package.json'));0
0
  if (!semver.gt(version, rootPackage.version)) {0
    throw Error(0
      chalk`Version {white ${rootPackage.version}} has already been published`0
    );0
  }0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const {existsSync} = require('fs');0
const {readJson} = require('fs-extra');0
const {join} = require('path');0
0
module.exports = async ({cwd, version, local}) => {0
  if (local) {0
    return;0
  }0
  const packagePath = join(0
    cwd,0
    'build',0
    'node_modules',0
    'react',0
    'package.json'0
  );0
0
  if (!existsSync(packagePath)) {0
    throw Error('No build found');0
  }0
0
  const packageJson = await readJson(packagePath);0
0
  if (packageJson.version !== version) {0
    throw Error(0
      chalk`Expected version {bold.white ${version}} but found {bold.white ${0
        packageJson.version0
      }}`0
    );0
  }0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const {exec} = require('child-process-promise');0
const {execRead, logPromise} = require('../utils');0
0
const update = async ({cwd, dry, version}) => {0
  const modifiedFiles = await execRead('git ls-files -m', {cwd});0
0
  if (!dry && modifiedFiles.includes('CHANGELOG.md')) {0
    await exec('git add CHANGELOG.md', {cwd});0
    await exec(0
      `git commit -am "Updating CHANGELOG.md for ${version} release"`,0
      {0
        cwd,0
      }0
    );0
  }0
};0
0
module.exports = async params => {0
  return logPromise(update(params), 'Committing CHANGELOG updates');0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const logUpdate = require('log-update');0
const prompt = require('prompt-promise');0
0
module.exports = async params => {0
  logUpdate(chalk`{green ✓} Npm two-factor auth code {gray (or blank)}: `);0
  const otp = await prompt('');0
  prompt.done();0
  logUpdate.clear();0
  return otp.trim() || null;0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const commandLineArgs = require('command-line-args');0
const commandLineUsage = require('command-line-usage');0
const figlet = require('figlet');0
const {paramDefinitions} = require('../config');0
0
module.exports = () => {0
  const params = commandLineArgs(paramDefinitions);0
0
  if (!params.version) {0
    const usage = commandLineUsage([0
      {0
        content: chalk0
          .hex('#61dafb')0
          .bold(figlet.textSync('react', {font: 'Graffiti'})),0
        raw: true,0
      },0
      {0
        content: 'Automated release publishing script.',0
      },0
      {0
        header: 'Options',0
        optionList: paramDefinitions,0
      },0
      {0
        header: 'Examples',0
        content: [0
          {0
            desc: '1. A concise example.',0
            example: '$ ./publish.js [bold]{-v} [underline]{16.0.0}',0
          },0
          {0
            desc: '2. Dry run publish a release candidate.',0
            example:0
              '$ ./publish.js [bold]{--dry} [bold]{-v} [underline]{16.0.0-rc.0}',0
          },0
          {0
            desc: '3. Release from another checkout.',0
            example:0
              '$ ./publish.js [bold]{--version}=[underline]{16.0.0} [bold]{--path}=/path/to/react/repo',0
          },0
        ],0
      },0
    ]);0
    console.log(usage);0
    process.exit(1);0
  }0
0
  return {0
    ...params,0
    cwd: params.path, // For script convenience0
  };0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const semver = require('semver');0
const {getUnexecutedCommands} = require('../utils');0
0
const printSteps = steps => {0
  return steps0
    .filter(Boolean) // Remove no-op steps0
    .map((step, index) => `${index + 1}. ${step}`)0
    .join('\n');0
};0
0
const printSections = sections => {0
  return sections0
    .map((section, index) => {0
      const [title, ...steps] = section;0
0
      return chalk`0
        {bold.underline Step ${index + 1}: ${title}}0
0
        ${printSteps(steps)}0
      `.replace(/\n +/g, '\n');0
    })0
    .join('');0
};0
0
module.exports = ({dry, version}) => {0
  const isPrerelease = semver.prerelease(version);0
0
  const sections = [];0
0
  // Certain follow-up steps are for stable releases only.0
  if (!isPrerelease) {0
    sections.push([0
      'Create GitHub release',0
      chalk`Open new release page: {blue.bold https://github.com/facebook/react/releases/new}`,0
      chalk`Choose {bold ${version}} from the dropdown menu`,0
      chalk`Paste the new release notes from {yellow.bold CHANGELOG.md}`,0
      chalk`Attach all files in {yellow.bold build/dist/*.js} except {yellow.bold react-art.*} to the release.`,0
      chalk`Press {bold "Publish release"}!`,0
    ]);0
0
    sections.push([0
      'Update the version on reactjs.org',0
      chalk`Git clone (or update) {blue.bold https://github.com/reactjs/reactjs.org}`,0
      chalk`Open the {bold.yellow src/site-constants.js} file`,0
      chalk`Update the {bold version} value to {bold ${version}}`,0
      chalk`Open a Pull Request to {bold master}`,0
    ]);0
  }0
0
  sections.push([0
    'Test the new release',0
    chalk`Install CRA: {bold npm i -g create-react-app}`,0
    chalk`Create a test application: {bold create-react-app myapp && cd myapp}`,0
    isPrerelease0
      ? chalk`Install the pre-release versions: {bold yarn add react@next react-dom@next}`0
      : null,0
    chalk`Run the app: {bold yarn start}`,0
  ]);0
0
  sections.push([0
    'Notify the DOM team',0
    chalk`Notify DOM team members: {bold @nhunzaker @jquense @aweary}`,0
  ]);0
0
  console.log(0
    chalk`0
    {green.bold Publish successful!}0
    ${getUnexecutedCommands()}0
    Next there are a couple of manual steps:0
    ${printSections(sections)}0
  `.replace(/\n +/g, '\n')0
  );0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const {readJson} = require('fs-extra');0
const {join} = require('path');0
const semver = require('semver');0
const {execRead, execUnlessDry, logPromise} = require('../utils');0
0
const push = async ({cwd, dry, otp, packages, version, tag}) => {0
  const errors = [];0
  const isPrerelease = semver.prerelease(version);0
  if (tag === undefined) {0
    // No tag was provided. Default to `latest` for stable releases and `next`0
    // for prereleases0
    tag = isPrerelease ? 'next' : 'latest';0
  } else if (tag === 'latest' && isPrerelease) {0
    throw new Error('The tag `latest` can only be used for stable versions.');0
  }0
0
  // Pass two factor auth code if provided:0
  // https://docs.npmjs.com/getting-started/using-two-factor-authentication0
  const twoFactorAuth = otp != null ? `--otp ${otp}` : '';0
0
  const publishProject = async project => {0
    try {0
      const path = join(cwd, 'build', 'node_modules', project);0
      await execUnlessDry(`npm publish --tag ${tag} ${twoFactorAuth}`, {0
        cwd: path,0
        dry,0
      });0
0
      const packagePath = join(0
        cwd,0
        'build',0
        'node_modules',0
        project,0
        'package.json'0
      );0
      const packageJSON = await readJson(packagePath);0
      const packageVersion = packageJSON.version;0
0
      if (!dry) {0
        // Wait a couple of seconds before querying NPM for status;0
        // Anecdotally, querying too soon can result in a false negative.0
        await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 5000));0
0
        const status = JSON.parse(0
          await execRead(`npm info ${project} dist-tags --json`)0
        );0
        const remoteVersion = status[tag];0
0
        // Compare remote version to package.json version,0
        // To better handle the case of pre-release versions.0
        if (remoteVersion !== packageVersion) {0
          throw Error(0
            chalk`Published version {yellow.bold ${packageVersion}} for ` +0
              chalk`{bold ${project}} but NPM shows {yellow.bold ${remoteVersion}}`0
          );0
        }0
0
        // If we've just published a stable release,0
        // Update the @next tag to also point to it (so @next doesn't lag behind).0
        if (!isPrerelease) {0
          await execUnlessDry(0
            `npm dist-tag add ${project}@${packageVersion} next`,0
            {cwd: path, dry}0
          );0
        }0
      }0
    } catch (error) {0
      errors.push(error.stack);0
    }0
  };0
0
  await Promise.all(packages.map(publishProject));0
0
  if (errors.length > 0) {0
    throw Error(0
      chalk`0
      Failure publishing to NPM0
0
      {white ${errors.join('\n\n')}}`0
    );0
  }0
};0
0
module.exports = async params => {0
  return logPromise(push(params), 'Publishing packages to NPM');0
};0
#!/usr/bin/env node0
0
'use strict';0
0
const {execUnlessDry, logPromise} = require('../utils');0
0
const push = async ({cwd, dry}) => {0
  await execUnlessDry('git push', {cwd, dry});0
  await execUnlessDry('git push --tags', {cwd, dry});0
};0
0
module.exports = async params => {0
  if (params.local) {0
    return;0
  }0
  return logPromise(push(params), 'Pushing to git remote');0
};0
'use strict';0
0
const {rollup} = require('rollup');0
const babel = require('rollup-plugin-babel');0
const closure = require('./plugins/closure-plugin');0
const commonjs = require('rollup-plugin-commonjs');0
const prettier = require('rollup-plugin-prettier');0
const replace = require('rollup-plugin-replace');0
const stripBanner = require('rollup-plugin-strip-banner');0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const path = require('path');0
const resolve = require('rollup-plugin-node-resolve');0
const fs = require('fs');0
const argv = require('minimist')(process.argv.slice(2));0
const Modules = require('./modules');0
const Bundles = require('./bundles');0
const Stats = require('./stats');0
const Sync = require('./sync');0
const sizes = require('./plugins/sizes-plugin');0
const useForks = require('./plugins/use-forks-plugin');0
const extractErrorCodes = require('../error-codes/extract-errors');0
const Packaging = require('./packaging');0
const {asyncCopyTo, asyncRimRaf} = require('./utils');0
const codeFrame = require('babel-code-frame');0
const Wrappers = require('./wrappers');0
0
// Errors in promises should be fatal.0
let loggedErrors = new Set();0
process.on('unhandledRejection', err => {0
  if (loggedErrors.has(err)) {0
    // No need to print it twice.0
    process.exit(1);0
  }0
  throw err;0
});0
0
const {0
  UMD_DEV,0
  UMD_PROD,0
  NODE_DEV,0
  NODE_PROD,0
  NODE_PROFILING,0
  FB_WWW_DEV,0
  FB_WWW_PROD,0
  RN_OSS_DEV,0
  RN_OSS_PROD,0
  RN_OSS_PROFILING,0
  RN_FB_DEV,0
  RN_FB_PROD,0
} = Bundles.bundleTypes;0
0
const requestedBundleTypes = (argv.type || '')0
  .split(',')0
  .map(type => type.toUpperCase());0
const requestedBundleNames = (argv._[0] || '')0
  .split(',')0
  .map(type => type.toLowerCase());0
const forcePrettyOutput = argv.pretty;0
const syncFBSourcePath = argv['sync-fbsource'];0
const syncWWWPath = argv['sync-www'];0
const shouldExtractErrors = argv['extract-errors'];0
const errorCodeOpts = {0
  errorMapFilePath: 'scripts/error-codes/codes.json',0
};0
0
const closureOptions = {0
  compilation_level: 'SIMPLE',0
  language_in: 'ECMASCRIPT5_STRICT',0
  language_out: 'ECMASCRIPT5_STRICT',0
  env: 'CUSTOM',0
  warning_level: 'QUIET',0
  apply_input_source_maps: false,0
  use_types_for_optimization: false,0
  process_common_js_modules: false,0
  rewrite_polyfills: false,0
};0
0
function getBabelConfig(updateBabelOptions, bundleType, filename) {0
  let options = {0
    exclude: '/**/node_modules/**',0
    presets: [],0
    plugins: [],0
  };0
  if (updateBabelOptions) {0
    options = updateBabelOptions(options);0
  }0
  switch (bundleType) {0
    case FB_WWW_DEV:0
    case FB_WWW_PROD:0
      return Object.assign({}, options, {0
        plugins: options.plugins.concat([0
          // Minify invariant messages0
          require('../error-codes/replace-invariant-error-codes'),0
          // Wrap warning() calls in a __DEV__ check so they are stripped from production.0
          require('../babel/wrap-warning-with-env-check'),0
        ]),0
      });0
    case RN_OSS_DEV:0
    case RN_OSS_PROD:0
    case RN_OSS_PROFILING:0
    case RN_FB_DEV:0
    case RN_FB_PROD:0
      return Object.assign({}, options, {0
        plugins: options.plugins.concat([0
          // Wrap warning() calls in a __DEV__ check so they are stripped from production.0
          require('../babel/wrap-warning-with-env-check'),0
        ]),0
      });0
    case UMD_DEV:0
    case UMD_PROD:0
    case NODE_DEV:0
    case NODE_PROD:0
    case NODE_PROFILING:0
      return Object.assign({}, options, {0
        plugins: options.plugins.concat([0
          // Use object-assign polyfill in open source0
          path.resolve('./scripts/babel/transform-object-assign-require'),0
          // Minify invariant messages0
          require('../error-codes/replace-invariant-error-codes'),0
          // Wrap warning() calls in a __DEV__ check so they are stripped from production.0
          require('../babel/wrap-warning-with-env-check'),0
        ]),0
      });0
    default:0
      return options;0
  }0
}0
0
function getRollupOutputOptions(0
  outputPath,0
  format,0
  globals,0
  globalName,0
  bundleType0
) {0
  const isProduction = isProductionBundleType(bundleType);0
0
  return Object.assign(0
    {},0
    {0
      file: outputPath,0
      format,0
      globals,0
      freeze: !isProduction,0
      interop: false,0
      name: globalName,0
      sourcemap: false,0
    }0
  );0
}0
0
function getFormat(bundleType) {0
  switch (bundleType) {0
    case UMD_DEV:0
    case UMD_PROD:0
      return `umd`;0
    case NODE_DEV:0
    case NODE_PROD:0
    case NODE_PROFILING:0
    case FB_WWW_DEV:0
    case FB_WWW_PROD:0
    case RN_OSS_DEV:0
    case RN_OSS_PROD:0
    case RN_OSS_PROFILING:0
    case RN_FB_DEV:0
    case RN_FB_PROD:0
      return `cjs`;0
  }0
}0
0
function getFilename(name, globalName, bundleType) {0
  // we do this to replace / to -, for react-dom/server0
  name = name.replace('/', '-');0
  switch (bundleType) {0
    case UMD_DEV:0
      return `${name}.development.js`;0
    case UMD_PROD:0
      return `${name}.production.min.js`;0
    case NODE_DEV:0
      return `${name}.development.js`;0
    case NODE_PROD:0
      return `${name}.production.min.js`;0
    case NODE_PROFILING:0
      return `${name}.profiling.min.js`;0
    case FB_WWW_DEV:0
    case RN_OSS_DEV:0
    case RN_FB_DEV:0
      return `${globalName}-dev.js`;0
    case FB_WWW_PROD:0
    case RN_OSS_PROD:0
    case RN_FB_PROD:0
      return `${globalName}-prod.js`;0
    case RN_OSS_PROFILING:0
      return `${globalName}-profiling.js`;0
  }0
}0
0
function isProductionBundleType(bundleType) {0
  switch (bundleType) {0
    case UMD_DEV:0
    case NODE_DEV:0
    case FB_WWW_DEV:0
    case RN_OSS_DEV:0
    case RN_FB_DEV:0
      return false;0
    case UMD_PROD:0
    case NODE_PROD:0
    case NODE_PROFILING:0
    case FB_WWW_PROD:0
    case RN_OSS_PROD:0
    case RN_OSS_PROFILING:0
    case RN_FB_PROD:0
      return true;0
    default:0
      throw new Error(`Unknown type: ${bundleType}`);0
  }0
}0
0
function isProfilingBundleType(bundleType) {0
  switch (bundleType) {0
    case FB_WWW_DEV:0
    case FB_WWW_PROD:0
    case NODE_DEV:0
    case NODE_PROD:0
    case RN_FB_DEV:0
    case RN_FB_PROD:0
    case RN_OSS_DEV:0
    case RN_OSS_PROD:0
    case UMD_DEV:0
    case UMD_PROD:0
      return false;0
    case NODE_PROFILING:0
    case RN_OSS_PROFILING:0
      return true;0
    default:0
      throw new Error(`Unknown type: ${bundleType}`);0
  }0
}0
0
function blacklistFBJS() {0
  return {0
    name: 'blacklistFBJS',0
    resolveId(importee, importer) {0
      if (/^fbjs\//.test(importee)) {0
        throw new Error(0
          `Don't import ${importee} (found in ${importer}). ` +0
            `Use the utilities in packages/shared/ instead.`0
        );0
      }0
    },0
  };0
}0
0
function getPlugins(0
  entry,0
  externals,0
  updateBabelOptions,0
  filename,0
  packageName,0
  bundleType,0
  globalName,0
  moduleType,0
  modulesToStub0
) {0
  const findAndRecordErrorCodes = extractErrorCodes(errorCodeOpts);0
  const forks = Modules.getForks(bundleType, entry, moduleType);0
  const isProduction = isProductionBundleType(bundleType);0
  const isProfiling = isProfilingBundleType(bundleType);0
  const isUMDBundle = bundleType === UMD_DEV || bundleType === UMD_PROD;0
  const isFBBundle = bundleType === FB_WWW_DEV || bundleType === FB_WWW_PROD;0
  const isRNBundle =0
    bundleType === RN_OSS_DEV ||0
    bundleType === RN_OSS_PROD ||0
    bundleType === RN_OSS_PROFILING ||0
    bundleType === RN_FB_DEV ||0
    bundleType === RN_FB_PROD;0
  const shouldStayReadable = isFBBundle || isRNBundle || forcePrettyOutput;0
  return [0
    // Extract error codes from invariant() messages into a file.0
    shouldExtractErrors && {0
      transform(source) {0
        findAndRecordErrorCodes(source);0
        return source;0
      },0
    },0
    // Shim any modules that need forking in this environment.0
    useForks(forks),0
    // Ensure we don't try to bundle any fbjs modules.0
    blacklistFBJS(),0
    // Use Node resolution mechanism.0
    resolve({0
      skip: externals,0
    }),0
    // Remove license headers from individual modules0
    stripBanner({0
      exclude: 'node_modules/**/*',0
    }),0
    // Compile to ES5.0
    babel(getBabelConfig(updateBabelOptions, bundleType)),0
    // Remove 'use strict' from individual source files.0
    {0
      transform(source) {0
        return source.replace(/['"]use strict['"']/g, '');0
      },0
    },0
    // Turn __DEV__ and process.env checks into constants.0
    replace({0
      __DEV__: isProduction ? 'false' : 'true',0
      __PROFILE__: isProfiling || !isProduction ? 'true' : 'false',0
      'process.env.NODE_ENV': isProduction ? "'production'" : "'development'",0
    }),0
    // We still need CommonJS for external deps like object-assign.0
    commonjs(),0
    // www still needs require('React') rather than require('react')0
    isFBBundle && {0
      transformBundle(source) {0
        return source0
          .replace(/require\(['"]react['"]\)/g, "require('React')")0
          .replace(/require\(['"]react-is['"]\)/g, "require('ReactIs')");0
      },0
    },0
    // Apply dead code elimination and/or minification.0
    isProduction &&0
      closure(0
        Object.assign({}, closureOptions, {0
          // Don't let it create global variables in the browser.0
          // https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/109090
          assume_function_wrapper: !isUMDBundle,0
          // Works because `google-closure-compiler-js` is forked in Yarn lockfile.0
          // We can remove this if GCC merges my PR:0
          // https://github.com/google/closure-compiler/pull/27070
          // and then the compiled version is released via `google-closure-compiler-js`.0
          renaming: !shouldStayReadable,0
        })0
      ),0
    // Add the whitespace back if necessary.0
    shouldStayReadable && prettier(),0
    // License and haste headers, top-level `if` blocks.0
    {0
      transformBundle(source) {0
        return Wrappers.wrapBundle(0
          source,0
          bundleType,0
          globalName,0
          filename,0
          moduleType0
        );0
      },0
    },0
    // Record bundle size.0
    sizes({0
      getSize: (size, gzip) => {0
        const currentSizes = Stats.currentBuildResults.bundleSizes;0
        const recordIndex = currentSizes.findIndex(0
          record =>0
            record.filename === filename && record.bundleType === bundleType0
        );0
        const index = recordIndex !== -1 ? recordIndex : currentSizes.length;0
        currentSizes[index] = {0
          filename,0
          bundleType,0
          packageName,0
          size,0
          gzip,0
        };0
      },0
    }),0
  ].filter(Boolean);0
}0
0
function shouldSkipBundle(bundle, bundleType) {0
  const shouldSkipBundleType = bundle.bundleTypes.indexOf(bundleType) === -1;0
  if (shouldSkipBundleType) {0
    return true;0
  }0
  if (requestedBundleTypes.length > 0) {0
    const isAskingForDifferentType = requestedBundleTypes.every(0
      requestedType => bundleType.indexOf(requestedType) === -10
    );0
    if (isAskingForDifferentType) {0
      return true;0
    }0
  }0
  if (requestedBundleNames.length > 0) {0
    const isAskingForDifferentNames = requestedBundleNames.every(0
      requestedName => bundle.label.indexOf(requestedName) === -10
    );0
    if (isAskingForDifferentNames) {0
      return true;0
    }0
  }0
  return false;0
}0
0
async function createBundle(bundle, bundleType) {0
  if (shouldSkipBundle(bundle, bundleType)) {0
    return;0
  }0
0
  const filename = getFilename(bundle.entry, bundle.global, bundleType);0
  const logKey =0
    chalk.white.bold(filename) + chalk.dim(` (${bundleType.toLowerCase()})`);0
  const format = getFormat(bundleType);0
  const packageName = Packaging.getPackageName(bundle.entry);0
0
  let resolvedEntry = require.resolve(bundle.entry);0
  if (bundleType === FB_WWW_DEV || bundleType === FB_WWW_PROD) {0
    const resolvedFBEntry = resolvedEntry.replace('.js', '.fb.js');0
    if (fs.existsSync(resolvedFBEntry)) {0
      resolvedEntry = resolvedFBEntry;0
    }0
  }0
0
  const shouldBundleDependencies =0
    bundleType === UMD_DEV || bundleType === UMD_PROD;0
  const peerGlobals = Modules.getPeerGlobals(bundle.externals, bundleType);0
  let externals = Object.keys(peerGlobals);0
  if (!shouldBundleDependencies) {0
    const deps = Modules.getDependencies(bundleType, bundle.entry);0
    externals = externals.concat(deps);0
  }0
0
  const importSideEffects = Modules.getImportSideEffects();0
  const pureExternalModules = Object.keys(importSideEffects).filter(0
    module => !importSideEffects[module]0
  );0
0
  const rollupConfig = {0
    input: resolvedEntry,0
    treeshake: {0
      pureExternalModules,0
    },0
    external(id) {0
      const containsThisModule = pkg => id === pkg || id.startsWith(pkg + '/');0
      const isProvidedByDependency = externals.some(containsThisModule);0
      if (!shouldBundleDependencies && isProvidedByDependency) {0
        return true;0
      }0
      return !!peerGlobals[id];0
    },0
    onwarn: handleRollupWarning,0
    plugins: getPlugins(0
      bundle.entry,0
      externals,0
      bundle.babel,0
      filename,0
      packageName,0
      bundleType,0
      bundle.global,0
      bundle.moduleType,0
      bundle.modulesToStub0
    ),0
    // We can't use getters in www.0
    legacy: bundleType === FB_WWW_DEV || bundleType === FB_WWW_PROD,0
  };0
  const [mainOutputPath, ...otherOutputPaths] = Packaging.getBundleOutputPaths(0
    bundleType,0
    filename,0
    packageName0
  );0
  const rollupOutputOptions = getRollupOutputOptions(0
    mainOutputPath,0
    format,0
    peerGlobals,0
    bundle.global,0
    bundleType0
  );0
0
  console.log(`${chalk.bgYellow.black(' BUILDING ')} ${logKey}`);0
  try {0
    const result = await rollup(rollupConfig);0
    await result.write(rollupOutputOptions);0
  } catch (error) {0
    console.log(`${chalk.bgRed.black(' OH NOES! ')} ${logKey}\n`);0
    handleRollupError(error);0
    throw error;0
  }0
  for (let i = 0; i < otherOutputPaths.length; i++) {0
    await asyncCopyTo(mainOutputPath, otherOutputPaths[i]);0
  }0
  console.log(`${chalk.bgGreen.black(' COMPLETE ')} ${logKey}\n`);0
}0
0
function handleRollupWarning(warning) {0
  if (warning.code === 'UNUSED_EXTERNAL_IMPORT') {0
    const match = warning.message.match(/external module '([^']+)'/);0
    if (!match || typeof match[1] !== 'string') {0
      throw new Error(0
        'Could not parse a Rollup warning. ' + 'Fix this method.'0
      );0
    }0
    const importSideEffects = Modules.getImportSideEffects();0
    const externalModule = match[1];0
    if (typeof importSideEffects[externalModule] !== 'boolean') {0
      throw new Error(0
        'An external module "' +0
          externalModule +0
          '" is used in a DEV-only code path ' +0
          'but we do not know if it is safe to omit an unused require() to it in production. ' +0
          'Please add it to the `importSideEffects` list in `scripts/rollup/modules.js`.'0
      );0
    }0
    // Don't warn. We will remove side effectless require() in a later pass.0
    return;0
  }0
0
  if (typeof warning.code === 'string') {0
    // This is a warning coming from Rollup itself.0
    // These tend to be important (e.g. clashes in namespaced exports)0
    // so we'll fail the build on any of them.0
    console.error();0
    console.error(warning.message || warning);0
    console.error();0
    process.exit(1);0
  } else {0
    // The warning is from one of the plugins.0
    // Maybe it's not important, so just print it.0
    console.warn(warning.message || warning);0
  }0
}0
0
function handleRollupError(error) {0
  loggedErrors.add(error);0
  if (!error.code) {0
    console.error(error);0
    return;0
  }0
  console.error(0
    `\x1b[31m-- ${error.code}${error.plugin ? ` (${error.plugin})` : ''} --`0
  );0
  console.error(error.stack);0
  if (error.loc && error.loc.file) {0
    const {file, line, column} = error.loc;0
    // This looks like an error from Rollup, e.g. missing export.0
    // We'll use the accurate line numbers provided by Rollup but0
    // use Babel code frame because it looks nicer.0
    const rawLines = fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf-8');0
    // column + 1 is required due to rollup counting column start position from 00
    // whereas babel-code-frame counts from 10
    const frame = codeFrame(rawLines, line, column + 1, {0
      highlightCode: true,0
    });0
    console.error(frame);0
  } else if (error.codeFrame) {0
    // This looks like an error from a plugin (e.g. Babel).0
    // In this case we'll resort to displaying the provided code frame0
    // because we can't be sure the reported location is accurate.0
    console.error(error.codeFrame);0
  }0
}0
0
async function buildEverything() {0
  await asyncRimRaf('build');0
0
  // Run them serially for better console output0
  // and to avoid any potential race conditions.0
  // eslint-disable-next-line no-for-of-loops/no-for-of-loops0
  for (const bundle of Bundles.bundles) {0
    await createBundle(bundle, UMD_DEV);0
    await createBundle(bundle, UMD_PROD);0
    await createBundle(bundle, NODE_DEV);0
    await createBundle(bundle, NODE_PROD);0
    await createBundle(bundle, NODE_PROFILING);0
    await createBundle(bundle, FB_WWW_DEV);0
    await createBundle(bundle, FB_WWW_PROD);0
    await createBundle(bundle, RN_OSS_DEV);0
    await createBundle(bundle, RN_OSS_PROD);0
    await createBundle(bundle, RN_OSS_PROFILING);0
    await createBundle(bundle, RN_FB_DEV);0
    await createBundle(bundle, RN_FB_PROD);0
  }0
0
  await Packaging.copyAllShims();0
  await Packaging.prepareNpmPackages();0
0
  if (syncFBSourcePath) {0
    await Sync.syncReactNative(syncFBSourcePath);0
  } else if (syncWWWPath) {0
    await Sync.syncReactDom('build/facebook-www', syncWWWPath);0
  }0
0
  console.log(Stats.printResults());0
  if (!forcePrettyOutput) {0
    Stats.saveResults();0
  }0
0
  if (shouldExtractErrors) {0
    console.warn(0
      '\nWarning: this build was created with --extract-errors enabled.\n' +0
        'this will result in extremely slow builds and should only be\n' +0
        'used when the error map needs to be rebuilt.\n'0
    );0
  }0
}0
0
buildEverything();0
'use strict';0
0
const bundleTypes = {0
  UMD_DEV: 'UMD_DEV',0
  UMD_PROD: 'UMD_PROD',0
  NODE_DEV: 'NODE_DEV',0
  NODE_PROD: 'NODE_PROD',0
  NODE_PROFILING: 'NODE_PROFILING',0
  FB_WWW_DEV: 'FB_WWW_DEV',0
  FB_WWW_PROD: 'FB_WWW_PROD',0
  RN_OSS_DEV: 'RN_OSS_DEV',0
  RN_OSS_PROD: 'RN_OSS_PROD',0
  RN_OSS_PROFILING: 'RN_OSS_PROFILING',0
  RN_FB_DEV: 'RN_FB_DEV',0
  RN_FB_PROD: 'RN_FB_PROD',0
};0
0
const UMD_DEV = bundleTypes.UMD_DEV;0
const UMD_PROD = bundleTypes.UMD_PROD;0
const NODE_DEV = bundleTypes.NODE_DEV;0
const NODE_PROD = bundleTypes.NODE_PROD;0
const NODE_PROFILING = bundleTypes.NODE_PROFILING;0
const FB_WWW_DEV = bundleTypes.FB_WWW_DEV;0
const FB_WWW_PROD = bundleTypes.FB_WWW_PROD;0
const RN_OSS_DEV = bundleTypes.RN_OSS_DEV;0
const RN_OSS_PROD = bundleTypes.RN_OSS_PROD;0
const RN_OSS_PROFILING = bundleTypes.RN_OSS_PROFILING;0
const RN_FB_DEV = bundleTypes.RN_FB_DEV;0
const RN_FB_PROD = bundleTypes.RN_FB_PROD;0
0
const moduleTypes = {0
  ISOMORPHIC: 'ISOMORPHIC',0
  RENDERER: 'RENDERER',0
  RENDERER_UTILS: 'RENDERER_UTILS',0
  RECONCILER: 'RECONCILER',0
  NON_FIBER_RENDERER: 'NON_FIBER_RENDERER',0
};0
0
// React0
const ISOMORPHIC = moduleTypes.ISOMORPHIC;0
// Individual renderers. They bundle the reconciler. (e.g. ReactDOM)0
const RENDERER = moduleTypes.RENDERER;0
// Helper packages that access specific renderer's internals. (e.g. TestUtils)0
const RENDERER_UTILS = moduleTypes.RENDERER_UTILS;0
// Standalone reconciler for third-party renderers.0
const RECONCILER = moduleTypes.RECONCILER;0
// Non-Fiber implementations like SSR and Shallow renderers.0
const NON_FIBER_RENDERER = moduleTypes.NON_FIBER_RENDERER;0
0
const bundles = [0
  /******* Isomorphic *******/0
  {0
    label: 'core',0
    bundleTypes: [0
      UMD_DEV,0
      UMD_PROD,0
      NODE_DEV,0
      NODE_PROD,0
      FB_WWW_DEV,0
      FB_WWW_PROD,0
    ],0
    moduleType: ISOMORPHIC,0
    entry: 'react',0
    global: 'React',0
    externals: [],0
  },0
0
  /******* React DOM *******/0
  {0
    label: 'dom-client',0
    bundleTypes: [0
      UMD_DEV,0
      UMD_PROD,0
      NODE_DEV,0
      NODE_PROD,0
      NODE_PROFILING,0
      FB_WWW_DEV,0
      FB_WWW_PROD,0
    ],0
    moduleType: RENDERER,0
    entry: 'react-dom',0
    global: 'ReactDOM',0
    externals: ['react'],0
  },0
0
  //******* Test Utils *******/0
  {0
    label: 'dom-test-utils',0
    moduleType: RENDERER_UTILS,0
    bundleTypes: [FB_WWW_DEV, NODE_DEV, NODE_PROD, UMD_DEV, UMD_PROD],0
    entry: 'react-dom/test-utils',0
    global: 'ReactTestUtils',0
    externals: ['react', 'react-dom'],0
  },0
0
  /* React DOM internals required for react-native-web (e.g., to shim native events from react-dom) */0
  {0
    label: 'dom-unstable-native-dependencies',0
    bundleTypes: [0
      UMD_DEV,0
      UMD_PROD,0
      NODE_DEV,0
      NODE_PROD,0
      FB_WWW_DEV,0
      FB_WWW_PROD,0
    ],0
    moduleType: RENDERER_UTILS,0

    // public package though.0
