// Based on deep-freeze by substack (public domain)0
function deepFreeze(o) {0
  Object.freeze(o);0
  Object.getOwnPropertyNames(o).forEach(function(prop) {0
    if (0
      o[prop] !== null &&0
      (typeof o[prop] === 'object' || typeof o[prop] === 'function') &&0
      !Object.isFrozen(o[prop])0
    ) {0
      deepFreeze(o[prop]);0
    }0
  });0
  return o;0
}0
0
// Don't accidentally mutate config as part of the build0
deepFreeze(bundles);0
0
module.exports = {0
  bundleTypes,0
  moduleTypes,0
  bundles,0
};0
'use strict';0
0
const bundleTypes = require('./bundles').bundleTypes;0
const moduleTypes = require('./bundles').moduleTypes;0
const inlinedHostConfigs = require('../shared/inlinedHostConfigs');0
0
const UMD_DEV = bundleTypes.UMD_DEV;0
const UMD_PROD = bundleTypes.UMD_PROD;0
const FB_WWW_DEV = bundleTypes.FB_WWW_DEV;0
const FB_WWW_PROD = bundleTypes.FB_WWW_PROD;0
const RN_OSS_DEV = bundleTypes.RN_OSS_DEV;0
const RN_OSS_PROD = bundleTypes.RN_OSS_PROD;0
const RN_OSS_PROFILING = bundleTypes.RN_OSS_PROFILING;0
const RN_FB_DEV = bundleTypes.RN_FB_DEV;0
const RN_FB_PROD = bundleTypes.RN_FB_PROD;0
const RENDERER = moduleTypes.RENDERER;0
const RECONCILER = moduleTypes.RECONCILER;0
0
// If you need to replace a file with another file for a specific environment,0
// add it to this list with the logic for choosing the right replacement.0
const forks = Object.freeze({0
  // Optimization: for UMDs, use object-assign polyfill that is already a part0
  // of the React package instead of bundling it again.0
  'object-assign': (bundleType, entry, dependencies) => {0
    if (bundleType !== UMD_DEV && bundleType !== UMD_PROD) {0
      // It's only relevant for UMD bundles since that's where the duplication0
      // happens. Other bundles just require('object-assign') anyway.0
      return null;0
    }0
    if (dependencies.indexOf('react') === -1) {0
      // We can only apply the optimizations to bundle that depend on React0
      // because we read assign() from an object exposed on React internals.0
      return null;0
    }0
    // We can use the fork!0
    return 'shared/forks/object-assign.umd.js';0
  },0
0
  // We have a few forks for different environments.0
  'shared/ReactFeatureFlags': (bundleType, entry) => {0
    switch (entry) {0
      case 'react-native-renderer':0
        switch (bundleType) {0
          case RN_FB_DEV:0
          case RN_FB_PROD:0
            return 'shared/forks/ReactFeatureFlags.native-fb.js';0
          case RN_OSS_DEV:0
          case RN_OSS_PROD:0
          case RN_OSS_PROFILING:0
            return 'shared/forks/ReactFeatureFlags.native-oss.js';0
          default:0
            throw Error(0
              `Unexpected entry (${entry}) and bundleType (${bundleType})`0
            );0
        }0
      case 'react-native-renderer/fabric':0
        switch (bundleType) {0
          case RN_FB_DEV:0
          case RN_FB_PROD:0
            return 'shared/forks/ReactFeatureFlags.native-fabric-fb.js';0
          case RN_OSS_DEV:0
          case RN_OSS_PROD:0
          case RN_OSS_PROFILING:0
            return 'shared/forks/ReactFeatureFlags.native-fabric-oss.js';0
          default:0
            throw Error(0
              `Unexpected entry (${entry}) and bundleType (${bundleType})`0
            );0
        }0
      case 'react-reconciler/persistent':0
        return 'shared/forks/ReactFeatureFlags.persistent.js';0
      case 'react-test-renderer':0
        return 'shared/forks/ReactFeatureFlags.test-renderer.js';0
      default:0
        switch (bundleType) {0
          case FB_WWW_DEV:0
          case FB_WWW_PROD:0
            return 'shared/forks/ReactFeatureFlags.www.js';0
        }0
    }0
    return null;0
  },0
0
  'shared/ReactScheduler': (bundleType, entry) => {0
    switch (bundleType) {0
      case FB_WWW_DEV:0
      case FB_WWW_PROD:0
        return 'shared/forks/ReactScheduler.www.js';0
      default:0
        return null;0
    }0
  },0
0
  // This logic is forked on www to fork the formatting function.0
  'shared/invariant': (bundleType, entry) => {0
    switch (bundleType) {0
      case FB_WWW_DEV:0
      case FB_WWW_PROD:0
        return 'shared/forks/invariant.www.js';0
      default:0
        return null;0
    }0
  },0
0
  // This logic is forked on www to blacklist warnings.0
  'shared/lowPriorityWarning': (bundleType, entry) => {0
    switch (bundleType) {0
      case FB_WWW_DEV:0
      case FB_WWW_PROD:0
        return 'shared/forks/lowPriorityWarning.www.js';0
      default:0
        return null;0
    }0
  },0
0
  // This logic is forked on www to blacklist warnings.0
  'shared/warning': (bundleType, entry) => {0
    switch (bundleType) {0
      case FB_WWW_DEV:0
      case FB_WWW_PROD:0
        return 'shared/forks/warning.www.js';0
      default:0
        return null;0
    }0
  },0
0
  // In FB bundles, we preserve an inline require to ReactCurrentOwner.0
  // See the explanation in FB version of ReactCurrentOwner in www:0
  'react/src/ReactCurrentOwner': (bundleType, entry) => {0
    switch (bundleType) {0
      case FB_WWW_DEV:0
      case FB_WWW_PROD:0
        return 'react/src/forks/ReactCurrentOwner.www.js';0
      default:0
        return null;0
    }0
  },0
0
  // Different wrapping/reporting for caught errors.0
  'shared/invokeGuardedCallback': (bundleType, entry) => {0
    switch (bundleType) {0
      case FB_WWW_DEV:0
      case FB_WWW_PROD:0
        return 'shared/forks/invokeGuardedCallback.www.js';0
      default:0
        return null;0
    }0
  },0
0
  // Different dialogs for caught errors.0
  'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiberErrorDialog': (bundleType, entry) => {0
    switch (bundleType) {0
      case FB_WWW_DEV:0
      case FB_WWW_PROD:0
        // Use the www fork which shows an error dialog.0
        return 'react-reconciler/src/forks/ReactFiberErrorDialog.www.js';0
      case RN_OSS_DEV:0
      case RN_OSS_PROD:0
      case RN_OSS_PROFILING:0
      case RN_FB_DEV:0
      case RN_FB_PROD:0
        switch (entry) {0
          case 'react-native-renderer':0
          case 'react-native-renderer/fabric':0
            // Use the RN fork which plays well with redbox.0
            return 'react-reconciler/src/forks/ReactFiberErrorDialog.native.js';0
          default:0
            return null;0
        }0
      default:0
        return null;0
    }0
  },0
0
  'react-reconciler/src/ReactFiberHostConfig': (0
    bundleType,0
    entry,0
    dependencies,0
    moduleType0
  ) => {0
    if (dependencies.indexOf('react-reconciler') !== -1) {0
      return null;0
    }0
    if (moduleType !== RENDERER && moduleType !== RECONCILER) {0
      return null;0
    }0
    // eslint-disable-next-line no-for-of-loops/no-for-of-loops0
    for (let rendererInfo of inlinedHostConfigs) {0
      if (rendererInfo.entryPoints.indexOf(entry) !== -1) {0
        return `react-reconciler/src/forks/ReactFiberHostConfig.${0
          rendererInfo.shortName0
        }.js`;0
      }0
    }0
    throw new Error(0
      'Expected ReactFiberHostConfig to always be replaced with a shim, but ' +0
        `found no mention of "${entry}" entry point in ./scripts/shared/inlinedHostConfigs.js. ` +0
        'Did you mean to add it there to associate it with a specific renderer?'0
    );0
  },0
0
  // We wrap top-level listeners into guards on www.0
  'react-dom/src/events/EventListener': (bundleType, entry) => {0
    switch (bundleType) {0
      case FB_WWW_DEV:0
      case FB_WWW_PROD:0
        // Use the www fork which is integrated with TimeSlice profiling.0
        return 'react-dom/src/events/forks/EventListener-www.js';0
      default:0
        return null;0
    }0
  },0
0
  // React DOM uses different top level event names and supports mouse events.0
  'events/ResponderTopLevelEventTypes': (bundleType, entry) => {0
    if (entry === 'react-dom' || entry.startsWith('react-dom/')) {0
      return 'events/forks/ResponderTopLevelEventTypes.dom.js';0
    }0
    return null;0
  },0
});0
0
module.exports = forks;0
'use strict';0
0
const forks = require('./forks');0
const bundleTypes = require('./bundles').bundleTypes;0
0
const UMD_DEV = bundleTypes.UMD_DEV;0
const UMD_PROD = bundleTypes.UMD_PROD;0
0
// For any external that is used in a DEV-only condition, explicitly0
// specify whether it has side effects during import or not. This lets0
// us know whether we can safely omit them when they are unused.0
const HAS_NO_SIDE_EFFECTS_ON_IMPORT = false;0
// const HAS_SIDE_EFFECTS_ON_IMPORT = true;0
const importSideEffects = Object.freeze({0
  'prop-types/checkPropTypes': HAS_NO_SIDE_EFFECTS_ON_IMPORT,0
  deepFreezeAndThrowOnMutationInDev: HAS_NO_SIDE_EFFECTS_ON_IMPORT,0
});0
0
// Bundles exporting globals that other modules rely on.0
const knownGlobals = Object.freeze({0
  react: 'React',0
  'react-dom': 'ReactDOM',0
});0
0
// Given ['react'] in bundle externals, returns { 'react': 'React' }.0
function getPeerGlobals(externals, bundleType) {0
  const peerGlobals = {};0
  externals.forEach(name => {0
    if (0
      !knownGlobals[name] &&0
      (bundleType === UMD_DEV || bundleType === UMD_PROD)0
    ) {0
      throw new Error('Cannot build UMD without a global name for: ' + name);0
    }0
    peerGlobals[name] = knownGlobals[name];0
  });0
  return peerGlobals;0
}0
0
// Determines node_modules packages that are safe to assume will exist.0
function getDependencies(bundleType, entry) {0
  // Replaces any part of the entry that follow the package name (like0
  // "/server" in "react-dom/server") by the path to the package settings0
  const packageJson = require(entry.replace(/(\/.*)?$/, '/package.json'));0
  // Both deps and peerDeps are assumed as accessible.0
  return Array.from(0
    new Set([0
      ...Object.keys(packageJson.dependencies || {}),0
      ...Object.keys(packageJson.peerDependencies || {}),0
    ])0
  );0
}0
0
// Hijacks some modules for optimization and integration reasons.0
function getForks(bundleType, entry, moduleType) {0
  const forksForBundle = {};0
  Object.keys(forks).forEach(srcModule => {0
    const dependencies = getDependencies(bundleType, entry);0
    const targetModule = forks[srcModule](0
      bundleType,0
      entry,0
      dependencies,0
      moduleType0
    );0
    if (targetModule === null) {0
      return;0
    }0
    forksForBundle[srcModule] = targetModule;0
  });0
  return forksForBundle;0
}0
0
function getImportSideEffects() {0
  return importSideEffects;0
}0
0
module.exports = {0
  getImportSideEffects,0
  getPeerGlobals,0
  getDependencies,0
  getForks,0
};0
'use strict';0
0
const {existsSync, readdirSync, unlinkSync} = require('fs');0
const Bundles = require('./bundles');0
const {0
  asyncCopyTo,0
  asyncExecuteCommand,0
  asyncExtractTar,0
  asyncRimRaf,0
} = require('./utils');0
0
const {0
  UMD_DEV,0
  UMD_PROD,0
  NODE_DEV,0
  NODE_PROD,0
  NODE_PROFILING,0
  FB_WWW_DEV,0
  FB_WWW_PROD,0
  RN_OSS_DEV,0
  RN_OSS_PROD,0
  RN_OSS_PROFILING,0
  RN_FB_DEV,0
  RN_FB_PROD,0
} = Bundles.bundleTypes;0
0
function getPackageName(name) {0
  if (name.indexOf('/') !== -1) {0
    return name.split('/')[0];0
  }0
  return name;0
}0
0
function getBundleOutputPaths(bundleType, filename, packageName) {0
  switch (bundleType) {0
    case NODE_DEV:0
    case NODE_PROD:0
    case NODE_PROFILING:0
      return [`build/node_modules/${packageName}/cjs/${filename}`];0
    case UMD_DEV:0
    case UMD_PROD:0
      return [0
        `build/node_modules/${packageName}/umd/${filename}`,0
        `build/dist/${filename}`,0
      ];0
    case FB_WWW_DEV:0
    case FB_WWW_PROD:0
      return [`build/facebook-www/${filename}`];0
    case RN_OSS_DEV:0
    case RN_OSS_PROD:0
    case RN_OSS_PROFILING:0
      switch (packageName) {0
        case 'react-native-renderer':0
          return [`build/react-native/oss/${filename}`];0
        default:0
          throw new Error('Unknown RN package.');0
      }0
    case RN_FB_DEV:0
    case RN_FB_PROD:0
      switch (packageName) {0
        case 'react-native-renderer':0
          return [`build/react-native/fb/${filename}`];0
        default:0
          throw new Error('Unknown RN package.');0
      }0
    default:0
      throw new Error('Unknown bundle type.');0
  }0
}0
0
async function copyWWWShims() {0
  await asyncCopyTo(0
    `${__dirname}/shims/facebook-www`,0
    'build/facebook-www/shims'0
  );0
}0
0
async function copyRNShims() {0
  await Promise.all([0
    // React Native0
    asyncCopyTo(`${__dirname}/shims/react-native`, 'build/react-native/shims'),0
    asyncCopyTo(0
      require.resolve('shared/ReactTypes.js'),0
      'build/react-native/shims/ReactTypes.js'0
    ),0
    asyncCopyTo(0
      require.resolve('react-native-renderer/src/ReactNativeTypes.js'),0
      'build/react-native/shims/ReactNativeTypes.js'0
    ),0
    asyncCopyTo(`${__dirname}/shims/react-native-fb`, 'build/react-native/fb'),0
  ]);0
}0
0
async function copyAllShims() {0
  await Promise.all([copyWWWShims(), copyRNShims()]);0
}0
0
function getTarOptions(tgzName, packageName) {0
  // Files inside the `npm pack`ed archive start0
  // with "package/" in their paths. We'll undo0
  // this during extraction.0
  const CONTENTS_FOLDER = 'package';0
  return {0
    src: tgzName,0
    dest: `build/node_modules/${packageName}`,0
    tar: {0
      entries: [CONTENTS_FOLDER],0
      map(header) {0
        if (header.name.indexOf(CONTENTS_FOLDER + '/') === 0) {0
          header.name = header.name.substring(CONTENTS_FOLDER.length + 1);0
        }0
      },0
    },0
  };0
}0
0
async function prepareNpmPackage(name) {0
  await Promise.all([0
    asyncCopyTo('LICENSE', `build/node_modules/${name}/LICENSE`),0
    asyncCopyTo(0
      `packages/${name}/package.json`,0
      `build/node_modules/${name}/package.json`0
    ),0
    asyncCopyTo(0
      `packages/${name}/README.md`,0
      `build/node_modules/${name}/README.md`0
    ),0
    asyncCopyTo(`packages/${name}/npm`, `build/node_modules/${name}`),0
  ]);0
  const tgzName = (await asyncExecuteCommand(0
    `npm pack build/node_modules/${name}`0
  )).trim();0
  await asyncRimRaf(`build/node_modules/${name}`);0
  await asyncExtractTar(getTarOptions(tgzName, name));0
  unlinkSync(tgzName);0
}0
0
async function prepareNpmPackages() {0
  if (!existsSync('build/node_modules')) {0
    // We didn't build any npm packages.0
    return;0
  }0
  const builtPackageFolders = readdirSync('build/node_modules').filter(0
    dir => dir.charAt(0) !== '.'0
  );0
  await Promise.all(builtPackageFolders.map(prepareNpmPackage));0
}0
0
module.exports = {0
  copyAllShims,0
  getPackageName,0
  getBundleOutputPaths,0
  prepareNpmPackages,0
};0
'use strict';0
0
const Table = require('cli-table');0
const filesize = require('filesize');0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const join = require('path').join;0
const fs = require('fs');0
const prevBuildResults = require('./results.json');0
0
const currentBuildResults = {0
  // Mutated inside build.js during a build run.0
  // We make a copy so that partial rebuilds don't erase other stats.0
  bundleSizes: [...prevBuildResults.bundleSizes],0
};0
0
function saveResults() {0
  fs.writeFileSync(0
    join('scripts', 'rollup', 'results.json'),0
    JSON.stringify(currentBuildResults, null, 2)0
  );0
}0
0
function fractionalChange(prev, current) {0
  return (current - prev) / prev;0
}0
0
function percentChangeString(change) {0
  if (!isFinite(change)) {0
    // When a new package is created0
    return 'n/a';0
  }0
  const formatted = (change * 100).toFixed(1);0
  if (/^-|^0(?:\.0+)$/.test(formatted)) {0
    return `${formatted}%`;0
  } else {0
    return `+${formatted}%`;0
  }0
}0
0
const resultsHeaders = [0
  'Bundle',0
  'Prev Size',0
  'Current Size',0
  'Diff',0
  'Prev Gzip',0
  'Current Gzip',0
  'Diff',0
];0
0
function generateResultsArray(current, prevResults) {0
  return current.bundleSizes0
    .map(result => {0
      const prev = prevResults.bundleSizes.filter(0
        res =>0
          res.filename === result.filename &&0
          res.bundleType === result.bundleType0
      )[0];0
      if (result === prev) {0
        // We didn't rebuild this bundle.0
        return;0
      }0
0
      const size = result.size;0
      const gzip = result.gzip;0
      let prevSize = prev ? prev.size : 0;0
      let prevGzip = prev ? prev.gzip : 0;0
0
      return {0
        filename: result.filename,0
        bundleType: result.bundleType,0
        packageName: result.packageName,0
        prevSize: filesize(prevSize),0
        prevFileSize: filesize(size),0
        prevFileSizeChange: fractionalChange(prevSize, size),0
        prevFileSizeAbsoluteChange: size - prevSize,0
        prevGzip: filesize(prevGzip),0
        prevGzipSize: filesize(gzip),0
        prevGzipSizeChange: fractionalChange(prevGzip, gzip),0
        prevGzipSizeAbsoluteChange: gzip - prevGzip,0
      };0
      // Strip any nulls0
    })0
    .filter(f => f);0
}0
0
function printResults() {0
  const table = new Table({0
    head: resultsHeaders.map(label => chalk.gray.yellow(label)),0
  });0
0
  const results = generateResultsArray(currentBuildResults, prevBuildResults);0
  results.forEach(result => {0
    table.push([0
      chalk.white.bold(`${result.filename}  (${result.bundleType})`),0
      chalk.gray.bold(result.prevSize),0
      chalk.white.bold(result.prevFileSize),0
      percentChangeString(result.prevFileSizeChange),0
      chalk.gray.bold(result.prevGzip),0
      chalk.white.bold(result.prevGzipSize),0
      percentChangeString(result.prevGzipSizeChange),0
    ]);0
  });0
0
  return table.toString();0
}0
0
module.exports = {0
  currentBuildResults,0
  generateResultsArray,0
  printResults,0
  saveResults,0
  resultsHeaders,0
};0
'use strict';0
0
const asyncCopyTo = require('./utils').asyncCopyTo;0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const resolvePath = require('./utils').resolvePath;0
0
const DEFAULT_FB_SOURCE_PATH = '~/fbsource/';0
const DEFAULT_WWW_PATH = '~/www/';0
const RELATIVE_RN_OSS_PATH = 'xplat/js/react-native-github/Libraries/Renderer/';0
const RELATIVE_WWW_PATH = 'html/shared/react/';0
0
async function doSync(buildPath, destPath) {0
  console.log(`${chalk.bgYellow.black(' SYNCING ')} React to ${destPath}`);0
0
  await asyncCopyTo(buildPath, destPath);0
  console.log(`${chalk.bgGreen.black(' SYNCED ')} React to ${destPath}`);0
}0
0
async function syncReactDom(buildPath, wwwPath) {0
  wwwPath = typeof wwwPath === 'string' ? wwwPath : DEFAULT_WWW_PATH;0
0
  if (wwwPath.charAt(wwwPath.length - 1) !== '/') {0
    wwwPath += '/';0
  }0
0
  const destPath = resolvePath(wwwPath + RELATIVE_WWW_PATH);0
  await doSync(buildPath, destPath);0
}0
0
async function syncReactNativeHelper(0
  buildPath,0
  fbSourcePath,0
  relativeDestPath0
) {0
  fbSourcePath =0
    typeof fbSourcePath === 'string' ? fbSourcePath : DEFAULT_FB_SOURCE_PATH;0
0
  if (fbSourcePath.charAt(fbSourcePath.length - 1) !== '/') {0
    fbSourcePath += '/';0
  }0
0
  const destPath = resolvePath(fbSourcePath + relativeDestPath);0
  await doSync(buildPath, destPath);0
}0
0
async function syncReactNative(fbSourcePath) {0
  await syncReactNativeHelper(0
    'build/react-native',0
    fbSourcePath,0
    RELATIVE_RN_OSS_PATH0
  );0
}0
0
module.exports = {0
  syncReactDom,0
  syncReactNative,0
};0
'use strict';0
0
const ncp = require('ncp').ncp;0
const path = require('path');0
const mkdirp = require('mkdirp');0
const rimraf = require('rimraf');0
const exec = require('child_process').exec;0
const targz = require('targz');0
0
function asyncCopyTo(from, to) {0
  return asyncMkDirP(path.dirname(to)).then(0
    () =>0
      new Promise((resolve, reject) => {0
        ncp(from, to, error => {0
          if (error) {0
            // Wrap to have a useful stack trace.0
            reject(new Error(error));0
            return;0
          }0
          resolve();0
        });0
      })0
  );0
}0
0
function asyncExecuteCommand(command) {0
  return new Promise((resolve, reject) =>0
    exec(command, (error, stdout) => {0
      if (error) {0
        reject(error);0
        return;0
      }0
      resolve(stdout);0
    })0
  );0
}0
0
function asyncExtractTar(options) {0
  return new Promise((resolve, reject) =>0
    targz.decompress(options, error => {0
      if (error) {0
        reject(error);0
        return;0
      }0
      resolve();0
    })0
  );0
}0
0
function asyncMkDirP(filepath) {0
  return new Promise((resolve, reject) =>0
    mkdirp(filepath, error => {0
      if (error) {0
        reject(error);0
        return;0
      }0
      resolve();0
    })0
  );0
}0
0
function asyncRimRaf(filepath) {0
  return new Promise((resolve, reject) =>0
    rimraf(filepath, error => {0
      if (error) {0
        reject(error);0
        return;0
      }0
      resolve();0
    })0
  );0
}0
0
function resolvePath(filepath) {0
  if (filepath[0] === '~') {0
    return path.join(process.env.HOME, filepath.slice(1));0
  } else {0
    return path.resolve(filepath);0
  }0
}0
0
module.exports = {0
  asyncCopyTo,0
  resolvePath,0
  asyncExecuteCommand,0
  asyncExtractTar,0
  asyncMkDirP,0
  asyncRimRaf,0
};0

 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.`;0

const wrappers = {0
  /***************** UMD_DEV *****************/0
  [UMD_DEV](source, globalName, filename, moduleType) {0
    return `/** @license React v${reactVersion}0
 * ${filename}0
 *0
${license}0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
${source}`;0
  },0
0
  /***************** UMD_PROD *****************/0
  [UMD_PROD](source, globalName, filename, moduleType) {0
    return `/** @license React v${reactVersion}0
 * ${filename}0
 *0
${license}0
 */0
${source}`;0
  },0
0
  /***************** NODE_DEV *****************/0
  [NODE_DEV](source, globalName, filename, moduleType) {0
    return `/** @license React v${reactVersion}0
 * ${filename}0
 *0
${license}0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
${0
      globalName === 'ReactNoopRenderer' ||0
      globalName === 'ReactNoopRendererPersistent'0
        ? // React Noop needs regenerator runtime because it uses0
          // generators but GCC doesn't handle them in the output.0
          // So we use Babel for them.0
          `const regeneratorRuntime = require("regenerator-runtime");`0
        : ``0
    }0
0
if (process.env.NODE_ENV !== "production") {0
  (function() {0
${source}0
  })();0
}`;0
  },0
0
  /***************** NODE_PROD *****************/0
  [NODE_PROD](source, globalName, filename, moduleType) {0
    return `/** @license React v${reactVersion}0
 * ${filename}0
 *0
${license}0
 */0
${0
      globalName === 'ReactNoopRenderer' ||0
      globalName === 'ReactNoopRendererPersistent'0
        ? // React Noop needs regenerator runtime because it uses0
          // generators but GCC doesn't handle them in the output.0
          // So we use Babel for them.0
          `const regeneratorRuntime = require("regenerator-runtime");`0
        : ``0
    }0
${source}`;0
  },0
0
  /***************** NODE_PROFILING *****************/0
  [NODE_PROFILING](source, globalName, filename, moduleType) {0
    return `/** @license React v${reactVersion}0
 * ${filename}0
 *0
${license}0
 */0
${0
      globalName === 'ReactNoopRenderer' ||0
      globalName === 'ReactNoopRendererPersistent'0
        ? // React Noop needs regenerator runtime because it uses0
          // generators but GCC doesn't handle them in the output.0
          // So we use Babel for them.0
          `const regeneratorRuntime = require("regenerator-runtime");`0
        : ``0
    }0
${source}`;0
  },0
0
  /****************** FB_WWW_DEV ******************/0
  [FB_WWW_DEV](source, globalName, filename, moduleType) {0
    return `/**0
${license}0
 *0
 * @noflow0
 * @preventMunge0
 * @preserve-invariant-messages0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  (function() {0
${source}0
  })();0
}`;0
  },0
0
  /****************** FB_WWW_PROD ******************/0
  [FB_WWW_PROD](source, globalName, filename, moduleType) {0
    return `/**0
${license}0
 *0
 * @noflow0
 * @preventMunge0
 * @preserve-invariant-messages0
 */0
0
${source}`;0
  },0
0
  /****************** RN_OSS_DEV ******************/0
  [RN_OSS_DEV](source, globalName, filename, moduleType) {0
    return `/**0
${license}0
 *0
 * @noflow0
 * @providesModule ${globalName}-dev0
 * @preventMunge0
 * ${'@gen' + 'erated'}0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
if (__DEV__) {0
  (function() {0
${source}0
  })();0
}`;0
  },0
0
  /****************** RN_OSS_PROD ******************/0
  [RN_OSS_PROD](source, globalName, filename, moduleType) {0
    return `/**0
${license}0
 *0
 * @noflow0
 * @providesModule ${globalName}-prod0
 * @preventMunge0

 */0
0
${source}`;0
  },0
0
  /****************** RN_OSS_PROFILING ******************/0
  [RN_OSS_PROFILING](source, globalName, filename, moduleType) {0
    return `/**0
${license}0
 *0
 * @noflow0
 * @providesModule ${globalName}-profiling0
 * @preventMunge0
 * ${'@gen' + 'erated'}0
 */0
0
${source}`;0
  },0
0
  /****************** RN_FB_DEV ******************/0
  [RN_FB_DEV](source, globalName, filename, moduleType) {0
    return `/**0
${license}0

 */0

'use strict';0

if (__DEV__) {0
  (function() {0
${source}0
  })();0

  },0

  [RN_FB_PROD](source, globalName, filename, moduleType) {0

0

const reconcilerWrappers = {0
  /***************** NODE_DEV (reconciler only) *****************/0
  [NODE_DEV](source, globalName, filename, moduleType) {0
    return `/** @license React v${reactVersion}0
 * ${filename}0
 *0
${license}0
 */0
0
'use strict';0
0
if (process.env.NODE_ENV !== "production") {0
  module.exports = function $$$reconciler($$$hostConfig) {0
${source}0
    var $$$renderer = module.exports;0
    module.exports = $$$reconciler;0
    return $$$renderer;0
  };0
}`;0
  },0
0
  /***************** NODE_PROD (reconciler only) *****************/0
  [NODE_PROD](source, globalName, filename, moduleType) {0
    return `/** @license React v${reactVersion}0
 * ${filename}0
 *0
${license}0
 */0
module.exports = function $$$reconciler($$$hostConfig) {0
${source}0
    var $$$renderer = module.exports;0
    module.exports = $$$reconciler;0
    return $$$renderer;0
};`;0
  },0
};0
0
function wrapBundle(source, bundleType, globalName, filename, moduleType) {0
  if (moduleType === RECONCILER) {0
    // Standalone reconciler is only used by third-party renderers.0
    // It is handled separately.0
    const wrapper = reconcilerWrappers[bundleType];0
    if (typeof wrapper !== 'function') {0
      throw new Error(0
        `Unsupported build type for the reconciler package: ${bundleType}.`0
      );0
    }0
    return wrapper(source, globalName, filename, moduleType);0
  }0
  // All the other packages.0
  const wrapper = wrappers[bundleType];0
  if (typeof wrapper !== 'function') {0
    throw new Error(`Unsupported build type: ${bundleType}.`);0
  }0
  return wrapper(source, globalName, filename, moduleType);0
}0
0
module.exports = {0
  wrapBundle,0
};0
'use strict';0
0
const ClosureCompiler = require('google-closure-compiler').compiler;0
const {promisify} = require('util');0
const fs = require('fs');0
const tmp = require('tmp');0
const writeFileAsync = promisify(fs.writeFile);0
0
function compile(flags) {0
  return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {0
    const closureCompiler = new ClosureCompiler(flags);0
    closureCompiler.run(function(exitCode, stdOut, stdErr) {0
      if (!stdErr) {0
        resolve(stdOut);0
      } else {0
        reject(new Error(stdErr));0
      }0
    });0
  });0
}0
0
module.exports = function closure(flags = {}) {0
  return {0
    name: 'scripts/rollup/plugins/closure-plugin',0
    async transformBundle(code) {0
      const inputFile = tmp.fileSync();0
      const tempPath = inputFile.name;0
      flags = Object.assign({}, flags, {js: tempPath});0
      await writeFileAsync(tempPath, code, 'utf8');0
      const compiledCode = await compile(flags);0
      inputFile.removeCallback();0
      return {code: compiledCode};0
    },0
  };0
};0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
'use strict';0
0
const gzip = require('gzip-size');0
0
module.exports = function sizes(options) {0
  return {0
    name: 'scripts/rollup/plugins/sizes-plugin',0
    ongenerate(bundle, obj) {0
      const size = Buffer.byteLength(obj.code);0
      const gzipSize = gzip.sync(obj.code);0
0
      options.getSize(size, gzipSize);0
    },0
  };0
};0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
'use strict';0
0
const path = require('path');0
const semver = require('semver');0
0
function resolveRelatively(importee, importer) {0
  if (semver.gte(process.version, '8.9.0')) {0
    return require.resolve(importee, {0
      paths: [path.dirname(importer)],0
    });0
  } else {0
    // `paths` argument is not available in older Node.0
    // This works though.0
    // https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/59630
    const Module = require('module');0
    return Module._findPath(importee, [0
      path.dirname(importer),0
      ...module.paths,0
    ]);0
  }0
}0
0
let resolveCache = new Map();0
function useForks(forks) {0
  let resolvedForks = new Map();0
  Object.keys(forks).forEach(srcModule => {0
    const targetModule = forks[srcModule];0
    resolvedForks.set(0
      require.resolve(srcModule),0
      require.resolve(targetModule)0
    );0
  });0
  return {0
    name: 'scripts/rollup/plugins/use-forks-plugin',0
    resolveId(importee, importer) {0
      if (!importer || !importee) {0
        return null;0
      }0
      if (importee.startsWith('\u0000')) {0
        // Internal Rollup reference, ignore.0
        // Passing that to Node file functions can fatal.0
        return null;0
      }0
      let resolvedImportee = null;0
      let cacheKey = `${importer}:::${importee}`;0
      if (resolveCache.has(cacheKey)) {0
        // Avoid hitting file system if possible.0
        resolvedImportee = resolveCache.get(cacheKey);0
      } else {0
        try {0
          resolvedImportee = resolveRelatively(importee, importer);0
        } catch (err) {0
          // Not our fault, let Rollup fail later.0
        }0
        if (resolvedImportee) {0
          resolveCache.set(cacheKey, resolvedImportee);0
        }0
      }0
      if (resolvedImportee && resolvedForks.has(resolvedImportee)) {0
        // We found a fork!0
        return resolvedForks.get(resolvedImportee);0
      }0
      return null;0
    },0
  };0
}0
0
module.exports = useForks;0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 */0
0

0

  __SECRET_INTERNALS_DO_NOT_USE_OR_YOU_WILL_BE_FIRED,0
} = require('ReactDOM-fb');0

  __SECRET_INTERNALS_DO_NOT_USE_OR_YOU_WILL_BE_FIRED.EventPluginHub;0

'use strict';0
0
const {0
  __SECRET_INTERNALS_DO_NOT_USE_OR_YOU_WILL_BE_FIRED,0
} = require('ReactDOM-fb');0

/**0
 * Creates a renderable ReactNative host component.0
 * Use this method for view configs that are loaded from UIManager.0
 * Use createReactNativeComponentClass() for view configs defined within JavaScript.0
 *0
 * @param {string} config iOS View configuration.0
 * @private0
 */0
const createReactNativeComponentClass = function(0
  name: string,0
  callback: ViewConfigGetter,0
): string {0
  return register(name, callback);0
};0
0
module.exports = createReactNativeComponentClass;0

'use strict';0
0
import type {0
  ReactNativeBaseComponentViewConfig,0
  ViewConfigGetter,0
} from './ReactNativeTypes';0
0
const invariant = require('fbjs/lib/invariant');0
0
// Event configs0
const customBubblingEventTypes = {};0
const customDirectEventTypes = {};0
const eventTypes = {};0
0
exports.customBubblingEventTypes = customBubblingEventTypes;0
exports.customDirectEventTypes = customDirectEventTypes;0
exports.eventTypes = eventTypes;0
0
const viewConfigCallbacks = new Map();0
const viewConfigs = new Map();0
0
function processEventTypes(0
  viewConfig: ReactNativeBaseComponentViewConfig,0
): void {0
  const {bubblingEventTypes, directEventTypes} = viewConfig;0
0
  if (__DEV__) {0
    if (bubblingEventTypes != null && directEventTypes != null) {0
      for (const topLevelType in directEventTypes) {0
        invariant(0
          bubblingEventTypes[topLevelType] == null,0
          'Event cannot be both direct and bubbling: %s',0
          topLevelType,0
        );0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  if (bubblingEventTypes != null) {0
    for (const topLevelType in bubblingEventTypes) {0
      if (customBubblingEventTypes[topLevelType] == null) {0
        eventTypes[topLevelType] = customBubblingEventTypes[topLevelType] =0
          bubblingEventTypes[topLevelType];0
      }0
    }0
  }0
0
  if (directEventTypes != null) {0
    for (const topLevelType in directEventTypes) {0
      if (customDirectEventTypes[topLevelType] == null) {0
        eventTypes[topLevelType] = customDirectEventTypes[topLevelType] =0
          directEventTypes[topLevelType];0
      }0
    }0
  }0
}0
0
/**0
 * Registers a native view/component by name.0
 * A callback is provided to load the view config from UIManager.0
 * The callback is deferred until the view is actually rendered.0
 * This is done to avoid causing Prepack deopts.0
 */0
exports.register = function(name: string, callback: ViewConfigGetter): string {0
  invariant(0
    !viewConfigCallbacks.has(name),0
    'Tried to register two views with the same name %s',0
    name,0
  );0
  viewConfigCallbacks.set(name, callback);0
  return name;0
};0
0
/**0
 * Retrieves a config for the specified view.0
 * If this is the first time the view has been used,0
 * This configuration will be lazy-loaded from UIManager.0
 */0
exports.get = function(name: string): ReactNativeBaseComponentViewConfig {0
  let viewConfig;0
  if (!viewConfigs.has(name)) {0
    const callback = viewConfigCallbacks.get(name);0
    invariant(0
      typeof callback === 'function',0
      'View config not found for name %s',0
      name,0
    );0
    viewConfigCallbacks.set(name, null);0
    viewConfig = callback();0
    processEventTypes(viewConfig);0
    viewConfigs.set(name, viewConfig);0
  } else {0
    viewConfig = viewConfigs.get(name);0
  }0
  invariant(viewConfig, 'View config not found for name %s', name);0
  return viewConfig;0
};0

 */0

'use strict';0
0
const chalk = require('chalk');0
const path = require('path');0
const spawnSync = require('child_process').spawnSync;0
const glob = require('glob');0
0
const extension = process.platform === 'win32' ? '.cmd' : '';0
0
// Performs sanity checks on bundles *built* by Rollup.0
// Helps catch Rollup regressions.0
function lint({format, filePatterns}) {0
  console.log(`Linting ${format} bundles...`);0
  const result = spawnSync(0
    path.join('node_modules', '.bin', 'eslint' + extension),0
    [0
      ...filePatterns,0
      '--config',0
      path.join(__dirname, `eslintrc.${format}.js`),0
      // Disregard our ESLint rules that apply to the source.0
      '--no-eslintrc',0
      // Use a different ignore file.0
      '--ignore-path',0
      path.join(__dirname, 'eslintignore'),0
    ],0
    {0
      // Allow colors to pass through0
      stdio: 'inherit',0
    }0
  );0
  if (result.status !== 0) {0
    console.error(chalk.red(`Linting of ${format} bundles has failed.`));0
    process.exit(result.status);0
  } else {0
    console.log(chalk.green(`Linted ${format} bundles successfully!`));0
    console.log();0
  }0
}0
0
function checkFilesExist(bundle) {0
  const {format, filePatterns} = bundle;0
  filePatterns.forEach(pattern => {0
    console.log(`Checking if files exist in ${pattern}...`);0
    const files = glob.sync(pattern);0
    if (files.length === 0) {0
      console.error(chalk.red(`Found no ${format} bundles in ${pattern}`));0
      process.exit(1);0
    } else {0
      console.log(chalk.green(`Found ${files.length} bundles.`));0
      console.log();0
    }0
  });0
  return bundle;0
}0
0
const bundles = [0
  {0
    format: 'fb',0
    filePatterns: [`./build/facebook-www/*.js`],0
  },0
  {0
    format: 'rn',0
    filePatterns: [0
      `./build/react-native/oss/*.js`,0
      `./build/react-native/fb/ReactFabric-*.js`,0
      `./build/react-native/fb/ReactNativeRenderer-*.js`,0
    ],0
  },0
  {0
    format: 'umd',0
    filePatterns: [`./build/node_modules/*/umd/*.js`],0
  },0
  {0
    format: 'cjs',0
    filePatterns: [0
      `./build/node_modules/*/*.js`,0
      `./build/node_modules/*/cjs/*.js`,0
    ],0
  },0
];0
0
bundles.map(checkFilesExist).map(lint);0
/**0
 * Copyright (c) 2013-present, Facebook, Inc.0
 *0
 * This source code is licensed under the MIT license found in the0
 * LICENSE file in the root directory of this source tree.0
 *0
 * @flow0
 */0
'use strict';0
0
function evalToString(ast /* : Object */) /* : string */ {0
  switch (ast.type) {0
    case 'StringLiteral':0
      return ast.value;0
    case 'BinaryExpression': // `+`0
      if (ast.operator !== '+') {0
        throw new Error('Unsupported binary operator ' + ast.operator);0
      }0
      return evalToString(ast.left) + evalToString(ast.right);0
    default:0
      throw new Error('Unsupported type ' + ast.type);0
  }0
}0
0
module.exports = evalToString;0

'use strict';0
0
const execFileSync = require('child_process').execFileSync;0
0
const exec = (command, args) => {0
  console.log('> ' + [command].concat(args).join(' '));0
  const options = {0
    cwd: process.cwd(),0
    env: process.env,0
    stdio: 'pipe',0
    encoding: 'utf-8',0
  };0
  return execFileSync(command, args, options);0
};0
0
const execGitCmd = args =>0
  exec('git', args)0
    .trim()0
    .toString()0
    .split('\n');0
0
const listChangedFiles = () => {0
  const mergeBase = execGitCmd(['merge-base', 'HEAD', 'master']);0
  return new Set([0
    ...execGitCmd(['diff', '--name-only', '--diff-filter=ACMRTUB', mergeBase]),0
    ...execGitCmd(['ls-files', '--others', '--exclude-standard']),0
  ]);0
};0
0
module.exports = listChangedFiles;0

'use strict';0
0
const evalToString = require('../evalToString');0
const babylon = require('babylon');0
0
const parse = source =>0
  babylon.parse(`(${source});`).program.body[0].expression; // quick way to get an exp node0
0
const parseAndEval = source => evalToString(parse(source));0
0
describe('evalToString', () => {0
  it('should support StringLiteral', () => {0
    expect(parseAndEval(`'foobar'`)).toBe('foobar');0
    expect(parseAndEval(`'yowassup'`)).toBe('yowassup');0
  });0
0
  it('should support string concat (`+`)', () => {0
    expect(parseAndEval(`'foo ' + 'bar'`)).toBe('foo bar');0
  });0
0
  it('should throw when it finds other types', () => {0
    expect(() => parseAndEval(`'foo ' + true`)).toThrowError(0
      /Unsupported type/0
    );0
    expect(() => parseAndEval(`'foo ' + 3`)).toThrowError(/Unsupported type/);0
    expect(() => parseAndEval(`'foo ' + null`)).toThrowError(0
      /Unsupported type/0
    );0
    expect(() => parseAndEval(`'foo ' + undefined`)).toThrowError(0
      /Unsupported type/0
    );0
  });0
});0

0
const extension = process.platform === 'win32' ? '.cmd' : '';0
0
// React-Linter public_repo token (this is publicly visible on purpose)0
const token = '80aa64c50f38a267e9ba' + '575d41d528f9c234edb8';0
spawn(path.join('node_modules', '.bin', 'danger-ci' + extension), [], {0
  // Allow colors to pass through0
  stdio: 'inherit',0
  env: {0
    ...process.env,0
    DANGER_GITHUB_API_TOKEN: token,0
  },0
}).on('close', function(code) {0
  if (code !== 0) {0
    console.error('Danger failed');0
  } else {0
    console.log('Danger passed');0
  }0
0
  process.exit(code);0
});0

async function checkAll() {0
  // eslint-disable-next-line no-for-of-loops/no-for-of-loops0
  for (let rendererInfo of inlinedHostConfigs) {0
    if (rendererInfo.isFlowTyped) {0
      await runFlow(rendererInfo.shortName, ['check']);0
      console.log();0
    }0
  }0
}0

'use strict';0

const chalk = require('chalk');0
const runFlow = require('../flow/runFlow');0
const inlinedHostConfigs = require('../shared/inlinedHostConfigs');0
0
// This script is using `flow status` for a quick check with a server.0
// Use it for local development.0
0
const primaryRenderer = inlinedHostConfigs.find(0
  info => info.isFlowTyped && info.shortName === process.argv[2]0
);0
if (!primaryRenderer) {0
  console.log(0
    'The ' +0
      chalk.red('yarn flow') +0
      ' command now requires you to pick a primary renderer:'0
  );0
  console.log();0
  inlinedHostConfigs.forEach(rendererInfo => {0
    if (rendererInfo.isFlowTyped) {0
      console.log('  * ' + chalk.cyan('yarn flow ' + rendererInfo.shortName));0
    }0
  });0
  console.log();0
  console.log('If you are not sure, run ' + chalk.green('yarn flow dom') + '.');0
  console.log(0
    'This will still typecheck non-DOM packages, although less precisely.'0
  );0
  console.log();0
  console.log('Note that checks for all renderers will run on CI.');0
  console.log(0
    'You can also do this locally with ' +0
      chalk.cyan('yarn flow-ci') +0
      ' but it will be slow.'0
  );0
  console.log();0
  process.exit(1);0
}0
0
runFlow(primaryRenderer.shortName, ['status']);0

'use strict';0
0
const reactVersion = require('../../package.json').version;0
const versions = {0
  'packages/react/package.json': require('../../packages/react/package.json')0
    .version,0
  'packages/react-dom/package.json': require('../../packages/react-dom/package.json')0
    .version,0
  'packages/react-test-renderer/package.json': require('../../packages/react-test-renderer/package.json')0
    .version,0
  'packages/shared/ReactVersion.js': require('../../packages/shared/ReactVersion'),0
};0
0
let allVersionsMatch = true;0
Object.keys(versions).forEach(function(name) {0
  const version = versions[name];0
  if (version !== reactVersion) {0
    allVersionsMatch = false;0
    console.log(0
      '%s version does not match package.json. Expected %s, saw %s.',0
      name,0
      reactVersion,0
      version0
    );0
  }0
});0
0
if (!allVersionsMatch) {0
  process.exit(1);0
}0
